column1: Now, though, they must choose between being outflanked by Euroskeptic parties on both the far left and far right, or responding to that threat by creating a supra-national democracy that can satisfy voters’ legitimate concerns.
column2: 但现在，他们必须选择是要在极左和极右翼遭到欧洲怀疑论政党的包抄，亦或是成立超国家民主制度来应对上述威胁，并解除选民的合理忧虑。

column1: The 2003 European Convention that produced the ill-fated EU Constitution offers no blueprint for the future.
column2: 制定出命运多舛的欧盟宪法的2003年欧洲公约并没有勾画出未来的蓝图。

column1: Its convoluted business was conducted largely out of sight.
column2: 其复杂业务的展开过程大体上并不接受公众的监督。

column1: To stem mounting criticism of “Europe,” the EU needs the coup de théâtre of an open debate involving civil society, not just a handful of political representatives.
column2: 为遏制愈演愈烈的针对“欧洲”的批评，欧盟不仅需要少数政治代表的参与，还需要民间社团参与开放辩论的突变情节。

column1: Its premise must be that the EU is heading toward dissolution, and that only by becoming more responsive to Europe’s citizens can it reverse the trend.
column2: 改革的前提是欧盟正在走向解体，只有更多响应欧洲民众的关切才能逆转欧盟解体的趋势。

column1: Wall-to-Wall Wal-Mart?
column2: 沃尔玛是否横扫千军？

column1: Do you want to know which video clip will soon be scaring the daylights out of policymakers throughout the world?
column2: 你是否知道哪一个录像片马上会令世界各地的决策者大惊失色？

column1: In a scenario that looks uncannily like the spread of a global pandemic, the economist Thomas Holmes has prepared a dynamic map simulation showing the spread of Wal-Mart stores throughout the United States.
column2: 经济学家托马斯·赫尔姆斯准备了一个展示沃尔玛商店席卷美国的动画地图模拟片，这一景象令人惊讶，看似就像是一场全球性的传染病。

column1: Starting at the epicenter in Bentonville, Arkansas, where Sam Walton opened his first store in 1962, giant boxy Wal-Mart stores have now multiplied to the point where the average American lives less than seven kilometers from an outlet.
column2: 1962年创始之初，山姆·沃顿在美国阿肯色州的本顿维尔老家开设了他的第一家店铺，现在，外表四四方方、巨大无比的沃尔玛商店已经翻倍增长，普通美国人的住家距离其中一家商店不到七公里。

column1: Interestingly, the video shows how the stores spread out like petals of a flower, ever thickening and expanding.
column2: 有趣的是，录像片展示的是沃尔玛如何像花束一样扩张，不断变厚和扩大。

column1: Rather than jumping out to the coasts – 80% of all Americans live within 80 kilometers of the Pacific or Atlantic oceans – Wal-Marts have spread organically through an ever-expanding supply chain.
column2: 80％的美国人口居住在太平洋或大西洋沿岸，沃尔玛并没有扑向美国的海岸线，而是通过不断扩张的供应链条有机地扩散。

column1: Even though each new store takes away business from Wal-Mart stores established nearby, ever-improving supply efficiencies help maintain the chain’s overall growth.
column2: 尽管每一家新店会抢走附近的沃尔玛店的生意，但是不断提高完善的供应效率帮助维持了连锁店的总体增长。

column1: Love them or hate them, what is undeniable is that Wal-Mart is the quintessential example of the costs and benefits of modern globalization.
column2: 无论你喜欢还是仇视沃尔玛，无可否认的事实是，沃尔玛本质上是现代全球化成本和效益的范例。

column1: Consumers pay significantly less than at traditional outlets.
column2: 与传统商店相比，消费者节省大笔开支。

column1: For example, economists estimate that the food section of Wal-Mart charges 25% less than a typical large supermarket chain.
column2: 例如，经济学家们估计，沃尔玛的食品部与典型的大型超市连锁店相比便宜25 ％ 。

column1: The differences in price for many other consumer goods is even larger.
column2: 其他许多消费品的价格差异甚至更大。

column1: Consider the following stunning fact: together with a few sister “big box” stores (Target, Best Buy, and Home Depot), Wal-Mart accounts for roughly 50% of America’s much vaunted productivity growth edge over Europe during the last decade.
column2: 看一看下面令人惊异的现实：美国大为炫耀过去十年来生产效率增长领先于欧洲，沃尔玛连同几家姊妹“大方盒子”商店，例如Target, Best Buy以及Home Depot一起所占的比重大约为50 ％ 。

column1: Fifty percent!
column2: 真是一半！

column1: Similar advances in wholesaling supply chains account for another 25%!
column2: 类似的批发供应链增长占据另外的25 ％ ！

column1: The notion that Americans have gotten better at everything while other rich countries have stood still is thus wildly misleading.
column2: 因此，其他富国停滞不前之时美国人一枝独秀的观点是大为误导的。

column1: The US productivity miracle and the emergence of Wal-Mart-style retailing are virtually synonymous.
column2: 美国生产效率的神话几乎就是沃尔玛式的零售业崛起。

column1: I have nothing against big box stores.
column2: 我对巨型零售商店并不抱有成见。

column1: They are an enormous boon to low-income consumers, partly compensating for the tepid wage growth that many of them have suffered during the past two decades.
column2: 他们对低收入消费者而言是一个佳音，在某种程度上弥补了过去二十年中他们中的许多人所忍受的缓慢工资增长。

column1: And I don’t agree with friends of mine who turn their noses down at Wal-Mart stores, and claim never to have visited one.
column2: 我有些朋友对沃尔玛店不屑一顾，宣称从来没有在那里购物，我也不赞同他们。

column1: As a consumer, I think big-box stores are great.
column2: 作为一个消费者，我认为巨型零售店是一件好事。

column1: They have certainly been great for America’s trading partners; Wal-Mart alone accounts for over 10% of all US imports from China.
column2: 对于美国的贸易伙伴来说它们无疑也是好事，仅仅沃尔玛一家就占美国进口中国商品的10％以上。

column1: But I do have some reservations about the Wal-Mart model as a blueprint for global growth.
column2: 但是，我对沃尔玛模式作为全球性增长的蓝图却持有保留。

column1: First, there is the matter of its effect on low-wage workers and smaller-scale retailers.
column2: 首先，这一模式对低工资工人以及小型零售者产生影响。

column1: While completely legal, studies suggest that Wal-Mart’s labor policies exploit regulatory loopholes that, for example, allow it to sidestep the burden of healthcare costs for many workers (Wal-Mart provides healthcare coverage to less than half its workers).
column2: 研究报告表明，沃尔玛的劳工政策尽管完全合法，但是却钻法规的空子。 例如，这些空子让沃尔玛规避给许多雇员承担医疗费用（沃尔玛只给一半的雇员提供医疗保险 ） 。

column1: And the entry of big-box stores into a community crushes long-established retailers, often traumatically transforming their character.
column2: 而且，巨型零售店进军某个社区，就会冲垮经营已久的零售者，经常痛楚地改变它们的性质。

column1: Yes, to some extent, such is the price of progress.
column2: 是的，在某种程度上而言这的确是进步的代价。

column1: But the loss of aesthetics and community is not easily captured in simple income and price statistics.
column2: 但是审美和社区的丧失并非可以轻而易举地用简单的收入和价格统计来加以俘获。

column1: Big-box stores are not exactly attractive – hence their name.
column2: 巨型商店并非引人入胜，因此口碑也是如此。

column1: If they continue their explosive growth over the next 20 years, will Americans someday come to regard their proliferation as a spectacular example of the failure to adopt region-wide blueprints for balanced growth?
column2: 如果在未来20年中继续爆炸式的增长，美国人是否会在某一天把它们的扩散视为未能采纳地区性平衡增长的巨大失败的例子呢？

column1: Indeed, many Europeans, and others, will view Holmes’s video simulation of Wal-Mart’s spread as a horror film.
column2: 的确，许多欧洲人和其他人将会把赫尔姆斯有关沃尔玛扩散的录相模拟片视为恐怖电影。

column1: The French may have invented the hyper mart – the forerunner of the big-box store – but they never intended to let their growth go unchecked.
column2: 也许是法国人发明了超市，也就是巨型超市的前身，但是他们从来就没有打算对其放任自流。

column1: The big question for Europeans is whether they can find ways to exploit some of the efficiency gains embodied by the Wal-Mart model without being overrun by it.
column2: 欧洲人的大问题是，他们是否可以找到在不被吞没的情况下利用沃尔玛模式所体现的某些效率提高。

column1: For Americans, there is the additional question of what to do when the big-box store phenomenon has run its course.
column2: 对于美国人而言还有一个问题，那就是当巨型商店现象长驱直入之时如何应对。

column1: If so much of the US productivity edge really amounts to letting Wal-Mart and its big-box cousins run amok, what will happen after this source of growth tapers off?
column2: 如果美国生产效率领先的确意味着让沃尔玛以及其他巨型零售企业为所欲为，那么这一增长源泉枯竭后又当如何呢？

column1: The US economy has many other strengths, including its superior financial system and leading position in high-tech capital goods, but the fact remains that America’s advantage in these areas has so far not been nearly as striking as the Wal-Mart phenomenon.
column2: 美国经济具有其他许多优势，包括其超人一等的金融体系以及在高科技资本商品上的领先地位，但是，美国在这些领域上的优势目前为止还没有像沃尔玛现象那样独树一帜也还是事实。

column1: It is curious how many people seem to think that the US will grow faster than Europe and Japan over the next ten years simply because it has done so for the past ten years.
column2: 许多人似乎认为，仅仅由于在过去十年中美国经济增长快于欧洲和日本，因而在以后的二十年里也是如此。 这一观点不可思议。

column1: Wal-Mart and its ilk are a central feature of the modern era of globalization.
column2: 沃尔玛及其同类就是现代全球化时代的中心特征。

column1: They are not quite the pandemic that their explosive growth pattern resembles, but nor is their emergence completely benign.
column2: 它们并不是类似其爆炸式增长模式的传染病，但是其崛起也并非完全良性。

column1: Those who would aim to emulate US productivity trends must come to grips with how they feel about big-box stores sprouting across their countryside’s, driving down wages and plowing under smaller-scale retailers.
column2: 那些想要模仿美国生产效率趋势的人们必须了解他们对巨型零售点遍布乡间、压低工资以及摧垮小规模零售商的感觉。

column1: Americans, in turn, must think about where the proper balance lies between aesthetics, community, and low prices.
column2: 美国人反过来也必须考虑在审美、社区以及低工资之间取得适当的平衡。

column1: Shaking Up “Shaken Baby Syndrome”
column2: 撼动“抖动婴儿综合征”

column1: OXFORD – The most tragic event that can befall new parents is the sudden, unexpected death of their baby.
column2: 牛津—对新晋父母来说，最悲剧的事情莫过于孩子突然间意外死亡。

column1: Perhaps the only thing worse is the parents being wrongly accused of causing the death, and indeed prosecuted, owing to the medical community’s misinterpretation of the findings.
column2: 也许唯一比这还要糟糕的是父母亲被错误地指责导致了孩子的死亡，并且因此被起诉，而造成这一幕的原因乃是医学界对发现的误解。

column1: A small number of babies who collapse and die unexpectedly in their first year are found to have one or more of the following three symptoms in common: bleeding just outside the brain (subdural hemorrhage); bleeding at the back of the eye (retinal hemorrhage); and brain swelling.
column2: 少数在不满一周岁意外夭折的婴儿被发现有以下三种症候中的一种或多种：大脑外延出血（膜下出血 ） 、 眼底出血（视网膜出血）和脑水肿。

column1: These same features are also seen in some babies who have suffered trauma, such as falls or motor-vehicle accidents.
column2: 同样的特征也见于一些受伤的婴儿，如坠落或车祸。

column1: Yet many babies with these symptoms have no history or medical evidence of trauma (such as fractures, abrasions, or bruises), physical abuse, or neglect.
column2: 但许多存在这西症候的婴儿并无外伤（如骨折、擦伤或撞击 ） 、 身体虐待或被忽视的历史或医学证据。

column1: Pediatricians wrestled with this conundrum until the 1970’s, when it was proposed that shaking might induce rotational forces and cause the “triad” of symptoms without bruises or fractures.
column2: 儿科医师一直在试图破解这一谜题，直到20世纪70年代才有人提出，震动可能造成旋转力，在没有擦伤和撞击的情况下导致“三重”症候。

column1: Over the years, these findings evolved into “shaken baby syndrome” (SBS), a medico-legal hypothesis that remains contentious, and scientifically unproven, to this day.
column2: 多年来，这些发现进一步演化为“抖动婴儿综合症 ” （ shaken baby syndrome，SBS ） 。 SBS是目前仍是有争议的、没有获得科学证明的法医学假说。

column1: The SBS hypothesis attributed the triad of symptoms to the physical rupture of blood vessels on the brain’s surface and in the retina, and the tearing of nerve fibers within the brain.
column2: SBS假说将三重症候归因于大脑表面和视网膜内血管的病理性破裂以及大脑内神经纤维的撕裂。

column1: It was suggested that these outcomes required a force equivalent to a multi-story fall or major motor-vehicle accident, causing immediate symptoms or collapse.
column2: 人们指出，这些结果需要相当于从多层楼高处掉落或严重车祸这么大的力才能造成，导致即刻生成的症候或死亡。

column1: Because violent shaking cannot be accidental, the hypothesis simultaneously established a criminal act and identified the perpetrator, typically the person with the baby at the time of collapse.
column2: 由于暴力震动不可能是事故性的，因此该假说同时坐实了犯罪行为并能够认定施暴者，通常是婴儿致死现场所在人物。

column1: Though the SBS hypothesis was incorporated into medical training and judicial decisions worldwide, it remained untested for almost two decades.
column2: 尽管SBS假说已在全世界范围被纳入医学训练和司法判决，但在近20年的时间里，它并没有经受过测试。

column1: In 1987, the first biomechanical experiments found that the force of shaking is much less than that of impact and concluded that shaking alone was unlikely to cause the triad of symptoms.
column2: 1987年，第一次生物力学实验发现，震动力远远小于撞击力，因此仅凭震动不可能造成三重症候。

column1: Subsequent research in my specialty, pediatric neuropathology, established that the medical basis for the SBS hypothesis was also flawed.
column2: 我所在专业 — — 儿科神经学的后续研究发现，SBS假说的医学基础也是有漏洞的。

column1: We learned that the brain damage in these children did not reflect trauma to nerve fibers, but rather a failure of blood supply.
column2: 我们了解到，这些孩子的大脑损伤并不反映神经纤维外伤，而是反映了供血失灵。

column1: We also learned that the typical subdural hemorrhages in these cases are too thin to result from the rupture of the large bridging veins on the brain’s surface.
column2: 我们还了解到，这些案例中的典型的膜下出血很薄，不可能来自大脑表层大型桥静脉的断裂。

column1: And we learned that the same findings are seen in natural deaths.
column2: 我们还了解到，同样的发现也见于自然死亡。

column1: In the last decade, the list of other causes – including accidental trauma, congenital causes, and natural illness – has continued to grow.
column2: 在过去十年中，其他原因 — — 包括事故外伤、先天性因素和自然疾病等 — — 一直在不断涌现。

column1: Perhaps the most compelling observation in recent years is that subdural hemorrhages are present in nearly half of normal, healthy newborns with no evidence of birth trauma.
column2: 也许最近几年来最有说服力的发现是，膜下出血现象在近一半的没有分娩外伤痕迹的健康新生儿身上出现。

column1: These findings, combined with the immature anatomy of the infant dura, suggest that dural bleeding in young babies may be a natural protective device – a reservoir to prevent backflow into the brain’s blood vessels during the pressure fluctuations of normal labor and delivery.
column2: 这些发现，加上婴儿硬脑膜发育不成熟，表明新生儿脑膜出血可能是天然保护机制 — — 为了防止正常劳作和分娩时压力波动造成血液回流大脑血管。

column1: Because these anatomical features persist into early childhood, the dura may remain similarly vulnerable to bleeding beyond the newborn period.
column2: 由于这些解剖学特征一直持续到早期童年，因此脑膜可能一直保持类似的易出血状态直到新生儿阶段后。

column1: Indeed, both birth-related bleeds and those attributed to shaking are most often located in the folds of membranes covering the brain that have more and larger blood vessels at this age than later in life.
column2: 事实上，不管是与出生有关的出血，还是被归因于震动的出血，通常都位于包裹大脑的膜的褶皱处，这些部位的血管在初生时比日后更大。

column1: While scientific evidence over the last three decades has undermined the shaken baby hypothesis, no new evidence has emerged to support it.
column2: 过去三十年来的科学证据不支持抖动婴儿假说，也没有新证据出现支持它。

column1: Instead, several researchers have relied upon the data in older studies to calculate the statistical probability of inflicted brain injury when certain features (such as intracranial hemorrhage, retinal hemorrhage, brain swelling, and seizures) are present.
column2: 相反，一些研究者根据旧研究中的数据计算出现某些特征（如颅内出血、视网膜出血、脑水肿和癫痫）情况下的大脑损伤的统计概率。

column1: These probabilities are then offered as the basis for diagnosis and as evidence in court.
column2: 这些概率常常被用于诊断依据和法庭证据。

column1: However, the reasoning behind the studies on which these researchers rely is circular, and based on assumptions now known to be unreliable.
column2: 但是，这些研究者的研究所基于的逻辑是��套逻辑，其基础假设现已知道是不可靠的。

column1: For example, in some studies, the researchers decided arbitrarily that falls of less than one meter could not harm a baby, so that parents who described such a fall must be lying.
column2: 比如，在一些研究中，研究者武断地认定不足一米高度跌落不会伤害婴儿，因此描述此类跌落情形的父母一定在撒谎。

column1: Other studies viewed the parents’ inability to explain the findings as evidence of abuse.
column2: 其他研究认为，父母对发现无力辩解便是虐待的证据。

column1: Given these flaws, reviews of old studies do not provide a reliable evidence base for diagnosing abuse.
column2: 由于存在这些缺陷，对旧研究的再检视无法为确认虐待提供可靠证据。

column1: They simply predict the likelihood that specific findings will be categorized as abusive, and that, consequently, the child’s caregiver at the time will be accused or convicted of abuse, regardless of the accuracy of the diagnosis.
column2: 它们只不过预测了具体发现可被归于虐待的概率，以及可以指控或确认当时在场的儿童看护者虐待的概率，确认的准确性并无保障。

column1: Leading proponents of the SBS hypothesis now acknowledge that the triad is a “myth,” that SBS diagnoses consist of “informed speculation,” and that the hypothesis is supported solely by confessions.
column2: SBS假说的主要支持者现在也承认，三重症候是一个“传说 ” ， SBS确认是“有根据的猜测 ” ， SBS假说的支持证据完全来自坦白。

column1: Some courts are following suit, with one US federal judge describing the types of confessions obtained as “worthless as evidence,” and another noting that, given recent developments, claims of SBS may be “more an article of faith than a proposition of science.”
column2: 一些法庭已有所跟进，一位美国联邦法官宣布以此获得的坦白“作为证据毫无价值 ” ， 另一位美国联邦法官指出，根据最新发展，SBS或许“更多地是一种信念，而不是一项科学 ” 。

column1: No one questions whether infants can be damaged or killed by violent shaking or abuse; of course they can.
column2: 没有人会质疑婴儿是否可能因为暴力震动或虐待而受伤甚至致死；当然是可能的。

column1: The real issue is whether shaking or abuse can be inferred on the basis of a hypothesis that lacks scientific support.
column2: 真正的问题在于是否可以根据缺少科学依据的假说推断震动或虐待。

column1: In no other area of medicine and law would an unproved hypothesis provide a basis for diagnosis, let alone criminal prosecution.
column2: 其他医学和法律领域都没有让未经证明的假说作为确认依据的做法，更不用说刑事指控了。

column1: Given the developments of the past decade, we now face the possibility that for the past 30 years we have been wrongly imprisoning parents on the basis of a flawed hypothesis.
column2: 从过去十年的发展来看，我们面临着一种可能性 — — 过去30年来，我们根据一项有缺陷的假说错误地将许多父母亲送入了监狱。

column1: China’s North Korean Pivot
column2: 中国的朝鲜重点

column1: BEIJING – After a spring of heightened tension on the Korean Peninsula, a flurry of diplomatic activity in recent weeks has brought some hope of a meeting of the minds, at least between China, South Korea, and the United States.
column2: 北京—在经历了一个朝鲜半岛局势紧张的春天后，最近几周的一系列外交活动带来了形成一致的希望，至少在中国、韩国和美国之间是如此。

column1: But the emergence of a viable consensus on how to minimize the security risks emanating from North Korea’s mercurial leadership remains to be found.
column2: 但关于如何将来自朝鲜领导层的变化无常的风险降到最低，目前还有待形成可行的一致意见

column1: After a reportedly tough meeting between Chinese President Xi Jinping and Vice Marshall Choe Ryong-hae, one of the four members of North Korea’s ruling presidium, the US-China summit in California took place with North Korea as one of the central points of discussion.
column2: 据称中国主席习近平和朝鲜副元帅、四人最高统治集团成员之一崔龙海进行了艰难的会谈，随后，加利福尼亚州中美峰会将朝鲜问题作为讨论的核心议题之一。

column1: This was quickly followed by a Beijing summit between Xi and South Korean President Park Geun-hye.
column2: 中美峰会后，习近平与韩国总统朴槿惠马上在北京举行了峰会。

column1: The fact that Xi participated in all three meetings underscores two truths: China’s policy toward North Korea is the key to a solution to the problems posed by North Korea, and China may be actively searching for a new approach to its wayward ally.
column2: 习近平参与了三次会面这一事实暗示了两大真相：中国对朝政策是形成针对朝鲜造成的问题的解决方案的关键；以及中国或许正在积极寻找对付其不安分的盟友的新方法。

column1: China’s interest in a new North Korea policy is not entirely new.
column2: 中国对新朝鲜政策的兴趣算不上全新。

column1: After all, China’s policy toward the country has been gradually moving in a more constructive direction for the past two decades, reflecting China’s growing international prominence, as well as its leaders’ cautious embrace of the global role that their country’s new economic might has provided.
column2: 毕竟，过去二十年来，中国对朝政策一直在逐渐朝更具建设性的方向改变，这反映出中国日渐提高的国际突出地位以及其领导人谨慎行使中国经济实力带来的全球影响力的态度。

column1: In the immediate post-Cold War period, China cooperated with other concerned parties in the process of resolving the first North Korea nuclear crisis of 1993-1994; but it tended to regard the North’s nuclear ambitions mainly as a bilateral issue between North Korea and the US.
column2: 冷张时代结束伊始，1993—1994年中国就与其他相关方面合作解决了第一次朝鲜核危机；但它倾向于将朝鲜和野心视为主要是朝鲜和美国的之间的双边问题。

column1: President Bill Clinton seemed to agree, and adopted a bilateral approach to the nuclear crisis, which resulted in the two countries’ Agreed Framework of 1994.
column2: 美国总统克林顿似乎也这样认为，并对朝鲜核危机采取双边主义方法，并于1994年与朝鲜达成框架协议。

column1: But China upgraded its role in the 2000’s.
column2: 但进入21世纪后，中国的作用开始升级。

column1: After North Korea’s enriched uranium program triggered another crisis in late 2002, President George W. Bush wanted to mobilize China’s influence in a more systematic way.
column2: 2002年底，朝鲜铀浓缩计划触发了又一场危机，小布什总统希望动员中国的影响力以形成更加系统性的方法。

column1: But China’s leaders balked, circumscribing their role severely.
column2: 但中国领导人踯躅不前，小心翼翼地控制着自己的角色。

column1: Though Chinese leaders became more active by hosting the six-party talks, they still regarded their role as that of mediator between the US and the North, rather than that of a party whose security interests were seriously affected by events on the Korean Peninsula.
column2: 尽管中国领导人通过主办六方会谈表现出更积极的态度，但仍把自己视为美国和朝鲜之间的调停人，而不是安全利益受朝鲜半岛局势严重影响的当事方。

column1: Immediately after the North’s second nuclear test in 2009, Chinese officials undertook a review of their country’s North Korea policy and decided to separate the nuclear issue from the overall bilateral relationship.
column2: 在2009年朝鲜进行第二次核试验后，中国官员马上反思了中国的对朝政策，决定将朝鲜核问题与全面双边关系分离。

column1: Thus, former Prime Minister Wen Jiabao visited Pyongyang in October 2009 and promised generous economic aid.
column2: 于是，前总理温家宝于2009年10月访问平壤，承诺给予朝鲜丰厚的经济援助。

column1: Chinese leaders may have believed that inducing the North to adopt the Chinese model of economic opening would create a better political environment for denuclearization.
column2: 中国领导人或许认为让朝鲜采取中国的经济开放模式能为去核化创造更好的政治环境。

column1: One result was a deepening of North Korea’s economic dependence on China.
column2: 这一政策的一个结果是朝鲜经济更加依赖中国了。

column1: But the big problem was that the North’s leadership apparently interpreted China’s policy as a sign of unwillingness to pressure the North on nuclear matters.
column2: 但大问题是朝鲜领导人显然将中国的这一政策解读为不愿意就核问题向朝鲜施压的信号。

column1: Indeed, North Korean behavior became much more provocative, including an attack in 2010 that sank the South Korean corvette Cheonan and another in which the South’s Yeonpyeong Island was shelled.
column2: 事实上，朝鲜的行为变得更具挑衅性，包括在2010年炮击延坪岛，击沉韩国巡洋舰天安号和另一艘军舰。

column1: Following this spring’s round of North Korean provocations, Xi appears to have concluded that enough is enough.
column2: 在今年春天朝鲜又一次挑衅后，习近平似乎感到忍无可忍。

column1: As a result, China’s North Korea policy has entered a new stage.
column2: 于是，中国的朝鲜政策迈入了新阶段。

column1: Xi’s criticism of the North’s nuclear ambitions has become both unusually public and blunt.
column2: 习近平对朝鲜和野心的批评反常地公开且尖锐。

column1: Chinese leaders may still view North Korea as a strategic buffer state, but China’s status as a global power is pushing them to view the North in a new way.
column2: 中国领导人或许仍把朝鲜视为战略缓冲国，但中国作为国际大国的地位使其以新视角看待朝鲜。

column1: Former State Councilor Tang Jiaxuan was even reported to have said recently that denuclearization is now a higher priority for China than stabilization of the Korean Peninsula.
column2: 据报道，前国务委员唐家璇最近甚至表示如今对中国来说朝鲜半岛的去核化比朝鲜半岛的稳定更加重要。

column1: This approach should favor China’s global strategy, which is premised upon Xi’s desire to build a new type of “major power” relationship between China and the US (the Chinese government prefers “major power” to “great power,” probably in order to highlight its stated renunciation of hegemonic ambition).
column2: 这一立场有利于中国的全球战略 — — 该战略的前提是习近平建立中美新型“大国”关系的渴望（中国政府喜欢用“大国”而不是“强国 ” ， 可能是为了突出其不称霸的原则 ） 。

column1: Indeed, among the myriad unresolved issues dividing the US and China, North Korea’s nuclear program is the one most likely to impede mutual trust.
column2: 事实上，在中美存在分歧的诸多未解决问题中，朝鲜核计划是最有可能妨碍双方互信的问题之一。

column1: If the US and China are to avoid being steered by North Korea onto a collision course, they probably have four or five years to pursue a joint strategy – a timetable established by the point at which North Korea could have the technology to load miniaturized nuclear warheads atop long-range missiles.
column2: 如果美国和中国欲避免被朝鲜引诱而发生碰撞，它们或许有四到五年时间追求联合战略 — — 即朝鲜获得制造小型远程导弹核弹头技术所需要的时间。

column1: As the North approaches this point, the US will have to strengthen its missile defenses in the western Pacific – areas close to China – in order to deter the North Korean threat.
column2: 如果朝鲜掌握了这一技术，美国将不得不强化其西太平洋（接近中国的地区）的导弹防御，以消除朝鲜的威胁。

column1: The result, invariably, will be heightened Sino-US tension.
column2: 其结果免不了将加剧中美紧张。

column1: China has no interest in such an outcome.
column2: 如此结局不符合中国的利益。

column1: The long-term costs of a worsening security confrontation with the US would exceed the short-term tactical benefits to be derived from continuing to support the North as a buffer state, especially given China’s deepening relationship with South Korea.
column2: 对美安全冲突恶化的长期成本将压倒继续支持朝鲜作为缓冲国所获得的战术好处，特别是在中国欲韩国关系深化的条件下。

column1: Though Park’s visit to Beijing has not closed the gap between the Chinese and South Korean approaches to the North Korean nuclear issue, it does seem to have prepared the ground for closer coordination between the two governments.
column2: 尽管朴槿惠的北京之行并没有完全弥合中国和韩国关于朝鲜核问题的分歧，但的确为两国政府跟紧密的合作做了铺垫。

column1: Those improved ties matter, because the time has come for China to rebalance its traditional geostrategic interests with its role as a global leader.
column2: 这些关系的改善十分重要，因为中国需要重新平衡其传统地缘政治利益和全球领袖的角色。

column1: That calls for a Chinese policy of disciplined engagement toward North Korea, without which an internationally coordinated solution to the nuclear problem – and, with it, the promise of more productive relations with the US and South Korea – will be impossible.
column2: 这需要中国为朝鲜制定纪律，否则朝鲜核问题的国际合作解决方案就无法实现，与美国和韩国建立更加建设性的关系的承诺也无法兑现。

column1: Wanted: An Arab Jean Monnet
column2: 寻找阿拉伯的让·莫内

column1: The Middle East is beyond doubt one of the most dangerous crisis regions worldwide.
column2: 毫无疑问中东是全世界最危险的危机高发区。

column1: The next war, terrorist attack, or failed peace initiative may lurk just around the corner.
column2: 下一场战争、恐怖袭击或和平倡议的失败都使其四伏的危机随时可能爆发。

column1: Compared to the politics of this region, a rollercoaster ride is downright calming.
column2: 相对于这一地区的政治局势来说，坐过山车的感觉应该算是让人十分心平气和的了。

column1: And yet the Middle East is also a region that, throughout its innumerable conflicts, has hardly changed, languishing in a strange kind of standstill.
column2: 然而，也正是中东这样一个地区，经过了无数的冲突后，几乎没有发生任何变化，至今仍在一种怪异的停滞不前的状态中煎熬。

column1: There must be an intrinsic correlation between the lack of developmental dynamism of most Middle Eastern societies and the fact that the region is so crisis-prone.
column2: 大部分的中东地区的社会缺乏发展的活力，而且该地区是如此容易发生危机，这两者之间一定存在着内在的联系。

column1: The conflict between Israel and the Palestinians stands out as an example of the static nature of this key geopolitical region, because it seems to be completely unaffected by any international upheaval.
column2: 以色列和巴勒斯坦之间的冲突，是这一重要地缘政治区域的停滞不前的一个突出例子，因为这种冲突似乎完全不受任何国际形势动荡的影响。

column1: The Ottomans, the British, decolonization, the Cold War, numerous American Presidents, and even more international mediators have come and gone, but the parameters of this conflict and the inability to find a solution never seem to change.
column2: 土耳其人、英国人、非殖民化、冷战、多任美国总统，甚至更多的国际调停人士来了又去，可是这一冲突的各种特征，以及找不到解决办法的困窘，似乎从未改变过。

column1: However, this impression – correct where the past is concerned – might prove deceptive in the future, because two global megatrends will subject the region to more profound change than all the many previous political crises and wars were able to bring about.
column2: 然而，这一印象，尽管从过去的历史来看是正确的，但可能在未来会被证明具有迷惑性，因为有两个全球大趋势，将给该地区带来前无所有变化，这些变化比过去多场政治危机和战争所带来的所有变化的总和还要更为深刻。

column1: The first is globalization, by which ever-larger parts of the Arab world, beginning with the Persian Gulf and its oil countries, will be influenced, albeit slowly, both economically and culturally.
column2: 第一是全球化，从波斯湾和该地区的产油国开始，阿拉伯世界越来越大的部分将受此大趋势的影响。 尽管全球化对其影响，无论在经济上还是文化上，其速度都是缓慢的。

column1: With the shift of wealth and power from the West to the East, the pressures of globalization will increasingly come from the East.
column2: 随着财富和权力从西方向东方转移，全球化的压力将越来越多地来自东方。

column1: In Morocco, for instance, investment from the Arab oil countries has already significantly reduced Europe’s importance.
column2: 例如，在摩洛哥，来自阿拉伯产油国的投资已经大大削弱了欧洲的重要性。

column1: The inherent contradiction between a governance structure incapable of change and economic modernization, between cultural and religious conservatism and social and normative transformation, will therefore increase and bring about new, additional frictions if positive answers to these fundamental changes cannot be found.
column2: 无法进行变革的治理结构和经济现代化之间的矛盾，文化和宗教保守主义和社会规范变革之间的矛盾，如果无法找到解决这些根本性变化的正面答案，这些固有的矛盾将加剧和带来新的、更多的摩擦。

column1: The second megatrend is the global climate crisis.
column2: 第二个大趋势是全球的气候危机。

column1: Apart from those countries that are threatened – partly or completely –by rising sea levels, global warming will primarily affect the desert belts and their already precarious water supplies.
column2: 除了那些部分或完全受到海平面上升的威胁国家，全球气候变暖还将主要影响沙漠带和那些地区已经岌岌可危的水供应。

column1: And, while the conflicts in the Middle East are primarily about territory, this includes the scarce water resources so essential for survival.
column2: 虽然中东的冲突主要是领土方面的，但也包括生存所必需的稀缺的水资源问题。

column1: Rapid population growth, a dramatic increase in water consumption due to industrial, agricultural, and tourism growth, and rising standards of living will make the water issue even more important to the region’s political stability than it is already.
column2: 人口的迅速增长、工农业和旅游业增长所引起的水消耗量大幅增长以及不断提高的生活水准，使现在已经对该地区的政治稳定起重要作用的水问题变得愈加重要。

column1: A sustainable answer to questions of such vital importance to the Middle East only makes sense if it is regional in character.
column2: 要回答这类对中东至关重要的问题并使答案有说服力，答案必须是针对整个区域的才会有意义。

column1: And the same applies to the increasing demand for energy: although the region as a whole is rich in energy resources, their uneven geographical distribution suggests that any viable solution must be built on cooperation.
column2: 这个标准也同样适用于能源需求增加的问题上：尽管整个地区有丰富的能源资源，但地域分布不平衡；这说明，任何可行的解决方案必须建立在合作的基础上。

column1: Of course, resolving the political crises and conflicts remains the top priority.
column2: 当然，解决政治危机和冲突仍是首要任务。

column1: To make regional peace and stability possible, however, the region’s very young and rapidly increasing populations require an economic perspective that makes their participation in globalization possible – in a dignified manner and grounded in their own culture and history.
column2: 然而，为了使区域的和平与稳定成为可能，该地区的非常年轻的、并迅速膨胀的人口，需要一个经济的视角使他们能够有尊严地、并基于自身的文化和历史上参与全球化进程。

column1: The Middle East’s individual states won’t be able to manage this without regional cooperation.
column2: 没有区域合作，中东的各分散的国家将无法做到上述这一点。

column1: The European Union’s successful track record could therefore provide an almost perfect model.
column2: 因此，欧盟的成功可以提供一个近乎完美的榜样。

column1: In fact, the preconditions for intra-regional cooperation – up to partial integration of the interests of the countries involved – look more auspicious than they did in Western Europe in the early 1950’s.
column2: 事实上，区域内合作的先决条件-参与的国家的利益部分一体化-看起来更比五十年代初的西欧更加成熟和有希望。

column1: Europe had neither a common language, nor was it as religiously and culturally as homogeneous as the Middle East.
column2: 那时的欧洲既没有共同语言也不如中东在宗教和文化上那样具有同质性。

column1: For Europe, the starting point was visionary leaders like Jean Monnet and the creation of new institutions like the Coal and Steel Community.
column2: 欧洲的出发点是出现了让·莫内那样富有远见的领导人和新机构如煤钢共同体的创立。

column1: In the Middle East, the process of regional integration could begin with water and energy.
column2: 在中东，区域一体化进程可以从与水和能源着手。

column1: A common market for goods and services could follow, along with a regional security system.
column2: 加上区域安全体系，一个商品和服务的共同市场便可以跟进。

column1: This would, finally, give the Middle East – a region poor in growth and rich in conflicts – a distinct identity, making it a player in global economic terms as well, and thus enabling it to become the architect of its own future.
column2: 这最终会给中东-这个缺乏增长但不乏冲突的地区-一个独特的身份，使其也成为在全球经济领域种的一个角色，进而使它能设计自己的未来。

column1: Europe, once the continent of war, has shown that this is possible.
column2: 曾经战事频繁的欧洲大陆已经证明了这是可能的。

column1: And Europe can help the Middle East – its neighboring region – achieve this strategic objective.
column2: 欧洲可以帮助中东，也是它的区域邻居，实现这一战略目标。

column1: An instrument for it already exists: the new Union for the Mediterranean.
column2: 一个实现目标的工具已经存在：新成立的地中海联盟。

column1: In any case, the time of standstill in the Middle East is coming to an end.
column2: 总之，中东停滞不前的时代即将结束。

column1: Whether the consequences of this development will be good or bad depends on whether the region can muster the foresight and strength actively to shape this process.
column2: 这种发展的后果是好是坏，取决于该地区是否能拿出远见和力量积极创造这一进程。

column1: Imagination, vision, and pragmatic perseverance will be necessary.
column2: 想象力、远见和务实的毅力是必需的。

column1: What is needed now is an Arabian Jean Monnet.
column2: 现在需要一个阿拉伯的让·莫内。

column1: A Fresh Look at the Afghan War
column2: 看待阿富汗战争的全新视角

column1: NEW YORK – With the Syria crisis dominating headlines, few are paying attention to America’s longest war.
column2: 纽约—随着叙利亚危机占据媒体头条，很少有人关注美国持续时间最长的战争。

column1: In fact, the war in Afghanistan has hardly been mentioned in the early months of US President Donald Trump’s administration, despite the presence of two experienced military officers – Defense Secretary Jim Mattis and National Security Adviser H.R. McMaster – in key positions.
column2: 事实上，阿富汗战争在美国总统特朗普上台后的几个月来极少被提及，尽管两位经验丰富的军官 — — 国防部长马蒂斯和国家安全顾问麦克马斯特 — — 身居要职。

column1: This must change.
column2: 这必须改变。

column1: After 15 years of failed intervention, the situation in Afghanistan is out of control.
column2: 在进行了15年的失败的干预后，阿富汗局面已经失控。

column1: The unity government that emerged after the contested presidential election of 2014 is dysfunctional, and security conditions are rapidly deteriorating.
column2: 2014年充满争议的总统选举后所形成的统一政府无法正常运转，安全环境也在迅速恶化。

column1: Meanwhile, opium production is surging, and Afghanistan now ranks second in the world in money laundering (after Iran).
column2: 与此同时，阿富汗鸦片产量飙升，并且目前已经位列洗钱世界排行榜第二名（仅次于伊朗 ） 。

column1: In Europe and elsewhere, inflows of Afghan refugees continue unabated.
column2: 在欧洲和其他地区，阿富汗难民不断地涌入。

column1: The war in Afghanistan has exacted enormous costs.
column2: 阿富汗战争已经造成了巨大的代价。

column1: So far, fatalities include roughly 3,500 coalition soldiers (some 70% of which were US troops), about the same number of contractors, and some 100,000 Afghans (including security forces, opposition fighters, and civilians).
column2: 目前，死亡名单包括大约3,500名联军士兵（其中70%为美军 ） ， 大约相同数量的承包商，以及大约100,000名阿富汗人（包括安全部队、反对派武装和平民 ） 。

column1: Since 2002, the US has spent over $780 billion on the war – roughly equivalent to the entire US foreign-affairs budget for more than two decades.
column2: 自2002年以来，美国已在这场战争中投入了7,800亿多美元 — — 大约相当于二十多年来美国外交事务预算的总和。

column1: Additional non-budgetary expenditure, including disability payments and compensation to the families of fallen soldiers, will add hundreds of billions more to the war’s total cost.
column2: 如果算上额外的非预算开支，包括残疾赔偿金和阵亡将士抚恤金，这场战争的总代价还要在增加几百亿美元。

column1: The war in Afghanistan was supposed to be over a long time ago.
column2: 阿富汗战争理应早就结束了。

column1: After all, US troops did not enter the country to reconstruct it or create a democracy.
column2: 毕竟，美军进入阿富汗不是为了它的复兴或建立一个民主国家。

column1: But a series of missteps – misguided civilian policies and misplaced priorities on the part of the government and its donors – have boosted recruitment for the very groups the US is supposed to be quelling, including al-Qaeda, the Afghan Taliban, and, more recently, the Islamic State.
column2: 但一系列失误 — — 错误的民事政策和政府及其出资者的错误的工作重点 — — 让美国准备清剿的武装力量更加壮大了，它们包括基地组织、阿富汗塔利班以及最近的伊斯兰国。

column1: The “nation-building” and counterinsurgency strategy that accompanied US President Barack Obama’s troop surge in 2010 was meant to turn the war around.
column2: 2010年伴随奥巴马总统的增兵而提出的“建国”和平叛战略原本是为了扭转战局。

column1: Instead, as US and allied troops left areas that had supposedly been “cleared,” the Taliban and other extremist groups soon returned.
column2: 相反，随着美国和联军离开应该已经“清理”的地区，塔利班和其他极端组织很快死灰复燃。

column1: The 43% increase in opium production in just the last year both reflects and reinforces the growing strength of these groups, which use drug-trafficking revenues to finance their operations.
column2: 仅仅在去年，鸦片产量就增加了43 % ， 这既反映、也增强了这些组织的优势，它们利用贩毒的收入来为行动提供资金。

column1: Of global annual flows of 430-450 tons of heroin and morphine, about 380 tons are produced with Afghan opium.
column2: 在全球每年430—450吨的海洛因和吗啡流通量中，大约380吨是用阿富汗鸦片生产的。

column1: Meanwhile, Afghanistan has been allowed to fall into an aid trap.
column2: 与此同时，美国坐看阿富汗陷入了援助陷阱。

column1: The US has disbursed about $110 billion for Afghan reconstruction.
column2: 美国拿出了大约1,100亿美元用于阿富汗复兴。

column1: (Adjusted for inflation, that is equivalent to the $12.5 billion cost of the Marshall Plan for reconstruction in Europe after World War II.)
column2: （经通胀调整，大约相当于二战后复兴欧洲的马歇尔计划所投入了125亿美元 ） 。

column1: Roughly $70 billion of those funds went to creating and financing Afghan security forces, and $40 billion went to non-military expenditure.
column2: 其中大约700亿被用于建立阿富汗安全力量并提供经费，400亿被用于非军事开支。

column1: Yet, despite all that spending, Afghanistan will be unable to stand on its own feet for decades to come.
column2: 但尽管投入了巨资，阿富汗仍然不可能在未来几十年中自力更生。

column1: The country’s cumulative GDP from 2002 to 2015 was only $170 billion; GDP in 2016 totaled just $17 billion, or $525 per capita.
column2: 2002—2015年，阿富汗累计GDP只有1,700亿美元；2016年GDP总共只有170亿美元，或人均525美元。

column1: Non-military aid from the US and others has amounted to 50% of GDP, on average, every year since 2002. And that aid has consistently been delivered in the same inefficient ways, even as the US Special Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction (SIGAR) and others have repeatedly highlighted enormous amounts of waste, fraud, and abuse.
column2: 自2002年以来，来自美国和其他国家的非军事援助平均每年都要占GDP的50%而这些援助一直以效率低下的方式交付，即使美国阿富汗复兴特别检察官（SIGAR）和其他官员反复强调存在巨大的资金浪费、欺诈和滥用。

column1: As the Trump administration alters US foreign-policy priorities, devising a more effective strategy for America’s Afghan operations must be a priority.
column2: 随着特朗普政府改变美国的外交政策重点，制定更有效的美国阿富汗行动战略必须作为重点。

column1: Only after such a strategy is in place should the administration meet the US military’s requests to send more troops.
column2: 只有在落实了这一战略后，政府才应该满足美军继续增兵的要求。

column1: Fortunately, both Mattis and McMaster know that simply throwing more troops and more money at Afghanistan won’t do the job.
column2: 幸运的是，马蒂斯和麦克马斯特都知道，仅仅向阿富汗投入更多部队和更多金钱根本无济于事。

column1: Indeed, both have emphasized the need to support counterinsurgency operations with effective policies that do not create new enemies and fuel the need for “more ammunition.”
column2: 事实上，他们两人都强调要用不会创造新敌人和助长“更多弹药”的需求的有效政策来支持平叛行动。

column1: Retired high-level officers from all branches of the US Armed Forces have taken this logic a step further, telling congressional leaders that combating terrorism requires addressing its causes, such as lack of opportunity, insecurity, injustice, and hopelessness.
column2: 美军各军种退休高级军官顺着这一逻辑更进一步，对国会领导人表示打击恐怖主义要直击其根源，比如缺少机会、不安全、不公平和没有希望。

column1: To create more cost-effective, integrated, and inclusive policies that benefit most Afghans, not just the privileged few, US leaders will need to engage in some radical rethinking.
column2: 要制定更具性价比、更全面、更包容的政策，从而让大部分阿富汗人而不是一小撮特权人士受益，美国领导人需要进行一些彻底的反思。

column1: Various proposals are on the table, including one of my own: to create synergistic “reconstruction zones” (RZs) – one aimed at local production and another aimed at exports – that support economic recovery.
column2: 可供选择的方案有很多，我本人也提出了一份：建立协同“复兴区 ” — —其一针对本地生产，其二针对出口 — — 以支持经济复苏。

column1: Such RZs can help the resource-rich Afghanistan to replace aid with foreign direct investment and export revenues.
column2: 这些复兴区能帮助资源富裕的阿富汗用外国直接投资和出口收入代替援助。

column1: Foreign investors would work in support of local communities, enabling them to produce food and services for local consumption, rather than displacing them, as is so often the case.
column2: 外国投资者将帮助支持本地社区，让它们能够生产满足本地消费的食品和服务，而不是像经常发生的那样取代它们。

column1: In exchange, the communities would protect the RZs, so that investors can produce for export at a lower security risk.
column2: 作为交换，这些社区要保护复兴区，以使投资者可以在较低的安全风险环境下生产出口产品。

column1: After 15 years of conflict, ending the war in Afghanistan may seem to have lost some of its urgency.
column2: 阿富汗冲突已经爆发了15年，结束这场战争似乎已经不再那么紧迫。

column1: But the truth is that it is more urgent than ever, not just to check the flows of refugees to Europe and elsewhere, but also to undermine terrorist recruitment efforts.
column2: 但真相是它其实比以往任何时候都更加紧迫，不仅是为了遏制涌向欧洲和其他地区的难民流，也是为了阻止恐怖分子的招募工作。

column1: By promoting “impact investment” by those seeking both economic gain and social progress, and by advancing projects that benefit foreign investors and local communities alike, the Trump administration may be able to do just that.
column2: 通过促进由追求经济收益和社会进步的投资者进行的“影响力投资 ” ， 以及通过推进同时有利于外国投资者和本地社区的项目，特朗普政府或能够完成这一工作。

column1: Washington and the Art of the Possible
column2: 华盛顿和可能的艺术

column1: CHICAGO – These days, the United States media are full of ordinary Americans venting their rage at the incompetence and immaturity of their politicians.
column2: 芝加哥 — — 近日来，美国各大媒体充斥着普通美国人对美国政客无能和不成熟的愤怒。

column1: Even though the US government’s debt limit was raised in the nick of time, the process was – and remains – fraught with risk.
column2: 美国政府在关键时刻终于成功地提高了债务上限，但整个过程险象环生，而且尚未脱离危险。

column1: Why, the public asks, can’t politicians sit down together like sensible adults and come up with a timely agreement that commands broad consensus?
column2: 公众怒问，为什么政客们不能像理智的成年人那样坐下来好好谈，及时达成广泛一致？

column1: If we can balance our household budgets, they ask irately, why can’t our political leaders?
column2: 公众怒问，既然我们可以实现家庭预算平衡，为什么政客们就不行呢？

column1: The reality, though, is that US politicians reflect the views of the American electorate – views that are fundamentally inconsistent. The absence of broad consensus is no wonder.
column2: 然而，现实是美国政客所代表的正是美国全体选民的意见，而全体选民的意见注定不会一致，这丝毫都不令人奇怪。

column1: Indeed, the last-minute agreement to raise the debt ceiling is proof that the politicians did what they were sent to Washington to do: represent their constituencies and only compromise in the interests of the country as a whole.
column2: 事实上，在最后一刻就提升债务上限达成一致倒是证明，政客们完成了自己的使命：代表自己的选区，只对全美国整体利益让步。

column1: The key question is whether the political gridlock exposed by the debt-ceiling debate will worsen in the run-up to the 2012 presidential and congressional elections – if not beyond.
column2: 关键的问题是，由债务上限争论导致的政治僵局是否会对2012年（甚至此后各届）总统和国会选举造成不良影响。

column1: That is possible, but we should not overlook cause for hope in what America’s politicians just accomplished.
column2: 这并非不可能，但我们也不应该忽视美国政客刚刚所取得的成果。

column1: Let’s start with why the electorate is so polarized.
column2: 让我们从选民为何会如此两极分化开始。

column1: There are two key divisive factors: income and age.
column2: 其中的决定性因素有二：收入和年龄。

column1: Income inequality has been growing in the US over the last three decades, largely because the labor market has increasingly demanded skills that the education system has been unable to supply.
column2: 过去三十年来，美国的收入不平等情况一直在恶化，这大部分是因为教育体系越来越难以满足劳动力市场所要求的技能。

column1: The everyday consequence for the middle class is a stagnant paycheck and growing employment insecurity, as the old economy of well-paying low-skilled jobs with good benefits withers away.
column2: 这给中产阶级带来了怎样的后果呢？ 薪金增长停滞，失业风险增加，因为低技能要求的高薪高福利旧经济一去不复返了。

column1: Until the financial crisis, the easy availability of credit, especially against home equity, enabled the middle class to sustain higher consumption despite stagnant incomes.
column2: 在金融危机爆发前，信贷泛滥（特别是住房信贷）让中产阶级得以维系高消费水平，尽管他们的收入并未增加。

column1: With the collapse of the housing bubble, many people lost their jobs and health insurance, risked losing their homes, and suddenly had little reason for economic optimism.
column2: 随着房地产泡沫的破裂，许多人丢到了自己的工作和医疗保险，还面临着丢掉房子的风险，一夜之间，他们就失去了所有对经济保持乐观的理由。

column1: The response from America’s Democratic Party, which has traditionally represented this constituency, was to promise affordable universal health care and more education spending, while also protecting government jobs and entitlement programs.
column2: 传统上代表这类选民的民主党提出的应对措施是承诺推行人人负担得起的普适医保以及增加教育支出，同时保证政府工作岗位和权利计划。

column1: When added up, such spending is unaffordable, especially with current federal revenues at just 15% of GDP.
column2: 但我们把所需支出一加总就会发现这根本是无法负担的，特别是在联邦岁入只有GDP的15%的情况下。

column1: The solution for many Democrats is to raise revenues by taxing the rich.
column2: 在很多民主党看来，这可以通过向富人征税以增加岁入来解决。

column1: But the rich are not the idle rich of the past; they are the working rich.
column2: 但富人已经不再是过去的有闲阶级了；现在的富人是劳动致富的。

column1: To balance the budget only by taxing the rich will require a significant increase in income taxes, to the point that it would lower incentives for work and entrepreneurial activity considerably.
column2: 仅仅依靠向富人征税来平衡预算将使所得税大幅提高，就目前的情况而言，这会大大降低努力工作的激励和企业家行为。

column1: This is not to say that taxes on the rich cannot be increased at all; but such increases cannot be the primary way of balancing the budget.
column2: 这并不是说完全不能对富人增税；但增税不应该作为平衡预算的首选方案。

column1: Republicans, trying to give voice to many working Americans’ ambient uneasiness with rising government expenditures, as well as to the growing anger of the working rich, find it easier to defend a principle than a particular constituency.
column2: 共和党试图吐出美国劳动阶级的心声 — — 境况越来越差，而政府支出越来越大，同时也试图代表劳动致富的富人表达心中的愤怒。 他们知道，维系选民支持比捍卫原则容易多了。

column1: Hence their mantra: no additional taxes.
column2: 因此，共和党的口号是：不加税。

column1: The neat divide based on income is muddled by the elderly.
column2: 收入带来的分歧是明确的，但年龄则否。

column1: It is understandable that older Americans who have few savings want to protect their Social Security and Medicare benefits.
column2: 不难理解，没有多少积蓄的老年人希望保护他们的社会保险和医疗保险福利。

column1: However, even elderly Tea Party Republicans, who are typically against big government, defend these programs because they view them as a form of property right, paid for when they worked.
column2: 但是，即使是通常反对大政府的高龄茶党共和党人现在也在捍卫这些计划，因为他们将它们视为产权，是他们通过自己过去的劳动所应获得的报酬。

column1: In truth, rising life expectancy and growing health-care costs mean that today’s elderly have contributed only a fraction of what they expect to receive from Social Security and Medicare.
column2: 事实上，预期寿命的提高与医疗成本的膨胀意味着与当前老年人所期待获得的社会保险和医疗保险福利比起来，他们对社会所做的贡献实在不值一提。

column1: The government made a mistake in the past by not raising taxes to finance these programs or reducing the benefits that they promised.
column2: 政府过去犯了一个错误，没有增税来为这些计划融资，也没有削减福利承诺。

column1: Unless the growth of these entitlement programs is curbed now, today’s young will pay dearly for that mistake, in the form of higher taxes now and lower benefits when they are old.
column2: 除非这些权利计划现在可以被削减，否则这个错误将极大增加现今年青一代的负担 — — 他们将在现在承担高税收，而在年老时享受低福利。

column1: But the elderly are politically active and powerful.
column2: 但老年人在政治上更活跃，也更有影响力。

column1: Not only do many defend their entitlements strongly; some oppose growth in other types of public spending for fear that it will weaken the government’s ability to pay for the benefits that they believe they are owed.
column2: 许多人不仅强烈捍卫他们的权利，而且还反对其他方面公共支出的增加，因为他们担心这会削弱政府支付他们认为自己应得福利的能力。

column1: These then are the roots of America fiscal impasse, which has produced passionate constituencies viscerally opposed to compromise.
column2: 这些就是美国财政僵局的根源，而财政僵局造成了选民发自内心的对妥协的强烈的反对。

column1: Any political deal significantly before the debt-ceiling deadline would have exposed politicians to charges of betrayal from their constituents.
column2: 任何在债务上限最后期限前所达成的政治妥协都会让政客背上背叛选民的恶名。

column1: And, given that President Barack Obama would ultimately be held responsible for a default, he needed the deal more than the Republicans did.
column2: 而一旦违约，最终负责的将是奥巴马政府，因此奥巴马比共和党更需要妥协。

column1: So he had to coerce his party into accepting a deal full of spending cuts and devoid of tax increases.
column2: 于是，他必须强迫他所在的民主党接受只有支出削减、丝毫不见增税字样的方案。

column1: Will the deal deliver what it promises?
column2: 最后的方案能够兑现承诺吗？

column1: A bipartisan committee has to propose $1.5 trillion in deficit reduction by the end of this year, and Congress must either accept that proposal, or see immediate, politically painful expenditure cuts, which would include defense spending – an area that America’s Republicans care about strongly.
column2: 一个跨党派委员会必须拿出在今年年底前削减1.5万亿美元赤字的方案，国会要么接受这一方案，要么接受马上开始但在政治上极为痛苦的方案（其中包括防务支出削减，而这是美国共和党所强力捍卫的领域 ） ， 没有第三个选择。

column1: If this structure works as advertised, Congress will be forced to reach a compromise, which can be sold once again by politicians to their polarized constituencies as being necessary to avoid a worse outcome.
column2: 如果这一结构如宣传的那样起效，那么国会必须达成妥协，而要达到妥协，政客就必须再一次说服两极分化的选民以避免更糟糕的结果。

column1: This time, Obama’s Democrats will be on a level playing field, because both parties will be held equally responsible for a failure to reach a deal.
column2: 这一次，奥巴马的民主党将和共和党站在同一条起跑线上，因为如果不能达成一致，两大党派所要负的责任是一样的。

column1: Ultimately, the big necessary decisions on curbing entitlement growth and reforming the tax code will probably have to wait until after the next election, giving the divided electorate an opportunity to reflect on its own inconsistency and send a clearer message.
column2: 最终，削减权利增长和改革税法所必须的重大决策可能不得不等到下一次选举之后才会做出，这给了意见相左的两派选民一次机会，反思自身阵营内部的不一致并给出清晰的信号。

column1: In the meantime, US politicians might have done just about enough to convince debt markets that America’s credit is still good.
column2: 与此同时，美国政客或许能够勉强使债券市场相信美国信用亦然坚挺。

column1: For that, Americans – and others around the world – should stop pillorying them and give them their due credit.
column2: 为此，美国和世界其他国家的人们应该停止攻击美国政府，给予他们应该给予的信用。

column1: Was Killing Bin Laden a Mistake?
column2: 杀死本·拉登错了吗？

column1: LONDON – “He lived a hero, he died a martyr...if they killed one Osama, a thousand others will be born,” says a comment on a Facebook group called “We are all Osama bin Laden.”
column2: 伦敦 — — Facebook网站上一个名叫“我们都是奥萨马·本·拉登”的组织称“他生为英雄，死为烈士…他们杀死一个奥萨马，一千个奥萨马会就此诞生 。 ”

column1: The group was formed one hour after US President Barack Obama’s announcement of the Al Qaeda leader’s death.
column2: 该组织成立于美国总统巴拉克·奥巴马宣布基地组织领袖死讯后的短短一小时。

column1: That Facebook group already has around 30,000 “likes.”
column2: 这家Facebook组织已经拥有约30，000名“追随者 ” 。

column1: Moreover, there are more than 50 similar groups on Facebook.
column2: 此外，Facebook网站上类似的组织还有50多家。

column1: Reaction to Bin Laden’s death on Al Jazeera and other Arabic news outlets has been mixed.
column2: 半岛电视台和其他阿拉伯新闻媒体对本·拉登之死反应复杂。

column1: Some view the man considered a mass murderer in the West as an icon, and his death and burial at sea at the hands of American forces will not undermine that perception in the eyes of his sympathizers.
column2: 有人把这个西方人眼中的刽子手视为偶像，他死于美军之手并被海葬丝毫不会影响支持者对他的看法。

column1: Indeed, Egypt’s former Mufti, Sheikh Nasr Farid Wasil, has already declared Bin Laden a martyr, “because he was killed by the hands of the enemy.”
column2: 实际上，埃及的前任穆夫提谢赫·纳斯尔·法里德·瓦西勒“因本·拉登死于敌手”已将他奉为烈士。

column1: (Sheikh Wasil, it should be made known, has no links or known sympathies for Al Qaeda and he represents a very different Islamic school of thought.)
column2: （值得一提的是，谢赫·瓦西勒此前与基地组织既无关系也不抱同情态度，他所代表的是一个完全不同的伊斯兰学派 ） 。

column1: Aside from the mixed signals online, in the virtual world, the critical question is whether eliminating Bin Laden marks the beginning of Al Qaeda’s demise in reality.
column2: 抛开错综复杂的网络反应，虚拟世界的关键问题在于消灭本·拉登是否标志着基地组织开始毁灭。

column1: Some terrorist organizations have, of course, collapsed following the death of their charismatic leader.
column2: 当然，有些恐怖组织在其超凡领袖死后逐渐土崩瓦解。

column1: The case of Shoko Asahara, the founder of Aum Shinrikyo (the Japanese group that organized the Sarin gas attack on Tokyo’s subway in 1995), comes to mind here.
column2: 这不禁让人想起（组织1995年东京地铁沙林毒气袭击事件的日本组织）奥姆真理教创始人麻原彰晃。

column1: But capturing and trying violent leaders is probably a better marker of the end of such organizations – the chances of such an outcome being higher when such leaders recant their views and call on their followers to lay down their arms.
column2: 但逮捕并审判暴力领袖也许是宣告组织终结的更好的方式 — — 如果该领导人宣布放弃自己的信仰并号召追随者放下武器，恐怖组织瓦解的可能性就会增大。

column1: Abimael Guzmán, the leader of the Maoist Shining Path in Peru, and Abdullah Ocalan, the leader of the Kurdistan Workers’ Party (PKK) in Turkey, are notable examples of this.
column2: 这方面的著名事例有秘鲁的毛派光辉道路领袖阿维马埃尔·古斯曼和土耳其库尔德工人党领袖阿卜杜拉•奥贾兰。

column1: By contrast, far from causing the demise of an armed movement, the killing of a charismatic leader at the hands of his enemies can transform such a figure into a martyr.
column2: 相反，被神化的领袖死于敌手不但不能导致武装运动的解体，反而会使其上升到烈士的高度。

column1: Che Guevera was far more valuable to leftist militancy after his death than he was while alive.
column2: 切·格瓦拉死后远比他在世时对左翼好战份子的价值更高。

column1: Armed Islamism has its particularities, of course, but it also shares important characteristics with some of these groups, including the relationship between the physical elimination of a leader and organizational survival.
column2: 当然，伊斯兰教武装有其自身的独特性，但领袖肉体消灭和组织生存之间的关系等等重要特点与其他某些武装组织相通。

column1: Decentralized organizations with relevant ideologies, operating in contexts full of conditions conducive to armed action, usually survive leadership losses, whereas hierarchical, cult-like organizations often do not.
column2: 在充满暴力诱因的环境中行动的具有相关意识形态的分散化组织通常能经受住失去领袖的打击，而等级森严的邪教组织则往往不能。

column1: Since 9/11, Al Qaeda has been far from a hierarchical, cult-like organization.
column2: 自9/11事件后，基地组织已经与等级森严的邪教组织大相径庭。

column1: Abu Musab al-Zaraqawi’s Al Qaeda offshoot in Iraq demonstrates this well: the group was called Al Qaeda in Mesopotamia for recruitment and propaganda purposes, but it was quite autonomous organizationally and operationally.
column2: 这一点在阿布·穆萨布·扎卡维的基地组织伊拉克海外分部问题上得到了充分的证明：该组织为方便招募和宣传起见在美索不达米亚对外自称为基地组织，但无论在机构还是运作方面都具有相当的自主性。

column1: When Bin Laden’s close collaborator Ayman al-Zawahiri asked al-Zaraqawi to avoid targeting Shiites, al-Zaraqawi instead escalated the violence against them.
column2: 本·拉登的亲密合作者艾曼·扎瓦希里要求扎卡维不要袭击什叶派的时候，扎卡维反而加强了对什叶派的进攻。

column1: Al Qaeda’s franchise model applies to Algeria, Yemen, North Mali, and Somalia as well.
column2: 基地组织的授权招募模式同样也适用于阿尔及利亚、也门、北马里和索马里等国。

column1: And, like guerrilla movements of yore, Al Qaeda partakes of “ideological front” tactics: small urban cells and/or vulnerable individuals subscribe to the ideology and self-recruit or self-start an affiliated cell.
column2: 基地组织像很久以前的游击运动一样采用所谓的“思想战线”模式：由接受相关意识形态的城市小团体和/或脆弱个体自主招募或者成立附属机构。

column1: In all of its decentralized modes of operation, Bin Laden mainly played the role of inspirational guide and iconic figurehead – a role better played when dead by American guns than alive, hiding from them.
column2: 在所有这些分散化的运作模式中，本·拉登主要担任负责引导和鼓舞人心的标志性代表人物 — — 死于美军之手比活着东躲西藏更有利于完成这样一项任务。

column1: Consider Sayyid Qutb, the Islamist intellectual who influenced Bin Laden and others.
column2: 比如影响本·拉登和其他势力的伊斯兰知识分子赛义德·库特布。

column1: Qutb was executed by Gamel Abdel Nasser’s dictatorship in Egypt in August 1966, in an attempt to reduce his influence.
column2: 为削弱其影响，库特布于1966年8月在埃及被加梅尔·纳赛尔的独裁政权执行死刑。

column1: That tactic backfired badly.
column2: 这一举动产生了惊人的反作用。

column1: Of the 98 fellow Muslim Brotherhood prisoners with whom Qutb discussed his new confrontational ideology in 1964, 35 were strongly supportive, 23 strongly opposed, and 50 hesitant.
column2: 在1964年与库特布讨论其全新对抗理念的共98名穆斯林兄弟会犯人中，35人强烈支持，23人坚决反对，其余50人举棋不定。

column1: Despite his intellectual status and prestige, Qutb had failed to persuade the majority of like-minded inmates under conditions of repression.
column2: 尽管拥有知识份子的威望和地位，库特布仍然未能在高压环境下说服绝大多数与他志同道合的犯人。

column1: But, no sooner was Qutb the intellectual executed than Qutb the grand martyr was born.
column2: 但就在知识分子库特布被处决之日，伟大的烈士库特布浴火重生。

column1: His supporters soon numbered in the thousands, rather than the dozens, and he came to inspire generations, not just individual inmates.
column2: 他的支持者很快就从区区几十发展到数以千计，而受他鼓舞的也从几名囚犯发展到几代人。

column1: Moreover, Qutb was executed by an Arab Nationalist Muslim leader, whereas Bin Laden was killed by US Navy Seals.
column2: 此外，库特布被阿拉伯民族主义穆斯林领袖处决，而杀死本·拉登的则是美国的海豹突击队。

column1: That makes a significant difference in the Muslim world.
column2: 这在穆斯林世界中有着很大的不同。

column1: Imprisonment, followed by recantation of violence, has become almost a trend in several jihadist groups, notably the 20,000-strong Egyptian Islamic Group, factions of the al-Jihad Organization in Egypt, and smaller groups like the Libyan Islamic Fighting Group.
column2: 遭到监禁后公开宣布放弃暴力，已近乎成为几个圣战组织，特别是拥有20，000多人的埃及伊斯兰组织、埃及圣战组织分部和利比亚伊斯兰战斗组织等小型组织的一种倾向。

column1: Leading figures in armed Islamist movements have not only abandoned political violence, but have also de-legitimized it as a means for social and political change after spending periods in prison.
column2: 伊斯兰运动领导人不仅放弃政治暴力，而且在度过一段铁窗生涯后承认以暴力实现社会和政治变革为非法。

column1: For example, Sayyid Imam al-Sharif (a.k.a. Dr. Fadl), an Al Qaeda ideologue for a decade, published several books denouncing armed activism, both theologically and on tactical grounds, after spending several years in prison.
column2: 比如在数十年时间里一直扮演基地组织理论家角色的赛义德·伊玛目·谢里夫被关押几年后就出版了几本在宗教和技术层面谴责激进武装的著作。

column1: The same applies to the Islamic Group, a movement implicated in violent acts in almost a dozen countries throughout the 1980’s and 1990’s, including armed insurgency in Egypt, bombings in the United States and Croatia, assassination attempts in Ethiopia, and training camps in Afghanistan.
column2: 20世纪80到90年代曾牵涉到十几个国家的暴力活动（包括埃及的武装叛乱、美国和克罗地亚的炸弹爆炸、埃塞俄比亚的暗杀行动和阿富汗训练营）的好战组织伊斯兰集团也属于这种情况。

column1: In the 2000’s, the imprisoned leadership of the Group produced more than 25 books aimed at de-legitimizing political violence as a method for change.
column2: 21世纪，该组织被监禁领袖出版了超过25本旨在谴责以政治暴力为变革手段的著作。

column1: Eliminating the “spiritual guide” (as opposed to the organizational leaders) of a militant group might be perceived as a political victory for a government in the short term, but it probably makes a comprehensive de-radicalization process less likely, and it will not necessarily mean the end of the organization in question.
column2: 消灭好战组织的“精神领袖 ” （ 而不是组织首脑）可能被政府视为一种短期的政治胜利，但这也许会令全面的去激进化进程更加被动，而且也不一定就意味着这个恐怖组织的结束。

column1: For long-term results, capture is almost always more effective than killing.
column2: 要想取得长期的效果，抓捕几乎总比杀死更为有效。

column1: Wasting Food in a Hungry World
column2: 在饥饿的世界中浪费粮食

column1: OTTAWA – One-quarter of all the food in the world is lost each year, owing to inefficient harvesting, inadequate storage, and wastage in the kitchen.
column2: 渥太华 — — 由于收割低效、仓储不足和厨房浪费，世界每年都有四分之一的粮食被白白浪费掉。

column1: Halve that waste, and the world could feed an extra billion people – and make hunger yesterday’s problem.
column2: 如果能让浪费减半，世界可以额外养活10亿人 — — 让饥饿成为昨天的记忆。

column1: The extent of food loss is particularly galling in view of a new global study on food security from the United Nations Food and Agricultural Organization.
column2: 新发布的联合国粮农组织粮食安全全球研究显示粮食损失的程度是极其惊人的。

column1: According to the FAO, 57 developing countries have failed to achieve the Millennium Development Goal of halving the proportion of hungry people by this year.
column2: 据联合国粮农组织统计，57个发展中国家未能实现今年饥饿人口比例减半的千年发展目标。

column1: One in every nine people on the planet – 795 million in all – still goes to sleep hungry.
column2: 地球上有九分之一的人口 — — 总数高达7.95亿 — — 仍然每天饿着肚子睡觉。

column1: Of course, there has also been remarkable progress: over the last 25 years, the world has fed an extra two billion people, and – for all the 57 failures – the developing world as a whole has almost halved its hunger rate.
column2: 其间当然也不乏显著的进步：过去25年里，世界多养活了20亿人口 — — 尽管有57个国家未能实现目标 — — 但发展中国家整体饥饿率已经下降了近一半左右。

column1: But the challenge is to sustain the progress: by 2050, demand for food will have nearly doubled.
column2: 但难就难在要保持这种进展：到2050年，世界将出现接近翻番的粮食需求。

column1: One reason is that by then the world will have added another two billion mouths to feed; a second reason will be the growing appetite of a surging new middle class.
column2: 原因之一是届时世界将额外增加20亿人需要供养；另一个原因是快速增长的新兴中产阶级胃口越来越高。

column1: At the moment, the UN is considering 169 new development targets to succeed the Millennium Development Goals (hunger is one target area, among many).
column2: 目前，联合国正在考虑接替千年发展目标的169个全新发展目标（饥饿是其中一个目标领域 ） 。

column1: These targets are vitally important, because they will determine how more than $2.5 trillion in development money is spent on everything from climate change to malaria.
column2: 这些目标极为重要，因为它们将决定超过2.5万亿美元的发展资金如何分配给从气候变化到疟疾等诸多发展目标。

column1: My think tank, the Copenhagen Consensus Center, therefore asked 60 teams of top economists to assess which proposed targets will do the most good – and which will not.
column2: 我所在智库哥本哈根共识中心因此邀请由60位顶尖经济学家组成的团队来评估拟议中的哪些目标能发挥最大作用 — — 以及哪些发挥的作用较小。

column1: Our research on food security shows that there are smart ways to feed many more on the planet – but they have little to do with the campaigns against waste seen in most of the rich world.
column2: 我们对粮食安全的研究显示有更明智的方式来养活地球上的更多人口 — — 但这与多数富裕国家开展的反浪费运动关系不大。

column1: In the rich world, the focus is on food wasted by the consumer.
column2: 富裕国家重点关注被消费者浪费的食品。

column1: This makes sense: more than half of the rich world’s losses take place in its kitchens (basically because we can afford it).
column2: 这样做是有道理的：富裕国家超过一半的损失来自于厨房（主要因为我们承受得了 ） 。

column1: In Britain, for example, the greatest waste is in salads, vegetables, and fruits – luxuries when compared with the cheap calories contained in the grains and tubers consumed throughout the developing world.
column2: 比方说在英国，沙拉、蔬菜、水果等构成最大的浪费 — — 相比整个发展中世界所消费的谷物及薯类所含的廉价热量堪称奢华。

column1: Smaller households in rich countries waste more per person, because it is harder to put everything to use, while richer households add waste when they can afford to buy extra “just to be on the safe side.”
column2: 富裕国家小家庭人均浪费更多，因为很难做到物尽其用，而富裕家庭“仅为安全起见”额外采购导致了浪费的增加。

column1: By contrast, the world’s hungry poor waste very little, simply because they cannot afford to.
column2: 相比之下，世界上饥饿的穷人浪费非常之少，仅仅因为这样的浪费他们无法承受。

column1: In Africa, daily food waste averages 500 calories per person – but consumers account for only 5% of this loss.
column2: 在非洲，餐厨垃圾每天人均浪费500卡路里的热量 — — 但消费者仅占上述浪费总额的5 % 。

column1: More than three-quarters of the waste occurs well before the kitchen, in inefficient agriculture, because birds and rats eat crops during harvest, for example, or pests spoil grain stores.
column2: 超过四分之三的浪费发生在厨房之前，因为农业效率低下，收割期鸟类和老鼠偷吃农作物，或者粮食储备被害虫糟蹋。

column1: There are many remedies for this kind of waste – from the “curing” of roots and tubers to minimize damage, to more expensive refrigeration.
column2: 此类浪费有诸多补救办法 — — 从腌制根茎以期减少损失，到更加昂贵的冷藏。

column1: So why aren’t these technologies – widely used in richer countries – adopted in the developing world?
column2: 那么为什么这些在富裕国家被广泛采用的技术并没有运用到发展中国家？

column1: The answer is a lack of infrastructure.
column2: 答案是基础设施的缺乏。

column1: If there are no proper roads linking fields to markets, farmers cannot easily sell their surplus produce, which may then spoil before it can be eaten.
column2: 如果没有恰当的道路连接田头和市场，农民就不能轻松出售自己的剩余产品，以致于它们在被食用之前就可能腐败掉。

column1: Improving road and rail capacity enables farmers to reach buyers – and fertilizer and other agricultural inputs to reach farmers.
column2: 改善公路及铁路运力使农民能够接触到购买者 — — 也有利于化肥和其他农业生产资料被运送到农民手中。

column1: Supplying reliable electricity permits grains to be dried and vegetables to be kept cool.
column2: 可靠的电力供应确保谷物得到干燥、蔬菜得到冷藏。

column1: Economists from the International Food Policy Research Institute estimate that the overall cost of approximately halving post-harvest losses in the developing world would be $239 billion over the next 15 years – and would generate benefits worth more than $3 trillion, or $13 of social benefits for every dollar spent.
column2: 国际粮食政策研究所的经济学家预测在发展中国家实现后收获期损失减半的总成本今后15年将达2，390亿美元 — — 但能带来超过3万亿美元（也就是1美元成本比13美元社会效益）的收入。

column1: This would make food more affordable for the poor.
column2: 这样穷人就更能买得起食物。

column1: By 2050, better infrastructure could mean that 57 million people – more than the current population of South Africa – would no longer be at risk of hunger, and that about four million children would no longer suffer from malnutrition.
column2: 到2050年，改建后的基础设施可能意味着5，700万人 — — 超过南非目前人口的总和 — — 将不再忍受饥饿，并且约400万儿童将摆脱营养不良。

column1: Most of these gains would be in Sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia, the world’s most deprived regions.
column2: 世界最贫困的撒哈拉以南非洲和南亚地区将是最大的受益者。

column1: But there is an even better investment.
column2: 但还有更好的投资方向。

column1: We can achieve three times the economic benefits, and even larger reductions in the number of people at risk of hunger, if we focus on improving food production rather than just on preventing food losses.
column2: 如果着眼于提高粮食产量而非仅仅预防粮食损失，我们就可以实现三倍的经济效益，并进一步减少受饥饿威胁的人口数量。

column1: Today, only $5 billion is spent annually on research to improve the seven major global food crops, and just one-tenth of that is targeted to help small farmers in Africa and Asia.
column2: 如今，每年只有50亿美元被用于研究改良全球七大主要粮食作物，这当中又仅有十分之一被用来定向帮助非洲和亚洲的小农。

column1: Investing an extra $88 billion in agricultural research and development over the next 15 years would increase yields by an additional 0.4% each year.
column2: 未来15年在农业研发领域额外投入880亿美元能额外增加每年0.4%的产量。

column1: That might not sound like very much, but the reduction in prices and improvements in food security would help almost everyone.
column2: 这听上去似乎微不足道，但粮价下降及粮食安全改善将为所有人带来好处。

column1: It would be worth nearly $3 trillion in social good – yielding an enormous $34 of benefits for every dollar spent.
column2: 这能产生近3万亿美元的社会效益 — — 即单位美元投入能够带来34美元的巨额回报。

column1: Hunger is a complex problem, exacerbated by financial pressures, volatile commodity prices, natural disasters, and civil wars.
column2: 饥饿的问题非常复杂，财政压力、商品价格波动、自然灾害和内战都会导致其恶化。

column1: But we could take an enormous step toward winning the global campaign against malnutrition, simply by investing in improved infrastructure and in agricultural research and development.
column2: 但只要坚持对改善基础设施和农业研发投资，我们就可以在赢得全球反营养不良的战争中迈出重要的一步。

column1: Water for All
column2: 全民水源

column1: This month, water once again takes center stage at the Fourth World Water Forum in Mexico City.
column2: 水的问题再次成为本月在墨西哥城举行的第四届世界水资源论坛的中心议题。

column1: It is an opportune moment: while much of the world’s attention has been fixed on issues of energy supply and security, hundreds of millions of people in the developing world continue to see the supply and security of fresh water as equally, if not more, important.
column2: 这是一个有利时机：虽然全球大多数人的注意力集中在能源供应和安全问题上，但发展中国家仍有数以亿计的人口同样关注（甚至更加重视）淡水的供应和保障问题。

column1: Surveys undertaken by the World Bank in developing countries show that, when poor people are asked to name the three most important concerns they face, “good health” is always mentioned.
column2: 世界银行在发展中国家进行的调查显示，在要求贫穷人口说出他们面临的三大重要问题时，他们总是提到“健康 ” 。

column1: And a key determinant of whether they will have good health or not is access to clean water.
column2: 而他们是否拥有健康的关键就在于能否获得清洁的用水。

column1: More than a billion people around the world today do not.
column2: 目前，全世界10多亿人都无法得到清洁的用水。

column1: As a result, they are increasingly vulnerable to poor health.
column2: 因此，他们的健康日益受到威胁。

column1: The World Bank estimates that by 2035, as many as three billion people, almost all of them in developing countries, could live under conditions of severe water stress, especially if they happen to live in Africa, the Middle East, or South Asia.
column2: 世界银行估计，到2035年，多达30亿人可能在严重缺水的条件下生活，这些人几乎全部来自发展中国家，特别是非洲、中东或南亚。

column1: This will cause obvious hardship, but it will also hold back the economic growth needed for millions of people to escape poverty.
column2: 这显然会带来苦难，还会阻碍经济发展，而发展正是成百上千万人摆脱贫困的关键。

column1: In Latin America, about 15% of the population – roughly 76 million people – do not have access to safe water, and 116 million people do not have access to sanitation services.
column2: 在拉丁美洲，大约15%的人口—约7,600万人—无法得到安全的水源，而且有1.16亿人享受不到卫生服务。

column1: The figures are worse in Africa and parts of Asia.
column2: 在非洲和亚洲部分地区，这个数字更大。

column1: This is a situation that few people in rich countries face.
column2: 这种情况富裕国家的人民是不会遇到的。

column1: Generally, these countries’ citizens enjoy services that provide for all water needs, from drinking to irrigation to sanitation.
column2: 一般说来，这些国家的公民可以享受一整套的供水服务，从饮用到灌溉到卫生设备。

column1: In addition, other water-related issues, such as the risks posed by flooding, have been reduced to manageable levels.
column2: 此外，其他有关水的问题，如洪灾所造成的风险，已经降低到了可以控制的水平。

column1: Rich industrial countries have invested early and heavily in water infrastructure, institutions, and management capacities.
column2: 富裕的工业国家很早就在水利基础设施、机构和管理能力方面投入大笔资金。

column1: The result, beyond the health benefits for all, has been a proven record of economic growth; one only has to look at investment in hydropower to see the positive impact of water management projects on many economies.
column2: 除了给全民健康带来的好处外，另外一个结果是切切实实的经济发展。 人们只要看看在水力发电方面的投资，就能够看到水利管理项目对很多国家产生的积极影响。

column1: Granted, rich countries have a certain advantage: they benefit from generally moderate climates, with regular rainfall and relatively low risks of drought and flooding.
column2: 诚然，富裕国家有一些优势：它们一般气候适宜，雨量均匀，并且干旱和洪涝风险相对较低。

column1: Even so, they are not immune to water-related disasters, as Hurricane Katrina’s destruction of New Orleans taught us.
column2: 即便如此，它们也并非不受与水有关的灾害影响，飓风卡特里娜对新奥尔良的破坏就是我们得到的一个教训。

column1: But the impact of such events on poor countries is much greater.
column2: 可是，诸如此类事件对贫穷国家的影响要大得多。

column1: Extreme rainfall variations, floods, and droughts can have huge social and economic effects and result in the large-scale loss of life.
column2: 极端的雨量变化、洪灾和干旱可能产生巨大的社会和经济影响，并导致很多人丧生。

column1: The Gulf coast of Mexico and Central American countries has repeatedly experienced such tragedies, with poor communities the most vulnerable and the least able to cope.
column2: 墨西哥湾沿岸和中美洲国家多次经历了这种悲剧，贫困地区受到的损害最为严重，而其应对危险的能力却最低。

column1: Ethiopia and Yemen are equally stark examples.
column2: 埃塞俄比亚和也门同样是典型的例证。

column1: Ethiopia’s development potential is closely tied to seasonal rains, so high rainfall variation, together with lack of infrastructure, has undermined growth and perpetuated poverty.
column2: 埃塞俄比亚的发展潜力与季节性降雨密切相关，因此，极大的雨量变化和基础设施缺乏已经阻碍了发展，造成了持久的贫困。

column1: A single drought can cut growth potential by 10% over an extended period.
column2: 仅一次干旱就可能使发展能力在很长一段时期内降低10 % 。

column1: Yemen, for its part, has no perennial surface water; its citizens depend entirely on rainfall, groundwater, and flash flooding.
column2: 而也门没有可供常年使用的地表水，其公民用水完全依靠降雨、地下水和急流。

column1: To move forward, developing countries need new water infrastructure and better management.
column2: 为了向前发展，发展中国家需要新的水利基础设施和更好的管理。

column1: Any approach must be tailored to the circumstances of each country and the needs of its people, but there is no fundamental constraint to designing water development investments that ensure that local communities and the environment gain tangible and early benefits.
column2: 必须针对各国的具体情况及人民需求采取适当的措施，但是，在确保当地社会和环境及早取得切实利益方面，发展中国家规划水利发展的投资并没有根本性的束缚。

column1: In some countries, new water infrastructure may mean canals, pumping stations, and levees.
column2: 在一些国家，新的水利基础设施可能指运河、抽水站和防洪堤。

column1: Still others might need deeper reservoirs, more modern filtration plants, or improved water transport schemes.
column2: 而另一些国家则可能需要深挖水库、改进滤水设备或完善输水计划。

column1: These can all potentially be designed to improve and expand water supplies for power generation, irrigation, and household and industrial use, while providing security against droughts and protection from floods.
column2: 这些措施都可以改善和增加发电、灌溉和家庭及工业用水的供应，同时提供防旱和防洪保障。

column1: The key to successful increased investment in water infrastructure is an equally increased investment in water institutions.
column2: 成功增加水利基础设施投资的关键是同时增加对水利机构的投资。

column1: Badly managed infrastructure will do little to improve peoples’ health or support economic growth, so water development and water management must go hand in hand.
column2: 管理不善的基础设施对改善人们的健康或支持经济增长毫无益处，因此，水利开发和水利管理必须齐头并进。

column1: Water infrastructure can and must be developed in parallel with sound institutions, good governance, great attention to the environment, and an equitable sharing of costs and benefits.
column2: 水利基础设施能够而且必须与完善的机构、良好的管理、对环境的关注以及公平分担管理成本、享受管理效益实现同步发展。

column1: A water investment policy that reduces the vulnerability of the poor and offers basic water security for all will require customized planning and an effective partnership of donor countries, developing country governments, the private sector, and local communities.
column2: 减轻贫困人口脆弱性和提供全民基本用水保障的水务投资政策需要捐助国、发展中国家、私营部门和地方社会的合理规划和有效合作。

column1: Delegates to the World Water Forum will have ample opportunity to forge and/or strengthen these partnerships.
column2: 参加世界水资源论坛的代表将有足够的机会建立和/或加强这种合作关系。

column1: If they succeed, the rewards for the world’s poor will be immense.
column2: 如果合作成功，对世界贫困人口的回报将是巨大的。

column1: War and Peace and Water
column2: 战争、和平与水资源

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – India is currently facing its worst water crisis in years, with an estimated 330 million people – one-quarter of its population – affected by severe drought.
column2: 华盛顿 — — 印度正面临多年来最严重的水资源危机，约有3亿3000万人（占全国人口的1/4）面临严重干旱的影响。

column1: Ethiopia is also dealing with its worst drought in decades, which has already contributed to the failure of many crops, creating food shortages that now affect around a tenth of the population.
column2: 埃塞俄比亚也面临着几十年来最严重的干旱，导致许多农作物歉收、由此造成的粮食短缺威胁着该国1/10左右的人口。

column1: Under such circumstances, the risk of tension over resources is high.
column2: 在这样的情况下，为争夺资源造成局势紧张的危险性非常之高。

column1: In the past, droughts of this severity have led to conflict and even wars between neighboring communities and states.
column2: 过去，如此程度的严重干旱曾导致临近社区与国家间爆发冲突乃至战争。

column1: One of the first in recorded history erupted around 4,500 years ago, when the city-state of Lagash – nestled between the Tigris and Euphrates rivers in modern-day Iraq – diverted water from its neighbor, Umma.
column2: 有记录历史以来的首次战争爆发于约4，500年前，当时位于现代伊拉克境内底格里斯和幼发拉底河之间的拉加什城邦曾想从其邻国乌玛引水。

column1: Competition for water sparked violent incidents in ancient China and fueled political instability in Pharaonic Egypt.
column2: 古代中国曾因为争水引发了暴力事件，水资源短缺也在法老统治的古埃及助长了政治上的不稳定。

column1: Today, actual wars between countries over water resources are uncommon, owing to improved dialogue and cross-border cooperation.
column2: 今天，因为争夺水资源而引发实际战争的情况已经十分罕见，因为对话和跨界合作的效率已经大幅提高。

column1: But, within countries, competition for scarce water is becoming a more common source of instability and conflict, especially as climate change increases the severity and frequency of extreme weather events.
column2: 但在国家内部，争夺稀缺水资源正在成为动荡和冲突比较常见的来源，特别是当气候变化加剧了极端天气事件的频率和严重程度。

column1: As we detail in our new report “High and Dry: Climate Change, Water and the Economy,” limited and erratic water availability reduces economic growth, induces migration, and ignites civil conflict, which fuels further potentially destabilizing migration.
column2: 正如我们在新报告“高纬度和干旱：气候变化、水资源和经济”中所提到的那样，有限和不稳定的水资源供应限制经济增长、诱发移民潮并导致内部冲突，而这又助长了可能进一步造成动荡的移民潮。

column1: This cycle has been apparent in some regions for decades.
column2: 数十年来在某些地区这种循环已经显性化。

column1: In Sub-Saharan Africa, for example, periods of low rainfall over the last 20 years have often been followed by spikes in violence, civil wars, and regime change.
column2: 例如在撒哈拉以南非洲地区，过去20年中降雨量稀少期过后往往伴随着内战、政权更迭和暴力活动抬头。

column1: And in many parts of rural Africa and India, a decline in rainfall has acted as a “push factor” for internal or cross-border migration to more water-abundant places, often cities, creating new social pressures as the numbers of displaced people grow.
column2: 在非洲和印度农村的许多地区，降雨量下降已经成为向城市等水资源较为丰富地区展开内部或跨境移民的“推动因素 ” ， 而随着流离失所人数的不断增加，新的社会压力由此产生。

column1: In our report, we predict that water scarcity could act as a conflict-risk multiplier, fueling cycles of resource-driven conflict, violence, and displacement, especially in already water-stressed regions, such as the Middle East and the Sahel in Africa, where agriculture remains an important source of employment.
column2: 在我们的报告中，我们预测水资源短缺有可能成为爆发冲突的风险乘数，进而推动由资源驱动的流离失所、暴力和冲突，尤其是在水资源已经紧缺的地区，例如中东地区和非洲萨赫勒。 在上述地区，重要的就业来源依然是农业。

column1: Fortunately, there is a way to avoid the cycle of poverty, deprivation, and conflict.
column2: 幸运的是，避免贫困、匮乏和冲突的恶性循环我们并非束手无策。

column1: If countries take action now to implement effective water-management policies and practices, backed by well-designed incentives, they can not only reverse the slide toward water scarcity, but also raise their rates of economic growth by as much as six percentage points per year.
column2: 如果各国现在采取措施实行有效的水资源管理政策及方法，再辅之以精心设计的激励机制，他们不仅可以扭转堕入水资源短缺的窘境，而且可以让经济增长每年加快6个百分点之多。

column1: One water-scarce country that has taken action to improve its resilience to climate change is Morocco.
column2: 采取措施改善其气候变化适应性的一个水资源短缺的国家是摩洛哥。

column1: In years of low rainfall, Morocco’s river-basin authorities give the lowest priority to crop irrigation, the largest consumer of the country’s water.
column2: 在降雨量不足的年份，摩洛哥的河流流域管理部门并未将重点放在其国内居首的耗水大户农作物灌溉上。

column1: But, of course, agriculture remains critical to feed the population.
column2: 当然，农业依然是养活民众的关键所在。

column1: So the government has been investing in modernizing irrigation infrastructure to provide farmers with more efficient water services that enable them to adjust more easily to variations in water availability.
column2: 因此政府坚持投资进行灌溉基础设施现代化建设，为农民提供高效的水资源服务，从而使他们能轻松适应水资源供应的变化。

column1: The Moroccan authorities are also working to improve groundwater governance, to avoid over-extraction.
column2: 摩洛哥当局同时也在改善地下水治理以避免过度开采现象。

column1: Farmers engaged in rain-fed agriculture receive support that helps them to make better use of rainfall – such as through the introduction of climate-resilient practices like direct seeding – resulting in higher yields than traditional practices produce during dry years.
column2: 采用雨水灌溉的农户能够得到支持，以帮助他们对降雨进行更好的利用 — — 例如通过引入直播等适应气候的先进方法 — — 采用上述方法后，干旱年份的产量能比采用传统方法出现显著的提高。

column1: The message from Morocco – and from our report – is that, with smart water policies and interventions, countries can ensure a climate-resilient, water-secure future.
column2: 来自摩洛哥 — — 和我们报告 — — 的信息显示，借助明智的水资源政策和干预手段，各国能够保证实现适应气候变化的安全的水资源未来。

column1: At the core of effective water-management strategies will be improved planning for water-resource allocation, the adoption of incentives to increase efficiency, investment in infrastructure for improved water security, and better urban planning, risk management, and citizen engagement.
column2: 有效水资源管理战略的核心是改善水资源分配规划、通过激励机制提高效率、投资改善水资源安全的基础设施、制定更为完善的城市规划、风险管理和民众参与机制。

column1: The recently created International High-level Panel on Water, comprising ten heads of state, will be promoting precisely this agenda to foster better water management globally.
column2: 最近组建的由十国首脑组成的国际高级水资源委员会就是负责推进上述议程，并在全球范围内促进更完善的水资源管理办法。

column1: Of course, not every country will follow the same path in safeguarding a water-secure future.
column2: 当然，每个国家在捍卫资源安全的未来时所走的道路各不相同。

column1: But, as countries develop their strategies, they can look to one another for ideas and insights into what works – and what doesn’t.
column2: 但在各国制定本国战略的时候，他们可以相互参考哪些理念和见解能产生实际效果 — — 哪些不能。

column1: With strong and prudent action, governments around the world can cope effectively with the natural limitations and uncertainties affecting water resources, ensuring that their people and economies are prepared for what might lie ahead.
column2: 世界各国政府可以采取谨慎有力的行动有效应对影响水资源安全的自然限制和不确定性，确保本国民众和国内经济为应对未来的形势做好准备。

column1: Hard Wisdom for Scarce Water
column2: 稀缺的水的硬智慧

column1: CAMBRIDGE – In California, residential consumers are being fined for wasting water.
column2: 剑桥—在加利福尼亚州，住宅消费者会因为浪费水而被罚款。

column1: The goal is to combat a severe drought by reducing residential consumption by 20%.
column2: 这一规定的目标是通过将居民用水削减20%来对抗严重干旱。

column1: The trouble is that residential water use accounts for less than 15% of total consumption.
column2: 麻烦在于居民用水只占总消费量的15%弱。

column1: The rest is used mainly for agriculture.
column2: 其余用途主要是农业。

column1: Even if the desired cuts are achieved, they will account for less than 3% of total demand – a drop in an otherwise empty bucket.
column2: 即使实现了预期的削减量，它们仍然只占总需求的不到3 % ， 只不过是杯水车薪罢了。

column1: Meanwhile, in China, some 30,000 workers are trying to change the weather, attempting to seed clouds from airplanes or using anti-aircraft guns to shoot shells into the air, hoping to coax some rain from the sky.
column2: 与此同时，在中国，30,000名工人正在试图改变天气，实施飞机人工降雨或用高射机枪发射凝结核，以期从天上“骗”点雨水下来。

column1: There is no statistical proof that this type of weather manipulation works, but cloud seeders are also busy in the United States, mainly in the west.
column2: 没有统计证据表明这种天气操控方式有效，但人工造雨者在美国特别是美国西部也是十分繁忙。
