column1: These pointless policies are what I have come to call “political placebos”: attempts by governments to demonstrate to their citizens that they are doing something – anything! – to alleviate water shortages.
column2: 这些无用政策我称之为“政治安慰剂 ” ： 政府采取措施向公民证明他们正在做些什么 — — 一切！ — — 缓和水短缺。

column1: Placebos may have their place in medicine, but when they distract from efforts to address the underlying malady, they can do more harm than good.
column2: 安慰剂在医学中有用，但如果影响到根治病灶的努力，它们就弊大于利了。

column1: Measures like those in California are like instructing police officers to blare their sirens wherever they drive to create the impression that crime is being fought.
column2: 加州采取这样的措施就好比是让警察在开警车时大鸣警笛以营造他们正在于犯罪活动斗争的印象。

column1: As climate change leads to deeper and more frequent droughts, the resulting water shortages will require new, sometimes difficult, solutions that go beyond futile attempts to placate the public.
column2: 是气候变化引起了更深、更频繁的干旱，由此造成的水短缺需要可能相当困难的新解决方案，光是抚慰公众是不够的。

column1: The challenges are daunting.
column2: 挑战十分艰巨。

column1: In many places, underground water is considered the property of the owner of the land where the water is extracted, even when a well’s user is tapping an aquifer that spreads across thousands of square miles.
column2: 在许多地区，地下水被视为属于采水地土地拥有者的产权，尽管水井用户是在绵亘数千平方英里的含水层上打水。

column1: As a result, there is little incentive to conserve.
column2: 结果是人们几乎没有动力保护地下水。

column1: Meanwhile, widespread pumping lowers the level of the entire aquifer, potentially allowing salt water to encroach.
column2: 与此同时，大量钻井降低了整个含水层，可能导致盐水入侵。

column1: And, because this arrangement is tied to property rights, only the bravest of politicians dare to address it.
column2: 此外，由于这一安排与产权挂钩，只有最勇敢的政客才敢于解决它。

column1: In some parts of California and Texas, a portion of the water supply is provided to consumers for almost nothing – delivered by a network of dams, reservoirs, and aqueducts that were built decades ago.
column2: 在加州和德克萨斯州的一些地方，部分水以几乎免费的形式供应给消费者 — — 通过几十年前建造的水坝、水库和水渠供水。

column1: The Hoover Dam, for example, which created Lake Mead, the largest reservoir in the US, was built in 1936 during the Great Depression as part of the New Deal.
column2: 比如，胡佛大坝（Hoover Dam）创造了美国最大的水库米德湖（Lake Mead ） ， 它建于大萧条期间，是罗斯福新政的一部分。

column1: Even if the federal government had intended to get a return on its investment by selling the water from Lake Mead, the dam’s construction costs have long since been amortized.
column2: 即使联邦政府曾经想通过出售米德湖水获得投资回报，大坝的建设成本也早已收回。

column1: Unlike other commodities, the price of water is very often a political decision, subject to the influence of interest groups that lobby for subsidies.
column2: 与其他大宗商品不同，水价常常是一个政治决定，受补贴游说利益集团的影响。

column1: For example, most of the water used in agriculture in Texas and California is sold at a price below its cost.
column2: 比如，德州和加州大部分农业用水以低于成本的价格出售。

column1: As a result, it is frequently wasted.
column2: 结果是浪费现象严重。

column1: The cost for an acre-foot of water in Dallas or Austin is at least $150.
column2: 在达拉斯和奥斯丁，一英亩尺（acre-foot）水的成本至少为150美元。

column1: Texas rice farmers, however, pay just $10, and every year they consume the equivalent of a five-foot flood.
column2: 但德州稻农只需要付10美元，而他们每年消费的水量相当于一场5英尺高的洪水。

column1: Such a large quantity of water is not even necessary for rice farming; most of it is used to drown weeds.
column2: 即使是种稻，也不必消耗如此大量的水；它们大部分被用来你淹死杂草了。

column1: The US federal government needs to intervene in the water industry.
column2: 美国联邦政府需要干预水行业。

column1: As long as these distortions persist, new technologies will struggle to compete.
column2: 只要这些扭曲状况存在，新技术就难以竞争。

column1: Rationalizing the water sector would allow new investors to enter the market.
column2: 水部门的合理化将吸引新投资者进入市场。

column1: Farmers in Texas and California need to stop growing rice, which should be imported from water-rich countries like Vietnam.
column2: 德州和加州农民需要停止种植水稻，而转为从越南等富水国家进口。

column1: Instead, US farmers should be encouraged to shift to other crops, such as sesame, with the government sharing the cost of replacement machinery needed to cultivate and harvest them.
column2: 相反，美国应该鼓励农民转向芝麻等其他作物，由政府分担耕种和收获芝麻所需要的机器更换成本。

column1: The adoption of technologies like drip irrigation would make current water use seem primitive and outdated.
column2: 滴管技术等科技的采用让当前的用水方式显得原始而陈旧。

column1: The water sector should follow the example of the electric-power industry, where changes to federal regulations in the second half of the twentieth century allowed independent power producers to use existing transmission lines.
column2: 水部门应该效仿电力业的例子。 20世纪下半叶联邦电力监管改革允许独立发电商使用现有输电线路。

column1: The deep price cuts and improved service ushered in by these regulatory changes prompted other countries to adopt the American model.
column2: 这些监管变化促使其他国家采取了美国模式，大减价和服务改善随之而来。

column1: It is time to turn off the tap on subsidized water and find a real cure for persistent water shortages.
column2: 如今，我们应该关上补贴之水的龙头，为持久水短缺找到真正的药方。

column1: Water as a Force for Peace
column2: 水，和平的力量

column1: MUMBAI – The changing of the guard on the 38th floor of the United Nations building in New York, with António Guterres taking over for Ban Ki-moon as UN Secretary-General, has taken place at a time when notions about peace and conflict are undergoing a subtle change.
column2: 孟买 — — 纽约联合国大厦38层卫兵更换，以及安东尼奥·古特雷斯接替潘基文出任联合国秘书长，发生在一个和平与冲突理念正在发生微妙变化的时刻。

column1: In particular, the role of resources – and especially water – is getting the recognition it deserves.
column2: 特别是资源 — — 尤其是水资源的作用，正在逐步得到应有的认可。

column1: This has been a long time coming.
column2: 我们为这一刻已经等了很久。

column1: Both Ban and his predecessor, Kofi Annan, have argued for some two decades that protecting and sharing natural resources, particularly water, is critical to peace and security.
column2: 潘基文及其前任科菲·安南二十年前就已经提出保护和共享自然资源 — — 尤其是水资源 — — 对和平和安全起到至关重要的作用。

column1: But it was not until last November that the issue gained widespread acknowledgement, with Senegal – that month’s UN Security Council president – holding the UN’s first-ever official debate on water, peace, and security.
column2: 但直到去年11月这个问题才得到广泛认可，当月联合国安理会轮值主席国赛内加尔主持召开了联合国有史以来首次有关水资源、和平与安全问题的正式辩论。

column1: Open to all UN member states, the debate brought together representatives of 69 governments, which together called for water to be transformed from a potential source of crisis into an instrument of peace and cooperation.
column2: 辩论向所有联合国成员国开放，汇集了69国政府代表，他们共同呼吁将水资源从潜在的危机来源转变为和平合作工具。

column1: A few weeks later, Guterres appointed Amina Mohammed, a former Nigerian environment minister, as his deputy secretary-general.
column2: 几个星期后，古特雷斯任命前尼日利亚环境部长阿米娜·穆罕默德担任副秘书长职务。

column1: The growing recognition of water’s strategic relevance reflects global developments.
column2: 全球进步体现在对水资源战略重要性的认识不断深入。

column1: In the last three years, the Islamic State (ISIS) captured the Tabqa, Tishrin, Mosul, and Fallujah dams on the Tigris and Euphrates Rivers.
column2: 过去三年来，伊斯兰国（ISIS）夺取了底格里斯和幼发拉底河流域的泰巴盖、提歇利、摩苏尔和费卢杰水坝。

column1: ISIS subsequently lost control of all of them, but not before using them to flood or starve downstream populations, to pressure them to surrender.
column2: 伊斯兰国不久后失去了对所有这些水坝的控制，但却在失控前成功地利用它们来淹没或者饿死下游人口，迫使他们投降。

column1: Many analysts hope that ISIS will finally be eliminated from Iraq and Syria in the next few months.
column2: 许多分析家希望今后几个月能将伊斯兰国从伊拉克和叙利亚消灭掉。

column1: But that does not mean that the group will disband; on the contrary, it may well relocate to the border areas between Libya and Chad, putting West African cities and water installations at risk.
column2: 但这并不意味着该团体会解散；恰恰相反，它可能迁移到利比亚和乍得边境地区，从而威胁到西非城市及其水利设施。

column1: This tactic is not exclusive to ISIS.
column2: 并非只有伊斯兰国才使用这一策略。

column1: Extremist groups in South Asia have also threatened to attack water infrastructure.
column2: 南亚极端势力团体同样威胁要袭击水利设施。

column1: And of course state actors, too, can use water resources to gain a strategic advantage.
column2: 当然还有国家主体也可以利用水资源来夺取战略优势。

column1: The importance of water in the twenty-first century – comparable to that of oil in the twentieth – can hardly be overstated.
column2: 21世纪水资源的重要性堪与二十世纪石油相媲美，其战略意义怎么强调都不为过。

column1: Yet some strategic experts continue to underestimate it.
column2: 但某些战略专家却仍然对其予以低估。

column1: The reality is that oil has alternatives like natural gas, wind, solar, and nuclear energy.
column2: 现实是石油具备像天然气、风能、太阳能和核能那样的替代品。

column1: By contrast, for industry and agriculture as much as for drinking and sanitation, the only alternative to water, as former Slovenian President Danilo Türk once put it, is water.
column2: 而相比之下，就工业、农业、饮用和卫生等用途而言，就像斯洛文尼亚前总统达尼洛·蒂尔克曾经说过的那样，水资源的唯一替代品就是水资源。

column1: The same is true for trade.
column2: 贸易的情况也同样如此。

column1: Consider the Rio Chagres.
column2: 例如里约查格雷斯河。

column1: While it may not be widely known, it is vitally important, as it feeds the Panama Canal, through which 50% of trade between Asia and the Americas flows.
column2: 虽然这条河可能不太出名，但却极其重要，因为它是巴拿马运河的水源，而巴拿马运河则承担着亚洲和美洲间50%的贸易运输任务。

column1: There is no risk of the natural depletion of the river flow for the next hundred years, but, in the event of a security crisis in Central America, it could be taken over by rogue forces.
column2: 未来100年这条河没有自然干枯的危险，但如果中美地区爆发安全危机，它完全有可能被流氓势力所掌握。

column1: The impact on the global economy would be enormous.
column2: 果真如此，对全球经济造成的影响将是巨大的。

column1: The consensus on the need to protect water resources and installations in conflict zones is clear.
column2: 人们就保护冲突地区资源和水利设施所达成的共识是明确的。

column1: What is less clear is how to do it.
column2: 不那么明确的是该怎么做。

column1: Unlike medicines and food packets, water cannot be airdropped into conflict zones.
column2: 与药品和食品不同，无法通过空投的方式为冲突地区补水。

column1: And UN Peacekeeping Forces are badly overstretched.
column2: 联合国维和部队保护水资源的力量严重不足。

column1: The International Committee of the Red Cross does negotiate safe passage for technicians to inspect and repair damage to water pipes and storage systems in Iraq, Syria, and Ukraine; but each passage needs to be negotiated with governments in conflict and rebel commanders – a long and cumbersome process.
column2: 红十字国际委员会确实通过谈判为技术人员开辟安全通道，以检查和修复伊拉克、叙利亚和乌克兰等国被损坏的水管和储水系统；但��次通过都需要与冲突政府和叛军指挥官谈判 — — 这是一个漫长而又繁琐的过程。

column1: A better approach would be for great powers, with their considerable influence, to negotiate short-term ceasefires in areas experiencing protracted conflict, specifically to repair and restore water systems.
column2: 更好的方法是由大国利用自身影响力在长期冲突地区谈判实现短期停火，特别是为修理和恢复供水系统。

column1: To pave the way for such an approach, however, the UN Security Council will have to declare water a “strategic resource of humanity” and adopt a resolution to protect water resources and installations, similar to Resolution 2286, adopted last May to protect medical facilities in armed conflicts.
column2: 但要为这样的策略铺路，联合国安理会必须宣布水资源为“战略人道主义资源”并通过像去年五月保护武装冲突地区医疗设施的2286号决议那样的法案来保护水资源和供水设施。

column1: In the longer term, countries that share riparian systems will need to establish regional security arrangements to preserve and protect their resources.
column2: 从长远看，共享河流体系的国家需要达成地区安全协议，对共有的水资源进行维持和保护。

column1: With collaborative management underpinning collective protection, water, often a source of competition and conflict, could become a facilitator of peace and cooperation.
column2: 通过以合作管理为基础的集体保护，时常沦为竞争和冲突源泉的水资源就会对和平与合作发挥促进作用。

column1: Denis Sassou-Nguesso, President of the Republic of the Congo, is at the forefront of this movement, by leading a group of eight governments toward the establishment of the Blue Fund for the Congo Basin.
column2: 刚果共和国总统德尼·萨苏-恩格索就处在水资源保护运动的前列，领导由八国政府组成的团体共同建立刚果盆地蓝色基金。

column1: If successful, the Fund will help to mitigate climate change, create new avenues of river-based employment, and promote collective security in an unstable region.
column2: 如果他的努力取得成功，该基金将有助缓解气候变化、创造全新的河流就业岗位，并促进动荡地区的集体安全。

column1: The Africa Action Summit in Marrakesh two months ago described the Fund as one of the four key ideas that can transform the continent.
column2: 两个月前马拉喀什举行的非洲行动峰会将该基金誉为能够改变非洲大陆的四大理念之一。

column1: Last March, on World Water Day, Jordan’s Prince Hassan bin Talal and I called for the establishment of a Marshall Fund for the world’s shared river basins.
column2: 去年3月的世界水日，我和约旦哈桑·本·塔拉勒王子呼吁为全球共有的流域盆地建立马歇尔基金。

column1: The Blue Fund for the Congo Basin is a step in that direction.
column2: 刚果盆地蓝色基金是向这个方向迈出的重要步骤。

column1: Now, we need similar funds to emerge to protect all of the world’s 263 shared river basins and lakes.
column2: 现在我们需要成立类似的基金来保护全世界263个共有的流域盆地和湖泊。

column1: It is a huge challenge; but, given the power of water to sow conflict and support peace, we must confront it head-on.
column2: 这是一个巨大的挑战；但鉴于水资源制造冲突和支撑和平的能力，我们必须勇敢地面对它。

column1: Water Wars.
column2: 水资源之战

column1: What is more vital for the future of humanity – and life in general – than water?
column2: 对于人类和所有生命形式的未来，还有什么比水更重要的呢？

column1: Water abounds in nature, and most of humanity will have lived more than ten millenniums without ever wondering about it.
column2: 自然界的水资源十分丰富，大多数人即便再活一万年也不会认真考虑水的问题。

column1: We draw it, use it, throw it away, most often back into rivers or oceans.
column2: 我们抽取水、利用水，再把废水排放到江河海洋。

column1: But we could very soon end up not having enough of the fresh water that accounts for just 3% of all the water available on our planet.
column2: 但很快我们就会缺少淡水，因为淡水只占全球水资源总量的3 % 。

column1: When one considers the fights we are capable of having over oil, one shudders to imagine where a lack of water could lead.
column2: 只要想一想石油会引发什么样的争斗，缺水所带来的灾难就会令人不寒而栗。

column1: While Latin America seems well endowed, the situation is very different elsewhere.
column2: 尽管拉丁美洲的水资源比较丰富，但其它地方的情况却没有那么乐观。

column1: Europe is nearing its limits, and water scarcity is already a pressing issue in Africa, Central Asia, and China.
column2: 欧洲正处在缺水的边缘，而水资源短缺的问题在非洲、中亚和中国已经迫在眉睫。

column1: Over the last 20 or 30 years we have begun to comprehend what is at stake, owing to initiatives like the World Water Forum, which held its fourth annual meeting in March.
column2: 近二三十年来我们才开始意识到问题有多么严重，而这要归功于像世界水资源论坛这样的节水组织，该组织第四届年会今年3月刚刚召开。

column1: Unfortunately, the Forum is not yet an official body and has no decision-making power.
column2: 遗憾的是，该论坛还算不上官方组织，也没有决策权。

column1: But providing an arena for thought and debate has brought at least one huge benefit: greater awareness about water issues among the public and policymakers.
column2: 但它为思想和辩论提供的土壤至少有一项极大的好处：那就是使公众和决策者意识到水资源问题的严重性。

column1: Water management is an inherently difficult challenge, and experience counts for a lot.
column2: 水资源管理注定是一项艰巨的挑战，经验在其中能起到很大的作用。

column1: Practice shows that local levels of government provide the most efficient water management, even if regulations must necessarily be national in scope.
column2: 实践告诉我们：即使全国需要实行统一的节水政策，但由地方政府对水资源进行管理却最为有效。

column1: But this is a division of labor that few national governments are ready to accept.
column2: 但在实际上，没有几个国家的政府愿意接受这样的分工。

column1: Nor do most states seem prepared to start a real dialogue over water policy with civil society groups.
column2: 多数国家也没有做好准备就水资源政策与民间组织展开真正的对话。

column1: At one extreme of exclusion, for example, consider that decisions about water management are largely taken by men, though in most of the world it is women who use the water.
column2: 举例来讲，一种极端状况是和水资源管理有关的决策都是由男人做出的，而在世界多数国家用水最多的却往往是女人。

column1: Moreover, interference is constant, and inevitable, between the public and the private sectors. A subtle mix of official regulation and private contracting is required.
column2: 这还不算，公有和私有部门之间的相互影响长期存在，也不可避免，这就需要在官方管制和私人约定间达到微妙的平衡。

column1: But not all jurisdictions respond in the same way.
column2: 但并非所有国家都采取了同样的对策。

column1: The multiplicity of interlocutors inevitably creates a multiplicity of water systems with vastly unequal levels of efficiency.
column2: 谈判方的多种多样不可避免地导致了水资源管理系统的多种多样，而不同系统的管理效率也大不相同。

column1: Initiatives like the World Water Forums thus inevitably highlight debates about what constitutes good water management, as well as elaborating useful concepts.
column2: 于是确定什么才是有效的水资源管理和宣传实用理念就成了像世界水资源论坛这样组织理所当然的工作重点。

column1: One casualty of such debates has been the myth that water is free.
column2: 水资源没有成本的观点在这样的辩论中备受抨击。

column1: Water has a cost, and someone, either end-users or taxpayers, has to pay it.
column2: 水资源有成本，不管是最终用户还是纳税人，反正水资源的成本需要有人来承担。

column1: It is possible, of course, to envision sharing the costs, but it is no longer possible not to charge for water.
column2: 当然，我们可以用某种方式来分摊水资源成本，但免费用水却不再成为可能的选择。

column1: The most recent World Water Forum debated two issues that will confront policymakers in the years ahead.
column2: 不久前举行的世界水资源论坛讨论了两个问题，这两个问题是决策者们在未来必须要面对的。

column1: The first concerns the so-called “right to water.”
column2: 首先是所谓的“用水权利 ” 。

column1: The urgency of the needs, with a billion people lacking access to drinking water and two billion without proper sewer systems, together with the vast number of diseases that result, underscore the need to recognize such a fundamental human right.
column2: 10亿人缺乏饮用水、20亿人缺乏合理的污水处理系统所带来的迫切需求，再加上随之而来的大量疾病，使这项基本人权的认定变得非常重要。

column1: A consensus was reached at the Forum that such a right makes sense only if it is formulated in such a way that particular policymaking entities, be they water companies or local governments, face an affirmative duty to respect this right.
column2: 人们在论坛上达成一致，无论是自来水公司还是地方政府，只有当尊重这项权利成为特定决策机构的当然义务，这样的权利才有意义。

column1: Only the state can be made responsible here.
column2: 只有国家才能承担这样的责任。

column1: But the acknowledged responsibility of states in implementing the right to water cannot turn them into the sole paying authority.
column2: 但国家落实水资源权利的当然义务也并不意味着它们是唯一的出资机构。

column1: The state must be charged with ensuring an effective water system that meets the basic needs of all, but the balance of this system remains to be defined.
column2: 国家必须出资建立能满足所有人基本需求的有效用水系统，但如何平衡这一系统还有待进一步研究。

column1: These uncertainties, indeed, led the Forum to avoid acknowledging a formal right to water in its final resolution.
column2: 正是由于存在上述不确定之处，水资源权利才没有正式载入水资源论坛的最终决议。

column1: The second issue concerned the role of local authorities.
column2: 第2个问题与地方政府有关。

column1: Despite the political and administrative centralization of most of the countries represented at the Forum, there was widespread agreement that the most efficient water systems are managed as close as possible to the resource and its users.
column2: 尽管参加水资源论坛的多数国家都实行政治和行政集中管理，但人们都认可最有效的水资源管理方式要尽可能贴近源头与用户。

column1: Agreement on this provided a real breakthrough for the future of water policy.
column2: 达成这样的一致使水资源政策在未来的突破成为可能。

column1: Naturally, conflicts among governments or local authorities and private enterprises resurfaced.
column2: 于是，政府、地方管理机构和私有企业之间的矛盾自然而然再次成为关注的焦点。

column1: Inevitably, the cruel lack of means was pointed out time and again.
column2: 于是，每个人都清醒地意识到我们在这个问题上束手无策。

column1: And, unsurprisingly, the lack of solidarity among water haves and have-nots was openly on display at the Forum.
column2: 不仅如此，论坛也再次公开暴露了有水国和无水国之间的不团结。

column1: As we grapple with our joint water future, we will face a time of trial and error in finding workable solutions.
column2: 在与共同的水资源未来抗争的同时，我们在寻找有效的解决方法时面临着严峻的考验。

column1: But humanity already seems to be making more progress on matters related to drinking water than other global threats, such as climate change.
column2: 但与其它全球问题，比如气候变化相比，人类在与饮用水相关的问题上似乎已经取得了更大的进展。

column1: We should all drink to that.
column2: 所有人都应该为此干杯。

column1: Breakthrough Vaccines
column2: 突破疫苗

column1: NEW YORK – Vaccines are one of the great success stories in the history of individual and public health.
column2: 纽约—疫苗是个人和公共健康史上最伟大的成功之一。

column1: They have helped rid the planet of the scourge of smallpox, are poised to eliminate polio, and each year prevent millions of deaths, reducing the suffering and costs caused by infectious diseases.
column2: 它们帮助地球摆脱了天花，即将消灭脊髓灰质炎，并且每一年能挽救数百万人的生命，减轻传染病造成的痛苦和负担。

column1: But there are still many diseases for which vaccines do not yet exist.
column2: 但仍有许多疾病我们没有疫苗可用。

column1: Moreover, strategies that have previously led to the successful development of vaccines are unlikely to work against more complex bacteria or viruses, such as HIV, which have evolved multiple mechanisms to evade the immune system.
column2: 此外，早前带来成功疫苗开发的策略不再适用于更加复杂的细菌和病毒，比如可通过多种机制削弱免疫系统的艾滋病毒。

column1: The history of vaccinology is one in which biomedical and technological advances usher in the “next generation” of vaccines.
column2: 疫苗学的历史是一部生物化学和技术进步带来“下一代”疫苗的历史。

column1: In the 1950’s, a breakthrough that enabled viruses to grow in tissue cultures led to the development of both live attenuated vaccines and inactivated vaccines for measles, polio, and other diseases.
column2: 20世纪50年代，能让病毒在培养基中生长的突破带来了麻疹、脊髓灰质炎和其他疾病的减毒活疫苗和灭活疫苗的发展。

column1: In the 1980’s, recombinant DNA technology led to the development of vaccines against hepatitis B and human papillomavirus.
column2: 20世纪80年代，DNA重组技术带来了乙肝和人乳头瘤病毒疫苗的发展。

column1: Around the turn of the century, the first sequencing of the human genome led to “reverse vaccinology.”
column2: 在世纪之交，人类基因组的首次测序带来了“逆向疫苗学 ” （ reverse vaccinology ） 。

column1: This approach, whereby computational analysis of a pathogen’s genome enables identification and screening of a great many more potential vaccine targets than was previously possible, was used in the successful development of a vaccine against meningitis B.
column2: 这一方法 — — 对病原体基因组进行计算机分析以识别和筛选潜在疫苗目标，数量之大远远超过了以前的可坑范围 — — 被用于乙脑疫苗的成功开发。

column1: The past decade has already yielded major advances in structure-assisted vaccine discovery, synthetic biology, systems biology, and immune monitoring.
column2: 过去十年产生了结构辅助疫苗发现、合成生物学、系统生物学和免疫监测的巨大进步。

column1: However, successfully translating these advances into the development of next-generation vaccines continues to be impeded by gaps in our understanding of the human immune response that protects against specific bacteria, viruses, or parasites.
column2: 但是，成功地将这些进步转化为下一代疫苗的开发仍受到我们关于人体对具体细菌、病毒和寄生虫的免疫反应的了解不足的制约。

column1: That is why I, along with eight fellow scientists, have proposed the establishment of a new human-immunology-based clinical-research initiative, the Human Vaccines Project.
column2: 这就是我和其他八位科学家同事提出成立新的基于人体免疫学的临床研究计划 — — 人类疫苗工程（Human Vaccines Project）的原因。

column1: In February 2014, leading scientists and public-health specialists will gather in La Jolla, California, to craft a scientific plan to identify, prioritize, and, most important, solve the major problems currently hindering development of vaccines against diseases such as AIDS, tuberculosis, and malaria.
column2: 2014年2月，主要科学家和公共健康专家将齐聚加州拉荷亚（La Jolla）起草一份科学计划来对目前阻碍艾滋病、肺结核和疟疾等疾病的疫苗的开发的主要问题进行识别、决定优先顺序以及（最重要的）予以解决。

column1: Such a project would represent a paradigm shift in vaccine development.
column2: 该工程代表疫苗开发的范式变化。

column1: The current process is long (often spanning decades from concept to licensure), has a low probability of success (because of the limitations of animal models in predicting immune response and efficacy in humans), and is costly (often requiring hundreds of millions of dollars to develop a single vaccine).
column2: 当前的开发过程很长（从提出概念到获得许可要走几十年 ） 、 成功概率低（因为动物模型在预测人类免疫反应和效果方面作用有限 ） 、 而且成本高昂（通常一种疫苗的开发就要耗费几亿美元 ） 。

column1: Consider this: In just the past few years, many candidate vaccines against HIV, dengue, herpes, tuberculosis, and staphylococcus aureus have failed, at a cost of more than $1 billion.
column2: 想一想：在过去几年中，许多候选HIV、登革热、疱疹、肺结核和金黄葡萄球菌疫苗遭遇了失败，超过10亿美元随之��流。

column1: Investing that amount over the next decade in a coordinated effort to address the major questions facing vaccine development would rapidly accelerate our search for effective solutions, implying a transformative impact on individual and public health.
column2: 投资相同数量的资金用于在未来十年合作解决疫苗开发的所面临的主要问题能够大大加速我们对有效解决方案的搜索，给个人和公共健康带来变革性影响。

column1: HIV presents perhaps the greatest challenge, because the virus leverages its extensive genetic variability to hide from the immune system.
column2: HIV大概是最大的挑战，因为这种病毒利用其多种多样的遗传变异而不被免疫系统所识别。

column1: Using recent advances, however, scientists have now identified highly conserved regions of this variable virus, determined their molecular structure, and begun designing next-generation vaccine candidates to elicit antibodies that target these regions to prevent HIV infection.
column2: 但是，如今科学家已可以利用最新的进步识别多变病毒的高度保守区（conserved region ） 、 确定它们的分子结构，并开始设计下一代候选疫苗以触发针对这些区域、防止HIV传染的抗体。

column1: But HIV vaccine development, like that for several other diseases, is still impeded by the limitations of what animal models can tell us about how to elicit the necessary immune responses in humans.
column2: 但与其他几种疾病的疫苗一样，HIV疫苗的开发仍受制于动物模型对如何触发必须的人类免疫反应的预测力的局限性。

column1: Two recent advances could accelerate vaccine development and reduce its costs dramatically.
column2: 两大最新进步有望加速疫苗开发、大大降低成本。

column1: In synthetic biology, the rapid engineering of nucleic acid-based vaccines means more candidates move more quickly from concept to trial.
column2: 在合成生物学领域，基于核酸的疫苗的快速工程意味着更多的候选疫苗可以更快地从概念阶段进入试验阶段。

column1: In systems biology, high-throughput technologies have increased the number of genetic and immunologic parameters assessed in trials.
column2: 在系统生物学领域，高通量技术增加了在试验中被评估的遗传和免疫参数的数量。

column1: This approach has helped predict the efficacy of potential new-generation vaccines against yellow fever and influenza within days of immunization, compared with the usual timeframe of months or years.
column2: 这一方法有助于预测潜在的下一代黄热病和流感疫苗的有效力，只需几天的免疫期即可，而通常的时间框架是几个月甚至几年。

column1: Vaccines already prevent the deaths of 2-3 million people every year, preempt human suffering, lighten the burden placed on health-care systems, and enable more rapid economic and social development.
column2: 疫苗每年能够挽救200—300万条生命，预防人类苦难，减轻医疗系统负担，并促进更快的经济和深灰发展。

column1: Models show that adding even a partly effective AIDS vaccine to the current range of prevention and treatment procedures could dramatically lower the rate of HIV infection.
column2: 模型表明，即使是部分有效的艾滋病疫苗，如果用于当前预防和治疗过程，也可以大大降低HIV传染率。

column1: As the Nobel Peace Prize laureate Desmond Tutu, one of the world’s great campaigners against HIV/AIDS, wrote recently: “We must make the most of scientific advances over the last half-century, which have made vaccines for other preventable diseases the most powerful and cost-effective health-care investment that currently exists.”
column2: 正如诺贝尔和平奖获得者、世界最著名的HIV/艾滋病斗士图图（Desmond Tutu）所说 ， “ 我们必须让过去半个世纪中的大部分科学进步 — — 这些进步已经形成了其他可预防疾病的疫苗 — — 成为目前所能找到的最有力、成本效率最高的健康投资 。 ”

column1: That is the idea behind the Human Vaccines Project – a concept that would have been unimaginable even a decade ago.
column2: 这就是人类疫苗工程背后的思想 — — 这一概念在十年前还不可想象。

column1: Today, technological advances in vaccine discovery and immune monitoring allow us realistically to explore this potentially game-changing approach to disease prevention.
column2: 如今，疫苗发现和免疫监测方面的技术进步让我们能够在实际中探索这一有望改变疾病预防局面的方法。

column1: February’s gathering in California may take us a giant step closer to a world without deadly and debilitating infectious diseases.
column2: 2月的加州会议或许是我们迈向没有致死和致衰传染病的世界的一大步。

column1: The G-20 to the Rescue?
column2: G-20集团来救援？

column1: BRISBANE – The G-20’s upcoming meeting in Brisbane, Australia, comes at a time when a precarious global economy requires big decisions to be made.
column2: 布里斯班 — — G-20会议即将在澳大利亚的布里斯班召开，恰逢此时，我们需要为拯救摇摇欲坠的全球经济做出重大决策。

column1: But it is far from clear who will provide the decisive voice needed to set a bold agenda – and then shepherd its implementation.
column2: 但由谁来制定大胆的日程计划，并且指导计划的实施目前尚不清楚。

column1: Economic data reveal that the global economy is shakier than at any time in the past two years.
column2: 经济数据显示全球经济比过去两年中的任何时候都更加不稳定。

column1: Capitalism is struggling to generate adequate demand.
column2: 资本主义正竭力创造足够的需求。

column1: Wealth and income have become increasingly concentrated, while middle-class incomes in the developed world have stagnated.
column2: 财富和收入越来越集中，而发达国家中产阶级的收入增长却陷入停滞状态。

column1: Tax avoidance by multinational companies is draining developing-country incomes, limiting their ability to invest in education and infrastructure.
column2: 跨国公司的避税行为正快速榨干发展中国家的收入，令发展中国家无力投资于教育和基础设施建设。

column1: And much more action is needed to address the largest and most urgent structural weakness of all – climate change.
column2: 需要采取进一步措施解决最大最紧迫的结构性弱点 — — 气候变化。

column1: Many leading economists and policymakers are forecasting continued economic gloom.
column2: 众多著名经济学家和决策者都对持续经济发展做出了悲观的预测。

column1: Stephen Roach has suggested that in the post-crisis global economy “relapse is the rule”; economist Brad DeLong, speaking of the “consequences of our lesser depression,” argues that the pretense of a eurozone recovery has collapsed; and European Central Bank President Mario Draghi has acknowledged the need not only for structural reform, but also fiscal expansion to boost aggregate demand.
column2: 史蒂芬·罗奇认为后危机时代全球经济“衰退才是王道 ” ； 经济学家布拉德·德隆则探讨“小规模衰退带来的后果 ” ， 并提出欧元区经济复苏的假象已经破灭；而欧洲央行行长德拉吉则承认不仅需要进行结构改革，还需要实施财政扩张以刺激总需求。

column1: At the heart of their concerns is the lack of sustained demand needed to drive growth.
column2: 他们忧虑的核心是缺乏推动增长的持续性需求。

column1: While structural reforms – particularly on the supply side – are required in developed and developing countries, they are not sufficient to address what former US Treasury Secretary Larry Summers has called “secular stagnation” – that is, the difficulty of sustaining sufficient demand to permit normal levels of output.
column2: 虽然结构性改革 — — 尤其是供应改革在发达和发展中国家同样必要，但单纯的结构改革还不足以解决前任美国财长拉里·萨默斯所谓的“长期停滞” 问题 — — 也就是难以找到足够的需求允许产能正常释放。

column1: The G-20’s central task, therefore, must be to establish a framework for strong and sustainable growth.
column2: 因此建设强劲的可持续发展框架理当是G-20峰会的核心任务。

column1: Member states need to introduce reforms aimed at achieving a 2% annual growth target, as agreed earlier this year by finance ministers.
column2: 会员国需要像年初财长协议所要求的那样推进改革以确保实现每年2%的增长。

column1: One structural reform that could drive global growth is substantial infrastructure investment in developing and developed countries alike.
column2: 在发达和发展中国家同时进行大规模基础设施投资是有能力推动全球增长的一项结构性改革。

column1: Unfortunately, no G-20 leader has seriously articulated this need, let alone lobbied for a solution.
column2: 遗憾的是，没有哪位G-20领导人认真提出过这方面的需求，更不用说为解决方案进行游说了。

column1: Apart from a World Bank presentation for a possible pilot infrastructure program, there is little to suggest how the 2% target could be met over the medium term.
column2: 除世行与试点基础设施项目有关的演示外，没有任何迹象表明如何在中期实现2%的增长目标。

column1: G-20 governments, especially those with strong balance sheets, should be calling for large-scale public and private infrastructure investment to expand the productive capacity of member economies.
column2: G-20成员国政府，特别是那些资产负债表相对强劲国家的政府，应当呼吁进行大规模公共及私人基础设施投资，以期在成员国经济内部实现产能扩张。

column1: In the area of tax avoidance, discussion needs to broaden beyond developed economies; as the International Monetary Fund recently pointed out, developing economies’ budgets are disproportionately affected by multinational companies’ savvy accounting strategies.
column2: 避税方面的讨论不能仅局限在发达经济体；国际货币基金组织最近指出，发展中经济体的预算在极大程度上受到跨国公司精明会计策略的影响。

column1: Unfortunately, judging by the initiatives already on the Brisbane agenda, the summit looks set to take a business-as-usual approach.
column2: 不幸的是，从布里斯班计划决定探讨的举措看，本届峰会仍将一切照旧。

column1: If the G-20 fails to put policy meat on its rhetorical bones, it will risk looking weak and irrelevant.
column2: 如果G-20集团只是夸夸其谈而没有相应的政策出台，就会在世人面前显得脆弱且无关紧要。

column1: Its very credibility is on the line.
column2: 人们会质疑它的可信度。

column1: Indeed, some in the developed world would prefer a smaller, more exclusive body – a G-14 or even a new G-7.
column2: 事实上，发达国家某些人���要缩小20国集团到14国甚至7国。

column1: Such a move would hurt the developing world, especially the Asia-Pacific region, including Australia.
column2: 这样的举措会伤害发展中国家，特别是亚太地区，包括澳大利亚。

column1: One reason why some want a tighter group is that the G-20 struggles to achieve consensus.
column2: 某些人想要缩小决策圈的原因是G-20很难达成共识。

column1: But this misses the point: It is harder to reach agreement precisely because all of the key leaders (representing around two-thirds of the world’s population and 80% of global GDP), whose support is needed for any truly global decision, are in the room.
column2: 但这种做法忽略了一点：即难以达成一致恰恰因为所有重要领导者（约占世界总人口的三分之二和全球GDP的80 % ） 都在场。 达成真正意义上的全球决策需要所有与会者。

column1: The Brisbane Summit therefore needs to rediscover the activism that it displayed in 2008 and 2009, during the height of the financial crisis.
column2: 布里斯班峰会因此必须重新找到它曾在金融危机高潮的2008及2009年所表现出活跃度。

column1: It must be led by the United States and other advanced economies, and backed up by major emerging economies.
column2: 布里斯班峰会必须由美国和其他发达经济体领导，同时得到主要新兴经济体的拥护。

column1: Australia, as host, also has a role to play.
column2: 身为东道国的澳大利亚也必须发挥作用。

column1: The country is respected by developed and developing countries alike, often bridging the interests of both, and is widely viewed as an honest broker.
column2: 澳大利亚深受发达及发展中国家的尊敬，往往会成为两者之间的利益桥梁，并广泛树立起诚实可靠的中间人形象。

column1: Unfortunately, the current government has had little to say about the big structural problems that underlie the world’s economic malaise.
column2: 不幸的是，现政府绝少提及世界经济低迷背后的严重结构性问题。

column1: The modest initiatives on the table reflect the government’s anti-public-sector rhetoric.
column2: 摆在桌面上的温和举措反应了政府反对公共部门的说辞。

column1: Worse, as developed and developing countries are starting to take climate change seriously, Australia is moving in the opposite direction.
column2: 更遭的是，在发达和发展中国家开始认真对待气候变化问题时，澳大利亚却反其道而行之。

column1: The Brisbane summit will be a crucial test for Australia, the G-20, and the possibility of truly global policy coordination.
column2: 布里斯班峰会是对澳大利亚、G-20集团和真正全球协调政策可能性的一次关键测试。

column1: Weak America = Weakened Europe
column2: 一损俱损的美国与欧洲

column1: America’s power has been so overwhelming for so long that many think it has survived George W. Bush’s presidency unscathed.
column2: 美国压倒性的威势已经保持得太久，以致许多人以为她在经历了乔治·W·布什执政的任期后还能毫发无损。

column1: That this is untrue is demonstrated by those, from Russia’s Vladimir Putin and Venezuela’s Hugo Chávez to Iran’s Mahmoud Ahmadinejad and Zimbabwe’s Robert Mugabe, who are exploiting America’s loss of standing and influence.
column2: 这种想法的错误性可以从那些利用美国声誉和影响力的削弱来大肆捞取利益的人身上可以看出来，从俄罗斯的弗拉基米尔·普京、委内瑞拉的雨果·查维斯，到伊朗的艾哈迈迪·内贾德和津巴布韦的罗伯特·穆加贝。

column1: This is no cause for schadenfreude .
column2: 这可不是幸灾乐祸的时候。

column1: On the contrary, it is high time for friends of the United States, particularly in Europe, to realize that America’s weakness undermines their international influence as well.
column2: 相反，美国的盟友，特别是欧洲，应该意识到，美国的衰落也会削弱他们自己的国际影响力。

column1: The evidence of America’s weakness is clear enough.
column2: 美国衰落的迹象已经十分明显。

column1: At the height of America’s power, Russia had resigned itself to the apparently unstoppable encroachment of NATO on the Soviet Union’s former sphere of influence.
column2: 在美国的威势达到巅峰的时期，北约对前苏联影响下的地区的蚕食似乎不可阻挡，俄罗斯只能黯然退避。

column1: President Putin tolerated a US presence in Central Asia to assist in the campaign against the Taliban in Afghanistan and raised no serious objections when the US trashed the Anti-Ballistic Missile Treaty prohibiting strategic missile defenses.
column2: 美国进军中亚，参与打击阿富汗塔利班的行动，普京总统予以默许；美国撕毁限制战略性导弹防卫系统的“反弹道导弹条约 ” ， 他也没有提出严肃的抗议。

column1: America, eager to bring both Ukraine and Georgia into NATO, felt scant need to consider Russian concerns, convinced that the Kremlin would have no choice but to bow to the inevitable.
column2: 美国急于将乌克兰和格鲁吉亚纳入北约时不觉得有必要考虑俄罗斯的想法，认为克里姆林宫面对必然的结果根本没有选择，只能接受现实。

column1: That was yesterday.
column2: 时过境迁。

column1: Today, Putin seeks to regain the influence Russia lost in previous years.
column2: 如今，普京正试图重新建立俄罗斯前几年失去的影响力。

column1: He is skillfully playing the anti-America card across Europe while putting pressure on the Baltic states, a clear warning not to extend Nato any further.
column2: 他一边对波罗的海三国施加压力，明确警告北约不得继续扩张，一边在整个欧洲巧妙地打着反美牌。

column1: In Ukraine, political forces resisting closer strategic links to the West have gained ground.
column2: 在乌克兰，反对与西方加强战略联系的政治力量已经站稳脚跟。

column1: And the Kremlin is aggressively portraying the planned establishment of a modest US missile defense installation in Poland and the Czech Republic as a threat to Russia’s vital security interests.
column2: 克里姆林宫将美国在波兰和捷克共和国建立小型导弹防御基地的计划渲染成对俄罗斯重大安全利益的威胁，态度咄咄逼人。

column1: Or consider Iran, another power exploiting American weakness.
column2: 再来看看伊朗，另一个利用美国的衰落获益的国家。

column1: Only a few years ago, Iran’s government seemed sufficiently in awe of the US to inch toward an agreement on its nuclear program that would have interrupted, and perhaps even halted, its enrichment activities.
column2: 仅仅几年前，伊朗政府还看似对美国十分敬畏，一步步走向会打断、甚至终止其核浓缩活动的协议。

column1: There was talk of possible bilateral contacts with the US, which, if successful, would have ended almost three decades of hostile relations.
column2: 传言他们会和美国进行双边接触，如果成功，就能结束近三十年的敌对关系。

column1: Today, Iran’s enrichment program is going ahead despite the United Nations Security Council’s warnings of new sanctions, while Iranian officials publicly ridicule threats of US military action.
column2: 如今，伊朗不顾联合国安理会实施新一轮制裁的警告，执意推行核浓缩计划，伊朗的官员还公开嘲笑美国的军事威胁。

column1: These examples reflect the same message: America is losing clout around the world.
column2: 这些例子反映了一个信息，即美国正在全球范围内失去影响力。

column1: The Bush administration is internationally exposed in both the arrogance of its concepts and the limits of its power. It lacks support at home and respect abroad.
column2: 布什政府傲慢的观念和有限的实力暴露在全世界面前，于内缺乏支持，于外则得不到尊重。

column1: Never since the US became the world’s predominant power during World War II has there been a similar decline in its international influence.
column2: 自从美国在二战中崛起，成为世界上的主导力量，其国际影响力还从未经历过类似的衰落。

column1: Even during the Vietnam War and following its humiliating withdrawal from Southeast Asia, there was never any serious doubt about America’s authority and ability to deal with what was then the central strategic challenge, the Cold War.
column2: 即使在越战期间，以及从东南亚狼狈地撤退之后，人们也从未真正怀疑过美国应对冷战这个当时的核心战略挑战的权威和能力。

column1: In today’s interdependent world, however, it is no longer the number of nuclear warheads that bestows influence, but a country’s ability to get others to go along with policies that it regards as serving its major interests.
column2: 然而，在今天这个互相依赖的世界上，影响力的来源不再是核弹头的数量，而是一个国家让他国追随她认为符合自己主要利益的政策的能力。

column1: Bush’s America has forfeited that influence– in the Middle East, in Asia and Africa, and in much of Europe.
column2: 布什治下的美国丧失了这样的影响力 — — 在中东、亚洲和非洲，以及欧洲的大部分地区。

column1: Many in the US like to think that this is a temporary state of affairs that will vanish with the election of a new president and Congress in 2008.
column2: 美国国内的许多人一厢情愿地认为这个势态只是暂时的，在2008年新的总统和国会选举之后就会烟消云散。

column1: But they are neither sufficiently aware of the damage done nor realistic enough about the chances of Bush’s potential successors – many of whom initially supported his adventurism – to revive the trust and respect their country once enjoyed.
column2: 但他们要不是对已经造成的损害缺乏充分的认识，就是对布什潜在的继任者 — — 这些人当初大多支持他的冒险主义 — — 重获这个国家曾经享有的信任和尊重的机会认识不够清醒。

column1: To achieve that will take more than a new face in the White House. It will require years of hard work to reconcile America’s resources and requirements, and to ensure that its initiatives can once again be seen as designed not to serve narrow US ideologies, but to advance a fair international order.
column2: 要实现这样的目标，仅靠白宫里换一张新面孔是不够的，还需要通过多年的努力，协调美国的资源和要求，并且让人们能够再次相信美国的行动是为了推进公平的国际秩序，而不是为狭隘的美国意识形态服务。

column1: The result of protracted US weakness is also a weaker Europe.
column2: 美国长时间衰落将导致欧洲也会变弱。

column1: In the heyday of American dominance, European governments profited doubly: they were part of a powerful West and courted as a potential counterweight to US dominance by third countries.
column2: 在美国优势地位的全盛期，欧���各国政府获得了双倍的利益：他们既是强大的西方社会的一分子，又被第三世界国家视为牵制美国的潜在势力。

column1: If they dissented from US positions, this did not seriously impair the West’s strategic efficacy because American power was more than sufficient to compensate.
column2: 即便他们不附和美国的立场，也不会严重削弱西方的战略效力，因为美国的力量够强，完全能够弥补。

column1: That arrangement no longer works.
column2: 这样的机制已不再起作用。

column1: If European governments today distance themselves from America, as their citizens frequently demand, they will both antagonize and further weaken the US.
column2: 如果现在欧洲各国政府按照民众频繁的要求疏远美国， 会和美国对立起来，使美国进一步衰落。

column1: At the same time, they will undermine their own international influence, allow others to play off Europe against America, destroying as well what chance remains for rebuilding the West with a reformed America.
column2: 同时，他们也会削弱自身的国际影响力，使其他势力在欧美的争斗中渔翁得利，还会断送通过改革后的美国重建西方社会的最后机会。

column1: European leaders, even when they are unhappy over US positions, therefore need to combine forceful support for the transatlantic community of interests with discrete, if firm lobbying in Washington not to strain it to the breaking point.
column2: 因此，欧洲的领导人即便对美国不满，也应该联合起来，给予这个跨大西洋利益团体审慎的支持，如通过在华盛顿进行强大的游说攻势，告诉美国物极必反的道理。

column1: Whether they can successfully perform this difficult act, remains to be seen.
column2: 他们是否能成功地完成这项困难重重的任务尚未可知。

column1: Fortunately, Angela Merkel, Nicolas Sarkozy, and Gordon Brown understand the challenge, and at least some parts of the Bush government seem aware of the problem.
column2: 幸运的是，安格拉·默克尔、尼古拉·萨科奇和戈登·布朗明白这个挑战的重要性，而且布什政府中至少有一部分人已意识到了问题所在。

column1: In the long period of American weakness, European leaders will have to demonstrate statesmanship for the West as a whole. It is a role for which decades of US supremacy have scarcely prepared them.
column2: 在美国长期的衰弱中，欧洲领导人将不得不表现出以整个西方为重的政治家才能，而这样的角色是在美国数十年的霸主地位下他们极少有机会担当的。

column1: Trump’s Diminishing Power and Rising Rage
column2: 衰落的特朗普权力和高涨的愤怒

column1: NEW YORK – The drama of Donald Trump’s presidency has centered around whether an extremist president would be able to carry out an extremist policy agenda against the will of the majority of Americans.
column2: 纽约—特朗普执政的闹剧的核心是一位走极端的总统是否可以违背大部分美国人的意愿，实施走极端的政策日程。

column1: So far the answer has been no, and the midterm elections make it far less likely.
column2: 到目前为止，答案是否定的，中期选举让这种可能性更加降低了。

column1: Yet Trump’s rising frustrations could push him over the edge psychologically, with potentially harrowing consequences for American democracy and the world.
column2: 但特朗普的日益失望可能导致他铤而走险，给美国的民主和全世界造成可怕的后果。

column1: None of Trump’s extremist policy ideas has received public support.
column2: 特朗普的极端政策思想都没有受到公众支持。

column1: The public opposed last year’s Republican-backed corporate tax cut, Trump’s effort to repeal the Affordable Care Act (Obamacare), his proposed border wall with Mexico, the decision to withdraw from the Iran nuclear agreement, and the imposition of tariff increases on China, Europe, and others.
column2: 公众反对去年共和党支持的公司税减税计划、特朗普取消平价医疗法（奥巴马医保）的方案、退出伊朗核协定，以及提高对中国、欧洲和其他地区的关税。

column1: At the same time, contrary to Trump’s relentless promotion of fossil fuels (coal, oil, and gas), the public favors investments in renewable energy and remaining in the Paris climate agreement.
column2: 与此同时，与特朗普不遗余力地支持化石燃料（煤炭、石油和天然气）相反，公众更支持投资可再生能源以及留在巴黎气候协定中。

column1: Trump has tried to implement his radical agenda using three approaches.
column2: 特朗普用三种方法实施他的激进日程。

column1: The first has been to rely on the Republican majorities in the two houses of Congress to pass legislation in the face of strong popular opposition.
column2: 第一种方法是依靠共和党在国会两院的多数优势，不顾群众的强烈反对通过立法。

column1: That approach succeeded once, with the 2017 corporate tax cut, because big Republican donors insisted on the measure, but it failed with Trump’s attempt to repeal Obamacare, as three Republican senators balked.
column2: 这种方法成果过一次，即2017年公司税学见计划，因为共和党的“金主”们坚持要采取这一措施；但在取消奥巴马医保的问题上它失败了，有三位共和党参议员投了反对票。

column1: The second approach has been to use executive orders to circumvent Congress.
column2: 第二种方法是用行政令绕过国会。

column1: Here the courts have repeatedly intervened, most recently within days of the election, when a federal district court halted work on the Keystone XL Pipeline, a project strongly opposed by environmentalists, on the grounds that the Trump administration had failed to present a “reasoned explanation” for its actions.
column2: 在这方面，法庭一再进行干预，最近一次是在选举前夕，联邦地区法院叫停了Keystone XL管道。 该项目受到环保主义者的强烈反对，因为特朗普政府没有为其行为作出“合理解释 ” 。

column1: Trump repeatedly and dangerously oversteps his authority, and the courts keep pushing back.
column2: 特朗普一再地、危险地滥用权力，而法院一直在顽强阻击。

column1: Trump’s third tactic has been to rally public opinion to his side.
column2: 特朗普的第三种伎俩是煽动民意支持他。

column1: Yet, despite his frequent rallies, or perhaps because of them and their incendiary vulgarity, Trump’s disapproval rating has exceeded his approval rating since the earliest days of his administration.
column2: 但是，尽管他经常煽动民意，或者也许是因为这种煽动和它们的粗俗，特朗普政府自上台以来的反对率一致高于支持率。

column1: His current overall disapproval rating is 54%, versus 40% approval, with strong approval from around 25% of the public.
column2: 目前，他的反对率是54 % ， 而支持率是40 % ， 强烈支持率只有25 % 。

column1: There has been no sustained move in Trump’s direction.
column2: 特朗普从未获得过持续的支持。

column1: In the midterm elections, which Trump himself described as a referendum on his presidency, the Democratic candidates for both the House and Senate vastly outpolled their Republican opponents.
column2: 在特朗普本人称之为对其总统地位的全民公投的中期选举中，众议院和参议院的民主党候选人都大胜他们的共和党对手。

column1: In the House races, Democrats received 53,314,159 votes nationally, compared with 48,439,810 for Republicans.
column2: 在众议院，民主党获得全国53,314,159张选票，共和党只有48,439,810张。

column1: In the Senate races, Democrats outpolled Republicans by 47,537,699 votes to 34,280,990.
Summing up votes by party for the three recent election cycles (2014, 2016, and 2018), Democratic Senate candidates outpolled Republican candidates by roughly 120 million to 100 million.
column2: 最近三个选举周期（2014、2016和2018年）合计，民主党参议院候选人以1.2亿张选票对1亿张选票领先共和党候选人。 尽管如此，共和党仍保持了参议院微弱多数。

column1: Nonetheless, the Republicans hold a slight majority in the Senate, where each state is represented by two senators, regardless of the size of its population, because they tend to win their seats in less populous states, whereas Democrats prevail in the major coastal and Midwestern states.
column2: 每个州只能有两名参议员，不管其人口规模如何。 共和党赢得的席位往往来自人口较少的州，而民主党在主要沿海和中西部诸州胜出。

column1: Wyoming, for example, elects two Republican senators to represent its nearly 580,000 residents, while California’s more than 39 million residents elect two Democratic senators.
column2: 比如，怀俄明州选出了两位共和党参议员来代表近580,000人，而有着3,900万人的加利福尼亚州，选择了两位民主党参议员。

column1: Democrats win more votes, but Republicans win more seats.
column2: 民主党赢得了更多选票，但共和党赢得了更多席位。

column1: Without control of the House, however, Trump will no longer be able to enact any unpopular legislation.
column2: 但失去了众议院控制权的特朗普，将无法实施任何不受欢迎的立法。

column1: Only policies with bipartisan support will have a chance of passing both chambers.
column2: 只有得到跨党派支持的政策有机会通过参众两院。

column1: On the economic front, Trump’s trade policies will become even less popular in the months ahead as the American economy cools from the “sugar high” of the corporate tax cut, as growing uncertainty about global trade policy hamstrings business investment, and as both the budget deficit and interest rates rise.
column2: 在经济方面，未来几个月的特朗普贸易政策支持率将会下降，因为美国经济已经从公司减税的“极乐”中冷静下来，而日益增加的全球贸易政策不确定性正在恶化商业投资，预算赤字和利率都在上升。

column1: Trump’s phony national-security justifications for raising tariffs will also be challenged politically and perhaps in the courts.
column2: 特朗普为提高关税所提出的伪善的国家安全借口也会早到政治上，也许还有来自法院的挑战。

column1: True, Trump will be able to continue appointing conservative federal judges and most likely win their confirmation in the Republican-majority Senate.
column2: 诚然，特朗普可以继续任命保守派联邦法官，并通过共和党占多数的参议院的批准。

column1: And on issues of war and peace, Trump will operate with terrifyingly little oversight by Congress or the public, an affliction of the US political system since World War II.
column2: 而在战争与和平的问题上，特朗普将几乎完全不受国会或公众的监督，这正是二战以来美国政治体系的一大阵痛。

column1: Trump, like his recent predecessors, will most likely keep America mired in wars in the Middle East and Africa, despite the lack of significant public understanding or support.
column2: 和他近期的前任们一样，特朗普很有可能让美国深陷于中东和非洲战事，哪怕群众根本不理解和支持这么做。

column1: Nonetheless, there are three further reasons to believe that Trump’s hold on power will weaken significantly in the coming months.
column2: 尽管如此，还有三个理由认为特朗普对权力的把持在未来几个月中将被严重削弱。

column1: First, Special Counsel Robert Mueller may very well document serious malfeasance by Trump, his family members, and/or his close advisers.
column2: 首先，特别检察官罗伯特·穆勒（Robert Mueller）会很好地记录特朗普、他的家庭成员和亲信幕僚的渎职行为。

column1: Mueller kept a low profile in the run-up to the election.
column2: 穆勒在选举期间保持低调。

column1: We will most likely hear from him soon.
column2: 我们可能很快就能从他口中听到些什么。

column1: Second, the House Democrats will begin to investigate Trump’s taxes and personal business dealings, including through congressional subpoenas.
column2: 其次，众议院共和党将开始调查特朗普的税务和个人商业交易，包括通过国会传票手段。

column1: There are strong reasons to believe that Trump has committed serious tax evasion (as the New York Times recently outlined) and has illegally enriched his family as president (a lawsuit that the courts have allowed to proceed alleges violations of the emoluments clause of the Constitution).
column2: 有很强的理由认为特朗普有严重的逃税行为（如《纽约时报》最近所列出的证据 ） ， 并利用总统职务之便为家庭谋取利益（一宗已经法院允许继续进行的诉讼指控他违反了宪法酬金条款 ） 。

column1: Trump is likely to ignore or fight the subpoenas, setting the stage for a major political crisis.
column2: 特朗普可能会忽视或反击传票，导致重大政治危机。

column1: Third, and most important, Trump is not merely an extremist politician.
column2: 第三也是最重要的是，特朗普不仅仅是一个走极端的政客。

column1: He suffers from what author Ian Hughes has recently called “a disordered mind,” filled with hate, paranoia, and narcissism.
column2: 他患有伊恩·休斯（Ian Hughes）最近所谓的“心智失常 ” ， 脑子里充满了仇恨、偏执和自恋。

column1: According to two close observers of Trump, the president’s grip on reality “will likely continue to diminish” in the face of growing political obstacles, investigations into his taxes and business dealings, Mueller’s findings, and an energized political opposition.
column2: 据特朗普的两位近距离观察者所言，面对日益严重的政治障碍、对税务和商业交易的调查、穆勒的发现，以及高涨的政治反对，总统对现实的把握“可能将进一步削弱 ” 。

column1: We may already be seeing that in Trump’s erratic and aggressive behavior since the election.
column2: 我们可能已经通过特朗普自选举以来的反覆 和 好斗看到了这一点。

column1: The coming months may be especially dangerous for America and the world.
column2: 未来几个月可能对美国和世界特别危险。

column1: As Trump’s political position weakens and the obstacles facing him grow, his mental instability will pose an ever-greater danger.
column2: 随着特朗普的政治地位的削弱，并且所面临的障碍增强，他的心智不稳定将成为一个越来越大的威胁。

column1: He could explode in rage, fire Mueller, and perhaps try to launch a war or claim emergency powers in order to restore his authority.
column2: 他可能爆发雷霆之怒，炒掉穆勒，甚至可能发动战争或宣布紧急状态来重塑权威。

column1: We have not yet seen Trump in full fury, but may do so soon, as his room for maneuver continues to narrow.
column2: 我们尚未看到狂怒的特朗普，但也许很快就会了，因为他的施展空间在不断地缩小。

column1: In that case, much will depend on the performance of America’s constitutional order.
column2: 果真如此的话，美国宪政秩序的表现将经受考验。

column1: Europe’s German Ball and Chain
column2: 欧洲的德国桎梏

column1: BRUSSELS – A storm-tossed ship near dangerous cliffs needs a strong anchor to avoid finishing on the rocks.
column2: 布鲁塞尔—在危险的悬崖边上遭遇风暴的船只需要强大的锚才能避免触礁。

column1: In 2012, when a financial storm engulfed the eurozone, it was Germany that kept the European ship off the shoals of financial disaster.
column2: 2012年，一场金融风暴席卷欧元区，是德国让欧洲之穿免于驶入金融灾难。

column1: But now Europe’s anchor has become a brake, hindering forward movement.
column2: 但如今，欧洲之锚变成了一个阻碍，阻碍欧洲的前进。

column1: Of course, German Chancellor Angela Merkel acted in 2012 only when she could tell her domestic constituency that there was no alternative.
column2: 当然，2012年德国总理默克尔是在告诉国内选民已经别无选择之后才采取行动的。

column1: But in the end, Merkel agreed to a permanent bailout fund for the eurozone.
column2: 但最终默克尔同意了永久性欧元区援助基金。

column1: She also backed the formation of a banking union, which remains incomplete but still represents a key step toward a financial system supervised by the European Central Bank.
column2: 她还支持建立银行联盟，这一联盟目前仍未完成，但仍是迈向由欧洲央行承担监督责任的金融制度的重要一步。

column1: Thanks to these measures, and ECB President Mario Draghi’s vow, which Germany tacitly approved, to do “whatever it takes” to save the euro, the financial storm abated.
column2: 有了这些措施，再加上欧洲央行行长德拉吉在德国默许的情况下承诺“不惜一切代价”拯救欧元，金融风暴消停了。

column1: But now the eurozone seems incapable of escaping near-deflation, with little economic growth and prices barely moving upwards.
column2: 但如今，欧元区似乎无力摆脱接近通缩的状态，经济几乎没有增长，物价也没有表现出向上的趋势。

column1: That was not supposed to happen.
column2: 本不应该如此。

column1: When the crisis struck, the economies of the eurozone periphery were buffeted by the twin shocks of spiking risk premiums and a collapsing housing market.
column2: 当危机袭来时，欧元区外围经济体受到风险溢价飙升和房地产市场崩盘的双重打击。

column1: At the same time, the German economy benefited from the return of capital fleeing the periphery.
column2: 与此同时，德国经济因为资本逃出外围的回流而受益。

column1: Real (inflation-adjusted) interest rates in Germany became substantially negative, triggering a housing boom.
column2: 德国真实（经通胀调整）利率降到了远低于零的水平，引起了房地产泡沫。

column1: It was assumed that this would generate strong domestic demand in Germany, helping the periphery to export more.
column2: 人们认为这会在德国形成强大的内需，有助于外围增加出口。

column1: Instead, the German economy has barely grown; indeed, weaker world trade threatens to put it in recession.
column2: 相反，德国经济几无增长；事实上，国际贸易的走弱有可能导致德国陷入衰退。

column1: The current-account surplus, which was supposed to decline sharply, has actually increased, as savings have remained higher – and investment lower – than expected.
column2: 被认为会暴跌的经常项目盈余实际上有所增加，因为储蓄保持比预期更高的水平（而投资保持着比预期更低的水平 ） 。

column1: Another problem, at least from the point of view of the rest of the eurozone, is that inflation in Germany remains too low.
column2: 另一个问题 — — 至少从欧元区其他部分看来 — — 是德国的通胀水平仍然太低。

column1: With German prices rising at less than 1% annually, the eurozone periphery needs falling prices in order to regain the competitiveness lost during the pre-2008 boom years.
column2: 德国物价每年升高不到1 % ， 这意味着欧元区外围需要价格下降才能重新获得2008年危机前的几年中所失去的竞争力。

column1: This lack of dynamism at the core of the eurozone has now become its key problem.
column2: 欧元区核心活力不振已成为关键问题。

column1: With no growth in Germany, the rest of the eurozone might not be able to reduce debt via external surpluses.
column2: 德国不增长，欧元区其他部分也许就无法通过外部盈余减少债务。

column1: And there might be no solution short of a magic button to increase German domestic demand.
column2: 而要增加德国内需，目前看来似乎只能寄希望于魔术了。

column1: Obviously, the German government is in charge of the country’s public finances.
column2: 显然，德国政府控制着德国的公共财政。

column1: But fiscal policy has been roughly neutral in recent years, and thus cannot be blamed for the German economy’s lack of dynamism.
column2: 但财政政策在近几年中基本上保持中性，因此不能把德国经济缺少活力归咎于财政政策。

column1: This year, the public-sector budget might move from a small deficit to what German officials call a “black zero” – a very small surplus.
column2: 今年，德国公共部门预算可能从略有赤字变为德国官方所谓的“零或略有盈余 ” （ black zero ） 。

column1: But this tightening by a fraction of a percentage point of GDP implies no adverse effect on growth.
column2: 但这一相当于零点几个百分点GDP的紧缩对增长没有什么消极影响。

column1: The root cause of Germany’s sluggish economic performance in recent years is the continuing unwillingness of its households and enterprises to consume and invest.
column2: 德国经济近几年表现呆滞的根源在于德国家庭和企业一直不愿消费和投资。

column1: And it is difficult to see what the government can do about this.
column2: 我们也看不到政府可以就此做些什么。

column1: Indeed, investment has fallen despite financing conditions for enterprises that have never been easier, both in terms of ultra-low interest rates and banks’ willingness to lend.
column2: 事实上，尽管企业的融资条件堪称史上最宽松（不管从超低的利率还是银行的放贷意愿看都是如此 ） ， 但投资仍在下降。

column1: Yet Germany’s corporate sector remains reluctant to borrow and invest in the country, because it sees little reason to expect long-term economic growth, given that the population is set to decline and productivity gains remain anemic.
column2: 而德国公司部门仍不愿再国内借钱和投资，因为它们看不到长期经济增长的希望，这又是因为人口即将减少且生产率增长停滞不前。

column1: With investment unlikely to become a motor for the German economy, consumption holds the key to stronger demand growth in Germany.
column2: 在投资不可能成为德国经济引擎的情况下，消费就成为提高德国内需的关键。

column1: Its weakness is somewhat surprising: real incomes are up, and the coalition government that came to power last year has introduced a series of generous welfare measures, including a large increase in the minimum wage, a reduction of the retirement age, and a special top-up pension for women with children.
column2: 从某种程度上说，消费的疲软令人惊奇：真实收入水平在上升，去年上台的联合政府也引入了一系列慷慨的福利措施，包括大幅增加最低工资、降低退休年龄以及面向有孩妇女的特别追加养老金。

column1: But even these measures, which foreign observers have largely overlooked, have failed to boost consumer demand.
column2: 但这些很少有外国观察者注意到的步骤也没能提振消费需求。

column1: So what more could the German government do to wean the Germans off their abstemious habits?
column2: 那么，德国政府应该怎样做才能改变德国人节约的习惯？

column1: Public investment is the one area where the government could act.
column2: 公共投资是政府可以有所作为的领域之一。

column1: But the growth fillip from public-sector infrastructure spending can only be modest.
column2: 但来自公共部门基础设施投资的增长刺激将十分有限。

column1: Increasing infrastructure spending by a quarter, which would represent a huge administrative effort, would lift GDP growth by just 0.4 percentage points.
column2: 将基础设施支出提高四分之一已是了不起的行政手笔，但只能让GDP增长提高0.4个百分点。

column1: The main danger now is political.
column2: 现在的真正威胁是政治。

column1: A weak German economy makes the necessary structural adjustments in the eurozone periphery much more difficult.
column2: 疲软的德国经济让欧元区外围所必须采取的结构性改革变得更加艰难了。

column1: That, in turn, fuels the perception that responsibility lies with the German government, which is seen as unwilling to take the steps needed to strengthen domestic demand – even as it prohibits the periphery governments from spending more themselves.
column2: 这反过来强化了一种感觉，即德国政府需要对此负责，因为人们觉得它不愿采取必要措施强化内需 — — 即使它禁止外围国政府自己来增加支出。

column1: As unemployment remains stubbornly high and incomes stagnate in much of the eurozone, the temptation to blame “the Germans” is becoming ever stronger.
column2: 欧元区大部失业率依然高企，而收入一直停滞不前，因此更有理由指责“德国人 ” 。

column1: The German government, no surprise, does not even acknowledge that there is a problem.
column2: 毫不奇怪，德国政府甚至不承认有问题存在。

column1: With unemployment remaining near record lows, the lack of demand growth is simply dismissed, and the absence of inflation is taken as a sign of success.
column2: 在失业率保持近乎历史最低水平的情况下，需求增长萎靡根本不受关注，而没有通胀也被视为是成功的象征。

column1: This is a mistake.
column2: 这是一个错误。

column1: Europe’s German anchor has become stuck, and the rising tide of anxiety among Germany’s partners should not leave its government indifferent.
column2: 欧洲的德国之锚被卡住了，而德国伙伴国日益上涨的焦虑之潮理应让德国政府无法坐视不理。

column1: Weak Labor, Strong Securities Markets
column2: 弱小的劳工，强大的证券市场

column1: A vital distinction between market economies is the degree to which ownership of large firms is separate from a firm's day-to-day management.
column2: 大公司的所有权与日常管理的分离程度是市场经济的重要特征。

column1: What makes a company's owners willingly hand over control to professional managers?
column2: 是什么让公司的所有者自愿将权力移交给职业经理人？

column1: That question is increasingly urgent as wealthy countries-as well as many transition and developing economies-attempt to create the robust securities markets needed to boost investment, productivity, and growth.
column2: 随着发达国家和发展中转型经济繁荣证券市场，促进投资、生产率和经济增长的努力，这个问题变得愈加紧迫。

column1: Separation of ownership from management and effective securities markets reinforce each other.
column2: 所有权和管理权分离与有效的证券市场相辅相成。

column1: The underlying theory is straightforward: if bosses can steal, distant owners will not buy shares.
column2: 潜在理论非常明显：如果老板可以窃取公司资产，外界股东就不会购买股票。

column1: The formalistic civil-law systems that prevail in continental Europe supposedly provide inadequate protection, so ownership remains concentrated.
column2: 人们认为欧洲大陆现行的形式主义民法体系提供不了足够的保护，因此所有权仍旧掌握在少数人手中。

column1: By contrast, Anglo Saxon common-law systems empower judges to interpret open-ended fiduciary rules on a case-by-case basis, thereby establishing legal precedents that are binding on managers.
column2: 与此相反，安格鲁萨克逊的普通法体系赋予法官按不同情况解释开放性信用规则的权力，并由此建立了约束公司经理的司法先例。

column1: But this is a weak explanation.
column2: 但这种解释不够强大。

column1: Before World War I, Europe's civil-law countries were developing securities markets as fast as the US and the UK.
column2: 一次大战前，欧洲民法国家证券市场的发展速度与美英两国相当。

column1: Indeed, regulatory agencies like the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) arose because common-law fiduciary duties failed to protect distant owners.
column2: 的确，由于普通法的信用义务不能保护外界所有者，美国证券交易委员会（SEC）这样的监管机构才应运而生。

column1: Insider trading, for example, was generally legal under the rules governing fiduciary duties in America's states, which back then played a dominant role.
column2: 比如内部交易在美国各州管理信用义务的法律中大多为合法，这在彼时彼刻占据了统治地位。

column1: By contrast, the SEC is a rule-generating institution of the type that civil-law countries like France or Germany would have little difficulty creating if they wished to .
column2: 与此相反，如果法德这样的民法国家真想建立美国证交会这样的立法机构，也应该没有什么困难。

column1: Moreover, fiduciary duties only aspire to prevent insiders from stealing. They do not control the main costs that shareholders face when they do not manage the company themselves, such as unprofitable expansion, shirking, retention of free cash flow, and empire building.
column2: 不仅如此，信用义务仅限于防止内部盗窃，而不能控制股东不亲自管理公司时面临的主要支出，包括非赢利性扩张、收缩、阻碍现金自由流动和创建独裁帝国。

column1: Unless there is a conflict of interest between a company's management and its board, owners in common-law countries have no legal recourse when managers' operational or strategic decisions are bad, stupid, or otherwise harmful to shareholders.
column2: 除非公司管理层与董事会之间存在利益冲突，否则如果经理做出错误、愚蠢的经营或战略决策，或者伤害到股东利益的时候，普通法国家的所有者可谓求诉无门。

column1: Throughout the rich world, institutions that raise the costs to shareholders of turning over control to professional managers play a powerful role in determining outcomes.
column2: 在整个财富世界，确定股东对职业经理权力移交成本的管理机构对最终结果起着非常重要的作用。

column1: But these institutions reflect the political power of social forces, not the differences between civil-law and common-law systems.
column2: 但这些机构是社会力量政治权力的反映，而不能代表民法和普通法两种体系的分歧。

column1: In particular, ownership separation in the wealthy continental European nations and the US can be linked with the role of labor inside the firm and within society.
column2: 具体地讲，富有的欧洲大陆国家和美国的所有权分离与公司和社会内部的劳工作用有密切的联系。

column1: In some nations, labor greatly influences the firm through politics-i.e., opposing mass lay-offs and resisting restructuring plans that change the nature of the workplace.
column2: 在有些国家，劳工通过政治对公司产生很大影响¾即反对大规模裁员，抵制改变工作特性的重组方案。

column1: Consider a simple scenario: a nation bars firms and owners from laying off employees for economic reasons. Faced with a no-fire rule, shareholders have reason to be very cautious: if expansion is not profitable, they cannot reduce labor costs.
column2: 想像一副简单的情景：国家禁止公司和所有者出于经济原因进行裁员，那么面对禁止解雇的规定，股东们有理由更小心谨慎：如果扩张不能盈利，他们就不能削减劳动力成本。

column1: France, for example, is notorious for forcing foreign firms like Britain's Marks and Spencer to keep redundant workers on the payroll.
column2: 比如法国就因为强迫英国Marks and Spencer这样的外国企业保留富余劳力而臭名昭著。

column1: Of course, no nation completely bans lay-offs, but flexibility varies greatly and can be central to profitability.
column2: 当然，没有国家完全禁止裁员，但灵活度却大相径庭，对盈利的作用也至关重要。

column1: In a nation like the US, where employees can be fired easily, shareholders have less to fear.
column2: 在美国这样解雇劳工相对容易的国家，股东们就不太会害怕。

column1: But in a labor-strong society, dominant shareholders-those with the most to lose if expansion goes awry-have reason to keep managers on a short leash.
column2: 但在劳动力相对强势的社会，那些如果扩张失误面临最惨重损失的主要股东，当然有理由捆住职业经理的手脚。

column1: Italy's Fiat illustrates the problem: even a conservative government seeks to impede downsizing.
column2: 意大利的菲亚特对这个问题说明如下：即便是保守的政府也希望阻止裁员。

column1: A second factor should also make owners want to stay close to the firm if labor is politically strong.
column2: 劳工取得政治强势的情况下，所有者希望保守经营还有另外一个因素。

column1: Bargaining over the economic surplus is often open-ended, especially if competition is weak.
column2: 对经济盈利的讨价还价不受限制，在竞争较弱的情况下更是如此。

column1: Where employees have high bargaining power, the profits pie is constantly up for re-division, both within the firm and at the national level.
column2: 哪里的员工讨价权利更大，那里的利润蛋糕就经常要重新分配，在公司和国家内部都是如此。

column1: If managers are only loosely tied to shareholders, they could more willingly give up a bigger share of the pie to labor.
column2: 如果管理者与股东的联系不那么紧密，他们就可能乐意将更大的蛋糕分给劳动力。

column1: Similarly, where shareholder interests do not come first, say, in a corporatist system, dominant owners have greater reason to keep financial information private, lest labor use it to press for more favorable terms.
column2: 与之相似，如果在组织体系中不优先考虑股东的利益，主要所有者��更有理由对财务信息严格保密，唯恐被劳动者利用，成为增加报酬的筹码。

column1: Both considerations support concentrated ownership and work against securities markets.
column2: 这两种考虑都会导致所有权更加集中，对证券市场颇为不利。

column1: So, where political and social values strongly favor labor, managers' loyalty to shareholder interests will be weaker.
column2: 因此，如果政治和社会价值观明显倾向于劳动力，经理对股东利益的忠诚度就会受到影响。

column1: Managers in such "left" societies are no less technically capable, but their organizational constraints, incentives, and goals are less pro-shareholder.
column2: 如此"左倾"社会中的经理不仅在技术上能力受限，其组织约束、动机和目标也更少为股东考虑。

column1: When forced to cut employment, they are more likely to think that they are destroying lives rather than raising economic efficiency and increasing wealth.
column2: 被迫裁减员工时，他们更倾向于认为是在摧残生命，而不是提高经济效益和增加财富。

column1: Such societies should have fewer public firms, and narrower or no ownership separation.
column2: 这样的社会中上市公司的数量减少，很少或几乎不存在所有权的分离。

column1: So they do.
column2: 情况的确如此。

column1: The OECD has indexed how easy it is to fire an employee in member countries.
column2: 经合组织统计了各成员国裁员的难易程度。

column1: Employees enjoy the least protection in the US, and a high degree of protection in Italy, France, and Germany.
column2: 美国对劳动力的保护最少，意大利、法国、德国保护程度较高。

column1: The correlation with ownership separation is striking: a sample of the 20 largest firms in each country shows that, whereas 90% of the US companies have no shareholder with more than a 20% stake, none of the Italian, French, or German firms have such highly dispersed ownership.
column2: 统计结果与所有权分离的关系令人吃惊：对各国名列前20位大公司的抽样调查显示，90%的美国公司股东持股不超过20 % ， 而意、法、德三国都不具备这样高度分散的所有权体系。

column1: True, with only 16 countries rich enough to be included in the survey, the correlation isn't perfect.
column2: 当然，由于仅有16个发达国家达到了调查标准，使得找到的联系并不精确。

column1: The United Kingdom is in seventh place in terms of labor-market flexibility, but a higher proportion of its largest companies have widely dispersed ownership than sixth-place Switzerland-and double the share of fifth-place Denmark and fourth-place Australia.
column2: 在劳工市场灵活度方面英国排名第七位，但却比排名第六的瑞士有更多的国内大型公司分散所有权¾甚至达到了第五名丹麦和第四名澳大利亚的两倍。

column1: But whatever measures of "political" qualities and ownership separation we use, the index of employment protection appears to be the best predictor of ownership separation in the wealthy West.
column2: 但无论采用何种"政治"性质和所有权分离手段，雇用保护指数似乎是富有西方国家所有权分离的最佳晴雨表。

column1: More fundamentally, creating the regulatory institutions conducive to ownership separation may be impossible unless a society's political orientation towards labor and capital is more favorable to capital.
column2: 更为重要的是，除非社会对劳资双方的政治倾向更偏于资方，否则不可能建立起有利于所有权分离的管理机构。

column1: The Failed State of Egypt?
column2: 失败之国埃及？

column1: CAIRO – The aggrieved supporters of ousted Egyptian President Mohamed Morsi and the jubilant protesters who pushed the military to remove him have divided Egypt into two irreconcilable camps, both reflecting and reinforcing the country’s deeper problems.
column2: 开罗—愤愤不平的被推翻总统穆尔西的支持者和欢呼雀跃的促使军队推翻穆尔西的反对者形成了埃及不可调和的两大阵营，双方都反映并恶化着埃及深层次的问题。

column1: Indeed, Egypt is now largely an ungovernable country that subsists on generous foreign handouts.
column2: 事实上，如今埃及已成为很大程度上不可治理的国家，只能靠慷慨的外国施舍过活。

column1: Morsi never appreciated his tenuous position.
column2: 穆尔西从来不曾满意过自己脆弱的地位。

column1: Though elected democratically, he chose to govern undemocratically.
column2: 尽管他是民选总统，却选择了不民主的治国方式。

column1: He was bent on purging the judiciary and the public prosecutor’s office, claiming that they were aligned with the protesters opposing his government and their military backers, who had been overthrown in 2011.
column2: 他热衷于更换司法系统和公共检察官，声称他们与他的政府的反对者及其军队支持者（于2011年被打倒）沆瀣一气。

column1: Morsi brooked little opposition in pushing through a controversial draft constitution.
column2: 穆尔西不能容忍对其所推行的保守主义宪法草案的反对。

column1: In doing so, he neglected to focus on the structural problems that propelled a docile society to pour into the streets two and a half years ago to bring down his predecessor, Hosni Mubarak.
column2: 如此作风表明，他早已忘记了两年半前让温顺的埃及人民走上街头、推翻其前任穆巴拉克的结构性问题。

column1: Just as damaging as Morsi’s governing style was the Muslim Brotherhood’s go-it-alone mentality.
column2: 与穆尔西的治国风格一样为害甚深的是穆斯林兄弟会的孤家寡人思维。

column1: Decades of persecution have instilled in its leaders the belief that the world is aligned against them.
column2: 几十年的迫害史给穆兄会的领导人灌输了一个观念 — — 全世界勾结起来和他们作对。

column1: Assuming power only stoked their paranoia.
column2: 掌权让他们的偏执狂思维愈演愈烈。

column1: The Brotherhood’s leaders believed that the United States and Egypt’s elite were bent on ensuring their failure.
column2: 穆兄会领导人相信，美国和埃及精英处心积虑要使他们失败。

column1: For this reason, they refused to reach out to their secular opponents to offer them a piece of the political pie.
column2: 因此，他们拒绝与世俗反对者接触，让他们也能从政治蛋糕上分一杯羹。

column1: Even members of the more puritanical Islamist Nour Party were not invited to join the government.
column2: 即使是更严格恪守教规的伊斯兰光明党（Nour Party）也没有参与政府组建。

column1: But it was not only Brotherhood politicians – inexperienced in the ways of democracy (and skeptical of them) – who stumbled.
column2: 但马失前蹄的并不只有对民主缺乏经验（也持怀疑态度的）穆兄会政客。

column1: The debate in the US, long Egypt’s primary ally and donor, did not center on strengthening Egypt’s embattled institutions, but focused instead on how to ease the military out of power by withholding aid.
column2: 埃及长期盟友和赞助人美国国内的争论的核心并非强化埃及陷入重围的制度，而是如何通过撤除援助让军队交还权力。

column1: Multilateral lenders like the International Monetary Fund were fixated on fiscal reforms such as reducing costly subsidies rather than shoring up a beleaguered economy.
column2: IMF等多边贷款机构则关注减少埃及大规模补贴等财政改革，而不是巩固其四面楚歌的经济。

column1: Today, a democratic transition that the West sought to portray as a model that other Arab nations could emulate lies in tatters.
column2: 如今，西方试图打造成其他阿拉伯国家应该效仿的民主转型已经轰然倒下。

column1: Egypt’s economy, bruised by the outflow of foreign investment and a dearth of tourists, is on life support.
column2: 资本外流和游客锐减让埃及经济遭受重创，已在垂死挣扎。

column1: Rebuilding the country will require much more than the cheering from the sidelines that Western countries have offered so far.
column2: 重建埃及所需要的远不只是对西方国家已经给出的援助欢呼雀跃。

column1: Egypt has always relied on munificent benefactors to sustain its patchy state and economy.
column2: 埃及一直依靠慷慨的捐助维持其千疮百孔的国家和经济。

column1: After the military coup in 1952, the Soviets provided much of the needed aid.
column2: 1952年军事政变后，苏联提供了大量所需援助。

column1: Their “technical” experts turned the country’s second city, Alexandria, into a Russian country club.
column2: 苏联“技术”专家将埃及第二大城市亚历山大港变成了俄罗斯乡村俱乐部。

column1: After Egypt pivoted to the West in the wake of the 1973 war against Israel, America became its main patron.
column2: 1973年对以战争结束后，埃及倒向西方，美国成为其主要金主。

column1: But America’s ritual annual gift of roughly $1.5 billion could only dull the pain of Egypt’s problems, not resolve them.
column2: 但美国礼仪性的每年15亿美元左右的资助只能暂时止住埃及经济的痛苦，而不无法根除顽疾。

column1: The country can no longer provide enough government stipends in the form of bureaucratic posts for college graduates.
column2: 国家已无力以官僚职位的形式给大学毕业生提供足够的政府津贴。

column1: Egypt can only hope for cash infusions to offset its internal hemorrhaging.
column2: 埃及只能寄希望于注资抵消经济的内出血。

column1: By making aid conditional on economic reform and democratic transition, however, the international community risks political triage.
column2: 但是，国际社会提出援助需以经济改革和民主转型为条件，这造成了政治混乱风险。

column1: It should instead focus on financial assistance that blunts Egyptians’ frustrations and that contributes to building the institutions that will facilitate the transition toward democracy.
column2: 国际社会应该将注意力放在能减轻埃及人沮丧感、有助于建立促进民主转型的机构的金融援助。

column1: But, of the $1.56 billion that the US State Department requested for Egypt in 2013, only $250 million is earmarked for non-military programs.
column2: 但是，在美国国务院许诺给埃及的15.6亿美元2013年援助中，只有2.5亿美元会用于非军事项目。

column1: The US should increase funding for projects that focus on governance, civil society, and strengthening the rule of law.
column2: 美国应该增加对着重于治理、公民社会和强化法治精神的项目的融资。

column1: Such programs receive a paltry $25 million in the 2013 budget.
column2: 这些项目的2013年预算只有区区2500万美元。

column1: To bolster the economy, the US needs to shift its aid policies away from funding projects toward providing immediate budgetary relief.
column2: 为了提振埃及经济，美国需要将援助政策从提供项目资金转变为提供即刻预算纾困。

column1: Though financing water-efficiency schemes certainly helps society, its effects are felt years after the aid is initially dispensed.
column2: 尽管为节水项目提供融资必然有助于社会，但其效果要在援助给出后好几年才能被��觉到。

column1: The US, and other Western donors, should instead help Egypt to husband its resources, which are often misspent in an effort to placate its people.
column2: 美国和其他西方赞助者应该转而帮助埃及节省使用其资源，埃及常常为了安抚人民而滥用资源。

column1: Egypt is the largest wheat importer in the world, and food subsidies account for approximately 2% of GDP.
column2: 埃及是世界最大的小麦进口国，食品补贴占了GDP的约2 % 。

column1: To preserve its precious foreign-currency reserves, Egypt needs the US and its allies to provide foodstuffs.
column2: 为了保护其宝贵的外汇储备，埃及需要美国及其盟友提供食品。

column1: Such a policy was adopted in the aftermath of the 1973 war, when America offered $200 million annually for wheat procurement.
column2: 这一政策市1973年战争后采用的，当时美国提供每年2亿美元的小麦采购量。

column1: Embracing such policies will give institutions and the democratic process the time and space they need to plant firm roots.
column2: 采取这类政策将给埃及机构和民主进程时间和空间打下扎实基础。

column1: Beyond such questions lies the fate of democracy in one of civilization’s most ancient lands.
column2: 除了这些问题，还有最古老文明之地的民主前途问题。

column1: Whoever triumphs in future elections will lack the legitimacy that only a majority can provide.
column2: 不管在未来选举中谁能胜出，都将缺少只有多数人才能提供的合法性。

column1: Such a majority spoke last year, when it elected Morsi.
column2: 去年，多数人的意见是选择穆尔西。

column1: To strip him of his post negates a basic pillar of democracy and sets a dangerous precedent.
column2: 把他轰下台无异于毁掉了民主的一大支柱，也树立了危险的先例。

column1: But, in a country that faces so many problems, the paradox of Morsi’s removal from power and the dilemmas of democracy that occasioned it are not among them.
column2: 但是，在这个面临如此之多问题的国家中，穆尔西被推翻的悖论和随之而来的民主两难并不在其中。

column1: Preparing for the Unknown Unknowns
column2: 为未知的未知做好准备

column1: LONDON – We live in perilous times.
column2: 伦敦—我们生活在危险的时代。

column1: Just as we seem to get our bearings, something happens to make us feel as if our legs have been knocked out from under us.
column2: 就在我们似乎认清了形势时，机会发生一些事情，让我们觉得双腿被位于我们之下的东西弄瘫痪了。

column1: Actions and events often are intertwined, and what happens on one level – affecting individuals, states, economic sectors, and companies of all sizes – may have repercussions on others.
column2: 行动和事件常常互相纠结，在某一层面所发生的事情 — — 影响个体、国家、经济部门和各个规模的公司 — — 可能会在其他层面引起反响。

column1: The recent terrorist attacks in Paris are a case in point, affecting not only the families and friends of the victims, or even only the people of France.
column2: 最近在巴黎发生的恐怖袭击就是这样的例子，它影响的不只是受害者的家庭和朋友，甚至不只是法国人民。

column1: The reverberations are being felt around the world, and they will continue to have an impact – far beyond Europe – on public policy, electoral politics, media freedom, and more.
column2: 反响在全世界都能体验到，并将继续给公共政策、选举政治、言论自由和其他方面造成影响 — — 并且远远不止于欧洲。

column1: The attacks came at a time when the world traditionally tries to make sense of the year ahead – to forecast the risks that lie in wait, the opportunities that will arise, and the challenges that will have to be overcome.
column2: 袭击发生在全世界根据传统展望新年的时候 — — 也就是预测前方有何风险、有何机会、需要克服何种挑战的时候。

column1: But what about longer-term risks?
column2: 但长期风险情况如何？

column1: Do events like the Paris attacks show that forecasting them is impossible?
column2: 巴黎袭击这样的事件是否表明预测它们是不可能的任务？

column1: Or did the attacks expose precisely the type of risk that long-term projections should identify?
column2: 或者，袭击是否暴露了长期预测应该看到的风险？

column1: The World Economic Forum has just released its “Global Risks 2015” report which attempts to predict and rank the biggest risks that the world faces over the next ten years.
column2: 世界经济论坛刚刚发布了其《2015年全球风险 》 （ “Global Risks 2015 ” ） 报告，该报告试图预测未来十年世界所面临的最大风险并进行排序。

column1: The WEF’s focus is squarely on the macro level.
column2: 世界经济论坛的注意力主要集中在宏观层面。

column1: For example, “the biggest threat to the stability of the world in the next ten years comes from the risk of international conflict.”
column2: 比如 ， “ 未来十年世界稳定的最大威胁来自国际冲突的风险 。 ”

column1: And the menace of war is followed by a raft of social, environmental, geopolitical, technological, and economic risks and trends.
column2: 而战争威胁排在许多社会、环境、地缘政治、技术和经济风险和趋势之前。

column1: But all of these risks will be felt on an organizational, and ultimately, individual level as well.
column2: 但所有这些风险都可以在组织层面，并且最终在个体层面被感觉到。

column1: That is why we spend time in conference rooms and around kitchen tables trying to identify and mitigate them.
column2: 正因如此，我们花时间在会议室和餐桌周围试图识别并遏制它们。

column1: And yet we also know that the pace of change is faster than ever before, and that governments, businesses, and households are finding it increasingly difficult to keep up.
column2: 但我们也知道，变化的速度比以往任何时候到要快，而政府、企业和家庭日益感到难以跟上变化的脚步。

column1: Beneath all of our identifying, quantifying, and mitigating of risk lies the undeniable and timeless truth that the only constant is change.
column2: 在我们所有的识别、量化和遏制风险努力之下时不可否认的永恒真理 — — 唯一不变的只有变化。

column1: For Heraclitus, change was the fundamental principle of life.
column2: 对赫拉克利特来说，变化是生命的基本原理。

column1: Machiavelli referred to it as fortuna:the events that shape us and determine our wellbeing are often beyond our reason and control.
column2: 马基雅维利称之为福尔图娜（fortuna ） ： 左右我们、决定我们福祉的事件往往超越我们的推理和控制。

column1: Though we can attempt to plan for change, we cannot always predict the precise nature and time at which it will occur.
column2: 尽管我们可以尝试规划变化，但我们不可能永远预测到变化的性质和发生时间。

column1: Moreover, for all the risks that we can and do plan for, it is those for which we cannot prepare that can do the most damage.
column2: 此外，对所有我们可以并作出规划的风险来说，我们无法做好准备的那些变化会带来最大的伤害。

column1: That is why, alongside all of the identifying, quantifying, and mitigating, we must also embrace the idea that not all change can be clearly foreseen and planned for.
column2: 正因如此，除了所有的识别、量化和遏制工作之外，我们还必须接受一个思想，即并非所有变化都可以明确地预测和规划。

column1: The implication is that we must instill in our families, organizations, and states the resilience and tools needed to act effectively in times of crisis – and thus to minimize the potentially damaging impact of unexpected change.
column2: 言下之意是我们必须潜移默化地在我们的家庭、组织和国家中建立有效应对危机时刻所需要的恢复力和工具，从而让意料外变化的潜在破坏力最小化。

column1: This ethos will also help us maximize the potential benefits of such flux.
column2: 这一思想有助于我们实现这些波动的潜在收益最大化。

column1: After all, without unforeseen change, much of human endeavor would be fruitless, and innovation would be unnecessary.
column2: 毕竟，没有未预见到的变化，人类的许多努力将无功而返，我们也没有创新的必要了。

column1: Shocking things like the massacre at Charlie Hebdo in Paris happen, and they seem to be happening more frequently than ever.
column2: 类似于巴黎《查理周刊》大屠杀的冲击性事件时不时地发生，并且似乎比以往任何时候都发生得更加频繁。

column1: They turn our world upside down and make us question our sense of who we are.
column2: 它们颠覆我们的世界，让我们质疑“我们是什么”的问题。
