column2: 但欧盟和北约必须对黑海国家伸出双手，这是实现大欧洲计划下一阶段必不可少的一个过程。

column1: What should a new bold yet realistic EU and NATO outreach strategy for the Black Sea region look like?
column2: 对欧盟和北约的黑海扩张大胆却又现实的估计是什么？

column1: Clearly, the region's countries are weaker and further behind previous candidates for Western integration.
column2: 显而易见，该地区国家国力较弱，比起从前融入西方社会的国家也是如此。

column1: But the good news is that the EU and NATO are much better positioned to develop an ambitious strategy than they were vis-à-vis Central and Eastern Europe a decade ago.
column2: 但有利的一面是，与10年前吸纳中东欧国家入盟时相比，欧盟和北约能够更好地执行扩张的宏图大略。

column1: If the EU and NATO decide to launch a bold outreach strategy for the region, they will be able to draw on existing tools, conceptual talent, and practical experience.
column2: 如果欧盟和北约决意采用大胆地扩张战略，他们将可以利用现有的工具、理念和实践经验。

column1: For example, NATO already has three members - Bulgaria, Romania, and Turkey - bordering the Black Sea.
column2: 举例来讲，北约已经有保加利亚、罗马尼亚和土耳其三个成员国临近黑海。

column1: As for the EU, the candidacies of Romania and Bulgaria need to be concluded successfully, together with the issue of Turkey's membership aspirations.
column2: 而对欧盟来讲，先要成功解决罗马尼亚和保加利亚的资格问题，然后才谈得上土耳其。

column1: An EU that includes Sofia and Bucharest, and that is on track with Ankara, will be well positioned to engage the wider region.
column2: 吸纳了索非亚和布加勒斯特之后，安卡拉会谈如果再走上正轨，欧盟就能为进一步扩张获取足够的资本。

column1: The EU also needs to put meat on the bones of its new Neighborhood Policy, while NATO must apply new mechanisms for strengthening ties with the region.
column2: 欧盟还要进一步细化新的睦邻政策，而北约则要采纳与该地区加强关系的新机制。

column1: As opposed to a 100- or 200-meter sprint, both organizations need to think more in terms of a much longer race, perhaps a marathon.
column2: 对两个组织来讲，这都不是什么100或200米短跑，而需要付出长期、甚至是马拉松般的努力。

column1: If countries in the region embrace the idea, a network of current EU and NATO members could step forward with projects and assistance aimed at promoting a Black Sea identity and community.
column2: 如果上述想法能够为该地区各国所接受，那么现有的欧盟和北约成员国就可以开始进一步合作，以推动成立黑海国家共同体。

column1: Recent events in Georgia remind us that resolving the region's "frozen conflicts"- i.e., those in the breakaway regions of South Ossetia and Abkhazia, of Transdneistria in Moldova, and Nagorno-Karabakh in Azerbaijan - must be a priority.
column2: 最近发生在格鲁吉亚的事件提醒我们：必须先铲除该地区"根深蒂固的矛盾 " － 也就是南奥塞梯和阿布哈兹、摩尔多瓦托斯德尼查、阿塞拜疆纳哥诺-卡拉巴赫的分离主义势力。

column1: In reality, these conflicts are not frozen; they are festering wounds that breed corruption and organized crime.
column2: 事实上，这些冲突不仅没有被"冻结 " ， 还像伤口一样迅速溃烂，成了滋生腐败和有组织犯罪的温床。

column1: They inhibit democratization and incite instability.
column2: 它们制约了民主，引发了动荡。

column1: While these conflicts involve historical grievances, outside actors - particularly Russia - contribute to their lack of resolution, which is essential for successful reform.
column2: 因为这些冲突牵扯到很多历史问题，外来势力－特别是俄国的介入－使它们的解决难上加难，但解决这些遗留问题却是改革成功不可缺少的前提。

column1: So far, neither America nor Europe has made these conflicts a top priority.
column2: 到目前为止，美国和欧洲都还没有把化解冲突列为今后工作的重点。

column1: Resolving these semi-dormant wars requires stepped-up political involvement, economic engagement, and a willingness to provide Western peacekeeping forces and monitors if and when they are needed.
column2: 我们需要在政治上更多介入、在经济上更多支持和在必要时派出西方维和部队进行监管，才能使这场处于半休眠状态的战争消弭于无形。

column1: But the long-term peace and stability needed to advance economic and political reform in the region will also require either a change in Russian behavior or a reduction in Russian influence.
column2: 但推动该地区经济和政治改革所需的长期的和平与稳定还需要改变俄国的行为方式、或削弱俄国的影响。

column1: The experience of the last decade suggests that a policy of engaging the Kremlin intensely while protecting fundamental Western interests may be the best way to proceed.
column2: 10年前的经验表明：在与克里姆林宫密切合作的同时保护西方的根本利益，也许是继往开来的最佳途径。

column1: Developing a new Euro-Atlantic strategy for the Black Sea region must start with the democracies of North America and Europe recognizing their moral and political stake in the outcome.
column2: 要想制定黑海地区新的欧洲－大西洋战略，北美和欧洲必须先认可黑海诸国的道德和政治权益。

column1: Projecting stability and security in these countries is the next logical step in building a Europe "whole and free" and securing the Euro-Atlantic community's eastern frontier with the Middle East.
column2: 下一步是预先规划好地区的安全和稳定，然后再建设一个"完整自由"的欧洲，确保欧洲－大西洋共同体与中东边界线的安全。

column1: This task will be as important over the next decade as integrating Central and Eastern Europe into the West was in the 1990's.
column2: 今后10年内这项任务的意义绝不亚于20世纪90年代中东欧国家与西方的融合。

column1: The Despotic Temptation
column2: 专制的诱惑

column1: MADRID – US President Franklin D. Roosevelt, when asked about American support for the notorious Nicaraguan despot Anastasio Somoza, purportedly replied, “He may be a son of a bitch, but he’s our son of a bitch.”
column2: 马德里 — — 据称美国总统富兰克林·罗斯福在被问及美国是否支持臭名昭著的尼加拉瓜暴君索莫查时回答说 ， “ 他或许是个恶棍，但却是我们的恶棍 。 ”

column1: Whether or not the quip is apocryphal, it sums up a longstanding Western approach to much of the world – and one that underpinned US foreign policy throughout the Cold War.
column2: 无论杜撰与否，这则轶事都准确地总结了西方国家对世界的态度 — — 上述态度奠定了冷战时期美国外交政策的基础。

column1: But lately an even more troubling sentiment seems to have emerged, with Western leaders willing to settle not for “our son of a bitch,” but for just about any son of a bitch who can impose stability, whatever the cost.
column2: 但近来出现了一种更令人不安的情绪，即西方领导人不仅满足于“我们的恶棍 ” ， 而且满足于任何能稳定局势的恶棍，而不管会因此付出多大的代价。

column1: It is an alluring but dangerous mindset.
column2: 这是一种颇具诱惑力但却危险的心态。

column1: Experience should have pushed Western leaders in the opposite direction.
column2: 经验本该推动西方领导人走向相反的方向。

column1: After all, as time passed, the ostensibly pragmatic clientelism of the Cold War proved far from ideal.
column2: 毕竟，随着时间的推移，事实证明貌似务实的冷战庇护主义其实远远不够理想。

column1: Indeed, in many cases – the Shah of Iran, Cambodia’s Lon Nol, Chile’s Augusto Pinochet, and the Democratic Republic of the Congo’s Mobutu Sese Seko, to name a few – it led to long-term insecurity and disorder.
column2: 事实上，在很多情况下 — — 比如伊朗国王，柬埔寨的朗诺，智利的奥古斯托·皮诺切特和刚果民主共和国的蒙博托 — — 冷战庇护主义都造成了长期动荡和混乱的后果。

column1: But these are desperate times.
column2: 但现在是绝望的时刻。

column1: Unable to contain the violence, suffering, and chaos engulfing the Middle East and North Africa – the consequences of which are increasingly being felt in Europe – Western leaders are falling back into the Cold War trap.
column2: 因为无法遏制席卷中东和北非的暴力、痛苦和混乱 — — 欧盟能越来越明显地感觉到上述后果 — — 西方领导人正再度陷入冷战陷阱之中。

column1: All they want is for someone – and now virtually anyone – to enforce order.
column2: 他们只希望有人 — — 现在几乎是任何人 — — 来稳定秩序。

column1: This desperation is perhaps most apparent in Syria.
column2: 这种绝望也许在叙利亚最为显著。

column1: After years of insisting that Syrian President Bashar al-Assad was the problem, a growing number of Western policymakers and strategists are now suggesting that he may actually be part of the solution – or at least the transition.
column2: 西方多年来一直坚持叙利亚总统巴沙尔·阿萨德是问题所在，但现在却有越来越多的西方决策者和战略家将其视为解决方案 — — 或至少是过渡方案的组成部分。

column1: Last month, German Chancellor Angela Merkel noted the necessity of including Assad in talks about Syria’s future.
column2: 上个月，德国总理默克尔强调必须让阿萨德参与叙利亚未来谈判。

column1: Likewise, both US Secretary of State John Kerry and British Prime Minister David Cameron now concede a role for Assad in a hypothetical transition.
column2: 同样，美国国务卿克里和英国首相卡梅伦现在承认阿萨德要在假设的过渡中扮演一定的角色。

column1: Spanish Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy went so far as to say that the world had to “count on” Assad in the fight against the Islamic State.
column2: 西班牙首相拉霍伊甚至表示世界必须“依靠”阿萨德打击伊斯兰国。

column1: Whether driven by realism or resignation, this shift reflects a distinct desire for stability – a desire that is reinforced, especially in Europe, by the presence of another governance black hole in Libya.
column2: 无论出于现实主义还是心灰意冷，上述转变都反映了一种对稳定的渴望：尤其在欧洲，利比亚的另一个治理黑洞强化了这种愿望。

column1: The same desire has already driven the West to support Abdel Fattah al-Sisi’s regime in Egypt – despite its dubious origins and continuing repression – with only the slightest of pressure for reform.
column2: 同样的愿望已推动西方支持埃及的塞西政权 — — 西方仅对其施加了轻微的改革压力，尽管该政权来源可疑且持续镇压民众。

column1: When confronted with anarchy, this eagerness to secure stability by whatever means necessary is understandable.
column2: 面对无政府状态时，这种不惜采取任何必要手段确保稳定的急切愿望是可以理解的。

column1: But it is a slippery slope.
column2: 但这是个危险的斜坡。

column1: And, in fact, it is based on a false dichotomy between autocracy and instability.
column2: 而且实际上基于专制和动荡错误的二分法。

column1: Of course, autocratic figures like Russian President Vladimir Putin have a strong interest in promoting this dichotomy.
column2: 当然，像俄罗斯总统普京这样的专制人物对推动这样的二分法兴趣浓厚。

column1: As the Bulgarian political analyst Ivan Krastev recently noted, Putin – a long-time ally of Assad – is doing his best to promote the idea that Western efforts to promote good governance lead only to volatility.
column2: 保加利亚政治分析家克拉斯杰夫最近指出，阿萨德的长期盟友普京正竭力宣传西方促进良好治理的努力所换来只有动荡。

column1: “Rather than bringing about reforms,” Putin declared in a recent address to the UN General Assembly, “aggressive foreign interference has resulted in…violence, poverty, and social disaster.”
column2: 普京在面向联合国大会的最近一次讲话中说 ， “ 激进的外交干预不仅没能带来改革，反而引发了暴力、贫困和社会灾难 。 ”

column1: A strong Assad-led government, the logic goes, would have the opposite effect – a point that Russia is now trying to prove on the ground in Syria.
column2: 俄国试图在叙利亚战场上证明，按照这样的逻辑，阿萨德领导的强势政府能够带来相反的效果。

column1: However compelling this idea might be, and however weary the West feels, the reality, demonstrated starkly during the Cold War and its bloody aftermath, is that tyranny is never genuinely stable – certainly not in the long run.
column2: 无论这种想法看似多么可信，也无论西方如何感到疲惫，冷战及其血腥后果所展示的赤裸裸的现实是从长期来看，专制从来不可能带来真正稳定的结果。

column1: The desire for human dignity and respect – the cornerstones of good governance – cannot be quelled, especially at a time when people have unprecedented access to information through the Internet and mobile technologies.
column2: 特别是在人们前所未有地通过互联网和移动技术了解信息的当下，人类对尊严和尊重的渴望 — — 也是善政的基础 — — 根本不可能被压制住。

column1: So good governance is the key to long-term stability.
column2: 因此善政是长期稳定的关键。

column1: But, like stability, good governance cannot be imposed from the outside; rather, it must develop organically, supported by sturdy roots within a society.
column2: 但善政和稳定一样无法从外部强加；而是必须从内部滋长，在国内社会树立牢固的根源。

column1: This does not mean that there is nothing Western governments can do.
column2: 这并不是说西方政府无事可做。

column1: On the contrary, by helping to cultivate a strong civil society at the local and national levels, external forces can play an important role in creating a strong foundation for good governance in crisis-stricken countries.
column2: 相反，外部力量可以通过在地方和国家层面上协助培育强大的民间机构，从而在危机国家创建牢固的善政基础方面发挥重要作用。

column1: The Tunisian National Dialogue Quartet – the group of civil-society organizations that was awarded this year’s Nobel Peace Prize for its “decisive contribution” to democracy after the country’s 2011 revolution – has shown just how effective a strong civil society can be in supporting stability.
column2: 2011年突尼斯革命后因对民主做出“决定性贡献”而被授予今年诺贝尔和平奖的民间组织突尼斯全国对话四方机构已经向世人证明强大的民间组织可以如何有效地支持稳定工作。

column1: To make a real difference in stabilizing today’s most tumultuous regions, the international community should hold Tunisia up as a model (and remain committed to ensuring that it continues on the path toward stable democracy), rather than falling prey to Putin’s cautionary fables about Syria and Libya.
column2: 要想在稳定当前最动荡地区的工作中真正发挥作用，国际社会应该将突尼斯引为榜样（并确保其沿着稳定的民主道路继续前进 ） ， 而不是成为继普京叙利亚和利比亚警世寓言之后的又一个牺牲者。

column1: Unfortunately, Western leaders have repeatedly shown that they lack the patience and dedication needed to engage consistently and humbly with communities in crisis-stricken countries or to provide the reliable, incremental, and prolonged governance assistance needed to prevent state collapse.
column2: 不幸的是，西方领导人一再证明他们缺乏怀着谦逊之心与危机国家社会持续接触的耐心和奉献精神，也无力提供防止国家崩溃所需的可靠、渐进和长期的治理援助。

column1: With their short attention spans and heightened sense of their own importance, they prefer the option of simply installing a despot to deal with it.
column2: 因为西方自视甚高且集中注意力的时间非常有限，他们更愿意扶植独裁者完成治理国家的任务。

column1: They need to get over themselves – for everyone’s sake.
column2: 为了所有人的利益，他们必须克服自己的短处。

column1: The Politics of Islamophobia
column2: 伊斯兰恐惧症的政治学

column1: NEW YORK – There are many roads to political disaster: greed, hubris, the charisma of the demagogue, and, perhaps most dangerous of all, fear.
column2: 纽约—可谓条条大路通政治灾难：贪婪、狂妄、魅力超凡又蛊惑人心的政客，但也许最危险的是恐惧。

column1: When people panic, they can become hysterical, and hysteria often leads to mass violence.
column2: 当人们开始恐慌时，他们会变得歇斯底里，而歇斯底里常常导致群体暴力。

column1: When politicians convince people that they are in a life-or-death battle – that survival is a matter of “us or them” – anything becomes possible.
column2: 当政客让人们相信，他们到了“最危险的时候 ” — —生存成为一件“我们还是他们”的事 — — 任何事情都可能发生。

column1: Adolf Hitler combined all the elements of political catastrophe: hubris, charisma, greed, and the idea that “Aryans” and Jews were locked in a struggle for survival.
column2: 希特勒就集中了所有政治灾难的要素：狂妄、魅力超凡、贪婪，以及“雅利安人”和犹太人已经进入你死我亡的生存斗争状态的概念。

column1: Of course, none of the demagogues in the West today – from Donald Trump in the United States to Marine Le Pen or Geert Wilders in Europe – are comparable to Hitler.
column2: 当然，如今，蛊惑人心的西方政客 — — 从美国的唐纳德·特朗普（Donald Trump）到欧洲的马琳·勒庞（Marine Le Pen）或吉尔特·怀德斯（Geert Wilders ） — —都无法与希特勒相提并论。

column1: None has promoted dictatorship, let alone mass murder.
column2: 没有一个人宣扬独裁，更不用说大屠杀了。

column1: But they are definitely stirring up the politics of fear.
column2: 但他们显然都在煽动恐慌政治。

column1: Trump, for one, also promotes greed, openly boasting of his wealth, and has somehow refined outlandish hubris and contradictory posturing into a bizarre form of charisma.
column2: 其中，特朗普也在煽动贪婪，公开炫耀他的财富，并将古怪的狂妄和矛盾的姿态融合为一种奇异的魅力。

column1: On the one hand, he promises to fix all the world’s problems, and to show China, Russia, the Islamic State, or anyone else who is boss.
column2: 一方面，他承诺要解决世界上所有问题，让中国、俄罗斯、伊斯兰国和其他所有人知道谁才是“老板 ” 。

column1: On the other hand, he claims that his vast and powerful country cannot take in desperate refugees from Syria, because, he warns, Muslim asylum-seekers might stage “one of the great military coups of all time.”
column2: 另一方面，他宣称他的广袤而强大的祖国不能接受绝望的叙利亚难民，因为，他警告说，寻求庇护的穆斯林可能“在酝酿有史以来最大的军事政变 ” 。

column1: Trump’s Republican colleagues in the race for the US presidency, such as Ted Cruz, Ben Carson, and Marco Rubio, stoke similar fears about refugees.
column2: 特朗普的共和党美国总统竞选对手同志 — — 如泰德·科鲁兹（Ted Cruz ） 、 本·卡尔森（Ben Carson）和马克·卢比奥（Marco Rubio ） — —也在煽动类似的难民恐惧。

column1: Cruz, as well as the supposedly more moderate Jeb Bush, even suggested that only Christians should be allowed into the US.
column2: 科鲁兹，以及理应更加温和的杰布·布什，甚至建议美国只允许基督徒进入。

column1: More than 10,000 people are killed every year by gun violence in the US – all but a handful for reasons having nothing to do with Islam.
column2: 在美国，每年有10,000多人死于枪支暴力 — — 其中只有极少数与伊斯兰教有关。

column1: And yet all of the Republican candidates are proud of opposing gun-control measures; indeed, they have no problem allowing people to enter a school or a bar bearing concealed weapons.
column2: 但所有共和党候选人都以反对枪支管制措施为豪；事实上，对于允许人们深藏武器进入学校或酒吧，他们一点问题都没有。

column1: But even a relative handful of Muslim refugees is too dangerous to contemplate.
column2: 但一小撮穆斯林难民对他们来说却过于危险，根本不予考虑。

column1: This is not to say that terrible acts of Islamist terror could not happen in the US, or elsewhere.
column2: 这并不是说美国或其他地区不可能发生伊斯兰恐怖袭击。

column1: They have, and there probably will be more of them, so long as the Middle East remains in turmoil and revolutionary Islam appeals to disaffected Western youth.
column2: 这种袭击早已发生过，并且未来也许还会更多，如果中东继续动荡、伊斯兰革命继续吸引心怀不满的西方青年的话。

column1: But it is hardly an existential threat.
column2: 但这绝非生存威胁。

column1: An American friend of mine speculated that, “We might be one terrorist act away from a Trump presidency.”
column2: 我的一位美国朋友猜测 ， “ 我们距离特朗普当总统大概也就相差一次恐怖行动 。 ”

column1: A spectacular murder spree by Islamists could spook Americans enough to vote for the greatest fear-monger.
column2: 如果伊斯兰教徒进行一次大凶杀，便可能让吓坏了的美国人选出散播恐惧最力的候选人。

column1: Anything is possible, but I don’t believe American voters would be that stupid.
column2: 一切都有可能，但我不相信美国选民有那么蠢。

column1: The greater danger is, however, that the demagogues will drive even mainstream politicians into their camp.
column2: 但是，更大的危险是蛊惑人心的政客甚至会导致主流政客加入他们的阵营。

column1: Since the November 13 terror attacks in Paris, François Hollande, the unpopular but altogether sensible French president, has been so afraid of being labeled a weakling by politicians of the right and far right that he has declared a national state of emergency – and war on the Islamic State (ISIS).
column2: 11月13日巴黎恐怖袭击以来，尽管支持率不高但十分明智的法国总统奥朗德生怕被右翼和极右翼政客贴上怯懦的标签，宣布法国进入紧急状态，并向伊斯兰国宣战。

column1: As long as France’s state of emergency lasts, police may arrest people without warrants, break down the doors of private residences in the middle of the night, take over restaurants and other public places with armed force, and generally behave like agents in a police state.
column2: 只要法国保持紧急状态，警察就可以不经许可抓人，可以半夜破门进入私宅，可以动用武力搜查餐厅和其他公共场所，可以像警察国家的特工那样行动。

column1: Most French citizens are now so frightened of Islamist attacks that such measures are widely supported.
column2: 目前，大部分法国公民因为伊斯兰袭击而胆战心惊，因此这些措施受到了广泛支持。

column1: But they are almost certainly counter-productive.
column2: 但它们几乎肯定将适得其反。

column1: A national leader can declare war on a state, not on a network of revolutionaries.
column2: 国家领导人可以对一个国家宣战，但无法向一个革命者网络宣战。

column1: ISIS, despite its claims, is not a state, and Hollande should not treat it as one.
column2: 伊斯兰国不是一个国家（尽管它自称是一个国家 ） ， 奥朗德也不应该把它当一个国家对待。

column1: Besides, even if bombing ISIS strongholds in Iraq or Syria makes military sense, it won’t break the spell of Islamist revolution for frustrated, bored, and marginalized young people in French slums.
column2: 此外，尽管轰炸伊拉克和叙利亚伊斯兰国据点有军事上���意义，但并不能摧毁伊斯兰革命对法国贫民窟的沮丧、无聊和边缘化青年的吸引力。

column1: On the contrary: The canny leaders of ISIS also rely on an apocalyptic “us or them” view of the world.
column2: 情况正好相反：伊斯兰国的精明领导人也依靠启示录式的“我们或他们”世界观。

column1: Most Muslims are not violent revolutionaries who condone, let alone admire, mass violence.
column2: 大部分穆斯林都不是容忍甚至崇尚群众暴力的暴力革命者。

column1: ISIS seeks to broaden its support, especially among young Muslims, by convincing them that true Muslims are in an existential war with the West – that the infidels are their mortal enemies. For them no less than for Trump, fear is the most powerful weapon.
column2: 伊斯兰国试图通过让他们相信真正的穆斯林正在与西方进行一场生存战争、异教徒就是他们的死敌来扩大其支持面，特别是年轻穆斯林中的支持面。

column1: So the more a Western government allows its policemen to humiliate and bully Muslims in the name of security, the more ISIS is likely to win European recruits.
column2: 因此，更多西方政府允许警察以安全名义羞辱和迫害穆斯林，伊斯兰国就越容易在欧洲招到人手。

column1: The only way to combat revolutionary Islamist violence is to gain the trust of law-abiding Muslims in the West.
column2: 打击革命伊斯兰暴力的唯一办法是赢得西方守法穆斯林的信任。

column1: This will not be easy, but arbitrary arrests are surely the wrong way to go about it.
column2: 这绝非易事，但肆意逮捕显然是错误的方法。

column1: Likewise, when it comes to civil wars in the Middle East, Western restraint is usually a better strategy than hasty military intervention driven by domestic fear.
column2: 类似地，对于中东内战，西方的约束常常是比出于国内恐惧而进行仓促的军事干预更好的策略。

column1: Republican candidates in the US are already using the recent murder spree in Paris to blame President Barack Obama, and by extension any future Democratic candidate, for being weak.
column2: 美国共和党候选人已开始利用最近的巴黎大谋杀指责总统奥巴马 — — 并将指责对象扩大到所有未来民主党候选人 — — 表现软弱。

column1: Trump has promised to “bomb the shit out of ISIS.”
column2: 特朗普承诺要“把伊斯兰国炸出屎来 ” 。

column1: This bellicosity has had the effect of pushing Hillary Clinton, the front-runner for the Democratic presidential nomination, into distancing herself from Obama.
column2: 如此好斗的结果是让在民主党候选人提名竞争中领先的希拉里·克林顿与奥巴马撇清界线。

column1: Like Hollande, she has to assuage public fear by talking tough and promising more military action.
column2: 和奥朗德一样，她必须通过强硬表态和承诺增加军事行动平息公共恐慌。

column1: Obama has consistently resisted the temptation to unleash more wars.
column2: 奥巴马一直在抵制发动更多战争的诱惑。

column1: His policies have sometimes been inconsistent and irresolute.
column2: 他的政策有时前后矛盾、犹豫不决。

column1: But in his refusal to give in to panic and act rashly, he has been far braver than all the big talkers who accuse him of being a wimp.
column2: 但他拒绝屈服于恐慌、轻率行事，在这一点上，他比指责他是懦夫的“嘴炮”更加勇敢。

column1: The Inconvenient Truth About Saudi Arabia
column2: 难以忽视的沙特真相

column1: NEW YORK – The 2006 documentary “An Inconvenient Truth” highlights former US Vice President Al Gore’s efforts to alert his fellow Americans to the perils of global warming.
column2: 发自纽约 — — 2006年的纪录片《难以忽视的真相》彰显出了美国前副总统戈尔为警告自己的同胞注意全球变暖风险而做出的努力。

column1: What made the truth inconvenient is that avoiding catastrophic climate change would require people to live differently and, in some cases, give up what they love (such as gas-guzzling cars).
column2: 而让真相如此难以忽视的原因则在于避免灾难性的气候变化将要求人们去改变自己的生活方式，甚至在某些情况下放弃自己的心爱之物（比如大排量汽车 ） 。

column1: For nearly two months, we have all been living with another inconvenient truth – ever since Jamal Khashoggi, a Saudi journalist working for The Washington Post and living in the United States, disappeared after entering Saudi Arabia’s consulate in Istanbul.
column2: 而近两个月来，我们一直生活在另一个难以忽视的真相之中 — — 自从为《华盛顿邮报》工作并居住在美国的沙特记者贾迈勒·卡舒吉（Jamal Khashoggi）在进入沙特驻伊斯坦布尔领事馆后失踪后。

column1: A large part of the truth is undeniable: Khashoggi was murdered by individuals with close ties to the Saudi government and its de facto leader, Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman (widely known as MBS).
column2: 很大一部分事实是无可否认的：卡舒吉是被与沙特政府及其事实上的领导人，王储穆罕默德·本·萨勒曼（Mohammed bin Salman）关系密切的个人杀害的。

column1: Weeks of official Saudi denials and lies only reinforced the conclusion – now also the reported judgment of the CIA – that the murder was premeditated and approved at the top.
column2: 沙特官方几周以来的否认和谎言都只是强化了这一结论（据报也是美国中情局的判断 ） ， 那就是这起谋杀是有预谋并获得沙特高层批准的。

column1: MBS’s direct role may not be 100% proven, but most observers familiar with Saudi Arabia harbor little doubt.
column2: 王储在此事件中所直接扮演的角色虽然无法得到100％的证实，但大多数熟悉沙特的观察家们都不会怀疑。

column1: This is not a system that tolerates much freelancing.
column2: 须知沙特的体制可不太能容下这类不受控制的人。

column1: What makes the truth inconvenient is Saudi Arabia’s strategic importance.
column2: 而使真相无可忽视之处还在于沙特阿拉伯的战略重要性。

column1: The Kingdom still accounts for over 10% of global oil output.
column2: 该国仍占据全球石油产量的10％以上。

column1: Its sovereign wealth fund sits on an estimated $500 billion.
column2: 其主权财富基金规模估计达5000亿美元。

column1: Saudi Arabia is the most influential Sunni Arab country, occupying a special role within the Muslim world, owing to its role as the custodian of Islam’s holiest sites.
column2: 它是最具影响力的逊尼派阿拉伯国家，作为伊斯兰教多个最神圣地点的监护者在穆斯林世界中扮演着特殊的角色。

column1: It is central to any policy of confronting Iran.
column2: 同时沙特也是任何对抗伊朗政策的核心。

column1: Moreover, MBS, for all his faults, is something of a reformer, understanding that his country must open up and diversify if it is to thrive and the royal family is to survive.
column2: 此外王储萨勒曼尽管有诸多缺点，但依然算是个改革者，知道自己国家的繁荣和王室的生存离不开开放和多元化。

column1: He is also popular at home, especially with younger Saudis, who constitute the bulk of the population.
column2: 他本人在国内也颇受欢迎，尤其是在占人口大多数的沙特年轻人中很有威望。

column1: The problem is that the faults of the young and impulsive Crown Prince are many.
column2: 但问题在于这位年轻和冲动王储的缺点真是相当多。

column1: In addition to his role in the murder of Khashoggi, he recklessly ordered the Saudi attack on Yemen that triggered his country’s equivalent of the US war in Vietnam – a strategic and humanitarian catastrophe.
column2: 除了卡舒吉谋杀案中的作用之外，他还鲁莽地下令沙特出兵也门，导致自己的国家陷入了类似美国越南战争的境地 — — 一场战略和人道主义的灾难。

column1: He kidnapped the Lebanese prime minister, did all he could to undermine Qatar, arrested wealthy Saudis who refused to embrace his consolidation of power, froze diplomatic relations with Canada over a critical tweet, and imprisoned political activists, including women seeking greater rights.
column2: 他绑架了黎巴嫩总理，想尽办法去打压卡塔尔，逮捕了一批拒绝接受其权力巩固措施的沙特富豪，因为一条批评性推文就冻结了与加拿大的外交关系，还监禁了一批政治活动分子，包括那些试图争取更多权利的妇女。

column1: The Saudi strategy for dealing with the outcry over Khashoggi’s murder is clear: hunker down and weather the storm.
column2: 沙特对卡舒吉谋杀案所引发的强烈抗议的处理策略很明确：就地卧倒，熬过冲击。

column1: MBS and his inner circle are calculating that the world’s outrage will fade, given their country’s importance.
column2: 鉴于本国的重要性，王储和他的核心圈子都算计说全世界的愤怒将会消退。

column1: He has good reason to believe that other Sunni Arab states will stand by him, given the subsidies he provides.
column2: 在他所提供的丰厚补贴之下，他有充分的理由相信其他逊尼派阿拉伯国家会站在他这边。

column1: Israel, too, has indicated support for MBS, owing to his willingness to move in the direction of normalizing relations and, more important, the two countries’ shared interest in countering Iranian influence in the region.
column2: 以色列也表示会支持王储，因为他愿意朝着关系正常化的方向前进，更重要的是两国在打击伊朗在该地区影响力方面有着共同的利益。

column1: And US President Donald Trump’s administration is standing by its man, so far refusing to acknowledge his role in Khashoggi’s murder and resisting calls for sanctions against Saudi Arabia.
column2: 美国总统特朗普的政府也愿意为他出面，至今依然拒绝承认他在卡舒吉谋杀中的作用并拒绝如外界所呼吁的那样对沙特实施制裁。

column1: What, then, should be done?
column2: 那么究竟该做些什么？

column1: Former US Secretary of State James A. Baker recently drew a parallel to US policy toward China in 1989, at the time of the massacre of protesting students in Beijing’s Tiananmen Square.
column2: 美国前国务卿詹姆斯·贝克（James A. Baker）最近将此事件与1989年北京天安门广场屠杀学生时的对华政策画上了等号。

column1: George H.W. Bush’s administration (of which I was a part) worked hard to thread the needle: introducing sanctions to convey displeasure with the Chinese government, but limiting the punishment and keeping lines of communication open, given China’s importance.
column2: 老布什政府（本人也是其中一员）的任务非常艰巨：一方面要实施制裁以表达对中国政府的不满，另一方面鉴于中国的重要性，又得限制惩罚力度并保持沟通渠道畅通。

column1: Would a similar policy toward Saudi Arabia prove viable?
column2: 那么针对沙特的类似政策是否可行？

column1: Ideally, the US and European governments would let it be known that they would be more open to working with Saudi Arabia if the power of the Crown Prince were reduced.
column2: 在理想状态下，欧美各国政府会公开宣称如果王储能削减其权力，那么它们也会更愿意与沙特合作。

column1: There should also be limits on US arms sales and intelligence support, which, fortunately, the US Congress is likely to impose.
column2: 来自美国军售和情报支持也应该会受到限制，幸运的是美国国会很可能实施这一点。

column1: But more important than any sanction would be ratcheting up public and private pressure on MBS regarding what is needed and what needs to be avoided.
column2: 但比任何制裁都更重要的是去增大王储所承受的公共和私人压力，让他知道需要做什么以及需要避免什么。

column1: What is needed is a concerted push to end the Yemen conflict. What needs to be avoided is exploitation of the Trump administration’s anti-Iran animus to provoke an armed confrontation that would force others to overcome their qualms and side with Saudi Arabia.
column2: 我们需要的是齐心协力结束也门冲突，需要避免的是利用特朗普政府的反伊朗敌意来挑起武装对抗，迫使其他人放弃顾虑加入沙特一方。

column1: A war with Iran would be costly and dangerous.
column2: 一场与伊朗的战争将是昂贵而危险的。

column1: MBS should be made to understand that the US will be a strategic partner for Saudi Arabia only if he acts with greater restraint in Yemen and elsewhere, and with greater respect for US interests.
column2: 应该让王储知道美国只有在他在也门和其他地方表现出更大克制且更加尊重美国利益时才会成为其战略伙伴。

column1: Consultations should also be held with China and Russia.
column2: 此外还应与中国和俄罗斯进行磋商。

column1: Unlike the US, both have working relationships with Saudi Arabia and Iran, which gives both a stake in preventing such a war from starting and shutting it down quickly if it does.
column2: 与美国不同的是这两国都分别与沙特和伊朗建立了合作关系，这既可以从一开始防止这么一场战争，就算战争爆发也可以迅速将其掐灭。

column1: All too often in the Middle East, a bad situation becomes a worse situation.
column2: 无奈一个坏情况变得更糟的状况在中东可谓层出不穷。

column1: MBS has created a bad situation. The aim should be to establish sufficient limits so that it does not become worse.
column2: 沙特王储已经创造了一个糟糕的局面，而各界的目标应该是建立足够的限制，好使其不会继续恶化下去。

column1: Decolonizing Western Sahara
column2: 西撒哈拉地区去殖民化

column1: BIR LEHLU, WESTERN SAHARA – When Western Sahara was annexed by Morocco in 1975, it had been under Spanish control for nearly a century.
column2: 西撒哈拉贝尔鲁鲁 — — 1975年西撒哈拉被摩洛哥吞并时，此前近一个世纪都处在西班牙的统治之下。

column1: But Spain’s grip on the territory had weakened in the dying days of Francisco Franco’s dictatorship.
column2: 但在弗朗西斯科·弗朗哥独裁统治期的末尾，西班牙对该地区的控制似乎有所削弱。

column1: And rather than allowing a process of decolonization, Spain signed the tripartite “Madrid Accords” with Morocco and Mauritania, both of which subsequently moved in to annex the territory.
column2: 但西班牙并没有坐视去殖民化进程，而是与摩洛哥和毛里塔尼亚签署了三方“马德里协议 ” ， 之后两国都派兵进驻吞并西撒哈拉。

column1: Mauritania relinquished its claim in 1979, but Morocco never left.
column2: 1979年，毛里塔尼亚放弃了这一诉求，但摩洛哥却从未离开过。

column1: Western Sahara’s legal status is crystal clear.
column2: 西撒哈拉的法律地位是非常明确的。

column1: In 1963, it was officially recognized as a Non-Self-Governing Territory by the United Nations General Assembly under the UN Charter – a legal status it retains to this day.
column2: 1963年，联合国大会根据联合国宪章的规定正式承认其为非自治领土 — — 这是一直保留至今的一种法律地位。

column1: It is, in short, the last colony in Africa.
column2: 简言之，西撒哈拉是非洲最后一块殖民地。

column1: In 1975, the International Court of Justice (ICJ) affirmed the Saharawi people’s right to self-determination, and found no ties of territorial sovereignty between Morocco and Western Sahara.
column2: 1975年，国际法院（ICJ）确认了撒哈拉民众的自决权，同时不承认摩洛哥和西撒哈拉领土主权之间是有联系的。

column1: Yet Morocco has been allowed to continue illegally occupying Western Sahara for over four decades.
column2: 但40多年来联合国一直允许摩洛哥继续非法占领西撒哈拉。

column1: And, as is often the case with unwanted occupations, Morocco has asserted its territorial claim through cruel repression, the systematic denial of basic human rights, and attempts to force demographic change – all while plundering Western Sahara’s natural resources.
column2: 而且，向其他不受欢迎的占领一样，摩洛哥一直通过残酷的镇压来宣示其领土主张，有计划的剥夺基本人权并试图强制推行人口变化 — — 同时对西撒哈拉的自然资源展开掠夺。

column1: The Polisario Front fought a war with Morocco until 1991, when the UN brokered a ceasefire agreement.
column2: 波利萨里奥阵线与摩洛哥的战争持续到1991年，而后在联合国的调停下停火协议签署。

column1: That deal was supposed to set the stage for a referendum on independence in Western Sahara the following year – a democratic solution.
column2: 协议签署后，本应在第二年就西撒哈拉独立问题举行全民公投 — — 这是一个民主的解决办法。

column1: But Morocco has prevented it from ever taking place.
column2: 但那次公投被摩洛哥阻止了。

column1: Morocco has also repeatedly obstructed progress toward further negotiations.
column2: 摩洛哥还一再阻挠举行进一步谈判。

column1: It has done so in defiance of the UN Security Council, even going so far as to bar the UN’s special envoy from travelling to the region to set the stage for talks.
column2: 这样做完全违背联合国安理会的意愿，甚至猖獗到阻止联合国特使来到西撒哈拉地区进行谈判的准备工作。

column1: At the same time, Morocco’s behavior on the ground – including its repression of the Saharawi people and its illegal exploitation of natural resources – has made reaching a political solution increasingly difficult.
column2: 与此同时，摩洛哥在当地的行为 — — 包括镇压撒哈拉民众和非法开采自然资源 — — 已经增加了达成政治解决方案的难度。

column1: In the 42 years of Morocco’s occupation of Western Sahara, we, the Saharawi people, have seen eight American presidents, six UN secretary-generals, and a battery of UN special representatives and personal envoys of the secretary-general come and go.
column2: 在摩洛哥占领西撒哈拉的42年期间，我们生活在撒哈拉地区的民众目睹了八位美国总统、六位联合国秘书长、一批联合国特别代表和联合国秘书长的个人特使上上下下。

column1: Through it all, we have maintained our faith in the international community, and in the UN-led political process that was launched in 1991.
column2: 但我们一直保持了对国际社会的信任，在联合国主导的1991年政治进程中也是一样。

column1: It is time for that faith to be rewarded.
column2: 这种信任现在应当得到回报。

column1: In its latest resolution on Western Sahara this year, the UN Security Council unanimously called for the launch of a new political process and acknowledged that the status quo is not acceptable.
column2: 在今年西撒哈拉问题的最新决议中，联合国安理会一致呼吁启动新的政治进程并承认目前的状况是不可接受的。

column1: The Security Council recognizes that this is the best route to achieving decolonization in Western Sahara, protecting human rights, enabling self-determination by the Saharawi people, and setting the stage for long-term stability in the territory.
column2: 安理会承认解决问题的最佳途径是实现西撒哈拉去殖民化，保护人权，确保撒哈拉民众拥有自决权并为该地区实现长期稳定奠定基础。

column1: The UN Secretariat, the office of the secretary-general, and the new special envoy for Western Sahara, former German President Horst Köhler, now must work rapidly on creating a mechanism for face-to-face time-bound talks.
column2: 联合国秘书长办公室联合国秘书处以及西撒哈拉新任特使前德国总统霍斯特·克勒现在必须加快建立面对面针对性谈判机制的进度。

column1: The progress report that they deliver to the Security Council in six months should establish what that mechanism will be, as well as a timetable for negotiations; it should not just be a record of exploratory efforts.
column2: 他们在六个月内向安理会提交的进度报告应当确立相关机制，同时制定谈判时间表；这份报告不应只是记录所做的探索性工作。

column1: In the meantime, we in the Polisario Front will continue to work toward securing the rights of the Saharawi people.
column2: 与此同时，我们波利萨里奥阵线将继续推进争取撒哈拉人民权利的工作。

column1: Whereas other countries often fold to Moroccan pressure, for fear of harming trade deals or cooperation over security and migration, the law has proved to be a reliable ally for the people of Western Sahara.
column2: 尽管其他国家由于担心损害贸易协议或安全及移民合作往往屈从于摩洛哥的压力，但事实证明法律是西撒哈拉人民的可靠朋友。

column1: It has been particularly effective in pushing back against Morocco’s continued illegal exploitation of natural resources.
column2: 在反抗摩洛哥不断非法开采自然资源方面拿起法律武器尤其有效。

column1: This is why we have often turned to the courts when the political process has failed us.
column2: 因此政治进程让我们失望时我们往往向法庭求助。

column1: Last December, the European Court of Justice joined the ICJ in stating unequivocally that Morocco has no sovereignty over Western Sahara – a move that could pose a significant challenge to Morocco’s relationship with the European Union.
column2: 去年12月，欧洲法院与国际法院联手明确表示摩洛哥对西撒哈拉地区不具有主权 — — 此举严重挑战了摩洛哥与欧盟的关系。

column1: That judgment states clearly that any agreement pertaining to Western Sahara’s natural resources requires the consent of the Saharawi people, who are represented by the Polisario Front, as General Assembly Resolution 34/37 established in 1979.
column2: 该判决明确表示任何与西撒哈拉自然资源有关的协议需要得到撒哈拉民众的同意，而波利萨里奥阵线是西撒哈拉民众的代表，就像1979年联大第 34/37号决议所规定的那样。

column1: And the EU is not alone.
column2: 而欧盟采取这种做法并非唯一一个。

column1: This past May, the Panamanian authorities detained a Canada-bound ship carrying phosphates that had been illegally mined by a state-owned Moroccan company in occupied Western Sahara.
column2: 今年5月，巴拿马当局扣留了一艘载有磷酸盐的驶往加拿大的船只，这艘船上的磷酸盐是由一家国有摩洛哥企业在在西撒哈拉占领区非法开采的。

column1: And South African authorities stopped a New Zealand-bound ship containing 54,000 tons of phosphate rock from Western Sahara.
column2: 而南非当局则拦截了一艘载有5，4000吨磷酸盐岩的从西撒哈拉驶往新西兰的船只。

column1: The high court in Port Elizabeth sent the case to trial to determine ownership, and the Polisario Front won a major victory – and ownership of the cargo – when Morocco announced that it would not contest the case.
column2: 伊丽莎白港高等法院将此案提交审判以确定所有权，而波利萨里奥阵线取得了重大胜利 — — 货物所有权 — — 同时摩洛哥宣布将不对此案提出申诉。

column1: The exploitation of Western Sahara’s natural resources is not only illegal; it also undermines the prospects for a successful political process.
column2: 开发西撒哈拉自然资源不仅非法，而且还破坏了政治进程成功的可能性。

column1: We have no intention of abandoning that process.
column2: 我们无意放弃政治进程。

column1: But, if Morocco continues to engage in such activities, we will ensure that its efforts are as costly and cumbersome as possible, both for private companies and state actors.
column2: 但如果摩洛哥继续进行这样的活动，我们将确保让该国私营和国营企业付出尽可能多的代价。

column1: We will fight for our rights in every venue available to us, from national courts to the court of international public opinion.
column2: 我们将在一切可能的地方争取我们的权利，从国家法院到国际舆论法庭无一遗漏。

column1: Over the last four decades, the UN Security Council has repeatedly proved unwilling or unable to bring Morocco to the negotiating table.
column2: 过去40年来，事实一再证明联合国安理会不愿或不能将摩洛哥带到谈判桌上。

column1: We, the people of Western Sahara, hope that this time will be different.
column2: 我们西撒哈拉地区的民众希望这一次是不同的。

column1: But, until we know that it is, we will not stand idly by while a hostile occupier tramples on our rights, and pillages our resources.
column2: 但直到我们确信这一点之前，我们绝不会袖手旁观地坐视占领者践踏我们的权利、掠夺我们的资源而不采取任何行动。

column1: A Future for Western Sahara
column2: 西撒哈拉的未来

column1: MADRID – International politics is replete with unresolved territorial disputes, from conflicting claims by China and Japan over the Senkaku/Diaoyu Islands in the East China Sea to the prolonged disagreement between Armenia and Azerbaijan over Nagorno-Karabakh.
column2: 马德里—国际政坛充斥着悬而未决的领土纠纷，如中日的东海钓鱼岛之争、亚美尼亚和阿塞拜疆的纳卡地区（Nagorno-Karabakh）的长期纠纷等。

column1: But one such dispute, over Western Sahara, is often overlooked, despite the very real possibility of resolving it.
column2: 但西撒哈拉纠纷常常为人所忽视，尽管我们有很大的可能解决它。

column1: With a population of about 600,000 on territory covering roughly 102,700 square miles (266,000 square kilometers), Western Sahara, a Spanish colony until 1975, is the largest of 17 non-self-governing territories listed by the United Nations as having not reached final political status.
column2: 西撒哈拉是一片266,000平方公里的土地，人口600,000，在1975年前一直是西班牙殖民地，现在是联合国所列举的17个为取得最终政治地位的非自治领地中最大的一块。

column1: The territory has been in limbo for much of the last four decades, with Morocco and the pro-independence Polisario Front both asserting claims to the territory.
column2: 在过去四十年里，该领地一直飘摇不定，摩洛哥和支持独立的波利萨里奥阵线（Polisario Front）都主张对这篇领地的主权。

column1: Morocco controls about 80%; the Polisario Front holds the remaining 20%, on the border with Algeria.
column2: 摩洛哥控制了其中的80%左右，波利萨里奥阵线控制了其余20%与阿尔及利亚接壤的地区。

column1: Last month, I visited Western Sahara’s Moroccan-controlled capital, Laayoune – a vibrant and gleaming city born from a dusty Spanish colonial outpost – to examine the sustainability of the operations of OCP Group, on whose international advisory board I serve.
column2: 上个月，我访问了摩控西撒哈拉首都拉尤恩（Laayoune ） 。 这是一个充满生机的闪亮城市，脱胎自一个破败的西班牙殖民地前哨站。

column1: OCP Group is a leading phosphate producer, with access to approximately 70% of the world’s phosphate reserves.
column2: 我来这里是考察OCP集团项目的可持续性。 OCP集团是全球领先的磷酸盐生产商，开采着全球大约70%的磷酸盐储备，我是其国际顾问委员会成员。

column1: It operates in Western Sahara through its subsidiary Phosboucraa, which represents about 6% of OCP’s business turnover and approximately 1.6% of its phosphate reserves.
column2: 它在西撒哈拉通过其子公司Phosboucraa开展业务。 Phosboucraa贡献了OCP大约6%的营业收入和大约1.6%的磷酸盐储备。

column1: My visit focused, first, on measuring the impact of Phosboucraa’s activities, such as infrastructure investment, the construction of job training centers, and partnerships with farming cooperatives.
column2: 我的访问重点首先是评估Phosboucraa的活动所造成的影响，如基础设施投资、培训中心的建设，以及农业合作等。

column1: Second, I was to consider how well those activities conform to UN doctrine on natural-resource exploitation in non-self-governing territories – namely, that they benefit the territory and its inhabitants until Western Sahara’s ultimate political status is determined.
column2: 其次，我到这里是为了考察这些活动是否遵循联合国的非自治领地自然资源开发指导思想 — — 即，它们要有利于该领地及其居民，直到西撒哈拉的政治地位最终得到确认。

column1: But when might that status be determined?
column2: 但政治地位到底什么时候才能确认？

column1: The UN has been trying to broker a resolution since Spain departed the territory, transferring administrative control over Western Sahara to Mauritania and Morocco.
column2: 自西班牙离开该领地、将西撒哈拉的行政权移交给毛里塔尼亚和摩洛哥以来，联合国一直在试图调停。

column1: Mauritania left in 1979, leaving Morocco to confront the Polisario Front, which had announced its claims to the territory in the last years of Spanish control.
column2: 1979年，毛里塔尼亚退出，西撒哈拉进入摩洛哥和波利萨里奥阵线对峙的时代，后者从西班牙控制时代末期开始主张对该领地的主权。

column1: In 1991, after a 16-year conflict, the UN managed to broker a truce between the two parties, which included an immediate ceasefire.
column2: 1991年，在经历了16年的冲突后，联合国成功调停了双方，并实现立刻停火。

column1: Under the auspices of the UN Security Council, negotiations were initiated, with the goal of resolving the conflict and determining the future status not just of Western Sahara, but also of the thousands of refugees in camps in Algeria.
column2: 在联合国安理会的斡旋下，双方开启谈判，目标是解决冲突、确定西撒哈拉 — — 以及数千万被收容在阿尔及利亚难民营的难民 — — 的未来命运。

column1: Along the way, there have been some milestones, often marked by the personality of the UN envoy of the moment.
column2: 在此期间，谈判取得了几个里程碑 — — 常常带有时任联合国特使的个人印记。

column1: The envoy who had perhaps the greatest impact was former US Secretary of State James Baker, who ushered the process beyond discussion of a referendum on Western Saharan independence – the initial focus of the talks – toward broader, more flexible solutions.
column2: 其中影响最大的一个是前美国国务卿詹姆斯·贝克尔（James Baker ） ， 他让和平进程不再局限于此前的谈判焦点 — — 西撒哈拉独立公投，而是转向了更广泛、更灵活的方案。

column1: In 2003, when I was Spain’s foreign minister, I had the opportunity to engage with the most ambitious of Baker’s proposals – the so-called Baker II plan – which envisioned self-rule under a Western Sahara Authority for a period of five years, with a referendum on independence to follow.
column2: 2003年我担任西班牙外交部长期间，曾有机会参与到贝克尔最雄心勃勃的方案中，这个所谓的贝克尔II计划着眼于建立一个西撒哈拉权力机构（Western Sahara Authority ） ， 在其领导下，西撒哈拉先自治五年，然后再举行独立公投。

column1: That plan failed, ultimately leading to Baker’s resignation as UN envoy. But the purview of the talks was fundamentally altered (though the Polisario Front has remained focused on a referendum that includes independence as an option).
column2: 这一计划以失败告终，并最终导致贝克尔辞任联合国特使，但谈判的界限已经从根本上改变（尽管波利萨里奥阵线仍然抓住将独立作为选项之一的公投不放 ） 。

column1: In 2007, following the suggestion by Baker’s successor to take into account the “political reality” of the situation, the UN Security Council opened a new phase of negotiations without preconditions, aimed at reaching “a mutually acceptable political solution.”
column2: 2007年，贝克尔的继任者建议考虑局面的“政治现实 ” ， 根据这项建议，联合国安理会启动了不设先决条件的谈判新阶段，旨在形成“双方都能接受的政治解决方案 ” 。

column1: This approach has endured until the present day, shepherded for the last ten years by the former US diplomat Christopher Ross.
column2: 这一方针在前美国外交官克里斯托弗·罗斯（Christopher Ross）的领导下，被贯彻至今。

column1: In March, however, Ross announced his resignation as UN envoy.
column2: 但在今年3月，罗斯辞任联合国特使。

column1: The following month, the UN’s new secretary-general, António Guterres, announced his intention to relaunch the process.
column2: 4月，联合国新秘书长古特雷斯宣布准备重启谈判进程。

column1: Now that a new UN envoy – former German President Horst Köhler – has been named, there is renewed hope for a breakthrough.
column2: 现在，联合国已经任命了新特使 — — 前德国总统科勒，我们又看见了取得突破的曙光。

column1: The shared conviction that there is no alternative to the UN negotiating process is its greatest strength.
column2: 我们现在最大的优势是，所有人都认为除了联合国谈判进程之外，没有其他路可走。

column1: But it is also a fragile framework, confronting mounting challenges.
column2: 但这也是一个脆弱的框架，面临着艰巨的挑战。

column1: In the last year, a potential flashpoint has emerged in an area called Guerguerat, with the Polisario Front sending forces into a UN buffer zone.
column2: 去年，在一个叫作Guerguerat的地区成为新的潜在“火药桶 ” ， 波利萨里奥阵线向联合国缓冲区派遣了武装力量。

column1: Moreover, members of the UN peacekeeping force were expelled, and later readmitted to the territory.
column2: 此外，联合国维和部队遭到驱逐，随后又重新进入该领地。

column1: There have also been proceedings before the European Court of Justice on the implementation of commercial agreements between Morocco and the EU in the territory.
column2: 欧洲法院也一直在审理摩洛哥和欧盟在该地区的商业合同的执行诉讼。

column1: So this is a moment of great opportunity for the process, but also of great risk.
column2: 因此，现在既是谈判进程的大机会，也是它的风险时刻。

column1: In this context, it is worth questioning the Polisario Front’s aggressive new campaign against third parties in the territory.
column2: 在这样的环境下，应该质疑波利萨里奥阵线针对领地内第三方的侵犯性新行动。

column1: At the end of April – just a day after the UN Security Council endorsed Guterres’s call to relaunch the negotiation process – the Polisario Front launched a legal challenge in a civil court in South Africa, seeking to seize a shipment of phosphate mined in the territory.
column2: 4月底 — — 即联合国安理会支持古特雷斯关于重启谈判进程的提议之后几天 — — 波利萨里奥阵线就向南非民事法庭提起了诉讼，要求扣留一艘装载在该领地进行采掘的磷酸盐的船只。

column1: Days later, a similar challenge was brought in Panama against another ship.
column2: 几天后，巴拿马法院也收到了扣留另一条船的诉讼。

column1: The Panamanian court dismissed the action, noting that it was a diplomatic and international question, but the South African matter is ongoing.
column2: 巴拿马法院驳回了上诉，指出这是一个外交和国际问题，但南非的案子仍在进行中。

column1: This new tactic of using third-country civil courts to hurt Morocco will only undermine the UN process.
column2: 这一利用第三国民事法庭伤害摩洛哥的新策略将破坏联合国谈判进程。

column1: A solution to the Western Saharan conflict can be reached only if all parties involved – especially Morocco and the Polisario Front, but also neighboring countries, particularly Algeria – commit to do so.
column2: 西撒哈拉要想形成解决冲突的方案，涉及各方 — — 特别是摩洛哥和波利萨里奥阵线，但也包括邻国特别是阿尔及利亚 — — 都必须竭尽全力。

column1: In fact, the entire international community has a stake in the success of the UN process – and a responsibility to do everything possible to bring it about.
column2: 事实上，整个国际社会都将因为联合国谈判进程的成功而受益 — — 因此也有责任尽其所能使进程获得成功。

column1: The West’s Decadent Foreign Policy
column2: 颓废的西方外交政策

column1: LONDON – Nowadays, the West can be described as decadent.
column2: 伦敦 — — 可以用颓废来形容现在的西方。

column1: That does not mean simply that we are addicted to “bread and circuses,” from welfare programs in Europe (which we can barely afford) to the Super Bowl in the United States. It means also that we are increasingly reluctant to allow our own vision of civil liberties and human rights to shape our foreign policies, owing to the potential commercial costs.
column2: 这不仅意味着我们沉迷于欧洲福利计划的“小恩小惠 ” （ 其实我们已经难以负担相关的开销）和美国的超级碗，还意味着因为潜在的商业成本，我们越来越不愿意让公民自由和人权观来决定自己的外交政策。

column1: Consider the case of the Chinese dissident and Nobel Peace Prize laureate Liu Xiaobo, who recently died while serving an 11-year prison sentence for calling for democracy in China.
column2: 以中国持不同政见者及诺贝尔和平奖得主刘晓波为例，他因为呼吁中国实行民主制度不久前在服刑11年期间死于狱中。

column1: The Chinese authorities refused Liu’s request, made just weeks before his death, to seek treatment abroad for his aggressive cancer, and his wife remains under house arrest.
column2: 中国政府拒绝了刘在死前几周所提出的到国外治疗癌症的请求，而他的妻子依然被软禁。

column1: China’s treatment of dissidents like Liu is nothing short of savage.
column2: 中国对待像刘这样持不同政见者的态度可以用野蛮来形容。

column1: Yet Western leaders have offered only a few carefully phrased diplomatic statements criticizing it.
column2: 但西方领导人仅仅发表了一些措辞谨慎的批评性的外交言论。

column1: I can only wonder how many Western leaders in recent years have raised Liu’s case with their Chinese counterparts behind closed doors.
column2: 我只想知道近年来有多少西方领导人曾关起门来向中国官员提到刘晓波。

column1: Opportunities surely abounded, including at this summer’s G20 meeting, when Liu was on his deathbed.
column2: 这样的机会肯定不少，其中包括今年夏天召开的G20峰会，当时刘晓波已经濒临死亡。

column1: But it seems unlikely that Western leaders confronted Chinese President Xi Jinping on the matter.
column2: 但西方领导人不太可能因此正面对抗中国国家主席习近平。

column1: After all, when Liu was awarded the Nobel Prize in 2010, and an infuriated China attempted to ostracize Norway, the West did not express outrage or display real solidarity with a NATO ally.
column2: 毕竟，当刘在2010年被授予诺贝尔奖以及被激怒的中国试图惩罚挪威时，西方并没有表达愤怒，也没有展现出与北约盟友的真正团结。

column1: China’s treatment of Hong Kong has gone similarly uncontested by Western leaders.
column2: 中国对香港的态度同样没有引起西方领导人的反抗。

column1: China seems intent on violating its obligations, established in the “joint declaration” signed with the United Kingdom, to preserve the city’s way of life and the rule of law until 2047.
column2: 中国似乎决意违反与英国所签署的“联合声明”所规定的义务，到2047年前保持这座城市的法治体系和生活方式。

column1: Already, it has threatened the independence of the judiciary, the autonomy of universities, and freedom of the press.
column2: 中国已经开始威胁香港的司法独立、大学自治和新闻自由。

column1: Yet there has been little pushback from the West, including the UK.
column2: 但西方国家，包括英国在内，几乎没有任何反抗的企图。

column1: Why are Western countries so reluctant to criticize China’s behavior more loudly and consistently?
column2: 西方国家为什么不愿大肆批评中国的所作所为？

column1: The answer, it seems, is money.
column2: 答案似乎是钱在作祟。

column1: Greece, which proudly claims to be the cradle of democracy, has leaders who largely grew up opposing an authoritarian military government.
column2: 自诩为民主摇篮的希腊领袖在成长过程中大都有反对独裁军政府的经历。

column1: Yet its cash-strapped government recently blocked the European Union from criticizing China’s human-rights record at the United Nations, because China provides critical investment, particularly from the China Ocean Shipping Company, known as COSCO, which in August 2016 acquired a majority stake in the port of Piraeus.
column2: 但希腊现金紧张的政府最近阻止欧盟在联合国对中国的人权状况提出批评，因为中国为他们提供了关键投资，尤其是来自中国远洋运输公司（英文缩写为COSCO）的投资，该公司于2016年8月完成了对希腊比雷埃夫斯港大部分股权的收购。

column1: Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras – a supposedly radical leftist who, paying homage to Che Guevara, named his son Ernesto – has become a Chinese patsy.
column2: 希腊总理亚历克西斯·齐普拉斯 — — 据称是一名敬重切·格瓦拉的激进左翼份子，他为自己的儿子取名为埃内斯托 — — 现在已经成为中国的傀儡。

column1: The West’s moral bankruptcy is on display closer to home, too.
column2: 西方也越来越接近道义上的破产。

column1: The EU continues to hold back from condemning the thuggery of Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán, who has proudly boasted of his belief in “illiberal democracy” (an oxymoron if ever there was one).
column2: 欧盟继续拒绝对谋财害命的匈牙利总理欧尔班进行谴责。 欧尔班曾自豪地吹嘘自己信仰“非自由民主 ” （ 非自由民主的说法本身就充满了矛盾 ） 。

column1: Under Orbán’s leadership, breaches of human-rights conventions in the treatment of refugees have been accompanied by a crackdown on civil society, particularly on organizations that receive money from outside the country.
column2: 在欧尔班的领导下，匈牙利不仅违反难民待遇人权公约而且镇压民间社会，尤其是那些资金来自国外的民间组织。

column1: One notable target of repression is Central European University, a bastion of open debate, teaching, and research in Hungary, which is funded by George Soros.
column2: 主要的镇压目标是中欧大学，这所大学是乔治·索罗斯出资修建的匈牙利教学、研究和公开辩论的堡垒。

column1: Orbán has even gone so far as to resurrect some of the nastiest anti-Semitic images of 1930s Hungary (an ally of Nazi Germany) to demonize Soros.
column2: 欧尔班甚至恢复了20世纪30年代匈牙利某些最恶毒的反犹形象（这些形象曾经是纳粹德国的盟友）以妖魔化索罗斯。

column1: Yet Orbán himself attended the University of Oxford (where I am Chancellor) on a Soros-funded scholarship, and studied there under the great liberal thinker Isaiah Berlin.
column2: 但欧尔班本人曾在索罗斯奖学金的资助下在牛津大学就读（我现在担任牛津大学的校长 ） ， 并曾经跟随伟大的自由思想家以赛亚·柏林学习。

column1: Even as Orbán’s Hungary rejects the obligations of EU membership, it receives more than €5.5 billion ($6.4 billion) from the EU each year, while contributing less than €1 billion to the common budget.
column2: 即便欧尔班的匈牙利拒绝履行欧盟成员国义务，该国仍从欧洲每年收到超过55亿欧元（合64亿美元）的巨资，而仅为共同预算贡献不到10亿欧元。

column1: Why should European citizens pay so much to a government that thumbs its nose at them and compares the EU to the Soviet Union?
column2: 欧洲民众为什么要为一个无视他们并将欧盟比作苏联的政府提供那么多资金？

column1: At the very least, the EU should apply the provisions of the Lisbon Treaty that allow it to suspend some of the rights of a country that is breaking its rules and showing contempt for its standards and values.
column2: 至少，欧盟应当适用《里斯本条约》的相关条款，该条约允许欧盟暂时收回破坏其规则并藐视其标准和价值观的某些国家的权利。

column1: The behavior of Poland’s Law and Justice (PiS) government – which shows scant concern for either law or justice – raises similar issues.
column2: 波兰法律与正义党政府的行为 — — 虽然该党对法律和正义几乎鲜有关注 — — 提出了类似的问题。

column1: The government is working to overhaul the constitution, in order to thwart democratic checks and balances.
column2: 该政府正在竭尽全力修宪，目的是取消民主制衡。

column1: It plainly wants judges to do what politicians tell them, and it does not want the media to be able to say much about it.
column2: 政府显然希望法官执行政客的命令，而且不希望媒体能够自由评论。

column1: I daresay that China’s rulers would have no difficulty in understanding the PiS’s approach.
column2: 我敢说中国的执政者能够与波兰法律与正义党产生共鸣。

column1: Turkey, of course, is not a member of the EU, nor will it ever become one if it continues along the road of dictatorial repression taken by President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, no small fan of Russia’s Vladimir Putin.
column2: 土耳其当然不是欧盟成员国，而且如果它沿埃尔多安独裁镇压的道路继续走下去也永远不可能加入欧盟。 雷杰普·塔伊普·埃尔多安总统非常崇拜俄国的弗拉基米尔·普京。

column1: But, judging by the EU’s growing tolerance of illiberalism, some EU leaders may well be prepared to contemplate a closer relationship with Erdoğan’s Turkey.
column2: 但根据欧盟对非自由主义越来越宽容的态度判断，某些欧盟领导人可能准备考虑与埃尔多安的土耳其建立更密切的关系。

column1: Such foreign-policy decadence threatens to undermine the EU’s claim to be a community of values, not just a glorified customs union.
column2: 欧盟不仅是关税同盟而且是价值共同体，而外交政策上的这种堕落有可能破坏欧盟的共同价值观。

column1: As we know from the 1920s and 1930s, as decadence breeds more decadence, the world becomes an increasingly dangerous and unstable place.
column2: 正如20世纪20年代和20世纪30年代的历史所告诉我们的那样，随着颓废滋生更多颓废，世界将变得越来越危险和不稳定。

column1: It is time for Europe – to be joined by the United States after President Donald Trump leaves office – to find our moral compass once again.
column2: 欧盟是时候联合唐纳德·特朗普总统离任后的美国 — — 再次找到我们的道德定位。

column1: How Western Economies Can Avoid the Japan Trap
column2: 西方经济如何能够避免日本陷阱

column1: NEW YORK – Not too long ago, the conventional wisdom held that “Japanification” could never happen in Western economies.
column2: 纽约—不久前，传统智慧还认为西方经济永远不会发生“日本化 ” 。

column1: Leading US economists argued that if the combined threat of weak growth, disinflation, and perpetually low interest rates ever materialized, policymakers would have the tools to deal with it.
column2: 美国著名经济学家们认为，如果增长萎靡、通胀疲软和长期低利率的综合威胁真的成为现实，决策者也有应对工具。

column1: They had no problem lecturing the Japanese about the need for bold measures to pull their country out of a decades-old rut.
column2: 他们毫无问题地指导日本人采取果断措施让国家走出长达几十年的“巨坑 ” 。

column1: Japanification was regarded as the avoidable consequence of poor policymaking, not as an inevitability.
column2: 日本化被认为是糟糕的决策的结果，它是可以避免的。

column1: And yet the specter of Japanification now looms over the West.
column2: 但日本化的幽灵如今飘荡在西方上空。

column1: After the 2008 financial crisis, the recoveries in both Europe and the United States were more sluggish and less inclusive than the majority of policymakers, politicians, and economists expected.
column2: 2008年金融危机后，欧洲和美国的复苏都比大部分决策者、政客和经济学家所预期的更缓慢，更不包容。

column1: And, more recently, hopes for achieving “escape velocity” out of the “new normal” of low growth and persistent disinflationary pressure have been dashed in Europe and Japan, and some worry that they may be receding in the US.
column2: 最近，实现摆脱低增长和持续反通胀压力的“新常态”的“逃逸速度”的希望在欧洲和日本日益渺茫，一些人担心美国也在日益疲软。

column1: Europe, in particular, is back in the grips of a worrisome regionwide slowdown.
column2: 特别是欧洲，令人担忧的地区性减速卷土重来。

column1: Growth projections have been consistently revised downward, and the European Central Bank has acknowledged that its earlier optimism about achieving on-target inflation was misplaced.
column2: 增长预测不断向下调整，欧洲央行承认早前实现通胀目标的乐观态度有误。

column1: With yields on government bonds having fallen, the global trade in securities at negative interest rates has reached around $10 trillion.
column2: 政府债券收益率下降，全球负利率政权交易量已达10万亿美元。

column1: Meanwhile, Japan is approaching its fourth consecutive decade of consistently low nominal growth, inflation, and interest rates.
column2: 与此同时，日本正在接近连续第四个持续低名义增长、通胀和利率的十年。

column1: And in the US, a growing number of economists are worried about a coming slowdown, with some urging the US Federal Reserve to cut interest rates, and others calling for it to adopt a higher inflation target in order to combat the risk of excessive disinflation.
column2: 而在美国，越来越多的经济学家担心减速将至，一些人敦促美联储削减利率，也有人要求调高通胀目标，以遏制过度反通胀的风险。

column1: Were all those Western economists who dismissed the threat of Japanification in the past being too glib?
column2: 是否所有过去否认过日本化威胁的西方经济学家都过于油嘴滑舌了？

column1: Yes and no.
column2: 是，也不是。

column1: Today’s Japanification fears stem from legitimate worries about structural disinflationary forces that could cause lower, less inclusive growth, both directly and indirectly.
column2: 今天的日本化恐慌来自对结构性反通胀力量的合理担忧，这些力量可能会直接和间接地导致更低迷、更不包容的增长。

column1: These forces include societal aging, rising inequality (in terms of income, wealth, and opportunity), social and economic insecurity among broad segments of the population, and a loss of trust in institutions and expert opinion.
column2: 这些力量包括社会老龄化、不平等性加剧（以收入、财富和机会衡量 ） 、 多个人口细分群体的社会和经济不安全，以及对机构和专家观点失去信任。

column1: Along with the zombification of firms after the last asset bubble, these structural factors have led to lower demand, as well as increased risk aversion and self-insurance, rather than growth-promoting risk-pooling, at the margin.
column2: 与上一场资产泡沫后的企业僵尸化一同出现的是，这些结构性因素导致了边际需求低迷以及风险厌恶和自我保险，而没有带来有利于增长的风险集中。

column1: Innovation, particularly in artificial intelligence, big data, and mobility, is another factor.
column2: 创新，特别是人工智能、大数据和移动技术的创新，是另一个因素。

column1: Though the economic impact of these technologies is ambiguous, there is no doubt that they are reducing entry barriers across a growing number of economic activities and putting downward pressure on prices (the “Amazon effect”), at least in the short term.
column2: 尽管这些技术的经济影响模棱两可，但毫无疑问它们降低了越来越多种类的经济活动之间的壁垒，也带来了价格下降压力 （ “ 亚马逊效应 ” ， 至少在短期是如此。

column1: Nonetheless, their long-term effects on growth and productivity remain to be seen.
column2: ）但是，它们对增长和生产率的长期效应仍有待观察。

column1: Growth is also being undercut in less direct ways.
column2: 增长还受到不那么直接的因素的影响。

column1: For example, persistently low – and in some cases negative – interest rates tend to eat away at the institutional integrity and operational effectiveness of the financial system, thereby reducing bank lending and limiting the range of long-term products that insurance/retirement firms can offer to households.
column2: 比如，持续低迷 — — 有时甚至为负 — — 的利率总会破坏机构完整性和金融体系的经营效率，从而减少银行贷款，限制保险/退休企业能够向家庭提供的长期产品的范围。

column1: Another indirect effect stems from expectations about the future.
column2: 另一个间接影响来自对未来的预期。

column1: The longer growth and inflation remain low, the more tempted households and companies will be to postpone consumption and investment decisions, thus prolonging low growth and inflation.
column2: 增长和利率低迷的时间越长，家庭和公司越有可能推迟消费和投资决定，从而延长低增长和通胀。

column1: The Western economists who initially underestimated the threat of Japanification did so because they had downplayed or simply ignored these direct and indirect factors.
column2: 一开始低估日本化的威胁的西方经济学家之所以如此，是因为他们低估或根本没有看到这些直接和间接因素。

column1: In retrospect, they should not be surprised to find that the societies with the fastest-aging populations and less inward migration are the ones now struggling with Japanification.
column2: 事后看来，他们看到迅速老龄化和移民到来较少的社会如今深陷日本化泥淖不会感到惊奇。

column1: Still, those economists were not wrong to argue that policies can play a decisive role in macroeconomic outcomes – especially when structural forces are being amplified by excessive cyclical tightening, as was the case in Japan in 1989.
column2: 尽管如此，那些经济学家认为政策能够对宏观经济结果起决定性作用是不错的 — — 特别是在结构性力量被过度的周期性紧缩放大的时候，比如1989年的日本。

column1: The problem is that they have tended to focus too narrowly on monetary policy, while overestimating its effectiveness.
column2: 问题在于，他们往往过于狭隘地关注货币政策，而高估了它的效果。

column1: Countries at risk of Japanification need a much broader mix of policies to address both the demand side and the supply side of the economy.
column2: 有可能发生日本化的国家需要更广泛的政策组合，以解决经济需求侧和供给侧的问题。

column1: Monetary policy, after all, is less effective near the “zero bound” and in scenarios where other “liquidity trap” factors are in play.
column2: 毕竟，货币政策在“零区间”附近和其他“流动性陷阱”起作用的情形效果会打折扣。

column1: Large-scale balance sheet operations like quantitative easing (QE) can buy time by seeking to inject more liquidity directly into the system.
column2: 大规模资产负债表操作，比如量化宽松（QE ） ， 通过向系统直接注入流动性来争取时间。

column1: But they don’t address the underlying issues, and they come with their own set of costs, forms of collateral damage, and unintended consequences.
column2: 但它们并不解决根本性问题，并且本身也会造成成本，各种附带伤害，以及意料外后果。

column1: The strongest protection against Japanification, then, is a combination of demand- and supply-side measures at the national, regional (in the case of Europe), and global levels.
column2: 因此，针对日本化的最强保护是在国家、地区（如欧洲）和全球层面，需求侧和供给侧措施双管齐下。

column1: In countries with adequate fiscal space, this could mean looser government budgets and more productivity-enhancing investments (such as in infrastructure, education, and training).
column2: 在财政空间充裕的国家，这意味着放松政府预算和增加提高生产率的投资（如基础设施、教育和培训 ） 。

column1: And in any country facing skills shortages, increased legal migration and better policies to facilitate labor mobility can help close the gap.
column2: 而凡是面临技能短缺的国家，增加合法移民和更好地便利劳动力流动的政策有助于弥补缺口。

column1: Moreover, these policies would need to be accompanied by more effective protections for the most vulnerable segments of the population, particularly when it comes to health, training, and labor retooling.
column2: 此外，这些政策必须辅之以更有效地保护人口中最脆弱的群体，特别是在健康、培训和劳动重组方面。

column1: None of this will materialize without better political leadership and more enlightened global policy interactions.
column2: 除非有更好的政治领导和更开明的全球政策互动，否则所有这些政策都无法实现。

column1: Japanification offers three lessons that Western policymakers and politicians have yet to internalize sufficiently.
column2: 日本化带来了三个教训，西方决策者和政客还没有充分消化。

column1: First, structural pressures make prompt action to reverse low growth, disinflation, and zero-to-low interest rates all the more critical.
column2: 首先，结构性压力使得扭转低增长、反通胀和零或低利率动作变得非常关键。

column1: Second, unconventional monetary measures may be necessary, but they certainly are not sufficient.
column2: 其次，非常规货币措施可能必要条件，但绝非充分条件。

column1: And, third, when crafting the required comprehensive policy response, we must recognize that the hurdles are a lot less technical, and a lot more political.
column2: 第三，在制定必要的全面政策响应时，我们必须承认，障碍的技术因素很小，而政治因素很大。

column1: What About the World?
column2: 把世界晾在一边了吗？

column1: As America’s primaries move beyond Iowa and New Hampshire, it is simply impossible to predict who will be the Democratic and Republican nominees, much less who will become the 44th president of the United States.
column2: 尽管美国已经完成了在艾奥瓦州和新罕布尔什州的预选，但是现在还很难预测谁将被民主党和共和党提名为候选人，更别说谁将成为美国的第44任总统了。

column1: But it is not too soon to address the question of what effect US foreign policy is having on the campaign and what it reveals about how Americans see the world.
column2: 但是现在来讨论美国的外交政策将对竞选活动产生怎样的影响以及它显示了美国人是如何看待世界的问题却并不嫌早。

column1: To the surprise of many seasoned observers, foreign policy is having only a modest impact on voters.
column2: 令许多老资格的观察家感到惊讶的是，外交政策只对选民产生了很小的影响。

column1: This is unexpected, because only six months ago the war in Iraq dominated the political landscape.
column2: 这是大家所没有预料到的，因为仅仅是在六个月前关于在伊拉克的战争的争论还一直是政治上的热点。

column1: Although Iraq still matters a lot to Americans, its importance for determining how they vote has receded, partly because US casualties there are markedly down as the security situation appears to be gradually improving.
column2: 尽管伊拉克问题对于美国人来说依然还是一个重要问题，它在决定他们把票投给谁的问题上的重要性却大大减弱了，这部分是因为美国在那儿的伤亡情况随着安全状况的逐步好转已经大大减少了。

column1: As a result, there is considerably less public pressure to do something dramatically different.
column2: 其结果是，公众要求做出一些引人注目的不同的举动的压力大大减弱了。

column1: Foreign policy has also become less salient than it was only months ago as the chance of war between the US and Iran has diminished, following the recently published National Intelligence Estimate on Iran’s nuclear program.
column2: 外交政策问题没有几个月以前那么突出的另一个原因是随着国家情报评估机构最近有关伊朗核计划报告的出台，美国和伊朗爆发战争的可能性已经减少了。

column1: The judgment by America’s intelligence community that Iran has suspended its nuclear weapon development program – and, more importantly, that its large-scale uranium enrichment capacity is likely years away – postpones the day when a US president may have to decide between living with or attacking a nuclear Iran.
column2: 根据美国情报部门的判断，伊朗已经搁置了它的核武器开发计划，并且，更重要的是，它大规模浓缩铀的能力似乎还要花很多年才能实现，这也使得某位美国总统必须对与一个拥有核武器的伊朗相处还是发起攻击做出决定的日期被大大延后了。

column1: A third reason for the modest impact of international issues on voters’ choice of the next president is another surprising development: more agreement between and among the leading candidates than meets the eye.
column2: 国际问题对于选民选择下一任总统的决定影响不太大的第三个原因是事态另一个惊人的发展：就是居于领先的候选人在许多问题上的观点有很大的相似之处。

column1: There is something of a consensus, for example, emerging around the notion that the US should remain in Iraq for some time to come, albeit with a reduced level of military forces.
column2: 比如说，大家对美军应该在伊拉克停留相当长一段时间有某种共识，尽管他们对于应该削减多少兵力意见也许不尽一致。

column1: There is also widespread acknowledgement that the US must do more both at home and diplomatically to address global climate change; that the US must work with its European allies to prevent Afghanistan from slipping back into anarchy; and that the US must take the strongest possible stand against terrorism and those who would support it in any way. No major candidate is advocating anything remotely resembling isolationism.
column2: 另外大家对于美国为应对全球气候变化问题而应该在国内和国外做出更大的努力、美国必须与它的欧洲盟友一道防止阿富汗滑向无政府状态以及美国采取最强硬的手段对抗恐怖主义以及以任何方式支持恐怖主义的人也有广泛的共识。 另外也没有哪个主要的候选人提出任何哪怕是与孤立主义沾一点边的主张。

column1: Finally, and perhaps most importantly, the deterioration of America’s economy is now overshadowing foreign policy.
column2: 最后，但也许是最重要的，人们对美国经济低迷的担忧现在盖过了对外交政策的关心。

column1: The greatest crisis facing many Americans is their increasing inability to meet their monthly mortgage payments.
column2: 许多美国人现在所面临的最大危机是他们越来越无力支付每月的房屋按揭。

column1: Recession, job loss, and expensive oil, not war, is what Americans fear most for 2008.
column2: 经济衰退、失业以及越来越昂贵的油价而不是战争是美国人在2008年最担心的问题。

column1: This is not to suggest that foreign policy is absent from the campaign.
column2: 这并不是说竞选活动不会涉及到外交政策问题。

column1: Along with the economy, a dominant issue on the political agenda – and one that has affected Republican politics in particular – is immigration.
column2: 除开经济问题，在政治议程上的一个主要问题，也是对共和党的政治家影响最大的问题是移民问题。

column1: There is growing opposition to illegal entry, but no consensus about what to do about those who have been in the country illegally for years or those who want to come to the US in the future.
column2: 公众对于非法入境问题的抗议声越来越大，但是对怎样处理那些已经在国内非法居住了数年或者未来想要到美国来的那些人并没有达成一致的意见。

column1: It is also possible to see in the politics of both parties mounting concern about globalization.
column2: 我们还有可能看到两党的政治家都越来越关注全球化问题。

column1: With tougher economic times inevitably come tougher positions toward foreign competition and outsourcing.
column2: 随着经济形势越来越严峻，公众对于外国竞争和外包问题的态度也会变得越来越强硬。

column1: There may also be latent concern about foreign policy in the attention being given to the quantity and quality of candidates’ relevant experience.
column2: 在大家关注候选人相关经验的数量和质量时，也可能会潜在涉及到外交政策问题。

column1: A desire for “change” is a common refrain of the American debate, but it is far from the only one.
column2: 对“变革”的渴望已经成为美国辩论中最常引用的一个词语，但是这远远不是人们唯一关心的问题。

column1: Renewed interest in foreign policy and the rest of the world could surface if there were a dramatic overseas development.
column2: 如果外部形势出现某些戏剧性的发展，大家可能会重新燃起对外交政策和外部世界的兴趣。

column1: We saw this a few weeks ago, when former Pakistani Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto was assassinated.
column2: 几周前当巴基斯坦前总理贝·布托遇刺身亡时我们就看到了这样的情况。

column1: Democratic and Republican candidates alike were called upon to explain what they would be prepared to do if there were an opportunity to capture Osama Bin Laden or a need to secure Pakistan’s nuclear weapons.
column2: 民主党和共和党的候选人都被要求解释如果他们遇到有机会抓住本·拉登或者需要保护巴基斯坦的核武器时他们准备如何应对。

column1: Likewise, Iraq could return to center stage if the positive momentum of recent months were suddenly reversed, perhaps following a new outbreak of violence between the country’s Sunnis and Shia.
column2: 同样地，如果近几个月伊拉克好转的形势发生突然的倒转，比如这个国家的逊尼派和什叶派爆发新一轮的暴力冲突，那么伊拉克问题就会重新回到人们视野的中心。

column1: The US and Iran could go to war not over nuclear issues but because of reckless behavior by the Revolutionary Guards (as occurred recently in the Strait of Hormuz), with Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmedinejad possibly seeking to provoke a crisis in order to distract domestic attention from his economic failures.
column2: 美国和伊朗也许会走向战争，不是因为核问题，而是因为国民卫队的鲁莽行为（就像最近在霍尔姆兹湾发生的事件 ） ， 以及伊朗总统内贾德可能会寻求挑起危机以分散国内对于他在经济问题上的失败的注意力。

column1: Order in Pakistan could break down irretrievably.
column2: 巴基斯坦国内的秩序可能会遭到无法挽回的破坏。

column1: A terrorist attack could remind Americans of their fundamental vulnerability.
column2: 一次恐怖袭击可能会提醒美国人他们在本质上的脆弱性。

column1: The possibilities are endless.
column2: 这里存在着种种的可能性。

column1: America’s next president will face a host of pressing and difficult foreign policy challenges – and how he or she responds will affect not only the US, but the entire world.
column2: 美国的下一任总统将会面临一系列紧迫并且艰难的外交政策上的挑战，而他或她对此将如何回应将不仅会影响美国，而且会影响整个世界。

column1: In the meantime, though, foreign policy will have only an indirect influence on Americans’ choice.
column2: 不过，与此同时外交政策对于美国人的选择只会产生某些间接的影响。

column1: What Are Homebuyers Thinking?
column2: 购房者在想什么？

column1: Many places around the world have been in a housing boom since the late 1990’s.
column2: 从20世纪90年代末开始，世界很多地方的住宅市场都一派繁荣。

column1: As I argued last year, in the second edition of my book Irrational Exuberance , the boom is rooted in speculative investment by ordinary homebuyers, fueled substantially by the worldwide perception that capitalism has triumphed, and that all people must look out for themselves by acquiring property.
column2: 正如去年我在拙作《非理性繁荣》第二版中所提到的那样，这种繁荣的根源在于普通购房者的投机性买入，而认为资本主义已经在全球范围内获胜，所有人都必须购进财产的普遍看法在很大程度上起了推波助澜的作用。

column1: Convinced that private ownership has become essential to smart living, buyers bid up home prices.
column2: 购房者坚信私有制已经成为明智生活不可或缺的组成部分，他们相互竞价，房价也跟着水涨船高。

column1: Moreover, the fear that one must get in on the boom before it is too late often drives people to bid up home prices faster now.
column2: 不仅如此，在无论如何要赶上这波繁荣浪潮，否则将追悔莫及的恐惧驱使下，人们更加不遗余力的抬高房价。

column1: This certainly seems to be the market psychology in China and India, where rapidly rising incomes and newly successful people are widely expected to put pressure on markets for land, real estate, and construction materials.
column2: 中国和印度无疑受到这种市场心理的左右，人们普遍认为那里快速增长的收入和飞黄腾达的新贵给土地、房地产和建筑材料市场带来了很大压力。

column1: Real estate booms have been going on in these countries’ major cities for years.
column2: 房地产繁荣已经在这些国家的主要城市上演了数年之久。

column1: In China, despite some signs of weakness – the Shanghai market is down, for example – price growth is still robust in much of the country.
column2: 尽管中国的房地产市场已经出现了转弱的迹象¾比如上海的房价就在下跌¾但绝大多数城市的房价上涨仍然风头正劲。

column1: But the boom generated by such beliefs cannot go on forever, because prices can’t go up forever, and there are already signs of a hard landing.
column2: 但这种心理所造就的繁荣不可能永远继续下去，因为价格不可能永远上涨，而且已经出现了硬着陆的迹象。

column1: In the United States, newspapers and magazines are trumpeting reports in the last few months that the decade-long boom in home prices may be at an end, and that the bubble may be bursting.
column2: 过去几个月来，美国的报纸和杂志一直在鼓吹长达10年之久的房价上涨也许即将结束，泡沫的破灭也许就在眼前。

column1: The psychology has suddenly changed, creating widespread fear of sharp drops in US home prices.
column2: 心理预期在眨眼之间发生了改变，人们普遍对美国房价骤跌充满了恐惧。

column1: The new futures market for single-family homes at the Chicago Mercantile Exchange (which I helped establish last May with our firm MacroMarkets LLC) is predicting that by next August prices will fall between 6% and 8% in all ten US cities traded.
column2: 据芝加哥商品交易所新设立的独立住宅期货市场（去年5月我所在的宏观证券研究有限公司曾经对该市场的筹建起到过辅助作用）预测：截至明年8月，在全部10座参与交易的美国城市中，房价的跌幅将达到6%到8 % 。

column1: If home prices crash in the US, the bastion of capitalism, could it destroy confidence and end the boom in other countries?
column2: 如果作为资本主义堡垒的美国房价骤跌，人们的信心是否会受到影响，从而给其他国家的房地产繁荣划上句号？

column1: If so, could a worldwide recession follow?
column2: 如果这种情况真的出现，世界性的经济衰退是否不可避免？

column1: This scenario is a distinct possibility, although there are reasons to be skeptical.
column2: 尽管人们有理由抱着怀疑的态度，但出现上述情况也绝非天方夜谈。

column1: Most importantly, the ultimate sources of the housing boom – the beliefs about capitalism and future economic growth – seem solidly entrenched.
column2: 最重要的是，住宅繁荣的终极源泉¾也就是人们对资本主义和未来经济发展所抱有的信心¾似乎是坚不可摧的。

column1: The downward price trend in the US market, for example, does not seem to reflect underlying changes in long-run economic confidence.
column2: 例如，美国市场的价格回落似乎并不是长期经济信心发生变化的标志。

column1: The survey that Karl Case and I conducted in May and June of this year, under the auspices of the Yale School of Management, shows sharp declines in short-term expectations for home prices in the US, but relatively little change in long-term expectations.
column2: 今年五、六月份卡尔·凯斯（Karl Case）和我在耶鲁管理学院的赞助下共同进行的民意调查表明：人们预期住宅价格会在短期内大幅下跌，但对长期房价的预测却变化不大。

column1: Most people still believe that housing is a great long-term investment.
column2: 绝大多数人依然相信住宅是长期投资的最佳方式。

column1: Maybe real estate prices are unlikely to fall to pre-boom levels because the fundamental change in perceptions concerning capitalism’s triumph will be longstanding.
column2: 也许房价不太可能跌落到暴涨之前的水平，因为从根本上改变人们对资本主义优越性的认识是一个长期的过程。

column1: Changes in people’s fundamental ways of thinking are not easily reversed.
column2: 人们最基本的思维方式很难改变。

column1: Nor, therefore, is their interest in housing as a major speculative investment asset likely to change.
column2: 因此，他们对住宅作为主要投机资产的兴趣似乎也将延续下去。

column1: The transformation in investors’ beliefs is striking.
column2: 投资人观念的变化令人震惊。

column1: Before the real estate boom of the late 1970’s, hardly anyone was worried about rising home prices.
column2: 20世纪70年代末房地产价格上涨之前，很少有人对房价的上涨表示忧虑。

column1: A search of old newspapers finds surprisingly few articles about the outlook for home prices.
column2: 翻遍过去的报纸也找不到几篇有关未来房价的评论。

column1: Those that did appear generally seem to be based on the assumption that minor fluctuations in construction costs, not massive market swings, drove the modest home price movements that they noted.
column2: 有限的几篇评论一般也认为建筑成本的小幅波动、而非大规模的市场振荡是造成小幅房价涨落的驱动力量。

column1: Indeed, hardly anything interesting about home prices was ever reported at all, aside from an occasional comment in an article about something else.
column2: 实际上，除去以其他内容为主题的某篇文章中偶尔可见些零星的评论，此外几乎看不到有关房价的任何有趣报道。

column1: For example, an article in The Times of London in 1970 argued that rising home prices reflected the switch to a new British Standard Time (imposed as a three-year experiment in 1968 to facilitate commerce with Western Europe by putting Britain in the same time zone).
column2: 例如，1970年《泰晤士报》上的一篇文章指出：房价上涨是实行新英国标准时间的反映（新标准时间从1968年开始，试行3年，目的是使英国处在与西欧各国相同的时区，从而推动相互之间的贸易 ） 。

column1: The article claimed that the change raised costs by forcing British construction workers to perform more of their jobs in relative darkness.
column2: 那篇文章声称这项改变提高了建筑成本，因为英国建筑工人不得不在相对较暗的天色中完成大部分工作。

column1: Speculative investment behavior was hardly an issue in those rare instances in which home prices were discussed.
column2: 在讨论房价的少数几篇文章中，投机获利行为几乎没能引起任何关注。

column1: To understand the nature of the subsequent shift, consider that it is hard to find anyone today who worries that automobile prices will soar because rising demand in China and India for steel and other materials will push automobile prices out of reach in the future.
column2: 要想对接下来的变化性质有所了解，只要类比一下今天很少有人会担心车价飞涨，以及中国和印度对钢铁和其他材料日益增长的需求会使未来车价变得高不可攀的事例就够了。

column1: Though a small group of collectors invests speculatively in antique or specialty cars, the idea of speculating in automobiles just is not in the public consciousness.
column2: 尽管一小群收藏爱好者对古董或特制汽车情有独钟，但投机汽车的想法根本没有被公众所广泛接受。

column1: That is how it was with housing until the late 1970’s.
column2: 直到20世纪70年代末，住房的情况也大同小异。

column1: Now that we think differently about real estate, we will never be the same again.
column2: 现在我们对房产的看法已经发生了改变，再也回不到原来的样子了。

column1: But, of course, housing prices can only rise so fast.
column2: 但勿庸置疑，房价的上涨实在是太快了。

column1: High and rapidly rising home prices tend to stimulate new housing supply, which in turn tends to undermine prices.
column2: 快速上涨的高昂房价将刺激新的住宅供应，而新增住宅供应又反过来威胁到价格。

column1: Over a period of years, as people see how much new supply there is, they may begin to revise their view that homes are such a terrific investment, causing a gradual, but eventually significant, drop in home prices.
column2: 在若干年内，随着人们对新房供应量的认识，房产是一种完美投资的看法就有可能发生改变，从而导致缓慢、但最终却是大幅度的房价回落。

column1: Indeed, while changes in fundamental perceptions may not occur easily or fast, they should never be ruled out.
column2: 实际上，尽管基本观念的转变艰难而又缓慢，但这样的变化却永远也无法彻底排除。

column1: Urban land prices in major Japanese cities have steadily dropped over much of the period since 1991, as the enormous faith in the miraculous powers of Japanese capitalism gradually faded.
column2: 随着对日本资本主义神奇力量信心的逐渐减退，1991年以后日本主要城市的地价一直处在稳步的回落当中。

column1: The same kind of erosion in home prices could occur in many cities around the world.
column2: 房价的下降同样也可能发生在世界许多城市。

column1: All that is required is that growth in housing supply eventually outstrips investors’ faith in capitalism to sustain faster growth in demand.
column2: 只需住宅供应的增长最终超过投资者对资本主义的信心，这样需求的更快增长则必将难以为继。

column1: The Ghosts of North Korea
column2: 朝鲜的鬼魂

column1: TOKYO – For most people, the arrival of a new year prompts a moment of reflection on what has been working and what needs to change.
column2: 东京 — — 对多数人来说，新一年的到来促使他们反思哪些应该保持、哪些需要改变。

column1: Not for the people of North Korea.
column2: 但朝鲜人除外。

column1: In that benighted country, “New Year’s resolutions” are not really an option for ordinary citizens.
column2: 在这个愚昧的国家 ， “ 新年决策”的权利不属于普通民众。

column1: What happens to them depends entirely on their supreme leader, Kim Jong-un, and typically involves grim paranoia and deprivation.
column2: 他们的未来完全取决于最高领导人金正恩，并且往往伴随着冷酷与偏执的剥夺。

column1: North Koreans endure plenty about which outsiders can only speculate.
column2: 朝鲜人忍受的苦难很多都不为外人所知。

column1: Consider the mysterious “ghost ships” that are carried to the Sea of Japan each autumn by southwesterly winds.
column2: 比如每年秋天被西南季风吹到日本海的神秘的“鬼船 ” 。

column1: The boats are crude, small (about ten meters in length), and equipped with little more than basic fishing gear.
column2: 这些船粗糙、狭小（长约10米 ） ， 除了最基本的渔具以外几乎没有任何其他设施。

column1: Some are empty; others carry the dead bodies of unidentified men.
column2: 其中有些空无一人，有些则携带着身份不明的男性尸体。

column1: Last month alone, 13 boats and 26 bodies (most already largely decomposed) were found.
column2: 仅上月一个月就发现了13艘这样的小船和26具尸体（其中多数都已大体腐烂 ） 。

column1: In 2014, more than 60 such boats turned up.
column2: 2014年一年，就发现了超过60艘这样的小船。

column1: Some of the boats and their contents bore markings in Korean Hangul script.
column2: 有些船及船上物品印有韩语标识。

column1: One carried a handwritten sign stating that it belonged to unit 325 of the North Korean army.
column2: 其中一条带有朝军325部队的手写标志。

column1: Another contained a tattered cloth that appeared to have once been part of a North Korean flag.
column2: 另一条船上有一块破布，似乎曾经是一面朝鲜国旗。

column1: Add to that the boats’ dilapidated condition and lack of equipment, and the conclusion that they were North Korean seems fairly certain.
column2: 再加上破旧且缺乏设备，这些船属于朝鲜似乎没有多少怀疑。

column1: What is more difficult to discern is what the ships were for, and why they have been making their way, in such large numbers, to Japan’s shores and territorial waters.
column2: 这些船是做什么的、它们为什么要成群结队前往日本领海及海岸似乎更难判断。

column1: After all, they seem like fishing boats, not military vessels, though North Korean soldiers are frequently also fishermen.
column2: 毕竟，尽管朝鲜士兵往往同时是渔民，这些船似乎并非军舰而仅仅是渔船。

column1: It has been widely speculated that the boats were filled with would-be defectors, not least because they resemble boats on which living defectors arrived in Japan.
column2: 人们普遍猜测这些船载有可能的叛逃者，这不仅因为它们像极了活的叛逃者逃往日本所坐的小船。

column1: Another explanation is that the boats are filled simply with fishermen who, under pressure from the government to boost their yields, ventured out too far into the open sea.
column2: 另一种解释是船上只是普通的渔民，在政府提高产量的压力下冒险驶入远海。

column1: Sadly, that explanation is all too plausible.
column2: 可悲的是，这种解释完全合情合理。

column1: North Korea’s government goes to great lengths to conceal the country’s abysmal food shortages, even going so far as to unveil to the foreign media an advanced indoor vegetable-farming facility near Pyongyang.
column2: 朝鲜政府竭力掩盖国内粮食极度短缺的事实，甚至不惜向外媒公开平壤附近一座先进的室内蔬菜种植设施。
