column1: But the fact is that there have been no sustained improvements to food production since the mass starvation of the 1990s and early 2000s, despite slightly greater tolerance of private production by farmers.
column2: 但实际情况是尽管对农民私人种植的容忍度略有提高，但20世纪90年代和21世纪初大规模饥荒爆发后粮食生产并未得到持续改善。

column1: Indeed, although Kim identified “food for the people” as one of his regime’s top three priorities for 2015, little investment in this effort was actually made.
column2: 事实上，尽管金正恩将“保障人民粮食供应”列为2015年政府三件大事之一，但在这方面实际投资却并不多见。

column1: Not even the resumption of fertilizer supplies by a private South Korean organization was enough to make a real difference.
column2: 就连韩国一家私营机构恢复供应化肥都不足以真正改变局面。

column1: With fallow soil and a poor climate inhibiting agriculture, North Korea’s government has indeed apparently been encouraging a growing number of fishing boats to go farther out in search of bigger catches.
column2: 由于土地撂荒和恶劣气候限制农业发展，朝鲜政府其实一直在鼓励更多渔船为提高产量而驶向远海。

column1: Given the boats’ poor quality, it is no surprise that many do not make it home.
column2: 鉴于这些船只质量低劣，其中很多有去无回也并不意外。

column1: The ghost ships are not the only source of odd questions and speculation about North Korea.
column2: 鬼船并非引发朝鲜奇特问题和猜测的唯一来源。

column1: Just this month, the all-girl Moranbong Band – reportedly organized and sponsored by Kim himself – canceled its first performance in China, intended for Chinese Communist Party officials.
column2: 就在这个月，全部由女孩组成的牡丹峰乐团 — — 据称由金本人亲自出资筹建 — — 取消了面向中国共产党官员的对华首演。

column1: Soon after arriving by train in Beijing, the band’s members were quickly bundled onto a plane back to Pyongyang.
column2: 乘火车抵达北京后不久，乐队成员很快又被塞进了返回平壤的飞机。

column1: Some have speculated that a song praising North Korea’s nuclear program was too much for China’s leadership to stomach, especially so soon after Kim declared (probably falsely) that his regime had detonated a hydrogen bomb.
column2: 有人猜测一首赞美朝鲜核计划的颂歌令中国领导人难以忍受，尤其是金正恩刚刚宣布（可能是假消息）其政府引爆了一颗氢弹。

column1: Others think that Kim was angered by the news that Chinese President Xi Jinping and other top Chinese leaders would not be attending the concert.
column2: 也有人认为中国国家主席习近平等高层领导人不出席音乐会的消息激怒了金正恩。

column1: In any case, the relationship with China, on which North Korea has long depended, seems to be coming under increasing strain.
column2: 无论如何，朝鲜长期依赖的对华关系紧张程度似乎在不断升高。

column1: As for Japan’s relationship with North Korea, the outlook remains far from rosy.
column2: 至于日本和朝鲜的关系，其前景离乐观也相去甚远。

column1: Discussions of North Korea’s abduction of Japanese citizens in the 1970s and 1980s – a major impediment to official relations – have stalled.
column2: 20世纪七八十年代有关朝鲜绑架日本公民的谈判 — — 一直是正式关系的主要障碍 — — 已经停滞不前。

column1: North Korea has stubbornly maintained its official line that only 13 Japanese were kidnapped; eight died and five were returned to Japan before ever making it to Pyongyang.
column2: 朝鲜一直固执地坚持只有13名日本人被绑架的官方说法；其中有八人死亡，五人在抵达平壤前就已经归还给日本。

column1: Japan insists – with good reason – that there were more kidnappings.
column2: 但日本坚持认为 — — 而且理由非常充分 — — 有更多的绑架事件。

column1: The five abductees who were repatriated in 2002 included Hitomi Soga, who was not included among the 13 acknowledged kidnappings.
column2: 2002年遣返的5名被绑架者中包括曾我瞳，此人并未包含在13名已知被绑架者之内。

column1: This creates the impression that North Korea may still be holding some kidnap victims to use as bargaining chips in discussions on economic cooperation.
column2: 日本据此认为朝鲜可能仍然扣押着某些被绑架者，并打算以此为筹码进行经济合作谈判。

column1: Japan continues to demand a new comprehensive investigation into the matter, though North Korea has not been particularly cooperative so far.
column2: 日本一直要求就此事展开新的全面调查，但朝鲜迄今为止并未表现出合作的姿态。

column1: During bilateral talks in Stockholm in 2014, the Kim regime agreed to pursue a new investigation, in exchange for Japan’s agreement to lift some sanctions once the inquiry began.
column2: 2014年斯德哥尔摩双边谈判期间，金正恩政府同意开始新一轮调查，条件是调查开始后日本同意解除部分制裁。

column1: In July, however, the North reportedly notified the Japanese government of its intention to postpone submitting the results of the reinvestigation.
column2: 但7月，朝鲜据称知会日本政府打算延期提交其调查结果。

column1: If the report is eventually submitted and includes the names of one or two abductees available to be sent back to Japan, how should Prime Minister Shinzo Abe’s government respond?
column2: 如果最终提交的报告包括一两名可以送回日本的被绑架者，日本首相安倍晋三的政府应当如何应对？

column1: This kind of manipulation may not merit a visit to North Korea by Abe or the lifting of sanctions.
column2: 这样的操纵可能并不值得安倍访问朝鲜或者取消制裁。

column1: So ends another bizarre year (which makes it similar to previous years) in the history of North Korea.
column2: 又是朝鲜历史上（与之前非常相似的）奇怪的一年。

column1: The only factor suggesting that 2016 could be different lies in the North’s estrangement from China.
column2: 2016年唯一不同的因素也许就是朝鲜与中国的疏远。

column1: Perhaps Japan could take advantage of the strains in that relationship to make some headway in other talks, say, on the nuclear issue.
column2: 或许日本可以利用中朝关系紧张在核问题等其他谈判中取得某些进展。

column1: The main question, however, is whether Kim is able and willing to act in his country’s real interests, and not those of his fantasies.
column2: 但主要问题是金正恩是否能够并愿意按照国家真正的利益行事，而不是一味满足自己的幻想。

column1: Carpet Bombing History in America
column2: 美国地毯式轰炸史

column1: NEW YORK – Ted Cruz, one of the Republican candidates for the US presidency, recently said that his solution to the turmoil in the Middle East would be to “carpet bomb” the Islamic State (ISIS) and see if “sand can glow in the dark.”
column2: 纽约—美国共和党总统候选人之一泰德·克鲁兹（Ted Cruz）最近说，他有办法解决中东乱局，那就是“地毯式轰炸”伊斯兰国，看看“沙子是否能在黑暗中发光 ” 。

column1: Donald Trump, the Republican frontrunner, promised to “bomb the shit out of ISIS.”
column2: 共和党竞选阵营领先者唐纳德·特朗普（Donald Trump）承诺“把伊斯兰国炸出屎来 ” 。

column1: A third candidate, Chris Christie, has threatened war with Russia.
column2: 另一位候选人克里斯·克里斯蒂（Chris Christie）威胁与俄罗斯开战。

column1: With such rhetoric from their candidates, it is no wonder that, according to a recent poll, some 30% of Republican voters (and 41% of Trump supporters) favored bombing Agrabah, the central (and fictional) location of the Disney film Aladdin.
column2: 总统候选人说出这样的话来，无怪乎最新民调表明30%左右的共和党选民（以及41%的特朗普支持者）支持轰炸阿格拉巴（Agrabah，迪士尼电影《阿拉丁》中虚构的中央地区 ） 。

column1: The place sounded Arabic, and that was enough.
column2: 这个地方听着像阿拉伯，这就足够了。

column1: One way to read such bellicose rhetoric is to assume that those who indulge in it must be bloodthirsty monsters.
column2: 一种解读这些好斗言论的方式是认为执迷于此的都是嗜血狂魔。

column1: A more charitable view is that they suffer from an appalling lack of historical memory and moral imagination.
column2: 更善意的观点是他们极度缺乏历史记忆和道德想象力。

column1: None has any personal experience of war.
column2: 这些人都没有对战争的个人体验。

column1: And they clearly find it impossible to comprehend the consequences of what they are saying.
column2: 他们显然无法理解他们的厥词的后果。

column1: And yet even a cursory acquaintance with fairly recent history is enough to know that “bombing the shit” out of people does little to win wars.
column2: 而即便是对最近一段历史的最粗浅的了解也足以让我们知道，把人“炸出屎来”根本无法赢得战争。

column1: It didn’t work in Vietnam, and it is unlikely to work in Syria or Iraq.
column2: 这在越南不起作用，在叙利亚或伊拉克也不可能起作用。

column1: Even the Nazis were not defeated by carpet bombing.
column2: 就连纳粹也不是被地毯式轰炸打败的。

column1: As postwar studies undertaken by the US and British air forces demonstrated, Russian tanks did more to bring down the Wehrmacht than did aerial bombing of German cities.
column2: 美国和英国空军的战后研究表明，俄式坦克对于击败德国国防军的作用要大于对德国城市的轰炸。

column1: This raises the question, suitable for the beginning of a new year, of whether history really can teach us many lessons.
column2: 这就引出了一个适合新年的问题，即历史是否真的教会了我们许多教训。

column1: After all, nothing is ever exactly the same as what went before.
column2: 毕竟，现在发生的事情永远不会与过去完全相同。

column1: It is probably true that we cannot expect history to tell us what to do in any given crisis.
column2: 也许我们确实无法期待历史告诉我们在某场危机中应该怎么做。

column1: But, given that some patterns of human behavior recur, knowledge about the past can help us understand our own times better.
column2: 但是，人类的某些行为模式会反复发生，因此关于过去的知识能够帮助我们更好地理解现时代。

column1: The problem is that politicians (and commentators) often pick the wrong examples to bolster their ideological positions.
column2: 问题在于政客（和评论家）常常选取错误的例子论证他们的意识形态立场。

column1: For example, because few people apparently can think back further than World War II, examples from the 1930s and 1940s are the most commonly abused.
column2: 比如，能将记忆追溯到二战前的人非常少，因此20世纪30和40年代的例子最常被滥用。

column1: Whenever we are encouraged to oppose a dictator, the specter of Adolf Hitler is invoked, and the ghosts of 1938 are resurrected to counter skepticism about hasty “preemptive” war.
column2: 每当我们被鼓励反对某位独裁者，希特勒的幽灵就会浮现，而1938年常常被用来反驳质疑仓促的“预防性”战争的人。

column1: Those who had doubts about George W. Bush’s invasion of Iraq were “appeasers,” akin to Neville Chamberlain.
column2: 质疑小布什入侵伊拉克的人被认为都是张伯伦式的“绥靖派 ” 。

column1: Our almost exclusive focus on Nazis and WWII blinds us to other – and possibly more instructive – historical parallels.
column2: 我们的关注点几乎完全集中在纳粹和二战，而对其他可能更具说明性的历史案例视而不见。

column1: The terrible wars in the Middle East today, pitting revolutionary religious sects and tribal chiefs against ruthless dictatorships backed by one great power or another, have much more in common with the Thirty Years War that devastated much of Germany and central Europe from 1618 to 1648.
column2: 今天可怕的中东战争是革命宗派和部落领袖反抗受到某个列强支持的独裁统治的战争，它们与1618—1648年间让德国和中欧大部化为焦土的三十年战争更加相似。

column1: For three decades, marauding armies murdered, plundered, and tortured their way through villages and towns.
column2: 在三十年中，军队如游寇般一路烧杀抢掠。

column1: Many who weren’t killed died of starvation or disease, spread by vast numbers of armed men.
column2: 许多没有被杀的也死于大量武装部队散播的饥饿和疾病。

column1: Like today’s wars, the Thirty Years War is often assumed to have been an essentially religious conflict, but between Catholics and Protestants.
column2: 和今天的战争相似，三十年战争常常被认为主要是宗教冲突，只不过发生在天主教和新教之间。

column1: In fact, again like the current violence in which the Arab world is embroiled, it was much more complicated.
column2: 事实上，和今天阿拉伯世界深陷其中的暴力相同，三十年战争要复杂得多。

column1: Mercenary soldiers, Protestant or Catholic, switched sides whenever it suited them, while the Vatican backed the Protestant German princes, Catholic France backed the Protestant Dutch Republic, and many other alliances were forged across sectarian lines.
column2: 雇佣兵 — — 不管是新教徒还是天主教徒 — — 只要形势不对就倒戈，梵蒂冈支持信奉新教的德国贵族，天主教法国支持新教荷兰共和国，其他许多联盟也包括众多不同宗派。

column1: In reality, the Thirty Years War was a struggle for European hegemony between the Bourbon and Habsburg monarchies.
column2: 事实上，三十年战争是波旁和哈布斯堡王朝争夺欧洲霸权的战争。

column1: As long as one was not strong enough to dominate the other, the war continued, causing horrendous suffering among innocent peasants and city dwellers.
column2: 只要一方不足以强大到主宰另一方，战争就无法结束，导致无辜农民和城市居民惨遭横祸。

column1: And just like in the Middle East today, other major powers – France, Denmark, and Sweden, among others – took part, backing one side or the other, hoping to gain advantage for themselves.
column2: 而正如今天的中东，其他主要力量 — — 法国、丹麦、瑞典等 — — 也参与其中，支持其中一方，以期从中渔利。

column1: The similarity to the wars in Syria and Iraq is striking.
column2: 叙利亚和伊拉克战争有着惊人的相似性。

column1: ISIS is a brutal Sunni rebellion against Shia rulers.
column2: 伊斯兰国是逊尼派对什叶派统治的残酷反抗。

column1: The US opposes it, but so do Iran, a Shia power, and Saudi Arabia, which is run by Sunni despots.
column2: 美国反对它，什叶派力量伊朗和逊尼派君主统治的沙特阿拉伯亦然。

column1: The main axis of conflict in the Middle East is not religious or sectarian, but geopolitical: the struggle for regional hegemony between Saudi Arabia and Iran.
column2: 中东的主要冲突轴心不是宗教或宗派，而是地缘政治：沙特阿拉伯和伊朗争夺地区霸权。

column1: Both have backers among the major powers, and both deliberately whip up religious fanatics; but theological differences are not the key to understanding the escalation of violence.
column2: 两国都有主要力量撑腰，都有意识地借助宗教狂热；但神学方面的分歧并不是理解暴力升级的关键。

column1: What is to be learned from all this?
column2: 从所有这些当中我们可以学到什么？

column1: Some might argue that only a thorough religious reformation will bring about long-term peace in the Middle East.
column2: 有人会说，只有彻底的宗教改革能给中东带来长期和平。

column1: But, though reformation of Islam might be desirable in itself, it will not bring an end to the war at hand.
column2: 但是，即便伊斯兰教改革本身值得追求，但它无法结束当下的战争。

column1: Syria’s President Bashar al-Assad is not fighting for a particular sect of Islam (the Alawites in his case), but for his survival.
column2: 叙利亚总统巴沙尔·阿萨德不是在为某个伊斯兰教派而战（他属于阿拉维派 ） ， 而是在为自己的生存而战。

column1: ISIS is not battling for Sunni orthodoxy, but for a revolutionary caliphate.
column2: 伊斯兰国不是在为逊尼派正统而战，而是在为革命的哈里发而战。

column1: The struggle between Saudi Arabia and Iran is not religious, but political.
column2: 沙特阿拉伯和伊朗之间的战争不是宗教战争，而是政治战争。

column1: There were moments during the Thirty Years War when a political settlement might have been possible.
column2: 在三十年战争期间，不乏有可能实现政治和解的时刻。

column1: But the will to take advantage of such opportunities was lacking; one party or another still sought greater advantage by fighting on (or encouraging others to do so).
column2: 但缺乏抓住这些机会的意愿；总有一方仍试图通过继续战斗（或鼓励其他人继续战斗）赢得更大优势。

column1: It would be a tragedy if similar opportunities were missed today.
column2: 如果今天也错失这样的机会，将是一个悲剧。

column1: Settlements demand compromise.
column2: 和解需要妥协。

column1: Enemies will have to talk to one another.
column2: 敌人将不得不互相谈判。

column1: Braggadocio about carpet bombing, and accusations of appeasement against those who try to negotiate, will only prolong the agony, if not cause an even greater catastrophe.
column2: 自负于地毯式轰炸、指责试图谈判者为绥靖，这些做法只能延长痛苦甚至造成更大的灾难。

column1: And that will affect almost all of us.
column2: 而这将影响到我们几乎每一个人。

column1: What Can Save the Euro?
column2: 怎样拯救欧元？

column1: NEW YORK – Just when it seemed that things couldn’t get worse, it appears that they have.
column2: 纽约 — — 有时候事情看上去并不会变得很糟，但实际上却并非如此。

column1: Even some of the ostensibly “responsible” members of the eurozone are facing higher interest rates.
column2: 即就是欧元区一些看似“负责”的成员国也将面临更高的利率。

column1: Economists on both sides of the Atlantic are now discussing not just whether the euro will survive, but how to ensure that its demise causes the least turmoil possible.
column2: 而大西洋两岸的欧美经济学家们现在讨论的已经不是欧元能否生存下来的问题，而是如何确保欧元体系的崩溃只带来最小的动荡。

column1: It is increasingly evident that Europe’s political leaders, for all their commitment to the euro’s survival, do not have a good grasp of what is required to make the single currency work.
column2: 尽管欧洲各国领导致力于挽救欧元，但在维系欧元运作的必要措施方面，各国领导对此的认识缺陷却逐渐暴露出来。

column1: The prevailing view when the euro was established was that all that was required was fiscal discipline – no country’s fiscal deficit or public debt, relative to GDP, should be too large.
column2: 欧元体系建立伊始，主流观点认为维系欧元体系的运作只需在财政方面进行约束，即，各成员国的财政赤字或公共债务应与各国国内生产总值相适应。

column1: But Ireland and Spain had budget surpluses and low debt before the crisis, which quickly turned into large deficits and high debt.
column2: 经济危机前，爱尔兰和西班牙仍有预算结余，并保持较低的债务值。 然而，很快一切都化为乌有，两国都陷入财政赤字，债台高筑。

column1: So now European leaders say that it is the current-account deficits of the eurozone’s member countries that must be kept in check.
column2: 所以，当今欧洲各国领导都指出控制各成员国的经常项目赤字才是当务之急。

column1: In that case, it seems curious that, as the crisis continues, the safe haven for global investors is the United States, which has had an enormous current-account deficit for years.
column2: 如果真是这样，那么随着经济危机的蔓延，美国这个常年保持经常项目赤字的国家却成了全球投资者的避风港，就显得不合常理了。

column1: So, how will the European Union distinguish between “good” current-account deficits – a government creates a favorable business climate, generating inflows of foreign direct investment – and “bad” current-account deficits?
column2: 而欧盟将如何分辨政府为创造有利投资环境以及增加外国直接投资而造成的“良性”经常性项目赤字和“不良”经常性项目赤字呢？

column1: Preventing bad current-account deficits would require far greater intervention in the private sector than the neoliberal and single-market doctrines that were fashionable at the euro’s founding would imply.
column2: 要想避免“不良”经常性项目赤字，那么对于私营部门的干预则应该远远大于欧元区建立时颇受欢迎的新自由主义以及单一市场原则所倡导的程度。

column1: In Spain, for example, money flowed into the private sector from private banks.
column2: 以西班牙为例，私营部门的资金主要来自私有银行。

column1: Should such irrational exuberance force the government, willy-nilly, to curtail public investment?
column2: 而受这种非理性繁荣的影响，政府是否应被迫削减公共投资呢？

column1: Does this mean that government must decide which capital flows – say into real-estate investment, for example – are bad, and so must be taxed or otherwise curbed?
column2: 而这是否又意味着政府必须决定这其中哪一种资金流是不良的（如，投资房产的资金 ） ， 从而这种投资是否应缴纳税款或者被限制呢？

column1: To me, this makes sense, but such policies should be anathema to the EU’s free-market advocates.
column2: 我个人觉得这样的政策会行之有效。 但是对于欧盟自由市场的倡导者而言，这些政策只会招来极大的不满。

column1: The quest for a clear, simple answer recalls the discussions that have followed financial crises around the world.
column2: 为了寻求一个明确简单的答案。 人们的注意力再一次集中到每次金融危机过后的讨论之上。

column1: After each crisis, an explanation emerges, which the next crisis shows to be wrong, or at least inadequate.
column2: 每一次金融危机结束，总有相应的解释出现。 而这些解释总是在下一次金融危机到来时被推翻或者至少证明其不全面。

column1: The 1980’s Latin American crisis was caused by excessive borrowing; but that could not explain Mexico’s 1994 crisis, so it was attributed to under-saving.
column2: 二十世纪八十年代的拉美经济危机是由于过度贷款造成的。 而这个解释却不适用于1994年的墨西哥经济危机，因为这一次危机的原因是由于储蓄不足。
而紧接着到了东亚经济危机。

column1: Then came East Asia, which had high savings rates, so the new explanation was “governance.” But this, too, made little sense, given that the Scandinavian countries – which have the most transparent governance in the world – had suffered a crisis a few years earlier.
column2: 东亚拥很高的储蓄率，但这一次问题出在“管理方式”之上。 在享有世界上最透明管理方式的斯堪的纳维亚国家几年前遭受金融危机时，这个解释则又成了无稽之谈。

column1: There is, interestingly, a common thread running through all of these cases, as well as the 2008 crisis: financial sectors behaved badly and failed to assess creditworthiness and manage risk as they were supposed to do.
column2: 但值得注意的是，这些金融危机，包括2008年的金融危机，都有一个共通的线索，即，金融行业表现欠佳，未能准确评估信用度，在危机出现时，未能及时处理。

column1: These problems will occur with or without the euro.
column2: 无论有没有欧元，这些问题都会出现。

column1: But the euro has made it more difficult for governments to respond.
column2: 但是对于政府来说，欧元的出现使得这些问题变得更加棘手。

column1: And the problem is not just that the euro took away two key tools for adjustment – the interest rate and the exchange rate – and put nothing in their place, or that the European Central Bank’s mandate is to focus on inflation, whereas today’s challenges are unemployment, growth, and financial stability.
column2: 而现在的问题不仅只是：欧元的崩溃将使得各国丧失两大调节方式（利率以及汇率 ） ， 以及欧洲央行的权限主要集中于控制通货膨胀；而且，现在各国政府还面临失业，增长速度慢，以及金融市场不稳定的挑战。

column1: Without a common fiscal authority, the single market opened the way to tax competition – a race to the bottom to attract investment and boost output that could be freely sold throughout the EU.
column2: 失去了共同财政管理体系的统一市场只会为税收竞争敞开大门。 各国会通过降低税收的方式来吸引投资并增加可以在欧盟区自由交易产品的产出。

column1: Moreover, free labor mobility means that individuals can choose whether to pay their parents’ debts: young Irish can simply escape repaying the foolish bank-bailout obligations assumed by their government by leaving the country.
column2: 再者，自由劳动流动意味着个人可以选择是否为自己的父母辈还债 — — 爱尔兰的年青人只需要离开自己的国家就不用在为政府愚蠢的银行担保买单。

column1: Of course, migration is supposed to be good, as it reallocates labor to where its return is highest.
column2: 当然，移民可以使劳动力按照收益重新分配，本身当然无可厚非。

column1: But this kind of migration actually undermines productivity.
column2: 但是，这种方式的移民实际是在削弱生产力。

column1: Migration is, of course, part of the adjustment mechanism that makes America work as a single market with a single currency.
column2: 当然，移民正是美国调节机制的一部分。 它使得美国能够以使用单一货币的统一市场的形式来运作。

column1: Even more important is the federal government’s role in helping states that face, say, high unemployment, by allocating additional tax revenue to them – the so-called “transfer union” so loathed by many Germans.
column2: 更为重要的是：联邦政府通过分配更多的额外税收来缓解各州面临的问题（如高失业率）时所扮演的角色，即所谓的“转移联盟 ” ， 让很多德国人深恶痛绝。

column1: But the US is also willing to accept the depopulation of entire states that cannot compete. (Some point out that this means that America’s corporations can buy senators from such states at a lower price.)
column2: 而美国同样也愿意在那些失去竞争力的州采取减少人口的方式来解决问题（一些人指出美国企业可以通过这种方法来从这些竞争力低的州购买议员的席位 ） 。

column1: But are European countries with lagging productivity willing to accept depopulation?
column2: 但是生产力相对落后的欧洲愿意通过减少人口来解决问题吗？

column1: Alternatively, are they willing to face the pain of “internal” devaluation, a process that failed under the gold standard and is failing under the euro?
column2: 或者，欧洲愿意忍痛采取“内部”贬值的方式 — — 这种方式在过去在黄金标准体系下曾经惨遭失败，而在如今在欧元体系也下日趋崩溃？

column1: Even if those from Europe’s northern countries are right in claiming that the euro would work if effective discipline could be imposed on others (I think they are wrong), they are deluding themselves with a morality play.
column2: 即便一些欧洲北部国家所宣称的通过采取一些有效的管理方法可以使欧元重获生机方法是正确的。 （我个人认为是错误的）他们也不过是在上演一出自欺欺人的道德剧罢了。

column1: It is fine to blame their southern compatriots for fiscal profligacy, or, in the case of Spain and Ireland, for letting free markets have free reign, without seeing where that would lead.
column2: 当然，采取奢侈财务政策的南部同盟，或者将自由市场等同为没有限制，对于后果毫无顾忌的西班牙和爱尔兰本身责无旁贷。

column1: But that doesn’t address today’s problem: huge debts, whether a result of private or public miscalculations, must be managed within the euro framework.
column2: 但指责并不能解决今天面临的问题：欧盟的巨额债务，无论是无私有还是公有行业造成的，必须从起自身出发着手解决。

column1: Public-sector cutbacks today do not solve the problem of yesterday’s profligacy; they simply push economies into deeper recessions.
column2: 往昔欠下的巨额债务并不能通过减少当下公共部门的预算来减少。 这样做只会适得其反，使经济更为衰退。

column1: Europe’s leaders know this.
column2: 欧洲的领导人明白这一点。

column1: They know that growth is needed.
column2: 他们知道欧洲需要经济增长。

column1: But, rather than deal with today’s problems and find a formula for growth, they prefer to deliver homilies about what some previous government should have done.This may be satisfying for the sermonizer, but it won’t solve Europe’s problems – and it won’t save the euro.
column2: 但是与其去解决问题，寻求经济增长的方式，还不如喋喋不休地去指责前几任政府的失职。 对于说教者而言这是个让人满意的行为，但是这并不会解决欧洲的问题，当然也拯救不了欧元。

column1: What China Wants in 2012
column2: 2012年，中国想要什么

column1: BEIJING – With economic globalization and the advent of a multi-polar world, China and other emerging countries are clearly set to play much more important roles not only in 2012, but in the coming decades.
column2: 北京 — — 随着经济的全球化以及多极世界的形成，中国和其他新兴国家必定会扮演更加重要的角色，不仅在2012年如此，在今后的数十年间都是如此，这已是众人皆知了。

column1: As China’s economic power and influence in the world economy have increased following the financial crisis of 2008, the idea has been floated that China and the United States should co-lead the world under some sort of “G-2” arrangement.
column2: 2008年金融危机以来，随着中国在世界经济中的经济实力和影响，出现了一种新观点：中国和美国应该被称为“G2 ” ， 共同领导整个世界。

column1: But such a G-2 framework is not consistent with China’s independent foreign policy, nor with the general trend towards wider dispersion of geopolitical power within the international community.
column2: 但这种G2框架与中国的独立外交并不一致，与国际社会地缘政治日渐分散化的趋势也不相符。

column1: Although China’s senior leadership will change this year, this position will not change.
column2: 尽管中国的高层领导人将在今年易届，但这一立场是不会随之改变的。

column1: Indeed, when China’s Premier Wen Jiabao visited Prague in May 2009 for the 11th China-European Union summit, he explained that China is opposed to the G-2 concept.
column2: 事实上，温家宝总理在2009年5月访问布拉格出席中欧峰会时就解释说，中国反对G2的概念。

column1: It is China’s firm intention never to seek hegemony, nor to support global domination by a small minority of countries.
column2: 中国永不追求霸权，也不支持一小撮国家主导全球，这是中国的坚定立场。

column1: What China does believe in is deepening cooperation with all of the world’s major regions.
column2: 中国坚信，世界各主要地区的合作将越来越深入。

column1: Consider Europe – a splendid and time-honored civilization, and now a major player on the world stage.
column2: 比如欧洲，这里有着历史悠久的灿烂文明，也是今日世界舞台的主角。

column1: The progressive deepening of EU integration has brought dynamic vigor to the European continent; despite Europe’s current difficulties, it still boasts extraordinary overall strength and international influence.
column2: 欧盟一体化的深化进程给欧洲大陆带来了动力；尽管欧洲当前遇到了一些困难，但它仍具有引以为豪的实力和国际影响力。

column1: China has always supported European integration, and hopes that the EU will become a pillar of international order.
column2: 中国一贯支持欧洲一体化，也希望欧盟能成为国际秩序之一级。

column1: In the wake of the global financial crisis and the eurozone’s sovereign-debt crisis, China has bought government bonds, made direct investments, and sent business delegations to Europe.
column2: 随着全球金融危机和欧元区主权债务危机的爆发，中国已经购买了欧洲政府债券、对欧洲进行了直接投资，并派遣了商业代表团赴欧。

column1: During Spanish Prime Minister José Luis Zapatero’s visit to Beijing in April 2011, Wen reaffirmed China’s willingness to continue purchasing Spanish government bonds as a further demonstration of our support for Europe’s efforts to emerge from its crisis.
column2: 2011年西班牙首相萨帕特罗访问中国时，温家宝总理确认，中国愿意继续购买西班牙政府债券，以进一步表明我们对欧洲应对危机的支持。

column1: Moreover, China’s huge market and labor pool have created important opportunities for Europe.
column2: 此外，中国的巨大市场和劳动力储备也未欧洲创造了重要机会。

column1: In this new multi-polar era, China and Europe must work together, and they are now at a critical moment if they are to deepen their cooperation.
column2: 在这个新的多极时代，中国和欧洲必须精诚合作，而如若双方意欲深化合作，那么现在就是关键时刻。

column1: What we do to share opportunities, meet challenges, and pursue development will be directly relevant not only to our own peoples’ welfare, but also to the world’s future.
column2: 我们分享机会、直面挑战和追求发展的举措不仅直接与我们自己的人民福祉有关，也关系到世界的未来。

column1: China-EU cooperation will be essential to maintaining global peace and stability.
column2: 中欧合作将是维持世界和平与稳定的关键。

column1: We share a commitment to resolving international issues through political means, and both sides have already played a constructive role in addressing global challenges such as climate change, terrorism, and the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction.
column2: 我们对通过政治途径解决国际问题有着共同承诺，双方在应对气候变化、恐怖主义、大规模杀伤新武器扩散方面已做出了建设性贡献。

column1: The parallel launch of China’s 12th Five-Year Plan and Europe’s 2020 Strategy has also helped to deepen our cooperation.
column2: 同时公布中国的十二五规划和欧洲的2020战略也有益于深化我们的合作。

column1: China and Europe worked together after 2008 to prevent a global financial meltdown, oppose protectionism, and promote reform of the international financial system, thus facilitating worldwide economic recovery.
column2: 2008年以来，中国和欧洲精诚合作，以防止全球金融体系的崩溃、反对恐怖主义、促进国际金融体系改革从而助力世界经济复苏。

column1: China also takes its relations with the US very seriously.
column2: 中国对于和美国的关系也很重视。

column1: Indeed, our bilateral relationship is among the most important in the international community.
column2: 事实上，我们的双边关系是国际社会中最重要的关系之一。

column1: That relationship has gone through some rough patches since diplomatic ties were established in 1979, but, overall, it has continued to grow and benefit both sides.
column2: 自1979年双方建立外交关系以来，中美关系经历了不少困难时刻，但总体而言在持续改善，双方均因此获益良多。

column1: Today, China and the US share more interests than ever, and there are encouraging prospects for still broader cooperation.
column2: 如今，中美的共同利益之大前所未见，双方的合作前景令人鼓舞。

column1: When President Hu Jintao visited Washington, DC in January 2011, he and President Barack Obama agreed to build what Hu referred to as “a China-US cooperative partnership based on respect and mutual benefit.”
column2: 2011年1月，胡锦涛主席访问华盛顿，他和奥巴马总统同意建设胡主席所谓的“基于尊重和共同利益的中美合作伙伴关系 。 ”

column1: They reaffirmed their deference for each other’s sovereignty and territorial integrity, and reached agreements on major strategic issues, including efforts to strengthen cooperation in the Asia-Pacific region and in multilateral institutions, and to respond jointly to regional and global challenges to peace and stability, for example, on the Korean Peninsula.
column2: 两人重申彼此尊重主权完整，并在包括强化亚太地区合作和多变制度、联合应对地区和全球和平与稳定的挑战（如朝鲜半岛问题）等重要战略问题上达成了一致。

column1: China is the world’s largest developing country; Europe is the largest bloc of developed countries; and the US is the largest single developed country.
column2: 中国是世界上最大的发展中国家，欧洲是世界上最大的发达国家联合体，美国是世界上最大的单一发达国家。

column1: Together, we account for nearly a third of humanity and two-thirds of the world economy.
column2: 三国加起来占据着全球三分之一的人口和三分之二的经济总量。

column1: As the three major global powers, China, the EU, and the US must strengthen their cooperation, and must work with the rest of the world to face the complex international issues that challenge us all.
column2: 作为全球三大势力，中国、欧盟和美国必须强化合作，与世界其他国家精诚合作，应对困扰我们所有人的复杂多变的国际问题。

column1: Together, we must shoulder the great task of upholding world peace and promoting common development.
column2: 我们必须联合起来承担维持世界和平、促进共同发展的重大任务。

column1: While China is committed to its own independent foreign policy, it cannot achieve development in isolation.
column2: 中国做出了独立外交政策的承诺，但它无法单枪匹马地发展。

column1: Likewise, the world cannot develop without China.
column2: 类似地，世界也无法在没有中国的情况下发展。

column1: Hu once said that the twenty-first century should be a century of peace, development, and cooperation.
column2: 胡主席曾说，21世纪应该是和平、发展和合作的世纪。

column1: China is willing to join with the EU, the US, and the rest of the world to realize the potential of a truly harmonious world.
column2: 中国愿意与欧盟、美国和世界其他国家一起，实现真正和谐的社会。

column1: Over the Cliff We Go
column2: 跨越财政悬崖

column1: BERKELEY – Unless something unexpected happens, the United States’ many legislated reductions in taxes over the past 12 years – all of which have been explicitly temporary – will expire simultaneously at the start of 2013.
column2: 伯克利 — — 除非发生意外，否则12年来美国众多法律规定的减税措施（其中很多都被明确规定为临时性措施）将于2013年伊始同时终止。

column1: American tax rates will revert overnight to their Clinton-era levels.
column2: 一夜之间，美国将恢复克林顿时代的税率。

column1: Some of these reductions were implemented to fight what was seen four years ago as a temporary downturn.
column2: 实行减税措施是为了抵御四年前暂时性的经济低迷。

column1: Although their supporters wanted to make them permanent, claiming that they were temporary allowed for the circumvention of procedural requirements in the legislative process that Democrats had created in a vain effort to guarantee fiscal sanity.
column2: 但支持者希望实现其永久化，称当时只是为了规避立法过程中民主党保证财政合理性的无效的程序性规定才将其确定为临时性措施。

column1: The immediate increase in tax rates is only part of the story.
column2: 减税计划到期后税率即刻调升还不是全部问题。

column1: At the same time, automatic reductions in the defense budget and “discretionary” domestic spending – agreed to by both Democrats and Republicans in the summer of 2011 – will take effect.
column2: 与此同时，民主共和两党于2011年夏达成的自动削减国防预算和“自由裁量”国内消费的协议也将开始实施。

column1: Couple these tax increases and spending cuts with the provisions of “Obamacare,” the US health-care reform championed by President Barack Obama, and, as of January 1, 2013, America’s long-run structural budget deficit disappears.
column2: 增税减支措施将于2013年1月1日生效，辅之以奥巴马总统倡导的“奥巴马医改”即可消除美国的长期结构性财政赤字。

column1: The restored tax rates will, for the foreseeable future, be sufficient to support the US defense establishment, the growing US social-insurance system, and a moderate – albeit inadequate and suboptimal – amount of other “discretionary” federal spending.
column2: 恢复后的税率在可以预见的未来足以支撑美国的国防建设、不断发展的社保系统和虽不理想但却适度稳健的其他“自由裁量”的联邦开支。

column1: The US national debt/GDP ratio will be on track to fall from its current level of 75% to 50% by 2035.
column2: 美国国债占国内生产总值的比例将有望从目前的75%下降到2035年的50 % 。

column1: Moreover, the US will begin running primary budget surpluses – the fiscal balance minus interest payments on existing debt – by 2015.
column2: 此外截止2015年，美国将开始实现基本预算盈余 — — 在扣除现有债务利息支出后实现财政收支平衡。

column1: So why isn’t the prospect of going over the fiscal cliff greeted with enthusiasm?
column2: 那么民众为什么对平安跨过财政悬崖的前景并不热衷？

column1: Yes, there will be big spending cuts – which will hit defense contractors, doctors with Medicare patients, and all who benefit from or rely on government discretionary spending – and substantial tax increases.
column2: 是的，我们需要大幅削减开支 — — 而这将打击国防承包商、为联邦医疗保险（Medicare）患者看病的医生和受惠于政府可自由支配开支的所有人 — — 同时大幅增加税收。

column1: But, to balance the budget in the long run, either taxes have to go up or spending has to go down relative to some baseline, or both.
column2: 但为实现长期预算平衡，税收必须相对于一定基准上升而开支则必须下降，或者两者兼而有之。

column1: There are two reasons why deficit hawks are not declaring victory.
column2: 赤字鹰派没有宣布胜利有两个原因。

column1: First, many who call themselves deficit hawks are really spending hawks: they believe that US social insurance is too generous to the unemployed, the disabled, the elderly, and the sick, and that by far the best policy is to cut back on such programs rather than raise taxes to pay for them.
column2: 其一，许多自诩的赤字鹰派其实应该叫支出鹰派：他们认为美国社会保险对失业者、残疾人、老年人和患病者过于慷慨，因此迄今为止的最佳政策不是提高税收，而是削减社保开支。

column1: But, they fear that calling for spending cuts will be unpopular, unlike, they hope, demands to balance the budget.
column2: 但他们害怕削减开支的要求不得人心，而平衡预算就不会引起那么大的反应。

column1: For them, the problem with the fiscal cliff is that it does not cut spending enough and raises taxes too much.
column2: 对他们而言，财政悬崖的问题在于加税加得过多，而开支减得不够。

column1: Second, and more important for those who worry about the US economy’s health, the process is not well-described by the term “fiscal cliff.”
column2: 第二点在为美国经济健康忧心忡忡者看来尤为重要，即“财政悬崖”一词无法贴切地形容整个过程。

column1: It is, rather, an austerity bomb that hits an economy in which unemployment remains high, the employment-to-population ratio remains horrifyingly low, and there are only feeble signs that the large gap between current and potential output is closing.
column2: 这相当于命中高失业率经济体的一枚紧缩炸弹，就业人口占总人口的比例依然低得惊人，且只有微弱迹象表明当前及潜在产值之间的巨大落差正在逐步弥合。

column1: The past two months’ run-up to the austerity bomb’s detonation has already reduced projected real GDP growth in 2013 from 3% to 2.5%, and has raised likely end-2013 unemployment from 7.5% to 7.7%.
column2: 紧缩炸弹爆炸前两个月的准备阶段，2013年实际国内生产总值预期增长已经从3%降至2.5 % ， 2013年底预期失业率也从7.5%增加到7.7 % 。

column1: Each day from January 1 to June 30 that the damage continues will have a roughly linear impact on economic performance in 2013, reducing the likely full-year real GDP growth rate by 0.0084% – and only if a deal is ultimately reached that would have caused no economic harm in 2013 had it been reached on November 10, 2012.
column2: 2013年1月1日至6月30日的每一个日夜都会对经济表现造成大致线性的影响，导致可能的全年实际国内生产总值增速下降0.0084 % — —只有在2012年11月10日前最终达成一致才不会损害2013年的经济发展。

column1: If no deal is reached by June 30, America’s likely 2013 real GDP growth rate will be -0.5%, with the likely unemployment rate returning to 8.9%.
column2: 如果到6月30日还未达成一致，美国2013年实际国内生产总值增长率将有可能降至负0.5 % ， 而失业率有可能重新升至8.9 % 。

column1: Spending cuts and tax increases that in the long run restore fiscal sanity and balance are good.
column2: 长远看能削减开支、增加税收，恢复财政平衡稳健的措施都有好处。

column1: Having them all hit a weak, still-depressed economy simultaneously is not good.
column2: 但任由它们同时打击仍然疲弱低迷的经济却绝非明智的选择。

column1: Thus, US officials face four tasks.
column2: 因此，美国官员必须完成四项任务。

column1: First, Republicans and Democrats must negotiate a bipartisan agreement to stretch out the spending cuts and tax increases that take effect on January 1, 2013.
column2: 首先，共和及民主两党必须谈判两党协议，从2013年1月1日起削减开支并增加税收。

column1: That way, they will affect the economy gradually over five years, rather than all at once.
column2: 相关措施对经济影响不是一次性的，而将在今后五年内逐步释放。

column1: Second, the Federal Reserve should expand its quantitative easing and forward guidance programs.
column2: 其次，美联储应扩大其量化宽松政策和前瞻性的指导方案。

column1: Consumers will be spending less in 2013, owing to higher taxes, as will government, which means that someone has to be spending more.
column2: 2013年消费者和政府将因为税收提高而紧缩开支，这也意味着有些领域需要多花钱。

column1: Housing construction and exports are the obvious candidates, and both can be boosted somewhat by more aggressive balance-sheet operations by the Fed, together with promises of continued low nominal interest rates and higher inflation in the medium term.
column2: 住宅建设和出口是显而易见的候选领域，美联储对资产负债表的积极运作，加之中期维持低名义利率和高通胀的承诺将在一定程度上刺激上述两个领域的复苏。

column1: Third, the large government-sponsored mortgage enterprises, Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, should be used as macroeconomic-policy tools to restore housing construction to its long-term trend level.
column2: 第三，政府资助的大型抵押贷款企业房利美和房地美应当发挥宏观经济政策工具的作用，让住房建设恢复到其长期趋势水平。

column1: This should have been done five years ago, but better late than never.
column2: 原本五年前就应当这样做，但亡羊补牢、犹未为晚。

column1: Finally, and also five years too late, the US Treasury secretary should announce that while the strong-dollar doctrine was appropriate (and in America’s interest) during the dot-com boom, the country needs a weak dollar in the aftermath of the austerity bomb’s detonation.
column2: 最后，虽然本来也应在五年前着手，但美国财政部长盖特纳应当宣布，因为网络繁荣期间盛行（符合美国利益的）字符串美元主义，美国在紧缩炸弹爆炸后需要弱势美元。

column1: Reaching the wrong agreement to defuse the austerity bomb, or cushion the economy from its impact, would merely recreate America’s long-run structural budget deficit – a very bad outcome.
column2: 就拆除紧缩炸弹或化解经济影响达成错误的共识只会重新造成美国的长期结构性预算赤字，这个结果非常糟糕。

column1: Failure to take all four steps outlined above all but guarantees renewed recession in America, even if a good agreement is reached on stretching out the tax hikes and spending cuts.
column2: 即便就增税减支达成了稳妥的协议，未能实行上述四个步骤就几乎注定了美国将重新陷入经济危机之中。

column1: And if no agreement is reached on that, undertaking the last three steps would at least reduce somewhat the subsequent damage.
column2: 如果未能就此达成协议，采取上述三个步骤至少能在一定程度上降低随之而来的损害。

column1: What Communism Still Teaches Us
column2: 共产主义至今仍留给我们的教训

column1: PRAGUE - The fifteenth anniversary of the Velvet Revolution on November 17, 1989, which brought an end to 41 years of communist dictatorship in Czechoslovakia, is an opportunity to ponder the meaning of moral behavior and free action.
column2: 1989年11月17日发生的“丝绒革命”给捷克斯洛伐克长达41年的共产主义独裁政治划上了句号。 今年是其十五周年，是我们思考道德行为和自由行动的意义的契机。

column1: Today we live in a democratic society, but many people - not only in the Czech Republic - still believe that they are not true masters of their destiny.
column2: 今天，我们生活在民主社会中，但是许多人 — — 不仅仅在捷克共和国内 — — 仍然相信自己无法真正主宰自己的命运。

column1: They have lost faith that they can really influence political developments, much less influence the direction in which our civilization is evolving.
column2: 他们已失去信心，不相信自己能对政治的发展产生现实的影响，更不用说影响我们的文明演进的方向。

column1: During the communist era, most people believed that individual efforts to effect change did not make sense.
column2: 在共产主义时期，绝大多数人认为个人的努力没有作用。

column1: Communist leaders insisted that the system was the result of history's objective laws, which could not be challenged, and those who refused this logic were punished - just in case.
column2: 共产主义领导人坚称其制度是历史客观规律的产物，是不可动摇的，任何拒不接受这个逻辑的人都要受到惩罚 — — 以防万一。

column1: Unfortunately, the way of thinking that supported Communist dictatorships has not disappeared entirely.
column2: 不幸的是，这种支持共产主义独裁政治的思维方式还没有完全消失。

column1: Some politicians and pundits maintain that Communism merely collapsed under its own weight - again, owing to "objective laws" of history.
column2: 某些政客和学究还坚持认为共产主义的崩溃是出于其自身的原因 — — 同样属于历史的“客观规律 ” 。

column1: Again, individual responsibility and individual actions are belittled.
column2: 个人的责任和个人的行为再次被低估。

column1: Communism, we are told, was only one of the dead ends of Western rationalism; therefore, it was sufficient to wait passively for it to fail.
column2: 我们听到的说法是，共产主义只是西方理性主义的死胡同之一；因此，只需要坐等它的消亡即可。

column1: The very same people often believe in other manifestations of inevitability, such as various supposed laws of the market and other "invisible hands" that direct our lives.
column2: 同样是这批人还常常相信必然性的其他表现方式，如各种假想中的市场规律和其他指挥我们的生活的“看不见的手 ” 。

column1: As there is not much space in such thinking for individual moral action, social critics are often ridiculed as naive moralists or elitists.
column2: 由于这种思想没有给个人的道德行为留下多少空间，社会批评家经常被嘲笑为天真的道德论或精英论者。

column1: Perhaps this is one of the reasons why 15 years after the fall of Communism, we again witness political apathy.
column2: 或许这就是为什么在共产主义垮台15年后，我们再次见到政治冷漠现象的原因之一。

column1: Democracy is increasingly seen as a mere ritual.
column2: 民主越来越被看作仅仅是一种仪式。

column1: In general, Western societies, it seems, are experiencing a certain crisis of the democratic ethos and active citizenship.
column2: 总的说来，西方社会似乎正在经历某种民主思潮和活跃公民的危机。

column1: It is possible that what we are witnessing is a mere change of paradigm, caused by new technologies, and we have nothing to worry about.
column2: 也许我们看到的现象只是一种由新的科技引起的范式转变，没有什么好担心的。

column1: But perhaps the problem is deeper: global corporations, media cartels, and powerful bureaucracies are transforming political parties into organizations whose main task is no longer public service, but the protection of specific clienteles and interests.
column2: 但是问题的根源也许比这要深刻：全球化的公司、媒体卡特尔、以及强势的官僚制度正在把政党的主要任务转变成不再是服务大众，而是保护特定客户群和利益。

column1: Politics is becoming a battleground for lobbyists; media trivialize serious problems; democracy often looks like a virtual game for consumers, rather than a serious business for serious citizens.
column2: 政治正在变成说客的战场；媒体把严肃的问题大事化小；民主常常看起来像是一场消费者的虚拟游戏，而不是严肃的公民面对的严肃问题。

column1: When dreaming about a democratic future, we who were dissidents certainly had some utopian illusions, as we are well aware today.
column2: 今天我们清楚，当初在梦想民主的未来时，作为持不同政见者的我们肯定有某些乌托邦式的幻想。

column1: However, we were not mistaken when we argued that Communism was not a mere dead end of Western rationalism.
column2: 但是，当我们辩称共产主义并非仅仅是西方理性主义的死胡同时，我们没有错。

column1: Bureaucratization, anonymous manipulation, and emphasis on mass conformism were brought to "perfection" in the Communist system; however, some of the very same threats are with us today.
column2: 官僚主义、匿名操纵、以及对群众顺从的强调在共产主义制度中被发挥至“极致 ” ； 然而，同样的威胁中有一部分今天仍然存在。

column1: We were already certain then that if democracy is emptied of values and reduced to a competition of political parties that have "guaranteed" solutions to everything, it can be quite undemocratic.
column2: 当时我们就明白，如果掏空民主的价值，把民主降格成“保证”能解决所有问题的政党之间的竞争，这样的民主其实相当不民主。

column1: This is why we put so much emphasis on the moral dimension of politics and a vibrant civil society as counterweights to political parties and state institutions.
column2: 这就是为什么我们花如此大的力气强调政治的道德方面和活跃的民众社会，以此作为政党和国家制度的平衡力。

column1: We also dreamed about a more just international order.
column2: 我们还梦想建立更加公正的国际秩序。

column1: The end of the bipolar world represented a great opportunity to make the international order more humane.
column2: 两极世界的结束是使国际秩序更加人性化的重大机遇。

column1: Instead, we witness a process of economic globalization that has escaped political control and, as such, is causing economic havoc as well as ecological devastation in many parts of the world.
column2: 相反，我们看到了经济全球化。 这个过程绕过了政治控制，并在世界上许多地方造成了经济浩劫和生态灾难。

column1: The fall of Communism was an opportunity to create more effective global political institutions based on democratic principles - institutions that could stop what appears to be, in its current form, the self-destructive tendency of our industrial world.
column2: 共产主义的垮台是在民主原则的基础上建立更加有效的全球政治制度 — — 一种能够遏止我们的工业化世界当前似乎具有的自毁趋势的制度的机会。

column1: If we do not want to be overrun by anonymous forces, the principles of freedom, equality and solidarity - the foundation of stability and prosperity in Western democracies - must start working globally.
column2: 如果我们不想被无名的力量践踏，那么，自由、平等和团结的原则 — — 西方民主的��定和繁荣的基础 — — 就必须在全球范围内发挥作用。

column1: But, above all, it is necessary - just as it was during the Communist era - that we not lose faith in the meaning of alternative centers of thought and civic action.
column2: 但是，最重要的是 — — 如同在共产主义时期一样 — — 我们决不能丧失对另一种思维核心和民众行为的意义的信心。

column1: Let's not allow ourselves to be manipulated into believing that attempts to change the "established" order and "objective" laws do not make sense.
column2: 我们决不能允许自己在别人的操纵下相信改变“既定”秩序和“客观”规律的努力是无用的。

column1: Let's try to build a global civil society, and let's insist that politics is not just a technology of power, but needs to have a moral dimension.
column2: 让我们尝试建立一个全球性的民众社会。 让我们坚持政治不仅是舞弄权力，而更需要有一个道德的层面。

column1: At the same time, politicians in democratic countries need to think seriously about reforms of international institutions, because we desperately need institutions capable of real global governance.
column2: 同时，民主国家的政客应该严肃地思考国际制度的改革，因为我们迫切地需要一种能真正覆盖全球的制度。 比如说，我们可以从联合国开始。

column1: We could start, for example, with the United Nations, which, in its current form, is a relic of the situation shortly after the end of World War II. It does not reflect the influence of some new regional powers, while immorally equating countries whose representatives are democratically elected and those whose representatives speak only for themselves or their juntas, at best.
column2: 当今的联合国已经沦为二战刚结束时世界格局的遗物，并不能反映某些新兴地区强国的影响力，同时又不道德地把通过民主选举产生代表的国家和那些代表只为自己或（充其量）为其小圈子代言的国家等同起来。

column1: We, the Europeans, have one specific task.
column2: 我们欧洲人有一个特殊的任务。

column1: Industrial civilization, which now spans the whole world, originated in Europe.
column2: 如今横跨全球的工业文明源自欧洲。

column1: All of its miracles, as well as its terrifying contradictions, can be explained as consequences of an ethos that is initially European.
column2: 工业文明带来的所有奇迹，连同那些可怕的副作用，都可以被看作是一种源自欧洲的社会思想的产物。

column1: Therefore, unifying Europe should set an example for the rest of the world regarding how to face the various dangers and horrors that are engulfing us today.
column2: 因此，一体化的欧洲应该给世界上其他地区树立一个如何应对充斥于当今世界的各种危险和恐怖的榜样。

column1: Indeed, such a task - which is closely tied to the success of European integration - would be an authentic fulfillment of the European sense of global responsibility.
column2: 的确，这样的任务 — — 与欧洲一体化的成功与否密切相关 — — 将真正地实现欧洲人的全球责任感。

column1: And it would be a much better strategy than cheaply blaming America for the contemporary world's various problems.
column2: 而且比起草率地斥责美国造成了当今世界的各种问题，这个策略将有意义得多。

column1: What Corporate Tax for Europe?
column2: 欧洲的公司税制

column1: The European Commission is considering a common model of corporate taxation for the European Union that cannot possibly work.
column2: 欧盟委员会正在考虑一种适用于整个欧盟的公司税收共同模式。 但这种模式肯定是行不通的。

column1: Instead, it should consider a simpler, and more viable, alternative that already exists.
column2: 因此，它应该考虑一种业已存在的，更为简单和可行的方案。

column1: Corporate income in the EU is currently taxed under widely divergent national rules, based on separate accounting (SA) of income earned in each country.
column2: 对公司收入的征税目前欧盟各国都有不同规定。 其基础都是将公司在各个国家所得收入进行分别核算(SA ) 。

column1: Cross-border intra-company transactions are accounted for according to market prices for similar transactions – the so-called “arm’s-length principle” (ALP).
column2: 公司内部的跨国交易根据类似交易的市场价核算—即所谓的“常规交易原则 ” ( ALP ) 。

column1: The system is complex, expensive to administer, and can result in double taxation because members usually do not allow full write-offs for losses and tax liabilities incurred abroad.
column2: 这种会计体系颇为复杂，管理成本高昂，并可能造成双重征税—因为各成员国通常不允许对发生在国外的亏损和税收义务进行完全销账。

column1: It is also prone to tax evasion, owing to different definitions of corporate income in the member states and the vast opportunities for cheating offered by ALP (since reference market prices often do not exist), not to mention profit-shifting to low-tax jurisdictions.
column2: 由于各成员国对公司收入的定义不同，再加上ALP所提供的大量舞弊机会（因为市场参考价通常不存在 ） ， 使得避税非常容易，更别说将利润转移到低税收国家。

column1: The Commission is now proposing that EU companies operating in more than one member state be taxed on a common definition of earned income – the Common Consolidated Base Taxation (CCBT).
column2: 欧盟委员会正提议对在一个以上的欧盟成员国营运的欧盟公司采用共同的所得收入征税—即统一共同税基（CCBT ） 。

column1: Earned income would be calculated on a consolidated basis for the group and then “apportioned” among the member states according to a formula reflecting each business unit’s contribution to overall group income.
column2: 该体系会把集团公司作为一个整体来计算所得收入，然后按照一个反映各业务单元对集团公司总收入的贡献的公式将收入“分配”到各成员国。

column1: The formula could include such factors as sales, payroll, and tangible assets, as in Canada and the United States, or value-added, adjusted to exclude imports in order to measure the value-added “produced” in each country.
column2: 这一公式可能包括销售额、薪资和有形资产等要素（就像加拿大和美国那样 ） ； 或者是计算不包括出口的增加值，以便衡量各国所“产出”的增值部分。

column1: Each member state would remain free to decide the tax rate applicable to its portion of group income.
column2: 每个成员国都有权决定适用于该国那一部分公司收入的税率。

column1: Under this approach, taxable income would be determined from the consolidated accounts based on international accounting standards (IAS), which since 2005 have become legally binding for EU-listed companies’ financial reports.
column2: 按照这种方式，可征税收入就会通过基于国际会计准则的(IAS)统一账目来决定。 从2005年起，该准则成为欧盟上市公司财务报告的法定标准。

column1: This offers full tax write-offs for losses within company groups, and transfer prices would no longer matter.
column2: 这就为公司内部的亏损提供了完全的税务注销，而交易价格也不再重要。

column1: Even so, the Commission’s proposal has fatal shortcomings.
column2: 即便如此，欧盟委员会的提案也有着致命的弱点。

column1: For one thing, the factors included in the apportionment formula would in practice be taxed at the national rates, creating fresh incentives for factor- and profit-shifting.
column2: 就其中一点来看，分配公式中所包含的要素在实际操作中适用国家税率，这就为要素和利润的转移提供了动机。

column1: But it is two other obstacles that render CCBT hopeless.
column2: 但真正让CCBT实行无望的还是另外两个障碍。

column1: First, the IAS responds to the information needs of financial investors, but it does not provide a reliable definition of income for tax purposes.
column2: 首先，IAS回应的是金融投资者的信息需求，但却并没有为税收目的而提供一个公司收入的定义。

column1: The accrual principle typical of financial accounting is incompatible with tax systems’ realization principle.
column2: 金融会计中典型的应计原则和税收体系中的实现原则并不兼容。

column1: Moreover, the IAS leaves the allocation of profit and losses to different fiscal years largely undetermined, with each member state choosing different solutions.
column2: 此外，IAS在很大程度上没有对损益在不同财政年度的分配作明确规定，而每个成员国在这方面都选择了不同的方案。

column1: Second, common legal rules on group consolidation do not exist; indeed, many EU countries’ commercial law contains no legal definition of a group.
column2: 其次，在集团公司统一核算方面并没有共同的法规；的确，在许多欧盟国家的商法中都没有对集团公司的法律定义。

column1: The attribution of companies to a common group would need to be based on legal control, that is, ownership of some defined threshold of equity – 51% or higher.
column2: 多家公司和同一个集团的归属关系需要以合法的控制为基础，即要有某种明确的股份门槛—51%及以上。

column1: But a much lower share of equity often is sufficient to secure de facto control, thus encouraging groups to adapt their capital structure – moving firms in and out of the group’s boundaries – to minimize tax liabilities.
column2: 但通常通过低得多的股份也能获得实际上的控制权，因此这就鼓励了各集团调整其资本结构—将公司在集团的边界内外挪移—从而使税收义务最小化。

column1: Clearly, CCBT is a non-starter.
column2: 显然，CCBT无法启动。

column1: But this doesn’t mean that EU companies are condemned to live with 25 different national tax systems.
column2: 但这并不意味着欧盟的公司们不得不应对25个不同的国家税收体系。

column1: The idea of a common tax base must be preserved in order to simplify the system and narrow the scope for profit-shifting.
column2: 必须保留共同税基以简化税制，并缩小利润转移的范围。

column1: However, a radical change in approach is required: the notion of income as a basis for corporate taxation should be scrapped altogether.
column2: 但这就需要进行一种激进的改革：将收入作为公司税基础的概念应该被完全废止。

column1: Referring to corporate income made sense when company taxation was seen as a “back stop” within a system of progressive taxation of personal incomes.
column2: 当公司税被视为个人所得税递进税制中的“定位杆”时，参考公司收入才是有意义的。

column1: But most countries have now adopted “dual” income taxation that treat the fruits of capital more leniently than other personal income.
column2: 但现在大多数国家都采用了“双重”收入税制，对待资本收益要比对待其他个人收入宽松。

column1: More importantly, the notion of corporate income is inherently arbitrary, for it is based on correct measurement of capital consumption in each tax period, which has become less and less reliable owing to the increased importance of intangibles in the value of companies.
column2: 更为重要的是，公司收入的概念在本质上是武断的，因为它是基于对每一税期内资本消费的正确度量。 但随着无形资产对公司价值的重要性的增加，这种度量正变得越来越不可靠。

column1: Moreover, any tax whose proceeds increase in line with company returns is bound to discourage investment.
column2: 另外，任何税收的递增如果和公司收益联动必定会挫伤投资。

column1: This disincentive disappears if the corporate tax base is decoupled from current profits and linked to some broad measure of activity.
column2: 如果公司税基不与目前的利润挂钩，而是和某些更广泛的衡量标准联系，那么这种挫伤因素就会消失。

column1: Indeed, this would create an incentive for each company to outperform the average, since above-average profits would go untaxed.
column2: 的确，这样就能激励每一家公司都努力增收，超过平均水平，因为超过平均水平部分的利润是免税的。

column1: Another reason to scrap income and move to presumptive taxation of corporate activities stems from the EU’s decentralized nature.
column2: 另一个废止收入税基，转向针对公司经营活动的假定税基的理由来自欧盟分散化的特点。

column1: While taxing the return on capital at the national level could discourage investment, taxing companies in exchange for location advantages might not.
column2: 虽然在国家层面上对资本收益征税可能会挫伤投资，但对公司收税以换取区位优势的做法则可能不会。

column1: Countries that offer world-class infrastructure, high-skill staff, and simple business rules may be well entitled to ask companies to pay a commensurate tax in return.
column2: 提供世界级基础设施、高素质的员工和简明的商务法规的国家可能有资格向公司征收与其营商环境相称的税。

column1: In sum, the EU “federal” corporate tax should be thought of as a benefit tax, based on a broad measure of activity, applied at a moderate rate, and unrelated to current returns; nor should it be deductible from other taxes.
column2: 总之，欧盟的“联邦”公司税应该被看作是一种福利税，它以对广泛的经营行为的度量为基础，采用适中的税率，不与当前收益挂钩；它也不应该从其他税收中扣除。

column1: Among the various options under consideration, the value-added tax base – perhaps averaged over a number of years – looks best, since the accounting and tax-assessment infrastructures already exist.
column2: 在考虑中的各种不同方案里，增值税基—可能在过去若干年里表现平平—似乎是最佳方案。 因为它的会计���税收评估基本框架已经到位了。

column1: Of course, value-added includes profits, and to this extent the incentive for companies to manipulate transfer prices may reappear.
column2: 当然，增加值中包括利润，在这一程度上，公司操纵交易价格的动机可能还会出现。

column1: But the incentive would be much weakened, because gross returns typically represent a fairly small share of total value-added.
column2: 但这一动机会被极大弱化，因为毛利润通常只代表着全部增加值中的较小一部分。

column1: This model leaves the assessment and administration of corporate taxes entirely in the hands of member states, and would not require harmonization of legal and accounting rules.
column2: 这一模式将公司税的评估和管理完全交到各成员国手中，并且也不需要法律和会计规则的协调。

column1: It would be transparent, simple, and easy to administer.
column2: 它将会是透明、简单和易于管理的。

column1: The gigantic apparatus for managing transfer prices and tax credit claims with foreign tax authorities could be dismantled.
column2: 如此一来，管理交易价格和国外课税扣除申报的庞大机构也可以撤销了。

column1: Indeed, the only losers would be Europe’s outsized army of tax lawyers and accountants.
column2: 的确，如果实施该税制，唯一的输家将会是欧洲过于庞大的税务律师和会计队伍。

column1: What do Arabs Want?
column2: 阿拉伯人想要什么？

column1: CAIRO – The self-immolation a year ago of Tunisian street vendor Mohammed Bouazizi triggered a wave of popular protests that spread across the Arab world, forcing out dictators in Egypt, Libya, and Yemen.
column2: 开罗 — — 一年前，突尼斯街头小贩穆罕默德•布瓦吉吉自杀引发了一系列深得人心的抗议活动，席卷了阿拉伯世界，迫使埃及、利比亚和也门的独裁者下台。

column1: Now, Syrian President Bashar al-Assad, too, seems near the end of his rule.
column2: 目前，叙利亚总统巴沙尔•阿萨德的统治似乎也接近尾声了。

column1: Together, these movements for change have come to be known as the Arab Spring.
column2: 这些求变的运动统称为“阿拉伯之春 ” 。

column1: But what values are driving these movements, and what kind of change do their adherents want?
column2: 但是什么价值观推动着这些运动，它们的追随者想要什么样的变革？

column1: A series of surveys in the Arab world last summer highlights some significant shifts in public opinion.
column2: 去年夏天在阿拉伯世界开展的一系列调查凸显出了民意方面的一些重要变化。

column1: In surveys, 84% of Egyptians and 66% of Lebanese regarded democracy and economic prosperity as the Arab Spring’s goal.
column2: 在调查中，84%的埃及人和66%的黎巴嫩人认为民主和经济繁荣是阿拉伯之春的目标。

column1: In both countries, only about 9% believed that these movements aimed to establish an Islamic government.
column2: 在这两个国家，只有约9%的人认为这些运动旨在建立伊斯兰政府。

column1: For Egypt, Iraq, and Saudi Arabia, where trend data are available, the Arab Spring reflected a significant shift in people’s values concerning national identity.
column2: 埃及、伊拉克和沙特阿拉伯有趋势数据，阿拉伯之春反映出人们在国家认同感的价值观方面发生了巨大转变。

column1: In 2001, only 8% of Egyptians defined themselves as Egyptians above all, while 81% defined themselves as Muslims.
column2: 2001年，最重要的是，只有8%的人自认为是埃及人，81%的人自认为是穆斯林人。

column1: In 2007, the results were roughly the same.
column2: 2007年，结果基本相同。

column1: In the wake of the Arab Spring, however, these numbers changed dramatically: those defining themselves as Egyptians rose to 50%, 2% more than those who defined themselves as Muslims. Among Iraqis, primary self-identification in national terms jumped from 23% of respondents in 2004 to 57% in 2011.
column2: 然而，阿拉伯之春之后，这些数字发生了巨大的变化：自认为是埃及人的数量上升到了50 % ， 比自认为是穆斯林人的数量多2 % 。 在伊拉克人中，主要自认为是伊拉克人的数量占到了2004年回复者中的23 % ， 2011年飙升到了57 % 。

column1: Among Saudis, the figure jumped from 17% in 2003 to 46% in 2011, while the share of those claiming a primary Muslim identity dropped from 75% to 44%.
column2: 在沙特阿拉伯人中，这一数据从2003年的17%蹿升至2011年的46 % ， 而主要自认为是穆斯林人的比重从75%下降到了44 % 。

column1: There has also been a shift toward secular politics and weakening support for sharia (Islamic religious law).
column2: 还在向世俗政治转变，伊斯兰教法的支持率也越来越低。

column1: Among Iraqis, the percentage of those who agreed that Iraq would be a better place if religion and politics were separated increased from 50% in 2004 to almost 70% in 2011.
column2: 在伊拉克人中，认为如果政教分离，伊拉克将更好的人的比例从2004年的50%上升到了2011年的近70 % 。

column1: Similar data are not available for Egypt and Saudi Arabia, but both countries show a decline in support for sharia.
column2: 埃及和沙特阿拉伯没有类似的数据可以利用，但是在这两个国家，伊斯兰教法的支持率有所降低。

column1: In Egypt, those considering it “very important” for government to implement sharia declined from 48% in 2001 to 28% in 2011.
column2: 在埃及，认为政府实行伊斯兰教法“非常重要”的人从2001年的48%下降到了2011年的28 % 。

column1: For Saudis, the figure fell from 69% in 2003 to 31% in 2011.
column2: 在沙特阿拉伯人中，这一数据从2003年的69%下降到了2011年的31 % 。

column1: Finally, an analysis of a nationally representative sample of 3,500 Egyptian adults, who rated their participation in the anti-Mubarak movement, showed that participants were more likely to be younger single males with higher socioeconomic status, users of the Internet, newspaper readers, urban residents, and believers in modern values and free will.
column2: 3500名埃及成年人（他们参加了反穆巴拉克运动）组成了具有全国代表性的样本。 最后，对这份样本的分析表明，参与者更有可能是社会经济地位较高的较年轻单身男性、互联网用户、新闻报纸的读者、城市居民以及现代价值观和自由意志的信奉者。

column1: They did not mind having Americans, British, or French as neighbors.
column2: 他们不介意与美国人、英国人和法国人做邻居。

column1: Religiosity did not predict participation, while religious intolerance reduced participation.
column2: 宗教狂热无法预测参与度，但是宗教的不宽容会降低参与度。

column1: These figures seem at odds with the results of Egypt’s recent parliamentary election, in which the Muslim Brothers and the Salafi fundamentalists together gained about 65% of the popular vote.
column2: 这些数据似乎与埃及最近的议会选举结果矛盾，在这次议会选举中，穆斯林兄弟会和萨里发原教旨主义者共获得了约65%的大众选票。

column1: It remains true that religion is an important factor for Egyptian voters, as 66% of those surveyed “strongly agree” or “agree” that it would be better if people with strong religious belief held public office; and 57% consider a government’s implementation of sharia “very important” or “important.”
column2: 对于埃及选民来说，宗教是一个至关重要的因素，这仍然是事实。 66%的受调查者“非常同意”或“同意 ” ， 如果具有强烈宗教信仰的人执政，该国将更美好；57%的人认为政府实行伊斯兰教法“非常重要”或“重要 ” 。

column1: Nonetheless, nationalism trumps religion.
column2: 尽管如此，民族主义战胜了宗教。

column1: Fully 78% agreed with the statement that it would be better if more people with a strong commitment to national interests rather than with strong religious views held public office.
column2: 整整78%的人认同如下看法：如果有更多坚定致力于国家利益而不是带有强烈宗教色彩看问题的人执政，该国家将更美好。

column1: How, then, to explain the inconsistency between the survey data and Egypt’s election results?
column2: 那么，如何解释调查数据和埃及选举结果之间的不一致性呢？

column1: First, the fundamentalists benefited from years of political organizing and activism, and thus were better able to mobilize their supporters, whereas the liberals, who led the uprising against the former regime, lacked nationwide organization and had little time to translate their newly acquired political capital into votes.
column2: 首先，原教旨主义者从多年的政治组织和活动中受益，因此能够更好地动员其支持者，而领导起义对抗前政权的自由主义者缺少全国性的组织，也没有什么时间将刚刚获得的政治资本转化成选票。

column1: Second, the liberals’ priorities were misplaced.
column2: 其次，自由主义者的优先任务有问题。

column1: Instead of pushing their agenda forward among Egyptians, they focused on the wrong enemy, spending invaluable time organizing rallies against the army.
column2: 他们没有在埃及人中推行其议程，而是把主要精力花在了错误敌人的身上，组织集会反对军队，白白浪费了时间。

column1: Finally, the election outcome is not as bad as it appears.
column2: 最后，选举结果并没有其看上去那么糟糕。

column1: Liberalism has been under continuous attack for decades from religious extremists and religious institutions, and liberal organizations were stifled by oppressive rules.
column2: 几十年来，自由主义受到宗教极端分子和宗教机构的不断攻击，自由组织也受到了压迫性法规的限制。

column1: If the Mubarak regime had fallen under the banner of political Islam, Muslim fundamentalists would have been in a much better position to advance more exclusivist claims over the revolution and the country.
column2: 如果穆巴拉克政权在政治性伊斯兰教的旗帜下垮台，穆斯林原教旨主义者将处于更加有利的位置，对这次革命和国家获得控制权，更加地排外。

column1: But it was the liberals who delivered Egypt from authoritarianism.
column2: 但是让埃及摆脱专制统治的是自由主义者。

column1: This, in turn, brought legitimacy to liberalism and generated the powerful feeling of nationalist awareness among Egyptians.
column2: 这反过来给自由主义带来了合法性，唤醒了埃及人强烈的民族意识。

column1: As a result, support for sharia declined and national identity soared.
column2: 因此，伊斯兰教法的支持率下降，国家认同感增强了。

column1: Insofar as political discourse is focused on national rebuilding and freedom, Islamic fundamentalists, in Egypt and elsewhere, will face an uphill battle.
column2: 一定程度上，由于政治论调大多是国家重建和自由，埃及以及其他地方的伊斯兰原教旨主义者将面临一场艰难的战斗。

column1: What do Egypt’s Generals Want?
column2: 埃及的将军想要什么？

column1: CAIRO – “Whatever the majority in the People’s Assembly, they are very welcome, because they won’t have the ability to impose anything that the people don’t want.”
column2: 开罗 — — “无论哪个党派在议会获得了绝大多数，他们都是受人欢迎的，因为他们无法实施任何人民不愿意实施的措施 。 ”

column1: Thus declared General Mukhtar al-Mulla, a member of Egypt’s ruling Supreme Council of the Armed Forces (SCAF).
column2: 埃及最高军事委员会委员穆赫塔尔•阿尔•穆拉将军宣布道。

column1: Al-Mulla’s message was that the Islamists’ victory in Egypt’s recent election gives them neither executive power nor control of the framing of a new constitution.
column2: 阿尔•穆拉的意思是，虽然伊斯兰主义者在埃及最近的选举中获胜，但是他们既不能获得行政权也无法控制新宪法的形成。

column1: But General Sami Anan, Chief of Staff and the SCAF’s deputy head, quickly countered that al-Mulla’s statement does not necessarily represent the official views of the Council.
column2: 但是参谋长兼最高军事委员会副委员长萨米•阿南将军立即反驳说，阿尔•穆拉的观点并不代表该委员会的官方观点。

column1: So, one year after the revolution that overthrew Hosni Mubarak, who, exactly, will set Egypt’s political direction?
column2: 革命推翻胡斯尼•穆巴拉克一年后，到底谁将确定埃及的政治方向？

column1: The electoral victory of the Muslim Brotherhood’s political wing and the Salafi parties, which together won more than 70% of the parliamentary seats, will give them strong influence over the transitional period and in drafting the constitution.
column2: 穆斯林兄弟会的政治派和萨拉菲各派在选举中获胜，总共获得了议会中70%的席位，这将在过渡阶段给予他们强大的影响力并制定宪法。

column1: But they are not alone.
column2: 但是并不是只有他们。

column1: Aside from the Islamists, two other powerful actors will have their say: the “Tahrirists” and the generals.
column2: 除了伊斯兰主义者，还有两个强大的参与者有发言权：解放广场的抗议者和将军们。

column1: Tahrir Square-based activism has not only brought about social and political change, but also has served as the ultimate tool of pro-democracy pressure on Egypt’s military rulers.
column2: 以解放广场为基地的活动不仅引发了社会和政治变革，最后还迫使埃及军方领导人支持民主。

column1: Indeed, while the army, the most powerful of the three actors, still officially controls the country, there is little confidence in the generals’ commitment to democracy.
column2: 实际上，三个参与者中，军队最强大，还正式控制着这个国家，人们几乎不相信将军们会致力于民主。

column1: “The SCAF are either anti-democratic….or some of their advisers told them that democracy is not in their best interest,” says Hazem Abd al-Azim, a nominee in the first post-Mubarak government.
column2: “最高军事委员会不反对民主 … … 但是其中一些顾问告诉他们，民主并不是最符合他们利益的 。 ” 穆巴拉克政府倒台后首次选举的候选人哈齐姆•阿卜德•阿尔•阿齐姆说。

column1: If the generals do not want democracy, nor do they want direct military rule à la Augusto Pinochet.
column2: 如果将军们不想要民主，他们也不想通过军队直接统治国家。

column1: So, what do they want?
column2: 那么，他们想要什么？

column1: Ideally, they would like to combine the Algerian army’s current power and the Turkish army’s legitimacy.
column2: 在理想的情况下，他们想融合阿尔及利亚军队当前的权力和土耳其军队的合法性。

column1: This implies a parliament with limited powers, a weak presidency subordinate to the army, and constitutional prerogatives that legitimate the army’s intervention in politics.
column2: 这意味着议会的权力有限，软弱的总统受制于于军队，军队享有宪法的特权，能够干预政治事务。

column1: The minimum that they insist on is reflected in statements by Generals al-Mulla, Mamdouh Shahim, Ismail Etman, and others. That would mean a veto in high politics, independence for the army’s budget and vast economic empire, legal immunity from prosecution on charges stemming from corruption or repression, and constitutional prerogatives to guarantee these arrangements.
column2: 阿尔•穆拉、马姆杜•沙希姆和伊斯梅尔•伊特曼等将军的声明反映了他们坚持的底线，即在重要政治问题上享有否决权、军队预算和大量的财政收入独立、享有腐败或镇压指控豁免权、享有宪法特权确保这些权益。

column1: The new parliament and constitutional assembly will have to lead the negotiations with the SCAF.
column2: 新国会和宪法议会必须与最高军事委员会谈判。

column1: But, given that any successful democratic transition must include meaningful civilian control over the armed forces and the security apparatus, the SCAF’s minimum demands could render the process meaningless.
column2: 但是鉴于任何成功的民主转型必须包括文官控制大部分军队和安全机构，最高军事委员会的最低要求可能会使这个过程毫无意义。

column1: The veto in high politics would include any issues that touch on national security or sensitive foreign policy, most importantly the relationship with Israel.
column2: 在重要问题上享有否决权意味着在涉及国家安全或敏感外交政策（最重要的是与以色列的关系）等问题时都享有否决权。

column1: With an Islamist majority in the parliament promising to “revise” the peace agreement with Israel, tensions over foreign policy are likely to rise.
column2: 伊斯兰主义者在国会中占大多数预示着要“重新修订”与以色列的和平协议，这样外交政策上的紧张关系很可能出现。

column1: The independent military-commercial empire, which benefits from preferential customs and exchange rates, no taxation, land-confiscation rights, and an army of almost-free laborers (conscripted soldiers), is another thorny issue.
column2: 独立的军事商业帝国又是一个棘手的难题。 它从优惠的关税和汇率、免税、土地没收权和大批几乎免费的劳动力（入伍的士兵）中受益匪浅。

column1: With the Egyptian economy suffering, elected politicians might seek to improve conditions by moving against the military’s civilian assets – namely, by revising the preferential rates and imposing a form of taxation.
column2: 由于埃及的经济萎靡不振，当选的政客可能会试图通过应付军队的民用资产 — — 具体点说就是修订优惠税率并采用新税收形式 — — 来改善经济状况。

column1: Immunity from prosecution is no less salient.
column2: 免受指控也很引人注目。

column1: “The Field-Marshal should be in jail now,” screamed the elected leftist MP, Abu Ezz al-Hariri, on the second day of the new parliamentary session.
column2: 当选的左翼议员阿布•伊兹•阿尔•哈里利在新国会选举的第二天喊道 ： “ 陆军元帅现在应该关在监狱了 。 ”

column1: When Mahmoud Ghozlan, the Muslim Brotherhood spokesperson, proposed immunity (known in Egypt as the “safe-exit” option), he faced a wave of harsh criticism.
column2: 当穆斯林兄弟会的发言人马哈茂德•戈兹朗提议豁免权（在埃及称为“安全脱身”的选择）时，他受到��严厉的批评。

column1: Pressure from the United States has also influenced the SCAF’s decision-making.
column2: 美国的压力也影响了最高军事委员会的决策。 “埃及军方接受了美国13亿美元的资助 … … 他们很重视美国的要求 。 ”

column1: “The military establishment receives $1.3 billion from the US….They are very sensitive to US requests,” according to Saad Eddin Ibrahim, who lobbied the Obama administration to support the revolution in January 2011.
column2: 萨德•埃丁•易卜拉欣说。 2011年1月，他曾游说奥巴马政府支持革命。

column1: But most of the SCAF’s pro-democracy decisions have come as a result of massive pressure from Tahrir Square.
column2: 但是最高军事委员会大多数支持民主的决定都是解放广场抗议者大力施压的结果。

column1: This includes the removal of Mubarak, his trial (and that of other regime figures), and bringing forward the presidential election from 2013 to June 2012.
column2: 其中包括推翻穆巴拉克政府、庭审穆巴拉克（以及其他穆巴拉克政府的官员）和将总统大选从2013年提前到2012年6月。

column1: Two other factors are equally, if not more, influential: the status quo inherited from the Mubarak era and the army’s internal cohesion.
column2: 如果不是更加具有影响力的话，另外两个因素至少具有相同的影响力：从穆巴拉克时代继承下来的现状和军队内部的凝聚力。

column1: With few exceptions, the SCAF’s members benefited significantly from Mubarak’s regime.
column2: 几乎没有什么特例，最高军事委员会的委员都从穆巴拉克政府中受益匪浅。

column1: They will attempt to preserve as much of it as possible.
column2: 他们将竭尽全力保住尽可能多的利益。

column1: “The sight of officers in uniform protesting in Tahrir Square and speaking on Al Jazeera really worries the Field Marshal,” a former officer told me.
column2: “在解放广场抗议并在阿拉伯半岛新闻电视台讲话的军人实际上是担心陆军统帅 ， ” 一位前官员对我说。

column1: And one way to maintain internal cohesion is to create “demons” – a lesson learned from the “dirty wars” in Algeria in the 1990’s and Argentina in the 1970’s and 1980’s.
column2: 保持内部凝聚力的一种方法是创造“恶魔 ” — —这是从二十世纪九十年代阿尔及利亚和二十世纪七八十年代阿根廷的“肮脏战争”中学来的。

column1: In particular, Coptic protesters are an easy target against which to rally soldiers and officers.
column2: 科普特的抗议者特别容易成为士兵和军官整治的目标。

column1: Last October, amid an unnecessary escalation of sectarian violence, state-owned television featured a hospitalized Egyptian soldier screaming, “The Copts killed my colleague!”
column2: 去年10月份，在不必要的宗派暴力升级过程中，国有电视特别报道一位住院的埃及士兵喊道 ， “ 科普特人杀了我的同事 ！ ”

column1: The systematic demonization of the Tahririst groups, and the violent escalation that followed in November and December, served the same purpose.
column2: 有系统地妖魔化解放广场上的抗议者以及11月和12月的暴力升级都是为了达到相同的目的。

column1: Despite everything, democratic Egypt is not a romantic fantasy.
column2: 尽管如此，埃及实现民主并不是不切实际的。

column1: A year ago, Saad al-Ketatni, the Muslim Brotherhood leader, would never have dreamed of being Speaker of Parliament.
column2: 一年前，穆斯林兄弟会的领袖萨德•阿尔•卡塔尼根本不会想到自己会当上国会的发言人。

column1: The same applies to the leftists and liberals who now hold around 20% of the parliament’s seats.
column2: 左翼人士和自由人士也不会想到，他们现在竟然占到了国会大约20%的席位。

column1: If 2011 witnessed the miracle of Mubarak’s removal, a brave parliament’s institutional assertiveness, coupled with non-institutional Tahririst pressure, could force the generals to accept a transfer of power to civilian rule (with some reserved domains for the army establishment) in 2012. What is certain is that this year will not witness a return to the conditions of 2010.
column2: 如果2011年见证了穆巴拉克下台的奇迹，2012年将见证勇敢的国会机制力量和解放广场抗议者压力的非机制力量迫使将军们接受向文官统治转变（军方在一些领域将保有权力 ） 。

column1: Egypt may become stuck in democratization’s slow lane, but there will be no U-turn.
column2: 埃及可能在民主的慢车道上前行，但是不会倒退。

column1: The hundreds of thousands who marched to Tahrir Square on the revolution’s anniversary will guarantee that.
column2: 成千上万的人到解放广场游行纪念革命一周年将保证这种趋势。

column1: What Do Muslim Women Want?
column2: 穆斯林女性究竟要什么？

column1: NEW YORK – When caricature takes the place of dialogue, everyone suffers – especially when it comes to understanding issues affecting women, who struggle worldwide against being silenced.
column2: 发自纽约 — — 当鹦鹉学舌取代了沟通对话，所有人都深受其害 — — 尤其是当话题关乎如何理解全世界反抗压制的女性之时。

column1: Some right-wing American bloggers recently twisted an article that I wrote in a way that did just that.
column2: 但就在最近，一些美国右翼博客写手却曲解了我的一篇有关女性的文章，所用伎俩恰如我在文章开头写的那样。

column1: I wrote that many women activists in Muslim countries tend to emphasize issues such as honor killings, legal inequality, and lack of access to education, and that they express frustration that the obsession among Westerners with Muslim women’s clothing can come at the expense of these concerns.
column2: 我在那篇文章中写到，许多穆斯林国家的女性活动家希望将一些诸如“荣誉谋杀 ” 、 法律不平等和缺乏受教育机会的问题重点展现给世人，但她们同时也对西方人总把对穆斯林女性穿着的迷思凌驾于这些问题之上感到困惑不满。

column1: I also pointed out that many Muslim feminists defend their dress in terms of nationalism, anti-imperialism, or as a matter of faith.
column2: 我还指出，许多穆斯林女权主义者维护她们的穿着方式，目的是捍卫她们的民族主义，反帝国主义理念，或者就是一个信仰问题。

column1: This provoked a small firestorm of distortion in the West: “Wolf Wants to Institutionalize the Burka,” etc.
column2: 但上述呼声却在西方掀起了一股歪曲我本意、所谓“沃尔夫想将布卡（穆斯林女性传统服装）合理化”的风暴。

column1: It was depressing to see a simple appeal for Westerners to listen to Muslim women deliberately distorted into a representation of all Muslim women as meek, will-less beings in need of rescue.
column2: 而令人沮丧的是：我仅仅是在呼吁西方人倾听穆斯林女性的心声，却被故意歪曲成某种象征，似乎所有穆斯林女性都是些急待拯救的，驯服而缺乏意志的小动物。

column1: I was so sure that Muslim women should be allowed to speak for themselves because of the faces of Muslim feminism I encountered in recent travels – notably in Jordan, a country fascinatingly poised between tradition and innovation, developing under a forward-looking monarchy that is seeking to modernize and, to an extent, democratize. For those Westerners who worry about Islamic fundamentalism in the Arab world, surely Jordan is a worthy model to understand, support, and engage.
column2: 而我之所以对穆斯林女性应拥有为自己说话的权利如此肯定，是缘自于我在最近旅行中遇到的几位穆斯林女权主义者 — — 尤其是在约旦这个在传统与创新中取得完美平衡，并在高瞻远瞩的君主政体领导下走向现代化以及在某种程度上的民主化的国度。 对于那些担忧阿拉伯世界原教旨主义的西方人来说，约旦无疑是一个值得我们理解、支持和加强交往的典型。

column1: The women leaders I met in Amman were not saying, “Please tell the West to save us.” They were too busy making egalitarian, modernist new worlds of their own, with an Arab, and often Islamic, imprimatur.
column2: 我在约旦首都阿曼遇到的那些女领导人并没有跟我说 ， “ 请转告西方世界快来拯救我们 ” ， 因为她们正忙于缔造属于自己的平等和现代主义新世界，并获得了阿拉伯世界甚至时常来自伊斯兰教的认可。

column1: Princess Rym Ali, sister-in-law of Queen Rania – the Chanel-wearing media star who is rebranding a more contemporary Jordan – is one vivid example; Princess Rym is making immense progress in a more behind-the-scenes way.
column2: 约旦王后拉尼娅是一位身着香奈尔时装的媒体宠儿，并且正致力将约旦重塑成为一个更加现代化的崭新国家。 而其妯娌丽姆·阿里王妃则更是一位生动的典范；作为王妃，她本人喜欢在幕后做出自己的巨大贡献。

column1: She met me in a leafy Amman suburb, in the palace that she shares with Prince Ali and their small children.
column2: 她与我在阿曼郊外一处树木葱郁的宫殿会面，这是她和阿里王子以及年幼的孩子们共同生活的地方。

column1: A former CNN journalist, her quiet bearing and diplomatic manner belie her courage: she captured her husband’s heart as she was reporting from Baghdad on the eve of “shock and awe,” standing firm before the cameras even as the bombs were falling.
column2: 作为一名前CNN记者，丽姆王妃娴静的举止和出色的外交辞令掩盖了她的过人勇气：在美军对伊拉克发动“震撼与威慑”行动前夕，在巴格达的丽姆即便在炸弹乱飞之时依然牢牢站在摄像机面前进行现场报道，并以此俘虏了阿里王子的心。

column1: Princess Rym and Prince Ali have supported a new film institute, the Red Sea Institute of Cinematic Arts, a joint production with the University of Southern California that is bringing together bright young people from all over the Middle East to learn contemporary filmmaking, apprentice with international film productions, and get the region’s stories out.
column2: 最近在丽姆王妃与阿里王子的支持下，约旦与南加州大学合作创建了红海电影艺术学院。 学院聚集了来自整个中东的青年才俊，师从国际电影出版公司学习制作现代电影制作，并讲述中东自己的故事。

column1: Though she can no longer practice journalism directly, Princess Rym is also co-founding new Jordanian journalism school. Her aim is to replace journalists’ acceptance of the “party line” – even if the party is her own extended family – with a more critical perspective.
column2: 而尽管王妃本人已经不能继续从事新闻事业，她仍然参与合作创建了新的约旦记者学校 — — 目的是让记者们不再做“党派路线”的跟风者 — — 即使这个政党就是她王室家庭的延伸 — — 并具备批判性的判断力。

column1: She directed my attention to Jordanian-made films about the subordination of women inside the home, and to Rana Husseini’s powerful book on honor killings, Murder in the Name of Honor .
column2: 她把我的注意力引向多部约旦制作，讲述妇女家庭从属地位的电影，以及一本有关“荣誉谋杀”的大作 — — 由拉娜·胡赛因撰写的《谋杀：以荣誉的名义 》 。

column1: But her implicit message was that these critical examinations of women’s inequality in the Arab world are most enlightening when they are created by women’s advocates from within that culture, rather than sensationalized or superficial versions of the problem created in the West.
column2: 而她的言下之意则是，这些对于阿拉伯世界里女性不平等现象的严厉拷问，来自阿拉伯文化内部妇女的呼声要比耸人听闻或肤浅无比的“西方制造”版本更加发人深省。

column1: Mary Nazzal, owner, with her family, of a chic and bustling boutique hotel, is another dynamo who looks as if she stepped out of a fashion shoot.
column2: 还有一位就是玛丽·纳扎尔，作为一座时髦而受欢迎的精品酒店的家族所有人，她也是一位精力充沛，仿佛刚从时尚大片中走出来的女性。

column1: But it would be a mistake to underestimate her seriousness. I call her “Martha Stewart meets Che Guevara,” because, when not renovating the elegant public spaces of her hotel, she is suing Israeli generals for war crimes that she claims were committed against civilians in Gaza.
column2: 但不能因此低估她的严肃认真态度：我把纳扎尔称为“玛莎·史都华+切·格瓦拉”式的女性，因为当纳��尔不在酒店里修整那些优雅的公共空间时，她正在国际刑事法院当庭控告以色列将军们对加沙平民所犯下的战争罪行。

column1: Nazzal was trained as a British barrister, and chairs the board of the Human Rights Legal Aid Fund.
column2: 纳扎尔接受过英国高级律师的教育，并且是“人权法律援助信托基金”的董事会主席。

column1: Her organization is intent on using international law to hold accountable members of the Israeli military who put civilians in harm’s way during the invasion of Gaza – events that the recent Goldstone Report confirms.
column2: 该组织的宗旨就是用国际法制裁那些在入侵加沙行动中对平民伤害事件负有责任的以色列军方成员，而这些暴行都是得到联合国调查小组发布的《戈德斯通报道》确认的。

column1: She is passionate about the Palestinian cause, mixing her cutting-edge legal advocacy with a willingness to listen to decent people from all sides of the conflict, and a fierce attachment to peace in the region based on due process and justice.
column2: 纳扎尔对于巴勒斯坦的案例非常积极，她把自己顶尖的法律辩护能力与听取冲突各方正直人士意见的意愿糅合在一起，并热切相信遵循法律程序和公正的审判将能够在地区内建立和平。

column1: Finally there is Rana Husseini herself – a role model for investigative reporters everywhere who began documenting and investigating honor killings in her newspaper, The Jordan Times .
column2: 最后一位女性则是拉娜·胡赛因本人 — — 世界各地调查记者的模范典型。 拉娜在她供职的《约旦时报》中首先记录并调查“荣誉谋杀”的问题。

column1: Honor killings claim an estimated 5,000 women every year, and are increasingly common in immigrant communities abroad.
column2: 据她估计，每年约有5000名女性被“荣誉谋杀”夺去生命，同时在海外移民社区里的死亡人数也有所增加。

column1: According to her account, a woman can be killed for “laughing at a joke in the street, wearing makeup or a short skirt…or being raped by a brother.”
column2: 按照拉娜的解释，一个女人因类似“在大街上被逗笑，化妆，身着短裙 ” ， 或者“被某个兄弟强奸”的理由就能被置于死地！

column1: After she began her series of reports, Husseini received death threats at her office almost daily – as well as hundreds of letters of support from readers.
column2: 自从拉娜展开一系列报道后，她的办公室几乎每天都收到死亡威胁，但同时也收到了成千上百封读者的支持信。

column1: As a result of her brave investigations, which included interviews in prisons, many Muslim countries are revising their criminal codes, and the issue has taken center stage internationally.
column2: 作为她勇敢调查的回报（这些调查甚至包括对狱中女性的采访 ） ， 许多穆斯林国家正在修订刑法，而这个话题也成为国际关注的中心。

column1: These women are exactly the kind of leaders that everyone should be cultivating and supporting, rather than overlooking because of a belief that they cannot exist in the Middle East.
column2: 这些女性正是我们每个人都应该加以培养和支持的领袖人士，而不是用“中东根本不存在这样的女性”的谬论来忽略她们。

column1: We would do better to find out more about them than to waste our time on superficial debates about how they – and many others who are just as accomplished – should dress.
column2: 这样我们才能更好的了解她们，而不是把时间都浪费在聒噪地争论这些女性，以及千千万万个同她们一样卓有成就的穆斯林女性应该如何穿着上。

column1: What Euro Crisis?
column2: 什么是欧元危机？

column1: FRANKFURT – What constitutes a crisis?
column2: 法兰克福 — — 危机的构成要素是什么？

column1: Is it sustained economic decline, high and long-term unemployment, poverty, rampant inflation, a precipitous fall in the exchange rate, fiscal deficits, high borrowing costs, and political dysfunction?
column2: 是经济的持续衰退、长期的高失业率、贫困、恶性通货膨胀、汇率的急剧下降、财政赤字、借贷成本高、还是政治问题？

column1: Most would agree that a crisis exists if just some of these “misery indices” are present.
column2: 大部分人都认为，如果此类“痛苦指数”中的某些问题出现，就会引发危机。

column1: But, while Europe is widely perceived to be in the grip of crisis, only a handful of them are present, and in only a few eurozone countries.
column2: 然而，虽然普遍认为欧洲正面临危机，但欧洲只是存在少数几个问题，而且此危机只存在于几个欧元区国家。

column1: So, why is there a eurozone crisis, and what defines it?
column2: 那么，欧元区为什么会出现经济危机呢？

column1: Time and again, it is argued that the single currency does not fit the different needs of its member countries, and that unsustainable economic divergence will ultimately require that the euro be abandoned.
column2: 该危机又是如何界定的呢？ 人们屡次争辩称，单一货币不符合各成员国迥然各异的需求，而且非持续性经济分歧最终将要求欧元区放弃欧元。
