column2: 因此，随着气候的变化，较小的营养水平上升和鱼类数量下降也会触发珊瑚礁转换为海藻世界。

column1: Thresholds also occur in social systems: think of fads or, more seriously, riot behavior in crowds.
column2: 社会系统也存在阈值：比如时尚或者更严重的群体暴动。

column1: In business, the debt/income ratio is a well-known threshold, one that can move in step with exchange rates.
column2: 在商业领域，债务/收入比率是一个广为人知的阈值，会随着汇率的变化而变化。

column1: Threshold effects have also been identified in labor supply, transport services, and other determinants of companies’ well-being.
column2: 阈值效应还可以存在于劳动力供给、通勤服务和其他公司福利决定因素上。

column1: Given the importance of threshold effects, how can a system’s resilience be maintained?
column2: 既然阈值效应如此重要，系统如何保持其恢复力呢？

column1: For starters, making a system very resilient in one way can cause it to lose resilience in other ways.
column2: 首先，让一个系统在某一方面具有超强恢复力会导致它其他方面失去恢复力。

column1: So we have to understand and enhance general resilience – a system’s capacity to cope with a variety of shocks, in all aspects of its functioning.
column2: 因此我们必须理解并增强总体恢复力 — — 系统应对各种 — — 全方位影响其运转的 — — 冲击的能力。

column1: From research on a variety of systems, the following attributes have been shown to confer general resilience:
column2: 从关于各种系统的研究中我们得出，下列因素决定着总体回复力：

column1: · A high degree of diversity, especially response diversity (different ways of doing the same thing, often mistakenly thought of as “redundancy”).
column2: · 高度的多样性，特别是反应多样性（用不同的方法做同一件事，常被误解为“冗余性 ” ） 。

column1: · A relatively modular structure that does not over-connect its components.
column2: · 相对模块化的结构，各成分之间不会过度连接。

column1: · A strong capacity to respond quickly to change.
column2: · 强大的快速响应变化的能力。

column1: · Significant “openness,” allowing emigration and immigration of all components (closed systems remain static).
column2: · 高度“开放 ” ， 各组成成分可流进流出（封闭系统是静态的 ） 。

column1: · Maintenance of adequate reserves – for example, seed banks in ecosystems or memory in social systems (which speaks against just-in-time supply services).
column2: · 维持重组的储备 — — 比如生态系统中的种子银行和社会系统中的记忆（与即时供给服务相对 ） 。

column1: · Encouragement of innovation and creativity.
column2: · 鼓励创新和创造力。

column1: · High social capital, particularly trust, leadership, and social networks.
column2: · 高度的社会资本，特别是信任、领导力和社交网络。

column1: · Adaptive governance (flexible, distributive, and learning-based).
column2: · 适应性治理（灵活、分布式且以学习为基础 ） 。

column1: These attributes comprise the essentials of a resilient system.
column2: 这些因素构成了高恢复力系统的基础。

column1: But resilience itself is neither “good” nor “bad.”
column2: 但恢复力本身没有“好 ” “ 坏”可言。

column1: Undesirable systems, such as dictatorships and saline landscapes, can be very resilient.
column2: 不良的系统 — — 比如独裁和盐碱地 — — 可能恢复力很强。

column1: In these cases, the system’s resilience should be reduced.
column2: 在这些例��中，系统恢复力应该被削弱。

column1: Moreover, it is impossible to understand or manage a system’s resilience at only one scale.
column2: 此外，不可能在一个规模水平上理解和管理一个系统的恢复力。

column1: At least three must be included – the focal scale and at least one below and one above – for cross-scale connections most often determine a system’s longer-term resilience.
column2: 至少需要包括三个规模水平 — — 核心规模和及其上下各一个规模 — — 跨规模联系是最普遍的决定系统长期恢复力的因素。

column1: Most losses in resilience are unintended consequences of narrowly focused optimization (like an “efficiency” drive) that fails to recognize feedback effects on the focal scale that stem from changes produced by such optimization at another scale.
column2: 大部分恢复力损失来自狭隘优化的意外后果（比如追求“效率 ” ） ，此类优化无法识别来自另一规模的这类优化所造成的变化引起的对核心规模的反馈效应。

column1: Resilience should not be confused with resistance to change.
column2: 恢复力不能和变化抵抗力混淆。

column1: On the contrary, trying to prevent change and disturbance to a system reduces its resilience.
column2: 相反，试图阻止对某系统的变化和干扰会降低其恢复力。

column1: A forest that never burns eventually loses species capable of withstanding fire.
column2: 从不着火的森林最终会失去能抵御火灾的物种。

column1: Children who are prevented from playing in dirt grow up with compromised immune systems.
column2: 被禁止玩泥巴的儿童长大后免疫系统功能偏低。

column1: Building and maintaining resilience requires probing its boundaries.
column2: 建立和维持恢复力需要探索系统的边界。

column1: If a shift into a “bad” state has already happened, or is inevitable and will be irreversible, the only option is transformation into a different kind of system – a new way of living (and making a living).
column2: 如果向“坏”状态的变化已经发生，或者这一变化不可避免且将不可逆转，那么唯一的选择是变为不同类型的系统 — — 新的生存方式（和谋生之道 ） 。

column1: Transformability and resilience are not opposites.
column2: 可变性和恢复力并不是对立的。

column1: In order for a system to remain resilient at one scale, parts of it at other scales may have to transform.
column2: 一个系统要维持某个规模水平的恢复力，其在其他规模水平上的一些部分就必须变化。

column1: In Australia, for example, the Murray-Darling basin cannot continue as a resilient agricultural region if all parts of it continue doing what they are doing now.
column2: 比如，在澳大利亚，如果穆雷-达令（Murray-Darling）盆地的所有部分继续今天的作为，那么它就不可能继续成为高回复力的农业区。

column1: There simply is not enough water.
column2: 那里没有足够的水。

column1: So some parts of it will have to transform.
column2: 其中一些部分必须变化。

column1: Of course, the need for transformation to create or maintain resilience may also affect the highest scale: If some countries and regions are to remain (or become) resilient social-ecological systems with high human well-being, it may be necessary to transform the global financial system.
column2: 当然，变化从而创造或维持恢复力的需要也可能影响最高规模：如果一些国家和地区要维持（或变成）高恢复力社会-生态系统，与此同时保持人类高福利，那么全球金融系统就必须变化。

column1: Transformation requires getting past denial, creating options for change, and supporting novelty and experimentation.
column2: 变化需要否定部分，创造出变化的选择，并支持创新和实验。

column1: Financial support from higher levels (government) all too often takes the form of help not to change (bailouts of too-big-to-fail banks, for example), rather than help to change.
column2: 来自更高水平（政府）的金融支持总是以有助于不变化的形式出现（比如援助太大而不可倒的银行 ） ， 而不是以有助于变化的形式出现。

column1: Resilience, in short, is largely about learning how to change in order not to be changed.
column2: 简言之，恢复力大体上是关于如何以变化防止被变化的东西。

column1: Certainty is impossible.
column2: 确定性是不存在的。

column1: The point is to build systems that will be safe when they fail, not to try to build fail-safe systems.
column2: 要点是建立倒闭时仍安全的系统，而不是建立不会倒闭的系统。

column1: What is the Deficit Endgame?
column2: 财政赤字何去何从？

column1: REYKJAVIK – No one yet has any real idea about when the global financial crisis will end, but one thing is certain: government budget deficits are headed into the stratosphere.
column2: 雷克亚未克 — — 没有人知道全球金融危机什么时候才会结束。 但有一点是肯定的：政府的财政赤字将达到一个惊人的水平。

column1: Investors in the coming years will need to be persuaded to hold mountains of new debt.
column2: 在接下来的日子里，投资者将被迫购买大量的新发国债。

column1: Although governments may try to cram public debt down the throats of local savers (by using, for example, their rising influence over banks to force them to hold a disproportionate quantity of government paper), they will eventually find themselves having to pay much higher interest rates as well.
column2: 虽然政府可以将债务转嫁到本国储户的头上（例如，政府利用自身的影响力来迫使银行持有大量的国债。 ） ， 但他们最终也会发现，为此会支付利息也是可观的。

column1: Within a couple years, interest rates on long-term US Treasury notes could easily rise 3-4%, with interest rates on other governments’ paper rising as much, or more.
column2: 在接下来的几年中，美国政府长期债券的利率很快就会升到3-4 % ， 其他国家还会更高。

column1: Interest rates will rise to compensate investors both for having to accept a larger share of government bonds in their portfolio and for an increasing risk that governments will be tempted to inflate away the value of their debts, or even default.
column2: 利率的升高主要有来自两个方面：一是补偿对投资人大量持有政府债券。 二是补偿国债通货膨胀后的损失，以及违约偿还的风险。

column1: In research that Carmen Reinhart and I have done on the history of financial crises, we find that public debt typically doubles, even adjusting for inflation, in the three years following a crisis.
column2: 根据我和卡门·莱因哈特对历史发生上的已经金融危机研究后得出的结果：在金融危机发生后的三年中，即使除去通货膨胀的因素，国债也会翻倍。

column1: Many nations, large and small, are now well on the way to meeting this projection.
column2: 现在很多国家都在朝着这个模式发展。

column1: China’s government has clearly indicated that it will use any means necessary to backstop growth in the face of a free fall in exports.
column2: 中国政府明确表示，他们会使用一切手段，阻止出口下滑的趋势。

column1: The Chinese have $2 trillion in hard currency reserves to back up their promise.
column2: 当然，他们有2万亿美元的外汇储备作为保证。

column1: President Barack Obama’s new budget calls for a stunning $1.75 trillion deficit in the United States, a multiple of the previous record.
column2: 美国总统巴拉克·奥巴马最新推出了财政预算，高达1万7千5百亿美元，是以往最高时期的几倍。

column1: Even those countries that are not actively engaged in a fiscal orgy are seeing their surpluses collapse and their deficits soar, mainly in the face of falling tax revenues.
column2: 即使那些没有陷于金融危机的国家也会发现，由于税收所得的下降，外汇储备正在崩溃，财政赤字激增。

column1: Indeed, few governments have submitted remotely realistic budget projections, typically relying on overly rosy economic scenarios.
column2: 实际上，几乎没有政府会提交符合现实的财政预算报告，通常都描述一个过于乐观的 经济前景。

column1: Unfortunately, in 2009, the global economy will not be a bed of roses.
column2: 不幸的是，2009年的经济将不再是“鲜花烂漫 ” 。

column1: Income in the US and euro-area both appear to have declined at an annualized rate of roughly 6% in the fourth quarter of 2008; Japan’s GDP fell at perhaps twice that rate.
column2: 如果按年计算的话，08年的第4季度，美国和欧元区国家财政收入几乎都下滑了6 % ， 日本更惨，可能是上者的两倍。

column1: China’s claim that its GDP grew at a 6% rate, during the end of last year, is suspect.
column2: 中国公布的数字显示，去年底的GDP增长了6 % ， 这个数字令人怀疑。

column1: Exports have collapsed throughout Asia, including Korea, Japan, and Singapore. Arguably India, and to a lesser extent Brazil, have been holding out a bit better.
column2: 在整个亚洲，出口已经开始崩盘，涉及的国家包括韩国，日本和新加坡，印度或许也能算上。 巴西受害的程度低一些，情况会好一点。

column1: But few emerging markets have reached a stage at which they can withstand a sustained collapse in the developed economies, much less serve as substitute engines of global growth.
column2: 但新兴市场的经济发展不可能抗得住来自发达国家那边所承受如此的损失，目前，他们还没有能力带动整个经济走向好转。

column1: With the credit crisis still making it difficult for many small and medium-size businesses to obtain even the minimal level of financing necessary to maintain inventories and conduct trade, global GDP is on a precipice in 2009.
column2: 随着信贷危机的加深，中小企业很难获得贷款，连维持他们日常的存货和运营所需的最低水平资金都没有保证。

column1: There is a real possibility that global growth will register its first contraction since World War II.
column2: 在2009年，全球的GDP已经处于悬崖边上，有可能出现自从二战以后的首次负增长。

column1: In all likelihood, a slew of countries will see output declines of 4-5% in 2009, with some. having true depression level drops, of 10% or more.
column2: 如此说来，2009年许多国家经济会下滑4-5 % ， 一些国家甚至会下降10%甚至更多，进入实际的经济萧条期。

column1: Worse yet, unless financial systems spring back, growth could disappoint for years to come, especially in “ground zero” countries such as the United States, Britain, Ireland and Spain. US long-term growth could be particularly dismal, as the Obama administration steers the country toward more European levels of welfare assistance and income redistribution,
column2: 更为糟糕的是，除非金融系统转好，否则经济的增长会在许多年内都不可能发生，尤其是在“零汇率”的国家，例如美国，英国，爱尔兰和西班牙等。 随着奥巴马的社会福利改革及收入再分配的方案，美国也将会越来越倾向于欧洲的模式，长期的经济形势会变得更糟。

column1: Countries with European-style growth rates could handle debt obligations of 60% of GDP when interest rates were low.
column2: 目前，利率还维持低水平，欧洲模式国家的债务已经占GDP的60 % 。

column1: But, with debts in many countries rising to 80% or 90% of GDP, and with today’s low interest rates clearly a temporary phenomenon, trouble is brewing.
column2: 而对于那些那些债务高达GDP80%甚至90%的国家来说，问题会变的越来越严重。

column1: Many of the countries that are piling on massive quantities of debt to bail out their banks have only tepid medium term growth prospects, raising real questions of solvency and sustainability
column2: 更不用说目前明显偏低利率维持时间不会太长，很多国家为了拯救银行系统已经背负了大量的债务，将来，偿还债务的能力和经济的稳定性也会是个大问题。

column1: Italy, for example with a debt-to-income ratio already exceeding 100%, has been able to manage so far thanks to falling global rates.
column2: 意大利就是一个例子，债务和收入的比例已经超过100 % ， 有幸的是下滑的全球利率，目前还暂时能维持。

column1: But as debts mount, and global interest rates rise, investors will become rightly nervous about the risk of debt restructuring.
column2: 不过随着债务的增加，全球利率的回升，投资者对债务重组的风险也肯定会越来越担心。

column1: Other countries, such as Ireland, Britain, and the US, started with a much stronger fiscal position, but may not be much better off when the smoke clears.
column2: 爱尔兰，英国和美国等国家的经济底子还算厚一些，不过在“警报”解除之前，情况也好不到哪里去。

column1: Exchange rates are another wild card.
column2: 汇率也是一个要考虑的因素。

column1: Asian central banks are still nervously clinging to the dollar. But with the US printing debt and money like it is going out of style, it would appear the euro is set to appreciate against the dollar two or three years down the road, if the euro is still around, that is.
column2: 亚洲国家的中央银行正紧张地盯着美元的汇率，但随着美国增发国债和大量印制钞票，以上的做法看来有些过时。 欧元对美元的汇率在最近两三年内一直在升值，欧洲国家的做法好象看起来更为正确 ， 。

column1: As debt mounts and the recession lingers, we are surely going to see a number of governments trying to lighten their load through financial repression, higher inflation, partial default, or a combinations of all three.
column2: 随着债务的增加和持续的经济萧条，我们相信，越来越多的国家会采取金融紧缩，高通货膨胀以及债务部分免除等三种方法，也可能是以上方法的组合。

column1: Unfortunately, the endgame to the great recession of the 2000’s will not be a pretty picture.
column2: 不幸的是，结束2000年危机的方式将不会是很乐观的。

column1: What is the West?
column2: 西方究竟为何物？

column1: PARIS -- Everyone everywhere has by now heard about the “clash of civilizations.”
column2: 巴黎 - - 世界各地的人们现在都已经听说了所谓的“文明的冲突 ” 。

column1: This Samuel Huntington concept has become universal.
column2: 亨廷顿的这一概念已经家喻户晓。

column1: In the 1950’s, the French economist, Alfred Sauvy had a comparable success with the expression “third world.”
column2: 五十年代，法国经济学家索维创造了“第三世界”一词也同样人人皆知。

column1: One reason these phrases gain wide acceptance is their lack of clear definition.
column2: 这些词语之所以为大众所接受是因为它们定义模糊。

column1: The “clash of civilizations,” basically the West against the rest, is supposed to describe the world as it is.
column2: “文明的冲突”基本上是西方对抗世界其他部分，它本应描述世界的本来面目。

column1: In reality, the West is vague enough to include a vast array of areas without describing their unifying characteristics.
column2: 在现实中，西方是含糊不清的，包括大量领域而并不确定其统一的特征。

column1: So what exactly is West?
column2: 那么究竟为何西方呢？

column1: What does Westernization mean?
column2: 西方化是什么？

column1: Why is Japan considered Western and China not?
column2: 为何认为日本是西方而中国不是？

column1: Where does Shanghai stand?
column2: 上海属于哪里？

column1: Is Russia part of the West?
column2: 俄国是西方的一部分吗？

column1: From these uncertainties, we can conclude that the West is not a geographic entity.
column2: 从这些不确定性中，我们可以得出结论说西方并非一个地理性的实体。

column1: It probably first established itself as a mindset when the Greeks, 25 centuries ago, perceived themselves as Western versus the Oriental Persians.
column2: 希腊人在2500年以前把他们自己视为是与东方波斯人对立的西方。 大概在那个时候西方作为一种心态而建立起来。

column1: Since the West has lost any clear territorial basis since then, the phrase “the West” has become a universal not a local notion.
column2: 由于西方从那时以来已经失去了明确的领土范围 ， “ 西方”一词已经成为普世而非地域概念。

column1: To be Western or Westernized, above all, is a mindset which does not coincide with any continent, nor with any specific nation or religion.
column2: 是否西方首先是一种心态，而这一心态并不与任何大陆吻合，也并不与任何具体国家或地区吻合。

column1: Huntington’s mistake, it seems, was to contain the West inside national borders: there is no map of the West.
column2: 亨廷顿的错误好像在于把西方局限在国家边界之内，而西方并没有边界。

column1: No map can work when some Asian nations are Western (Japan, Taiwan), when non-Western groups (Muslims in Europe) live in supposedly Western countries, when some Eastern countries are partially Westernized and some Western countries (Russia) are not fully Westernized. Eventually it looks easier to define the mental borders of the West than its territorial borders.
column2: 某些亚洲国家(日本和台湾)属于西方，非西方人群(欧洲的穆斯林)生活在本应属于西方的国家，某些东欧国家部分被西方化而某些西方国家(俄国)并没有完全西方化。 在这些情况下，地图是无济于事的。
最终，确定西方的心理边界要比确定领土边界好像更为容易一些。

column1: I believe that the West is a mindset defined by three fundamental traits that cannot easily be found in the so-called Eastern civilizations: a passion for innovation, a capacity for self-criticism, and gender equality.
column2: 我相信西方是一个由三个基本特征确定的心态，在东方文明中不大容易找到这种心态。 这些特征是对创新的热情、自我批评的能力以及性别平等。

column1: ‘What is new?’ -- a personal greeting since the Hellenistic age – captures the essence of the Western mind.
column2: 从古希腊时代以来人们的问候语就是“有什么新消息吗 ” 。 这一句话总结了西方心态的要害。

column1: The non-Westerner, however, would rather place tradition above innovation.
column2: 但是非西方人更加愿意把传统置于创新之上。

column1: But innovation as a fundamental value explains the scientific breakthroughs of the West versus the East. It explains unavoidable conflicts with conservative non-Western societies and it also explains what we should call ‘the Westernization of the West.’
column2: 但是创新作为一种基本价值观可以解释与东方相比西方取得了科学突破。 它也说明西方与传统非西方社会不可避免的冲突，同时也说明了我们应该称作的“西方的西方化 ” 。

column1: The West keeps destroying its own traditions, including its religions. The economist Joseph Schumpeter defined this process as one of “creative destruction.”
column2: 西方不断破坏自身的传统，包括其宗教。 经济学家熊彼德把这一过程成为“创造性破坏 ” 。

column1: The term could be applied to all walks of life in the West.
column2: 这一名词可以适用于西方所有阶层。 西方保守派在创造性破坏上并不比西方自由派差劲。

column1: Western conservatives are no less prone to creative destruction than Western liberals: conservatives, indeed, are well known for inventing traditions. Take the 19th century British Prime Minister Benjamin Disraeli, who invented most of the supposedly ancient traditions around the British monarchy.
column2: 保守派实际上因创造传统而著名。 例如，十九世纪英国首相迪斯雷利就创造出了大多数本应该是有关英国君主制度悠久的传统。

column1: Innovation in the West seems to be a never-ending, self-transforming process.
column2: 西方的创新好像是一个没有尽头、自我转变的进程。

column1: Self-criticism, even more than innovation, is a defining characteristic of the West.
column2: 自我批评与创新相比更加能够确定西方的特征。

column1: In most if not all non-Western civilizations, pride and self love exclude self-criticism or at least the criticism of one’s civilization as such.
column2: 非西方文明中面子和自恋排除了自我批评，至少不会自我批评自身的文化。

column1: A true Muslim or Chinese scholar cannot be defined as a true Chinese or a true Muslim by being critical of his own world.
column2: 一个真正的穆斯林或者中国学者由于对自身文化的批评而难以被称为一个真正的中国人或者穆斯林。

column1: Not so in the West.
column2: 西方就不是如此。

column1: The Western scholar remains perfectly legitimate when putting to death Western values: there is no Chinese or Muslim Nietzsche claiming that his own God is dead.
column2: 西方学者宣布西方价值观死亡完全正当，而中国或者穆斯林世界中就没有向尼采那样的人说他自己的上帝已经死了。

column1: Is there a Chinese or a Muslim Montaigne ready to write that the “Indian savages” may be wiser than us, as Montaigne did in 16th century France?
column2: 中国或者穆斯林世界中有没有人像16世纪法国的蒙田那样那样说“印第安野人”或许比我们更加明智呢？

column1: Of course there must be some Chinese or Muslim Montaigne or Nietzsche, but they would not be considered beacons of their civilizations.
column2: 当然肯定会有像蒙田或者尼采那样的中国人或者穆斯林，但是他们不会被视为自身文明的灯塔。

column1: Self-criticism, not self-love, and cultural relativism are the nuts and bolts of the Western mindset.
column2: 自我批评而非自恋以及文化相对主义是西方心态的根基。

column1: The same goes with gender equality.
column2: 在性别平等上也是如此。

column1: This has not always been so. In the ancient Greek, Jewish, and Christian religions, women were perceived as inferior to men.
column2: 情况并不总是这样。 在古希腊、犹太和基督教地区，妇女被视为低人一等。

column1: But this notion has been contentious in the West for centuries. Nowadays, gender equality has become the norm.
column2: 但是很多世纪以来这一观点一直引发争议。 如今，性别平等已经成为通例。

column1: This is not the case in most non-Western civilizations.
column2: 在非西方文明中并非如此。

column1: Some would argue that gender equality is a consequence of the modernization process, not of Westernization.
column2: 有人会说性别平等是现代化进程的结果，而非西方化的结果。

column1: This may be true, but the status of women is clearly one issue that puts non-Western Muslims into opposition to the West.
column2: 这种说法不无道理，但是妇女的地位问题明显把非西方的穆斯林与西方世界对立起来。

column1: If we accept the above definition of the West as a mindset, this leaves open three major questions: can the East be modernized without being Westernized?
column2: 如果我们接受以上西方作为一种心态的定义就会带来三个大问题。 它们是：东方在不被西化的情况下能否现代化？

column1: Where do we draw the line between West and East?
column2: 我们如何区分东方和西方？

column1: Will the West remain Western?
column2: 西方世界会保持西方吗？

column1: So far, there is no case in history of non-Western modernization; the discourse on Asian values, initially started in Singapore, is basically a political discourse.
column2: 目前为止，历史上还没有非西方的现代化。 有关亚洲价值观的讨论最初起源于新加坡，这基本上是一个政治性讨论。

column1: It is after retooling their mindset towards innovation and self-criticism that Asian countries have become modern.
column2: 亚洲国家只是在把它们的心态转向了创新以及自我批评之后才变得现代化。

column1: This does not make them less Asian.
column2: 这并不让这些国家不那么亚洲化。

column1: Contemporary Koreans or Japanese remain fully Korean or Japanese but are closer to a Westerner than they would be to their own ancestors.
column2: 当代的韩国人和日本人还依旧完全是韩国人和日本人但是要比祖先相比更加靠近西方。

column1: Similarly, a modern Egyptian or a modern Saudi will be more on par with a French or an American than they would be with an ancient Arab.
column2: 同样，现代埃及人或者沙特人比古代阿拉伯人更加接近法国人或者美国人。

column1: Does this Westernization make the Egyptian or the Saudi less authentic Arabs?
column2: 这一西方化是否让埃及人或者沙特人不再是正宗的阿拉伯人呢？

column1: Such a debate does take place within all Eastern societies, which leads us to the real clash of civilizations: all societies today are fragmented between Westernizers and non-Westernizers.
column2: 所有的东方社会都存在这一辩论，从而把我们带到了真正的文明冲突，也就是当今所有社会都分裂为西方化人士和非西方化人士。

column1: This clash within civilizations on what modernization means is more significant than Huntington’s alleged conflict between geographical entities.
column2: 这一文明内部有关现代化含义的冲突要比亨廷顿所谓的地理实体之间的冲突更加显著。

column1: The controversy on the essential meaning of modernization, also known as an identity crisis, does impact Western countries as well.
column2: 有关现代化基本含义的争议也被称作身份认同危机同样也影响到西方国家。

column1: Vast groups who live in the West, Western and non-Western fundamentalists, fight the unending Westernization process in the name of tradition.
column2: 生活在西方的大量西方和非西方原教旨主义者以传统的名义与西方化进程进行永无休止的斗争。

column1: Many would like to stop the engine by using various guises like ecology or identity, but a Western society where you could not start your day by asking ‘What's new?’ would not be Western any more.
column2: 许多人想要通过使用生态或者身份认同的伪装来停止熄火，但是如果你早上第一句话不是“有没有新消息”的话，西方社会也就不再是西方了。

column1: What Lies Ahead in 2011?
column2: 2011年将迎来什么？

column1: NEW YORK – The global economy ends 2010 more divided than it was at the beginning of the year.
column2: 发自纽约 — — 相对于2010年初，今年年末的全球经济更为分化。

column1: On one side, emerging-market countries like India, China, and the Southeast Asian economies, are experiencing robust growth.
column2: 一方面，印度，中国这样的新兴市场国家以及东南亚经济体都在蓬勃增长。

column1: On the other side, Europe and the United States face stagnation – indeed, a Japanese-style malaise – and stubbornly high unemployment.
column2: 而另一方面，欧美却面临着滞胀（其实就是一种日本式的经济萎靡）以及挥之不去的高失业率。

column1: The problem in the advanced countries is not a jobless recovery, but an anemic recovery – or worse, the possibility of a double-dip recession.
column2: 发达国家当前的问题并不是一场缺乏就业的复苏，而是一场贫血的复苏 — — 或者再更悲观地说：一种二次衰退的可能性。

column1: This two-track world poses some unusual risks. While Asia’s economic output is too small to pull up growth in the rest of the world, it may be enough to push up commodity prices.
column2: 这一两极发展的状况也因此引发了某些特殊风险：虽然亚洲经济尚不足以带动世界其他地区的增长，但在推高商品价格方面却已绰绰有余了。

column1: Meanwhile, US efforts to stimulate its economy through the Federal Reserve’s policy of “quantitative easing” may backfire.
column2: 与此同时，美国试图通过美联储的“量化宽松”政策来刺激国内经济的做法可能会弄巧反拙。

column1: After all, in globalized financial markets, money looks for the best prospects around the world, and these prospects are in Asia, not the US. So the money won’t go where it’s needed, and much of it will wind up where it’s not wanted – causing further increases in asset and commodity prices, especially in emerging markets.
column2: 毕竟在全球金融市场中资金总是向那些最繁荣的地区流动，而这些区域目前是在亚洲而不是美国。 因此资金是不会向那些急需它的地方流动的，而是涌向那些不需要它的地方 — — 这会导致资产和商品价格进一步升值，在新兴市场尤甚。

column1: Given the high levels of excess capacity and unemployment in Europe and America, quantitative easing is unlikely to trigger a bout of inflation.
column2: 考虑到欧美地区巨量的过剩产能以及极高的失业率，量化宽松政策不太可能引发通胀。

column1: It could, however, increase anxieties about future inflation, leading to higher long-term interest rates – precisely the opposite of the Fed’s goal.
column2: 但它会增加人们对未来通胀的忧虑，导致长期利率进一步升高 — — 这与美联储的愿望恰好倒了过来。

column1: This is not the only, or even the most important, downside risk facing the global economy.
column2: 而这并不是世界经济所面对的唯一或是最重要的危机。

column1: The gravest threat comes from the wave of austerity sweeping the world, as governments, particularly in Europe, confront the large deficits brought on by the Great Recession, and as anxieties about some countries’ ability to meet their debt payments contributes to financial-market instability.
column2: 最严重的威胁来自于席卷全球的紧缩浪潮，这是因为以欧洲国家为首的各国政府都面对着大萧条所带来的巨额赤字，而对某些国家还债能力的忧虑则导致了金融市场的不稳定。

column1: The outcome of premature fiscal consolidation is all but foretold: growth will slow, tax revenues will diminish, and the reduction in deficits will be disappointing.
column2: 对这种不成熟的财政巩固措施所导致的结果其实已经早有预言：增长将放缓，税收将减少，而赤字削减的效果却不如人意。

column1: And, in our globally integrated world, the slowdown in Europe will exacerbate the slowdown in the US, and vice versa.
column2: 同时在我们这个一体化的世界上，欧洲经济的放缓将加剧美国经济的下滑，反之亦然。

column1: With the US able to borrow at record-low interest rates, and with the promise of high returns on public investments after a decade of neglect, it is clear what it should do.
column2: 随着将贷款利率降低到历史最低水平，以及在十年的迷失之后重拾对公共投资的高回报承诺，美国终于知道了自己应当如何做为。

column1: A large-scale public-investment program would stimulate employment in the short term, and growth in the long term, leading in the end to a lower national debt.
column2: 一个大规模的公共投资计划应能在短期内刺激就业，并推动长期增长，最终减低国家债务水平。

column1: But financial markets demonstrated their shortsightedness in the years preceding the crisis, and are doing so once again, by applying pressure for spending cuts, even if that implies reducing badly needed public investments.
column2: 但金融市场不但在危机袭来的前几年暴露了自己的短视，如今又再次重蹈覆辙，逼迫政府削减支出，而这则意味着急需的公共投资将大幅减少。

column1: Moreover, political gridlock will ensure that little is done about the other festering problems confronting the American economy: mortgage foreclosures are likely to continue unabated (legal complications aside); small and medium-sized enterprises are likely to continue to be starved of funds; and the small and medium-sized banks that traditionally provide them with credit are likely to continue to struggle to survive.
column2: 此外，政治僵局也将导致美国政府在另一个不断恶化的经济难题上难有作为：抵押贷款赎回权取消（mortgage foreclosures，意指贷款人因无法偿还而被银行收回房产）的风潮将愈演愈烈（先不管其同时引发的法律纠纷 ） ， 中小企业依旧无法得到贷款，而那些往常贷款给他们的中小型银行则将继续挣扎在死亡线上。

column1: In Europe, meanwhile, matters are unlikely to be any better.
column2: 与此同时，欧洲的状况也没有转好的迹象。

column1: Europe has finally managed to come to the rescue of Greece and Ireland. In the run up to the crisis, both were governed by right-wing governments marked by crony capitalism or worse, demonstrating once again that free-market economics didn’t work in Europe any better than it did in the US.
column2: 欧洲最终出手拯救的两个国家 — — 希腊和爱尔兰 — — 都是在一个与大资本勾肩搭背的右翼政府领导下滑向危机的，这再一次证明了自由市场理论不但在美国一败涂地，在欧洲也行不通。

column1: In Greece, as in the US, a new government was left to clean up the mess.
column2: 与美国类似，希腊组建了一个新政府来收拾这个烂摊子。

column1: The Irish government that encouraged reckless bank lending and the creation of a property bubble was, perhaps not surprisingly, no more adept in managing the economy after the crisis that it was before.
column2: 而爱尔兰那个鼓励银行滥发贷款并制造了地产泡沫的政府则在危机之后现出了不懂管理经济的原形。

column1: Politics aside, property bubbles leave in their wake a legacy of debt and excess capacity in real estate that is not easily rectified – especially when politically connected banks resist restructuring mortgages.
column2: 抛开政治因素不谈，地产泡沫给爱尔兰政府留下了一大堆债务和一个产能过剩的房地产行业，而这些东西是不那么容易被消除的 — — 尤其是当那些在政治上抱团的银行拒绝进行抵押贷款重组的时候。

column1: To me, attempting to discern the economic prospects for 2011 is not a particularly interesting question: the answer is bleak, with little upside potential and a lot of downside risk.
column2: 对于我本人来说，预测2011年的经济并不是个特别有趣的问题：答案必定是黯淡的，既难寻上升之潜力，又充斥着下滑的风险。

column1: More importantly, how long will it take Europe and America to recover, and can Asia’s seemingly export-dependent economies continue to grow if their historical markets languish?
column2: 更重要的是，欧美究竟要花费多少时间才能复苏，而当这些传统出口目的地一蹶不振之时，亚洲的出口导向型经济又能增长多久？

column1: My best bet is that these countries will maintain rapid growth as they shift their economic focus to their vast and untapped domestic markets.
column2: 我的最佳方案是这些亚洲国家都将重点转向庞大且尚未开发的国内市场，并以此维持快速增长。

column1: This will require considerable restructuring of their economies, but China and India are both dynamic, and proved their resilience in their response to the Great Recession.
column2: 这需要他们对本国的经济结构进行重大改革，但中印两国都充满活力，使之在面对这场大萧条时拥有更大的回旋余地。

column1: I am not so bullish on Europe and America.
column2: 我对欧美的前景都不太乐观。

column1: In both cases, the underlying problem is insufficient aggregate demand.
column2: 他们所面临的根本问题其实就是累计总需求不足。

column1: The ultimate irony is that there are simultaneously excess capacity and vast unmet needs – and policies that could restore growth by using the former to address the latter.
column2: 而最大的讽刺莫过于一方面产能过剩，另一方面却有巨大的需求无法的到满足 — — 而利用前者来应对后者的政策对恢复增长是有帮助的。

column1: Both the US and Europe, for instance, must retrofit their economies to address the challenges of global warming. There are feasible policies that would work within long-term budget constraints.
column2: 比如说，欧美两地都必须对自身经济进行革新以应对全球变暖的挑战，即便处于长期的预算限制之下，还是有可行的政策可供施展的。

column1: The problem is politics: in the US, the Republican Party would rather see President Barack Obama fail than the economy succeed.
column2: 问题还是出在政治上，在美国，共和党宁愿不要经济振兴也要看着奥巴马出丑。

column1: In Europe, 27 countries with different interests and perspectives are pulling in different directions, without enough solidarity to compensate.
column2: 在欧洲，27个国家都有着不同的利益诉求和观点，危机之下各自突围，连足够的凝聚力都没有。

column1: The bailout packages are, in this light, impressive achievements.
column2: 由此看来，那个紧急援助计划的出台已经是很了不起的成就了。

column1: In both Europe and America, the free-market ideology that allowed asset bubbles to grow unfettered – markets always know best, so government must not intervene – now ties policymakers’ hands in designing effective responses to the crisis.
column2: 无论是在欧洲还是美国，纵容资产泡沫任意疯长的自由市场理念 — — 所谓市场万能，政府切勿干预 — — 如今变成了套在政策制定者身上的枷锁，使之无法制定有效的危机应对策略。

column1: One might have thought that the crisis itself would undermine confidence in that ideology.
column2: 有人会觉得危机本身的出现将动摇这一理念的公信力。

column1: Instead, it has resurfaced to drag governments and economies down the sinkhole of austerity.
column2: 但事实上，它却重新得势，又把各国政府和经济体拖入了紧缩的泥潭。

column1: If politics is the problem in Europe and America, only political changes are likely to restore them to growth.
column2: 如果欧美的问题是政治，那只有政治变革才能使它们重新走上增长之路。

column1: Or else they can wait until the overhang of excess capacity diminishes, capital goods become obsolete, and the economy’s internal restorative forces work their gradual magic.
column2: 或者它们可以选择等到过度产能减少，资本货物被抛弃，经济内部的恢复性力量逐渐滋长的那一刻。

column1: Either way, victory is not around the corner.
column2: 但无论选择哪一条道路，胜利都不会立刻到来。

column1: India’s Outrage
column2: 印度之怒

column1: NEW DELHI – Last year ended for India on a note of public outrage that has burdened the country with anger, frustration, and pessimism.
column2: 新德里—印度的去年以公共愤怒收尾。 这场愤怒让印度背上了怨气、沮丧和悲观。

column1: The cause, as all the world knows, was the fatally brutal rape of a young woman on a moving bus, after which she and her male companion – himself beaten nearly to death – were thrown, naked, into the street on a freezing night.
column2: 其原因早已全世界皆知 — — 一名女性在公交车上被野蛮的强奸夺取了生命，和她在一起的男伴也遭到了几乎致命的殴打，在寒冷的夜晚被剥光了衣物扔下街头。

column1: The savagery and wanton cruelty of the attack shocked the country to its core.
column2: 这一轻薄而野蛮的袭击恶行震入了印度的骨髓。

column1: But there is more behind the spontaneous protests that have choked the great central vistas of Delhi (to such an extent that the government was forced to change the venue for meetings with visiting Russian President Vladimir Putin).
column2: 但在万人空巷的德里自发游行背后，有很多东西值得我们反思（游行达到了什么样的规模呢？ 政府被迫改变与来访的俄罗斯总统普京举行会晤的地点。

column1: The anger that has poured onto the streets of Delhi and many other Indian cities was fueled by a great accumulated discontent – at the bestial rape and murder of that still-unnamed woman, yes, but also at pervasive public and private corruption, the absence of governance and accountability, and much more.
column2: 在德里和其他许多印度城市街头挥洒的愤怒的背后是极深的积怨 — — 不仅是对这位不知名女性所遭受的强奸和杀害的愤怒，也包括对无处不在的公私腐败、治理和问责的缺乏以及其他诸多问题的愤怒。

column1: Years of pent-up rage are now flowing out.
column2: 多年的积怨如今终于爆发。

column1: Of course, the government deserves – and has received – no quarter.
column2: 当然，政府不值得原谅，也没人原谅它。

column1: The government failed to prevent the crime, then failed again when its unresponsive, inefficient, and crooked police force was unable to respond appropriately.
column2: 政府没能预防犯罪在先，犯罪发生后，在腐败低效的警方没能恰当响应的情况下，政府又没能拿出措施。

column1: A wholly moribund and sclerotic administration simply did not know where its duty lay.
column2: 一个完全僵化、行将就木的政府根本不知道自己的责任在哪里。

column1: When protests erupted, the government, in a fit of blind idiocy, set the police upon peaceful protesters, men and women, with long batons, water cannon, and tear gas.
column2: 游行爆发后，政府又像抽风一样把警察派向示威群众，用警棍、水枪和催泪弹对付走上街头的男男女女。

column1: This heavy-handedness of course resolved nothing. Citizens’ fury deepened into grim resolve; the government’s repressive impulse was challenged and defeated.
column2: 如此笨拙的应对措施解决不了任何问题，群众的愤怒开始向暴行深化；政府的抑制措施根本无法阻挡。

column1: Since then, tokenism has replaced leadership.
column2: 此后，装门面取代了领导力。

column1: Not one government official had the courage, skill, or decency to rise to the occasion.
column2: 政府之中没有一位官员有勇气、能力和人格魅力出现在示威群众跟前。

column1: The opposition, too, floundered, doing no more than simply faulting the ruling establishment.
column2: 反对派也在胡乱挣扎，除了大肆指责执政党外拿不出任何策略。

column1: After an unconscionably long delay of seven days, Prime Minister Manmohan Singh finally broke his incomprehensible silence about the rape.
column2: 在经历了冷漠无情的七天后，总理辛格终于打破了令人费解的沉默。

column1: But his public statement offered no answers and no balm – indeed, nothing but platitudes.
column2: 但他的公开讲话并不构成强奸案的答案，也起不了镇抚人心的作用 — — 事实上，这全是一番陈词滥调。

column1: Then, humiliatingly, Singh inquired, sotto voce, of those surrounding him: “Was it all right?”
column2: 接着，辛格做了令人汗颜的动作：他轻声问随从说 ： “ 这么说对吗 ？ ”

column1: A torrent of electronic wrath burst forth.
column2: 这在电子世界中掀起了怒波。

column1: Protest placards could be seen all over the country: “No!
column2: 全国各大论坛随处可见示威标语 ： “ 不！

column1: Prime Minister, it is not all right.”
column2: 总理，这么说不对 。 ”

column1: Clearly, Machiavelli was correct: for a political leader, the people’s contempt is worse than their hatred.
column2: 显然，马基雅维利是对的：对政治领袖来说，人民的轻视比人民的愤怒更糟糕。

column1: Then, in another mindless act, the victim, struggling for life, was flown to a hospital in Singapore.
column2: 接着，政府又干了一件蠢事，生命垂危的受害者被飞机送到了新加坡的医院。

column1: No one would or could say why.
column2: 没人知道为什么要这样。

column1: It was there that she died – some say that she arrived already brain-dead.
column2: 后来她死在了新加坡 — — 也有人说到达新加坡时她已经陷入了脑死亡。

column1: Her body was then hurriedly flown back to India, where it was quietly, almost surreptitiously, cremated.
column2: 随后，她的遗体又被匆忙运回印度，悄悄地 — — 甚至可以说是偷偷地 — — 火化了。

column1: If the government feared her alive, it was petrified of her dead.
column2: 如果说政府害怕她活着，那么她的死足以令政府恐惧。

column1: All of India was shamed by this callous and inhuman folly.
column2: 全体印度人都因为这场野蛮残忍的蠢事而蒙羞。

column1: As a result, India’s Congress-led government has irretrievably lost the public’s confidence; the establishment’s authority has evaporated.
column2: 结果，国大党领导的印度政府已经彻底失去了公众信心；执政者的权威已经蒸发殆尽。

column1: A blunt question is now being asked frequently and openly: “Is this India’s Tahrir Square?”
column2: 如今，一个尖锐的问题被公开地频繁提及 ： “ 这会是印度的解放广场吗 ？ ”

column1: Even if it is not, how can an internally roiled India respond adequately to its many external tests, the severity of which was underscored recently by Pakistani troops’ killing of two Indian soldiers along the Line of Control in Kashmir.
column2: 即使答案是否定的，内部阵脚已乱的印度如何充分地应对诸多外部考验，比如最近发生的巴基斯坦军方在克什米尔控制线附近杀害两名印度士兵的事件？

column1: Meanwhile, as India flounders, Northeast Asia has been astir choosing new leaders, who have now been installed in China, Japan, and North and South Korea.
column2: 在印度苦苦挣扎的同时，东北亚 纷纷选出了新领导人，中国、日本、朝鲜和韩国都完成了权力交接。

column1: With an assertive China, ongoing regime change in Myanmar, a troubled Bangladesh, a constitutionally stymied Nepal, and continuing ethnic tensions in Sri Lanka, India’s eastern challenges are many and mighty.
column2: 咄咄逼人的中国、体制转变方兴未艾的缅甸、麻烦重重的孟加拉国、宪政问题缠身的尼泊尔、种族冲突不断的斯里兰卡 — — 在印度的东面可谓强敌四伏，挑战重重。

column1: But they are even more severe to India’s west, with Pakistan heading into elections (one hopes) in the spring of 2013, and NATO troops withdrawing from Afghanistan.
column2: 而西面的情况甚至更为严峻，巴基斯坦（有望）即将在2013年春迎来大选，北约将从阿富汗撤军。

column1: Indian diplomacy faces a time of trial in both countries.
column2: 印度外交将同时面临这两个国家的考验。

column1: Farther west, too, India’s statecraft is in question.
column2: 进一步向西看，印度的国基也存在问题。

column1: Where does India, which remains dependent on Middle Eastern energy, stand on that region’s many crises?
column2: 仍需依赖中东能源的印度在中东诸多危机中立场如何？

column1: How will it address the nuclear issue in Iran – a country with which it has close historical, cultural, and economic ties – or the civil war in Syria, the rise of Salafism in Egypt, and the Israel-Palestine standoff?
column2: 印度如何处理与之存在密切历史、文化和经济关系的伊朗的核问题，或是叙利亚内战问题、埃及沙拉菲主义崛起问题以及以巴冲突问题？

column1: Moreover, India no longer appears to be the vigorous economic dynamo that was the darling of global investors only five years ago.
column2: 此外，印度已不再是强大的经济发动机，而五年前，它还是全球投资者梦想的地方。

column1: Already some say that the “I” in BRICS (Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa) should now stand for Indonesia.
column2: 有人说，金砖国家（BRICS，巴西、俄罗斯、印度、中国和南非）中的“I”现在应该是印度尼西亚。

column1: India is running high current-account and fiscal deficits; food-price inflation is in the double digits; and the rupee has weakened.
column2: 印度存在巨大的经常项目和财政赤字；食品价格通胀率高达两位数；卢比也在贬值。

column1: As for trade with China, The Economist points out that “for every dollar’s worth of exports to China [principally raw materials], India imports three.”
column2: 至于与中国的俄贸易 ， 《 经济学人》指出“印度每向中国出口1美元（主要是原材料 ） ， 都要进口3美元 。 ”

column1: Can outrage turn to catharsis?
column2: 愤怒���导致动乱吗？

column1: Clearly, the current government is unable to bring about any of the necessary changes.
column2: 显然，现任政府拿不出任何必须的改变。

column1: A possible answer lies in an early election: a new mandate for an India that is in desperate need of renewal.
column2: 可能的答案在于提前大选：渴望涅槃的印度需要一个新指挥官。

column1: What McCain and Obama Ignore
column2: 麦凯恩和奥巴马无瑕顾及之处

column1: PRINCETON – Barack Obama worked for three years as a community organizer on Chicago’s blighted South Side, so he knows all about the real poverty that exists in America.
column2: 普林斯顿 - - 奥巴马曾经在芝加哥破烂不堪的城南当过三年的社区组织者，所以他完全了解美国真实的贫困状况。

column1: He knows that in one of the world’s richest nations, 37 million people live in poverty, a far higher proportion than in Europe’s wealthy nations.
column2: 他知道，在世界上最为富有的国家中有三千七百万人生活在贫困之中。 这一比例要远远高于欧洲富国。

column1: Yet Obama’s campaigning has focused on “Main Street” and tax cuts for the middle class, bypassing the issue of what to do about poverty.
column2: 但是奥巴马竞选集中谈论的是大众百姓以及中产阶级减税，却忽略了如何应对贫困。

column1: It’s not as if Obama has no policies for helping the poor.
column2: 这并非是奥巴马没有扶贫规划。

column1: Go to his Web site, click on “The Issues” and then on “Poverty.”
column2: 到他的网站上，点击“议题 ” ， 然后再点击“贫困 ” 。

column1: There you will find a set of thoughtful proposals ranging from raising the minimum wage to establishing model “Promise Neighborhoods” that will attempt to turn around areas with high levels of poverty and low levels of educational achievement by providing services such as early childhood education and crime prevention.
column2: 在那里你可以找到一整套规划，内容遍及提高最低工资到建立模范“保证邻里”项目等。 这些都试图通过提供类似早期幼儿教育以及阻止犯罪等服务项目来整治高贫困以及低教育地区。

column1: (Go to John McCain’s Web site, and you won’t even find “poverty” among the list of issues to click on – although “Space Program” is there.)
column2: (你到麦凯恩的网站上就找不到“贫困”议题可以点击，然而“空间计划”却赫然在目。 )

column1: So why isn’t Obama speaking up about an issue on which he has so much more first-hand experience than his opponent, and better policies, too?
column2: 在贫困问题上，奥巴马比麦凯恩更有切身体会和更好的政策。 那么，为何奥巴马没有大声疾呼呢？

column1: Perhaps not enough of the poor vote, or they will vote Democratic anyway.
column2: 也许是因为贫困人口选票不够多，或者是因为反正他们会投票给民主党。

column1: Moreover, his researchers presumably have told him that independent middle-class voters are more likely to be won over by appeals to their wallets than to concern for America’s poor.
column2: 而且，他的研究人员据说告诉他，收入问题要比关心美国的贫困人口更会赢得独立中产选民的支持。

column1: If America’s poor don’t rank high among voters’ concerns, it is no surprise that the poor abroad are virtually invisible.
column2: 如果贫困问题并非为选民关注，那么，外国的贫困问题几乎视而不见也就不足为奇了。

column1: Again, Obama has both the background – with his family ties to Kenya – and a promising policy, to increase America’s foreign assistance to $50 billion by 2012, using the money to stabilize failing states and bring sustainable growth to Africa.
column2: 同样，奥巴马家族与肯尼亚有渊源，他也就有这一问题的背景，他也有令人鼓舞的规划。 他的规划就是到2012年把美国的对外援助增加到五百亿美元，用这笔钱来稳定摇摇欲坠的国家并且带给非洲可持续增长。

column1: (Currently, of all the OECD donor nations, only Greece gives a lower percentage of its gross national income than the United States does.)
column2: (目前，在所有经合组织成员中，只有希腊的外援占国民总收入的比例比美国的低。 )

column1: But when Obama’s running mate, Joe Biden, was asked, in his debate with his Republican counterpart, Sarah Palin, what proposals an Obama-Biden administration might have to scale back as a result of the $700 billion Wall Street bailout, the only specific proposal he mentioned was the increase in foreign assistance.
column2: 但是，奥巴马的竞选搭档拜登在与共和党副总统候选人佩林的电视辩论中被问到奥巴马和拜登政府如何削减开支来应付七千亿美元的华尔街救市计划时，他提到的唯一具体建议就是增加外援。

column1: McCain has never gotten down to specifics about how much foreign aid he would like the US to give.
column2: 在美国给予多少外援时，麦凯恩从来都是语焉不详。

column1: Both candidates refer to deaths of American military personnel in Iraq, but there has been less attention to the war’s civilian causalities.
column2: 两个候选人都谈到了在伊拉克的美军阵亡，但是对于战争中的平民死亡却较少谈论。

column1: In her debate with Biden, Palin actually attacked Obama for saying that, in her words, “All we’re doing in Afghanistan is air-raiding villages and killing civilians.”
column2: 在与拜登的辩论中，佩林攻击奥巴马的言论，用她的话来说就是“我们在阿富汗所做的一切就是空袭村庄以及杀害平民 ” 。

column1: She called that comment “reckless” and “untrue,” because, “That’s not what we’re doing there.
column2: 她称这一言论“鲁莽”以及“不真实 ” ， 因为 ， “ 那不是我们在那里干的事。

column1: We’re fighting terrorists, and we’re securing democracy.”
column2: 我们在与恐怖分子作战，而且我们在保护民主 ” 。

column1: Of course, killing civilians is not all that the US and its NATO allies are doing in Afghanistan, and if Obama implied that it was, his rhetoric was careless.
column2: 当然，杀害平民并非美国及其北约盟国在阿富汗所从事的所有事情。 而且如果奥巴马暗示那就是他们的所作所为，那么他的言论就是没有头脑。

column1: But what is extraordinary about Palin’s comment is that, despite being a strong proponent of the sanctity of human life, in criticizing Obama she did not pause to deplore the serious loss of innocent human life that American air strikes in Afghanistan have caused.
column2: 但是佩林评论的惊人之处在于，尽管她强烈支持人命不可侵犯，但是在批评奥巴马的时候她并没有停下来哀悼美国空袭在阿富汗造成的巨大平民死亡。

column1: Afghanistan’s president, Hamid Karzai, has repeatedly expressed outrage at American air strikes that have killed civilians – most recently in August, when he said that 95 Afghans, including 50 children, were killed in the bombing of a village.
column2: 阿富汗总统卡尔扎伊多次对美军空袭造成平民死亡表示愤怒。 最近的一次发生在八月，95名阿富汗人，包括五十名儿童在空袭村庄中死亡。

column1: The global ethical challenge that has been most prominent in the campaign is climate change.
column2: 竞选中最为主要的全球性伦理问��是气候变化问题。

column1: Here, the candidates’ goals are virtually identical: they both support a cap-and-trade system to make deep cuts in US greenhouse-gas emissions by 2050.
column2: 在这一问题上，候选人的目标几乎是一致的。 他们都支持限额-交易机制，从而到2050年大幅度削减美国的温室气体排放。

column1: Obama wants the goal to be an 80% reduction and McCain says 66%, but, since the next president will leave office no later than 2016, that difference is irrelevant.
column2: 奥巴马想要削减80 % ， 麦凯恩则为66 % 。 但是，由于下一任总统最晚也要在2016年离任，所以，这一区别也就微不足道了。

column1: Interestingly, one ethical issue on which neither candidate has campaigned has been shown to have the potential to move voters.
column2: 有趣的是，有一个两党候选人在竞选中都还没有涉及到的一个伦理问题却有可能会打动选民。

column1: A group called Defenders of Wildlife has been running an ad graphically highlighting Palin’s support for shooting wolves from aircraft.
column2: 一个名为野生动物守护者的团体投放了一则广告，用图表的方式突出表现了佩林支持从飞机上射杀狼。

column1: A study of Republicans, Democrats, and independents showed that viewing the ad led to greater support for Obama.
column2: 一项对共和党、民主党以及独立党派的研究显示看过这则广告的人大部分会转而支持奥巴马。

column1: According to Glenn Kessler, the head of HCD research, which conducted the study with the Muhlenberg College Institute of Public Opinion, whereas recent ads from both parties have had little impact among voters, “This is the first ad in over a month that seems to have broken through.”
column2: 与穆伦堡学院民意研究所共同进行该项研究的HCD研究的主管Glenn Kessler指出。 尽管两党候选人最近投放的广告在选民中很少产生影响 ， “ 这是一个月来第一个似乎打动选民的广告 。 ”

column1: Consistent with that finding, an historic ballot initiative in California to ban cruel forms of animal confinement on factory farms, including the battery cage system of keeping hens, is also showing strong support.
column2: 与这项发现相符的是，在历史上加利福尼亚对制止工厂化农场囚禁动物的残酷方式，包括笼养鸡只的系统进行的投票表决也获得了相当高的支持率。

column1: What Monetary Policy Does China Need?
column2: 中国需要何种货币政策？

column1: China’s remarkable growth has been financed recently by a rapid expansion of money and bank credit that is producing an increasingly unsustainable investment boom.
column2: 最近，中国货币和银行信贷的快速扩张为其引人注目的经济增长提供了资金，而这正在产生一个愈发难以持久的投资激增。

column1: This renews concerns that the country may not be able to avert a replay of the painful boom–and-bust cycle such as the one it endured in the mid-1990’s.
column2: 这重新引发人们的担忧，那就是中国可能无法避免重演其在九十年代中期所经历的痛苦的经济繁荣破灭循环。

column1: Monetary policy is usually the first line of defense in such situations.
column2: 在这种情况下，货币政策往往是第一道防线。

column1: But China’s monetary policy has been hamstrung by the tightly managed exchange-rate regime.
column2: 但是中国的货币政策却被严格管理的汇率体系所削弱。

column1: This regime prevents the central bank – the People’s Bank of China (PBC) – from taking appropriate policy decisions to manage domestic demand, because interest-rate hikes could encourage capital inflows and put further pressure on the exchange rate.
column2: 这一体系阻止中央银行即中国人民银行作出适当的政策决定来管理国内需求，因为利率提升可能会鼓励资本流入并且进一步对汇率造成压力。

column1: There is, of course, a vigorous ongoing debate about China’s exchange-rate policy.
column2: 当然，有关中国的汇率政策一直争论不休。

column1: China’s rising trade surplus has led some observers to call for a revaluation of the renminbi to correct what they see as an unfair competitive advantage that China maintains in international markets.
column2: 中国上升的贸易顺差让某些观察家呼吁对人民币重新估价，以便修正他们所认为的中国在国际市场中维持的不公平的竞争优势。

column1: Others argue that the stable exchange rate fosters macroeconomic stability in China.
column2: 其他人则提出，稳定的汇率促进中国的宏观经济稳定。

column1: But this debate misses the point.
column2: 但是，这一论点不得要领。

column1: What China really needs is a truly independent monetary policy oriented to domestic objectives.
column2: 中国需要的是切实独立的、面向国内目标的货币政策。

column1: This would enable the PBC to manage domestic demand by allowing interest rates to rise in order to rein in credit growth and deter reckless investment.
column2: 这将会让人民银行通过允许利率上升来管理国内需求，从而限制信贷增长以及抑制盲目投资。

column1: An independent monetary policy requires a flexible exchange rate, not a revaluation.
column2: 独立的货币政策要求灵活的汇率，而非重新估价。

column1: But what could take the place of the stable exchange rate as an anchor for monetary policy and for tying down inflation expectations?
column2: 但是，什么东西可以取代作为货币政策以及压制通货膨胀预期的依靠的稳定汇率呢？

column1: We recommend a low inflation objective as the anchor for monetary policy in China.
column2: 我们建议采用低通货膨胀目标作为中国货币政策的出发点。

column1: Theoretical research and the practical experiences of many countries both show that focusing on price stability is the best way for monetary policy to achieve the broader objectives in the charter of the PBC: macroeconomic and financial stability, high employment growth, etc.
column2: 理论研究以及多国实际经验都表明，致力于价格稳定是货币政策实现人民银行职能中更为广泛的目标的最佳途径。 这些目标包括宏观经济和金融稳定以及高就业增长等等。

column1: The low inflation objective need not involve the formalities of an inflation-targeting regime, such as that practiced by the European Central Bank and the Bank of England, and is similar in approach to that recommended for the United States by US Federal Reserve Chairman Ben Bernanke.
column2: 低通胀目标并不需要包括以通胀为指标的体系中的手段，欧洲央行和英格兰银行就采用这些手段，而且，美联储主席伯南特也建议美国采取类似的手段。

column1: How could such a framework be operated effectively in an economy in which financial sector problems have weakened the monetary transmission mechanism?
column2: 中国金融体系问题已经削弱了货币转变机制，这样的一个框架如何在这种经济体中有效运作呢？

column1: This is a key concern because, notwithstanding recent reforms, the banking system remains fragile.
column2: 这是一个关键性的顾虑，因为最低程度的金融体系改革应当足以落实低通胀目标。

column1: Nevertheless, we believe that a minimal set of financial sector reforms – essentially making banks’ balance sheets strong enough to withstand substantial interest-rate policy actions – should suffice to implement a low inflation objective.
column2: 这些改革基本上可以将银行的资产负债表强化到足以抵御根本性的利率政策行动的程度。

column1: Although full modernization of the financial sector is a long way off even in the best of circumstances, the minimal reforms that we recommend could strengthen the banking system sufficiently in the near term to support a more flexible exchange rate anchored by an inflation objective.
column2: 即使在最佳情况下实现金融体系的现代化还都是遥远的事情。 尽管如此，我们建议的最低程度的改革应当可以在近期内有力地加强银行体系，从而支持通胀目标所包含的更为灵活的汇率。

column1: Indeed, price stability, and the broader macroeconomic stability emanating from it, would provide a good foundation for pushing forward with other financial sector reforms.
column2: 事实上，价格稳定，以及由此带来的更大程度的宏观经济稳定将会为推动金融体系的其他改革提供良好的基础。

column1: The framework we suggest has the important benefit of continuity.
column2: 我们建议的框架具有连续性的重要益处。

column1: The PBC would not have to change its operational approach to monetary policy.
column2: 人民银行将不必改变其针对货币政策的运作手段。

column1: Only a shift in strategic focus would be needed to anchor monetary policy with a long-run target range for low inflation.
column2: 只需要改变战略关注点就可以在长期指标范围内为低通胀制定货币政策。

column1: Monitoring of monetary (and credit) targets would still be important in achieving the inflation objective.
column2: 监控货币以及信贷指标在实现通胀目标上仍将十分重要。

column1: Furthermore, it should be easier to adopt the new framework when times are good – like now, when growth is strong and inflation is low.
column2: 而且，时机妥当的时候采纳新的框架将会较为容易。 当前，增长强劲而通胀较低，正是好时机。

column1: There is some risk that appreciation of the exchange rate if greater flexibility were allowed could precipitate deflation.
column2: 现在还有一种风险，那就是如果允许更大的灵活性会引起汇率上升从而加快通货紧缩。

column1: What this really highlights, however, is the importance of framing the debate about exchange-rate flexibility in a broader context.
column2: 但是，这一情形实际上突出将汇率灵活性放在更大的范围内进行辩论的重要性。

column1: Having an independent monetary policy that could counteract boom-and-bust cycles would be the best way for China to deal with such risks.
column2: 具有独立的、能够抵御从繁荣到破灭循环的货币政策是中国应付此类风险的最佳途径。

column1: Contrary to those who regard the discussion of an alternative monetary framework as premature, there are good reasons for China to begin right now to build the institutional foundation for the transition to an independent monetary policy.
column2: 某些人认为现在讨论替换性的货币框架为时尚早。 与此相反，中国有很好的理由现在就为向独立的货币政策过渡建立机制性基础。

column1: Indeed, early adoption of a low inflation objective would help secure the monetary and financial stability that China needs as it allows greater exchange-rate flexibility.
column2: 实际上，低通胀可以允许更大的汇率灵活度，尽早采纳这一目标将会帮助中国所需要的货币和金融稳定。

column1: What Money Can Buy
column2: 金钱可以买什么

column1: CHICAGO – In an interesting recent book, What Money Can’t Buy: The Moral Limits of the Market, the Harvard philosopher Michael Sandel points to the range of things that money can buy in modern societies and gently tries to stoke our outrage at the market’s growing dominance.
column2: 芝加哥—在迈克尔·桑德尔（Michael Sandel）颇有意思的新书《钱买不到的：市场的道德边界 》 （ What Money Can’t Buy: The Moral Limits of the Market）中，这位哈佛大学哲学家提到了许多在现代社会中可以用金钱买到的东西，然后优雅地煽风点火哦，激发我们对市场主宰一切的愤怒。

column1: Is he right that we should be alarmed?
column2: 我们真的应该引起警惕吗？

column1: While Sandel worries about the corrupting nature of some monetized transactions (do kids really develop a love of reading if they are bribed to read books?), he is also concerned about unequal access to money, which makes trades using money inherently unequal.
column2: 桑德尔担心某些货币化交易的腐败性质（真的可以用悬赏开发孩子的阅读兴趣吗？ ） ， 但他也担心金钱获得渠道的不平等性，因为这导致了用钱进行的贸易具有内在不平等性。

column1: More generally, he fears that the expansion of anonymous monetary exchange erodes social cohesion, and argues for reducing money’s role in society.
column2: 更一般地讲，阿担心匿名货币交换的扩张会侵蚀社会凝聚力，并呼吁减弱金钱在社会中的作用。

column1: Sandel’s concerns are not entirely new, but his examples are worth reflecting upon.
column2: 桑德尔的担忧算不上最新鲜，但他举的例子值得我们深思。

column1: In the United States, some companies pay the unemployed to stand in line for free public tickets to congressional hearings.
column2: 在美国，一些公司花钱雇失业者排队抢过会听证的公共入场券。

column1: They then sell the tickets to lobbyists and corporate lawyers who have a business interest in the hearing but are too busy to stand in line.
column2: 接着，他们把入场券卖给游说集团和公司律师 — — 听证对事关后两者的利益，但他们又太忙，没有时间排队。

column1: Clearly, public hearings are an important element of participatory democracy.
column2: 显然，公共听证是参与性民主的重要元素。

column1: All citizens should have equal access.
column2: 所有公民都应该有平等的参与权。

column1: So selling access seems to be a perversion of democratic principles.
column2: 因此出售参与权似乎是对民主原则的滥用。

column1: The fundamental problem, though, is scarcity.
column2: 但是，根本问题出在稀缺上。

column1: We cannot accommodate everyone in the room who might have an interest in a particularly important hearing.
column2: 我们无法协调可能在某个重要听证上存在利益的所有人。

column1: So we have to “sell” entry.
column2: 因此，我们不得不“出售”参与权。

column1: We can either allow people to use their time (standing in line) to bid for seats, or we can auction seats for money.
column2: 我们可以让人们牺牲时间（排队）换取听证席位，也可以将听证权拿来拍卖换钱。

column1: The former seems fairer, because all citizens seemingly start with equal endowments of time.
column2: 前者比较公平，因为似乎所有公民的初始时间禀赋都是一样的。

column1: But is a single mother with a high-pressure job and three young children as equally endowed with spare time as a student on summer vacation?
column2: 但是，可以说一位从事高压力工作还带着三个幼儿的单身母亲的闲暇禀赋和一位放暑假的学生是一样的吗？

column1: And is society better off if she, the chief legal counsel for a large corporation, spends much of her time standing in line?
column2: 而作为某大公司首席法律顾问的这位单身母亲花时间排队能产生让社会变得更好的效果吗？

column1: Whether it is better to sell entry tickets for time or for money thus depends on what we hope to achieve.
column2: 用时间还是用金钱换取入场券孰优孰劣取决于我们希望达到的目的是什么。

column1: If we want to increase society’s productive efficiency, people’s willingness to pay with money is a reasonable indicator of how much they will gain if they have access to the hearing.
column2: 如果我们希望增加社会生产率，那么人们愿意付多少钱可以作为合理的指标显示他们可以从参与听证中获得多少好处。

column1: Auctioning seats for money makes sense – the lawyer contributes more to society by preparing briefs than by standing in line.
column2: 货币拍卖听证席位是有用的 — — 律师准备总结陈词对社会的贡献大于排队。

column1: On the other hand, if it is important that young, impressionable citizens see how their democracy works, and that we build social solidarity by making corporate executives stand in line with jobless teenagers, it makes sense to force people to bid with their time and to make entry tickets non-transferable.
column2: 另一方面，如果重点在于让年轻、敏感的公民体验他们身处其中的民主是如何运转的，以及通过让公司高管与失业年轻人一起排队培养社会凝聚力，那么就应该迫使人们牺牲时间换取不可转移的入场券。

column1: But if we think that both objectives – efficiency and solidarity – should play some role, perhaps we should turn a blind eye to hiring the unemployed to stand in line in lieu of busy lawyers, so long as they do not corner all of the seats.
column2: 但如果我们两个目标 — — 效率和凝聚力都应该起作用，也许我们应该对繁忙的律师雇用失业者替自己排队的现象睁一只眼闭一只眼，只要他们被霸占所有席位。

column1: What about the sale of human organs, another example Sandel worries about?
column2: 那么贩卖人体器官又该怎么看呢？ 这是桑德尔所担心的又一件事。

column1: Something seems wrong when a lung or a kidney is sold for money.
column2: 卖肾或者卖肺听起来似乎总有那么一丝不对劲。

column1: Yet we celebrate the kindness of a stranger who donates a kidney to a young child.
column2: 但对于捐献肾脏给年轻小孩的陌生人，我们总要赞扬他的善良。

column1: So, clearly, it is not the transfer of the organ that outrages us – we do not think that the donor is misinformed about the value of a kidney or is being fooled into parting with it.
column2: 因此，显然，是器官的交易激怒了我们 — — 我们并不会去想捐献者被误导了肾脏的价值，或是受骗上当才接受取肾的。

column1: Nor, I think, do we have concerns about the scruples of the person selling the organ – after all, they are parting irreversibly with something that is dear to them for a price that few of us would accept.
column2: 而我认为，我们也不会去想出售器官者所经历的犹豫 — — 毕竟他们所经历的是与宝贵之物的不可逆的分离，而他们所获得的代价是很少有人愿意能够的。

column1: I think part of our discomfort has to do with the circumstances in which the transaction takes place.
column2: 我想，我们的不满部分是来自交易发生的环境。

column1: What kind of society do we live in if people have to sell their organs to survive?
column2: 如果一个人得出售器官才活得下去，那么我们生活在其中的是怎样一个社会啊！

column1: But, while a ban on organ sales may make us feel better, does it really make society better off?
column2: 但是，尽管禁止贩卖器官会让我们感觉好受些，这真的能让社会变得更好吗？

column1: Possibly, if it makes society work harder to ensure that people are never driven to the circumstances that would make them contemplate selling a vital organ.
column2: 也许是，如果这能让社会变得更努力从而确保人们永远不会陷入被诱出售活体器官的境况中去的话。

column1: But possibly not, if it allows society to ignore the underlying problem, either moving the trade underground, or forcing people in such circumstances to resort to worse remedies.
column2: 但也可能不是，如果社会并没有意识到基本问题，而是将器官贩卖行为转入地下并迫使出售器官者得不到更好医疗的话。

column1: Then again, part of our unease probably has to do with what we perceive as an unequal exchange.
column2: 再一次，我们的不安可能部分来自我们对不公平交换的定义。

column1: The seller is giving up part of her body in an irreversible transaction.
column2: 出售者在一次不可逆的交易中放弃了身体的一部分。

column1: The buyer is giving up only money – perhaps earned on a lucky stock trade or at an overpaid job.
column2: 购买者只放弃了金钱 — — 这笔钱可能来自某次撞大运的炒股或薪酬过高的工作。

column1: If that money had been earned by selling a portion of a lung, or represented savings painfully accumulated during years of backbreaking work, we might consider the exchange more equal.
column2: 如果这笔钱本身便来自出售一部分肺脏，或是多年来辛勤劳作、一分一厘苦苦储蓄而得，我们或许会觉得这样的交换会公平些。

column1: Of course, the central virtue of money is precisely its anonymity.
column2: 当然，钱最核心的优点正在于其匿名性。

column1: I need know nothing about the dollar bill I receive to be able to use it.
column2: 我不需要知道拿到的美元钞票的相关信息就可以使用它。

column1: But, because money’s anonymity obscures its provenance, it may be socially less acceptable as a medium of payment for some objects.
column2: 但是，匿名性使得我们无从考证钱的来源，而对于某些目标，这会导致人们对钱作为支付中介的角色难以接受。

column1: In both examples – congressional tickets and organ sales – Sandel suggests reducing money’s role.
column2: 在上述两例中 — — 国会入场券和贩卖器官 — — 桑德尔都建议减弱钱的作用。

column1: But money has many virtues in facilitating transactions – hence its ubiquitous use.
column2: 但钱在促进交易和使用范围方面有着大量好处。

column1: So, perhaps the more important message is that society’s tolerance for monetization is proportional to the legitimacy accorded to the distribution of money.
column2: 因此，也许更重要的问题在于社会对货币化的容忍度与源自金钱分配的合理性成正比。

column1: The more people believe that it is the hardworking and the deserving who have money, the more they are willing to tolerate transactions for money (though some transactions remain beyond the pale).
column2: 人们越是认为多劳多能者才能多得，就越是愿意忍受金钱交易（尽管仍有某些交易超出了仍受界限 ） 。

column1: But if people believe that the moneyed are primarily those who are well connected or crooked, their tolerance for monetary transactions falls.
column2: 但如果人们认为关系最多、人品最劣者往往最能致富，那么他们对货币交易的容忍度也会下降。

column1: Rather than focusing on prohibiting monetary transactions, perhaps a more important lesson imparted by Sandel’s examples is that we should work continuously to improve the perceived legitimacy of money’s distribution.
column2: 不要将注意力放在禁止货币交易上。 也许桑德尔的例子给我们的更重要的教训是我们应该不断改善对金钱分配的合理性的感觉。

column1: The Moral Limits of Markets
column2: 市场的道德局限性

column1: TOKYO – Today, there are very few things that money can’t buy.
column2: 发自东京 — — 在今天这个社会，不能用钱来换取的东西已经少之又少了。

column1: If you are sentenced to a jail term in Santa Barbara, California, and don’t like the standard accommodations, you can buy a prison-cell upgrade for about $90 per night.
column2: 如果你在美国加利福尼亚州的圣塔芭芭拉市被判入狱，却又不喜欢跟普通囚犯一样的监狱环境，那么只需支付90美元/天就可以享受升级版的监仓。

column1: If you want to help to prevent the tragic fact that, each year, thousands of babies are born to drug-addicted mothers, you can contribute to a charity that uses a market mechanism to ameliorate the problem: a $300 cash grant to any drug-addicted woman willing to be sterilized.
column2: 如果你不忍看见每年有数千名婴儿由吸毒妇女生下的悲惨事实，就可以捐款给一个利用市场机制来缓解这一状况的慈善组织：他们向每个愿意接受绝育的吸毒妇女支付300美元。

column1: Or, if you want to attend a US Congressional hearing, but don’t want to wait for hours in line, you can enlist the services of a line-standing company.
column2: 又或者，你希望旁听一场国会听证，却不愿花费几个小时排队轮候入场券。 那么你可以找一家排队公司。

column1: The company hires homeless people and others in need of work to wait in line – overnight if necessary.
column2: 这些公司雇佣那些无家可归或者其他需要工作的人去排队 — — 有必要的时候甚至可以通宵。

column1: Just before the hearing begins, the paying customer can take his or her line-stander’s place in the queue, and claim a front-row seat in the hearing room.
column2: 等到听证会就快开始之前，付了钱的顾客就可以和排队者交换个位置，并因此在听证厅里占据一个前排的座位。

column1: Is there anything wrong with buying and selling these things?
column2: 买卖这些东西有什么不对的吗？

column1: Some would say no; people should be free to spend their money to buy whatever someone else is willing to sell.
column2: 有些人说没问题；人们应当有自由去花钱购买别人愿意出售的一切东西。

column1: Others believe that there are some things that money should not be able to buy.
column2: 其他人则相信有些东西是不应该被投入金钱交易的。

column1: But why? What exactly is wrong with selling prison-cell upgrades to those who can afford them, or offering cash for sterilization, or hiring line-standers?
column2: 但这是为什么？ 购买升级监仓，给绝育吸毒妇女送钱或者雇佣排队者究竟有什么错呢？

column1: To answer questions such as these, we need to pose a bigger question: What role should money and markets play in a good society?
column2: 要解答这类问题，我们需要提出一个更宏大的问题：在一个好的社会里金钱和市场究竟应该扮演一个什么角色？

column1: Asking this question, and debating it politically, is more important than ever.
column2: 询问这一问题并在政治上进行讨论的重要性已经变得前所未有的紧迫。

column1: The last three decades have witnessed a quiet revolution, as markets and market-oriented thinking have reached into spheres of life previously governed by non-market values: family life and personal relations; health and education; environmental protection and criminal justice; national security and civic life.
column2: 过去30年我们见证了一场平静的革命，市场和以市场为导向的思维已经延伸到了那些原本被非市场价值观所主宰的生活领域：家庭生活和私人关系，健康和教育；环境保护和刑事司法；国家安全和公民生活

column1: Almost without realizing it, we have drifted from having market economies to becoming market societies.
column2: 几乎在无意识的情况下，我们从拥有市场经济漂流到了逐渐成为市场社会。

column1: The difference is this: A market economy is a tool – a valuable and effective tool – for organizing productive activity.
column2: 不同之处在于：市场经济组织生产活动的一种 — — 有价值且富有成效的 — — 工具。

column1: A market society, by contrast, is a place where almost everything is up for sale.
column2: 而相比之下市场社会则是一个几乎所有东西都可以用来出售的地方。

column1: It is a way of life in which market values seep into social relations and govern every domain.
column2: 这是一种市场价值观渗入社会关系并主宰每一个领域的生活方式。

column1: We should be worried about this trend for two reasons.
column2: 我们应当为此而感到忧虑，原因有二：首先，随着金钱在我们的社会中所占据的形象越来越高大。

column1: First, as money looms larger in our societies, affluence – and its absence – matters more.
column2: 富有 — — 或者不富有 — — 就变得越发重要。

column1: If the main advantages of affluence were the ability to afford yachts and fancy vacations, inequality would matter less than it does today.
column2: 如果富有的主要好处只不过在于能否支付得起游艇或者奢华假期，那么不平等在今时今日的重要性就不会那么大。

column1: But, as money comes to govern access to education, health care, political influence, and safe neighborhoods, life becomes harder for those of modest means.
column2: 但随着金钱开始主宰获取教育、医疗，政治影响力和社区安全的渠道，中下收入者的生活就变得越发艰难。

column1: The marketization of everything sharpens the sting of inequality.
column2: 所有事物的全盘市场化因此导致不平等状况对人的刺痛感不断增加。

column1: A second reason to resist putting a price tag on all human activities is that doing so can be corrupting.
column2: 第二个反对把所有人类活动都贴上价格标签的理由就是这样做可以是道德败坏的。

column1: Prostitution is a classic example.
column2: 其中卖淫堪称一个经典例子。

column1: Some object to it on the grounds that it typically exploits the poor, for whom the choice to sell their bodies may not be truly voluntary.
column2: 有些人反对卖淫，理由是这是典型的剥削穷人行为，因为那些选择去出卖自己肉体的人可能不是真正自愿的。

column1: But others object on the grounds that reducing sex to a commodity is inherently degrading and objectifying.
column2: 而另一些人反对的理由则是将性降格成一种商品是本来就是有辱人格且将人物质化的。

column1: The idea that market relations can corrupt higher goods is not restricted to matters of sex and the body.
column2: 这种市场关系可以腐蚀更高层次事物的理念可不仅仅局限在性和人的身体方面。

column1: It also applies to civic goods and practices.
column2: 它同样也适用于公共产品和实践。

column1: Consider voting. We don’t allow a free market in votes, even though such a market would arguably be “efficient,” in the economist’s sense of the term.
column2: 以投票为例，即便在经济学意义上把投票交给自由市场据说是“更为高效 ” ， 但我们也不会允许这样做。

column1: Many people don’t use their votes, so why let them go to waste?
column2: 既然许多人不会使用自己的投票权，那么为什么要让这些选票白白浪费了呢？

column1: Why not let those who don’t much care about an election’s outcome sell their vote to someone who does?
column2: 为什么不能让那些不在意选举结果的人把选票出售给其他在意的人？

column1: Both parties to the transaction would be better off.
column2: 须知在这场交易中双方都会得益啊。

column1: The best argument against a market in votes is that the vote is not a piece of private property; rather, it is a public responsibility.
column2: 但反对投票市场化的最有利论证则认为选票并不是一个私人财产，而是一项社会责任。

column1: To treat a vote as an instrument of profit would be to degrade it, to corrupt its meaning as an expression of civic duty.
column2: 将选票当成赚钱工具就等于贬低和腐蚀了其作为一种公民责任表现方式的意义。

column1: But, if a market in votes is objectionable because it corrupts democracy, what about systems of campaign finance (including the one currently in place in the United States) that give wealthy donors a disproportionate voice in elections?
column2: 然而如果因为腐蚀民主制度就可以反对一个选票市场，那么又该如何看待那些在选举中给予富有捐助者一个不相称的影响力的竞选筹款体制（包括美国当前这个 ） 。

column1: The reason to reject a market in votes – preserving the integrity of democracy – may be a reason to limit financial contributions to political candidates as well.
column2: 反对选票市场的理由 — — 维护民主制度的完整性 — — 或许也是一个限制对政治候选人实施经济资助的理由。

column1: Of course, we often disagree about what counts as “corrupting” or “degrading.”
column2: 当然，我们经常会在什么才算是“腐蚀”或“侮辱”上有不同意见。

column1: To decide whether prostitution is degrading, we have to decide how human sexuality is properly valued.
column2: 为了认定卖淫是否是种侮辱，我们得定义如何合理地评估人类性活动的价值。

column1: To decide whether selling prison-cell upgrades corrupts the meaning of criminal justice, we have to decide what purpose criminal punishment should serve.
column2: 为了认定升级监狱仓室是否侮辱了刑事司法制度，我们必须定义刑罚本身应当服务于什么样的目的。

column1: To decide whether we should allow the buying and selling of human organs for transplantation, or hire mercenaries to fight our wars, we have to think through hard questions about human dignity and civic responsibility.
column2: 为了认定是否应该放开人类器官移植或者使用雇佣兵参战，我们需要深刻思考与人类尊严和公民责任有关的问题。

column1: These are controversial questions, and we often try to avoid addressing them in public discourse.
column2: 这些都是些富有争议性的问题，而我们也常常试图避免在公共论述中提到它们。

column1: But that is a mistake.
column2: 但这是不对的。

column1: Our reluctance to engage morally contested questions in politics has left us ill-equipped to deliberate about one of the most important issues of our time: Where do markets serve the public good, and where do they not belong?
column2: 羞于在政治中提及存在道德冲突的问题使我们无力深刻思考我们时代中最重要的议题：市场究竟在哪些领域能促进公共福祉，而哪里又是市场不应涉足的地方？

column1: What Next after Failed Sanctions on Iran?
column2: 制裁伊朗无效又当如何？

column1: LOS ANGELES amp#45;amp#45; The approval of fresh sanctions on Iran marks the third time that the United Nations Security Council has been galvanized to stem the Islamic Republic’s feared uranium enrichment efforts.
column2: 联合国安理会行动起来制止伊朗令人担忧的铀浓缩行动以来已经第三次批准对伊朗实行新的制裁。

column1: Unfortunately, the new sanctions are unlikely to be any more effective than the first two rounds.
column2: 不幸的是，新的制裁不大可能比前两次更有效果。

column1: Consider the two earlier Security Council resolutions.
column2: 让我们来看一看前两次的安理会决议。

column1: The December 2006 resolution curbed international assistance to Iran in mastering the nuclear fuel cycle.
column2: 2006年12月的决议限制国际社会帮助伊朗掌握核燃料循环技术。

column1: The March 2007 resolution called for “vigilance and restraint” in the sale of heavy weapons to Iran and avoidance of new grants, financial assistance, or concessional loans.
column2: 2007年3月的决议则呼吁在向伊朗出售重型武器的时候要“审慎和克制 ” ， 并且避免新的赠款、财政援助或者减让性贷款。

column1: Neither moved the country’s ruling mullahs.
column2: 而统治伊朗的毛拉们对它们则无动于衷。

column1: Few expect a different outcome from the new sanctions, which authorize international interception of Iranian contraband and tightened monitoring of the regime’s financial institutions, along with travel limitations and asset freezes applied to people and companies involved in Iran’s nuclear program.
column2: 新的制裁授权国际社会拦截伊朗的违禁品，加紧监控该政权的金融机构并且对参与伊朗核子项目的人员和公司实施旅行限制和冻结资产，但是很少有人预计它们能够产生什么不同的结果。

column1: The failure of targeted UN sanctions should come as no surprise.
column2: 联合国有针对性的制裁未能奏效并不出人意外。

column1: The US has been on the sanctions treadmill for years.
column2: 美国多年来一直推动制裁。

column1: Between 2003 and 2007 the US Treasury Department brought litigation against 94 companies for violating the ban against trade and investment in Iran. The State Department imposed sanctions 111 times against foreign entities that engaged in proliferation or terrorism-related activities with Iran.
column2: 2003年至2007年间，美国财政部对49家违犯禁令与伊朗贸易并在该国投资的公司提起诉讼。 美国国务院对参与伊朗扩散或者与恐怖主义有关活动的外国实体实行了111次的制裁。

column1: And both departments have used their power to freeze financial assets or access to the US financial system.
column2: 这两个部门都使用了其权力来冻结金融资产或者禁止使用美国的金融系统。

column1: The results amounted to little more than a pin prick.
column2: 而制裁却无济于事。

column1: Iran’s nuclear programs continued to be financed by international commerce.
column2: 伊朗的核子项目继续得到国际贸易的资金。

column1: In 1994, Iran exported $37 billion in goods; by 2007, the figure had nearly doubled, to $70 billion.
column2: 1994年，伊朗出口了370亿美元的商品；到2007年，这一数字几乎翻倍，达到700亿美元。

column1: In roughly the same period, Iran’s imports also soared, from $22 billion in 1994 to $45 billion in 2006.
column2: 几乎在同一时期，伊朗的进口也大幅度增加，从1994年的220亿美元增加到2006年的450亿美元。

column1: Evaluating two decades of US sanctions to curb Iran’s nuclear appetite, the US Congress’s Government Accountability Office recently concluded that the results are “unclear,” adding with candid obliqueness that “some evidence, such as foreign firms signing contracts to invest in Iran’s energy and Iran’s continued proliferation efforts, raise questions about the extent of the sanctions’ impact.”
column2: 美国国会政府职责办公室回顾了二十年来美国为限制伊朗的核子胃口而对其实施的制裁，最近得出结论说其效果“不明朗 ” ， 并且用客气的语调说 ： “ 外国公司签署合同投资于伊朗的能源、伊朗继续扩散等证据对于制裁效果的大小提出了疑问 。 ”

column1: Not only have sanctions failed to halt Iran’s fuel cycle programs, but so have other avenues.
column2: 制裁不仅没有阻止伊朗的燃料循环项目，而且其他手段也无济于事。

column1: The European Union’s multiple offers of political and economic inducements went nowhere, as did cajoling by the International Atomic Energy Agency.
column2: 欧盟提供多种政治和经济引诱毫无成效，而国际原子能机构的诱胁也是如此。

column1: To be sure Iran offered, in 2005 and subsequently, to tether its program to international co-management, which arguably could have placed resident international monitors on site.
column2: 的确，伊朗曾经在2005年以及后来曾经提出将其核子项目处于国际共同管理之下，这样做无疑会将国际监督员派驻现场。

column1: But both the international community and Iran failed to follow through, and now that opportunity has increasingly become moot as Iranian engineers gain confidence in their handiwork.
column2: 但是国际社会和伊朗都没有跟进，而且随着伊朗的工程师对其工作增加了信心，这一机会日益无用。

column1: Some hope that the next US administration can stem Iran’s nuclear ambitions through bilateral diplomacy.
column2: 有些人希望，美国下届政府可以通过双边外交来阻止伊朗的核子野心。

column1: But Europe’s negotiating experience raises doubts about that prospect, as Iran remains unequivocal about never abandoning its nuclear fuel cycle program.
column2: 但是欧洲的谈判经历对这一前景提出了疑问，而伊朗也对绝不放弃核燃料循环项目毫不含糊。

column1: Assuming that concern over Iran’s nuclear “breakout” capacity mounts, this leaves the US and its allies with three options, each with its own risks.
column2: 假设对伊朗的核子突破能力的担忧不断增加，美国及其盟国就有三个选择，而每个选择都有各自的风险。

column1: First, a naval blockade (reminiscent of the Cuban missile crisis) that halted both Iran’s oil exports and imports of refined fuel would cripple the country’s economy.
column2: 首先，海上封锁(这让人回想其古巴导弹危机)中断伊朗的石油出口以及提炼燃料的进口将会让该国的经济限于瘫痪。

column1: But the US military would have to be able to prevent Iran from closing the Strait of Hormuz, through which much of the world’s oil supply passes.
column2: 但是美国军队不得不将要防止伊朗关闭霍尔穆兹海峡，世界石油供应的很大部分都通过这一海峡。

column1: A halt in Iran’s oil exports alone would dramatically upset international oil markets, and the Iranian leadership would likely dig in its heels to continue, if not accelerate, nuclear development.
column2: 仅仅是中止伊朗的石油出口就会大大打乱国际石油市场，而伊朗领导人将会坚持立场，如果不是加速、也会继续其核子发展计划。

column1: Second, while a military strike would slow Iran’s nuclear program, facilities could be rebuilt in the absence of inspectors to find and destroy remnants, regime change, and/or military occupation.
column2: 第二，尽管军事打击可以减缓伊朗的核子项目，在没有监察员在场或者军事占领以寻找和销毁残余以及政权改变的情况下，各种设施可以重建。

column1: Moreover, the attack shock could trigger Iranian vengeance regionally and elsewhere, with a global economic impact far exceeding that implied by a blockade.
column2: 而且，军事打击的冲击将会引发伊朗在该地区和其他地方实施报复，其对全球经济的影响要远远超过封锁。

column1: This leaves an unsettling fallback option.
column2: 这样就只有令人不安的撤回选择了。

column1: An Iran on the cusp of becoming a nuclear-armed state confronting a nuclear-armed Israel bringing its bomb out of the basement.
column2: 伊朗即将成为核武国家与具有核武器的以色列对峙。

column1: In that event, there remains the hope that mutual nuclear deterrence will promote mutual common sense.
column2: 在这一情形下，人们还是希望相互间的核子威摄将会促进相互间的人类常识。

column1: Absent a dramatic improvement in the Middle East’s grim political landscape, the failure of deterrence would bring the sum of all the fears of our nuclear age upon us.
column2: 在中东地区严峻的政治形势没有得到大幅度改善的情况下，威摄无力将会让核子时代的所有恐惧降临到我们头上。

column1: What Next After the Gaza Withdrawal?
column2: 加沙撤离之后又会是什么？

column1: The withdrawal of Israeli troops and the evacuation of Jewish settlers from Gaza, after 38 years of occupation, is the most recent proof of the limits of military power, even when that power is overwhelming.
column2: 在加沙长达38年的占领后，以色列军队的撤退和犹太定居点的撤离是军力限度的最新证明，即便军力再强大也不能例外。

column1: Now is the time to take stock of the lessons learned from the years of occupation and resistance in order to understand what Israelis and Palestinians should do next.
column2: 现在应该汲取从多年占领和反抗运动中得来的教训，进而了解以色列和巴勒斯坦人应该怎么做。

column1: To begin with, it is imperative to understand how much credit Palestinians can credibly claim for the Israeli withdrawal.
column2: 首先必须弄清巴勒斯坦人在以色列撤军中的贡献到底有多大。

column1: True, Palestinian resistance and sacrifices were a contributing factor in Ariel Sharon’s decision to reverse a policy he had espoused for decades. But it would be a mistake to attribute the Israeli withdrawal exclusively to Palestinian militancy.
column2: 没错，巴勒斯坦人的抵抗和牺牲对阿里埃勒·沙龙在摒弃和平政策几十年后的重新回归作出了贡献，但将以色列撤军完全归功于巴勒斯坦的抵抗肯定是错误的。

column1: After all, this bittersweet Israeli action was neither a clear result of military defeat nor a consequence of political negotiations.
column2: 毕竟，以色列实施这项苦乐参半的行动并非军事失败和政治谈判的明确结果。

column1: But unilateralism is not a rational long-term and effective policy, for it will not lead to a genuine and lasting peace in the Middle East.
column2: 但单方政策绝非合理有效的长期政策，因为它带不来中东地区真正的持久和平。

column1: Just as President Bush has discovered in Iraq, Sharon will also be forced to acknowledge the limits of his strategy.
column2: 正如布什总统在伊拉克学到的，沙龙也不得不承认自己政策的局限性。

column1: Unilateralism seems very expedient to shortsighted politicians, for it obviates the need for what they perceive as the mess of actual negotiations – that is, meeting their counterparts face to face and discovering the human results of their policies.
column2: 单边政策似乎是目光短浅的政客们最喜欢的权宜之计，因为这样就能避开一团乱麻似的艰苦谈判¾具体地讲，就是与对手面对面地进行交锋，从而弄清不同政策可能产生的人文后果。

column1: Going it alone also seems politically advantageous domestically, because leaders can decide how much and how far they want to carry out a particular policy.
column2: 自作主张也能在国内政治中拣到便宜，因为某项政策如何执行和执行到何种程度都由领导人自己决定。

column1: To be fair, unilateralism is convenient not only for a reluctant Israeli prime minister who does not wish to make substantial compromises during negotiations; it is also attractive to hard-line Palestinians who regard multilateralism as a means of pressing them to make unpopular concessions.
column2: 公平地讲，单边主义不仅对不愿在谈判中做出实质性让步的以色列总理有利，还能够吸引持强硬态度的巴勒斯坦人，在他们眼中，多边主义不过是一种手段，迫使他们做出不受欢迎的让步。

column1: In any case, the day after the completion of the Gaza withdrawal, Israelis and Palestinians will be confronted with important unresolved questions.
column2: 无论如何，加沙撤军完成后，以色列人和巴勒斯坦人还将面对重要的遗留问题。

column1: There is no doubt that the evacuation of Jewish settlers in areas that Israelis consider part of their God-given territory represents a huge ideological reversal.
column2: 勿庸置疑，犹太定居者撤出以色列人心目中的神赐之地的确代表了观念上的逆转。

column1: But after years of preaching and practicing one of Zionism’s main tenets, will the removal of settlements continue in the West Bank, or will this be a one-time exception?
column2: 但是在多年宣扬和实行犹太复国主义的主要原则后，撤除定居点的行动是将继续下去，还是将成为千古绝唱？

column1: Palestinians, for their part, will be expected to answer questions – in deeds, not just in words – about their ability to build a modern pluralistic state.
column2: 巴勒斯坦人需要回答的问题是：他们是否有能力建立现代的多元化国家，实际上，这个问题仅仅用语言回答是远远不够的。

column1: How will the Palestinian body politic deal with the growing power of the Islamic movements that undoubtedly will expect a significant share of power in post-withdrawal Gaza?
column2: 巴勒斯坦国将如何应对实力日益增强的伊斯兰运动，面对他们在撤军后的加沙不可忽视的权力要求？

column1: The international community also will have to answer some key questions.
column2: 国际社会也需要回答一些重要的问题。

column1: According to the Palestinian Economic Council for Reconstruction and Development (PECDAR), annual per capita income in Gaza continues to average roughly $700, while Israelis enjoy incomes averaging a $16,000 per capita.
column2: 据巴勒斯坦发展和重建经济理事会（PECDAR）统计，加沙地带的年人均收入继续维持在大约700美元，而以色列的人均收入却达到了16，000美元。

column1: In the absence of relatively well-paying jobs, what will happen to the lines of unemployed Gazans?
column2: 由于缺乏相对高薪的职业机会，失业的加沙人未来又将如何？

column1: The potential flight of employment seekers – a formidable force worldwide – is only one problem.
column2: 加沙人为了求职可能会背井离乡，这虽然是一个世界性的难题，但却仅仅是问题的一个方面。

column1: More immediately, if Gazan families are not well fed, the recurrence of cross-border violence, if not the eruption of a third intifada, will only be a matter of time.
column2: 更直接的后果是如果加沙家庭的生活继续窘迫下去，那么爆发跨边界暴力，甚至是第三次就地起义都只是一个时间问题。
