column1: While the economic situation in Gaza is a critical issue, the future of the Palestinian-Israeli conflict will be determined mainly by the next steps in the peace process.
column2: 加沙的经济形势正处在危急关头，而巴以冲突的未来将主要取决于和平进程中的后续步骤。

column1: Permanent-status issues concerning borders, the West Bank, Jerusalem, and refugees must be dealt with bilaterally.
column2: 与边界、西岸、耶路撒冷和难民相关的永久性地位问题必须通过双边努力才能得以解决。

column1: Any serious observer of the Palestinian-Israeli conflict will no doubt acknowledge that there can be no unilateral solution to these issues.
column2: 巴以冲突的任何认真的观察者都无疑会承认：上述问题不可能找到单边的解决方案。

column1: As for the peace process’s multilateral guarantors, the United States and its quartet partners – the European Union, the United Nations, and Russia – have failed to provide even the most basic facts regarding Israel’s withdrawal or how it relates to the “road map” agreed in 2003.
column2: 至于和平进程的多边担保人，美国及其四重奏表演的搭档，欧盟、联合国和俄国，甚至未能就有关以色列撤军的最基本事实或与2003年路线图计划的关系达成一致。

column1: They cannot continue to sit on the sidelines.
column2: 他们再也不能冷眼旁观了。

column1: Washington’s quixotic decision to call Israel’s unilateral move part of the road map has failed to convince many Palestinians.
column2: 华盛顿将以色列单边行动纳入路线图计划的幻想对多数巴勒斯坦人来讲根本没有说服力。

column1: The prevailing opinion among Palestinians is that the road map will be put into deep freeze once the Israelis complete their Gaza withdrawal.
column2: 巴勒斯坦人中普遍流行的观点是：一旦以色列完成从加沙的撤军，路线图计划就会进入深度休眠的状态。

column1: But the Palestinian and Israeli peoples, their leaders, and the international community must all respond to the challenges that will follow.
column2: 但巴勒斯坦���、以色列人、两国领袖和国际社会都必须对接踵而来的挑战做出反应。

column1: Most importantly, the future of the conflict and the chances for genuine peace in the region will depend on understanding the limits of offensive military power, defensive resistance, and unilateralism.
column2: 最为重要的是，巴以冲突的未来和真正实现地区和平的机遇将会取决于人们是否了解进攻性军事力量、防御性自卫和单边主义各自的局限。

column1: Serious face-to-face talks, in accordance to international law and with the help of the international community, are the only way forward.
column2: 取决于人们能否在国际社会的帮助下，按照国际法的规定进行认真的面对面谈判。 这才是解决问题的唯一出路。

column1: What Next After the Likud Referendum?
column2: 利库德公决之后的巴以局势

column1: Prime Minister Ariel Sharon's proposal for a unilateral Israeli withdrawal from the Gaza Strip and part of the West Bank has been overwhelmingly defeated by a referendum within his own party, Likud, in what seems to be a humiliating defeat.
column2: 阿里尔•沙龙总理企图让以色列从约旦河西岸和加沙地带单方面撤离的提议被其所在政党"利库德集团"的公决所否定。

column1: Yet this is likely to have little or no effect on Sharon's intention to carry through with the plan.
column2: 这次失败看似个奇耻大辱，但它似乎完全没有影响沙龙实施这项计划的意图。

column1: At first, this seems surprising, since he said before the referendum that he would abide by its outcome.
column2: 乍一看这有点让人惊讶。 因为他在全党公决以前曾表示会遵守表决的结果。

column1: But Sharon is 75 years old and probably within two years of retirement.
column2: 但沙龙已是75岁高龄，并且有可能在两年内退休。

column1: He is determined that his plan becomes his political legacy.
column2: 他是决心要让这项计划成为其政治遗策。

column1: Since there is no precedent for a party referendum, he can argue that the vote does not bind him.
column2: 由于从未有过党内公决的先例，他可以争辩说自己不受表决结果束缚。

column1: Moreover, Sharon made sure that his main political rivals - notably former Prime Minister Benjamin (Bibi) Netanyahu - supported his plan.
column2: 此外，沙龙还确保了其主要的政治对手-特别是前总理本杰明•内塔尼亚胡-支持他的计划。

column1: They are now in no position to challenge him as the champions of the opposition within Likud.
column2: 如此一来，他们现在就不能以利库德集团内部反对派的拥护者的身份对他发起挑战了。

column1: So while some members may walk out, Sharon can easily hold on to control of the party.
column2: 因此，虽然有些党员可能弃他而去，沙龙也能轻易地控制党内的局面。

column1: In addition, many Sharon supporters, torn by what they saw as the plan's combination of costs and benefits, stayed home or even voted against it, but still want Sharon as their leader.
column2: 另外，许多沙龙的支持者在这项计划所包含的成本和利益之间进退两难。 他们有的弃权，有的甚至投票反对，但仍然都希望沙龙担任他们的领导。

column1: But Sharon is prepared to go even further in taking political risks to push through the withdrawal.
column2: 但沙龙已经准备好承担政治风险，进一步推进他的撤离计划。

column1: Small right-wing parties in his coalition have already announced that his determination to do so will make them walk out of the government.
column2: 沙龙联合政府中的一些右翼小党派已经宣称如果沙龙决心实施这项计划就会使他们退出政府。

column1: Sharon will then turn to the leader of the opposition, 80-year-old former prime minister Shimon Peres, to form a national unity government.
column2: 在那样的形势下，沙龙会转而寻求反对派领导人，80岁高龄的前首相西蒙•佩雷斯的支持，组建国家团结政府。

column1: And Peres is ready to do so.
column2: 佩雷斯已做好了准备。

column1: The passionate debate stirred up by Sharon's plan shows how truly revolutionary his proposal is.
column2: 沙龙的计划所引起的激烈辩论反映了他的建议多么具有革命性。

column1: Having the army uproot Jewish settlements - with inevitable scenes of settlers resisting and being dragged off - will be a traumatic event for the country.
column2: 让军队拆除犹太人定居点-不可避免的引发定居者抗拒然后被拖走的场面-这会给这个国家造成创伤。

column1: The plan also entails considerable strategic risks, which, probably more than the prospect of uprooted settlements, account for the large "no" by Likud members.
column2: 这项计划还会带来比拆除定居点更为巨大的战略风险，即引发利库德集团内部多数人的反对之声。

column1: A key concern is the precedent of withdrawal from southern Lebanon in 2000.
column2: 2000年从黎巴嫩南部撤离的前车之鉴让人不由得对沙龙的撤离计划担忧。

column1: Today, most Israelis believe that this step, though justified on strategic grounds in the face of constant attacks by the Lebanese group Hizbollah, convinced Palestinians that violence worked.
column2: 今天，大多数的以色列人认为上一次撤离虽然是在不断遭受黎巴嫩Hizbollah组织攻击之下的正确战略决策，但也让巴勒斯坦人相信暴力是有用的。

column1: In the same manner, a withdrawal from Gaza, many people worry, will bring increased anarchy there and a rise in overall terrorist attacks.
column2: 同样，许多人担心从加沙地带撤离会加剧该地区的无政府状态和全面的恐怖袭击。

column1: But convinced - as are most Israelis - that there is no Palestinian partner ready to negotiate seriously and implement its promises, the prime minister wants to prepare for an extended interim period.
column2: 但正如大多数的以色列人一样，沙龙首相也确信巴勒斯坦人并不准备进行认真的谈判并履行他们的承诺。 所以他要为一段延长的过渡期做准备。

column1: Assuming that terrorist attacks against Israel are going to continue under any circumstances, he seeks to improve the country's strategic position to handle this war.
column2: 假定恐怖分子对以色列的袭击在任何情况下都会继续，他正寻求改善以色列控制这场战争的战略地位。

column1: Combined with the long-completed security fence around the Gaza Strip and one being built near Israel's border with the West Bank, pulling out of the most exposed positions is intended to reduce casualties and the number of clashes with the Palestinians.
column2: 结合包围加沙地带的早已完工的安全屏障和正在以色列和约旦河西岸边界修建的屏障，以色列从最无掩护的地方撤退是为了减少伤亡和与巴勒斯坦人的冲突。

column1: A secondary intention is to show the world that Israel is ready to withdraw from most of the remaining territories it captured in 1967 in exchange for real peace.
column2: 第二层意图则是向世界显示以色列准备从其在1967年占领的大多数领土撤退以换取真正的和平。

column1: The United States and Britain have supported the withdrawal plan, while most other European countries have been critical.
column2: 美英两国对撤退计划表示支持，而大多数欧洲国家则持批评态度。

column1: While demanding an Israeli withdrawal for years, the Palestinian leadership opposes Sharon's plan, arguing it is intended to create permanent borders.
column2: 虽然巴勒斯坦领导层长久以来一直要求以色列撤离，但他们此次却反对沙龙的计划，认为这是想要制造永久的边界。

column1: Nevertheless, if implemented, Sharon's proposal would leave them in control of about 99 percent of the Gaza Strip and roughly 50 percent of the West Bank.
column2: 可无论如何，如果该计划得以实施，巴勒斯坦人将会控制约99%的加沙地带和约旦河西岸近50%的土地。

column1: If it appears that the withdrawal will proceed and Sharon can assemble a government to implement it, the Palestinian side will then face a major challenge.
column2: 如果撤离会得以实施且沙龙有能力组建一个政府来实施该计划，那么巴勒斯坦方面就会面临一个巨大的挑战。

column1: Will it be able to put together an effective governmental authority to rule the Gaza Strip, or will that area dissolve into bloody battles among Palestinian factions and a staging area for attacks into Israel that will bring reprisal raids?
column2: 他们有能力组建一个政府性的机构去管理加沙地带吗？ 抑或该地区会陷入巴勒斯坦血腥的派系斗争之中并成为发动会招致以色列报复性打击的恐怖袭击的基地呢？

column1: A key issue in this mix is the division of power between the nationalist Fatah group and the Islamist Hamas organization.
column2: 这个问题的关键是民族主义的"法塔赫"组织和伊斯兰主义的"哈马斯"之间的权力分化。

column1: Local Fatah officials want support from their leader, Yassir Arafat, to take firm control of the territory.
column2: 当地的"法塔赫"官员希望得到其领导人阿拉法特的支持以牢固地控制该领土。

column1: But Arafat has shown a willingness to let groups act as they please, apparently believing that continuing unrest will bring international sympathy and intervention on his behalf.
column2: 但阿拉法特的表现却像是希望该组织内的不同利益集团自行其是，明显是希望继续的不安定局面会引来国际社会的同情和干预。

column1: Yet Arafat himself will be 75 in a few months and is clearly reaching the end of his career.
column2: 而阿拉法特自己在几个月后就75岁，已经到了其政治生涯的尽头。

column1: He has been the only leader his movement has ever known, having led Fatah for 40 years and the Palestinians as a whole for 35 years.
column2: 在领导了"法塔赫"40年及全体巴勒斯坦人35年之后，他是其所发起的运动中唯一一位被公众熟悉的领导者。

column1: With no apparent successor, his departure from the scene will bring a massive and unpredictable shake-up in Palestinian politics.
column2: 在没有指明继任者的情况下，他的离开会给巴勒斯坦政局带来巨大的，不可预知的动荡。

column1: The Israeli government's projection has been that both the withdrawal and the security fence will be completed by the end of 2005.
column2: 按照以色列政府的构想，撤离计划和安全屏障都会在2005年底完成。

column1: Sharon's retirement is likely to come within another twelve months, with a new opposition leader having to be chosen as well.
column2: 沙龙极有可能在未来的12个月内退休，而同期的巴勒斯坦也存在领导人更替的问题。

column1: Thus, while the Likud referendum seems to have left the Israeli-Palestinian dispute at yet another impasse, both sides are on the verge of enormous changes.
column2: 因此，虽然利库德的全党公决似乎使以巴争端陷入了另一个僵局，但双方的政局都处在巨变的边缘。

column1: What Next for Europe?
column2: 欧洲何去何从？

column1: In many ways, 2005 has been Europe’s annus horibilis.
column2: 在很多方面，2005年对于欧洲而言都是不堪回首。

column1: It began well, when Spanish voters approved the draft European Union constitution, but it turned sour when French and Dutch voters spurned it soon after.
column2: 年初西班牙选民批准欧盟宪法时开局顺利。 但是，当法国和荷兰选民不久拒绝该宪法时，形势就急转而下。

column1: Those votes partly reflected displeasure with domestic policies, and partly disappointment with the way governments conduct European affairs.
column2: 那些选民拒绝宪法，部分是由于不满国内政策，部分则是对政府处理欧洲事务的方式感到失望。

column1: Governments promptly obliged with more of the same.
column2: 欧洲各国政府随即变本加厉。

column1: Within days of the votes, they failed to agree on the EU budget for 2007-13.
column2: 投票几天后，它们未能就2007年到2013年的欧盟预算达成一致。

column1: French and British leaders engaged in a heated quarrel that derailed the subsequent summit, before Britain assumed the rotating six-month EU presidency in July.
column2: 英国在七月就任欧盟轮值主席国前，法英两国领导人争吵不休，使得欧盟峰会不欢而散。

column1: Normally, countries use their EU presidencies to display their ability to solve problems and move the Union forward.
column2: 通常，各国会利用轮值主席国的时机来展示其有能力解决问题并推动欧盟前进。

column1: But, as of early December, Britain has remained dormant.
column2: 但是，直至12月初，英国却保持低沉。

column1: Besides burying the draft constitution, it has largely sidestepped the budget issue.
column2: 除了终止欧盟宪法外，它还大体上绕过了预算问题。

column1: Chances that it gets the budget approved this year are slim, and, unless the dispute is resolved soon, the Union will not have an operational budget by 2007.
column2: 今年内批准这一预算的机会渺茫，而且，除非马上解决争端，否则，到2007年欧盟将没有一个运营预算。

column1: Even if a budget is adopted, there is no lack of depressing business for the Austrian presidency, which starts on January 1.
column2: 即使批准预算，当奥地利在1月1日就任轮值主席国之时，棘手的问题也会堆积如山。

column1: The deepest problem is Europe’s inability to grow at more than a snail’s pace and to provide jobs to its citizens.
column2: 最为严重的问题是，欧洲经济增长迟缓，无法提供就业机会。

column1: This is mostly due to the Big Three – France, Germany, and Italy – which produce 70% of Europe’s GDP.
column2: 这主要是由于欧盟三大国的问题，即法国、德国和意大利。 三国的国民生产总值占欧洲的70 ％ 。

column1: The collective response, adopted in 2000, has been the “Lisbon Strategy,” which aims at making the EU “the most dynamic and competitive knowledge-based economy in the world” by 2010.
column2: 2000年采取的联合举动是所谓的“里斯本战略 ” ， 其目标是将欧盟在2010年前变成“世界上最富活力和竞争力的知识经济体 ” 。

column1: More realistically, it is designed to provide governments with the incentive to undertake the reforms that stimulate economic growth and productivity.
column2: 出于更为现实的原因，这一战略激励各国政府实施改革，解决抑制经济增长和生产效率的问题。

column1: That means facing down the myriad interest groups – from industry lobbies to trade unions and entrenched bureaucracies – that have (so far) successfully protected their turfs.
column2: 这就意味着抵制难以计数的从产业游说团体到工会乃至地位稳固的官僚组织等利益集团。 目前为止，它们成功地保护了它们的既得利益。

column1: The strategy rests on peer pressure, naming and shaming governments that fail to make progress.
column2: 里斯本战略依赖于同等地位者的压力，点名未能取得进展的政府并使其蒙羞。

column1: In practice, however, peer pressure has become peer collusion.
column2: 然而在实际上，这一压力成为串通。

column1: When EU leaders met last spring to assess progress, they pitifully recognized that the Lisbon Strategy’s goal was unlikely to be met.
column2: 今年春季欧盟领导人开会评估进展之时，他们可怜地承认里斯本战略的目标难以实现。

column1: The best that they could do now would be to dump the pretense of a strategy and carry on with the other business.
column2: 他们所能做的是放弃战略的托辞而着手其他事务。

column1: Unfortunately, the host of the 2000 summit was José Manuel Barroso, then Prime Minister of Portugal and current President of the European Commission, who has staked his presidency on the Lisbon Strategy.
column2: 不幸的是，2000年欧盟峰会的东道主是当时的葡萄牙首相和现任欧盟委员会主席巴罗佐。 他将欧盟委员会主席的成败系于里斯本战略。

column1: Expect him to push on hopelessly.
column2: 可以想见他知其不可为而为之。

column1: One of the few good ideas contained in the Lisbon Strategy was to remove barriers to trade in services.
column2: 里斯本战略包含的少数明智之策是消除服务贸易壁垒。

column1: Intra-European competition in services is restricted by innumerable national regulations that, for instance, strictly determine the requirements for becoming a hairdresser or a plumber.
column2: 欧盟各国内部难以计数的规章限制了各国间服务业竞争。 例如，有的规定成为理发师或水管工的条件要求。

column1: One of the defining features of the past decades is the sharp increase in services productivity in the US; none of that happened in Europe.
column2: 过去十年最显著的特征是美国的服务业生产效率大幅提高，而欧洲则悄无声息。

column1: Guess why.
column2: 猜一猜原因。

column1: Because services account for 70% of European GDP, the potential impact from enhanced competition is substantial.
column2: 由于服务业占欧洲GDP的70 ％ ， 提高竞争后可能造成的影响剧烈。

column1: But removing protection is always politically difficult.
column2: 但是，消除保护总归在政治上难以做到。

column1: The European Commission submitted a proposal in 2005 – just as the constitution was being put up for a vote.
column2: 欧盟委员会在2005年欧盟宪法全民公决时提出一项建议。

column1: Not surprisingly, the proposal was quickly shelved.
column2: 不出所料，这一建议立即被束之高阁。

column1: Now, with countless private interest groups trying to water it down into irrelevance, the battle will be firmly on the EU’s agenda in 2006.
column2: 现在，众多的私营利益集团试图削弱这一建议使其无关痛痒。 这一斗争将无疑提上欧盟2006年的议事日程。

column1: At the same time, Europe is again blocking progress in the Doha round of world trade talks, with the farmers’ lobby fighting to preserve its subsidies.
column2: 同时，由于欧洲农民抗争要求保留补贴，欧洲再一次阻挡世界贸易组织多哈回合谈判的进展。

column1: Many governments are so fearful of their farmers that they see no other option than to hold their ground, no matter what.
column2: 众多国家政府惧怕农民，从而除坚持立场外别无他途。

column1: Europe has agreed to a single trade policy.
column2: 欧洲有统一的贸易政策。

column1: When disagreements run as deep as they do on agriculture, there can be no give-and-take of the kind that allows for successful negotiations.
column2: 如果分歧正如农业问题一般严重，则毫无妥协退让可言，惶论谈判成功。

column1: There is little reason for optimism.
column2: 对前景也就毫不乐观。

column1: And what next for the ECB, which has just nudged up interest rates by 0.25%, after 30 months on hold.
column2: 欧洲中央银行在30个月纹丝不动后新近将利率提升0.25 ％ 。 其前景如何呢？

column1: Experts can disagree about whether the move was premature, but no one agrees with the many political leaders who have argued that the tiny hike will derail the timid resumption of economic growth.
column2: 专家对于升息是否过早可能见仁见智，但是并无人同意政治领导人的观点，即利率微升会破坏微弱的经济增长复苏。

column1: The sharpness of political attacks on the ECB might trigger dangerous talk about restricting its independence.
column2: 对于欧洲央行尖锐的政治抨击可能引发有关限制其独立性的讨论。

column1: While such a move is out of the question – it would require a change in the European Treaty – the noise is unhealthy.
column2: 尽管这一举措需要修改欧盟条约而不可能，但是这一噪音却并不健康。

column1: It distracts the ECB, adds to the impression that Europe is bad, and, more importantly, will be used by ineffective governments as a scapegoat for their failings.
column2: 它干扰欧洲央行，增加了欧洲有害的印象，而且，更为重要的是，无能为力的政府可以此为其失策寻找替罪羊。

column1: Expect more ECB-bashing.
column2: 将会有更多的对欧洲央行的抨击。

column1: Is Europe stuck?
column2: 欧洲是否陷入泥潭？

column1: The current team of leaders has been an enormous disappointment.
column2: 目前的欧洲领导人团队令人大失所望。

column1: But as they fade away, there could be some light at the end of the tunnel.
column2: 但是随着他们的淡出，隧道尽头可能会出现亮光。

column1: In Germany, Chancellor Angela Merkel is obviously more positive on Europe and more pro-reform than her predecessor, but she is tied up in a grand coalition.
column2: 在德国，默克尔总���与她的前任相比更为肯定欧洲并更为亲改革，但是她却受大联合政府的束缚。

column1: In France, President Jacques Chirac, the epitome of a leader captured by his lobbies, is staggering impotently toward the end of his term in 2007.
column2: 在法国，作为被其游说集团俘虏的缩影，希拉克总统正虚弱无力地踟蹰迈向2007年任期届满。 继任者中的两位佼佼者德维尔潘和萨尔科齐都在政府任职。

column1: The two frontrunners to succeed him, Dominique de Villepin and Nicolas Sarkozy, both in government, compete on a reformist agenda, but pre-election years do not encourage bold moves.
column2: 他们在改革议程上互不相让。 然而，大选前几年里并不鼓励大胆的举措。

column1: Meanwhile, Italy must decide whether it replaces Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi, who displayed no interest in reform and European affairs, with the cautious Romano Prodi, the former European Commission President.
column2: 与此同时，意大利必须决定是否用前任欧盟委员会主席普罗狄更换对改革和欧洲事务毫无兴趣的总理贝鲁斯科尼。

column1: Tony Blair, once an ardent pro-European (at least by Britain’s undemanding standards), might finally have to cede power to Gordon Brown, who is famously cold to European integration.
column2: 至少根据英国松软的标准，英国首相布莱尔曾经是热烈的亲欧洲派。 他可能最终让位给布朗，而布朗对欧洲联合冷漠众所周知。

column1: Fortunately, Britain has always been an outsider.
column2: 幸运的是，英国素来是欧洲联合的局外人。

column1: In the end, whatever light there is, it may not shine until 2007, after the French elections.
column2: 最终，在法国2007年总统大选前，无论有何光亮都不会闪烁。

column1: What Next in Afghanistan?
column2: 阿富汗，下一步怎么办？

column1: BERLIN – Afghanistan’s future does not look good.
column2: 柏林 — — 阿富汗前景不妙。

column1: The Taliban are gaining military and political strength, and President Hamid Karzai is losing support at home and internationally due to his administration’s rampant corruption and the obvious fraud committed in his re-election.
column2: 塔利班在军事、政治上日益坐大，总统哈米德·卡尔扎伊在国内、国外渐失人心 — — 他的政府太过腐败，而他的再度当选则明显存在舞弊。

column1: Weariness with the war is spreading in the United States, where President Barack Obama finds it difficult to decide about an increase in troops, as demanded by his own generals.
column2: 美国国内的厌战情绪不断蔓延，于是乎贝拉克·奥巴马总统增兵阿富汗的命令迟迟难以下达，尽管他的将军已一再敦促。

column1: European NATO members with troops in Afghanistan would prefer to withdraw them today rather than tomorrow.
column2: 在阿富汗驻有军队的欧洲北约成员国则一门心思地想要早日抽身而出。

column1: The West seems to have lost its orientation in the Hindu Kush – that “graveyard of empires,” as it was called after the British disaster in January 1842, when only one man survived an expedition 16,000.
column2: 西方国家似乎在兴都库什山区迷失了方向 — — 1842年1月，第一次英阿战争期间，一支1万6千人的英国远征军在此遭阿富汗军袭击，仅一人生还，这一带由此得名“帝国的坟墓 ” 。

column1: What, many people are asking, is NATO really fighting for in Afghanistan?
column2: 许多人质疑，北约在阿富汗，究竟为什么而战？

column1: Europe remains silent on that question and has only one aim: to get out.
column2: 欧洲对此质疑仍避而不答，心里只想着如何脱身。

column1: In the US, the debate about the purposes being served in Afghanistan is at least still taking place.
column2: 在美国，至少还有人辩论，继续阿富汗战争意义何在。

column1: Follow it, and you will conclude that, ultimately, the war is all about the American superpower’s military victory over the Taliban, so that it can finally withdraw its troops – for a second time.
column2: 细究下去，你将得出结论：说到底，阿富汗战争打到这个份上，作为超级大国的美国，其目的无非是从军事上彻底打败塔利班，好让自己的军队最终能够撤出来 — — 这将是美国第二次从阿富汗撤军。

column1: The source or meaning of the conflict in Afghanistan is impossible to find in the country itself.
column2: 发生在阿富汗的战争有什么意义，答案不可能在阿富汗内部找到。

column1: Afghanistan is the battlefield, but the causes of the wars that have devastated it since the mid-1970’s were and are still to be found beyond its borders.
column2: 阿富汗只是外部势力的角斗场而已，自20世纪70年代以来，这里爆发的历次战争，根源都在国外。

column1: So an exclusively “Afghan solution” is not possible.
column2: 所以，想找到一种局限于阿富汗的“阿富汗解决方案 ” ， 只是痴人说梦。

column1: Three dates are central to understanding today’s Afghan quagmire: 1989, 2001, and 2003.
column2: 要理解今日的阿富汗泥潭，有三个年份必须牢记：1989、2001和2003。

column1: In 1989, when the Cold War ended, the Red Army had already withdrawn from the country, thereby admitting its defeat.
column2: 1989年，冷战告终，苏联从阿富汗撤军，实质上承认在苏阿战争中失败。 美国也随即撤出。

column1: Following the Soviet Union, the US withdrew from the conflict, too, and at that moment, the second Afghan war started – a proxy war between regional neighbors over power in the Hindu Kush, disguised as a civil war.
column2: 于是阿富汗内战再度爆发 — — 说是内战，其实是一场代理人战争，是盘踞在兴都库什山区和武装力量和邻近的各部武装之间的一场混战。

column1: Supported by Saudi Arabia, Pakistan sought strategic depth against its arch-enemy India with the help of militant religious students from Afghan refugee camps. These “Taliban” were created and equipped by the Pakistani secret service, the ISI.
column2: 为了寻求战略纵深以对抗世仇印度，巴基斯坦在沙特阿拉伯的支持下，以阿富汗难民营好战的宗教学生为班底拉起一支队伍 — — 由巴基斯坦三军情报局（ISI）一手组建和武装起来的“塔利班 ” 。

column1: Iran defended its own interests and those of the Shia minority in the west of the country.
column2: 为了本国利益，也为了保护阿富汗西部地区的少数派 — — 什叶派穆斯林，伊朗也介入了阿富汗。

column1: And in the north, the Tajik Northern Alliance and Abdul Rashid Dostum’s Uzbek militia were supported and equipped by Afghanistan’s northern neighbors and Russia.
column2: 在阿富汗北部，塔吉克族背景的北部同盟和阿卜杜勒·拉希德·杜斯塔姆领导的乌兹别克族武装背后则是阿富汗的北方邻国和俄罗斯。

column1: In the shadow of this second Afghan war, Osama bin Laden established his terrorist organization in Taliban-ruled Afghanistan: Al Qaeda, which, on September 11, 2001, carried out its terrible terrorist attack on the US.
column2: 在阿富汗内战的背景下，奥萨马·本·拉登在塔利班统治下的阿富汗创建了恐怖组织 — — “基地组织 ” 。 该组织于2001年9月11日对美国发动了骇人听闻的恐怖袭击。

column1: A month later, the current war in Afghanistan started.
column2: 一个月之后，目前的这场阿富汗战争开打。

column1: In March 2003, George W. Bush launched his invasion of Iraq, not only squandering America’s military strength, but also connecting all the individual crises between the eastern Mediterranean and the Indus Valley.
column2: 2003年3月，时任美国总统的乔治·W·布什入侵伊拉克，这一决策非常愚蠢，不仅耗费了美国大量军力，而且促使地中海以东到印度河流域广大地区原先互不相干的几个冲突点连成了一片。

column1: As a result of America’s foreign-policy folly, Iran became the central geo-political player in the entire region, linking the western and eastern part of this long belt of instability.
column2: 美国对外政策上的昏招令伊朗成为整个区域的地缘政治核心力量，成为连结起该区域东西地带不稳定因素的桥梁。

column1: So, those who are grappling with the Afghan riddle today should consider, first and foremost, the regional realities: can the West afford to withdraw?
column2: 所以，我奉劝那些正为阿富汗焦头烂额的人们，首先好好思考一下这一地区的现实：西方国家能否承受从阿富汗撤军所要付出的代价？

column1: If so, we should pull out of Afghanistan immediately.
column2: 如果能，我们就立即撤出阿富汗。

column1: If not, we should stop discussing an “exit strategy.”
column2: 如果不能，我们就别再为讨论什么“推出战略”而白费唇舌了。

column1: The cost of the West’s retreat from this troubled region is predictable, since we must deal with several threats that endanger Western security, and that would not disappear with withdrawal from Iraq and Afghanistan: terrorism, Islamist radicalism, nuclear threats (Pakistan, Iran), proxy wars and regional conflicts (Israel-Palestine, Iraq, Afghanistan, and Kashmir), and looming disintegration (Iraq, Afghanistan, Pakistan, and in the longer term in the Persian Gulf and the Arabian Peninsula).
column2: 西方国家从这一混乱地区撤军的代价是可以预估的。 西方安全的几大威胁并不会随着从伊拉克和阿富汗撤军而消失：恐怖主义、伊斯兰极端势力、核威胁（巴基斯坦与伊朗 ） 、 代理人战争、地区冲突（巴以冲突、伊拉克、阿富汗和克什米尔地区）以及愈演愈烈的脱离国际秩序中���倾向（伊拉克、阿富汗、巴基斯坦，从长远来看还包括波斯湾以及阿拉伯半岛 ） 。

column1: This means that we cannot talk about withdrawing our troops, but only of redrawing the battle line farther West.
column2: 这说明，西方国家完全撤军根本是不可能的，最多是向西收缩战线。

column1: It is extremely doubtful that such a step would bring more security.
column2: 即便走向西收缩战线这一步棋，是否会使安全形势得到很大改善，也是极其值得怀疑的一件事。

column1: On the other hand, the West’s strategy in Afghanistan up to now has also yielded little progress, only strengthening the Taliban day by day.
column2: 但另一方面，西方国家的阿富汗战略到目前为止也没有取得多大进展，反而一天天壮大了塔利班。

column1: So what should we do?
column2: 如此进退维谷之际，我们应当怎么做？

column1: First, we need to define a clear political goal: a stable status quo in Afghanistan that will prevent the country from again becoming a battlefield of regional interests and an organizational base for Al Qaeda.
column2: 首先，我们得树立一个明确的政治目标：在不打破现状的前提下稳定阿富汗局势，防止这个国家再次沦为地区博弈的战场，或者成为基地组织的庇护所和大本营。

column1: Without a sufficient military presence, as well as improved and reinforced reconstruction efforts, this goal is not attainable.
column2: 要实现这一目标，需要充足的军力投入和更有效的重建努力，两者缺一不可。

column1: Second, a renewed regional consensus on Afghanistan’s future would also help avoid further destabilizing nuclear-armed Pakistan.
column2: 其次，协调各方，就阿富汗的前途达成共识。 这也有助于遏止巴基斯坦进一步滑向内乱，要知道巴基斯坦可是拥有核武器的国家。

column1: This requires that Pakistan’s and Iran’s interests be included in this consensus, as well as India’s, Saudi Arabia’s and probably also China’s. (The Kashmir conflict must, indirectly, play a role in this settlement, but the difficulties of including it should not be underestimated.)
column2: 这样一个共识必须照顾到巴基斯坦、伊朗、印度、沙特阿拉伯甚至中国的利益（克什米尔地区冲突必然会间接影响这一共识的形成，不过要把它纳入议程的难度不容低估 ） 。

column1: Forging this consensus will not be an easy diplomatic task.
column2: 促成这一共识并不是一个轻松的外交使命，但它并非不可完成。

column1: But it is feasible and should be the goal of a new conference on Afghanistan.
column2: 应召开一次新的阿富汗问题国际会议，把这个目标明确起来。

column1: Third, a parallel effort at crisis containment – and perhaps even at finding solutions – is needed for the wider Middle East, Iraq, the Persian Gulf, and Iran.
column2: 第三，与此同时，需要在中东、伊拉克、波斯湾和伊朗也就是更广大的中东地区缓和危机，甚至寻求解决方案。

column1: It’s an equation with very many known unknowns, but if we do not try at least to mitigate these issues, the known unknowns will continue challenging all partial solutions.
column2: 我们早已意识到，这一进程充满未知变数，但如果我们连试都不试，这些已经意识到的未知数必将继续挑战一切局部性的解决方案。

column1: But the big question remains whether the US and its European allies still have the strength, perseverance and far-sightedness for such an undertaking.
column2: 说一千，道一万，根本的问题在于，美国及其欧洲盟友是否还有足够的实力、坚毅与远见来承担这一使命。

column1: There are good reasons to doubt this.
column2: 人们有理由怀疑。

column1: The alternative would be a chaotic and dangerous future in this large hot spot.
column2: 但如果我们不这样做，这个大“火药桶”就势必面临一个混乱而危险的前景。

column1: Afghanistan may seem far away, but its chaos and violence are in fact just next door.
column2: 阿富汗看似遥远，但那里的混乱和暴力其实就是我们家门口的威胁。

column1: What Now In the Middle East?
column2: 中东现在该怎么办？

column1: The political and security situation in the vast region between the Indus Valley and the shores of the Eastern Mediterranean is a cause for grave concern.
column2: 从印度河到地中海东海岸之间地域广阔，政治和安全形势却不容乐观。

column1: When the US intervened militarily in Iraq in 1991, the intention was to effect fundamental change in the entire region.
column2: 1991年，美军抱着给整个地区带来根本性变化的初衷入侵伊拉克。

column1: Today it is clear that hardly any aspect of this policy has succeeded. Even the success of free elections in Iraq is threatening to divide rather than unite the country.
column2: 到今天，形势已经渐趋明朗，美国的政策没有在任何方面取得成功，即便的确在伊拉克成功地实现了自由选举，也没有因此带来伊拉克的团结，相反却使这个国家进一步四分五裂。

column1: The existing power relations in the Middle East have indeed been permanently shaken and, indeed, revolutionized.
column2: 美军入侵的确从根本上动摇了中东现有的权力关系，带来了一场轰轰烈烈的权力革命。

column1: The effect however, has not been a domino-like democratization; instead we are threatened with a domino effect of descent into chaos.
column2: 但想象中多米诺骨牌式的民主化进程并没有因此实现，恰恰相反，摆在我们面前的却是一连串的混乱局势。

column1: The decision to go to war against Iraq to liberate Kuwait, back in 1991, marked the beginning of America’s role as the sole hegemonic military power in the region.
column2: 1991年做出对伊宣战、解放科威特的决定，标志着美国开始成为中东地区唯一的军事霸权。

column1: The decision to go to war against Iraq for a second time, and then to occupy the country in March 2003, transformed this hegemony into direct US responsibility for the future of the Middle East.
column2: 第二次对伊宣战、并在2003年3月占领伊拉克，将美国的军事霸权演变成了对中东未来所承担的直接责任。

column1: Two outcomes could flow from America’s adopted role as the decisive power in the Middle East.
column2: 美国成为中东霸主可能带来两种结果。

column1: Were the US to succeed in using its military strength, it would create a new, democratic Middle East. But were it, despite its military might, to fail, it would create a power vacuum and destabilize the region.
column2: 如果美国成功地施展其军事力量，将会缔造出一个崭新、民主的中东；可如果军事霸权遭受失败，带来的必将是地区的动荡和权力的真空。

column1: The second scenario – which was foreseeable from the outset – has now become a reality.
column2: 后一种情况从战争一开始就可以预见，现在果然变成了现实。

column1: The very character of the war in Iraq has been transformed from a democratizing mission into a stabilizing mission high in casualties and in cost.
column2: 伊拉克战争的性质也从追求民主降格为制止动荡，伴随着大量的人员伤亡和财产损失。

column1: Instead of the intended radical realignment of power relations in the region, the aim is now to simply maintain the status quo.
column2: 原本期待的地区权力关系的彻底调整终于没有实现，而当前的目标已经沦落为简单地维持现状。

column1: The most the US can hope at this point is a withdrawal that saves face.
column2: 现在，既能安全撤军、又能保留些许颜面已经是美国所能期待的最佳选择。

column1: The recent elections in America were a referendum on the war in Iraq.
column2: 不久前进行的美国选举实际上是关于伊拉克战争的全民公决。

column1: Their result in fact set a timetable for the “Iraqisation” and US withdrawal – before the next presidential election.
column2: 选举的结果实际确定了“伊拉克自制”和美军撤退的具体计划，而所有这一切都要在下一届总统大选前完成。

column1: Behind the all-too-foreseeable end of the American stabilizing mission lurks a civil war in Iraq, which threatens to turn into an Arab-Iranian proxy war for dominance in Iraq, the Gulf, Lebanon, the Palestinian territories, and beyond.
column2: 美国稳定行动的结果怎样已经毫无悬念，但在这毫无悬念的结果背后，一场伊拉克内战正在酝酿之中。 这场内战很可能演变为阿拉伯－伊朗为争夺伊拉克、波斯湾、黎巴嫩、巴勒斯坦和其余地区霸权而一手操纵的傀儡战争。

column1: Moreover, there is an acute risk that the power vacuum created in Iraq will fuse the Israeli-Arab conflict, Iraq, and Afghanistan into one regional mega-crisis.
column2: 不仅如此，伊拉克的权力真空使得以巴冲突、伊拉克和阿富汗冲突演变成为大规模地区冲突的危险已经迫在眉睫。

column1: In light of America’s impending withdrawal, the regional powers are reassessing their interests and objectives.
column2: 在美军即将撤离的背景下，各地区大国正在重新审视自己的利益和目标。

column1: Iran, Syria, Saudi Arabia, Egypt, Jordan, Pakistan, Turkey, and Israel will be the main players.
column2: 伊朗、叙利亚、沙特阿拉伯、埃及、约旦、巴基斯坦、土耳其和以色列将会扮演主要角色。

column1: With the Iraq war, the US has lost its unilateral-power position in the Middle East, and elsewhere.
column2: 对伊战争后，美国失去了它在中东及世界各地独一无二的霸主地位。

column1: In the future, various global powers will be active in the Middle East – primarily the US, Russia, China, India.
column2: 从今以后，包括美国、俄国、中国、印度在内的各大强国将活跃在中东的历史舞台。

column1: Let’s hope Europe is amongst them, because its security is defined there.
column2: 让我们共同期待欧洲也能在其中扮演重要角色，因为中东的局势也直接关系到欧洲的安全。

column1: So at stake is no longer just Iraq, but rather the future of the entire region.
column2: 因此，这不仅关系到伊拉克的命运，而且关系到整个地区的未来。

column1: We can count ourselves lucky if the emerging chaos can be contained in Iraq.
column2: 如果伊拉克即将到来的混乱局势能够得到控制，这将是我们共同的幸运。

column1: Washington’s realization that Iraq can no longer be won or even stabilized unless the regional framework changes, has come late – perhaps too late.
column2: 当华盛顿最终认识到除非地区构架发生变化，否则伊拉克战争不仅没有战胜者，甚至就连最基本的局势稳定都将成为奢望的时候已经迟了¾或许是太迟了。

column1: The US will have to find agreement with its allies and enter into direct talks with all the other players to try and achieve a new regional consensus.
column2: 美国必须与盟国达成一致，同其他国家展开直接对话，以图达成新的地区共识。

column1: If this policy shift had taken place a year ago or even early last summer, the prospects would have been better.
column2: 同样的政策变化如果发生在一年前、甚至发生在去年夏天，前景都会比现在乐观。

column1: And with every passing day, America’s position in the region is weakening further and the chances of a successful new political strategy become more remote.
column2: 随着时间一天天流逝，美国在中东的地位也一天天衰弱，新对策的成功前景也将因此变得更加渺茫。

column1: The greatest danger stems from Iran, the clear beneficiary of the Iraqi power vacuum.
column2: 最大的威胁来自于伊朗，这个国家显然从伊拉克的权力真空中坐收渔翁之利。

column1: Iran harbors hegemonic ambitions which it seeks to realize by means of its military potential, oil and gas reserves, its nuclear program, its influence over Shiites throughout the region, and its efforts to upset the status quo within the Arab Muslim world.
column2: 伊朗野心勃勃，要凭借自身的军事实力、油气储备、核能计划、遍布整个地区的什叶派影响和破坏阿拉伯穆斯林世界现有格局的计划来谋求自己在中东地区的霸权。

column1: Yet Iran is also relatively isolated.
column2: 但伊朗也因此备受冷落。

column1: Its only allies in the region are Syria and Hezbollah.
column2: 它在地区之内的唯一盟友是叙利亚和黎巴嫩真主党。

column1: What’s more, it is threatened by a de-facto anti-Iranian coalition of all other regional powers, united by their fear of Iranian ascendancy.
column2: 不仅如此，伊朗还处在其他地区大国构造的反伊联盟的威胁之下，对伊朗强势地位的恐惧把这些国家紧紧联合在一起。

column1: If the West – America and Europe – act swiftly, decisively, and with a joint strategy, there remains a chance to stabilize the situation.
column2: 如果以美国和欧洲为代表的西方世界能够迅速、果断地采取联合行动，稳定地区局势也并非毫无希望。

column1: But to achieve this, it will be necessary to offset, or at least balance, the interests of the most important actors in the region.
column2: 但要想达到目的，该地区内多数重要角色的利益必须相互抵消、最低限度也要达到暂时的平衡。

column1: This means a strategy based on political leverage not a threat of military intervention or regime change.
column2: 这意味着必须以政治力量对比为基础来制定策略，而不是单纯依靠武力侵略或政权颠覆的军事威胁。

column1: In their stead must come, on the one hand, direct talks, security guarantees, and support in political and economic integration.
column2: 相反，各国之间必须开展直接对话、提供安全保障、并支持政治和经济领域的相互融合。

column1: To be successful, this strategy also requires a realistic threat of isolation of those who continue to undermine regional stability, as well as substantial progress in the Arab-Israeli conflict.
column2: 要想获得成功，这一策略还需要孤立破坏地区稳定的力量，并在阿以冲突中取得实质性的进展。

column1: A new Middle East policy will thus have to concentrate primarily on four aspects: 1) a comprehensive offer to Syria to detach the country from Iran and settle open conflicts; 2) an offer to Iran for direct talks about the perspective of a full normalization of relations; 3) a decisive and realistic initiative to resolve the Israeli-Arab conflict 4) a regional security architecture that centers on stabilizing Iraq and Afghanistan.
column2: 因此，新的中东政策必须关注以下几个方面：1)向叙利亚提供脱离伊朗、解决现有争端的综合方案；2)为伊朗制定实现全面关系正常化的方案，提供直接谈判机会；3)制定解决阿以冲突的切实可行的果断计划；4)建立以稳定伊拉克和阿富汗局势为核心的地区安全构架。

column1: What Now?
column2: 现在怎么办？

column1: More Europe!
column2: 加强欧洲一体化！

column1: The rejection of the European Union’s Constitution by French and Dutch voters forces us to think well beyond that treaty.
column2: 法国与荷兰对欧盟宪法的反对迫使我们开始好好考虑一些条约之外的问题。

column1: That much is clear from the current debate on the Community budget.
column2: 这在目前有关共同体预算的辩论中毫无涉及。

column1: The naysayers’ victories show that sovereignty-based arguments that oppose any kind of European political union are on the march.
column2: 反对者的胜利表明以基于主权、反对任何形式的欧洲政治联盟的辩论已经启动。

column1: Euroskeptics, it seems, are gaining ground everywhere, and a kind of xenophobia is on the rise.
column2: 欧洲怀疑论者的队伍看来正在各地壮大，并且一种惧外主义也日渐抬头。

column1: But xenophobia and sovereignty were not the primary impulses that propelled the “no” votes.
column2: 但是，惧外主义和主权并非推动否决票的主要因素。

column1: Above all, the “no” votes in France and Holland – and rising discontent in other member states, such as Germany – are the result of the inability of national governments and the Union to respond effectively to the problems that most concern citizens.
column2: 首先，法国和荷兰的否决票 — — 以及在其他成员国内不断升温的不满情绪 — — 是国家政府以及欧盟对大多数民众关心的问题未能有效反应的结果。

column1: Not only anti-Europeans rejected the constitution; far from it.
column2: 反对欧盟宪法的不仅仅是反欧洲主义者，远远不止他们。

column1: Many Europeans are, in fact, calling on the EU to act to reduce unemployment and to intervene decisively in the international arena.
column2: 事实上，许多欧洲人都呼吁欧盟采取措施以降低失业率并在国际领域内要果敢介入。

column1: Many interpreted Europe’s internal division over the war in Iraq, with ordinary citizens overwhelmingly opposed to military intervention, as a sign of the Union’s weakness.
column2: 许多人将当时普通民众强烈抗议军事介入情形下欧洲内部在伊拉克战争问题上的分歧看作欧盟无能的一个信号。

column1: But the answer to such doubt and dismay is more Europe, not less.
column2: 但是要消除这些怀疑和沮丧情绪，办法就是加强欧洲一体化，而非削弱。

column1: The European Council’s summit on June 16-17 should give a clear sign that it recognizes this.
column2: 6月16-17日举行的欧洲理事会峰会应该给出一个明确信号，表示理事会已经认识到了这一点。

column1: Most supporters of the Constitution believe that it will not only help build a citizens’ Europe, but also create better conditions for European economic development, and for the EU to act globally.
column2: 大多数欧盟宪法的支持者们相信，这部宪法将不仅仅有助于建立一个欧洲公民们的欧洲，也将为欧洲经济发展以及欧盟的全球行动创造更好的条件。

column1: They are right.
column2: 他们是正确的。

column1: It would be imprudent to assume that the French and Dutch “no” votes were not about discontent with Union policies; but that anger was directed against the French and Dutch governments, not Europe itself.
column2: 假定法国和荷兰的反对票与他们对欧盟政策的不满毫无关系是草率的。 只是他们将愤怒矛头直指法国和荷兰政府而并非欧盟本身而已。

column1: The fact is that citizens in every EU member country are increasingly aware that national policies are determined by decision making at the European level, over which they have little influence.
column2: 事实上，每个欧盟成员国的公民越来越意识到，他们的国家政策现在由欧洲级别的决策来决定，而他们对此几乎无法施加任何影响。

column1: The European Constitution has little to do with this, but referenda are never confined to the actual questions put to voters.
column2: 欧盟宪法与此无甚关联，但是公民投票从不仅限于那些需要投票决定的实质问题。

column1: Instead, they provide opportunities for citizens to express what they feel about the choices their governments make, particularly within the EU framework.
column2: 相反，它们为公民提供了机会来表达他们对政府所作选择的看法，尤其是在欧盟框架内的决定。

column1: The 2004 elections for the European Parliament had already shown that the level of discontent with the Union was high.
column2: 2004年欧洲议会选举已经表现出了人们对欧盟的不满程度。

column1: Voters heavily punished almost all national governments.
column2: 投票者狠狠惩罚了几乎所有政府。

column1: Yet nobody thought that that election had changed the course of Europe.
column2: 然而没有人想到那场选举改变了欧盟的进程。

column1: Above all, the French and Dutch referendums confirmed that politics in the Union is now conducted “on the street,” and that it is no longer possible to “construct” Europe at a distance and by stealth.
column2: 首先，法国和荷兰的公投证实了欧盟内的政治现在是“在大街上”进行的，再也不可能保持一定距离暗暗“建造”欧洲了。

column1: This means that EU governments must respond to popular anxieties and make the Union more transparent and democratic.
column2: 这意味着欧盟各国政府必须对普遍的民众忧虑做出反应，并使欧盟变得更加透明民主。

column1: This would be a lot easier with the Constitution in place, but there are measures that can and should be adopted now to make that possible.
column2: 如果我们手里有一部宪法，这就容易多了，但是我们还需要采取能够采取同时也是必要的措施，以使之成为可能。

column1: First, the community budget should be structured so that it has a significant impact on growth and employment (a return to the voluntarism of the Delors Packages, now applied to the Lisbon Strategy).
column2: 首先，应当制定一份对经济增长和就业率具有重大影响的共同体预算方案（重回德罗尔的唯意志论，其现在正适用于里斯本战略）

column1: Second, European governments must show a real commitment to act together.
column2: 其次，欧盟各国政府必须做出一致行动的实际承诺。

column1: A key opportunity presents itself with the celebration of the tenth anniversary of the Barcelona Declaration to define a common position to support democratic change in the Mediterranean by ceasing to back the political status quo there.
column2: 巴塞罗那宣言十周年纪念为他们提供了一个重要机会来达成对统一立场的共识，即通过停止支持地中海地区的政治现状来支持当地的民主改革。

column1: Finally, Council meetings should be open when legislative matters are at stake, so that citizens can know who voted for what and according to which criteria.
column2: 最后，当立法无法奏效的时候，就应该召开欧盟理事会会议，这样公民们就能知道谁该根据哪种标准为什么投票。

column1: All of this can be decided at the next European Council, even before the constitutional problem is resolved.
column2: 所有这些将在欧盟理事会下届会议中决定，甚至还赶在宪法问题解决之前。

column1: This kind of action is more likely to win back a skeptical citizenry than any information campaign, however well designed.
column2: 这样的行动比起任何精心策划的宣传活动都更有可能赢回持怀疑态度的公民们。

column1: At the same time, it is necessary to solve the Constitutional deadlock.
column2: 同时，我们必须化解宪法所陷入的僵局。

column1: As already proposed by the Convention, this would mean separating constitutional matters per se from Union policy.
column2: 正如公约所提议，这意味着将宪法问题本身与欧盟政策分离开来。

column1: The real innovations are found in Part I and II of the proposed Constitution, in the definition of the normative and political identity of the Union, its competences, the new institutional balance – including the creation of a European Minister of Foreign Affairs – and, last but not least, the introduction of a Bill of Rights.
column2: 我们在被提议的宪法中的第一和第二部分中发现了真正的革新内容，表现在对欧盟政治身份及标准身份、权限，新体制平衡的定义中 — — 包括产生一名欧洲外交部长 — — 最后但却十分重要的一点是，引入了权利法案。

column1: The part that was actually rejected and raises the most concerns among citizens of the member States is in Part III, which focuses on Union policies such as the Common Market, competition policy and the Common Agricultural Policy.
column2: 真正遭到拒绝以及在成员国公民中引起最多忧虑的在第三部分中，该部分将重点放于诸如统一市场、竞争政策以及共同农业政策等欧盟政策上。

column1: So the first and second parts could be ratified without new negotiations and could form the basis for the new Treaty, so that the Treaty of Nice would still apply; and the debate on the European social model would continue.
column2: 因此，第一和第二部分无须新辩论就可通过并能为形成新条约打下基础，因此尼斯条约将继续适用；并且有关欧洲社会模式的辩论将持续下去。

column1: It is essential to reaffirm the normative essence of the Constitutional Treaty to protect the greatest achievement of the Constitutional Convention.
column2: 最基本的是要再次重申宪法条约的规范本质以保护宪法公约所取得的伟大成就。

column1: Diversity and inclusiveness, through the integration of European democracies with a common project, remains Europe’s great gift to the world.
column2: 在一个共同方案下，通过欧洲民主体制一体化进程所达成的多样性和包容性，使欧洲得以保持它对这个世界的伟大贡献。

column1: It is what has made Europe an “international public good” to use former Brazilian foreign minister Celso Lafer’s felicitous turn of phrase.
column2: 正是这，使欧洲成为一个使用巴西前外交部长塞尔索·拉弗（Celso Lafer）那及其精巧措辞的“国际公共产品 ” 。

column1: Such a Europe is better placed to contribute to a fairer international order than the narrow, bitter Europe the xenophobes have in mind.
column2: 这样一个欧洲最好还是致力于维护更为公平的国际秩序，而不是成为惧外主义者所希望的那个狭隘刻薄的欧洲。

column1: For Europe to remain a promise for the world, it must thrive as a public good for all its citizens.
column2: 若要维持它对全世界的承诺，欧洲必须作为一个为其所有公民谋利的公共产品而繁荣发展。

column1: Europe and Europeans cannot wait for a new treaty to show that the Union is able to fulfill that promise.
column2: 欧洲和欧洲人都不能干等着一个新条约的出现来表明欧盟有能力履行那个承诺。

column1: What Nuclear Energy Renaissance?
column2: 核能的“文艺复兴”从何而来？

column1: ZURICH – Repeatedly in recent years there have been calls for a revival of civilian nuclear power.
column2: 发自苏黎世 — — 这几年来不断有人呼吁要重振民用核能的雄风。

column1: Yet that renaissance never seems to come.
column2: 但在我看来，这么一场民用核能的“文艺复兴时代”似乎还远未到来。

column1: Indeed, of the more than 200 countries in the world, only 30 use nuclear power.
column2: 事实上，全世界200多个国家中采用了核能的只有区区30国。

column1: In July 2010, a total of 439 nuclear power plants with a net installed capacity of 373.038 GW(e) were connected to various national electricity grids, about 1.2 GW(e) more than at the beginning of 2006.
column2: 截止到2010年7月，全球总共有439座核电站投入运作，净装机容量达373.038吉瓦（GW(e ) ， 电力学单位，1吉瓦=10亿瓦）并实现了联网，较2006初又增加了1.2吉瓦。

column1: Roughly 16% of total energy needs (up to 25% in the highly industrialized countries) are now met by electric energy.
column2: 全球大概有16%的能源需求（发达国家为25 % ） 是由电来提供的。

column1: Nuclear fission’s contribution to total electric energy has decreased from about 18% more than ten years ago to about 14% in 2008.
column2: 而相比于1998年之间的18 % ， 核能所占的份额在2008年已经下降到了14 % 。

column1: On a worldwide scale, nuclear energy is thus only a small component of the global energy mix, and its share, contrary to widespread belief, is not on the rise.
column2: 从全球角度上看，核能如今只能算是能源多样性中的一个小的组成部分，更出乎人们意料的是，其所占的份额也没有上升。

column1: During 2009, for example, nuclear power plants provided 2,560 TWh(e) (2,560 billion kWh) of electric energy, about 1.6% lower than during 2008 and almost 4% lower than during the record year of 2006, when 2,658 TWh(e) were produced.
column2: 比如说在2009年，核电站提供了2560太瓦时（TWh(e ) ， 电力学单位，1太瓦时=10亿千瓦时）的电能，比2008年降低了1.6 % ， 更比2006年的2658太瓦时下降了近4 % 。

column1: Early results for the first four months of 2010 for the OECD countries, collected by the International Energy Agency indicate that so far the 2010 results are as low or lower than during the last year.
column2: 从国际能源机构搜集的经合组织国家2010年1~4月核能发电数据来看，各月数据都与去年同期持平或更低。

column1: During the next five years, on average, roughly 10 new nuclear reactors are expected to become operational every year. But this assumes that all of them are constructed according to schedule, and the nuclear industry has rarely met its promised construction deadlines.
column2: 在未来五年内预计每年会有大概10座新反应堆投入运行，但这要求所有建设都按期完工，而核能行业却经常是不守时的。

column1: According to the World Nuclear Association (WNA), 17 new reactors should have become operational between 2007 and 2009. But only five came onstream during this period – three in 2007 and two in 2009.
column2: 依照世界核能组织的数据，2007~2009年间本该有17座新反应堆投入运行，谁知最后只有5座得以发电 — — 2007年3座，2009年两座。

column1: Moreover, four reactors were de-commissioned during 2009, and a larger number of reactors in Japan and Germany are not in use, owing to various technical stoppages.
column2: 此外，还有4座反应堆于2009年退役，日本和德国都有相当数量的反应堆由于各种技术原因而处于闲置状态。

column1: At least one hundred older and smaller reactors will most likely be closed over the next 10-15 years.
column2: 在未来10到15年内，至少会有100座旧式或小型反应堆停止运行。

column1: Furthermore, during the past 10 years, only about two-thirds of worldwide demand for nuclear fuel – about 68,000 tons of natural uranium equivalent are needed for 2010 – was met from resources obtained from mining.
column2: 更重要的是在过去10年间，铀矿的开采只能满足全世界核能发电燃料总需求量的2/3 — — 2010年度需求量约为6.8万当量吨天然铀。

column1: The remaining 20,000 tons came from so-called secondary uranium sources – mainly inventories held by utilities and governments, re-processed nuclear fuel, and stockpiles of depleted uranium.
column2: 而剩下的2万当量吨缺口就由所谓的“二次铀资源”来满足 — — 主要是一些公营机构和政府的库存，再加工的核燃料以及贫化铀储藏。

column1: The supply from these sources will drop by roughly 10,000 tons at the end of 2013, when the Megatons to Megawatt Program between Russia and the United States – which recycles highly-enriched uranium from Russian nuclear warheads into low-enriched uranium for nuclear power plants – comes to an end.
column2: 但上述这类物资的储备量将在2013年末下降到约1万吨，因为那时美俄两国之间的“兆吨到兆瓦”项目（回收俄罗斯核弹头的高浓缩铀并将其转化为民用发电的低浓缩铀）就走到尽头了。

column1: Current projections indicate that uranium shortages in the coming years can be avoided only if existing and new uranium mines operate according to plan.
column2: 照目前的预测，未来铀资源短缺问题的解决只能依靠现有及新铀矿的按步骤开采。

column1: Indeed, extrapolations of global supply that foresee an increase in uranium mining are based on claims about the ability to expand output in Kazakhstan.
column2: 事实上，当前对铀开采量增加的预期都是基于哈萨克斯坦的产能提升。

column1: So far, uranium mining in Kazakhstan has increased roughly as expected, from 4,357 tons in 2005 to 8,521 tons in 2008 to 14,000 tons in 2009.
column2: 而迄今为止该地的铀矿产量增长都与预期相符，从2005年的4357当量吨到2008年的8521当量吨，再到2009年的1.4万当量吨。

column1: But it remains to be seen if the uranium mining in this country can indeed increase further to 18,000 tons in 2010 and to 30,000 tons by 2018.
column2: 但该国铀矿产量是否能在2010年和2018年分别达到1.8万和3万当量吨？ 这还有待观察。

column1: According to the WNA’s latest estimates, from July 2010, the expected uranium extraction figure for 2010 has actually been decreased to 15,000 tons.
column2: 按照世界核能组织的最新估算，从2010年7月开始，哈萨克斯坦的铀矿预计开采量将下降到1.5万吨。

column1: The view that the amount of energy derived from nuclear power worldwide will continue its slow decrease during the coming years is further supported by the 2008 annual report of the Euratom Supply Agency, which coordinates the long-term uranium needs of nuclear power plants within the European Union.
column2: 全球核能发电量将在未来持续走低的观点也在欧洲原子能共同体供应机构（Euratom Supply Agency，负责协调欧盟境内各国核电站的长期铀需求）的2008年报中得到了印证。

column1: According to the agency’s forecast, uranium demand in Europe will fall from 21,747 tons in 2010 to 17,378 tons by 2018 and roughly 16,000 tons by 2024.
column2: 据该机构估计，欧洲铀资源需求量将从2010年的2.1747万当量吨下降到2018年的1.7378当量吨，最终降低到2024年的约1.6万当量吨。

column1: These numbers indicate that the EU, currently producing about 1/3 of the world’s nuclear electric energy, is heading for a reduction in nuclear-energy production of up to 20% over the coming 10 years.
column2: 这些数字显示欧盟 — — 这个目前占全球核能发电量1/3的区域 — — 有在未来十年内减少20%核能发电量的趋势。

column1: One can also expect that the current worldwide economic crisis will not help to accelerate the construction of nuclear power plants and new uranium mines.
column2: 人们也同样可以预计当前的全球经济危机也无法加速反应堆的建设和新铀矿的开采。

column1: In summary, the hard facts about nuclear energy are inconsistent with the possibility of a worldwide renaissance of nuclear energy.
column2: 总而言之，这些令人皱眉的数据都与核能的“文艺复兴”背道而驰。

column1: Indeed, they point toward a continuing slow phase-out of civilian nuclear energy in most of the large OECD countries.
column2: 事实上，这些数据意味着在大多数经合组织大国，民用核能都将被逐步淘汰。

column1: It thus seems unavoidable that energy consumers, especially in many rich countries, will have to learn to exchange their current worries about the distant future consequences of global warming for the reality of energy shortages during periods of peak demand.
column2: 而对于（尤其是富裕国家）的能源消费者来说，他们无可避免地要学会将自己对那些全球变暖的遥不可及的后果的忧虑，转化成用电高峰期能源短缺的现实认识。

column1: Such shortages could result either in chaotic supplies and power outages or in a coordinated policy of energy rationing.
column2: 这些短缺要么将可能导致能源的混乱供应以及短缺，要么就是能源配给制度。

column1: In the absence of nuclear-energy revival, most of us will be forced to reduce our direct energy consumption.
column2: 在核能复兴无望的情况下，大多数人将被迫减少自己的直接能源消费。

column1: Let us hope that we can learn to adapt to simpler – though perhaps still satisfying – lifestyles.
column2: 让我们期望自己能适应那种更简单 — — 或许也同样舒适 — — 的生活方式吧。

column1: What Reset Button?
column2: 重设按钮，什么重设按钮？

column1: MOSCOW – The emergence of a Kremlin leader, President Dmitri Medvedev, without a KGB background, combined with the economic crisis, has inspired talk that when Barack Obama visits Moscow, America’s president will be seeing a country on the verge of a new political thaw, a revived perestroika .
column2: 发自莫斯科 — — 作为一个没有克格勃背景的克里姆林宫领导人，迪米特里·梅德韦杰夫总统的成功崛起在加上经济危机的影响，令外界不禁猜测当美国总统奥巴马正式踏上莫斯科之行时，呈现在美国人眼中的俄罗斯会是一个政治桎梏即将解禁的国度，一个重焕改革之光的国度。

column1: But pushing the “re-set button” on US-Russia relations may be harder than Obama and his team imagined.
column2: 但对奥巴马和他的团队来说，启动全新美俄关系的“重设按钮”可比他们想象中要更难触动。

column1: Russian (or Soviet) leaders opt for perestroika or a thaw only when forced to do so by dire conditions that threaten the regime’s survival.
column2: 事实上，俄罗斯（或者苏联）领导人只会在情况已经糟糕到威胁其生存的情况下才会选择改革。

column1: An atmosphere of mortal fear, mutual suspicion, and hatred among the Communist elite was the catalyst for Nikita Khrushchev’s post-Stalin thaw.
column2: 前苏联领导人尼基塔·赫鲁晓夫在斯大林死后的改革就是由共产体制内精英之间的极端恐惧，互相猜忌和仇恨来作为改革催化剂的。

column1: For Mikhail Gorbachev in the 1980’s, the catalyst for his perestroika was the USSR’s growing economic paralysis.
column2: 而对于1980年代的米哈伊尔·戈尔巴乔夫来说，改革的催化剂则是苏联不断恶化的经济瘫痪局面。

column1: For both men, the goal of clinging to power was a top priority.
column2: 对于上述两位领导人来说，想方设法攀附权力才是其首要目标。

column1: Changing the system and easing their grip on power was a risky move that could undermine their authority.
column2: 而改革整个政治系统以及放松对权力的掌控则是一个极可能动摇其权威的危险行动。

column1: But the risks of inertia seemed to be even higher. In the end, having opted for change, both were forced to leave their posts prematurely, against their will.
column2: 但整个政治系统的行为惯性似乎比他们的权力更强大，以致这两个迷恋权力的最高领导人最后都被过早地赶下了台。

column1: As he revived centralized Kremlin control over Russian politics and public affairs, Vladimir Putin has been concerned primarily with minimizing challenges to state power, which he concentrated in his own hands.
column2: 而当弗拉基米尔·普京重新把决定俄罗斯政治和公共事务的大权集中在克里姆林宫的宫墙之内时，他的首要考虑则是如何把各方对他手中中央权力的挑战最小化。

column1: To this end, he stripped the political system of competition, emasculated state institutions, marginalized the opposition, and basically eliminated public participation.
column2: 于是他废除了竞争性的政治体制，弱化国家机构的作用，排斥反对派并从根本上将公众屏蔽在政治生活之外。

column1: His power-building project was facilitated by high oil prices, but came at the cost of a steady deterioration in the quality of governance and abandonment of the goal of modernization.
column2: 他的权力建构计划在高油价的帮助下大功告成，但却付出了政府管治水平不断下滑而国家现代化目标迟迟未能实现的代价。

column1: With policymaking fully nontransparent and reduced to a very closed circle, and implementation delegated to an unaccountable bureaucracy, the inevitable result of Putin’s political model was pervasive corruption.
column2: 由于政府决策程序极端不透明且小圈子作业，而政策执行的任务又委派给了不可靠的官僚机构，因为普京政治模式所无法避免的结果就是深层次和大面积的腐败。

column1: The desire to avoid public discontent and ensure social stability led to a suspension of reform.
column2: 与此同时对公众不满的压制和一定要保持社会稳定的思维则导致整个改革进程停滞不前。

column1: Instead of creating incentives that would unleash public energies, the government pushed citizens farther and farther from politics and policymaking, thereby deepening social apathy and atomization.
column2: 对此政府不但没有设法去释放公众参与政治生活的能量，反而不断把公众与政治和政策制订领域隔离得越来越远，并因此加深了社会冷漠和分散化。

column1: Moreover, the opportunity provided by the oil boom was wasted.
column2: 此外由高油价带来的改革契机则被浪费殆尽。

column1: Indeed, today Russia risks lagging even further behind the developed countries.
column2: 事实上今天的俄罗斯已经面临着被发达国家抛离得越来越远的危险。

column1: Its economy remains undiversified and uncompetitive, and its contribution to global technological progress is minuscule.
column2: 其国内经济结构单一而且缺乏竞争力，而对全球技术进步的贡献甚至微不足道。

column1: Worse still, economic growth based on exports of natural resources has proved unsustainable.
column2: 更严重的是，通过出口自然资源来支撑的经济发展已被证明是不可靠的。

column1: When oil prices were high and growing, the government could compensate for poor performance by throwing money at problems.
column2: 当油价保持在高位并不端攀升之时，政府可以通过大洒金钱来掩盖低劣的执政能力。

column1: Today, with oil prices dramatically reduced, this largesse is no longer available, and economic experts agree that the growth potential of Russia’s petro-economy has been exhausted.
column2: 而在今时今日油价戏剧性回落之后，这种慷慨疏财之举就再也行不通了。 经济专家们更一致认为，俄罗斯石油经济的发展潜力已经被过早地耗尽了。

column1: Despite all this, the situation is not sufficiently dire to push Russia’s leaders to open at least some channels of genuine public participation and yield any of their power.
column2: 但即便如此，情况还是没有坏到要让俄罗斯领导人对民众开放哪怕寥寥几条参与政治的渠道并下放权力的地步。

column1: The price of oil, at around $70 a barrel, may be half of what it was a year ago, but up from around $40 earlier this year.
column2: 目前70美元一桶的原油价格可能只是一年前的一半，但至少也比年初的40美元一桶有所提升了。

column1: Nor does the Russian economy’s contraction and the expected deepening of poverty (the World Bank’s report released in late June was grimmer about Russia than its previous report) presage an immediate catastrophe.
column2: 而即便俄罗斯正面临着经济紧缩和贫困问题恶化（世界银行在6月底发布的报告对俄罗斯的评语也比前几份要更为严厉 ） ， 这也并不预示着改革的催化剂将立刻到来。

column1: And, unlike in the late 1980’s and 1990’s, Russia is not indebted to foreign banks or international organizations, though it plans to resume foreign borrowing next year.
column2: 即便政府有计划在明年恢复向外国借贷，但当今的俄罗斯也几经不像上世纪80，90年代那样背负着外国银行或者国际组织的债务了。

column1: So the government will prefer to muddle through the crisis, rather than risk any decisive reform.
column2: 因此政府会想方设法在危机中蒙混过关，而不是冒险去做出决定性的改革。

column1: The goal of clinging to power remains the priority, and risk-aversion the main guideline.
column2: 对于官员来来说，攀附权力依然是最高要务，而逃避风险也是照样是重要的行事原则。

column1: The ruling elite are known to be torn by disputes and rivalries.
column2: 而统治精英阶层也被争吵和敌意所分裂。

column1: Just recently, two of Putin’s deputies gave interviews to two Western media outlets offering what sounded like starkly opposite visions for Russia’s development.
column2: 就在最近，普京的两个副手分别接受两家西方媒体的采访，谁知两人却对俄罗斯的未来发展提出了针锋相对的观点。

column1: But such disputes never spill over into the broad public sphere; members of the elite are primarily concerned about social and political stability and would not stir the public by seeking support for an alternative policy course.
column2: 但这种争端可不会被扩散到民众中间去；因为精英们也都小心翼翼地维持着社会和政治的稳定，断然不会为了某个其他的政治进程就贸然挑动民众。

column1: These delaying tactics are enabled by a lack of pressure from below.
column2: 由于缺乏来自社会底层的压力，这些拖延战术也凑效了。

column1: Russians may be concerned by growing unemployment and reduced incomes, but this is not manifesting itself in any drive to organize or try to effect political change.
column2: 俄罗斯人大都关注失业和收入减少的问题，但这并不意味着他们就有动力去组织起来并试图影响政治变革。

column1: The public below, just like the leaders above, cherish political stability; the popularity ratings of both Prime Minister Putin and President Dmitri Medvedev remain above 70%.
column2: 跟上层领导一样，下层的公众也极为珍视政治稳定的局面，以至于普京总理和梅德韦杰夫总统的公众支持度都双双维持在70%以上。

column1: Disgruntlement over the increasingly authoritarian governance may be common among business circles, elements of the neutered political opposition, liberal intellectuals, and even part of the bureaucracy.
column2: 而对独裁政治的不满可能也存在于商界、中立的政治反对派、自由派知识分子甚至一部分官僚的意识当中。

column1: But these forces are too timid and fragmented, with no drive for political action.
column2: 但这些力量太过懦弱和分散，同时也缺乏发动政治行动的动机。

column1: The current government’s tactic of muddling through without changing the political system or the structure of the economy is fraught with the risk of gradual decline.
column2: 在不改变政治系统或者经济结构的情况下，当今政府试图混过危机的策略使俄罗斯面临着逐步衰落的危险。

column1: To the Kremlin’s rulers, this may seem an acceptable cost for retaining power, but postponing reform will only aggravate Russia’s countless problems.
column2: 对于那些克里姆林宫的当权者来说，这可能是为保住权力而付出的必要代价，但推迟改革只能令国内的诸多问题更加恶化。

column1: Besides, muddling through may prove unaffordable even in the short run, if oil prices decline again.
column2: 这种蒙混策略甚至在短期看来都难以维持，因为油价又再次走低了。

column1: A dramatic curtailment of state resources may eventually push the government toward modernization, but it might also produce an uglier shift— toward harder political crackdown, economic nationalism and an essentially isolationist course.
column2: 而政府手中资源的大幅度缩减可能最终将政府推上改革之路，但这也可能导致更可怕的蜕变 — — 一连串更强力的政治高压，经济国有化和孤立主义政策。

column1: This would be catastrophic for Russia— to say nothing of relations with the US.
column2: 这对于俄罗斯来说堪称灾难性的 — — 而美国重启两国关系的期望，换来的可能只是沉默。

column1: What Role for the State?
column2: 国家能承担什么角色？

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – The financial crisis of 2008 has spurred a global debate on how much government regulation of markets – and what kind – is appropriate.
column2: 发自华盛顿特区 — — 2008年的金融危机触发了一个关于政府应当对市场进行何种程度 — — 以及何种形式 — — 的监管才算恰当的全球讨论。

column1: In the United States, it is a key theme in the upcoming presidential election, and it is shaping politics in Europe and emerging markets as well.
column2: 而这一点既是在美国总统大选临近的核心主题，还左右着欧洲和新兴市场的政治形势。

column1: For starters, China’s impressive growth performance over the last three decades has given the world an economically successful example of what many call “state capitalism.”
column2: 首先，中国过去30年令人瞩目的增长表现塑造了一个被许多人称之为“国家资本主义”的成功经济范本。

column1: Brazil’s development policies have also accorded a strong role to the state.
column2: 另一方面巴西的发展政策同时也与国家的强势角色相得益彰。

column1: Questions concerning the state’s size and the sustainable role of government are central to the debate over the eurozone’s fate as well.
column2: 关于国家规模以及政府会否继续存在的问题也是欧元区命运讨论的核心议题。

column1: Many critics of Europe, particularly in the US, link the euro crisis to the outsize role of government there, though the Scandinavian countries are doing well, despite high public spending.
column2: 虽然高公共支出的斯堪的纳维亚半岛国家都表现不错，但许多对欧洲的批评（尤其是来自于美国）都将欧元危机归咎于政府规模的过度膨胀。

column1: In France, the new center-left government faces the challenge of delivering on its promise of strengthening social solidarity while substantially reducing the budget deficit.
column2: 在法国，新上台的中左翼政府也面临着挑战：一方面要兑现自己增强社会团结的承诺，另一方面又得持续减少预算赤字。

column1: Alongside the mostly economic arguments about the role of government, many countries are experiencing widespread disillusionment with politics and a growing distance between citizens and government (particularly national government).
column2: 除了主要集中在经济层面上的对政府角色的争论之外，许多国家都在经历着民众对政治的大规模幻灭以及民众和政府（尤其是国家政府）之间不断增大的距离感。

column1: In many countries, participation rates in national elections are falling, and new parties and movements, such as the Pirate Party in Germany and the Five Star Movement in Italy, reflect strong discontent with existing governance.
column2: 在许多国家，全国大选的参与率不断下降，而新的党派和运动，例如德国的海盗党（Pirate Party）和意大利的五星运动（Five Star Movement）都反映出人们对当前政府的极度不满。

column1: In the US, the approval rating of Congress is at a record-low of 14%.
column2: 在美国，对国会的满意率已经跌落到了创纪录的14 % 。

column1: Many there, such as my colleague Bruce Katz at the Brookings Institution, believe that the only solution is to bring a larger share of governance and policy initiation to the state and municipal level, in close partnership with the private sector and civil society.
column2: 许多美国人，例如我在布鲁金斯学会的同事布鲁斯·凯特兹（Bruce Katz ） ， 都相信唯一的解决方案就是给予州和市级层面更多的治理和政策动议，并与私人部门和公民社会建立紧密的伙伴关系。

column1: But that approach, too, might have a downside.
column2: 但这种做法其实也有不足之处。

column1: Consider Spain, where too much fiscal decentralization to regional governments contributed significantly to weakening otherwise strong public finances.
column2: 以西班牙为例，对地方政府的过度财政分权也大大削弱了在其他方面非常强大的公共财政。

column1: A crucial problem for this global debate is that, despite the realities of twenty-first-century technology and globalization, it is still conducted largely as if governance and public policy were almost exclusively the domain of the nation-state.
column2: 在21世纪的技术进步和全球化背景下，这场全球讨论中依然存在着一个关键问题，那就是在讨论过程中似乎依然在很大程度上将治理和公共政策视为民族国家的专属地盘。

column1: To adapt the debate to the real challenges that we face, we should focus on four levels of governance and identify the most appropriate allocation of public-policy functions to them.
column2: 而如果要让这场辩论与我们面临的真正挑战相适应的话，就应当把焦点集中在治理的四个层面上，并针对各个层面制定出最适合的公共政策职能分配方案。

column1: First, many policies – including support for local infrastructure, land zoning, facilitation of industrial production and training, traffic ordinances, and environmental regulations – can largely be determined at the local or metropolitan level and reflect the wishes of a local electorate.
column2: 首先，许多政策 — — 包括对地方基础设施，土地划分，对工业生产和训练的扶助，交通条例以及环境监管的支持 — — 可以在很大程度上交由地方或是市级层面决定，并体现出本地选民的智慧。

column1: Of course, defense and foreign policy will continue to be conducted primarily at the second level – the nation-state.
column2: 当然，国防和外交政策将依然由第二个层面（民族国家）来决定。

column1: Most nation-states maintain national currencies, and must therefore pursue fiscal and economic policies that support a monetary union.
column2: 大多数民族国家都保有本国货币，并因此必须寻求能维护一个货币联盟的一系列财政和经济政策。

column1: As the eurozone crisis has starkly reminded us, decentralization cannot extend too far into the budgetary sphere, lest it threaten the common currency’s survival.
column2: 但欧元区危机也明确提醒我们，权力下放不能过度延伸到预算领域，不然就会影响到共同货币的生存。

column1: The US system is manageable, because the American states are largely constrained to running balanced budgets, while the federal government accounts for most fiscal policy.
column2: 美国的体系可以做到这一点，因为各州都在很大程度上被强制保持预算平衡，而联邦政府则为大部分财政政策负责。

column1: Moreover, banking regulation and deposit insurance are centralized in the US, as they must be in a monetary union.
column2: 此外，美国的银行监管和存款保险都被收归联邦，因为它们必须存在于一个货币联盟之中。

column1: The eurozone has finally recognized this.
column2: 欧元区最终也意识到了这一点。

column1: So, governance at the nation-state level remains hugely important and is intimately linked to monetary sovereignty.
column2: 因此，在民族国家层面的治理依然非常重要而且与货币主权息息相关。

column1: The key problem in Europe today is whether eurozone members will advance towards something resembling a federal nation-state.
column2: 但当今欧洲的关键问题��是各欧元区成员国是否会继续往前迈进，组成一个类似联邦民族国家的政体。

column1: Unless they do, it is difficult to see how the common currency can survive.
column2: 除非他们能做到这一点，否则共同货币的生存就将面临极大困难。

column1: There is also a third, regional or continental, level of governance, which is most advanced in the European Union (and is being tested in Latin America, Africa, and Asia) and can be very useful.
column2: 第三个层面的治理则是区域或者洲层面，这点在欧盟中最为深入，也在拉美，非洲和亚洲进行过相关测试，而且可以非常有用。

column1: Customs unions, free-trade areas, or a single market, as in Europe, allow greater mobility of goods and services, which can lead to benefits from economies of scale that remaining trade impediments at the global level do not permit.
column2: 像欧洲那样的海关联盟，自由贸易区或者单一市场都可以使货物和服务获得更大的流动性，从而在依然存在贸易壁垒的全球层面上不允许的规模经济上得到好处。

column1: Europe’s borderless Schengen Area is another example of regional supra-national governance.
column2: 欧洲无国界的申根区就是超国家治理的另一个例子。

column1: There are also aspects of infrastructure that can best be addressed at the continental level.
column2: 而某些基础设施也能在洲际层面上进行更好的选址。

column1: Finally, there is the global level.
column2: 最后就是全球层面。

column1: The spread of infectious disease, global trade and finance, climate change, nuclear non-proliferation, counterterrorism, and cyber security are just some of the issues that require broad international cooperation and global governance.
column2: 流行病、全球贸易金融、气候变化、核不扩散，反恐以及网络安全都是一些需要进行广泛国际合作以及全球治理的事务。

column1: In today’s interdependent world, the debate about the role of public policy, the size and functions of government, and the legitimacy of public decision-making should be conducted with the four levels of governance much more clearly in focus.
column2: 在当今这个互相依存的世界上，针对公共政策所扮演角色，政府的规模与职能，以及公共决策制定的合法性的讨论应当在这四个治理层面被更加清晰聚焦的情况下进行。

column1: The levels often will overlap (infrastructure and clean energy issues, for example), but democracy could be greatly strengthened if the issues were linked to the levels at which decisions can best be taken.
column2: 这些层面往往会发生重叠（比如说基础设施和洁净能源事务 ） ， 但如果这些事务可以与那些能更好地执行决策的层面相联系的话，民主就能得到大大加强。

column1: As Pascal Lamy, the director of the World Trade Organization, has said, it is not only the “local” that has to be brought to the “global”; the inherently “local” political sphere has to internalize the global or regional context.
column2: 正如世界贸易组织总干事帕斯卡尔·拉米（Pascal Lamy）所说，不仅仅是必须将“地方”推向“全球 ” ； 依附在内的“地方”政治领域也必须融入到全球或者区域的大背景下。

column1: That is a huge challenge for political leadership and communication, but, if it is not met, democracy and globalization will be difficult to reconcile.
column2: 这对政治领导力和沟通交流都是极大的挑战，但如果无法应对这一点挑战的话，民主和全球化就难以协调一致。

column1: How to conduct democratic debate with reference to these local, national, continental, and global levels, and to structure a political space that better reflects economic and social space, will be the great challenge of the decades ahead.
column2: 如何在提及这些地方，国家，洲和全球层面的情况下进行讨论，如何并构建一个更好地体现经济和社会空间的政治空间，都将成为未来数十年内的重大挑战。

column1: What’s Holding Back the World Economy?
column2: 是什么在阻碍世界经济？

column1: NEW YORK – Seven years after the global financial crisis erupted in 2008, the world economy continued to stumble in 2015.
column2: 发自纽约 — — 全球金融危机在2008年爆发七年后的2015年，世界经济依然萎靡。

column1: According to the United Nations’ report World Economic Situation and Prospects 2016, the average growth rate in developed economies has declined by more than 54% since the crisis.
column2: 根据联合国发布的《2016年世界经济形势与展望》报告，自危机以来发达经济体的平均增长率下降了超过54 ％ 。

column1: An estimated 44 million people are unemployed in developed countries, about 12 million more than in 2007, while inflation has reached its lowest level since the crisis.
column2: 据估计这些国家现有约4400万失业人口，较2007年多了1200万，而通胀则已经下探到自危机以来的最低水平。

column1: More worryingly, advanced countries’ growth rates have also become more volatile.
column2: 更令人担忧的，发达国家的增长速度也变得更为不稳定。

column1: This is surprising, because, as developed economies with fully open capital accounts, they should have benefited from the free flow of capital and international risk sharing – and thus experienced little macroeconomic volatility.
column2: 这是有点出人意料，因为这些完全开放资本账户的经济体本应从资本的自由流动和国际风险分担中获益 — — 并因此只会经历小范围的宏观经济波动。

column1: Furthermore, social transfers, including unemployment benefits, should have allowed households to stabilize their consumption.
column2: 此外，包括失业救济金在内的各类社会转移支付手段应该​​也可依然让家庭维持自身的消费水平。

column1: But the dominant policies during the post-crisis period – fiscal retrenchment and quantitative easing (QE) by major central banks – have offered little support to stimulate household consumption, investment, and growth. On the contrary, they have tended to make matters worse.
column2: 但在后危机时期的主要政策 — — 各大中央银行的财政紧缩和定量宽松 — — 在刺激居民消费，投资和增长方面没有多大帮助，反而让事态变得更加糟糕。

column1: In the US, quantitative easing did not boost consumption and investment partly because most of the additional liquidity returned to central banks’ coffers in the form of excess reserves.
column2: 在美国，量化宽松政策未能刺激消费和投资的部分原因是大部分额外流动性都以超额准备金的形式回到了中央银行的金库。

column1: The Financial Services Regulatory Relief Act of 2006, which authorized the Federal Reserve to pay interest on required and excess reserves, thus undermined the key objective of QE.
column2: 2006年的《金融服务管制放松法案》授权美国联邦储备委员会为法定和超额准备金支付利息，从而削弱了量化宽松的主要目标。

column1: Indeed, with the US financial sector on the brink of collapse, the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 moved up the effective date for offering interest on reserves by three years, to October 1, 2008. As a result, excess reserves held at the Fed soared, from an average of $200 billion during 2000-2008 to $1.6 trillion during 2009-2015.
column2: 事实上，在美国金融业濒临崩溃之时 ， 《 紧急经济稳定法案》将提供储备利率的生效日期提前了三年，从2008年10月1日开始，结果美联储持有的超额准备金额暴增，从2000~2008年间平均2000亿美元上升到2009~2015年间的1.6万亿。

column1: Financial institutions chose to keep their money with the Fed instead of lending to the real economy, earning nearly $30 billion – completely risk-free – during the last five years.
column2: 金融机构选择把自己的钱留在美联储而非向实体经济贷款，收并因此在过去五年间无风险套利近300亿美元。

column1: This amounts to a generous – and largely hidden – subsidy from the Fed to the financial sector.
column2: 这相当于美联储向金融部门给与了一个慷慨的 — — 而且在很大程度上隐蔽的 — — 补贴。

column1: And, as a consequence of the Fed’s interest-rate hike last month, the subsidy will increase by $13 billion this year.
column2: 同时由于上个月美联储加息，今年的补贴还会增加约130亿美元。

column1: Perverse incentives are only one reason that many of the hoped-for benefits of low interest rates did not materialize.
column2: 负面激励措施只是导致低利率的预期好处无法兑现的其中一个原因。

column1: Given that QE managed to sustain near-zero interest rates for almost seven years, it should have encouraged governments in developed countries to borrow and invest in infrastructure, education, and social sectors. Increasing social transfers during the post-crisis period would have boosted aggregate demand and smoothed out consumption patterns.
column2: 由于量化宽松在接近七年间维持了近零利率，它本应鼓励各发达国家政府借贷并投资于基础设施，教育和社会部门，在后危机时期增加社会转移支付，提振总需求并将原本扭曲的消费模式理顺过来。

column1: Moreover, the UN report clearly shows that, throughout the developed world, private investment did not grow as one might have expected, given ultra-low interest rates.
column2: 此外，联合国报告清楚地表明，在整个发达世界，民间投资并未像人们所认定的那样在超低利率下扩大。

column1: In 17 of the 20 largest developed economies, investment growth remained lower during the post-2008 period than in the years prior to the crisis; five experienced a decline in investment during 2010-2015.
column2: 20个最大的发达经济体中有17个在2008年后投资增速低于危机前水平; 5个国家在2010~2015年间出现了投资总额下跌。

column1: Globally, debt securities issued by non-financial corporations – which are supposed to undertake fixed investments – increased significantly during the same period.
column2: 全球范围内，本应转化为固定资产投资的非金融企业债券的发行量在同一时期显著上升。

column1: Consistent with other evidence, this implies that many non-financial corporations borrowed, taking advantage of the low interest rates. But, rather than investing, they used the borrowed money to buy back their own equities or purchase other financial assets.
column2: 这跟与其他众多证据一致表明，许多非金融企业只是以低利率的优势来借款，不过目的不是投资，而是用借来的钱回购自己的股票或购买其他金融资产。

column1: QE thus stimulated sharp increases in leverage, market capitalization, and financial-sector profitability.
column2: 因此量化宽松政策反而大幅提升了杠杆率，市场资本化程度和金融部门的盈利。

column1: But, again, none of this was of much help to the real economy.
column2: 但这一切同样都对实体经济没有多大帮助。

column1: Clearly, keeping interest rates at the near zero level does not necessarily lead to higher levels of credit or investment.
column2: 显然，保持利率在接零水平并不一定会催生更高水平的信贷或投资。

column1: When banks are given the freedom to choose, they choose riskless profit or even financial speculation over lending that would support the broader objective of economic growth.
column2: 当银行被赋予自由选择的权利时，它们宁愿选择无风险利润甚至金融投机，而非把款贷出去以支持更宏观的经济增长目标。

column1: By contrast, when the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund lends cheap money to developing countries, it imposes conditions on what they can do with it.
column2: 相反，当世界银行或国际货币基金组织把廉价资金出借给发展中国家的时候，它们都会规定贷款的用途。

column1: To have the desired effect, QE should have been accompanied not only by official efforts to restore impaired lending channels (especially those directed at small- and medium-size enterprises), but also by specific lending targets for banks.
column2: 如果要收到预期的效果，伴随着量化宽松政策的不应仅有政府恢复受损贷款渠道（特别是那些针对中小规模的企业）的努力，还有对银行贷款的具体目标。

column1: Instead of effectively encouraging banks not to lend, the Fed should have been penalizing banks for holding excess reserves.
column2: 相对于适得其反地激励银行不放贷，美联储应该已经处罚那些存入超额准备金的银行。

column1: While ultra-low interest rates yielded few benefits for developed countries, they imposed significant costs on developing and emerging-market economies.
column2: 而超低利率虽然对发达国家无甚好处，它却对发展中国家和新兴市场经济体强加了巨大的成本。

column1: An unintended, but not unexpected, consequence of monetary easing has been sharp increases in cross-border capital flows.
column2: 这个并非政策制定者本意却是意料之中的后果就是货币宽松政策导致跨境资本流动急剧增加。

column1: Total capital inflows to developing countries increased from about $20 billion in 2008 to over $600 billion in 2010.
column2: 流入发展中国家的总资本从2008年的约2000亿美元增加到2010年的超过6000亿。

column1: At the time, many emerging markets had a hard time managing the sudden surge of capital flows. Very little of it went to fixed investment.
column2: 与此同时，许多新兴市场都难以应对资本流动的突然激增，这些资金中也只有很少的一部分转化为固定资产投资。

column1: In fact, investment growth in developing countries slowed significantly during the post crisis period.
column2: 事实上，发展中国家的投资增长在后危机时期显著放缓。

column1: This year, developing countries, taken together, are expected to record their first net capital outflow – totaling $615 billion – since 2006.
column2: 今年以来，发展中国家整体将经历自2006年以来首次资本净流出的局面 — — 金额共计达6150亿美元。

column1: Neither monetary policy nor the financial sector is doing what it’s supposed to do.
column2: 无论是货币政策还是财政部门都未能履行自己的职责。

column1: It appears that the flood of liquidity has disproportionately gone toward creating financial wealth and inflating asset bubbles, rather than strengthening the real economy.
column2: 显然泛滥的流动性中的极大部分都朝着创造金融财富和催生资产泡沫奔去，而非巩固实体经济。

column1: Despite sharp declines in equity prices worldwide, market capitalization as a share of world GDP remains high.
column2: 尽管全球股价大幅下跌，市场资本占世界GDP的份额仍然很高。

column1: The risk of another financial crisis cannot be ignored.
column2: 爆发另一场金融危机的风险也不容忽视。

column1: There are other policies that hold out the promise of restoring sustainable and inclusive growth.
column2: 还有其他一些政策也在支撑着恢复可持续和包容性增长承诺的兑现。

column1: These begin with rewriting the rules of the market economy to ensure greater equality, more long-term thinking, and reining in the financial market with effective regulation and appropriate incentive structures.
column2: 这些政策首先由改写市场经济的规则开始，以确保更高程度的平等，更长远考虑，并用有效的监管和适当的激励机制来管理金融市场。

column1: But large increases in public investment in infrastructure, education, and technology will also be needed.
column2: 但是也有必要大幅加大在基础设施，教育和科技方面的公共投资。

column1: These will have to be financed, at least in part, by the imposition of environmental taxes, including carbon taxes, and taxes on the monopoly and other rents that have become pervasive in the market economy – and contribute enormously to inequality and slow growth.
column2: 而这些投资的资金，至少部分地，都可以通过包括碳税在内的环境税，以及对已经在市场经济中产生负面效应的 — — 并极大催生不平等状况和低增长 — — 的垄断以及其他租金征税来筹集。

column1: The views expressed here do not reflect the views of the United Nations or its member states.
column2: 本文观点并不反映联合国及其会员国的意见。

column1: What Should Bretton Woods II Look Like?
column2: 布雷顿森林体系II看起来应该是什么样子？

column1: NEW YORK – For those of us who have long claimed that the world’s international financial architecture needed deep reform, the call for a “Bretton Woods II” is welcome.
column2: 纽约－对我们当中长期以来声称国际金融体系需要进行深刻改革的人来说，布雷顿森林体系II的倡议是很受欢迎的。

column1: Of course, similar calls were made after the Asian and Russian crises of 1997-1998, but were not taken seriously by the rich industrial countries.
column2: 当然，在1997年到1998年的亚洲和俄罗斯危机以后，有人提出了类似的倡议，但是这些倡议都没有得到富裕工业国家的认真对待。

column1: Now that these countries are at the center of the storm, perhaps they will now be serious.
column2: 当前，这些富裕的工业国家处在金融风暴的中心地带，或许它们现在会对这个倡议认真起来。

column1: Two fundamental problems exist with the call for reform.
column2: 当前，进行国际金融体系改革的呼吁存在两个基本问题。

column1: First, it lacks content: it is unclear what any eventual Bretton Woods II discussions will be about.
column2: 首先，它缺乏内容：最终的布雷顿森林体系II要讨论什么，还不清楚。

column1: Second, the process started the wrong way, by excluding most countries from the talks.
column2: 其次，这个过程是以将绝大多数国家排除在会谈之外的错误方式开始的。

column1: It is obviously good for the G-7 or a subset of G-7 members to show leadership, but no fundamental reform can occur without an inclusive process that gives both industrial and developing countries, and both large and small countries an adequate voice.
column2: 显然，对G-7或G-7的一部分成员国来说，这对显示它们的领导地位是有好处的，但是，在没有给予工业国家以及发展中国家，大国以及小国足够的发言权的 包含过程 的情况下，根本性的改革是不可能出现的。

column1: Global institutions, not ad hoc groups of countries, must be at the center of the reform effort.
column2: 是全球性机构，而不是是临时性的国家集团，是国际金融体系改革活动的中心。

column1: The clearest issue right now is correcting the deficit of regulations that characterizes global financial markets.
column2: 现在，最明确的问题是要纠正全球金融市场表现出来的监管缺位。

column1: Discussion must start by agreeing on regulatory principles .
column2: 改革全球金融体系的讨论应该以同意监管原则为开端。

column1: An obvious one is that regulations must be comprehensive, to avoid the massive loopholes that led to the current turmoil.
column2: 一个显而易见的原则是监管必须全面，以避免产生导致当前的金融动荡的大量漏洞。

column1: Regulations should also have a strong counter-cyclical focus, preventing excessive accumulation of leverage and increasing capital and provisions (reserves) during booms, as well as preventing asset price bubbles from feeding into credit expansion.
column2: 监管也应该具有很强的抗周期关注点，以便在繁荣时期防止金融杠杆的过渡累计，并且增加资本和供应（储备 ） ， 同时防止资产泡沫助长信贷扩张。

column1: Reliance on financial institutions’ internal models, the major focus of the Basel II agreement on banking regulation, should be discarded.
column2: 有关银行监管的巴塞尔协议II，其主要的观点是要依靠金融机构的内部模型，现在应该抛弃这种观点。

column1: That strategy has now been exposed as perilous, and the use by financial institutions of similar risk models can lead to greater instability.
column2: 这种策略现在已经显示出其危险性，并且金融机构使用相似的风险模型会导致更大的不稳定。

column1: Any new regulatory system should be based on a well functioning network of national and regional authorities (still missing in the European Union) and include truly international supervision of financial institutions with a global reach.
column2: 任何新的金融机构监管体系都应该建立在运作良好的国家以及区域机构（在欧盟仍然不存在这样的机构）网络之上，并且也应该包含用全球视野对金融机构进行的真正的国际监管。

column1: Most agree that the International Monetary Fund should not be at the center of the regulatory system.
column2: 绝大多数人认为国际货币基金组织 不 应该处于这个监管体系的中心位置。
