column1: A groundbreaking study of the political economy of agricultural biotechnology concluded that over-regulation causes “delays in the global diffusion of proven technologies, resulting in a lower rate of growth in the global food supply and higher food prices.”
column2: 一项对农业生物技术的政治经济影响的突破性研究发现过度监管导致“得到证实的技术在全球范围内的扩散速度减慢，引发世界食品供应量增速偏低以及更高昂的食品价格 ” 。

column1: Current policies also create “disincentives for investing in further research and development, resulting in a slowdown in innovation of second-generation technologies anticipated to introduce broad consumer and environmental benefits.”
column2: 当前的政策同时也“阻碍了对进一步技术研究和发展的投资，因此减缓了预计将为消费者和环境带来更广泛好处的第二代技术方面的创新 。 ”

column1: Everyone involved in food production and consumption has suffered: consumers (especially in developing countries) have been subjected to avoidable health risks, and food producers have placed themselves in legal jeopardy for selling products known to have “design defects.”
column2: 每个牵涉到食品生产和消费的人都因此而受害：消费者们（尤其是发展中国家）面临着本可避免的健康风险，食品生厂商们则只能销售那些有“设计缺陷”的产品并随时可能背上官司。

column1: Public policy that discriminates against and discourages vital innovations in food production is not policy that has the public’s interest at heart.
column2: 由此可见，那些敌视并压制在食品生产方面的重要革新的公共政策并不是真心维护民众利益的政策。

column1: The World When the Fed Raises Rates
column2: 美联储提高利率之后的世界

column1: VIENNA – The United States Federal Reserve is the world’s most powerful bank, and its most powerful component is the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC), the twelve men and women who meet eight times a year to determine – essentially by setting interest rates – the monetary policy of the world’s largest economy.
column2: 发自维也纳 — — 美联储是全世界最具权势的银行，而其最内部权势最大的部门则是联邦公开市场委员会，委员会的八名成员每年召开8次会议来决定（主要是通过设定利率的方式）这个全世界最大经济体的货币政策。

column1: The last time the Fed raised interest rates was in 2006, before the growth-sapping impact of the global financial crisis persuaded it and other central banks to lower rates effectively to zero and to employ so-called quantitative easing (QE) to pump money into advanced economies.
column2: 上次美联储调高利率的时候还是2006年，但随后爆发的全球金融危机导致增长乏力，使其及各国央行只得将实际利率降为0并实施所谓量化宽松政策，将货币注入各发达经济体。

column1: But this year, for the first time since 2007, every advanced economy in the world is growing – including America’s.
column2: 但就在今年，也就是2007年以来首次，全球所有发达经济体都同时出现了增长 — — 包括美国。

column1: And that means that the FOMC, fearful of asset bubbles, will at some point decide that America’s interest rates must rise.
column2: 而这也意味着在资产泡沫的阴影下，联邦公开市场委员会在某个时点决定调高美国的利率。

column1: That may (or may not, depending on the timing) be good for the US economy, but what will it mean for the rest of the world?
column2: 这或许会（或者不会，取决于当时的时机）有益于美国经济，但这对世界其他国家来说又意味着什么呢？

column1: Our research shows why the world, especially emerging countries, will be paying nervous attention.
column2: 我们的研究发现了为何全球各地，尤其是新兴经济体，会对此忐忑不安。

column1: In mid-2013, when the Fed announced that it would gradually reduce its unconventional monetary-policy measures (for example, large-scale purchases of mortgage-backed securities), emerging markets suffered large capital outflows.
column2: 在2013年中，当美联储宣布将逐渐减少其非常规货币政策手段（例如大规模购买有抵押证券）之时，新兴市场立刻爆发了大规模资金外流。

column1: In other words, when the Fed even hints at tightening monetary policy, other countries suffer. Depending on just how much the FOMC decides to tighten at a future meeting, we foresee negative effects on world GDP in the medium term, not only for emerging markets but also for industrialized economies.
column2: 换言之，就算美联储只是暗示会在未来的会议中收紧政策，人们也会预期会对世界GDP产生中期负面效应，无论是新兴经济体还是发达工业国都概莫能外。

column1: Since the Fed started to curb its QE program, there has been constant speculation over just when its current accommodative monetary policy will end.
column2: 自从美联储开始收紧其量化宽松政策以来，外界就持续怀疑前者的宽松货币政策将在何时终结。

column1: Market participants, be they lenders or borrowers, know that “easy money” has an expiry date.
column2: 市场参与者，无论是放贷者还是借贷者，都知道这些“快钱”迟早要收回。

column1: They can see that after three large asset-purchase programs, the Fed’s balance sheet has more than quadrupled since 2007, totaling about $4.5 trillion in February 2015.
column2: 他们发现在三次大规模资产收购之后，美联储的资产负债表规模已经是2007年的四倍，在2015年达到了4.5万亿美元。

column1: However, when assessing what the FOMC intends to do, it is important to bear in mind that the Fed’s mandate is to advance America’s national economic goals.
column2: 然而在猜度公开市场委员会的的意图之时，也一定要记住美联储的任务就是推动美国的国家经济目标。

column1: This means that it has to consider not just the desirable rate of inflation (the target is a 2% annual rate), but also the state of the labor market – and its judgment has global implications.
column2: 这意味着它不仅仅要考虑合适的通胀率（目标是每年2 % ） ，还得顾及劳动力市场 — — 以及其判断的全球影响。

column1: That is why the Fed’s talk in mid-2013 about a gradual exit from unconventional monetary policy led to a so-called “taper tantrum” among investors, triggering a surge in global volatility and a shift in market sentiment against emerging markets.
column2: 这也是为何美联储在2013年中关于逐渐退出非常规货币政策的讲话在投资者中引发了一个所谓“减债恐慌 ” ， 导致全球流动性大减以及对新兴市场的负面情绪。

column1: The question now is whether future changes by the FOMC in the federal funds rate (the interest rate at which banks lend each other their overnight money deposited at the Fed) will have similar, or indeed worse, effects.
column2: 如今问题在于公开市场委员对联邦基金利率���各银行互相拆借自身在美联储存款的隔夜利率）的变更会否存在类似（或者实际上更糟糕）的效应。

column1: To narrow any gap between its expectations for the economy and those of the public, the Fed publishes each FOMC member’s view of the range of interest rates that should be expected over the next few years.
column2: 为了缩小自身与公众之间对经济的预期差异，美联储公布了每位公开市场委员会成员对未来几年的预期利率范围。

column1: A member with a positive assessment of the US economy’s growth prospects will expect a rise in the federal funds rate; a pessimist will expect the rate to stay close to zero for a longer period.
column2: 一位对美国经济增长存在正面预期的委员将会预计联邦基金利率上升；而持悲观态度的则会让更长时期内的利率接近零。

column1: Using information released by the Fed in March, we have constructed two scenarios: “lift-off” is based on the maximum projected interest rates, while “delayed lift-off” is based on the minimum.
column2: 利用美联储 在3月公布的信息，我们设想了两个情境 ： “ （火箭）发射”是基于最大的预期利率，而“延迟发射”则基于最低预期。

column1: To see the impact beyond America on GDP, consumer prices, exchange rates, and interest rates, we then apply the scenarios to a total of 36 emerging and advanced economies that together account for 90% of global output.
column2: 为了研究对美国之外地区GDP、消费者指数，汇率和利率的影响，我们将这两大情境应用在占全球产出90%的36个新性和发达国家身上。

column1: Assuming a phased rise in the federal funds rate to 4% by 2017, we believe that economic growth in all regions except Latin America will slow in 2016, and then slow even more in 2017.
column2: 试想如果在2017年联邦基金利率被阶段性调高到4 % ， 那么除拉丁美洲之外的全球经济增长将在2016年放缓，接着在2017年进一步降速。

column1: The cumulative loss in this “lift-off” scenario is about ten times as large as any lost economic output under the “delayed lift-off” alternative of only minimal changes to rates over the next couple of years.
column2: 而这一“发射”情境所带来的累计损失要比尽量减少利率变化的“延迟发射”选项在未来几年内造成的任何GDP损失都大十倍。

column1: Our research shows that any monetary tightening by the Fed will affect the rest of the world, but to differing degrees.
column2: 我们的研究证明美联储的任何货币紧缩都将对世界其他地区造成影响，但程度会有所不同。

column1: Those emerging markets that were hit severely during the “taper tantrum” episode – for example, Brazil, Indonesia, and Turkey – will certainly suffer.
column2: 那些在“减债恐慌”中受灾最重的新兴市场国家 — — 比如巴西，印尼和土耳其 — — 必定将再次受灾。

column1: But the greatest negative impact will be on countries such as Canada and Mexico, which have close trade links with the US economy or those, like Germany, Japan, and Singapore, that are deeply integrated into the global economy.
column2: 但最大的负面效应将出现在加拿大和墨西哥这类与美国有紧密经济联系的国家，或者是德国，日本和新加坡这类深度整合进全球经济的国家。

column1: In other words, though emerging markets – through their dependence on capital inflows – will be at risk when America’s monetary policy eventually returns to “normal,” the same will be true for advanced economies.
column2: 换言之，虽然新兴市场国家 — — 由于其对资本流的依赖 — — 会在美国货币政策逐渐恢复“常态”后面临风险，但发达国家也不太可能置身事外。

column1: This commentary reflects the authors’ personal views, not those of the Oesterreichische Nationalbank or the Eurosystem.
column2: 本文仅代表作者本人观点，与奥地利国民银行或欧元系统无关。

column1: Ready for a US Rate Hike?
column2: 美国加息，你准备好了吗？

column1: MANILA – The possibility that the US Federal Reserve could raise the interest rate for the first time in a decade sent jitters across emerging markets for weeks.
column2: 发自马尼拉 — — 美联储可能在近十年来首次加息的消息让一批新兴市场国家连续几周不得安宁。

column1: Though the Fed has now decided to keep its policy rate ‎unchanged, it also stated that a rate hike is still on the table for 2015.
column2: 虽然美联储已经决定维持政策利率不变，但表示加息仍在2015年的日程上。

column1: The concern is that countries that are dependent on foreign financing could be hit by sudden outflows of international capital, or that currency depreciation following the Fed hike could raise debt-servicing costs for countries and businesses.
column2: 值得关注的是，依赖外国资金的国家可能会受到国际资本突然外流的冲击，或者说美联储加息后的货币贬值可能会提高各国和企业的偿债成本。

column1: Governments in the developing world would be wise to worry less about interest-rate changes in the United States – which, in any case, they cannot control – and think more about policy changes they can make at home to strengthen their economies’ resilience.
column2: 对于发展中国家的政府来说，最好少去担心美国利率变化 — — 毕竟谁也没法控制美国怎么做，把思考重点放在调整国家内部政策以加强经济抗波动性才是明智的。

column1: An increase in US interest rates is not necessarily bad news for emerging countries.
column2: 美国利率提高对新兴国家来说并不一定是坏消息。

column1: Many developing countries – especially in Asia – are in much better macroeconomic shape than they were just before the Asian financial crisis of the late 1990s or at the onset of the 2008 global financial crisis.
column2: 如今许多发展中国家 — — 尤其是亚洲各国 — — 的宏观经济形势都比1990年代末亚洲金融危机或是2008年全球金融危机爆发前要更好。

column1: And the Fed is likely to raise rates only if it judges US economic growth to be strong and sustainable, which would be a positive sign for the global economy in general.
column2: 美联储只有在判断美国经济增长将保持强劲且持续时才可能提高利率，因为这是全球经济总体表现积极的反映。

column1: Furthermore, a delay in raising rates carries its own dangers, encouraging yield-hungry investors to take larger risks – possibly necessitating a sharper or more abrupt change in interest rates in the future.
column2: 此外延迟加息也有其风险，因为这会鼓励渴望收益的投资者冒更大的风险 — — 而这可能会在未来造成更剧烈或更突然的利率变化。

column1: Emerging countries can enhance their resilience to fluctuations in global interest rates by pursuing sound fiscal and monetary policies, continuing necessary structural reforms, and strengthening their financial systems.
column2: 新兴国家可以通过追求稳健的财政和货币政策，继续进行必要的结构性改革以及巩固金融体系来增强其对全球利率的抗波动能力。

column1: In particular, recent research suggests four key policy areas in which governments should consider intervening.
column2: 特别是最近的研究表明，政府应该考虑在以下四个关键政策领域进行干预。

column1: For starters, countries should embrace policies that favor foreign direct investment (FDI) over inflows that can be withdrawn more quickly, such as foreign bank loans, debt, or equity investments.
column2: 首先，国家应该施行有利于那类资金流入可以更迅速撤回的外国直接投资的政策，如外国银行贷款，债务或股权投资。

column1: My research with Hui Tong of the International Monetary Fund shows that countries whose capital inflows that are mainly in the form of FDI tend to be more resilient to foreign financial shocks.
column2: 笔者与国际货币基金组织经济学家童晖的研究成果表明，以外国直接投资为主要资本流入形式的国家往往更能抵御外国金融冲击。

column1: When the global financial crisis erupted, countries with high FDI relative to total capital flows tended to experience a less severe liquidity crunch.
column2: 当全球金融危机爆发时，外国直接投资相对总资本流动额较高的国家流动性紧缩情况一般不太严重。

column1: Second, exchange rates need to reflect economic fundamentals.
column2: 其次，汇率需要反映经济基本面。

column1: But while theory suggests that flexible exchange rates should blunt foreign monetary or financial shocks, in practice, such a currency regime rarely works on its own.
column2: 但尽管有理论认为弹性汇率应该可以弱化货币或金融冲击，但在实践中这种汇率制度却很少能自行运作。

column1: Indeed, my research with the Asian Development Bank’s Xuehui Han has shown that when the US raises or lowers interest rates, most developing countries tend to follow suit, even when they have a flexible exchange rate.
column2: 事实上，笔者与亚洲开发银行的韩雪辉研究表明，当美国提高或降低利率时，大多数使用弹性汇率的发展中国家往往也会跟风。

column1: The key reason is that they want to avoid large swings in the value of their currency.
column2: 关键原因是他们要避免本国币值出现大的波动。

column1: Appreciation can harm competitiveness, while depreciation increases the cost of servicing foreign-currency debt, erodes market confidence, and leads to higher inflation.
column2: 升值会损害竞争力，而贬值会增加外币债务的偿还成本，削弱市场信心，并导致更高的通货膨胀。

column1: The notable exceptions to this trend are countries that manage cross-border capital flows, especially the corporate sector’s exposure to foreign-currency debt.
column2: 而这一趋势的显著例外是那些管理跨境资本流动，尤其是监管企业部门承担外币债务的国家。

column1: Indeed, certain types of capital-flow management – including limiting domestic debt denominated in foreign currency for both firms and households – have been shown to increase resilience.
column2: 事实上，某些类型的资本流动管理 — — 包括限制企业和家庭以外币计价的国内债务 — — 都被证明能增加抗冲击能力。

column1: Third, domestic macroprudential and microprudential policies increase resilience.
column2: 第三，国内宏观和微观调控政策可以增加抗冲击能力。

column1: These policies should aim at reducing or eliminating the wedge between activities that are good for individuals, banks, and firms, and those that benefit society as a whole.
column2: 这些政策应该是减少或消除对个人、银行、企业和那些有利于社会整体利益的活动之间的脱节状况。

column1: One example of such a policy is to link banks’ mandatory reserve ratios to the speed at which credit is expanding or to the stage of the business cycle.
column2: 这类政策的其中一个例子是将银行的法定存款准备金率与信贷业务扩大的速度或商业周期的不同阶段联系起来。

column1: Thus, during periods of expansion, when banks are eager to fund ever more risky borrowers, the reserve ratio rises, curbing potentially disruptive asset bubbles or overinvestment.
column2: 因此，在扩张期间，当银行急于向偿付风险更大的借款人贷款时，提升存款准备金率，抑制潜在的破坏性资产泡沫和过度投资。

column1: For those countries capable of designing and implementing prudential regulations, management of cross-border capital flows becomes less useful and less desirable.
column2: 对于那些能够设计和实施审慎监管的国家来说，跨境资本流动管理就显得不那么有用也不太可取。

column1: Finally, it is no longer appropriate to judge whether a country’s foreign-currency reserves are adequate based on how many months of imports they can cover.
column2: 最后，以覆盖多少个月的进口额来判断一个国家的外汇储备是否足够已不再恰当。

column1: Instead, the question to ask is whether the reserves can comfortably service the public and private sectors’ debt denominated in foreign currencies.
column2: 取而代之是要问外汇储备是否可以妥善偿付公共和私营部门以外币计价的债务。

column1: The US will normalize its interest rate policy sooner or later according to its need.
column2: 美国按照自身需要来实现利率政策正常化是迟早的事情。

column1: For other countries, it is important to focus on policies that can strengthen resilience to foreign financial or monetary shocks.
column2: 因此对其他国家而言，重要的是要把重点放在能增强抵御外国金融或货币冲击的政策上面。

column1: When the Yankees Go Home
column2: 洋基人回家

column1: ISLAMABAD – Relations between the United States and Pakistan have continued to fray since a US Special Forces team killed Osama bin Laden in a comfortable villa near a major Pakistani military academy.
column2: 伊斯兰堡 — — 美国一支特种部队小组在一所知名巴基斯坦军校附近一栋舒适的别墅里杀死奥萨马·本·拉登后，美国和巴基斯坦之间的关系开始不断恶化。

column1: But the tit-for-tat retaliation that has followed the raid reflects deeper sources of mistrust and mutual suspicion.
column2: 但袭击后针锋相对的报复行动反应了双方之间更深层次的猜疑和不信任。

column1: The latest round has focused on the alleged activities of the Pakistani military’s powerful intelligence agency, Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI), in the United States.
column2: 在美国，巴基斯坦强大的军方情报机构 — — 三军情报局的所作所为成为新一轮摩擦的焦点。

column1: ISI is accused of watching over the Pakistani diaspora and of sponsoring unregistered lobbyists working to shape congressional opinion.
column2: 三军情报局被指监督巴基斯坦人移民，并且出资赞助未经注册的说客影响国会意见。

column1: Indeed, this is not the first time that Pakistan’s relations with the US have been on a slippery slope.
column2: 实际上，巴基斯坦和美国关系下滑也不是第一次了。

column1: In 1965, after helping the country to build up its economy and its military strength, the US walked out over the war with India that Pakistan had provoked by sending “freedom fighters” into Kashmir.
column2: 1965年，在帮助巴基斯坦提高经济和军事实力后，巴基斯坦派遣“自由战士”进入克什米尔挑起印巴战争导致美国退出。

column1: In 1989, following the Soviet Union’s exit from Afghanistan, the US lost interest in what it now calls AfPak – Afghanistan-Pakistan.
column2: 1989年，随着苏联撤出阿富汗，美国对目前所谓的阿富汗巴基斯坦区域失去了兴趣。

column1: The Americans began returning to Pakistan until, in 1998, the Pakistani government decided to follow India in testing an atomic bomb.
column2: 直到1998年巴基斯坦政府决定步印度后尘试验原子弹，美国才开始对巴基斯坦的回归。

column1: This led to the imposition of US sanctions – and America’s third exit from Pakistan.
column2: 巴基斯坦核试验决策招致美国制裁 — — 以及美国第三次从巴基斯坦撤出。

column1: That situation remained unchanged when Afghanistan-based Al Qaeda struck America on September 11, 2001.
column2: 直到2001年9月11日驻阿富汗的基地组织袭击美国之前，一直维持着这样一种形势。

column1: After receiving a “you are either with us or against us” warning from President George W. Bush’s administration, General Pervez Musharraf’s Pakistan decided to side with the US.
column2: 在接到乔治·W·布什总统“要么与我们为友、要么为敌”的最后通牒后，巴基斯坦的穆沙拉夫将军决定和美国站在一起。

column1: It severed relations with Afghanistan’s Taliban regime, which it had helped to install five years earlier, and allowed America to use its air space to launch strikes on Afghanistan.
column2: 穆沙拉夫政府切断了五年前建立的与阿富汗塔利班组织的联系，并允许美国使用其空军基地对阿富汗发起攻击。

column1: For more than a decade, Pakistan and the US were close allies.
column2: 10多年来，巴基斯坦和美国形成了亲密的盟友关系。

column1: Pakistan let the US use its air bases to launch drone attacks on Taliban fighters in Afghanistan and northwestern Pakistan; allowed its territory to be used as a supply route for NATO forces in landlocked Afghanistan; and, less enthusiastically than the US wished, launched military operations against Taliban sanctuaries on the Pakistani side of the porous border with Afghanistan.
column2: 巴基斯坦允许美国用其空军基地对阿富汗及巴基斯坦西北部的塔利班战机发动无人机攻击，并允许本国领土被用作北约军队在内陆国家阿富汗的补给线，而且虽然没有表现出美国所希望的那种热情，巴基斯坦依然发动了针对漏洞百出的巴阿边境巴方一侧塔利班避难所的军事袭击。

column1: In return for its help, Pakistan received large doses of economic and military assistance.
column2: 作为这种帮助的回报，巴基斯坦得到了大量的经济和军事援助。

column1: According to the US Congress, Pakistan was provided $20 billion in aid between 2001 and 2011.
column2: 据美国国会统计，2001到2011年间巴基斯坦得到了200亿美元的援助。

column1: In addition, Congress passed the Kerry-Lugar bill, which promised $7.5 billion in economic aid from 2009-2014.
column2: 此外，国会还通过一项克里－卢格法案，承诺从2009－2014年间提供75亿美元的经济援助。

column1: The US also encouraged the International Monetary Fund to give Pakistan emergency financial assistance equivalent to $11 billion, to be disbursed starting in late 2008.
column2: 美国还鼓励国际货币基金组织给予巴基斯坦合计110亿美元的紧急财政援助，从2008年下半年开始分批拨付。

column1: This cozy relationship created a “moral hazard” in Pakistan, as the generous flow of US aid insulated the government and military from any sense of urgency about economic reform: some foreign friend would always rescue the country from its perennial shortage of cash.
column2: 这种亲密关系在巴基斯坦催生出“道德风险 ” ， 因为美国援助的慷慨流入使政府和军方不再着急推进经济改革：某些外国朋友总能解决巴基斯坦持续出现的现金短缺问题。

column1: So far, that friend has been America, but the US could well pull out of Pakistan for the fourth time in the countries’ turbulent relationship – a threat that several influential figures in the US Congress have already made.
column2: 截至目前为止，美国一直扮演着那个朋友的角色，但美国很可能在目前的动荡关系中第四次撤出巴基斯坦 — — 美国国会几位颇有影响的人物已经威胁要这么做。

column1: The dynamic that has brought Pakistan-US relations to this point arguably began on December 1, 2009, when President Barack Obama, announcing a surge in the number of US troops in Afghanistan, also indicated his intention to start pulling back American troops beginning in July 2011 – a pledge that he reiterated two months ago.
column2: 导致巴美关系发展到目前地步的事态始于2009年的12月1日，当天巴拉克·奥巴马总统宣布增加驻阿富汗的美军人数，并同时明确他从2011年7月开始撤出美军的意图 — — 他在两个月前又重申了这一承诺。

column1: This alerted Pakistan to the fact that, with the imminent departure of US troops, it would be left alone to fight the insurgency on both sides of its border with Afghanistan.
column2: 于是巴基斯坦意识到随着美军撤离迫在眉睫，它将不得不与巴阿边境两侧的叛乱分子独自战斗。

column1: To do that, Pakistan would need help from some of the Afghan Pashtun tribes with which it had developed strong relations during the war against the Soviet Union.
column2: 要想独自对抗这些叛乱分子，巴基斯坦需要得到某些阿富汗普什图族的帮助，巴方在对抗苏联的那场战争中与这些普什图部族的关系非常牢固。

column1: The Jalaluddin Haqqani group, which was allowed to base itself in a sanctuary in Pakistan’s North Waziristan tribal agency, was one such ally that Pakistan’s government thought could be used to further its interests in Afghanistan.
column2: 被获准驻扎在巴基斯坦北部北瓦济里斯坦的部落机构庇护所的贾拉鲁丁·哈卡尼部落是巴基斯坦政府打算用来维护其在阿富汗利益的盟友。

column1: But the Haqqanis were also the group that threatened the Americans the most.
column2: 但哈卡尼同时也是对美国人构成最大威胁的部落。

column1: The US pressed Pakistan to move against them. Pakistan resisted.
column2: 美国向巴基斯坦施压对他们采取行动，但遭到巴方的抵制。

column1: And, in the midst of this tussle, the US sent Navy Seals to find Bin Laden at a compound deep in Pakistani territory, informing Pakistan’s government only after the raid was over.
column2: 而且在这次争斗同时，美国派遣海豹突击队在深入巴基斯坦境内的一栋建筑中找到本·拉登，而且只在袭击行动结束后才通知了巴基斯坦政府。

column1: Pakistan’s embarrassed military pressed the government to begin distancing itself from the US.
column2: 倍感尴尬的巴基斯坦军队迫使政府开始疏远美国。

column1: After the identity of the CIA’s station chief in Pakistan was exposed (probably by Pakistani military officials), America made it known that it had good evidence that a prominent Pakistani journalist was ordered murdered by ISI.
column2: 在中情局驻巴基斯坦站长的身份暴露之后（揭发他的可能是巴基斯坦军官 ） ， 美国公开宣称自己掌握充分证据，即著名的巴基斯坦三军情报局下令谋杀了一位著名的巴基斯坦记者。

column1: This time around, the break between the US and Pakistan might not be easily repaired.
column2: 这一次，美国和巴基斯坦之间的分歧已经不太可能轻易得到修复。

column1: Pakistan has turned to China for economic and military help, clearly hoping for a less volatile relationship than the one that it has with America.
column2: 巴基斯坦已经转而寻求中国的经济和军事援助，显然希望与中国之间的关系能比巴美关系更为稳固。

column1: On one hand, Pakistan is seeking large investments from China to improve its physical infrastructure and exploit its considerable mineral wealth.
column2: 一方面，巴基斯坦正在寻求大量的中国投资用以改善本国的基础设施并开发其可观的矿产财富。

column1: On the other hand, the Chinese have been invited to develop Gwadar port on the Balochistan coast, and to use it as a base for their fast-expanding navy.
column2: 另一方面，中国应邀在俾路支省海岸修建瓜达尔港，并将该港用于其快速扩张的海军的基地。

column1: While China has not responded to these overtures with the degree of enthusiasm that accompanied them, the Chinese would be happy to fill the strategic vacuum likely to be created by America’s accelerated departure from AfPak.
column2: 尽管中国尚未对围绕他们的热情提议做出反应，但他们非常乐于填补美国加速撤离阿富汗巴基斯坦后留下的战略真空。

column1: A major realignment of forces in the region is looming, and, with it, a new round of Asia’s old Great Game.
column2: 该地区即将发生重大的力量调整，随着这次力量调整，又会上演新一轮亚洲博弈的戏码。

column1: When Women Lead
column2: 当女性掌权

column1: MUNICH – Would the world be more peaceful if women were in charge?
column2: 慕尼黑—如果让女性来领导，世界会变得更和平吗？

column1: A challenging new book by the Harvard University psychologist Steven Pinker says that the answer is “yes.”
column2: 哈佛大学心理学家斯蒂芬·平克（Steven Pinker）的新书对此的回答是“是 ” 。

column1: In The Better Angels of Our Nature, Pinker presents data showing that human violence, while still very much with us today, has been gradually declining.
column2: 在《天性善良的天使 》 （ The Better Angels of Our Nature）一书中，平克用大量数据证明，人身暴力虽然仍然困扰着世界，但已呈现出逐渐减少之势。

column1: Moreover, he says, “over the long sweep of history, women have been and will be a pacifying force.
column2: 此外，他还宣称“从历史长河看，女性一直是、将来也会继续是和平的动力。

column1: Traditional war is a man’s game: tribal women never band together to raid neighboring villages.”
column2: 传统战争是男性之间的游戏：部落中的女成员从来不会联合起来扫荡相邻部落 。 ”

column1: As mothers, women have evolutionary incentives to maintain peaceful conditions in which to nurture their offspring and ensure that their genes survive into the next generation.
column2: 作为母亲，女性具有进化性动力维系和平环境，以便更好地哺育后代，确保自己的基因传递下去。

column1: Skeptics immediately reply that women have not made war simply because they have rarely been in power.
column2: 质疑者马上就可以反驳说，女性之所以不曾引发战争，只是因为她们很少掌权。

column1: If they were empowered as leaders, the conditions of an anarchic world would force them to make the same bellicose decisions that men do.
column2: 如果她们能获得领袖之位，得到权力，那么这个弱肉强食的世界将迫使她们采取与男性一致的好战决策。

column1: Margaret Thatcher, Golda Meir, and Indira Gandhi were powerful women; all of them led their countries to war.
column2: 撒切尔夫人、梅厄夫人和英迪拉·甘地都是掌权的女性；在她们的任期内，她们的国家无不对别国开战了。

column1: But it is also true that these women rose to leadership by playing according to the political rules of “a man’s world.”
column2: 但不可否认的是，这些女性是顺着“男性世界”的政治规则爬到领导人的位子上的。

column1: It was their success in conforming to male values that enabled their rise to leadership in the first place.
column2: 她们首先满足了男性的价值观，这是她们获得领导权的第一步。

column1: In a world in which women held a proportionate share (one-half) of leadership positions, they might behave differently in power.
column2: 如果女性能够在领导岗位上顶半边天，那么她们掌权后的行为也许会有所不同。

column1: So we are left with the broader question: does gender really matter in leadership?
column2: 因此，我们需要面临更广泛的问题：性别真的能影响领导行为吗？

column1: In terms of stereotypes, various psychological studies show that men gravitate to the hard power of command, while women are collaborative and intuitively understand the soft power of attraction and persuasion.
column2: 很多心理学研究表明，男性渴望发号施令的硬权力，而女性更具合作精神，在本能上更理解吸引和说服的软权力。

column1: Americans tend to describe leadership with tough male stereotypes, but recent leadership studies show increased success for what was once considered a “feminine style.”
column2: 在美国传统中，领导人总是硬朗的男性形象，但最新的领导力研究表明，曾经被认为是“娘娘腔”的做派，其成功的可能性正在增加。

column1: In information-based societies, networks are replacing hierarchies, and knowledge workers are less deferential.
column2: 在一个基于信息的社会中，网络正在代替层级，脑力工作者更加难以驯服了。

column1: Management in a wide range of organizations is changing in the direction of “shared leadership,” and “distributed leadership,” with leaders in the center of a circle rather than atop a pyramid.
column2: 大量组织的管理正在朝“共同领导”和“分散领导”的方向转变，其领导层处于圆心，而不是金字塔塔尖。

column1: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt said that he had to “coddle” his employees.
column2: 前谷歌首席执行官施密特（Eric Schmidt）说，他必须“骄纵”手下的雇员。

column1: Even the military faces these changes.
column2: 就连军队也面临着这种改变。

column1: In the United States, the Pentagon says that Army drillmasters do “less shouting at everyone,” because today’s generation responds better to instructors who play “a more counseling-type role.”
column2: 在美国，五角大楼宣称陆军教官“动辄大吼的情况更少了 ” ， 因为新新一代对“更多扮演导师角色”的教官反应更好。

column1: Military success against terrorists and counterinsurgents requires soldiers to win hearts and minds, not just break buildings and bodies.
column2: 从军事上战胜恐怖主义以及反暴动要求士兵能够赢得心理战，而不仅仅是摧毁敌人的工事和肉体。

column1: Former US President George W. Bush once described his role as “the decider,” but there is much more to modern leadership than that.
column2: 前美国总统乔治·W·布什曾经将他的角色描述为“决定者 ” ， 但现代领导工作的范围远不止这一点。

column1: Modern leaders must be able to use networks, to collaborate, and to encourage participation.
column2: 现代领导人必须能够使用网络，能够协调并鼓舞参与者。

column1: Women’s non-hierarchical style and relational skills fit a leadership need in the new world of knowledge-based organizations and groups that men, on average, are less well prepared to meet.
column2: 女性的非层级制风格和公关技巧更适合在当今新涌现的基于知识的组织和团体中担任领导职位，男性（平均而言）还没有做好适应这一变化的准备。

column1: In the past, when women fought their way to the top of organizations, they often had to adopt a “masculine style,” violating the broader social norm of female “niceness.”
column2: 过去，当女性奋斗在爬向组织最高宝座之路的时候，她们通常不得不采取一种“阳刚风格 ” ， 打破女性“温柔”的常规社会范式。

column1: Now, however, with the information revolution and democratization demanding more participatory leadership, the “feminine style” is becoming a path to more effective leadership.
column2: 但是，如今，信息革命和民主化要求更具参与性的领导，因此“娘娘腔”正在成为更有效率的领导方式。

column1: In order to lead successfully, men will not only have to value this style in their women colleagues, but will also have to master the same skills.
column2: 为了获得成功，男性不但必须理解女性同事处事风格的价值，还必须掌握这一技巧。

column1: That is a trend, not (yet) a fact.
column2: 这是一个趋势，而（尚）不是既成事实。

column1: Women still lag in leadership positions, holding only 5% of top corporate positions and a minority of positions in elected legislatures (just 16% in the US, for example, compared to 45% in Sweden).
column2: 女性仍然在领导职位的竞争中处于劣势，公司首脑中只有5%是女性，议员选举中当选女性也只是少数（比如，美国只有16 % ， 而瑞典达到了45 % ） 。

column1: One study of the 1,941 rulers of independent countries during the twentieth century found only 27 women, roughly half of whom came to power as widows or daughters of a male ruler.
column2: 一项研究表明，在20世纪独立国家的1 941名执政者中，只有27名女性，其中还有一半是以男性执政者的遗孀或女儿身份问鼎权力的。

column1: Less than 1% of twentieth-century rulers were women who gained power on their own.
column2: 整个20世纪，只有不到1%的执政者是完全靠自己获得成功的。

column1: So, given the new conventional wisdom in leadership studies that entering the information age means entering a woman’s world, why are women not doing better?
column2: 那么，既然领导力研究中的新传统智慧表明进入信息时代等于进入女性时代，那么为什么女性的表现没有起色呢？

column1: Lack of experience, primary caregiver responsibilities, bargaining style, and plain old discrimination all help to explain the gender gap.
column2: 因为女性缺乏经验，其首要角色是看护者，其谈判风格尚不为人所接受，且旧歧视顽固不化，这些都能解释性别差异。

column1: Traditional career paths, and the cultural norms that constructed and reinforced them, simply have not enabled women to gain the skills required for top leadership positions in many organizational contexts.
column2: 传统职业道路及其形成和加强的文化范式使得女性无法在组织环境中获得最高领导职位所必须的技能。

column1: Research shows that even in democratic societies, women face a higher social risk than men when attempting to negotiate for career-related resources such as compensation.
column2: 研究表明，即使是在民主社会中，女性在进行与职业生涯资源有关的谈判（比如薪资谈判）时所面临的社会风险也要高于男性。

column1: Women are generally not well integrated into male networks that dominate organizations, and gender stereotypes still hamper women who try to overcome such barriers.
column2: 女性总的来说无法很好地融入主导组织的男性网络，而顽固的性别观念仍然是女性克服这些障碍的绊脚石。

column1: This bias is beginning to break down in information-based societies, but it is a mistake to identify the new type of leadership we need in an information age simply as “a woman’s world.”
column2: 这一歧视在基于信息的社会中正开始被打破，但把我们在信息时代所需要的新的领导风格简单地归为“女性世界”是不对的。

column1: Even positive stereotypes are bad for women, men, and effective leadership.
column2: 即便是积极的顽固观念，对女性、男性和高效领导也是不利的。

column1: Leaders should be viewed less in terms of heroic command than as encouraging participation throughout an organization, group, country, or network.
column2: 领袖应该更多地在组织、团队、国家或网络中承担鼓励参与的角色，更少地扮演英雄式的主宰者。

column1: Questions of appropriate style – when to use hard and soft skills – are equally relevant for men and women, and should not be clouded by traditional gender stereotypes.
column2: 什么才是合适的风格 — — 什么时候硬，什么时候软 — — 对男性和女性同样重要，我们不应该被传统的性别顽固旧观念蒙蔽了双眼。

column1: In some circumstances, men will need to act more “like women”; in others, women will need to be more “like men.”
column2: 在某些情形中，男性需要表现得“像个娘们 ” ， 而女性在某些情形中需要表现得“像个爷们 ” 。

column1: The key choices about war and peace in our future will depend not on gender, but on how leaders combine hard- and soft-power skills to produce smart strategies.
column2: 我们的未来是战争还是和平，关键的选择并不取决于性别，而取决于领袖如何软硬兼施来构造巧妙的战略。

column1: Both men and women will make those decisions.
column2: 不论是男性还是女性，都可以做出决策。

column1: But Pinker is probably correct when he notes that the parts of the world that lag in the decline of violence are also the parts that lag in the empowerment of women.
column2: 但平克指出，从世界范围看，暴力消解不力的地区往往也是女性掌权情形落后的地区，或许，他是对的。

column1: When Yes Means No
column2: 当“是”意味着“不”

column1: Most commentators routinely assume that a Yes vote in the May 29 French referendum on the proposed European Union Constitution would be good for Europe and the EU.
column2: 大部分评论家都例行公事地以为，若5月29日法国公民投票结果赞成正在审议中的欧盟宪法，这将对欧洲和欧盟都有好处。

column1: But there is reason to doubt the conventional wisdom.
column2: 但是，我们却有理由对这些想当然的观点表示质疑。

column1: The French referendum will determine the political fate of French President Jacques Chirac – not France’s commitment to Europe, which is fixed and immutable.
column2: 法国公投将决定的不是法国对欧洲永恒不变的义务，而是法国总统雅克·希拉克的政治命运。

column1: If the French vote No, M. Chirac is finished.
column2: 如果法国投了反对票，那么希拉克先生就完蛋了。

column1: If they vote Yes, he is re-empowered.
column2: 如果他们投了赞成票，那么希拉克将东山再起。

column1: Europe clearly would be better off with Chirac weakened than strengthened, even if it means a temporary slowing of the pace of integration.
column2: 显然，势力削弱的希拉克比势力强大的他对欧洲更为有利，即使这意味着欧洲整合的进程将暂时放缓脚步。

column1: Chirac practices the politics of “scapegoatism” and excuses.
column2: 希拉克善于在政治上寻找“替罪羊”和运用借口托词。

column1: According to Chirac, France’s exports are lagging not because France is losing its international competitiveness – although it is, especially to Germany – but because of the strong euro.
column2: 他辩称，法国出口下降并不是因为法国失去了它的国际竞争力 — — 尽管事实的确如此，尤其是法国对德国的出口 — — 而是因为走势强劲的欧元。

column1: Likewise, France’s economic growth is waning not because France has failed to undertake necessary structural reforms, but because European interest rates are too high.
column2: 同样地，法国的经济增长衰退并不是因为法国没有能够采取必要的结构性改革，而是因为欧洲的利率太高了。

column1: Who does Chirac think is at fault?
column2: 那希拉克认为究竟是谁的错呢？

column1: The European Central Bank, of course, for allowing the euro to appreciate too much and for not cutting interest rates enough.
column2: 当然是欧洲中央银行，因为是它默许欧元升值过快，却没有降低利率。

column1: Unfortunately, this is typical of Chirac’s leadership style: blame others, excuse yourself, and ignore reform.
column2: 不幸的是，这正是典型的希拉克领导风格：责怪他人，原谅自己，无视改革。

column1: This is hardly the type of leadership Europe needs to survive and prosper in the modern world.
column2: 欧洲若要在现代世界中生存并繁荣，这可不是它需要的领导风格。

column1: But Europe will get more of it if the French vote Yes.
column2: 但是如果法国投了赞成票，那么欧洲就更有的受了。

column1: Europe also would continue to be dominated by the interests of the big countries, with the small countries in the back of the bus.
column2: 由于小国的胆小懦弱，欧洲还将继续受到大国利益的控制。

column1: The fate of the Franco-German axis, in particular, hinges on the outcome of the referendum.
column2: 法-德轴心的命运尤其与此次公投的结果休戚相关。

column1: A Yes invigorates the axis; a No weakens it.
column2: 法国的赞成票将加强该轴心，否决票则将削弱它。

column1: “Who would follow Chirac if the French vote No?” asked one EU ambassador in a recent interview.
column2: “若法国投否决票，谁会跟在它的后面呢 ？ ”

column1: “Even Berlin has options.”
column2: 一位欧盟大使在最近一次采访中这样发问 ， “ 就连柏林也有自己的选择 。 ”

column1: But Berlin would not like a No vote.
column2: 但是柏林并不希望看到一张否决票。

column1: If Chirac goes down, German Chancellor Gerhard Schroeder loses face as well.
column2: 如果希拉克下台，德国总理格哈德·施罗德也会脸上无光。

column1: Two birds would be wounded with one stone.
column2: 正所谓一石可伤二鸟。

column1: The prospect of a re-energized Franco-German axis is why the Dutch – who are traditionally pro-European but do not want a Europe that marginalizes small countries – might vote No in their referendum (which follows shortly upon France’s) if the French vote Yes.
column2: 重新注入生机的法-德轴心的前景解释了为何一旦法国投出否决票，荷兰 — — 这个历史上一向亲欧、反对欧洲边缘化小国的国家 — — 可能会在它（紧随法国公投之后）的公民投票中投出反对票。

column1: A Dutch No would signal rejection of a corporatist Europe dominated by French and German interests, as well as representing a protest against the unpopular conservative and moralistic policies of the Balkenende government.
column2: 荷兰的否决票是他们反对法国和德国利益控制下的合作主义欧洲的一个信号，也表达了他们对鲍肯内得（Balkenende）政府不得人心的保守说教政策的抗议。

column1: France is not the only EU country with an unpopular leader.
column2: 法国并非欧洲唯一一个领导人不受拥戴的国家。

column1: Eastern Europe also has a big stake in the outcome of the French referendum.
column2: 东欧和法国公投的结果也利害彼关。

column1: Chirac made it perfectly clear how he feels about the new smaller countries when he told them to “shut up” when they disagreed with him over Iraq.
column2: 当那些小国对希拉克的伊拉克政策表示不同意见时候，希拉克通过让他们“闭嘴”明确地表示出了他对这些小国的态度。

column1: More recently, Chirac’s foreign minister, Michel Barnier, chastised the Romanian President Traian Barescu for lacking a “European reflex,” because Barescu plans to align Romania with Anglo-Saxon liberal economic policies, and wants a special relationship with the US and UK to improve security in the Black Sea region.
column2: 就在前不久，法国外长米歇尔·巴尼耶（Michel Barnier）严厉谴责罗马尼亚总统特拉扬·伯塞斯库（Traian Barescu）缺乏“欧洲反应 ” ， 因为伯塞斯库准备在罗马尼亚实施盎格鲁-萨克逊自由经济政策，并欲与英国及美国建立特殊关系以加强黑海地区的安全。

column1: Rather than buckle to France’s will, however, the Romanian president warned France’s leaders to stop lecturing his country – a sure sign that French influence is on the wane even in countries with which it has had close historical ties.
column2: 罗马尼亚总统没有顺从法国的意思，相反他警告法国领导人不要再对罗马尼亚指手画脚地说教 — — 这明确表明，即使在那些与它历史渊源深厚的国家，法国的影响力也在不断下降。

column1: A French No would sit well with the Union’s newer members from Eastern Europe, who know Chirac is not their friend, and who are more attracted by promises of rapid economic growth than social protection and corporate state mischief.
column2: 法国的否决票将正合那些来自东欧的新欧盟成员国之意，他们知道希拉克并非善友，比起社会保障和合作主义国家这些招数，他们对快速经济增长更感兴趣。

column1: Finally, the referendum contains an unstated question about the future of European Monetary Union (EMU) and the euro.
column2: 最后，公民投票包含了一个未说明的问题，即欧洲货币联盟(EMU)和欧元的未来。

column1: The Yes camp argues that rejecting the Constitution would damage the European Central Bank (ECB) and the euro.
column2: 支持宪法的阵营坚称，反对欧盟宪法将会损害欧洲中央银行（ECB）和欧元。

column1: But why would the EU fall into chaos and the euro wilt if the Treaty of Nice remains in force.
column2: 但是，如果尼斯条约仍然有效的话，为什么欧盟会陷入混乱，欧元会疲软呢？

column1: In the area of monetary integration, the European Constitution doesn’t change anything, other than the voting procedures in the Governing Council if EMU grows beyond 15 member countries.
column2: 在货币整合时代，欧盟宪法除了在欧洲货币联盟的成员国超过15个的情况下改变管理委员会内的投票程序，并不能改变其他任何事情，

column1: A Yes vote, on the other hand, would encourage a reassured Chirac to continue his policy of no reform and scapegoating the ECB.
column2: 从另外一方面来说，一张赞成票，将会鼓励一个重整旗鼓的希拉克继续他的无改革政策，继续把责任推卸给欧洲中央银行。

column1: External political pressure on the ECB and its president, Jean-Claude Trichet, to lower interest rates and talk the euro down surely would increase.
column2: 施加于欧洲中央银行及其行长让·克洛德·特里谢（Jean-Claude Trichet）身上、要求降低利率并且降低欧元的外部政治压力肯定还会加强。

column1: This is more likely to bring the euro down than a No vote.
column2: 比起一张否决票，这看起来也许更能有效降低欧元。

column1: Where are the Global Problem Solvers?
column2: 全球问题的解决者到哪去了？

column1: NEW YORK – One odd and disturbing aspect of global politics today is the confusion between negotiations and problem-solving.
column2: 发自纽约 — — 当今全球政治的一个奇怪和令人困扰之处是对谈判协商和解决问题的混淆。

column1: According to a timetable agreed in December 2007, we have six months to reach a global agreement on climate change in Copenhagen.
column2: 在2007年12月份在哥本哈根制定的时间表，我们本还有6个月的时间在气候变化问题上达成全球一致的协议。

column1: Governments are engaged in a massive negotiation, but they are not engaged in a massive effort at problem-solving.
column2: 然而各国政府却都把心思放在了大规模谈判而非不遗余力地解决问题之上。

column1: Each country asks itself, “How do I do the least and get the other countries to do the most?,” when they should be asking instead, “How do we cooperate to achieve our shared goals at minimum cost and maximum benefit?”
column2: 每一个本应自问“该如何合作以最低成本和最大收益实来现共同目标”的国家，却反而在算计“该如何让自己承担最少而让其他国家做的更多 ？ ”

column1: These might sound like the same thing, but they are not.
column2: 上述两个问题虽然都跟国家利益最大化有关，但却有着天渊之别。

column1: Addressing the problem of climate change requires reducing emissions of carbon dioxide from fossil fuels, which in turn involves choices in technology, some of which already exists and much of which needs to be developed.
column2: 事实上，解决气候变化问题需要减少燃烧化石燃料所排放的二氧化碳，但这反过来又涉及到相关技术的选择问题，虽然其中一些技术已经成熟，但还有一大部分仍有待发展。

column1: For example, coal plants, if they are to remain a major part of the energy mix, will need to capture and store their CO2, a process called “carbon capture and sequestration,” or CCS for short. Yet this technology remains unproved.
column2: 举例来说，如果那些燃煤发电厂希望自己能继续作为能源供给结构的重要组成部分存在的话，那么就要应用捕获并储存二氧化碳的技术，这个技术过程被称为“碳捕捉和封存 ” （ 简称CCS ） ， 但却还未经研究证明有效。

column1: Similarly, we will need renewed public confidence in a new generation of nuclear power, with plants that are safe and reliably monitored.
column2: 同样，我们需要公众对新一代的核电厂重新树立信心并安全可靠地监控其核反应堆的运作。

column1: We will need new technologies to mobilize large-scale solar power, wind power, and geothermal power. We might try to tap bio-fuels, but only in forms that do not compete with food supplies or with precious environmental assets.
column2: 我们还需要发展能够大规模利用太阳能、风能和地热资源的新技术，甚至可以尝试开发生物燃料，只要不威胁到粮食供给和稀有环境资源就行了。

column1: The list goes on.

We will need improved energy efficiency, through “green buildings” and more efficient appliances. We will need to switch from cars with internal-combustion engines to hybrids, plug-in hybrids, battery-powered, and fuel-cell-powered vehicles.
column2: 此外世界各国还需要利用“绿色建筑”和节能家用电器来提高能源利用率，并引进以混合动力，充电式混合动力，充电电池以及燃料电池等新技术驱动的汽车来取代那些传统内燃机汽车。

column1: Achieving a new generation of electric vehicles will require a decade of public and private partnership to achieve basic technological development (such as improved batteries), a more robust electric grid, new infrastructure for re-charging the automobiles, and much more.
column2: 但实现电动汽车的更新换代就要求公共和私人部门通力合作，耗费10年时间来发展基础技术（如电池改良 ） ， 架设更加强大的电网，建造为汽车充电的新基础设施以及更多其他方面的措施。

column1: Similarly, it will take a decade of public and private investments to demonstrate the feasibility of coal-fired plants that capture their carbon dioxide.
column2: 同样，我们也将需要10年的公共和私人合作投资来进行燃煤发电厂捕捉二氧化碳技术的可行性研究。

column1: The switchover to new technologies is not mainly a matter of negotiation but of engineering, planning, financing, and incentives.
column2: 而上述这些新技术的转换不仅涉及谈判协商，更涉及到工程，规划，融资和激励机制。

column1: How can the world most effectively develop, demonstrate, and then spread these new technologies?
column2: 试问全世界如何才能最有效地开发，展示，然后推广这些新技术？

column1: Where the benefits are unlikely to accrue to private investors, who should pay for the early demonstration models, which will require billions of dollars?
column2: 当投资收益吸引不了私人投资者时，谁又应该为建造早期示范工程的数十亿美元买单？

column1: How should we preserve private incentives for research and development while committing to transfer successful technologies to developing countries?
column2: 如何既维护私人部门研究发展这些技术的积极性，又确保能将技术成功转让给发展中国家？

column1: These are pressing, unsolved questions.
column2: 这些问题都非常紧迫而尚未解决。

column1: Yet the global negotiations on climate change are focusing on a different set of questions.
column2: 然而应对全球气候变化问题的国际谈判却在关注一组截然不同的问题。

column1: The negotiations are mainly about which groups of countries should cut their emissions, by how much, how fast, and relative to which baseline year.
column2: 谈判主要集中于哪些国家应该减排，减排多少，减排速度以及从哪一年开始。

column1: Countries are being pressed to cut emissions by 2020 by certain percentage targets, without much serious discussion about how the cuts can be achieved.
column2: 以致许多国家在还没有认真讨论该如何减排的情况下就已经承受着在2020���达到特定指标的重压。

column1: The answers depend, of course, on which low-emission technologies will be available, and on how fast they can be deployed.
column2: 而很显然能这些问题的答案其实要取决于使用哪些低排放技术以及什么时候投入使用。

column1: Consider the United States. To cut emissions sharply, the US will need to switch over this decade to a new fleet of automobiles, powered increasingly by electricity.
column2: 以美国为例，要想迅速减少碳排放量，美国需要在十年内将所有汽车逐渐替换为新的电力驱动车型。

column1: The US will also have to decide on the renewal and expansion of its nuclear power plants, and on the use of public lands to build new renewable energy plants, especially using solar power.
column2: 美国还要下决心改造并扩大其核电厂，并在公共用地上建造更多可再生能源发电厂，特别是太阳能发电厂。

column1: And the US will need a new power grid to carry renewable energy from low-density population sites – such as the southwestern deserts for solar power and the northern plains for wind power – to the high-density populations of the coasts.
column2: 同时，美国还需要一个新电网将可再生能源从低人口密度地区 — — 比如太阳能资源丰富的西南部沙漠和风能充沛的北部平原 — — 传输到高人口密度的沿海地区。

column1: Yet all of this requires a national plan, not simply a numerical target for emissions reduction.
column2: 然而，这一切的实现都需要全盘的国家计划，而不仅仅是一个减排的数字目标。

column1: Similarly, China, like the US, can reduce CO2 emissions through increased energy efficiency and a new fleet of electric vehicles. But China must consider the question from the vantage point of a coal-dependent economy.
column2: 而中国跟美国一样，可以通过提高能源利用率和电动汽车来减少二氧化碳排放，但也要考虑到自身经济是煤依赖型经济这一具体情况。

column1: China’s future choices depend on whether “clean coal” can really work effectively and on a large scale. Thus, China’s emissions path depends crucially on early testing of the CCS technologies.
column2: 因此中国的未来技术选择将取决于“清洁煤”技术是否有效应用并大规模推广，而整个国家的二氧化碳减排策略在很大程度上将取决于“碳捕捉和封存”技术的早期测试成果。

column1: A true global brainstorming approach would first discuss the best technological and economic options available, and how to improve these options through targeted research and development and better economic incentives.
column2: 由此可见，一个真正全球集思广益的办法就是首先讨论可资利用的最佳技术和经济选项，以及如何通过有针对性的研发和更好的经济激励措施来改进这些选项。

column1: The negotiations would discuss the range of options open to each country and region – from CCS to solar, wind, and nuclear power – and would sketch a timetable for a new generation of low-emission automobiles, recognizing that market competition as well as public financing will set the actual pace.
column2: 而谈判协商将讨论每一个国家和地区的技术选择范围 — — 从“清洁煤”到太阳能，风能，以及核能 — — 并拟定推广新一代低排放汽车的时间表，同时也认识到市场竞争和政府资助这两项因素将决定上述技术推广的真实进度。

column1: Based on these building blocks, the world could agree on allocating the costs for speeding the development and spread of new low-emission technologies.
column2: 基于这些讨论模块，世界各国将讨论决定具体哪些国家将分担某种低排放技术的研发推广成本。

column1: This global framework would underpin national and global targets for emissions control and for monitoring the progress of the technological overhaul.
column2: 而这一全球性框架将成为实现各国/全球减排目标以及监测技术革新进展的基础。

column1: As new technologies are proven, the targets would become more stringent.
column2: 随着新技术的不断研究成功，那些减排目标也将变得更有说服力。

column1: Of course, part of the strategy would be to create market incentives for new low-emission technologies, so that inventors could develop their own ideas with the prospect of large profits if those ideas are right.
column2: 当然，这个策略的其中一部分将是为低排放技术引入市场激励体制，以便让那些私人研究者在有利可图的情况下发展自己的新技术。

column1: My plea to discuss plans and strategies alongside specific emissions targets might seem to risk impeding the negotiations. But if we don’t have a strategy to accompany our targets, the world’s governments might not accept such targets in the first place, or might accept them cynically, without any intention of actually meeting them.
column2: 虽然笔者提出要在具体减排目标之外制定计划和战略的请求似乎有阻碍谈判进行之嫌，但如果没有跟目标相配套的具体策略的话，各国政府首先都不会接受这一目标，即便接受了，或许也没打算真正去实现它。

column1: We need to think hard, and collaboratively, about the world’s real technological options, and then pursue a common global framework that allows us to move into a new era, one based on feasible and sustainable technologies for energy, transport, industry, and buildings.
column2: 因此各国需要同心协力认真思考世界上真正可供选择的技术，然后以各种能源，运输，工业和建筑方面的可行和可持续技术为基础，最终构建一个能带领世界踏入新时代的全球性框架。

column1: Where Are the Syrian Peacemakers?
column2: 叙利亚和平的缔造者尚在何处？

column1: DENVER – Much has been said about the similarities between the chaos in Syria and the Balkan wars of the 1990’s.
column2: 发自丹佛 — — 人们对于叙利亚与巴尔干战争之间的相似性已经多有论述。

column1: But, while the prolonged killing may indeed be reminiscent, the political and diplomatic effort that finally ended the war in Bosnia is hardly in evidence today.
column2: 但当旷日持久的杀戮确实令人回想起过去的惨剧时，当年在终结波斯尼亚战事方面所付出的政治和外交努力如今却不那么引人注目了。

column1: To date, there has been nothing similar to the Contact Group plan that was hammered out in the summer of 1994 by representatives from Britain, France, Germany, Russia, and the United States, and implemented the following year in Dayton, Ohio, after months of on-the-scene diplomacy.
column2: 迄今为止，虽然在叙利亚进行了数月的现场外交行动，我们依然未能看到任何跟1994年由英国、法国、德国，俄罗斯和美国分别派代表发起，随后那年在美国俄亥俄州代顿市开始执行的联络小组计划（Contact Group plan）类似的东西。

column1: In Syria, the only diplomatic process is in the hands of the courageous, if beleaguered, former United Nations Secretary-General Kofi Annan, who has understood – better than many analysts of this latest international outrage – that any lasting political settlement must not be a triumph of one side or the other.
column2: 目前该国唯一的外交进程由勇气可嘉 — — 同时也身陷重围的 — — 前联合国秘书长科菲·安南操持着，而他比许多关注这场最新国际暴行的分析者们更清楚的一点，就是任何有持续效力的政治和解都不会是一方压倒另一方的胜利。

column1: No one can watch the ongoing violence in Syria without a sense of horror at the armed attacks on largely unarmed civilians, overwhelmingly by groups that support President Bashar al-Assad’s regime.
column2: 没人可以毫无恐惧感地坐视那些目前持续发生在叙利亚国内的，对手无寸铁平民的武装袭击 — — 且主要是由总统阿萨德的支持者发动的。

column1: But those who say that Syria is on the brink of civil war miss what has become more obvious with each passing day: Syria alreadyis in a state of civil war, one whose battle lines were drawn months ago.
column2: 但那些认为叙利亚正处于内战边缘的人也忽视了一个每过一天都变得越发明显的事实：叙利亚已经处于内战状态，而且战线早在数月之前就已划定了。

column1: On one side is Assad’s minority Alawite tribe, which over the years has attracted secular Sunnis to share in the spoils of a one-party, authoritarian state.
column2: 一方是总统阿萨德所属的少数伊斯兰什叶派阿拉维派部族，多年来他们一直与世俗逊尼派共同分享一个一党独裁国家所带来的甜头。

column1: But Assad’s coalition is broader than that, which helps to explain how he has been able to hold on to power while other regimes in the region have not.
column2: 但阿萨德的联盟构成可比这更广泛，也足以解释他为什么能在本地区其他政权先后崩溃的情况下屹立不倒。

column1: Syria’s Christians, many of its 1.5 million Kurds, and even Damascus-based, secular classes have been disinclined to join what is widely perceived in the country – though not by the rest of the world – as a sectarian Sunni opposition that might not be supportive of cultural pluralism were it to assume power.
column2: 叙利亚的基督教徒 — — 其中绝大部分是150万库尔德人 — — 甚至还有主要分布在首都大马士革的世俗阶层，都被迫加入一个可能在执政后不会支持文化多元主义的宗派主义逊尼派反对派 — — 这点在叙利亚国内司空见惯，但在国际上却鲜为人知。

column1: In the past, characterizing as a civil war a conflict in a complex region was a tacit warning that others should stay out.
column2: 在过去，在一个复杂区域发生的具备内战特征的冲突其实就是某种沉默的警告：外人不要插手。

column1: But the civil war in Syria has much broader ramifications, which could lead to a wider regional conflict.
column2: 但叙利亚的内战却有着更加严重的后果，并可能导致一场波及面更广的区域性冲突。

column1: Given this looming threat, it is becoming increasingly clear that staying out of the Syrian mess may not be an acceptable choice for countries that have an interest in a calmer and more democratic Middle East.
column2: 考虑到这个不断增大的威胁，我们也应该逐渐明白袖手旁观对于那些对一个更平静也更民主的中东感兴趣的国家来说不是一个可接受的选项。

column1: Ominously, the conflict looks increasingly like a proxy war between Iran and the Sunni Arab states, which regard their own minority Shia populations as a potential Iranian fifth column.
column2: 更不祥的是，这场冲突越来越像一场伊朗和逊尼派阿拉伯国家之间的代理人战争，而后者将本国的少数什叶派教徒视为伊朗的第五纵队。

column1: Iran has sought to maintain its influence in the Levant (including in Lebanon and among some Palestinian groups) by providing material support to Assad.
column2: 伊朗试图通过对阿萨德提供物质支持的方式来保持自身对地中海东部地区（包括在黎巴嫩以及一些巴勒斯坦团体中）的影响力。

column1: By contrast, many Sunni Arab states have provided varying degrees of support to the largely Sunni opposition, a hodgepodge of groups that include the Muslim Brotherhood and other sectarian forces similar to Egypt’s ultra-conservative Salafis.
column2: 相反，许多逊尼派阿拉伯国家则对主要由逊尼派组成的反对派提供不同程度的支持，而这股反对力量其实是一个包含了穆斯林兄弟会和其他宗派主义力量 — — 类似极端保守的埃及萨拉非党（Salafi ） — —的大杂烩。

column1: Russia and China, bruised by their loss of face in the NATO-led intervention in Libya in 2011, have sought to keep the international community out of Syria.
column2: 而俄罗斯和中国则因为在2011年北约主导的利比亚干涉行动上丢了面子，于是希望把国际社会隔绝在叙利亚国门之外。

column1: Both countries fear that intervention – whether militarily or through economic sanctions – could harm their interests in Syria, where they – especially the Russians – have been the dominant external players.
column2: 两国都害怕干涉行动 — — 不管是通过军事还是经济制裁的方式 — — 会损害他们在叙利亚的利益，而它们 — — 尤其是 — — 本来就是该国最主要的外部参与者。

column1: In the absence of concerted international action, the US and Europe have largely weighed in with vocal condemnation of the party committing the overwhelming number of human-rights violations: Assad and his henchmen. They have also highlighted the loss of life in an effort to shame Russia into adopting a more amenable position.
column2: 在缺乏协同一致的国际行动的情况下，美国和欧洲在很大程度上都是通过对那些犯下大量人权暴行的组织 — — 阿萨德及其党羽 — — 进行口头谴责的方式来施加影响,同时还不断对人员伤亡情况进行渲染以迫使俄罗斯采取一个更负责任的立场。

column1: But denouncing Assad or Russia is unlikely to produce any effect except to assure domestic audiences that the West is on the side of the angels in the conflict.
column2: 但除了能使当地听众确信西方是站在好人一方之外，谴责阿萨德或者俄罗斯起不到任何作用。

column1: Likewise, proclaimed support for disparate, barely-known rebel groups; demands for dead-on-arrival sanctions resolutions; feckless calls for Assad’s departure (as if he plans to take the advice); and half-baked ideas about enforced “safe areas” (an utter failure in Bosnia) are unlikely to spare many lives, much less bring about the endgame that is so desperately needed.
column2: 同样，对那些杂七杂八鲜为人知的反抗团体表示支持；要求执行那些几乎毫无实施可能性的制裁方案；胡乱要求阿萨德离境（好像他愿意接受这个建议的样子 ） ； 以及那些不成熟的关于建立“安全区”的想法（在波斯尼亚就遭遇了彻底的失败 ） ， 都不足以拯救许多生命，也更无法带来人们迫切需要的冲突终结。

column1: What is really needed are serious and sustained negotiations among interested international powers (let’s call them a “contact group”) on a viable political outcome.
column2: 真正需要的是关注此事的各国际力量之间进行认真且持续的谈判协商（让我们将其称之为���个“联络小组 ” ） 并因此产生一个切实可行的政治结论。

column1: A “Contact Group Plan” should be carefully worked out with Annan and his team (the only entity at this point that seems to have access to all sides).
column2: 一个“联络小组计划”应该由安南及其团队（也是目前唯一能联络各方的实体）认真制定出来。

column1: Most importantly, all of the plan’s stakeholders then need to support Annan, publicly and privately.
column2: 最重要的是，所有该计划的利益相关方都必须在计划出台后支持安南，不管是公开还是私下的。

column1: Publicly declaring support for Annan’s ceasefire plan, and then whispering to journalists that it is “in tatters,” as has occurred repeatedly in recent weeks, will not get the job done.
column2: 一边公开宣称支持安南的停火计划，一边却私下告诉记者说该计划“彻底破产 ” ， 这种最近不断重演的做法是无法取得成果的。

column1: Clearly, a new way forward is needed, and a good start would be a political/diplomatic plan that Annan could sell to the parties.
column2: 很显然，我们需要一个新的前进方式，而一个好的开始则是一个可以由安南向各方推销的政治/外交方案。

column1: In the Balkans, it was a US team that finally sold the Contact Group Plan to the parties directly involved.
column2: 在巴尔干地区是一个美国团队最终向涉事各方推销了联络小组计划。

column1: We didn’t succeed because we were geniuses. We succeeded because we had tremendous support from every country that wanted to see the horrific conflict in Bosnia brought to an end.
column2: 而我们成功推销的原因并不是因为自己是什么天才人物，是因为我们从所有希望看到波斯尼亚惨剧终结的国家处获得了极大的支持。

column1: The same unqualified support is what Annan – the best diplomat we have out there – needs and deserves.
column2: 同样的无条件支持也是安南 — — 目前叙利亚地区最优秀的外交家 — — 所需要和应得的。

column1: Where Did Market Volatility Go?
column2: 市场波动到哪里去了?

column1: Television and newspapers continue to trumpet every twist and turn of global financial markets.
column2: 电视和报纸依然在鼓吹着全球金融市场的每一次波动。

column1: In truth, however, the big story is the uneerie calm that has engulfed virtually every major asset class, from stocks to bonds.
column2: 然而，从大的层面上讲真正的情况却是令人不安的平静几乎已经席卷了从股票和债券所有大的资产品种。

column1: Is the whole investment world on Prozac?
column2: 难道整个投资界都服了缓解焦虑的百忧解了吗？

column1: Conspiracy theories abound, particularly among the ranks of financial traders, for whom volatility is like wind to a sailor.
column2: 合谋理论大量存在，尤其是在金融投资者的阶层中，对他们来说波动就像是水手眼里的风。

column1: These traders confidently figure that as long as markets gyrate, no matter what the direction, they can always make money.
column2: 这些投资者声称只要市场在转动，不管它是转向哪个方向，他们总能够赚到钱。

column1: And, thanks to the rest of us who don’t have the time, information, and skill to match wits with them, they are mostly right.
column2: 并且，我们其他的人并不拥有足够的时间、信息和技能去与他们斗智斗勇，所以他们总是对的。

column1: But, with today’s dormant markets, the pickings are slim.
column2: 可是面对今天平静的市场，他们的利润就少得可怜了。

column1: The favored bogeymen of the day are giant government investors, particularly Asian central banks, with their trillions of dollars in assets.
column2: 今天受益的精灵是巨大的政府投资者，尤其是拥有数以万亿计美元资产的亚洲中央银行。

column1: These superfunds, whose managers do not necessarily share the same passion for profit as private investors, are said to be squeezing the life out of interest rates and exchange rates.
column2: 这些超级基金，它们的经理人并不需要像私人投资者那样一心一意地追求利润，被认为挤压了利率和汇率的活力。

column1: “The big Asian central banks are oppressing us,” one young trader recently complained to me.
column2: 一位年轻的投资者最近向我抱怨说 ： “ 巨大的亚洲中央银行在压制着我们 。 ”

column1: What a difference a decade makes.
column2: 仅仅十年间就发生了怎样巨大的变化啊。

column1: During the 1990’s, private investors looked at big, lumbering central banks as cash cows, long on money and short on financial acumen.
column2: 在二十世纪九十年代，私人投资者把行动迟缓的中央银行看作现金金牛，它们有的是钱但是却缺乏敏锐的金融洞察力。

column1: George Soros once made a billion dollars off the Bank of England in just an hour.
column2: 乔治·索罗斯曾在一个小时内从英格兰银行身上赚了十亿美元。

column1: His basic strategy was a standard one: bet against any central bank that tries to defend an inconsistent macroeconomic policy.
column2: 他的基本策略很普通：攻击任何试图捍卫一个不连贯的宏观经济政策的中央银行。

column1: Traders did not win every battle, of course.
column2: 当然，投资者并不是每一次都会赢。

column1: It was the speculators whose blood flowed in the streets when they attacked Hong Kong’s dollar peg in 1998.
column2: 当他们1998年攻击香港的联系汇率时投机者们遭到了惨败。

column1: But overall, betting against big government financial institutions proved to be a richly rewarding business.
column2: 但是总的来说，攻击巨大的政府金融机构被证明可以获得巨大的回报。

column1: That was the 1990’s.
column2: 那是二十世纪九十年代的事情。

column1: Today, many traders see formerly inept state giants as financial geniuses, capable of taming complex financial formulas and exploiting their superior size and trading information to squeeze the life out of currency and interest rate markets.
column2: 今天，许多投资者把他们以前心目中无能的政府庞然大物看作金融天才，它们可以驾驭复杂的金融公式并且利用它们的超大规模和贸易信息来挤压利率和汇率市场的活力。

column1: These behemoths’ innate conservatism, having calmed bond and currency markets, is now having a similar effect on stocks.
column2: 这些庞然大物天生的保守思想使债券和汇率市场变得平静，并且现在对股票市场也正在发挥同样的作用。

column1: Although few accuse Asian central banks of explicitly conspiring to calm global markets, some say that their common cautious approach to trading is a form of implicit collusion.
column2: 尽管很少有人指责亚洲中央银行有显而易见的合谋活动来平息全球市场，但是有些人说它们在贸易上共同的谨慎措施是一种隐含的合谋方式。

column1: As much as we may sympathize with young would-be millionaire traders, does their story of oppression make any sense?
column2: 在我们对那些梦想成为百万富翁的年轻投资者表示同情的同时，他们所谓受到压制的说法真的如此吗？

column1: Could it be true that huge government investors from Asia (not to mention Russia, Latin America, and the Middle East) have quietly taken control of world markets?
column2: 亚洲（更不用提俄罗斯、拉丁美洲和中东）巨大的政府投资者真的悄悄地控制了世界市场了吗？

column1: Perhaps, but the bogeyman theory seems a bit overblown.
column2: 也许是的，但是所谓受益的精灵的说法有点夸大其词了。

column1: Yes, the big Asian central banks do sit on almost $3 trillion in assets; China’s central bank alone has around a trillion dollars.
column2: 是的，巨大的亚洲中央银行确实坐拥将近3万亿美元的资产；中国的中央银行一家就拥有将近1万亿美元。

column1: This gives them a capital base similar to the combined assets of all the world’s major hedge funds.
column2: 它们的资金相当于世界上所有大的对冲基金的资产总和。

column1: But this metric is very deceptive.
column2: 但是这个衡量标准是极具欺骗性的。

column1: Hedge funds constitute only a small percentage of overall world financial markets, which, according to a recent study by the McKinnsey Global Institute, now exceed $120 trillion.
column2: 对冲基金只在整个世界金融市场中占有很小的百分比。 而根据麦肯锡全球机构最近的一项研究显示，世界金融市场的总资产超过120万亿美元。

column1: And hedge funds, unlike banks, can leverage their bets, borrowing to take on assets many times the size of their capital base.
column2: 而跟银行不同，对冲基金可以通过贷款来下注，借到数倍于它们资金规模的资金。

column1: Otherwise, George Soros and his wealthy fellow investors could not have dreamed of taking on the Bank of England.
column2: 否则的话，乔治·索罗斯和他富有的投资者伙伴也不会梦想去挑战英格兰银行。

column1: In fact, the explanation for market calm probably lies elsewhere.
column2: 事实上，市场平静的原因也许出在其他方面。

column1: So, if a conspiracy of Asian central banks is not to blame for the volatility drought that is parching traders’ earnings, what is?
column2: 如果亚洲中央银行没有合谋造成市场波动的严重不足从而使投资者无从收益，那么原因在哪儿呢？

column1: Surely, today’s low volatility is partly cyclical.
column2: 当然，今天的低波动���分是周期性的。

column1: Stock market volatility was also very low during the early 1990’s, before reaching new peaks later in the decade.
column2: 在二十世纪九十年代早期股票市场在该年代后期达到新的顶点前其波动也非常小。

column1: Moreover, financial innovation and globalization allow markets to spread risk more effectively than ever before, placing it in the hands of those who can best manage it.
column2: 另外，金融革新和全球化使市场比以前能更有效地传播风险，而把它放在那些能最好地控制它的人手中。

column1: Improved central bank policy is another huge factor.
column2: 中央银行政策的改进也是另外一个巨大的因素。

column1: In the early 1990’s, the average level of world inflation exceeded 30%; now it is less than 4%.
column2: 在二十世纪九十年代早期，世界通货膨胀的平均水平超过30 % ； 而现在它只有不到4 % 。

column1: All of these changes have in turn contributed to lower economy-wide output and consumption volatility in both rich and developing countries.
column2: 所有这些变化反过来使富有国家和发展中的国家经济方面的产量和消费波动都降低了。

column1: They have also contributed mightily to the high general level of asset prices, helping create the vast riches of which today’s hungry young traders are so jealous.
column2: 它们还大大地帮助使资产价值总体上处于一个很高的水准，并且创造了令当今的饥渴的年轻投资者们如此羡慕的巨大的财富。

column1: So will today’s relative market calm continue?
column2: 那么今天市场相对的平静会一直延续下去吗？

column1: Unfortunately, no.
column2: 不幸的是，答案是否定的。

column1: Today’s brave new world of financial globalization will almost surely face severe new stress tests, reminding us that recessions still happen.
column2: 今天金融全球化美妙的新世界几乎肯定会面临严峻的新的压力的挑战，提醒我们衰退依然在发生着。

column1: Frankly, although I do not see the five-year-old global expansion coming to an end yet, there is no question that risks are on the rise, with output in the United States having slowed sharply in the third quarter, and central banks’ hands tied by inflation risks. Further ahead, it is not hard to imagine geopolitical instability – possibly emanating from Iran, Iraq, or North Korea – unsettling markets.
column2: 坦率地说，尽管我并不认为长达五年的全球增长已经走到了尽头，但是毫无疑问风险正在加大，美国第三季度的产量就大大放缓了，而中央银行正在极力消除通货膨胀的危险。

column1: Whatever the scenario that ends the calm, today’s age of low volatility will seem like a distant dream to most of us – and a forgotten nightmare for ambitious financial traders.
column2: 不管用什么方案来结束现在市场的平静，今天的低波动对于我们大多数人来说将会成为一个遥远的梦 — — 并且成为雄心勃勃的金融交易者们的一个遗忘的恶梦。

column1: Which New Middle East?
column2: 什么样的新中东？

column1: BERLIN – Regardless of whether democratization in the “new Middle East” succeeds or authoritarian forms of government prevail once again, one fundamental change has already become clear: no one will be able to govern without taking into account domestic public opinion.
column2: 发自柏林 — — 不管“新中东”的民主化能否成功或是独裁政府卷入土重来，一个根本性的变化已经明白无误地发生了：再没有人能在无视本国民意的情况下推行自身统治。

column1: This change will shift the foreign-policy parameters of the Middle East conflict (understood as both an Israeli-Palestinian conflict and as a conflict between Israelis and Arabs more generally).
column2: 这一变化将改变应对中东地区冲突 — — 以巴之间，或者宏观上的以色列人和阿拉伯人之间 — — 的外交政策考虑因素。

column1: Despite wars in Lebanon and Gaza, and the intifadas in the occupied West Bank, these parameters have proven surprisingly stable for decades, anchored by the peace agreements with Egypt and Jordan and the Oslo accords with the Palestinians.
column2: 在以色列与埃及和约旦两国签署的和平协议，以及与巴勒斯坦人签订的《奥斯陆协议》的基础上，不管经历了黎巴嫩和加沙地区的战争还是西岸占领区的巴勒斯坦人起义，数十年里来这些因素都出人意料地保持了稳定

column1: All this is about to change.
column2: 但这一切都将被改变。

column1: And, while the tectonic shift in the region was triggered by the “Arab Awakening,” its players are not limited to the Arab world or to the confines of the Middle East conflict.
column2: 虽然该地区的政治架构变动是由所谓的“阿拉伯觉醒”所触发的，但其参与者并不仅限于阿拉伯世界或是中东冲突的范围。

column1: The United States, Europe, Turkey, and, in a certain sense, Iran all play a role – some more directly than others.
column2: 美国、欧洲，土耳其以及（在某种情况下）伊朗都粉墨登场 — — 只是干涉的程度有不同而已。

column1: Let’s begin with the US.
column2: 让我们先看看美国。

column1: President Barack Obama’s speech in Cairo two years ago created great expectations, but few or none have been fulfilled.
column2: 奥巴马总统两年前发表的开罗讲话构思了一个宏大的远景，但事实上却毫无建树（或仅仅实现了极少部分 ） 。

column1: Instead, the US allowed a political vacuum to form in the absence of any movement on the part of Israel’s government. This vacuum has now been filled by the Arab Awakening.
column2: 相反，美国容许在以色列政府缺乏任何行动的情况下出现一个政治真空，而如今这个真空就被“阿拉伯觉醒”所填补了。

column1: Europe, meanwhile, is preoccupied with its own crisis.
column2: 与此同时，欧洲正深陷于内部危机当中。

column1: But, in the last few years, the Europeans, led by German Chancellor Angela Merkel and French President Nicolas Sarkozy, have de facto slammed the door to European Union accession in Turkey’s face.
column2: 但在过去几年中，由德国总理默克尔和法国总统萨科齐带领下的欧洲人事实上当着土耳其人的面关上了加入欧盟的大门。

column1: As a result, Turkey has embraced a “neo-Ottoman” foreign policy, in which the Arab world – even more than the Caucasus, Central Asia, and the Balkans – plays the central role.
column2: 于是土耳其转而采取了一项“准土耳其帝国”外交政策，把重心放在了阿拉伯世界 — — 甚至包括高加索，中亚和巴尔干地区。

column1: Of course, Turkey, in accordance with its political, security, and economic interests, has no choice but to pay close attention to its southern neighborhood, and must try to prevent chaotic developments there.
column2: 当然基于其政治，安全和经济利益，土耳其都必须密切关注其南面各邻邦并尝试阻止那些地区陷入任何形式的混乱当中。

column1: Turkey would be facing the same risks even if it were integrated into a European context, but its priorities would then be completely different.
column2: 虽然应对的重点会完全不同，但即使是纳入了欧洲架构中的土耳其都将面对同样的风险。

column1: Because of Europe’s short-sightedness, Turkey has in effect abandoned its ambitions for EU membership and opted for the neo-Ottoman project of becoming a Middle Eastern power – a policy shift that reflects both interests and ideology.
column2: 由于欧洲的短视，土耳其实际上放弃了自己的入盟梦想并转而走上了一条寻求成为中东重要势力的准土耳其帝国之路 — — 而这也是一条反映出其利益和意识形态的政策。

column1: On the one hand, Turkey views regional dominance as a stepping-stone to a greater global role; on the other hand, it views itself as a role model for successful modernization of the Middle East on an Islamic-democratic basis.
column2: 一方面，土耳其将区域称霸视为晋身全球势力的垫脚石；另一方面，该国也将自身视为中东地区成功实现伊斯兰民主现代化的楷模。

column1: This bid for regional preeminence will sooner or later bring Turkey into serious conflict with neighboring Iran.
column2: 这种争当区域老大的做法迟早将使土耳其和伊朗两国爆发严重冲突。

column1: If Turkey prevails, Iran and the radicals in the region will be caught on the losing side of history – and they know it.
column2: 如果土方得胜，伊朗以及区域内的极端势力将遭遇历史性的惨败 — — 而后者也深知这一点。

column1: While Turkish Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdoğan’s government is trying to maintain good relations with Iran, its ambition to become the leading Sunni power means that Turkey must sooner or later contest Iran’s influence in Iraq, as well as in Syria and Palestine. And that means conflict.
column2: 而当土耳其总理埃尔多安的政府试图与伊朗维持友好关系之时，前者成为逊尼派穆斯林国家领头羊的野心意味着土耳其迟早会在伊拉克，叙利亚和巴勒斯坦挑战伊朗的影响力 — — 这当然也意味着冲突。

column1: The drastic deterioration in Turkey’s relations with Israel is related to this emerging Iranian-Turkish rivalry.
column2: 此外土耳其与以色列关系的迅速降温也与伊朗-土耳其敌对状态的出现有关。

column1: To be sure, this rivalry also has a positive side from the Israeli point of view – the weakening of Iran and other regional radicals.
column2: 可以确定的是，这种敌对状态对以色列来说是有利的 — — 伊朗和极端分子将遭到削弱。

column1: But, for Turkey as an aspiring regional leader, the interests of the Palestinians are naturally more important than its relations with Israel.
column2: 但对土耳其这个野心勃勃的区域领袖来说，巴勒斯坦所代表的利益自然要比以色列要大。

column1: This has become all the more true in light of the revolutionary changes in the Arab world, and is at the root of Erdoğan’s foreign-policy reorientation.
column2: 而根据目前阿拉伯世界所发生的革命性变化来看这个判断显然更加正确，也是埃尔多安外交政策转向的根源。

column1: As a result, Israel is in an increasingly difficult situation.
column2: 结果以色列就陷入了一个日渐艰难的境地。

column1: Without a strategic re-orientation of its own – to remain passive is a risky endeavor in a rapidly changing world order – Israel would further delegitimize and isolate itself internationally.
column2: 由于其本身并未实施任何战略转向 — — 在一个急速变化的世界秩序中持有消极态度实在是个危险之举 — — 以色列将进一步失去其存在合法性并在国际上孤立自己。

column1: A viable Israeli answer to the dramatic changes in the region – and to their already foreseeable consequences – can only take the form of a serious offer of negotiations to Mahmoud Abbas’s Palestinian government, with the objective of signing a comprehensive peace treaty.
column2: ��以色列针对该区域激烈变革 — — 以及他们已经预料到的后果 — — 的积极回应只能是与阿巴斯领导下的巴勒斯坦权力机构展开认真谈判，并以此签署一个全面的和平条约。

column1: Security questions must be taken seriously, but they carry less and less weight, because a sufficiently long period can be left between the treaty’s conclusion and its full implementation to resolve them by mutual agreement.
column2: 虽然安全问题必须认真考虑，但由于双方在上述和平条约的签署和全面实施之间会有足够时间对此进行协商，它们所占的分量已经日渐减轻了。

column1: But Israel’s current passivity – with all of its negative long-term consequences for the country – is likely to continue as long as Prime Minister Binyamin Netanyahu considers his coalition’s survival more important than a decisive peace initiative.
column2: 但只要总理内塔尼亚胡继续认为自己执政联盟的生存比一个决定性和平方案更重要的话，以色列目前的消极 — — 以及所有将对这个国家造成的长期后果 — — 都将依然存在下去。

column1: At the same time, the pressure of the Arab revolutions is transforming the Palestinians into a dynamic political factor.
column2: 与此同时，阿拉伯革命的压力将把巴勒斯坦转变成为一个活性政治因素。

column1: For example, in view of the looming fall of Syria’s President Bashar al-Assad, the pressure of the Egyptian revolution, and the new role of Islamism in the region, Hamas’s alliance with Iran is becoming increasingly problematic.
column2: 比如说鉴于叙利亚总统阿萨德下台，埃及革命的压力以及伊斯兰教在该区域所扮演的新角色，哈马斯与伊朗的结盟正变得越来越充满变数。

column1: It remains to be seen whether, in the end, the “Turkish course” will prevail against the radicals in Gaza or not.
column2: 我们也可以拭目以待，看“土耳其进程”是否将在最后压倒加沙地区的极端势力。

column1: In any case, Hamas faces some risky and consequential decisions of its own – all the more so should its main rival, Abbas’s Palestinian Authority, succeed in its current diplomatic campaign at the United Nations.
column2: 而无论在何种情况下哈马斯都将面对一系列将给自身带来风险和负面结果的决定 — — 如果阿巴斯领导下的巴勒斯坦民族权力机构最近在联合国展开的外交行动取得成功的话，情况就将更加严重。

column1: Obama had promised a Palestinian state within one year, and Abbas is now building upon that promise.
column2: 奥巴马已经承诺在一年之内实现巴勒斯坦建国，而阿巴斯则在进一步落实这一承诺。

column1: But what happens next is crucial.
column2: 但下一步将发生的事则极端重要。

column1: Will Abbas be able to keep the Palestinians on a diplomatic path, or will the situation degenerate again into violence and another disaster?
column2: 阿巴斯是否能巴勒斯坦人团结在一条外交道路上，或者再次堕落为暴力和另一场灾难。

column1: And what will the Palestinian road towards peace look like after the UN decision to recognize some form of statehood for Palestine?
column2: 而当联合国认可了某种形式的建国之后巴勒斯坦的和平之路又将是何种走向？

column1: Given the current pace of change in the Middle East, we might not have to wait long for answers – or for more questions.
column2: 依照中东地区目前的变革轨迹，我们可能不需要等待太久就能看到答案 — — 或者是更多的麻烦。

column1: Which Turkey in What Europe?
column2: 何种土耳其加入何种欧洲？

column1: “A tempest in a teapot” is perhaps the best description of the recent squabbles about opening the European Union’s accession negotiations with Turkey.
column2: 最近欧盟开启与土耳其的入盟谈判所引起的争论可谓小题大做。

column1: The election in Germany was in part fought on the issue, as Chancellor Angela Merkel ran on a platform of offering Turkey a “privileged partnership,” rather than full admission.
column2: 德国大选有一部分也是有关这一问题，德国总理安格拉·默克尔的竞选纲领为土耳其提供一个“特殊伙伴关系 ” ， 而非完整成员资格。

column1: The Austrian government’s posturing – motivated as much by its upcoming elections as genuine foreign policy concerns – seemed to threaten the opening of the accession talks themselves.
column2: 奥地利政府受即将到来的选举和切实的外交担忧的双重推动而做出的姿态似乎威胁到开启入盟谈判。

column1: But German foreign policy has always been marked by continuity, and the new foreign minister, Frank-Walter Steinmeier, the chief of staff under former Chancellor Gerhard Schröder, has repeatedly advocated full membership for Turkey.
column2: 但是，德国的外交政策素来以连续性著称，前总理施罗德办公厅主任、新任外长弗兰克·沃尔特·施泰因迈尔多次重申土耳其应当具有完整的成员资格。

column1: It is thus unlikely that the Grand Coalition will adopt a different political approach towards Turkey than the previous Red-Green government.
column2: 因此，德国的大联合政府不大可能在对待土耳其的问题上采取与前红绿政府不同的政治策略。

column1: After a bit of drama, Austria also gave up its opposition to the accession talks, in exchange for a promise of admission for Croatia, and the intra-European squabbles have been patched up.
column2: 一阵激变之后，奥地利也不再反对入盟谈判。 作为交换，它得到了克罗地亚入盟的保证。
这场欧洲内部的争论终于终结。

column1: So the British, under Tony Blair’s current presidency of the EU Council of Ministers, have gotten their way for now, and the Americans – keen backers of Turkey’s EU aspirations – have once again succeeded in acting as a “European power.”
column2: 于是，英国作为欧盟轮值主席国暂时如愿以偿。 美国积极支持土耳其入盟的愿望，也再一次成功地扮演了“欧洲列强”的角色。

column1: Accession negotiations with Turkey are now a fact.
column2: 土耳其的入盟谈判现在成为了既成事实。

column1: But much of the debate about Turkey’s possible accession has been focused on the wrong issues: whether Turkey is culturally “in line” with Europe or whether Europe is in some sense “Christian” and could assimilate 100 million Muslims.
column2: 但是，有关土耳其的可能的入盟争论却集中于错误的问题上。 也就是，土耳其在文化上是否与欧洲“一致 ” ， 或者，欧洲在某种含义上是否归属“基督教 ” 、 能否吸纳一亿穆斯林。

column1: The real issue – not disputed even by most Turks – is that Turkey is neither economically ready nor, above all, a mature enough democracy for full EU membership.
column2: 真正的问题是，土耳其既非在经济上准备就绪，而且最为重要的是，并不是一个符合欧盟成员资格的完全民主国家。 这一问题连大多数土耳其人都不质疑。

column1: and Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, Turkey’s prime minister, can place his trust in the near automatic mechanisms that characterize the EU’s instDespite substantial progress, democratization is only a torso.
column2: 尽管土耳其取得了实质性进步，但是民主化仍然残缺不全。

column1: Human and civil rights still do not meet Western European standards, religious and ethnic minorities are recognized only on paper, acknowledgment of the historic genocide of the Armenians is given mere lip service, and civilian control over the military remains weak.
column2: 人权以及民权仍然无法满足西欧标准，宗教和少数族裔只是在纸面上得到承认，承认史上对亚美尼亚人的种族屠杀还仅仅是口惠而实不至，而军队的平民控制依然微弱。

column1: Raising this long list of shortcomings puts Western critics in an uncomfortable position with their pro-European Turkish interlocutors.
column2: 列举这一长长的不足清单足以把西方批评家同他们的亲欧洲的土耳其对话者处于一个不利的地位。

column1: Turkey’s pro-Western forces find just as much fault with their country’s political system as the European critics, but they expect the prospect of EU membership to accelerate the progress of reforms.
column2: 土耳其的亲西方势力所看到的他们国家政治体制中的毛病和欧洲批评家所看到的一样多，但是，他们期望欧盟成员的前景可以加快改革进程。

column1: Nationalist Turks, on the other hand, regard joining the EU mainly as a confirmation of national power and view all criticism of the country as a violation of Turks’ collective honor.
column2: 另一方面，土耳其的民族主义者主要把加入欧盟视为对其国力的确认，而且将对其国家的所有批评都看作是对土耳其人集体荣誉的破坏。

column1: Had the start of accession negotiations been postponed or canceled, Turkey’s pro-Europeans would have suffered from a nationalist backlash.
column2: 如果入盟谈判推迟或取消，那么，土耳其的亲欧洲人士将受到民族主义者回击。

column1: Even now, Turkey’s unrequited love for Europe can still fade into aversion, with Islamic fundamentalism and Greater Turkey nationalism continuing to represent other, eastward-leaning options.
column2: 即使是现在，土耳其对欧洲的一厢情愿仍旧可能转变为厌恶，到时，伊斯兰原教旨主义和大土耳其民族主义将继续代表其他向东方倾斜的选择。

column1: Advocates of a conditioned accession are thus under extraordinary pressure to be nice, even as Turkish officials stage provocations, like the recent suit against the noted author Orhan Pamuk for “public denigration of Turkish identity” because he dared to question the official position on the Armenian genocide.
column2: 有条件入盟的支持者因此面临巨大的压力要做到无懈可击，即使是土耳其官员挑起事端也是如此。 著名作家奥冉·巴穆最近因“公开诋毁土耳其特色”而遭到起诉，因为他敢于质疑官方有关亚美尼亚种族屠杀的立场。

column1: As a result, a general lack of clarity about what kind of Turkey should be accepted characterizes the accession debate, which focuses – much as in the recent referenda on the EU constitution in France and the Netherlands – on rather meaningless generalities.
column2: 所以，对于究竟应当接受哪种土耳其的问题莫衷一是成为入盟争论的特征。 这一争论就像最近法国和荷兰的欧盟宪法全民公投一样集中于没有意义的一般原则。

column1: But, more importantly, the lack of clarity on the Turkish accession question reflects Europe’s ambivalence regarding its image of itself.
column2: 但是，更为重要的是，在土耳其入盟问题上莫衷一是反映了欧洲在其本身形象上的矛盾态度。

column1: To be sure, Turkey shows substantial political and cultural differences, especially when it comes to the importance of civil society, sexual equality, and the role of religion in public life.
column2: 的确，土耳其展现了实质上的政治和文化区别，特别是在公众社会的重要性、性别平等以及公共生活中宗教的作用等等问题上。

column1: But the real question is this: what kind of Europe do Europeans themselves want?
column2: 然而，实际问题是：欧洲人自己想要一个什么样子的欧洲？

column1: “Deepening” and “widening” European integration are the superficial opposites here.
column2: 在此 ， “ 加深”和“扩大”欧洲联合只是表面对立。

column1: Austria does not want any more members – with the inconsistent exception of Croatia – but wants to deepen the EU’s political and cultural unity.
column2: 除了克罗地亚这一并不连贯的例外之外，奥地利不想要任何更多的成员，但是想要加深欧盟的政治和文化团结。

column1: Many “old” Europeans, including Germany after Schröder’s resignation and France under a weakened Jacques Chirac, share that stance.
column2: 许多“老”欧洲人，包括施罗德辞职后的德国和雅克·希拉克权力削弱后的法国，都持有那一立场。

column1: Britain, the leading nation of “new” Europe, has no desire for an EU constitution, more executive and parliamentary power in Brussels, a stronger European Parliament, or the euro.
column2: 作为“新”欧洲的主要国家，英国无意通过欧盟宪法，增强布鲁塞尔的行政和议会权力和欧洲议会或者实行欧元。

column1: Like many new members, Britain prefers a loosely connected Europe of different nations – essentially a free-trade zone, but with open borders at its periphery – with sufficient strategic coordination to constitute a quasi-empire in geopolitical terms, on a par with the United States.
column2: 像许多新成员一样，英国更喜欢一个由不同国家组成的、松散联合的欧洲，也就是基本上是一个自由贸易区，外围开放边界，战略协调充分，以便同美国平起平坐，成为一个地缘政治意义上的准帝国。

column1: The fundamental difference is that a loosely tied Union is attractive to all sorts of aspirants, including Georgia, Ukraine, and other Soviet successor states – and perhaps even North African countries like Morocco – while a “deepened” Europe, with a clear political identity, high social-welfare entitlements, and growing cultural homogeneity, would naturally set itself apart and not be particularly attractive to these countries.
column2: 根本区别是，一个松散的联盟对各类有意入盟的国家而言都有吸引力，包括格鲁吉亚、乌克兰以及其他苏联继承国，甚至像摩洛哥那样的北非国家；而“深化的”欧洲，由于明显的政治特征、高昂的社会福利以及不断增长的文化同性，自然会与众不同，对于这些国家而言并无特别吸引力。

column1: Paradoxically, then, what the British, with their opposition to “deepening” European integration, are really offering the Turks is precisely the sort of “privileged partnership” that Austria, together with Angela Merkel, has been backing.
column2: 因此，自相矛盾的是，英国尽管反对“深化”欧洲联合，恰恰给土耳其提供奥地利以及安格拉·默克尔所支持的“特殊伙伴关系 ” 。

column1: Both positions reject the idea of making Turkey really “European.”
column2: 两种立场都拒绝将土耳其完全“欧洲化”的主张。

column1: The structure that Britain seems to have in mind is, according to some, reminiscent of the loose alliance binding the British Commonwealth.
column2: 据某些人的看法，英国看起来所设想的结构令人联想起联合英联邦的松散联盟。

column1: But “History’s ruse” could be that even as the British succeed in improving Turkey’s prospects for admission, the renegotiation of the Nice treaty, which will become necessary if Croatia is admitted, is likely to lead to stronger European integration.
column2: 然而 ， “ 历史诡计”可能是，即使英国成功地改善土耳其入盟的前景，但是，一旦接纳克罗地亚就必须对尼斯条约重新谈判，这样就有可能导致更为强大的欧洲联合。

column1: Thus, what we may get is both deepening and widening of the EU – something that today seems like squaring the circle.
column2: 这样，我们可能既深化欧盟又扩大欧盟。 这样的结果今天看起来好似水中捞月。

column1: Which Way is West for Turkey?
column2: 哪里才是土耳其的西方？

column1: When Turkey's parliament voted in March 2003 against allowing American troops to open a northern front against Iraq, Turkey's traditional strategic partnership with the United States ended.
column2: 随着2003年3月土耳其议会对美国军队开辟伊战北线的计划投下反对票，土耳其与美国之间传统的战略伙伴关系终于走到了尽头。
