column1: The two countries still recognize many mutual interests, but now they manage these interests on a far different basis.
column2: 尽管土美之间还有不少共同利益，可如今他们管理这些利益的基础却已经大不相同了。

column1: The vote shocked "old Europe" and the Arab world as much as the Bush administration.
column2: 投票结果震惊了"老欧洲"和阿拉伯世界，也震惊了布什政府。

column1: Europeans who considered Turkey a potential Trojan horse for America within the European Union were forced to reconsider.
column2: 这个结果让那些曾把土耳其当成美国可能安插到欧盟内部的一匹特洛伊木马的欧洲人也不得不对土耳其刮目相看。

column1: For many Arabs, the vote showed that Turkey was not an American lackey and would not cooperate with American imperial designs, despite close Turkish-Israeli relations.
column2: 而对阿拉伯人来讲，这一结果表明尽管土以关系十分密切，但土耳其毕竟不是美国的马屁精，也不会配合美国的霸权企图。

column1: Long-simmering disagreements between Turkey and the US came to a boil with the emergence of the Kurds of northern Iraq as the Pentagon's main allies in the Iraq War.
column2: 随着居住在伊拉克北部的库尔德人成为五角大楼对伊战争的主要盟友，潜藏已久的土美分歧终于爆发了。

column1: The American administration made it clear that military intervention by Turkey in Northern Iraq would not be tolerated.
column2: 美国政府明确表示：美国绝不容许土耳其对伊北部实行军事干预。

column1: That message was confirmed on July 4, 2003, when American forces arrested several Turkish Special Forces troops in the town of Sulaimaniya, humiliating them by putting sacks over their head as they took them into custody.
column2: 2003年7月4日，美军在苏莱曼尼亚逮捕了几名土耳其特种部队成员，并在押送过程中把布袋套在他们头上以示羞辱，这再次表明了美国不许土耳其军事干预的强硬态度。

column1: Only intervention by US Vice President Dick Cheney two and a half days later secured the release of the soldiers, who were alleged to have been planning clandestine operations within the Kurdish zone.
column2: 两天半后，只是因为美国副总统迪克·切尼出面干预，这几名土耳其士兵才得以获释。 他们的罪名是：企图在库尔德地区策划秘密行动。

column1: Despite ongoing tensions, the Turkish government has been eager to mend relations with America, as it is anxious to have some influence over developments in Iraq.
column2: 尽管近来摩擦不断，土耳其政府还是尽量想和美国修复关系，因为它非常希望能对伊拉克的事态发展施加影响。

column1: So the authorities responded quickly to the Bush administration's request for Turkish troops to join the coalition, although the idea was stillborn - rejected by both the Kurds and the American-appointed Governing Council in Iraq.
column2: 因此，土耳其政府对布什政府发出的加入联军的邀请做出了快速的响应，尽管这次行动从一开始就注定不可能成功－库尔德人和美国任命的伊拉克管理委员会都明确表示反对。

column1: America has its own reasons to patch up the relationship.
column2: 美国也同样有着修复关系的愿望。

column1: Turkey's secular, capitalistic, democratic order has become especially valuable to the Bush administration as it seeks to integrate the wider Middle East into the world system by liberalizing its economy and democratizing its polity.
column2: 在布什政府试图把中东广大地区纳入其全球体系，在那里实现经济自由化和政治民主化的过程中，土耳其的世俗、资本和民主秩序在美国政府看来都显得弥足珍贵。

column1: Thus, America trumpeted its continuing support for Turkish membership in the EU, notably in President Bush's speech in June at Istanbul's Galatasaray University - at a bridge that joins Asia and Europe.
column2: 于是，布什总统6月在伊斯坦布尔加拉塔萨雷大学的讲话中再次重申了支持土耳其加入欧盟的立场，布什这次讲话的地点被安排在一座连接亚欧大陆的桥上。

column1: But serious bilateral problems remain.
column2: 但土美双边关系还是存在着严重问题。

column1: The government is irritated by US occupation forces' neglect of the northern Iraqi bases of the PKK, the Kurdish separatist insurgents who have fought a 15-year war against Turkey.
column2: 代表库尔德分离主义势力的库尔德工人党已经和土耳其交战了15年，而美国占领军却对其在伊北部的大本营视而不见。

column1: More broadly, the government regards the US as too complacent vis-à-vis Kurdish political developments and unmoved by Turkey's concerns about Kurdish independence.
column2: 从更广义的角度讲，土耳其政府认为美国在对待库尔德局势发展的问题上太自以为是，根本不顾及土耳其在库尔德独立问题上的重重顾虑。

column1: The US, for its part, is unhappy with the government's objections to unrestricted American use of the Incirlik airbase in southeastern Turkey, as well as by recent tensions with Israel.
column2: 而美国方面也对土政府拒绝其无限制使用土北部因斯里克空军基地的决定感到十分不快，此外引起美国不满的还有近来土以之间的紧张关系。

column1: In the meantime, Turkey is moving closer to the EU, with the government overcoming nationalistic objections in the Parliament to push through comprehensive reforms.
column2: 与此同时，土耳其与欧盟的关系正日益密切，政府战胜了议会中的民族主义势力，开始推行全面的改革。

column1: Turkey also showed its good will over Cyprus, removing a nagging political obstacle to EU membership.
column2: 此外，土政府在塞浦路斯问题上也表达了诚意，去掉了加入欧盟过程中一个令人心烦的政治障碍。

column1: These steps led to the European Commission's recent recommendation to begin accession negotiations with Turkey.
column2: 上述举措使欧盟委员会在不久前发出倡议，建议开始与土耳其进行入盟谈判。

column1: The EU accession process has also underpinned a shift in Turkish policy on Iraq.
column2: 欧盟的入盟进程也改变了土耳其的对伊政策。

column1: Previously, Turkey viewed Iraq solely in the context of its domestic Kurdish problem.
column2: 从前，土耳其是单纯从国内库尔德问题出发来看待伊拉克的。

column1: But widespread European opposition to the war removed the possibility of Turkish military intervention, forcing the government to develop another vision of Turkey's interests.
column2: 但欧洲国家的普遍反对消除了土耳其军事干预的任何可能性，迫使政府从另外的角度去看待土耳其的利益。

column1: At the same time, the Iraqi Kurds also appear to appreciate how much they need a friendly Turkey.
column2: 与此同时，伊拉克库尔德人似乎也极为看重一个态度友好的土耳其。

column1: The northern border with Turkey is their lifeline to the outside world.
column2: 与土耳其的北部边界是他们与外界沟通的生命线。

column1: As a result, Turkey no longer considers a federalized Iraq a threat to its security, as long as each federal unit maintains a measure of ethnic diversity.
column2: 其结果是只要伊拉克联盟停留在保持种族多样性的范围之内，土耳其就不再把伊拉克联盟看成是对本国安全的威胁。

column1: Of course, Turkey remains opposed to an independent Kurdistan. But now its concern is more closely tied to regional politics than to the Kurdish issue.
column2: 当然，土耳其仍然反对库尔德斯坦独立，但现在它所担心的问题更多地集中在地区政治，而不是库尔德问题的领域。

column1: Turkey has no desire to serve as a strategic counterweight to Iran and believes that only a territorially intact Iraq can continue to play that role.
column2: 土耳其并不希望成为平衡伊朗的战略砝码，而且它认为，只有领土完整的伊拉克才能继续担此重任。

column1: Furthermore, Turkey is concerned about the possibility of civil war in Kurdistan between the two largest Kurdish factions.
column2: 不仅如此，库尔德斯坦两大集团间爆发内战的可能性令土耳其政府倍感忧虑。

column1: But, unlike either Iran or Syria, Turkey genuinely wishes to see a strong and representative government in Baghdad.
column2: 但与伊朗和叙利亚不同，土耳其是真心希望看到巴格达建立起有代表性的强大政府。

column1: Thanks to EU pressures, Turkey's domestic Kurdish problem is well on the way to being resolved democratically, with most Kurdish leaders in Turkey expressing their commitment to Turkish unity.
column2: 多亏来自欧盟的压力，土耳其国内的库尔德问题正在走入民主解决的轨道，土耳其国内的绝大多数库尔德领袖都表达了他们支持土耳其统一的立场。

column1: For Turkey to consider military intervention in Kurdistan, EU member states would first have to renege on their commitment to negotiate Turkish accession.
column2: 如果要让土耳其重新考虑对库尔德斯坦的军事介入，首先要欧盟成员国撕毁他们开始土耳其入盟谈判的承诺。

column1: Equally dramatic would be any attempt by the Kurds to forcibly change the demographic balance of the multiethnic city of Kirkuk.
column2: 此外，库尔德人采取任何措施，强行改变多种族城市基尔库克的人口构成，其可能性也将同样微乎其微。

column1: Turkey would prefer that Kirkuk, with its large Turkmen population, be given special status in the forthcoming draft Iraqi constitution.
column2: 土耳其希望有着众多土库曼人口的基尔库��，能在即将出台的伊拉克宪法草案中获得特殊的地位。

column1: The US also shows signs of understanding the importance of maintaining a multiethnic Kirkuk and is putting pressure on its Kurdish allies.
column2: 有迹象表明美国也了解保持基尔库克多种族环境的重要性，而且正在对自己的库尔德盟友施加压力。

column1: Turkish diplomacy has thus become a well-calibrated balancing act, moving closer to European positions in the Middle East, but eager to maintain close relations with the US.
column2: 正因如此，土耳其外交就成了需要准确调校的平衡行动，不断在中东问题上接近欧洲立场的同时也希望与美国保持密切的关系。

column1: If this approach succeeds, Europe's bridge to Asia may also become its bridge to America.
column2: 如果能取得成功，那么这座连接欧亚的桥梁也可能会同时沟通欧美。

column1: White House Sex Crimes
column2: 白宫性犯罪

column1: NEW YORK – Sex crime has a telltale signature, even when those directing the outrages are some of the most powerful men and women in the United States.
column2: 纽约－性犯罪具有露出蛛丝马迹的特征，即使指挥这些暴行的是美国最有权力的男人或女人，也是如此。

column1: How extraordinary, then, to learn that one of the perpetrators of these crimes, Condoleezza Rice, has just led the debate in a special session of the United Nations Security Council on the use of sexual violence as a weapon of war.
column2: 那么，得知康多莉扎·赖斯－犯下这些罪行的罪犯之一，刚刚在联合国安理会领导了一个关于把性暴力作为战争武器的辩论，是多么的令人意外。

column1: I had a sense of déjà vu when I saw the photos that emerged in 2004 from Abu Ghraib prison.
column2: 当我在2004年看到从阿布格莱布监狱流出的照片时，我有一种似曾相识的感觉。

column1: Even as the Bush administration was spinning the notion that the torture of prisoners was the work of “a few bad apples” low in the military hierarchy, I knew that we were seeing evidence of a systemic policy set at the top.
column2: 即使布什政府编造出是一些军队下层的“坏蛋”在折磨囚犯这样的说辞，我也知道我们看见了在美国上层的系统性政策作恶的证据。

column1: It’s not that I am a genius. It’s simply that, having worked at a rape crisis center and been trained in the basics of sex crime, I have learned that all sex predators go about things in certain recognizable ways.
column2: 这并不是因为我是个天才，而仅仅是因为我曾在一个强奸危机中心工作过，并接受过关于性犯罪的基本知识的训练，我知道所有的性罪犯都是用一定的可识别的方式进行犯罪。

column1: We now know that the torture of prisoners was the result of a policy set in the White House by former Secretary of Defense Donald Rumsfeld, Vice President Dick Cheney, and Rice – who actually chaired the torture meetings.
column2: 现在我们知道对罪犯的折磨是白宫的前国防部长唐纳德·拉姆斯菲尔德，副总统迪克·切尼以及赖斯－她实际上主持折磨会议－在白宫制定的政策的结果。

column1: The Pentagon has also acknowledged that it had authorized sexualized abuse of detainees as part of interrogation practices to be performed by female operatives.
column2: 五角大楼也承认它授权女性特工可以用对被关押人员进行性虐待作为审问活动的一部分。

column1: And documents obtained by the American Civil Liberties Union have Rumsfeld, in his own words, “checking in” on the sexualized humiliation of prisoners.
column2: 并且，美国民权同盟取得的材料显示，拉姆斯菲尔德，用他自己的话说，要对囚犯的性羞辱进行“登记 ” 。

column1: The sexualization of torture from the top basically turned Abu Ghraib and Guantánamo Bay into an organized sex-crime ring in which the trafficked sex slaves were US-held prisoners.
column2: 从美国上层来的折磨性趋势化将阿布格莱布和关塔那摩基地变成了一个有组织的性犯罪集团，其中被交易的性奴隶是美国控制的囚犯。

column1: Looking at the classic S and M nature of some of this torture, it is hard not to speculate that someone setting policy was aroused by all of this.
column2: 看看有些是S和M级别的折磨，很难不去推测制定这个政策的人不被这些行为引起性冲动。

column1: The nonsexual torture that was committed ranged from beatings and suffocation, electrodes attached to genitals, and forced sleep deprivation, to prisoners being hung by the wrists from the ceiling and placed in solitary confinement until psychosis was induced.
column2: 非性折磨包括了从毒打和窒息，电击生殖器以及强迫性睡眠剥夺，到将囚犯拴住手腕吊在天花板上并单独囚禁直到其精神失常。

column1: These abuses violate both US and international law.
column2: 这些虐待既违反了美国法又违反了国际法。

column1: Three former military attorneys, recognizing this blunt truth, refused to participate in the “military tribunals” – rather, “show trials” – aimed at condemning men whose confessions were elicited through torture.
column2: 三位承认了这个残酷现实的前军事律师，拒绝参加目的为判处其供述是通过折磨取得的囚犯刑罚的“军事法庭 ” － 它还不如说是“审判表演 ” 。

column1: Though we can now debate what the penalty for water-boarding should be, America as a nation, maintaining an odd silence, still cannot seem to discuss the sexual crimes involved.
column2: 虽然我们现在辩论对用模拟溺水虐待囚犯的惩罚是什么，但是美国作为一个国家，对这类行为保持了令人奇怪的沉默，似乎仍然不可能讨论这类行为中涉及的性犯罪。

column1: Why?
column2: 为什么？

column1: It’s not as if the sex crimes that US leaders either authorized or tolerated are not staring Americans in the face: the images of male prisoners with their heads hooded with women’s underwear; the documented reports of female US soldiers deployed to smear menstrual blood on the faces of male prisoners, and of military interrogators or contractors forcing prisoners to simulate sex with each other, to penetrate themselves with objects, or to submit to being penetrated by objects.
column2: 并不是美国领导人要么授权要么容忍的性犯罪没有注视着美国人：用女性内衣罩住头部的男性囚犯的图像；有证明文件的安排美国女兵用月经血涂抹在男性囚犯脸上，以及军事审讯人员或者军事承包人强迫囚犯相互模拟性行为，将物品插入他们的私处，或者被强迫用物品插入私处的报道。

column1: Indeed, the Military Commissions Act of 2006 was written deliberately with loopholes that gave immunity to perpetrators of many kinds of sexual humiliation and abuse.
column2: 确实， 2006年的《特别军事法庭法案》故意为许多性羞辱和性虐待的罪犯免于惩罚留下了漏洞。

column1: There is also the testimony by female soldiers such as Lynndie England about compelling male prisoners to masturbate, as well as an FBI memo objecting to a policy of “highly aggressive interrogation techniques.”
column2: 也有诸如林迪·英格兰这样的女兵的关于强迫男性囚犯手淫的证词，以及反对“高度激烈的审讯方法”的FBI备忘录。

column1: The memo cites a female interrogator rubbing lotion on a shackled detainee and whispering in his ear – during Ramadan when sexual contact with a strange woman would be most offensive – then suddenly bending back his thumbs until he grimaced in pain, and violently grabbing his genitals.
column2: 该备忘录引用了一个女性审讯人员在一个戴着脚镣手铐的被押人员身上涂抹乳液并在他耳边低语的例子－在斋月，与一个陌生女人的性接触是非常犯忌的－然后突然将他的拇指往后掰直到他因疼痛而面部表情扭曲，并猛烈地抓他的生殖器。

column1: Sexual abuse in US-operated prisons got worse and worse over time, ultimately including, according to doctors who examined detainees, anal sodomy.
column2: 随着时间的推移，在美国掌管的监狱里性虐待情况越来越严重，根据检查被押人员的医生的反映，最极端的情况还包括肛门鸡奸。

column1: All this may sound bizarre if you are a normal person, but it is standard operating procedure for sex offenders.
column2: 如果你是一个正常人，所有这些都听起来很变态，但是这对性侵害者来说是标准的操作程序。

column1: Those who work in the field know that once sex abusers control a powerless victim, they will invariably push the boundaries with ever more extreme behavior.
column2: 那些在这个领域工作的人都知道，一旦性虐待者控制了无力反抗的受害者，他们总是会用更极端的行为突破界限。

column1: Abusers start by undressing their victims, but once that line has been breached, you are likely to hear from the victim about oral and anal penetration, greater and greater pain and fear being inflicted, and more and more carelessness about exposing the crimes as the perpetrator’s inhibitions fall away.
column2: 开始的时候，虐待者脱掉受害人的衣服，但是一旦突破了这个界限，你就有可能听到有关在其嘴巴插入物体和在其肛门插入物体的叙述，并且当罪犯的禁忌消失的时候，他会给受害者造成更大的痛苦和恐惧，而且对其罪行的暴露越来越不关心。

column1: The perpetrator is also likely to engage in ever-escalating rationalizations, often arguing that the offenses serve a greater good.
column2: 罪犯也有可能将他们的行为无限合理化，并经常辩称这样做是为了达到一个的良好目的。

column1: Finally, the victim is blamed for the abuse: in the case of the detainees, if they would only “behave,” and confess, they wouldn’t bring all this on themselves.
column2: 最后，受害者被归咎为要对受到虐待承担责任：在被押的情况下，如果他们仅仅能“表现不出格”并坦白其罪行，他们是不会招致这些东西的。

column1: Silence, and even collusion, is also typical of sex crimes within a family.
column2: 沉默，甚至是共谋，是家庭性犯罪的特征。

column1: Americans are behaving like a dysfunctional family by shielding sex criminals in their midst through silence.
column2: 美国人现在的表现就像是在一个机能不良的家庭内，用他们的沉默来袒护性罪犯。

column1: Just as sex criminals – and the leaders who directed the use of rape and sexual abuse as a military strategy – were tried and sentenced after the wars in Bosnia and Sierra Leone, so Americans must hold accountable those who committed, or authorized, sex crimes in US-operated prisons.
column2: 像性罪犯一样－那些指挥使用强奸和性虐待作为军事策略的领导人－在波斯尼亚和塞拉利昂的战争过后都受到了审判并被判刑，所以美国人必须使那些从事性犯罪，或授权在美国掌管的监狱进行性犯罪的人承担责任。

column1: Throughout the world, this perverse and graphic criminality has added fuel to anxiety about US cultural and military power.
column2: 在世界范围内，这种不正常的生动的犯罪行为加剧了人们对美国文化和军事实力的担忧。

column1: These acts need to be called by their true names – war crimes and sex crimes – and people in America need to demand justice for the perpetrators and their victims.
column2: 这些行为应被叫它们真正的名字－战争犯罪和性犯罪－在美国的人们应该使罪犯受到审判，为受害者主持正义。

column1: As in a family, only when people start to speak out and tell the truth about rape and sexual assault can the healing begin.
column2: 这就像是在一个家庭一那样，只有在人们开始大胆地说出强奸和性侵犯的真相时，创伤才能开始愈合。

column1: Whither Africa’s “Frontier Markets”?
column2: 非洲“前沿市场”的凋谢

column1: NEW YORK – Zimbabwe’s election appears, once again, to confirm a truism: Africa only seems to make international headlines when disasters strike – a drought, a coup, a war, a genocide, or, as in the case of Robert Mugabe, grossly incompetent government.
column2: 津巴布韦的选举好像再一次验证了这一真理，也就是非洲好像只有在干旱、政变、战争或者种族屠杀等灾害来临的时候才会成为国际头条新闻。

column1: But, over the past several years, a number of sub-Saharan countries have attracted unprecedented inflows of foreign capital.
column2: 但是在过去几年时间里，几个萨哈拉沙漠以南国家吸引了前所未有的外国资本。

column1: Recent global financial turmoil has only added to Africa’s allure, because its frontier markets are less vulnerable to international volatility than are most of the world’s more familiar emerging economies.
column2: 最近的全球金融风暴也只是增加了非洲的吸引力，因为与人们更为熟悉的大多数新兴市场相比，非洲前沿市场并不如此受国际市场的风吹草动影响。

column1: There are three main reasons why many sub-Saharan countries are performing well.
column2: 萨哈拉以南国家表现优异有三个主要原因。

column1: First, high commodity prices yield windfall profits for the region’s leading producers of raw materials.
column2: 首先，高昂的原材料价格给这一地区原材料生产国带来巨大利润。

column1: Growing demand for energy, metals, and minerals – particularly in China – has driven unprecedented levels of foreign investment.
column2: 特别是来自中国的对能源、金属以及矿产品不断增长的需求推动了外国投资达到前所未有的水平。

column1: Even large pension funds are beginning to take notice.
column2: 即使是大型养老基金也开始注意到了这一点。

column1: Moreover, a large number of Africa’s poorest countries have benefited from exponential growth in (primarily United States-based) philanthropy.
column2: 而且，非洲的大量穷国也从主要来自美国的慈善事业巨大增长中获得了利益。

column1: But, while both of these positive trends are likely to continue, a third positive factor may not prove as durable.
column2: 但是，尽管这两个积极的趋势有可能会继续，但是，第三个积极因素却未必持久。

column1: Every year, Africans living outside the continent send roughly $30 billion to family and friends back home.
column2: 每年，在非洲大陆以外的非洲人给在非洲的亲朋好友寄大约300亿美元。

column1: These remittances are vitally important for economic stability in several African countries. An economic slowdown in the US and Europe could substantially slow this infusion of cash, because immigrants are often the first to lose their jobs when recession fears take hold.
column2: 美国和欧洲经济放缓可能会减缓这一现金流入，因为在衰退担忧立足的时候，移民往往是首先丢掉工作。

column1: At the same time, though Africa’s frontier economies are less vulnerable than other emerging markets to global financial turbulence, they are highly vulnerable to political turmoil closer to home.
column2: 与此同时，尽管与其他新兴市场相比，非洲的前沿经济体并不如此受到全球金融动荡的影响，它们还是容易受到临近的政治动荡的影响。

column1: The three countries that served as pillars of regional stability for the past several years – Nigeria, Kenya, and South Africa – are now too pre-occupied with political troubles of their own to provide the peacekeepers, reconstruction funds, and political pressure that often limit the damage from conflicts elsewhere in the region.
column2: 尼日利亚、肯尼亚和南非这三个在过去几年中成为地区稳定支柱的国家现在忙于应付自己的政治困难，无法提供限制该地区其他地方冲突而带来的破坏的维和士兵、重建基金以及政治压力。

column1: Most of Nigeria’s problems are well known.
column2: 尼日利亚的大部分问题为人们所熟知。

column1: Militants in the oil-rich Niger Delta region have at times shut down as much as 30% of the country’s oil exports, a vital source of state revenue.
column2: 盛产石油的尼日尔三角洲地区的武装人员有时候关闭该国30%的石油出口，而石油是国家财政收入的关键来源。

column1: President Umaru Yar’Adua has taken concrete steps to tackle elite-level corruption in Nigeria, and appears to have made progress toward a comprehensive peace agreement with the Delta rebels.
column2: 亚拉杜瓦总统已经采取确实的步骤来处理尼日利亚上层腐败问题，而且好像也在与三角洲地区反叛组织达成全面和平协议的道路上取得了进展。

column1: But Yar’Adua might soon confront a big short-term problem.
column2: 但是亚拉杜瓦可能马上会遇到一个巨大的近期麻烦。

column1: The country’s National Election Tribunal, having overturned the outcomes of several provincial elections, may well annul the results of last year’s presidential race, forcing him to run for president all over again.
column2: 全国选举委员会推翻了几个省的选举结果，也许会宣布去年总统选举的结果无效，从而迫使他再度竞选总统。

column1: While Yar’Adua could use the goodwill that he has built up over the past year to win by an even larger margin, the 90-day election campaign would almost certainly trigger civil unrest, and Nigeria’s leadership would be too busy navigating domestic political rivalries to help stabilize conflicts elsewhere in Africa.
column2: 尽管亚拉杜瓦可以利用在过去一年时间里建立起来的亲善来赢得更大的胜利，但是为期90天的竞选活动几乎可能会引发民间动乱，而且尼日利亚领导人将会忙于在国内政治斗争中辗转而无瑕帮助稳定非洲其他地区的冲突。

column1: Kenya’s troubles run deeper.
column2: 肯尼亚的麻烦还要深重。

column1: Solid economic expansion and one of the world’s fastest-growing stock markets have not helped the country avert a deepening political crisis and mounting ethnic violence since disputed presidential election results in December.
column2: 该国经济成长稳健并且拥有世界上增长最快的股票市场。 但是自从去年十二月总统选举结果受到质疑以来，这些并没有帮助这个国家避免一场日益加剧的政治危机以及种族暴力事件。

column1: President Mwai Kibaki, whom international observers accuse of rigging the vote, has hinted at a plan to share power in a unity government, but opposition leader Raila Odinga has heard these promises before.
column2: 齐贝吉总统被国际观察员指责为操纵选举投票。 他已经暗示在团结政府中分享权力，但是反对派领导人奥廷加以前也听到多这些保证。

column1: Odinga worked hard to help elect Kibaki in 2002, only to see Kibaki renege on a similar pledge.
column2: 奥廷加在2002年尽力帮助齐贝吉当选，而齐氏则随后食言。

column1: Despite the alarming escalation in violence, fears of civil war in Kenya are probably exaggerated.
column2: 尽管肯尼亚暴力升级令人担忧，但是内战的担心确是有点过分。

column1: The country’s Orange opposition movement has recently won key posts in parliament and, for the moment, is heeding calls for calm from former United nations Secretary-General Kofi Annan and representatives of the African Union.
column2: 该国橙色反对派运动最近在议会中赢得了关键职位，而且目前而言，它也在听取前联合国秘书长安南以及非洲联盟代表保持冷静的呼吁。

column1: But no one should expect Kenya to play a stabilizing regional role again anytime soon.
column2: 但是人们不应当指望肯尼亚马上再次发挥地区性稳定作用。

column1: The continent’s third pillar, South Africa, will spend 2008 mired in an escalating political feud between Thabo Mbeki, the lame-duck president, and Jacob Zuma, a former deputy who is the newly elected leader of the ruling African National Congress and the leading candidate to succeed Mbeki, his bitter rival, next year.
column2: 非洲大陆的第三根支柱南非将会在即将卸任的总统姆贝基和前任副总统祖玛之间日益升级的政治争斗下度过2008年。 而后者刚刚当选为非洲国民大会领导人并且是明年接替其死对手姆贝基的主要侯选人。

column1: South Africa’s courts have become a political battleground, as Mbeki and his allies use corruption charges to try to cripple Zuma’s candidacy.
column2: 当姆贝基及其同盟者利用腐败指控来摧毁祖玛的候选资格的时候，南非的法院也已经成为政治战场。

column1: The resulting political firestorm may well force Zuma to rely on core support from key allies within the country’s trade union movement and Communist Party, challenging the political elite’s pro-market consensus and provoking debate over the future of South Africa’s economic policy.
column2: 接下来的政治风暴或许会迫使祖玛依赖于南非工会运动和共产党的主要盟友的支持来挑战政治精英亲市场的共识并且促发有关未来南非经济政策的辩论。

column1: No countries in sub-Saharan Africa will have the economic heft and political self-confidence to replace Nigeria, Kenya, and South Africa as pillars of stability anytime soon.
column2: 萨哈拉沙漠以南国家中没有一个会马上具有足够的经济实力和政治自信来取代尼日利亚、肯尼亚和南非成为稳定的支柱。

column1: Regional blocs like the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS), the Southern African Customs Union (SACU), and the East African Community (EAC) will eventually assume larger roles in helping resolve the continent’s most intractable diplomatic and economic problems.
column2: 类似西非国家经济共同体、南部非洲关税联盟以及东非共同体那样的地区性组织最终将会在帮助解决非洲最为棘手的外交和经济问题上发挥更大的作用。

column1: But that won’t happen this year.
column2: 但是这种情况今年不会出现。

column1: There remain many good reasons for investors to take a chance on Africa’s frontier markets.
column2: 投资者有许多理由在非洲前沿市场上进行冒险。

column1: But it will not necessarily take a drought, a coup, a war, or a genocide to make them think twice.
column2: 但是，这并不一定要用干旱、战争或者种族屠杀才能够让他们三思。

column1: Whither Europe?
column2: 欧洲将向何处去？

column1: BEIJING – With the likelihood of a contagious sovereign-debt implosion and European bank failures greatly reduced by the Greek debt deal and the European Central Bank’s lending program, it is time to look ahead.
column2: 北京—希腊债务协议的达成和欧洲央行贷款计划的实施大幅减少了传染性主权债去大爆发和欧洲央行大批倒闭的可能性，现在，我们应该把目光朝前看。

column1: Where do the European Union, the eurozone, and the EU’s highly indebted countries go from here?
column2: 欧盟、欧元区以及债务沉重的欧元区成员国将何去何从？

column1: Will Europe be able to roll back its welfare states’ biggest excesses without economic distress and social unrest toppling governments and, in the peripheral countries, undermining already-tenuous agreements with creditors?
column2: 欧洲能够成功地减少其福利国家最大的国度支出项，同时又不引起经济灾难、颠覆政府的社会动荡并且（在外围国家）不影响弱不禁风的债权人协议。

column1: Some good news globally will have an impact on how these questions are resolved.
column2: 全球范围内的一些好消息将对这些问题的解决产生影响。

column1: The United States’ economy is gradually reviving, albeit slowly by the standards of recovery from a deep recession.
column2: 美国经济正在逐步恢复活力，尽管从深度衰退复苏的角度看显得相当缓慢。

column1: China, Brazil, and India have not decoupled from their customers in Europe and North America, and so are slowing, though a relatively soft landing is likely if Europe’s recession is as short and mild as predicted.
column2: 中国、巴西和印度并没有与欧洲和北美的消费者脱钩，因此，尽管它们正在减速，但若欧洲的衰退如预计那样缓慢而温和，它们可以实现相对较“软”的着陆。

column1: The EU’s economic output and population are larger than that of the US, so the fate of the 27 EU countries is everyone’s business, from New York to New Delhi, São Paulo to Shanghai.
column2: 欧盟的经济产出和人口数量都要高于美国，因此其17个成员国的命运与我们所有人息息相关，不管你身处纽约还是新德里，圣保罗还是上海。

column1: Formed originally as a free-trade area, the eurozone comprises 17 of the countries.
column2: 由自由贸易区演变而成的欧元区拥有17个成员国。

column1: Knitting together 17 disparate economies, cultures, and institutions was a monumental undertaking, fraught with risk.
column2: 将17个经济、文化和制度都大相径庭的国家捆绑在一起是一项伟业，需要面临重重危险。

column1: The Lisbon Treaty emphasizes unanimity in decision-making.
column2: 里斯本条约强调决策的一致同意。

column1: With some members inside of the eurozone, and others remaining outside of it, and with disparate economic interests and monetary and fiscal traditions even within the eurozone, agreement is difficult.
column2: 里斯本条约缔约国既有欧元区成员国，也有非欧元区成员国，每个国家都有不同的经济利益和货币和财政传统（即使同处于欧元区的国家也不例外 ） ， 因此达成一致是很困难的。

column1: That sets the stage for three broad scenarios, each with implications for the European and global economy, the financial and banking system, and relations between the member states and EU institutions.
column2: 这就次年改成了三个大方向，每一个都对欧洲和全球经济、金融和财政体系以及欧盟成员国和欧盟机构之间的关系具有影响。

column1: In the first scenario, a more united and homogeneous Europe emerges from the crisis, enforcing greater restrictions on member states’ budgets to reduce apparent risk.
column2: 第一个方向是一个更统一、更相近的欧洲从危机中站立起来，给成员国的预算施加更严格的限制，以减少显而易见的风险。

column1: Accompanied by a strong, broad eurozone, risk of a future currency crisis remains.
column2: 强大而广大的欧元区的出现并不能完全消除未来货币危机风险。

column1: In the second scenario, a two- or three-tiered Europe includes a two-tiered euro, with the weaker countries using a separate “euro-B” currency that can float against the stronger economies’ “euro-A.”
column2: 第二个方向是出现一个两到三个层次的欧洲，使用两层次的欧元设计，疲软国家使用单独的“B欧元”货币，其对坚挺国所使用的“A欧元”汇率可以浮动。

column1: This arrangement would hold out the promise to fiscally stressed economies that, if they get their act together, they could rejoin euro-A – and do so more readily than they could from their own currency.
column2: 这一安排可以让财政不堪重负的国家维持承诺，如果它们采取一致行动，可以重新回到A欧元集团 — — 比它们使用自己的货币要容易得多。

column1: In the final scenario, what emerges is a more decentralized Europe, with less top-down agreement in areas beyond trade and a smaller, more homogeneous eurozone composed of the EU’s core economies.
column2: 最后一个方向是出现一个分散化的欧洲，不会有多少超越贸易层次的自上而下的协定，欧元区也会缩小，仅由品质均较好的核心欧盟国家组成。

column1: Such a construct would be far more popular with citizens who are unhappy with the accretion of EU power in Brussels and the loss of traditional sovereignty.
column2: 反对扩大欧盟权力、减少传统主权的人士将会较为欢迎这种结构。

column1: Some current euro members – Greece (and perhaps others) – would revert to national currencies.
column2: 一些现有欧元区成员国（希腊，可能还有其他国家）将恢复国家货币。

column1: None of these options is easy; each entails serious difficulties and great risks.
column2: 这三种选择都是艰难的选择，每一种都伴随着严重的困难和极高的风险。

column1: Episodic muddling through may be the best that can be hoped for.
column2: 阶段性的得过且过或许是人们最希望的选择。

column1: For example, how would Greece (or any country) exit the euro in order to cushion the extreme downward wage adjustment required to regain competitiveness, and to avoid the severe social unrest that could result from reining in debt too rapidly?
column2: 比如，如果希腊（或任何国家）为了缓冲重获竞争力所需要的极端工资下调压力以及避免过快减债所造成的严重社会动荡而退出欧元区将会怎样？

column1: As soon as word got out that Greece was seriously considering such a move – well before it could even generate a new drachma currency – euro bank deposits would flee Greece.
column2: 只要希腊认真考虑这一选择的消息一出 — — 就算它还来不及铸造新的德拉克马货币 — — 欧元银行存款就会争相逃离希腊。

column1: As a result, Greece would be forced to impose capital controls.
column2: 结果，希腊将被迫采取资本管制。

column1: Some contracts denominated in euros would be subject to Greek law, some to European law, and others – for example, derivatives contracts – to British or US law.
column2: 一些用欧元计价的合同将由希腊法律来裁定，一些将由欧洲法律来裁定，而其他，比如衍生品合约，将由英国或美国法律来裁定。

column1: Legal chaos would result.
column2: 这将会产生法律混乱。

column1: Yet sticking to the euro and forcing all of the adjustments in wages risks greater unrest; indeed, it might merely postpone the inevitable.
column2: 但死抱欧元不放、强行采取工资调整有可能导致严重动乱；事实上，这只能延缓不可避免之事的发生。

column1: Governments and the bond market will test the seriousness of the newly agreed fiscal guidelines (if they are ratified).
column2: 政府和债券市场将考验新达成的财政指导协议（如果被批准的话 ） 。

column1: While talk is tough now, the history of such agreements does not inspire optimism.
column2: 现在，谈判仍在艰难进行中，而历史表明，此类协议并不会激发乐观情绪。

column1: Before the financial crisis, even Germany violated the EU Stability and Growth Pact’s (SGP) deficit limits.
column2: 在金融危机爆发前，即使是德国也违反了欧洲增长和稳定公约（GSP）的债务上限规定。

column1: In the US, the 1980’s deficit limits set by the Gramm-Rudman-Hollings law were not met, and, like the SGP, were revised and extended.
column2: 在美国，1980年的格拉姆-罗德曼-霍林斯（Gramn-Rudman-Hollings）法所规定的赤字上限从未被执行过，与GSP一样，该上限也被修订和扩大了。

column1: Agreements with, and access to, the International Monetary Fund and Europe’s new bailout fund provide (soft) constraints.
column2: 关于如何才能获得IMF和欧洲新成立的援助基金的协议倒是能产生一定的（软）约束。

column1: Regardless of how these governance and fiscal issues are resolved, or muddled through, Europe’s banks remain a thorny issue.
column2: 不论这些治理和财政问题如何被解决，或只是得过且过，欧洲银行的日子都不会好过。

column1: With the time afforded by the ECB’s three-year cheap loans, they have some breathing room to rebuild their capital and clean up their balance sheets.
column2: 欧洲央行的三年期廉价贷款计划为欧洲银行赢得了时间，使它们能够重建资本基础、清理资���负债表。

column1: But, while doing so, they are not likely to be expanding private-sector lending to support economic growth.
column2: 但是，在此期间，它们很可能不会扩张私人部门贷款以支持经济增长。

column1: European banks are far more thinly capitalized, and account for a much larger share of credit extended, than banks in the US, where much more lending originates in capital markets.
column2: 与美国银行相比，欧洲银行的资本严重不足，而且信用扩张主要通过银行来进行。

column1: Most large US banks – Citi is an exception – passed US Federal Reserve stress tests recently, with enough capital to withstand a hypothetical deep recession (13% unemployment, a 21% further fall in home prices, and a 50% stock-market decline).
column2: 大部分美国大银行（花旗是个例外）都通过了最近的美联储压力测试，有足够的资本抵御假设的深度衰退（失业率13 % 、 房价继续下跌21 % 、 股票继续下跌50 % ） 。

column1: Europe’s stress tests have been much weaker.
column2: 欧洲的压力测试要宽松得多。

column1: Some sort of Brady bond to reduce and extend excessive sovereign debt will be necessary.
column2: 某种形式的布雷迪债券 — — 以减少和延期过重的主权债务 — — 看来是必不可少的。

column1: We can expect further European turmoil – from banks, sovereign debt, and social unrest in response to even modest welfare-state rollbacks – and clashing visions, within and among countries, concerning the desirability of deeper European integration.
column2: 我们可以预期，欧洲（各国内部和国与国之间）将出现更多的动荡 — — 银行、主权债务、即使是略有削减的福利国家政策也会引起社会动荡 — — 面临更糟糕的前景，这使得欧洲一体化的客观需要进一步加大了。

column1: Europe has come a long way from the days when its leaders prophesied that the euro would quickly rival the dollar as a global reserve currency.
column2: 欧洲距离其领导人所宣称的欧元将很快崛起为可与美元分庭抗礼的全球储备货币还有很长一段距离。

column1: Yet no one should write off Europe.
column2: 但没人可以小觑欧洲。

column1: It still has great strengths, and, with sensible reforms, the EU can survive and eventually return to greater prosperity and stability.
column2: 欧洲仍然坚挺，只要实施合理的改革，欧盟就能生存下来并最终实现更大的繁荣和稳定。

column1: But Europe remains closer to the beginning of that process of renewal than to the end.
column2: 欧洲距离开启涅槃改革要比距离走向衰亡更近。

column1: Whither North Korea?
column2: 北朝鲜何去何从？

column1: SEOUL – According to North Korean state television, the heart attack that killed Kim Jong-il on December 17 was “due to severe mental and physical stress from overwork.”
column2: 首尔 — — 据朝鲜电视台报道，12月17日致金正日死亡的心脏病发作是因“过度劳累引发的严重的精神和身体压力导致的 。 ”

column1: That report instantly raised a question in my mind: if we accept the regime’s diagnosis, why did Kim need to work so hard, despite his frail health?
column2: 读了这份报告，我脑海中立即闪现出一个疑问：如果接受朝鲜政权的结论，那么金正日为什么要在身体虚弱时这么努力工作？

column1: In some sense, his sudden death seems to symbolize the helplessness of a desperate leader confronting overwhelming challenges.
column2: 从某种意义上讲，他的猝死似乎表明了一位陷入绝望的领导人在面对巨大挑战时的无奈。

column1: Seen in this light, the more important question is whether or not Kim’s inexperienced son, the twenty-something “Great Successor” Kim Jong-un, will be able to consolidate power and somehow steer the country out of its deep malaise.
column2: 由此看来，更重要的问题是金正日缺乏经验的儿子、年仅二十多岁的“伟大接班人”金正恩能否成功地巩固政权，并以某种方式引导这个国家走出极度困境。

column1: So far, the succession in Pyongyang seems to be proceeding in an orderly fashion.
column2: 从目前情况看，平壤的权力交接似乎正在有序进行中。

column1: But, despite appearances, few totalitarian regimes, save those of Hitler, Stalin, and Mao, have ever maintained a monolithic inner circle of power.
column2: 但尽管表面平稳，但除希特勒、斯大林和毛泽东外，没有几个独裁政权的权力核心能始终保持铁板一块。

column1: North Korea is unlikely to be an exception to this rule.
column2: 朝鲜也不太可能例外。

column1: The legitimacy of Kim Jong-un’s claim to power is weak, despite his blood tie to his father and grandfather, the dynasty that has ruled North Korea since its inception.
column2: 金氏家族自建国伊始就一直统治朝鲜，虽然与父亲及祖父有血缘关系，但金正恩接权的合法性依然相对薄弱。

column1: The “Great Successor” has had barely two years of on-the-job training, compared to the 14 years his father spent studying directly under Kim Il-sung.
column2: “伟大的接班人”仅仅接受过两年的在职培训，而他的父亲在金日成手下直接学习长达14年之久。

column1: Of course, Kim Jong-il’s sister, Kim Kyung-hee, and his sister-in-law, Jang Seong-taek, will assume something of a regency role, acting both as patron to the Great Successor and as a force to mobilize the military to close ranks behind the Kim dynasty.
column2: 当然，金正日的妹妹金敬姬和他的妹夫张成泽将在一定程度上起到摄政作用，既扮演“伟大接班人”的支持者，又动员军队紧密团结在金氏家族周围。

column1: But it is not clear how faithfully, and for how long, Kim Kyung-hee and Jang will remain supportive of Kim Jong-un.
column2: 但金敬姬和张成泽对于金正恩的忠诚度还无法确定，也不知道他们能够支持他多久。

column1: They might even try to supplant Kim by claiming power for themselves.
column2: 这两人甚至可能试图取代金正恩把权力控制在自己手中。

column1: Another challenge may come from the country’s senior leaders, especially among the military. Will they remain faithful to Kim, who is 40-50 years their junior?
column2: 另一个挑战可能来自国家的高级领导人，特别是军队。 比他们小四五十岁的金正恩能否获得他们的效忠？

column1: It is known that some senior military officers were quietly critical of Kim Jong-il’s failure in managing the country’s relationship with the United States and Japan.
column2: 众所周知某些高级军官私下对金正日未能管理好美日关系有诸多批评。

column1: Their expectation might have been that North Korea could improve relations with the US while retaining its nuclear weapons, in exchange for not developing long-range missiles.
column2: 他们本来希望朝鲜以放弃发展远程导弹为代价，在保留核武器的同时改善朝美关系。

column1: After all, if Pakistan did it, why not North Korea?
column2: 毕竟，如果巴基斯坦能这么做，朝鲜为什么不能？

column1: Had that happened, economic assistance from the US and Japan would have flowed into North Korea, enabling the regime to manage the country’s moribund economy much better without initiating reforms, which the military appears to regard as dangerous.
column2: 如果实现这一计划，来自美日的经济援助就会流入朝鲜，使朝鲜政府在无需启动改革的情况下挽救奄奄一息的国内经济，这种举措被军队视为危险的。

column1: Instead, with the economy, particularly food production, continuing to falter, perhaps one-third of the country is living at or below starvation levels.
column2: 相反，随着经济、特别是粮食生产持续衰退，或许有三分之一的朝鲜人挣扎在饥荒线上下。

column1: Will Kim Jong-un leader be able to do better?
column2: 金正恩能做得更好吗？

column1: In the early stages of this precarious succession, China has behaved as expected, trying to prop up the regime in order to ensure stability in its nuclear-armed neighbor.
column2: 在此次不稳定继承的早期阶段，中国的表现不出所料，北京试图支持朝鲜政府，以稳定这个拥有核武器的邻国的局势。

column1: China’s foreign ministry sent a strong message of support for Kim Jong-un, and encouraged North Koreans to unite under the new leader.
column2: 中国外交部强烈表示支持金正恩，并鼓励朝鲜人民团结在新领袖的周围。

column1: But the key external factor in ensuring a peaceful succession will be the policies of South Korea and the US, which must decide whether they can work with the North in the post-Kim Jong-il era.
column2: 但韩美政策才是确保和平继承顺利实现的关键外部因素，这两国必须确定能否在后金正日时代与朝鲜合作。

column1: Will they wait to see what happens to the new leader, and thus continue their policy of “strategic patience,” which focuses mainly on denuclearization, and not move on to other areas until the North moves first?
column2: 他们是否会继续奉行以无核化为主的“战略耐心”政策，让朝鲜率先在其他领域采取行动，静候新领袖出现结果？

column1: In that case, North Korea will gradually become more unstable, despite China’s support, as economic collapse undermines its quasi-legitimate leadership.
column2: 如若真是如此，即便拥有中国的支持，朝鲜仍将因为经济萎缩会影响其准合法领导地位而逐渐丧失稳定局面。

column1: Or will South Korea and the US try to take advantage of Kim Jong-il’s passing with new policy initiatives?
column2: 韩美两国是否会借金正日去世之机推行新的政策？

column1: If they can develop a two-track policy framework aimed at facilitating economic reform inside North Korea while continuing international pressure for denuclearization, constructive engagement may be possible.
column2: 如果他们能成功制定双轨制的政策框架，在推动朝鲜经济改革的同时继续保持国际无核化压力，就有可能实现建设性的接触。

column1: Alas, next year is an election year in South Korea and the US.
column2: 可叹的是明年韩美两国即将举行大选。

column1: In the feverish atmosphere of political high season, it will not be easy for incumbent administrations to pursue bold but risky policies.
column2: 在政治旺季的狂热氛围中，现任政府大胆采取冒险政策面临着很大的难度。

column1: This is the agony of democracy, and it is why the next year may prove to be the most unstable, and even dangerous, period in decades for the Korean peninsula and the region.
column2: 这是民主之痛，同时也解释了明年为什么可能成为朝鲜半岛及地区数十年来最不稳定、甚至是最危险的阶段。

column1: What happens if things go the wrong way?
column2: 如果局势朝着错误的方向发展后果将是什么？

column1: What if, for example, Kim Jong-un fails to consolidate power, perceives the domestic political situation as worsening, owing to elite power struggles or popular discontent, and deems the external environment, especially South Korea and the US ever more hostile?
column2: 比方说，如果金正恩未能巩固权力，因为精英权力斗争抑或民众不满而认定国内政局恶化，同时认定外部环境，特别是韩美两国更加充满敌意将带来什么后果？

column1: In that case, Kim III may grasp at provocation in one form or another, as his father did with intermittent attacks on South Korea in recent years.
column2: 如果真是如此，金氏家族第三代统治者将以这样或者那样的方式进行挑衅，就像其父近年来断断续续对韩国发动袭击那样。

column1: If things do worsen even more, the world, like it or not, must be prepared to manage – and even confront – a scenario in which the Kim dynasty, and with it the North Korean state, collapses.
column2: 如果局势进一步恶化，无论世界各国是否愿意，都必须准备应对 — — 甚至解决金氏王朝，甚至连带朝鲜政府陷入崩溃的状况。

column1: Unfortunately, considering the current state of ill-preparedness in terms of international coordination, there will be confusion, misunderstanding, and overreaction among South Korea, the US, and China to other actors’ behavior.
column2: 遗憾的是，鉴于目前国际合作准备不足的窘境，韩、美、中之间肯定会出现混乱、误解和过度反应的状况。

column1: So it is past time for all three powers, together with Japan and Russia, to start talking and planning ahead, jointly.
column2: 因此韩美中三国，以及日本和俄罗斯早就应当开启联合会谈和提前计划了。

column1: A chaotic, imploding North Korea is in no one’s interest.
column2: 混乱、一触即发的朝��局势是不符合各方利益的。

column1: Whither Pakistan?
column2: 逐渐枯萎的巴基斯坦？

column1: LAHORE – Pakistan remains the world’s never-ending question.
column2: 拉合尔 — — 巴基斯坦仍然是全世界一个没完没了的问题。

column1: As 2010 concludes, several outstanding issues continue to bedevil the country.
column2: 2010年末，几个悬而未决的问题仍然困扰着巴基斯坦。

column1: How they are managed in the year ahead will determine not only Pakistan’s immediate future and long-term prospects, but also the security of its region and, indeed, much of the world.
column2: 这几个问题不仅将决定巴基斯坦的短期和长远命运，而且将影响到该地区和世界绝大多数地区的安全局势。

column1: It has been said – without exaggeration – that Pakistan faces an existential threat.
column2: 有人说巴基斯坦正面临着现实威胁，此言一点不虚。

column1: The country has not defined a coherent approach towards those who are resorting to terrorism to advance their agendas, both within Pakistan and abroad.
column2: 巴基斯坦对国内和国外借助恐怖手段实现目标的极端份子缺乏一以贯之的态度。

column1: It remains uncommitted to the idea of denying sanctuaries on its territory to Taliban fighters battling American and NATO troops in Afghanistan.
column2: 它仍然对拆毁阿富汗反美反北约塔利班分子在其领土上修建的避难所表现得并不积极。

column1: Relations with India have soured in recent months, because Pakistan’s government is once again lending diplomatic support to the insurgency in Indian-controlled Kashmir.
column2: 与印度关系也在近几个月急转直下，因为巴基斯坦政府再次给印控克什米尔叛乱人员提供外交方面的支持。

column1: Domestic terrorism in Pakistan has taken a heavy human and economic toll.
column2: 巴基斯坦的国内恐怖主义已经造成了惨重的人员伤亡和经济损失。

column1: It is no longer aimed at official support of United States-led anti-terrorism activities.
column2: 恐怖主义所针对的已经不再是美国领导下官方支持的反恐行动。

column1: Sunni Islamic extremists now target minority groups as well as other Muslim sects.
column2: 逊尼派伊斯兰极端分子现在既攻击其他穆斯林教派也攻击少数族裔。

column1: Some 800 liberal and Sufi Islamic scholars have died in targeted killings by extremist groups who receive financial assistance from like-minded people in the Middle East, and some well-known and much-visited Sufi shrines have been bombed.
column2: 约800名自由和苏非派伊斯兰学者在由中东同道提供财务支持的极端组织针对性杀戮中丧生，某些人流量大的知名苏非派寺庙也遭遇炸弹袭击。

column1: The economy is in shambles, and unable to meet the International Monetary Fund demands for its continued support.
column2: 国内经济一片混乱，无法达到国际货币基金组织继续援助的要求。

column1: If the IMF terminates its current program, Pakistan will be unable to service its foreign debt.
column2: 如果国际货币基金组织终止援助计划，巴基斯坦的外债将陷入无法偿还的境地。

column1: Indeed, a senior cabinet minister suggested recently that the international community should write off Pakistan’s debts – an amount estimated at $40 billion.
column2: 实际上，一名高级内阁部长不久前提出国际社会应取消巴基斯坦总额约400亿美元的外债。

column1: The minister of finance forcefully repudiated the suggestion the following day, indicating that the government has not developed a consistent approach towards the faltering economy.
column2: 财政部长第二天就出面驳斥了这种说法，表示政府尚未制定统一措施来挽救低迷的经济。

column1: The economy was also badly hurt by the massive floods of 2010, which caused damage estimated at $10 billion.
column2: 2010年的大洪水也对经济造成了影响，造成约100亿美元的巨额损失。

column1: This damage could lower annual GDP growth by 1-1.5% for several years to come.
column2: 这可能使巴基斯坦未来几年的年均GDP增长降低1－1.5个百分点。

column1: In the 2010-2011 fiscal year, the IMF estimates that economic output will increase by less than 3% – one-third the rate expected in neighboring India and less than half that of Bangladesh.
column2: 2010－2011财年，国际货币基金组织估计经济增长将低于3 % — —这样的速度只有邻国印度的三分之一左右，还不到孟加拉共和国的一半。

column1: Slower economic growth will cause a shortfall of jobs for new entrants to the workforce, thereby increasing the incidence of poverty.
column2: 经济增长放缓将加大新增劳动力的就业缺口，从而提高贫困的几率。

column1: Indeed, the number of people living in absolute poverty is likely to increase by 10 million, bringing the total to more than 70 million, or 40% of the population.
column2: 事实上，绝对贫困人口可能增加1000万以上，总数达到7000多万，或占总人口的40 % 。

column1: Pakistan thus ends 2010 as the sick man of South Asia.
column2: 巴基斯坦就这样以南亚病夫的形象结束了2010之旅。

column1: The political system also remains unsettled.
column2: 政治体系同样充满动荡。

column1: Despite passage in July of the 18th amendment to the Pakistani constitution, which restored it to the form in which it was promulgated in 1973, political and executive authority remains in the hands of President Asif Ali Zardari.
column2: 尽管7月18日巴基斯坦宪法修正案获得通过，从而使宪法恢复到1973年颁布时的形式，但掌握政治和行政大权的仍然是巴基斯坦总统阿西夫·阿里·扎尔达里。

column1: The changes are supposed to make the executive branch accountable to the elected parliament, expand the prime minister’s authority, devolve more power to the provinces, and ensure independence to the judiciary.
column2: 修宪旨在让行政部门对当选议会负责，扩大总理权力，下放权力给地方各省，并确保司法独立。

column1: In late 2009, the president also approved the seventh National Finance Commission, which will allocate to the provinces a larger share of the revenues collected by the central government.
column2: 2009年末，总统还批准召开第七次全国金融委员会，批准将中央政府收入的更大份额向地方财政拨付。

column1: But a significant transfer of power from the presidency to parliament, or from the central to provincial governments, has yet to be brought about.
column2: 但从总统到议会、从中央到地方的大规模权力转移还远未完成。

column1: Worse yet, the military remains outside civilian control.
column2: 更糟糕的是，军队仍然不接受文人控制。

column1: General Ashfaq Pervez Kayani’s term in office, which was set to expire in November, was extended by three years.
column2: 原定于11月结束的卡亚尼将军的任期更是延长了三年。

column1: Thus empowered, the general has been able to exert his influence over foreign policy, in particular in defining the country’s relations with the US, India, and Afghanistan.
column2: 得到授权后，将军就有权干预外交政策，特别是影响巴基斯坦与美国、印度和阿富汗的关系。

column1: Even though the US offered $2 billion of assistance to the military to be disbursed over a period of 3-5 years, Kayani has resisted American pressure to move against the Taliban’s sanctuary in North Waziristan, used to stage operations against US and NATO troops in southern and eastern Afghanistan.
column2: 尽管美国已经在3－5年内提供了20亿美元的军事援助，卡亚尼将军依然抵制了美国攻击塔利班北瓦济里斯坦庇护所的压力，恐怖分子利用当地庇护所在阿富汗东南部对美国和北约部队发起攻击。

column1: So, is a further increase in violence by various extremist groups likely?
column2: 那么各极端组织是否可能扩大使用暴力？

column1: Will the economy collapse if the IMF withdraws its support?
column2: 国际货币基金组织撤销援助是否会导致经济崩溃？

column1: Will the US increase its pressure by intervening militarily if Pakistan continues to harbor Taliban fighters operating from the tribal areas?
column2: 如果巴基斯坦继续庇护隐藏在部族区域的塔利班武装分子，美国是否会加大军事干预的压力？

column1: Will the military subvert the constitutional changes aimed at reforming the political system?
column2: 改革政治体系的修宪活动是否会遭到军队的暗中破坏？

column1: Despite all the grim news and auguries, there is some hope, owing to the increased political mobilization of Pakistan’s middle classes, whose members have finally begun to question those espousing extremism.
column2: 尽管存在所有这些不详的信息和预兆，但巴基斯坦中产阶级政治力量的增强仍然为问题的解决保留着一线生机，新兴的中产阶级终于开始质疑支持极端主义。

column1: The judiciary is also more active, and is attempting to force the executive to remain within the bounds of the constitution.
column2: 司法系统也更加活跃，并试图迫使行政部门在宪法的范围内行事。

column1: Moreover, a trade agreement with Afghanistan that allows Afghan goods to cross Pakistan en route to India may be one step towards an improvement of economic relations with that large and rapidly growing neighbor.
column2: 此外，与阿富汗签订允许阿富汗货物过境运往印度的贸易协议可能是与这个高速发展的邻国改善经济关系的第一步。

column1: Indeed, an able economic team that has been installed in the government seems – at long last – to be addressing some of the economy’s deep structural flaws.
column2: 事实上，政府组建的有能力的经济团体似乎终于开始解决某些深层次的经济结构性问题。

column1: As India in the 1990’s and Brazil in the early 2000’s showed, economies in deep distress can recover quickly once the right policies are implemented.
column2: 正如20世纪90年代的印度和21世纪的巴西所表明的那样，实行正确的经济政策可以令经济从危机中迅速复苏。

column1: It could also happen in Pakistan, which would help to solve other, seemingly intractable problems.
column2: 这一点在巴基斯坦也不例外，而且经济的发展有可能解决似乎非常棘手的其他问题。

column1: So all hope is not lost in Pakistan.
column2: 因此巴基斯坦并未失去所有的希望。

column1: On the contrary, 2011 may well prove to be a better year for a battered economy and a political system under stress.
column2: 恰恰相反，历史可能证明2011年对其陷于困境的经济和承受压力的政治体系来讲是一次机遇。

column1: Whither the Egyptian Revolution?
column2: 埃及革命何去何从？

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – Egypt’s revolution toppled a dictator in February, but the country’s future as a stable, functioning democracy remains uncertain.
column2: 华盛顿 — — 2月，埃及革命推翻了独裁者，但埃及是否能够成为一个正常运转的稳定民主国家还远未尘埃落定。

column1: The West is, of course, limited in its ability to shape the transition process.
column2: 当然，西方在决定埃及转型过程方面只能起到有限作用。

column1: Nonetheless, the potential for constructive influence remains considerable, and it should be responsive to those in Egypt who favor liberal ideas, democratic institutions, and broad distribution of the benefits of economic development.
column2: 尽管如此，西方仍具有相当可观的潜在建设性影响力，对于支持自由思想、民主制度以及让经济发展惠及全埃及的埃及人，西方应该有所反应。

column1: The upcoming parliamentary elections are but an early stage in a long (perhaps decades-long) struggle to define the new Egypt.
column2: 即将到来的议会选举只是迈向新埃及的漫长斗争的第一步，整个过程可能会持续数十年。

column1: Will Egypt gravitate toward Islamic theocracy or adopt a secular government that respects minority rights?
column2: 埃及将滑向伊斯兰神权政体，还是会产生一个尊重少数派权利的世俗政府？

column1: Which economic policies – statist, liberal, or some combination of the two – will best ensure social justice and broad distribution of prosperity?
column2: 哪些经济政策能最好地确保社会公平和惠及广大埃及人民的繁荣？ 是中央计划体制，还是自由经济，还是两者的结合？

column1: Can civilian control of the military be established?
column2: 是否会建立由人民掌控的军队？

column1: Will the regional security structure formed around the United States, Egypt, and Israel survive?
column2: 围绕美国、埃及以及以色列的地区安全结构是否能保留下来？

column1: The November elections will not resolve these fundamental questions, and whether a workable constitutional framework will develop is uncertain.
column2: 11月的选举解决不了基本问题，且是否能产生一个有效的宪法框架还不确定。

column1: A parliamentary system of government will likely emerge, including a prime minister and a cabinet, with the strong possibility that the presidency will be politically overshadowed, particularly if the presidential election is delayed.
column2: 到时可能会产生一个政府议会体系，包括一位总理和一个内阁，总统的政治影响力很有可能会受到压制，特别是若总统选举被推迟的话。

column1: The central unknown is the composition of the ruling coalition.
column2: 最大的未知数是执政联盟的组成。

column1: It appears unlikely that a single party will emerge from the election with enough parliamentary seats to govern on its own.
column2: 看起来不太可能有哪个单一政党能从选举中胜出，获得足够席位单独执政。

column1: So a coalition government will be necessary.
column2: 因此联合政府将是无可避免之事。

column1: The political arm of the Muslim Brotherhood (the Freedom and Justice Party) currently is the best-organized party, and may be in the strongest position to form a majority coalition, including Salafist elements.
column2: 目前，穆斯林兄弟会（Muslim Brotherhood）的政治部门（即自由和公平党（Freedom and Justice Party ） ） 拥有最好的组织形态，最可能组成一个包括沙拉菲派（Salafist）在内的多数联盟。

column1: By contrast, secular liberal parties have yet to develop effective organizations or project compelling visions for the future.
column2: 相反，世俗的自由派政党尚没有建立起高效组织，也没有提出吸引眼球的未来愿景。

column1: Although sentiment favoring a secular state is considerable, a coalition that can serve as an alternative or counterweight to the Muslim Brotherhood will be difficult to assemble.
column2: 尽管埃及社会支持建立世俗国家的情绪相当高涨，但很难建立起一个足以与穆斯林兄弟会相抗衡甚至取而代之的联盟。

column1: In the near term, the most likely counterweight could be a liberal coalition with a heavy component of former members of deposed President Hosni Mubarak’s National Democratic Party (NDP) – that is, those who have not been discredited by their association with Mubarak.
column2: 从短期看，最可能的抗衡者将是一个以下台总统穆巴拉克的国家民主党（NDP）为重要组成部分自由派的联盟 — — 也就是说，这将是一群因与穆巴拉克有过合作而失去了信誉的人。

column1: Election rules favor those who were organized before the revolution.
column2: 选举规则对在革命前就组织起来的政党有利。

column1: Approximately one-third of the new parliament will comprise “non-party list” candidates.
column2: 新议会将有大约三分之一席位被“无党派”候选人占据。

column1: Established networks based on family, local loyalties, and tribal affiliations will be key determinants in voting.
column2: 基于家庭、地方忠诚和部落势力的现有网络将成为选票的决定性因素。

column1: These circumstances may favor “non-party list” candidates associated with the Muslim Brotherhood and the former NDP, particularly in rural Egypt.
column2: 这样的环境可能有利于与穆斯林兄弟会和前NDP有关联的“无党派”候选人，特别是在埃及农村地区。

column1: Post-election shifts in the composition of coalitions could complicate the situation, making governance even more difficult.
column2: 各联盟在选举之后的成分变迁将使情况复杂化，让治国难上加难。

column1: Power-sharing among coalition partners will be an intricate affair, including behind-the-scenes deals with the military, which will insist on measures to safeguard its interests.
column2: 联盟伙伴之间的权力分割错综复杂，包括与军方的幕后交易 — — 后者肯定会坚持采取捍卫其自身利益的措施。

column1: The political atmosphere in Egypt remains volatile.
column2: 埃及的政治氛围仍然极不稳定。

column1: Expectations of economic improvement are extremely high.
column2: 人们对于经济改善的期望极高。

column1: The initial elected government may pay an early political price for failure.
column2: 如果最初选出的政府不能满足人们的期望，将为此付出政治代价。

column1: The starting point for the West in trying to assist Egypt’s transition must be recognition that patient, long-term engagement will be required.
column2: 西方援助埃及转型的起点应该是认识到这是一项需要耐心和长期参与的事情。

column1: The effectiveness of this engagement will depend primarily on the persuasiveness of the West’s policy prescriptions, rather than on the volume of financial assistance.
column2: 西方的介入能否见效，主要取决于西方政治药方是否具有说服力，而不是财政援助手笔有多大。

column1: G-8 countries have already pledged support to post-Mubarak Egypt, including economic aid, debt relief, and loan guarantees.
column2: G8国家已经承诺支持后穆巴拉克时代的埃及，包括经济援助、债务纾困和贷款担保。

column1: These steps are important, though delivery will be prolonged and the likely impact modest, at least in the near-term.
column2: 这些举措都是十分重要的，但实现过程将会十分漫长，效果至少在短期是有限的。

column1: Egypt has already declined support from the International Monetary Fund.
column2: 埃及已然回绝了IMF的支持。

column1: But, apart from an IMF-backed reform program, if the Egyptian government’s policy framework is right, resources will flow from the private sector, including foreign investment supportive of job creation and economic development.
column2: 但是，除了IMF的改革计划之外，如果政府的政策框架对头，那么埃及还可以从私人部门获得资源，包括有利于就业创造和经济发展的外国投资。

column1: This is the message that Egypt needs to grasp and embrace.
column2: 这一点是埃及需要抓住并牢牢把握的。

column1: G-8 governments should urgently and repeatedly undertake quiet, structured, and consistent communications with Egyptian counterparts about the economic reforms needed to bring about prosperity.
column2: G8政府迫切需要反复与埃及政府就实现繁荣的所需的经济改革进行静悄悄、结构性、持续性的对话。

column1: It is far too early to judge the strength of internal forces promoting liberal economic policies.
column2: 断言有利于自由经济政策的内部推动力有多强还为时尚早。

column1: The need for economic growth could intrinsically push policymakers toward market-oriented economic policies (sensitive to considerations of “social justice”) and an open investment environment.
column2: 经济增长的需要将成为推动政客采取市场导向的经济政策（这对“社会公正”十分重要）和开放的投资环境的内因。

column1: Powerful forces within the Egyptian business community are silent at the moment, but in time will reassert themselves.
column2: 眼下，埃及商界内部的强大力量还没有发声，但迟早会表明自己的立场。

column1: Many business interests with job-creating capacity want the continuation of market-oriented reforms begun a decade ago (which produced impressive growth rates), but support broadening prosperity and rooting out corruption.
column2: 许多与就业创造能力息息相关的商业利益希望十年前开始的市场导向改革（创造了令人印象深刻的增长率）能够继续下去，同时也支持扩大繁荣、根除腐败。

column1: Moreover, an independent media might tend to reinforce pro-market and democratic sentiment.
column2: 此外��独立媒体也能强化支持市场和民主的情绪。

column1: Indeed, Western governments should continue to use their channels to the Egyptian military and future civil leadership to encourage them to uphold the rule of law, to act with restraint, and to respect free expression.
column2: 事实上，西方政府应该继续利用与埃及军方和未来民事领导人的渠道来促使他们赞成法治精神、保持行动克制、尊重言论自由。

column1: Regional security arrangements will also require careful maintenance.
column2: 地区安全安排也需要小心维持。

column1: Finally, countries supportive of a democratic Egypt should focus on encouraging the institutional and social underpinnings of democratic process and market reform.
column2: 最后，支持民主埃及的国家应该专注于鼓励国际和社会支持埃及的民主进程和市场改革。

column1: This depends on the development of a robust civil society, tolerant of open debate, and healthy liberal political parties, as well as active participation by women and an independent media.
column2: 这取决于稳健公民社会的发展、对公开争论的包容、健康的自由派政党，以及女性和独立媒体的积极参与。

column1: Winning broad public support will take time.
column2: 赢得广泛的公众支持需要时间。

column1: Private non-profit organizations and private enterprise, rather than governments directly, are best equipped to provide this type of training and expertise for leadership development and capacity building.
column2: 私人非营利组织和私人企业，而不是各国政府的直接干预，最适于提供此类关于领导力开发和能力建设的培训和专业意见。

column1: The job of democratic governments is to provide the resources that can make delivery of this aid possible.
column2: 而个民主国家的政府的职责则是提供让这种援助成为可能的资源。

column1: Who Are Tomorrow’s Consumers?
column2: 谁是明天的消费者?

column1: SINGAPORE – Luxury-brand companies’ stock prices plunged in July, after their financial results disappointed investors, owing largely to slower sales in emerging markets, especially in China.
column2: 发自新加坡 — — 由于在新兴市场（尤其是中国）的销售额走低，财务数据令投资者感到忧虑，奢侈品牌公司的股价在7月大幅下挫。

column1: Meanwhile, news reports indicate that high-end shopping malls in India and China are increasingly empty.
column2: 与此同时又有新闻报道指出印度以及中国高端购物中心的人流正不断减少。

column1: What is going on?
column2: 究竟发生了什么事？

column1: Many analysts had expected emerging markets to generate exponential growth over the next decade.
column2: 许多分析家都预计说新兴市场在未来十年内都将实现指数式的增长。

column1: But now there is talk of how the global crisis is slowing down these economies and killing off discretionary spending.
column2: 而今人们谈论的却是全球危机是如何减缓这些经济体发展并扼杀自由支出的。

column1: But a slowdown in China’s economic growth cannot really be blamed for slower sales of luxury goods or empty malls.
column2: 然而奢侈品牌或是购物中心门可罗雀可不能归咎于中国经济增长的放缓。

column1: The annual growth rate of China’s $7.5 trillion economy decelerated to 7.6% in the second quarter, from 8.1% in January-March – hardly a cause for panic.
column2: 这个7.5万亿经济体的增速从今年第一季度的8.1%下降到第二季度7.6%的表现根本无法引起任何恐慌。

column1: Moreover, two-thirds of the decline is attributable to slower investment rather than slower consumption.
column2: 此外，2/3的减速是源自于投资降低而不是消费疲软。

column1: For all of China’s long-term structural problems, it is not exactly slipping into recession.
column2: 就中国所有的长期结构性问题看来，它还未滑入衰退。

column1: The real problem is that many analysts had exaggerated the size of the luxury-goods segment in emerging markets.
column2: 真正的问题在于许多分析家都夸大了奢侈品牌在新兴市场的销售份额。

column1: China is by far the largest emerging-market economy, with 1.6 million households that can be called “rich” (defined as having annual disposable income of more than $150,000).
column2: 目前中国这个最庞大的新兴市场经济体有160万可以被称为“富有”的家庭（界定标准是拥有超过15万美元的年均可支配收入 ） 。

column1: But this is still smaller than Japan’s 4.6 million and a fraction of the 19.2 million rich households in the United States.
column2: 但相对于日本的460万来说还是偏低，跟美国的1920万相比更是相形见拙。

column1: The number of rich households amounts to barely 0.7 million in India and one million in Brazil.
column2: 而印度和巴西的富裕家庭数量也分别只有80万和100万。

column1: The point is that developed countries still dominate the income bracket that can afford luxury goods.
column2: 由此可见，可支付奢侈商品的收入层次中还是以发达国家的人占绝大多数。

column1: The explosive growth recorded by this segment in emerging markets in recent years reflected entry into previously untapped markets, with the subsequent slowdown resulting from saturation.
column2: 而近年来新兴市场这部分分额所取得的爆炸式增长则反映了一种进入原本未开发市场的现象，而销售下跌也是由于市场饱和。

column1: The number of high-income households is still growing, but not enough to justify the 30-40% compounded growth rates expected by some.
column2: 高收入家庭的数量依然在增长，但不足以支撑某些人所期望的30-40%复合增长率。

column1: This does not mean that growth opportunities in emerging markets have disappeared, but expectations do need to be recalibrated.
column2: 这并不意味着新兴市场的增长机会已经消失，而是预期水平必须被重新调整。

column1: Despite the economic boom of the last decade, China still has 164 million households that can be called “poor” (with annual disposable income of less than $5,000) and another 172 million that are “aspirant” (between $5,000-$15,000). Similarly, India has 104 million poor households and 107 million aspirant households.
column2: 尽管在过去10年内实现了蓬勃增长，但中国国内依然有1.64亿“贫困”家庭（年均可支配收入低于5000美元）以及1.72亿“积极消费”家庭（年均可支配收入介乎5000到1.5万美元之间 ） ， 而印度的对应数字则分别是1.04亿和1.07亿家庭。

column1: The real story for the next two decades will be these countries’ shift to middle-class status.
column2: 而未来20年的真实情况将是这些国家将进入中产状态。

column1: Although other emerging regions will undergo a similar shift, Asia will dominate this transformation.
column2: 虽然其他新兴地区都将出现类似的转换，但转型的中心将会是亚洲。

column1: A study by the economist Homi Kharas of the Brookings Institution gives us a sense of the scale of this change.
column2: 布鲁金斯学会经济学家荷米·卡拉斯（Homi Kharas）的一项研究向我们展示了这一变革的规模。

column1: He estimates that 18% of the world’s middle class lived in North America in 2009, while another 36% lived in Europe. Asia’s share was 28% (after including Japan).
column2: 他首先判断2009年时全球有18%的中产阶级住在北美，另有36%在欧洲，亚洲（计入日本）为28 % 。

column1: But Kharas’s projections suggest that Asia will account for two-thirds of the world’s middle class by 2030.
column2: 卡拉斯预计到2030年将全球有2/3的中产阶级住在亚洲。 换句话说。

column1: In other words, Asia will displace not just the West, but even other emerging regions.
column2: 亚洲不仅将取代西方，甚至连��他新兴区域也无法望其项背。

column1: This is the real business opportunity.
column2: 这才是真正的商业机会。

column1: Of course, the rise of Asia’s middle class is not the only change we should expect.
column2: 当然，亚洲中产阶级的崛起并不是我们唯一预期的变革。

column1: We are in the middle of a social and demographic shift that will both destroy and create consumer markets.
column2: 我们正处于一个同时会破坏和创造消费者市场的社会和人口结构变革。

column1: The aging of developed markets is well known, but the latest data show that emerging markets are aging at an even faster pace.
column2: 发达国家市场的老龄化已经众所周知。 但最新数据显示新兴市场正在更加迅速地经历老龄化。

column1: China’s median age is today 34.5 years, compared to 36.9 years for the US.
column2: 中国目前的中间年龄为34.5岁，而美国的数字则是36.9岁。

column1: However, the average Chinese will be 42.5 years old by 2030, compared to 39.1 for the average American. The median Russian will be even older, at 43.3 years.
column2: 然而中国人的平均年龄到2030年将达到42.5岁，美国只有39.1岁，俄罗斯则更甚，43.3岁。

column1: The impact of aging is already being felt in these countries’ education systems.
column2: 这些国家的教育系统已经遭到了老龄化的冲击。

column1: The number of students enrolled in primary schools in China has fallen by 18% since 1990, and by an astonishing 33% in South Korea.
column2: 中国的小学生入学数量自1990年以来已经下降了18 % ， 韩国更是严重下跌了33 % 。

column1: At the other end of the demographic scale, the share of the aged is growing explosively.
column2: 在人口结构量表的高龄一端，老年人的份额正出现爆炸性的增长。

column1: Meanwhile, the nature of the basic consuming unit – the household – is also changing rapidly.
column2: 与此同时，基本消费单位 — — 家庭 — — 的特性也在迅速改变。

column1: In most developed countries, the traditional nuclear family is in severe decline and is being replaced by single-individual households.
column2: 在发达国家，传统的核心家庭（只包括父母和儿女的家庭）数量不断减少，取而代之是单人家庭。

column1: In Germany, for example, 39% of households consist of just one person.
column2: 例如在德国，39%的家庭只有一名成员。

column1: Couples with children now account for barely 19% and 22% of households in the United Kingdom and the US, respectively.
column2: 有孩家庭仅仅分别占到了英国和美国家庭总量的19%和22 % 。

column1: Nevertheless, it is not all about consumer atomization.
column2: 但情况不仅仅是消费者的分散原子化。

column1: We are simultaneously witnessing the re-emergence of the multigenerational extended family, with as many as 22% of American adults in the 25-35 age group living with parents or relatives.
column2: 我们同时也见证了几代同堂家庭的重新兴起：在25-35年龄段的美国人中有22%都与父母或者亲戚住在一起。

column1: By contrast, the extended family is giving way in India to nuclear families, which now account for 64% of households.
column2: 相比之下，印度的大家庭正在为核心家庭让路，前者目前占全部家庭总数的64 % 。

column1: All of these changes will profoundly affect the future of consumer markets.
column2: 所有这些变革将深刻影响消费市场的未来走向。

column1: For example, we need to revise our mental image of the nuclear family from American suburbia to fit the rapidly expanding cities of India.
column2: 比如我们需要重新修改原本来自美国郊区的核心家庭形象以使其适应印度迅速发展的各大城市。

column1: By the same token, our mental image of the multigenerational extended family needs to include those in the West.
column2: 出于同样原因，我们对大家庭的形象认识也必须包含来自西方的大家庭。

column1: An aging but increasingly middle-class Asia will be at the core of this new consumer landscape.
column2: 而一个年龄不断增长且中产阶级不断增长的亚洲将会是新消费者市场的核心。

column1: Who Beats Corruption?
column2: 谁来打击腐败？

column1: Corruption undermines the quality of life for people around the world, not only in poor countries.
column2: 腐败危害全世界人民的生活质量，而不仅仅是穷国。

column1: The US currently is witnessing several corruption scandals.
column2: 美国正在经历几个腐败丑闻。

column1: Even America’s Federal Emergency Management Agency, responsible for providing relief after natural disasters and man-made catastrophes, was in the hands of inept political cronies rather than professionals.
column2: 甚至是在自然灾害和人为灾难后负责提供援助的美国联邦紧急情况管理局也落于不称职的政治密友之手而非专业人士。

column1: When hurricane Katrina struck America’s Gulf Coast, that incompetence proved fatal.
column2: 当卡特琳纳飓风袭击美国海湾沿岸时，这一不称职是致命的。

column1: All societies require an effective government that can provide vital and irreplaceable public services and infrastructure.
column2: 所有的社会都要求有效力的政府来向它为之服务的人民提供关键和不可替代的公共服务。

column1: Thus, governments are invested with unique powers, especially the powers of policing and judicial control.
column2: 因此，政府被授予独特的权力，特别是维持治安和司法控制的权力。

column1: But these powers are also readily abused.
column2: 但是，这些权力同时也经常遭到滥用。

column1: How, then, to ensure that governments are law-abiding as well as strong?
column2: 那么，如何来保证政府在强大的同时也守法呢？

column1: The best answer, both in theory and practice, is to find ways to hold governments accountable to the people that they serve.
column2: 理论上和实践上最好的办法是寻求使得政府向其服务的人民负责的方法。

column1: Elections are obviously one method, though campaign financing can be a source of corruption.
column2: 尽管竞选资助可能成为腐败的源泉，但是，选举明显地是方法之一。

column1: Politicians around the world trade favors for cash needed to win elections, and they often use that cash to buy the votes of desperately poor people.
column2: 全世界的政客们都用特殊照顾来换取赢得选举所需要的资金，而且，他们经常用这些资金来买取赤贫人口的选票。

column1: Clear electoral rules and procedures can help ensure transparency, but accountability also comes from the broad society in between elections.
column2: 清晰的选举规则和程序可以帮助确保透明，但是，在两次选举当中，广泛的社会阶层也可以产生向选民负责的效果。

column1: Privately owned newspapers, independent radio and television networks, trade unions, churches, professional societies, and other groups within civil society provide a bulwark against despotism.
column2: 私人拥有的报纸、独立电台和电视网络、工会、教会、专业团体以及其他公民社会的团体为防止专制主义提供保障。

column1: In the poorest countries, where illiteracy is high, desperate people are subject to government manipulation, and there is a lack of independent control through the media and professional organizations, governments face only weak control by society.
column2: 在最贫穷国家，文盲比例很高，绝望的民众受到政府操纵，缺乏通过媒体以及专业组织的独立监督，政府只面对来自社会的微弱的控制。

column1: They tend to be the most despotic and corrupt, not because poor people care less about good governance – on the contrary, their very lives depend on it – but because they lack the means to keep their government disciplined and law abiding.
column2: 它们有可能最为专制和腐败，这并不是由于贫苦民众对良好的管制漠不关心（相反，他们的生计取决于此 ） ， 而是由于他们缺乏控制政府并使其守法的手段。

column1: The result is a trap in which poverty causes bad governance and bad governance causes poverty – a two-way spiral downward that can lead to such extreme deprivation that the government, lacking computers, telephones, information systems, and trained civil servants, couldn’t function honestly even if it wanted to.
column2: 其结果是这样一个困境：那就是，贫困造成管制混乱，而管制混乱又造成贫困。 这种恶性循环造成极端的窘境，即，由于政府缺乏电脑、电话、信息系统以及训练有素的公务员，即使想要廉洁运作也不可能。

column1: The end result can be collapse into a kind of anarchy, as in Liberia, Sierra Leone, and Somalia.
column2: 最终结果就是社会崩溃到无政府状态形式，就像利比里亚、塞拉利昂以及索马里那样。

column1: One measure of the quality of governance in over 150 countries is provided by Transparency International, an organization dedicated to strengthening civil society in the fight against government corruption.
column2: 透明国际在超过150个国家中提供政府管制质量的衡量标准。 该组织在反对政府腐败的斗争中致力于强化公民社会。

column1: Transparency International produces an annual ranking of “corruption perceptions,” measuring the public’s view of the extent of corruption in a country.
column2: 它制作“腐败洞察”的年度排名来衡量公众对某国腐败程度的观点。

column1: In the 2005 rankings, Iceland scored as the least corrupt country, with the Scandinavian countries, New Zealand, and Singapore close behind.
column2: 在2005年的排名中，冰岛在最廉洁的国家中名列第一，斯堪的那维亚国家、新西兰以及新加坡紧随其后。

column1: The US ranked seventeenth from the top, a not-so-glorious position for the world’s leading power.
column2: 美国排名第七，这对于一个全球统领强国而言并不十分光彩耀人。

column1: In general, the poorer the country, the lower the ranking: tied for last place are Chad and Bangladesh.
column2: 总体而言，国家越穷，排名越低。 乍得和孟加拉国并列最末。

column1: A bit of statistical analysis reveals further important patterns.
column2: 稍加进一步统计分析就可以揭示更为重要的模式。

column1: First, Sub-Saharan African countries are less corrupt on average than countries at the same income level in other parts of the world.
column2: 首先，平均而言，萨哈拉沙漠以南国家与收入水平相同的其他国家相比腐败程度较低。

column1: For example, Burkina Faso, Ghana, Mali, and Rwanda rank much higher than Bangladesh, Indonesia, Pakistan, and Vietnam. Yet the Asian countries’ economies have tended to grow much faster over the past generation.
column2: 例如，布基那法索、加纳、马里以及卢旺达要比孟加拉国、印尼、巴基斯坦和越南排名远远靠前。

column1: Corruption therefore cannot be the unique factor that holds Africa back.
column2: 但是，在过去一代人中，亚洲国家的经济发展要远远更快。

column1: Africa’s problems have more to do with droughts, malaria, AIDS, and lack of infrastructure.
column2: 非洲的问题更多地与干旱、霍乱、艾滋病以及基础设施缺乏有关。

column1: Poor countries achieve lower levels of corruption when civil rights are protected.
column2: 当穷国的民权得到保护时，它们的腐败程度就较低。

column1: When people have the freedom to assemble, to speak, and to publish their views, society benefits not only by increasing the range of ideas that are debated, but also by keeping corruption in check.
column2: 当民众有集会、言论以及发表观点的自由时，辩论的观点范围加宽，而且腐败得到抑制，社会因此而受益。

column1: It is no surprise that corrupt regimes routinely clamp down on the press, trade unions, and on professional associations.
column2: 因此，腐败定时压制报纸、工会以及专业团体也就不足为奇了。

column1: In Africa, less corrupt countries like Ghana also have much better protection of civil liberties than more corruption-prone countries like Chad and Ethiopia, which are also even poorer.
column2: 在非洲，类似加纳 一样的腐败程度较低的国家对公民自由的保护要远远超过像乍得和埃塞俄比亚等更为贫困、更为倾向腐败的国家。

column1: Finally, the data show that corruption is highest in oil and gas-producing countries.
column2: 最后，数据显示，石油和天然气生产国家的腐败最为严重。

column1: In general, natural resources like oil, gas, diamonds, and other precious minerals breed corruption, because governments can live off of their export earnings without having to “compromise” with their own societies.
column2: 总体而言，由于政府可以依靠出口收入而无需同其社会“妥协 ” ， 因此，类似石油、天然气、钻石以及其他稀有金属的天然资源会促生腐败。

column1: The natural resources are therefore not only a target of corruption but also an instrument of holding power.
column2: 所以，自然资源不仅是腐败目标，而且是维护权力的手段。

column1: Many foreign companies, intent on cashing in, fuel the pathology of corrupt regimes by peddling in bribes and political protection.
column2: 许多外国公司意在获取利益而通过贿赂和政治保护而加剧腐败当局的病状。

column1: The implications for action are clear.
column2: 采取行动的含义是明白无误的。

column1: By strengthening civil society – through legal rights and long-term economic development – and instituting clear rules to ensure accountability, political despotism and corruption will be brought under control.
column2: 通过合法权利以及长期经济发展强化公民社会，以及制定清晰的规则来确保政府对人民负责，政治专制和腐败将会得到控制。

column1: We should be uncompromising, therefore, in our defense of civil liberties.
column2: 因此，我们要坚定不移地维护公民自由。

column1: The rich world should offer impoverished regions like sub-Saharan Africa more economic support to break out of poverty.
column2: 富国应当向类似萨哈拉以南国家的贫穷地区提供更多的经济支持以摆脱贫困。

column1: Of course, aid should be directed to specific needs – for example, malaria control, food production, safe drinking water, and sanitation – whose fulfillment can be measured and monitored to resist corruption.
column2: 当然，应当将援助提供给专门的需求，例如，控制霍乱、粮食生产、安全饮用水以及卫生。 可以衡量并监督是否满足这些需求以抵制腐败。

column1: By raising living standards, we would also be empowering both civil society and impoverished governments to defend the rule of law.
column2: 通过提高生活水平，我们还将使得公民社会和贫穷的政府能够维护法治。

column1: Breaking the WHO’s Glass Ceiling
column2: 打破世卫组织的玻璃天花板

column1: TORONTO/NEW YORK – This year, the World Health Organization will elect a new Director-General.
column2: 多伦多/纽约—今年，世界卫生组织将选出新的总干事。

column1: Last September, WHO member states nominated six candidates for the position: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, Flavia Bustreo, Philippe Douste-Blazy, David Nabarro, Sania Nishtar, and Miklós Szócska.
column2: 去年9月，世卫组织各成员国提名了六位候选人：泰德罗斯·亚德哈诺姆·盖布勒耶瑟斯（Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus ） 、 弗拉维亚·布斯特里奥（Flavia Bustreo ） 、 菲利普·道斯特-布莱奇（Philippe Douste-Blazy ） 、 大卫·纳巴罗（David Nabarro ） 、 萨尼亚·尼什塔尔（Sania Nishtar）和米克洛斯·左斯卡（Miklós Szócska ） 。

column1: On January 25, the WHO Executive Board will shortlist three candidates; and in May, the World Health Assembly will elect one of those candidates to succeed Margaret Chan.
column2: 1月25日，世卫组织执行委员会将把候选名单缩减至三位。 5月，世卫组织大会将选出陈冯富珍的继任者。

column1: All of the candidates have presented a vision for how they would lead the organization, and we personally know and admire several of them.
column2: 所有这些候选人都提出了一个领导愿景，我们私底下对其中几位候选人也十分了解和敬仰。

column1: But, ultimately, we believe that Ghebreyesus is the most qualified person for the job.
column2: 但是，我们还是最相信盖布勒耶瑟斯是最有资格担此大任的人。

column1: Our endorsement is based on three considerations that are important in any hiring process, and especially for a position such as this: the candidate’s past achievements, leadership style, and the diversity that he or she brings to the table.
column2: 我们之所以支持他，是出于在任何聘用程序中都至关重要、但对世卫组织总干事这样的职位尤其重要的三个考量：候选者过去的成就、领导风格，及其所能带来的多样性。

column1: With respect to the first consideration, Ghebreyesus has a proven track record of success.
column2: 从第一个考量角度看，盖布勒耶瑟斯拥有经过考验的成功记录。

column1: As Ethiopia’s health minister from 2005 to 2012, he championed the interests of all of the country’s citizens, and strengthened primary-care services.
column2: 他在2005—2012年担任埃塞俄比亚卫生部长期间着力推进所有埃塞俄比亚人民的利益，强化了该国的基本医疗。

column1: He created 3,500 health centers and 16,000 health posts, and dramatically expanded the health-care workforce by building more medical schools and deploying more 38,000 community-based health extension workers.
column2: 他建立了3,500家医疗中心和16,000家医疗站，通过建立更多医学院校和部署38,000多名社区卫生推广工作者极大地扩充了医护工作人员数量。

column1: Ghebreyesus’s efforts now serve as a model that other countries seek to emulate as they try to achieve universal health coverage for their citizens.
column2: 如今，盖布勒耶瑟斯的措施已经成为其他国家在试图实现全民医疗覆盖时竞相模仿的对象。

column1: He is the only candidate who has achieved such results at a national level.
column2: 他是唯一一个在国家层面实现这些成就的候选人。

column1: Ghebreyesus is also a longtime champion and advocate of gender equality and the rights of women and girls.
column2: 盖布勒耶瑟斯也长期致力于推进和支持性别平等和妇女和女孩权利。

column1: In fact, his efforts to strengthen Ethiopia’s health system played a crucial role in more than doubling the percentage of Ethiopian women with access to contraception, and in reducing maternal mortality by 75%.
column2: 事实上，他的加强埃塞俄比亚卫生系统的措施令埃塞俄比亚妇女获得避孕手段的比例翻了一番，令产妇死亡率下降了75 % 。

column1: When Ghebreyesus was Ethiopia’s foreign minister from 2012 to 2016, he gained extensive diplomatic experience, not least by leading negotiations for the Addis Ababa Action Agenda, the international community’s plan to finance the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals.
column2: 2012—2016年，盖布勒耶瑟斯担任埃塞俄比亚外交部长，积累了大量外交经验，如领导亚的斯亚贝巴行动日程谈判。 该日程是国际社会对联合国可持续发展目标的融资计划。

column1: This same knack for diplomacy is now needed to bring WHO member states together for cooperative action on collective health challenges.
column2: 如今，让世卫组织成员国团结一致采取合作行动应对共同卫生挑战也需要这一外交技巧。

column1: Ghebreyesus’s leadership style is also perfectly suited for this role: he speaks last, and encourages others to share their views.
column2: 盖布勒耶瑟斯的领导风格也非常契合世卫组织总干事的角色：他总是最后发言，鼓励其他人分享观点。

column1: He also knows how to spot and nurture talent, and how to bring the best out of the people around him.
column2: 他还知道如何发现和培养人才，如何让周围的人人尽其用。

column1: He would undoubtedly boost organizational morale and motivate the staff to deliver maximum value and efficiency – to the benefit of all member states and their citizens.
column2: 他将毫无疑问地提高世卫组织的士气和世卫组织工作人员实现最大价值和效率的动力 — — 为了所有成员国和它们的人民的利益。

column1: And while he is a receptive listener, he is also decisive, which is an attribute for the leader of the world’s foremost health institution, especially during global public-health emergencies.
column2: 除了是一位优秀的聆听者，他也具有决断力，而这正是领导世界上最重要的卫生机构所必须的特质之一，尤其是在发生全球公共卫生紧急情况时。

column1: Then there is Ghebreyesus’s extensive leadership experience within global health institutions.
column2: 盖布勒耶瑟斯还具有丰富的全球卫生机构领导静研。

column1: As Board Chair of the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis, and Malaria between 2009 and 2011, and as Chair of the Roll Back Malaria Partnership between 2007 and 2009, Ghebreyesus pushed through sweeping changes that dramatically improved both organizations’ operations.
column2: 2009—2011年，他担任全球对抗艾滋病、结核病和疟疾基金理事会主席；2007—2009年，他担任对抗疟疾伙伴合作计划（Roll Back Malaria Partnership）主席，其间他带来了令人耳目一新的变化，大大改善了这两个卫生组织的运营情况。

column1: What’s more, he helped them raise record-breaking financial commitments from donors: $11.7 billion for the Global Fund, and $3 billion for Roll Back Malaria.
column2: 此外，他还帮助它们从出资者那里筹集到创纪录的融资承诺：全球基金获得117亿美元，抗疟疾计划获得30亿美元。

column1: This is precisely the kind experience and expertise that the WHO needs in today’s global health environment, and it explains why the African Union has officially endorsed Ghebreyesus’s candidacy.
column2: 这正是世卫组织在当今全球卫生环境中所需要的经验和专业，也解释了为何非盟官方支持他的候选人资格。

column1: Amazingly, in its almost 70-year history, the WHO has never had a Director-General from Africa.
column2: 有趣的是，在其近70年的历史上，世卫组织从未有过来自非洲的总干事。

column1: This fact alone is not a reason to pick a candidate; but in Ghebreyesus’s case, his direct experience working in developing countries makes him uniquely qualified to tackle our toughest global health problems, which tend to hit developing countries the hardest.
column2: 这一事实本身就构成了选一位非洲总干事的理由；但在盖布勒耶瑟斯的例子中，他在发展中国家的直接工作经验让他具备了应对最棘手的全球卫生问题（受影响最严重的往往是发展中国家）的独一无二的资质。

column1: It is time to break the WHO’s African-leadership glass ceiling.
column2: 世卫组织应该打破非洲领导人的玻璃天花板。

column1: Sustainable development is truly achievable only when leaders of global institutions are from the communities most affected by those institutions’ work.
column2: 只有当全球机构领导人来自受该机构的工作影响最大的地区时，可持续发展才有可能真正实现。

column1: Ghebreyesus’s candidacy presents the WHO with an historic opportunity, which its Executive Board should seize on January 25.
column2: 盖布勒耶瑟斯成为候选人是世卫组织的一次历史性机遇，其执行委员会应该在1月25日抓住这次机会。

column1: Who is Gordon Brown?
column2: 布朗的真面目

column1: At long last, Gordon Brown is taking over from Tony Blair as Britain’s Prime Minister, thus attaining his life-long ambition, as if by right.
column2: 最终，布朗从布莱尔手中接任英国首相一职，因而好像理所当然地实现了其终身的雄心。

column1: That is his first problem.
column2: 这是他的第一个问题。

column1: He has not been elected by anyone – not by the Labour Party, and not by Britain’s voters; he has merely come into an inheritance that he has long thought was his due.
column2: 他并非经过选举上任，即不是工党，也不是英国选民。 他只不过是继承了他长久以来认为本应是他的东西。

column1: How, then, will Brown acquire legitimacy as Britain’s new leader?
column2: 那么，布朗将会如何获得作为英国新领导人的合法性呢？

column1: The one thing that is clear is that he will not gain legitimacy if he offers only more of what Blair has been dishing up for the past ten years.
column2: 现在唯一清楚的事情就是，如果他仅仅重蹈布莱尔过去十年中的复辙，那么他就不会获得合法性。

column1: Brown’s second problem is the mirror image of the first.
column2: 布朗的第二个问题是第一个问题的翻版。
