column2: 如果美国、英国和其它西方官员能够认真对待阿拉伯世界的改革，那么他们必须支持具备改革思想的阿拉伯个人和组织，即便这些组织有时让他们感到不快。

column1: If that becomes the West's standard, Al Jazeera will rightly be seen as part of the solution, not part of the problem.
column2: 如果这能够成为西方的处事标准，半岛电���台就自然会成为解决方案，而不是问题的组成部分。

column1: Who’s Dependent Now?
column2: 如今谁在依附？

column1: If the late great Argentine economist Raul Prebisch were alive today, he no doubt would wonder whether the world had turned upside down.
column2: 如果阿根廷已故的伟大经济学家罗尔·普里比时如今在世，他肯定会疑惑，这个世界是否换了人间。

column1: His hugely influential “dependency” theory argued that if poor countries relied too much on commodity exports, they would never achieve the industrial depth needed to sustain rapid growth.
column2: 他影响深远的“依附”理论认为，如果穷国过度依赖于原料出口，那么。 它们将永远不会达到维持快速增长所需要的产业深度。

column1: Instead, they would become mired in a cycle of declining global commodity prices and ever-dwindling income shares.
column2: 实际上，它们将陷于全球性原料价格下跌和不断降低的收入份额的恶性循环之中。

column1: Prebisch’s preferred policy response, protectionism, proved disastrous for the many Latin American and African countries that heeded him.
column2: 普里比时所喜爱的政策对应是保护主义。 对于许多听取他的意见的拉美国家和非洲国家而言，这一政策危害不浅。

column1: But the fact is that for many years, Prebisch seemed to have made the right call on long-term commodity price trends.
column2: 但是，事实却是，普里比时可能对原料的长期价格趋势作出了正确的预测。

column1: Relentless efficiency gains in agriculture and resource extraction pushed down prices for commodities, especially during the 1980’s and 1990’s.
column2: 农业和原材料采集的效率大为提高，降低了原料价格，特别是在二十世纪八十年代和九十年代。

column1: With few exceptions, countries that focused on commodity exports performed dismally, whereas many resource-poor Asian countries raced ahead.
column2: 除了少数例外情况，致力于原料出口的国家惨淡经营，而许多资源匮乏的亚洲国家则高歌猛进。

column1: Today, however, with Asia’s giants, India and China, joining the global economy, prices for oil, gold, wheat, and virtually every other commodity are exploding.
column2: 然而如今，随着亚洲巨人印度和中国加入全球经济，石油、黄金、小麦以及几乎所有其他原料的价格都在扶摇直上。

column1: While there will always be cycles – oil prices, for example, will probably fall before they start rising again – the long-run trend for many commodities will clearly remain upward for some time to come.
column2: 尽管总会有周期，例如说，石油价格再次上升之前可能还会下降，但是，长期而言，许多原料将无疑在一段时期内保持上扬趋势。

column1: What many trade negotiators and other policymakers do not seem to have recognized yet, though Prebisch would have realized it instantly, is that this dramatic turn of events carries huge implications for the global balance of power.
column2: 许多贸易谈判代表和其他决策者并未认识到、而普里比时会立即意识到的情况是，对于全球权力平衡而言，这一局势巨变影响巨大。

column1: Indeed, perhaps no other aspect of economic globalization will pose greater challenges to world leaders over the coming decades.
column2: 的确，在未来几十年中，可能不会有其他经济全球化的问题对世界各国领导人带来更大的挑战。

column1: The questions are many.
column2: 需要解答的问题众多。

column1: Are today’s rich countries prepared for an era of co-dependency, in which they are just as desperate for commodities as developing countries are for industrial imports and technology?
column2: 如今的富国是否为相互依附的时代做好准备？ 届时，富国急需原料，正如发展中国家急需工业产品进口和技术。

column1: Are they prepared for the inevitable flow of power and influence to commodity producers as they become much wealthier?
column2: 它们是否准备好，随着原料生产国变得大为富有，权力和影响力将不可避免地流向这些国家？

column1: How will the world’s two superpowers, China and the United States, come to terms with the fact that important commodity-exporting regions from Africa to the Middle East to Central Asia are littered with ill-formed nation states?
column2: 世界两大超级大国中国和美国如何应对这一事实，即从非洲到中东和中亚的重要的原料出口地区散布于不稳定的民族国家之中？

column1: Some self-anointed seers portray the problem as being one of finite natural resources, with the world running out of critical commodities at an alarming rate.
column2: 一些自我吹嘘的预言家认为，问题在于有限的自然资源，关键性原料正在以惊人的速度消失。

column1: Nowadays, there are many adherents of the “Hubbert’s peak” theory of oil production, which holds that we have reached the upper limits of output capacity, the wells are running dry, and it is all downhill from here.
column2: 有关石油生产的“哈伯特顶峰”理论认为，我们已经达到了生产能力的上限，油井已经干枯，石油产量将从此下滑。 如今，这一理论的信徒为数众多。

column1: However, as leading oil historian Dan Yergin points out, prophets of doom have declared that the world is running out of oil at least four times already.
column2: 但是，正如知名的石油问题历史学家耶金指出的那样，预言大难临头的预言家宣称世界石油耗尽已经至少有四次了。

column1: Each time, radical improvements in technology made the threat evaporate.
column2: 每次，技术上的大幅更新都使得威胁不攻自破。

column1: In the late 1800’s, oil extraction involved dredging with a mule.
column2: 十九世纪后期，人们用驴来开采石油。

column1: Today, no one thinks anything of drilling 3,000 meters beneath the ocean floor.
column2: 今天，人们对在洋底以下3,000米钻井不以为然。

column1: There have been similar improvements across the board in metals mining and agriculture.
column2: 在金属采矿和农业方面也有全面的改进。

column1: No, the world is not about to run out of commodities.
column2: 世界并不会耗尽原料。

column1: Instead, what is happening is that the integration of 2.5 billion people (China and India alone) into the global economy is producing a demand shift that is likely to put far more upward pressure on commodity prices than any technology gains are likely to offset.
column2: 实际上，25亿人口（仅仅是中国和印度两国）融入全球经济，其产生的需求移动带来的对原料价格的上浮压力要远远大于技术进步所可能抵消的部分。

column1: So, for at least the next 50 to 75 years, and perhaps until humans start mining on Mars sometime in the coming centuries, prices for many natural resources are headed up.
column2: 所以，在未来50到75年的时间里，甚至未来几百年人类开始在火星采矿之前，许多自然资源的价格都会上扬。

column1: Will the rebalancing of global economic power that results from this destabilize world politics?
column2: 由此带来的全球经济力量重新平衡会破坏世界政治的稳定吗？

column1: World War I, of course, was partly set off by Germany’s concern that the other colonial powers had locked up too large a share of world oil and commodity supplies.
column2: 第一次世界大战无疑是部分由于德国担忧其他殖民列强占据了过多的世界石油和原料供应而引发。

column1: Similarly, in World War II, Japan feared for the stability of its foreign supplies of oil and other natural resources.
column2: 类似的情况是，在第二次世界大战中，日本对它的石油和其他自然资源的稳定供应感到担心。

column1: Will similar tensions arise between resource-challenged China (where even water scarcity is a problem) and the West?
column2: 资源短缺的中国（甚至连用水短缺都成为问题）和西方之间会产生类似的紧张关系吗？

column1: Fortunately, this does not seem likely for the moment, especially given the Chinese leadership’s sober and pragmatic approach to its resource problems.
column2: 幸运的是，目前这并不大可能，特别是鉴于中国领导人对其资源问题采取冷静和务实的做法。

column1: The Chinese are looking to regions like Africa, hoping to find stable trading partners.
column2: 中国正在寻求类似非洲那样的地区，希望找到稳定的贸易伙伴。

column1: They do not share the political evangelism of the Americans, who don’t just want to trade with commodity exporters, but to convert them as well.
column2: 他们并不像美国人那样具有政治福音教义。 美国人不仅想要与原料出口国做交易，而且同时想要使其皈依。

column1: Then there are those American leaders who still speak of making the US self-sufficient in energy supplies.
column2: 有的美国领导人还在谈论美国的能源供应自给自足。 但是这基本上是一个笑话。

column1: But this is basically a joke: self-indulgent, maybe, but self-sufficient, never.
column2: 可能是一个空想，而永远不会自给自足。

column1: Much of the Arab world understandably views the invasion of Iraq as the cornerstone of the real US strategy for securing stable energy supplies.
column2: 可以理解的是，大多数阿拉伯世界把入侵伊拉克视为美国真正的确保稳定能源供应战略的基石。

column1: If they are right, one can only hope that America has a plan B.
column2: 他们如果是正确的话，但愿美国还有第二套方案。

column1: Meanwhile, commodity prices will continue to rise, with oil exporters now constituting the largest contributors to America’s gaping trade deficit.
column2: 目前，原料价格将继续上升，石油生产国现在成为美国庞大贸易赤字的最大因素。

column1: Maybe the real US strategy is to try to owe the commodity-exporting countries so much money that they will feel dependent on making America happy!
column2: 美国的真实战略可能是试图欠原料出口国大量金钱，迫使它们感觉要依赖于讨美国的欢心！

column1: That is one twist that Prebisch would never have anticipated.
column2: 这一变局是普里比时所永远不会料想得到的。

column1: Whose Champions, Anyway?
column2: 大公司到底是谁的？

column1: The links between states and companies have grabbed headlines, most recently in Russia, where President Vladimir Putin seems obsessed with creating “national champions” in the energy and aerospace sectors.
column2: 最近在俄国，国家和公司之间的关系占据了报纸的头版头条，弗拉基米尔·普京（Vladimir Putin）总统似乎沉湎于在能源和航天领域建立“全国性大公司”的梦想。

column1: Such efforts seem but a part of a surge of protectionism in European political debate about business, especially when it comes to cross-border acquisitions.
column2: 普京的所作所为只是当前欧洲政治辩论中企业保护主义甚嚣尘上的一部分表现，尤其是在涉及到跨国收购问题时这种保护主义趋势就更加明显。

column1: Across Europe, governments position themselves to be seen as defending “national” players from “foreign” competitors.
column2: 欧洲所有国家政府无一不在履行保护“国内”企业免受“国外”竞争威胁的职责。

column1: “Economic patriotism,” the slogan coined by France’s Prime Minister Dominique de Villepin following PepsiCo’s rumored attempt in July 2005 to takeover Danone, perhaps best encapsulates the political imperative.
column2: “经济爱国主义”是法国总理多米尼克·德维尔潘（Dominique de Villepin）在2005年7月百事公司传闻收购达能集团后创造出来的口号，也可能是对上述政治责任的最佳概括。

column1: Although de Villepin’s speeches are more flamboyant than those of most political leaders, the underlying sentiment extends far beyond France.
column2: 虽然德维尔潘的辞藻比其他多数政治领袖都要华丽，但内中所蕴含的核心精神却绝对不仅局限在法国。

column1: The same impulse appears to be at work behind Italy’s policy on Autostrade, Spain’s on Endesa, Poland’s on its banking sector, the former Swedish Prime Minister’s on Volvo, German unease about “locust”-like funds on Deutsche Börse, or the United Kingdom’s ever louder defense of the London Stock Exchange’s independence from the United States.
column2: 如出一辙的冲动似乎也左右了意大利对Autostrade公司、西班牙对Endesa公司、波兰对银行业和瑞典前首相对沃尔沃公司的政策。 德国对“入侵者”的戒惧¾比如拨款支持德国证券交易所，或是英国大张旗鼓地捍卫伦敦证交所相对于美国的独立性，背后也隐藏着同样的原因。

column1: The basic belief that underpins “economic patriotism” is that of an alignment of interests between companies considered “national” (most prominently the largest ones or so-called “champions”), their national employees, and the national community.
column2: 支撑“经济爱国主义”的基本理念是在“国内”公司（尤其是大公司或者所谓“顶级公司 ” ） 、国内雇员以及各式各样的国内团体之间建立起利益联盟。

column1: According to de Villepin, “to defend the employees’ interests well, we must protect the interests of our companies.”
column2: 按照德维尔潘的话讲 ， “ 为了更好地保护员工的利益，我们必须先保护好国内公司的利益 ” 。

column1: He later argued that Danone should be considered “French” because its “milk collection and its water sources are in France.”
column2: 他接下来提出达能应该算作“法国”的企业，因为该公司“奶源和水源均取自法国 ” 。

column1: But Danone’s own filings indicate that only 22% of its global sales and less than 14% of its global workforce are in France.
column2: 但达能公司的内部档案显示，该公司仅有22%的全球销售额来源于法国，而法国境内的员工人数还不到其全球员工总数的14 % 。

column1: In fact, the link between European companies and national communities is becoming more tenuous by the day.
column2: 事实上，欧洲公司和国内团体之间的联系已经日渐薄弱。

column1: Research that I carried out for Bruegel surveyed the largest 100 listed companies headquartered in Europe (ranked by market capitalization) and analyzed the geographical distribution of their revenue, which is increasingly transparent since the adoption of International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) last year.
column2: 我为Bruegel所作的研究调查了以欧洲为总部的百强上市公司（按市场资本总额进行排序 ） ， 并分析了其收入来源的地理分布状况。 去年国际财务报告准则（IFRS）正式实施后，公司营业收入的来源及分布状况的透明度也大大增加。

column1: Europe was divided into eight broad zones, comprising individual countries like Germany, France, and Italy, or groupings of smaller countries such as Benelux and the Nordic area.
column2: 这项研究把欧洲分成了8大区域，囊括了德国、法国、意大利等国家或卢比荷关税同盟及北欧区域联盟等小型国家集团。

column1: The survey then calculated the share of revenue earned by each company in the zone in which it is headquartered (or “home base”), the rest of Europe, and the rest of the world.
column2: 调查接下来计算了总部设在区域之内、欧洲其他国家和世界其他国家的各公司所挣得的收入份额。

column1: Where relevant information for companies was available, the comparable distribution of employees was also examined.
column2: 如果能找到相关资料，我们也对员工的可比分布进行了研究。

column1: The results show that the share of the home base in total revenue has become, on average, relatively low: just three-eighths, or 37.5%, on average for Europe’s largest 100 companies.
column2: 结果显示总部所在地收入在总收入中所占的比重平均相对较低：欧洲百强公司平均只有八分之三，或37.5 % 。

column1: Of course, this figure covers a wide diversity of industries, and also some geographical differences across the continent.
column2: 当然，这一数字包含各式各样的行业，而且欧洲大陆的不同国家也存在一些地理上的差异。

column1: For example, the averages for German (34%) or French (35%) companies are markedly lower than for their Spanish (56%) or Italian (65%) counterparts.
column2: 比如，德国公司（34 % ） 和法国公司（35 % ） 的平均数就比他们在西班牙（56 % ） 或意大利(65 % ) 的同伴有着显著的差距。

column1: But the general trend is unambiguous.
column2: 虽然如此，但总体趋势依然十分清晰。

column1: For a broadly representative sub-sample of 55 companies that could be tracked since 1997, the proportion of revenue generated in the home region has fallen sharply on average, from 50.2% to 36.9%.
column2: 在1997年后追踪的具有广泛代表性的55个公司子样中，总部所在地的收入比重平均起来都有大幅度下降，从50.2%降到了36.9 % 。

column1: For these companies, sales to the “rest of Europe,” which represented an average of less than 30% of total European sales in 1997, rose above 43% in 2005.
column2: 同样在这些公司中，对“欧洲其他国家”的销售额1997年平均只占其欧洲总销售额的不到30 % ， 而2005年已经上升到超过43 % 。

column1: If the trend is extrapolated, the home bases of Europe’s largest companies will account, on average, for less than half of their European revenue, and less than a third of their global revenue, before the end of this decade.
column2: 如果这样的趋势得以延续，那么到2010年，欧洲最大公司在所在地获得的收入占其欧洲地区总收入的平均比重将低于一半，而在其全球总收入中所占的比重将低于三分之一。

column1: These companies are “Europeanizing” fast, and the relative weight of their home base is declining even faster.
column2: 这些公司正在迅速实现“欧洲化 ” ， 其所在地的相对重要性则下降得更为迅速。

column1: Moreover, this is not just a story about sales. The survey also measured the geographical distribution of employees relative to the distribution of revenue.
column2: 调查不仅研究了销售状况，还研究了员工的地理分布与收入分布之间的相对关系。

column1: While the distribution profiles between employees and revenue could be sharply dissimilar in some companies, on average they were almost identical: for a sub-sample of 73 companies among Europe’s top 100, the home base represented 37% of employees and 35% of revenue on average in 2005, while the rest of Europe accounted for 29% of employees and 28% of revenue.
column2: 尽管有些公司人员和收入的分布状况可能相去甚远，但一般来讲这两者都具有一致性：名列欧洲百强的73家公司子样中，其原属地在2005年占员工总数和收入总数的平均比例分别是37%和35 % ， 而欧洲其他地区占员工总数和收入总数的平均比例则分别是29%和28 % 。

column1: This strongly suggests that jobs broadly “follow” sales (or perhaps the other way round), even though, once again, this is true only on average and not for all companies.
column2: 这样的结果有力地表明：尽管只适用于部分公司的平均状况，但就业的分布状况与销售的分布状况大致关系呈“正相关 ” （ 反之亦然 ） 。

column1: What are the implications for policymakers?
column2: 政府决策者能从中得到什么启示？

column1: Put simply, the numbers show a growing gap of interests between these so-called “champions” and their national home bases.
column2: 简言之，上述统计数据显示了这些所谓的“顶级公司”和他们的总部所在地之间有着越来越明显的利益差异。

column1: For Europe’s governments, fostering champions increasingly means providing benefits to non-national customers and employees – a dubious use of taxpayer money.
column2: 对欧洲政府来讲，培育顶级公司越来越多地意味着为非国民客户和员工提供好处¾这种利用纳税人钱财的方式非常值得怀疑。

column1: Another consequence is that regulatory competition is likely to increase in Europe, as companies are less bound by local interests to keep their headquarters at “home” if the tax or regulatory environment becomes unfavorable.
column2: 另外一个结果就是欧洲各国的管理竞争可能会加剧，因为在税收或管理环境不那么有利的情况下，本地利益不再能约束公司继续把总部设在“本国 ” 。

column1: The decision by Depfa Bank to shift its headquarters from Wiesbaden to Dublin in 2002 may be a sign of things to come.
column2: 德国银行2002年决定把总部从威斯巴登迁往都柏林的举动可能就代表了未来的趋势。

column1: The biggest risk is that the growing disconnect between the perception of “national” companies and the reality of Europeanization may lead to spectacularly ill-judged policies.
column2: 其中最大的风险是，人们对“国内”公司的传统认识和欧洲化日益扩大的现实可能会导致在制定政策时南辕北辙。

column1: It is high time for business leaders to be more candid about where their real constituencies lie, and for national politicians to recognize that they can no longer wield control over the giants of today’s European business.
column2: 现在是时候让企业领导者坦率地公布他们真正的客户到底在哪里，也是时候让国内政治家们明白，他们今天再也无法真正控制欧洲的企业。

column1: Whose Corporate Social Responsibility?
column2: 谁的企业社会责任？

column1: NEW YORK – Increasingly, corporations are under pressure, often from activist non-governmental organizations, to take on specific “corporate social responsibility” (CSR) obligations.
column2: 发自纽约 — — 以非政府组织为首的外界正向企业施加越来越大的压力，要求他们去承担某些特定的“企业社会责任 ” 。

column1: But the fact that CSR is being demanded, and occasionally conceded, does not ensure clarity about either its rationale or the ways in which it should be undertaken.
column2: 但即便对这类责任的呼声越来越大，企业也偶尔做出让步，却不能确保这些责任以及承担这些责任的方式是合理的。

column1: CSR can be divided into two categories: what corporations should do (say, contribute to a women’s rights NGO or build a village school) and what they should not do (say, dump mercury into rivers or bury hazardous materials in landfills). The latter is wholly conventional and subject to regulation (and recently to questions about how corporations should behave when there are no host-country regulations).
column2: 一般来说，企业社会责任可以被分成两类：企业应该做的（比如说向一个保护妇女权益的非政府组织捐款，或是捐建一所乡村学校）以及不应该做的（向河中排放水银或在填埋场掩埋危险物料 ） ， 而后者属于一般性行为，且易于监管（但在东道国缺乏相关监管的情况下，企业该如何作为？
对此也有争论 ） 。

column1: But are CSR obligations really good practice?
column2: 但是，企业承担社会责任真的一种合理的行为吗？

column1: Milton Friedman and other critics often asked if it was the business of businesses to practice corporate altruism.
column2: 米尔顿·弗里德曼以及其他一些批评家一直都质疑企业是否应开展利他主义行为。

column1: Prior to the rise of the corporation, there were mainly family firms, such as the Rothschilds. When they made money, it accrued principally to the family itself.
column2: 在企业诞生之前，社会上存在的主要是一些诸如罗斯柴尔德这样的家族产业，赚到的收入主要归家族所有。

column1: Altruism, where it existed, also was undertaken by the family, which decided how and on what to spend its money. Whether the firm or its shareholders and other stakeholders spent the money was beside the point.
column2: 那个时候，利他主义行为主要也是由家族来承担，钱怎么花，花在哪里，决定权都在家族手里，而不是在企业或其股东以及其他利益相关者身上。

column1: With the rise of the business corporation, large family firms have generally disappeared.
column2: 随着企业的发展壮大，大型家族产业大多退出了历史的舞台。

column1: But that does not mean that a corporation is the right entity to engage in altruism – though its various stakeholders obviously can spend any portion of the income they earn from the corporation and other sources in altruistic ways.
column2: 但这并不意味着企业就是继承利他主义的合适主体 — — 当然，企业的股东完全可以把自己从企业和其他渠道赚来的钱以个人名义花在利他主义行为上。

column1: Instead of CSR, we should have PSR (personal social responsibility).
column2: 实际上，相对于企业社会责任这个说法，我们更应该提倡的是个人社会责任。

column1: One can also argue for PSR on the grounds that asking for CSR becomes a way of “passing the buck” – evading personal responsibility for doing good.
column2: 个人社会责任之所以更加合理，是因为苛求企业承担社会责任已经成了一种“推卸责任”的途径 — — 企业责任已经成了个人逃避行善的借口。

column1: This is the flip side of blaming corporations for everything from obesity to scalding from spilled coffee – both the subject of lawsuits in recent years.
column2: 而这恰恰是人们把肥胖到被咖啡烫伤都统统归咎于快餐店的背后原因 — — 近年来，这类诉讼已经成为了大热门。

column1: There is also an added advantage in replacing CSR with PSR: there is virtue in diversity of approaches to altruism.
column2: 此外，以个人社会责任取代企业社会责任还有一个好处：因为其优势在于可以利用多种途径来具体实现利他主义。

column1: Chairman Mao wanted a hundred flowers to bloom, but only so that he could cut them all off at their roots.
column2: 企业社会责任就像毛主席提倡“百花齐放 ” ， 最终只是为了获得斩草除根的结果。

column1: But PSR is more like President George H.W. Bush’s metaphor of a “thousand points of light.”
column2: 但个人社会责任却更像老布什总统说所说的那样“发出万千光芒 ” 。

column1: Moreover, it is hard to see how a corporation’s stakeholders can always arrive democratically at a common position on how the corporation should engage in social responsibility on their behalf.
column2: 而且在公司如何代表他们来承担社会责任的问题上，很难想象一间公司的股东能够民主地达成共识。

column1: Each will consider his or her CSR view the best.
column2: 毕竟每个人都会觉得自己的想法是最好的。

column1: But there are strong arguments in favor of CSR as well. First, the political reality is that society treats corporations as if they were persons, which is often also a legal reality for many purposes.
column2: 不过话又说回来，企业社会责任也有其存在的依据：首先，不可忽略的一个政治现实是，社会以对待个人的要求来对待企业，这在许多方面也是一个法律现实。

column1: Society increasingly demands that these “corporate citizens” be altruistic, just as people are.
column2: 社会越来越要求这些“企业公民”要如社会上的个人一样承担起利他主义的责任。

column1: Given this reality, corporations want to give simply because it is expected of them.
column2: 在这种情况下，企业愿意承担起相应的责任也只是因为社会是这样的期待它们的。

column1: Such CSR builds the firm’s image as a “good” corporation, just as giving by Bill Gates and Warren Buffet builds their image as “good” billionaires.
column2: 而承担这些责任也为企业建立起了“良好”形象，正如参与慈善事业为比尔·盖茨和沃伦·巴菲特这些亿万富翁建立起了“富贵善人”形象一样。

column1: Second, many corporations view CSR as an effective defensive strategy against powerful activist NGOs (such as Greenpeace) that have taken to using online agitation, boycotts, and other means to “blackmail” targeted corporations into acceding to the activists’ demands.
column2: 其次，许多公司都把企业社会责任作为一种有效的防御性战略，以此来应付那些非政府组织（诸如绿色和平组织 ） — —这些人利用网络煽动，抵制和其他各种方法来迫使企业满足他们的要求。

column1: The more CSR a company can point to, the less such efforts will succeed – or even be mounted.
column2: 而企业越是承担起社会责任，那些非政府组织的要挟就越不可能成功 — — 甚至反过来被企业所利用。

column1: Consider the contrasting experiences of Coke and Pepsi.
column2: 试回想一下可口可乐与百事可乐这个两个截然相反的例子。

column1: Coke has been targeted by NGOs for alleged lapses in labor and environmental standards.
column2: 可口可乐公司在劳资关系和环保标准等问题上与非政府组织纠缠不休，声名狼藉。

column1: By contrast, Pepsi, which once teamed up with AT&T and the CIA to oust President Salvador Allende in Chile, smells like a rose nowadays, because it has distributed CSR largesse to several causes that influential NGOs embrace.
column2: 相反，曾与AT&T和中情局联手驱逐了智利总统萨尔瓦多·阿连德的百事可乐公司却誉满天下，原因很简单，因为它在好几个由大型非政府组织发起的运动中都表现出了极大的企业社会责任感，慷慨解囊。

column1: That is a lesson that Wal-Mart has since learned.
column2: 沃尔玛在这个问题上也吃过亏。

column1: In 2005, the Service Employees’ International Union (SEIU) created Wal-Mart Watch, with an annual budget of $5 million. The purpose was to make Wal-Mart a “better employer, neighbor, and corporate citizen,” and Wal-Mart eventually capitulated on some of the SEIU’s specific demands as well.
column2: 在2005年，服务业雇员国际工会（SEIU）创立了一个名叫沃尔玛监视者的组织，每年活动经费500万美元，目标只有一个，就是为了使沃尔玛成为一个“更好的雇主，邻居和企业公民 ” ， 而沃尔玛最终也只能屈从于SEIU的某些特殊要求。

column1: Finally, CSR can be simply a matter of advertising.
column2: 最后，企业社会责任也可以仅仅作为一个宣传手段。

column1: In this case, the choice of CSR spending is focused directly on generating added revenue, much like advertising, and is aimed at sales much the way advertising is.
column2: 在这种情况下，选择承担责任主要是为了直接创造额外收益和刺激销售额上升，正如广告的效果一样。

column1: A benign example is Adidas’s sponsorship of tennis tournaments.
column2: 阿迪达斯赞助网球比赛就是一个很好的例子。

column1: A malign example is Philip Morris’s donation of money to museums, symphony orchestras, and opera houses, cynically aimed at buying off artists who might otherwise work to ban cigarettes.
column2: 而烟草巨头菲利普莫里斯公司给博物馆，交响乐团以及歌剧院的慈善捐款则别有用心，捐款被揭露是出于收买那些地方的艺术家，好让他们不要致力于禁烟运动。

column1: All these rationales for CSR suggest that it should be left to each corporation to determine, just as PSR leaves altruism to each individual’s conscience and sense of what needs supporting.
column2: 总的来说，所有承担企业社会责任的行为都应该由企业自己来决定，正如个人社会责任让每个个人依靠自己的良知和感觉来进行判断，决定哪些事情是值得支持和赞助的一样。

column1: The attempt by some NGOs and activists to impose a straitjacket on CSR, reflecting their priorities, is misguided and must be rejected.
column2: 部分非政府组织以及一些社会活动家都企图按照他们自己的个人好恶来左右企业社会责任的实现，这样的做法绝对是个误导，必须坚决抵制。

column1: Instead, the model should be former United Nations Secretary General Kofi Annan’s initiative, the Global Compact.
column2: 所以说，联合国前秘书长科菲·安南所提倡的“全球契约”才是理想的方案。

column1: What Annan has done is to embrace ten wide-ranging guiding principles while leaving signatory corporations free to choose that which they wish to support actively.
column2: 安南的贡献在于他列出了范围广泛的十大指导性原则，而把选择承担哪些社会责任的权利留给了签约企业，让他们自由选择。

column1: Whose Georgia?
column2: 格鲁吉亚究竟属于谁？

column1: In recent weeks, leaders of various opposition organizations in Georgia, such as Antisoros and Fairness, have been jailed on unfair accusations of plotting a coup on behalf of Russia.
column2: 最近几周，格鲁吉亚“反索罗斯”运动和“公正”党等反对组织领袖都因遭到不公正指控而入狱，罪名是替俄国策划政变。

column1: But the wave of political repression merely reflects President Mikhail Saakashvili’s desperate effort to cling to power.
column2: 但新一轮政治镇压不过反映了米哈伊尔·萨卡什维利(Mikhail Saakashvili)总统想要继续掌权的疯狂努力。

column1: With popular dissent growing and opposition forces strengthening, the authorities have sought to controll non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and strengthen the security forces.
column2: 随着公众不满与日俱增，反对力量日渐强大，格鲁吉亚当局试图掌控非政府组织（NGO ） ， 并加强安全力量。

column1: But this will only make mass protests inevitable, ultimately jeopardizing the democratic transition in Georgia that Saakashvili claims to represent.
column2: 但这样的努力只会导致公众抗议不可避免，最终致使萨卡什维利声称代表的格鲁吉亚民主转型陷入危险之中。

column1: Saakashvili sees a “Moscow hand” in every challenge to his authority, which could be explained by his government’s close alliance with the United States.
column2: 萨卡什维利认定对他权威的每次挑战背后都有“莫斯科的操纵 ” ， 原因是他所领导的政府与美国建立了亲密的伙伴联盟。

column1: But the people rounded up in the latest raid against the opposition were originally imprisoned by Eduard Shevarnadze’s government, which Saakashvili helped depose in Georgia’s supposedly democratic “Rose revolution” in 2003.
column2: 但不久前聚在一起袭击反对派的民众很多都曾受到过爱德华·谢瓦尔德纳泽(Eduard Shevardnadze)政府的监禁，谢瓦尔德纳泽政府在被认定为民主运动的2003年“玫瑰革命”中被萨卡什维利推翻。

column1: The latest events clearly indicate that a czarist mentality survived the revolution, reflected in a Byzantine model of political power — an emperor and his court — that has as its main vehicle largely unconstrained presidential authority.
column2: 不久前的事件显然表明沙皇主义思想逃过了革命的清洗，并在拜占庭模式（皇帝及其法庭）的政权下把基本不受控制的总统权力作为其执政的主要手段。

column1: Before the security forces targeted the opposition bloc that I represent, supporters of educational reforms were prosecuted, while most of the press is under the influence of the government.
column2: 在安全部队打击我所代表的反对派集团之前，教育改革的支持人士已经遭到了迫害，而绝大多数媒体都处在政府的严密控制之下。

column1: Saakashvili claims that the opposition forces that I represent oppose Western values.
column2: 萨卡什维利称以我为代表的反对力量抵制西方价值观。

column1: But we advocate parliamentarism – genuine separation of executive and legislative power – in Georgia.
column2: 而我们却积极倡导在格鲁吉亚推行议会制度，从而在真正意义上实现行政和司法权力分开。

column1: And, in supporting the Western model of parliamentariansm, we are on the side of Georgia, not Russia.
column2: 而且从支持西方议会模式的角度讲，我们也代表了格鲁吉亚、而非俄国的立场。

column1: It is strange that Saakashvili, a graduate of Columbia Law School, fails to see the disparity between his own democratic rhetoric and autocratic actions.
column2: 作为哥伦比亚大学法学院的毕业生，萨卡什维利看不到自己的民主言论与独裁行为之间的差异真是咄咄怪事。

column1: Thus, those of us who value Georgia’s historical ties with Russia are called, at best, “archaists,” and at worst “enemies of Georgian independence,” as if Georgia would become a Russian colony if we ever came to power.
column2: 于是，珍惜格鲁吉亚与俄国历史渊源的人士被客气地称做“复古主义者 ” ， 更有甚者，他们被指责为“格鲁吉亚独立的敌人 ” ， 就好像我们一上台，格鲁吉亚就会沦为俄国的殖民地。

column1: But what separates us from Saakashvili is that we understand that history, geography, and economics dictate close ties to Russia.
column2: 但我们与萨卡什维利的不同之处就是我们了解是历史、地理和经济因素造就了我们与俄国之间的密切关系。

column1: We simply see no contradiction between that stance and support for Western values.
column2: 我们认为这一立场与支持西方价值观之间没有任何冲突。

column1: Indeed, even Russia, with all its imperfections, cannot be said to oppose Western values.
column2: 实际上，尽管俄国有着各种各样不尽如人意之处，也不能说俄国反对西方的价值观。

column1: The unfortunate paradox in Georgia – and elsewhere in the post-Soviet world – is that self-serving pro-Western rhetoric has often led democratic values to be sacrificed in favor of a new dictatorship.
column2: 与后苏联世界的其他国家一样，格鲁吉亚所面临的不幸悖论是：只为一己私利的亲西方言论经常为了迎合新的专制统治而牺牲民主价值观。

column1: When the West actively supports popular revolutions, as in Georgia and Ukraine, the newly established power relies on democratic slogans, not democratic behavior.
column2: 西方积极支持格鲁吉亚和乌克兰的民众革命，但革命所建立的政权依托的却是民主口号，而不是民主行动。

column1: Shevardnadze, too, was initially viewed as a symbol of post-Soviet Georgian democracy.
column2: 谢瓦尔德纳泽一度也曾被看作后苏联时代格鲁吉亚民主的象征。

column1: As a government minister in 1993, however, I was already hearing CIA officials express concern that a “Mafia state” was being created instead.
column2: 但在1993年任政府部长时，我已经听到中央情报局官员对格鲁吉亚沦为“黑手党国家”的可能性深表忧虑。

column1: First with Shevarnadze, and now with Saakashvili, popular disillusionment reflects not rejection of democracy, but frustration with its continuing absence.
column2: 以前是谢瓦尔德纳泽，现在是萨卡什维利，格鲁吉亚民众的觉醒并不代表拒绝民主，而恰恰是民主的长期缺位使他们感到心灰意冷。

column1: Saakashvili is evidently mesmerized by the US, and the West in general, but what is the point if there is no independent and democratic political process in Georgia today?
column2: 萨卡什维利显然对美国和西方世界有着异乎寻常的迷恋，但如果今天的格鲁吉亚没有独立和民主的政治程序，单纯的迷恋美国又有什么意义？

column1: And why, then, is sustaining close ties to the US so desirable, while refusing to dismiss Russia as a partner is regarded as being an agent of the Kremlin?
column2: 为什么与美国保持密切关系就那么令人期待，而拒绝排斥与俄国的合作就成了克里姆林的代言人？

column1: Is the US, in contrast to Russia, by definition honest, innocent, and high-minded?
column2: 是不是与俄国相比，美国就一定诚实、纯洁、高尚？

column1: There should be no place for such unfortunate double standards.
column2: 绝不能容许这种双重标准的存在。

column1: Regardless of what the Saakashvili government claims about his opponents, our political orientation is not pro-Russian, but pro-Georgian.
column2: 无论萨卡什维利政府对反对派人士作何评价，我们的政治倾向不是亲俄，而是亲格鲁吉亚。

column1: We believe that Georgia should pursue its own interests, which it may share with Europe, Russia, or the US, but which are nonetheless our own.
column2: 我们相信格鲁吉亚应该勇敢追求自身的利益，这些利益也许与欧洲、俄国或美国所共有，但即便如此仍要坚持从我们自身出发。

column1: We have no interest in merely executing US policy, or in basing Georgia’s foreign and domestic policy solely on distancing the country from Russia, as Saakashvili has done.
column2: 我们对单纯执行美国的政策不感兴趣，也不愿像萨卡什维利那样，把疏远俄国作为格鲁吉亚的外交和内政的基础。

column1: Thus, pro-Georgian politics should not countenance nationalism.
column2: 因此，亲格鲁吉亚政治不应支持民族主义。

column1: Nowadays, some of our politicians have embraced the slogan “Georgia for Georgians.”
column2: 今天，我们有些政治家笃信“格鲁吉亚人的格鲁吉亚”的口号。

column1: But nationalism suggests the lack of a coherent conception of Georgia’s interests.
column2: 但民族主义者显然对格鲁吉亚的利益缺乏深入的了解。

column1: Georgia’s tradition as a multinational, tolerant state, which has been weakened in the last 15 years, must be reinvigorated, because we have no need for enemies against which to define ourselves.
column2: 过去15年来，格鲁吉亚作为一个多民族、宽容国家的传统遭到了削弱，而现在必须加以恢复，因为我们不需要以树敌的方式来定义自身的存在。

column1: A strong relationship with Russia need not come at the expense of relations with America and the West, and vice versa.
column2: 与俄国建立密切的联系并不一定要损害与美国和西方的交往，反之亦然。

column1: Georgia should be neither pro-Russian nor pro-American.
column2: 格鲁吉亚不应该亲俄、也不应该亲美。

column1: It is a small, poor country that desperately needs stability and economic development.
column2: 它是一个贫困的小国，迫切需要的是稳定和经济发展。

column1: Its model should not be Palestine and permanent battle, but Switzerland and permanent prosperity.
column2: 我们的榜样不应该是巴勒斯坦的永久战争，而应该是瑞士的持久繁荣与和平。

column1: Whose War on Terror?
column2: 谁的反恐战争？

column1: “We are all Americans,” wrote Le Monde on September 12, 2001.
column2: 2001年9月12日法国世界报写到 ： “ 我们都成了美国人 ” 。

column1: And so it was with most people in the Muslim world, who were as appalled as anyone else at the carnage of the terrorist attacks on Washington and New York.
column2: 大多数穆斯林世界的人也是如此，他们也和其他人一样对在华盛顿和纽约的恐怖主义大屠杀袭击感到震惊。

column1: Indeed, when America responded to the attacks, almost no one mourned the fall of the Taliban, who were universally condemned for their fanaticism.
column2: 确实，当美国对袭击做出反应之时，几乎没有人哀悼塔利班的垮台。 塔利班的狂热主义受到全世界的谴责。

column1: This unanimity of opinion no longer exists.
column2: 这种一致观点已经不复存在了。

column1: In the five years since the attacks, two audiences for the so-called “war on terror” have emerged.
column2: 袭击发生后的五年时间里，出现了两种所谓的“反恐战争”观众。

column1: Indeed, as the “war” progressed, the audience closest to the action began to see the emerging combat in a way that was diametrically opposed to that of the United States and the West.
column2: 确实，当“战争”进行之际，最为接近战场的观众开始以一种完全反对美国和西方的眼光看待正在呈现的战斗。

column1: To the US administration, every act in the drama of the war on terror was seen as discrete and self-contained: Afghanistan, Iraq, Palestine, and Hezbollah in Lebanon.
column2: 对于美国当局而言，他们视发生在阿富汗、伊拉克、巴勒斯坦以及黎巴嫩的真主党的反恐战争的每个行动都是互不相关、各成一体的。

column1: The Bush administration, having proclaimed a war on terror, invaded and occupied countries, and yet failed to see that these events were being linked in the eyes of people in the region.
column2: 布什政府向恐怖主义宣战，入侵并占领了不同的国家，但是却没有看到，中东地区的人民把这些事件连接了起来。

column1: Glued to Al Jazeera and other Arab satellite channels, the various battles of the “war on terror” came to be viewed as a single chain of events in a grand plot against Islam.
column2: 他们目不转眼睛地观看半岛电视台和其他阿拉伯卫星频道，并把“反恐战争”中的各场战役视为针对伊斯兰惊天大阴谋中的系列事件。

column1: Worse yet, America waved the banner of democracy as it prosecuted its wars.
column2: 更为糟糕的是，美国在开战之时摇晃民主的旗帜。

column1: But hopes for democracy, be it secular or Islamist, for the people concerned have been buried in the rubble and carnage of Baghdad, Beirut, and Kandahar.
column2: 但是对于民主的希望，无论是世俗的还是伊斯兰式的，对于相关的国家人民而言都被埋葬在了巴格达、贝鲁特和坎大哈的瓦砾和屠杀之中。

column1: Many Muslims understand – as well as anyone in the West, and in the same terms – the underlying causes of the alienation that animates Islamic radicalism and violence.
column2: 正如西方人士一样，许多穆斯林都理解促发伊斯兰极端主义和暴力的分离的根本原因。

column1: They know that the rigid dictatorships of the region have paralyzed their populations.
column2: 他们知道该地区严酷的独裁统治让人民苦不堪言。

column1: Only those consumed by the fires of their rage seem able to melt the shackles of these authoritarian societies.
column2: 只有那些怒火中烧的人才看起来能够熔化这些专制社会的枷锁。

column1: But the price of escape is a kind of deformation.
column2: 但是，逃避的代价是某种畸形。

column1: Embittered, fanatical, vengeful: those who rebel against the status quo enter the wider world seeking retaliation, not just against the regimes that deformed them, but against the West, which propped up the region’s authoritarians in the interest of “stability.”
column2: 那些反抗现状的人愤怒、狂热而且充满复仇心理。 他们进入更为广大的世界去寻求复仇，不仅仅是针对让他们畸形的政权，而且是为了“稳定”的利益而支持该地区独裁政权的西方世界。

column1: Many Muslims also understand that the problem of Palestine, unsolved for three generations, goes beyond the suffering of the Palestinian people.
column2: 许多穆斯林还理解，历经三代人依然没有解决的巴勒斯坦问题范围要超出巴勒斯坦人民的苦难。

column1: They know that the region’s dictators have used Palestine to justify their misrule and to avoid political and economic liberalization.
column2: 他们知道该地区的独裁者利用巴勒斯坦来为他们的恶劣治理提供理由并且避免政治和经济自由化。

column1: So when America called for democracy, the hearts of many in the region soared with the hope that reform would come at last.
column2: 所以，当美国呼吁民主之时，该地区许多人心情高涨，希望改革终于来临。

column1: But America, as so many times before, let them down.
column2: 但是，正如以往许多次那样，美国让他们失望。

column1: As people at last began to hope for more liberal and decent societies, the US continued to endorse the regimes that were repressing them.
column2: 当人民最终开始希望自由和体面的社会时，美国继续支持压迫他们的政权。

column1: America simply could not adhere to its own democracy-promotion script.
column2: 美国根本无法遵守其自身促进民主的说辞。

column1: After the ouster of the Taliban in Afghanistan, the US turned its sights on the secular dictatorship of Saddam Hussein’s Iraq.
column2: 阿富汗塔利班倒台后，美国把目光转向萨达姆侯赛因在伊拉克的世俗专制统治。

column1: Instead of encouraging reform of the Saudi/Wahhabi regime – the system that spawned 15 of the 19 hijackers in the 9/11 attacks – the average Muslim saw America as waging war on a regime that had nothing to do with that crime.
column2: 沙特瓦哈比政权体制产生了9/11袭击中19名劫机犯中的15人。 美国并没有鼓励该政权的改革，普通穆斯林民众认为美国在向一个与9/11犯罪毫无牵连的政权发动战争。

column1: Many Muslims acquiesced in this deviation, viewing the invasion of Iraq as part of the passing of dictatorship and the coming of democracy.
column2: 许多穆斯林默许了这一偏离，他们认为入侵伊拉克是结束专制、迎来民主的一部分。

column1: But the bloodstained shambles of the US occupation led America to abandon the quest for democracy.
column2: 但是，美国占领血迹斑斑，促使美国放弃对民主的追求。

column1: The deeper America sank into the Iraqi quagmire, the more the US began to turn a blind eye to the region’s surviving dictators, particularly those in Saudi Arabia, Syria, Egypt, and Pakistan.
column2: 美国陷入伊拉克的泥潭越深，美国就越开始对该地区的独裁者视而不见，特别是沙特、叙利亚、埃及以及巴基斯坦。

column1: Indeed, the last thing the region’s dictators wanted to see was a democratic Iraq.
column2: 确实，该地区独裁者最不愿意见到的就是一个民主的伊拉克。

column1: Almost from the moment of Saddam’s fall, Saudi/Wahhabi jihadis poured into Iraq almost unimpeded.
column2: 几乎是从萨达姆倒台一开始，沙特瓦哈比圣战份子就毫无阻拦地涌入伊拉克。

column1: Worse yet, the Muslims who supported the project to democratize Iraq widely suspect that the Sunni resistance that incited the Iraqi civil war has been financed by Saudi oil money. (Terrorism also kept Iraqi oil from becoming a serious challenger to Saudi Arabia.)
column2: 更为糟糕的是，支持民主化伊拉克的穆斯林广泛怀疑煽动伊拉克内战的逊尼派抵抗力量是由沙特的石油金钱资助的(恐怖主义还阻止伊拉克石油成为沙特阿拉伯的严重挑战 ) 。

column1: So the effort to democratize Iraq – indeed, the entire American project to democratize the region – has fallen under deep suspicion by even the most moderate of Muslims.
column2: 因此民主化伊拉克、或曰美国民主化中东地区的工作受到了即使是大多数穆斯林温和派的深刻怀疑。

column1: America, they believe, only wants a democracy that suits its interests.
column2: 他们相信，美国只是想要符合其利益的民主国家。

column1: If Palestinians freely vote for Hamas, their choice is actively opposed.
column2: 如果巴勒斯坦人自由地选举哈马斯，那么，他们的选择就会遭到积极的反对。

column1: Lebanon’s “Cedar Revolution,” which galvanized the West in the same way as Ukraine’s Orange Revolution, has been systematically undermined.
column2: 黎巴嫩的“雪松革命”就像乌克兰的橙色革命一样令西方振奋，但是却受到了系统化的破坏。

column1: With democracy in most of the region still a long way off – indeed, perhaps a more distant prospect now than five years ago – US Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice repeats her mantra that the dead civilians of Beirut, Sidon, Tyre, and Gaza represent the “birth pangs” of a new Middle East.
column2: 中东地区的民主依然遥不可期，与五年前相比，其前景更为遥远。 美国国务卿莱斯重复其祷文，即贝鲁特、西顿、提尔以及加沙的平民死亡代表的是新的中东分娩时的阵痛。

column1: But until the West stops regarding dead babies as political props, we cannot understand how the Muslim world perceives all that has happened since September 11, 2001.
column2: 但是，直到��方停止把死婴看作政治道具之前，我们无法理解穆斯林世界如何看待2001年9月11日以来所发生的事件。

column1: Only then will we understand why the unified view of five years ago has fractured so violently.
column2: 只有那时，我们才会理解为什么五年前的一致观点已经土崩瓦解。

column1: Whose World Bank?
column2: 谁的世界银行？

column1: NEW YORK – US President Barack Obama’s nomination of Jim Yong Kim for the presidency of the World Bank has been well received – and rightly so, especially given some of the other names that were bandied about.
column2: 纽约—美国总统奥巴马提名金辰勇为世界银行行长之举受到了广泛好评 — — 理应如此，特别是其他提名也已昭告天下之时。

column1: In Kim, a public-health professor who is now President of Dartmouth College and previously led the World Health Organization’s HIV/AIDS department, the United States has put forward a good candidate.
column2: 金辰勇是公共卫生专家，现任达特茅斯大学校长，此前曾担任过世界卫生组织艾滋病部门。 这是一个相当好的候选人。

column1: But the candidate’s nationality, and the nominating country – whether small and poor or large and rich – should play no role in determining who gets the job.
column2: 但候选人的国籍以及提名国 — — 不管是大是小、是穷是富 — — 不应该在人选决定中起到任何作用。

column1: The World Bank’s 11 executive directors from emerging and developing countries have put forward two excellent candidates, Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala of Nigeria and Jose Antonio Ocampo of Colombia.
column2: 世界银行的11名新兴和发展中国家执行董事已经提出了两位优秀的候选人：尼日利亚的奥孔乔-伊韦拉和哥伦比亚的奥坎波。

column1: I have worked closely with both of them.
column2: 我和这两人都有过共事。

column1: Both are first-rate, have served as ministers with multiple portfolios, have performed admirably in top positions in multilateral organizations, and have the diplomatic skills and professional competence to do an outstanding job.
column2: 两人都是第一流的人才，在多个部门担任过部长，在多边组织担任过要职且取得过令人称道的表现，也拥有出色胜任所需要的外交技能和职业素养。

column1: They understand finance and economics, the bread and butter of the World Bank, and have a network of connections to leverage the Bank’s effectiveness.
column2: 他们懂金融和经济、明了世界银行的基本结构，也拥有能改善世行效率所需要的人脉。

column1: Okonjo-Iweala brings an insider’s knowledge of the institution.
column2: 奥孔乔-伊韦拉很了解世界银行的内幕。

column1: Ocampo, like Kim, brings the advantages and disadvantages of being an outsider; but Ocampo, a distinguished professor at Columbia University, is thoroughly acquainted with the World Bank.
column2: 奥坎波和金辰勇都是外部人士，这有利也有弊；但奥坎波作为哥伦比亚大学的杰出教授对世界银行是相当熟悉的。

column1: He previously served not only as minister of economics and finance, but also of agriculture – a critically important qualification, given that the vast majority of the developing countries’ poor depend on farming.
column2: 他以前不但是经济和财政部长，也当过农业部长 — — 考虑到发展中国家的大部分穷人都得依靠务农生活，这是相当重要的资历。

column1: He also brings impressive environmental credentials, addressing another of the Bank's central concerns.
column2: 他在环境方面也有令人印象深刻的经历，这契合世行的另一大关键职责。

column1: Both Okonjo-Iweala and Ocampo understand the role of international financial institutions in providing global public goods.
column2: 奥孔乔-伊韦拉和奥坎波都明白国际金融机构在全球公共品供给方面的重要作用。

column1: Throughout their careers, their hearts and minds have been devoted to development, and to fulfilling the World Bank’s mission of eliminating poverty.
column2: 在两人的职业生涯中，大量心血都奉献给了发展和完成世行消除贫困的任务。

column1: They have set a high bar for any American candidate.
column2: 对于任何美国候选人，他们都是相当高的标杆。

column1: Much is at stake.
column2: 需要考虑的方面很多。

column1: Almost two billion people remain in poverty in the developing world, and, while the World Bank cannot solve the problem on its own, it plays a leading role.
column2: 发展中国家仍有20亿人口生活在贫困之中，世界银行不可能单枪匹马解决这个问题，但需要担起领导之责。

column1: Despite its name, the Bank is primarily an international development institution.
column2: 世界银行虽然挂着一个“银行”的名字，但其主要职责是国际发展机构。

column1: Kim’s specialty, public health, is critical, and the Bank has long supported innovative initiatives in this field.
column2: 金辰勇的专长 — — 公共卫生 — — 相当关键，世行产期以来也一直支持着该领域的创新活动。

column1: But health is only a small part of the Bank’s “portfolio,” and it typically works in this area with partners who bring to the table expertise in medicine.
column2: 但卫生在世行的“组合”中只是一个次要部分，而且通常只是配合其他在医药领域领先的专业伙伴。

column1: Rumors suggest that the US is likely to insist on maintaining the perverse selection process in which it gets to pick the World Bank’s president, simply because, in this election year, Obama’s opponents would trumpet loss of control over the choice as a sign of weakness.
column2: 各路消息表明，美国可能会坚持要求有悖常理的选人程序，坚持世行行长人选由它确定，这样做的唯一原因是2012是选举年，奥巴马的对手会将美国人不能问鼎世行行长宝座夸大为奥巴马示弱的表现。

column1: And it is more important for the US to retain that control than it is for emerging and developing countries to obtain it.
column2: 此外，保持对该职位的控制之于美国要比获得该职位之于新兴和发展中国家更重要。

column1: Indeed, the more powerful of the emerging markets know how to live within the current system, and they may use it to their advantage.
column2: 事实上，新兴市场中实力较强者知道如何在现有体系中生存，并能利用现有体系。

column1: They will, in effect, obtain an IOU, to be cashed in for something that is more important.
column2: 它们可以获得一张白条，用之换取更加重要的东西。

column1: The Realpolitik of the moment makes fighting over the presidency unlikely; America may well prevail.
column2: 眼下，现实政治已使得行长人选指正毫无悬念，美国人将最终获选。

column1: But at what cost?
column2: 问题是代价多大。

column1: Should America continue to insist on controlling the selection process, it is the Bank itself that would suffer.
column2: 如果美国坚持死握行长选择过程控制权不放，那么受害的将是世行自身。

column1: For years, the Bank’s effectiveness was compromised because it was seen, in part, as a tool of Western governments and their countries’ financial and corporate sectors.
column2: 多年来，世界银行的效益一直受着牵累，因为它在一定程度上被视为是西方政府及其金融和公司部门的工具。

column1: Ironically, even America’s long-term interests would be best served by a commitment – not just in words, but also in deeds – to a merit-based system and good governance.
column2: 讽刺的是，就算是从美国的长期利益出发，最优选择也是作出唯才是举、改善治理的承诺 — — 不仅仅是口头承诺，还要见诸实践。

column1: One supposed achievement of the G-20 was an agreement to reform the governance of the international financial institutions – most importantly, how their leaders are selected.
column2: G20的一个预期成果是达成关于国际金融机构治理改革的协议，其中最重要的部分就是领导人的选择。

column1: Since expertise on development by and large lies within the emerging and developing countries – after all, they live development – it seems natural that the World Bank’s head would come from one of those countries.
column2: 如今，发展专家大体上都来自新兴和发展中国家 — — 毕竟，这些国家生活在发展中 — — 因此，世界银行行长应该出自这些国家中的一个似乎是理所当然的。

column1: To maintain a cabal among developed countries, whereby the US appoints the World Bank president and Europe picks the International Monetary Fund’s head, seems particularly anachronistic and perplexing today, when the Bank and the Fund are turning to emerging-market countries as a source of funds.
column2: 维持发达国家的小算盘 — — 美国人把持世界银行、欧洲人把持IMF — — 在今天看来早已落后与时代，实在令人难以理解，因为世界银行和IMF正在日益依靠新兴市场作为资金来源。

column1: While the US, the international community, and the Bank itself repeatedly emphasize the importance of good governance, a selection procedure that de facto leaves the appointment to the US president makes a mockery of it.
column2: 美国、国际社会和世界银行自身一再强调改善治理的重要性，但行长任命权实际归属美国总统这一事实让这一切看上去颇为可笑。

column1: Okonjo-Iweala put the matter forcefully in an interview with the Financial Times: what is at stake is a matter of hypocrisy.
column2: 奥孔乔-伊韦拉在接受《金融时报》采访时强有力地批评了这一问题：一切充满了伪善。

column1: The integrity of the advanced industrial countries, which have a majority of the votes at the World Bank, is being put to the test.
column2: 发达工业国 — — 它们在世界银行投票中占据着多数 — — 的团结度正在接受考验。

column1: Who Should Be Helped First?
column2: 谁应当首先得到帮助？

column1: The list of urgent challenges facing humanity is depressingly long.
column2: 人类面临的急迫挑战数不胜数。

column1: AIDS, hunger, armed conflict, and global warming compete for attention alongside government failure, malaria, and the latest natural disaster.
column2: 艾滋病、饥荒、武装冲突以及全球气候变暖等问题与政府无能、霍乱以及新近的自然灾害等一道在争取人们的注意力。

column1: While our compassion is great, our resources are limited.
column2: 尽管我们富有同情心，但是资源有限。

column1: So who should be helped first?
column2: 那么，谁应当首先得到帮助呢？

column1: To some, making such priorities seems obscene.
column2: 对于某些人来说，作出这样的优先顺序看起来是可憎的。

column1: But the United Nations and national governments spend billions of dollars each year trying to help those in need without explicitly considering whether they are achieving the most that they can.
column2: 但是，联合国和各国政府每年开支数以几十亿美元试图帮助那些需要帮助的人们，却不明确考虑它们是否最大程度地实现了其所能实现的目标。

column1: The western media focuses on a tsunami in Asia; donations flow freely.
column2: 西方媒体关注于亚洲的海啸；捐助源源而来。

column1: An earthquake that devastates Pakistan garners fewer headlines, so the developed world gives a lot less.
column2: 一场摧毁巴基斯坦的地震并没有得到头条新闻报道，结果发达国家援助大为减少。

column1: There is a better way.
column2: 我们可以有一个更好的办法。

column1: We could prioritize our spending to achieve the greatest benefit for our money.
column2: 我们可以对我们的开支分清轻重缓急来达到最大效益。

column1: This month, I will ask UN ambassadors how they would spend $50 billion to reduce suffering.
column2: 本月，我将询问驻联合国的大使们如何花费500亿美元来减少人类的痛苦。

column1: They will repeat the same exercise that some of the world’s best economists tackled in a 2004 project called the “Copenhagen Consensus”: weighing up solutions to the great challenges facing the world, and deciding what should be done first.
column2: 他们将会重复当今某些最好的经济学家在2004年的一个被称为“哥本哈根共识”项目所作出的答案，那就是对世界面临的重大挑战作出评估，然后决定哪些事情应当优先处理。

column1: But the question shouldn’t be left to politicians or Nobel laureates alone.
column2: 但是，这个问题不应当仅仅交给政客或者诺贝尔奖得主们解决。

column1: We must all engage in the debate.
column2: 我们都应当参与到辩论中来。

column1: One hopes that this task has been made slightly simpler by the publication of a book in which the Copenhagen Consensus economists boil down their insights.
column2: 哥本哈根共识经济学家们将他们的高见发表在一本专著之中，人们因此希望这一任务稍许变得简单一些。

column1: Here’s one fact to consider: the entire death toll from the Southeast Asian tsunami is matched each month by the number of worldwide casualties of HIV/AIDS.
column2: 我们要考虑这样一个事实：全球每个月死于艾滋病的人数与东南亚国家海啸造成的整个死亡人数旗鼓相当。

column1: A comprehensive prevention program providing free or cheap condoms and information about safe sex to the regions worst affected by HIV/AIDS would cost $27 billion and save more than 28 million lives.
column2: 一项完整的、向艾滋病影响最大的地区提供免费或者廉价避孕套和有关安全性行为信息的预防性项目可能花费270亿美元并且挽救2800万生命。

column1: This, say the economists who took part in the Copenhagen Consensus, makes it the single best investment that the world could possibly make.
column2: 参与哥本哈根共识的经济学家们说，这是世界所可以作出的最佳投资。

column1: The social benefits would outweigh the costs by 40 to one.
column2: 社会效益超出费用40倍。

column1: Other options that the economists favored spending some of their $50 billion include providing micro-nutrients to the world’s hungry, establishing free trade, and battling malaria with mosquito nets and medication.
column2: 经济学家们倾向于花费部分500亿美元的其他选项还包括为世界饥饿人口提供微观营养、建立自由贸易以及使用蚊帐和药物与霍乱作斗争。

column1: At the other end of the scale, responses to climate change like the Kyoto Protocol would cost more than they would achieve, so the economists crossed them off the list of things to do right now.
column2: 最后，类似京都议定书等对气候变化的对应措施得不偿失，所有经济学家们将它从优先清单中划掉。

column1: Regardless of whether we agree with the economists, everybody must admit that we cannot do everything at once.
column2: 无论我们是否同意经济学家所言，每个人都必须承认，我们无法面面俱到。

column1: Discussing our priorities is crucial.
column2: 讨论我们的优先项目很关键。

column1: Often, politicians avoid prioritization.
column2: 政客们经常回避轻重缓急。

column1: Why?
column2: 这是为什么呢？

column1: The glib answer is because it is hard.
column2: 圆滑的解释是做起来很难。

column1: There are many interested parties.
column2: 有许多利益相关方。

column1: No group wants their solution to come last, and no government wants its country’s national challenges to be overlooked.
column2: 没有任何一个团体愿意让它们的方案排在最后，而且没有任何一个国家政府愿意让它们国家的挑战受到忽略。

column1: The UN conference won’t be easy.
column2: 联合国会议不会轻而易举。

column1: But it shows that there is a will to put prioritization squarely at the center of attention.
column2: 但是这表明，还是有意愿最大程度地关心轻重缓急的问题。

column1: It will produce a “to do” list that will demonstrate how to achieve the most that we can for humanity, which could lead, in turn, to more transparent decision-making.
column2: 这将会产生一份待办事项清单。 这份清单将显示我们所能为人类做的最大最好的事情，而这样就会反过来导致更多透明化的决策。

column1: The principles of economics provide a sound basis on which to make rational choices.
column2: 经济学原则为作出理性选择提供了坚实的基础。

column1: Now, the discussion needs to shift from the academic sphere to political life.
column2: 现在，讨论应当从学术领域转移到政治生活。

column1: It’s time for all of us to consider and compare our own priority lists.
column2: 现在已经是让我们考虑并比较我们自己的优先事项的时候了。

column1: We must endeavor to shorten the list of challenges facing humanity.
column2: 我们必须努力缩短人类面临的挑战的清单。

column1: But that requires all of us to engage in a debate about what we need to do first.
column2: 但是，这要求我们参加到有关哪些事情应当优先处理的辩论中来。

column1: Who Should Lead the IMF?
column2: 谁该领导IMF？

column1: BERKELEY – The International Monetary Fund, many say, has had a good crisis.
column2: 伯克利 — — 许多人说，国际货币基金组织（ IMF ）也曾遭遇过一场危机。

column1: As recently as three years ago, many observers thought that the Fund had outlived its usefulness and should be closed down.
column2: 仅仅在三年前，颇有一些观察家认为，它已经失去作用，可以关门大吉了。

column1: Since then, it has intervened in Hungary, Latvia, Iceland, and Ukraine, among other crisis-stricken countries – and has received a massive infusion of new resources.
column2: 但是后来，它先后介入了匈牙利、拉脱维亚、冰岛和乌克兰以及其他一些爆发危机的国家，并得到了新一轮大规模注资。

column1: Part of the explanation for the higher esteem in which the IMF is now held is its recent display of intellectual flexibility – a rare virtue for a big, lumbering bureaucracy.
column2: 为什么 IMF 眼下如此炙手可热？ 部分的解释是它近来显示出一种变通精神 — — 对于一个庞大的官僚机构来说，这是一种难得的美德。

column1: It has rethought its traditional opposition to capital controls.
column2: 它反思了传统上一贯秉持的反资本管制立场。

column1: It has suggested that central banks may want to consider higher inflation targets in order to avoid hitting the zero bound in the event of deflationary shocks. For this, it drew a stern reproach from Germany’s Bundesbank – a clear sign that it is doing something right.
column2: 它建议各国央行考虑调高通胀目标，以免在通缩冲击下，降息时过快触及零利率底线，由此，它遭到了来自德国央行的强烈反对，而这恰恰说明它的主张是正确的。

column1: The IMF has also put in place a Flexible Credit Line to disburse funds quickly – and free of onerous conditions – to countries buffeted by financial crosswinds through no fault of their own.
column2: IMF 还推出了“灵活信贷额度 ” （ FCL ）以便快速划拨资金，资助那些在金融风暴中无辜受难的国家，而且不带附加条件。

column1: The problem is that, despite its alluring name, the new facility has had few takers, and no Asian takers in particular.
column2: 不过，尽管这个新工具的名字听上去很有吸引力，但是目前接受者寥寥，尤其是没有亚洲国家提出申请。

column1: Indeed, it is revealing that when South Korea was desperate for dollars following the failure of Lehman Brothers, it borrowed from the United States Federal Reserve, not from the Fund.
column2: 在雷曼兄弟倒闭后那一段时间，韩国极度需要美元，但它跑去向美联储借款，而没有向 IMF 求助，这很能说明问题。

column1: After their experience in 1997-1998, Korean policymakers would sooner jump off a cliff than borrow, even without conditions, from the IMF.
column2: 自从有了 1997~1998 年的不快经验以后，韩国政府宁可从悬崖上跳下去，也不愿向 IMF 借钱，哪怕不附带任何条件。

column1: Nevertheless, while not all is sweetness and light, there has been progress.
column2: 尽管有这些小插曲， IMF 还是取得了长足的进步。

column1: And for this the IMF’s strong, politically astute management – not exactly something from which the Fund has regularly benefited in recent years – deserves credit.
column2: 它那强有力的、政治上不乏精明的管理层理应得到好评 — — 这样的管理层近年来并不多见。

column1: Now, however, the rumor mill is heating up with gossip that the Fund’s managing director, Dominique Strauss-Kahn, will leave in order to oppose Nikolas Sarkozy in the 2012 French presidential elections.
column2: 然而，眼下正有传言，说 IMF 总裁多米尼克·施特劳斯 — 卡恩打算卸任，参加 2012 年法国总统大选，跟萨尔科齐一角高低。

column1: Sarkozy’s popularity is hitting new lows, and Strauss-Kahn’s friends say that he has never made a secret of his political ambitions.
column2: 萨尔科齐的支持率屡创新低。 施特劳斯 — 卡恩的朋友则说，他从不隐瞒自己从政的抱负。

column1: A lame-duck managing director would hamstring the Fund.
column2: 如果卡恩真的去意已定，成了“跛鸭”总裁，那会削弱 IMF 的影响力。

column1: Already there is a sense that the IMF is reluctant to tell Europe more forcefully how to handle its problem with Greece because the managing director must be careful to avoid meddling in Europe’s internal politics.
column2: 已经有人在揣测，说 IMF 之所以不愿更高调地介入希腊危机，就是因为总裁必须小心翼翼地避免卷入欧洲内部的政治纠葛。

column1: On top of this now comes the interesting news that the IMF has appointed Zhu Min, previously a deputy governor of the People’s Bank of China, as special adviser to Strauss-Kahn.
column2: 在这种背景下，最近又传出新闻，说 IMF 任命中国人民银行副行长朱民为总裁特别顾问。

column1: Zhu will thus be part of the core management team.
column2: 朱民成为 IMF 核心管理团队的一员。

column1: This, in turn, has fueled speculation that Zhu will be a candidate to become the next managing director.
column2: 这引得外界纷纷猜测，朱民将成为 IMF 下一总裁的一个人选。

column1: It is the turn of someone from outside Europe to head the IMF – Europe having had a monopoly on the position since the Fund was created following World War II.
column2: 有人说，是时候让欧洲之外的人士来坐这个位子了。 自第二次世界大战后 IMF 成立以来，欧洲人就垄断了 IMF 总裁这一职位。

column1: The bargain then was that the US could pick the president of the World Bank while the Europeans would get the top slot at the IMF (US policymakers in their wisdom believing that the Bank would become the more important institution).
column2: 当时欧美达成了一个默契，美国人当世界银行行长，欧洲人当 IMF 总裁（当年美国的决策者自以为是地认为世界银行会成为两者之中更重要的国际组织 ） 。

column1: But today’s world is more multi-polar. It is no longer dominated by the Atlantic economies, so those economies should no longer dictate who holds the top jobs at the two Bretton Woods institutions.
column2: 但当今世界已是个多极化的世界，它再也不是大西洋两岸的经济体所主导的那个世界了，因此，这些经济体也不应该继续垄断布雷顿森林体系里最重要的两个机构的领导职位。

column1: It is now, the argument goes, another region’s turn.
column2: 有人由此推论说，应该轮到其他地区来分享权力了。

column1: The obvious choice is Asia, home to the most dynamic emerging markets.
column2: 亚洲当是首选，因为世界上最有活力的几大新兴市场经济体都位于这片大陆。

column1: It is the region to which the world’s economic center of gravity is shifting.
column2: 世界经济的重心正在向这一地区移动。

column1: If you ask Asian leaders what would make them consider again approaching the Fund after their traumatic experience with IMF “assistance” in 1997-1998, they will answer: an Asian managing director.
column2: 如果你问亚洲各国领导人，在��了 1997~1998 年 IMF “援助”的“创伤记忆”之后，怎么才能让他们再次考虑向 IMF 求助，他们会回答：除非 IMF 有个亚洲人当总裁。

column1: In fact, this is precisely the wrong way to think about the problem.
column2: 可实际上，这种思考方式恰恰是错的。

column1: The IMF’s problem in the past has been parochialism and lack of accountability.
column2: IMF 过去的问题是狭隘和不负责任。

column1: The best way to ensure that the Fund remains open to new ideas is by selecting the person with the best ideas to lead it.
column2: 要确保改革后的 IMF 保持开放心态，容纳新思想，最好的办法是选择最有头脑的人去领导它。

column1: The best way to ensure that the IMF’s management is accountable to all of its governmental shareholders is to prevent the top job from becoming the sinecure of any region, whether Europe or Asia.
column2: 要让它保持对各方负责的态度，最好的办法也是不要让总裁职位成为 任何 地区的禁脔，不论是欧洲还是亚洲。

column1: The next managing director should be selected on the merits, not on the basis of nationality.
column2: 下一任 IMF 总裁的推选标准应当是能力，而不是国籍。

column1: There should be an open competition, in which the best candidate wins on the basis of his or her ideas.
column2: 应当允许公开竞争，让提出最好理念的最佳候选人胜出。

column1: Asia has plenty of competent economic officials who might be considered as the next managing director of the IMF. But just because they are Asian is not reason enough to select them.
column2: 亚洲有很多能力很强的经济官员，都值得考虑作为下任 IMF 总裁的人选。 但如果要选择他们中的任何一个人，都不应仅仅因为他 / 她是亚洲人。

column1: Prepping Gay Men for PrEP
column2: 让男同性恋了解PrEP

column1: LONDON – In October, two groups researching the effectiveness of a potential breakthrough drug in the fight against HIV did something unusual.
column2: 伦敦 — — 10月，在抗击艾滋病工作中研究某种潜在突破性药物的两个小组取得了非同寻常的突破。

column1: They announced that the therapy they were testing, an antiretroviral drug called Truvada, had proved effective enough to end the randomized phases of the trials, and that they were offering the pill to all of the studies’ participants.
column2: 他们宣布已证实测试对象抗逆转录药物“特鲁瓦达”的效果足以通过随机阶段试验，他们目前正将此药品提供给所有的试验参与者。

column1: The researchers found that gay men who take Truvada, in addition to using condoms when they have sex, were significantly less likely to contract HIV.
column2: 研究人员发现服用特鲁瓦达的男同性恋若能在性行为中配合使用避孕套，将大幅降低感染艾滋病毒的风险。

column1: This is further evidence of the effectiveness of pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP), a technique by which people who are HIV-negative use antiretroviral drugs to protect themselves from infection.
column2: 这进一步证实了接触前预防（PrEP）技术的有效性，该技术旨在让艾滋病毒测试阴性者利用抗逆转录病毒药物保护自己远离感染威胁。

column1: In 2011, a trial funded by the Gates Foundation found that straight couples using Truvada reduced the risk of transmitting HIV by 73%.
column2: 2011年，由盖茨基金会资助的一项试验发现服用特鲁瓦达的异性恋夫妇感染艾滋病毒的风险降低了73 % 。

column1: Those fighting to prevent the spread of HIV/AIDS thus have a new tool in their arsenal.
column2: 为防止艾滋病毒/艾滋病传播而奋斗的人终于有了新工具来充实自己的武器库。

column1: The question now is how best to deliver it to those who need it most: gay men in developing countries.
column2: 现在的问题是如何才能更好地交给那些最需要的人：生活在发展中国家的男同性恋。

column1: This summer, the World Health Organization took an important step to that end, recommending PrEP for all gay men and men who have sex with men, making it the first major international health organization to do so.
column2: 今年夏天，世卫组织为实现这一目标迈出了重要的一步，向所有男同性恋及男同性性行为群体推荐PrEP，从而成为首家采取上述措施的重要国际卫生机构。

column1: The WHO estimates that increased use of PrEP could reduce HIV infections by up to 25% over the next decade among men who have sex with men (this category includes anyone with elevated risk, not just those who identify as gay).
column2: 世卫组织预测扩大使用PrEP可以在今后十年男同性性行为群体中减少高达25%的艾滋病毒感染（该群体囊括了所有高风险个体，而不只是已经明确的男同性恋 ） 。

column1: But an important obstacle remains: the legal predicament of gay men in much of the developing world.
column2: 但多数发展中国家男同性恋法律困境等重要障碍依然存在。

column1: In countries like Nigeria, where anti-homosexuality legislation has recently been approved, those following the WHO’s new PrEP guidelines could find themselves subject to imprisonment.
column2: 像尼日利亚这样的国家刚刚批准了反同性恋立法，导致执行世卫组织PrEP新规者可能为此遭受监禁的威胁。

column1: The climate of officially sanctioned homophobia in Nigeria has already set back the fight against AIDS.
column2: 官方认可的尼日利亚恐同氛围已经破坏了抗击艾滋病斗争的成果。

column1: In 2006, a study found that 13% of men who have sex with men in Nigeria were HIV-positive, compared to 4.5% of all Nigerians.
column2: 2006年， 一项研究发现尼日利亚男同性性交群体13%的人艾滋病毒测试呈阳性，而该数据在尼全体民众中仅有4.5 % 。

column1: By 2012, the HIV rate among men who have sex with men had jumped to 17%.
column2: 截止2012年，男同性性交群体中的艾滋病毒感染率已经上升至17 % 。

column1: Meanwhile, an increasing number of men reported encountering homophobia at healthcare centers, making them less likely to seek help.
column2: 此外，报告在医疗中心遭遇同性恋恐惧症的人越来越多，使他们寻求治疗的积极性大打折扣。

column1: The consequences could not be more serious.
column2: 这样的后果严重到了极点。

column1: Two years ago, a young HIV-positive Nigerian man contacted me on Facebook to tell me about his monthly ordeal at the clinic.
column2: 两年前，一位艾滋病毒测试呈阳性的尼日利亚男青年在Facebook上与我联系，向我讲述了他每个月在诊所经受的折磨。

column1: The nurse at the hospital spent more time lecturing him on the evils of homosexuality than telling him about the drugs he was taking and their possible side effects.
column2: 医院的护士长篇大论地向他讲述同性恋的罪恶，而不是向他解释所服的药物和药物可能的副作用。

column1: The man, a third-year medical student, told me that he had decided to stop going to the clinic.
column2: 这位男青年当时是医学院三年级学生，他告诉我他决定不再去诊所接受治疗。

column1: When I asked how he would continue treatment, he said that he had a friend abroad who could get him the drugs.
column2: 我问他他想如何继续接受治疗，他说他在国外有朋友，可能帮他买药。

column1: Less than two years later, I saw a Facebook update announcing his death.
column2: 不到两年后，我看到Facebook上的一条新信息宣布了他的死讯。

column1: My Facebook friend is not the only one who has paid the price for Nigeria’s homophobia.
column2: 我在Facebook上的朋友并不是为尼日利亚恐同氛围付出代价的唯一一个。

column1: A preliminary report from the Solidarity Alliance Nigeria, a coalition of gay, lesbian, bisexual, and transgender (LGBT) organizations, details a huge decrease in the use of HIV services by men who have sex with men in the six months following the enactment of the anti-gay legislation.
column2: 尼日利亚团结联盟是由男女同性恋、双性恋和变性人（LGBT）组织组成的联盟机构，其初步报告详细说明了反同性恋法出台六个月后在男同性性行为群体中使用HIV服务的人大幅减少。

column1: The decrease ranges from 40% in Lagos – Nigeria’s most cosmopolitan city – to 70% in Kano, a predominantly Muslim state.
column2: 具体降幅从尼日利亚最国际化城市拉各斯的40%到以穆斯林为主的卡诺州的70%不等。

column1: Nigerians living with HIV must do more than just fight the infection; they also must brave social stigma, weather discrimination by secular and religious institutions, and now, potentially, face threats from the legal system.
column2: 尼日利亚的艾滋病毒感染者不仅要对抗感染；还必须承受来自社会的羞辱、面对世俗和宗教机构歧视的目光。 现在，他们还有可能面临来自法律系统的威胁。

column1: In this environment, the promise of PrEP begins to dim, as the risks of seeking treatment outweigh the potentially life-saving benefits.
column2: 在这样的环境下， PrEP的前景开始变得暗淡，因为潜在的治疗收益抵不过寻求治疗所带来的风险。

column1: The story is similar in Uganda.
column2: 乌干达的状况也与此相似。

column1: Last spring, as legal persecution of gays there mounted, the government raided an HIV clinic and withheld its operating license for providing care and support to HIV-positive men who have sex with men.
column2: 去年春天，随着对同性恋法律迫害的升级，政府突击检查了一家为男同性性交群体HIV阳性患者提供医疗服务及支持的艾滋病诊所并暂扣了其营业执照。

column1: As an African activist with more than ten years of experience in the fight against HIV, I hope that the WHO will build on its important first step of advising the use of PrEP.
column2: 作为在抗击HIV领域有10余年经验的非洲活动家，我希望世卫组织能在迈出建议使用PrEP这关键一步的基础上更上一层楼。

column1: That means initiating a public conversation with countries like Nigeria, Uganda, Gambia, and Russia on the importance of inclusion in the battle against HIV.
column2: 这意味着就包容对抗击HIV病毒斗争的重要性方面与尼日利亚、乌干达、冈比亚和俄罗斯等国家展开公众对话。

column1: The WHO should make it clear that while it may not be advocating for LGBT political rights, it is determined to ensure that all those who can benefit from PrEP are able to access the necessary drugs, without fear of legal consequences.
column2: 世卫组织应该明确表态虽然它或许并不宣扬男女同性恋、双性恋和变性人（LGBT）的政治权利，但却有决心确保能从PrEP中受益的所有人都能获得必须的药品，而不必担心可能的法律后果。

column1: Researchers, drug companies, and human-rights campaigners must take up the fight to ensure that PrEP is made available – without risk – to those who need it most.
column2: 研究人员、制药公司和人权活动家必须担负起确保 PrEP能够普及的斗争责任 — — 让最需要的群体不冒任何风险就能得到它。

column1: Who’s Who on Putin’s Payroll?
column2: 普京的工资单花名册

column1: MOSCOW – Germany’s ex-Chancellor Gerhard Schroeder is a legend in Russia.
column2: 莫斯科 — — 德国前总理格哈德·施罗德在俄罗斯是个传奇人物。

column1: He serves Gazprom’s interests for a measly couple of million euros a year, sits in at sessions of the Russian Academy of Sciences, and writes books about his staunch friendship with “Genosse Wladimir,” who, in the not-so-distant past, earned himself the well-deserved nickname of “Stasi” among business circles in gangster-ridden St. Petersburg.
column2: 他为挣得区区每年数百万欧元的酬金替俄罗斯天然气公司工作，列席俄罗斯科学院召集的会议，并写书称颂他与“弗拉基米尔同志”之间忠诚的友谊，而后者就在不算太远的过去，还在完全由歹徒控制的圣彼得堡企业界当之无愧地赢得了的“东德秘密警察 ” （ Stasi）的浑名。

column1: But it is not immediately obvious whether it is Schroeder licking Putin’s boots nowadays or vice versa.
column2: 不过现在究竟是施罗德对普京俯首听命还是情况恰恰相反似乎并不清楚。

column1: The two of them are building, or trying to build, the Nord Stream gas pipeline, an exceptionally costly project that satisfies twin strategic objectives.
column2: 这两人正在建设、或者说设法建设服务于双重战略目标的造价极端高昂的北溪（Nord Stream）输气管线。

column1: Demonstratively hostile to the interests of both Belarus and Ukraine, the pipeline is intended to ensure that these countries are under Russia’s energy thumb, regardless of who is in power in Minsk and Kiev.
column2: 这项工程将威胁到白俄罗斯和乌克兰两国的利益，这条管线目的是确保无论明斯克和基辅由谁来当政，这两个国家都完全受制于俄罗斯的能源。

column1: As a bonus, the pipeline will also consolidate the Russian economy’s status as an appendage of Germany’s – its supplier of natural resources.
column2: 附带的好处是这条管线将进一步巩固俄国经济相对于德国的附属地位 — — 俄国是德国自然资源的供应商。

column1: Certain of Schroeder’s predecessors as German chancellor sought to attain the same objective by rather different means.
column2: 在施罗德之前任职的某些德国总理曾试图通过完全不同的手段达到同样的目标。

column1: The Kremlin’s achievements in securing the help of Americans willing to offer their influence are equally impressive.
column2: 克里姆林在争取有影响力的美国人帮助方面也同样成绩斐然。

column1: Indeed, the Obama administration’s Russia policy is being nurtured with advice from people who have no official position in the administration but close business ties to Russia and the Kremlin: Henry Kissinger, James A. Baker, Thomas Graham, and Dimitri Simes.
column2: 事实上，影响奥巴马政府对俄政策的人士很多并未在政府中正式任职，而是与俄国和克里姆林有着千丝万缕的商业关系：亨利·基辛格、詹姆斯·A·贝克、托马斯·格雷厄姆和迪米特里·西门斯。

column1: The first two are major geo-politicians; Graham and Simes are respected as outstanding Russia specialists.
column2: 前两位是著名的地缘政治家，格雷厄姆和西门斯则是作为杰出的俄罗斯专家而倍受尊敬。

column1: They write key reports for the administration, and shuttle between Moscow and Washington, coordinating the parameters of the Obama administration’s effort to “reset” the bilateral relationship.
column2: 他们为政府起草关键报告，在莫斯科和华盛顿之间穿梭往返，对奥巴马政府“重塑”双边关系努力的各项参数进行协调。

column1: Like Schroeder, all these people are not economically disinterested.
column2: 像施罗德一样，这些人在经济利益方面并非没有私心。

column1: Baker is a consultant for the two companies at the commanding heights of the Russian economy, Gazprom and Rosneft.
column2: 贝克在占领俄国经济制高点的俄罗斯天然气公司和俄罗斯石油公司担任顾问。

column1: The Kissinger Associates lobbying group, whose Russian section is headed by Graham, feeds in to the Kissinger-Primakov working group, a quasi-private-sector effort, blessed by Putin, to deepen ties between Russia and the United States.
column2: 而基辛格顾问公司游说团的俄罗斯分部则由格雷厄姆领导，为基辛格－普里马科夫工作组提供服务，这是一股受到普京庇护的准私人力量，以深化俄美两国之间的关系为目标。

column1: It is highly instructive to read the recommendations of these people and groups, as they unobtrusively render the objectives of their Kremlin clients into a language familiar to American leaders.
column2: 阅读上述人士及组织的建议非常发人深省，因为他们谨慎地把克里姆林客户的目标翻译成与美国领导人相似的语言表达。

column1: Graham’s latest contribution, “Resurgent Russia and US Purposes,” is most revealing in this respect.
column2: 格雷厄姆的最新贡献 ， “ 复兴的俄罗斯和美国目标”在这方面最具启迪作用。

column1: The author finds the government of a “Russia getting up off its knees” to consist of progressive modernizers fully aware of the challenges facing their country as it attempts to “return to the great powers club.”
column2: 作者发现“站起来的俄国”政府由进步的改革人士构成，这些人对国家面临的挑战具有清醒的认识，并企图“重返大国俱乐部 ” 。

column1: “In order to become a genuinely developed and modern country,” Graham continues, “in the coming decade Russia will need to invest at least one trillion dollars in modernizing its infrastructure.
column2: “为了成为真正意义上的发达现代化国家 ， ” 格雷厄姆继续写道 ， “ 俄罗斯在今后十年中需要投入至少1万亿美元，用于实现基础设施现代化。

column1: America and the West in general have a vital interest in seeing the modernization of Russia succeed.
column2: 美国和西方一般来讲愿意目睹俄国现代化取得成功。

column1: The lion's share of the technologies, know-how, and a substantial proportion of the investment, needs to come from Europe and the USA.”
column2: 这里面最大部分的技术、诀窍和占很大比例的投资都需要来自欧洲和美国 。 ”

column1: In addition to the technology and investments, Graham quietly slips in a foreign policy suggestion for the Obama administration that is sure to please the Kremlin: “Finlandizing” Ukraine.
column2: 除去技术和投资以外，格雷厄姆还在不知不觉间为奥巴马政府提出了外交政策建议，这个建议肯定非常符合克林姆林的胃口：即实现乌克兰的“芬兰化 ” 。

column1: Unless that sort of appeasement is pursued, he warns, Russia will continue to oppose the US “wherever and whenever it can.”
column2: 他警告除非采取这样的缓和政策，俄罗斯将会继续“在任何可能的时间和地点”对抗美国。

column1: According to Graham, “At the extreme, a weak Russia, with its vast resources and sparse population east of the Urals, could become the object of competition among the great powers, notably China and the United States.”
column2: 按照格雷厄姆的说法 ， “ 一个衰落的俄罗斯至多可以凭借乌拉尔以东稀少的人口及其广袤的资源成为大国，尤其是中美两国争夺的对象 。 ”

column1: That unspoken help-us-develop-or-we’ll-let-the-Chinese-do-it threat is a logical development of Prime Minister Putin’s homily at this year’s World Economic Forum in Davos, where he advocated decisive action to end the world economic crisis.
column2: 这种“帮助我们发展否则我们就求助于中国人”的隐含威胁是普京总理在今年达沃斯世界经济论坛说教的合乎逻辑的发展，他在达沃斯论坛上倡议采取果断行动，结束世界经济危机。

column1: His recipe?
column2: 你问他的办法？

column1: Western countries should write off half a trillion dollars’ worth of debt owed to them by the Russian state corporations run by his pals from the Dresden KGB and the Ozero dacha cooperative.
column2: 西方国家应当取消由他的好友管理的德累斯顿克格勃和Ozero dacha合作企业所欠下的价值5千亿美元的债务。

column1: But no amount of money will succeed in modernizing Putin's kleptocratic regime, which has already squandered trillions in oil wealth.
column2: 可是多少钱都无法实现普京窃国政权的现代化，他们已经挥霍了数万亿美元的石油财富。

column1: Simply put, the Putin system is politically, institutionally, and intellectually antithetical to the task of modernization.
column2: 简言之，普京的制度无论在政治、制度还是知识结构上都与现代化的目标背道而驰。

column1: Graham’s only error in his presentation is his attempt to frighten the administration with a hypothetical confrontation between the US and China over Russian resources.
column2: 格雷厄姆在表述中���唯一错误就是企图用美中争夺俄罗斯资源的对峙假设来恐吓政府。

column1: This is not his area of specialization.
column2: 这超出了他的专业范畴。

column1: Kissinger works personally with the Chinese account, jointly propounding with his long-time rival Zbigniew Brzezinski the notion, so seductive for an America growing weary of its imperial burden, of a global Big Two.
column2: 基辛格与中国客户有不少私人接触，他与自己的长期对手兹比格涅夫·布热津斯基共同提出了一种学说，这对越来越厌倦帝国负担及全球两大国现状的美国很有吸引力。

column1: Here is a recent sample of Kissinger’s geopolitical arts: “The role of China in a new world order is crucial.
column2: 下面是基辛格地缘政治艺术的最新范例 ： “ 中国在新世界秩序中的作用至关重要。

column1: A relationship that started on both sides as essentially a strategic design to constrain a common adversary has evolved over the decades into a pillar of the international system... The Sino-American relationship needs to be taken to a new level.
column2: 双方发展出来的限制共同对手的战略设计实质已在近几十年间演变为国际体系的基石…中美关系需要上升到新的层次。

column1: This generation of leaders has the opportunity to shape relations into a design for a common destiny, much as was done with trans-Atlantic relations in the post-war period.”
column2: 就像二战结束后的跨大西洋关系一样，这一代领导人有机会缔造同呼吸共命运的新美中关系 。 ”

column1: No doubt Kissinger believes every word he wrote, but his ideas also honestly articulate the aspirations of his customers.
column2: 无疑基辛格相信自己写下的每一个字，不过他的理念也忠实地表达了客户的愿望。

column1: It’s just that not all customers have the same motives.
column2: 但问题是并非所有客户都抱有完全相同的动机。

column1: One wants to get his hooks into a further trillion dollars that it can pick away at, while the other wants to become “a central construct of the system of international relations.”
column2: 他们有的人想要再侵吞1万亿美元，以供今后慢慢挥霍，而其他人则想要成为“国际关系系统的核心要素 。 ”

column1: But, in both cases, the customers are getting the influence for which they are paying.
column2: 但无论动机如何，这些客户为购买影响力所花的每一分钱都可谓物有所值。

column1: Who Wants Peace in the Middle East?
column2: 谁希望中东和平？

column1: Forty years after the Six Day War peace between Israelis and Palestinians seems as distant as ever.
column2: 在六日战争四十年以后，以色列人和巴勒斯坦人之间的和平似乎依然像过去一样遥不可及。

column1: Israel still refuses to accept the new Palestinian national unity government as a negotiating partner because Hamas is part of that government.
column2: 以色列依然拒绝接受新的巴勒斯坦民族团结政府作为谈判对手，因为哈马斯是那个政府的一部分。

column1: What is the cause of this seeming paradox?
column2: 这个看上去有些自相矛盾的事情的原委是什么呢？

column1: Is there any hope?
column2: 还存在希望吗？

column1: The Palestinian government is united administratively, but divided politically.
column2: 巴勒斯坦政府只是在行政上是联合的，但是在政治上却是分裂的。

column1: The Palestinians have one government with two policies.
column2: 巴勒斯坦人的政府有着两种政策。

column1: Politically, Palestine’s Prime Minister Ismail Haniyeh remains against recognizing Israel and respecting the existing agreements.
column2: 在政治上，巴勒斯坦总理哈尼亚依然拒绝承认以色列以及尊重已有的协议。

column1: He declared that he is for the continuation of resistance in all forms.
column2: 他宣称他支持继续进行所有形式的抵抗。

column1: What kind of guarantee of a good faith effort to reach a peace agreement can come from such a stance?
column2: 对于一个持这样立场的人，有谁能保证他会以真诚的努力去达成一项和平协议呢？

column1: That is the question the European Union needs to ask itself as it debates whether to resume providing financial aid to the Palestinian Authority.
column2: 这正是欧盟在争论是否应该恢复对巴勒斯坦权力机构的经济援助时应该问自己的问题。

column1: The EU should make it clear to Hamas that the Union is not going to finance terror and is not going to finance a refusal to make peace.
column2: 欧盟应该明确地向哈马斯表明它不会资助恐怖活动，也不会援助拒绝达成和平。

column1: If the Palestinians want to have European help – which I support completely – it must be ready to make peace, not to break peace.
column2: 如果巴勒斯坦人想得到欧洲的帮助，对此我完全表示支持，那么它必须准备好达成和平，而不是破坏和平。

column1: After all, it is not Hamas as a party that is objectionable; what is objectionable are the politics and policies which Hamas pursues.
column2: 不管怎样，应该反对的不是作为一个政党的哈马斯，而是哈马斯遵循的政治和政策。

column1: We have nothing against Hamas; we are against their belligerent policies, which service in government has not changed.
column2: 我们对哈马斯并不抱有成见，我们反对的是它好战的政策，这种政策在它加入政府后依然没有改变。

column1: There was a time when the PLO held positions that were the same as those of Hamas.
column2: 过去巴解组织的立场曾经是和哈马斯是一样的。

column1: Then the PLO changed.
column2: 此后巴解组织改变了它的立场。

column1: If the current Palestinian leadership changes its position, there will be no problem from our side.
column2: 如果现在的巴勒斯坦领导层也改变它的立场的话，我们这面是绝对没有问题的。

column1: We will have nothing against negotiations. We are for negotiations.
column2: 我们绝对不会反对通过谈判解决问题，我们赞成谈判。

column1: We are for the “two-state solution.”
column2: 我们赞成“两国方案 ” 。

column1: We accept the Middle East “road map.”
column2: 我们接受中东“路线图 ” 。

column1: What we are against is terror.
column2: 我们反对的是恐怖主义。

column1: Where we cannot agree, however, is on a “right of return” for Palestinians.
column2: 然而，我们所不能同意的，是巴勒斯坦人有“回归的权利 ” 。

column1: If such a right were recognized, there would be a Palestinian majority instead of a Jewish majority, which would mean the end of the Jewish state.
column2: 如果接受这种权利，巴勒斯坦人就会取代犹太人成为多数，而这意味着犹太国家的终结。

column1: This is a demographic, not a religious, question: an Arab state is where the Arabs are the majority, and the Jewish state is where the Jews are the majority.
column2: 这是一个人口的问题，而不是一个宗教的问题：一个阿拉伯国家应该是阿拉伯人占据多数，而犹太人的国家应该是犹太占据多数。

column1: Indeed, the “right of return” contradicts the very idea of a two-state solution, as it would mean one state – a Palestinian state.
column2: 事实上 ， “ 回归的权利”正是与两国方案相抵触的，因为它将意味着只有一个国家，即巴勒斯坦国家。

column1: Nobody in Israel will accept this.
column2: 没有哪个以色列人会接受这一点。

column1: But there are other problems in the region that Israel – and the world – must face.
column2: 但是在这个地区还有其他的一些问题是以色列以及全世界必须要面对的。

column1: The Palestinians’ current unity government resulted from Saudi mediation, which came in response mainly to Iran’s ambition to increase its influence, not only in Iraq, but also in Lebanon, Gaza, and the West Bank.
column2: 巴勒斯坦当前的联合政府来自沙特的调解，而这主要是出于对伊朗想不仅是在伊拉克，还包括黎巴嫩、加沙和西岸增强其影响力的野心的回应。

column1: Of course, that issue is completely outside Israel’s control.
column2: 当然，这个问题完全不在以色列的控制范围之内。

column1: The ongoing fight in the Muslim world between Sunnis and Shi’a recalls the struggle between Protestants and Catholics in seventeenth-century Europe.
column2: 穆斯林世界逊尼派和什叶派之间正在进行的斗争令人回想起十七世纪欧洲发生在新教徒与天主教派之间的战争。

column1: So it is little wonder that the Saudis, Jordanians, Egyptians, and the Gulf states are seeking to resist Iran’s hegemonic ambitions in the region.
column2: 所以不难想象沙特人、约旦人、埃及人以及海湾国家都在努力寻求抵制伊朗在该地区的霸权野心。

column1: Nevertheless, the stakes are far higher than in the seventeenth century, because Iran represents a threat that combines a fanatic religion with a determination to acquire nuclear weapons.
column2: 然而，现在的利害关系要远比十七世纪时严重得多，因为伊朗人所代表的威胁融合了狂热的宗教和获得核武器的决心。

column1: Indeed, Iran is the only country that openly declares its desire to destroy another member of the United Nations.
column2: 事实上，伊朗是唯一一个公开宣称要毁灭联合国的另一个成员国的国家。

column1: That is a threat that every country is obliged to take seriously.
column2: 这样的一种威胁是任何一个国家都必须严肃对待的。

column1: When a country’s president delivers crazy speeches, denies the Holocaust, and does not hide his ambition to control the Middle East, who can guarantee that the threat is not serious?
column2: 当一个国家的总统发表疯狂的演讲，拒绝承认二战期间纳粹对犹太人的大屠杀的存在，并且丝毫不掩饰他控制整个中东地区的野心，谁能保证这样的一种威胁不是真的呢？

column1: The issue is not one of restoring nuclear “balance” to the Middle East, as Iran’s leaders maintain.
column2: 问题并不是伊朗的领导人所一再声称的要恢复中东地区的核“平衡 ” 。

column1: First of all, Israel does not threaten anybody.
column2: 首先，以色列并不威胁任何人。

column1: Israel never said that it wants to destroy Iran; Israel never openly proclaimed that it would enrich uranium and build nuclear bombs in order to destroy another country.
column2: 以色列从未说过它想要毁灭伊朗这样的话；以色列从未公开宣称它要进行浓缩油活动以及制造核弹头以摧毁另一个国家。

column1: On the contrary, Israel has said that it will not be the first to use nuclear weapons in the Middle East.
column2: 恰恰相反，以色列表态说它绝不会在中东首先使用核武器。

column1: But that does not mean that we can afford to ignore an obvious threat from countries that want to destroy us.
column2: 但是那并不意味着我们会对来自其他国家的想要毁灭我们的明显威胁置之不理。

column1: Despite the current unfavorable situation, the path to stabilizing the Middle East still leads through joint economic projects.
column2: 尽管面对目前不利的局面，稳定中东之路依然通过联合经济计划在延续着。

column1: Even now, Israel is planning to build a new “corridor of peace,” which will comprise the Jordanians, the Palestinians, and us.
column2: 甚至现在，以色列正在计划建立一条新的“和平走廊 ” ， 它将包含约旦人、巴勒斯坦人还有我们。

column1: Within the framework of this project, we are seeking to halt the dehydration of the Dead Sea, build a joint airport and a joint water network with Jordan, and develop tourism infrastructure, at a cost of up to $5 billion.
