column2: 在这个计划的框架内，我们正寻求制止死海的脱水化、与约旦建造一个联合机场和联合水网，开发旅游基础设施，其总成本高达50亿美元。

column1: We have the donors, so there is no shortage of money to finance our efforts, which, I am sure, will be realized.
column2: 我们有捐献资金的人，所以我们的努力不会出现资金短缺的现象，而我相信，我们的努力一定能够实现。

column1: Israel wants – indeed, desperately needs – peace and stability in the Middle East, and we will continue to do everything in our power to achieve it.
column2: 以色列非常非常希望看到中东地区的和平与稳定，而我们将继续尽我们的一切努力去实现这一点。

column1: But we cannot reach that goal alone, much less negotiate with those whose idea of a stable and peaceful Middle East is one that has no place for Israel.
column2: 但是我们无法单靠我们自己去实现这一目标，更无法通过与那些在他们有关一个稳定与和平的中东的概念中并没有以色列的位置的人谈判去实现这一目标。

column1: Who Will Eclipse America?
column2: 谁将压倒美国?

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – According to Voltaire, the Roman Empire fell “because all things fall.”
column2: 发自华盛顿特区 — — 伏尔泰曾说，罗马帝国的崩溃是因为“一切都崩溃了 ” 。

column1: It is hard to argue with this as a general statement about decline: nothing lasts forever. But it is also not very useful.
column2: 当然我们还可以用“没有什么是永恒的”这句话来解释国家的衰落，但这句话同时也没什么实际意义。

column1: In thinking, for example, about American predominance in the world today, it would be nice to know when it will decline, and whether the United States can do anything to postpone the inevitable.
column2: 但如果在思考美国当今的世界霸权时能够知道它何时衰落，而美国又能采取哪些方法延缓这一进程，就再好不过了。

column1: Contemporary commenters despaired of the Roman Empire for several hundred years before it finally collapsed.
column2: 当今的评论家们都对罗马帝国在崩溃前依然维持了数百年而感到绝望。

column1: Could America find its way to a similar extension?
column2: 那么美国又能否找到类似这样延长其支配地位的途径？

column1: In terms of providing an essential structure for discussion of this problem, Arvind Subramanian’s new book, Eclipse: Living in the Shadow of China’s Economic Dominance, is a major contribution.
column2: 而在为该问题提供一个可供讨论的必要框架方面，阿尔文·苏布拉曼尼恩的新书《日食：生活在中国经济霸权的阴影之下》做出了一个重要贡献。

column1: (Full disclosure: Subramanian and I are colleagues at the Peterson Institute for International Economics, and we have worked together on other issues.)
column2: （信息披露：苏布拉曼尼恩与笔者都在美国彼得森国际经济研究所共事，并在其他课题上展开合作 ） 。

column1: In particular, Subramanian develops an index of economic dominance that should become a focus of conversation anywhere that people want to think about changes in world economic leadership.
column2: 尤其重要的是，苏布拉曼尼恩制定出了用以一个衡量经济强权的指数，而这一指数应当被那些正在思考世界经济领导权变迁的人们视为议论的焦点。

column1: There is no need to know any economics in order to be fascinated by this book: it is about power, pure and simple.
column2: 阅读这本书并不需要任何经济基础：因为书中的内容都是关于 — — 纯粹而简单的 — — 权力。

column1: The basic facts are incontrovertible.
column2: 有些基本事实是毋庸置疑的。

column1: The United Kingdom was the world’s dominant economic power from the rise of industrialization in the early nineteenth century. But it lost its predominance and was gradually eclipsed by the US, which, at least since 1945, has been the undisputed leader among market-based economies.
column2: 自19世纪早期工业化兴起后英国一度占据世界经济霸主地位，但它却逐渐失去其统治力并被美国取代，而后者至少从1945年以来一直是市场经济国家中当之无愧的领袖。

column1: The US surpassed the UK in terms of industrial production as early as the end of the nineteenth century, but that was not enough to tip the balance.
column2: 美国的工业生产其实在19世纪末期已经超过了英国，但这并不足以影响后者的地位。

column1: Economic predominance shifted only when the UK ran large current-account deficits during World Wars I and II – the country had to borrow heavily in order to finance its war effort, and imports were significantly higher than exports.
column2: 经济霸权只有在英国在一战和二战中积累了大量经常账户赤字 — — 因为必须大规模借贷来维持战争支出，而且进口远大于出口 — — 之后才最终易手。

column1: Much of the world’s gold reserves ended up in the hands of the US.
column2: 全球大部分黄金储备最后也都集中到了美国人手里。

column1: This helped undermine the role of the British pound internationally and catapulted the US dollar to the fore – particularly after the Bretton Woods conference in 1944, at which it was agreed that countries would hold their reserves in dollars as well as gold.
column2: 这使得英镑的国际地位大受影响，而美元则粉墨登场 — — 尤其是1944年建立布雷顿森林体系，各方协定可以将美元和黄金一样用作储备之后。

column1: More recently, however, it has been the Americans’ turn consistently to run large current-account deficits, buying more from the rest of the world than they earn by selling goods and services abroad.
column2: 但最近的情况反而是美国越来越依赖于大规模经常账户赤字，出口的收入也低于比进口的支出。

column1: On this dimension, the US seems destined to repeat the mistake of the British.
column2: 在这一点上，美国似乎注定要步英国后尘。

column1: At the same time, emerging-market countries’ per capita income has risen – as has their international role.
column2: 与此同时，新兴市场国家的人均收入则不断攀升 — — 同时提升的还有其国际地位。

column1: In particular, China has followed a strategy in the past decade or so that entails running large current-account surpluses and building up foreign-exchange reserves, which are now reported to be in excess of $3 trillion.
column2: 尤其是中国在过去十多年中奉行了一个创造大量经常账户顺差并积累外汇储备的战略，使其当前的外汇储备总额达到3万亿美元之巨。

column1: Indeed, Subramanian’s most provocative argument is that China has already surpassed the US in terms of economic dominance – but we have not yet woken up to this new reality.
column2: 事实上，苏布拉曼尼恩最具争议性的观点就是中国在经济霸权方面其实已经超过了美国 — — 只是我们还未能意识到这个新现实而已。

column1: The story is fascinating and well told; but there is still a great deal worth arguing.
column2: 针对过去那段精彩历史已经有大量论述；但依然有很多问题值得深究。

column1: For example, did the British decline because the US could not be stopped, or because of problems within the British Empire and at home?
column2: 比如说，英国的衰落是否是因为美国的不可遏制，而是源自于整个大英帝国或者英国本土的内部问题？

column1: A few years ago, some regarded Japan as having overtaken the US. Europe also was supposedly vying for global economic dominance.
column2: 许多年前也有人认为日本已经取代了美国，当时的欧洲似乎也在争夺全球经济霸权。

column1: Now any such claims would seem preposterous.
column2: 如今看来这一切都近乎荒缪。

column1: In both cases, the credit system got out of control, with too much lending to the private sector in 1980’s Japan and excessive government borrowing during the 2000’s in the eurozone.
column2: 上述两个地区的信贷系统其实都已失控，1980年代的日本向私人部门发放了过多贷款，而2000年后的欧元区国家政府又欠下了巨额政府债务。

column1: Similarly, it remains unclear that the Chinese development path will remain smooth.
column2: 同样，中国的发展能否一直保持平稳也有待观察。

column1: Fixed investment in China is close to 50% of GDP – which must be a world record.
column2: 该国固定资产投资额已经接近GDP的50 % — —这堪称一项世界记录。

column1: Credit to state firms and to households continues to grow rapidly.
column2: 对国有企业和家庭的信贷则持续快速增长。

column1: Isn’t this a version of exactly what derailed Japanese growth?
column2: 这不正跟当年日本的失控增长类似吗？

column1: On the key issue of being able to issue a “reserve currency” that investors and governments want to hold, Subramanian is correct that China has many of the prerequisites in place.
column2: 在发行一个投资者和政府都愿意持有的“储备货币”问题上，苏布拉曼尼恩认为中国已经具备了许多先决条件，这是事实。

column1: But it still lacks some key elements, including fully-fledged property rights.
column2: 但中国依然缺乏某些关键因素。 包括完全意义上的所有权。

column1: If you worry about getting your money out of a country when times turn tough, China is not an attractive place to hold your reserves.
column2: 如果你担心当经济环境转差时无法转移资金的话，中国就不是一个适合存放储备的地方。

column1: External challenges do sometimes bring down states.
column2: 外部挑战有时也会拖垮整个国家。

column1: But, more frequently, the big problems are internal – the regime cannot deliver growth, its legitimacy fades, and people start to head for the exits (or at least get their money out).
column2: 但更频繁出现的情况时是国家内部出现了大的变故 — — 政权无法实现经济增长，失去其合法性，人民开始设法转移到其他国家（或至少将资金转移出国 ） 。

column1: If the US is eclipsed any time soon, this will more likely be due to its loss of social cohesion and its dysfunctional politics.
column2: 因此如果美国将在近期任何时候被超越的话，这更可能是因为其社会凝聚力的丢失以及无效运作的政治系统。

column1: China might well step in to fill that vacuum, but that is quite different from being able to elbow America aside.
column2: 中国很有可能会填补这一真空，但我们并不能说是它压倒了美国。

column1: Who Will Help the Poor?
column2: 谁来保护弱者？

column1: PARIS – With the deepening of the economic crisis and the prospect of another recession looming large on the horizon, growing social inequality has become an increasingly urgent issue.
column2: 巴黎 — — 经济危机进一步加深，衰退前景再度出现，这一切也加剧了社会不平等，使其成为日益严峻的一个问题。

column1: How does one reinforce a sense of solidarity and responsibility within a country?
column2: 如何才能在一个国家内部加强归属感和责任感？

column1: Who will protect the weakest?
column2: 谁来保护弱势者的权益？

column1: As I ponder this issue, I am reminded of a debate that I had more than ten years ago in Berlin with the German theologian Hans Küng and American and Asian participants.
column2: 在思考这个问题之际，我回想起十多年前在柏林同德国神学家孔汉斯（Hans Küng）的一场辩论，当时参加讨论的还有来自美国和亚洲的人士。

column1: The subject was “Globalization and Ethics” – specifically, a comparison of the ways that Europe, the United States and Asia protect the most fragile members of their respective societies.
column2: 讨论的主题是“全球化与伦理学 ” — —具体而言，是对欧洲、美国和亚洲保护弱势社会成员的方式做一个比较。

column1: All of the participants agreed that in Europe the state traditionally filled the role played by private philantropy in the US and by the family in Asia.
column2: 我们一致认为，传统上，扮演这个保护者角色的，在欧洲是国家，在美国是私营慈善事业，在亚洲则是家庭。

column1: But we all hastened to add that no model was “pure,” i.e., the family was no longer what it used to be in Asia, the state was playing a bigger role than expected in America, and it was often underperforming in Europe.
column2: 但我们都连忙补充说，没有哪种模式是“纯粹的 ” ， 比方说，亚洲的家庭早已不是原先那样，国家在美国所起的作用超出人们的预想，而在欧洲则往往表现得不尽人意。

column1: Reality has become even more complicated since then: the family’s role continues to decline in Asia; philantropy, despite a few extraordinarily generous individuals, has more than met its limits in America; and, with the possible exception of the Nordic countries, the state in Europe, overburdened by debt, no longer has the means or the will to shoulder new responsibilities.
column2: 这十几年来，现实已经变得愈加复杂：亚洲家庭的角色进一步衰微；美国的慈善事业遭遇瓶颈，除了几个慈善家特别慷慨以外，整体上不进反退；而欧洲的国家被债务压得喘不过气来，已没有能力和意愿去肩负新的责任 — — 北欧国家可能算是例外。

column1: So who will take on the responsibility to protect the weakest if none of these three actors can do it properly?
column2: 如果上述三个能动因素统统失灵，还能指望谁去保护弱者？

column1: Are we heading toward a world united by shared incompetence and inadequacy?
column2: 这个世界是不是正在走向集体无能的境地？

column1: In the Western world, the poorest are the worst affected by economic stagnation.
column2: 在西方，穷人是经济停滞最大的受害者。

column1: But, in rapidly growing emerging-market countries, the rich tend to close their eyes to the suffering of the poorest, except when they feel threatened by the risk of political upheaval, as in, say, Saudi Arabia.
column2: 即使在经济快速增长的新兴市场国家，新富们也对穷人的苦难视而不见，只有政治动乱迫近的威胁才能令他们有所醒悟，就像在沙特那样。

column1: In fact, wealthy elites in emerging countries live in a state of denial towards their poor, literally ignoring them.
column2: 事实上，新兴国家的富裕精英阶层，其生活方式就是在排斥穷人，就是在漠视穷人。

column1: Brazil and India are particularly striking in this regard.
column2: 这情况在巴西和印度尤其令人触目惊心。

column1: Economic growth is necessary, but not sufficient: a strong sense of social responsibility is needed as well.
column2: 经济增长是必要的，但光有增长是不够的：对社会责任的强烈意识也不可或缺。

column1: It would be absurd to condemn, as some do, globalization as the main and only culprit in the erosion of traditional sources of support for the poor.
column2: 光去谴责全球化，说它是侵蚀传统弱者保护网的主要嫌疑犯，甚至是唯一的嫌疑犯，无疑是荒谬的。

column1: Globalization is above all a context, an environment, even if the consequences of the first major financial and economic crisis of the global age will further deepen the gap between the very rich and the very poor.
column2: 全球化最多只是一个背景、一种环境，尽管全球时代的第一场金融经济大危机的确把富豪和赤贫之间的差距进一步拉大了。

column1: But globalization makes the weakest among us more visible, and therefore makes the absence of social justice more unacceptable.
column2: 但全球化也凸显了弱者的处境，从而令社会公正的缺位显得尤其不可容忍。

column1: A world of much greater transparency and interdependency creates new responsibilities for the rich.
column2: 在一个具有更高透明度和更大相依性的世界里，富人面临着新的责任。

column1: Or, more precisely, it makes the old responsibility to protect the weakest both more difficult and more urgent.
column2: 说得更准确一点，它令保护弱势者的旧有责任变得更加困难和更加紧迫。

column1: In a world of increasing complexity, perhaps what is needed are simple solutions.
column2: 在一个变得日益复杂的世界里，也许恰恰需要简单的办法。

column1: One could follow, for example, Adam Smith’s principle of comparative advantage: what Europe does best is the state, while Asia still relies on the family and the US continues to focus on individual initiative.
column2: 例如，人们可以遵循亚当·斯密的比较优势原理：欧洲的强项是国家，亚洲仍然依赖家庭，美国继续坚持个人善举。

column1: The problem is that in a world of universal benchmarking, the legitimacy of solutions will stem more than ever from their cultural acceptability and their efficiency.
column2: 问题是在一个普世对标的世界里，各种办法的合法性以前所未有的程度依赖于文化兼容性和效果的优劣性。

column1: In Western Europe, for example, the call for sacrifice from all citizens in order to resolve the debt crisis runs up against a lingering perception that not all will contribute equally, and that social inequality will be exacerbated by austerity.
column2: 例如，在西欧，呼吁全体公民为解决债务危机做牺牲，在一种根深蒂固的感受面前变得苍白无力：每个人的牺牲并不平等，削减福利会加剧社会不公。

column1: Restoring growth in the short term while addressing debt problems in the medium and long term may well be the only valid response to the crisis.
column2: 但是，短期内重振经济增长，中长期内解决债务问题，毕竟是应对危机的唯一恰当方式。

column1: But it will not work, in Europe or elsewhere, without a much greater emphasis on social justice.
column2: 然而，不论是在欧洲或是其他地方，假如不加大力度强调社会公平，这些应对方式就无法奏效。

column1: While some of the very rich complain, as Warren Buffett did recently, that they do not pay enough taxes, the enlightened generosity of these happy few – who want to save capitalism and liberalism – is unlikely to be emulated by the new rich in the emerging countries, much less by the rich elsewhere.
column2: 不过，像沃伦·巴菲特等富豪直言自己纳税太少的开明、慷慨之举 — — 当然，他们是为了拯救资本主义和自由主义 — — 不太可能得到新兴市场国家新富们的群起效仿，更不容易在其他国家的富人群体中一呼百应。

column1: Let’s be realistic: people like Buffett and Bill Gates have very few followers even among the very rich in the US.
column2: 我们得现实一点看问题：像巴菲特和比尔·盖茨那样的慈善富豪，即便是在美国这样的富裕国家，也响应者聊聊。

column1: And can Asian societies really revive an effective sense of family responsibility?
column2: 此外，亚洲社会真的能够复兴家庭的责任感吗？

column1: Globalization does appear to have weakened cultural differences noticeably in the past decade.
column2: 过去十年，全球化的确显著地敉平了文化差异。

column1: But, when it comes to the protection of the weakest and the struggle against rising social injustice, perhaps “global deculturation” creates an opportunity to combine the best of what remains in particular traditions.
column2: 但是，在保护弱势者、抵抗社会不公加剧势头方面，这种“文化差异的全球化消除”也许恰恰创造了一个机会，令我们可以把各个传统中的精华部分结合起来。

column1: Perhaps countries should seek to base their social-welfare systems on a new synthesis of the state, the family, and philanthropy.
column2: 也许，各国都应尝试在综合国家、家庭和慈善的基础上重建社会福利体系。

column1: Who Will Rescue the Rest of Us?
column2: 谁又来拯救我们？

column1: SYDNEY – The rescue of the 33 Chilean miners, from what was feared would be their tomb, gave the world something to cheer about.
column2: 发自悉尼 — — 33名智利矿工的成功脱险无疑值得全世界为之欢欣鼓舞。

column1: Hope has not, after all, become a redundant virtue in the twenty-first century.
column2: 这毕竟说明希望这玩意儿还是存在于21世纪的。

column1: But, looking around us today, there do not seem to be many reasons for optimism elsewhere.
column2: 但除此之外，我们身边已经没有多少能带来希望的事物了。

column1: The world lurches towards a currency war, or even towards trade protectionism, threatening to destroy jobs and growth.
column2: 当今世界，货币战争一触即发，贸易保护主义再度抬头，两者都是拉低就业破坏增长的危险因子。

column1: America’s recovery from recession is anemic and largely jobless.
column2: 美国衰退后的复苏进程十分疲软，并伴随着大量的失业。

column1: China, meanwhile, with foreign reserves worth half its total output, denies with a straight face that it is deliberately manipulating the value of the renminbi. So its trade surplus continues to soar at the expense of other countries.
column2: 而中国这个外汇储备相当于其出口总额的一半的国家则不敢直面自己一直刻意操纵人民币汇率的现实，并继续把自己的贸易顺差建立在他国的痛苦之上。

column1: Nor does a global solution to the challenge of climate change appear any closer.
column2: 此外，应对气候变迁的全球共识方案仍遥遥无期。

column1: A few weeks of rain in Australia has emboldened those who think that global warming is a gigantic hoax perpetrated by the United Nations or conspiring scientists or maybe men from Mars.
column2: 澳大利亚连续数周的降雨更让人们怀疑，所谓的全球变暖，只不过是联合国或那些心怀不轨的科学家，甚至是火星人杜撰出来的大骗局罢了。

column1: The war in Afghanistan bleeds more lives and treasure into the inhospitable terrain of that sad land, with little immediate chance of whatever might constitute sufficient success to allow America and its allies to quit. And the problems of Pakistan fester next door.
column2: 在阿富汗战场，大量的生命和财富湮灭在滚滚黄沙之中，却无法为美国及其盟友换来哪怕一丁点的胜利，好让他们能给自己找一个体面脱身的理由，而邻国巴基斯坦的问题也在日渐恶化。

column1: In Palestine, Israeli colonies continue to grow with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu ignoring Washington’s efforts to secure traction for the peace process.
column2: 在巴勒斯坦，以色列总理内塔尼亚胡置华盛顿当局推动中东平和进程的决心于不顾，犹太人定居点不断在巴勒斯坦的土地上蚕食蔓延。

column1: Europeans continue to look inward, obsessed with their own problems of declining competitiveness and how to pay for entitlements that they have come to regard as theirs by right.
column2: 而欧盟也自顾不暇，因为它们既头痛于如何处理竞争力下降的问题，又为如何支付那些人们自以为应得的福利而苦恼。

column1: With the gap between the world’s rich and poor increasing, the impoverished South seeks a home or a job in the developed North.
column2: 随着世界贫富差距逐渐扩大，贫穷的南半球人民开始去富裕的北半球寻找家园和工作。

column1: Legal and illegal migration triggers far-right hostility in countries that customarily brag about their commitment to civil liberties.
column2: 但在那些平时吹嘘自己奉行公民自由的国家里，无论是合法还是非法的移民都激起了极右势力的敌意。

column1: So, as Lenin once asked, what is to be done?
column2: 事到如今，正如列宁曾经问过的 ： “ 该怎么办呢 ？ ”

column1: The world obviously needs political leadership of the highest quality to see us through.
column2: 很明显，我们需要最优秀的政治领袖来带领众人度过难关。

column1: We need the sort of courage that was the hallmark of Margaret Thatcher. We need Bill Clinton’s extraordinary ability to spin a political narrative that enabled voters to identify their own interests with his goals.
column2: 我们需要撒切尔夫人那样的勇气，需要比尔·克林顿那种能引导选民把自身利益与政治家目标融为一体的超凡政治游说力。

column1: We require Helmut Kohl’s understanding of the need to identify the big decisions in politics, and to get those decisions right.
column2: 我们要德国前总理科尔这样的人物，不但能认识到锁定关键政治决策的紧迫性，还能将这些决策很好地落实下来。

column1: We need leaders with sufficient mastery of detail, like China’s last premier Zhu Rongji, who can not only tell us how they will get us from A to Z, but can actually lead us from A to B.
column2: 我们还需要如中国前总理朱镕基这样对全局了如指掌的领袖，不但能告诉我们起点和终点在哪里，还能具体带领我们一步一步向目标迈进。

column1: Looking around, leaders like this seem to be an extinct species.
column2: 放眼全球，这样的领袖真的是凤毛麟角。

column1: Or, if they exist at all, they appear to be constrained by dysfunctional political systems. Their ability to act is limited by their political environment.
column2: 即便有这样的人，也被机能失调的政治制度限制着，他们的行动能力也被身处的政治环境所制约着，无法动弹。

column1: The best example is US President Barack Obama, on whom so many hopes rested – probably too many for any one leader.
column2: 美国总统奥巴马就是一个很好的例子，在他身上承载着如此多的希望，已经超出了任何一个领袖的承受能力了。

column1: Obama inherited messy and expensive wars in Afghanistan and Iraq, and an economy in meltdown.
column2: 奥巴马接过了阿富汗和伊拉克这两个肮脏而昂贵的烂摊子，同时还得面对近乎崩溃的国内经济。

column1: His attempts to revive the economy have inevitably driven up the deficit.
column2: 为了挽救经济，他无可避免地要扩大财政赤字。

column1: But no recovery in the labor or housing markets has yet materialized.
column2: 但就业和住房市场的复苏却并未如期出现。

column1: Now Obama faces defeat in the mid-term elections at the hands of Republicans whose past policies created many of the problems that weigh him down today.
column2: 如今奥巴马眼看要在中期选举中败于共和党之手，而事实上，正是共和党人此前制造的众多麻烦令奥巴马落到了这般田地。

column1: They want less government, lower taxes, and a smaller deficit, a combination to be achieved seemingly without pain.
column2: 这些共和党人宣布要压缩政府规模，要降低税收，要减少财政赤字 — — 仿佛这一切都无须付出任何代价唾手可得一样。

column1: This nonsense on stilts is articulated by some zany candidates who enjoy the support of the Tea Party, a reference not to the Mad Hatter in Alice in Wonderland, which would be fitting, but to the Bostonians who rebelled against colonial Britain’s imposition of taxes in the eighteenth century.
column2: 这种愚蠢的政治表演已经为成为了某些脑残候选人的拿手好戏，而背后支持他们的则是“茶党（Tea Party ） ” — — 我说的是18世纪反抗英国征收税款的那批波士顿民众，而不是电影《爱丽丝梦游仙境》里与男主角“疯帽子”共进下午茶的那帮疯子，不过这个解释似乎更适合这些政治家。

column1: The rest of the world needs a strong, self-confident, and decisive America.
column2: 世界需要一个强大，自信且果断的美国。

column1: But America’s political system is about to deliver a balance of power in Washington that is likely to produce stalemate and paralysis.
column2: 但美国的政治体制的核心却使华盛顿内部的权力相互制衡，并因此导致了政治僵局和瘫痪。

column1: In Europe, meanwhile, many of our problems are exemplified by what is happening in France, where President Nicolas Sarkozy’s attempt to recognize demographic and fiscal reality by raising the retirement age from 60 to 62 provoked a wave of strikes and stormy protests from workers and students.
column2: 此外，欧洲的许多问题都因法国国内的混乱而被放大�� — — 萨科齐总统被迫承认人口和财政的压力，他试图把退休年龄从60岁延迟到62岁的计划激起了一浪接一浪的罢工，以及工人学生暴风骤雨般的游行示威。

column1: Is there not something deeply depressing about 18-year-olds demonstrating about the retirement age?
column2: 我很难明白，在退休年龄这个问题上，究竟是什么深深挫伤了这帮18岁示威者幼小的心灵？

column1: How on earth did they acquire such a statist and conservative mind-set?
column2: 他们又是在哪里养成了如此僵化和保守的思维呢？

column1: Perhaps, then, Asia is the answer.
column2: 也许，问题的答案在亚洲。

column1: Perhaps the Singapore-based strategist Kishore Mahbubani is correct to write off the West and tell us that the future lies in his own continent.
column2: 也许新加坡战略家马凯硕说得对，西方已经没落，世界的未来在亚洲。

column1: The evidence on that point is mixed.
column2: 这个观点的论据是复杂多样的。

column1: India is a glorious democracy with an economically literate government and pockets of real economic achievement.
column2: 印度是一个伟大的民主国家，其政府深谙经济理论，也取得了一定的经济建设成果。

column1: But the fiasco in the run-up to the Commonwealth Games showcased some of India’s problems, not least deep corruption and inadequate infrastructure.
column2: 但英联邦运动会的一地鸡毛也折射出印度的一些问题，且不仅仅是深层次的腐败和落后的基础设施而已。

column1: If those problems were sorted out, India’s growth rate would outstrip China’s.
column2: 如果这些问题都解决了，印度的增长率将超过中国。

column1: And what of the booming Middle Kingdom?
column2: 至于蓬勃发展的“中央帝国”又怎么样呢？

column1: In Brussels the other day, Premier Wen Jiabao scolded European leaders for pressing for the renminbi’s revaluation.
column2: 前几天在布鲁塞尔，温家宝总理指责欧洲各国领导人逼迫人民币升值。

column1: Did they not understand, he argued, that this would lead to factory closures and social turbulence in China?
column2: 他说，难道这些欧洲人不知道，人民币升值将导致中国国内大量工厂倒闭和社会动荡吗？

column1: Elsewhere, of course, this sort of turmoil has democratic safety valves.
column2: 当然，在其他地方，这种混乱自有民主的安全阀来排泄掉。

column1: It is more than odd to argue that the rest of the world has to cope with a built-in advantage for China’s exporters because its authoritarian political system cannot cope with any change.
column2: 但让人无比讶异的是：世界其他国家之所以必须忍受中国出口商这种内生性优势，原来就是因为该国的独裁政治体制无法承受任何波动。

column1: No wonder the impressive premier is thought to favor some political loosening.
column2: 难怪这位给人印象深刻的总理似乎也打算给国内政治松绑了。

column1: From East to West, politics seems to be operating in a manner that is, to be diplomatic, sub-optimal.
column2: 从东方到西方，政治似乎都在以某种妥协的次优方式在运作。

column1: Then again, maybe we’re lucky that things aren’t worse.
column2: 可能我们也该为事情没有继续恶化而暗自庆幸了。

column1: The Chilean miners survived against the odds, so perhaps the rest of us will somehow get by as well.
column2: 智利矿工在九死一生的情况下重见天日，因此我们或许也能挺过来的。

column1: But who, exactly, is responsible for the rescue operation?
column2: 但问题是，究竟谁才能承担起拯救我们的重任呢？

column1: Who Will Run the World?
column2: 何人统领世界？

column1: SINGAPORE – Barack Obama’s election comes at a moment when a new bit of conventional wisdom is congealing.
column2: 新加坡 - - 奥巴马当选总统正值新的传统智慧凝固之际。

column1: It concerns the end of America’s global dominance.
column2: 这事关美国全球统领地位的终结。

column1: True, freewheeling American-style capitalism has not acquitted itself proudly of late.
column2: 的确，美国式自由放任的资本主义最近乏善可陈。

column1: And America’s military superiority has not proved all that useful in accomplishing American ends.
column2: 而美国军事优势在实现美国的目标上也并不奏效。

column1: But who may pick up the slack in providing global leadership?
column2: 但是谁又会在提供全球领导地位上收拾局面呢？

column1: The uncomfortable answer that Obama is likely to confront is this: nobody.
column2: 奥巴马有可能面对的并不令人愉乐的答案是：谁也不行。

column1: America may be damaged, but no replacement is on offer.
column2: 美国或许受到了伤害，但是还没有出现替代国家。

column1: Europe is self-absorbed, focused on creating whatever kind of entity it ends up deciding to be.
column2: 欧洲关注自我，只是在建立随便它打算要的实体。

column1: China’s standard response to any suggestion that it exercise global leadership is to hide beneath its vast internal agenda and plead poverty.
column2: 中国对任何其实施全球领导地位建议的标准回复就是躲在国内问题背后并且宣称自己的贫困问题。

column1: No other country comes close to having either the capacity or the ambition.
column2: 没有任何国家接近于拥有能力或者雄心。

column1: In the face of the familiar litany of desperate global problems – not just financial instability, but also climate change, energy insecurity, potential pandemics, terrorism, and the spread of weapons of mass destruction – the prospect of a rudderless world is more than alarming.
column2: 人们面对熟悉的一大堆急迫的全球性问题，不仅是金融不稳定，而且还包括气候变化、能源不安全、潜在的传染病、恐怖主义以及大规模杀伤性武器的扩散。 世界群龙无首的局面极为令人担忧。

column1: What is to be done?
column2: 应该做些什么？

column1: And by whom?
column2: 由谁来做呢？

column1: Given that the United States has not been playing much of a leadership role on many of these issues recently, it is worth taking a look at what happens when no one country exercises effective leadership.
column2: 鉴于美国最近在这些问题上并未发挥多大的领导作用，现在就值得观察一下在没有任何一个国家实施有效领导作用之际局面会是如何。

column1: One set of answers might seem apparent from the collapse of international trade negotiations and the unraveling international system to control the spread of nuclear weapons.
column2: 其中一套答案从国际贸易谈判破裂以及国际体系无力制止核武器扩散来看就十分明显。

column1: Things can certainly get grim.
column2: 事情会变得十分严峻。

column1: But that is not the whole story.
column2: 但是这还不是问题的全部。

column1: To see why, consider climate change.
column2: 要知道为什么，可以看一看气候变化问题。

column1: It is now clear that avoiding catastrophic climate change requires dramatic and rapid reductions in greenhouse-gas emissions, cuts that would lower annual emissions to 80% below 1990 levels by 2050.
column2: 现在清楚的是，为了避免灾难性的气候变化就要求迅速大幅度降低温室气体排放，年度排放水平必须在2050年的时候低于1990年80%的水平。

column1: Yet emissions are not just rising, but accelerating.
column2: 但是排放量不仅还在上升，而且在加速。

column1: The coming recession may stem their growth temporarily, but only slightly.
column2: 即将而来的经济衰退也许能够暂时阻止其增长，但是程度轻微。

column1: The necessary reductions imply a rapid and radical transformation of industrial, energy, and land-use systems around the world.
column2: 必要的削减要求全球工业、能源以及土地使用体系发生迅速巨大的转变。

column1: What are governments doing about this?
column2: 各国政府如何从事这一工作呢？

column1: Supposedly, by December 2009 they will agree on a new treaty to set limits on emissions.
column2: 它们理应在2009年12月达成新的协议来限制排放。

column1: But the prospects that an agreement will be reached in Copenhagen in December 2009 are close to nil.
column2: 但是这一协议能够在2009年12月在哥本哈根达成的前景几乎是零。

column1: The new Obama administration will have only a few months to develop meaningful proposals that can win domestic support, and will be preoccupied with the aftermath of the current financial debacle and the Iraq war.
column2: 奥巴马政府只有几个月的时间制定有意义的、可以赢得国内支持的建议，而且该政府将会集中经理处理当前金融危机和伊拉克战争的后果。

column1: Europe is pushing for ambitious targets but is having trouble with its own vested interests.
column2: 欧洲正在推动雄心勃勃的目标但是在自身既得利益上存在麻烦。

column1: The large emerging countries, although they will suffer disproportionately from wilder weather and rising sea levels, show little interest in picking up the slack.
column2: 新兴的大国尽管更多地承受气候反复无常和海平面升高之苦，但是却没有兴趣收拾残局。

column1: Negotiation watchers term the current American-Chinese dance of mutual blame a suicide pact.
column2: 观察谈判的人士把美中之间相互指责的游戏称为自杀协议。

column1: In short, the process is a mess.
column2: 简而言之，整个进程就是混乱不堪。

column1: This is hardly surprising.
column2: 这并不奇怪。

column1: An inter-governmental system that falls apart under the challenges of trade negotiations and proliferation threats is unlikely to master the deep complexity and multitudinous vested interests that the issue of climate change entails.
column2: 政府间体系在贸易谈判以及武器扩散的挑战之下瓦解，就难以掌握气候变化问题所带来的千头万绪和众多既得利益。

column1: Traditional diplomacy will at best devise a face-saving but meaningless accord next year.
column2: 传统外交明年最多可以创造不丢面子但是没有意义的协议。

column1: In many areas, frustration with inter-governmental intransigence and incompetence has sparked extraordinary innovation by non-governmental organizations, corporations, and ordinary people.
column2: 在许多领域，人们对政府间互不妥协以及难以胜任感到沮丧，从而激发了非政府组织、公司以及普通民众的特殊创新。

column1: Private organizations such as the Forest Stewardship Council and the Marine Stewardship Council provide and, increasingly, implement environmental standards where inter-governmental action has failed.
column2: 例如森林管理委员会以及海运管理委员会等私有组织提供了政府间行动所没有达到的环境标准并且正在越发实施这些标准。

column1: Private actors from foundations to pharmaceutical corporations to NGOs are actively experimenting with alternative ways to tackle transnational health challenges.
column2: 基金会、制药公司以及非政府组织等私有组织正在积极地试验替代性方式来处理跨国界的医疗挑战。

column1: Often governments are part of these experiments – but they are not necessarily the drivers, and progress does not depend on signing treaties.
column2: 各国政府通常参与这些试验，但是它们并非一定是推动者，而且进步也并不取决于签署协议。

column1: Indeed, there are many ways to put matters on the global agenda, as shown by Bono’s campaigns on African development and Al Gore’s on climate change.
column2: 确实，有许多办法把问题放到全球议题上。 波诺推动非洲发展以及戈尔推动气候变化问题都证明了这一点。

column1: Agreements about how to make things better already frequently include NGOs and corporations in various capacities – and sometimes exclude governments altogether.
column2: 有关改进已经经常包括不同身份的非政府组织和公司，有时候干脆就排除政府在外。

column1: Private groups using everything from satellite imagery (as in forestry) to the unofficial equivalent of on-site inspections (as in human rights) monitor who is abiding by – or violating – what standard of behavior.
column2: 私有组织利用一切手段，从森林卫星图像到人权问题上相当于非正式的现场视察谁在遵守或者违反行为标准。

column1: While enforcement in the coercive sense remains the domain of states, coercive enforcement is rare even when it comes to inter-governmental agreements.
column2: 尽管使用强迫手段实施还是国家的范围，但是即使在政府间协议上强迫实施也是极为少见的。

column1: Whether countries abide by agreements has far more to do with international processes of persuasion, socialization, and capacity-building – and those can be done by anyone with a good argument.
column2: 各国是否遵守协议更为主要地是在于国际间劝说、交际以及能力建设的进程，而这些只要有好的论点任何人都可以做到。

column1: The big question today is whether all these alternative approaches can add up to more than a bit of desperate tinkering around the edges.
column2: 如今的大问题是，这些替代性手段是否可以要比绝望地在边缘运作要有效。

column1: Standard international-relations thinking does not even entertain the question, and those conventional ways of seeing the world have blinded us to looking at this crucial question.
column2: 标准的国际关系思维甚至并不考虑这一问题，而传统观察世界的方法阻碍我们看到这一关键问题所在。

column1: As a result, we do not yet know the answer.
column2: 结果，我们还不知道答案。

column1: Data remain scarce.
column2: 数据还是稀少。

column1: There are hundreds of global public-private partnerships working on various global ills – but few have been examined to see what good they do.
column2: 全世界有数以百计的公私伙伴组织在处理解决不同的全球性难题，但是人们很少检查它们做了那些好事。

column1: The mishmash of initiatives, actors, campaigns, and appeals creates opportunities for major progress – and mass confusion.
column2: 各种倡议、参与者、运动以及申诉给重大进展和大范围混乱提供了机会。

column1: If there is to be real progress toward more effective and efficient global governance that can address the unprecedented challenges posed by climate change and the rest of the global agenda, we must do much more than look for an easy replacement for American hegemony.
column2: 气候变化以及其他全球性议题带来了前所未有的挑战。 要想在处理这些挑战的更为有效和效力的全球管理上实现真正的进步，我们还必须不能停留在简单地寻求替换美国霸权上。

column1: We must figure out how to make sense of this enormous diversity of ways of saving the world.
column2: 我们必须找到方式来理解如此众多的拯救世界的多样途经。

column1: Citizen Bezos?
column2: 公民贝索斯？

column1: NEW YORK – My very first serious job was as a fact-checker for Forbes magazine (now mostly a laissez-faire collection of blogs).
column2: 纽约 — — 我的第一份工作是在《福布斯》杂志（现已基本成为放任自流的博客大杂烩）负责事实审核。

column1: I consider fact-checkers to be the altar boys of journalism.
column2: 我认为事实审核员是新闻业的忠实侍者。

column1: And, despite having left the church, I still feel a profound reverence for the holy truth.
column2: 尽管已离开教堂，我仍然敬畏神圣的真理。

column1: So, in most of the discussion about business models occasioned by the sale of the Washington Post to Amazon.com founder and CEO Jeff Bezos, the values that I have held dear are being tarnished.
column2: 因此，在亚马逊创始人兼首席执行官杰夫·贝索斯收购《华盛顿邮报》引发的商业模式大讨论中，我所珍视的价值观遭到了践踏。

column1: How so?
column2: 为什么这么说？

column1: Even reputable fact-checkers disagree on the origin of the famous admonition to journalists: “Comfort the afflicted, and afflict the comfortable!”
column2: 就连享有盛誉的事实审核员也无法就“给苦难者以慰藉、给舒适者以折磨 ！ ” 这条知名记者箴言的起源达成一致。

column1: (They even disagree on whether it was first directed at preachers or at newsmen).
column2: （他们甚至无法确定这句话最早是用来形容牧师还是新闻记者 ） 。

column1: In any case, journalism is one business in which the customer is not always right.
column2: 但无论如何，新闻行业的客户并不总是正确的。

column1: The challenge that business considerations pose to journalism – both news and commentary providers – takes the form of three separate temptations: to slant the news to please readers rather than inform them, and thus attract advertisers; to slant the news to please advertisers directly; and to slant the news to advance owners’ political or commercial interests.
column2: 商业因素给包括新闻及评论机构在内的新闻业以诱惑的形式带来三重挑战：歪曲新闻以取悦而不是客观地告知读者，并以此来吸引广告客户；歪曲新闻直接吸引广告客户；歪曲新闻为所有者的政治或商业利益服务。

column1: These temptations have always been present, but “hard” news could be supported by constituency-pleasing sections, advertiser-pleasing features and product reviews, news-you-can-use sections replete with ads for related goods, and, of course, the classified ads.
column2: 上述诱惑始终存在，但“重大”新闻背后其实还可以掺杂取悦顾客的报导、取悦广告商的特写和产品评述，以及充斥着相关产品、当然还有分类广告的实用新闻栏目。

column1: Today, the church of newspaper journalism is fragmenting.
column2: 今天新闻的神圣殿堂正在土崩瓦解。

column1: Brands and advertisers can speak directly to customers, and markets no longer need the convening power of a newspaper to match buyers and sellers (the purpose of classified ads).
column2: 品牌和广告商可以直接与客户沟通，市场也不再需要媒体扮演将买卖双方匹配在一起（也是分类广告的目的）的角色。

column1: Investigative journalism and serious commentary, like religion, do not have a profit model.
column2: 像宗教一样，新闻调查和严肃评论本身并不具备盈利的模式。

column1: They serve a higher purpose (although they can be and often are corrupted or twisted for bad ends).
column2: 它们为更高的目标服务（虽然往往遭到扭曲或破坏，为不可告人的目标提供服务 ） 。

column1: So, should we welcome Bezos’s entry into this world?
column2: 那么，我们是否应当欢迎贝索斯进入新闻行业？

column1: Many commentators expect him to digitize-monetize-revolutionize the Post (whatever that means).
column2: 许多评论家预测他将实现《华盛顿邮报》的数字化、货币化及改革化（无论这几个词究竟是什么意思 ） 。

column1: But I think he bought it for a different purpose.
column2: 但我认为其收购背后另有目标。

column1: He is a canny businessman – that much is clear.
column2: 他是一位精明的商人 — — 这一点是毋庸置疑的。

column1: He runs Amazon tightly and for the long term; it generates huge amounts of cash, which it reinvests on behalf of all of its shareholders.
column2: 他长期在亚马逊开展严密的经营活动；后者为他带来巨额现金，他又代表全体股东进行再投资操作。

column1: But it is Bezos personally, not Amazon, who bought the Post.
column2: 但收购《邮报》的是贝索斯个人，而不是亚马逊这家企业。

column1: This is a man who is a generous donor to the Long Now Foundation (I am on its board) and who personally founded and owns a rocket company, Blue Origin (I am on the board of a competing company called XCOR).
column2: 贝索斯是今日永存基金会（我也是该基金会的董事成员）慷慨的捐助者，其个人还创办并且拥有一家叫蓝源（Blue Origin）的火箭公司（而我则是其竞争对手XCOR公司的董事 ） 。

column1: I think – I hope! – that Bezos will make the proper distinctions.
column2: 我认为 — — 我希望！ 贝索斯能够进行适当的区隔。

column1: He understands the difference between media (yet another of his personal investments is the Web site Business Insider) and journalism.
column2: 他理解媒体和新闻之间的区别（但商业内幕网站是他的另外一项个人投资 ） 。

column1: In our market-driven times, we tend to think about the price of everything and the value of nothing, as Oscar Wilde put it.
column2: 恰如奥斯卡·王尔德所说，在以市场为导向的年代，价格而非价值是我们考虑的目标。

column1: But we are also discovering behavioral economics – the human quirks and emotional urges that drive people to do things that make little economic sense.
column2: 但我们也见证了行为经济学 — — 人类的怪癖和情绪冲动促使人们做出没有经济意义的决策。

column1: The best joke of all – that Bezos bought the Post by mistake through an errant one-click purchase (a capability patented by Amazon) – has a ring of truth to it.
column2: 其中最离谱的笑话 — — 贝索斯因为点错鼠标而错误地一键买入（这是亚马逊一项曾获专利的技术 ） 《 华盛顿邮报》多少有一点现实的味道。

column1: The purchase was not an economically motivated decision, though it was no mistake.
column2: 虽然算不上是一次错误，但也不是一次有意义的经济收购。

column1: There probably is not a sustainable business model for newspapers like the Post.
column2: 《邮报》这样的报纸或许没有可持续的经营模式。

column1: But I do think there is sustainable value of the kind that no corporation or financially driven investor could ever justify.
column2: 但我的确认为企业或金融投资者永远无法理解的长期价值是切实存在的。

column1: Bezos’s move is not like the recent purchases of Newsweek, where there was an illusion of turning it around, or the Boston Globe, bought by John Henry, who owns the Boston Red Sox baseball team and Liverpool Football Club.
column2: 贝索斯此举不同于此前抱着扭亏为盈的幻想对于《新闻周刊》的收购。 它也不同于约翰·亨利收购《波士顿环球报 》 ， 后者已经将波士顿红袜队和利物浦足球俱乐部的所有权收入囊中。

column1: Perhaps the most interesting example is Rupert Murdoch – the son of an Australian news baron – who recently split his family-controlled News Corporation, into the TV and film company 21st Century Fox and the less profitable new News Corp, which retains the news and publishing operations.
column2: 最耐人寻味的例子也许是澳大利亚新闻巨头的儿子鲁珀特·默多克，默多克不久前将其家族控制的新闻集团一分为二，形成了21世纪福克斯电视电影公司和保留新闻出版业务的利润不那么丰厚的新闻集团两块业务。

column1: Although Murdoch remains chairman of both, everyone expects him to focus more on the news business.
column2: 尽管默多克身兼这两个集团的董事长，但所有人都预料他会更专注于新闻业务。

column1: That portfolio includes both customer-pleasing tabloids with a troubled history of pandering, spying, and bribing, and the venerable journalism of the Wall Street Journal’s news pages – a contradiction that splitting the parent has not resolved.
column2: 上述业务包括曾以刺探收买等低俗手段迎合读者的小报和受人尊敬的《华尔街日报》新闻版 — — 分拆母公司并没有解决这其中的冲突。

column1: And, finally, there is Project Syndicate itself (which publishes this column).
column2: 最后还要谈到发布这篇专栏文章的Project Syndicate本身。

column1: Originally funded by yet another billionaire, George Soros, Project Syndicate operates independently to provide hard-to-monetize informed opinion and analysis with nary an “advertorial” or product review in sight.
column2: Project Syndicate集团最初由另外一名亿万富翁乔治·索罗斯赞助，现在独立运营发表鲜有经济效益的观点和分析文章（在可以预见的未来既没���软广告也没有产品评述 ） 。

column1: One way to think about the best business model for journalism is to think about the best business model for food.
column2: 思考新闻业最佳商业模式可以借鉴食品业的经验。

column1: Is it an all-you-can-eat buffet?
column2: 究竟你想经营随意取用的自助餐？

column1: A tony à la carte sanctuary with great wines that generate most of the profit?
column2: 以高档红酒为卖点的时尚豪华的点餐服务？

column1: A franchise with pre-cooked dishes thawed and heated in huge ovens?
column2: 还是用大型烤箱加热事先煮熟并解冻的各色菜肴？

column1: All can work – but only with good management.
column2: 任何一种形式都可以赚钱，问题是管理必须跟得上。

column1: But there is also the philanthropic soup kitchen – in the Post’s case, a high-end one, delivering nutritious food in a world in which restaurants now give away less-healthy food, because they use it to sell other goods.
column2: 但还有一种情况是爱心厨房 — — 具体到《华盛顿邮报 》 ， 这家高端爱心厨房在餐馆普遍提供垃圾食品（因为他们把其他产品与垃圾食品捆绑销售）的今天为人们提供营养丰富的菜肴。

column1: In the end, I think Bezos wants less to own the Post than to set it free, for at least a generation or two.
column2: 最后，我认为贝索斯与其想拥有《华盛顿邮报》还不如说想在至少一两代人的时间里给它以自由。

column1: As Bezos wrote in a memo to the staff: “The values of the Post do not need changing.
column2: 正如贝索斯在给员工的一份备忘录中所写的那样 ： “ 《华盛顿邮报》的价值观不需要变化。

column1: The paper’s duty will remain to its readers and not to the private interests of its owners.
column2: 这份报纸不会忠实于其所有者的私利，而将继续忠实于它的读者。

column1: We will continue to follow the truth wherever it leads....”
column2: 我们将继续追寻真理到天涯海角 … ” 。

column1: If I am wrong, I hope this commentary will help to afflict him into righteousness!
column2: 如果我说错了，希望这篇评论能让他认识到真理的价值 ！ ”

column1: Why America Must Not Re-elect President Bush
column2: 为什么美国不该再选乔治·布什当总统

column1: I have never been heavily involved in partisan politics, but these are not normal times.
column2: 我从来没热衷参与过党派政治，但现在已经是非正常时期了。

column1: President George W. Bush is endangering the United States and the world's safety while undermining American values.
column2: 乔治·W·布什总统正在把美国和世界的安全拖入险境，同时也损害了美国信奉的价值观。

column1: For opposing him, I have been demonized by the Bush campaign.
column2: 迫于布什班子的种种丑行，我不得不站出来反对他。

column1: President Bush ran in 2000 on a platform promising a "humble" foreign policy.
column2: 2000年布什竞选时曾承诺实行"温和"的外交政策。

column1: If re-elected, the Bush doctrine of preemptive action - and the invasion of Iraq - will be endorsed, and the world will have to live with the consequences.
column2: 如果再次当选，布什的霸权信条－和侵略伊拉克的行径－将会得到承认，而全世界都不得不为此付出惨重代价。

column1: By repudiating Bush's policies at the polls, America will have a chance to regain the respect and support of the world.
column2: 通过在全民投票中批判布什的政策，美国将有机会重新赢得世界的尊敬与支持。

column1: The terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001, required a strong response.
column2: 2001年9月11日的恐怖袭击迫使我们做出强烈的反应。

column1: But they also led to suspension of the critical process so essential to a democracy - a full and fair discussion of the issues.
column2: 但这也导致了关键民主程序的缺失－没有人就此进行过全面、公正的探讨。

column1: Bush silenced criticism by calling it unpatriotic.
column2: 所有批评意见都被布什贴上了不爱国的标签并加以压制。

column1: For 18 months after 9/11, he managed to suppress all dissent. That is how he led America in the wrong direction.
column2: 9/11以后长达18个月，他成功地压制了所有的不同意见，他就是这样把美国引入了歧途。

column1: In fact, Bush played right into the hands of Osama bin Laden.
column2: 实际上，布什此举正中奥萨马·本·拉登的下怀。

column1: Afghanistan's invasion was justified: that was where bin Laden lived and al Qaeda had its training camps. Invading Iraq was not.
column2: 美国有理由入侵阿富汗：因为那里是本·拉登的驻地，也是基地组织的训练营，但入侵伊拉克却站不住脚。

column1: It was Bush's unintended gift to bin Laden.
column2: 这是布什送给本·拉登的一份意外礼物。

column1: Immediately after 9/11, there was a spontaneous outpouring of sympathy for America worldwide. It has given way to widespread resentment.
column2: 9/11事件刚结束时，全世界都弥漫着对美国自发的同情，现在却统统变成了憎恨。

column1: There are many more people willing to risk their lives to kill Americans than there were on September 11.
column2: 与9月11日前相比，有更多的人愿意冒着生命的危险去刺杀美国人。

column1: Bush likes to insist that terrorists hate Americans for what they are - a freedom loving people - not what they do.
column2: 布什总喜欢强调恐怖份子仇恨美国是因为我们之为美国－因为我们拥有热爱自由的人民，他却从未提及这种仇恨是来自我们的所作所为。

column1: But war and occupation create innocent victims.
column2: 可是战争和占领会让无辜群众成为牺牲品。

column1: We count the body bags of American soldiers - over 1,000 in Iraq.
column2: 让我们数一数美国士兵在伊拉克的尸骨－超过1000人已经在伊拉克丧失了生命。

column1: The wider world also counts the Iraqis who get killed daily, perhaps 20 times more.
column2: 别的国家还在计算每天死了多少伊拉克人，这个数字几乎是美国伤亡的20倍。

column1: Nor was the torture of detainees at Abu Ghraib prison the work of a few bad apples. It was part of a system of dealing with prisoners put in place by Defense Secretary Donald Rumsfeld.
column2: 阿布格莱布监狱的虐囚行为也绝非少数害群之马的个别行为，而是国防部长唐纳德·拉姆斯菲尔德对待犯人政策的组成部分。

column1: Public opinion condemns America worldwide, and our troops in Iraq are paying the price.
column2: 所有的世界舆论都在谴责美国，而我们驻伊拉克的军队在为此付出代价。

column1: Bush convinced people that he is good for American security by playing on the fears generated by the 9/11 attacks.
column2: 布什利用9/11恐怖袭击后的恐惧，成功地说服了人们他是美国安全的守护神。

column1: At a time of peril, people rally around the flag, and Bush exploited this by fostering a sense of danger.
column2: 在危机时刻，人们集结在共同的旗帜下，而布什通过让他们相信身处险境而充分利用了这种大敌当前的团结。

column1: His campaign assumes that people do not really care about the truth and will believe almost anything if it is repeated often enough.
column2: 这种策略的前提是人们毫不看重事实，而会相信反复灌输给他们的一切思想。

column1: There must be something wrong with Americans if we fall for it.
column2: 如果我们真的落入了这个陷阱，那么美国人一定有什么地方出了问题。

column1: For instance, some 40% of Americans still believe that Saddam Hussein was connected with 9/11, although the 9/11 Commission - set up by Bush and chaired by a Republican - definitively established that no such connection existed.
column2: 举个例子，40%左右的美国人到现在仍然相信，萨达姆·侯赛因与9/11事件脱不了干系，尽管由布什组建、并由民主党人任主席的9/11委员会已经做出了结论：这种所谓的联系纯属子虚乌有。

column1: I want to shout: "Wake up America.
column2: 我想大声疾呼 ： " 美国人醒醒吧。

column1: Don't you realize we are being misled?"
column2: 难道你们还没发现，我们正在被人所误导 ？ "

column1: The war in Iraq was misconceived from start to finish - if it has a finish.
column2: 伊拉克战争从头到尾都是个骗局－如果它还能有个"结尾 " 。

column1: It is a war of choice, not necessity.
column2: 这是我们主动挑起的战争，而不是被迫的还击。

column1: Moreover, America went to war on false pretenses.
column2: 不仅如此，美国人发动战争的借口并不存在。

column1: Weapons of mass destruction could not be found, and the connection with al Qaeda could not be established.
column2: 大规模杀伤性武器根本没有找到，和基地组织的联系也根本得不到证实。

column1: Bush then claimed that America went to war to liberate Iraq.
column2: 于是布什又声称美国发动战争是为了解放伊拉克。

column1: But democracy cannot be imposed by force.
column2: 但真正的民主绝不可能来自武力。

column1: Saddam Hussein was a tyrant, and Iraqis - and the world - can rejoice in being rid of him.
column2: 萨达姆·侯赛因是独裁者，伊拉克和整个世界都会为他的倒台欢呼雀跃。

column1: But America had an obligation to maintain law and order; instead, we stood idly by while Baghdad and other cities were ransacked.
column2: 美国有义务维护法律和秩序，但恰恰相反，当巴格达和其它城��被洗劫一空时，我们却始终坐视不管。

column1: If we had cared about the Iraqi people, we should have had more troops available for the occupation.
column2: 如果我们真的在意伊拉克人民，就应该派更多的军队维持秩序。

column1: We should have provided protection not only for the oil ministry, but also other ministries, museums, and hospitals.
column2: 我们应该保护的不仅是石油部，还有其它政府部门、博物馆和医院。

column1: Worse still, when American soldiers encountered resistance, they employed methods - invading homes and mistreating prisoners - that alienated and humiliated the population, generating resentment and rage.
column2: 更糟糕的是，美国士兵遇到抵抗时，他们选择了侵入民宅和虐待俘虏－这种做法使伊拉克人蒙受了耻辱，使他们最终丧失了信心，并激发了他们的愤怒与怨恨。

column1: The Bush administration's flip-flops and missteps are legion.
column2: 我们看到了太多的朝令夕改和决策失误。

column1: First the Iraqi army was dissolved, then America tried to reconstitute it.
column2: 开始时伊拉克军队遭到解散，接着美国又试图重建。

column1: First the US tried to eliminate the Baathists, then America turned to them for help.
column2: 起初美国想消灭叙利亚社会党，后来又转而寻求他们的帮助。

column1: When the insurgency became intractable, America installed an Iraqi government. The man chosen to lead it was a protégé of the CIA with a reputation for being a strongman - a far cry from democracy.
column2: 当动荡局面演变得无法控制，美国又扶植了伊拉克政府，并把中央情报局的保护对象扶上了头把交椅，此人一贯有着铁腕的名声，这与民主要求可谓相去甚远。

column1: Despite the Bush campaign's efforts at spin control, the situation in Iraq is dire.
column2: 尽管布什阵营绞尽脑汁想扭转颓势，但伊拉克局势仍旧危机重重。

column1: Much of the western part of the country has been ceded to insurgents, the prospect of holding free and fair elections in January is fast receding, civil war looms.
column2: 那里西部的大片领土都落入了叛乱分子的控制，而1月举行自由公正选举的可能性几乎为零，内战更是一触即发。

column1: Bush's war in Iraq has done untold damage to America as well, impairing its military power and undermining the morale of the armed forces.
column2: 布什的对伊战争也给美国造成了不可估量的损害，不仅削弱了我们的军力，也给部队的士气带来了沉重的打击。

column1: Before the war, America could project overwhelming force. Not anymore.
column2: 对伊战争前，美国曾拥有压倒优势的军力，现在这已经不复存在。

column1: Afghanistan is slipping from control.
column2: 阿富汗局势正在失控。

column1: North Korea, Iran, Pakistan, and other countries pursue nuclear programs with renewed vigor.
column2: 北朝鲜、伊朗、巴基斯坦和其它国家又鼓起勇气投入了核武器的研究。

column1: The Bush administration can be criticized for many other policies, but none are as important as Iraq.
column2: 布什政府还有很多其它政策值得商榷，但没有一个像伊拉克这么严重。

column1: The war has cost nearly $200 billion, and costs will continue to mount, because getting into Iraq was much easier than getting out will be.
column2: 战争耗费了近2000亿美元，这个数字还会继续上升，因为进入远比撤出更加容易。

column1: Bush has been taunting John Kerry to explain how he would do things differently.
column2: 布什一直嘲笑约翰·凯利，让他说说能带来哪些变化。

column1: Kerry has responded that he would have done everything differently, and that he would be in a better position to extricate us.
column2: 凯利的回答是，他的所有做法都会变化，他能够更好地解脱美国。

column1: But it won't be easy for him, either, because America is caught in a quagmire.
column2: 但这对他来讲也并不容易，因为美国已经陷入了一个巨大的泥潭。

column1: Top military and diplomatic experts desperately warned Bush not to invade Iraq. He ignored them.
column2: 军政两界的顶级专家拼命地告诫布什别侵入伊拉克，可他对这种警告充耳不闻。

column1: He suppressed the critical process, arguing that any criticism of the Commander-in-Chief puts US troops at risk.
column2: 他压制批评意见，说任何对总司令的批评都会给美国军队带来危险。

column1: But this is Bush's war, and he ought to be held responsible for it.
column2: 可这是布什的战争，他应该为此负责。

column1: Americans should step back for a moment and ask: who got them into this mess?
column2: 美国人应该退一步思考并扪心自问：是谁把他们带到了目前的境地？

column1: A moment's reflection should raise another question: does Bush's Texas swagger qualify him to remain America's Commander-in-Chief?
column2: 片刻的思考会引发另外一个疑问：布什的德克萨斯牛皮能不能使他继续留任美国的三军统帅？

column1: Calling Off America’s Bombs
column2: 阻止美国的炸弹

column1: NEW YORK – As the US Congress considers whether to authorize American military intervention in Syria, its members should bear in mind a basic truth: While Syrian President Bashar Al-Assad has repeatedly used extreme violence to retain power, the United States – and other governments in the Middle East and Europe – share responsibility for turning Syria into a killing field.
column2: 纽约—在美国国会在考虑是否授权军事干预叙利亚，各位议员应该记住一个基本事实：叙利亚总统巴沙尔·阿萨德为了把持权力而一再使用极端暴力，但美国 — — 以及其他中东和欧洲政府 — — 也要为叙利亚变成屠杀场承担一定责任。

column1: These governments, led by the US, have explicitly sought the violent overthrow of Assad.
column2: 这些政府在美国的领导下赤裸裸地寻求以暴力推翻巴沙尔。

column1: Without their involvement, Assad’s regime would most likely have remained repressive; with their involvement, Syria has become a site of mass death and destruction.
column2: 没有它们的介入，巴沙尔政权极有可能仍然会采取高压政策；有了它们的参与，叙利亚变成了大规模死亡和毁灭之地。

column1: More than 100,000 people have died, and many of the world’s cultural and archaeological treasures have been demolished.
column2: 超过10万人已经丧生，大量世界文化和考古财富被摧毁。

column1: Syria’s civil war has occurred in two phases.
column2: 叙利亚内战包括两个阶段。

column1: The first phase, roughly from January 2011 until March 2012, was largely an internal affair.
column2: 第一阶段大概在2011年1月至2012年3月，这一阶段大体上是叙利亚内部事务。

column1: When the Arab Spring erupted in Tunisia and Egypt in January 2011, protests erupted in Syria as well.
column2: 当阿拉伯之春于2011年1月在突尼斯和埃及爆发时，叙利亚也爆发了游行示威。

column1: In addition to the usual grievances under a brutal regime, Syrians were reeling from a massive drought and soaring food prices.
column2: 除了常规的对暴政政权的仇恨外，叙利亚人还饱受大规模干旱和食品价格飙升的挤压。

column1: The protests became a military rebellion when parts of the Syrian army broke with the regime and established the Free Syrian Army.
column2: 随着一部分叙利亚军队与政权决裂，成立自由叙利亚军（Free Syrian Army ） ， 游行示威演变成了军事起义。

column1: Neighboring Turkey was probably the first outside country to support the rebellion on the ground, giving sanctuary to rebel forces along its border with Syria.
column2: 邻国土耳其可能是第一个从地面支持叛军的外国，它沿土叙边境为叛军提供庇护所。

column1: Although the violence was escalating, the death toll was still in the thousands, not tens of thousands.
column2: 尽管暴力升级，但死亡人数仍只有几千人，而没有达到万人级别。

column1: The second phase began when the US helped to organize a large group of countries to back the rebellion.
column2: 第二阶段始于美国帮助组织起一大群国家支持叛军。

column1: At a meeting of foreign ministers in Istanbul on April 1, 2012, the US and other countries pledged active financial and logistical support for the Free Syrian Army.
column2: 在2012年4月1日举行的伊斯坦布尔外交部长会议上，美国和其他国家承诺为自由叙利亚军提供金融和物流支持。

column1: Most important, then-Secretary of State Hillary Clinton declared: “We think Assad must go.”
column2: 最重要的是，时任美国国务卿希拉里·克林顿宣称“我们认为巴沙尔必须下台 。 ”

column1: That open-ended statement, without any clear means to achieve the goal that it announced, has done much to fuel military escalation and the rising death toll in Syria, while pushing the US repeatedly to defend its “credibility” against a line in the sand that it should not have drawn.
column2: 这一陈述颇为含糊，并没有给出实现这一目标的手段，结果导致了叙利亚军事冲突升级和死亡人数暴增，同时也给美国自己划了一条毫无必要的底线，使其不得不一再捍卫自己的“信誉 ” 。

column1: Then and now, the US has claimed to speak in the interest of the Syrian people.
column2: 从那时到现在，美国一直声称代表叙利亚人民的利益。

column1: This is very doubtful.
column2: 这十分可疑。

column1: The US views Syria mainly through the lens of Iran, seeking to depose Assad in order to deprive Iran’s leaders of an important ally in the region, one that borders Israel.
column2: 美国看待叙利亚的角度大体是站在伊朗问题的基础上，它之所以寻求推翻巴沙尔，是为了除掉伊朗领导人在中东的一个重要盟友，一个与以色列接壤的盟友。

column1: The US-led effort in Syria is thus best understood as a proxy war with Iran – a cynical strategy that has contributed to the massive rise in violence.
column2: 于是，对美国领导的叙利亚任务的最合适的理解是，这是一场与伊朗的代理人战争 — — 这一颇可质疑的战略导致了暴力的严重升级。

column1: The US government’s misguided move from potential mediator and problem solver to active backer of the Syrian insurrection was, predictably, a terrible mistake.
column2: 美国政府从潜在的调停人和问题解决者变成了叙利亚暴动的积极支持者。 不难预测，这一是个严重的错误。

column1: It put the US in effective opposition to the United Nations peace initiative then being led by former UN Secretary-General Kofi Annan, whose approach was to call for a ceasefire followed by a negotiated political transition.
column2: 这使美国事实上违反了由前秘书长科菲·安南领导的联合国维和措施。 安南的办法是呼吁停火，然后进行政治转型谈判。

column1: The US preempted this process by backing the military rebellion and insisting on Assad’s immediate departure.
column2: 美国则操之过急，支持叛军并坚持巴沙尔必须立刻下台。

column1: It is hard to understand this blunder.
column2: 美国的这一错误令人难以理解。

column1: Even if the US ultimately sought to force Assad from office, its blunt action hardened Assad’s resistance, as well as that of his two allies in the UN Security Council, Russia and China.
column2: 即使美国的最终目的是迫使巴沙尔下台，其迫不及待的举动也会增加巴沙尔的抵抗，并且触犯其在联合国安理会的两大盟友俄罗斯和中国。

column1: Aside from seeking to defend their own interests in the region, both countries understandably rejected the idea of US-led regime change in Syria.
column2: 不难理解，中俄两国除了寻求捍卫其自身在中东的利益外，还 否决了由美国领导叙利亚体制变革的方案。

column1: Russia argued that America’s insistence on Assad’s immediate departure was an impediment to peace.
column2: 俄罗斯认为美国的坚持巴沙尔立刻下台是在阻止和平。

column1: In this, Russia was right.
column2: 在这一点上，俄罗斯是正确的。

column1: Indeed, Russia was playing a plausibly constructive role at the time, albeit one premised on Assad remaining in power for at least a transitional period, if not indefinitely.
column2: 事实上，当时俄罗斯所扮演的角色颇具建设性，尽管其先决条件是巴沙尔政权即使不能用就延续，至少在过渡期仍应该在台上。

column1: Russia sought a pragmatic approach that would protect its commercial interests in Syria and its naval base at the port of Tartus, while bringing an end to the bloodletting.
column2: 俄罗斯追求的是一种务实方案，以保护其在叙利亚的商业利益和其在塔尔图斯港的军事基地，同时还能结束流血。

column1: The Russians openly backed Annan’s peace initiative.
column2: 俄罗斯人公开支持安南的和平计划。

column1: Yet, with the US and others financing the rebels, Russia (and Iran) supplied more – and more sophisticated – weapons to the regime.
column2: 但是，由于美国和其他国家为叛军提供金融支持，俄罗斯（和伊朗）向巴沙尔政权提供了更多、也更先进的武器。

column1: Now, with the use of chemical weapons, probably by the Syrian government (and possibly by both sides), the US has again ratcheted up the stakes.
column2: 如今，化学武器的使用（可能是叙利亚政府，也可能是双方都用了）使得美国再次加大了赌注。

column1: Bypassing the UN once again, the US is declaring its intention to intervene directly by bombing Syria, ostensibly to deter the future use of chemical weapons.
column2: 美国再次绕过联合国，宣布准备通过轰炸叙利亚直接进行干预 — — 表面借口是为了阻止进一步使用化学武器。

column1: America’s motivations are not entirely clear.
column2: 美国的动机并不十分明确。

column1: Perhaps there is no underlying foreign-policy logic, but only carelessness.
column2: 也许其中并无外交政策基本逻辑，而只是疏忽。

column1: If there is a kind of logic, however weak, it seems to revolve around Iran and Israel, rather than Syria per se.
column2: 如果有某种逻辑，那么不管多么弱，都必然是以伊朗和以色列而不是以叙利亚为核心的。

column1: There are many dictatorships in the world that the US does not try to overthrow.
column2: 世界上有许多独裁体制美国都没有去试图推翻。

column1: On the contrary, many of them are ostensibly America’s close allies.
column2: 相反，其中不少表面上还是美国的紧密盟友。

column1: So why does the US continue to back a deadly rebellion in a civil war that is continuing to escalate dangerously, now to the point of chemical-weapons attacks?
column2: 因此美国为何要在正在继续危险发酵的内战中支持叛军，如今甚至找出了化学武器攻击的借口？

column1: To put it simply, President Barack Obama’s administration has inherited the neoconservative philosophy of regime change in the Middle East.
column2: 简言之，总统奥巴马政府继承了针对中东政权变革的新保守主义思想。

column1: The overriding idea is that the US and its close allies get to choose who governs in the region.
column2: 其最重要的出发点是美国及其紧密盟友来选择谁主导这一地区。

column1: Assad must go not because he is authoritarian, but because he is allied with Iran, which, from the perspective of the US, Israel, Turkey, and several Gulf countries, makes him a regional threat.
column2: 巴沙尔之所以必须下台，不是因为他独裁，而是因为它与伊朗结盟，在美国、以色列、土耳其和一些海湾国家看来，这让巴沙尔成为了地区威胁。

column1: In fact, the US has probably been lured into serving these countries’ own narrower interests, whether it be Israel’s unconvincing vision of its own security or the Sunni countries’ opposition to Shia Iran.
column2: 事实上，美国可能被这些国家自身的狭隘利益所利用，不管是以色列对其自身安全的无法令人信服的愿景还是逊尼派国家队什叶派伊朗的反对。

column1: But, in the long term, US foreign policy divorced from international law cannot produce anything other than more war.
column2: 但是，从长期看，美国违背国际法的外交政策不可能产生除了更多战争之外的结果。

column1: The US should reverse course.
column2: 美国需要转变方向。

column1: A direct US attack on Syria without UN backing is far more likely to inflame the region than it is to resolve the crisis there – a point well appreciated in the United Kingdom, where Parliament bucked the government by rejecting British participation in a military strike.
column2: 在没有联合国的支持下直接对叙利亚进行打击极有可能点燃地区战火，而不是解决危机 — — 英国充分认识到了这一点，其议会否决了政府关于英国参与军事打击的动议。

column1: Instead, the US should provide evidence of the chemical attacks to the UN; call on the Security Council to condemn the perpetrators; and refer such violations to the International Criminal Court.
column2: 相反，美国应该把化学攻击的证据提供给联合国；要求安理会谴责袭击者；并将这些罪行诉诸国际刑事法庭。

column1: Moreover, the Obama administration should try to work with Russia and China to enforce the Chemical Weapons Convention.
column2: 此外，奥巴马政府应该试图与俄罗斯和中国合作强制执行化学武器公约。

column1: If the US fails in this, while acting diplomatically and transparently (without a unilateral attack), Russia and China would find themselves globally isolated on this important issue.
column2: 如果美国已透明的外交手段这样做（而不是单方面打击）而遭到了失败，那么中俄两国会在这一重要问题上被全球所孤立。

column1: More broadly, the US should stop using countries like Syria as proxies against Iran.
column2: 更广泛地说，美国应该停滞利用叙利亚等国家作为反对伊朗的代理。

column1: Withdrawal of US financial and logistical support for the rebellion, and calling on others to do the same, would not address Syria’s authoritarianism or resolve America’s issues with Iran, but it would stop or greatly reduce the large-scale killing and destruction in Syria itself.
column2: 撤回美国对叛军的金融和物流支持、呼吁其他国也这样做无法解决叙利亚的独裁主义或解决美国与伊朗的问题，但能停止或极大地减少叙利亚本国的大规模杀伤和破坏。

column1: It would also enable the UN peace process to resume, this time with the US and Russia working together to restrain violence, keep Al Qaeda at bay (a shared interest), and find a longer-term pragmatic solution to Syria’s deep domestic divisions.
column2: 美国还可以重启联合国和平进程，由美国和俄罗斯携手阻止暴力、防范基地组织（符合两国共同利益）并寻找叙利亚深刻国内分歧的长期务实解决方案。

column1: And the search for a US modus vivendi with Iran – where a new president suggests a change of course on foreign policy – could be revived.
column2: 此外，美国还应该重新开始寻找针对伊朗的权宜之计 — — 伊朗新总统的上任可能意味着外交政策的转变。

column1: It is time for the US to help stop the killing in Syria.
column2: 美国应该帮助停滞叙利亚的杀戮。

column1: That means abandoning the fantasy that it can or should determine who rules in the Middle East.
column2: 这意味着放弃它能够或应该决定谁主宰中东的幻想。

column1: Diplomacy and Double Standards
column2: 外交和双重标准

column1: CANBERRA – When does acceptable diplomatic caution and realism become indefensible abdication of moral standards?
column2: 堪培拉—可接受的外交警告和现实主义何时变成了站不住脚的不顾道德标准？

column1: Not everyone on the foreign-policy frontline cares, but those who do often face deeply uncomfortable choices.
column2: 并非所有外交界人士都在乎这一点，但在乎这一点的，通常要面临令人极度不安的选择。

column1: Negotiating a life-saving peace may mean giving amnesty to the murderously guilty.
column2: 谈判救命的和平可能意味着给予罪大恶极者赦免。

column1: Living with tyranny might be less life-threatening than embracing anarchy.
column2: 生活在暴政中可能比接受无政府状态对生命的威胁更小。

column1: Calming a volatile situation may mean not publicly denouncing behavior that cries out for condemnation.
column2: 平息动荡局势可能意味着不公开谴责应该被定罪的行为。

column1: Making the right call is more difficult in the real world than in a philosophy classroom.
column2: 在现实中发出正确的声音比在哲学教室中更难。

column1: But sometimes the line really is crossed, all relevant players know it, and the consequences are potentially profound.
column2: 但有时这条线真的会被越过，所有相关方都知道这一点，而且后果可能影响深远。

column1: The United States’ failure so far to cut off its military aid to Egypt in response to the regime’s massacre of hundreds of Muslim Brotherhood supporters, in the streets and in prisons, is as clear a recent case as one can find.
column2: 美国至今没有因为军队在街头和监狱中屠杀数百名穆斯林兄弟会支持者而砍掉其对埃及的军事援助，这是人人都看到的最新例子。

column1: Former President Mohamed Morsi’s government was a catastrophic failure – ruthlessly ideological, economically illiterate, and constitutionally irresponsible.
column2: 前总统穆尔西政府是一场灾难性的失败 — — 意识形态上冷酷无情，经济上完全外行，宪政上又不可靠。

column1: It deeply polarized a society yearning for a new inclusiveness.
column2: 它将一个渴望新的包容性的社会深深地极化了。

column1: But, had the army held its nerve – and triggers – there is every reason to believe that Morsi would have been voted out in the next election.
column2: 但是，如果军队保持冷静 — — 并且管住扳机 — — 有充分的理由相信穆尔西在下一次选举中将被选下台。

column1: If the Muslim Brotherhood denied a ballot, or refused to accept defeat, tougher measures could then have been contemplated.
column2: 如果穆斯林兄弟会否认投票结果，或拒绝接受被击败的事实，此时再采取更严厉的措施不迟。

column1: As it is, the army’s coup was indefensible, and its slaughter of mostly unarmed protesters ranks in infamy with the Tiananmen Square massacre of 1989, and those of Libya’s former leader, Muammar el-Qaddafi, and Syria’s Hafez and Bashar al-Assad.
column2: 军队的政变是站不住脚的，其对大多手无寸铁的示威者的屠杀堪与1989年天安门事件以及利比亚前领导人卡扎菲和叙利亚的哈菲兹和巴沙尔等人的暴行相提并论。

column1: It is not as if maintaining its $1.3 billion in annual military aid gives the US any leverage over Egypt’s behavior.
column2: 维持每年13亿美元的军事援助并没有让美国获得任何左右埃及行为的能力。

column1: It might have once, but the amount now pales in significance next to the $12 billion in economic assistance recently rushed to the generals by Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, and the United Arab Emirates.
column2: 它或许曾经获得过，但如今埃及将军们从沙特、科威特和阿联酋那里获得了120美元的经济援助，让美国的援助相形见绌。

column1: Certainly, the regime would resent withdrawal of this aid, as would most of the Brotherhood’s civilian opponents; but that matters less than the impact on American credibility, in the Middle East and the rest of the world, of not doing so.
column2: 显然，若撤销这一援助，埃及军方将会记仇，大部分穆兄会的平民反对者也是如此；但更大的影响是不这么做会对美国在中东和世界其他地区的信誉构成冲击。

column1: Unless political leaders know that tearing up the rule book on the scale seen in Egypt will expose them to more than rhetorical consequences, the tacit message – that regimes that pick the “right” targets can repress at will – will resonate in Bahrain, Yemen, and Saudi Arabia, not to mention Syria.
column2: 除非政治领导人知道，像埃及如此规模的破坏规则，给他们带来的后果不仅仅是暴露于辞令上的抨击之下，还有大家心照不宣的信息 — — 军方可以随意选择“正确”的目标进行镇压 — — 这会在巴林、也门和沙特引起共振，更不用说叙利亚了。

column1: Farther afield, the US risks reinforcing the perception that it is comfortable with double standards.
column2: 往更远的地方说，美国也有被坐实安然接受双重标准的风险。

column1: For a country whose global leadership depends as much on its soft power as on its military might, that is dynamite.
column2: 美国的全球领导力取决于软实力的程度不亚于武力，因此这具有爆炸性的后果。

column1: The charge sheet here is already rather full, with multiple instances in recent years of America being almost universally regarded as not practicing what it preaches.
column2: 在这方面，美国的案底已经相当多，近年来，很多例子表明美国几乎总是说一套做一套。

column1: For starters, there was the invasion of Iraq in 2003: Embracing the United Nations Security Council when you get your way, but bypassing it when you don’t, does not do much to encourage a cooperative rule-based international order.
column2: 首先是2003年入侵伊拉克：联合国安理会批准你时就与安理会合作，安理会不批准就绕开它，这对合作性的、以规则为基础的国际秩序来说可不是好榜样。

column1: Then there was the Palestinian election of 2006: Promoting democracy generates ridicule when it extends only to elections that produce palatable winners, as Gaza’s vote for Hamas did not.
column2: 接着是2006年巴勒斯坦选举：推进民主最后成了笑柄，因为它只扩展到产生了合意获胜者的选举，加沙选出哈马斯却不被承认。

column1: Or, again in the Middle East, there has been the blind eye endlessly turned to Israel’s actual possession of nuclear weapons, in contrast to the response to Iran’s possible early moves in that direction.
column2: 还有，同样是在中东，美国对以色列实际拥有核武器视而不见，而对伊朗有核化的可能早期举动一惊一乍。

column1: And there was the 2008 agreement to trade nuclear material and technology with India, despite its unwillingness to accept serious new disarmament or non-proliferation commitments.
column2: 还有2008年同意与印度交易核材料和技术，尽管后者不愿接受严肃的新削减核武器和核不扩散承诺。

column1: To be fair to the US, such double standards abound among other major powers as well.
column2: 平心而论，美国的这些双重标准在其他大国身上也存在。

column1: Russia’s invocation of the “responsibility to protect” to justify its 2008 invasion of Georgia was met with incredulity at the time, and rendered even more cynical by its resolute failure since 2011 to condemn the Syrian regime for mass-atrocity crimes against its own people.
column2: 2008年俄罗斯借口“保护责任”入侵格鲁吉亚就受到了质疑，而自2011年以来，俄罗斯断然拒绝谴责叙利亚政府对本国人民犯下了严重大规模伤害罪行，这引起了更多的抨击。

column1: China’s strategic aspirations in the South China Sea, and its unwillingness to embrace a maritime code of conduct there, sit uncomfortably with its stated concern for sovereign boundaries and the peaceful resolution of territorial disputes.
column2: 中国在南海的战略雄心，及其不愿用海洋法解决南海问题，都与其关注主权边界和和平解决领土争端的说法不符。

column1: And every one of the nuclear-armed states has been guilty of “do as I say, not as I do” in insisting on non-proliferation while making no serious commitment to disarmament.
column2: 每个有核国家都有“照我说的做，别照我做的做”的罪��，在坚持核不扩散的同时不愿许下严肃的核裁军承诺。

column1: To be fair to diplomatic policymakers everywhere, it is often the case that hard choices between competing moral values – for example, justice and peace – simply have to be made.
column2: 平心而论，各国外交决策者经常必须在相互矛盾的道德价值之间 — — 比如公正和和平 — — 做出艰难抉择。

column1: And positions that are claimed to embody double standards are often nothing of the kind.
column2: 被认为采纳双重标准的立场通常不是此类。

column1: A good example is the allegation that the “responsibility to protect” principle is inherently flawed, because the major powers will always be immune from intervention, not only because five of them can exercise a Security Council veto, but also because of their inherent military strength.
column2: 一个很好的例子是指责“保护责任”原则具有天然缺陷，因为大国永远对干涉免疫，不仅是因为五常拥有安理会否决权，也是因为它们所具有的的军事优势。

column1: But this ignores the principle that no military intervention will ever be legitimate unless it satisfies, among other criteria, the test of diminishing, not augmenting, human suffering. And going to war against any of the major powers to protect a suffering minority would certainly trigger a much wider conflagration.
column2: 但这忽略了一个原则：军事干预永远是不合法的，除非它经受减少而不是增加人道灾难的考验，并且符合其他一系列标准。 而为了保护受难的少数派而向大国选战必然会触发更大的战火。

column1: The bottom line is that values matter in international relations, and states that place great emphasis on the promotion of values are extremely vulnerable to charges of hypocrisy.
column2: 总之，价值在国际关系中有作用，极力强调推进价值的国家极易受到伪善的指责。

column1: No state that aspires to win the support or cooperation of others can afford to be seen to be comfortable with unambiguous double standards.
column2: 没有哪个想赢得他国支持和合作的国家能接受被视为安然采取暧昧的双重标准的国家。

column1: And worst of all is to be perceived as being soft on those who, like Egypt’s current military rulers, commit mass-atrocity crimes against their own citizens.
column2: 其中最糟糕的指责要数对那些犯有针对本国人民的大规模暴行的人立场软弱 — — 比如埃及目前的军事统治者。

column1: Why America Will Lead the “Asian Century”
column2: 美国为什么能够领导“亚洲世纪”

column1: SINGAPORE – Not a week passes, it seems, without a big-picture thinker releasing a big-picture book or giving a big-picture sermon describing the gradual eclipse of American hegemony in Asia.
column2: 新加坡 — — 似乎每个礼拜都有一位着眼于全局的思想家发表一部着眼于全局的著作，或者进行一次着眼于全局的演讲，绘声绘色的描述美国逐步丧失亚洲霸权的过程。

column1: True, American power will inevitably decline in relative terms as Asian giants such as China and India rise.
column2: 没错，随着中国和印度等亚洲巨人的崛起，美国的力量相对下降将成为一种不可避免的趋势。

column1: But, at least as far as Asia is concerned, arguments about the end of American hegemony ring hollow.
column2: 但至少在亚洲这块土地上，有关美国霸权终结的论断显得空洞无力。

column1: For one thing, the United States was never a hegemon in Asia.
column2: 首先，美国从来就不是亚洲霸主。

column1: Only some American post-Cold War triumphalists thought it was.
column2: 只有美国冷战后某些胜利主义者才这样认为。

column1: The nature of US power and the exercise of its influence was always much more clever and subtle than most assume.
column2: 美国权力的性质及其影响力的行使从来就比多数人想象中更明智、也更敏锐。

column1: In fact, as India and China rise, the US could actually find itself in a stronger position.
column2: 事实上，随着印度和中国的崛起，美国在亚洲的地位可能会更加稳固。

column1: How can this be?
column2: 为什么会是这样？

column1: After all, power and influence are built on the back of economic success.
column2: 归根结底，经济领域的成功才是权力和影响力的根基。

column1: The Chinese economy has been doubling in size every ten years since 1978.
column2: 中国经济总量从1978年以后每10年都以翻番的速度增长。

column1: The Indian economy has been doing the same since 1991.
column2: 而印度经济从1991年后也实现了同样的增长速度。

column1: In contrast, it takes about two decades for the US economy to double in size.
column2: 相反，美国经济翻番需要大约20年。

column1: Doesn’t this surely mean that Asia is rushing toward a state of multi-polarity – a configuration of roughly equal great powers balancing against each other – while American influence is on the wane?
column2: 这难道不意味着亚洲正快速实现多极化 — — 形成大致对等的强国相互制约的格局 — — 同时美国的影响力正在日益削弱？

column1: The seemingly obvious conclusion would be true but for the fact that Asia has a unique kind of hierarchical security system that came about partly by accident and partly by design.
column2: 如果不是部分出于偶然部分出于设计的亚洲独特的多级安全体系，这个看上去似乎显而易见的结论可能会是真的。

column1: No power can be preeminent if it cannot maintain its military advantage over rivals.
column2: 如果不能相对于对手保持军事优势，就没有哪个大国能够一枝独秀。

column1: Yet, despite the fact that America spends more on defense than the next ten powers combined, it has never been a regional hegemon because it actually relies on the cooperation of other states to remain predominant.
column2: 不过尽管美国在国防领域的开支超过紧随其后的十大强国，但它从来没有成为地区霸主，因为它实际上有赖于其他国家的合作来维持其优势地位。

column1: Without cooperation from allies such as Japan, South Korea, Singapore, and the Philippines, the US could not retain its forward military positions in the West Pacific.
column2: 没有日本、韩国、新加坡、菲律宾等盟国的合作，美国就无法在西太平洋保持其先进的军事地位。

column1: Likewise, the US needs the cooperation of Indonesia, Malaysia, and Thailand to host its critical radar infrastructure.
column2: 同样，美国需要印尼、马来西亚和泰国的合作，来容纳其至关重要的雷达设施。

column1: Moreover, in remaining preeminent, America requires other key states and regional groupings, such as ASEAN, to acquiesce in its security relationships.
column2: 此外，为保持优势地位，美国需要其他重要国家和东盟等地区组织对其安全关系持默许态度。

column1: Thus, there is broad-based regional approval of US alliances with Japan, South Korea, and Australia, as well as with partners such as the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, and India.
column2: 因此，亚洲地区已经就美国与日本、韩国和澳大利联盟以及与菲律宾、新加坡、泰国和印度的伙伴关系达成了的广泛共识。

column1: The key to the effectiveness of these bilateral relationships is that they enjoy widespread support (and thus legitimacy) in the region as stabilizing arrangements.
column2: 上述双边关系有效性的关键之处在于它们在区域内享有非常广泛的支持（以及合法性 ） ， 被公认为是维护稳定的因素。

column1: The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.
column2: 且加在一起的维稳效果大于各部分之和。

column1: Combined with the raw military capacity that the US brings to the table, this means that America is powerful enough to enforce the peace and provide stability for commerce to thrive.
column2: 与美国的强硬军力相结合，这意味着美国拥有足够的力量维护和平与稳定，并实现商业繁荣。

column1: America’s presence and bilateral partnerships are complementary to Asian states’ obsession with counter-dominance and non-interference in the region.
column2: 美国的势力和双边合作关系构成了对亚洲国家在本地区内反控制反干涉目标的补充。

column1: This dynamic “liberal order” – largely fair, flexible, and open enough to welcome new entrants as they rise – will continue to serve Asia well.
column2: 这种动态的“自由秩序”将继续在亚洲起到很好的作用，它在大体上做到了公平、灵活、开放，而且欢迎新崛起的国家加入。

column1: For example, even China has been a major beneficiary of the public goods provided by the US-led hierarchical system.
column2: 举例来讲，就连中国都成为由美国领导的多级安全体系的主要受益者。

column1: This interdependent relationship means that the US is not so powerful, that it can readily ignore the wishes of key states, and it is here that its apparent weakness is actually strength.
column2: 这种相互依存的关系意味着美国并没有强大到可以轻易无视关键国家的愿望，也正是在这方面，这种表面看上去的弱点其实正是其优势所在。

column1: America is not a Hobbesian Leviathan with absolute authority and power.
column2: 美国不是霍布斯哲学中手握绝对权力的集权主义庞然大物。

column1: Indeed, China’s strategists are frequently puzzled by the lack of “balancing” that takes place against the US in the region.
column2: 实际上，亚洲地区在对美问题上“平衡”的缺乏经常困扰着中国的战略学者。

column1: But it is puzzling only if we characterize Asia as being multi-polar rather than hierarchical.
column2: 但只有当我们把亚洲看作多极化而非多级体系的时候，这个问题才令人感到困惑。

column1: In fact, any balancing tends to take place in order to preserve the hierarchy, not to replace or supersede it.
column2: 事实上，任何平衡行为的出现都是为了 保护 这种多级体系，而不是接替或者取代它。

column1: Other states tend to resist bids by any Asian power – be it Japan, China or India – to rise to the top of the pyramid.
column2: 其他国家似乎对任何亚洲国家，无论是日本、中国还是印度上升到金字塔顶端的努力抱有一种抗拒的态度。

column1: As a foreign-based power, the US needs the cooperation of Asian partners.
column2: 作为一股外来力量，美国需要得到亚洲伙伴的合作。

column1: This keeps the top dog in check.
column2: 这使得领头者必须受到约束。

column1: Were an Asian country like China to rise to the top, it would not need the same level of regional cooperation and acquiescence to maintain its position and military footholds.
column2: 如果一个中国这样的亚洲国家坐上头把交椅，它不会需要同样水平的地区合作和认可来保持自己的地位，或拥有军事上的立足之处。

column1: As China and India rise, and Japan becomes more “normal,” they will balance each other within the US-led hierarchy to ensure that the US remains on top and one or the other doesn’t dominate.
column2: 随着中国和印度的崛起，以及日本逐渐“正常化 ” ， 它们将会在美国领导的多级体系中相互制衡，保证由美国占据领导地位，其他任何国家都无法成为主导。

column1: If China makes a bid for regional hegemony, it will find it difficult to resist the structural constraints placed on it within this hierarchy.
column2: 如果中国试图争取地区霸权，它会发现在现有多级制度下的结构性限制很难克服。

column1: US power is in relative decline, but that is no bad thing.
column2: 美国的权力正在相对衰落，但这并不是什么坏事。

column1: False triumphalism breeds poor discipline.
column2: 虚假的必胜信念带来纪律上的松弛。

column1: But a sense of strategic vulnerability breeds interdependency, which has always been the key to successful US leadership in Asia.
column2: 但战略上的脆弱感却能促进相互依赖，而这正是美国成功领导亚洲的关键所在。

column1: China without North Korea
column2: 不再支持朝鲜的中国

column1: NOTTINGHAM – North Korea’s third nuclear test is a game changer not only for the United States and Japan, but also for the regime’s last ally, China.
column2: 发自诺丁汉 — — 朝鲜的第三次核试验不仅对美国和日本来说改变了游戏规则，对其仅剩的盟友中国来说也是如此。

column1: The official Chinese reaction to North Korea’s latest provocation was stern: China is “strongly dissatisfied and resolutely opposed” to the test, and it is calling for the resumption of international talks.
column2: 对朝鲜的最新挑衅中国官方反应极为严厉：中国对核试验“表示强烈不满并坚决反对 ” ， 并呼吁重启国际谈判。

column1: But China’s stance lacks meaningful bite, because its leaders fail to recognize that they no longer need to succumb to their unruly neighbor’s blackmail.
column2: 但这一立场却并未造成任何重大影响，因为中国领导人依然未能意识到：他们已经没必要再继续屈从于这个恶邻居的讹诈了。

column1: In carrying out the test, the North Koreans have once again compromised China’s national interests.
column2: 通过这场核实验，朝鲜再一次损害了中国的国家利益。

column1: The international community is again firmly focused on China’s relationship with its rogue ally, and expects that, as an emerging superpower seeking to reassure the world of its peaceful rise, China will play a constructive role.
column2: 国际社会又开始密切关注中国与其难以控制的盟友之间的关系，并希望中国作为一个想要向世界昭示自身和平崛起的新兴超级大国能发挥建设性的作用。

column1: However limited China’s influence may be, the North Korean regime can sustain itself only with Chinese backing.
column2: 不管中国的影响是多么有限，朝鲜政权只有在中国的支持下才得以维持下去。

column1: With North Korea’s latest nuclear test coming so quickly after its rocket launch in December, the United Nations has good reason to ask China, a permanent Security Council member, to take the diplomatic lead.
column2: 鉴于朝鲜在去年12月发射火箭后如此短的时间内又再度进行核试验，联合国有充分的理由要求中国这个常任理事国带头发起外交行动。

column1: It is simply not enough for China to call, as its official statement does, for the resumption of the Six-Party Talks with South Korea, China, the US, Japan, and Russia.
column2: 仅仅呼吁朝鲜重启六方会谈（与韩国、中国、美国、日本和俄罗斯 ） — —正如中方的官方声明那样 — — 是不够的。

column1: That framework has been thoroughly discredited by North Korea’s repeated violation of past agreements.
column2: 由于朝鲜屡次推翻过去的协议，六方会谈框架早已毫无信誉可言了。

column1: China must warn North Korea that it will not be pressured into providing support even when Chinese national interests have been undermined.
column2: 中国必须警告朝鲜：它宁可让自身国家利益受损也不会为朝鲜提供帮助。

column1: Indeed, China should make clear that, much as it would prefer North Korea to survive and prosper, it could afford to allow its erstwhile ally to implode.
column2: 事实上，中国应当表明态度，尽管也很希望朝鲜能继续存在并走向繁荣，但倘若后者一意孤行，它也有能力承担这个昔日盟友土崩瓦解的后果。

column1: Simply put, the conventional wisdom that North Korea’s collapse would be disastrous for China is misconceived.
column2: 简而言之，认为朝鲜瓦解会给中国带来灾难性影响的一般理念是错误的。

column1: Any crisis sparked by North Korean refugees fleeing across the Chinese border would be short-lived, and international assistance would be readily available.
column2: 由涌入中国边境的朝鲜难民引发的所有危机都是暂时的，而且也很容易得到国际援助。

column1: Likewise, China need not fear a South Korea-led unification of the peninsula.
column2: 同样，中国不需要担心韩国会牵头促进朝鲜半岛统一。

column1: China already enjoys a smoother relationship with the South than it does with the North.
column2: 中国与韩国的关系现在比它与朝鲜的关系要平稳顺利。

column1: Unification would occupy the Korean people for the next two decades, with Japan and the US compelled to inject a huge amount of aid to rebuild and reintegrate the North.
column2: 半岛统一能让朝鲜半岛上的人们忙上二十年，而日本和美国在此期间将不得不注入大量的援助来重建并整合北朝鲜。

column1: This hardly runs counter to China’s interests as it continues its own advance toward becoming the world’s largest economy.
column2: 这几乎不会伤及中国的利益，也无碍其走向世界第一经济大国的进程。

column1: Indeed, if this process were to unfold, the US rationale for keeping its own military forces in South Korea would disappear.
column2: 的确，如果这个进程被展开，美国就不再有理由继续在韩国驻军。

column1: A phased reduction of the American presence would follow.
column2: 接下来就是分阶段的美军撤退。

column1: If the US wished to maintain bases in Korea in the longer term, it would have to secure permission from a proud and newly united Korean nation – hardly a forgone conclusion.
column2: 如果美国想要在朝鲜半岛继续安插军事基地，就需要征得扬眉吐气且新近统一的朝鲜国许可 — — 但这几乎是不可能的。

column1: Moreover, a united Korea will have inherited the North’s nuclear weapons.
column2: 此外，统一后的朝鲜国将会继承前朝鲜的核武器。

column1: This will pose challenges to US-Korea relations, which should work to China’s advantage.
column2: 这将对美国与新政权之间的关系提出了挑战，却对中国有利。

column1: The US will remain committed to de-nuclearizing the peninsula, while the Korean government will be tempted to retain the North’s nuclear capabilities.
