column1: Bannon reinforced the nationalist inclination that led Trump to overrule his daughter Ivanka and his economic advisers by withdrawing from the Paris climate agreement.
column2: 班农强化了特朗普的民族主义倾向，导致后者推翻了其女伊万卡和经济顾问的建议撤出了巴黎气候协议。

column1: And Bannon intruded on foreign policy by getting himself put on the National Security Council for a while, until two of the generals in Trump’s administration – National Security Adviser H. R. McMaster and John Kelly (now the chief of staff) – got him removed.
column2: 班农通过将自己安插在国家安全委员会一段时间以插手外交政策，直到特朗普当局的两名将军 — — 即国家安全顾问H·R·麦克马斯特（H. R. McMaster）和约翰·凯利（John Kelly，现任幕僚长）将他解职。

column1: (Bannon was believed to be behind the recent push to force out McMaster, mainly by suggesting that he is “anti-Israel.”)
column2: （据信班农在幕后推动了近期迫使麦克马斯特下台的动作，主要是声称他“反以色列 ” ）

column1: But Bannon’s role as genius-without-portfolio – in which Trump indulged him, until Kelly arrived and clarified chains of command – was his undoing.
column2: 但班农所扮演的不管事天才角色 — — 特朗普对他如此着迷，直到凯利上任并理清了指挥链条才告终 — — 也是他失败的原因。

column1: Without any defined responsibilities, he intruded where he wished – and ended up with a lot of enemies.
column2: 在缺乏任何明确责任的情况下，他肆意进入他所希望的领域 — — 最终结下了很多仇敌。

column1: He had plenty of time to fight internal battles by feeding reporters stories about his White House rivals, though he would switch someone (for example, former Chief of Staff Reince Priebus) from rival to friend, as convenient.
column2: 尽管他可以很方便地将某人 — — 比如前幕僚长瑞因斯·普利巴斯（Reince Priebus ） — —从对手转化为朋友，但他却花了大量的时间在内斗上，向记者爆料自己的白宫对手。

column1: Bannon was a troublemaker as much as a policymaker – and the two roles didn’t mesh.
column2: 班农既是个麻烦制造者又是个政策决策者 — — 这两个角色根本不相匹配。

column1: Trump also began to see Bannon as a “leaker.”
column2: 特朗普也开始把班农看成是一个“告密者 ” 。

column1: And Trump’s White House is all too leaky: many who work there let reporters know that they have, at best, mixed feelings about working for Trump, but believe the better part of valor is to stay and protect the country from his leadership.
column2: 而特朗普的白宫已经太多漏洞了，许多在那里工作的人都会告诉记者他们对于为特朗普工作的心情很复杂，但是相信最勇敢的事情莫过于留下来保护国家不受这位总统的荼毒。

column1: Bannon’s braggadocio took him to the most dangerous terrain on which to confront Trump: the president’s obsession with his election victory.
column2: 班农的自负也把他带到了与特朗普对抗的最危险地带：总统对选举胜利的痴迷。

column1: The ambiguity of winning the Electoral College vote (not, as he has falsely claimed, by the greatest margin since Reagan) but losing the popular vote by nearly three million votes, dogs Trump.
column2: 赢得了选举团投票（不是像他错误地宣称那样自里根以来最大的优势）却落后了近300万个人选票的纠结始终困扰着特朗普。

column1: That’s why he invented millions of “illegal” voters and had maps printed showing the states he won in red – covering most of the territory of the United States – even suggesting to at least one reporter that his newspaper run the map on the paper’s front page.
column2: 这就是为什么他发明了数以百万计的“非法”选民并在地图上用红色来标识所赢得的州 — — 覆盖了美国的大部分领土 — — 甚至建议至少一名记者在其所属报纸的头版上展示该地图。

column1: Suggestions by Bannon that he played a major role in Trump’s election victory were poisonous to the relationship between the two men.
column2: 而班农所谓在特朗普胜选中发挥了重要作用的说法损害了两人的关系。

column1: And so this White House misfit finally had to go.
column2: 因此这对白宫冤家终于也无以为继了。

column1: Now that Bannon is gone, however, he will hurl missives from his new-old perch at Breitbart, to which he returned the same day as his announced departure.
column2: 如今班农已不在，但他会在布莱因巴特新闻网的老窝里继续大放厥词 — — 他在宣布离职的同一天就回归了那里。

column1: And Trump will still be Trump.
column2: 但是特朗普，还将是那个特朗普。

column1: Why Barack Obama?
column2: 为什么要选择巴拉克·奥巴马？

column1: NEW YORK – The winner of America’s presidential election will inherit a perfect storm of problems, both economic and international.
column2: 纽约 — — 美国总统选举的获胜者将在经济以及国际领域继承由一系列问题组成的完美风暴。

column1: He will face the most difficult opening-day agenda of any president since – and I say this in all seriousness – the man who saved the Union, Abraham Lincoln.
column2: 我可以严肃的讲，他将面临着自挽救联邦的亚伯拉罕·林肯总统以后最艰巨的就职任务。

column1: But a more instructive precedent is 1933, when Franklin Roosevelt offered inspiring rhetoric and “bold experimentation” to a nation facing economic meltdown and a breakdown in public confidence.
column2: 但1933年的先例能给我们以某种启示，当时富兰克林·罗斯福为一个处在经济灾难和公众信心崩溃边缘的民族奉献了鼓舞人心的讲演和“大胆的实验 ” 。

column1: For me, the choice is simple – and not only because I am, by temperament and history, a Democrat.
column2: 对于我而言，选择非常简单 — — 这不光是因为我从天性和历史上看都是个不折不扣的民主党。

column1: The long and intense political campaign has revealed huge differences in the two candidates’ positions, style, and personal qualities. And the conclusion seems clear.
column2: 漫长而激烈的政治竞选过程已经暴露了两位候选人在立场、作风和个人素质之间的巨大差异。

column1: Judgment .
column2: 判断力。

column1: John McCain has shown throughout his career a penchant for risk-taking; in his memoirs, he proudly calls himself a gambler.
column2: 纵观约翰·麦凯恩的职业生涯，他一贯表现出非常强烈的风险偏好，甚至在回忆录中骄傲地称自己为赌徒。

column1: His selection of Sarah Palin, a charismatic but spectacularly unqualified candidate, as his running mate, is just the most glaring of many examples of the real McCain.
column2: 他选择拥有超凡魅力却根本达不到候选人要求的萨拉·佩林作为自己的竞选伙伴，这一突出例证恰好能够反映出麦凯恩的真实个性。

column1: His bravery in combat attests to his patriotism, courage, and toughness, but his judgment has been found sorely lacking time and time again over his career.
column2: 他在战斗中的勇敢证明了他的爱国、勇气和坚定，但在他的职业生涯中，却时常表现出判断力的极度匮乏的弊病。

column1: Barack Obama is tough, too, but in a different way.
column2: 巴拉克·奥巴马也非常坚定，但他的方式却有所不同。

column1: No one should underestimate how difficult it was to travel his road, against incredible odds, to the cusp of the presidency.
column2: 谁也不该低估他所遇到的困难，面对着令人难以置信的种种不平等，他终于登上了总统竞选的巅峰。

column1: But where McCain is impulsive and emotional, Obama is low-key and unemotional.
column2: 但如果说麦凯恩是冲动而感情用事，那么奥巴马的风格则是低调而理性。

column1: He makes his judgments in a calm and methodical manner; McCain’s impulsiveness is anathema to Obama, and rightly so – one cannot play craps with history.
column2: 他以一种冷静而系统的方式做出决策，厌恶麦凯恩个性中的那种冲动，这种厌恶自有其道理 — — 因为任何人都不能拿历史当赌注。

column1: Having seen so many political leaders falter under pressure, I prize this ability above most others.
column2: 因为曾经看到过如此多的政治领袖在压力面前动摇和畏缩，我把这种素质看得比其它多数能力更重。

column1: And Barack Obama has it.
column2: 而巴拉克·奥巴马身上就具备这样的素质。

column1: The economy .
column2: 经济。

column1: The first priority of the new president will be the economy and the financial crisis.
column2: 应对经济和金融危机将成为新总统的首要任务。

column1: Since the crisis hit, Obama has been calm and, indeed, presidential.
column2: 危机袭来后，奥巴马一直保持冷静，的确颇具总统之风。

column1: He consulted the best advisory team in the nation, weighed each course of action carefully, and then issued a series of precise, calm statements.
column2: 他咨询了国内最高水平的顾问团队，仔细权衡了各种可能的行动，而后发表了一系列准确、冷静的声明。

column1: Meanwhile, McCain has veered bizarrely, issuing contradictory statements, “suspending” his campaign (while continuing to campaign), and urging that the first debate be canceled (when it was all the more needed).
column2: 同时，麦凯恩却莫名其妙地改变态度，做出的声明都相互矛盾，他宣布“暂停”竞选活动（而同时却继续竞选 ） ， 并（在首次竞选辩论的必要性越来越迫切的时候）敦促取消这次辩论。

column1: Advantage Obama.
column2: 麦凯恩的自相矛盾让奥巴马占尽了上风。

column1: Foreign policy .
column2: 外交政策。

column1: The most explicit disagreements between the candidates are over Iraq, Iran, and Russia.
column2: 候选人之间最明显的分歧是伊拉克、伊朗和俄罗斯政策。

column1: But there are deeper differences.
column2: 但他们之间还有更深层次的差异。

column1: McCain’s positions, with the notable exception of climate change, suggest that he would simply try to carry out George W. Bush’s policies more effectively.
column2: 麦凯恩的立场除去气候变化这个特殊问题外，表明他只会试图更有效地执行乔治·W·布什的政策。

column1: Obama offers a different approach to foreign policy.
column2: 而奥巴马则会以一种完全不同的方式来处理外交问题。

column1: By starting to draw down combat troops in Iraq, Obama would change the image and policies of America immediately.
column2: 通过开始减少在伊拉克的作战部队，奥巴马将立即改变美国的形象和政策。

column1: By engaging Iran in talks that would cover not only the nuclear issue but other aspects of Iran’s destabilizing role in the region, he would either reach agreements that lowered the dangers from Iran, or he would mobilize a stronger international coalition to isolate Iran.
column2: 通过邀请伊朗参与不仅商讨核问题而且涉及伊朗在该地区其它领域所起不稳定作用的谈判，奥巴马或者能够达成降低伊朗危险性的协议，或者能够动员更强大的国际联盟来孤立伊朗。

column1: Either way, engaging Iran is the right policy, and it is hard to understand why Bush and McCain have continued to hold out against such an obvious change of course, which, if carried out with firmness, will not compromise American or Israeli national security.
column2: 无论怎样，与伊朗保持接触都是正确的决定，很难理解布什和麦凯恩为什么一直坚持反对如此明显的路线变化。 如果新路线得到坚定不移的贯彻，将不会损害到美国或以色列的国家安全。

column1: On Russia since its invasion of Georgia, Obama and his running mate, Joe Biden (who was the first member of Congress to visit Georgia after the invasion), emphasize helping Georgia rebuild its economy and maintain its independence in the face of a continuing Russian campaign against it.
column2: 俄国入侵格鲁吉亚后，奥巴马和他的竞选伙伴乔·拜登（入侵后第一位访问格鲁吉亚的参议员 ） ， 强调帮助格鲁吉亚重建国内经济，并在不断爆发的对俄战斗中保持自己的独立性。

column1: McCain, on the other hand, wants to punish Russia by such actions as expelling it from the G-8.
column2: 另一方面，麦凯恩却希望通过诸如将俄国赶出八国集团这样的方式来惩罚俄国对格鲁吉亚的入侵。

column1: Such measures may ultimately be necessary, but they will not help Georgia survive as an independent democracy.
column2: 采取这样的措施可能最终确有必要，但它们却丝毫无助于格鲁吉亚作为独立民主政体的生存。

column1: Moreover, even after the outrage in Georgia, there are issues of common interest – such as energy, climate change, and Iran – on which the West and the Kremlin must cooperate.
column2: 此外，即便在格鲁吉亚暴行发生以后，西方和克里姆林之间仍然拥有需要合作维护的共同利益 — — 比如能源、气候变化和伊朗问题等等。

column1: This was true even during the Cold War, and remains true today, yet McCain seems not to recognize it.
column2: 这样的现实即便在冷战期间也无法改变，今天也同样如此，可麦凯恩却似乎拒不承认。

column1: Leadership .
column2: 领导力。

column1: In the end, all presidential elections come down to the intangibles of leadership.
column2: 最终，所有的总统选举全部归结为无形的领导力。

column1: The vote for a president is a sort of private contract directly between each voter and his or her preferred choice.
column2: 总统投票是每位选民和他或她所喜爱的领导人之间一份直接的私人合同。

column1: Who do you want to see on your television screen for the next four years?
column2: 今后四年你希望在电视屏幕上看到谁的身影？

column1: To whom do you wish to entrust the nation’s fate?&
column2: 你希望把国家的命运交给谁来掌控？

column1: Here again, the contrasting styles of Obama and McCain offer a clear choice between a calm and confident man and a highly emotional one, between a major change in the nation’s direction and a minor one, between a conciliatory style and a more combative one.
column2: 说到这儿，奥巴马和麦凯恩迥异的风格让你有机会在冷静自信和高度情绪化的两个男人间做出明确的选择，你可以选择让国家方向做出重大变化，也可以选择在大体上维持原来的路线。 你还可以在温和与好斗的行为模式之间做出选择。

column1: Effectiveness .
column2: 有效性。

column1: Finally, in a year in which the Democrats are certain to increase their majority in both houses of Congress, an Obama victory would offer the Democrats control of both the legislative and executive branches for the first time since 1994, and with it the possibility of legislative achievement after years of stalemate.
column2: 最后，在一个民主党人确定会在参众两院扩大领先优势的年份，奥巴马获胜会使民主党人从1994年以后第一次控制立法和行政机构，从而在多年僵局之后出现取得立法进展的可能性。

column1: After so many years of polarization at home and unilateralism abroad, the choice for president seems clear.
column2: 在这么多年的国内分化和国外单边主义之后，很明显该选择谁来担任总统。

column1: Why Big Banks Will Get Bigger
column2: 为什么大银行成了危机赢家

column1: FLORENCE – Severe banking crises bring painful and long-lasting disruptions. But they also lead to surprises.
column2: 佛罗伦萨 — — 我们都认识历次银行大危机的一个产物：痛苦而长期的经济干扰；但它们的另一些产物却出人意料。

column1: The lessons learned in the immediate aftermath bear little relationship to the eventual outcome.
column2: 危机当头，人们都会总结出若干教训，但危机后的世界如何演变，跟这些教训往往没啥关系。

column1: There are immediate and obvious answers to the question of who was to blame, but they rarely correspond with the new shape of the financial landscape that ultimately emerges.
column2: 谁是危机的罪魁祸首，回答这个问题似乎再容易不过，但不论谁受到谴责，这种谴责都不会影响到最终出现的金融新格局。

column1: The crisis that began in 2007 originated in the sub-prime mortgage sector in the United States, and in US banks that were “too big to fail,” prompting many observers at the outset to predict the end of American financial capitalism.
column2: 肇始于 2007 年美国次贷危机的这一轮金融海啸，起源地是美国一些“大到倒不得”的银行。 危机伊始，不少观察家便由此断定，它标志着美国式金融资本主义的终结。

column1: But the banks that were most affected were elsewhere, and the long-term winners will be a few American banks – including some of the most notoriously weak banks – which will get bigger as a result of the crisis.
column2: 然而，如今看来，美国的银行反倒不是危机的最大受害者，其中颇有一些 — — 包括几家出了名的问题银行 — — 居然在危机中坐大，成了长时段上的赢家。

column1: Fueled by the injection of taxpayers’ money, American capitalism is back in force.
column2: 用大把纳税人的钱输了血以后，美式资本主义卷土重来。

column1: The explanation of why the obvious lessons of the crisis are being not drawn lies in the curious character of financial activity.
column2: 为什么危机的教训明明摆在那里，人们偏偏不吸取？ 根源在于金融活动的一个奇怪特性。

column1: Banking is inherently competitive; but at the same time, it is not an industry where competition ever worked very well.
column2: 银行业固然是个存在竞争的行业，但这个行业的竞争，从来都是不充分的。

column1: The core of financial activity depends on reputation, information networks, and the ability to make markets as well as trade on them.
column2: 金融活动的核心在于信誉、信息网、从事市场交易以及营造市场（做市）的能力。

column1: The result is that there are indisputable advantages to being big, as well as the disadvantages that have become obvious over the past two years.
column2: 因此，规模大的金融机构，虽然也具有过去两年所暴露出来的一些劣势，但它们所拥有的优势更是无可争议的。

column1: The market tends to be dominated by a relatively small number of firms.
column2: 金融市场天然倾向于寡头主导。

column1: In the old days, when banking was stable and regulated securely in a national setting, three or four leading banks tended to form an oligopoly: Barclays, Lloyds, Midland, and National Westminster in the United Kingdom; Commerzbank, Deutsche, and Dresdner in Germany.
column2: 过去，金融业在国家层面上受到稳妥监管，整体比较稳定，往往是三四家大银行形成寡头垄断：英国有巴克莱（ Barclays ） 、 劳埃德（ Lloyds ） 、 米德兰（ Midland ）和国民威斯特敏斯特（ National Westminster ） ； 德国有商业银行（ Commerzbank ） 、 德意志（ Deutsche ）和德累斯顿（ Dresdner ） 。

column1: There were always suspicions of formal or informal banking cartels, which would agree on conditions and interest rates.
column2: 一直有人怀疑，存在着正式或非正式的银行业卡特尔，操纵着市场上的放贷条件和利率水平。

column1: Regulators generally turned a blind eye to these suspicions.
column2: 对于此类怀疑，监管者的普遍态度是睁一只眼闭一只眼。

column1: In the 1990’s and 2000’s, internationalization promised to produce a new landscape, in which a small handful of banks would once again divide up a single global market.
column2: 最近二十年，金融国际化趋势渐渐催生一种新格局：一小撮银行瓜分全球大市场。

column1: Banks maneuvered to get the best position to take advantage of financial globalization, which usually meant locating themselves where the regulatory regime was least restrictive.
column2: 各大银行不择手段，抢占有利地形，欲占金融全球化鳌头 — — 最常见的伎俩则是，向金融监管最松弛的地区转移。

column1: Banks got much bigger very quickly, and bigness brought problems.
column2: 银行规模急剧扩张，扩张的规模则带来麻烦。

column1: As they grew, banks found it difficult to manage the multiplicity of their divergent activities.
column2: 伴随着体量疯涨，许多银行都发觉，要管理千头万绪的庞杂业务越来越让人头疼。

column1: They were beset with incompatible computer software systems, rogue employees, and the need to account for the different national cultures in which they were now operating.
column2: 电脑软件系统总是差口气，员工工作效率总嫌不够高，跨国运营所遭遇的文化差异也令人疲于应付。

column1: Almost inevitably, the biggest banks in the world got into trouble.
column2: 于是，银行巨无霸陷入困境，几乎成了一种宿命。

column1: In the 1990’s, the largest banks were mostly Japanese. Who now remembers Daiichi Kangyo?
column2: 20 世纪 90 年代，世界上最大的银行几乎都是日资银行，可如今谁还记得第一劝业（ Dai-Ichi Kangyo ） ？

column1: The financial crisis has produced a new answer to where the greatest competitive advantages lie.
column2: 什么才是金融业最大的竞争优势？ 这一轮金融危机给出了一个全新的答案。

column1: From banks’ perspective, the most obvious lesson was the need for a strong national government to bear the potential costs of a rescue.
column2: 银行这回认识到，国家政府负担金融业救助成本的能力至关重要。

column1: It is no longer best to be subject to the most favorable regulatory regime, but to be where the state has the deepest pockets.
column2: 它们现在想的，不再是到哪个岛国上去享用最宽松的监管，而是如何去傍一个荷包鼓鼓的大款政府。

column1: Very large banks in small territories with small-scale governments are vulnerable.
column2: 小国家、小政府管辖下的大银行很脆弱。

column1: The US is big enough to handle behemoths like Bank of America or Citigroup.
column2: 美国够大，可以帮美银（ America ）和花旗（ Citigroup ）这样的大恐龙擦屁股。

column1: China can handle its large banks, even if they have large portfolios of poor credits.
column2: 中国也能罩着它的大银行，虽然后者的资产组合里颇有一些呆坏账。

column1: European banks are in a more precarious situation.
column2: 欧洲银行的处境就可怜一些。

column1: Ireland and Iceland have become notorious cases where a financial sector metastasized and destroyed the host country.
column2: 爱尔兰和冰岛的金融业畸形膨胀，压垮了自己的国家，让全世界看得目瞪口呆。

column1: Even in France and Germany, large and internationally active banks potentially exceed the government’s capacity to mount a rescue.
column2: 就连法国和德国这样的欧洲大国，政府救助金融业的能力也是有限的，未必招架得住那些跨国大银行惹的麻烦。

column1: In addition, there is the complexity of disentangling which country is responsible for what part of a rescue, when, for instance, Central European banks are controlled by an Austrian bank that is bought by a German bank that is then bought by an Italian bank.
column2: 此外，要搞清楚哪个政府该救哪一块，也是个麻烦事儿，举个例子：几家中欧的银行，由一家奥地利银行控股，这家奥地利银��被一家德国银行收购，那家德国银行的老板又是一家意大利银行 — — 谁能理清这一团乱麻？

column1: As a result, the big transnational institutions are lobbying hard for a pan-European approach to banking supervision and regulation (and implicitly for fiscal bailouts should that supervision and regulation fail).
column2: 所以，几家跨国大行目前正在苦苦游说欧洲各国，希望建立其一个泛欧洲的银行业监管规制体系（言外之意，如果那样的监管和规制再失灵，财政救助也就是整个欧洲的事儿了 ） 。

column1: In the case of the banks that required state rescues, European competition rules are requiring divestment and downsizing.
column2: 至于已经申请国家救助的那些银行，根据欧盟的竞争法规，要对他们进行撤资和瘦身。

column1: Institutions such as Royal Bank of Scotland, which for a time in 2009 headed the list of the world’s largest international banks, are being pruned by the EU’s Directorate General for Competition.
column2: 一度位居国际大行排行榜榜首苏格兰皇家银行（ Royal Bank of Scotland ）这样一棵大树，也正受欧盟委员会竞争总署（ Directorate General for Competition ）的修剪。

column1: Even the stronger banks are being pressed to increase their capital reserves.
column2: 就连相对健康的银行也被迫充实其资本金。

column1: In most cases, this means that they will continue to cut back on lending, worsening the impact of the financial crisis on the rest of the economy.
column2: 这通常会促使它们继续收缩放贷规模，这对饱受金融危机创伤的世界经济可不是什么好消息。

column1: By contrast, in the US, the government pushed big banks into buying up smaller and vulnerable banks, and is now doing everything it can to press them to lend more.
column2: 相反，美国政府正在怂恿大银行兼并弱小和生病的银行，并且用尽一切手段逼它们放贷。

column1: Government reactions are full of paradoxes.
column2: 政府干预的后果十分诡异。

column1: The more we insist that a banking system should be competitive, the greater the risks that individual banks will take.
column2: 越是鼓励银行体系放开竞争，个别银行就越是会盲目冒险。

column1: The more governments are prepared to step in, and the greater the resources of those governments, the more big banks and big countries will be favored.
column2: 政府越是出手干预，干预的能力越是强，就越是有利于大银行和大国。

column1: The last 20 years of globalization saw the emergence of small, open economies as global leaders.
column2: 最近二十年的全球化见证了小型开放经济崛起为全球领先者的奇迹。

column1: The next 20 years will see a different globalization, in which the winners are large, powerful countries that mobilize government resources in the interest of creating winners in the race for financial supremacy.
column2: 未来二十年将会是另一种逻辑的全球化，将来的赢家会是那些大国强国，只有它们才能动员庞大的政府资源，扶植自己的嫡系部队，在金融争霸赛中胜出。

column1: Why Bipartisanship is Good Politics
column2: 为什么两党合作是治国良方

column1: LONDON – Bipartisanship seems to have taken a drubbing in Washington since President Barack Obama got to the White House.
column2: 伦敦-自奥巴马入主白宫以来，在华盛顿的两党合作似乎遭到了重创。

column1: Like most recent American presidents, Obama campaigned on a promise to work with his political opponents for the greater good of the country.
column2: 像最近几任美国总统一样，奥巴马竞选中承诺说为了更大的国家利益要与他的政治对手们合作。

column1: Bill Clinton said much the same thing before he was elected, and then spent his first term in a knockdown fight with Newt Gingrich’s Republican majority in Congress, and his second term fighting off impeachment.
column2: 克林顿在他当选之前也说了同样的话，然而在他当选后的第一任期中对纽特·金里奇领导的在国会占多数的共和党进行打击，在他的第二个任期中忙于击退对他的弹劾。

column1: George W. Bush also said that he would reach out to those who disagreed with him.
column2: 布什也曾说，他将和不同意见的人合作。

column1: He then turned into the most partisan and ideological president of modern times, egged on by his vice-president, Dick Cheney.
column2: 但后来他却变成了现代史上最具有党派观念和善于空谈的总统，并和他的副总统切尼一唱一和。

column1: Obama already appears to have gone further in the pursuit of bipartisanship than his predecessors.
column2: 比起他的前任们来，奥巴马似乎在追求两党合作方面走得更进了一步。

column1: His selection of Republicans for key posts – including retaining Robert Gates as Secretary of Defense – has raised a few eyebrows among his supporters.
column2: 他选择的担任重要职位的共和党人-包括保留罗伯特·盖茨担任国防部长-着实让一些他的支持者吃惊。

column1: But, above all, he has tried hard to secure Republican support for his efforts to prevent the economy from disappearing into a deep recessionary hole.
column2: 但是，最重要的是，在为了防止经济滑向衰退的无底洞的努力上，他已尽力地争取共和党对他的支持。

column1: Only three maverick Republican Senators went along with Obama’s proposals to get the plan accepted.
column2: 只有三位特立独行的共和党参议员同意奥巴马的方案被通过。

column1: And in the House of Representatives, the Republicans unanimously rejected every amendment, every compromise, and every courtesy that he offered.
column2: 在众议院，全体共和党人一致拒绝奥巴马提出的每一项修正方案、每一个妥协的方案以及每一个礼貌的姿态。

column1: Some commentators suggest that Obama made a bad mistake.
column2: 一些评论家认为，奥巴马犯了严重的错误。

column1: First, he promised bipartisanship, but got heavily rebuffed.
column2: 首先，他承诺要进行两党合作，但却遭遇了沉重的挫折。

column1: Second, he and his administration were so busy trying to build consensus that they watered down some of the vital ingredients of the stimulus package, and failed to defend it robustly from Republican attack.
column2: 第二，他和他的政府如此急于要建立共识而淡化了其刺激方案中一些关键因素，在共和党的攻击下没法捍卫其刺激方案。

column1: There may sometimes be a downside in trying to woo your opponents.
column2: 当你试图去讨好对手的时候，有时会产生负面影响。

column1: When they are plainly wrong, why let them off the hook?
column2: 当你的对手明显错误的时候，为什么不反击他们呢？

column1: Here we have had Republicans criticizing an increase in America’s budget deficit after doubling America’s national debt in the Bush presidency’s eight years.
column2: 当美国的国债在布什总统当政的八年里增加了一倍之后，我们却看到共和党人在批评美国的预算赤字的增加。

column1: Moreover, Republicans’ belief that only tax cuts, not public spending, will delivery recovery is a sad example of blinkered ideology.
column2: 此外，共和党人认为只有减税而不是公共开支才能带来复苏，这是不开化脑筋的一个可悲的例子。

column1: But there are more positive reasons for Obama effort at bipartisanship.
column2: 但奥巴马在争取两党合作上的努力也有更积极的理由。

column1: In any democratic system of checks and balances, leaders usually require coalitions in order to get what they want done.
column2: 任何民主的制衡制度，领导人通常需要形成联盟以完成他们想要做的事情。

column1: Moreover, a consensual style is good politics.
column2: 此外，在协商一致的风格是治国的良方。

column1: Most voters – certainly swing voters, who usually decide elections – do not like partisan battles as much as some politicians and their supporters do.
column2: 大多数选民-当然包括摇摆不定的选民，而通常是他们的票数最后决定了选举的结果-和政客以及其追随者不一样，他们不那么喜欢党派斗争。

column1: After all, the wise, the moderate, and the floating voter do not switch on the radio to listen to archconservatives like the American broadcaster Rush Limbaugh.
column2: 毕竟，那些明智的、温和的和无党派的流动选民们不会打开收音机听极端保守派们如美国的全国联网电台主持人拉什·林堡的节目。

column1: When things get tough in politics, as will happen in most of the world as we struggle with the impact of the global recession, every sensible government will try to hang on to the benefit of doubt. It is the most important attribute in politics.
column2: 当治理国家很困难的时候，世界上大多数国家在为应付全球经济衰退带来的影响的时候会将会发生这样的情况，每一个明智的政府都会极力抓住遇事宁愿往好处想的大众心理，这是政治最重要的特性。

column1: Citizens know that running a country, especially in a time like this, is tough.
column2: 公民们都知道，管理一个国家，尤其是在这样的时刻，是很难的。

column1: They are prepared to spare governments from too much criticism, if they think they are trying to do what is right for everyone.
column2: 如果他们认为政府在为之努力的事情对每一个人都是有好处的，他们也准备不对政府过于苛求。

column1: They bridle at a government that must do unpopular things and that also looks narrow and mean-spirited.
column2: 他们为之生气的是尽管政府必须做不讨人喜欢的事，但这个政府看上去心胸狭隘且卑鄙。

column1: There is also a lot to be said for making political argument more civil.
column2: 在让政治争论更心平气和方面，也很值得一谈。

column1: Ronald Reagan had a strong ideological bent.
column2: 罗纳德·里根有着强烈的意识形态的倾向。

column1: He reshaped American politics, pulling the center firmly to the right.
column2: 他改变了美国的政治，他坚定地把中间派拉向了右派。

column1: But he did so without ever seeming to despise his opponents or disparage their intentions.
column2: 但他似乎从来也没有瞧不起他的对手或贬低他们的意旨。

column1: Obama’s aides have confessed that he modeled his own election program on the sunny and optimistic decency of the Republican actor.
column2: 奥巴马的助手曾承认，奥巴马自己的竞选规划是他模仿这位共和党演员的阳光和乐观的正派作风的而制定的。

column1: Civility in politics is not simply political confectionery.
column2: 政治中的礼貌态度不仅是政治糖果。

column1: A leader who respects his or her opponents is more likely to earn respect himself than one who doubts their patriotism and resents their criticism.
column2: 尊重其对手的领袖，比起怀疑他人的爱国主义和憎恶批评的人，更有可能为自己赢得尊重。

column1: One reason for the widespread respect felt for Nelson Mandela is that years of imprisonment did not embitter him.
column2: 纳尔逊·曼德拉普遍受到尊敬的一个原因是，多年的监禁并没有使他产生怨恨。

column1: Jawaharlal Nehru was hugely popular because he was known to cherish free speech, take seriously the views of his critics, and defend their right to disagree with him.
column2: 贾瓦哈拉尔·尼赫鲁非常受欢迎的原因是因为大家知道他珍惜言论自由，认真对待批评他的人的意见，并捍卫他们和他持不同意见的权利。

column1: His role in establishing enduring democracy in India, despite the tensions of caste, ethnicity, religion, and regional loyalties, made him one of the towering figures of the twentieth century.
column2: 他在把印度建成巩固持久的民主国家方面所起的作用，尽管有种姓、种族、宗教和区域忠诚方面的紧张关系，仍然使他成为20世纪的伟人之一。

column1: So my own hope is that Obama will not be dissuaded from trying to work with his opponents, to build consensus, and to deal courteously even with those whose views he may thoroughly dislike.
column2: 所以我自己怀有的希望是，奥巴马不会被说服停止与对手的合作和共识的建立，也不会不再有礼貌地与即使持让他及其厌恶的意见的人打交道。

column1: Personally, I do not think that those whose philosophy deplores the whole idea of government, except when it is required to bail out businesses or banks, and who purport to offer a better future by stitching together the shreds and tatters of policies that helped produce today’s economic disaster, will have much respect or support from voters.
column2: 就个人而言，那些对政府的作用不屑一顾（除了在需要政府为企业或银行摆脱困境的时候）而把那些导致目前的经济大灾难的政策缝缝补补后就声称可以创造更美好的未来的人们，将会获得选民的多大的尊重和支持。

column1: Even in Washington, there is not much to be said for being partisan, unpopular, and wrong.
column2: 即使在华盛顿，关于那些热衷党派斗争而变得不受欢迎和错误百出的现象，也没有什么值得一说的。

column1: Blockchain’s Broken Promises
column2: 区块链的虚伪承诺

column1: NEW YORK – The financial-services industry has been undergoing a revolution.
But the driving force is not overhyped blockchain applications such as Bitcoin. It is a revolution built on artificial intelligence, big data, and the Internet of Things.
column2: 发自纽约 — — 金融服务业正在经历一场革命，但其推动力并不是比特币这类被过度夸大的区块链应用，而是一场以人工智能，大数据和物联网为基础的革命。

column1: Already, thousands of real businesses are using these technologies to disrupt every aspect of financial intermediation.
column2: 数千家实体企业已经应用了这些技术来击穿金融中介的各个方面。

column1: Dozens of online-payment services – PayPal, Alipay, WeChat Pay, Venmo, and so forth – have hundreds of millions of daily users.
column2: PayPal，支付宝，微信支付，Venmo等数十种在线支付服务拥有数以亿计的日常用户。

column1: And financial institutions are making precise lending decisions in seconds rather than weeks, thanks to a wealth of online data on individuals and firms.
column2: 基于大量的个人和企业在线数据，金融机构能在几秒钟内做出准确的贷款决定，而不是几周。

column1: With time, such data-driven improvements in credit allocation could even eliminate cyclical credit-driven booms and busts.
column2: 随着时间的推移，这种数据驱动的信贷分配提升甚至可以消除周期性的信贷驱动型繁荣和萧条。

column1: Similarly, insurance underwriting, claims assessment and management, and fraud monitoring have all become faster and more precise.
column2: 同样，保险业的承保，理赔评估和管理以及欺诈监控都会变得更快更准。

column1: And actively managed portfolios are increasingly being replaced by passive robo-advisers, which can perform just as well or better than conflicted, high-fee financial advisers.
column2: 进取型管理的投资组合越来越被被动式的机器人顾问所取代，而它们的表现相比于时而自相矛盾且收费高昂的财务顾问来说或许一致或更佳。

column1: Now, compare this real and ongoing fintech revolution with the record of blockchain, which has existed for almost a decade, and still has only one application: cryptocurrencies.
column2: 如今，让我们试将这个真实且正在进行的金融科技革命与已经存在了近十年且仍然只有一项应用（加密货币）的区块链应用记录进行比较。

column1: Blockchain’s boosters would argue that its early days resemble the early days of the Internet, before it had commercial applications.
column2: 区块链的鼓吹者会辩解说在实现商业应用之前，其早期阶段类似于互联网的早期阶段。

column1: But that comparison is simply false. Whereas the Internet quickly gave rise to email, the World Wide Web, and millions of viable commercial ventures used by billions of people, cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin do not even fulfill their own stated purpose.
column2: 但是这个比较是错的，互联网很快催生了电子邮件，万维网以及被数十亿人所使用的数以百万计的可运行商业企业，但是像比特币这样的加密货币甚至连其赋予自身的目的都无法满足。

column1: As a currency, Bitcoin should be a serviceable unit of account, means of payments, and a stable store of value. It is none of those things.
column2: 作为一种货币，比特币应该是可供使用的账户单位，支付手段和稳定的价值储备。

column1: No one prices anything in Bitcoin.
column2: 但这些目的它都没能实现。

column1: Few retailers accept it. And it is a poor store of value, because its price can fluctuate by 20-30% in a single day.
column2: 没有人用比特币来标价；很少有零售商接受它；价值储备功能也很糟糕，因为它的价格可以在一天内波动20~30 ％ 。

column1: Worse, cryptocurrencies in general are based on a false premise.
column2: 更糟的是，加密货币通常是基于一个错误的前提。

column1: According to its promoters, Bitcoin has a steady-state supply of 21 million units, so it cannot be debased like fiat currencies.
column2: 根据其推广者的说法，比特币只拥有2100万单位的稳定供应量，因此不会像法定货币那样贬值。

column1: But that claim is clearly fraudulent, considering that it has already forked off into three branches: Bitcoin Cash, Litecoin, and Bitcoin Gold. Besides, hundreds of other cryptocurrencies are invented every day, alongside scams known as “initial coin offerings,” which are mostly designed to skirt securities laws.
column2: 但是这种说法显然是欺诈性的，因为它已经分成了三个分支：比特现金（Bitcoin Cash ） ， 莱特币（Litecoin）和比特金（Bitcoin Gold ） ， 此外每天还会创设出数百种主要是为了摆脱相关证券法律法规而设计的其他加密货币，还有所谓“初始供应币 ” （ initial coin offerings）的骗局。

column1: So “stable” cryptos are creating money supply and debasing it at a much faster pace than any major central bank ever has.
column2: 所以“稳定”的加密算法一面创造货币供应，同时又以比任何大型央行都快得多的速度将其贬值。

column1: As is typical of a financial bubble, investors are buying cryptocurrencies not to use in transactions, but because they expect them to increase in value.
column2: 就像典型的金融泡沫一样，投资者购买加密货币并不是为了交易，而是期望它们能增值。

column1: Indeed, if someone actually wanted to use Bitcoin, they would have a hard time doing so.
column2: 事实上，如果有人真的想使用比特币，过程也会相当麻烦。

column1: It is so energy-intensive (and thus environmentally toxic) to produce, and carries such high transaction costs, that even Bitcoin conferences do not accept it as a valid form of payment.
column2: 这类货币的生产耗能极大（因此毒害环境 ） ， 并附带很高的交易成本，甚至连跟比特币有关的会议也不愿接受其作为有效的支付方式。

column1: Until now, Bitcoin’s only real use has been to facilitate illegal activities such as drug transactions, tax evasion, avoidance of capital controls, or money laundering.
column2: 到目前为止，比特币的唯一真正用途是促进诸如毒品交易，逃税，避免资本管制或洗钱等非法活动。

column1: Not surprisingly, G20 member states are now working together to regulate cryptocurrencies and eliminate the anonymity they supposedly afford, by requiring that all income- or capital-gains-generating transactions be reported.
column2: 不出意料，G20成员国现正通力合作，通过要求对所有收入或产生资本收益的交易进行申报来监管加密货币并消除它们所谓的匿名性。

column1: After a crackdown by Asian regulators this month, cryptocurrency values fell by 50% from their December peak.
column2: 在本月遭受亚洲监管机构打压之后，加密货币的价值从12月份的高点下跌了50 ％ 。

column1: They would have collapsed much more had a vast scheme to prop up their price via outright manipulation not been rapidly implemented.
column2: 如果不是某些方面迅速实施了一项庞大计划来公然操纵其价格，那么这一崩溃还会更严重。

column1: But, like in the case of the sub-prime bubble, most US regulators are still asleep at the wheel.
column2: 但就像次贷泡沫一样，大多数美国监管机构依然在睡梦中，浑然不知危机已近。

column1: Since the invention of money thousands of years ago, there has never been a monetary system with hundreds of different currencies operating alongside one another.
column2: 自从数千年前货币发明以来，从来没有出现过一个有数百种不同货币并存的货币体系。

column1: The entire point of money is that it allows parties to transact without having to barter.
column2: 货币的存在意义在于允许各方在无须交换的情况下进行交易。

column1: But for money to have value, and to generate economies of scale, only so many currencies can operate at the same time.
column2: 但是为了让货币有价值，并且要产生规模经济，只能允许特定数量的货币同时运作。

column1: In the US, the reason we do not use euros or yen in addition to dollars is obvious: doing so would be pointless, and it would make the economy far less efficient.
column2: 我们不会在美国国内使用除美元以外的其他货币（比如日元或欧元）的原因是显而易见的：这样做毫无意义，而且会使经济效率下降。

column1: The idea that hundreds of cryptocurrencies could viably operate together not only contradicts the very concept of money; it is utterly idiotic.
column2: 数以百计的加密货币可以一起运作的想法不仅与货币的概念相矛盾；而且是彻彻底底的愚蠢。

column1: But so, too, is the idea that even a single cryptocurrency could substitute for fiat money.
column2: 而所谓单一加密货币可以取代法定货币的想法也是如此。

column1: Cryptocurrencies have no intrinsic value, whereas fiat currencies certainly do, because they can be used to pay taxes.
column2: 加密货币没有内在价值，而法定货币则有，因为后者可以用来纳税。

column1: Fiat currencies are also protected from value debasement by central banks committed to price stability; and if a fiat currency loses credibility, as in some weak monetary systems with high inflation, it will be swapped out for more stable foreign fiat currencies or real assets.
column2: 法定货币也会受到贬值保护，因为各央行都承诺保持价格稳定；如果一个法定货币像在某些高通胀弱势货币体系中那样失去信誉，它就被换成更稳定的外币或实物资产。

column1: As it happens, Bitcoin’s supposed advantage is also its Achilles’s heel, because even if it actually did have a steady-state supply of 21 million units, that would disqualify it as a viable currency.
column2: 碰巧的是，比特币所谓的优势也是它的致命弱点，因为即使实际上确实有稳定的2100万单位供应量也无法使其成为一个可行的货币。

column1: Unless the supply of a currency tracks potential nominal GDP, prices will undergo deflation.
column2: 除非能货币供应能与潜在的名义GDP挂钩，否则价格就将出现通缩。

column1: That means if a steady-state supply of Bitcoin really did gradually replace a fiat currency, the price index of all goods and services would continuously fall.
column2: 这意味着如果比特币的稳定状态供应确实逐渐取代了某一法定货币，那么所有商品和服务的价格指数将不断下降。

column1: By extension, any nominal debt contract denominated in Bitcoin would rise in real value over time, leading to the kind of debt deflation that economist Irving Fisher believed precipitated the Great Depression.
column2: 此外，以比特币计价的任何名义债务合约将随着时间的推移而出现实际价值上涨，导致经济学家欧文·费雪（Irving Fisher）认为促成了大萧条的那种债务通缩。

column1: At the same time, nominal wages in Bitcoin would increase forever in real terms, regardless of productivity growth, adding further to the likelihood of an economic disaster.
column2: 与此同时，无论生产率如何增长，以比特币计算的名义工资实际上将永远增长，进一步增加了爆发经济灾难的可能性。

column1: Clearly, Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies represent the mother of all bubbles, which explains why every human being I met between Thanksgiving and Christmas of 2017 asked me if they should buy them.
column2: 很显然，比特币和其他加密货币形同于所有泡沫之母，这就解释了为什么我在2017年感恩节和圣诞节之间遇到的每个人都问我是否应该买一点。

column1: Scammers, swindlers, charlatans, and carnival barkers (all conflicted insiders) have tapped into clueless retail investors’ FOMO (“fear of missing out”), and taken them for a ride.
column2: 作局者、诈骗犯、伪专家和拉客仔（都是利益相互冲突的内幕人士）都吃准了无知散户投资者害怕踏空的心理，并把他们骗个干净。

column1: As for the underlying blockchain technology, there are still massive obstacles standing in its way, even if it has more potential than cryptocurrencies.
column2: 至于底层区块链技术，即使它比加密货币更有潜力，但其推广仍然存在巨大的障碍。

column1: Chief among them is that it lacks the kind of basic common and universal protocols that made the Internet universally accessible (TCP-IP, HTML, and so forth).
column2: 其中最主要的是它缺乏可以像互联网那样被广泛访问的基础共同通用协议（TCP-IP，HTML等 ） 。

column1: More fundamentally, its promise of decentralized transactions with no intermediary authority amounts to an untested, Utopian pipedream.
column2: 更根本的是，它关于去中介去中心化交易的承诺如同一个未经考验的乌托邦式白日梦。

column1: No wonder blockchain is ranked close to the peak of the hype cycle of technologies with inflated expectations.
column2: 也难怪区块链在技术成熟度曲线中几乎位于曲线顶端且伴随着虚高的预期。

column1: So, forget about blockchain, Bitcoin, and other cryptocurrencies, and start investing in fintech firms with actual business models, which are slogging away to revolutionize the financial-services industry.
column2: 所以请忘掉区块链，比特币和其他加密货币，并着手投资于那些拥有真实商业模式的，正在为金融服务业带来革命性冲击的金融科技企业。

column1: You won’t get rich overnight; but you’ll have made the smarter investment.
column2: 它们不会让你一夜暴富；但你的投资一定会是更明智的。

column1: Did the Bankers Do It?
column2: 真是银行家干的？

column1: NEW DELHI – Few areas of economic activity in the United States are more politicized than housing finance.
column2: 新德里—在美国，没有什么经济活动领域比住房融资更加政治化了。

column1: Yet the intellectual left has gone to great lengths to absolve regulators, government lending mandates, and agencies like Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac of any responsibility for the housing boom and the subsequent bust.
column2: 但思想左翼在为监管者、政府借贷指令、房利美和房地美等机构开脱造成房地产泡沫及随后的破灭的责任方面走得很远。

column1: The rationale is clear: if these officials, institutions, and policies were held accountable, the reform agenda would necessarily shift from regulating greedy bankers and their bonuses to asking broader questions.
column2: 逻辑是明确的：既然这批官员、机构和政策都是可问责的，那么改革日程就应该从监管贪婪银行家及其奖金转为质疑更宏大的问题。

column1: Might government mandates contribute to bad behavior by private players?
column2: 政府放权有可能是私人行为人不良行为的帮凶吗？

column1: Can regulators be trusted to make appropriate trade-offs between financial stability and mandates that have wide political support?
column2: 可以放心让监管者做出金融稳定和政治支持度高的授权之间的权衡吗？

column1: Indeed, can central bankers be truly independent?
column2: 中央银行真的是独立的吗？

column1: Unquestioning acceptance of a greater government role in taming markets would, in short, give way to asking whether that role can sometimes be part of the problem.
column2: 简言之，不置疑地接受政府在驯服市场上扮演更大作用不禁让人疑问，这样的作用有时也可能成为问题的一部分。

column1: The left has had an easy task in dominating the debate, partly because the intellectual right’s attempt to place all the blame for the crisis on government is thoroughly implausible.
column2: 左派轻而易举地就主导了争论，这部分是因为思想右派将所有危机肇因归咎于政府的做法实在站不住脚。

column1: It is far more defensible and correct to argue that everyone – bankers, households, regulators, and politicians – contributed to (and took credit for) the boom while it lasted, only to point fingers at one another when it collapsed.
column2: 更有力也更正确的观点是，所有人 — — 银行家、家庭、监管者和政客 — — 都在泡沫的持续发展中起了作用，当泡沫破裂时，他们开始玩起相互指责的游戏来。

column1: But bankers’ political tin ear in the aftermath of the crisis – first taking public bailouts and then paying themselves huge bonuses as if nothing had changed – ensured that they got the lion’s share of the blame, with everyone else willing to pose as their unwitting victims.
column2: 但银行家在危机之后的政治不正确 — — 在接受了公共援助后为自己发放大笔奖金，好像什么都没有发生变化似的 — — 使得他们遭受了最大的指责，所有其他人都乐意担任他们的不知情的受害者。

column1: As a result, the public-policy response has been dominated by “the bankers did it” narrative.
column2: 结果，公共政策反应被“这是银行家干的”的论调所主导。

column1: The risk is that this approach is incomplete – and thus unlikely to be effective.
column2: 这其中的风险在于，这一观点是不完善的，因此也不可能是正确的。

column1: It is therefore refreshing to see a careful econometric study take on an assertion by Paul Krugman, perhaps the most influential left-leaning US economist, that “the Community Reinvestment Act of 1977 was irrelevant to the subprime boom.”
column2: 因此，一份仔细的计量经济学研究对也许是美国最有影响力的左倾经济学家的克鲁格曼的“1977年社区再投资法（Community Reinvestment Act，CRA）与次贷繁荣不相关”论点所做的批评令人眼前一亮。

column1: The CRA instructs federal financial supervisory agencies to encourage the institutions that they regulate to help the communities in which they are chartered to meet their credit needs, while also conforming to “safe and sound” standards.
column2: 作为CRA要求联邦金融监督机构鼓励其所监管的机构帮助所在社区满足信用需求，同时需满足“安全稳固”标准。

column1: In practice, regulators measure the volume of lending to CRA target tracts – poor areas with median income less than 80% of the median income of the local community – as well as to low-income and minority borrowers in non-CRA tracts to verify compliance with the Act.
column2: 在实践中，监管者所使用的该法执行检查指标包括CRA目标区域 — — 中位收入低于当地社区中位收入80%的贫困地区 — — 的贷款量以及非CRA目标区域中低收入和少数族裔借款人的贷款量。

column1: The left has dismissed any claim that the CRA played a role in the housing boom by pointing out that it was enacted in 1977, while the subprime boom played out in the early 2000’s.
column2: 左派拒绝承认所有CRA在1977年实施后催生了房地产繁荣的观点，而次贷繁荣在21世纪初结束。

column1: But this ignores the possibility that regulators may have started to enforce the CRA rigorously only later.
column2: 但这忽略了一种可能性：监管者只能在之后大力推进CRA。

column1: To enforce the statute, regulators periodically examine banks for CRA compliance.
column2: 为了加强执法，监管者定期检查银行的CRA执行情况。

column1: To hone in on the “regulatory enforcement” effect, the recent study compares the behavior of banks that are undergoing examination (which takes place over several quarters) to that of banks that are not undergoing examination in a particular tract in a particular month.
column2: 为了增强“监管强化”效果，最新研究比较了被检查的银行（在几个季度中）和在某个月的某个目标区域没有受到检查的银行的行为区别。

column1: The findings are clear.
column2: 结论是清晰的。

column1: Compared to banks that are not undergoing examination, the volume of loans by banks in the six quarters surrounding a CRA examination is 5% higher, and these loans are 15% more likely to be delinquent one year after origination.
column2: 与没有受到检查的银行相比，六个季度中受到CRA检查的银行的贷款量要高出5 % ， 且这些贷款在发出一年后被拖欠的可能性要高15 % 。

column1: In other words, banks undergoing examination lend more and make riskier loans – and these findings are even more pronounced in CRA-eligible tracts.
column2: 换句话说，接受检查的银行贷款更多，贷款风险也更大，这一发现在符合条件的CRA目标区域更加显著。

column1: Good econometric studies examine secondary effects to persuade readers that the main effect is what it is.
column2: 优秀的计量经济学研究还考察了次级效应，以说服读者主要效应确有其事。

column1: Regulators’ primary tool to enforce compliance was their authority to reject non-CRA-compliant banks’ requests for new branches or mergers.
column2: 监管者强化执行的主要工具是拒绝不执行CRA的银行开设新分行或开展兼并活动的权力。

column1: During the subprime boom, large banks were more likely to want to expand, and thus had greater incentive to comply.
column2: 在次贷繁荣期，大银行更可能渴望扩张，因此由更大的激励执行CRA。

column1: The study finds that CRA lending by larger banks does indeed respond more to a CRA examination.
column2: 研究发现，大银行的CRA贷款事实上对CRA检查反应更大。

column1: At the height of the lending frenzy (2004-2006), the study finds that banks loaned even more in response to an examination, and that the outcomes were even worse.
column2: 在贷款疯（2004—2006年）高峰期，研究表明银行因检查而增加的贷款规模更大了，结果也更加糟糕。

column1: The authors speculate that easier loan securitization may have made risky CRA-compliant loans seem less costly.
column2: 作者推测，贷款证券化更加容易可能是为执行CRA而发放的高风险贷款成本下降的原因。

column1: Finally, like all good studies, this one explains why the authors more careful analysis produces results that differ from those in previous studies.
column2: 最后，与所有优秀研究一样，该研究解释了为何作者更仔细的研究产生了与此前研究不同的结果。

column1: Because of the way it is structured, the study only suggests a lower bound on the effects of CRA compliance.
column2: 出于研究方法构造的原因，该研究只揭示了CRA执法效应存在下限。

column1: It focuses on the differential impact of the CRA on banks undergoing examination and those not undergoing examination.
column2: 该研究的注意力集中在CRA对于接受检查和不接受检查��行的效应的差异。

column1: In fact, all banks are likely to have upped their CRA-compliant lending.
column2: 事实上，可能所有银行都提高了它们的CRA贷款。

column1: The study cannot measure this increase.
column2: 该研究并不能测量这一增量。

column1: There is room in economics for grand speculation – some part intuition, some part common sense, and some part ideology.
column2: 经济学具有大胆猜测的空间 — — 一部分来自直觉，一部分来自常识，一部分来自意识形态。

column1: If economists were to wait for careful studies before offering opinions about policy, we would never have anything timely to say.
column2: 如果经济学家等到仔细的研究出现之后再给出政策选择建议，我们就不可能及时发出任何声音。

column1: And it is certainly better to have some economic intuition guiding policy than none at all.
column2: 显然，让一些经济直觉来指导政策比一刀切杜绝经济直觉好。

column1: But there is a danger that the public mistakes speculation for truth, only because of the speculator’s credentials and assertiveness.
column2: 但存在公众将猜测和真相混淆的危险，而公众之所以会混淆，只是因为猜测者的资质和自信。

column1: Studies like this one are useful in setting the record straight.
column2: 类似该研究的研究在让记录变得更直观方面很有用。

column1: More broadly, the study suggests that we should move beyond blaming the bankers.
column2: 从更广的意义上说，该研究证明我们应该不再把矛头一股脑儿指向银行家。

column1: We must recognize that in the desire to broaden home ownership, essential checks and balances broke down.
column2: 我们必须认识到，为了扩大房屋所有权，必要的检查和平衡被打破了。

column1: Households, politicians, and regulators were also complicit.
column2: 家庭、政客和监管者都是同谋。

column1: As we go about the process of reform, we should bear in mind that the only thing worse than fighting the last war is fighting the wrong last war.
column2: 我们即将进入改革程序，此时应该牢记，唯一比上一场战争更糟糕的事情是打了一场错误的上一场战争。

column1: Why Border Walls Fail
column2: 为何边境墙会失败

column1: HONOLULU – Call this the Year of Border Walls.
column2: 檀香山—今年可称之为边境墙之年。

column1: In 2015, Estonia, Hungary, Kenya, Saudi Arabia, and Tunisia all announced or began the construction of barriers on their frontiers.
column2: 2015年，爱沙尼亚、匈牙利、肯尼亚、沙特阿拉伯博和突尼斯均宣布或开始沿国境线建设隔离屏障。

column1: We may live in an era of globalization, but much of the world is increasingly focused on limiting the free movement of people.
column2: 我们也许生活在与一个全球化时代，但世界上很大一部分正日益着重于限制人们的自由迁徙。

column1: At the end of World War II, there were only five border walls around the world.
column2: 第二次世界大战结束时，全世界只有五座边境墙。

column1: Today, according to Elisabeth Vallet of the University of Quebec at Montreal, there are 65, three-quarters of them built in the past 20 years.
column2: 如今，根据魁北克大学蒙特利尔分校的伊丽莎白·瓦利特（Elisabeth Vallet）的数据，全球有65座边境墙，其中四分之三是在过去20年建设的。

column1: And in the United States, Republican presidential candidates are promising more.
column2: 在美国，共和党总统候选人们承诺要建更多边境墙。

column1: The Republican frontrunner, Donald Trump, has repeatedly proposed building a wall along the entire border with Mexico.
column2: 在共和党候选人竞争中领跑的唐纳德·特朗普（Donald Trump）一再建议沿着墨西哥边境全线建立一座墙。

column1: And on a Sunday morning talk show, another Republican candidate, Wisconsin Governor Scott Walker, described building a wall on the US-Canada border as “a legitimate issue for us to look at.”
column2: 在一次周日晨间脱口秀上，另一位共和党候选人、威斯康辛州州长斯科特·沃克尔（Scott Walker）称在加拿大边境建设一座边境墙是“一个我们看来相当合理的事项 ” 。

column1: And yet existing border walls are neither cheap nor effective.
column2: 然而现有边境墙可谓事倍功半。

column1: Israel’s wall in the West Bank cost more than $1 million per mile to construct.
column2: 以色列在约旦河西岸建立的边境墙每英里耗资超过一百万美元。

column1: According to US Customs and Border Protection, building and maintaining the existing 670 miles of border fencing on the US-Mexico border would cost $6.5 billion over the barrier’s expected 20-year life cycle. At this price, fortifying the remaining 1,300 miles of the Mexico border would cost more than $12.6 billion.
column2: 据美国海关与边境保护局的数据，建设和维护现有670英里墨西哥边境隔离障将在隔离障设施20年的生命周期中耗费65亿美元。

column1: Erecting a wall along the 5,525-mile border with Canada would cost almost $50 billion and would cut through an airport runway, an opera house, homes, and businesses that currently straddle the border.
column2: 照此推算，在剩余1,300英里墨西哥边境依样画葫芦的代价将超过126亿美元。

column1: Nor is there much evidence that border walls work as intended.
column2: 也没有多少证据表明边境墙起到了初衷。

column1: To be sure, prisons demonstrate that short, well-guarded walls can be extremely effective at preventing movement.
column2: 诚然，监狱证明了距离较短、看守完善的高墙在阻止人身移动方面非常有效。

column1: But even prison walls are only as effective as the guards who ensure that they are not breached, and guards can be susceptible to bribes.
column2: 但即使是监狱高墙，也只有在看守保证它不出现漏洞时有效，而看守是可以贿赂的。

column1: The recent escape of the drug cartel leader Joaquin “El Chapo” Guzman from a Mexican prison highlights another vulnerability of border walls: tunnels.
column2: 最近，大毒枭“矮子”华金·古兹曼（Joaquin “El Chapo” Guzman）从一间墨西哥监狱中越狱，凸显出边境墙的另一个弱点：地道。

column1: Since 1990, the US Border Patrol has found 150 tunnels beneath the US-Mexico border.
column2: 1990年以来，美国边防局在美墨边境发现了150条地道。

column1: Those with money will always be able to cross borders using fake documents, bribes, or innovative infrastructure.
column2: 只要有钱，就能用假证件、贿赂或创新方法越境。

column1: Indeed, fortified frontiers are most effective at stopping poor migrants and refugees.
column2: 事实上，加强的边境阻挡的大多是贫穷的移民和难民。

column1: And even then, rather than preventing migrants from entering, fortifications all too often funnel them toward more dangerous crossing points.
column2: 而即使是对贫穷的移民和难民，边防往往也不能阻止他们入境，而是驱使他们前往更加危险的越境点。

column1: The result is a mounting toll of predictable deaths.
column2: 结果是可预见死亡人数越来越多。

column1: The International Organization for Migration estimates that from 2005 to 2014, some 40,000 people died attempting to cross a border.
column2: 国际移民组织估算，从2005年到2014年，大约40,000人在试图穿越边境时丧生。

column1: Unlike prison perimeters, borders can be thousands of miles long, which makes them difficult to monitor properly.
column2: 和监狱不同，边境可能长达数千英里，这意味着很难对其进行恰当的监控。

column1: The US employs more than 20,000 Border Patrol agents; but even if they were all on duty at the same time, each would need to guard a 1,700-foot section of the border.
column2: 美国边防局雇用了20,000名雇员；但即使他们同时出勤，每人也需要看守1,700英尺长的边境线。

column1: Of course, equipment like cameras, motion sensors, drones, helicopters, and vehicles allow agents to watch long sections of the border.
column2: 当然，摄像机、运动传感器、无人机、直升机和汽车使得边防人员能够监控相当长的边境线。

column1: But the necessity of monitoring border walls points to one of the fundamental truths about them: historically, most have proved to be pretty useless.
column2: 但监控边境墙的必要性直指一个关于它们的基本事实：从历史上看，它们大多毫无用处。

column1: The most famous sections of the Great Wall of China were overrun within a few decades of their construction.
column2: 最著名的是中国的长城，建成不过几十年就被穿越。

column1: When Germany invaded France in WWII, it simply went around the Maginot Line.
column2: 二战中德国入侵法国时也轻松绕过了马奇诺防线。

column1: The Berlin Wall fell within 30 years of its construction.
column2: 柏林墙也在建成后不出30年倒塌。

column1: Indeed, border guards and their equipment can be equally effective without a physical barrier.
column2: 事实上，边境看守和他们的设备在没有实体隔离障的情况下同样有效。

column1: At best, walls and fences only slow people down, making them a poor investment from a security standpoint.
column2: 高墙和藩篱充其量只能减缓人们越境的速度，这意味着从安全角度，建设边境墙是拙劣的投资。

column1: They are similarly ineffective from a military perspective.
column2: 从军事角度，边境墙同样无效。

column1: Missiles and airplanes can fly over them and tanks can smash through them.
column2: 导弹和飞机可以飞越它们，坦克可以碾过它们。

column1: And yet, despite their high cost and low efficacy, walls remain popular among policymakers and politicians.
column2: 然而，尽管事倍功半，但高墙仍是决策者和政客的最爱。

column1: They provide imposingly tangible evidence that something is being done about migration.
column2: 高墙可以提供铁证，证明他们为移民问题做了些什么。

column1: High-tech surveillance and boots on the ground may be more effective at preventing people from crossing a border, but a wall can be used as a political prop.
column2: 高科技监控和荷枪实弹也许能更有效地阻止人们穿越边境，但高墙可以作为政治支撑。

column1: If Trump ever builds his wall, he should build a really nice one, like the Great Wall of China.
column2: 如果特朗普真的建起了他的边境墙，那么应该会是一座相当漂亮的墙，就像中国的长城。

column1: Then one day it might become a popular tourist attraction – and finally serve a useful purpose.
column2: 有一天它会变成热门旅游景点 — — 也算是终于找到了大用场。

column1: Football Fury
column2: 足球狂怒

column1: PARIS – Who would have thought it?
column2: 巴黎—有谁能想到？

column1: There they were, Brazilians, protesting outside football stadiums against their country hosting the World Cup in 2014 – and this even as their national team was thrashing Spain in the final of the Confederations Cup.
column2: 他们，巴西人民，在足球场外抗议祖国举办2014年世界杯 — — 而与此同时，巴西国家足球队在联合会杯决赛上痛宰了西班牙队。

column1: It was as if Catholics were to protest outside the Vatican against picking a new Pope.
column2: 这就好比是天主教徒在梵蒂冈外抗议选出新教皇。

column1: What cuisine is to the French, soccer is to Brazilians: a matter of the highest national pride.
column2: 足球之于巴西，正如烹饪之于法国，乃国之瑰宝也。

column1: Regardless of their economic, racial, or political differences, all Brazilians are uplifted by having the best team in the world, winning the World Cup many times, and inventing and reinventing “the beautiful game.”
column2: 不论他们经济、种族和政治上有什么差别，巴西人因为拥有世界最强足球队而自豪，他们赢得过多次世界杯，上演过一次又一次“完美比赛 ” 。

column1: Staging the next World Cup in Brazil, as well as the Olympic Games in 2016, even though the football tournament alone will cost up to $13 billion, seems a logical move.
column2: 下一届世界杯和奥运会（2016年）都将在巴西举行，尽管光是世界杯就要花费130亿美元，但这再自然也没有了。

column1: Rio de Janeiro is where soccer belongs.
column2: 里约热内卢是足球的家园。

column1: So what possessed the 19-year-old Brazilian male who told reporters: “We don’t need the World Cup.
column2: 那么，是什么让19岁的巴西男子对记者说出“我们不需要世界杯。

column1: We need education, better health services, more humane police.”
column2: 我们需要的是教育、更好的服务和更人性的政策 。 ” 这样惊世骇俗的话？

column1: Many people feel the same way.
column2: 许多人都有同样的感觉。

column1: Have millions of Brazilians suddenly lost their passion for the game?
column2: 难道数百万巴西人一夜之间失去了对足球运动的热情？

column1: If so, it is not the game itself that they have forsaken, but rather the kind of game that football has become: a billion-dollar business, a prestige object for louche plutocrats, and an extravagant showpiece for corrupt governments and international sporting organizations.
column2: 果真如此的话，被他们所放弃的也不是足球运动本身，而是足球运动所变成的样子：一桩10亿美元的生意，富而不仁的显贵拿它来装点门面，沦为腐败的政府和国际运动组织的奢侈展示品。

column1: Football was once a popular sport, rooted in local communities.
column2: 曾几何时，足球是一项植根于社区的大众运动。

column1: Local working-class boys played for local clubs that inspired fierce loyalty among fans.
column2: 本地工人阶级男孩为本地俱乐部效力，本地俱乐部拥有非常忠诚的球迷群体。

column1: Football chauvinism always contained an edge of violence, for it often included an ethnic, religious, or class component: Protestants versus Catholics (in Scotland); “Jewish” clubs (in Amsterdam, Berlin, London, and Budapest), taunted by fans who opposed the “Yids”; posh clubs (like Galatasaray in Istanbul) and resolutely proletarian sides (West Ham in London); clubs that took pride in a strong regional identity (Barcelona); and clubs that were close to the centers of power (Real Madrid).
column2: 足球沙文主义总是有着暴力之刃，因为它通常包括了种族、宗教和阶级元素：新教徒与天主教徒（在苏格兰 ） ； 被反对“犹太佬”的球迷奚落的“犹太”俱乐部（在阿姆斯特丹、柏林、伦敦和布达佩斯 ） ； 奢侈俱乐部（比如伊斯坦布尔的加拉塔萨雷）和纯粹的工人阶级俱乐部（伦敦的西汉姆 ） ； 以强烈的地区身份为傲的俱乐部（巴塞罗那 ） ； 以及接近权力中心的俱乐部（皇家马德里 ） 。

column1: Some clubs were financed by industrial corporations in order to promote loyalty among their workers: Philips sponsored the Dutch club PSV Eindhoven, for example, while Fiat played the same role for Italy’s Juventus.
column2: 一些俱乐部受产业公司的财政支持，以赢得员工支持：比如，飞利浦公司赞助着荷兰俱乐部埃因霍温，菲亚特在意大利的尤文图斯也扮演着同样角色。

column1: But, regardless of the sponsorship or the location, fans felt close to most of the clubs, as well as to their national teams.
column2: 但是，不管有没有赞助、位于何处，球迷与大部分俱乐部心心相印，对国家队亦然。

column1: They were part of people’s “identity.”
column2: 它们是人们“身份”的一部分。

column1: This is still true to some extent, but something crucial has changed: football, like other types of commerce, has gone global.
column2: 从某种程度上说，这一点仍然成立，但一些关键之处已经发生了变化：足球和其他种类的营生一样，已经走向了全球化。

column1: Thanks to new ownership rules, cable television, product endorsements, and other business-related factors, there are probably more supporters of Manchester United in China than there are in the United Kingdom, let alone in the city of Manchester.
column2: 新的所有权规则、有线电视、产品代言和其他商业相关因素使得中国的曼联球迷可能比英国还多，更不用说曼彻斯特了。

column1: Football teams are now like multinational franchises, with coaches and players from all over the world.
column2: 足球队现在就像是跨国特许精英企业，教练和队员都是全球遴选而得。

column1: But this alone does not account for the kind of alienation from the game expressed by the Brazilian protesters.
column2: 但光是这一点无法解释巴西示威者对足球产生的疏离感。

column1: The worldwide reach of football was preceded by that of the Olympic Games, and it is here where we should turn to understand the corruption of globalized sports.
column2: 论全球普及，足球不如奥运会，而在这方面，我们得回过头来理解一下全球化运动的腐败问题。

column1: Unlike football, the Olympics were always closely associated with elites: amateur athletes recruited from universities, and so on.
column2: 与足球不同，奥运会始终与精英阶层紧密相连：从大学生中遴选出来的业余选手，如此等等。

column1: The father of the modern Olympic Games, Baron de Courbertin, was a French aristocrat who promoted sports to reinvigorate the men of France after their defeat in the Franco-Prussian War of 1871.
column2: 奥运会之父顾拜旦是法国贵族，他推广体育是为了刺激法国人从1871年普法战争的失败中重新振作。

column1: His aim for the Olympic Games was to embody a noble ideal of world peace and brotherhood through athletic competition.
column2: 他举办奥运会的目的是通过体育竞赛实现世界和平和四海之内皆兄弟的高尚理想。

column1: How easily this ideal could be corrupted by distinctly ungentlemanly politics was already clear in 1936, when Coubertin’s doddering speech about peace and fair play was played over the loudspeakers of the Olympic Stadium in Berlin, while Hitler and his henchmen raised their arms to salute the Nazi flag.
column2: 这一理想极易被毫无优雅性可言的政治所腐蚀，1936年就是明证：老态龙钟的顾拜旦关于和平和公平竞赛的演讲通过扬声器飘荡在柏林奥林匹克体育场���空，而希特勒及其亲信朝纳粹旗帜敬礼。

column1: But even without noisome politics, the sheer amount of money required to stage the Olympic Games – the building contracts for stadiums, transport infrastructure, and hotels, together with all the other commercial razzmatazz – was bound to produce a culture of bribery and kickbacks.
column2: 但即使没有臭不可闻的政治，举办奥运会所需要的巨资 — — 建造体育场的合同、交通基础设施、饭店，以及其他各种商业设施 — — 注定会滋生贿赂和回扣文化。

column1: An international elite of Olympic officials arose, living in a self-contained bubble of wealth and privilege.
column2: 奥林匹克官员成了国际精英，他们生活在自成体系的财富和地位泡沫中。

column1: I once had occasion to watch these men as they trooped in and out of first-class hotels in an Asian capital, sleek figures in gold-buttoned blazers.
column2: 我曾经在亚洲某国首都的一家顶级饭店中巧遇这些人，他们金履华服，风度翩翩。

column1: It was striking to see how often the most prosperous-looking representatives came from the world’s poorest countries.
column2: 令人惊异的是，这些最优渥的代表往往来自世界最贫穷的国家。

column1: Football is now like the Olympics (or Formula 1 racing), except that even more money is involved.
column2: 如今，足球就和奥运会（或一级方程式赛车）一模一样，除了它所涉及的钱更多之外。

column1: Football clubs have become the status symbols of newly rich tycoons from Russia or the Middle East, and international competitions, especially the World Cup, have become occasions to bolster the prestige, and sometimes even the legitimacy, of national governments.
column2: 足球俱乐部已经成为俄罗斯和中东新富豪地位的象征，国际足球比赛，特别是世界杯，已经成为彰显国家政府地位甚至合法性的盛会。

column1: Such events reinforce the tendency of modern political regimes, dictatorships as well as democracies, to measure themselves in monumental building projects – giant new stadiums, gargantuan shopping malls, huge conference halls – which are sometimes needed, but often are not.
column2: 这类盛会强化了现代政治体制 — — 不管是民主还是独裁 — — 建造不朽建筑工程的倾向（巨型的新体育场、庞大的购物中心、巨大的会议中心等 ） ， 有时这些建筑是有必要的，但通常并非如此。

column1: As a result, developers, architects, politicians, tycoons, and international sporting officials are now in charge of the beautiful game.
column2: 结果，现如今开发商、建筑商、政客、富豪和国际体育官员主宰了完美比赛。

column1: This adds to their power, wealth, and prestige.
column2: 这增加了他们的权势、财富和地位。

column1: But once they have staged their spectacles, at vast expense to the host country, they move on.
column2: 但他们在康东道国之慨办了盛会后便拍拍屁股一走了之。

column1: This is especially galling in countries where much of the population is poor and deprived of decent schools or proper medical services.
column2: 这让大量人口仍然处于贫困、无法接受体面教育和合适的医疗服务的国家尤其难堪。

column1: Millions of Brazilians have made clear where their priorities lie.
column2: 数百万巴西人明确地表明了什么才是他们最先考虑的东西。

column1: They haven’t fallen out of love with football.
column2: 他们并没有失去对足球的热爱。

column1: On the contrary, by protesting against the grotesque manipulation of the modern game, they are trying to take it back.
column2: 相反，他们在通过抗议对现代足球运动的可笑操纵，试图让足球正本清源。

column1: BRICS Without Mortar
column2: 没有泥浆的砖

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Last month, China’s new president, Xi Jinping, chose Moscow for his first foreign visit.
column2: 美国剑桥—上个月，中国新国家主席习近平选择莫斯科为出国访问第一站。

column1: He and Russian President Vladimir Putin announced a number of agreements and then traveled to Durban, South Africa, for the fifth “BRICS” summit, where they joined with the leaders of India, Brazil, and South Africa to announce the creation of a new development bank that could challenge the dominance of the World Bank and the International Monetary Fund.
column2: 他和俄罗斯总统普京商定了一系列协议，接着来到南非德班出席第五届“金砖国家”峰会，与印度、巴西和南非领导人宣布将成立能够对世界银行和IMF主导地位形成挑战的新开发银行。

column1: The five leaders’ speeches referred to a shifting world order, and Xi said “the potential of BRICS development is infinite.”
column2: 五国领导人在讲话中提到了世界秩序的变迁，习近平表示“金砖国家发展潜力无穷 。 ”

column1: It looked as if the BRICS had finally come of age.
column2: 看起来金砖国家终于成熟了。

column1: Three years ago, I was skeptical about the BRICS. And, despite the recent summit’s apparent success, I still am.
column2: 三年前我对金砖国家持怀疑态度，现在亦然，尽管最新的峰会看上去颇为成功。

column1: Nearly 12 years ago, Jim O’Neill, then the chief economist for Goldman Sachs, coined the term “BRIC” to describe the “emerging markets” of Brazil, Russia, India, and China.
column2: 近12年前，高盛首席经济学家奥尼尔（Jim O’Neil）创造了“金砖”一词描述巴西、俄罗斯、印度和中国四个“新兴市场 ” 。

column1: From 2000 to 2008, these four countries’ share of global output rose rapidly, from 16% to 22% (in purchasing power parity terms), and their economies performed better than average in the subsequent global recession.
column2: 从2000年到2008年，这四个国家占全球产出比重大幅上升，从16%升至22 % （ 以购买力平价衡量 ） ， 在随后的全球衰退中，它们的经济表现也好于平均水平。

column1: For investors, that outcome justified the creation of the catchy acronym.
column2: 对投资者来说，这一结果表明“金砖”一词名副其实。

column1: But then a strange thing happened: the investors’ creature came to life.
column2: 但接下来发生了怪事：投资者的创造物开始活跃。

column1: In 2009, the four countries met for the first time in Russia in an effort to forge an international political organization.
column2: 2009年，四国在俄罗斯首次举行会晤，试图打造一个国际政治组织。

column1: South Africa joined the bloc in late 2010 primarily for political reasons.
column2: 南非在2010年末也加入其中，主要是出于政治考虑。

column1: As O’Neill recently told China Daily, “South Africa is quite fortunate enough to be in the group, as, economically, it is rather small compared to the others.”
column2: 奥尼尔最近对《中国日报》表示 ： “ 南非加入金砖国家何其幸运，因为从经济上讲，它与其他四国相比规模相当小 。 ”

column1: Moreover, its economic performance has been relatively sluggish, with a growth rate of just 2.3% last year.
column2: 此外，它的经济表现也相对萎靡，去年增长率只有2.3 % 。

column1: Indeed, while the BRICS may be helpful in coordinating certain diplomatic tactics, the term lumps together highly disparate countries.
column2: 事实上，尽管金砖国家或许有助于协调某些外交策略，但这个词所指的五个国家之间情况大不相同。

column1: Not only is South Africa miniscule compared to the others, but China’s economy is larger than those of all of the other members combined.
column2: 南非规模太小，而中国经济比其他四国加起来还要打。

column1: Likewise, India, Brazil, and South Africa are democracies, and occasionally meet in an alternative forum that they call “IBSA.”
column2: 类似地，印度，巴西和南非是民主国家，有时候会以“IBSA”的名义搞小团体。

column1: And, while the large autocracies, Russia and China, find it diplomatically advantageous to tweak the Americans, both have different but crucial relationships with the United States.
column2: 此外，专制大国俄罗斯和中国认为这有助于在外交上与美国角力，但两国各自与美国有着各不相同但至关重要的关系。

column1: And both have worked to thwart efforts by India, Brazil, and South Africa to become permanent members of the United Nations Security Council.
column2: 两国也都在致力于阻挠印度、巴西和南非成为联合国安理会常任理事国。

column1: As I wrote three years ago, in analytical terms, it makes little sense to include Russia, a former superpower, with the developing economies.
column2: 我在三年前指出，从分析角度讲，把昔日超级大国俄罗斯纳入金砖国家范围、与发展中国家为伍毫无必要。

column1: Russia lacks diversified exports, faces severe demographic and health problems, and, in former President Dmitri Medvedev’s words, “greatly needs modernization.”
column2: 俄罗斯没有多样化的出口，面临着严峻的人口和卫生问题，用前总统梅德韦杰夫的话说，俄罗斯“急切地需要现代化 。 ”

column1: Little has changed since Putin returned to the presidency last year.
column2: 自去年普京重回总统宝座以来，俄罗斯并没有发生多少变化。

column1: While economic growth benefited from the dramatic growth in oil and gas prices during the last decade, other competitive industries have yet to emerge, and the country now faces the prospect of declining energy prices.
column2: 经济增长因过去十年的油价和气价飙升而获益良多，但除此之外便再无竞争力产业，而如今俄罗斯面临着能源价格下跌的前景。

column1: While it aims to maintain 5% annual growth, its economy was relatively flat last year.
column2: 尽管俄罗斯仍维持着5%的年经济增长，但去年其经济表现相对较为沉寂。

column1: If Russia’s power resources seem to be declining, Brazil’s appear to be more impressive, given it has a territory nearly three times the size of India’s, a 90% literacy rate, and triple the per capita income of India (and nearly twice that of China).
column2: 如果说俄罗斯实力源泉在告竭，那么巴西可谓令人印象深刻，其国土几为印度的三倍，识字率高达90 % ， 人均收入也是印度的三倍（和中国的近两倍 ） 。

column1: But, in the three years since my earlier assessment, Brazil’s performance has slipped: annual economic growth has slowed from 7.5% in 2010 to 1% last year, with a 3.5% rate expected in 2013.
column2: 但是，在我的早先评估做出三年后，巴西的表现有所滑坡：经济增长从2010年的7.5%降至去年的1 % ， 2013年预计也只有3.5 % 。

column1: Like Brazil, India experienced a spurt of output growth after liberalizing its economy in the 1990’s; indeed, until a few years ago, GDP growth was approaching Chinese-style rates.
column2: 与巴西相同，印度在20世纪经济自由化之后出现了产出井喷；事实上，前些年印度GDP增长堪与中国媲美。

column1: This year, however, output is expected to rise by a relatively sluggish 5.9%.
column2: 但是，今年产出增长预计将相对缓慢，只有5.9 % 。

column1: Unless it improves its infrastructure and literacy rate (particularly for women), India is unlikely to catch up with China.
column2: 除非印度改善其基础设施和识字率（特别是女性识字率 ） ， 否则绝无可能赶超中国。

column1: So, should we take today’s BRICS more seriously than the BRICs of three years ago?
column2: 因此，今天的金砖国家比三年前的金砖四国更值得关注吗？

column1: Tellingly, the meeting in Durban failed to produce any details of the structure of the proposed new development bank, suggesting that little progress had been made in the year since the BRICS’ last meeting in New Delhi, where the plan was announced.
column2: 显然，德班会晤并没有就建议中的新开发银行的细节和结构给出多少信息，这表明自上届新德里会晤以来，在这方面并未取得多少进展（开发银行的计划正是在新德里提出的 ） 。

column1: In fact, despite a commitment to launch “formal negotiations” to establish the bank, disagreements about the size and shares of the bank’s capital have not been resolved.
column2: 事实上，尽管做出了就成立新开发银行展开“正式谈判”的承诺，但该银行的规模和出资份额等问题仍有待解决。

column1: That lack of unity is symptomatic of the BRICS members’ underlying incompatibilities.
column2: 如此缺少统一其实是金砖国家内在不协调的表征。

column1: In political terms, China, India, and Russia are vying with each other for power in Asia.
column2: 从政治上讲，中国、印度和俄罗斯是亚洲领导权的竞争对手。

column1: And, in economic terms, Brazil, India, and South Africa are concerned about the effects of China’s undervalued currency on their economies.
column2: 从经济上讲，巴西、印度和南非都担心人民币低估对各自经济的影响。

column1: Three years ago, I wrote that, “BRIC is not likely to become a serious political organization of like-minded states.”
column2: 三年前我写道 ， “ 金砖四国不可能形成由观念一致的国家组成的政治组织 。 ”

column1: The BRICS’ most recent meeting has given me no reason to revise that assessment.
column2: 金砖国家的最新会晤并没有让我觉得有必要修正这一论断。

column1: Why Capital Flows Uphill
column2: 资金为什么会往高处流

column1: LONDON – At first, it seems difficult to grasp: global capital is flowing from poor to rich countries.
column2: 伦敦 — — 起初似乎很难理解全球资本为什么会从穷国倒流向富国。

column1: Emerging-market countries run current-account surpluses, while advanced economies have deficits.
column2: 新兴市场国家普遍录得经常账户盈余，而发达经济体则录得赤字。

column1: One would expect fast-growing, capital-scarce (and young) developing countries to be importing capital from the rest of world to finance consumption and investment.
column2: 年轻的发展中国家增长速度快，资本匮乏，按常理他们本该从其他国家进口资金以支持金融消费和投资。

column1: So, why are they sending capital to richer countries, instead?
column2: 那么为什么事实却恰恰相反，他们在向富裕国家进行资本输出？

column1: China is a case in point.
column2: 中国就是一个很好的例子。

column1: With its current-account surplus averaging 5.5% of GDP in 2000-2008, China has become one of the world’s largest lenders.
column2: 中国的经常账户盈余在2000－2008年间平均达到5.5 % ， 已经成为全世界最大的贷款国之一。

column1: Despite its rapid growth and promising investment opportunities, the country has persistently been sending a significant portion of its savings overseas.
column2: 尽管投资机会诱人、经济也快速成长，中国却一直将很大一部分储蓄向海外输出。

column1: And China is not alone.
column2: 中国的情况并非个例。

column1: Other emerging markets – including Brazil, Russia, India, Mexico, Argentina, Thailand, Indonesia, Malaysia, and the Middle Eastern oil exporters – have all increased their current-account surpluses significantly since the early 1990’s.
column2: 包括巴西、俄罗斯、印度、墨西哥、阿根廷、泰国、印尼、马来西亚和中东石油出口国在内的其他新兴市场经常账户盈余自20世纪90年代初起就显著增加。

column1: Collectively, capital-scarce developing countries are lending to capital-abundant advanced economies.
column2: 资金匮乏的发展中国家向资金充裕的发达国家放贷成为一种集体现象。

column1: Many observers believe that these global imbalances reflect developing economies’ financial integration, coupled with underdevelopment of domestic financial markets.
column2: 很多观察家认为这样的全球失衡反映了发展中国家金融一体化的现状，以及国内金融市场还很不成熟。

column1: According to this view, these countries’ demand for assets cannot be met – in terms of both quantity and quality – at home, so they deploy part of their savings to countries like the US, which can offer a more diverse array of quality assets.
column2: 按照此类说法，这些国家对资产的需求（无论从数量还是质量上）都无法在国内得到满足，因此他们只得将部分储蓄配置到以美国为首的国家，因为这些国家拥有更多样化的优质资产可供选择。

column1: While plausible, this argument suggests that, as financial markets improve over time in developing countries, the global imbalances are bound to shrink.
column2: 这种说法虽然有一定道理，但人们因此可以顺理成章地认为随着发展中国家金融市场的逐步发展，全球失衡的现象必然日渐萎缩。

column1: But such a reversal is nowhere in sight.
column2: 但这样的逆转似乎还遥遥无期。

column1: Why?
column2: 这又是什么原因呢？

column1: A crucial dimension of globalization has been trade liberalization.
column2: 全球化的一个重要方面是贸易自由化。

column1: For China, foreign trade as a percentage of GDP soared from 25% in 1989 to 66% in 2006, largely owing to its admission to the World Trade Organization in 2001.
column2: 对中国而言，由于在2001年加入世贸组织，外贸占其国内生产总值的比重从1989年的25%猛增至2006年的66 % 。

column1: Most of what China and other developing countries produce and export are labor-intensive goods such as textiles and apparel.
column2: 中国和其他发展中国家生产出口的多数是劳动密集型产品，如纺织品和服装。

column1: This has allowed advanced economies, in turn, to produce and export more capital-intensive, higher-value-added products.
column2: 发达国家则反过来得以从事资本更密集、附加值更高的生产活动。

column1: Globalization of trade enabled countries to tap the efficiency gains that specialization in their sectors of comparative advantage has brought about.
column2: 贸易全球化使各国能充分利用专注于比较优势领域所带来的效率回报。

column1: With a slight mental stretch, one can imagine that what a country produces and trades may affect its savings and investment decisions.
column2: 稍微发挥一下想象力就不难想见，一个国家的产品和贸易可能会影响其储蓄和投资决策。

column1: An economy in which the main productive activity is berry picking, for example, has little need for investment and capital accumulation.
column2: 比方说，一个以浆果采摘为主要生产活动的经济体将鲜有投资和资本积累的需求。

column1: Its laborers earn wages, consume, and save part of that income.
column2: 那里的劳动者挣钱、消费，并储存部分劳动收入。

column1: Since the production process requires little capital, there is no demand for domestic investment – and thus no savings vehicles.
column2: 因为简单的生产过程不需要多少资金，国内的投资需求比较匮乏 — — 因此也没有多少储蓄工具可供选择。

column1: Instead, the only way to save is by purchasing capital abroad – in economies with capital-intensive production and demand for investment.
column2: 相反，唯一的储蓄方法是向从事资本密集型生产并有投资需求的国家购买外国资本。

column1: This economy will always export its savings.
column2: 这样的国家总会将储蓄出口。

column1: That may be an extreme example, but it illustrates a more general point about how merchandise trade can influence financial flows.
column2: 这或许是个极端的例子，但却足以证明贸易影响资金流动的普遍原则。

column1: Countries that produce and export more labor-intensive goods – perhaps owing to increased trade openness, or faster labor-force and productivity growth, all of which are true of China – may experience a rise in saving, but a less-than-equivalent increase in demand for capital.
column2: 像中国这样生产及出口劳动密集型产品的国家可能因为贸易开放或劳动力及生产率快速增长而出现储蓄增长，但是对资金的需求却相对匮乏。

column1: Rich countries, by contrast, are able to export more capital-intensive goods, and thus have a greater need for investment.
column2: 相反，富国则可以出口资本更为密集的产品，因此拥有更为强劲的投资需求。

column1: So they may be importing more capital – resulting in a greater current-account deficit – simply because they are producing more capital-intensive goods.
column2: 于是他们可能仅仅因为生产资本密集型产品而要进口更多的资金 — — 从而导致经常账户赤字的增加。

column1: With developing countries – in particular, China, India, and the ex-Soviet bloc – bringing almost 1.5 billion workers into the world economy since the early 1990’s, it is not difficult to understand the potential impact of this effect.
column2: 因为中国、印度、前苏联等发展中国家从20世纪90年代初起即携带近15亿劳动力融入世界经济，上述效应所产生的潜在影响力并不难想象。

column1: After all, much of this labor force was absorbed by labor-intensive industries that eventually churned out products exported to the rest of the world.
column2: 毕竟其中多数人被劳动力密集型行业所吸收，批量制造出各种产品出口到世界各国。

column1: Indeed, that massive addition of labor helped to drive down the relative price of labor-intensive goods, which fell by roughly 15% between 1989 and 2008.
column2: 事实上，这些大幅增加的劳动力压低了劳动力密集型产品的相对价格，该类产品从1989到2008年间价格降低了约15 % 。

column1: As developing countries increased their labor-intensive production and exports, their current-account surpluses rose – by almost 3.6 percentage points, on average, between 1989-1993 and 2002-2006.
column2: 1989-1993及2002-2006年间，随着发展中国家加大劳动密集型产品的生产及出口，他们的经常账户盈余平均增长了近3.6 % 。

column1: China’s current-account surplus increased by almost 11 percentage points over the same period, India’s by 2.5 percentage points, and Russia’s by seven percentage points.
column2: 中国同期内经常账户盈余增长近11 % ， 印度增长2.5 % ， 而俄罗斯则增长7 % 。

column1: These countries, as well as other large surplus economies, such as Brazil, Saudi Arabia, and Iran, all experienced a simultaneous increase in the labor content of exports.
column2: 上述国家及巴西、沙特、伊朗等其他大规模盈余经济体均出现了出口产品劳动力含量同步增长的势头。

column1: This pattern contrasts with that of the United States and many other advanced countries, which have experienced a deterioration of their current-account balances as their production and exports have become more capital-intensive.
column2: 美国和其他很多发达国家的模式则恰好相反，随着其国内生产及出口资本密集度的提升，他们的经常账户余额均出现了恶化。

column1: Many might doubt the view that China is exporting more labor-intensive goods, rather than upgrading its exports on the capital- and skill-intensity ladder.
column2: 中国仍在出口更多劳动密集型产品，而不是提高其出口产品资金和技术密度的说法可能遭致很多人的怀疑。

column1: But trade data suggest the opposite, perhaps because China’s accession to the WTO led to tariff reductions that released more labor-intensive production.
column2: 但贸易数据的显示却恰恰相反，可能因为中国加入WTO所导致的关税下降释放了劳动密集型产业。

column1: In fact, trade data may underestimate the true extent of China’s labor intensity andoverstate the capital and skill intensity of China’s exports.
column2: 事实上，贸易数据可能低估中国真实的劳动力密集度，同时高估资本和技术密集度。

column1: China has witnessed rapid growth in the processing trade: assembling intermediate inputs – imported from countries like the US and Japan – that have high capital and skill content.
column2: 中国经历了加工贸易的飞速发展：组装从美日等国进口的中间零件，这里所说的中间零件本身具有较高的资金及技术含量。

column1: So, while the exports of these final goods may count towards China’s own capital and skill content, the country’s real role was only in the labor-intensive process of assembly.
column2: 因此，虽然上述最终产品的出口可能被算做中国自身的资金和技术含量，但劳动密集型的组装过程才是这个国家所扮演的真正角色。

column1: A country’s production structure may very well determine how much capital it supplies and how much it needs.
column2: 一个国家的生产结构完全可以决定它所需求和供应的资金数额。

column1: So the fact that capital may flow towards rich countries that produce and export more capital-intensive goods should not be so puzzling, after all.
column2: 因此归根结底，资金流向生产并出口资金密集型产品的富有国家并没有什么值得大惊小怪的。

column1: Why China Can’t Adjust
column2: 为什么中国无法调整

column1: CLAREMONT, CALIFORNIA – China’s current economic slowdown has no shortage of causes: Europe’s financial turmoil, sputtering recovery in the United States, and weak domestic investment growth, to name the most commonly cited factors.
column2: 加州克莱蒙特—中国近期的经济减速原因很多：谈得最多的有欧洲金融动荡、美国复苏萎靡、国内投资增长不振等等。

column1: Since exports and investment account, respectively, for 30% and 40% of China’s GDP growth, its economy is particularly vulnerable to weakening external demand and accumulation of non-performing loans caused by excessive and wasteful spending on fixed assets.
column2: 出口和投资分别贡献了中国GDP增长的30%和40 % ， 因此中国经济极易受到外需不振和固定资产开支过度和浪费导致的不良贷款积累的冲击。

column1: But China’s vulnerability to these factors, as serious as they are, is symptomatic of deeper institutional problems.
column2: 但中国对这些因素如此脆弱只不过是深层次制度问题的表征。

column1: Until these underlying constraints are addressed, talk of a new consumption-based growth model for China, reflected in the government’s recently approved 12th Five-Year Plan, can be no more than lip service.
column2: 除非其基础性约束得到修正，否则关于基于消费的增长模式的说法 — — 见于中国政府最新的十二五规划中 — — 就只能是空谈。

column1: After all, China’s major trading partners, international financial institutions such as the World Bank and the International Monetary Fund, and senior Chinese officials themselves have long recognized the structural vulnerabilities caused by excessive investment and low household consumption.
column2: 毕竟，中国的主要贸易伙伴、国际金融机构（如世界银行和IMF）以及中国高级官员本身早就知道投资过度和家庭消费不足导致了结构性脆弱性。

column1: And, for nearly a decade, China has been urged to undertake reforms to redress these economic patterns, which have undermined the welfare of ordinary Chinese and strained the global trading system.
column2: 近十年来，中国一直迫切地采取改革矫正其经济模式，而这拖累了普通中国百姓的福利，也束缚了全球贸易体系。

column1: The best-known feature of China’s macroeconomic imbalances is heavy dependence on exports for growth, which is typically attributed to weak domestic demand: as a middle-income country, China lacks the purchasing power to consume the goods that it produces.
column2: 在中国的宏观失衡中，最著名的便是对出口提振增长的严重依赖，而这通常被归因于内需萎靡：作为中等收入国家，中国缺少消费它所生产的产品的购买力。

column1: With nearly unlimited access to advanced-country markets, China can tap into global external demand and raise its GDP growth potential, as it has done for the past two decades.
column2: 中国基本上可以毫无限制地进入发达国家市场，因此可以充分利用全球外需并提升其GDP增长潜力，这正是中国过去二十年来做法。

column1: If this view is right, the solution is straightforward: China can correct its imbalances by increasing its citizens’ incomes (by cutting taxes, raising wages, or increasing social spending), so that they can consume more, thereby reducing the economy’s dependence on exports.
column2: 如果这一观点正确，那么解决办法相当简单：中国可以通过增加人民收入（通过减税、增加工资和社会支出实现）纠正失衡，从而增加消费，从而降低经济对出口的依赖度。

column1: Indeed, nearly all mainstream economists prescribe this approach for China.
column2: 事实上，几乎所有主流经济学家都给中国开出了这一药方。

column1: But there is another explanation for China’s excessive export dependence, one that has more to do with the country’s poor political and economic institutions.
column2: 但对中国过度依赖出口的现象还有另一个解释，即这与中国政治和经济制度缺陷有关。

column1: Specifically, export dependence partly reflects the high degree of difficulty of doing business in China.
column2: 具体来说，出口依赖部分反映了在中国做生意的高难度。
