column1: It funds the upstream research that generates discovery and invention; supports the creation of new networks, from canals to the Internet; and serves as a creative customer for innovative products, as it did during the computer revolution’s nascence.
column2: 它资助能产生发现和发明的上游研究；支持新网络的建立 — — 无论是从前的运河还是如今的互联网；同时也作为创新产品的消费者，正如其在计算机革命发生时所做的一样。

column1: The state must also preserve continuity in the market economy when the speculative bubble that has funded its transformation bursts.
column2: 国家还必须在引发市场转型的投机泡沫爆破时保持市场经济的持续性。

column1: And here, too, Gordon disappoints.
column2: 在这方面，戈登的论述也不尽如人意。

column1: The only reference to government in his paper is not even to this stabilizing role. Rather, it is to the asserted headwind represented by the very debt incurred to prevent the global financial crisis of 2008 from triggering a second Great Depression.
column2: 其论文中唯一涉及政府的参考文献甚至还不是关于政府稳定作用有关的，而是为了说明防止2008年全球金融危机引发第二次大萧条而产生的债务是“逆风 ” 。

column1: The Truth About Sovereignty
column2: 关于主权的真相

column1: CAMBRIDGE – In the French parliament’s recent debate on Europe’s new fiscal treaty, the country’s Socialist government vehemently denied that ratification of the treaty would undermine French sovereignty.
column2: 美国剑桥—最近，法国议会对欧洲新财政条约进行了讨论，社会党政府义正辞严地否认批准这一条约有损于法国的主权。

column1: It places “not one constraint on the level of public spending,” Jean-Marc Ayrault, the prime minister, asserted. “Budget sovereignty remains in the parliament of the French Republic.”
column2: 它“并没有在公共支出方面形成约束 ， ” 总理埃罗声称 ， “ 预算主权仍在法兰西共和国议会手中 。 ”

column1: As Ayrault was trying to reassure his skeptical colleagues, including many members of his own party, European Commissioner for Competition Joaquin Almunia was delivering a similar message to his fellow social democrats in Brussels.
column2: 在埃罗试图让其怀疑派同事 — — 包括许多社会党同志 — — 放心的同时，负责竞争事务的欧洲委员阿尔穆尼亚（Joaquin Almunia）也在布鲁塞尔向其社会民主党同志传递相同的信息。

column1: To succeed, he argued, Europe must prove wrong those who believe there is a conflict between globalization and sovereignty.
column2: 他指出，要想成功，欧洲就必须证明，那些认为全球化和主权之间存在冲突的人是错的。

column1: Nobody likes to give up national sovereignty, least of all, it seems, politicians on the left.
column2: 没人愿意放弃国家主权，左翼政客尤其如此。

column1: Yet, by denying the obvious fact that the eurozone’s viability depends on substantial restraints on sovereignty, Europe’s leaders are misleading their voters, delaying the Europeanization of democratic politics, and raising the political and economic costs of the ultimate reckoning.
column2: 但是，否认欧元区之生存严重依赖于对主权的约束这一事实表明，欧洲领导人正在误导选民，民主政治的欧洲化进程将因此延迟，最终醒悟的政治和经济成本也会因此提高。

column1: The eurozone aspires to full economic integration, which entails the elimination of transaction costs that impede cross-border commerce and finance.
column2: 欧元区最求的是完全的经济一体化，包括消除阻碍跨国商业和金融的交易成本。

column1: Obviously, it requires that governments renounce direct restrictions on trade and capital flows.
column2: 显然，这要求各国政府抛弃对贸易和资本流的直接限制。

column1: But it also requires that they harmonize their domestic rules and regulations – such as product-safety standards and bank regulations – with those of other member states in order to ensure they do not act as indirect trade barriers.
column2: 但这同样要求各国政府协调各自的国内法规和监管 — — 如产品安全标准和银行监管 — — 已确保这些因素不会构成间接贸易壁垒。

column1: And governments must forswear changes in these policies, lest the uncertainty itself act as a transaction cost.
column2: 各国政府还不能对这方面的政策朝令夕改，因为不确定性本身会就会形成交易成本。

column1: This was all implicit in the European Union’s single-market initiative.
column2: 这些都是欧盟单一市场方案的应有之义。

column1: The eurozone went one step further, aiming through monetary unification to eradicate fully the transaction costs associated with national currencies and exchange-rate risk.
column2: 欧元区则更进一步，旨在形成完全的货币联盟，彻底消除与国家货币和汇率风险有关的交易成本。

column1: Simply put, the European integration project has hinged on restrictions on national sovereignty.
column2: 简单说，欧洲一体化工程的瓶颈就在于国家主权的限制。

column1: If its future is now in doubt, it is because sovereignty stands in the way once again.
column2: 如今，其前景之所以可疑，是因为主权再一次挡在了前进的道路上。

column1: In a true economic union, underpinned by union-wide political institutions, the financial problems of Greece, Spain, and the others would not have blown up to their current proportions, threatening the existence of the union itself.
column2: 在一个以泛联盟政治制度为基础的真正的经济联盟中，希腊、西班牙和其他国家的财政问题不会演变到如今的威胁到联盟本身生存的程度。

column1: Consider the United States.
column2: 就拿美国来说吧。

column1: No one even keeps track of, say, Florida’s current-account deficit with the rest of the country, although we can safely guess that it is huge (since the state is home to many retirees living off benefits that come from elsewhere).
column2: 根本不会有人关心（比如）佛罗里达州对美国其余部分的经常项目赤字，尽管我们可以大胆猜测这笔赤字不会小（因为大量来自其他地区的依靠退休福利生活的退休人士生活在佛罗里达州 ） 。

column1: When Florida’s state government goes bankrupt, Florida’s banks continue to operate normally, because they are under federal rather than state jurisdiction.
column2: 当佛罗里达州政府陷入破产时，佛罗里达银行仍能正常经营，因为监管它们的是联邦政府，而不是州政府。

column1: When Florida’s banks go belly-up, state finances are insulated, because the banks are ultimately the responsibility of federal institutions.
column2: 当佛罗里达州银行倒闭时，州财政不会受到影响，因为说到底银行是联邦机构的责任。

column1: When Florida’s workers become unemployed, they get unemployment checks from Washington, DC.
column2: 当佛罗里达州工人失业时，他们从华盛顿获得失业救济。

column1: And when Florida’s voters are disenchanted about the economy, they do not riot outside the state capital; they put pressure on their representatives in Congress to push for changes in federal policies.
column2: 而当佛罗里达州选民对经济彻底失望时，他们也不会在州首府闹事；他们会对他们在国会的代表施压，要求联邦政策有所反应。

column1: Nobody would argue that US states have an abundance of sovereignty.
column2: 没人会争论说美国各州拥有充分的主权。

column1: The relationship between sovereignty and democracy is also misunderstood.
column2: 主权和民主的关系也被误解了。

column1: Not all restrictions on the exercise of sovereign power are undemocratic.
column2: 并非所有对主权权力的执行的限制都是非民主的。

column1: Political scientists talk about “democratic delegation” – the idea that a sovereign might want to tie its hands (through international commitments or delegation to autonomous agencies) in order to achieve better outcomes.
column2: 政治学词叫“民主授权 ” ， 说的是君主可能甘愿自缚双手（通过国际承诺或授权自治机构）以追求更好的结果。

column1: The delegation of monetary policy to an independent central bank is the archetypal example: in the service of price stability, daily management of monetary policy is insulated from politics.
column2: 将货币政策授权给独立央行就是原生的例子：在维持价格稳定这个问题上，货币政策的日常管理从政治中独立出来了。

column1: Even if selective limitations on sovereignty may enhance democratic performance, there is no guarantee that all limitations implied by market integration would do so.
column2: 即便是对主权施以有选择的限制也有可能加强民主表现，没人能够保证市场一体化所隐含的限制能够做到这一点。

column1: In domestic politics, delegation is carefully calibrated and restricted to a few areas where the issues tend to be highly technical and partisan differences are not large.
column2: 在民主政治中，授权将得到仔细审议，并被限制于有限的领域 — — 那些问题具有高度技术性且党派差异不大的领域。

column1: A truly democracy-enhancing globalization would respect these boundaries.
column2: 真正能够强化民主的全球化会尊重这些界限。

column1: It would impose only those limits that are consistent with democratic delegation, possibly along with a limited number of procedural norms (such as transparency, accountability, representativeness, use of scientific evidence, etc.) that enhance democratic deliberation at home.
column2: 其所施加的限制将与民主授权一致，大致上遵循能够增进国内民主自由化的有限的程序范式（比如透明度、可问责性、代议制、使用科学证据，等等 ） 。

column1: As the American example illustrates, it is possible to give up on sovereignty – as Florida, Texas, California, and the other US states have done – without giving up on democracy.
column2: 正如美国的例子所标明的，放弃主权 — — 佛罗里达、德克萨斯、加利福尼亚，美国各州都是如此 — — 并不一定意味着放弃民主。

column1: But combining market integration with democracy requires the creation of supranational political institutions that are representative and accountable.
column2: 但将市场一体化与民主结合起来要求创造代议制、可问责的跨国政治机构。

column1: The conflict between democracy and globalization becomes acute when globalization restricts the domestic articulation of policy preferences without a compensating expansion of democratic space at the regional/global level.
column2: 如果全球化限制了国内政策偏好的表达，同时民主空间又无法在地区/全球水平进行补偿性扩张，那么民主和全球化之间的冲突就会激烈起来。

column1: Europe is already on the wrong side of this boundary, as the political unrest in Spain and Greece indicates.
column2: 西班牙和希腊的政治动荡表明，欧洲已经陷入了这一错误的区域。

column1: That is where my political trilemma begins to bite: We cannot have globalization, democracy, and national sovereignty simultaneously.
column2: 这就是我的政治三难：我们无法同时实现全球化、民主和国家主权。

column1: We must choose two among the three.
column2: 我们必须在三者中选择两个。

column1: If European leaders want to maintain democracy, they must make a choice between political union and economic disintegration.
column2: 如果欧洲领导人要维持民主，那么他们必须在政治联盟和经济分裂中选择。

column1: They must either explicitly renounce economic sovereignty or actively put it to use for the benefit of their citizens.
column2: 他们要么选择完全放弃经济主权，要么积极用经济主权来为本国公民造福。

column1: The first would entail coming clean with their own electorates and building democratic space above the level of the nation-state.
column2: 前一个选择要求他们向自己的选民说实话，并建设超越民族国家水平的民主空间。

column1: The second would mean giving up on monetary union in order to be able to deploy national monetary and fiscal policies in the service of longer-term recovery.
column2: 后一个选择意味着放弃货币联盟，从而得以实施旨在提振长期复苏的国家货币和财政政策。

column1: The longer this choice is postponed, the greater the economic and political cost that ultimately will have to be paid.
column2: 这一选择被拖得越久，最终必须付出的经济和政治成本就越大。

column1: Economic Policy’s Narrative Imperative
column2: 经济政策的故事动力

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – The best advice I received when taking up policymaking responsibilities in Turkey more than a decade ago was to take “a lot of time and care to develop and communicate the ‘narrative’ to support the policy program that you want to succeed.”
column2: 华盛顿—十多年前我负责土耳其的政策制定，我所听到的最佳建议是“把大量时间和精力花在发展和传达一种‘故事’来支持你所想让其成功的政策计划上 。 ”

column1: The more that economic policy is subject to public debate – that is, the more democracy there is – the more important such policy narratives are.
column2: 经济政策越是容易引起公共争论 — — 即民主成分越多 — — 政策故事的重要性就越大。

column1: The crisis faced by the European Union and the eurozone is a telling example of the need for a narrative that explains public policy and generates political support for it.
column2: 欧盟和欧元区所面临的危机就是很好的例子，说明了能解释公共政策并激发对政策的政治支持的故事的重要性。

column1: A successful narrative can be neither too complicated nor simplistic.
column2: 成功的故事既不能太复杂，也不能太简单。

column1: It must capture the imagination, address the public’s anxieties, and generate realistic hope.
column2: 它必须抓住眼球、解决公众的焦虑并激发现实希望。

column1: Voters often sense cheap populism.
column2: 选民通常会感冒于廉价的民粹主义。

column1: European Central Bank President Mario Draghi provided such a narrative to the financial markets last July.
column2: 去年7月，欧洲中央银行行长德拉吉就为金融市场提供了这样一种故事。

column1: He said that the ECB would do everything necessary to prevent the disintegration of the euro, adding simply: “Believe me, it will be enough.”
column2: 他说欧洲央行将做任何该做之事防止欧元解体，并且言简意赅地加了一句 ： “ 相信我，这就够了 。 ”

column1: With that sentence, Draghi eliminated the perceived re-denomination tail risk that was highest in the case of Greece, but that was driving up borrowing costs in Spain, Italy, and Portugal as well.
column2: 德拉吉用这句话消除了人们所感到的重新计价尾部风险 — — 这一风险在希��最高，但也推高了西班牙、意大利和葡萄牙的借贷成本。

column1: It was not a populist message, because the ECB does indeed have the firepower to buy enough sovereign bonds on the secondary market to put a ceiling on interest rates, at least for many months.
column2: 这不是民粹主义说辞，因为欧洲央行真有在二级市场购买足够多主权证券从而将利率限制在某个水平之下的实力，至少在若干个月内是如此。

column1: Central bankers, more generally, are typically able to provide short- or medium-term narratives to financial markets.
column2: 更一般地说，央行行长通常都有能力向市场提供短期和中期故事。

column1: US Federal Reserve Board Chairman Ben Bernanke provided his own by pledging that US short-term interest rates would remain very low, and the Bank of Japan’s new chairman, Haruhiko Kuroda, has just provided another by saying that he will double the money supply so that inflation reaches 2%.
column2: 美联储主席伯南克也这么做了 — — 他承诺美国短期利率将维持极低水平；日本银行新行长黑田东彦最近也如法炮制了一次 — — 他宣布会将货币供应量扩大一倍，让通胀达到2 % 。

column1: While central bankers can provide such narratives to financial markets, it is political leaders who must provide the overall socioeconomic messages that encourage long-term real investment, electoral support for reform, and hope for the future.
column2: 尽管央行行长可以向金融市场提供这类故事，但要鼓励长期真实投资、激发选民支持改革、点燃未来希望，还是要靠政治领袖给出总体社会经济承诺。

column1: Central bank alchemy, to borrow a term from the US journalist Neil Irwin’s new book, has its limits.
column2: 央行炼金术 — — 借用美国记者尼尔·埃尔文（Neil Irwin）新著的用词 — — 总归有限。

column1: Europe, in particular, needs a narrative of long-term hope that will trigger a real recovery.
column2: 特别是欧洲，它需要带来长期希望的故事，触发真正的复苏。

column1: France is coming closer to the danger zone, and even Germany’s annual GDP growth is falling well below 1% per year.
column2: 法国正在接近危险区，甚至德国的年GDP增长也会大大低于每年1 % 。

column1: In the meantime, the easing of sovereign interest-rate spreads provides little comfort to the growing army of unemployed in southern Europe, where youth unemployment has reached dramatic heights – close to 60% in Greece and Spain, and almost 40% in Italy.
column2: 与此同时，主权利差的放松并没有让南欧日渐庞大的失业大军更好过 — — 年轻人失业纷纷达到了极高的数字，希腊和西班牙接近60 % ， 意大利接近40 % 。

column1: The narrative should address three essential questions.
column2: 故事要解决三大关键问题。

column1: How can the European model of strong social solidarity and security be reformed, but endure?
column2: 欧洲强大的社会团结和安全模式如何改革并维系？

column1: How can economic growth be revived and sustained throughout the EU?
column2: 如何重振经济增长并在整个欧盟维持？

column1: And how can Europe’s institutions function with enhanced legitimacy to accommodate countries that share the euro and others that retain their national currencies?
column2: 如何增加欧洲机构的合法性以协调共用欧元和保有本国货币的国家？

column1: For starters, a revolution is required in the organization of work, learning, and leisure.
column2: 首先，工作、学习和休闲的组织必须改变。

column1: Social solidarity, essential to European identity, can and must include longer work lives, but also more work-sharing, adult learning, and shorter average work weeks (particularly close to retirement).
column2: 社会团结是欧洲身份认同的关键，它可以并必须包括更长的工作寿命，也可以并必须包括更大的工作共担、成人教育和更短的工作周（特别是在接近退休时 ） 。

column1: Such flexibility requires the consent of all: employees must adjust to changing requirements; employers must re-organize their enterprises to allow more work-sharing, work from home, and learning intervals; and governments must overhaul taxes, income support, and regulation to promote a “flex-solidarity revolution” that encourages personal choice and responsibility, while remaining committed to social cohesion.
column2: 如此灵活度要求所有人的一致意见：雇员必须调整适应变化的要求；雇主必须重新组织企业允许更多的工作分担、在家办公和脱产学习；政府必须修正税收、收入支持和监管以促进鼓励个人选择和责任的“灵活团结革命 ” ， 同时继续致力于增进社会凝聚。

column1: This can lead to a better future for all, with citizens gaining better access to adult education, having more free time to pursue personal interests, and remaining productive and occupationally engaged far longer into their healthy lives.
column2: 这能给所有人带来更加美好的未来，公民有更多的机会获得成人教育，拥有更多的自由时间追求个人兴趣，并大大延长健康岁月的生产率和就业时间。

column1: Europe does not need Asia’s rates of economic growth.
column2: 欧洲不需要亚洲那样的经济增长率。

column1: It can secure decent jobs and prosperity, with a sustained annual growth rate of around 2%.
column2: 2%左右的持续年增长率就可以让它保持体面的就业和繁荣。

column1: To achieve that, German voters should be told not that their country’s resources will forever flow to Spain, but that their wages can rise at twice the rate of the recent past without risking inflation or a current-account deficit, because Germany has the world’s largest external surplus.
column2: 要达到这一点，德国选民应该明白该国的资源将永远流向西班牙，但他们的工资可以以两倍于当前的速度增长而不导致通货膨胀和经常项目赤字，因为德国拥有世界最大的外部盈余。

column1: Service-sector industries throughout the EU must be opened up.
column2: 整个欧盟的服务行业必须开放。

column1: The countries with stronger fiscal positions should take the lead in a major pan-European skill-upgrading program.
column2: 财政状况更好的国家应该率先推出大规模泛欧洲技能升级计划。

column1: The number of pan-European scholarships should be doubled.
column2: 泛欧洲奖学金数量应该翻番。

column1: School programs everywhere should aim to educate trilingual citizens.
column2: 各地学校项目应该定位于培养能说三种语言的公民。

column1: Moreover, a full European banking union with shared resources for resolution should be created without further delay.
column2: 此外，应该成立清算资源共享的完全的欧洲银行联盟，这一点已不容再拖。

column1: The European Investment Bank, which received a significant capital increase in 2012, should add a large investment-support program for medium-size enterprises to its current operations, with a subsidy financed from the European budget to encourage first-time job takers for a limited period.
column2: 2012年，欧洲投资银行的资本金获得了极大提升，它应该在现有业务的基础上增加一个面向中等企业的投资支持计划，由欧洲预算出资为初次就业者提供临时性津贴以示鼓励。

column1: Jobs and training for young people must be the centerpiece for the new growth pact, and projects must move ahead in “crisis mode,” rather than according to business as usual.
column2: 新增长契约必须以年轻人就业和培训为核心，各项目必须对“危机模式”未雨绸缪，而不是根据正常情况的业务模式制定。

column1: Finally, while monetary union obviously requires greater sharing of sovereignty, there should also be a “greater Europe” that includes the United Kingdom and others.
column2: 最后，货币联盟明确要求更大程度的主权共享，与此同时，也应该有一个包括英国和其他国家在内的“大欧洲 ” 。

column1: This implies two-tier institutions that can accommodate both types of countries: the “euro-ins” and those that prefer to preserve their monetary sovereignty in a larger Europe built around a vibrant single market and common democratic values.
column2: 这意味着两套机构共存，以协调两种国家 ： “ 欧元国 ” （ euro-in）和更愿意在以强健的单一市场和共同民主价值为基础的大欧洲中保留货币主权的国家。

column1: These interconnected visions can and must be realized if Europe is to thrive again.
column2: 这些相互交融的愿景可以也必须实现，如果欧洲意在重振雄风的话。

column1: Together, they form a compelling narrative that European leaders must begin to articulate.
column2: 它们合在一起就形成了欧洲领导人必须现在就开始宣扬的故事。

column1: Why Eurobonds are Un-American
column2: 为什么说欧元债券不是美国式的

column1: BRUSSELS – The emerging consensus in Europe nowadays is that only “debt mutualization” in the form of Eurobonds can resolve the euro crisis, with advocates frequently citing the early United States, when Alexander Hamilton, President George Washington’s treasury secretary, successfully pressed the new federal government to assume the Revolutionary War debts of America’s states.
column2: 布鲁塞尔—目前，欧洲的新共识是只有通过欧元债券将“债务共同化”才能拯救欧元危机，该方案的鼓吹者频繁引用美国早期的历史，当时华盛顿政府的财政部长汉密尔顿成功地迫使新联邦政府揽下美国各州的独立战争债。

column1: But a closer look reveals that this early US experience provides neither a useful analogy nor an encouraging precedent for Eurobonds.
column2: 但若更仔细地考察就能发现，美国建国之初的经验既算不上是有用的类比，也绝不是欧洲债券令人鼓舞的先例。

column1: First, taking over a stock of existing state debt at the federal level is very different from allowing individual member states to issue bonds with “joint and several” liability underwritten by all member states collectively.
column2: 首先，揽下现存州债务转换为联邦债务与允许个别成员国发行所有成员国共同兜底的“连带”责任债券是截然不同的。

column1: Hamilton did not have to worry about moral hazard, because the federal government did not guarantee any new debt incurred by the states.
column2: 汉密尔顿并不需要担心道德风险，因为联邦政府并不对任何州级新债提供担保。

column1: Second, it is seldom mentioned that US federal debt at the time (around $40 million) was much larger than that of the states (about $18 million).
column2: 其次，很少被提及的是，当时美国联邦债务（约4000万美元）比各州债务（约1800万美元）多得多。

column1: Thus, assuming state debt was not central to the success of post-war financial stabilization in the new country; rather, it was a natural corollary of the fact that most of the debt had been incurred fighting for a common cause.
column2: 因此，将州债务揽下并不是美国独立战争后实现金融稳定性的中心原因，相反，这只是大部分债务起源于为统统目标而战这一事实的自然结果。

column1: Moreover, the most efficient sources of government revenues at the time were tariffs and taxes collected at the external border.
column2: 此外，当时，最高效的的政府收入之源是关税和取自外部边界的税收。

column1: Even from an efficiency point of view, it made sense to have the federal government service public debt.
column2: 即使从有效性的角度看，让联邦政府来为公债买单也是有道理可循的。

column1: Federal assumption of the states’ war debts also yielded an advantage in terms of economic development: once states no longer had any debt, they had no need to raise any revenues through direct taxation, which might have impeded the growth of America’s internal market.
column2: 联邦将各州战争债揽下还产生了经济发展的优势：各州卸下了战无负担，因此不必通过可能阻碍美国内部市场发展的直接税开源。

column1: Indeed, after the federal government assumed the states’ debt (already a small part of the total), state revenues fell by 80-90%.
column2: 事实上，在联邦政府揽下各州债务（只是总债务的小头）后，各州岁入下降了80—90 % 。

column1: The states then became for some time fiscally irrelevant.
column2: 各州也因此在一段时间内不必担心财政状况。

column1: Finally, the key to the success of financial stabilization was a profound restructuring.
column2: 最后，金融稳定成功的关键是深化重组。

column1: Hamilton estimated that the federal government could raise enough revenues to pay approximately 4% interest on the total amount of debt to be serviced – significantly less than the 6% yield on the existing obligations.
column2: 汉密尔顿估算，联邦政府能够征收足够的岁入承担的总债务4%的利率 — — 比当时债务存量6%的收益率低多了。

column1: Holders of both state and federal bonds were thus offered a basket of long-dated bonds, some with an interest rate of 3%, and others with 6 % (with a ten-year grace period).
column2: 州债券和联邦债券持有者将获得一篮子长期债券，其中一些利率为3 % ， 另一些为6 % （ 但有10年宽限期 ） 。

column1: The basket was designed in such a way as to result in an average debt-service cost of 4%.
column2: 这个债务篮子的平均债务利息成本的4 % 。

column1: In modern terms, the “net present value” of the total debt (federal and state) was reduced by about one-half if one were to apply the usual exit yield of 9%.
column2: 从现代观点看，这样一来，与以当时常见的到期收益率9%相比，总债务（包括联邦债务和州债务）的“净现值”被削减了一半。

column1: Moreover, the new federal bonds’ very long maturities meant that there was no rollover risk.
column2: 此外，新的联邦债券极长的到期期限意味着不存在展期风险。

column1: It would have been very dangerous to expose the federal government to this danger, given that the operation was rightly perceived at the outset as extremely risky.
column2: 联邦政府暴露于这一风险之下是十分危险的，如果这一操作从一开始就被正确地意识到风险极高的话。

column1: For the country’s first few years, debt service swallowed more than 80% of all federal revenues.
column2: 在美国建国的最初几年中，债务利息吞噬了80%的联邦总岁入。

column1: The slightest negative shock could have bankrupted the new federal government.
column2: 只要发生一丝负面冲击，就能让新成立的联邦政府破产。

column1: Fortunately, the opposite happened: federal revenues tripled under the impact of a rapid post-war reconstruction boom, and continued to grow rapidly, aided by the country’s ability to remain neutral while wars ravaged the European continent.
column2: 幸运的是，情况正好相反：受战后重建繁荣刺激，联邦岁入增长了三倍，并因为美国在斩获蹂躏欧洲大陆时保持中立而持续快速增长。

column1: By contrast, growth prospects in Europe today are rather dim, and interest payments, even for Greece or Italy, account for less than 20% of total revenues.
column2: 与美国相反，如今欧洲的增长前景十分黯淡，而即使是意大利和希腊，利息支付也只占总岁入的20 % 。

column1: The real problem is the rollover of existing debt in a stagnating economy.
column2: 真正的问题是在经济停滞的情况下展期现有债务。

column1: For example, Italy will soon have a balanced budget in structural terms, but must still face the problem of refinancing old debt as it matures each year.
column2: 比如，从结构上说，意大利很快就会实现平衡预算，但它仍必须面对为每年到期的旧债再融资的问题。

column1: Assuaging doubt about the sustainability of public debt in the eurozone would thus probably require a deep restructuring as well.
column2: 因此，要缓和关于欧元区公债可持续性的质疑，可能也需要深刻的结构重组。

column1: The eurozone crisis could certainly be resolved if all existing public debt were transformed into 20-year Eurobonds with a yield of 3%, and a five-year grace period on debt service.
column2: 如果现有债务转换为20年期、收益率3%的欧元债券，并得到5年利息宽限期，那么欧元区危机肯定能够解决。

column1: One can easily anticipate the impact that this would have on financial markets.
column2: 你一眼就能看出这个方案对金融市场会造成什么影响。

column1: More interesting in view of the current situation in the eurozone is what followed roughly a half-century after Hamilton acted.
column2: 对于如何看待欧元区现状这个问题，更有意思的办法是看看汉密尔顿方案出台后五十年发生了什么。

column1: In the 1830’s and 1840’s, a number of states had over-invested in the leading transport technology of the time – canals.
column2: 在19世纪20年代和30年代，很多州在当时领先的运输技术 — — 运河上投资过度。

column1: When the canal-building boom ended, eight states and the Territory of Florida (accounting for about 10% of the entire US population at the time) were unable to service their debt and defaulted on their, mostly British, loans.
column2: 运河挖掘繁荣结束时，佛罗里达领地的八个州（当时占美国全国人口的10 % ） 无法支付债务利息，不得不违约（其中大部分是对英国的债务 ） 。

column1: British bankers threatened that they would never again invest in these untrustworthy Americans.
column2: 英国银行家威胁说，他们绝不会再向这群没有信誉的美国佬投钱。

column1: They could point to the precedent set by Hamilton, and had probably invested on the implicit understanding that, if necessary, the federal government would bail out the states again.
column2: 他们大概是受了汉密尔顿先例的误导，他们之所以投资，是因为他们认为联邦政府（如果必要的话）会再次出手拯救各州。

column1: But, despite foreign creditors’ threats, the federal government did not come to the rescue.
column2: 但是，尽管有外国债权人的威胁，联邦政府仍拒绝出手援助。

column1: The bailout request did not succeed because it could not muster a simple majority of the states (represented by the Senate) and the population (represented by the House of Representatives) under the normal decision-making procedure (the “Community method,” in European Union jargon).
column2: 援助要求没有成功，因为根据常规决策程序（用欧盟的话说，叫“共同体方法 ” ） ，这需要州（由参议院代表）和人口（由众议院代表）简单多数的批准，而援助要求没有获得简单多数。

column1: The defaults proved to be costly.
column2: 违约的代价是沉重的。

column1: The 1840’s were a period of slow growth, and continued pressure from foreign creditors forced most of the official debtors to resume payments after a while.
column2: 19世纪40年代，美国增长缓慢，来自外国债权人源源不断的压力迫使大部分官方债务人在一段时间后重新履行偿还义务。

column1: Default was not an easy way out, and all US states (with the exception of Vermont) have since embraced balanced-budget amendments to their constitutions as a way to shore up their fiscal credibility.
column2: 违约不是简单的解决之道，此后，所有美国州（只有佛蒙特州是例外）都在州宪法中加入了平衡预算修正案，以此捍卫财政信誉。

column1: Are EU members prepared to take a similar step?
column2: 欧盟成员国准备好采取类似动作了吗？

column1: Europe’s Asian Pivot
column2: 欧洲的亚洲重心

column1: CAMBRIDGE/OXFORD – The Obama administration’s so-called “pivot to Asia” is the most important strategic shift that the United States has undertaken since the end of the Cold War – and it has profound implications for Europe.
column2: 剑桥/牛津—奥巴马政府的“亚洲重心”是美国自冷战结束以来最重要的战略变化 — — 它对欧洲有着深远的影响。

column1: But Europe’s leaders have largely ignored or misunderstood its significance, and thus have failed to seize the opportunity that it represents.
column2: 但欧洲领导人大多忽视或误解了它的重要性，因而没能抓住它所带来的机会。

column1: For example, some in Europe believe that America’s interest in Asia is a recent development.
column2: 比如，一些欧洲人认为美国对亚洲的兴趣是最近才发展起来的。

column1: But, as President Barack Obama put it in 2011, “The US has been, and always will be, a Pacific nation.”
column2: 但是，正如奥巴马在2011年所指出的 ， “ 美国已经是、未来也将一直是太平洋国家 。 ”

column1: The shift is aimed at ensuring that the US plays “a larger and long-term role in shaping this region,” where it has long helped to maintain stability and contributed to unprecedented economic growth.
column2: 这一转变的目的是确保美国“在决定太平洋地区局势方面扮演更大、更长期的角色 ” ， 长期以来，美国帮助该地区实现了稳定和前所未有的经济增长。

column1: Given this, America’s pivot should be viewed more as a consolidation of established policies than as an abrupt, short-term change.
column2: 基于此，美国的重心应该被视为对已有政策的整合，而不是突然的短期政策变化。

column1: The policy’s scope is also widely misunderstood.
column2: 该政策的范围也往往被误解。

column1: While the policy does include a rebalancing of America’s military posture in Asia – by 2020, the US Navy will deploy more of its forces, including six of its 11 carrier groups, to the Pacific Ocean – it covers the entire spectrum of diplomacy, economics, development, culture, and inter-societal relations.
column2: 它确实包括了美国亚洲军事部署的再平衡 — — 到2020年，美国海军将把主力部队（包括11个航母战斗群中的六个）部署在太平洋 — — 但也涵盖了外交、经济、发展、文化和跨社会关系的全方位内容。

column1: This comprehensive approach is evident in Obama’s choice of destination for the first overseas trip of his second term.
column2: 这一套全面方案也体现在奥巴马第二任期的第一个出访对象的选择上。

column1: By visiting Myanmar, Thailand, and Cambodia, Obama reinforced earlier efforts to strengthen diplomatic and economic engagement with the Asia-Pacific region.
column2: 他访问了缅甸、泰国和柬埔寨，进一步强化了早先加强亚太地区外交和经济参与的做法。

column1: Furthermore, America officially joined the East Asia Summit in 2011, easing concerns in the region about China’s increasingly aggressive posture in the South China Sea.
column2: 此外，2011年美国正式加入了东亚峰会，缓解了东亚关于中国在南海越来越强硬的担忧。

column1: Likewise, America’s proposed Trans-Pacific Partnership and offers of economic engagement to Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) countries are the latest initiatives underscoring its determination to strengthen its economic ties in the region.
column2: 类似地，美国提出的跨太平洋合作伙伴关系以及向东盟国家提供经济合作机会都是它强化与该地区经济合作决心的最新动作。

column1: Such efforts to safeguard regional stability will ultimately benefit Europe, for which Asia has become an increasingly important trading partner.
column2: 这些捍卫地区稳定的动作最终将有利于欧洲。 对欧洲来说，亚洲已成为越来越重要的贸易伙伴。

column1: Given the rising risk of conflict in Asia – owing to a toxic combination of rapid GDP growth, an arms race, historical resentments, rampant chauvinism, territorial disputes, and a lack of effective institutional arrangements for conflict resolution – Europe should welcome a stronger US presence in the region.
column2: 目前亚洲呈现出快速GDP增长、军备竞赛、历史仇恨、普遍的沙文主义、领土纠纷的危险组合，又缺少有效的制度性安排来解决冲突，因此发生冲突的风险很大，在这样的环境下，欧洲应该欢迎美国在该地区起到更大作用。

column1: At the same time, Europe’s leaders must recognize that, by increasing its engagement in Asia, the US is not turning away from its European partners.
column2: 与此同时，欧洲领导人必须认识到，通过更多地参与亚洲，美国并没有与其欧洲伙伴国渐行渐远。

column1: On the contrary, as US Vice President Joe Biden said in February, Europe remains “the cornerstone of [US] engagement with the rest of the world.”
column2: 相反，正如美国副总理拜登在2月所指出的，欧洲仍是“美国参与世界其他地区的基石 。 ”

column1: US leaders are well aware of the geopolitical factors that make Europe their most important and reliable ally.
column2: 美国领导人非常明白让欧洲成为美国最重要、最可靠盟友的地缘政治因素。

column1: Its proximity to the Middle East and Africa – where the European Union and its member countries are the most important aid donors, trading partners, and security actors – will ensure the partnership’s continued relevance, as will the common values and deep economic integration that underpin transatlantic relations.
column2: 欧洲靠近中东和非洲 — — 欧盟及其成员国是最重要的援助国、贸易伙伴和安全行动方 — — 这样的地理位置决定了美欧伙伴关系的重要性，除此之外，跨大西洋关系更有共同价值和深度经济一体化为基础。

column1: But the rebalancing does have strategic implications for Europe.
column2: 但再平衡确实对欧洲形成了战略影响。

column1: America’s military presence in Europe will be gradually reduced, as will its willingness to take the lead in international crises – even those affecting Europe’s interests.
column2: 美国在欧洲的军事部署将逐渐减弱，其领导国际危机干预的意愿亦然 — — 即使是对于影响欧洲利益的危机也是如此。

column1: As a result, while the US will continue to provide intelligence, air support, and ammunition on a case-by-case basis, as it did recently in Libya and Mali, Europe will increasingly have to act first and alone.
column2: 因此，尽管美国将继续在危机发生时提供情报、空中支援和武器装备（如最近的利比亚和马里事件 ） ， 但欧洲将逐渐独立行动。

column1: If Europe is to overcome its current financial constraints and acquire the military capacity and level of coordination needed to fulfill its new role, it must pool and share its resources more effectively.
column2: 如果欧洲要克服当前的金融约束、获得满足其新角色要求的军事能力和协作水平，就必须更有效地集中和共享它的资源。

column1: Furthermore, whether on a bilateral basis, through NATO, or through the EU, France’s insistence on military sovereignty must be reconciled with Germany’s culture of excessive military restraint.
column2: 此外，不管是在双边基础上还是通过北约或欧盟，法国对军事主权的坚持必须与德国过度的军事克制协调���来。

column1: Failure to share resources and coordinate policy would seriously undermine Europe’s security interests.
column2: 不能共享资源和协调政策将严重危害欧洲的安全利益。

column1: The US rebalancing will also create an opportunity for Europe to play a greater role in an increasingly important region.
column2: 美国再平衡还为欧洲创造了在日渐重要地区扮演更大作用的机会。

column1: By joining the US in the rebalancing process and supporting relations with China that are built on cooperation rather than containment, the EU would contribute to global stability, while spreading European values.
column2: 欧洲可以加入美国的再平衡过程，支持建立在合作而不是遏制基础上的对中国关系，以此有助于全球稳定，同时传播欧洲价值。

column1: To this end, the EU can leverage its position as a leading trading partner, investor, and aid donor; it can also contribute at leaders’ summits, such as the Asia-Europe Meeting and the ASEAN Regional Forum.
column2: 在这方面，欧盟可以利用其领先贸易伙伴、投资者和援助出资者的地位；也可以通过领导人峰会起作用，比如亚欧峰会和东盟地区论坛。

column1: The Obama administration seems to understand the potential benefits of such a “joint rebalancing,” with the EU-US statement on the Asia-Pacific region issued last July suggesting a move toward policy coordination.
column2: 奥巴马政府明白这一“联合再平衡”的潜在好处，去年7月欧盟-美国关于亚太地区的声明提出要迈向政策协作。

column1: But, in pursuing such harmonization, Europeans should recognize that their Asia strategy – which has so far focused on commerce and, to a lesser degree, on the rule of law and human rights – will have to take on a security dimension.
column2: 但是，在追求融合的过程中，欧洲人应该认识到，他们的亚洲战略 — — 目前集中于商业，而对法治精神和人权的关注较少 — — 必须增加一个安全维度。

column1: Indeed, if conflicts in Asia become more virulent, Europe cannot expect the US to shoulder the burden of maintaining regional stability alone.
column2: 事实上，如果亚洲冲突升级，欧洲不能期待美国独力承担维护地区稳定的责任。

column1: While this does not necessarily imply a military role for Europe in Asia (although participation in peacekeeping missions should not be excluded), it does mean a more forceful diplomatic posture in support of mediation and multilateralism.
column2: 这并不一定意味着欧洲要在亚洲扮演军事角色（尽管参与维和任务的可能性不应该被排除 ） ， 但确实意味着欧洲应该采取更强硬的外交姿态支持调停和多边主义。

column1: A joint rebalancing would help to fortify all facets of the EU-US relationship, possibly catalyzing progress on the Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership.
column2: 联合再平衡将有利于增强欧盟-美国关系的各方面，并有望推进跨大西洋贸易和投资合作伙伴关系的前进。

column1: It would also strengthen the largest economies’ rule-making capacity vis-à-vis the emerging economies, most notably China, in maintaining a liberal economic order.
column2: 这还可以加强两个最大经济体相对新兴经济体（特别是中国）在维持自由经济秩序方面的规则决定力。

column1: In short, a common approach toward Asia would reinvigorate the transatlantic relationship at just the right time, and would guarantee that, despite having suffered from internal disagreements in the last decade, the EU-US partnership remains the cornerstone of a peaceful and prosperous world order.
column2: 简言之，一起偏向亚洲能够在正确的时间重振跨大西洋关系，并能够保证尽管过去十年内部分歧众多，但欧盟-美国伙伴关系仍是和平而繁荣的世界秩序的基石。

column1: Why Fair Trade?
column2: 为何要有公平贸易？

column1: LONDON – Historically, the term “fair trade” has meant many things.
column2: 发自伦敦 — — 在历史上 ， “ 公平贸易”这个词有着许许多多的含义。

column1: The Fair Trade League was founded in Britain in 1881 to restrict imports from foreign countries.
column2: 公平贸易联盟于1881年在英国成立以限制来自外国进口商品。

column1: In the United States, businesses and labor unions use “fair trade” laws to construct what economist Joseph Stiglitz calls “barbed-wire barriers to imports.”
column2: 在美国，商界以及工会都利用“公平贸易”法来构建经济学家约瑟夫•斯提格利茨（Joseph Stiglitz）所谓的“进口商品铁网屏障 ” 。

column1: These so called “anti-dumping” laws allow a company that suspects a foreign rival of selling a product below cost to request that the government impose special tariffs to protect it from “unfair” competition.
column2: 一系列“反倾销”法允许那些怀疑国外对手以低于成本的价格销售商品的企业要求政府征收特别关税来保护其免遭“不公平”竞争的威胁。

column1: Such dark protectionist thoughts are far from the minds of the benevolent organizers of the United Kingdom’s annual “Fairtrade Fortnight,” during which I just bought two bars of fair-trade chocolate and a jar of fair-trade chunky peanut butter.
column2: 当然，那些好心的英国年度“公平贸易双周”组织者们可没有这些阴暗的保护主义思想。 笔者也在活动中购买了两条公平贸易巧克力以及一罐公平贸易花生酱。

column1: Their worthy aim is to raise the price paid to developing-country farmers for their produce by excluding the inflated profits of the middlemen on whom they depend for getting their goods to distant markets.
column2: 他们可敬的目标就是希望绕过那些将农产品销往远方赚取额外利润的中间人，向发展中国家农民支付更高的产品价格。

column1: Fair-trade products like cocoa, coffee, tea, and bananas do not compete with domestic European production, and therefore do not have a protectionist motive.
column2: 类似可可、咖啡，茶叶和香蕉这样的公平贸易产品与欧洲本地产品并无竞争，因此也并不存在任何贸易保护主义动机。

column1: This is how it works: In exchange for being paid a guaranteed price and meeting “agreed labor and environmental standards” (minimum wages, no pesticides), poor-country farming cooperatives receive a FAIRTRADE mark for their products, issued by the FAIRTRADE Labeling Organization.
column2: 整个规则是这样的：通过满足“约定的劳工以及环境标准（比如最低工资和不施农药 ） ” 并以保底价出售农产品，穷国的农业合作社可以从公平贸易标签发放机构获得一个公平贸易标签。

column1: This certification enables supermarkets and other retailers to sell the products at a premium.
column2: 这一认证确保超级市场和其他零售商以额外溢价出售这些商品。

column1: Third-world farmers get a boost to their income, while first-world consumers get to feel virtuous: a marriage made in heaven.
column2: 于是第三世界国家的农民获得了高收入，而第一世界的消费者们则自我感觉良好：简直是天作之合啊！

column1: The fair-trade movement, launched in the 1980’s, has been growing rapidly.
column2: 发端于1980年代的公平贸易运动正在迅速发展。

column1: In a notable breakthrough in 1997, the British House of Commons decided to serve only fair-trade coffee.
column2: 其中1997年的一次突破性进展则是英国下议院决定只提供公平贸易咖啡。

column1: By the end of 2007, more than 600 producers’ organizations, representing 1.4 million farmers in 58 countries, were selling fair-trade products.
column2: 到2007年底为止已经有超过600个生产组织 — — 代表58个国家的140万农民 — — 在销售公平贸易产品。

column1: Today, a quarter of all bananas in UK supermarkets are sold under a FAIRTRADE mark.
column2: 时至今日，全英超市中1/4的香蕉都拥有公平贸易标签。

column1: But FAIRTRADE-labeled products still represent a very small share – typically less than 1% – of global sales of cocoa, tea, coffee, etc.
column2: 但这些贴着公平贸易标签的商品（可可，茶叶和咖啡等）依然只占全球市场的一小部分 — — 基本上少于1 % 。

column1: The economic rationale for guaranteed prices is well known: stabilizing the prices of primary products, which are subject to sharp fluctuations, stabilizes their producers’ incomes.
column2: 设立保证收购价的经济逻辑众所周知：稳定这些基本产品的价格，避免出现大起大落，并因此稳定生产者的收入。

column1: This argument inspired proposals – most famously by John Maynard Keynes in 1942 – to create “buffer stocks” for the main commodities, which would take supply off the market when prices fell, and add to supply when prices rose.
column2: 而这个引发众多争议的提议 — — 其中最著名的倡议者是约翰•凯恩斯（John Maynard Keynes ） — —要求为初级商品建立一个“缓冲库存 ” ， 当价格下跌时吸纳产品，反之则增加供应量。

column1: Keynes’s proposal never made it into the Bretton Woods Agreement of 1944, and, while buffer-stock schemes re-surfaced in the 1970’s, they, too, went nowhere.
column2: 凯恩斯的提议最终没能被1944年的布雷顿森林体系采纳，而当缓冲库存方案在1970年代重新抬头之后也最终不了了之.

column1: Left-wing economists like Raúl Prebisch, moreover, later advanced the theory of “declining terms of trade” for primary products: their prices’ long-run tendency to fall relative to the prices of manufactured goods.
column2: 此外，类似保罗•普雷维什（Raúl Prebisch）这样的左翼经济学家后来又进一步推广了初级商品的“贸易条件衰退”理论：这些产品的价格相对于制成品价格来说在长期趋势上是下跌的。

column1: This tendency seemed to be at work from the mid-1980’s, as commodity producers experienced a persistent decline in prices.
column2: 这一趋势判断在1980年代中期开始似乎都适用，初级产品生产者都经历了价格的持续下跌。

column1: In addition, price fluctuations throughout that decade were huge, with dire effects on sub-Saharan African and other developing countries that were largely dependent on commodities for export earnings.
column2: 此外，这段时期的价格波动极为剧烈，对撒哈拉以南非洲以及其他严重依赖初级产品来赚取外汇的发展中国家都造成了恶劣影响。

column1: Since then, however, the price decline has been reversed.
column2: 但自那以后价格下跌的趋势却发生了逆转。

column1: Food commodity prices have increased by 150% since 2001.
column2: 食品价格自2001年以来已经上涨了150 % 。

column1: This has raised farm producers’ income independently of the fair-trade movement’s efforts.
column2: 这一状况也在排除公平贸易运动影响的情况下提升了农民的收入。

column1: The “declining terms of trade” argument has collapsed.
column2: “贸易条件衰退”理论也宣告破产。

column1: But primary-product prices remain much more volatile than the prices of manufactured goods and services, causing large fluctuations in producers’ incomes.
column2: 但初级商品的价格依然比制成品和服务价格更加反复无常，导致生产者收入的极大波动。

column1: This exaggerates the effects of booms and busts.
column2: 这也放大了兴衰周期的影响。

column1: So the issue of price stabilization has not gone away.
column2: 因此价格稳定问题也依然存在。

column1: It is difficult to see how the fair-trade movement can contribute much to solving this problem, because the only serious policy for stabilizing producers’ incomes is to control supply. But that is beyond the scope of fair trade.
column2: 目前依然无法得知公平贸易是否能为解决这个问题做出重大贡献，因为稳定生产者收入的唯一可靠方式就是控制供应，但这已经超出公平贸易的范畴之外了。

column1: The target of all versions of fair trade is “free trade,” and the most damaging attacks on FAIRTRADE have come from free traders.
column2: 所有形式的公平贸易的目标就是“公平贸易 ” ， 而对公平贸易制度最有力的攻击则来自那些自由贸易者。

column1: In Unfair Trade, a pamphlet published in 2008 by the Adam Smith Institute, Mark Sidwell argues that FAIRTRADE keeps uncompetitive farmers on the land, holding back diversification and mechanization.
column2: 在亚当•斯密研究所于2008年发布的一本名为《不公平贸易》的小册子中，马克•斯德维尔（Mark Sidwell）认为公平贸易制度保护了那些竞争力低下的农民，遏制了农产品多样化和机械化的推广。

column1: According to Sidwell, the FAIRTRADE scheme turns developing countries into low-profit, labor-intensive agrarian ghettos, denying future generations the chance of a better life.
column2: 据斯德维尔所说，公平贸易方案将发展中国家转变成了低附加值劳动密集型的农业贫民区，剥夺了下一代人追求更优质生活的机会。

column1: This is without considering the effect that FAIRTRADE has on the poorest people in these countries – not farmers but casual laborers – who are excluded from the scheme by its expensive regulations and labor standards.
column2: 这还没有考虑到公平贸易制度对那些国家中最贫穷的人民所带来的影响 — — 这些人连农民都不是，只能算是散工 — — 他们被公平贸易所设定的昂贵规章制度和劳工标准排斥在外。

column1: In other words, FAIRTRADE protects farmers against their rivals and against agricultural laborers.
column2: 换句话说，公平贸易成为了农民对抗其他竞争者以及农业散工的保护伞。

column1: Consumers, Sidwell argues, are also being duped.
column2: 斯德维尔还指出，消费者也遭到了愚弄。

column1: Only a tiny proportion – as little as 1% – of the premium that we pay for a FAIRTRADE chocolate bar will ever make it to cocoa producers.
column2: 我们为一个公平贸易巧克力所支付的额外费用中只有极少比例 — — 1 % — —最终到了可可种植者手里。

column1: Nor is FAIRTRADE necessarily a guarantee of quality: because producers get a minimum price for fair-trade goods, they sell the best of their crop on the open market.
column2: 此外公平贸易也不意味着优质：因为种植者可以以一个最低价来出售公平贸易产品，于是他们转而把最优质的产品拿到公开市场上销售。

column1: But, despite its shaky economics, the fair-trade movement should not be despised.
column2: 但虽然在经济上站不住脚，公平贸易运动也不应遭到鄙视。

column1: While cynics say that its only achievement is to make consumers feel better about their purchases – rather like buying indulgences in the old Catholic Church – this is to sell fair trade short.
column2: 即便批评者们说该运动的唯一成就就是让消费者们对自己感觉良好 — — 就像从前在天主教堂购买赎罪券那样，但这其实是低估了公平贸易。

column1: In fact, the movement represents a spark of protest against mindless consumerism, grass-roots resistance against an impersonal logic, and an expression of communal activism.
column2: 事实上，这场运动代表了对愚蠢消费主义的某种抗议，对某些冷漠逻辑的草根反抗以及一种公共行动主义的表达方式。

column1: That justification will not convince economists, who prefer a dryer sort of reasoning.
column2: 这一理由也许并不能说服那些喜欢枯燥推理的经济学家。

column1: But it is not out of place to remind ourselves that economists and bureaucrats need not always have things their own way.
column2: 但这也提醒了我们：经济学家和政府官僚们不是永远都能按照自己的意愿行事的。

column1: Is US Monetary Policy Made in China?
column2: 美国货币政策是中国制造吗？

column1: AMSTERDAM – For much of the year, investors have been fixated on when the Fed will achieve “liftoff” – that is, when it will raise interest rates by 25 basis points, or 0.25%, as a first step toward normalizing monetary conditions.
column2: 阿姆斯特丹—在今年大部分时间里，投资者一直关注着美联储何时“升空 ” — —即何时将利率提高25个基点（或0.25 % ） ，作为迈向货币条件正常化的第一步。

column1: Markets have soared and plummeted in response to small changes in Fed statements perceived as affecting the likelihood that liftoff is imminent.
column2: 市场因为美联储声明中的微小变化而波动，将这种措辞的变化视为即将“升空”的可能性的影响因素。

column1: But, in seeking to gauge changes in US monetary conditions, investors have been looking in the wrong place.
column2: 但是，在寻找美国货币条件变化迹象方面，投资者们找错了目标。

column1: Since mid-August, when Chinese policymakers startled the markets by devaluing the renminbi by 2%, China’s official intervention in foreign-exchange markets has continued, in order to prevent the currency from falling further.
column2: 自8月中旬以来，中国决策者让人民币贬值2 % ， 震惊了市场。 为了防止货币进一步贬值，中国官方外汇市场干预还在继续。

column1: The Chinese authorities have been selling foreign securities, mainly United States Treasury bonds, and buying up renminbi.
column2: 中国当局一直在出售外汇储备（主要是美国国债 ） ， 买入人民币。

column1: This is the opposite of what China did when the renminbi was strong.
column2: 这与中国在人民币强势期间的做法正好相反。

column1: Back then, China bought US Treasury bonds to keep the currency from rising and eroding the competitiveness of Chinese exporters.
column2: 那时，中国买入美国国债，阻止人民币升值和影响其竞争力。

column1: As a result, it accumulated an astounding $4 trillion of foreign reserves.
column2: 结果，中国积累了令人咋舌的4万亿美元外汇储备。

column1: And what was true of China was also true of other emerging-market countries receiving capital inflows.
column2: 中国的情况也是其他得到资本流入的新兴市场国家的情况。

column1: These countries’ foreign reserves, mainly held in US securities, topped $8 trillion at their peak last year.
column2: 这些国家的外汇储备（主要是美国债券 ） ， 在去年达到了8万亿美元以上的峰值。

column1: The effects of these purchases attracted considerable attention.
column2: 这些买入美国国债的行为所造成的效果吸引了大量关注。

column1: In 2005, US Federal Reserve Chair Alan Greenspan pointed to the phenomenon as an explanation for his famous “conundrum”: interest rates on Treasury bonds were lower than market conditions appeared to warrant.
column2: 2005年，美联储主席艾伦·格林斯潘（Alan Greenspan）用这一现象解释他著名的“谜”论：美国国债利率比市场条件所隐含的水平还要低。

column1: His successor, Ben Bernanke, similarly pointed to purchases of US debt by foreign central banks and governments as a reason why American interest rates were so low.
column2: 类似地，他的继任者本·伯南克（Ben Bernanke）也将外国央行购买国债描述为美国利率如此低的一个原因。

column1: Now this process has gone into reverse.
column2: 如今，这一过程颠倒过来了。

column1: Although no one outside official Chinese circles knows the exact magnitude of China’s foreign-exchange intervention, informed guesses suggest that it has been running at roughly $100 billion a month since mid-August.
column2: 尽管除了中国官方，其他人谁也不知道中国外汇干预的确切程度，但消息灵通人士猜测自8月中旬以来一直保持每个月1,000亿美元的规模。

column1: Observers believe that roughly 60% of China’s liquid reserves are in US Treasury bills.
column2: 观察者认为，中国高流动性外汇储备中有60%是美国国债。

column1: Given that reserve managers prefer to avoid unbalancing their carefully composed portfolios, they probably have been selling Treasuries at a rate of roughly $60 billion a month.
column2: 储备管理者更愿意避免让他们精心构筑的组合失衡，因此他们抛售美国国债的速度应该在每个月600亿美元。

column1: The effects are analogous – but opposite – to those of quantitative easing.
column2: 其效果与量化宽松相当 — — 但方向相反。

column1: Recall that the Fed began its third round of quantitative easing (QE3) by purchasing $40 billion of securities a month, before boosting the volume to $85 billion.
column2: 回忆一下，美联储开始其第三轮量化宽松（QE3）时，每个月买入证券量为400亿美元，后来增加到850亿美元。

column1: Monthly sales of $60 billion by China’s government would lie squarely in the middle.
column2: 中国政府每月抛售600亿美元正好是其中间量。

column1: Estimates of the effects of QE3 differ.
column2: 关于QE3效果的估计莫衷一是。

column1: But the weight of the evidence is that QE3 had a modest but significant downward impact on Treasury yields and a positive effect on demand for riskier assets.
column2: 但大量证据表明，QE3对于美国国债收益率从存在温和但显著的抑制作用，对风险资产的需求存在积极影响。

column1: Menzie Chinn of the University of Wisconsin has examined the impact of foreign purchases and sales of US government securities on ten-year Treasury yields.
column2: 威斯康辛大学的秦孟席（Menzie Chinn）估算了外国买卖美国政府债券对十年期国债收益率的影响。

column1: His estimates imply that foreign sales at a rate of $60 billion per month raise yields by ten basis points.
column2: 他的估算表明，外国以每月600亿美元的速度抛售将让美国国债收益率升高10个基点。

column1: Given that China has been at it for 2.5 months, this implies that the equivalent of a 25-basis-point increase in interest rates has already been injected into the market.
column2: 中国的抛售已经维持了2.5个月，因此其效果相当于市场利率已经提高了25个基点。

column1: Some would object that the renminbi is weak because China is experiencing capital outflows by private investors, and that some of this private money also flows into US financial markets. This is technically correct, but it is already factored into the changes in interest rates described above.
column2: 有人会反对说，人民币疲软是因为中国遭遇私人投资者资本外流，其中一些私人资金还流入了美国金融市场。

column1: Recall that capital also flowed out of the US when the Fed was engaged in QE, without vitiating the effects. That was what the earlier debate over “currency wars” – when emerging markets complained about being inundated by financial inflows from the US – was all about.
column2: 从技术上说，这是对的，但这一因素已经在上述利率变化中考虑到了。

column1: Another objection is that QE operates not just through the so-called portfolio channel – by changing the mix of securities in the market – but also through the expectations channel.
column2: 另一个反对意见是量化宽松操作并不仅仅是通过所谓的投资组合渠道 — — 通过改变市场中的证券的组合 — — 进行的，也通过预期渠道进行。

column1: It signals that the authorities are seriously committed to making the future different from the past.
column2: 这表明当局十分认真地想让未来不同于过去。

column1: But if Chinese intervention is just a one-off event, and there are no expectations of it continuing, then this second channel shouldn’t be operative, and the impact will be smaller than that of QE.
column2: 但如果中国的干预只是暂时事件，无人预期会持续进行下去，那么第二渠道就没有操作性，其影响也将小于量化宽松。

column1: The problem is that no one knows how long capital outflows from China will persist or how long the Chinese authorities will continue to intervene.
column2: 问题在于没人知道中国资本外流会持续多久，或中国当局会坚持干预多久。

column1: From this standpoint, the Fed’s decision to wait to begin liftoff is eminently sensible.
column2: 从这一点看，美联储决定推迟升空非常明智。

column1: And, given that China holds (and is therefore now selling) euros as well, the European Central Bank also should bear this in mind when it decides in December whether to ramp up its own program of quantitative easing.
column2: 此外，考虑到中国也持有（因此目前正在抛售）欧元，欧洲央行也应该在12月决定是否加码其本身的量化宽松计划是考虑到这一点。

column1: Why Finance Can Save the Planet
column2: 为何金融能够拯救地球

column1: PARIS – Most people hate finance, viewing it as the epitome of irresponsibility and greed.
column2: 巴黎—大部分人讨厌金融，把金融堪称不负责任和贪婪的同义词。

column1: But, even after causing a once-in-a-century recession and unemployment for millions, finance looks indispensable for preventing an even worse catastrophe: climate change.
column2: 但是，即使金融引发了百年一遇的衰退和数百万人失业，但它仍是阻止更糟糕的灾难 — — 气候变化所不可或缺的工具。

column1: Action is urgently needed to contain global warming and prevent a disaster for humanity; yet the global community is desperately short of tools.
column2: 急需采取行动遏制气候变暖、阻止人类灾难；但全球社会极度缺乏工具。

column1: There is not much support for the most desirable solutions advocated by economists, such as a global cap on greenhouse-gas emissions, coupled with a trading system, or the enforcement of a worldwide carbon price through a global tax on CO2 emissions.
column2: 经济学家所宣扬的最合理的方案 — — 如全球温室气体排放限额和相关的交易制度，或通过全球二氧化碳排放税执行世界范围内的碳定价 — — 得不到多少支持。

column1: Instead, negotiations for the United Nations Climate Change Conference in Paris in December are being conducted on the basis of voluntary, unilateral pledges called Intended Nationally Determined Contributions.
column2: 相反，12月的巴黎联合国气候变化会议谈判基于被称之为各国自定贡献预案的自愿的单方面承诺。

column1: Although the inclusion of voluntary targets has the merit of creating global momentum, this approach is unlikely to result in commitments that are both binding and commensurate to the challenge.
column2: 尽管纳入自愿目标有助于增加全球动力，但这一方针不可能产生具有约束力的、与挑战规模匹配的承诺。

column1: That is why climate advocates are increasingly looking for other means of triggering action.
column2: 因此，气候支持者正在日益寻求其他方式促使人们采取行动。

column1: Finance is at the top of their list.
column2: 金融在他们的工具清单上位居前茅。

column1: For starters, finance provides an accurate yardstick to gauge if deeds are consistent with words.
column2: 首先，金融提供了衡量行动是否与言辞符合的准确准绳。

column1: In 2011, “Unburnable Carbon,” a path-breaking report by the nongovernmental Carbon Tracker Initiative, showed that the proven fossil-fuel reserves owned by governments and private companies exceed by a factor of five the quantity of carbon that can be burned in the next 50 years if global warming is to be kept below two degrees Celsius.
column2: 2011年，非政府组织碳追踪计划（Carbon Tracker Initiative）发布了与一份突破性报告《不可燃碳 》 （ Unburnable Carbon ） ， 报告指出，政府和私人公司所拥有的已证实化石燃料储备是未来五十年将全球变暖幅度控制在二摄氏度以内所允许燃烧的碳量的五倍。

column1: Reserves held just by the 200 top publicly listed fuel companies – thus excluding state-owned producers such as Saudi Arabia’s Aramco – exceed this carbon budget by one-third.
column2: 最大的200家上市燃料公司 — — 因此不包括沙特阿美石油（Aramco）等国有生产商 — — 所持有的储备就比这一碳预算多出三分之一。

column1: And that means that these companies’ stock-market valuation is inconsistent with containing global warning.
column2: 这意味着这些公司的股市估值与遏制全球变暖不相符。

column1: This realization prompted a campaign to convince investors to divest from carbon-rich assets.
column2: 这一现实激发了一场说服投资者撤回富碳资产投资的运动。

column1: Individuals and institutions representing a $2.6 trillion portfolio have already joined the divestment movement.
column2: 个人和机构投资者加起来共有2.6万亿美元的投资组合加入了这场撤回投资运动。

column1: Furthermore, Bank of England Governor Mark Carney has highlighted the threat represented by potentially stranded carbon assets.
column2: 此外，英格兰银行行长卡尼（Mark Carney）强调了隐含碳资产所带来的风险。

column1: Investors are being warned that, from the standpoint of financial stability, “brown” securities bear specific risk.
column2: 投资者被警告说，从金融稳定角度 ， “ 褐色”证券 （ ” brown” securities） 包含着特殊风险。

column1: The amount of divestment may look big – and it is, particularly given that the campaign started recently.
column2: 撤回投资的规模看上去很大 — — 确实如此，特别是考虑到这场运动才刚刚开始。

column1: Yet $2.6 trillion amounts to less than 5% of global private non-financial securities.
column2: 答案2.6万亿美元只占全球私有非金融证券总量的不到5 % 。

column1: The trend is real, but it is still too little to trigger significant changes in fossil-fuel companies’ valuation and behavior.
column2: 趋势确实存在，但力度太小，不足以大幅改变化石燃料公司的估值和行为。

column1: A second reason why finance matters is that the transition to a low-carbon economy requires huge investments.
column2: 金融很重要的第二个原因是向低碳经济的转型需要巨量投资。

column1: According to the International Energy Agency, global investment in energy supply currently amounts to $1.6 trillion annually, and 70% of it is still based on oil, coal, or gas.
column2: 据国际能源署的数据，目前全球能源供给投资总量为每年1.6万亿美元，其中70%仍基于石油、煤炭或天然气。

column1: Green investment amounts to only 15% of the total, and investment in energy efficiency – in buildings, transport, and industry – totals a meager $130 billion.
column2: 绿色投资只占总量的15 % ， 而能源效率投资 — — 建筑、交通和行业等 — — 总共还不到1,300亿美元。

column1: Containing the increase in average surface temperature to two degrees requires developing clean technologies, and even more important, a four-fold increase in investment in energy efficiency over the next ten years.
column2: 将地表平均升温幅度控制在两度以内需要发展清洁技术，更重要的是，未来十年能源效率投资需要增加四倍。

column1: Yet such investment will not be financed easily: its return depends on a still-elusive carbon price and will often materialize only in the long run, while improving energy efficiency implies replacing hundreds of millions of outdated vehicles and refitting hundreds of millions of energy-voracious buildings.
column2: 但这笔投资的融资绝不容易：投资回报取决于依然难以理解的碳定价，并且通常需要长期才能收回，而改进能源效率意味着淘汰数亿量陈旧车辆、修缮数亿栋耗能建筑。

column1: Adequate financing instruments are required for the right purpose at the right place and at the right scale.
column2: 在正确的地方以正确的规模追求正确的目的需要充足的融资工具。

column1: Development banks and green banks have a huge role to play.
column2: 开发银行和绿色银行可以起到巨大的作用。

column1: For example, dedicated long-term loans, coupled with a tax break or a subsidy, would help households decide to modernize their homes.
column2: 比如，专用长期贷款与税收减免或补贴一道，有助于家庭对其房屋进行现代化改造。

column1: But the real hope among climate specialists is that innovative finance could help provide the planning clarity that is currently missing.
column2: 但气候专家真正的希望是创新金融能有助于提供目前所不具备的计划明确性。

column1: To elicit the investments that are necessary to mitigate climate change and green the economy, the elimination of fossil-fuel subsidies and a credible, fast-rising path for the price of carbon are vital.
column2: 为了引出减轻气候变化、绿化经济所必须的投资，至关重要的一点是取消化石燃料补贴并找到可靠、迅速的碳定价方法。

column1: But, because high fuel prices are unpopular with consumers and raise competitiveness concerns among businesses, governments are reluctant to take action today – and may renege on their commitments to act tomorrow.
column2: 但是，由于高企的能源价格会引起消费者不满、引起企业关于竞争力的忧虑，政府不愿立刻采取行动 — — 而明天采取行动的承诺也有可能是一纸空文。

column1: To overcome such trepidation, advocates for climate action are turning to incentives.
column2: 要克服这些忧虑，气候行动的支持者将目光投向了激励。

column1: Some have recommended that governments issue CO2 performance bonds, whose yield would be reduced if companies exceed their carbon target.
column2: 一些人建议政府发行二氧化碳表现债券，这种债券的收益率将因为公司超过碳排目标而降低。

column1: Another idea, put forward in a recent paper by Michel Aglietta and his colleagues, is to map out a path for an indicative price of carbon called its “social value” and provide green project developers a government-guaranteed carbon certificate representing the value of the corresponding emissions reduction.
column2: 米切尔·阿格列塔（Michel Aglietta）和他的同事在一篇最新文章中提出了另一个想法，即为碳制定一个参考定价，称之为碳的“社会价值 ” ， 并为绿色项目开发者颁发政府担保的、代表相应减排价值的碳证书。

column1: Central banks, they suggest, would then refinance loans to such developers, up to the value of the carbon certificate.
column2: 他们建议，接着由中央银行对这些开发者提供再融资贷款，以碳证书的价值为限。

column1: This would amount to a calculated bet.
column2: 这就构成了一个算计选择。

column1: If the price of carbon in, say, ten years, actually corresponds to the announced social value, the project will be profitable and the developer will repay the loan.
column2: 如果十年后的碳定价果真与宣布的社会价值相符，这个项目就能盈利，开发者将偿还贷款。

column1: But if the government reneges on its commitment, the developer will default, leaving the central bank with a claim on the government.
column2: 如果政府违背承诺，开发者将违约，中央银行获得对政府的索偿权。

column1: Failure to increase the price of carbon would result either in higher public debt or, in the case of monetization, inflation.
column2: 不能提高碳定价要么导致公共债务负担增加，要么导致通货膨胀（如果货币化的话 ） 。

column1: The idea is to force governments to have skin in the game, by balancing the risk of inaction on the carbon tax with the risk of insolvency or inflation.
column2: 这一想法的初衷是迫使政府通过权衡在碳税问题上不作为的风险和破产或通胀风险参与博弈。

column1: There would be no procrastination.
column2: 这样不会有任何拖延。

column1: Action against global warming would take place without delay.
column2: 遏制全球变暖的行动将毫不迟疑地开始。

column1: But a decade or so later, governments – and societies more broadly – would need to choose between taxation, debt, and inflation.
column2: 但过十年左右，政府 — — 以及更广义的政府 — — 将需要在税收、债务和通胀之间做出选择。

column1: Undertaking massive investment now and deciding only later how to finance it looks irresponsible – and so it is.
column2: 现在进行大量投资、日后在决定如何为投资融资看上去很不负责任 — — 确实如此。

column1: But not acting at all would be even more irresponsible.
column2: 但一点都不行动更加不负责任。

column1: Banking Reform’s Fear Factor
column2: 银行业改革的恐惧因素

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – Nearly five years after the worst financial crisis since the 1930’s, and three years after the enactment of the Dodd-Frank financial reforms in the United States, one question is on everyone’s mind: Why have we made so little progress?
column2: 发自华盛顿特区 — — 20世纪30年代后最严重的经济危机过去五年后，也就是美国多德·弗兰克金融改革实施三年之后，有一个问题盘旋在每个人的心中:为什么过去几年我们几乎没什么进展?

column1: New rules have been promised, but very few have actually been implemented.
column2: 政府承诺会出台新的规则，但实际上实施的却很少。

column1: There is not yet a “Volcker Rule” (limiting proprietary trading by banks), the rules for derivatives are still a work-in-progress, and money-market funds remain unreformed. Even worse, our biggest banks have become even larger.
column2: 迄今仍没有“沃尔克法则 ” ( Volcker Rule，用以限制银行自营交易 ) ， 对衍生品的规定仍处于进展当中，货币市场基金仍未改革。

column1: There is no sign that they have abandoned the incentive structure that encourages excessive risk-taking.
column2: 更糟糕的是，我们最大的银行变得更大了。

column1: And the great distortions from being “too big to fail” loom large over many economies.
column2: 现在没有任何迹象表明银行放弃了那些鼓励过度冒险的激励机制。

column1: There are three possible explanations for what has gone wrong.
column2: 对过去发生的问题有三种合理的解释。

column1: One is that financial reform is inherently complicated.
column2: 一是金融改革本质上是复杂的。

column1: But, though many technical details need to be fleshed out, some of the world’s smartest people work in the relevant regulatory agencies.
column2: 然而，虽然很多技术细节需要被具体化，我们有世界上最聪明的一群人正在相关的监管机构工作，所以这并不构成问题。

column1: They are more than capable of writing and enforcing rules – that is, when this is what they are really asked to do.
column2: 他们不仅可以编写并实施法规 — — 也就是说，如果真的需要他们做得更多，他们也可以胜任。

column1: The second explanation focuses on conflict among agencies with overlapping jurisdictions, both within and across countries.
column2: 第二种解释关注国家内及国家之间具有重叠权限的部门之间的矛盾。

column1: Again, there is an element of truth to this; but we have also seen a great deal of coordination even on the most complex topics – such as how much equity big banks should have, or how the potential failure of such a firm should be handled.
column2: 再强调一次，这种观点有一定的道理; 但我们也看到了即使是在最复杂的问题上也有大量的协调 — — 比如大银行应该要有多少股本，或者应该怎样应对这样一所银行的破产可能性。

column1: That leaves the final explanation: those in charge of financial reform really did not want to make rapid progress.
column2: 那么，这就只剩下了最后一种解释：那些负责金融改革的人并非真的想要取得迅速的进步。

column1: In both the US and Europe, government leaders are gripped by one overriding fear: that their economies will slip back into recession – or worse.
column2: 在美国和欧洲，政府领导人都被一种压倒性的恐惧给抓住了：即害怕本国经济会退回经济衰退时期的水平 — — 甚至更糟。

column1: The big banks play on this fear, arguing that financial reform will cause them to become unprofitable and make them unable to lend, or that there will be some other dire unintended consequence.
column2: 大银行则利用了他们的这种恐惧心理，提出金融改革会导致银行更加不能盈利并使得他们无法放贷，不然就是还有其它一些可怕的意外后果。

column1: There has been a veritable avalanche of lobbying on this point, which has resulted in top officials moving slowly, for fear of damaging the economy.
column2: 对这一点进行游说已经构成了一个名副其实的雪崩效应，这导致了高层官员采取行动缓慢，因为他们害怕损害经济。

column1: But this is a grave mistake – based on a failure to understand how big banks can damage the economy.
column2: 但这是一个重大的失误 — — 这个失误建立在无法理解大银行如何能破坏了经济的基础之上。

column1: Higher equity-capital requirements, for example, require banks to fund themselves with relatively more equity and relatively less debt.
column2: 比如更高的股权资本要求，就需要银行用相对更多的股权和更少的债务来支持自己。

column1: This makes them safer, because they are more able to absorb losses, and less likely to become zombie banks (which do not make sensible loans).
column2: 这让银行变得更加安全，因为它们更有能力承受损失，不那么可能变成僵尸银行(即那些不发放合理贷款的银行 ) 。

column1: The banks claim that higher capital requirements and other regulations will drive up the cost of credit.
column2: 银行声称更高的资本要求和其它监管会抬高信贷成本。

column1: But there is no sign of any such effect – a point made, rather belatedly, in the Federal Reserve’s monetary policy report to the US Congress last week.
column2: 但事实表明并没有这样的效应 — — 这是上周美联储给国会做的货币政策报告上一个姗姗来迟的观点。

column1: On the contrary, the biggest US banks are reporting very healthy profits for the last quarter.
column2: 与银行所说相反，美国最大的银行对最后一个季度的报告却有着很可观的利润。

column1: Unfortunately, a big part of these banks’ profits stems from trading securities – exactly the sort of high-risk activity that got them into trouble in the run-up to the 2008 global financial crisis.
column2: 不幸的是，这些银行的利润很大一部分来源于证券交易 — — 正是那种始于2008年的金融危机中让银行陷入麻烦的高风险活动。

column1: These are highly leveraged businesses, typically funding their balance sheets with no more than 5% equity (and thus 95% debt).
column2: 这些都是高度杠杆化的交易活动，具有代表性的是银行仅仅用5%的股权(意味着95%的债务)来支撑它们的资产负债表。

column1: To understand why this is a problem, consider what happens when you buy a house with just 5% down (or less than 3% down, which is a better analogy for some European banks).
column2: 要理解这为何会成为一个问题，想一想当你买一套房子时只付5 % ( 或少于3%的，这用来比喻一些欧洲银行更恰当)的首付会发生什么 。

column1: If house prices go up, you make a good return on your equity (and a better return than if you had put 20% down).
column2: 如果房价上涨，那么相对你的投资资本就会有很好的回报(如果你的首付是20%那么回报会更高 ) 。

column1: But if house prices go down, your equity may well be wiped out (which is what it means to be underwater on your mortgage).
column2: 但如果房价下跌，那么你的投资就相当于打了水漂(你的抵押贷款额也会高于实际房屋价格 ) 。

column1: Higher equity-capital requirements for banks are good for the broader economy – they make financial crises (and the zombie-syndrome) less likely, less severe, or both.
column2: 要求银行要有更高的股本对大经济来说是有好处的 — — 这让金融危机(和停滞的经济状态)变得更不可能，不那么严重或者两者兼而有之。

column1: US banks are currently funded with more equity than was the case before the financial crisis, and they are doing fine.
column2: 现在美国银行比金融危机爆发之前有更多的股本，它们的表现的确也良好。

column1: Nonetheless, we should still worry about their ability to blow themselves up in a novel and creative fashion – hence the need for the Volcker Rule, derivatives reform, and new rules for money-market funds.
column2: 然而，我们仍然要担心银行可能会以一种异常且新颖的方式来毁掉自己 — — 因此我们需要沃尔克法则，对衍生产品进行改革并对货币市场基金实施新的规则。

column1: And equity-capital requirements for large, systemically important financial institutions remain too low.
column2: 而当前对大型具有系统重要性的金融机构的股本要求仍然很低。

column1: The latest indications are that US policymakers are finally starting to focus on this point.
column2: 最新的情况显示是美国政策制定者最终开始关注这一点。

column1: Many European banks, however, have less equity than their US counterparts, which creates an important source of vulnerability going forward.
column2: 然而，很多欧洲银行跟它们的美国同行相比，持有更少的股本，这就成了其将来弱点的主要来源。

column1: If there is to be a broad-based European recovery, the banks must raise more equity, thereby strengthening their ability to absorb potential losses.
column2: 如果说将来会有基础深厚的欧洲经济复苏，银行就必须提高其股本持有数量，从而加强它们承受潜在损失的能力。

column1: Unfortunately, there is little sign that European policymakers understand this point.
column2: 不幸地是，几乎没有迹象表明欧洲政策制定者理明白这一点。

column1: Instead, senior officials in Europe think and talk like US policymakers did three years ago.
column2: 相反，欧洲的高级官员的思维和言论跟他们美国同行三年前一样。

column1: They are wary of rocking the financial boat, so they go easy on financial reform and refuse to insist on more equity capital for banks.
column2: 他们太害怕搞翻了金融这条船，所以他们温和地对待金融改革并拒绝坚持要求银行持有更多的股本。

column1: This is a mistake that they – and possibly all of us – may come to regret.
column2: 这是一个错误，他们 — — 很有可能我们全部人 — — 将来都会后悔。

column1: Models Behaving Badly
column2: 表现不佳的模型

column1: LONDON – “Why did no one see the crisis coming?”
column2: 发自伦敦 — — “为何没人预料到危机降临 ？ ”

column1: Queen Elizabeth II asked economists during a visit to the London School of Economics at the end of 2008.
column2: 2008年底，英女王伊丽莎白二世到访伦敦经济学院时曾向经济学家们提出这样一个问题。

column1: Four years later, the repeated failure of economic forecasters to predict the depth and duration of the slump would have elicited a similar question from the queen: Why the overestimate of recovery?
column2: 时隔四年，经济预测者在衰退深度以及持续时间上的持续失准又让人们不禁跟女王一样发问：为何会高估了经济复苏？

column1: Consider the facts. In its 2011 forecast, the International Monetary Fund predicted that the European economy would grow by 2.1% in 2012.
column2: 请参考以下事实：2011年，国际货币基金组织预测欧洲经济将在2012年实现2.1%的增长。

column1: In fact, it looks certain to shrink this year by 0.2%.
column2: 但事实上，今年欧洲经济萎缩0.2%似乎已成定局。

column1: In the United Kingdom, the 2010 forecast of the Office for Budget Responsibility (OBR) projected 2.6% growth in 2011 and 2.8% growth in 2012; in fact, the UK economy grew by 0.9% in 2011 and will flat-line in 2012.
column2: 在英国，其预算责任办公室于2010年预测2011年经济会增长2.6 % ， 而2012年会增长2.8 % ； 而实际上英国经济在2011年只增长了0.9%而2012年将停滞不前。

column1: The OECD’s latest forecast for eurozone GDP in 2012 is 2.3% lower than its projection in 2010.
column2: 此外世界经济合作与发展组织对欧元区2012年GDP的最新预测也比其2010的推测要低2.3 % 。

column1: Likewise, the IMF now predicts that the European economy will be 7.8% smaller in 2015 than it thought just two years ago.
column2: 同样地，国际货币基金组织当前预测的2015年欧洲经济规模将比两年预测要小7.8 % 。

column1: Some forecasters are more pessimistic than others (the OBR has a particularly sunny disposition), but no one, it seems, has been pessimistic enough.
column2: 其中一些预测者要比另外一些更为悲观（相比之下英国预算责任办公室算是尤其乐观的 ） ， 但似乎没有人能悲观到足够接近真相的程度。

column1: Economic forecasting is necessarily imprecise: too many things happen for forecasters to be able to foresee all of them.
column2: 经济预测必然是不精确的：即将发生的事情如此之多，以致经济预测者们根本无法全部预见。

column1: So judgment calls and best guesses are an inevitable part of “scientific” economic forecasts.
column2: 所以判断估计和最佳猜测就成为了“科学的”经济预测中不可分割的一部分。

column1: But imprecision is one thing; the systematic overestimate of the economic recovery in Europe is quite another.
column2: 然而不精确是一回事；对欧洲经济复苏作出系统性高估又是另一回事。

column1: Indeed, the figures have been repeatedly revised, even over quite short periods of time, casting strong doubt on the validity of the economic models being used.
column2: 事实上，数据一直被反复修改，有时甚至是在很短的时间内被修改，这就使人们不得不怀疑经济预测者们手中经济模型的有效性。

column1: These models, and the institutions using them, rely on a built-in theory of the economy, which enables them to “assume” certain relationships.
column2: 这些模型以及其使用机构都依赖于经济中的固有理论，该理论使得他们能够“假定”某些事物之间的关联。

column1: It is among these assumptions that the source of the errors must lie.
column2: 而错误的来源必然存在于这些设想之中。

column1: Two key mistakes stand out.
column2: 其中有两个非常突出的关键错误。

column1: The models used by all of the forecasting organizations dramatically underestimated the fiscal multiplier: the impact of changes in government spending on output.
column2: 各大预测机构所使用的模型都显著低估了财政乘数：政府支出变化对产出的影响。

column1: Second, they overestimated the extent to which quantitative easing (QE) by the monetary authorities – that is, printing money – could counterbalance fiscal tightening.
column2: 第二，他们高估了金融当局实施的量化宽松政策 — — 也就是印钞票 — — 对财政紧缩的抵消程度。

column1: Until recently, the OBR, broadly in line with the IMF, assumed a fiscal multiplier of 0.6: for every dollar cut from government spending, the economy would shrink by only 60 cents.
column2: 直到最近，预算责任办公室 — — 大致与国际货币基金组织一样 — — 都依然采用0.6的财政乘数：也就是政府每减少一美元的支出，经济只会收缩60美分。

column1: This assumes “Ricardian equivalence”: debt-financed public spending at least partly crowds out private spending through its impact on expectations and confidence.
column2: 这就假定了“李嘉图等价定理 ” ： 举债融资的公共支出通过对预期和信心的影响至少会在某种程度上挤压私人消费。

column1: If households and firms anticipate a tax increase in the future as a result of government borrowing today, they will reduce their consumption and investment accordingly.
column2: 如果家庭和公司预期到由于政府借款而导致未来增税的话，他们就将减少相应的消费和投资。

column1: On this view, if fiscal austerity relieves households of the burden of future tax increases, they will increase their spending.
column2: 从这一观点来看，如果财政紧缩能减轻未来增税给家庭带来的负担，后者就将增加支出。

column1: This may be true when the economy is operating at full employment – when state and market are in competition for every last resource.
column2: 这点或许在经济充分运行时是真实的 — — 当政府和市场都在争夺每一份资源时。

column1: But when there is spare capacity in the economy, the resources “freed up” by public-sector retrenchment may simply be wasted.
column2: 但当经济体中出现富余产能时，由公共部门紧缩释放的资源就可能只会被浪费掉。

column1: Forecasting organizations are finally admitting that they underestimated the fiscal multiplier.
column2: 预测机构最终承认他们低估了财政乘数。

column1: The OBR, reviewing its recent mistakes, accepted that “the average [fiscal] multiplier over the two years would have needed to be 1.3 – more than double our estimate – to fully explain the weak level of GDP in 2011-12.”
column2: 预算责任办公室回顾了其近期的错误，承认“这两年的平均财政乘数应该是1.3 — — 比我们原来预测的两倍还要多 — — 这才能解释2011到2012年GDP的疲弱水平 。 ”

column1: The IMF has conceded that “multipliers have actually been in the 0.9 and 1.7 range since the Great Recession.”
column2: 国际货币基金组织已经承认“自从大萧条以来财政乘数实际上已经处于0.9到1.7之间的水平 。 ”

column1: The effect of underestimating the fiscal multiplier has been systematic misjudgment of the damage that “fiscal consolidation” does to the economy.
column2: 对财政乘数的低估已经导致了“财政巩固”对经济影响的系统性判断失误。

column1: This leads us to the second mistake.
column2: 而这又导致我们犯下了第二个错误。

column1: Forecasters assumed that monetary expansion would provide an effective antidote to fiscal contraction.
column2: 预测者假定货币扩张会有效地消除财政紧缩。

column1: The Bank of England hoped that by printing £375 billion of new money, ($600 billion), it would stimulate total spending to the tune of £50 billion, or 3% of GDP.
column2: 英格兰银行过去希望通过加印3750亿英镑新钞（约合6000亿美元）可以刺激共计500亿英镑的支出（或等于3%的GDP ） 。

column1: But the evidence emerging from successive rounds of QE in the UK and the US suggests that while it did lower bond yields, the extra money was largely retained within the banking system, and never reached the real economy.
column2: 然而在英美两国先后几轮量化宽松政策中展现出的事实表明虽然债券收益确实有所降低，但额外加印的货币很大程度上还滞留在银行系统，从未流入实体经济。

column1: This implies that the problem has mainly been a lack of demand for credit – reluctance on the part of businesses and households to borrow on almost any terms in a flat market.
column2: 这意味着问题主要是缺乏信贷需求 — — 在这个萧条的市场，无论条件有多优惠，企业和家庭都不愿向银行贷款。

column1: These two mistakes compounded each other: If the negative impact of austerity on economic growth is greater than was originally assumed, and the positive impact of quantitative easing is weaker, then the policy mix favored by practically all European governments has been hugely wrong.
column2: 这两种错误相互作用：如果紧缩对经济增长的负面影响比原先估计的要大，而量化宽松政策的积极影响比估计的要弱，那么几乎所有欧洲政府偏爱的政策组合就是一个巨大的错误。

column1: There is much greater scope for fiscal stimulus to boost growth, and much smaller scope for monetary stimulus.
column2: 财政刺激促进经济增长的余地很大，而货币刺激就没那么有用。

column1: This is all quite technical, but it matters a great deal for the welfare of populations.
column2: 这一切基本上都是些技术问题，但它在很大程度上影响着人们的福祉。

column1: All of these models assume outcomes on the basis of existing policies.
column2: 所有的经济模型都在现行政策的基础上假定产出。

column1: Their consistent over-optimism about these policies’ impact on economic growth validates pursuing them, and enables governments to claim that their remedies are “working,” when they clearly are not.
column2: 他们一直过于乐观地看待这些政策对经济增长的影响，因此为追求这些政策提供了正当性，并使政府能够声称自身的挽救经济措施正在“起作用 ” ， 但事实上却没有。

column1: This is a cruel deception.
column2: 这是一个残忍的骗局。

column1: Before they can do any good, the forecasters must go back to the drawing board, and ask themselves whether the theories of the economy underpinning their models are the right ones.
column2: 在这些预测者们起到任何作用之前，他们应该回到图表板前，抚心自问那些支撑他们模型的经济理论究竟是不是对的。

column1: Hollande in Mali
column2: 奥朗德在马里

column1: PARIS – While hundreds of thousands demonstrated in Paris against the right of homosexual couples to marry and adopt children, French troops were arriving in Mali to stop a coalition of Islamist and rebel forces from taking control of its capital, Bamako, and creating in the Sahel a sanctuary for terrorists.
column2: 巴黎—在数十万人在巴黎街头反对同性恋结婚和养育孩子的权利的同时，法军正在开赴马里，阻止伊斯兰武装和叛军组成的联军控制其首都巴马科，让萨赫勒草原成为恐怖分子的避难所。

column1: These are trying times for French President François Hollande.
column2: 这些都是对法国总统奥朗德的试金石。

column1: Besieged economically at home, where his popularity is at its lowest since his election last year, can he regain credibility, if not support, as supreme commander of French forces?
column2: 在国内，奥朗德饱受经济问题困扰，其支持度已降至去年当选以来最低。 在这样的情况下，他能从新赢得作为法军最高指挥官的信誉（姑且不论支持）吗？

column1: Once upon a time, “I intervene, therefore I am” might as well have been a French motto, particularly in Africa.
column2: 曾几何时 ， “ 我与故我在”称得上是法国的座右铭，特别是在非洲。

column1: But, while French national identity is intimately bound up with France’s international standing – how it is perceived in the world – enthusiasm for intervention has receded.
column2: 但是，尽管法兰西的民族认同与法国的国际地位 — — 即它在世界人民心目中的形象 — — 息息相关，干预的热情却在减退。

column1: The benefits have become more dubious, while the costs and risks have grown increasingly evident.
column2: 干预的好处越来越受到质疑，而成本和风险越来越表露无遗。

column1: If France has again become a regional gendarme by default, it is largely for three reasons.
column2: 如果法国自动重新成为地区警察，那么主要是出于三方面原因。

column1: American enthusiasm for intervention in Africa has greatly diminished since the operation in Somalia in 1992-1993 – and more globally following the long wars in Iraq and Afghanistan.
column2: 自1992—1993年的索马里以来，特别是在伊拉克和阿富汗打了两场旷日持久的战争之后，美国干预非洲的热情有所消退。

column1: European interest in military intervention in Africa is as low as ever.
column2: 欧洲干预非洲的军事利益前所未有地低。

column1: And, as for the region’s governments, it would be an understatement to say that they are not yet ready militarily to take their fate into their own hands.
column2: 此外，对该地区的政府来而言，说它们还不具备独立掌握命运的军事实力是站不住脚的。

column1: While France is not alone – manifestations of support have come from its Western and African partners, as well as from the Middle East – it will bear the primary responsibility and the risks.
column2: 尽管法国并不孤独 — — 其西方和非洲甚至中东盟国纷纷表示支持 — — 但它将承担主要责任和风险。

column1: For Islamic fundamentalists, France is now the “Great Satan.”
column2: 对伊斯兰原教旨主义者来说，法国现在是“大恶魔 。 ”

column1: Indeed, the conflict in Mali is taking place geographically in Africa, but in many ways its causes and ramifications lie in the Middle East.
column2: 事实上，马里冲突虽然从地理上说发生在非洲，但从很多方面看，其根源和演化都是中东式的。

column1: When France intervened in an African country in the past, there was no risk of terrorist attacks on its territory or on its citizens elsewhere in the world.
column2: 过去，法国在干预非洲国家时不会在当地或在世界其他地区遭到该国人策划的恐怖袭击。

column1: That is no longer the case.
column2: 现在则非如此。

column1: It is too early to say what will happen in Mali or the Sahel – or, for that matter, in France itself.
column2: 现在判断马里和萨赫勒 — — 或者就这个问题而言，在法国本土 — — 将发生什么还为时过早。

column1: For the moment, the French are standing, overwhelmingly, behind Hollande.
column2: 现在，法国人一边倒地支持者奥朗德。

column1: They would have criticized him had he remained passive while Bamako fell into the hands of terrorists.
column2: 若巴马科落入恐怖分子之手，则奥朗德将被千夫所指。

column1: Yet this support may be fragile, and could collapse if something goes wrong on the ground – or, worse, in France.
column2: 但这一支持是脆弱的，如果形势转坏（特别是在法国国内 ） ， 奥朗德的支持就会轰然瓦解。

column1: Before the intervention, Mali was not a French priority.
column2: 在出兵干预之前，马里并非法国日程上的重点。

column1: Rising unemployment at home seemed to be a more urgent task than did addressing instability in Africa.
column2: 国内的失业上升之势是比解决非洲不稳定问题更紧迫的任务。

column1: While the French public agrees that Mali cannot be allowed to become a haven for terrorists, the way Afghanistan did in the late 1990’s, attitudes toward intervention have evolved in recent decades.
column2: 尽管法国公众都同意不能让马里如同20世纪90年代末的阿富汗那样沦为恐怖分子的避风港，但关于干预的态度，几十年来发生了很大改变。

column1: In the early 1980’s, after a particularly bloody terrorist attack on French and American forces in Lebanon, France’s tolerance for military casualties seemed much higher than that of the United States.
column2: 20世纪80年代初，黎巴嫩发生了针对法军和美军的严重流血恐怖袭击，此后法国对军事伤亡的厌恶程度便远远胜过了美国。

column1: But this has changed.
column2: 但这已经发生了改变。

column1: The French now find themselves on the front line at a time when they have much less appetite for it.
column2: 如今，在法国人对军事伤亡容忍度大大降低的时候，法国又站在了干预的前沿。

column1: Moreover, budget restrictions have severely constrained French military capabilities.
column2: 此外，预算限制严重约束着法国的军事实力。

column1: French and British military intervention was successful in Libya in 2011 at least in part as a result of US military procurement.
column2: 法国和英国之所以能够在2011年对利比亚成功实施军事干预，部分原因是因为有美国的军事采购支持。

column1: Of course, from a French perspective, the US role is somewhat ironic.
column2: 当然，从法国角度看，美国的角色颇有些讽刺意味。

column1: In the years after the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001, the Americans always had to be on the front line – battling the enemy abroad to avoid having to battle him at home, in the parlance of the time – while the European allies were perceived as the cleaning staff.
column2: 2001年9月11日恐怖袭击发生后的几年中，美国一直站在冲突前沿 — — 用当时的话说，就是在国外与敌人战斗以保本土安全 — — 而其欧洲盟国给人的感觉是清道夫。

column1: But imperial fatigue after Iraq and Afghanistan has left its imprint.
column2: 但在伊拉克和阿富汗之后，美国疲态尽露。
