column1: Call China’s recent actions revenge for a century of humiliation by stronger powers.
column2: 同理，我们也可以把中国最近的蛮横看作是用强权对百年屈辱的报复。

column1: But this may not be the best explanation for China’s behavior.
column2: 不过，我觉得这不是对中国最近行为最好的解释。

column1: In fact, the reason may be just the opposite: a sense among China’s rulers of weakness at home.
column2: 事实上，真正的原因可能正好是这个解释的反面：中国统治者感到在国内统治的衰弱。

column1: At least since 1989, the legitimacy of the Chinese Communist Party’s monopoly on power has been fragile.
column2: 至少从1989年开始，中国共产党独裁的合法性就已经变得很脆弱了。

column1: Communist ideology is a spent force.
column2: 共产主义意识形态已是明日黄花。

column1: Using the People’s Liberation Army to murder civilian protesters, not only in Beijing, but all over China in June 1989, further undermined the one-party system’s legitimacy.
column2: 1989年6月，人民解放军在北京及去全国各地残杀异见人士的恶劣行径进一步削弱了一党专制的基础。

column1: The way to regain the support of the burgeoning Chinese middle class was to promise a quick leap to greater prosperity through high-speed economic growth.
column2: 为了挽回新兴中产阶级的支持，共产党许诺将通过高速经济发展向集体富裕大步迈进。

column1: The ideological vacuum left by the death of Marxist orthodoxy was filled with nationalism.
column2: 由于对马克思主义信仰的幻灭而带来的意识形态真空被民族主义所填补。

column1: And nationalism in China, promoted through schools, mass media, and “patriotic” monuments and museums, means one thing: only the firm rule of the CCP will prevent foreigners, especially Westerners and the Japanese, from humiliating Chinese ever again.
column2: 而中国通过学校，大众媒体以及“爱国”纪念碑和博物馆所宣扬的民族主义，其核心只有一条：只有在中国共产的领导下，才能避免外国，特别是西方和日本，羞辱中国的历史重演。

column1: This is why anyone, even a relatively unknown intellectual like Liu Xiaobo, who challenges the legitimacy of Communist Party rule by demanding multi-party elections, must be crushed.
column2: 这就是为什么任何挑战共产党统治的合法性，提倡多党制的人，即便如刘晓波这样鲜为人知的学者，都必须被打倒。

column1: It is why the government does not dare to let the renminbi appreciate too fast, lest economic growth slow, causing the Party loses face and legitimacy.
column2: 这也是为什么中国政府不敢让人民币升值太快的原因，避免经济衰退，导致共产党没面子和丧失统治地位。

column1: And it is why bullying Japan is always a good option: China’s rulers do not necessarily hate Japan, but they are afraid to look weak in the eyes of their citizens, who are taught from kindergarten that foreign powers want to humiliate China.
column2: 这也是为什么欺负日本总是外交手段的一个好选择：中国的统治者不一定恨日本，但他们不能接受被国人视为软弱无能，因为国人从小就被教导国外势力都企图欺负中国。

column1: This suggests that if Liu Xiaobo and like-minded dissidents ever got their wish, and democracy came to China, the problem of Chinese nationalism would not go away.
column2: 这就意味着，即便刘晓波和类似的异见人士得偿所愿，民主真的降临中国，但中国民族主义的问题仍将如影随形地存在。

column1: After all, if the people feel persecuted by Japan or the United States, then the people will demand chauvinistic policies.
column2: 毕竟，如果人们感到遭受了日本或美国的迫害，那么他们就会强烈要求国家采取大国沙文主义政策。

column1: Democracy has not tempered South Korean chauvinism much, either, since the demise of the military dictatorship in the 1980’s.
column2: 20世纪80年代，虽然韩国推翻了国内的军事独裁，但民主并没有缓和其沙文主义政策。

column1: But nationalism may not be a political constant.
column2: 不过，民族主义不是一个政治常态。

column1: Nationalism is often fed by a sense of impotence.
column2: 民族主义通常都由软弱无力的感受所激发。

column1: When citizens feel disempowered by an authoritarian government, the next best thing is to feel empowered by national prowess.
column2: 当公民感到被权威政府剥夺了权利时，为避免民族主义抬头，接下来最好还是让他们为国家强大的实力而自豪。

column1: In a multi-party democracy, on the other hand, citizens are concerned with other interests, material, social, even cultural ones, and thus less likely to be drawn into aggressive chauvinism.
column2: 另一方面，在一个多党制民主国家里，民众可以选择关注其他别的利益，物质的，社会的，甚或是文化的，因此很少会投入侵略性的沙文主义怀抱之中。

column1: Or so we must hope.
column2: 或者说，我们希望是这样的。

column1: The state of many democracies today is not the best advertisement for political freedom. But the Chinese should have the right to decide about that themselves.
column2: 尽管当今世界许多民主国家的情况并不能最好地体现政治自由的好处，但中国人应该有选择的权利。

column1: And Liu Xiaobo should be honored for saying so.
column2: 从这个角度讲，刘晓波获得诺奖，当之无愧。

column1: Why is France Burning?
column2: 法国为何在燃烧？

column1: The urban disturbances in France have been called the most severe since the riots by students and workers in 1968.
column2: 法国的城市骚乱被称为1968年学潮和工潮以来最为严重的事件。

column1: The analogy is misleading.
column2: 这个比喻是不恰当的。

column1: While the 1968 protests challenged the French Republican model to live up to its finest aspirations, today’s crisis challenges the French Revolution’s model of citizenship and integration itself.
column2: 1968年的抗议要求法兰西共和国实现其最高的理想，而今天的危机则挑战法国大革命的公民资格和融入模式本身。

column1: The French Republican model asserts that all French citizens have the same cultural identity.
column2: 法兰西共和国模式宣扬所有的法国公民都有相同的文化特征。

column1: Indeed, this is the only acceptable identity.
column2: 实际上，这是唯一可以接受的特征。

column1: To achieve this shared identity, all citizens have to speak the one official language and be educated according to a common curriculum.
column2: 为了实现这一共同特征，所有的公民都必须讲唯一的官方语言并按照相同的课程接受教育。

column1: But they also enjoy equal rights, and have the same duties, in the public arena.
column2: 但是在公共场合，他们也享有平等的权利和同样的义务。

column1: All this is not only fostered by the state, but also requires the kind of uniformity that only a centralized state can impose.
column2: 这一切不仅由国家予以扶持，而且要求一种只有中央集权国家才能施行的统一。

column1: Indeed, the French Revolution’s ideological commitment to unity was so strong that during parts of the nineteenth century, advocating federalism was a capital offense.
column2: 实际上，法国大革命对于团结的意识形态上的承诺十分严肃，以致于在十九世纪的某些时候，鼓吹联邦主义是死罪。

column1: Three components of this model incited today’s crisis and make it difficult for the French Republic to address it effectively.
column2: 这一模式的三个要素引发了今天的危机，并且使得法兰西共和国难以有效地加以解决。

column1: The first component is the classic French Republican prohibition on gathering data in the official census – or by government agencies or public or private enterprises – on ethnicity, religion, and even social class.
column2: 第一个要素是，法兰西共和国素来禁止在官方人口普查中，或者由政府机构或私营企业收集有关种族、宗教甚至是社会阶层的数据。

column1: Collecting these data would, it is argued, violate the Republican tenet that France is “one and indivisible.”
column2: 法国认为，收集这些数据会违反共和国的信条，也就是，法兰西是“统一不可分割的 ” 。

column1: But the absence of a secondary breakdown of such data, like the UK-style, four-fold class analysis (plus examination of patterns of unemployment by ethnicity or religion), makes it hard for social workers, public heath officials, and economic planners to diagnose new problems.
column2: 但是，如果没有像英国模式那样对此类数据进行第二层分析以及四层社会阶层分析（加上按照种族或宗教区分进行的失业模式分析 ） ， 使得社会工作者、政府卫生官员以及经济规划者很难诊断新的问题。

column1: Without the necessary data for analysis, public health policies, for example, cannot be directed toward groups that are especially disadvantaged or otherwise at risk.
column2: 举例说，没有进行分析所必要的数据，就难以针对特别弱势或有危险的群体制定公共卫生政策。

column1: The second factor is the classic French Republican rejection of, and legal norms against, any form of “affirmative action,” or positive discrimination, even of the most inoffensive kind.
column2: 第二个因素是，法兰西共和国一向拒绝任何形式的、哪怕是最无伤害的“肯定行动”或积极性区别对待，并且在法律上予以禁止。

column1: Like the prohibition of fine-tuned data – without which positive discrimination is in any case impossible – affirmative action is seen as damaging to the Republican model because it is based on recognition of ethnic differences.
column2: 没有对数据的精确分析就不可能有积极性区别对待。 肯定行动和精确分析一样基于承认种族区别而被视为有害于共和国模式。

column1: The third component is the post-welfare state, which is now part of the French model of citizenship and guarantees all full-time employees one of the highest minimum wages in the world and high employer-paid benefits.
column2: 第三个因素是后福利国家。 这是法国公民资格模式的一部分，并且保证给所有全职雇员全世界最高的最低工资和很高的雇主支付的福利。

column1: This makes it extremely difficult to let workers go, which makes employers reluctant to hire new people in the first place.
column2: 这样就很难解雇工人，而且使得雇主不愿意招募新的雇员。

column1: Many of the social-democratic countries of Europe, like Sweden, Holland, and Denmark, created similar norms in their full-employment eras.
column2: 瑞典、荷兰和丹麦等众多欧洲社会民主主义国家在它们全面就业时期建立了类似的规定。

column1: Unlike France, however, they also used census data to identify pockets of new unemployment, and to invest socially and politically, not only in excellent job-training programs, but in job creation, and, just as importantly, in job-placement schemes.
column2: 但是，和法国不同的是，它们也使用人口普查数据来确定新的失业人口的经济状况，在社会福利和政治上不仅建立良好的职业培训项目，而且也创造就业机会，同时更为重要的是，建立职业介绍规划。

column1: France is now very bad at creating new jobs.
column2: 法国目前在创造就业机会上无所作为。

column1: It has few training programs, but high benefits for the unemployed and strong restrictions against firing workers.
column2: 基本上没有培训项目，而失业福利很高，解雇限制重重。

column1: Put all of this together, and it is like slamming a door in the face of young minority men looking for work.
column2: 凡此种种，就如同在找工作的少数族裔年轻人面前关上大门一样。

column1: This is the primary cause of the 30-50% unemployment rates among minorities aged 16-24 in many French “urban zones of sensitivity.”
column2: 法国的许多“敏感城市地带”中16岁至24岁少数族裔人口失业率达到30％到50 ％ ， 这是首要原因。

column1: Thus, the riots that France is now seeing emerge from French policies, not from instigations by Islamists.
column2: 因此，法国现在看到的骚乱源于法国的政策，而不是穆斯林煽动。

column1: France has simply failed to incorporate minority citizens – many of them third-generation immigrants who have been educated for twenty years in assimilationist public schools.
column2: 法国根本上没有融合少数族裔公民，他们中的许多人都是第三代移民，在同化主义的公共学校中接受了二十年的教育。

column1: But few political leaders accept that the crisis has anything to do with the French model of citizenship.
column2: 但是，很少有政治领导人承认这场危机和法国的公民资格模式有关。

column1: Indeed, they confidently wait for assimilation to kick in.
column2: 实际上，他们都充满信心，等待同化奏效。

column1: But in today’s high unemployment, low job-creation, and now multicultural France, assimilation will not occur without big changes.
column2: 但是，在当今高失业率、低就业机会以及多元文化的法国，没有巨大的变革就不会有同化。

column1: France is only now beginning to come to grips with the crisis of its Republican model of equal citizenship.
column2: 法国目前刚刚开始应付共和国平等公民资格模式的危机。

column1: A newly created Minister of Social Cohesion has begun to commission studies documenting discrimination.
column2: 新近成立的社会凝聚部已经开始委托进行有关歧视的研究。

column1: One study showed that for similarly qualified job applicants, those with an Islamic-sounding name, and an address in an ethnically segmented suburb, had only one-fifth the chance of even getting an interview as people with a French-sounding name and a “safe” address.
column2: 其中一项研究发现，对于大体同样合格的求职者，那些听起来像伊斯兰的名字和种族分离郊区的地址的人得到哪怕是面试的机会只有那些听起来像法国人的名字和“安全的”地址的人的五分之一。

column1: Two hundred and fifty of the largest private and public enterprises have created an organization aimed at working with the government to allow them, for the first time ever, to document, and then redress, their discriminatory employment practices.
column2: 二百五十家最大的私营和公营企业建立了一个组织，旨在和政府合作让它们第一次记述歧视性的雇用做法并加以矫正。

column1: Fortunately, organized Muslim leaders so far have not aggravated the rioting.
column2: 所幸的是，有组织的穆斯林领导人目前为止并没有加重骚乱。

column1: Of course, the government’s reduction of community policing in favor of paramilitary forces stationed in quasi-military barracks, and the Minister of Interior’s description of the young rioters as “scum” who should be washed away with an industrial power hose, has not helped.
column2: 当然，政府减少社区警力而将半军事化部队驻扎在半军事化营房内、内政部长将年轻的骚乱份子称为应当用强力工业水笼冲刷掉的“人渣”则于事无补。

column1: The French Republican model enshrines the laudable abstract principles of liberty, equality, and fraternity.
column2: 法兰西共和国崇仰值得称赞的、���象的自由、平等和博爱的原则。

column1: However, so long as second- and third-generation minority citizens are taught that the only acceptable cultural identity is French, but are not in fact accepted as French – indeed, are blocked from enjoying the full rights of French citizenship – the Republican model will fuel alienation rather than democratic integration.
column2: 但是，只要第二和第三代少数裔公民被教化说唯一可以接受的文化特征是法国式的，而实际上并不被接纳为法国人，却无法享受作为法国公民所理应享受的完整的权利，那么，这一共和国模式将会激起分离，而非民主化融合。

column1: Why ISIS Persists
column2: 为何ISIS能持久存在

column1: NEW YORK – Deadly terrorist attacks in Istanbul, Dhaka, and Baghdad demonstrate the murderous reach of the Islamic State (ISIS) in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia.
column2: 纽约—伊斯坦布尔、达卡和巴格达的致命恐怖袭击表明伊斯兰国（ISIS）的魔爪已经触及欧洲、北非、中东和亚洲多部。

column1: The longer ISIS maintains its strongholds in Syria and Iraq, the longer its terrorist network will create such carnage.
column2: ISIS在叙利亚和伊拉克保持强势越久，其恐怖网络炮制此类大屠杀的日子也越久。

column1: Yet ISIS is not especially difficult to defeat.
column2: 但ISIS并不特别难以根除。

column1: The problem is that none of the states involved in Iraq and Syria, including the United States and its allies, has so far treated ISIS as its primary foe.
column2: 问题在于牵涉伊拉克和叙利亚的各国，包括美国及其盟国，都没有将ISIS作为主要敌人。

column1: It’s time they do.
column2: 这一点应该改变了。

column1: ISIS has a small fighting force, which the US puts at 20,000 to 25,000 in Iraq and Syria, and another 5,000 or so in Libya.
column2: ISIS有一支小规模战斗力量，美国预测其在伊拉克和叙利亚有20,000到25,000人，在利比亚还有5,000人左右。

column1: Compared to the number of active military personnel in Syria (125,000), Iraq (271,500), Saudi Arabia (233,500), Turkey (510,600), or Iran (523,000), ISIS is minuscule.
column2: 与叙利亚（125,000 ） 、 伊拉克（271,500 ） 、 沙特阿拉伯（233,500 ） 、 土耳其（510,600）和伊朗（523,000）现役军队人数相比，ISIS根本不值一提。

column1: Despite US President Barack Obama’s pledge in September 2014 to “degrade and ultimately destroy” ISIS, the US and its allies, including Saudi Arabia, Turkey, and Israel (behind the scenes), have been focusing instead on toppling Syria’s Bashar al-Assad.
column2: 2014年9月，美国总统奥巴马承诺“打击并最终消灭”ISIS，但美国及其盟国，包括沙特阿拉伯、土耳其和以色列（在幕后 ） ， 一直专注于颠覆叙利亚的巴沙尔·阿萨德。

column1: Consider a recent candid statement by Israeli Major General Herzi Halevy (quoted to me by a journalist who attended the speech where Halevy made it): “Israel does not want to see the situation in Syria end with [ISIS] defeated, the superpowers gone from the region, and [Israel] left with a Hezbollah and Iran that have greater capabilities.”
column2: 最近，以色列陆军少将赫尔齐·哈勒威（Herzi Halevy）直言不讳地声称（由一位哈勒威讲话现场的记者向我转述 ） ： “以色列不想看到叙利亚局势以（ISIS）被击败、超级大国退出该地区 、 （ 以色列）面对实力更强的真主党和伊朗结束 。 ”

column1: Israel opposes ISIS, but Israel’s greater concern is Assad’s Iranian backing.
column2: 以色列反对ISIS，但以色列更大的担忧是阿萨德背后的伊朗。

column1: Assad enables Iran to support two paramilitary foes of Israel, Hezbollah and Hamas.
column2: 阿萨德让伊朗得以支持以色列的两大准军事对手 — — 真主党和哈马斯。

column1: Israel therefore prioritizes the removal of Assad over the defeat of ISIS.
column2: 因此，以色列的重点是推翻阿萨德，而不是击败ISIS。

column1: For the US, steered by neoconservatives, the war in Syria is a continuation of the plan for global US hegemony launched by Defense Secretary Richard Cheney and Under Secretary Paul Wolfowitz at the Cold War’s end.
column2: 受新保守主义影响，对美国来说，叙利亚战争是国防部长切尼（Richard Cheney）和副国务卿保罗·沃尔福威茨（Paul Wolfowitz）在冷战结束时所提出的全球美国霸权计划的延续。

column1: In 1991, Wolfowitz told US General Wesley Clark:
column2: 1991年，沃尔福威茨对美国将军韦斯利·克拉克（Wesley Clark）说：

column1: “But one thing we did learn [from the Persian Gulf War] is that we can use our military in the region – in the Middle East – and the Soviets won’t stop us.
column2: “但我们（从海湾战争中）确实学到了一件事，那就是我们可以在该地区 — — 在中东 — — 使用武力，而苏联人不会阻止我们。

column1: And we’ve got about 5 or 10 years to clean up those old Soviet regimes – Syria, Iran (sic), Iraq – before the next great superpower comes on to challenge us.”
column2: 在下一个超级大国出现挑战我们之前，我们有大约5到10年时间清理旧苏联政权 — — 叙利亚、伊朗（原文如此 ） 、 伊拉克 。 ”

column1: The multiple US wars in the Middle East – Afghanistan, Iraq, Syria, Libya, and others – have sought to remove the Soviet Union, and then Russia, from the scene and to give the US hegemonic sway.
column2: 美国在中东的多场战争 — — 阿富汗、伊拉克、叙利亚、利比亚，等等 — — 是为了让苏联以及随后的俄罗斯退出竞争，让美国独树霸权。

column1: These efforts have failed miserably.
column2: 这些“努力”遭到了惨败。

column1: For Saudi Arabia, as for Israel, the main goal is to oust Assad in order to weaken Iran.
column2: 对沙特阿拉伯，以及对以色列来说，主要目标是颠覆阿萨德以削弱伊朗。

column1: Syria is part of the extensive proxy war between Shia Iran and Sunni Saudi Arabia that plays out in the battlefields of Syria and Yemen and in bitter Shia-Sunni confrontations in Bahrain and other divided countries in the region (including Saudi Arabia itself).
column2: 叙利亚是什叶派伊朗和逊尼派沙特阿拉伯之间规模浩大的代理战争的一部分，这场战争在叙利亚和也门等��场展开，也在巴林和其他该地区有分裂倾向的国家（包括沙特阿拉伯本身）更加激烈的什叶派-逊尼派对峙前沿展开。

column1: For Turkey, the overthrow of Assad would bolster its regional standing.
column2: 对土耳其来说，推翻阿萨德将加强它的地区地位。

column1: Yet Turkey now faces three foes on its southern border: Assad, ISIS, and nationalist Kurds.
column2: 但土耳其现在在其南部边境面临三个对手：阿萨德、ISIS以及民族主义库尔德人。

column1: ISIS has so far taken a back seat to Turkey’s concerns about Assad and the Kurds.
column2: 到目前为止，ISIS对土耳其来说不如阿萨德和库尔德人重要。

column1: But ISIS-directed terrorist attacks in Turkey may be changing that.
column2: 但ISIS炮制的土耳其恐怖袭击可能改变这一局面。

column1: Russia and Iran, too, have pursued their own regional interests, including through proxy wars and support for paramilitary operations.
column2: 俄罗斯和伊朗也追求自身的地区利益，通过代理战争和支持准军事行动实现。

column1: Yet both have signaled their readiness to cooperate with the US to defeat ISIS, and perhaps to solve other problems as well.
column2: 但两国都表态准备与美国合作打击ISIS，并且可以在解决其他问题方面也进行合作。

column1: The US has so far spurned these offers, because of its focus on toppling Assad.
column2: 到目前为止，美国一直无动于衷，因为它的关注点是颠覆阿萨德。

column1: The US foreign-policy establishment blames Russian President Vladimir Putin for defending Assad, while Russia blames the US for trying to overthrow him.
column2: 美国外交政策界谴责俄罗斯总统普京袒护阿萨德，而俄罗斯谴责美国试图推翻阿萨德。

column1: These complaints might seem symmetrical, but they’re not.
column2: 这些抱怨看上去针锋相对，实则不然。

column1: The attempt by the US and its allies to overthrow Assad violates the UN Charter, while Russia’s support of Assad is consistent with Syria’s right of self-defense under that charter.
column2: 美国及其盟国颠覆阿萨德的尝试违反了联合国宪章，而俄罗斯支持阿萨德符合宪章规定的叙利亚的自卫权。

column1: Yes, Assad is a despot, but the UN Charter does not give license to any country to choose which despots to depose.
column2: 诚然，阿萨德是一位暴君，但联合国宪章并没有授予任何国家选择推翻哪位暴君的权力。

column1: The persistence of ISIS underscores three strategic flaws in US foreign policy, along with a fatal tactical flaw.
column2: ISIS的持久存在彰显出美国外交政策的三大战略缺陷，以及一个致命战术缺陷。

column1: First, the neocon quest for US hegemony through regime change is not only bloody-minded arrogance; it is classic imperial overreach.
column2: 首先，新保守主义要求通过颠覆政权实现美国霸权不但是血腥思维的无知；更是经典的帝国主义不自量力。

column1: It has failed everywhere the US has tried it.
column2: 凡是美国如此尝试的地方，无一不以失败告终。

column1: Syria and Libya are the latest examples.
column2: 叙利亚和利比亚是最新的例子。

column1: Second, the CIA has long armed and trained Sunni jihadists through covert operations funded by Saudi Arabia.
column2: 其次，中央情报局长期以来通过沙特阿拉伯出资的秘密行动武装和培训逊尼派圣战者。

column1: In turn, these jihadists gave birth to ISIS, which is a direct, if unanticipated, consequence of the policies pursued by the CIA and its Saudi partners.
column2: 反过来，这些圣战者催生了ISIS，这是中央情报局及其沙特合作者所追求的政策的同一个直接（或许是意料外的）后果。

column1: Third, the US perception of Iran and Russia as implacable foes of America is in many ways outdated and a self-fulfilling prophecy.
column2: 第三，美国将伊朗和俄罗斯视为美国不可和解的敌人在很大程度上是一个自我实现的过时预言。

column1: A rapprochement with both countries is possible.
column2: 与两国重塑关系是可能的。

column1: Fourth, on the tactical side, the US attempt to fight a two-front war against both Assad and ISIS has failed.
column2: 第四，在战术层面，美国试图打赢对阿萨德和ISIS的双线战争已经失败。

column1: Whenever Assad has been weakened, Sunni jihadists, including ISIS and al-Nusra Front, have filled the vacuum.
column2: 凡是阿萨德被削弱时候，逊尼派圣战者，包括ISIS和努斯拉阵线（al-Nusira Front）就会填补真空。

column1: Assad and his Iraqi counterparts can defeat ISIS if the US, Russia, Saudi Arabia, and Iran provide air cover and logistical support.
column2: 如果美国、俄罗斯、沙特阿拉伯和伊朗提供空中掩护和物流支持，阿萨德及其伊拉克同道能够击败ISIS。

column1: Yes, Assad would remain in power; yes, Russia would retain an ally in Syria; and yes, Iran would have influence there.
column2: 诚然，阿萨德将继续掌权；诚然，俄罗斯将继续是叙利亚的盟国；诚然，伊朗将在那里获得影响力。

column1: Terrorist attacks would no doubt continue, perhaps even in the name of ISIS for a while; but the group would be denied its base of operations in Syria and Iraq.
column2: 恐怖袭击毫无疑问将继续存在，也许在一段时间里仍将打着ISIS的旗号；但该组织将被驱逐出其在叙利亚和伊拉克的行动基地。

column1: Such an outcome would not only end ISIS on the ground in the Middle East; it could lay the groundwork for reducing regional tensions more generally.
column2: 这一结果不但可以在中东大地上根除ISIS；还能为更加全面地缓解地区紧张打下基础。

column1: The US and Russia could begin to reverse their recent new cold war through shared efforts to stamp out jihadist terrorism.
column2: 美国和俄罗斯可以通过共同驱逐圣战恐怖主义开始扭转最近的新冷战。

column1: (A pledge that NATO will not offer admission to Ukraine or escalate missile defenses in Eastern Europe would also help.)
column2: （北约承诺不让乌克兰入盟或不升级东欧弹道导弹防御也能有所裨益。 ）

column1: There’s more.
column2: 还有其他好处。

column1: A cooperative approach to defeating ISIS would give Saudi Arabia and Turkey reason and opportunity to find a new modus vivendi with Iran.
column2: 采取合作方针打击ISIS将给沙特阿拉伯和土耳其理由和机会寻找与伊朗的新权宜之计。

column1: Israel’s security could be enhanced by bringing Iran into a cooperative economic and geopolitical relationship with the West, in turn enhancing the chances for a long-overdue two-state settlement with Palestine.
column2: 以色列的安全可以通过让伊朗构建与西方的合作性经济和地缘政治关系、反过来增加一拖再拖的以巴两国和解的机会而得到强化。

column1: The rise of ISIS is a symptom of the shortcomings of current Western – particularly US – strategy.
column2: ISIS的崛起是当前西方 — — 尤其是美国 — — 战略缺陷的表征。

column1: The West can defeat ISIS.
column2: 西方能够击败ISIS。

column1: The question is whether the US will undertake the strategic reassessment needed to accomplish that end.
column2: 问题在于美国是否会进行实现这一目标所需要的战略重估。

column1: Why Is Physics Beautiful?
column2: 物理学为何是美？

column1: CAMBRIDGE – The nineteenth-century physicist Heinrich Hertz once described his feeling that James Clerk Maxwell’s equations, which depict the fundamentals of electricity and magnetism, “have an independent existence and an intelligence of their own, that they are wiser…even than their discoverers, that we get more out of them than was originally put into them.”
column2: 纽约剑桥—十九世纪物理学家赫兹曾经描述道，他觉得构成电磁学基础的麦克斯韦方程组“拥有独立存在和自己的智能，它们甚至比其他发现者 … … 都跟聪明，我们从它们身上得到的比我们最初投入它们身上的更多 。 ”

column1: Not long after, Albert Einstein called Niels Bohr’s atomic model “the highest form of musicality in the sphere of thought.”
column2: 此后不久，爱因斯坦将玻尔的原子模型称为“思想界最高的音乐形式 。 ”

column1: More recently, the late Nobel laureate Richard Feynman, describing his discovery of new laws of physics, declared, “You can recognize truth by its beauty and simplicity.”
column2: 更晚近一些，已故诺贝尔物理学奖获得者费曼这样描述他所发现的物理学新定律 ： “ 你可以从它的美和简单中认识真理 。 ”

column1: Similar sentiments are all but universal among modern physicists.
column2: 类似的感觉在现代物理学家中间无处不在。

column1: Wishful thinking could never produce working iPhones, photographs of Pluto, or atomic bombs.
column2: 想当然永远无法创造出能用的iPhone、冥王星照片和原子弹。

column1: Physics, as summarized in a handful of mathematically precise laws, indisputably works.
column2: 被总结为一小撮数学上精确的定律的物理学毫无争议是有效的。

column1: Yet many things that “work” do not inspire the kind of admiration that the fundamental laws of nature do.
column2: 但许多“有效”的东西并没有激起类似于对自然基本定律的崇拜的情感。

column1: Their beauty is rooted, first, in the laws’ symmetry, here meaning the possibility of change without change – a precise yet almost mystical concept.
column2: 物理学定律的美首先植根于它们的对称性（symmetry ） — —这里意味着不变之变的可能性 — — 一个精确的，但几乎是神秘的概念。

column1: Just as a circle can be rotated about its center at any angle, changing the position of each of its points without changing its form, symmetric laws apply to changed situations without changing or losing validity.
column2: 正如圆可以绕其圆心旋转任意角度，让圆上所有的点改变位置而不改变圆本身的形状，对称定律适用于变化的情况而不必作出变化或失去有效性。

column1: For example, special relativity asserts that the fundamental laws of physics remain the same when we view the world from a platform moving at constant velocity.
column2: 比如，狭义相对论认为，当我们从匀速运动的平台看世界时，物理学基本定律不会发生改变。

column1: Similarly, so-called time translation symmetry encodes the uniformity of physical law in time: Even as the universe ages, the laws remain the same.
column2: 类似地，所谓的时间平移对称性描述了物理学定律在时间上的一致性：就算天荒地老，定律依然不变。

column1: The second source of beauty in the laws of physics is their productivity – what I call their exuberance.
column2: 物理学定律之美的第二个来源是其生产力（productivity ） — —我称之为繁茂（exuberance ） 。

column1: Just a handful of basic principles generates an astonishing wealth of consequences – everything in the physical world!
column2: 少数几个基本原理就能衍生出令人震惊的大量结果 — — 物理学世界的一切！

column1: You can write the equations of the core theories of physics – known as the standard model – quite comfortably on a T-shirt.
column2: 你可以轻松地在一件T恤衫上写下物理学核心理论的方程组 — — 所谓的标准模型。

column1: To paraphrase Hertz, they give back far more than we put in.
column2: 用赫兹的话说，它们给我们的东西比我们投入它们的东西更多。

column1: It is important to note that the laws of physics need not necessarily have such marvelous properties.
column2: 物理学定律不一定具有如此非凡的性质，认识到这一点很重要。

column1: Consider this hypothetical situation: Developments in computer power, virtual reality, and artificial intelligence enable the creation of self-aware beings whose “world” is, from our perspective, a programmed simulation.
column2: 考虑以下假想情形：计算机能力、虚拟现实和人工智能的发展让我们得以创造出一种有自我意识的物种，它们的“世界”在我们看来是一种编程仿真。

column1: If a self-aware Super Mario began to analyze the laws of his world, he would find very little symmetry or productivity.
column2: 如果有自我意识的超级马里奥开始分析他的世界的定律，他不会发现多少对称性和生产力。

column1: Instead, he would find a vast collection of loosely connected, quirky rules, reflecting the whims of the programmer.
column2: 相反，我们会发现大量联系松散的古怪规则，它们反映出编程者的奇思妙想。

column1: The beauty of physical law is too impressive to be accidental.
column2: 物理定律之美实在太炫目，它不可能是偶然的。

column1: It has led people throughout history to believe that some tasteful higher being created us, and that we inhabit a consciously designed world, like our notional Super Mario.
column2: 这让历史上的人们相信，是一些情趣高雅的高等生物创造了我们，我们定居在一个刻意设计的世界中，就像我们的抽象的超级马里奥。

column1: But this is an extravagant hypothesis, which goes far beyond the facts it is meant to explain.
column2: 但这是一个夸张的假说，远远超过了它意在解释的事实。

column1: Before adopting it, we should explore more economical alternatives.
column2: 在接受它以前，我们应该考察一下，更划算的替代方案。

column1: The answer likely lies within us.
column2: 答案可能在我们中间。

column1: Beautiful things are those in which we find pleasure and seek out.
column2: 美丽的东西是我们可以从中找到并获得愉悦的东西。

column1: They are, in neurobiological terms, things that stimulate our reward system.
column2: 用神经生物学的术语讲，它们是刺激我们的犒赏系统的东西。

column1: That explains why parents tend to find their young children beautiful, and adults are attracted to nubile models and their images.
column2: 这解释了为何父母亲总是认为他们的小孩很美，成年人总是被性感模特和他们的照片吸引。

column1: It makes evolutionary sense to reward such feelings.
column2: 犒赏这些感觉具有进化意义。

column1: The evolutionary utility of the beauty of physical laws is somewhat less obvious, but no less real.
column2: 物理学之美的进化效用也许不那么明显，但也是实实在在的。

column1: Given the usefulness of accurately assessing the consequences of our actions, our reward system has evolved so that we derive joy from making successful predictions.
column2: 准确评估我们的行为的后果十分有用，因此，我们的犒赏系统进化出一种能力，让我们从做出成功的预测中感到乐趣。

column1: Understanding the forces and patterns defining our world, and especially principles that apply (without changing) to a wide variety of situations, can help to improve our predictions.
column2: 理解决定我们的世界的力量和模式，特别是（无需变化）适用于各种情况的原理，有助于改善我们的预测。

column1: The fact that we can often infer the behavior of complex objects or systems from knowledge of their parts – that we get back more than we put in – can help us to hone our predictions further.
column2: 我们常常可以从关于复杂对象或系统的某些部分的知识中推断它们的行为 — — 获得比我们的投入更多的东西 — — 这一事实有助于我们进一步精炼我们的预测。

column1: In short, because evolution predisposes us to find beautiful those things that help us understand the world correctly, it is no accident that we find the correct laws of nature beautiful.
column2: 简言之，由于进化让我们倾向于认为有助于我们正确理解世界的东西是美丽的，因此，我们发现自然定律之美并非偶然。

column1: Viewed from this perspective, the apparent beauty of the laws of physics – our attraction to their symmetry and exuberance – is not surprising.
column2: 从这个角度看，物理学定律的显而易见的美 — — 我们被它们的对称性和繁茂所吸引 — — 并不令人奇怪。

column1: What remains mysterious is why they are comprehensible.
column2: 依然神秘的是为何它们可以被理解。

column1: A profound link between beauty and comprehensibility is an increasingly important source of scientific progress.
column2: 美和可理解性之间的意义深远的联系是科学进步日益重要的源泉。

column1: Today’s frontiers of fundamental physics are far removed from everyday experience.
column2: 今天的基础物理学前沿早已不是来自日常生活。

column1: They are difficult and expensive to access experimentally, and we cannot rely on our intuition to fill in the blanks.
column2: 要想用实验接近它们困难又昂贵，我们也不可能依靠直觉填补空白。

column1: The patient accumulation of fact recommended by Francis Bacon, Isaac Newton, and Sherlock Holmes is thus no longer practical.
column2: 因此，培根、牛顿和福尔摩斯所建议的耐心地积累事实已不再具有实践意义。

column1: Instead, we reverse the process, using guesswork to motivate experiment.
column2: 相反，我们倒转了这一过程，用猜测驱动实验。

column1: We first construct beautiful equations, then derive their consequences, and, finally, craft experiments to test them.
column2: 我们首先构造美妙的方程组，然后导出结果，最后设计实验验证它们。

column1: In recent decades, that strategy has proved remarkably successful.
column2: 近几十年来，这一战略取得了令人瞩目的成功。

column1: It has given us quantum chromodynamics, which resolves the central problem of nuclear physics, as well as predicting the Higgs particle and much else.
column2: 它给我们带来了量子色动力学，该学科解决了核物理学的核���问题，并预言了希格斯粒子和其他许多成果。

column1: Rather than recognizing the beauty of laws otherwise discovered, we use principles of beauty – vast symmetry and a high ratio of output to input – to enable discovery.
column2: 我们不是去认识发现的定律的美，而是用美的原理 — — 高度对称和高投入产出比 — — 来促成发现。

column1: When this works, we have an “anthropic” explanation of the laws’ beauty: If they were not beautiful, we would not have found them.
column2: 当这起作用时，我们就有了关于美的定律的“人类”解释：如果它们不美，我们就不会发现它们。

column1: Why is the US Presidential Race So Close?
column2: 美国总统竞争为何如此接近？

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – Many people around the world are probably wondering why Hillary Clinton – who is obviously more prepared and better suited for the American presidency than her opponent, Donald Trump – isn’t waltzing to victory.
column2: 华盛顿—全世界很多人可能正在奇怪为何希拉里·克林顿 — — 她显然比她的对手唐纳德·特朗普准备更充分，也更适合当美国总统 — — 没有势如破竹。

column1: Many Americans share the world’s bewilderment.
column2: 许多美国人也有这样的疑惑。

column1: National opinion polls may well continue to fluctuate until the election on November 8.
column2: 在11月8日的大选开始前，全国民调很可能将继续摇摆。

column1: But Trump has been closing in on Clinton in recent weeks, even threatening to catch up with her in the Electoral College vote, where the Democrats’ control of some of the most populous states (New York and California) give Clinton an advantage.
column2: 但最近几周，特朗普一直在追近希拉里，甚至有望在选举人团（Electoral College）投票中追上她。 民主党控制着一些人口最多的州（纽约州和加利福尼亚州 ） ， 这给了克林顿优势。

column1: Why is this happening?
column2: 为什么会这样？

column1: For starters, Trump, despite knowing almost nothing about governance or public policy, has managed to consolidate most Republicans behind him.
column2: 首先，特朗普尽管对于治国和公共政策几乎一无所知，但他成功地将大部分共和党人团结在自己背后。

column1: One motivation is Republicans’ long-held hatred of Clinton.
column2: 一个动机是共和党对克林顿由来已久的恨意。

column1: Another is the Supreme Court; the court already has one vacant seat for the next president to fill and is likely to have more over the next four years.
column2: 另一个动机是最高法院；最高法院已经空出了一个席位，将由下任总统来填补，并且在未来四年中可能还有更多空位。

column1: Trump has also exploited many Americans’ economic anxieties, tapping the same anti-immigrant, anti-elite rage that is sweeping across European countries.
column2: 特朗普还利用了许多美国人的经济焦虑，煽动与横扫欧洲诸国类似的反移民、反精英愤怒。

column1: But Trump cannot win by appealing only to white men without a college degree.
column2: 但特朗普不可能只凭借诉诸没有大学文凭的白人男性赢得选举。

column1: So he has been clumsily trying to suggest that he also cares about African Americans and Latinos – not by talking to African-American and Latino voters, but by speaking in exaggerated stereotypes about them to white audiences.
column2: 因此他一直在笨拙地试图证明他也顾及非洲裔美国人和拉丁裔 — — 不仅仅通过与非洲裔美国人和拉丁裔选民对话，也通过以夸张的语调在白人听众前谈及他们。

column1: Not surprisingly, African-Americans and Latinos consider his comments insensitive and patronizing; white women – his real target audience – haven’t yet been persuaded, either.
column2: 毫不奇怪，非洲裔美国人和拉丁裔认为他的评论愚蠢又傲慢；白人女性 — — 他的真正目标听众 — — 也没有被说服。

column1: Meanwhile, Clinton is having her own difficulties reconstructing President Barack Obama’s coalition of women, African Americans, Latinos, and millennials.
column2: 与此同时，克林顿在重建奥巴马总统的女性、非洲裔美国人、拉丁裔和千禧一代联盟方面也遇到了困难。

column1: Many young people who passionately supported Clinton’s Democratic primary opponent, Senator Bernie Sanders, have ignored Sanders’s own admonitions to support Clinton, and are saying that they’ll vote for third-party candidates, which would help Trump.
column2: 许多年轻人热烈支持克林顿的民主党初选对手、参议员伯尼·桑德斯（Bernie Sanders ） ， 现在他们忽视桑德斯本人支持克林顿的劝诫，称他们将投票给其他党派候选人，这将有助于特朗普。

column1: Since the two major parties’ national conventions in July, each candidate has alternately made gains and suffered losses.
column2: 自7月份两党召开全国大会以来，两位候选人彼此有得有失。

column1: This month, just as Trump was rising in the polls, he attempted to separate himself from the racist “birther” movement, which falsely claims that Obama – America’s first black president – wasn’t born in the United States, and thus was ineligible for the presidency.
column2: 本月，在特朗普在民调中得势的同时，他试图将自己与种族主义“出身论”运动划清界线，后者子虚乌有地宣称美国首任黑人总统奥巴马并非出生在美国，因此没有资格当美国总统。

column1: Trump’s remarks, terse and grudging, reminded everyone that he himself was one of the loudest “birthers” of all.
column2: 特朗普简短而勉强的声明提醒所有人，他本人便是最顽固的“出身论”者之一。

column1: His damage-control effort further backfired, because he falsely claimed that Clinton and her 2008 presidential campaign had started the birther rumor.
column2: 他的止损举动带来了更多的副作用，因为他错误地宣称克林顿及其2008年总统选战是从出身论流言开始的。

column1: Many news outlets finally used the word “lie” in their coverage of Trump, who had gone essentially unchallenged on past fabrications.
column2: 许多新闻媒体最后都用“说谎”一词来报道特朗普，他过去的诸多信口开河基本上都没有受到过挑战。

column1: Trump’s recent polling gains say less about his improvement as a candidate than they do about Clinton’s own weaknesses and bad luck.
column2: 特朗普最近在民调中得势与其说是因为他作为候选人有所进步，不如说是因为克林顿自己的弱势和倒霉。

column1: Outside her base of passionate loyalists, Clinton has always had a voter-enthusiasm problem.
column2: 除了她的基本盘，克林顿一直面临着选民热情问题。

column1: She comes across to many as a packaged know-it-all, the super-smart girl who put off the boys in school.
column2: 对许多人来说，她的形象是万事通，就像学校里令男生汗颜的“学霸 ” 。

column1: And she confronts a fair amount of sexism, even among her supporters.
column2: 她还面临着相当大的性别歧视，即使在她的支持者中也是如此。

column1: (A former Democratic governor recently declared that she should smile more.
column2: （一位前民主党州长最近宣称她应该更多地微笑。

column1: Would he have said that about a man?)
column2: 他会这样评论男候选人吗？ ）

column1: But Clinton has also created some of her own problems.
column2: 但克林顿自己也给自己制造了一些麻烦。

column1: Her poor judgment in using a private email server as Secretary of State, thereby risking the disclosure of classified material, has become a chronic burden for her campaign.
column2: 她在担任国务卿期间使用私人邮件服务器，从而导致保密材料有可能泄露，这表明她判断力糟糕，也是她选战中的一个永远的污点。

column1: She compounded the problem when she claimed, falsely, that her predecessors had done the same thing, and that State Department security officials had cleared it.
column2: 她错误地宣称她的前任也这么做过，并且国务院安全官员已经清理了邮件，这让问题更加复杂化了。

column1: And, unlike Trump, she received no deference from the press on this issue.
column2: 此外，与特朗普不同，在这个问题上，她没有获得媒体的尊重。

column1: The email saga added to voters’ long-held impression that Clinton isn’t “honest and trustworthy,” and it exposed her to attacks from adversaries on the right.
column2: “邮件门”加强了选民由来已久的克林顿不“诚实可信”的印象，也让她饱受右翼对手的攻讦。

column1: The highly conservative advocacy group Judicial Watch has continually called attention to the issue, forcing the disclosure of emails that Clinton hadn’t turned over to the State Department.
column2: 高度保守的游说团体司法观察（Judicial Watch）一直在鼓吹关注这一问题，施压披露克林顿没有转交国务院的邮件。

column1: (The FBI found nearly 15,000 emails on Clinton’s server that she hadn’t provided.)
column2: （联邦调查局在克林顿的服务器上找到了近1,500封她没有提供的邮件。

column1: Numerous as-yet-undisclosed emails with the potential to damage Clinton may well be released before the election.
column2: ）为数巨大的尚未披露邮件可能在选举前公之于众，危及克林顿的选情。

column1: While FBI Director James Comey decided not to recommend prosecution of Clinton for the email issue, he hurt her campaign by commenting that she’d been “extremely careless.”
column2: 尽管联邦调查局局长詹姆斯·科梅（James Comey）决定不建议就邮件问题起诉克林顿，但仍评论说她“非常不谨慎 ” ， 这将危及克林顿的选情。

column1: In any case, the choice not to prosecute had Republicans and conservative commentators howling that she’d received preferential treatment from the Democratic administration.
column2: 无论如何，不起诉的选择让共和党和保守派评论家猛烈评级她从民主党政府中获得特殊优待。

column1: Polls showed that 56% of respondents agreed that Clinton should have been prosecuted.
column2: 民调显示56%的受访者同意克林顿应该被起诉。

column1: A new issue for Clinton arose in August, when the Associated Press reported that numerous donors to the Clinton Foundation had received special treatment by the State Department during Clinton’s tenure there, mainly by winning an appointment with her.
column2: 8月份，克林顿又有了一个新问题。 美联社报道众多克林顿基金会捐赠者在克林顿任职国务卿期间获得了国务院的特殊对待，主要形式是通过她获得任命。

column1: But many of these people would have received an appointment anyway; and there is no evidence that State Department policies were changed as a result.
column2: 但这些人中有许多本来就可以获得任命；并无证据表明国务院政策因此被改变。

column1: Meanwhile, the Washington Post has begun to report on questionable – possibly illegal – expenditures by Trump’s own charitable foundation.
column2: 与此同时 ， 《 华盛顿邮报》开始报道特朗普本人的慈善基金会的可疑 — — 有可能非法 — — 支出。

column1: Trump, who hadn’t donated to his foundation since 2008, subsequently used its funds to buy personal items (including a six-foot portrait of himself) and to pay legal settlements.
column2: 特朗普自2008年以来便再未向基金会捐资，但使用基金会资金购买个人物品（包括衣服他本人的六英尺画像）和支付法律和解费用。

column1: Previously, it had also been disclosed that funds from the Trump Foundation had been used to contribute to the election campaigns of attorneys-general in Florida and Texas, which would also be illegal.
column2: 此前，据披露特朗普基金会资金还被用于佛罗里达州和德克萨斯州检察长的竞选活动，这也是非法的。

column1: Finally, Clinton had the bad luck of falling ill, with cellphone video showing her nearly collapsing as she left early a ceremony in New York City commemorating the September 11, 2001, terrorist attack.
column2: 最后，克林顿不幸生病，手机视频显示，在9月11日出席纽约市恐怖袭击纪念仪式时她在离开时险些跌倒。

column1: This added further fuel to right-wing media speculation that she is in poor health; Trump added the sexist charge that she lacks the “stamina” to be president.
column2: 这进一步助长了右翼媒体猜测她健康有问题；特朗普更是发动性别攻击，说她缺少当总统的“耐力 ” 。

column1: The press covering Clinton were furious to learn that twodays earlier she had been diagnosed with pneumonia and had kept it to herself.
column2: 克林顿团队先是说她太疲劳了，后来又披露她两天前被诊断为肺炎。 许多媒体对她不早点披露这一信心感到愤怒。

column1: But American presidential elections are brutal marathons, and it’s understandable that she did not want to cancel planned events.
column2: 但美国总统选战是一场残酷的马拉松，她不想取消计划行程完全可以理解。

column1: A later poll showed that the majority of the public agreed.
column2: 随后的民调显示大部分公众也同意这一点。

column1: Clinton’s four-day convalescence came just as she was preparing to make the case for why people should vote for her, rather than why they shouldn’t vote for Trump.
column2: 克林顿为期四天的康复期正逢她准备向人们解释为什么要投票给她，而不是不投票给特朗普。

column1: Just as she resumed campaigning, there were bombings in New York and New Jersey, and two more police shootings of unarmed African Americans, which spurred demonstrations in North Carolina, a swing state.
column2: 她一回归选战，纽约和新泽西就爆发了爆炸事件，更有两起警察枪击未携带武器的非洲裔美国人事件，导致摇摆州加利福尼亚北部爆发游行示威。

column1: The events took over the national dialogue, with Trump, as usual, playing on racial divisions and blaming Obama and Clinton.
column2: 这些事件占据了全国对话的焦点，而特朗普像往常一样利用种族分歧并指责奥巴马和克林顿。

column1: This is the background against which the candidates will head into face-to-face debates, which tend to play a large (even excessive) role in shaping US elections.
column2: 在这样的背景下，两位候选人将进行面对面辩论，而辩论将给美国选情造成巨大（甚至过度）的影响。

column1: It would be unwise to call this election over before it is.
column2: 在此之前就宣布选举结束是不明智的。

column1: Pulling the OMT Trigger
column2: 扳下OMT扳机

column1: CHICAGO – Europe has been experiencing a period of calm after the storm since European Central Bank President Mario Draghi’s “whatever it takes” speech in July and the ECB’s decision in September to proceed with its “outright monetary transactions” (OMT) program to purchase distressed eurozone members’ government bonds.
column2: 芝加哥—自欧洲央行行长德拉吉7月“竭尽所能”演讲以及欧洲央行9月决定采取“直接货币交易 ” （ OMT）买入受困欧元区成员国政府债券后，欧洲经历着稳定期。

column1: The interest-rate spreads for Italian and Spanish government bonds have dropped dramatically, corporate-bond issues have resumed, and a sense of normalcy is slowly pervading the continent.
column2: 意大利和西班牙政府的利差大幅下降，公司债券发行重现江湖，欧洲大陆也开始逐渐弥漫恢复正常的感觉。

column1: But it would be foolish to conclude that the euro’s problems have been solved.
column2: 但这样就认为欧元问题已被解决是愚蠢的。

column1: The economic fundamentals are far from stable, while the reduced financial tension is the fortunate outcome of an expectation game.
column2: 经济基本面远远称不上稳定，尽管预期游戏产生了财政压力纾解的幸运效果。

column1: As long as investors believe that Italy and Spain will eventually be rescued by the OMT, these countries’ borrowing costs will be low, and the rescue will not be needed.
column2: 只要投资者认为意大利和西班牙最终能够被OMT所救，这些国家的借贷成本就将保持低位，救援也就没有必要实施。

column1: If, however, the slightest doubt about the OMT’s effectiveness arises, the expectation game will shift into reverse, and both countries’ bonds will quickly come under attack.
column2: 不过，如果人们对OMT的作用产生哪怕是最轻微的质疑，预期游戏就将向相反的地方发展，两国债券将马上受到攻击。

column1: One such source of doubt may be the OMT’s safety catch.
column2: 质疑原因之一的OMT的安全阀装置。

column1: To become operational, all European governments must approve it.
column2: 为了使其可操作，所有欧洲国家政府都必须批准它。

column1: The rules vary among EU countries, but, in Germany, “government approval” implies parliamentary approval.
column2: 各个欧盟国家的规则各不相同，但在德国 ， “ 政府批准”意味着议会批准。

column1: In an emergency situation, it is difficult to imagine that Germany will not prefer approval to the disaster of an Italian or Spanish default.
column2: 在紧急情况下，很难想象德国会放任意大利或西班牙违约而不批准OMT。

column1: Still, any delay could be enough to trigger a bank run in either country.
column2: 但是，任何拖延都有可能足以出发意大利或西班牙的银行挤兑。

column1: By the time the German Bundestag decided, it could be too late.
column2: 到德国议会作出决定的时候，说不定一切都太晚了。

column1: To eliminate this uncertainty, Italy and Spain should ask for the OMT intervention before it is desperately needed – a request that the Bundestag would most likely approve, viewing it as an insurance scheme rather than a pure transfer.
column2: 为了消除这一不确定性，意大利和西班牙应该要求OMT在不得不出手之前就进行干预 — — 这一要求德国议会很可能会批准，将其视为一种保险机制，而不仅仅是转移支付。

column1: Doing so would also eliminate the uncertainty surrounding the program itself and its implementation mechanisms.
column2: 如此还能消除围绕在OMT计划本身及其实施机制的不确定性。

column1: Identifying and addressing problems when intervention is not urgently needed is much easier than working them out under the threat of a pending sovereign default.
column2: 在干预并非迫切需要的时候识别并纠正问题要比受到迫在眉睫的主权违约的威胁时才动手更容易。

column1: Finally, an early request for OMT intervention would not only reduce the Italian and Spanish governments’ borrowing costs (and thus their fiscal deficits), but would also lower the cost of capital for local firms, which currently find it difficult to borrow and invest.
column2: 最后，早早要求OMT干预不但可以降低意大利和西班牙政府的借贷成本（从而降低它们的财政赤字 ） ， 还可以降低本地企业的资本成本，后者目前陷入了借贷和投资困境。

column1: Thus, it would provide a much-needed boost to these countries’ struggling economies.
column2: 如此，OMT可以对这些深陷麻烦的国家提供急需的提振。

column1: So, if triggering OMT intervention would be so beneficial, why are the Spanish and Italian governments so reluctant to do so?
column2: 那么，既然触发OMT干预的好处是如此之大，为何西班牙和意大利政府不愿这样做？

column1: The main reason is political.
column2: 主要原因在于政治。

column1: In the 1930’s, all European governments feared that breaking from the gold standard would be perceived as a sign of weakness.
column2: 20世纪30年代，所有欧洲政府都害怕与金本位脱钩将被视为疲软的信号。

column1: As a result, they waited too long.
column2: 结果，它们等待了太长时间。

column1: The same is true of the OMT program: elected politicians fear that triggering it would be perceived as a sign of weakness, implying a cost that they have a strong incentive to delay paying.
column2: OMT也是如此：当选政客害怕触发OMT被视为示弱，这就构成了一种成本，他们有强烈的激励推迟该成本的发生。

column1: But why is Italian Prime Minister Mario Monti, who is not an elected politician (and has promised not to run for election), so hesitant?
column2: 但为何作为非当选（并承诺不参加竞选）的政客的意大利总理蒙蒂也如此犹豫？

column1: Given that he does not have to fear electoral defeat, he could help Spanish Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy by filing first, which would weaken the political stigma for Rajoy’s government were it to file subsequently.
column2: 他不用担心在选举中被击败，可以成为第一个要求OMT干预者，从而助西班牙首相拉霍伊一臂之力 — — 如果拉霍伊政府在意大利之后才要求OMT干预，则它就不会面临多少政治难堪。

column1: Triggering OMT now would also be a safe play for Italy in the face of an imminent general election with a highly uncertain outcome.
column2: 到现在，触发OMT也是意大利在面临即将到来的结果极不确定的大选时的安全之选。

column1: What is not uncertain is that an anti-euro party, run by a professional comedian, Beppe Grillo, will gain at least 20% of the Italian vote.
column2: 确定的是，以职业喜剧演员格里洛（Beppe Grillo）为首的反欧元政党至少将在意大利大选中赢得20%的选票。

column1: The political instability that could ensue would not provide a good opportunity to ask Germany for help.
column2: 这可能引发政治动荡，不利于寻求德国的帮助。

column1: In fact, if one were to imagine reasons why Germany might not approve a request by Italy to trigger the OMT, political turmoil would top the list.
column2: 事实上，如果你思考一下德国不批准意大利触发OMT的要求的原因，那么政治乱象肯定是首先冒出来的内容。

column1: By contrast, triggering the OMT in advance would promote political stability in the face of uncertainty, because it would tie the hands of any future Italian government.
column2: 相反，提前触发OMT将增加面临不确定性时的政治稳定性，因为这能够束缚未来意大利政府的手脚。

column1: Why, then, is Monti not acting?
column2: 既然如此，为什么蒙蒂无所作为？

column1: One possible reason is personal pride.
column2: 一个可能的原因是个人尊严。

column1: Monti wants to be remembered as the prime minister who saved Italy from disaster.
column2: 蒙蒂希望以带领意大利走出灾难的总理被人铭记。

column1: He does not want to go down in history as the prime minister who had to surrender Italy’s sovereignty to save the country from default.
column2: 他不愿意在历史上留下将为避免主权��约而将意大利主权拱手出让的总理的名声。

column1: An alternative explanation is that Monti does indeed have political ambitions.
column2: 另一个解释是蒙蒂确实怀有政治野心。

column1: While Monti’s mandate was set to last until the election, he might be trying to extend it with the support of the new parliament.
column2: 尽管其执政只能维持到大选，但他可能会在新议会的支持下谋求留任。

column1: Delay for either of these reasons would be a very selfish act.
column2: 不管出于哪种原因，不作为都是自私的行为。

column1: Monti should not risk European stability for his personal benefit.
column2: 蒙蒂不应该因为个人好处而将欧洲稳定性置于风险之中。

column1: He should trigger OMT before it is too late.
column2: 他应该在犹未为晚时触发OMT。

column1: Italy’s French Temptation
column2: 意大利的法国诱惑

column1: FLORENCE – Italy is once again being gulled by the false hope that if it can just “fix” its institutions, its politics will normalize.
column2: 佛罗伦萨—意大利再一次受了错误希望的骗，认为只要能够“修正”其制度，其政治就会正常化。

column1: This time, it is the French model that is enticing Italy’s leaders.
column2: 这一回，迷惑意大利领导人的是法国模式。

column1: Since February’s inconclusive general election, Italian lawmakers have managed to agree on only one thing: the reelection of 88-year-old President Giorgio Napolitano, which makes him the first two-term president since Italy abolished the monarchy in 1946.
column2: 自2月份大选没有产生决定性结果以来，意大利立法者只在一个问题上形成了一致：88岁的纳波利塔诺再一次当选总统，成为自1946年意大利放弃君主制以来第一个连任的总统。

column1: The main center-left and center-right parties that supported Napolitano – despite the protests of Beppe Grillo and his anti-establishment Five Star Movement, which won a quarter of the parliamentary vote – hope that he can oversee the creation of a broad-based coalition government.
column2: 支持纳波利塔诺的主流中左翼和中右翼政党希望，在他的监督下，意大利能形成获得广泛支持的联合政府。 不过格里洛（Beppe Grillo）及其反对现状的五星运动党（Five Star Movement，该党赢得了议会选举的四分之一选票）反对纳波利塔诺。

column1: But addressing Italy’s myriad institutional weaknesses – which have led to ungovernability, endemic fragmentation, disfattismo (defeatism), and widespread public frustration with the establishment – will require an overhaul of the country’s political system.
column2: 但纠正意大利为数众多的制度弱点 — — 它们导致意大利无从治理，地方各自为政，失败主义盛行，以及公众对现状的普遍沮丧感 — — 要求改变该国的政治制度。

column1: Given that France overcame similar weaknesses and political deadlock with the creation of the Fifth Republic, which includes a robust executive led by a powerful president, the French model seems like an effective one to follow.
column2: 法国曾以建立第五共和国的方式 — — 其中包括强势总统领导下的稳健执政 — — 克服了类似的弱点和政治僵局，因此法国模式似乎是可供遵循的善例。

column1: Indeed, at first glance, pursuing such a change in Italy appears simple.
column2: 事实上，咋一看，意大利追求类似变化好像易如反掌。

column1: Perhaps it is not surprising that Italians admire France’s Fifth Republic.
column2: 也许意大利仰慕法国第五共和国并不令人奇怪。

column1: After all, its governments – unlike those in Italy – have been remarkably stable and relatively durable, lasting 643 days, on average.
column2: 毕竟，其政府 — — 与意大利政府不同 — — 令人注目地稳定和相对持久，平均执政时间为643天。

column1: Moreover, no one party or figure has dominated French politics for too long, with power alternating regularly between parties of the left and the right, at least since François Mitterrand’s first victory in 1981.
column2: 此外，没有哪个政党或个人能主宰法国政治太长时间，权力定期在左翼和右翼政党之间交替，至少自1981年密特朗首次获选以来是如此。

column1: But, for many Italians, the French political system’s most attractive feature is that the president is the true head of the executive – and, since the presidential and legislative terms were aligned in 2000, that authority has run for five years at a time.
column2: 但是，对许多意大利人来说，法国政治制度最吸引人的特征是其总统乃是真正的执政首脑 — — 而自2000年总统和立法任期统一以来，每五年选举一次。

column1: To Italian lawmakers, mired in stalemate and indecision, the French executive’s considerable influence over the parliament is appealing.
column2: 对陷于僵局和犹豫的意大利立法者来说，法国行政影响力远高于议会的状态吸引力极大。

column1: That influence is bolstered by the electoral rules’ inherent bias in favor of powerful parties.
column2: 这一影响力来自选举规则有利于强势政党的内在偏向性。

column1: Indeed, no electoral system creates a greater vote-seat distortion than France’s two-round majoritarian system.
column2: 事实上，没有哪种选举制度能比法国的两轮多数制度更能制造选票-席位扭曲的了。

column1: For example, in 2012, the Socialists obtained nearly 50% of the seats in the National Assembly, despite having won only 29% of the vote in the first round.
column2: 比如，2012年法国社会党在国民大会（National Assembly）中赢得近50%的席位，尽管它在第一轮选举中只获得了29%的选票。

column1: The right-wing RPR-UDF coalition did even better in 1993, when it won 38.5% of the vote in the first round but obtained an astonishing 82% of the seats.
column2: 右翼的PDR-UDF联盟在1993年的表现甚至更加出色，它在第一轮选举中赢得38.5%的选票，但最终赢得了惊人的82%的议席。

column1: In France, smaller parties can gain parliamentary seats only if they manage to negotiate a pre-election agreement with one of the major parties to secure for them some constituencies.
column2: 在法国，小政党要想获得议院席位，必须设法在选举前与某大政党达成协议，以确保拿下一些选区。

column1: One could argue that this system facilitates more efficient governance, and thus could potentially save Italy from its debilitating gridlock.
column2: 你可能会说，这一制度有利于更高效的治理，因此可能把意大利从令人疲敝的僵局中拯救出来。

column1: But it is difficult to see how it is good for democracy.
column2: 但很难看到这对民主有什么好处。

column1: Before becoming overly enamored of French institutions, Italians should consider what the French think of their own system.
column2: 在过度沉迷于法国制度之前，意大利应该考虑一下法国人如何看待自己的制度。

column1: In fact, the French are extremely frustrated with their country’s politics, particularly with their presidents.
column2: 事实上，法国人对自己国家的政治感到无比失望，特别是对他们的总统。

column1: This dissatisfaction does not reflect a failure of François Hollande, whose approval rating stands at only 26% one year into his presidential term; his two immediate predecessors, Jacques Chirac and Nicolas Sarkozy, also left office in disgrace.
column2: 这一不满不光体现在奥朗德的失败上 — — 在问鼎总统宝座仅仅一年后，他的支持率只有26 % ； 他的两位前任，希拉克和萨科齐，离职时���颇不体面。

column1: According to Eurobarometer data collected over the last two decades, Italy’s political system, its leaders, and its democratic institutions have the lowest level of citizen satisfaction among the first 15 European Union countries.
column2: 根据欧洲晴雨表（Eurobarometer）在过去二十年中所收集的数据，以人民满意度衡量，意大利的政治制度、它的领导人以及它的民主机构在第一批15个欧盟国家中叨陪末座。

column1: But France is a close second.
column2: 但法国也只是倒数第二。

column1: Likewise, France is second only to Italy when it comes to the desire to reform and restructure its political institutions.
column2: 类似地，在人民改革和重组政治制度意愿排名上，意大利名列第一，而紧随其后的也正是法国。

column1: At the end of the day, there is no institutional reform that could miraculously “save” Italy.
column2: 所到底，没有哪种制度改革能奇迹般地“拯救”意大利。

column1: While a semi-presidential system like France’s could enable Italy to suppress symmetric bicameralism and reform the worst aspects of its electoral law (known as porcellum, or “the crap law”), thereby improving governability, it would create as many problems as it would solve.
column2: 尽管类似法国的半总统制能让意大利遏制其对称两院制并改革其选举法中最糟糕的的部分（被称为“porecellum ” ， 即“废话法律 ” ） ，从而改善其可治理性，但也它所带来的问题一点也不比它所解决问题少。

column1: French history demonstrates that excessive presidential power is likely to create an almighty and, at times, politically feckless executive, alongside a weak parliament that chronically under-represents a significant proportion of the population.
column2: 法国历史表明，总统权力过大可能会形成人造神，有时也会造成政治上软弱的执政者，以及长期无法代表人口大部的弱势议会。

column1: Beyond the incantatory formulas, Italians should reflect carefully on the desirability of adopting such a system.
column2: 意大利应该破除迷信，认真考虑是否应该追求这样一套制度。

column1: Why Marx Was Wrong
column2: 为什么马克思是错误的

column1: STOCKHOLM – The bicentennial of Karl Marx’s birth has occasioned a surge of interest in the man’s work, complete with the unveiling of a statue in his hometown of Trier, Germany.
column2: 斯德哥尔摩—卡尔·马克思诞辰两百周年引起对他的著作的兴趣大涨，他的家乡德国特里尔（Trier）揭幕了马克思雕像。

column1: At a celebration of Marxism in Beijing last week, Chinese President Xi Jinping declared that, “like a spectacular sunrise, the theory illuminated the path of humanity’s exploration of the law of history, and humanity’s search for [its] own liberation.”
column2: 上周在北京举行的马克思主义纪念大会中，中国国家主席习近平强调 ， “ 。 这一理论犹如壮丽的日出，照亮了人类探索历史规律和寻求自身解放的道路 。 ”

column1: He would go on to claim that Marx “pointed out the direction, with scientific theory, toward an ideal society with no oppression or exploitation, where every person would enjoy equality and freedom.”
column2: 接着他又说，马克思“以科学的理论为最终建立一个没有压迫、没有剥削、人人平等、人人自由的理想社会指明了方向 。 ”

column1: Given that Xi’s words were uttered in “Marxist” China, those in attendance had no choice but to agree with them.
column2: 习近平的这番话是在“马克思主义”中国说出的，在场各位别无选择，只有同意。

column1: Yet, speaking in Trier on the same day, European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker offered a somewhat generous appraisal of his own: “Today he stands for things which is he not responsible for and which he didn’t cause, because many of the things he wrote down were redrafted into the opposite.”
column2: 但是，在同一天的特里尔，欧盟委员会主席容克也不吝慷慨平价 ： “ 今天，他代表了他不必负责也非他引起的东西，因为他所写下的很多东西遭到了意义完全相反的改写 。 ”

column1: It is not entirely clear what Juncker meant by this.
column2: 容克的这番话到底是什么意思并不完全清楚。

column1: Marxism, after all, has inflicted untold misery on tens of millions of people who have been forced to live under regimes waving its banner.
column2: 毕竟，马克思主义给数千万被迫生活在高举它的大旗的体制中的人带来了不可名状的悲惨。

column1: For much of the twentieth century, 40% of humanity suffered famines, gulags, censorship, and other forms of repression at the hands of self-proclaimed Marxists.
column2: 在二十世纪的大部分时间里，40%的人类在自称的马克思主义者手中，经受着饥荒、集中营、审查和其他形式的压迫。

column1: In his speech, Juncker seemed to be alluding to the standard counterargument: that communist atrocities throughout the twentieth century were due to some sort of distortion of Marx’s thought, for which the man himself can scarcely be held responsible.
column2: 在他的讲话中，容克似乎暗示标准的反驳：贯穿二十世纪的共产主义暴行是因为对马克思思想的某种扭曲导致的，而马克思本人不必为此负责。

column1: Is there anything to this argument?
column2: 这一观点有道理吗？

column1: Marx spent most of his life analyzing the political economy of the industrializing mid-nineteenth-century West.
column2: 马克思大半辈子都在分析工业化的十九世纪中期西方的政治经济学。

column1: But his enduring relevance owes more to his ideas for the future, and the implications they would have for society.
column2: 但他的持续重要性更多来自他关于未来的思想，以及这些思想给社会造成的影响。

column1: In considering his legacy, this area of his thought cannot be ignored.
column2: 在思考他的遗产时，他的思想的这一领域不能忽视。

column1: Marx regarded private property as the source of all evil in the emerging capitalist societies of his day.
column2: 马克思认为，私有财产是他的时代的新兴资本主义社会的万恶之源。

column1: Accordingly, he believed that only by abolishing it could society’s class divisions be healed, and a harmonious future ensured.
column2: 据此，他相信只有消灭私有财产，社会阶级分化问题才能解决，和谐的未来才有保障。

column1: Under communism, his collaborator Friedrich Engels later claimed, the state itself would become unnecessary and “wither away.”
column2: 他的合作者恩格斯后来宣称，在共产主义下，国家本身将变得没有必要并将“幻灭 ” 。

column1: These assertions were not made as speculation, but rather as scientific claims about what the future held in store.
column2: 这些主张不是作为预测提出，而是作为对未来的科学论断提出。

column1: But, of course, it was all rubbish, and Marx’s theory of history – dialectical materialism – has since been proved wrong and dangerous in practically every respect.
column2: 但是，所有这些当然都是垃圾，马克思的历史理论 — — 辩证唯物主义无论从什么角度看，都是错误和危险的。

column1: The great twentieth-century philosopher Karl Popper, one of Marx’s strongest critics, rightly called him a “false prophet.”
column2: 二十世纪著名哲学家、马克思主义最强烈的批评者之一卡尔·波普尔（Karl Popper）正确地称马克思为“假先知 ” 。

column1: And, if more evidence were needed, the countries that embraced capitalism in the twentieth century went on to become democratic, open, and prosperous societies.
column2: 如果说还需要更多证据的话，看看二十世纪接受了资本主义的国家，纷纷成为民主、开放、繁荣的社会。

column1: By contrast, every regime that has rejected capitalism in the name of Marxism has failed – and not by coincidence or as a result of some unfortunate doctrinal misunderstanding on the part of Marx’s followers.
column2: 相反，所有以马克思主义的名义拒绝资本主义的体制，都遭到了失败 — — 这不是巧合，也不是因为马克思的信徒不幸地错误理解了马克思的思想。

column1: By abolishing private ownership and establishing state control of the economy, one not only deprives society of the entrepreneurship needed to propel it forward; one also abolishes freedom itself.
column2: 消灭私有产权、建立国家对经济的控制不但让社会失去了推动国家前进的企业家精神，也消灭了自由本身。

column1: Because Marxism treats all contradictions in society as the products of a class struggle that will disappear when private property does, dissent after the establishment of communism is impossible.
column2: 马克思将一切社会矛盾都处理为阶级斗争，而阶级斗争会随着私有财产的消失而消失，因此，共产主义成立后不可能再有异见。

column1: By definition, any challenge to the new order must be an illegitimate remnant of the oppressive order that came before.
column2: 顾名思义，任何对新秩序的挑战必然此前压迫性秩序的非法残余。

column1: Thus, Marxist regimes have in fact been logical extensions of his doctrines.
column2: 因此，马克思主义体制实际上是他的学说的逻辑延伸。

column1: Of course Juncker is right that Marx – who died 34 years before the Russian Revolution – was not responsible for the Gulag, and yet his ideas clearly were.
column2: 当然，容克说马克思 — — 他逝世于俄国大革命34年前 — — 不必为古拉格负责是正确的，但他的思想显然需要负责。

column1: In his landmark three-volume study Main Currents of Marxism, the Polish philosopher Leszek Kołakowski, who became a leading critic of Marxism after having embraced it in his youth, notes that Marx showed almost no interest in people as they actually exist.
column2: 在其标志性的三卷本研究《马克思主义的主流 》 （ Main Currents of Marxism）中，波兰哲学家、青年时代接受马克思主义但后来成为马克思主义的主要批评者的莱斯泽克·科拉科夫斯基（Leszek Kołakowski）指出，马克思几乎对作为实际存在的人的毫无兴趣。

column1: “Marxism takes little or no account of the fact that people are born and die, that they are men and women, young or old, healthy or sick,” he writes.
column2: “马克思主义基本没有考虑一个事实，即人有出生和死亡，有男女，有老少，有病健 。 ” 他写道。

column1: As such, “Evil and suffering, in his eyes, had no meaning except as instruments of liberation; they were purely social facts, not an essential part of the human condition.”
column2: 同样地 ， “ 邪恶和苦难在他眼中除了成为解放的工具之外毫无意义；它们是纯粹的社会事实，而不是人的条件的不可或缺的一部分 。 ”

column1: Kołakowski’s insight helps to explain why regimes that have embraced Marx’s mechanical and deterministic doctrine inevitably must turn to totalitarianism when confronting the reality of a complex society.
column2: 科拉科夫斯基的洞见有助于解释，接受了马克思的机械和决定论的体制，在面临复杂社会的现实时，都不可避免地必须变成极权主义。

column1: They have not always fully succeeded; but the results have always been tragic.
column2: 它们不总能完全成功；但结果总是悲剧。

column1: For his part, Xi views China’s economic development over the past few decades as “cast iron proof” of Marxism’s continued validity.
column2: 至于习近平，他认为中国在过去的经济发展是马克思主义持续的活力的“铁证 ” 。

column1: But, if anything, it is exactly the other way around.
column2: 但如果说它们证明了什么的话，内容正好相反。

column1: Remember that it was the China of pure communism that produced the famine and terror of the “Great Leap Forward” and the “Cultural Revolution.”
column2: 不要忘了，纯粹共产主义的中国产生了“大跃进”和“文化大革命”的饥荒和恐怖。

column1: Mao’s decision to deprive farmers of their land and entrepreneurs of their firms had predictably disastrous results, and the Communist Party of China has since abandoned that doctrinaire approach.
column2: 毛泽东没收农民土地和企业家企业的决定带来了可以预见的灾难性结果，而中国共产党后来也抛弃了这一教条主义方针。

column1: Under Mao’s successor, Deng Xiaoping, the CPC launched China’s great economic “opening-up.”
column2: 在毛泽东的继任者邓小平的领导下，中共开启了中国伟大的经济“开放 ” 。

column1: After 1978, it began to restore private ownership and permit entrepreneurship, and the results have been nothing short of spectacular.
column2: 1978年后，中国开始恢复私人所有权，允许企业家精神，结果可谓壮观。

column1: If China’s development is being held back by anything today, it is the remnants of Marxism that are still visible in inefficient state-owned enterprises and the repression of dissent.
column2: 要论中国的发展今天被什么东西所拖累，那就是可以从无效的国有企业和对异见的压迫中管窥的马克思主义残余。

column1: China’s centralized single-party system is simply incompatible with a modern and diverse society.
column2: 中国的中央集权一党制与现代的多元化社会完全不相容。

column1: Two hundred years after Marx’s birth, it is certainly wise to reflect on his intellectual legacy.
column2: 马克思诞生已经过去了两百年，思考他的思想遗产毫无疑问是明智的。

column1: We should do so not in celebration, however, but to inoculate our open societies against the totalitarian temptation that lurks in his false theories.
column2: 但我们不应该庆祝，而应该让我们的开放社会免疫于潜伏在他的错误理论中的极权主义诱惑。

column1: Why Mexico is Sick
column2: 墨西哥病在何处

column1: Mexico City – As I reflect on my troubled country, the lyrics of a Bruce Springsteen song come to mind: “We are far, far away from home. Our home is far, far away from us.”
column2: 墨西哥城 — — 故乡墨西哥层出不穷的问题让我不禁想起布鲁斯·斯普林斯汀的一句歌词 — — “我们离家乡很远很远；家乡在那很远很远的远方 。 ”

column1: That’s how it feels to live in Mexico nowadays: far from democratic normalcy; far from a health system that inspires confidence; far from a government that builds trust; far from home and close to everything that imperils it.
column2: 这句歌词正是今天墨西哥人的真实感受：正常的民主、可靠的医疗卫生体系、可信的政府都已远去，不见了家乡，只剩下危机重重。

column1: My homeland has become a place where too many people are victims, succumbing to a virus, or gunned down by a drug-trafficker; assaulted by a robber, shot by an ill-trained policeman, or kidnapped by a member of a criminal gang.
column2: 今天的墨西哥，病毒肆虐、毒贩猖獗、盗贼横行，再加上警察训练无素，有太多人为此丢了性命，太多人被犯罪团伙所挟持绑架。

column1: The flu epidemic, which probably began in the southern state of Veracruz, is yet another sign that all is not well in Mexico.
column2: 这场可能源自南部韦拉克鲁斯州的猪流感疫情则给墨西哥目前一团糟的局面雪上加霜。

column1: The country seems to be caught in a permanent, uneasy tug-of-war between the past and the future, between change and the actors who seek to place obstacles in its path.
column2: 墨西哥似乎陷入了一场过去与未来、变革与阻碍之间的、永久的、令人不安的拉锯战中。

column1: For example, when initial reports surfaced about the first swine flu cases, it took three weeks for the information to reach federal health authorities, because state governments were reluctant to report cases quickly due to political and electoral considerations.
column2: 从这场猪流感疫情暴发来看，各州政府出于政治选举考虑，不愿尽快向上报告疫情，因此直到第一批猪流感病例出现三周以后，墨西哥联邦医疗卫生部门才得到消息。

column1: Mexico faces mid-term elections for Congress in the fall, and President Felipe Calderón’s National Action Party is trailing slightly in the polls over its main rivals, who would like nothing better than to see a health emergency translate into a political defeat.
column2: 今年秋天，墨西哥国会将迎来中期选举，总统费利佩·卡尔德龙所在的国家行动党在民意调查中目前略微落后于主要竞争对手。 这些竞选对手最希望看到的莫过于国家行动党在医疗卫生事件上政治行动的失败。

column1: In the face of a public health system that seemed incapable of diagnosing and treating the outbreak quickly, the government felt it had little choice but to shut down Mexico City, dealing a severe blow to an already crippled economy.
column2: 疫情暴发后，墨西哥的公共医疗卫生体系似乎无力迅速诊治患者、控制疫情，政府不得不下令“关闭”墨西哥城，给原本已举步维艰的经济带来重创。

column1: In contrast with Mexico’s authoritarian past, when an “imperial presidency” constituted a major obstacle to modernization, power has been dispersed.
column2: 与过去阻碍现代化进程的“帝王总统”式独裁统治不同，如今墨西哥权力已不再集中。

column1: What the executive branch has relinquished, or been forced to give up, vested interests have seized.
column2: 行政部门放弃或被迫放弃的一部分权力如今已被各既得利益集团所掌控。

column1: The problem is no longer too much power in the president’s hands, but too much power in the hands of “veto centers” – including public-sector unions – that are blocking much-needed reforms, including in the health system.
column2: 现在权利过大的不是总统，而是包括公共部门工会在内的各 “否决中心 ” ， 正是它们阻挠了医疗卫生体制改革等一系列亟需推进的改革。

column1: In all likelihood, the 22 reported dead from swine flu reflect a social safety net falling to pieces due to lack of public investment and union recalcitrance.
column2: 由于公共投入不足和工会的反对阻挠，墨西哥的社会安全网已千疮百孔，这次疫情中22人死亡就是明证。

column1: The flu also revealed some of Mexico’s other fundamental flaws.
column2: 这场猪流感疫情同样也暴露出墨西哥其他根本性缺陷。

column1: The political system has become a peculiar hybrid of authoritarian remnants and newly established mechanisms for transparency.
column2: 其特有的政治体制中既含有独裁主义的残余也包括新建立起来的透明机制。

column1: The electoral process has been unable to guarantee decent democratic governance, rein in predatory practices among the political class, or make public officials follow established rules, keep them responsive to citizen preferences, and deter them from channeling public funds into private hands.
column2: 现行选举程序下，正当的民主治理得不到保证，政治阶级的掠夺行为屡禁不止，政府官员有章不循、中饱私囊、对民众诉求无动于衷。

column1: Lack of accountability has both encouraged corruption and fed perceptions that abuse remains unpunished. Impunity, in turn, erodes the credibility of the country’s institutions, including public hospitals and clinics.
column2: 问责制度的缺失滋生了腐败，滥用职权好像总能逃脱惩罚，这反过来又损害了公立医院、诊所等国家机构的公信力。

column1: Today, conspiracy theories abound in Mexico about the origins of the virus, because government officials are viewed with such ingrained suspicion.
column2: 关于疫情病毒的起源，目前在墨西哥有很多传言，民众莫衷一是，因为他们对政府官员早已不再信任。

column1: Throughout the epidemic, citizens have largely obeyed government guidelines and followed public health prescriptions. But that doesn’t mean they trust the government.
column2: 猪流感疫情暴发后，墨西哥民众虽然基本上遵照了政府的指示 和公共医疗卫生指南，但这并不意味着他们信任政府。

column1: Public-opinion polls reveal that more than 50% of the population believe that political parties are “not necessary” for the good of the country.
column2: 民意调查表明，超过50%的人认为政党间的竞争并不符合国家利益。

column1: Disapproval of Congress is growing, and people’s satisfaction with representative democracy has decreased.
column2: 民众对国会的支持率越来越低，对代议民主制度的满意程度也出现了下降。

column1: In the midst of the epidemic, 66% of Mexicans believe that the country is regressing.
column2: 疫情暴发后，多达66%的墨西哥人认为墨西哥正在退步。

column1: Seventy-five percent of crimes are not reported due to lack of trust in the authorities, and 98% of crimes are never resolved or punished.
column2: 由于民众对当局缺乏信心， 75% 的犯罪案件没有上报；98%的犯罪案件无果而终，犯罪分子仍逍遥法外。

column1: Public opinion seems disenchanted with a democracy incapable of offering tangible solutions to problems, the flu crisis being the most recent example.
column2: 民众对于现行民主政体似乎已不抱希望，不指望看到切实的解决方案，而这场猪流感疫情危机则再次证明了这一点。

column1: Saddled by a viral infection, drug-related insecurity, and rising crime, Mexico feels like a besieged place.
column2: 病毒的蔓延、毒品的泛滥、社会的动荡、不断上升的犯罪率，墨西哥似乎已四面楚歌、走投无路。

column1: The noted columnist Miguel Angel Granados Chapa wrote last week: “All that’s missing is for Mexico to get peed on by a dog.”
column2: 著名专栏作家Miguel Angel Granados Chapa上周就曾写道 ： “ 现在墨西哥就差受狗的胯下之辱了 。 ”

column1: Mexico’s bad health is a symptom of problems that run deeper and are more widespread than swine flu.
column2: 墨西哥生病了，其症状的根源比猪流感疫情来得更深更广。

column1: Over the past ten years, political and economic actors intent on preserving the status quo have blocked further democratic change and economic reform, condemning Mexico to move sideways, even as other emerging markets surge ahead.
column2: 过去十年中，政界和商界人士为维持现状，阻挠民主和经济的进一步改革，使墨西哥的发展偏离了方向。 而与此同时，其他新兴市场则纷纷崛起。

column1: Lately, political battles among key actors have not been about how to build a more effective of representative political system or a more equitable, dynamic economy, but about how to maintain control of accumulated power or distribute it among their allies.
column2: 最近，墨西哥政坛激烈争论的焦点并不是如何建立更有效、更具代表性的政治体系，或更公平、更具活力的经济体系，而是如何继续掌控手中的权利，如何与同盟分配这些权利。

column1: Political parties appear far removed from citizen demands, beset by internal divisions, incapable of addressing deep-rooted inequality and lawlessness, and prone to populist or authoritarian leadership that promises quick fixes to entrenched problems.
column2: 各政党忙于处理内部纠纷，无力实现公平、法治，指望善作承诺的民粹主义或独裁主义领导者瞬间把根深蒂固的问题消弭于无形。 对于民众的诉求，它们早已无暇顾及。

column1: Mexico’s current quandary is the flu, but it faces more important challenges than a mutating microbe.
column2: 墨西哥当前面临的难题是控制猪流感疫情��但这远远不是其挑战的全部。

column1: With more than 40 million people living in poverty and 7,000 killed in drug-related violence last year, Mexico will need to reform quickly to address what the virus has brought to light: a government far removed from the suffering of ordinary people and too frequently insensitive to their plight.
column2: 墨西哥仍有4000万贫困人口，仅去年一年就有7000余人死于毒品相关的暴力事件。 墨西哥需要迅速推进改革，以解决由猪流感疫情所暴露出的根源性问题 — — 即政府对普通民众的疾苦不闻不问、无动于衷。

column1: In this national crisis, Mexico’s people have closed ranks, collaborated, and showed that they are capable of working together to achieve common goals in the public interest.
column2: 面对这场全国性的危机，墨西哥人民齐心协力、共克时艰，展现出为公共利益团结奋斗的能力。

column1: But their political and economic elites frequently seem incapable of doing so.
column2: 然而，墨西哥政界和商界的精英们似乎常常无法做到这一点。

column1: That is why home seems far, far away for so many Mexicans.
column2: 因此，许多墨西哥人才会觉得家乡还在那很远很远的远方。

column1: How Economics Survived the Economic Crisis
column2: 经济学该如何从经济危机中幸存下来

column1: LONDON – The tenth anniversary of the start of the Great Recession was the occasion for an elegant essay by the Nobel laureate economist Paul Krugman, who noted how little the debate about the causes and consequences of the crisis have changed over the last decade.
column2: 发自伦敦 — — 在“大衰退”爆发十周年之际，诺贝尔经济学奖获得者，经济学家保罗·克鲁格曼（Paul Krugman）撰写了一篇雅致的论文，指出过去十年来关于危机成因和后果的辩论基本上无甚变化。

column1: Whereas the Great Depression of the 1930s produced Keynesian economics, and the stagflation of the 1970s produced Milton Friedman’s monetarism, the Great Recession has produced no similar intellectual shift.
column2: 鉴于1930年代的经济大萧条催生了凯恩斯主义经济学，而1970年代的滞胀则诞生了米尔顿·弗里德曼（Milton Friedman）的货币主义，但“大衰退”却并未产生类似的智力转变。

column1: This is deeply depressing to young students of economics, who hoped for a suitably challenging response from the profession.
column2: 这对那些年轻的经济学学子来说可算是非常令人沮丧的，因为他们希望这个专业至少能做出一个有恰当挑战性的回应。

column1: Why has there been none?
column2: 但为何却一片沉寂呢？

column1: Krugman’s answer is typically ingenious: the old macroeconomics was, as the saying goes, “good enough for government work.” It prevented another Great Depression.
column2: 克鲁格曼的答案果然极为巧妙：正如大家所认定的那样，旧有的宏观经济学“对政府工作来说已经足够了 ” ， 也阻止了另一场大萧条。

column1: So students should lock up their dreams and learn their lessons.
column2: 所以学生们应该把自己的梦想先放一放，先把课程学好。

column1: A decade ago, two schools of macroeconomists contended for primacy: the New Classical – or the “freshwater” – School, descended from Milton Friedman and Robert Lucas and headquartered at the University of Chicago, and the New Keynesian, or “saltwater,” School, descended from John Maynard Keynes, and based at MIT and Harvard.
column2: 十年前，两大流派的宏观经济学家都在争夺制高点：源自米尔顿·弗里德曼和罗伯特·卢卡斯（Robert Lucas ） ， 大本营位于芝加哥大学的新古典学派 — — 或所谓“淡水 ” ； 沿袭于约翰·梅纳德·凯恩斯（John Maynard Keynes ） ， 以麻省理工学院和哈佛大学为基地的新凯恩斯学派，或称“咸水 ” 。

column1: Freshwater-types believed that budgets deficits were always bad, whereas the saltwater camp believed that deficits were beneficial in a slump.
column2: 淡水派认为预算赤字总是不好的，而咸水阵营相信赤字在经济处于低谷时是有益的。

column1: Krugman is a New Keynesian, and his essay was intended to show that the Great Recession vindicated standard New Keynesian models.
column2: 克鲁格曼是一位新凯恩斯主义者，他的论文旨在表明“大衰退”正好证明了标准的新凯恩斯主义模式的有效性。

column1: But there are serious problems with Krugman’s narrative.
column2: 但克鲁格曼的叙述存在严重的问题。

column1: For starters, there is his answer to Queen Elizabeth II’s now-famous question: “Why did no one see it coming?”
column2: 首先是他对英女王伊丽莎白二世那个“为什么没有人意识到危机即将来临 ？ ” 的著名问题的回答。

column1: Krugman’s cheerful response is that the New Keynesians were looking the other way.
column2: 克鲁格曼乐观地回应说新凯恩斯主义者当时正在专心关注其他问题。

column1: Theirs was a failure not of theory, but of “data collection.” They had “overlooked” crucial institutional changes in the financial system.
column2: 他们的失败不是理论有问题，而是“数据收集”有误，他们“忽视”了金融体系的重大制度变迁。

column1: While this was regrettable, it raised no “deep conceptual issue” – that is, it didn’t demand that they reconsider their theory.
column2: 虽然这确实令人扼腕，但也并未暴露出“深层次的概念问题 ” — —也就是说这并不要求他们去重新思考自己的理论。

column1: Faced with the crisis itself, the New Keynesians had risen to the challenge.
They dusted off their old sticky-price models from the 1950s and 1960s, which told them three things. First, very large budget deficits would not drive up near-zero interest rates.
column2: 在危机来临之时，新凯恩斯主义者奋起迎接挑战。

column1: Second, even large increases in the monetary base would not lead to high inflation, or even to corresponding increases in broader monetary aggregates. And, third, there would be a positive national income multiplier, almost surely greater than one, from changes in government spending and taxation.
column2: 他们重新拾起了上世纪五六十年代的粘性价格模型，而该模型也给他们指明了三点：首先，巨额预算赤字不会推高近乎为零的利率；其次，基础货币量的更大幅增长不会导致高通胀，甚至不会导致更广意货币总量的相应增长；第三，政府支出和税收的变化会产生正面的国民收入乘数，而且该数字基本上一定会大于1。

column1: These propositions made the case for budget deficits in the aftermath of the collapse of 2008.
column2: 这些主张为2008年经济崩盘后的预算赤字铺平了道路。

column1: Policies based on them were implemented and worked “remarkably well.”
column2: 基于这些原则的政策得以施行而且运作得“极为良好 ” 。

column1: The success of New Keynesian policy had the ironic effect of allowing “the more inflexible members of our profession [the New Classicals from Chicago] to ignore events in a way they couldn’t in past episodes.” So neither school – sect might be the better word – was challenged to re-think first principles.
column2: 而新凯恩斯主义政策取得如此成就的讽刺性作用在于允许“我们这行中那些更为缺乏灵活性的成员（芝加哥的新古典学派）以一种在过去事件中不可能发生的方式去忽略这类事件 ” ， 因此这两大学派 — — 说不上谁比谁更好 — — 都面临着重新思考自身基本原则的挑战。

column1: This clever history of pre- and post-crash economics leaves key questions unanswered.
column2: 这种对崩盘前和崩盘后经济学流变的机智回顾却未能解答一系列关键问题。

column1: First, if New Keynesian economics was “good enough,” why didn’t New Keynesian economists urge precautions against the collapse of 2007-2008?
column2: 首先，如果新凯恩斯主义经济学真的“足够良好 ” ， 那为何新凯恩斯主义经济学家未能敦促人们对2007 ~2008年的崩溃加以防范？

column1: After all, they did not rule out the possibility of such a collapse a priori.
column2: 毕竟他们的推算也未排除崩盘的可能性。

column1: Krugman admits to a gap in “evidence collection.” But the choice of evidence is theory-driven.
column2: 克鲁格曼承认在“证据收集”方面存在差距，但证据的选择是由理论驱动的。

column1: In my view, New Keynesian economists turned a blind eye to instabilities building up in the banking system, because their models told them that financial institutions could accurately price risk.
column2: 在我看来，新凯恩斯主义经济学家们对银行系统的不稳定性视而不见，因为他们的模型告诉他们金融机构可以准确地为风险定价。

column1: So there was a “deep conceptual issue” involved in New Keynesian analysis: its failure to explain how banks might come to “underprice risk worldwide,” as Alan Greenspan put it.
column2: 所以在新凯恩斯主义分析中曾经出现了一个“深层次的概念问题 ” ： 它无力解释银行如何会像艾伦·格林斯潘（Alan Greenspan）所说的那样“全球一致地低估了​风险 ” 。

column1: Second, Krugman fails to explain why the Keynesian policies vindicated in 2008-2009 were so rapidly reversed and replaced by fiscal austerity.
column2: 其二，克鲁格曼没有解释为何在2008~2009年被证明有效的凯恩斯主义政策会如此迅速地被财政紧缩政策逆转和取代。

column1: Why didn’t policymakers stick to their stodgy fixed-price models until they had done their work?
column2: 为什么政策制定者未能在完工之前一直坚持使用那套古板的固定价格模型呢？

column1: Why abandon them in 2009, when Western economies were still 4-5% below their pre-crash levels?
column2: 为什么在2009年西方经济体经济总量仍然低于事件发生前水平4~5％的时候就放弃了它们呢？

column1: The answer I would give is that when Keynes was briefly exhumed for six months in 2008-2009, it was for political, not intellectual, reasons.
column2: 我所给出的答案是，当凯恩斯主义在2008~2009年间被短暂起用了六个月时，这是出于政治而非理智的原因。

column1: Because the New Keynesian models did not offer a sufficient basis for maintaining Keynesian policies once the economic emergency had been overcome, they were quickly abandoned.
column2: 由于一系列新凯恩斯主义模型在度过了经济紧张时期后未能为凯恩斯主义政策提供充分的依据，所以很快就被抛弃了。

column1: Krugman comes close to acknowledging this: New Keynesians, he writes, “start with rational behavior and market equilibrium as a baseline, and try to get economic dysfunction by tweaking that baseline at the edges.”
column2: 克鲁格曼几乎承认了这一点：他写道，新凯恩斯主义者“以理性行为和市场均衡为基准线，试图通过对基准线的边缘微调来应对经济功能失调 ” 。

column1: Such tweaks enable New Keynesian models to generate temporary real effects from nominal shocks, and thus justify quite radical intervention in times of emergency.
column2: 这种微调使得新凯恩斯主义模型能够通过名义货币上的冲击产生暂时性的真实作用，从而证明在紧急情况下实施相当激进的干预手段是合理的。

column1: But no tweaks can create a strong enough case to justify sustained interventionist policy.
column2: 但是没有任何微调措施可以为持续的干预政策创造足够强大的理由。

column1: The problem for New Keynesian macroeconomists is that they fail to acknowledge radical uncertainty in their models, leaving them without any theory of what to do in good times in order to avoid the bad times.
column2: 新凯恩斯主义宏观经济学家面临的问题在于不愿承认自身模型中存在的极端不确定性，以致缺乏任何理论来指导在景气时期应该做些什么以避免不景气。

column1: Their focus on nominal wage and price rigidities implies that if these factors were absent, equilibrium would readily be achieved.
column2: 他们对名义工资和价格刚性的关注似乎意味着倘若不存在这些因素，均衡就能被毫不费力地实现。

column1: They regard the financial sector as neutral, not as fundamental (capitalism’s “ephor,” as Joseph Schumpeter put it).
column2: 他们认为金融部门是中性的，而不是基础性的 — — 正如约瑟夫·熊彼特（Joseph Schumpeter）所说的那样是资本主义的“监察官 ” 。

column1: Without acknowledgement of uncertainty, saltwater economics is bound to collapse into its freshwater counterpart.
column2: 如果不承认这一不确定性，咸水经济学派必然会沦落到跟淡水学派一个德行。

column1: New Keynesian “tweaking” will create limited political space for intervention, but not nearly enough to do a proper job.
column2: 新凯恩斯主义的“微调”可以为干预行为创造出有限的政治空间，但还不足以恰当地完成整个工作。

column1: So Krugman’s argument, while provocative, is certainly not conclusive.
column2: 因此克鲁格曼的论点虽然让人觉得有点道理，但肯定还算不上是定论。

column1: Macroeconomics still needs to come up with a big new idea.
column2: 宏观经济学还有待提出一个新的大理论来支撑。

column1: Why a Sino-American Cold War Won’t Happen
column2: 为何中美冷战不会发生

column1: OXFORD – It is often said that the US and China – superpowers at economic, geopolitical, and ideological loggerheads – are heading toward a new cold war.
column2: 牛津—经常有人说美国和中国 — — 经济、地缘政治和意识形态的超级大国 — — 正在走向新冷战。

column1: And the rhetoric – at least from one side – has come to resemble that of Winston Churchill’s 1946 “Iron Curtain” speech, one of the inaugural events of the Cold War.
