column2: 其说辞 — — 至少从一方看 — — 类似于丘吉尔1946年的《铁幕》演说。 丘吉尔的这次演说是冷战拉开序幕的标志性事件之一。

column1: Just this month, US Vice President Mike Pence accused China of predatory economic practices, military aggression against the United States, and attempts to undermine US President Donald Trump.
column2: 这个月，美国副总统彭斯指责中国的掠夺性经济政策、对美军事侵略，以及试图削弱美国总统特朗普。

column1: But despite the media hype, a new cold war is not inevitable – or even likely.
column2: 但是，媒体固热闹，然则新冷战并非不可避免 — — 甚至连发生的可能性都很小。

column1: To be sure, Chinese leaders, fearing disorder and any weakening of the Communist Party of China’s legitimacy, are determined to prevent the US from forcing changes on China’s political and economic system.
column2: 诚然，中国领导人担心失序和中共在中国的合法性削弱，必然会阻止美国迫使中国改变政治和经济制度。

column1: China will continue to pursue reforms at its own pace and in its own way.
column2: 中国将继续以自己的节奏和方式实施改革。

column1: For Chinese President Xi Jinping, a top priority is to merge the CPC with the machinery of government in order to reduce corruption and burnish the state’s ideological credentials.
column2: 对中国国家主席习近平而言，重中之重是将中共与政府机器融合在一起，消除腐败，让国家的意识形态闪光。

column1: Any attempt to interfere in this process would be crossing a red line.
column2: 一切干扰这一进程的动作都会被视为越过红线。

column1: Fortunately for Xi, Trump has no interest in “democratizing” other countries, and he doesn’t seem to have been swayed by the US investors, financiers, and technology titans who want his administration to press for more access to the Chinese economy.
column2: 对习近平来说，幸运的是特朗普没兴趣“民主化”其他国家，也没有被迫切想要更深入中国经济的美国投资者、金融家和科技巨头动摇。

column1: No doubt, US tariffs threaten the 18% of Chinese exports that go to the US each year.
column2: 毫无疑问，美国的关税威胁着中国对美出口年度总量的18 % 。

column1: But the Trump administration has more urgent priorities than changing China’s system of government, notwithstanding the aggressive rhetoric of US Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer and White House National Trade Council Director Peter Navarro.
column2: 但改变中国治国的制度（system of government）不是特朗普政府最紧迫的重点工作，尽管美国贸易代表罗伯特·莱特希泽（Robert Lighthizer）和白宫国家贸易委员会主任彼得·纳瓦罗（Peter Navarro）气势汹汹。

column1: Trump desperately wants to bolster US manufacturing by repatriating global supply chains and blocking or curbing imports.
column2: 特朗普急于通过让全球供应链回流以及阻止和削减进口来提振美国制造业。

column1: “Make America Great Again” is really about making in America again.
column2: “让美国再次伟大”其实就是让美国再次制造。

column1: Still, even if today’s US-China standoff does not evolve into a new cold war, it could weaken both countries and usher in a more multipolar world.
column2: 尽管如此，即便当下的美中僵局没有演化为新冷战，也有可能让两国两败俱伤，形成更加多极化的世界。

column1: Within China, US rhetorical broadsides, tariffs, and sanctions may be empowering Xi’s domestic critics.
column2: 在中国国内，美国言辞激烈的抨击、关税以及制裁可能会让习近平的国内批评者得势。

column1: And it doesn’t help that China currently has limited options for retaliating.
column2: 中国目前报复手段有限也是个问题。

column1: True, it could start to sell off some of its $1 trillion in US dollar reserves.
column2: 诚然，它可以抛售部分1万亿美元储备。

column1: But that would weaken the value of the US Treasuries that it continues to hold.
column2: 但这将让其剩下的美国国债价值缩水。

column1: Within the US, Trump’s decision to pursue sweeping import tariffs has been described by one industry representative as “the most self-destructive trade act I’ve ever seen.”
column2: 在美国国内，特朗普征收全面进口关税的决定被某产业代表描述为“我所见过的最为自杀性的贸易政策 。 ”

column1: And the administration’s renegotiation of the North American Free Trade Agreement – which includes a clause to prevent Canada or Mexico from negotiating with China – has met with similar disdain.
column2: 其政府重新谈判北美自由贸易协定 — — 其中一个条款禁止加拿大和墨西哥与中国进行谈判 — — 也遭到了类似的抨击。

column1: Such policies threaten both to destroy US jobs and to alienate America’s allies, many of which are already distancing themselves.
column2: 这些政策有可能会毁掉美国的就业岗位，疏远美国的盟友 — — 其中许多已开始自我疏远。

column1: Indeed, the Trump administration’s “America First” positions have increasingly translated into “America Alone.”
column2: 事实上，特朗普政府的“美国优先”立场已日益转变为“美国孤立 ” 。

column1: The US now constitutes a minority of one within the G7, the G20, and the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change.
column2: 目前，美国已是G7、G20和联合国气候变化框架公约的孤家寡人。

column1: After Trump pulled the US out of the Trans-Pacific Partnership (TPP), the remaining parties moved ahead on their own.
column2: 特朗普令美国退出跨太平洋合作伙伴关系（TPP）后，其他各方在继续前进。

column1: Far from setting the terms of debate on international issues, the Trump administration has convinced other countries to reduce their reliance on US leadership.
column2: 特朗普政府没能为国际问题的争论制定规范，反而让其他国家决定降低对美国领导的依赖。

column1: Widespread circumvention of the US will hasten the emergence of a new multipolar order.
column2: 普遍的规避美国现象将加快新多极秩序的出现。

column1: For example, by withdrawing from the Iran nuclear deal, Trump has essentially dared the United Kingdom, France, Germany, China, Russia, and the European Union to defy US prerogatives.
column2: 比如，特朗普退出伊朗核协议其实起到了让英国、法国、德国、中国、俄罗斯和欧盟敢于否认美国的特权的效果。

column1: For now, countries that rely on Iranian oil may have no choice but to go along with the US.
column2: 现在，需要依靠伊朗石油的国家可能别无选择，只能与美国站边。

column1: Like most traded goods, oil exports are paid for in dollars – largely through the Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication (SWIFT) in Belgium – and the US has the power to shut down such transactions.
column2: 和大部分贸易品一样，石油出口用美元支付 — — 主要是通过位于比利时的世界银行间通讯协会（SWIFT）进行 — — 美国有权力切断这些交易。

column1: Most companies and countries have concluded that doing business in Iran is not worth losing access to the US market and the international dollar-payments system.
column2: 大部分公司和国家认为与伊朗做生意还无法与失去美国市场和国际美元支付体系相提并论。

column1: But in the future, they may no longer have to make such tradeoffs.
column2: 但在未来，它们也许根本不必做出这样的权衡。

column1: On August 21, Germany’s foreign minister, Heiko Maas, urged Europe to establish payment channels that are independent of the US.
column2: 8月21日，德国外交部长海科·马斯（Heiko Maas）敦促欧洲建立独立于美国的支付渠道。

column1: And the following month, the EU’s foreign policy chief announced plans to form a “special purpose vehicle” to “assist and reassure economic operators pursuing legitimate business with Iran.”
column2: 9月，欧盟外交政策长官宣布准备成立“特殊目的机构”以“协助和确保经济运营者与伊朗进行合法的业务往来 。 ”

column1: Meanwhile, Russia has said that it is developing its own system for financial transfers, to protect itself from being shut out of the SWIFT system in the event of harsher US sanctions.
column2: 与此同时，俄罗斯说它正在开发自己的金融转账系统，以免因为美国制裁升级而被排斥在SWIFT系统之外。

column1: And China has been pursuing a similar project at least since 2015, when the People’s Bank of China launched a system to facilitate cross-border transactions in renminbi.
column2: 中国则至少从2015年就开始实施类似的计划，中国人民银行推出了便利跨境人民币交易的系统。

column1: None of these alternative systems have yet to match the convenience of SWIFT and the dollar system.
column2: 目前，这些替代方案无一能够比拟SWIFT和美元系统的便利性。

column1: But if a new system were to take hold, it could rapidly shift power away from the US.
column2: 但如果新系统站稳了脚跟，就有可能迅速从美国手中夺取权力。

column1: Rather than a cold war, the world may be heading toward an international system led by four powers, with the US, China, Russia, and Germany dominating their respective regions and seeking the upper hand in international negotiations.
column2: 世界可能没在迈向冷战，而是在迈向由四方力量领导的国际体系，美国、中国、俄罗斯和德国主导各自的地区，并在国际谈判中争夺上风。

column1: Such a scenario is reminiscent of the World War II vision of US President Franklin D. Roosevelt, who proposed that the four victorious allies – the US, the UK, China, and the Soviet Union – act as “Four Policemen,” each patrolling its own sphere of influence and negotiating with the others on world peace.
column2: 这一情景让人想起了美国总统小罗斯福的二战愿景 — — 他提出由美国、英国、中国和苏联四个战胜同盟国组成“四大警察 ” ， 各自巡查自己的势力范围，并与其他三方协商世界和平。

column1: Today, approximations of the same four powers are once again in the lead, only now we have stronger international institutions to help keep the peace.
column2: 如今，基本相同的四股力量再一次领先，只不过这一次我们拥有更强大的国际制度帮助维持和平。

column1: Whether that peace lasts will depend on the willingness of the four powers to use and adapt those institutions to the emerging international system.
column2: 和平能否持续将取决于四强运用和调整这些制度，使之与新形成的国际体系匹配的意愿。

column1: Natural-Born Pianists?
column2: 天生钢琴家？

column1: LONDON – The editor of The Guardian, Alan Rusbridger, has written a book about how he decided to practice the piano 20 minutes a day.
column2: 伦敦 一 《卫报》编辑艾伦·拉斯布里哲（Alan Rusbridger）写了一部关于他如何决定每天弹20分钟钢琴的书。

column1: Eighteen months later, he played Chopin’s fearsomely difficult Ballade No. 1 in G Minor to an admiring audience of friends.
column2: 18个月后，他弹出了肖邦难度极高的G小调一号叙事曲，围观亲友为之倾倒。

column1: Could anyone have done this?
column2: 任何人都能做到这一点吗？

column1: Or did it require special talent?
column2: 还是说着需要特别的天分？

column1: The nature-versus-nurture debate has been around a long time. It is unresolved because the scientific question has always been entangled with politics.
column2: 先天-后天争论由来已久，至今仍未解决，因为这一科学问题总是与政治纠结不清。

column1: Broadly speaking, those stressing inborn capacity have been political conservatives; those emphasizing nurture have been political radicals.
column2: 大体说来，强调天赋异禀的是政治保守派，强调后天的是政治激进派。

column1: The nineteenth-century philosopher John Stuart Mill was of the “anyone can do it” school.
column2: 19世纪哲学家约翰·穆勒是“人人都是天才”派成员。

column1: He was convinced that his achievements were in no way due to superior heredity: anyone of “normal intelligence and health,” subjected to his father’s educational system – which included learning Greek at the age of three – could have become John Stuart Mill.
column2: 他相信他的成就跟基因优良毫无关系：任何“智力和健康状况正常者”在其父的教育制度下 — — 包括从三岁开始学习希腊文 — — 都可以变成约翰·穆勒。

column1: Mill was part of his century’s liberal attack on aristocratic privilege: achievement was the result of opportunity, not birth.
column2: 穆勒是当时对贵族特权发起攻击的人之一：成就来自机会，而不是出身。

column1: The practice of the faculties (education) unleashes potential that would otherwise remain dormant.
column2: 学校（教育）实践能激发隐藏的潜能。

column1: Charles Darwin seemingly overturned this optimistic view of the potential beneficial effects of nurture.
column2: 查尔斯·达尔文似乎扭转了这一后天努力潜在积极影响的乐观观点。

column1: Species evolve, Darwin said, through “natural selection” – the random selection, through competition, of biological traits favorable to survival in a world of scarce resources.
column2: 达尔文说，物种通过“自然选择”进化 — — 即通过竞争随机选择生物特征有利于在资源稀缺的世界生存的物种。

column1: Herbert Spencer used the phrase “survival of the fittest” to explain how societies evolve.
column2: 赫伯特·斯宾塞用“适者生存”来解释社会演化。

column1: Social Darwinists interpreted natural selection to mean that any humanitarian effort to improve the condition of the poor would impede the progress of the human race by burdening it with an excess of drones.
column2: 社会达尔文主义者对自然选择的解读是，这意味着改善穷人条件的人道主义努力会产生过多的懒汉，从而阻碍人种进步。

column1: Society would be spending scarce resources on losers rather than winners.
column2: 社会将把稀缺资源用于输家而不是赢家。

column1: This fit the ideology of a brand of capitalism that was “red in tooth and claw.”
column2: 这符合“野蛮”资本主义观念。

column1: Indeed, social Darwinism provided a pseudo-scientific justification for the American belief in laissez-faire (with the successful businessman epitomizing the survival of the fittest); for eugenics (the deliberate attempt to breed superior individuals, on the model of horse-breeding, and prevent the “over-breeding” of the unfit); and for the eugenic-cum-racial theories of Nazism.
column2: 事实上，社会达尔文主义为美国人的自由放任信仰（成功商人即生存下来的适者 ） 、 优生学（按照育马模式有意识地选育超级个人，防止不适者的“过度繁育 ” ） 以及纳粹的优等人种理论提供了伪科学的论据。

column1: In reaction to social Darwinism’s murderous tendencies, Mill’s view became dominant after World War II in the form of social democracy.
column2: 为了对付社会达尔文主义这残暴倾向，穆勒的观点在二战后以社会民主的形式成为主流。

column1: State action to improve diet, education, health, and housing would enable the poor to realize their potential.
column2: 改善饮食、教育、卫生和住房条件的国家行动能让穷人实现自己的潜能。

column1: Competition as a social principle was downgraded in favor of cooperation.
column2: 竞争作为社会原则，其重要性不如合作。

column1: Differences in innate ability were not denied (at least by the sensible).
column2: 先天能力的差别并没有被否认（至少理智者没有否认 ） 。

column1: But it was rightly felt that there was a huge amount of work to be done to raise average levels of achievement before one needed to start worrying that one’s policies were promoting the survival of the unfit.
column2: 但一种正确的观念是可以通过大量工作提高成就的平均水平，然后再开始担心某政策会有利于不适者的生存不迟。

column1: Then the mood began to shift again.
column2: 接着，情绪又开始了转变。

column1: Social democracy was attacked for penalizing the successful and rewarding the unsuccessful.
column2: 社会民主受到了抨击，因为它惩罚成功者，奖励不成功者。

column1: In 1976, the biologist Richard Dawkins identified the unit of Darwinian selection as the “selfish gene.”
column2: 1976年，生物学家理查德·道金斯识别出达尔文主义选择单元，称之为“自私的基因 ” 。

column1: The evolutionary story was now recast as a battle of genes to secure their survival over time by means of mutations, which create individuals (phenotypes) best adapted to pass on their genes.
column2: 如今，进化的故事被演绎成基因生存战，随着时间的推移，各种基因通过突变保证其生存，于是产生了最适于传递基因的表型。

column1: In the course of evolution, the inferior phenotypes disappear.
column2: 在进化过程中，劣等表型消失了。

column1: Although this view of evolution would not have been possible before the discovery of DNA, it is no coincidence that it rose to prominence in the age of Ronald Reagan and Margaret Thatcher.
column2: 尽管这一进化观点在DNA发现之前根本不可能出现，但其在里根和撒切尔时代成为主流并非巧合。

column1: To be sure, the selfish gene needs to be “altruistic” insofar as its survival depends on the survival of the kinship group.
column2: 平心而论，在生存取决于亲族的生存时，自私的基因需要“利他 ” 。

column1: But it need not be that altruistic.
column2: 但此利他非彼利他。

column1: And, although Dawkins later regretted calling his gene “selfish” (he says that “immortal” would have been better), his choice of adjective was certainly best adapted to maximizing sales of his book at that particular time.
column2: 此外，尽管道金斯后来又后悔将他的基因称为“自私 ” （ 他说 ， “ 不朽”更合适 ） ， 但他对形容词的选择毫无疑问最适合在当时的特定时期最大化其著作销��。

column1: Since then, we have turned away from advocacy of selfishness, but we have not recovered an independent moral language.
column2: 此后，我们开始远离自私论，但尚未重新找到新的独立道德规则。

column1: The new orthodoxy, suitable for a world in which the unrestrained pursuit of greed has proved economically disastrous, is that the human species is genetically programmed to be moral, because only by acting morally (caring for the survival of others) can it ensure its long-term survival.
column2: 新正统 — — 适合不受约束的贪婪已被证明市场灾难的世界 — — 是人类基因程序设定是让其符合道德，因为有道德（关心他人生存）能保证其自身的长期生存。

column1: The “hard-wiring” metaphor dominates contemporary moral language.
column2: “硬接线”比喻主导着当代道德观念。

column1: According to the United Kingdom’s chief rabbi, Jonathan Sacks, religious beliefs are useful for our survival, by inducing us to act in socially cooperative ways: “We have mirror neurons that lead us to feel pain when we see others suffering,” he recently wrote.
column2: 根据英国首席拉比乔纳森·萨克斯（Jonathan Sachs）的说法，宗教信仰有利于我们的生存，因为它让我们的行为变成社会合作：他最近写道“我们拥有镜像神经元，这让我们在目睹他人遭难时感同身受 。 ”

column1: Consideration for others is “located in the prefrontal cortex.”
column2: 而宗教“重新配置了我们的神经通路 。 ”

column1: And religion “reconfigures our neural pathways.” In short: “Far from refuting religion, the Neo-Darwinists have helped us understand why it matters.”
column2: 简而言之 ， “ 新达尔文主义绝不排斥宗教，反而有助于我们理解为何宗教很重要 。 ”

column1: So we need not fear that it will decline.
column2: 因此我们不必担心宗教衰落。

column1: Atheists might not agree.
column2: 无神论者可能不会同意。

column1: But it is an extraordinary statement for a religious leader to make, because it sets to one side the question of the truth or falsehood, or the ethical value, of religious beliefs.
column2: 但宗教领袖作此言论是极不寻常的，因为这集中于真理和谬误，或宗教信仰的道德价值问题的一面。

column1: Or rather: all that wiring in the prefrontal cortex must be ethical, because it is good for survival.
column2: 或者说，所有前额皮质内的通路都是道德的，因为这有助于我们的生存。

column1: But, in that case, what ethical value is there in survival?
column2: 但是，既然如此，那里生存着什么道德价值呢？

column1: Does the continued survival of the human race have any value in itself, independent of what we achieve or create?
column2: 人类的持续生存自有其价值，不论我们的成就和创造吗？

column1: We need to rescue morality from the claims of science.
column2: 我们需要从科学角度拯救道德。

column1: We need to assert what philosophers and religious teachers have at all times asserted: that there is something called the good life, apart from survival, and our understanding of it has to be taught, just as Mill’s father taught him the elements of Aristotle’s Posterior Analytics.
column2: 我们需要维护哲学家和宗教导师时刻教导的 — — 有一种东西叫美好生活（good life ） ， 它独立于生存之外，对它的理解需要有人教导，正如穆勒的父亲教他亚里士多德《后分析篇》的内容。

column1: Our nature may predispose us to learn; but what we learn depends on how we are nurtured.
column2: 我们的天性或许能驱使我们学习，但学习什么取决于后天接受。

column1: Obama’s Rocky Path to Success in Syria
column2: 奥巴马在叙利亚艰难的成功之路

column1: NEW YORK – In my experience, if you are attacked for your diplomacy from both left and right, by doves and hawks, and by internationalists and isolationists, you probably have it just right.
column2: 纽约 — — 以我的经验，如果左右翼势力、鸽派和鹰派、国际主义者和孤立主义者同时攻击你的外交政策，那么你的政策可能恰到好处。

column1: In the avalanche of commentary on this month’s US-Russia deal on Syria’s chemical weapons, few have been prepared to call it a “win-win-win” outcome for the United States, Russia, and the Syrian people.
column2: 在对本月美俄叙利亚化武交易雪片般的评论中，很少有人认为这是美国、俄国和叙利亚民众共赢的结果。

column1: But – at least so far – that is what it is.
column2: 但至少从目前看，恰恰出现了这样的状况。

column1: President Barack Obama and his team, despite some missteps, deserve most of the credit.
column2: 虽然有些失误，但大部分功劳应当归结于奥巴马总统及其团队。

column1: The charge sheet against Obama over Syria is long.
column2: 奥巴马在叙利亚有很多可以指责的东西。

column1: The US, it is said, took no decisive action while 100,000 Syrians were dying, and it had no strategy to end the conflict.
column2: 人人都说美国在100,000叙利亚民众面临死亡时没有采取果断行动，也没有拿出结束冲突的策略。

column1: Obama created expectations that the US would act if chemical weapons were used, only to stall when the time came.
column2: 奥巴马创造了启用化学武器就会招致美国军事行动的预期，但那一刻真正到来时却又找出各种托辞。

column1: Then, when a response became unavoidable, he threatened both too much and too little military force.
column2: 之后，当不可避免要做出反应时，他总是言辞威胁，却极少诉诸武力。

column1: He paid too little, then too much, attention to domestic opponents of intervention.
column2: 他先是太不注重、之后又太过注重国内反对干预的势力。

column1: Above all, he allowed an ever-cynical Kremlin to outplay the US diplomatically.
column2: 最重要的是，他让玩世不恭的克里姆林在外交上抢占了先机。

column1: But consider the constraints.
column2: 但我们必须考虑到其中的诸多限制。

column1: There was never a time in the crisis, until the chemical-weapons issue erupted, when US military intervention in any form seemed likely to save more lives than it would endanger.
column2: 直到化武问题爆发之前，美国军事干预在危机中害人的机率从来都大于救人的机率。

column1: The increasing influence of jihadists in the rebel ranks made support for an outright opposition victory increasingly untenable.
column2: 圣战者在叛军队伍中的影响日益扩大让反对派获得全胜的可能性越来越小。

column1: There simply was not enough hard evidence of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad’s use of chemical weapons, at least before the Ghouta massacre in August, to pressure Russia – either in the United Nations Security Council or the court of global opinion – to reconsider its reflex support of the regime.
column2: 至少在叙利亚总统巴沙尔·阿萨德在8月的古塔（Ghouta）大屠杀中使用化学武器之前，无论是在联合国安理会还是全球舆情领域，根本没有足够的铁证能够迫使俄国重新考虑其对阿萨德政权的习惯性支持。

column1: Moreover, while the Obama administration remained determined to preserve US leadership in responding – with force, where necessary – to mass atrocity crimes (the global “responsibility to protect” agenda), a decade of fighting in Iraq and Afghanistan has left Americans desperately war-weary.
column2: 此外，虽然奥巴马政府依然决心维护美国在应对大规模暴行（全球“保护责任”议程 ） （ 必要的话不排除武力应对）中的领导地位，十年的伊拉克和阿富汗战争已经让美国人感到极度疲惫。

column1: That is true in the West generally, as shown by the United Kingdom’s parliamentary vote against participating in any intervention.
column2: 这种情绪在西方非常普遍，比如英国议会就投票反对参与任何干预行动。

column1: For almost everyone, George W. Bush’s “decisiveness” made vacillation seem like a better option.
column2: 几乎所有人都认为乔治·W·布什的“果断”还不如犹豫。

column1: Against this background, consider what Obama has achieved.
column2: 在这样的背景下再看看奥巴马取得的成绩。

column1: A descent into chemical-weapons hell has been averted, almost certainly permanently: the Assad regime knows that it has no friends or protectors left should it cross that red line again.
column2: 堕入化武地狱的恐怖局面已经避免，而且几乎肯定具有永久性：阿萨德政权知道如果再次越过红线朋友和保护伞都将不复存在。

column1: Military intervention, with all of its problems, has been avoided for now; but Assad knows that the US will have no option but to attack – with or without explicit Security Council and Congressional resolutions – should he perpetrate another such horror.
column2: 能造成诸多问题的军事干预至少目前得以避免；但阿萨德知道不管有没有明确的安理会和国会决议，如果他再次进行这样的恐怖活动，美国将别无选择只能干预。

column1: Above all, diplomatic cooperation on chemical weapons has opened the door at last to a negotiated settlement of the underlying conflict in Syria.
column2: 最重要的是，化武外交合作最终打开了谈判解决叙利亚冲突的大门。

column1: And the UN is back at center stage, as a rules-based international order demands that it should be on such issues, with both its weapons inspectors and the Security Council regarded as central to future developments.
column2: 联合国也像以规则为基础的国际秩序所要求的那样回到了舞台的中央，武器核查人员和安理会被视为未来形势发展的核心角色。

column1: Yes, there were some things that could and should have been done differently.
column2: 是的，总有些问题可以而且应当采取不同的处理方式。

column1: There always are.
column2: 永远会有改进的余地。

column1: If the justified intervention in Libya by the US, the UK, and France had not later been conducted with such cloth-eared indifference to Russian, Chinese, and developing-country concern about mandate overreach, greater unity on Syria could have been achieved in the Security Council in 2011, when a united message might have stopped Assad cold.
column2: 如果美、英、法等国的正当干预后来没有以无视俄、中和其他发展中国家对越权干预担心的方式进行，安理会在2011年或许就能在叙利亚问题上更加团结，各方发出的联合讯息或许已经阻止了阿萨德的胡作非为。

column1: Going to Congress for approval was always going to involve more risks than rewards.
column2: 报请国会批准所伴随的风险几乎肯定要大于收益。

column1: Secretary of State John Kerry’s description of the planned US military response to the Ghouta massacre as likely to be “unbelievably small” almost derailed the utility of the US threat in concentrating Syrian and Russian officials’ minds.
column2: 约翰·克里国务卿有关美国对古塔大屠杀的军事应对计划可能“令人难以置信的微不足道”的描述几乎彻底消灭了美国在叙利亚和俄罗斯官员眼中的威胁。

column1: And the administration could have helped itself by better explaining that a cooperative response to the Assad regime’s use of chemical weapons had long been on the table, and was not just the result of deftly opportunistic Russian diplomacy in response to a Kerry thought-bubble.
column2: 而奥巴马政府更好地解释对阿萨德政权使用化武的合作策略其实一直存在，而并非俄国对克里思想泡沫所做出的灵光一现的机会主义外交反应可能会有所帮助。

column1: What has trumped these missteps, and enabled each side to focus on opportunities rather than excuses, is that both the US and Russia now understand that they have common interests in Syria.
column2: 美国和俄罗斯现在清楚他们在叙利亚拥有共同利益掩盖了这些失误，使得各方对机会而不是借口更加关注。

column1: Both sides want not only to preclude the Assad regime’s further use of chemical weapons, but also to find a route to sustainable peace in Syria, and to reestablish the authority and utility of the UN in these situations.
column2: 双方想要的不只是杜绝阿萨德政权进一步使用化学武器，而且要找到叙利亚持久和平之路，并且重建联合国在类似情况下的权威和效用。

column1: Of course, optimism must be tempered.
column2: 当然，还必须逐步培养乐观主义。

column1: Plenty can go wrong in the period ahead.
column2: 今后还有很多��以犯的错误。

column1: Either a beleaguered Assad or an increasingly desperate opposition might destroy the deal on the ground.
column2: 身处困境的阿萨德或者越来越绝望的反对派都有可能破坏已经达成的协议。

column1: The fragile rapprochement between the US and Russia may not hold, particularly if the US again insists – breaking its recent helpful silence – that Assad has no place at the negotiating table.
column2: 美俄之间的脆弱和解可能无法坚持，特别是如果美国打破近来有益的沉默，再次提出谈判桌上没有阿萨德的位置。

column1: But when the major powers cooperate in a just cause, the world is a safer and saner place.
column2: 不过当大国合作完成正义的事业，世界就会变得更加安全和理智。

column1: That is where both the US and Russia – and on this issue China as well – want to be.
column2: 那是美国、俄国（在叙利亚问题上还有中国）希望看到的结果。

column1: If Obama’s caution and flexibility have been the key to getting us here, let us give praise where it is due.
column2: 如果奥巴马的谨慎和灵活是我们实现目标的关键所在，那么让我们不吝给予它应有的评价。

column1: The US with Iran in Syria
column2: 美国和伊朗在叙利亚

column1: PRINCETON – The prospect of a US military strike on Syria has dimmed following President Barack Obama’s embrace of an international initiative to take control of Syria’s chemical-weapons stockpile.
column2: 普林斯顿 — — 继美国总统奥巴马接受控制叙利亚化学武器库存的国际倡议之后，美国军事打击叙利亚的可能性已经越来越小。

column1: The eleventh-hour U-turn on the push for military action has come against a backdrop of intensifying diplomatic pressure from the international community to avoid escalation of the violence in Syria.
column2: 国际社会呼吁避免叙利亚暴力活动升级的外交压力越来越强，直接导致了此次军事行动在最后时刻调头。

column1: And that outcome is not possible without Iran.
column2: 没有伊朗的参与根本不可能实现这一目标。

column1: In a joint press conference with his Syrian counterpart, Walid al-Moallem, Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov tabled a proposal, originally agreed with Iran, calling for Syria to “place chemical weapons storage sites under international control.”
column2: 在与叙利亚外长瓦利德·穆阿利姆的联合新闻发布会上，俄罗斯外长拉夫罗夫提出了一份最初与伊朗达成一致的议案，呼吁叙利亚“将化学武器的储存点置于国际控制之下 。 ”

column1: The stockpiles would then be destroyed and Syria would fully join the international Chemical Weapons Convention.
column2: 化学武器库存将会被销毁，同时叙利亚将全面加入国际《禁止化学武器公约 》 。

column1: The second component of the Russian-Iranian proposal calls for international efforts, under the auspices of the United Nations Security Council, to rein in Syrian rebel forces’ chemical-weapons capabilities.
column2: 俄伊提案的第二部分呼吁在联合国安理会主持下展开国际努力，以遏制叙利亚叛军使用化学武器。

column1: Moallem immediately embraced the proposal.
column2: 穆阿利姆立即接受了这项提议。

column1: Hours later, UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon did as well, while Obama said that “I fervently hope that this can be resolved in a non-military way.”
column2: 几小时后，联合国秘书长潘基文也表示赞同，奥巴马则表示“我热切希望能够以非军事方式解决这一问题 。 ”

column1: This initiative would allow Obama to escape from a messy political and foreign-policy predicament.
column2: 这项倡议能使奥巴马摆脱杂乱无章的政治和外交政策困局。

column1: But the matter is far from settled: Obama has not ruled out a military strike.
column2: 但问题还远远没有解决：奥巴马并没有彻底放弃军事打击。

column1: So here are 12 reasons why America should grasp the opportunity for a diplomatic resolution afforded by the Russian-Iranian plan.
column2: 因此有12条理由支持美国抓住俄伊计划所带来的叙利亚问题的外交解决机会。

column1: First, there is evidence that the Syrian opposition has amassed chemical weapons.
column2: 首先，有证据表明叙利亚反对派已经积聚了化学武器。

column1: In December 2012, Iran officially informed the US about chemical weapons, including sarin gas, being transferred to Syria.
column2: 2012年12月，伊朗正式通知美国有迹象表明沙林毒气等化学武器正在运往叙利亚国内。

column1: The US declined to cooperate with Iran to press ahead on the case.
column2: 美国拒绝与伊朗合作解决这一问题。

column1: Second, US military strikes on Syria have the potential to engulf the entire region – and perhaps the US – in a broader war.
column2: 其次，美国军事打击叙利亚有可能引燃大规模战火吞噬整个地区 — — 甚至可能包括美国自己。

column1: After its experiences in Afghanistan and Iraq over the past decade, the US can hardly afford a Syrian quagmire.
column2: 有了过去10年在阿富汗和伊拉克的经历，再次陷入叙利亚泥潭超出了美国的承受能力。

column1: Third, with the regional Sunni-Shia conflict intensifying, the prospect of tens of billions of petrodollars backing terrorist extremists has already destabilized the region.
column2: 第三，在逊尼派和什叶派冲突加剧的大背景下，数以亿计的石油美元支持恐怖主义极端分子的预期已经破坏了地区的稳定局势。

column1: US military strikes against Syria would further fuel extremism and result in widespread atrocities by the rebels against Syrians of all faiths.
column2: 美军事打击叙利亚将进一步助长极端主义，导致叛军对所有信仰的叙利亚人发动大规模暴行。

column1: Reports point to the execution and mutilation of Syrian-government prisoners.
column2: 报告直指对叙利亚政府囚犯的处决和酷刑。

column1: There is no doubt that the fate of Syria’s Christian and Jewish communities is now extremely precarious.
column2: 叙利亚基督教和犹太教群体的命运现在无疑极不稳定。

column1: Fourth, America’s decision to back extremists in Syria contradicts its “war on terrorism” and will erode international support for it.
column2: 第四，美国决定支持叙利亚极端分子与它的“反恐战争”自相矛盾，并将削弱国际社会对反恐的支持。

column1: The prospect of Iranian cooperation to root out Al Qaeda extremists, which it provided in Afghanistan and Iraq, would be unlikely following any intervention.
column2: 如果真的进行军事干预，几乎不可能指望伊朗像在阿富汗和伊拉克那样协助消灭“基地”极端分子。

column1: Fifth, it is wrong to assume that without Syrian President Bashar al-Assad, Iran would lose its influence in the Muslim world as well as its link to Hezbollah in Lebanon.
column2: 第五，假设没有叙利亚总统巴沙尔·阿萨德，伊朗就会失去在穆斯林世界的影响力和与黎巴嫩真主党的联系根本就没有依据。

column1: America’s regional position weakened, and Iran’s strengthened, following the US-led invasions of Afghanistan and Iraq; US intervention in Syria could reproduce that pattern.
column2: 在以美国为首的阿富汗及伊拉克入侵行动后，美国的地区地位有所削弱，而伊朗则反之。

column1: Sixth, a US attack on Syria would leave the US isolated internationally and end any hope of a diplomatic resolution.
column2: 第六，袭击叙利亚将导致美国在国际上陷入孤立，而且再没有希望通过外交途径解决问题。

column1: There is no domestic or international appetite for another US military adventure – NATO, the G-20, the Europeans, Russia, China, and 60% of Americans oppose a unilateral US military strike.
column2: 美国国内或国际社会都不愿看到美国再次进行军事冒险 — — 北约、G-20、欧洲、俄罗斯、中国和60%的美国人都反对美国单方面发动军事打击。

column1: Seventh, the civilian casualties arising from a military strike would be high.
column2: 第七，军事打击将造成大量的平民伤亡。

column1: If the main justification for an attack is humanitarian – to end the senseless slaughter of Syrian civilians – US military intervention would do more harm than good.
column2: 如果发动袭击的主要理由是人道主义（结束对叙利亚平民的毫无意义的屠杀 ） ， 美国军事干预将弊大于利。

column1: Eighth, US involvement in Syria will breathe new life into efforts to press for a wider war between the US and Iran.
column2: 第八，美国卷入叙利亚内战将为游说美伊大规模开战的势力注入新的生命力。

column1: Al Qaeda affiliates will target US regional interests in the hope that the blame falls on Iran and its militant proxies – providing a pretext for US military confrontation.
column2: 基地组织分支机构将针对性打击美国的地区利益，希望将责任推给伊朗及其好战代理 — — 进而为美国军事对抗创造托辞。

column1: Ninth, a US military strike against a third Muslim-majority country would demolish the credibility of Obama’s efforts to repair America’s image in the Islamic world.
column2: 第九，美国第三次对以穆斯林为主的国家发动军事袭击将摧毁奥巴马政府修复美国在伊斯兰世界形象努力的可信性。

column1: Indeed, it would most likely prove to be a strategic boon to the “resistance axis” – Iran and Hezbollah.
column2: 事实上，最后袭击很可能被证明是对伊朗和真主党等“抵抗轴心”的战略福音。

column1: Tenth, any US unilateral military strike against Syria would ratchet up tensions between the US and Russia.
column2: 第十，美国对叙利亚的任何单边军事打击都可能加剧美俄两国间的紧张关系。

column1: This, in turn, would strengthen the Russia-Iran alliance.
column2: 这将反过来增强俄伊联盟的实力。

column1: Eleventh, Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has issued permission for President Hassan Rouhani’s new administration to enter into direct talks with the US.
column2: 十一，伊朗最高领袖哈梅内伊许可新组建的哈桑·鲁哈尼总统政府与美国直接会谈。

column1: No better opportunity to end decades of bilateral hostility is likely to come along.
column2: 恐怕不会有比这更好的机会结束几十年的双边敌对关系。

column1: In these circumstances, a US attack on Syria would almost certainly dash any hope of a US-Iran rapprochement for years to come.
column2: 在这种情况下，美国对叙利亚的袭击几乎肯定将使今后几年的美伊和解希望完全破灭。

column1: Finally, with the moderate Rouhani now installed as President, a US military strike could undermine a golden opportunity for America and Iran to reach a face-saving solution (for both sides) on Iran’s nuclear program.
column2: 最后，因为温和派的鲁哈尼目前担任总统，美国的军事打击可能破坏美伊双方就伊朗核计划达成能为双方保存颜面的方案的黄金机会。

column1: Both Iran and the US consider the use of weapons of mass destruction a grave crime.
column2: 伊朗和美国都认为使用大规模杀伤性武器是一种严重的罪行。

column1: Indeed, Iran was a major victim of chemical-weapons attacks during its 1980-1988 war with Saddam Hussein’s Iraq.
column2: 事实上，伊朗曾经是1980-1988年与萨达姆·侯赛因的两伊战争中化学武器袭击的主要受害者。

column1: Iran can be a major partner to halt proliferation of WMDs in Syria, the Middle East, and beyond.
column2: 伊朗可以成为制止大规模杀伤性武器在叙利亚、中东和全世界扩散的主要合作伙伴。

column1: Iran maintains that the Security Council is the only body legally authorized to verify allegations concerning the use of such deadly weapons and to decide on the appropriate response.
column2: 伊朗认为安理会是验证与使用上述致命武器相关指控并决定合理对策的唯一的合法授权机构。

column1: One promising avenue for US-Iran cooperation on Syria could be joint support for a fact-finding mission by the Security Council to identify the perpetrators.
column2: 美伊就叙利亚问题合作的唯一正当途径是联合支持安理会事实调查团，明确真正的肇事者。

column1: Obama has his “red line” on the use of chemical weapons.
column2: 奥巴马的“红线”是不容许使用化学武器。

column1: So does Khamenei.
column2: 哈梅内伊也同样如此。

column1: Why Pay More for Fairness?
column2: 为何为公平多付钱？

column1: Marks & Spencer, a supermarket and clothing chain with 400 stores throughout Britain, recently announced that it is converting its entire range of coffee and tea, totaling 38 lines, to Fairtrade, a marketing symbol of “ethical production.”
column2: 玛科斯和斯宾塞是一家超级市场和服装连锁店，在英国具有400家分店。 它最近宣布将把它整个咖啡和茶产品总计38条线转到公平贸易。

column1: The chain already sells only Fairtrade tea and coffee in its 200 Café Revive coffee shops.
column2: 公平贸易是“符合伦理产品”的市场营销标志。 这家连锁店已经在其200个“咖啡馆复兴”咖啡店中只销售公平贸易的茶和咖啡。

column1: It is also boosting its purchases of shirts and other goods made with Fairtrade cotton.
column2: 它还大幅增加购买使用公平贸易棉花的衬衣和其他产品。

column1: The announcement came during “Fairtrade Fortnight,” a two-week promotion of Fairtrade products that included speaking tours by farmers from developing countries, telling Britons how Fairtrade has assisted their communities.
column2: 这一宣布是在“公平贸易双周”期间作出的。 这一双周活动促进公平贸易产品，包括来自发展中国家的农民的演讲，他们告诉英国人公平贸易如何援助了他们的社区。

column1: The movement toward more ethical consumption has made significant gains in the United States as well, as consumers increasingly turn to organic, locally produced foods, and eggs from hens not kept in cages.
column2: 随着美国的消费者们愈发购买有机的和当地生产的食品以及不是由在笼子里的鸡产下的鸡蛋，这一朝向更为符合伦理消费的运动在那里也取得了重大进展。

column1: In the UK, a survey has found that half of those shown the Fairtrade symbol recognized it and understood that it refers to products that give a better deal for Third World farmers.
column2: 在英国，一项调查显示，看到公平贸易标志的人有一半认识这一标志而且知道它指的是能够给第三世界的农民带来更多利益的产品。

column1: There is no comparable US research, but related data, and discussions with my own students, suggests that the figure would be much lower.
column2: 在美国并没有类似的研究，但是相关数据以及和我自己的学生们的讨论可以显示这一数字要低很多。

column1: Traders seeking Fairtrade certification must pay producers a price that covers the costs of sustainable production and provides a living wage.
column2: 想要公平贸易认证的贸易商必须给生产者支付能够涵盖可持续生产成本并且提供生活必要工资的价格。

column1: For example, the minimum price for coffee is $1.26 per pound, no matter how low the market price may fall.
column2: 例如，无论市场价格如何下跌，咖啡的最低价格都是每磅1.26美元。

column1: If the market price rises above that figure, the fair trade price will increase so that it remains five cents per pound higher.
column2: 如果市场价格高于这一数字，那么，公平贸易的价格也将上升，高于市场价格每磅5分钱。

column1: Small farmers, for their part, are required to be organized in cooperatives or other groups that allow democratic participation.
column2: 对于小农场主而言，他们必须以合作社或者其他组织等允许民主参与的形式组织起来。

column1: Plantations and factories can use the Fairtrade label if they pay their workers decent wages, comply with health, safety, and environmental standards, allow unions or other forms of workers’ associations, provide good housing if workers are not living at home, and do not use child labor or forced labor.
column2: 农业种植园以及工厂如果给工人支付合理的工资、符合医疗、安全以及环境标准、允许工会或者其他形式的工人社团、为不在家居住的工人提供良好的宿舍以及不使用童工或强迫劳工的话，就可以使用公平贸易标志。

column1: Not every one approves of Fairtrade.
column2: 并非所有人都赞同公平贸易。

column1: Brink Lindsey, director of the pro-market Cato Institute’s Center for Trade Policy Studies, believes that the campaign for Fairtrade coffee is a “well-meaning dead end.”
column2: 亲市场的卡托贸易政策研究中心主任林德赛认为，为公平贸易咖啡造势是一个“用心良苦的死胡同 ” 。

column1: With some justification, he argues that the real cause of the fall in coffee prices was not the profiteering of multinationals, but big increases in coffee production in Brazil and Vietnam, combined with new techniques that make it possible to grow coffee with less labor and hence more cheaply.
column2: 他不无道理地指出，咖啡价格下跌的真正原因并非是跨国公司的巧取豪夺，而是巴西和越南咖啡产量的激增，加之新技术可以让使用较少的劳力进而更低的价格成为可能。

column1: In Lindsey’s view, if we want to assist coffee growers, we should encourage them either to abandon coffee and produce more profitable crops – and here he rightly points to rich nations’ trade barriers and subsidies as obstacles that must be dismantled – or to move into higher-value products, like specialty coffees, that bring higher prices.
column2: 根据林德赛的观点，如果我们想要援助咖啡种植者，那么我们就应当鼓励他们要么放弃种植咖啡并且生产更为有利可图的作物（他在这一点上正确地指出了富有国家的贸易壁垒以及补贴等障碍必须解除 ） ， 要么转向可以得到更高价格的更高价值的产品，例如特色咖啡。

column1: What is curious about Lindsey’s argument, however, is that the Fairtrade coffee campaign can be seen as doing just what he recommends – encouraging coffee farmers to produce a specialty coffee that brings a higher price.
column2: 但是，林德赛主张的奇怪一面是，公平贸易咖啡运动就是在做他所推荐的事情，也就是鼓励咖啡农场主们生产可以带来更高价格的特色咖啡。

column1: Pro-market economists don’t object to corporations that blatantly use snob appeal to promote their products.
column2: 亲市场的经济学家们并不反对公司用招摇的手段吸引势利的顾客来对其产品加以促销。

column1: If people want to pay $48 for a pound of Jamaican Blue Mountain coffee because that’s what James Bond prefers, economists don’t object that the market is being distorted.
column2: 如果人们由于帮德喜欢牙买加蓝山咖啡而愿意花48美元一磅购买的话，经济学家并不因市场受到扭曲而加以反对。

column1: So why be critical when consumers choose to pay $12 for a pound of coffee that they know has been grown without toxic chemicals, under shade trees that help birds to survive, by farmers who can now afford to feed and educate their children?
column2: 那么，如果消费者们花12美元一磅购买他们知道由现在可以供得起他们的孩子们上学的农民们采用无毒化学品、在让鸟类存活的绿茵树下种植的咖啡时，经济学家们为什么要提出批评呢？

column1: Economists might reply that if you want to help people feed and educate their children, you can pay $10 for a pound of non-Fairtrade coffee that tastes the same and give the $2 you save to an aid agency that provides food and education to poor children.
column2: 经济学家们可能会说，如果你想要帮助农民养育他们的孩子并且供他们上学的话，你可以花10美元一磅来购买味道一样的非公平贸易的咖啡并且把你节省下来的2美元交给为贫困儿童提供食品和教育的援助机构。

column1: That’s a possible strategy, but there are advantages to Fairtrade.
column2: 这一战略是可能的，但是，公平贸易是有利可图的。

column1: The growers know that they have to provide a product that consumers like, both for its taste and for the way it is grown.
column2: 种植者们知道，他们必须提供一种为消费者们所喜欢的产品，不仅是味道，而且种植方式也要如此。

column1: If their product sells well, they can take pride in having produced something that is sought after around the world.
column2: 如果他们的产品畅销，他们就可以因为提供了一种在全世界热销的产品而自豪。

column1: From the growers’ perspective, receiving a premium by selling a Fairtrade product is preferable to receiving a charitable handout that they would get whether they worked or not and regardless of the quality of what they produce.
column2: 从种植者的角度而言，通过销售平贸易产品而得到溢价要比无论他们是否工作或者他们的产品质量如何而得到慈善捐助更为可取。

column1: Paying more for a Fairtrade label is no more “anti-market” than paying more for a Gucci label, and it reflects better ethical priorities.
column2: 为公平贸易标签支付更多的钱并不比为Gucci品牌多付钱更为“非市场化 ” ， 而且它反映的是更好的伦理取向。

column1: Fairtrade is not a government subsidy.
column2: 公平贸易并非一种政府补贴。

column1: Its success depends on market demand, not political lobbying.
column2: 它的成功取决于市场需求，而非政治游说。

column1: Fortunately, in Europe, that market demand is growing rapidly.
column2: 幸运的是，这一市场需求正在欧洲快速增长。

column1: One hopes that it will soon reach similar levels throughout the developed world, and wherever people can make choices about their discretionary spending.
column2: 人们希望在所有发达国家以及在人们对他们自主决定的消费中都能够达到相似的水平。

column1: The Populist War Against Intelligence
column2: 情报民粹主义战争

column1: ATLANTA – Despite his seemingly limitless capacity for vindictiveness, it would be a mistake to interpret US President Donald Trump’s decision to withdraw the security clearance of former CIA director John Brennan as only his latest vendetta for lèse-majesté.
column2: 亚特兰大—尽管美国总统特朗普破坏力无穷，但认为他决定撤销对中央情报局前局长约翰·布雷南（John Brennan）的忠诚调查只是其报复大不敬的最新例子是一个错误。

column1: True, Brennan has all but labeled Trump and his behavior, including his Russian connections, a national security threat.
column2: 诚然，布雷南给特朗普和他的行为 — — 包括与俄罗斯的关系 — — 贴上了国家安全威胁的标签。

column1: But Trump’s move is more than personal payback.
column2: 但特朗普的行动更多的是个人报复。

column1: As the most recent blow in his two-year-long attack on the intelligence community, his slap at Brennan is a harbinger of more to come as he tries to bring his espionage agencies to heel.
column2: 这是他两年来攻击情报界的最新动作，羞辱布雷南预示着他还会采取更多行动让情报机构屈服。

column1: More ominously for the health of the democracies of the West, other populists are following Trump’s example.
column2: 对西方民主的健康来说，更险恶的迹象是其他民粹主义者正在效仿特朗普的榜样。

column1: In Europe, a variety of right-wing parties, having now found themselves in power, are taking on former government antagonists, who have monitored and policed their extremism for decades.
column2: 在欧洲，众多已经掌权的右翼政党反击几十年来监控和管制他们的极端主义的前政府。

column1: In Austria, the country’s populist leaders have been intimidating, muzzling, and purging the country’s intelligence services.
column2: 在奥地利，民粹主义领导人一直在恐吓、封口和清洗情报机关。

column1: In February, on orders from the populist interior minister, Austrian police raided the country’s main intelligence agency – the very organization charged with monitoring right-wing extremism.
column2: 2月，在民粹主义内政部长的命令下，奥地利警方突击搜查了奥地利主要情报机关 — — 负责监控右翼极端主义的组织。

column1: (It should be recalled that the Freedom Party, the coalition partner in Austrian Chancellor Sebastian Kurz’s government, was founded by ex-SS officers).
column2: （有必要回忆一下，奥地利总理库尔茨政府的执政伙伴自由党便是由前SS官员创建。 ）

column1: And what was the pretext for the raid and subsequent demotion of senior Austrian intelligence officials?
column2: 突击检查和随后对奥地利情报高官的降级的借口是什么？

column1: That the agency was running an operation aimed at harming North Korea.
column2: 该机关正在实施旨在危害朝鲜的行动。

column1: No doubt, Trump wishes that he could pull off such a stunt, and both halt the investigation of him led by Robert Mueller and bring to heel all of the US intelligence agencies.
column2: 毫无疑问，特朗普也想着自己能够完成这样的“壮举 ” ， 既中止罗伯特·穆勒（Robert Mueller）领衔的对他的调查，又让美国情报机关屈服于自己。

column1: A fan of strongman leaders who “get it done,” Trump admires diktats and brazen contempt for legal processes.
column2: 作为一个“搞定它”的强人领袖的崇拜者，特朗普渴望绝对权威，无耻地无视法律程序。

column1: He almost certainly will pay even closer attention as the intelligence-fueled investigations into his presidential campaign’s possible collusion with Moscow in 2016 close in on him.
column2: 他几乎肯定会更加关注此事，因为情报导致他遭到对其2016年竞选活动与莫斯科的可能的勾结的调查，令他十分难堪。

column1: It is this combination of self-interest and contempt for law that makes Trump’s revocation of the Brennan’s security clearance so troubling.
column2: 这一自利和蔑视法律的组合让特朗普撤销布雷南的忠诚调查的决定变得很有问题。

column1: The regulations governing clearances are straightforward: the president has the power to deny access to official secrets if someone is found to have compromised classified information or is at risk of doing so.
column2: 关于忠诚调查的规定非常直白：如果某人被发现曾经泄露机密信息或有可能这样做，总统有权取消他接触官方机密的权利。

column1: By all accounts, Brennan has done nothing of the sort.
column2: 不管从哪个角度看，布雷南都没有做过这种事。

column1: In fact, Trump admits that.
column2: 事实上，特朗普也承认这一点。

column1: Buried in the explanatory word salad that accompanied the revocation of Brennan’s security clearance, the White House claimed that Brennan’s “erratic” behavior was the cause.
column2: 撤销布雷南忠诚调查的决定带来了无数风言风语，遭到口诛笔伐的白宫宣称这是布雷南的“古怪”行为导致的。

column1: That accusation would be laughable if it wasn’t so serious.
column2: 这简直贻笑大方。

column1: Trump has simply ignored the laws – including laws governing the US intelligence services – that he swore faithfully to execute.
column2: 特朗普根本无视他宣誓效忠的法律 — — 包括管理美国情报机构的法律。

column1: Eleven former CIA directors and deputy directors, as well as 70 former senior CIA officers (including me), said as much last week, criticizing the unprecedented revocation as political coercion and accusing Trump of misusing presidential powers, damaging national security, and threatening current and former officials’ right of free speech.
column2: 十一位中央情报局前局长和副局长，以及70 为中央情报局前高级官员（包括我 ） ， 在上周都发声批评这一前所未有的撤销忠诚调查的行为属于政治压迫，并指责特朗普滥用总统权力，危害国家安全，威胁现任和前任官员的言论自由。

column1: As if to underscore the point, White House spokespeople say that Trump intends to order more revocations, including a former national security adviser and deputy attorney general, as well as former directors of national intelligence, the CIA and the National Security Agency.
column2: 好像觉得这还不够分量，白宫发言人表示特朗普准备下达更多撤销令，包括一位前国家安全顾问和司法部副部长，以及中央情报局和国家安全局等情报机关的前主管。

column1: The hit list is no coincidence.
column2: 这份打击名单绝非巧合。

column1: Those in the crosshairs have overseen intelligence collection and analysis that informed the intelligence community’s conclusion that Russia interfered in the 2016 election, including possible collusion with Trump’s presidential campaign.
column2: 其对准的目标所负责的情报收集和分析工作让情报机关认定俄罗斯干预了2016年总统竞选，并且可能与特朗普的竞选活动勾结。

column1: With attacks on the intelligence and law enforcement communities playing well among his supporters, Trump could well double down on this demagoguery.
column2: 特朗普的支持者很吃特朗普攻击情报和执法部门这一套，因此特朗普很可能会变本加厉散播谣言。

column1: But his willingness to use his presidential powers as a blatantly partisan political weapon breaks ground that no American should want him to tread.
column2: 但他将总统权力赤裸裸地用于政治党争越过了没有一个美国人认为他可以跨越的边界。

column1: The damage that has resulted from the raid in Austria shows why.
column2: 奥地利突袭情报机关所带来的后果说明了原因。

column1: While Austrian courts ultimately will determine the raid’s legality, the effects are already clear.
column2: 尽管突袭合法性需要法院来裁定，但其后果已经显而易见。

column1: By stripping Austria’s spies of their files, the raid has essentially put the intelligence service out of operation and raised doubts among allied intelligence services about the Austrians’ reliability.
column2: 突袭卷走了奥地利间谍的档案，让情报机关行动陷入了瘫痪，也让盟友情报机关质疑奥地利的可靠性。

column1: Internal operations are dead in the water, as is intelligence sharing with European counterparts.
column2: 内部运行一潭死水，与欧洲情报机关的情报共享亦然。

column1: Washington is not Vienna, but the parallels deserve close attention nonetheless.
column2: 华盛顿不是维也纳，但相似性仍然值得密切注意。

column1: Trump’s attacks on the intelligence community and its former leaders are unprecedented, and it would be naive not to consider their impact, not only on the current intelligence leadership but also on the rank-and-file officers that do the difficult and often dangerous work of intelligence gathering and analysis.
column2: 特朗普对情报机关及其前领导人的攻击是前所未有的，不考虑其影响 — — 不仅仅是对现任情报领导人，也包括从事艰苦的、常常也很危险的情报搜集和分析工作的普通工作者 — — 将失之天真。

column1: That is why it is so important to adhere to the laws that empower (and constrain) intelligence agencies and that underpin the political independence and integrity of their officers.
column2: 因此，必须遵守法律并赋权（和约束）情报机关，支持情报官员的政治独立性和诚信。

column1: Events in Austria should be a warning.
column2: 奥地利发生的事情应该成为警示。

column1: For democracies to thrive, government must be transparent as well as publicly accountable.
column2: 民主要想繁荣，政府就必须透明并接受公众问责。

column1: When it comes to overseeing intelligence agencies pledged to protect their sources and methods, the challenges are obvious.
column2: 对于承诺保护信息源和手段的情报机构的监管工作，挑战是显而易见的。

column1: But so, too, are the threats, including to the democratic process itself, when politicians violate rather than respect the rules that govern their intelligence services’ integrity.
column2: 但威胁也是显而易见的，如果政客违反而不是尊重管理情报机构诚信问题的规则，民主程序本身也将受到威胁。

column1: In the final analysis, Brennan isn’t the only victim of Trump’s unwarranted and vindictive action.
column2: 在最后的分析中，布雷南不是特朗普子虚乌有的报复行动的唯一受害者。

column1: So are all Americans when national leaders put their own interests above those of the country and corrupt the political system they are sworn to defend.
column2: 当国家领导人将个人利益置于国家利益之上、侵蚀他们宣誓要捍卫的政治制度时，全体美国人都是受害者。

column1: Why Putin Makes a Bad Ally
column2: 普京为什么是糟糕的盟友

column1: STANFORD – Russian President Vladimir Putin’s intervention in the Syrian conflict has been welcomed by some as a moment for the Kremlin to “come in from the cold.”
column2: 斯坦福 — — 俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京对叙利亚冲突的干预一直深受某些人的欢迎，认为这是克里姆林宫“摆脱孤立”的时刻。

column1: Russia’s conflict with the Islamic State, the argument goes, has aligned the country’s interests with those of the West.
column2: 这种观点认为俄罗斯与伊斯兰国的冲突已经把俄罗斯的利益绑在了西方的战车上。

column1: Even Turkey’s downing of a Russian warplane does not seem not to have deflated this optimism.
column2: 就连土耳其击落俄罗斯战机似乎也没有让这种乐观情绪受到影响。

column1: Indeed, at a recent press conference, US President Barack Obama again urged Putin to join the alliance against the Islamic State.
column2: 事实上，在最近一次新闻发布会上，美国总统奥巴马再次敦促普京加入反对伊斯兰国的联盟。

column1: And French President François Hollande billed his recent visit to Moscow as an effort to build a broad international coalition against the terrorist group.
column2: 而法国总统奥朗德则将不久前对莫斯科的访问标榜为试图建立反对恐怖组织的广泛的国际联盟。

column1: At first blush, the idea that Russia is a natural ally against Islamist terrorists seems to make sense.
column2: 乍一看，俄罗斯是打击伊斯兰恐怖分子天然盟友的说法似乎颇有道理。

column1: The country has suffered horrific terrorist attacks by Islamist extremists, including the bombing in November of a plane above the Sinai Peninsula, which killed 224 passengers and crew, nearly all of them Russian.
column2: 该国遭受过伊斯兰极端分子可怕的恐怖主义袭击，其中包括十一月西奈半岛上空发生的飞机爆炸，造成224名乘客和机组人员死亡，几乎所有人都是俄罗斯公民。

column1: Around 20 million Muslims, most of them Sunni, live within the Russian Federation, and the country’s security officials report that some 7,000 fighters from the former Soviet republics and Russia have joined the Islamic State.
column2: 约有2，000万穆斯林，多数是逊尼派，在俄罗斯联邦境内生活，据该国安全官员报告，来自前苏联加盟共和国和俄罗斯的大约7，000名武装人员已经加入了伊斯兰国。

column1: On deeper examination, however, it becomes clear that an anti-terror alliance with Russia is wishful thinking.
column2: 但只要深入分析形势，就会明白与俄罗斯建立反恐联盟不过是一厢情愿的想法。

column1: Putin has not gone into Syria to defeat the Islamic State.
column2: 普京进入叙利亚不是为击败伊斯兰国。

column1: He has intervened to save the regime of Russia’s client, Syrian President Bashar al-Assad.
column2: 他的介入是为挽救俄国的附庸政权，叙利亚总统巴沙尔·阿萨德。

column1: Putin may sometimes give the appearance that he is ready to abandon Assad, but ultimately he will defend him.
column2: 普京有时可能看似做好了放弃阿萨德的准备，但最终他会保护阿萨德。

column1: Leaving Assad to his fate would be a sign of weakness – and thus anathema to Putin.
column2: 让阿萨德听任命运的安排将是一种软弱的表现 — — 因此对普京来讲根本无法接受。

column1: Ordinary Russians may be in danger of attacks by Islamic extremists, but they pose little threat to Putin or his allies.
column2: 普通俄国人可能会受到伊斯兰极端分子的袭击，但他们对普京及其盟友构不成太大的威胁。

column1: Russia has indeed suffered a number of terrorist attacks, including the 2004 Beslan massacre, in which 334 people, most of them schoolchildren, were killed.
column2: 俄罗斯实际上的确遭遇了若干次恐怖袭击，包括2004年的别斯兰惨案，造成334人，多数是学生死亡。

column1: In nearly every case, the response to the attacks was brutal, inept, and costly in terms of civilian lives lost.
column2: 几乎在所有情况下，对袭击采取的反制措施都残酷、无能，让民众付出了惨重的生命代价。

column1: And yet the Putin regime has emerged unscathed each time.
column2: 但每次普京政权却都能安然渡过、毫发无伤。

column1: Indeed, terrorist attacks at the turn of the century solidified public opinion against Chechen rebels and gave Putin the public support he needed to raze Grozny, Chechnya’s capital.
column2: 事实上，发生在世纪之交的恐怖袭击巩固了反对车臣叛军的公众舆论，并赋予了普京夷平车臣首都格罗兹尼所需的公众支持。

column1: Putin’s confidence in dealing with terrorism reflects the design of Russia’s security state.
column2: 普京应对恐怖主义的信心反映了俄罗斯的安全国家设计。

column1: Russia spends more on internal security than it does on national defense.
column2: 俄国在国内安全上的开支甚至超过国家防御。

column1: It has interior ministry troops, federal security agency (FSB) special forces, OMON (mobile special service) troops, military intelligence troops, and a vast network of internal spies and informants.
column2: 它组建了内政部部队、联邦安全局（FSB）特种部队，内政部特种（机动特服）部队、军事情报部队和由国内间谍和线人组成的庞大网络。

column1: Regime opponents are not allowed to run for office, their rights to demonstrate are restricted, and they are subject to a legal arbitrariness in the courts.
column2: 政权反对者不得竞选公职，他们的示威权利受到限制，并在法庭面对法律强制。

column1: Citizens have virtually no protection from wiretaps or the interception of their electronic communications.
column2: 公民的谈话遭到监听，他们的电子邮件遭到拦截。

column1: Every society must balance civil rights against national security.
column2: 所有社会都必须平衡国家安全和公民权利。

column1: Putin’s Russia has swung to one extreme of the spectrum, while the United States and Europe (despite the protests of civil libertarians) have chosen to occupy the other end.
column2: 普京的俄罗斯走到了其中一个极端，而美国和欧洲（尽管不时发生公民自由抗议活动）则选择了相反的一头。

column1: Indeed, Russia is an example of the upper limit of what state power can do to control terrorist activity.
column2: 事实上，俄罗斯代表了国家政权控制恐怖活动所能达到的上限。

column1: It would be a rare extremist group that had not been infiltrated with an informant who reports to Moscow.
column2: 鲜有极端主义团体从未被向莫斯科汇报的线人渗透。

column1: There is even evidence that those who carried out the Beslan massacre were infiltrated by Russian intelligence.
column2: 甚至有证据表明别斯兰惨案的制造者也已遭到俄罗斯情报部门的渗透。

column1: Moreover, any terrorist group knows that their operations will be met with the most extreme use of force.
column2: 此外，任何恐怖组织都知道他们的行动将遭到极端的武力镇压。

column1: In Beslan, for example, Russian special forces used thermobaric weapons.
column2: 比方说在别斯兰，俄罗斯特种部队就使用燃料空气弹作为武器。

column1: As the reaction to the attacks in Paris illustrates, the seemingly random murder of 130 civilians has monumental resonance in the West – especially when the religious and ideological motives are difficult to understand.
column2: 对巴黎袭击事件的反应说明，貌似随意的130名平民屠杀事件却在西方掀起了巨大的波澜 — — 尤其当宗教和意识形态动机很难理解的时候。

column1: But the Kremlin places a lower value on human lives than Western societies do.
column2: 但克里姆林宫不像西方社会那样珍视人的生命。

column1: In Putin’s calculations, the loss of lives in extremist attacks is unwelcome, but ultimately acceptable if it does not threaten the regime.
column2: 在普京看来，极端分子袭击造成人员伤亡令人不快，但如果不威胁政权那么最终可以接受。

column1: The Russian people might be horrified and frightened.
column2: 俄罗斯民众可能感到非常惊恐。

column1: But the Russian regime is primarily concerned with its own survival – and with how it might use the public’s horror to its benefit.
column2: 但俄罗斯政权主要关心其自身的生存 — — 以及如何利用公众恐惧为自己谋求好处。

column1: Working with the West to combat the Islamic State serves neither of those purposes.
column2: 与西方合作打击伊斯兰国不符合他们的目标。

column1: Hard to be Easing
column2: 难以宽松

column1: NEW YORK – The United States Federal Reserve’s decision to undertake a third round of quantitative easing, or QE3, has raised three important questions. Will QE3 jump-start America’s anemic economic growth?
column2: 发自纽约 — — 美联储实施第三轮量化宽松（QE3）的决定引出了三大重要问题：QE3能否紧急启动美国当前乏力的经济增长？

column1: Will it lead to a persistent increase in risky assets, especially in US and other global equity markets?
column2: 它是否会导致风险资产的持续增长，尤其是在美国以及其他全球股票市场？

column1: Finally, will its effects on GDP growth and equity markets be similar or different?
column2: 最后，其对GDP增长和股票市场的影响将会相似还是有所不同？

column1: Many now argue that QE3’s effect on risky assets should be as powerful, if not more so, than that of QE1, QE2, and “Operation Twist,” the Fed’s earlier bond-purchase program.
column2: 许多人如今认为QE3对风险资产的影响应该与第一轮（QE1 ） ， 第二轮量化宽松（QE2）以及美联储早前的债券购买计划“扭曲操作（Operation Twist ） ” 具备同样威力（如果不是更大的话 ） 。

column1: After all, while the previous rounds of US monetary easing have been associated with a persistent increase in equity prices, the size and duration of QE3 are more substantial.
column2: 毕竟以股票价格计算的话，QE3的规模和持续时间都更具实质性。

column1: But, despite the Fed’s impressive commitment to aggressive monetary easing, its effects on the real economy and on US equities could well be smaller and more fleeting than those of previous QE rounds.
column2: 但尽管美联储实施积极货币宽松的许诺非常引人注目，但此举对实体经济和美股的影响可能比前两轮的都要更小也更短暂。

column1: Consider, first, that the previous QE rounds came at times of much lower equity valuations and earnings.
column2: 首先，考虑到以往的宽松政策都是在股票估值和收益都更加低的时候推出。

column1: In March 2009, the S&P 500 index was down to 660, earnings per share (EPS) of US companies and banks had sunk to a financial-crisis low, and price/earnings ratios were in the single digits.
column2: 在2009年3月，标准普尔500指数下跌到660点，美国企业和银行的每股收益率都降到了危机以来的最低点，市盈率降到了单数。

column1: Today, the S&P 500 is more than 100% higher (hovering near 1,430), the average EPS is close to $100, and P/E ratios are above 14.
column2: 如今，标准普尔500指数已经翻了超过一番（接近1430点 ） ， 平均每股收益率约有100美元，市盈率超过了14。

column1: Even during QE2, in the summer of 2010, the S&P 500, P/E ratios, and EPS were much lower than they are today.
column2: 即便是2010年夏的QE2期间，标普500指数，市盈率和每股收益率都比今天要低得多。

column1: If, as is likely, economic growth in the US remains anemic in spite of QE3, top-line revenues and bottom-line earnings will turn south, with negative effects on equity valuations.
column2: 倘若（而且很可能）美国的经济增长在QE3之下依然疲软，营业收入和实际利润将下降，并对股票估值也会产生负面的影响。

column1: Moreover, fiscal support is absent this time: QE1 and QE2 helped to prevent a deeper recession and avoid a double dip, respectively, because each was associated with a significant fiscal stimulus.
column2: 此外，本次宽松也缺乏财政支持：QE1和QE2分别防止了陷入更严重衰退并阻以及二次下滑，因为每次宽松都是与一个大型财政刺激计划联系在一起的。

column1: In contrast, QE3 will be associated with a fiscal contraction, possibly even a large fiscal cliff.
column2: 相比之下，QE3将会与一轮财政收紧联系在一起，甚至很可能是一场财政大幅削减。

column1: Even if the US avoids the full fiscal cliff of 4.5% of GDP that is looming at the end of the year, it is highly likely that a fiscal drag amounting to 1.5% of GDP will hit the economy in 2013.
column2: 即便美国避免了可能在今年年末出现的相当于GDP4.5%的全面财政削减，也很有可能会有一场相当于GDP1.5%的财政拖累来对2013年的经济造成打击。

column1: With the US economy currently growing at a 1.6% annual rate, a fiscal drag of even 1% implies near-stagnation in 2013, though a modest recovery in housing and manufacturing, together with QE3, should keep US growth at about its current level in 2013.
column2: 美国经济目前的年均增长为1.6 % ， 即便住宅和制造业都已经出现温和复苏，加上QE3，都能将美国2013年的增长保持在这一水平，但即便是1%的财政拖累都将意味着经济增长会在2013年近乎停滞。

column1: But there is no broader rebound underway.
column2: 但目前没有更大范围的反弹出现。

column1: In both 2010 and 2011, leading economic indicators showed that the first-half slowdown had bottomed out, and that growth was already accelerating before the announcement of monetary easing.
column2: 在2010和2011年，一些前导经济指数显示上半年的经济放缓已经触底反弹，且增长在货币宽松宣布之前就已经开始加速。

column1: Thus, QE nudged along an economy that was already recovering, which prolonged asset reflation.
column2: 因此当时宽松助推了一个已经开始复苏的经济，并因此延长了资产的再膨胀。

column1: By contrast, the latest data suggest that the US economy is performing as sluggishly now as it was in the first half of the year.
column2: 相比之下，最近的数据显示美国当前的经济表现正如上半年一样步履维艰。

column1: Indeed, if anything, weakness in the US labor market, low capital expenditures, and slow income growth have contradicted signals in the early summer that third-quarter growth might be more robust.
column2: 事实上，更可能表现出来的是，美国劳动力市场的疲软，低资本支出以及缓慢的收入增长都反映出第三季度是不可能出现更强劲增长的。

column1: Meanwhile, the main transmission channels of monetary stimulus to the real economy – the bond, credit, currency, and stock markets – remain weak, if not broken.
column2: 与此同时，货币刺激向实体经济传导的主要渠道 — — 债券，信贷，货币和股票市场 — — 都依然疲软 — — 如果不是千疮白孔的话。

column1: Indeed, the bond-market channel is unlikely to boost growth.
column2: 事实上，债券市场渠道不太可能去刺激增长。

column1: Long-term government bond yields are already very low, and a further reduction will not significantly change private agents’ borrowing costs.
column2: 长期政府债券收益已经非常低下，即便进一步下调，也不会对私人机构的借贷成本产生太大影响。

column1: The credit channel also is not working properly, as banks have hoarded most of the extra liquidity from QE, creating excess reserves rather than increasing lending.
column2: 而信贷渠道同样不甚通畅，因为银行已经囤积了来自量化宽松的大部分额外流动性，不但没有增加贷款，反而还产生了多余的储备。

column1: Those who can borrow have ample cash and are cautious about spending, while those who want to borrow – highly indebted households and firms (especially small and medium-size enterprises) – face a credit crunch.
column2: 那些有资格贷款者都拥有充足的现金并小心控制支出，而那些急需贷款者 — — 高负债的家庭和企业（尤其是中小企业 ） — —都在面对着信贷紧缩。

column1: The currency channel is similarly impaired.
column2: 货币渠道同样也存在缺陷。

column1: With global growth weakening, net exports are unlikely to improve robustly, even with a weaker dollar.
column2: 当全球增长减弱之时，即便美元贬值也难以使净出口出现极大改善。

column1: Moreover, many major central banks are implementing variants of QE alongside the Fed, dampening the effect of the Fed’s actions on the dollar’s value.
column2: 此外，许多主要中央银行都在和美联储一样实施某些量化宽松政策的变体，抵消了美联储行动对美元价值的影响。

column1: Perhaps most important, a weaker dollar’s effect on the trade balance, and thus on growth, is limited by two factors.
column2: 或许更重要的是，一个弱势美元对贸易平衡的作用以及因此对增长的影响会受到两个因素的限制。

column1: First, a weaker dollar is associated with a higher dollar price for commodities, which implies a drag on the trade balance, because the US is a net commodity-importing country.
column2: 首先，一个弱势美元是与一个更高的大宗商品美元采购价格联系在一起的，而这也意味着会对贸易平衡产生拖累，因为美国是一个大宗商品的净进口国。

column1: Second, any improvement in GDP derived from stronger exports leads to an increase in imports.
column2: 其二，任何源自于更强劲出口的GDP改善都会引发进口增加。

column1: Empirical studies estimate that the overall impact of a weaker US dollar on the trade balance is close to zero.
column2: 观察研究预计弱势美元对贸易平衡的总体影响接近于零。

column1: The only other significant channel to transmit QE to the real economy is the wealth effect of an equity-market increase, but there is some circularity in the argument that QE3 will lead to a persistent rise in equity prices.
column2: 量化宽松向实体经济传导的另外唯一一个重要渠道就是股市上涨所带来的财富效应，但在QE3将引发股票价格持续上涨的观点中存在着某种自相矛盾的东西。

column1: If persistent asset reflation requires a significant GDP growth recovery, it is tautological to say that if equity prices rise enough following QE, the resulting increase in GDP from a wealth effect justifies the rise in asset prices.
column2: 如果持续的资产再膨胀需要GDP增长显著复苏来实现的话，那么声称如果股票价格能在量化宽松之后出现足够上涨，而因此产生的由财富效应所引发的GDP上涨就证明资产价格上升是合理的说法就是一个有逻辑的废话罢了。

column1: If monetary policy’s transmission channels to the real economy are broken, one cannot assume that QE will have a significant effect on economic growth.
column2: 如果货币政策向实体经济的传导渠道出了问题，人们也不能假设量化宽松会对经济增长产生较大影响。

column1: Fed Chairman Ben Bernanke has recently emphasized the importance of an additional channel: the confidence channel, through which the Fed’s commitment to maintaining generous monetary conditions for longer could improve private spending.
column2: 美联储主席本·伯南克最近强调了另一条额外渠道的重要性：信心渠道，美联储维持大量货币供应状况的承诺可以改善私人消费。

column1: The issue is how substantial and durable such effects will be.
column2: 问题是这些措施就能有多大实质性，又能维持多长时间？

column1: Confidence is fragile in an environment characterized by ongoing deleveraging, macro uncertainties, weak labor-market growth, and a fiscal drag.
column2: 在一个不断去杠杆化，充满宏观不确定因素，劳动市场增长疲弱以及财政拖累的现状下，信心是极为脆弱的。

column1: In short, QE3 reduces the tail risk of an outright economic contraction, but is unlikely to lead to a sustained recovery in an economy that is still enduring a painful deleveraging process.
column2: 简而言之，QE3减少了立刻出现经济收缩的尾部风险，但也不可能为一个依然承受着痛苦去杠杆化过程的经济体立刻带来持续复苏。

column1: In the short run, QE3 will lead investors to take on risk, and will stimulate modest asset reflation.
column2: 在短期内，QE3会令投资者敢于承担风险，并会刺激温和的资产价格再膨胀。

column1: But the equity-price rise is likely to fizzle out over time if economic growth disappoints, as is likely, and drags down expectations about corporate revenues and profitability.
column2: 但如果经济增长令人失望的话 — — 这情况很可能出现，股票价格的上升也会随着时间逐渐消弭，并拖低对企业收入和盈利的预期。

column1: Quantitative Quicksand
column2: 量化流沙

column1: PITTSBURGH – Almost all recoveries from recession have included rapid employment growth – until now.
column2: 匹兹堡—几乎所有衰退后的复苏都伴随着快速的就业增长 — — 目前除外。

column1: Though advanced-country central banks have pursued expansionary monetary policy in the wake of the global economic crisis in an effort to boost demand, job creation has lagged.
column2: 尽管发达国家央行面对全球经济危机采取了扩张性货币政策以提振需求，就业创造始终萎靡不振。

column1: As a result, workers, increasingly convinced that they will be unable to find employment for a sustained period, are leaving the labor force in droves.
column2: 结果，日益感到自己无法找到持续工作的工人正在陆续离开劳动力市场。

column1: Nowhere is this phenomenon more pronounced than in the United States, where the Federal Reserve has reduced interest rates to unprecedented levels and, through quantitative easing (QE), augmented bank reserves by purchasing financial assets.
column2: 这一现象在美国最为明显，美联储将利率降至前所未有的低水平，并通过量化宽松购买金融资产从而扩大了银行准备金。

column1: But inflation – which rapid money-supply expansion inevitably fuels – has so far remained subdued, at roughly 2%, because banks are not using their swelling reserves to expand credit and increase liquidity.
column2: 但通货膨胀 — — 应该是快速货币供给扩张的必然结果 — — 至今仍然不见起色，维持在2%左右，这是因为银行并没有用增加的准备金扩大信用、增加流动性。

column1: While this is keeping price volatility in check, it is also hindering employment growth.
column2: 尽管这让物价免于波动，但也阻碍了就业增长。

column1: Rather than changing its approach, however, the Fed has responded to slow employment growth by launching additional rounds of QE.
column2: 但是，美联储并没有改变方针，而是以增加一轮又一轮量化宽松应对就业增长缓慢的问题。

column1: Apparently, its rationale is that if expanding reserves by more than $2 trillion has not produced the desired results, adding $85 billion more monthly – another $1 trillion this year – might do the trick.
column2: 显然，美联储的考虑是，既然增加2万多亿美元还不能形成渴望的结果，那么每个月再增加850亿美元 — — 今年再增1万亿 — — 可能就会有所成效吧。

column1: America’s central bankers need not search far to find out why QE is not working; evidence is published regularly for anyone to see.
column2: 美国的中央银行家需要花点力气找找为何量化宽松没有效果；证据一直在发表，每个人都看得见。

column1: During QE2 (from November 2010 to July 2011), the Fed added a total of $557.9 billion to reserves, and excess reserves grew by $546.5 billion.
column2: 在第二次量化宽松（QE2，2010年11月—2011年7月）期间，美联储增加了总共5579亿美元的准备金，超额准备金增加了5465亿美元。

column1: That means that banks circulated only 2% of QE2’s contribution, leaving the rest idle.
column2: 这意味着银行只发放了2%的QE2规模，剩下的部分都闲置着。

column1: Similarly, since QE3 was launched last September, total bank reserves have grown by $244.1 billion, and excess reserves by $239.4 billion – meaning that 99% of the funds remain idle.
column2: 类似地，自去年9月推出第三次量化宽松（QE3）以来，银行总准备金增加了2441亿美元，超额准备金增加了2394亿美元 — — 99%的资金被闲置了。

column1: Given that banks earn 0.25% in interest on their reserve accounts, but pay very low – indeed, near-zero – interest to their depositors, they might choose to leave the money idle, drawing risk-free interest, rather than circulate it through the economy.
column2: 银行的准备金账户可以获得0.25%的利息，而它们对储户所付出的的利息非常低（实际近于零 ） ， 它们可能选择让这些钱闲置获得无风险利息，而不是把它们注入经济中。

column1: At current interest rates, banks lend to the government, large stable corporations, and commercial real-estate dealers; they do not extend credit to riskier borrowers, like start-up companies or first-time home buyers.
column2: 在当前利率下，银行把钱贷给政府、稳定的大公司和商业地产交易商；而不会扩大对高风险借款人的信用，比如创业公司或首次购房者。

column1: While speculators and bankers profit from the decline in interest rates that accompanies the Fed’s asset purchases, the intended monetary and credit stimulus is absent.
column2: 投机者和银行家从美联储资产购买计划所带来的利率下降中获益，而计划中的货币和信用刺激却打了水漂。

column1: At some point, the Fed must realize that its current policy is not working.
column2: 迟早，美联储必须认识到目前的政策是无效的。

column1: But developing a more effective alternative requires an understanding of the US economy’s actual problems – something that the Fed also seems to lack.
column2: 但开发更有效的替代政策需要了解美国经济的核心问题 — — 这也是美联储没有做到的。

column1: Indeed, Fed Chairman Ben Bernanke often says that his goal is to prevent another Great Depression, even though the Fed addressed that risk effectively in 2008.
column2: 事实上，美联储主席伯南克经常说，他的目标是避免另一次大萧条，尽管美联储在2008年就已经打消了这一风险。

column1: The US economy has not responded to the Fed’s monetary expansion, because America’s biggest problems are not liquidity problems.
column2: 美国经济没有响应美联储的货币扩张，因为美国最大的问题不是流动性问题。

column1: As every economics student learns early on, monetary policy cannot fix problems in the real economy; only policy changes affecting the real economy can.
column2: 每个经济学学生很早就会学到，货币政策无法修正实体经济的问题；只有影响实体经济的政策变化可以。

column1: The Fed should relearn that lesson.
column2: 美联储应该回去重修。

column1: One major problem, insufficient investment, is rooted in President Barack Obama’s effort to increase the tax paid by those whose annual incomes exceed $250,000 and, more recently, in his proposal to cap retirement entitlements.
column2: 一大问题 — — 投资不足的根源是奥巴马总统试图提高年收入250000以上人群的税收以及最近的退休福利封顶方案。

column1: While such proposals have been met with opposition, Obama cannot be expected to sign a deficit-reduction bill that does not include more revenue.
column2: 尽管这些方案遇到了反对，但奥巴马不可能签署不包括增加收入的赤字削减法案。

column1: As long as that revenue’s sources, and the future effects of new regulations, remain uncertain, those whom the policies would most harm – the country’s largest savers – are unlikely to invest.
column2: 只要收入源以及新规则的未来影响尚不明确，受这些政策伤害最大的人群 — — 美国最大的储蓄者 — — 就不可能投资。

column1: Likewise, Obama’s health-care reform, the Affordable Care Act, has hampered employment growth, as businesses reduce their hiring and cut workers’ hours to shelter themselves from increased labor costs (estimates of the rise vary).
column2: 类似地，奥巴马的医疗改革 — — 平价医疗法案（Affordable Care Act）阻碍了就业增长，因为企业减少了招聘，削减了工人的工时，以应对劳动力成本的上升（上升幅度估计各不相同 ） 。

column1: Meanwhile, the faltering European economy and slowing GDP growth in China and elsewhere are impeding export demand.
column2: 与此同时，萎靡的欧洲经济和中国和其他地区GDP增长的放缓拖累了出口需求。

column1: While subdued liquidity and credit growth are delaying the inflationary impact of the Fed’s determination to expand banks’ already-massive reserves, America cannot escape inflation forever.
column2: 尽管受抑制的流动性和信用增长推迟了美联储扩张银行已然相当庞大的准备金规模的决定的通胀性效果，但美国不可能永远逃脱通胀。

column1: The reserves that the Fed – and almost all other major central banks – are building will eventually be used.
column2: 美联储 — — 以及几乎所有其他世界主要央行 — — 所注入的准备金迟早会用起来。

column1: Shinzo Abe’s Monetary-Policy Delusions
column2: 安倍晋三的货币政策迷思

column1: NEW HAVEN – The politicization of central banking continues unabated.
column2: 发自纽黑文 — — 中央银行政治化的趋势有增无减。

column1: The resurrection of Shinzo Abe and Japan’s Liberal Democratic Party – pillars of the political system that has left the Japanese economy mired in two lost decades and counting – is just the latest case in point.
column2: 而安倍晋三以及日本自民党的卷土重来 — — 它们都是使日本经济从20多年前至今依然陷入停滞的政治系统的核心元素 — — 只是这一现象的最新注解而已。

column1: Japan’s recent election hinged critically on Abe’s views of the Bank of Japan’s monetary policy stance.
column2: 日本近期的选举与安倍对日本银行货币政策立场的见解紧密联系在一起。

column1: He argued that a timid BOJ should learn from its more aggressive counterparts, the US Federal Reserve and the European Central Bank.
column2: 他指出过于谨慎的日本央行应该向它更为激进的同行 — — 美联储和欧洲央行 — — 学习。

column1: Just as the Fed and the ECB have apparently saved the day through their unconventional and aggressive quantitative easing (QE), goes the argument, Abe believes it is now time for the BOJ to do the same.
column2: 而正如美联储和欧洲央行显然通过非常规且激进的量化宽松政策挽救了大局一样，安倍认为日本央行也是时候该采取相同的行动了。

column1: It certainly looks as if he will get his way.
column2: 而如今看来安倍似乎也将如愿以偿。

column1: With BOJ Governor Masaaki Shirakawa’s term ending in April, Abe will be able to select a successor – and two deputy governors as well – to do his bidding.
column2: 随着日本央行行长白川方明（Masaaki Shirakawa）的任期于明年四月份届满，首相就可以另选一位继任者 — — 以及两个副行长 — — 来执行他的命令。

column1: But will it work?
column2: 但这种政策能起作用吗？

column1: While experimental monetary policy is now widely accepted as standard operating procedure in today’s post-crisis era, its efficacy is dubious.
column2: 尽管在后危机时代的今天，实验性的货币政策被当作标准的操作流程进得到大范围推广，但其有效性依然值得怀疑。

column1: Nearly four years after the world hit bottom in the aftermath of the global financial crisis, QE’s impact has been strikingly asymmetric.
column2: 世界经济在全球金融危机冲击下触底后的近四年里，量化宽松政策的影响明显不对称。

column1: While massive liquidity injections were effective in unfreezing credit markets and arrested the worst of the crisis – witness the role of the Fed’s first round of QE in 2009-2010 – subsequent efforts have not sparked anything close to a normal cyclical recovery.
column2: 大量流动性的注入的确在解冻信贷市场上取得成效并阻止了危机深度恶化 — — 这在美联储2009-2010年度首轮量化宽松政策中得到了证明 — — 然而随后的措施都未能催生任何常见的周期性复苏。

column1: The reason is not hard to fathom.
column2: 其中原因并不难理解。

column1: Hobbled by severe damage to private and public-sector balance sheets, and with policy interest rates at or near zero, post-bubble economies have been mired in a classic “liquidity trap.”
column2: 由于私营及公共企业的资产负债表受到严重破坏，政策利率又几近为零，后泡沫经济已经陷入了典型的“流动性陷阱 ” 。

column1: They are more focused on paying down massive debt overhangs built up before the crisis than on assuming new debt and boosting aggregate demand.
column2: 相对于进一步举债或刺激总需求，人们更加关心如何偿还危机之前积累的巨额债务。

column1: The sad case of the American consumer is a classic example of how this plays out.
column2: 美国消费者的悲剧正是这种政策后果的典型例子。

column1: In the years leading up to the crisis, two bubbles – property and credit – fueled a record-high personal-consumption binge.
column2: 在危机前的几年中，两种经济泡沫 — — 房地产和信贷 — — 加剧了创纪录的个人消费热潮。

column1: When the bubbles burst, households understandably became fixated on balance-sheet repair – namely, paying down debt and rebuilding personal savings, rather than resuming excessive spending habits.
column2: 当泡沫爆发时，不难理解每个家庭都开始关注如何改善其负债 — — 也就是偿还债务并重新开始储蓄，而不是恢复过度消费的习惯。

column1: Indeed, notwithstanding an unprecedented post-crisis tripling of Fed assets to roughly $3 trillion – probably on their way to $4 trillion over the next year – US consumers have pulled back as never before.
column2: 确实，尽管前所未有的危机后美联储资产大概翻了三倍到3万亿美元 — — 并可能在未来一年内达到4万亿美元，美国的消费还是前所未有的回落了。

column1: In the 19 quarters since the start of 2008, annualized growth of inflation-adjusted consumer spending has averaged just 0.7% – almost three percentage points below the 3.6% trend increases recorded in the 11 years ending in 2006.
column2: 自2008年初以来的19个季度中，计入通胀因素后消费支出的年化增长率平均仅为0.7 % — —几乎比截至2006年的前11年每年3.6%的增长趋势低了3个百分点。

column1: Nor does the ECB have reason to be gratified with its strain of quantitative easing.
column2: 欧洲央行也没有理由为其量化宽松政策的作为而感到满意。

column1: Despite a doubling of its balance sheet, to a little more than €3 trillion ($4 trillion), Europe has slipped back into recession for the second time in four years.
column2: 尽管它的资产翻了倍，达到3万多亿欧元（折合约4万亿美元 ） ， 欧洲已经在四年中第二次回落到衰退状态。

column1: Not only is QE’s ability to jumpstart crisis-torn, balance-sheet-constrained economies limited; it also runs the important risk of blurring the distinction between monetary and fiscal policy.
column2: 不仅量化宽松政策重启那些饱受危机折磨且资产负债表受制的经济体的能力有限；它还冒着模糊货币政策和财政政策之间区别的重大风险。

column1: Central banks that buy sovereign debt issued by fiscal authorities offset market-imposed discipline on borrowing costs, effectively subsidizing public-sector profligacy.
column2: 那些购买由财政当局发行的主权债务的央行逃脱了市场对借贷成本施加的约束，实际上资助了公共部门的挥霍行为。

column1: Unfortunately, it appears that Japan has forgotten many of its own lessons – especially the BOJ’s disappointing experience with zero interest rates and QE in the early 2000’s.
column2: 不幸地是，日本似乎忘了自身所经历的许多教训 — — 尤其是日本央行在2000年代实施零利率和量化宽松政策的沮丧经历。

column1: But it has also lost sight of the 1990’s – the first of its so-called lost decades – when the authorities did all they could to prolong the life of insolvent banks and many nonfinancial corporations.
column2: 但它同时也也忘记了1990年代 — — 也是第一个所谓“失落的10年 ” — —再此期间当局尽其所能延长资不抵债的银行和许多非金融公司的寿命。

column1: Zombie-like companies were kept on artificial life-support in the false hope that time alone would revive them.
column2: 这些行尸走肉般的公司靠着人为力量勉强继续运行，它们都抱着一种虚幻的希望 — — 时间能够拯救一切。

column1: It was not until late in the decade, when the banking sector was reorganized and corporate restructuring was encouraged, that Japan made progress on the long, arduous road of balance-sheet repair and structural transformation.
column2: 直到这个10年的末期，当银行开始重组而且企业也被鼓励重组时，日本才在修复资产负债表和结构改革的道路上取得了进步。

column1: US authorities have succumbed to the same Japanese-like temptations.
column2: 美国当局已经屈服于与日本一样的诱惑。

column1: From quantitative easing to record-high federal budget deficits to unprecedented bailouts, they have done everything in their power to mask the pain of balance-sheet repair and structural adjustment.
column2: 从量化宽松政策到破纪录的联邦预算赤字都被用于前所未有的救援行动，他们用尽一切力量来掩饰资产负债表修复与结构调整所带来的痛苦。

column1: As a result, America has created its own generation of zombies – in this case, zombie consumers.
column2: 结果，美国已经创造出了它自己的僵尸 — — 也就是僵尸消费者。

column1: Like Japan, America’s post-bubble healing has been limited – even in the face of the Fed’s outsize liquidity injections.
column2: 跟日本一样，美国泡沫破裂后的恢复是有限的 — — 即使是在美联储注入大规模流动资金的情况下。

column1: Household debt stood at 112% of income in the third quarter of 2012 – down from record highs in 2006, but still nearly 40 percentage points above the 75% norm of the last three decades of the twentieth century.
column2: 2012年第三季度美国家庭负债相当于收入的112 % — —虽然较2006年的创纪录高位有所回落，但仍比20世纪最后30年75%的标准高了几乎40个百分点。

column1: Similarly, the personal-saving rate, at just 3.5% in the four months ending in November 2012, was less than half the 7.9% average of 1970-99.
column2: 同样，2012年截止到11月的后四个月中个人储蓄率仅为3.5 % ， 这还不到1970~1999年7.9%的平均储蓄率的一半。

column1: The same is true of Europe. The ECB’s über-aggressive actions have achieved little in the way of bringing about long-awaited structural transformation in the region.
column2: 欧洲的情况也是如此，欧洲央行过于激进的行动并未在区内促成人们期待已久的结构性改革。

column1: Crisis-torn peripheral European economies still suffer from unsustainable debt loads and serious productivity and competitiveness problems.
column2: 饱受危机折磨的欧洲外围经济体仍然面对着无法承受的债务负担和严重的生产力和竞争力问题。

column1: And a fragmented European banking system remains one of the weakest links in the regional daisy chain.
column2: 而碎片化的欧洲银行体系仍然是区域链条中最脆弱的一环。

column1: Is this the “cure” that Abe really wants for Japan?
column2: 这就是安倍想为日本寻求的“解决方案”吗？

column1: The last thing that the Japanese economy needs at this point is backsliding on structural reforms.
column2: 此时日本经济最不需要的就是结构改革的倒退。

column1: Yet, by forcing the BOJ to follow in the misdirected footsteps of the Fed and the ECB, that is precisely the risk that Abe and Japan are facing.
column2: 然而通过迫使日本央行追随美联储和欧洲央行的错误步伐，这正是安倍和日本所面临的风险。

column1: Massive liquidity injections carried out by the world’s major central banks – the Fed, the ECB, and the BOJ – are neither achieving traction in their respective real economies, nor facilitating balance-sheet repair and structural change.
column2: 由世界主要的央行 — — 即美联储、欧洲央行、日本央行 — — 贯彻的大规模流动性注入既不能在各自的实体经济里促进交易，也不能促进资产负债表修复和结构性变革。

column1: That leaves a huge sum of excess liquidity sloshing around in global asset markets.
column2: 这就让大量多余的流动资金在全球资本市场上流动。

column1: Where it goes, the next crisis is inevitably doomed to follow.
column2: 不管这些资金流到何处，下一个危机也无可避免地注定随之而来。

column1: Why Remember Pearl Harbor?
column2: 纪念珍珠港事件

column1: NEW YORK – December 7 marks the 67th anniversary of the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor.
column2: 纽约 - - 今年12月7日是日本攻击珍珠港事件67周年纪念日。

column1: Over the years, “the day of infamy” has become a classic reference point for galvanizing patriotic sentiment in America.
column2: 多年来，人们用这一“奇耻大辱之日”激发美国爱国情怀百试不爽。

column1: In the wake of the September 11, 2001 terrorist attack, for example, analogies to Pearl Harbor were made frequently.
column2: 例如，在2001年9月11日恐怖主义攻击事件后，人们经常把它和珍珠港事件进行类比。

column1: But despite its central place in America’s collective memory, Pearl Harbor remains little understood.
column2: 但是尽管珍珠港在美国人的集体记忆中占据中心地位，但是人们对它还是一知半解。

column1: Why did Japan initiate such a seemingly self-destructive war in the first place?
column2: 日本为何进行这一看起来是自我毁灭的战争呢？

column1: Aside from lessons that Japan must learn from its momentous decision, is there something to be learned by the United States as well?
column2: 除了日本要从这一重大决定中吸取教训之外，美国有没有经验教训要总结呢？

column1: The decision to attack Pearl Harbor was reached after five months of deliberations that included numerous official conferences.
column2: 袭击珍珠港的决定是在经过五个月的审议后做出的，决策过程中举行了难以计数的会议。 这是一个渐进的过程。

column1: It was a gradual process in which more sympathetic, albeit firm, US engagement might have helped sway Japan in a different direction.
column2: 在这一过程中，如果美国坚定而又富有同情地与日本接触，那么或许会把日本引向另一个方向。

column1: In fact, Japanese government opinion was so divided that it is surprising that it was able to unite in the end.
column2: 实际上，日本政府内部观点充满分歧，最终能够团结一致实在令人惊讶。
