column1: Italy’s parliament is divided among three mutually incompatible political forces, with none strong enough to rule alone.
column2: 意大利议会分裂为三个互不相容的政治阵营，没有一个强大到足以单独执政。

column1: Worse, one of these forces, which won 25% of the vote, is an anti-euro populist party, while another, a Euro-skeptic group led by former Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi, received close to 30% support, giving anti-euro parties a clear majority.
column2: 更糟糕的是，其中一个获得了25%选票的阵营是反欧元民粹主义政党，另外一个支持率近30%的阵营是前总理贝卢斯科尼领导的欧元怀疑派，这使得反欧元政党占据明显多数。

column1: Despite these scary results, the interest-rate spread for Italian government bonds relative to German bunds has increased by only 40 basis points since the election.
column2: 尽管结果令人担忧，但选举以来意大利政府债券相对德国国债的利差只上升了40个基点。

column1: In July 2012, when a pro-European, austerity-minded government was running the country, with the well-respected economist Mario Monti in charge, the spread reached 536 basis points.
column2: 2012年6月，执政意大利的是紧缩派政府，政府首脑是德高望重的经济学家蒙蒂，此时的利差为536个基点。

column1: Today, with no government and little chance that a decent one will be formed soon, the spread sits at 314 points.
column2: 如今，陷入无政府状态、且没有任何迹象表明会在不久的将来形成得体政府的意大利，利差只有314个基点。

column1: So, are markets bullish about Italy, or have they lost their ability to assess risk?
column2: 那么，是市场看好意大利，还是市场失去了评估风险的能力？

column1: A recent survey of international investors conducted by Morgan Stanley suggests that they are not bullish.
column2: 摩根士丹利进行的最新国际投资者调查表明，投资者并不看好意大利。

column1: Forty-six percent of the respondents said that the most likely outcome for Italy is an interim administration and new elections.
column2: 46%受访者声称意大利最有可能的结果是过渡政府+新选举。

column1: And they regard this outcome as the worst-case scenario, one that implies a delay of any further economic measures, deep policy uncertainty, and the risk of an even less favorable electoral outcome.
column2: 他们认为这一结果堪称最坏情形，意味着进一步经济措施将被推迟、政策面临极大的不稳定性，并有可能形成更加不利的选举结果。

column1: The survey also clearly indicated why the interest-rate spread for Italian government bonds is not much wider: the perceived backstop provided by the European Central Bank.
column2: 调查还明确显示了为何意大利政府债券利差没有显著加大：人们感到欧洲央行在支持意大利。

column1: Although investors believe that the backstop is unlikely to be used, its mere presence dissuades them from betting against Italy.
column2: 尽管投资者认为这一支持不可能成为实际动作，但仅仅是有支持存在便足以促使他们不再看空意大利。

column1: In other words, the “outright monetary transactions” (OMT) scheme announced by ECB President Mario Draghi last July has served as the proverbial “bazooka” – a gun so powerful that it does not need to be used.
column2: 换句话说，欧洲央行行长德拉吉去年7月宣布的“直接货币交易 ” （ OMT）机制已经成了“火箭炮”的代名词 — — 这个武器威力如此巨大，以致于根本不必真正拿出来使用。

column1: Then-US Treasury Secretary Hank Paulson sought a bazooka during the 2008 financial crisis.
column2: 时任美国财政部长保尔森在2008年金融危机期间就祭出过类似的火箭炮。

column1: He failed, because he believed that even a fake gun would work if it looked scary enough.
column2: 他失败了，因为他认为只要气势汹汹，就算是假枪也能奏效。

column1: Not falling for the trick, speculators repeatedly called his bluff.
column2: 投资者并不买账，一再戳穿了他的虚张声势。

column1: Draghi, with his famous pledge to do “whatever it takes” to ensure the euro’s survival, succeeded where Paulson did not.
column2: 德拉吉的著名承诺 — — “不惜一切代价”确保欧元生存正是成功在保尔森的失败之处。

column1: After all, he controls the monetary spigot.
column2: 毕竟，他控制着货币龙头。

column1: But even Draghi’s bazooka is partly a bluff.
column2: 但即使是德拉吉的火箭炮，也有一半是虚张声势。

column1: Draghi designed it to relieve the ECB of the huge political responsibility of deciding when to save a country from default.
column2: 德拉吉的火箭炮是用来纾解欧洲央行决定何时拯救一国走出违约困境的政治责任压力的。

column1: For this reason, triggering the OMT mechanism requires the unanimous consent of eurozone governments.
column2: 出于这一理由，出发OMT机制要求欧元区各国政府的一致同意。

column1: But, if the bazooka is needed, how likely is it to be fired before the German election in September?
column2: 但是，如果火箭炮真的需要开炮，有多少可能能够在9月德国选举之前实现？

column1: The Morgan Stanley survey did not ask this question, probably because everybody knows the answer: not likely at all.
column2: 摩根士丹利的调查并没有问道这一问题，其原因也许在于所有人都知道答案：根本没有可能。

column1: Thus, markets remain calm because they expect the bazooka not to be needed.
column2: 因此，市场之所以保持冷静，是因为市场预期德拉吉的火箭炮不会真的使用。

column1: In that case, the fact that it cannot be triggered easily does not pose a significant problem.
column2: 果真如此的话，火箭炮不会轻易发射这一事实并不构成严重问题。

column1: Its presence is enough to support a benign self-fulfilling prophecy.
column2: 它的存在已足以支持良性的自我实现预言。

column1: In other words, Draghi’s bazooka has anesthetized markets, impairing their ability to assess risk.
column2: 换句话说，德拉吉的火箭炮麻醉了市场，是它丧失了评估风险的能力。

column1: But as with all anesthetics, Draghi’s cannot and will not last forever.
column2: 但它的麻醉作用再大，也无法也不会永远持续。

column1: Either the underlying problem is fixed before the patient wakes up, or the pain will be devastating.
column2: 要么根本问题在耐心耗尽前得到解决，要么发生灾难性的痛苦事件。

column1: The investors surveyed by Morgan Stanley put the chance of a renewed crisis in Italy below 25%.
column2: 摩根士丹利所调查的投资者认为意大利危机重新爆发的几率不到25 % 。

column1: I believe that it is higher than 50%.
column2: 我认为高于50 % 。

column1: Even after Germany’s election, I am not sure that the government will be willing to support an Italian rescue program without asking for major guarantees concerning the objectives – and even the composition – of Italy’s ruling coalition.
column2: 即使在德国选举之后，我仍不确定德国政府愿意支持意大利援助计划而不要求获得关于意大利执政联盟目标 — — 甚至其组成 — — 的重大承诺。

column1: Indeed, German Chancellor Angela Merkel will face a serious dilemma following her likely re-election.
column2: 事实上，德国总理默克尔将在可能的连任后面临一个严重的两难。

column1: Without strict conditionality, she would risk shifting the domestic consensus in favor of Germany’s emerging Euro-skeptic mood.
column2: 如果不要求严苛的条件，她可能会让国内一致观点倒向新崛起的怀疑欧元派。

column1: But, by insisting on such conditionality, she would trigger a huge political crisis in Europe. If the German government gets to decide who governs Italy, why should Italians bother voting?
column2: 如果德国政府能够决定谁来治理意大利，那���意大利人还要选举干什么？

column1: The eurozone will look like a German protectorate, rather than a voluntary union of sovereign countries.
column2: 欧元区则像是德国的保护国，而不是主权国家组成的自愿联盟。

column1: The political backlash would be enormous.
column2: 其政治反响将会极其激烈。

column1: The only hope is that the eurozone makes strong progress toward establishing fiscal-redistribution mechanisms, such as European unemployment insurance, before Draghi’s anesthetic wears off.
column2: 唯一的希望是欧元区在德拉吉的麻药失去药效前朝着成立财政再分配机制的方向去的重大进步，比如形成欧洲失业保险制度。

column1: Otherwise, Europe will face a very rude awakening indeed.
column2: 否则的话，欧洲将面临极其痛苦的未来。

column1: China’s American Bailout?
column2: 中国的 美国援助？

column1: ZURICH – The twenty-first-century economy has thus far been shaped by capital flows from China to the United States – a pattern that has suppressed global interest rates, helped to reflate the developed world’s leverage bubble, and, through its impact on the currency market, fueled China’s meteoric rise.
column2: 苏黎世—到目前为止，21世纪的经济由中国向美国的资本流决定着 — — 这一模式压低了全球利率，帮助发达世界杠杆泡沫再次膨胀，并通过在货币市场的影响助长了中国的迅速崛起。

column1: But these were no ordinary capital flows.
column2: 但这不是普通的资本流。

column1: Rather than being driven by direct or portfolio investment, they came primarily from the People’s Bank of China (PBOC), as it amassed $3.5 trillion in foreign reserves – largely US Treasury securities.
column2: 它不是由直接投资或组合投资驱动的，而主要来自中国人民银行，后者囤积了3.5万亿美元外汇储备，其中大部分是美国国债。

column1: The fact that a single institution wields so much influence over global macroeconomic trends has caused considerable anxiety, with doomsayers predicting that doubts about US debt sustainability will force China to sell off its holdings of US debt.
column2: 一个机构对全球宏观经济趋势施加了如此之大的影响，这引起了大规模的不安，末日预言家纷纷表示对美国债务可持续性的怀疑将迫使美国甩卖其持有的美国债务。

column1: This would drive up interest rates in the US and, ultimately, could trigger the dollar’s collapse.
column2: 这将推高美国利率，并最终触发美元的崩溃。

column1: But selling off US Treasury securities, it was argued, was not in China’s interest, given that it would drive up the renminbi’s exchange rate against the dollar, diminishing the domestic value of China’s reserves and undermining the export sector’s competitiveness.
column2: 这一观点指出，甩卖美国国债并不符合中国的利益，因为这会推高人民币对美元汇率，降低中国储备的本币价值，破坏出口部门的竞争力。

column1: Indeed, a US defense department report last year on the national-security implications of China’s holdings of US debt concluded that “attempting to use US Treasury securities as a coercive tool would have limited effect and likely would do more harm to China than to the [US].”
column2: 事实上，去年美国国防部的一百分报告分析了中国所持美国债务对国家安全的影响，结论是“试图将美国国债作为强制工具使用效果有限，对中国的危害比对[美国]更大 。 ”

column1: To describe the symbiotic relationship between China’s export-led GDP growth and America’s excessive consumption, the economic historians Niall Ferguson and Moritz Schularick coined the term “Chimerica.”
column2: 经济史学家弗格森（Niall Ferguson）和舒拉里克（Moritz Schularick）创造了“中美国 ” （ Chimerica）一词来形容中国的出口导向型GDP增长和美国的过度消费之间的共生关系。

column1: The invocation of the chimera of Greek mythology – a monstrous, fire-breathing amalgam of lion, goat, and dragon – makes the term all the more appropriate, given that Chimerica has generated massive and terrifying distortions in the global economy that cannot be corrected without serious consequences.
column2: 希腊神话式的幻想 — — 狮子、山羊和龙的混合体喷火怪兽 — — 让这个词更加合适了，因为中美国给全球经济带来了巨大的、令人恐怖的扭曲，纠正这一扭曲必然会带来严重后果。

column1: In 2009, these distortions led Ferguson and Schularick to forecast Chimerica’s collapse – a prediction that seems to be coming true.
column2: 2009年，这一扭曲促使弗格森和舒拉里克预言中国将崩溃 — — 这一预言似乎即将实现。

column1: With the reserves’ long-term effects on China’s internal economic dynamics finally taking hold, selling off foreign-exchange reserves is now in China’s interest.
column2: 随着外汇储备对中国内部经济动态的长期影响最终显现，如今甩卖外汇储备已经符合中国的利益。

column1: Over the last decade, the vast quantities of short-term capital that were being pumped into China’s banking system drove commercial banks and other financial institutions to expand credit substantially, especially through the shadow-banking system, leading to a massive credit bubble and severe over-investment.
column2: 在过去十年中，大量涌入中国银行系统的短期资本促使商业银行和其他金融机构大量扩张信用，特别是通过影子银行系统进行扩张，这导致了巨大的信用泡沫和严重的过度投资。

column1: In order to manage the resulting increase in risk, China’s new leaders are now refusing to provide further liquidity injections, as well as curbing loans to unprofitable sectors.
column2: 为了应对因此增加的风险，如今中国新领导人拒绝进一步注入流动性，并遏制贷款流向无盈利能力的部门。

column1: But these efforts could trigger a financial crisis, requiring China to initiate a major recapitalization of the banking system.
column2: 但这些措施可能引发金融危机，使中国不得不进行大规模的银行系统资本重组。

column1: In such a scenario, non-performing loans in China’s banking system would probably amount to roughly $1 trillion.
column2: 在这一情形下，中国银行系统的不良贷款可能会达到1万亿美元左右。

column1: The most obvious means of recapitalizing China’s banks would be to inject renminbi-denominated government debt into the banking sector.
column2: 对中资银行进行资本重组最显而易见的方式是向银行部门注入人民币计价的政府债务。

column1: But China’s total public debt, including off-balance-sheet local-government financing vehicles, probably amounts to around 70% of GDP already.
column2: 但中国总公债水平 — — 包括表外的地方政府融资平台 — — 可能已经达到了GDP的70%左右。

column1: Despite debate over the details, the conclusion of Carmen Reinhart and Kenneth Rogoff – that a high debt/GDP ratio can inhibit economic growth – remains widely accepted; so it is unlikely that raising the debt ratio to 100% would be in China’s long-term interest.
column2: 尽管细节存在争议，但莱因哈特（Carmen Reinhart）和罗格夫（Kenneth Rogoff）的结论 — — 高债务/GDP比率会抑制经济增长 — — 仍被广泛接受；因此，将让债务比率升至100%显然不符合中国的长期利益。

column1: Even if China’s leaders decided that they had the necessary fiscal latitude to pursue such a strategy, they probably would not, owing to the risk of inflation, which, perhaps more than any other economic variable, tends to lead to social unrest.
column2: 即使中国领导人认为他们拥有必要的财政空间事实这一战略，他们也有可能因为通胀风险而不这么做。 通胀风险比其他任何经济变量更有可能导致社会动荡。

column1: Given this, in the event of a crisis, China would most likely have to begin selling off its massive store of US debt.
column2: 基于此，若发生危机，中国极有可能不得不开始甩卖其手中的巨量美国债务。

column1: Fortunately for China, the negative consequences of such a move would probably be far less severe than previously thought.
column2: 对中国来说，幸运的是这一动作的消极后果可能远没有此前设想的严重。

column1: To be sure, an injection of US Treasuries into the banking sector, and their subsequent conversion to renminbi, would still strengthen China’s currency.
column2: 平心而论，将美国国债注入银行部门并在随后转换为人民币仍可以强化中国货币。

column1: But the rise would most likely be offset by capital outflows, as looser capital controls would enable savers to escape the financial crisis.
column2: 但因为较松的资本管制使储蓄者可以逃避金融危机，升值极有可能被资本外流抵消。

column1: Moreover, even if the renminbi became stronger in the short term, China is no longer as dependent on maintaining export competitiveness as it once was, given that, excluding assembly and reprocessing, exports now contribute less than 5% of China’s GDP.
column2: 此外，即使人民币在短期有所升值，中国也不再能像从前那样依赖于维持出口竞争力，因为剔除组装和再加工业务，出口目前只占中国GDP的5 % 。

column1: Against this background, the US Federal Reserve, rather than focusing only on “tapering” its monthly purchases of long-term securities (quantitative easing), must prepare itself for a potential sell-off of US debt.
column2: 与这一背景相对的是，美联储不能专注于依靠“减弱”其每月长期证券购买量（量化宽松 ） ， 还必须做好准备面对可能发生的美国债务甩卖。

column1: Given that a Fed-funded recapitalization of China’s banking system would negate the impact of monetary policy at home, driving up borrowing costs and impeding GDP growth, the Fed should be ready to sustain quantitative easing in the event of a Chinese financial crisis.
column2: 美联储提供融资的中国银行系统的资本重组将使货币政策在国内失效，推高借贷成本并阻碍GDP增长，因此美联储应该做好准备在中国爆发金融危机时维持量化宽松。

column1: After spending years attempting to insulate the US economy from the upshot of its own banking crisis, the Fed may ultimately be forced to bail out China’s banks, too.
column2: 美联储花了多年时间让美国经济不再受其自身银行危机的影响，到头来还得被迫援助中国的银行。

column1: This would fundamentally redefine – and, one hopes, rebalance – US-China relations.
column2: 这将从根本上重塑中美关系 — — 我们希望是再平衡。

column1: Why the Fed Should Postpone Rate Hikes
column2: 为何美联储应该暂停升息

column1: JACKSON HOLE, WYOMING – As central bankers from around the world gather this week in Jackson Hole for the Federal Reserve’s annual Economic Policy Symposium, one key topic of discussion will be the current global stock-market turmoil.
column2: 杰克森霍尔，怀俄明州—本周，全球央行行长将齐聚杰克森霍尔（Jackson Hole ） ， 出席一年一度的美联储经济政策讨论会。 讨论会的一个重要议题是当前股市动荡。

column1: There are many reasons for these gyrations, but the expectation that the Fed will start to raise interest rates – perhaps as early as September – is clearly one of them.
column2: 动荡的原因有很多，但预期美联储将开始升息 — — 也许从9月份就会开始 — — 显然是其中之一。

column1: The arguments for a rate hike are valid.
column2: 支持升息的理由很充分。

column1: The United States’ economy is gaining traction.
column2: 美国经济正在重获动力。

column1: The International Monetary Fund forecasts 3% annual growth in 2015 and 2016, accompanied by inflation rates of 0.1% and 1.5%, respectively.
column2: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）预测2015和2016年增长率为3 % ， 对应通胀率分别为0.1%和1.5 % 。

column1: When an economy is normalizing, it is reasonable to reduce expansionary measures, such as those introduced after the crisis of 2008.
column2: 当经济开始正常化时，减少扩张政策（比如2008年危机后实施的那些）再合理不过了。

column1: Because the Fed has clearly communicated that it will move gradually toward less expansionary policies, its credibility would be damaged if it did not follow through.
column2: 美联储早就明确表示它将逐渐减少扩张性政策，因此，如果它不那么做，信誉就会收到影响。

column1: But there are strong reasons for the Fed to postpone interest-rate hikes and to keep monetary policy expansionary over the coming quarters.
column2: 但有很好的理由认为美联储应该暂停升息，并在未来几个季度保持货币政策扩张。

column1: For starters, the US recovery remains weak.
column2: 首先，美国复苏仍然疲软。

column1: Historically, 3% growth during a recovery is far from impressive.
column2: 从历史看，复苏期间3%的增长绝算不上漂亮。

column1: In other recent recoveries, growth often hit 4% or even 5% when increased capacity utilization pushed up productivity and investment.
column2: 在其他几次最近的复苏中，随着产能利用率的提高助推生产率和投资，增长率常常达到4%甚至5 % 。

column1: Over the past three decades, the US has been able to grow at an average annual rate of around 2.5%.
column2: 在过去三十年中，美国能够以平均每年2.5%的速度增长。

column1: Some attribute relatively slow growth to demographic factors, which have reduced the labor force, as well as to weak productivity levels, which have been low.
column2: 一些人将相对较慢的增长归因于人口因素，人口因素导致劳动力减少和已然低迷的生产率水平进一步恶化。

column1: But America’s potential output may be underestimated, and its inflation propensity exaggerated.
column2: 但美国的潜在产出可能被低估，而通胀倾向被高估。

column1: The US labor market works well.
column2: 美国劳动力市场运转良好。

column1: Unemployment is down to 5%, with no signs of overheating.
column2: 失业率已下降至5 % ， 没有过热迹象。

column1: The employment cost index suggests that wage increases so far have been surprisingly low.
column2: 就业成本指数表明目前工资增长低得出人意料。

column1: One reason for this is that labor-market flexibility increased during the recovery.
column2: 这一现象的一个原因是复苏期间劳动力市场弹性有所增加。

column1: Self-employment, short-term contracts, or part-time arrangements account for many of the jobs that have been created over the past few years.
column2: 自由职业、短期合同工和兼职占了过去几年工作岗位创造的很大一部分。

column1: Full-time jobs with comprehensive benefits are now much rarer.
column2: 如今，福利俱全的全职工作少见多了。

column1: This ongoing “Uberization” of the US labor market means that the balance in the wage-setting process has shifted.
column2: 美国劳动力市场的这一持续的“优步化 ” （ Uberization）意味着工资决定过程的平衡已经发生了改变。

column1: As a result, it will take longer for demand to feed through to wages and inflation than in the past.
column2: 结果，需求反馈到工资和通胀所需要的时间比以前更长了。

column1: Moreover, the economy is undergoing an ongoing technological shift stemming from digitization and globalization.
column2: 此外，美国经济正在经历数字化和全球化带来的持续的技术变迁。

column1: Estimates from Citigroup indicate that almost half of all jobs will be disrupted in the coming decades.
column2: 花旗集团的估算表明，在未来几十年中，近一半的工作岗位将不复存在。

column1: Jobs that require lower skills and less training are particularly vulnerable; but it is also clear that many other occupational categories – including administration, accounting, logistics, banking, and various service activities – are likely to be affected.
column2: 技能和训练要求低的岗位尤其脆弱；但同样明确的是，许多其他岗位类别 — — 包括管理、会计、物流、银行和各种服务活动 — — 也可能受到影响。

column1: Companies will be able to reduce their headcount and production costs while improving customer service, which, like Uberization, will affect the wage-setting process.
column2: 公司可以在减少人手、降低生产成本的同时改进客户服务，这与优步化一样，也将影响工资决定过程。

column1: Central bankers, I believe, are underestimating the impact of this structural shift.
column2: 我认为，央行行长低估了这一结构变迁的影响。

column1: In the more tech-oriented economies, like the US, the United Kingdom, and the Nordic countries, there is a risk that traditional macroeconomic models will overestimate the cost pressure from labor.
column2: 在更加技术导向的经济体，如美国、英国和北欧国家，一个风险是传统宏观经济模型将高估来自劳动力的成本压力。

column1: Another reason why the Fed should postpone a rate hike is that financial turmoil in emerging markets, particularly China, could have a substantial impact on the global economy, with some clear implications for the US economy.
column2: 美联储应该暂停升息的另一个原因是新兴市场（特别是中国）的金融动荡可能给全球经济造成重大冲击，美国经济也将受到明显影响。

column1: In particular, lower energy and commodity prices are likely to dampen inflationary pressure.
column2: 特别是，能源和大宗商品价格下跌可能消除通胀压力。

column1: When inflation is low for a long period, inflation expectations also tend to be low.
column2: 当通胀长期保持低迷时，通胀预期也会趋于下降。

column1: Add falling commodity and energy prices to the mix and there is a risk that inflation expectations will remain too low to sustain a balanced recovery.
column2: 再加上大宗商品和能源价格下跌，就产生了一个风险，即，通胀压力太低而无法维持平衡复苏。

column1: The global implications of lower emerging-market currencies are also likely to be deflationary.
column2: 新兴市场货币贬值的全球影响也可能是通缩性的。

column1: The direct impact is that a stronger dollar reduces the cost of imported goods.
column2: 直接影响是强势美元增加进口品的成本。

column1: The indirect effect, which might be substantial, is that cost-competitive light manufacturing in emerging markets increases.
column2: 间接影响可能更大，即成本竞争力强的新兴市场制造业的增长。

column1: That would reinforce the deflationary pressure from globalization for years to come.
column2: 这将强化今后多年内来自全球化的通缩压力。

column1: There is also a risk of greater currency-market volatility if the Fed jumps the gun in raising rates.
column2: 如果美联储抢先升息，还会带来货币市场波动扩大的风险。

column1: The Fed’s unconventional monetary policies have been necessary for the US.
column2: 美联储的非常规货币政策对美国来说是必要的。

column1: But, because they flooded global markets with liquidity, large portfolio flows have moved into emerging-market countries, whose currencies often are not as liquid as the dollar.
column2: 但是，这些政策给全球市场注入了流动性，巨大的投资组合流流向了新兴市场国家，而它们的货币流动性常常不如美国。

column1: When investment moves back into dollars, the currency fluctuations in these less liquid markets can become excessive.
column2: 当投资流回美元时，这些流动性较差的市场的货币就会过度波动。

column1: The Fed clearly has a responsibility to consider how its policy decisions affect the global financial system.
column2: 美联储有责任考虑其政策决定如何影响全球金融体系。

column1: Excessive currency volatility is not in America’s interest, not least because large exchange-rate depreciations in emerging markets would amplify the effects of globalization on US jobs, wages, and inflation, particularly as weaker foreign currencies make outsourcing a more economically viable solution.
column2: 过度货币波动不符合美国的利益，因为新兴市场的大规模汇率贬值将放大全球化对美国就业、工资和通胀的影响，特别是当外币贬值使外包在经济上更加划算时。

column1: Another reason for the Fed to reconsider hiking rates is that the legitimacy of the Bretton Woods institutions depends on a well-functioning global financial system.
column2: 美联储应该重新考虑是否升息的另一个理由是布雷顿森林机构的合法性依赖全球金融体系的正常运转。

column1: The global economy’s center of gravity is moving to Asia, Latin America, and Africa, but the IMF and the World Bank still seem to mirror the reality of the 1950s.
column2: 全球经济的重心正在转向亚洲、拉丁美洲和非洲，但IMF和世界银行所体现的仍然是20实际50年代的现实。

column1: If the Fed is seen as unleashing a major crisis in emerging markets, this will almost certainly do long-term damage to the global financial system.
column2: 如果美联储被认为是在制造一场新兴市场大危机，那么这几乎肯定会给全球金融体系造成长期伤害。

column1: The Fed should regard lower commodity prices, reduced inflationary pressures, changes in the labor market, and further disruptive technological shifts as sufficiently convincing arguments to postpone a rate hike.
column2: 美联储应该将大宗商品价格的下跌、通胀压力的减小、劳动力市场的变化以及未来破坏性技术变迁视为暂停升息的压倒性证据。

column1: Including the risk of excessive volatility in the global financial system tips the balance even further.
column2: 如果考虑到全球金融体系过度波动的风险，那么暂停升息的理由就更加充分了。

column1: There is plenty of time for the Fed to signal that its policy stance has shifted, and the conclave in Jackson Hole is an excellent opportunity to start that communication.
column2: 美联储有充足的时间释放信号表明其政策立场的转变，而杰克森霍尔会议便是一次开始释放这一信号的良机。

column1: If the facts have changed, the policy implications must also change.
column2: 如果事实发生了改变，政策也应该改变。

column1: The greatest loss of credibility always comes when policymakers try to ignore changing realities.
column2: 信誉的最大损失永远来自决策者试图忽视变化的现实。

column1: Why the Greek Bailout Failed
column2: 失败的希腊援助

column1: CAMBRIDGE – As the Greek crisis evolves, it is important to understand that a successful structural-adjustment program requires strong country ownership.
column2: 美国剑桥—随着希腊危机的演进，一个很重要的要点是明白成功的结构调整方案需要强大的国家所有权（ownership ） 。

column1: Even if negotiators overcome the most recent sticking points, it will be difficult to trust in their implementation if the Greek people remain unconvinced.
column2: 即使谈判者克服了最近的症结，如果说服不了希腊人民，也很难信任调整方案的实施。

column1: That has certainly been the experience so far.
column2: 显然，目前的经验就是如此。

column1: And without structural reform, there is little chance that the Greek economy will see sustained stability and growth – not least because official lenders are unwilling to continue extending an unreformed Greece significantly more money than it is asked to pay.
column2: 而如果没有结构改革，希腊经济就无从实现持续稳定和增长 — — 官方贷款人不愿给予不实施改革的希腊远远多于要求它偿还的资金。

column1: (This has been the case through most of the crisis, even if one would never know it from the world press coverage.)
column2: （大部分危机都是如此，尽管也许无法从全球媒体报道中了解这一点。 ）

column1: Greece’s membership in the European Union gives its creditors significant leverage, but evidently not enough to change the fundamental calculus.
column2: 希腊的欧盟成员资格给了其债权人很大的杠杆（leverage ） ， 但显然仍不足以改变基本面。

column1: Greece remains very much a sovereign country, not a sub-sovereign state.
column2: 希腊仍然是主权国家（country）而不是次主权的邦国（state ） 。

column1: The “troika” of creditors – the International Monetary Fund, the European Central Bank, and the European Commission – simply do not enjoy the kind of leverage over Greece that, say, the Municipal Assistance Corporation wielded over New York City when it teetered on the edge of bankruptcy in the mid-1970s.
column2: “三驾马车”债权人 — — IMF、欧洲央行和欧盟委员会 — — 在希腊问题上并没有获得类似于20世纪70年代市政援助公司（Municipal Assistance Corporation）在纽约市濒临破产时所获得的杠杆。

column1: The best structural-adjustment programs are those in which the debtor country’s government proposes the policy changes, and the IMF helps design a bespoke program and provides the political cover for its implementation.
column2: 最好的结构调整计划应该让债务国政府实施政策变化，并由IMF帮助设计定制方案和提供实施方案的政治掩护。

column1: Imposing them from the outside is simply not an effective option.
column2: 从外部实施这些政策绝非有效方法。

column1: So, for reforms to take hold, the Greek government and its electorate must believe in them.
column2: 因此，要想巩固改革，希腊政府及其选民必须相信改革政策。

column1: That a country must take ownership of its reform program is not a new lesson.
column2: 一国必须拥有其改革方案的所有权（ownership ） ， 这并非新教训。

column1: The IMF’s rocky relationship with Ukraine began long before the latest round of negotiations.
column2: IMF与乌克兰关系不稳定在最近一轮谈判之前很久就开始了。

column1: Back in 2013, IMF staff wrote a sobering report on the organization’s experience in the country.
column2: 2013年，IMF工作人员撰写了一份发人深省的报告，总结了IMF在乌克兰的经验。

column1: Their conclusion, in essence, was that the government’s failure to embrace the reform process fully all but guaranteed that its program would not work.
column2: 从根本上说，他们的结论是政府不充分相信改革程序，改革方案就无从奏效。

column1: If a government is incapable of or uninterested in making the needed adjustments, the report argued, the best option is to drip money out as reforms are implemented, as is now being done in Greece.
column2: 报告认为，如果政府无力执行需要的调整或对调整不感兴趣，那么最佳办法是不实施改革就不给钱，就像现在对希腊做得那样。

column1: Unfortunately, that approach has not proved adequate to overcome the challenges there.
column2: 不幸的是，这一方针不足以克服希腊的问题。

column1: Structural-reform conditions often tilt the balance between competing domestic factions, for better or for worse.
column2: 结构改革的条件常常会改变互相竞争的国内派系，结果有利有弊。

column1: If there is no will inside the country to maintain the reforms, they will quickly be undermined.
column2: 如果国内没有意愿维持改革，那么改革很快就会遭到破坏。

column1: Left-wing ideologues have long viewed structural-reform programs with deep suspicion, accusing international lenders like the IMF and the World Bank of being captured by neoliberal market fundamentalists.
column2: 左翼思想一直认为结构改革方案十分可疑，IMF和世界银行的国际贷款人被新自由派市场原教旨主义绑架了。

column1: This critique has some truth in it, but is overblown.
column2: 这一批评不无道理，但用力过猛。

column1: To be sure, structural reforms often favor policies like labor-market flexibility.
column2: 诚然，结构改革常常向弹性劳动力市场等等政策倾斜。

column1: But one should not make the mistake of viewing these interventions in black-and-white terms.
column2: 但不应该非黑即白地看待这些干预。

column1: Breaking down dual labor markets that are excluding young workers (as they do in much of southern Europe, including Italy and, to some extent, France) is very different from making it easier to fire all workers.
column2: 打破将年轻工人排除在外的二���劳动力市场（南欧有很多这样的情况，包括意大利和一定程度上的法国）与让解雇一切工人变得更容易是完全不同的两码事。

column1: Making pension systems sustainable does not amount to making them stingier.
column2: 让退休金体系变得可持续并不意味着一定要减少退休金。

column1: Making tax systems simpler and fairer is not the same as raising all taxes.
column2: 简化和公平化税收体系并不等同于提高一切税收。

column1: Recently, opponents of structural reform have put forward more exotic objections – most notably the problem caused by deflation when policy interest rates are at zero.
column2: 最近，结构改革的反对者提出了更加奇怪的反对理由 — — 最值得关注的是政策利率处于零水平时通缩所造成的问题。

column1: If structural reforms simply lower all wages and prices, it may indeed be difficult in the short-term to counter the drop in aggregate demand.
column2: 如果结构改革降低了所有工资和物价，那么克服短期总需求下降的确十分困难。

column1: But a similar critique could be made of any other change in policy: if it is poorly designed, it will be counter-productive.
column2: 但类似的批评也适用于其他任何政策变化：如果设计不合理，必然不利于生产。

column1: The truth is that the way forward in Europe requires achieving greater productivity.
column2: 真相是欧洲要向前进就必须提高生产率。

column1: The lessons from Greece and other unsuccessful bailout programs are sobering.
column2: 希腊和其他失败援助方案的教训发人深省。

column1: If a debt bailout program requires a wholesale change in a country’s economic, social, and political model, the best course of action might be to write off the private losses, rather than pour in public money to cover them.
column2: 如果债务援助方案要求一国经济、社会和政治模式发生全面的变化，那么最好的行动方案可能是减记私人损失，而不是用公共资金覆盖私人损失。

column1: In cases like Greece, the creditors’ passion for structural reforms might be better directed at home – particularly toward improving financial regulation.
column2: 在希腊的例子中，债权人的结构改革热情也许更应该引导向国内 — — 特别是改善金融监管。

column1: The vast majority of Greeks want to stay in the EU.
column2: 绝大多数希腊人都希望留在欧盟。

column1: In an ideal world, offering financial aid in exchange for reforms might help those in the country who want to shape it into a modern European state.
column2: 在理想情形中，以改革为交换提供金融援助也许有助于那些希望转变为现代欧洲邦国的国家。

column1: But given the difficulty Greece has had so far in making the necessary changes to reach that goal, it might be time to reconsider this approach to the crisis completely.
column2: 但考虑到希腊目前在做出必要改变从而实现这一目标方面所遇到的困难，也许应该彻底重新思考这一危机解决方案。

column1: In place of a program providing the country with further loans, it might make more sense to provide outright humanitarian aid – regardless of whether Greece remains fully within the eurozone.
column2: 对于向一国提供更多贷款的方案，也许最好的办法是提供直接人道援助 — — 不管希腊是否完全留在欧元区。

column1: Why the Greek Deal Will Work
column2: 为何希腊协议会起作用

column1: LONDON – Now that Greek banks have reopened and the government has made scheduled payments to the European Central Bank and the International Monetary Fund, does Greece’s near-death experience mark the end of the euro crisis?
column2: 伦敦—希腊银行已经重新开门，希腊政府也按期偿付了欧洲央行和国际货币基金组织（IMF ） 。 那么，希腊差点死去的经验是否标志着欧元危机的结束？

column1: The conventional answer is a clear no.
column2: 传统答案是言简意赅的“不 ” 。

column1: According to most economists and political commentators, the latest Greek bailout was little more than an analgesic.
column2: 根据大部分经济学家和政治评论家的观点，最新一轮希腊援助充其量只是止痛剂。

column1: It will dull the pain for a short period, but the euro’s deep-seated problems will metastasize, with a dismal prognosis for the single currency and perhaps even the European Union as a whole.
column2: 它能够暂时减少痛苦，但欧元的深层次问题将会转移，这个单一货币乃至整个欧盟的预后非常不乐观。

column1: But the conventional wisdom is likely to be proved wrong.
column2: 但传统智慧可能是错误的。

column1: The deal between Greece and the European authorities is actually a good one for both sides.
column2: 希腊和欧洲当局的协议实际上对于双方都是好事。

column1: Rather than marking the beginning of a new phase of the euro crisis, the agreement may be remembered as the culmination of a long series of political compromises that, by correcting some of the euro’s worst design flaws, created the conditions for a European economic recovery.
column2: 该协议绝非欧元危机新阶段开始的标志，它有可能作为一系列漫长的政治妥协的起点被人铭记，这一系列妥协纠正了欧元最糟糕的设计缺陷，为欧洲经济复苏创造了条件。

column1: To express guarded optimism about the Greek deal is not to condone the provocative arrogance of former Greek Finance Minister Yanis Varoufakis or the pointless vindictiveness of German Finance Minister Wolfgang Schäuble.
column2: 表示对希腊协议谨慎乐观并不是要饶恕前希腊财政部长瓦鲁法基斯（Yanis Varoufakis）目中无人的傲慢或德国总理朔伊布勒（Wolfgang Schäuble）毫无意义的恶意相逼。

column1: Neither is it to deny the economic criticism of the bailout provisions presented by progressives like Joseph Stiglitz and conservatives like Hans-Werner Sinn.
column2: 这也不是要否认斯蒂格利茨（Joseph Stiglitz）等进步人士和辛恩（Hans-Werner Sinn）等保守人士对援助条款的经济学批评。

column1: The arguments against creating a European single currency and then allowing Greece to cheat its way into membership were valid back in the 1990s – and, in theory, they still are.
column2: 反对创造欧洲单一货币然后允许希腊作弊获得欧元区成员资格的批评可以在20世纪90年代很有道理 — — 理论上，它们至今仍然如此。

column1: But this does not mean that breaking up the euro would be desirable, or even tolerable.
column2: 但这并不意味着应该让欧元区解体，甚至不意味着可以容忍欧元区解体。

column1: Joining the euro was certainly ruinous for Greece, but there is always “a great deal of ruin in a nation,” as Adam Smith remarked 250 years ago, when losing the American colonies seemed to threaten Britain with financial devastation.
column2: 加入欧元区显然给希腊造成了破坏，但亚当·斯密在250年前失去美国殖民地眼看着要给英国带来金融灾难时就指出 ， “ 一个国家永远有各种破坏 ” 。

column1: The great virtue of capitalism is that it adapts to ruinous conditions and even finds ways of turning them to advantage.
column2: 资本主义的一大优点是它能适应破坏性条件甚至找到办法把它们转化为优势。

column1: The United States in the mid-nineteenth century was badly suited for a single currency and a single economic structure, as evidenced by the Civil War, which was provoked as much by single-currency tensions as by moral abhorrence to slavery.
column2: 十九世纪中叶的美国十分不适合采取单一货币和单一经济结构，南北战争就是明证，单一货币紧张局势和对奴隶制到的痛恨都是战争爆发的原因。

column1: Italy would probably be better off today if Garibaldi had never launched unification.
column2: 如果加里波第没能统一意大利，说不定意大利会比今天更好。

column1: But once unification has happened, the pain of dismantling the political and economic settlement usually overwhelms the apparent gains from a break-up.
column2: 但一旦统一事件发生了，废除政治和经济制度安排的痛苦常常会比分裂的直接好处更大。

column1: This seems to be the case in Europe, as clear majorities of voters are saying in all eurozone countries, including Germany and Greece.
column2: 欧洲似乎就是如此，所有欧元区国家，包括德国和希腊的绝对多数选民都这么认为。

column1: Thus, the question was never whether the single currency would break up, but what political reversals, economic sacrifices, and legal subterfuges would occur to hold it together.
column2: 因此，问题从来不是单一货币是否将打破，而是何种政治逆转、经济牺牲和法律借口能让单一货币得以维持。

column1: The good news is that Europe now has some persuasive answers.
column2: 好消息是欧洲现在已经有了一些有说服力的答案。

column1: Indeed, Europe has overcome what could be described as the “original sin” of the single-currency project: the Maastricht Treaty’s prohibition of “monetary financing” of government deficits by the ECB and the related ban on mutual support by national governments of one another’s debt burdens.
column2: 事实上，欧洲已经克服了可称之为单一货币工程“原罪”的东西：马斯特里赫特条约禁止欧洲央行给政府赤字“货币融资”以及对国家政府共同支持彼此债务负担的禁令。

column1: In January, ECB President Mario Draghi effectively sidestepped both obstacles by launching a program of quantitative easing so enormous that it will finance the entire deficits of all eurozone governments (now including Greece) and mutualize a significant proportion of their outstanding bonds.
column2: 1月，欧洲央行行长德拉吉事实上绕过了这两个障碍，实施了量化宽松方案，其规模之大足以为所有欧元区政府（现在也包括希腊）的全部赤字提供融资，并将它们未偿还债务的大部分共同化。

column1: Moreover, European governments have belatedly understood the most basic principle of public finance.
column2: 此外，欧洲政府终于认识到公共财政的最基本原则。

column1: Government debts never have to be repaid, provided they can be extended in a cooperative manner or bought up with newly created money, issued by a credible central bank.
column2: 政府债务永远不必偿还，只要可以以合作的方式展期或用由可信央行发行的新创造的货币买断。

column1: But for this to be possible, interest payments must always be made on time, and the sanctity of debt contracts must always take precedence over electoral promises regarding pensions, wages, and public spending.
column2: 但要让这一幕发生，必须按时支付利息，并且债务契约的神圣性永远高于关于退休金、工资和公共支出的选举承诺。

column1: Now that Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras’s government has been forced to acknowledge the unqualified priority of debt servicing, and can now benefit from unlimited monetary support from the ECB, Greece should have little problem supporting its debt burden, which is no heavier than Japan’s or Italy’s.
column2: 如今，希腊总理齐普拉斯政府被迫承认了支付债务利息才是至高无上的当务之急，因此可以获得来自欧洲央行的无限量货币支持，因此，希腊支持其并不比日本或意大利更沉重的债务负担应该没有什么问题。

column1: Finally, Germany, Spain, Italy, and several northern European countries required, for domestic political reasons, a ritual humiliation of radical Greek politicians and voters who openly defied EU institutions and austerity demands.
column2: 最后，德国、西班牙、意大利和一些北欧国家出于国内政治原因要求对公开违抗欧盟机构和紧缩要求的希腊政客和选民给予形式羞辱（ritual humiliation ） 。

column1: Having achieved this, EU leaders have no further reason to impose austerity on Greece or strictly enforce the terms of the latest bailout.
column2: 实现了这一目的，欧盟领导人就没有进一步的理由对希腊施加紧缩或严格执行最新援助的条件。

column1: Instead, they have every incentive to demonstrate the success of their “tough love” policies by easing austerity to accelerate economic growth, not only in Greece but throughout the eurozone.
column2: 相反，他们有很大的激励通过放松紧缩以加速经济增长（不仅仅是希腊，而是整个欧元区）来证明“严���的爱”的成功。

column1: This raises a key issue that the Tsipras government and many others misunderstood throughout the Greek crisis: the role of constructive hypocrisy in Europe’s political economy.
column2: 这就引出了一个齐普拉斯政府和其他人在整个希腊危机中误解的问题：假设性伪善在欧洲政治经济学中的作用。

column1: Gaps between public statements and private intentions open up in all political systems, but these become huge in a complex multinational structure like the EU.
column2: 公开言论和私下意图之间的差异在所有政治制度中都存在，但像欧盟这样的复杂多边结构中特别巨大。

column1: On paper, the Greek bailout will impose a fiscal tightening, thereby aggravating the country’s economic slump.
column2: 表面上，希腊援助将带来财政紧缩，从而加剧希腊经济衰退。

column1: In practice, however, the budget targets will surely be allowed to slip, provided the government carries out its promises on privatization, labor markets, and pension reform.
column2: 但在实际中，预算目标必然有商量余地，只要政府兑现其在私有化、劳动力市场和退休金改革方面的承诺。

column1: These structural reforms are much more important than fiscal targets, both in symbolic terms for the rest of Europe and for the Greek economy.
column2: 这些结构改革比财政目标重要得多，不管是对欧洲其他国家的象征意义还是对希腊经济而言。

column1: Moreover, the extension of ECB monetary support to Greece will transform financial conditions: interest rates will plummet, banks will recapitalize, and private credit will gradually become available for the first time since 2010.
column2: 此外，延长欧洲央行对希腊的货币支持将转变金融环境：利率将下降，银行将资本重组，私人信用将逐渐可得（这是2010年以来没有发生过的事 ） 。

column1: If budget targets were strictly enforced by bailout monitors, which seems unlikely, this improvement in conditions for private borrowers could easily compensate for any modest tightening of fiscal policy.
column2: 如果援助监督者严格执行预算目标 — — 这看起来不太可能 — — 这一私人借款人条件的改善轻而易举就能补偿任何财政政策的略微收紧。

column1: In short, the main conditions now seem to be in place for a sustainable recovery in Greece.
column2: 简言之，目前希腊可持续复苏的主要条件看起来已经具备。

column1: Conventional wisdom among economists and investors has a long record of failing to spot major turning points; so the near-universal belief today that Greece faces permanent depression is no reason to despair.
column2: 经济学家和投资者的传统智慧常常无法辨认重要转折点；因此，完全不必担心当下几乎人人都持有的观点：希腊面临持久萧条。

column1: Money-Market Resistance
column2: 货币市场基金的抵抗

column1: CAMBRIDGE – The United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) recently rejected proposed rules aimed at making money-market funds safer in a financial crisis – a rejection that has caused consternation among observers and other regulators.
column2: 发自剑桥 — — 美国证券交易委员会最近否决了一系列旨在令货币市场基金在金融危机中更加安全的提案，令众多观察员和其他监管者大惊失色。

column1: Given the risks that money market funds can pose to the global financial system, as shown by their destabilizing role in the 2008 financial crisis, it is not hard to see why they are worried.
column2: 而考虑到货币市场基金可能为全球金融系统带来的风险 — — 正如其在2008年所扮演的不稳定角色—自然也不难明白人们为何如此忧虑。

column1: Money-market funds take excess cash from investors and use it to purchase short-term IOUs from businesses, banks, and other financial institutions.
column2: 货币市场基金从投资者处吸收多余的资金来从企业，银行和其他金融机构购买短期金融要求权（IOU ） 。

column1: They mimic bank accounts by allowing investors to write checks and promise that their investment’s value will not fall.
column2: 他们通过允许投资者写支票来模仿银行账户，并承诺后者的投资价值不会下跌。

column1: In 2012, American “prime” money-market funds, which buy bank and corporate debt, were worth nearly $1.5 trillion.
column2: 在2012年，购买银行和企业债券的美国“主要”货币市场基金规模达1.5万亿美元。

column1: The money flowing through these funds went to many of the world’s largest banks, including not just the obvious US suspects (JP Morgan Chase, Bank of America, and Citi), but also major European and Japanese banks such as Barclays, Deutsche Bank, Bank of Tokyo, Sumitomo, Credit Suisse, and ING.
column2: 通过这些基金的资金流通往全球许多大型银行，不仅包括常说的那几个美国巨头（摩根大通，美洲银行和花旗银行 ） ， 还有英格兰银行、德意志银行、东京银行，住友银行，瑞士瑞信银行和荷兰ING银行等欧日大型银行。

column1: These six international banks alone accounted for nearly 20% of the prime money-market funds’ value.
column2: 单单后面这六家国际银行就占了主要货币市场基金总市值的近20 % 。

column1: Many readers know how money-market funds work: An investor buys a $1.00 share from the XYZ fund, which keeps each share’s value at a constant $1.00, allowing the investor to believe that the money – invested in a pool of safe, secure, but not always government-guaranteed assets – is on deposit.
column2: 许多读者知道货币市场基金如何运作：一个投资者从某基金买了价值1美元的份额，而基金则一直保持每个份额都值1美元，令投资者相信自己的钱 — — 投资在一揽子安全，可靠但不常有政府担保的资产上 — — 是存款。

column1: Even if the asset pool declines in value, the fund’s managers keep the value of each share at $1.00 by rounding upward the fund’s real value.
column2: 即便这个资产组合的价值下跌，基金经理也会通过将基金实际价值凑整的方式来将每份价值维持在1美元。

column1: If the fund’s losses are big enough that rounding off still leaves it short of a stable $1.00 value, the fund “breaks the buck.”
column2: 如果基金的损失使其即便凑整也无法维持稳定的1美元价值，基金就“跌破面值”了。

column1: That happened when Lehman Brothers failed in September 2008.
column2: 这种情况在2008年9月雷曼兄弟破产时就出现了。

column1: The Reserve Fund, a well-established money-market fund with too many unpaid IOUs from Lehman, could not keep its value steady. It broke the buck.
column2: “储备基金”这家持有过多未支付雷曼兄弟金融要求权的老牌货币市场无法维持自身价值稳定，出现了跌破面值的状况。

column1: All money-market funds then became suspect, and many investors fled – withdrawing one-third of a trillion dollars in a single week.
column2: 所以货币市场基金都因此遭到了质疑，许多投资者闻风撤资 — — 仅仅一个星期内就赎回了3000多亿美元。

column1: Since much of the money-market funds’ assets are IOUs from the world’s biggest banks, the withdrawals weakened the already-shaky global banking system.
column2: 由于大多数货币市场基金的资产都是那些来自各大银行的金融要求权，赎回行动削弱了本已摇摇欲坠的全球银行系统。

column1: The Federal Reserve, seeking to stem the growing panic and stabilize the American and international banking system, promptly guaranteed the value of all money-market funds.
column2: 为了遏制恐慌的蔓延并稳定美国和国际银行系统，美联储则迅速为所有货币市场资金的价值做了担保。

column1: The proposals that the SEC rejected were aimed at making money-market funds more robust by requiring that each fund maintain capital reserves or let its value “float” – and not be rounded up – to reflect its true, underlying risk.
column2: 而美国证券交易委员会所否决的几个提案正是为了让货币市场基金更加稳固，要求每个基金保持资本储备或者任其“浮动 ” — —而不是凑整 — — 来体现真实和潜在的风险。

column1: The proposal would also have required that money-market funds hold back a fraction of some redemptions, thereby making investors take some risk that funds might not have complete transactional liquidity if their investments weakened.
column2: 提案同时也要求货币市场基金拒绝某些赎回行动中的一部分交易，从而令投资者们承担更多的风险 — — 如果他们的投资受损的话基金或许不会有完全的交易流动性。

column1: A majority of the commissioners turned down the proposals after substantial lobbying from the mutual-fund industry.
column2: 在共有基金行业的有力游说下，委员会的大多数委员否决了这些提案。

column1: If money-market funds had to maintain capital reserves, industry representatives argued, yields to investors would decline and the industry’s profits would suffer.
column2: 那些行业的代理人认为，如果货币市场基金需要保持资本储本金的话，投资者的收益和行业的利润都将受损。

column1: And, if retail investors saw their money-market funds’ values declining from the amount that they had invested, and if they knew that they could not get all of their money back immediately, the funds would become less attractive.
column2: 同时如果零售投资者发现原本投资的货币市场基金价值出现了下跌，如果他们知道自己无法迅速把自己的钱赎回来，那么这些基金的吸引力就会下降。

column1: Investors might choose other places for their excess cash, like banks.
column2: 投资者会选择其他地方来配置自己的多余现金，比如银行。

column1: Banks are obliged to hold reserves, maintain capital, and pay deposit insurance to ensure that they can honor their deposits.
column2: 银行有义务去持有储备金，维持资本，并支付储蓄保险以确保能为这些储蓄负责。

column1: The mutual-fund industry, one can assume, feared that the SEC’s rules would induce customers to redirect much of their cash directly into banks.
column2: 因此可以推测，共同基金行业害怕证券交易委员会的监管规则会令消费者将大部分现金转入银行。

column1: As a result of the SEC’s inaction, money-market funds will continue to operate outside the scope of bank-style rules on capital and reserves, even though investors treat them like bank accounts.
column2: 即便投资者依然将其当作银行账户般看待，但由于证券交易委员会的不做为，货币市场基金将继续在银行式的资本和储备规则之外运作。

column1: Unlike banks, though, they do not pay the government to insure their investors.
column2: 跟银行不同的是，他们并不会像政府付钱来为投资者担保。

column1: But the 2008 financial crisis showed that, when push comes to shove, the government will backstop money-market funds nonetheless.
column2: 但2008年的金融危机显示，当情况危急时，政府依然会为货币市场基金撑腰。

column1: The rejected proposals are thus good policy: money-market funds should be made safer – via capital requirements and liquidity restrictions – because they already receive a de facto government guarantee.
column2: 因此被否决的提案都是些好政策：货币市场基金应该变得更加安全 — — 通过对资本的要求以及流动性限制 — — 因为他们已经获得了一个事实上的政府担保。

column1: Their steady value makes them appear safer to investors than they are to the world’s financial system.
column2: 它们的稳定价值使它们看上去对投资者显得更安全 — — 对全球金融系统就难说了。

column1: The SEC’s rejection of the proposed rules demonstrates the power of concerted lobbying – and that concentrated interests often trump diffuse benefits.
column2: 证券交易委员会的否决行动显示出协商一致的游说行动 — — 以及集中的利益往往会胜过分散的利益。

column1: Typically, an interest group lobbies Congress, blandishing persuasive arguments, campaign contributions, and other support; often enough members – or enough key members – come to see the merit of the group’s point of view (or at least vote as if they do).
column2: 通常来说，一个利益集团游说国会，组织有说服力的论据，发起筹款以及其他支持；往往有足够的议员 — — 或者足够的核心议员 — — 会看到该集团观点的可取之处（���至少看似明白地投下一票 ） 。

column1: Meanwhile, ordinary citizens do not notice unless the issue receives significant media attention.
column2: 与此同时，普通市民直到情况受到媒体极大关注时才注意到这些事情。

column1: Often no one lobbies the other side of the issue.
column2: 往往也没有人去游说并陈述事情的另外一面。

column1: One might think that banks would counter-balance the mutual-fund industry’s lobbying efforts, because the likely effect of forcing money-market funds to pay for more of their systemic costs would be to expand funds flowing directly to banks.
column2: 有人或许会认为银行会抵消共同基金行业的游说努力，因为迫使货币市场基金支付更多系统成本可能会扩大直接流入银行的资金流。

column1: But inflows through money-market funds are not so bad for banks, which get the cash without having to set aside reserves or pay for deposit insurance.
column2: 但以货币市场基金形式流入的资金对于银行来说其实并不太坏，因为后者无须为这些现金进行资本储备或者支付存款保险。

column1: Some banks may even prefer these flows to direct deposits.
column2: 一些银行甚至更喜欢这类现金流而非直接存款。

column1: So the mutual-fund industry had the regulators all to itself.
column2: 因此共同基金行业令监管者完全倒向了他们这边。

column1: Its lobbyists told the SEC commissioners that current rules already did everything possible to ensure safety; that retail investors want money-market funds’ steady value; that change would hurt all investors; and that the recent Dodd-Frank financial-reform legislation disrupts regulators’ ability to bail out money-market funds next time.
column2: 其游说者告诉一众证券交易委员会委员说没有比当前法规在确保资金安全方面更完善的了；说零售投资者想要货币市场基金的稳定价值；说改革会伤害所有投资者；说最近通过的Dodd-Frank金融改革立法削弱了监管者下次援助货币市场基金的能力。

column1: Other regulators were watching, as were academics and journalists – and some regulators may now feel compelled to take over the money-market safety rules from the SEC or push the SEC back into action.
column2: 和学者和记者一样，其他监管者都在旁观这一切 — — 有些监管者可能现在会觉得必须去从证券交易委员会处接管货币市场安全法规或者促使委员会有所作为。

column1: With no one having a direct financial interest in the outcome pressing an alternative view, the SEC’s initial decision was as predictable as it was bad.
column2: 由于没有人在推动另一个观点方面拥有直接的金融利益，委员会最初的决定也就变得毫无悬念，正如我们知道这个决定必将很糟糕那样。

column1: Transatlantic Free Trade?
column2: 跨大西洋自由贸易？

column1: MADRID – This month, the United States National Intelligence Council released a sobering report entitled Global Trends 2030: Alternative Worlds.
column2: 马德里—本月，美国国家情报委员会公布了一份不容乐观的报告 ： 《 全球趋势2030：不一样的世界 》 （ Global Trends 2030: Alternative Worlds ） 。

column1: Most important, according to the authors, if current trends continue, Asia could soon surpass North America and Europe in global power.
column2: 作者所指出的最重要的一点是，如果当前趋势继续下去，亚洲将很快超过北美和欧洲成为全球一极。

column1: It will have a higher GDP, larger population, higher military spending, and more technological investment.
column2: 亚洲将拥有更高的GDP、更多的人口、更大的军事支出和更多的技术投资。

column1: In this geopolitical context, Europe and the US need each other more than ever, making greater transatlantic cooperation crucial.
column2: 在这样的地缘政治环境下，欧洲和美国比从前更加需要彼此，跨大西洋合作比以前更加重要。

column1: This seems to be the approach that inspired outgoing US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton’s recent speech at the Brookings Institution on US-European relations.
column2: 这似乎也是即将离任的美国国务卿希拉里·克林顿在布鲁克林研究所美欧关系演讲的主旨。

column1: Given the shift in global power and the prospect of US energy self-sufficiency as domestic hydrocarbon output booms, America is trying to adapt its foreign policy to the new multi-polar international order.
column2: 全球实力正在发生变迁，美国也因国内碳氢化合物产量增加而走向能源自给，在这样的背景下，美国将调整外交政策，以适应新的多极国际秩序。

column1: And, although Asia is now America’s strategic priority, Europe is still the partner with which Americans have the most in common.
column2: 此外，尽管亚洲现在是美国的战略重点，但欧洲仍是和美国最有共同语言的伙伴。

column1: “I want to be clear,” Clinton noted. “Our reorientation toward Asia is not a withdrawal from Europe.”
column2: “我要澄清 ， ” 克林顿指出 ， “ 我们的亚洲导向并不意味着从欧洲撤出 。 ”

column1: The US, according to Clinton, hopes that Europe will follow suit, so that Asia is seen not only as a market, but also as a focus of common strategic action.
column2: 按克林顿的说法，美国希望欧洲可以紧随其后，这样一来亚洲将不再仅仅是一个市场，而同时也是共同战略行动的焦点。

column1: But, beyond that, as the US and Europe seek to ensure their global roles, cooperation between them is more important than ever.
column2: 但是，除此之外，在美国和欧洲都在寻求确保全球地位时，它们之间的合作前所未有地重要。

column1: So now is the time for a bold initiative: the launch of a US-European Union free-trade agreement.
column2: 因此，现在正是果断行动的良机：推出美欧联盟（US-European Union）自由贸易协定。

column1: Clinton has already hinted at America’s readiness for this, mentioning the possibility of negotiating a complete agreement that would increase trade and stimulate growth on both sides of the Atlantic.
column2: 克林顿暗示美国已为此做好准备，提及了进行能够增进大西洋两岸贸易、刺激大西洋两岸经济的完整协定谈判。

column1: The journalist David Ignatius even dared to give it a name in a recent article in The Washington Post: TAFTA (Transatlantic Free-Trade Agreement).
column2: 记者伊格内修斯（David Ignatius）甚至在《华盛顿邮报》的最新文章中给它起了个名字：TAFTA（跨大西洋自由贸易协定 ） 。

column1: Edward Luce, writing in the Financial Times, preferred “Transatlantic Partnership.”
column2: 《金融时报》的卢斯（Edward Luce）则更喜欢“跨大西洋伙伴关系”这个名字。

column1: The US and the EU (taken as a whole) are not only the world’s two largest economies and typically the largest commercial partners for other major economies; they also maintain the world’s largest bilateral trade relationship.
column2: 美国和欧盟（作为一个整体）不但是世界第一和第二大经济体、其他主要经济体通常的最大商业伙伴；它们还是世界规模最大的双边贸易的双方。

column1: American investment in Europe is three times higher than it is in Asia.
column2: 美国在欧洲的投资比在亚洲高三倍。

column1: European investment in the US is eight times larger than its investments in China and India combined.
column2: 欧洲在美国的投资比在中国和印度的总和还高八倍。

column1: So transatlantic trade is crucial for both economies, particularly for job creation.
column2: 因此跨大西洋贸易对双方都很关键，特别是在就业创造方面。

column1: Indeed, it is estimated that one-third of all bilateral US-EU trade consists of internal transfers by companies that operate in both markets.
column2: 事实上，据估计，美国-欧盟双边贸易总额的三分之一是在双方都有经营活动的公司的内部转移。

column1: Although US and EU tariffs on each other’s marketed manufactured goods are already low (below 3%, on average), a free-trade agreement would be enormously beneficial in promoting further investment, thereby boosting economic growth and creating more jobs.
column2: 尽管美国和欧盟对彼此的制造品关税已经很低（平均不到3 % ） ，但自由贸易协定仍能大大有利于后续投资，从而提振经济增长、创造就业。

column1: Such an agreement could include trade in goods, services, financial instruments, and agriculture, and would necessitate greater compatibility of European and American regulations and legal norms, implying substantial savings.
column2: 这样一个协定可以包括商品、服务、金融工具和农业方面的贸易，也将成为增加欧洲和美国监管和法律规范兼容性的必要条件，这意味着省下大笔资金。

column1: Moreover, the effects of such an agreement would be felt far beyond the US and Europe.
column2: 此外，这样一个协定的影响范围将远超美国和欧洲。

column1: For example, both have already signed free-trade treaties with various Latin American countries, implying the creation of a geographically enormous free-trade area, which should boost economic resilience in the face of global crisis.
column2: 比如，美国和欧洲均已和许多拉丁美洲国家签订了自由贸易条约，这意味着可以建立一个地理范围极广的自由贸易区，从而增强抵御全球危机的韧性。

column1: Indeed, regional free-trade agreements are gaining momentum worldwide.
column2: 事实上，地区自由贸易协定正在全世界高歌猛进。

column1: The Trans-Pacific Partnership, a free-trade agreement spearheaded by the US, is set to be a game-changer in the Asia-Pacific region, with decisive advances this year putting it on course to be concluded in 2015.
column2: 美国牵头的自由贸易协定跨太平洋合作伙伴关系改变亚太地区的格局，该协定在今年取得了决定性进步，计划将于2015年完成。

column1: Potential signatories include the US, Australia, Malaysia, Vietnam, Singapore, New Zealand, Chile, Peru, Brunei, Canada, Mexico, and perhaps Japan and South Korea.
column2: 潜在签署方包括美国、澳大���亚、马来西亚、越南、新加坡、新西兰、智利、秘鲁、文莱、加拿大、墨西哥，可能还有日本和韩国。

column1: The result will be trade liberalization in an area that produces 40% of global GDP.
column2: 其结果将是一个站全球GDP份额40%的自由贸易区。

column1: Isn’t it time to consider something similar for Europe and the US?
column2: 现在难道不是考虑在欧洲和美国之间实行类似安排的良机吗？

column1: The EU, now confronting a wave of populism and Euro-skepticism, could revive its sense of purpose by committing itself to closer transatlantic cooperation and coordination on trade, to be carried out by the European Commission.
column2: 眼下，欧盟正面对着欧元怀疑派的民粹主义风潮，它可以通过更深地投入跨大西洋贸易合作和协作（将由欧盟委员会负责实施）重新燃起使命感。

column1: Such a project has worked before in bringing Europe together; it can do so again.
column2: 类似的工程曾经在团结欧洲方面祈祷过重要作用；现在可以依样画葫芦。

column1: The most precious asset today is confidence, and the mere fact of launching negotiations would generate it in abundance.
column2: 眼下，信心比黄金更重要，而进行谈判这一事实变已足够产生足够的信心。

column1: Protectionism is no solution to the crisis, whereas a transatlantic free-trade agreement would favor multilateralism and openness.
column2: 保护主义绝不是危机的解决方案，而跨大西洋自由贸易协定有利于多边主义和开放。

column1: In this sense, it is important to stress the work of the World Trade Organization, the best multilateral forum that the world has for resolving trade disputes.
column2: 从这个角度看，促进世贸组织的工作十分重要，因为这是世界所拥有的解决贸易纠纷的最好论坛。

column1: Signing a transatlantic trade treaty would be irrefutable proof that the political case for open trade can be made – and won.
column2: 毫无疑问，签署跨大西洋贸易条约能够证明，开放贸易的政治条件可以创造并成功。

column1: The only way to achieve this is through the clear commitment of political leaders on both sides of the Atlantic, together with private-sector involvement, which is fundamental to sustaining urgently needed economic growth.
column2: 达到这一目标的唯一办法是大西洋两岸政治领袖的明确承诺，并辅之以私人部门参与，后者是维持急需的经济增长的关键。

column1: But let’s not wait: faced with predictions of the West’s relative decline, the US and the EU must commit themselves to more union, more cooperation, and more prosperity.
column2: 但所谓时不我待，在西方相对衰落的预言声中，美国和欧盟应该致力于更多的联合，更多的合作和更大的繁荣。

column1: Today, that means a transatlantic free-trade agreement.
column2: 如今，这就意味着跨大西洋自由贸易协定。

column1: Financial Reform’s Breakthrough Year
column2: 金融改革的突破之年

column1: ZANZIBAR – Here’s an odd prediction for the coming year: 2013 will be a watershed for financial reform.
column2: 桑给巴尔—新一年有老预言：2013年将是金融改革的分水岭之年。

column1: True, while the global financial crisis erupted more than four years ago, and the Dodd-Frank financial reforms were adopted in the United States back in 2010, not much has changed about how Wall Street operates – except that the large firms have become bigger and more powerful.
column2: 诚然，尽管全球金融危机爆发已逾四年，美国的多德-弗兰克金融改革也在2010年便被通过，但华尔街的运作方式并没有什么变化 — — 除了大公司变得更大、更有权势之外。

column1: Yet there are reasons to expect real progress in the new year.
column2: 但仍有不少理由期待新的一年中会有真正的进步。

column1: The US Federal Reserve is finally shifting its thinking.
column2: 美联储终于开始转变思维了。

column1: In a series of major speeches this fall, Governor Dan Tarullo made the case that the problem of “too big to fail” financial institutions remains with us.
column2: 在今年秋天的一系列重要演讲中，美联储理事塔鲁罗（Dan Tarullo）明确指出，金融机构“太大而不能倒”的问题仍然没有消除。

column1: We need to take additional measures to reduce the level of systemic risk – including limiting the size of our largest banks.
column2: 我们需要动用更多的措施降低系统性风险 — — 包括限制最大银行的规模。

column1: News reports indicate that the Fed has already started saying no to some bank mergers.
column2: 新报告表明，美联储已经开始对一些银行并购说不。

column1: At the same time, the US Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation has become a bastion of sensible thinking on financial-sector issues.
column2: 与此同时，美国联邦存款保险公司（FDIC）已成为理智思考金融部门问题的重要堡垒。

column1: In part, this is because the FDIC is responsible for cleaning up the mess when financial-sector firms fail, so its senior officials have a strong incentive to protect its insurance fund by preventing risks from getting out of control.
column2: 这部分是因为FDIC需要在金融部门企业倒闭时收拾残局，因此其高级官员有强烈的激励通过防止风险失控保护保险资金。

column1: The FDIC is showing intellectual leadership as well as organizational capabilities – Vice Chairman Tom Hoenig’s speeches are a must-read.
column2: FDIC不但起到了观念领袖作用，也是组织能力的先锋 — — 其副主席霍尼格（Tom Hoenig）的演讲不容错过。

column1: Wall Street is pushing back, of course.
column2: 当然，华尔街在卷土重来。

column1: But the rolling series of scandals surrounding global megabanks makes it difficult for anyone to keep a straight face when executives insist that our largest banks must maintain their current scale and scope.
column2: 但全球银行巨头没完没了的丑闻让所有人都不会对银行高管所声称的大银行必须维持现有规模的论调买账。

column1: Do we need HSBC to facilitate global money laundering?
column2: 我们需要汇丰帮助在全世界洗钱吗？

column1: Do we need Barclays and UBS to manipulate Libor (a key benchmark for interest rates around the world)?
column2: 我们希望巴克莱和瑞银操纵Libor（世界关键性基准利率之一）吗？

column1: Do we need still more losses at poorly run trading operations for JP Morgan Chase?
column2: 我们需要JP摩根大通的不慎交易给我们带来更大损失吗？

column1: The pro-bank lobby groups are positioning themselves to argue that the new resolution powers under Dodd-Frank have ended the too-big-to-fail problem, and we can expect a public-relations drive in this direction early in the new year.
column2: 支持银行的游说集团辩称新多德-弗兰克法案下的解决方案已经终结了太大而不能倒问题，明年年初，我们可以期待公共关系推动这一方向的进步。

column1: But the consensus view at the most recent meeting of the FDIC’s Systemic Resolution Advisory Committee (of which I am a member) was that this claim should not be taken seriously.
column2: 但FDIC系统性解决方案咨询委员会（Systemic Resolution Advisory Committee，我也是委员之一）最新的一致意见是对这一论断不能妄加信任。

column1: Under Dodd-Frank, it is arguably easier for the FDIC to handle the failure of a single large financial institution than it was in pre-Dodd-Frank days.
column2: 在多德-弗兰克法案下，FDIC处理一家大金融机构的难度确实比多德-弗兰克法案出台前容易了一些。

column1: But what if two or three or seven firms are all in trouble at the same time?
column2: 但如果两家、三家甚至所有金融企业同时陷入麻烦呢？

column1: The answer, as former Fed Chairman Paul Volcker implied at the meeting, is that we would be right back where we started – in the panic and frozen credit markets that followed the collapse of Lehman Brothers in September 2008.
column2: 前美联储主席沃克尔在会议中指出，答案在于我们应该回到起点 — — 2008年9月雷曼兄弟倒闭所引起的恐慌和信用市场冻结。

column1: Indeed, the idea that substantial shocks could soon hit the US financial system is not far-fetched.
column2: 事实上，严重冲击很快会袭向美国金融体系的观点绝非杞人忧天。

column1: The European debt crisis, for example, remains far from being resolved.
column2: 比如，欧洲债务危机就远远没有得到解决。

column1: A significant sovereign-debt restructuring there would bring down European banks and potentially damage US banks – as well as financial institutions around the world.
column2: 欧洲的大规模主权债务重组将导致欧洲银行的倒闭，并可能危害美国银行以及全世界的金融机构。

column1: Meanwhile, the continuing problems at European banks are a stark reminder that operating highly leveraged, thinly capitalized firms is incredibly risky.
column2: 与此同时，欧洲银行问题的持续提醒我们，高杠杆、低资本经营的公司风险极高。

column1: And the regulatory failures in Europe – consider the German Landesbanks, for example – will become only more obvious in the coming months.
column2: 而欧洲的监管无能 — — 德国Landesbanks就是明证 — — 在未来几个月中将进一步显现。

column1: Creating a common supervisory authority will mean nothing unless it can clean up the mess created by the existing supervisors.
column2: 成立共同监督当局是毫无意义的，除非它能够收拾好现任监督者留下的残局。

column1: And that cleanup will expose more of the rot in banks’ current operations.
column2: 而收拾残局将会把更多欧洲银行的经营问题暴露出来。

column1: The need for banks to finance themselves with more equity and relatively less debt will be the focus of one of the main publishing events in economics in 2013.
column2: 银行需要更多地依靠股权融资、相对减少债务为自己筹集资金，这将使2013年经济读物的主要关注点之一。

column1: Anat Admati and Martin Hellwig’s The Bankers’ New Clothes: What’s Wrong with Banking and What to Do About it? will appear officially in March, but advance copies are already being closely read in leading central banks.
column2: 阿德马蒂（Anat Admati）和赫尔维格（Martin Hellwig）的《银行家的新衣：银行犯了什么错以及怎样纠正错误？ 》 （ The Bankers’ New Clothes: What’s Wrong with Banking and What to Do About it ? ） 将在3月正式面世，但抢鲜版已经开始在主要央行中间流传。

column1: Bankers everywhere will rush to read it before their regulators do.
column2: 各国银行家都会抢在监管者之前阅读这本书。

column1: The road to the ongoing financial and economic crisis was built on a foundation of intellectual capture: not only regulators, but academics, too, became captivated by modern finance and its methods.
column2: 迈向持续金融和经济之路建立在思想禁锢的基础上：不仅仅是监管者，学术界也越来越受制于现代金融学及其方法的支配。

column1: Admati and Hellwig are at the vanguard of the counterrevolution, challenging the great myths of banking head-on.
column2: 阿德马蒂和赫尔维格是反革命先锋，挑战了“银行向前冲”的大神话。

column1: Do we need financial institutions to be so highly leveraged (that is, carrying so much debt relative to equity)?
column2: 我们需要金融机构杠杆如此职高吗（也就是说，相对于股本债务太多 ） ？

column1: No, they argue.
column2: 他们的回答是否定的。

column1: If banks of all kinds were financed with more equity, they would have stronger buffers to absorb losses.
column2: 如果各种各样的银行都更多地通过股权方式融资，它们将拥有更大的损失吸收缓冲。

column1: Both the equity and the debt issued by well-capitalized banks would be safer – and therefore cheaper.
column2: 资本状况较好的银行所发行的股票和债券将更安全 — — 因此成本更低。

column1: Bankers want to be so highly leveraged for a simple reason: implicit government guarantees mean that they get the upside when things go well, while the downside is someone else’s problem.
column2: 银行家希望杠杆率如此之高，原因很简单：隐性政府担保意味着他们可以在好光景时获利，而坏光景是其他人的问题。

column1: Contrary to bankers’ claims, this is not a good arrangement for society.
column2: 与银行家的言论相反，这绝不是好的社会安排。

column1: Admati and Hellwig are confronting the bankers and their allies in no uncertain terms, grounding their argument in deep financial thinking, yet writing for a broad audience.
column2: 阿德马蒂和赫尔维格以斩钉截铁的方式站在了银行界及其盟军的对立面，他们的论点具有深层金融思想根基，尽管他们的书是写给大众看的。

column1: Whatever else happens in 2013, we can be sure that they will not win the Goldman Sachs Business Book of the Year award.
column2: 不论2013年发生什么事情，我们可以确定的是，这本书得不到高盛年度商业书籍奖。

column1: In Defense of Non-Visionaries
column2: 为非空想主义者辩护

column1: OXFORD – Many of the recent tributes for Margaret Thatcher following her death celebrated her as a “transformational” leader who brought about great changes.
column2: 牛津—玛格丽特·撒切尔去世后，很多最新纪念文章称赞她是带来伟大变革的“转型”领袖。

column1: There were frequent references to her equally transformational American counterpart, Ronald Reagan.
column2: 经常被提到的还有她的美国转型同侪罗纳德·里根。

column1: But a more interesting comparison is with her other presidential contemporary, George H. W. Bush.
column2: 但更有趣的比较是把她和另一位美国总统放在一起 — — 老布什。

column1: Though often dismissed as a mere “transactional” manager, Bush had one of the best foreign-policy records of the past half-century.
column2: 尽管通常被贬低为“事务性”管理者，老布什却拥有着过去半个世纪的最佳外交政策记录。

column1: His administration managed the end of the Cold War, the dismantlement of the Soviet Union, and the unification of Germany within NATO – all without violence.
column2: 他的政府让冷战结束，目睹了苏联的解体，让德国在北约框架内实现了重新统一 — — 所有这些都没有使用暴力。

column1: At the same time, he led a broad United Nations-backed coalition that repelled Saddam Hussein’s aggression against Kuwait.
column2: 与此同时，他领导了广泛的由联合国支持的联盟，击退了萨达姆·侯赛因对科威特的入侵。

column1: Had he dropped any of the balls he was juggling, today’s world would be much worse.
column2: 他在任何一个方面稍有闪失，当今世界就会糟糕得多。

column1: Although he presided over a major global transformation, Bush, by his own account, did not have transformational objectives.
column2: 尽管他主导了重要的全球转型，但就个人而言，老布什并没有转型目标。

column1: On the unification of Germany, he resisted the advice of Thatcher and others, apparently out of a sense of fairness and responsiveness to his friend, German Chancellor Helmut Kohl.
column2: 在德国重新统一的问题上，它坚持撒切尔和其他人的意见，显然偏向于他的朋友、德国总理科尔而不顾公平。

column1: In October 1989, Bush responded to a call from Kohl by publicly stating that he did not “share the concern that some European countries have about a reunified Germany.”
column2: 1989年10月，老布什响应科尔的呼吁，公开声称他不“同意一些欧洲国家对重新统一的德国的担心 ” 。

column1: At the same time, he was careful to let Kohl and others take the lead.
column2: 与此同时，他小心翼翼地让科尔和其他人主导形势发展。

column1: When the Berlin Wall was opened a month later, partly owing to an East German mistake, Bush was criticized for his low-key response.
column2: 当一个月后柏林墙倒掉时（部分是因为东德的错误 ） ， 老布什因其反应太过低调而受到批评。

column1: But Bush had made a deliberate choice not to humiliate the Soviets or gloat: “I won’t beat on my chest and dance on the wall,” was his response – a model of emotional intelligence in a leader.
column2: 但老布什深思熟虑地选择不去羞辱苏联，也不幸灾乐祸 ： “ 我不会在柏林墙上手舞足蹈 ， ” 这就是他的反应 — — 堪称领袖心理智慧的样板。

column1: Such self-restraint helped to set the stage for the successful Malta Summit with Soviet President Mikhail Gorbachev a month later.
column2: 如此自我克制帮助他成功地在一个月后于苏联总统戈尔巴乔夫举行了马耳他峰会。

column1: The Cold War ended quietly, and the dismantlement of the Soviet empire followed.
column2: 冷战静悄悄地结束了，随之而来的苏联帝国的倒闭。

column1: As Bush and his team responded to forces that were largely outside of his control, he set goals and objectives that balanced opportunities and constraints in a prudent manner.
column2: 当老布什及其团队应对他所无法控制的力量时，他审慎地权衡机会和约束，设定目标和目的。

column1: Some critics have faulted him for not supporting the national aspirations of Soviet republics like Ukraine in 1991 (when he delivered his infamous “Chicken Kiev” speech warning against “suicidal nationalism”); for failing to go to Baghdad to unseat Saddam Hussein in the Gulf War; or for sending Brent Scowcroft to Beijing to maintain relations with China after the Tiananmen Square massacre of 1989.
column2: 一些批评家挑他的刺，认为他不支持苏联加盟��和国的民族意愿（比如1991年的乌克兰，他做了臭名昭著的《基辅鸡 》 （ Chicken Kiev）演讲，警告“自杀式民族主义 ” ） 、批评他没能在海湾战争中进军巴格达把萨达姆赶下台、指责他在1989年天安门事件后派布伦特·斯考克罗夫特（Brent Scowcroft）前往北京维持与中国的关系。

column1: But, in each instance, Bush was limiting his short-term gains in order to pursue long-term stability.
column2: 但是，在所有这些事件中，老布什都为了长期稳定而牺牲短期利益。

column1: Other critics complained that Bush did not set more transformational objectives regarding Russian democracy, the Middle East, or nuclear non-proliferation at a time when world politics seemed fluid.
column2: 也有批评家认为老布什没有在俄罗斯民主、中东和核不扩散问题上追求更有转型意义的目标 — — 当时的世界政坛波诡云谲。

column1: But, again, Bush remained more focused on maintaining global stability than on advancing new visions.
column2: 但是，老布什扔更关注维持全球稳定而不是推行新愿景。

column1: Bush was also respectful of institutions and norms at home and abroad, going to the US Congress for authorization of the Gulf War, and to the United Nations for a resolution under Chapter 7 of the UN Charter.
column2: 老布什还尊重国内外制度和范式，要求美国国会授权参与海湾战争，要求联合国根据联合国宪章第七条给出决议。

column1: Although a realist in his thinking, he could be Wilsonian in his tactics.
column2: 尽管他的思维是现实主义的，但在策略上，他是威尔逊主义的。

column1: Bush’s termination of the ground war in Iraq after only four days was motivated in part by humanitarian concerns about the slaughter of Iraqi troops, as well as by an interest in not leaving Iraq so weakened that it could not balance the power of neighboring Iran.
column2: 老布什在结束伊拉克地面战争开始仅仅四天后就鸣金，部分原因是出于伊拉克军队遭屠的人道主义考虑，也有部分是出于不能让伊拉克过于孱弱以至于无法制衡相邻的伊朗的利益计算。

column1: While Bush’s invasion of Panama to capture (and later put on trial) Manuel Noriega may have violated Panamanian sovereignty, it had a degree of de facto legitimacy, given Noriega’s notorious behavior.
column2: 老布什的入侵巴拿马并俘获（随后审判）曼努尔·诺列加（Manuel Noriega）也许破坏了巴拿马的主权，但这具有一定程度的实际合法性，因为诺列加是臭名昭著的暴君。

column1: And, when Bush organized his international coalition to prosecute the Gulf War, he included several Arab countries – not to ensure military success, but to boost the mission’s legitimacy.
column2: 而当老布什组织多国联合控诉海湾战争时，他把一些阿拉伯国家也包括了进来 — — 这不是为了确保军事胜利，而是为了增加行动的合法性。

column1: When Bush and Thatcher met in Aspen, Colorado, in the summer of 1990, Thatcher allegedly warned him “not to go wobbly.”
column2: 1990年夏，老布什和撒切尔在科罗拉多州阿斯彭（Aspen）举行会晤，据说撒切尔警告他“不要摇摆不定 ” 。

column1: But most historians agree there was no such danger.
column2: 但大部分历史学家同意根本不存在这样的危险。

column1: With his careful combination of hard and soft power, Bush created a successful strategy – one that accomplished American goals in a manner that was not unduly insular and with minimal damage to the interests of foreigners.
column2: 老布什小心翼翼地结合了硬实力和软实力，创造了成功的战略，以既不过于狭隘、又能将他国利益损害最小化的方式实现美国的目标。

column1: He was careful not to humiliate Gorbachev, and to manage the transition to Boris Yeltsin’s presidency in a newly independent Russia.
column2: 他小心地不去羞辱戈尔巴乔夫，并完成了新成立的独立的俄罗斯向叶利钦做总统的过渡。

column1: Of course, not all foreigners were adequately protected.
column2: 当然，并非所有外国人都得到了充分保护。

column1: For example, Bush assigned a low priority to Kurds and Shia in Iraq, to dissidents in China, and to Bosnians in the former Yugoslavia.
column2: 比如，老布什对伊拉克库尔德人和什叶派、中国持异见者和前南斯拉夫的波斯尼亚人就不那么上心。

column1: In that sense, Bush’s realism set limits to his cosmopolitanism.
column2: 从这个角度来说，老布什的现实主义限制了他的世界大同观。

column1: Could Bush have done more had he been a transformational leader like Thatcher or Reagan?
column2: 如果老布什是像撒切尔和里根那样的转型领袖，他能做得更多吗？

column1: Perhaps he might have done more in a second term.
column2: 也许他可以在第二个任期做得更多。

column1: And, with better communication skills, he might have been able to do more to educate the American public about the changing nature of the post-Cold War world.
column2: 而如果沟通技巧更好，他或许能更好地教育美国公众明白后冷战世界的变化本质。

column1: But, given the profound uncertainty of a world in flux, as well as the dangers of miscalculation as the Soviet empire collapsed, prudent management trumped grand visions.
column2: 但是，在流动世界的高度不确定性中，在错误估计苏联帝国解体的风险阴影笼罩下，审慎管理要胜于宏伟空想。

column1: Bush famously said that he did not do “the vision thing.”
column2: 老布什有句名言，他不“做空想的事 ” 。

column1: Nonetheless, few people at the end of 1989 believed that Germany could be reunited peacefully within the Western alliance.
column2: 尽管如此，在1989年底，很少有人相信德国灰和平地重新统一并留在西方同盟中。

column1: Thatcher certainly did not.
column2: 撒切尔显然不相信。

column1: The lesson is that in some circumstances, we should prefer leadership by good transactional managers like George H. W. Bush (or Dwight Eisenhower before him), rather than by more flashy and inspirational transformers.
column2: 这表明，在某些环境中，我们应该看好作为优秀事务性管理者的领导人，比如老布什（以及他之前的艾森豪威尔 ） ， 而不是更犀利、更能激发人心的转型领导人。

column1: Should Business Travel Be Obsolete?
column2: 商务旅行应该淘汰吗？

column1: COLOMBO – Think about it: You can call, email, and even watch your counterparty on FaceTime, Skype, or GoToMeeting.
column2: 科伦坡—想一想：你可以在FaceTime、Skype或GoToMeeting上呼叫你的对手方、给他们发电邮，甚至与与他们面对面。

column1: So why do companies fork out more than $1.2 trillion a year – a full 1.5% of the world’s GDP – for international business travel?
column2: 既然如此，为何公司每年还要花1.2万亿美元以上的钱 — — 足足相当于世界GDP的1.5 % — —用于国际商务旅行？

column1: The expense is not only huge; it is also growing – at 6.5% per year, almost twice the rate of global economic growth and almost as fast as information and telecommunication services.
column2: 开支不但巨大，而且还在增长 — — 每年6.5 % ， 几乎是全球经济增长的两倍，或者与信息和通讯服务业增长相当。

column1: Computing power has moved from our laptops and cellphones to the cloud, and we are all better off for it.
column2: 计算能力已经从笔记本和手机移动到云端，这让我们所有人都从中获益。

column1: So why do we need to move brains instead of letting those brains stay put and just sending them bytes?
column2: 那么，为何我们还需要移动大脑，而不是让这些大脑留在原地，而只是传输大脑中的数据？

column1: Why waste precious work time in the air, at security checks, and waiting for our luggage?
column2: 为何要把宝贵的工作时间浪费在空中、安检门和等待行李上？

column1: Before anyone starts slashing travel budgets, let’s try to understand why we need to move people rather than information.
column2: 在开始削减差旅预算前，让我们试着理解一下为何我们需要让人移动，而不是信息。

column1: Thanks to a research collaboration on inclusive growth with MasterCard and an anonymized donation of data to the Center for International Development at Harvard University, we are starting to shed some light on this mystery.
column2: 通过与万事达卡的联合包容增长研究，以及向哈佛大学国际发展中心的匿名数据捐赠，我们开始探索这一谜题并取得了一些洞见。

column1: In ongoing work with Dany Bahar, Michele Coscia, and Frank Neffke, we have been able to establish some interesting stylized facts.
column2: 在与丹尼·巴哈尔（Dany Bahar ） 、 米歇尔·柯西亚（Michele Coscia）和弗兰克·尼福柯（Franke Neffke）的研究中，我们已经能够识别出一些有趣的典型事实。

column1: More populous countries have more business travel in both directions, but the volume is less than proportional to their population: a country with 100% more population than another has only about 70% more business travel.
column2: 人口较多的国家双向商务旅行也更多，但旅行量的增量不及人口比例：如果一个国家人口比另一个国家多100 % ， 其商务旅行量将只多出70%左右。

column1: This suggests that there are economies of scale in running businesses that favor large countries.
column2: 这表明营商存在有利于大国的规模经济。

column1: By contrast, a country with a per capita income that is 100% higher than another receives 130% more business travelers and sends 170% more people abroad.
column2: 相反，如果一国人均收入比另一国高100 % ， 那么它所接收的商务旅行者将多出130 % ， 它发出的商务旅行者将多出170 % 。

column1: This means that business travel tends to grow more than proportionally with the level of development.
column2: 这意味着商务旅行增长比例要高于发展水平。

column1: While businesspeople travel in order to trade or invest, more than half of international business travel seems to be related to the management of foreign subsidiaries.
column2: 商务人士旅行的目的是做交易或投资，但超过一半的国际商务旅行与外国分支管理层有关。

column1: The global economy is increasingly characterized by global firms, which need to deploy their know-how to their different locations around the world.
column2: 全球经济中的全球企业越来越多，它们需要在全世界各地部署专业知识。

column1: The data show that there is almost twice the amount of travel from headquarters to subsidiaries as there is in the opposite direction.
column2: 数据表明，从总部到分支的旅行量是相反方向的近两倍。

column1: Exporters also travel twice as much as importers.
column2: 出口国旅行量是进口国的两倍。

column1: But why do we need to move the brain, not just the bytes?
column2: 但为什么我们需要移动大脑，而不仅仅是数据？

column1: I can think of at least two reasons.
column2: 我可以想到至少两个原因。

column1: First, the brain has a capacity to absorb information, identify patterns, and solve problems without us being aware of how it does it.
column2: 首先，大脑具有吸收信息、识别模式和解决问题的模式，我们根本不需要知道大脑如何做到这一点。

column1: That is why we can, for example, infer other people’s goals and intentions from facial expressions, body language, intonation, and other subtle indicators that we gather unconsciously.
column2: 因此，我们能够（比如）在面部表情、肢体语言、语调和其他我们下意识收集到的微妙信号中推断他人的目标和意图。

column1: When we attend a meeting in person, we can listen to the body language, not just the spoken word, and we can choose where to look, not just the particular angle that the video screen shows.
column2: 当我们召开现场会议时，我们可以倾听肢体语言，而不仅仅是说出来的话，我们可以选择看哪里，而不仅仅是通过视频中的特殊角度。

column1: As a consequence, we are better able to evaluate, empathize, and bond in person than we can with today’s telecom technologies.
column2: 因此，我们能够比通过当今通讯技术更好地评估他人、产生共鸣、建立纽带。

column1: Second, the brain is designed to work in parallel with other brains.
column2: 其次，大脑天生具有与其他大脑并行工作的能力。

column1: Many problem-solving tasks require parallel computing with brains that possess different software and information but that can coordinate their thoughts.
column2: 许多解决问题的任务需要与拥有不同软件和信息，但能够协调思想的其他大脑进行并行计算。

column1: That is why we have design teams, advisory boards, inter-agency taskforces, and other forms of group interaction.
column2: 因此我们有了设计团队、顾问委员会、跨部门任务小组和其他形式的集体互动。

column1: Conference calls try to match this interaction, but it is hard to speak in turn or to see one another’s expressions when someone is talking.
column2: 电话会议试图取代这一互动，但在电话会议中很难依次发言或在某人正在发言时 观察彼此的表情。

column1: Conference calls have trouble replicating the intricacy of human conscious and unconscious group interactions that are critical to solve problems and accomplish tasks.
column2: 电话会议无法复制人的意识和无意识集体互动的复杂性，而这种复杂性是解决问题、完成任务的关键。

column1: The amount of travel should then be related to the amount of know-how that needs to be moved around.
column2: 因此，旅行量应该与有多少知识需要移动有关。

column1: Countries differ in the amount of know-how they possess, and industries differ in the amount of know-how they require.
column2: 各国拥有的知识量不同，各行业所需要的知识量也不同。

column1: Controlling for population and per capita income, travel is significantly more intense to and from countries and industries that possess or use more know-how.
column2: 控制人口和人均收入变量，拥有或使用更多知识的国家和行业，商务旅行的密集程度显著更高。

column1: The countries that account for the most travel abroad, controlling for population, are all in Western Europe: Germany, Denmark, Belgium, Norway, and the Netherlands.
column2: 出国旅行量最大的国家（控制人口因素后）都在西欧：德国、丹麦、比利时、挪威和荷兰。

column1: Outside of Europe, the most travel-intensive countries are Canada, Israel, Singapore, and the United States, a reflection of the fact that they need to deploy many brains to make use of their diverse know-how.
column2: 在欧洲之外，旅行最密集的国家为加拿大、以色列、新加坡和美国，这反映了一个事实：它们需要部署许多大脑来让它们多样化的知识派上用场。

column1: Interestingly, countries in the developing world differ substantially in the amount of know-how they receive through business travel.
column2: 有趣的是，发展中国家通过商务旅行所获得的知识量大相径庭。

column1: For example, countries such as South Africa, Bulgaria, Morocco, and Mauritius receive much more know-how than countries at similar levels of development such as Peru, Colombia, Chile, Indonesia, or Sri Lanka.
column2: 比如，南非、保加利亚、摩洛哥和毛里求斯等国家所获得知识量远远多于发展水平相当的秘鲁、哥伦比亚、智利、印度尼西亚或斯里兰卡。

column1: The fact that firms incur the cost of business travel suggests that, for some key tasks, it is easier to move brains than it is to move the relevant information to the brains.
column2: 企业愿意承担商务旅行的成本，这一事实表明，对于一些关键性任务，移动大脑要比将相关信息传递给大脑更加容易。

column1: Moreover, the fact that business travel is growing faster than the global economy suggests that output is becoming more intensive in know-how and that know-how is diffusing through brain mobility.
column2: 此外，商务旅行比全球经济增长更快这一事实表明，产出的知识密集程度日益增加，而知识通过大脑的移动扩散。

column1: And, finally, the huge diversity of business travel intensity suggests that some countries are deploying or demanding much more know-how than others.
column2: 最后，商务旅行密集程度的巨大差异表明一些国家比其他国家部署或需求更多的知识。

column1: Rather than celebrate their thrift, countries that are out of the business travel loop should be worried.
column2: 位于商务旅行环路之外的国家不应该因为节俭而自豪，而应该感到担忧。

column1: They may be missing out on more than frequent flyer miles.
column2: 它们也许已经被更加频繁地飞来飞去的国家远远甩在了身后。

column1: Why Tuberculosis Persists
column2: 结核病为什么无法根除

column1: SAN FRANCISCO – It surprises many people in Europe and North America that tuberculosis (TB) remains one of the great scourges in human history.
