column1: CAMBRIDGE – At the start of 2013, the eurozone’s “fiscal compact” entered into force, owing to its ratification on December 21 by a 12th country, Finland, a year after German Chancellor Angela Merkel prodded eurozone leaders into agreement.
column2: 发自剑桥 — — 在德国总理安吉拉·默克尔（Angela Merkel）敦促欧元区各国领导人达成协议的一年之后，2012年12月21日 ， “ 财政契约”得到了欧元区第12个国家芬兰的批准，由此从2013年起，欧元区“财政契约”开始生效。

column1: The compact – technically called the Treaty on Stability, Coordination, and Governance in the Economic and Monetary Union – requires member countries to introduce laws limiting their structural government budget deficits to less than 0.5 % of GDP (or less than 1% of GDP if their debt/GDP ratio is “significantly below 60%”).
column2: 这份全称为《欧洲经济货币联盟稳定、协调与治理公约》的文件要求成员国制定法律限制政府结构性预算赤字不得高于GDP的0.5 % （ 如果该国的债务对GDP比率“显著低于60 % ” ，则为1 % ） 。

column1: So, will this new approach work?
column2: 那么这一新措施能起到作用吗？

column1: A limit on the “structural deficit” means that a country can run a deficit above the limit to the extent – and only to the extent – that the gap between revenue and spending is cyclical (that is, its economy is operating below potential due to temporary negative shocks).
column2: 对“结构性赤字”的限制意味着成员国可以 — — 也只可以 — — 在收入与支出之间的差距是周期性的范围内最大程度地存在财政赤字，所谓周期性是指一国经济在暂时的负面冲击下在低于其潜能的水平上运行。

column1: In other words, the target is cyclically adjusted.
column2: 换句话说，所设立目标是可以随周期性调整的。

column1: The budget-balance rule must be adopted in each country – preferably enshrined in their national constitutions – by the end of 2013.
column2: 在2013年结束之前，每个成员国都必须将预算平衡内容添加到其法律体系中 — — 最好是加入到本国宪法体系之中。

column1: The aim is to fix Europe’s long-term fiscal problem, which has been exacerbated by three factors: the failure, since the euro’s inception, of the eurozone-wide Stability and Growth Pact (SGP) to enforce deficit and debt limits; the crisis that erupted in Greece and other countries on the eurozone periphery in 2010; and the various bailouts that have followed.
column2: 此举的目的是为了解决欧洲的长期财政问题，且该财政问题已在以下三个因素的作用下加速恶化：自欧元诞生后覆盖欧元区的《稳定与增长公约》已经无法有效实施赤字与债务限制；2010年在希腊和一些欧元区外围国家爆发的经济危机；以及随后的各种救助行动。

column1: There is no reason to doubt that the member states will follow through and adopt national rules by the end of the year.
column2: 毫无疑问，在年底之前各成员国都会跟进并颁布实施相关国家规定。

column1: The problem is what comes after that: the risk that the fiscal compact will founder on precisely the same shoals as the SGP.
column2: 而问题在于随后发生的事情：财政契约的失败风险其实和《稳定与增长公约》是同样大的。

column1: Ever since the eurozone was established, its members have issued official fiscal forecasts that are systematically biased in the optimistic direction.
column2: 自从欧元区建立以来，其成员国发布了一系列普遍偏向乐观的官方财政预测。

column1: Other countries do this, too, but the bias among eurozone countries is, if anything, even worse than it is elsewhere.
column2: 当然其他国家也会如此，但如果说欧元区国家的预测有什么不同的话，那就是这种偏向实在是太离谱了。

column1: During an economic expansion, such as in the 2002-2007 period, governments are tempted to forecast that the boom will continue indefinitely.
column2: 在经济扩张期间，比如2002到2007年，各国政府都倾向于预测经济繁荣会无限期持续下去。

column1: Forecasts for tax revenue and budget surpluses are correspondingly optimistic and so hide the need for fiscal adjustment.
column2: 税收收入和预算盈余的预测都相对乐观，因而掩盖了财政调整的必要。

column1: During a recession, such as in 2008-2012, governments are tempted to forecast that their economies and budgets will soon rebound.
column2: 在衰退期间，比如2008到2012年，各国政府都倾向于预测本国经济和预算都会很快回升。

column1: Since forecasting is subject to so much genuine uncertainty, no one can prove that the forecasts are biased when they are made.
column2: 由于预测会受到很多不确定性因素的影响，在做预测时也没人能够证明那些预测有失偏颇。

column1: But, if forecasts are biased, fiscal rules will not constrain budget deficits.
column2: 但由于预测有失偏颇，财政规定就不会对预算赤字进行限制。

column1: In any given year, governments can forecast that their growth rates, tax revenues, and budget balances will improve in subsequent years, and then argue the following year that the shortfalls were unexpected.
column2: 在任何一年，政府都会预测本国增长率、税收收入及预算平衡将在未来几年有所上升，而在接下来的一年又会为自己辩护说那些不符合预期的差额是意外因素导致的。

column1: Indeed, in a new paper, co-authored with Jesse Schreger, we show that eurozone members’ bias in official forecasts can be neatly characterized as responding to the SGP’s 3%-of-GDP limit on budget deficits in 1999-2011: each time governments exceeded the limit, over-optimistic forecasts followed.
column2: 确实，在笔者与杰西·施雷格（Jesse Schreger）合作撰写的新报告中，我们提出欧元区成员国在官方预测上的偏向性整齐划一地表现为对《稳定与增长公约》中1999-2011年财政赤字低于GDP3%条款的回应：每当政府预算赤字超过限制，就会出台过度乐观的预测。

column1: In other words, governments adjust their forecasts, not their policies.
column2: 换句话说，各国政府调整的是其预测，而非政策。

column1: Framing the budget rules in cyclical terms, while highly desirable in terms of its macroeconomic impact, does not help to solve the problem of forecast bias.
column2: 而周期性地调整财政限制制度尽管在其对宏观经济的影响方面非常有利，却无助于解决财政预测偏差的问题。

column1: In fact, it can make the problem worse.
column2: 事实上，这只会让问题变得更严重。

column1: In a year when a forecast for the structural budget deficit turns out to have been over-optimistic, the government can still claim that its own calculations show the shortfall to have been cyclical rather than structural.
column2: 对结构性预算赤字的预测被证明过度乐观的一年，政府依然可以声称其内部计算显示差额的出现是周期性而非结构性的。

column1: After all, estimation of potential output – and hence the cyclical versus structural decomposition of the fiscal position – is notoriously difficult, even after the fact.
column2: 毕竟对潜在产出的估算 — — 从而对财政状况进行周期性或是结构性的解读 — — 是出了名的困难，即便是在事实之后计算也是如此。

column1: Perhaps it will help that, under the fiscal compact, the rules are to be adopted at the national level, as opposed to the SGP, which operated on the supranational level.
column2: 也许在财政契约实施的情况下，它会有助于这些规则在国家层面上被采纳，而不像《稳定与增长公约》在超国家的层面上运作。

column1: A look at the various rules and institutions that European countries have already tried shows that some work and others do not.
column2: 纵观欧洲国家已经尝试过的各种规则和机制我们就会知道，有些能起作用，有些则不能。

column1: Creating an independent fiscal institution that provides its own budget forecasts works, insofar as it reduces the bias in deficit projections.
column2: 创建一个能自行做出预算预测的独立财政机构是可行的，因为它减少了赤字预算的偏差。

column1: When forecasting while in violation of the eurozone’s Excessive Deficit Procedure, eurozone members with an independent budget-forecasting institution have a mean bias that is 2.7% of GDP smaller at the one-year horizon than members without such an institution.
column2: 当预测违反了欧元区的过度赤字程序机制时，拥有独立预算预测机构的欧元区成员国的一年期平均偏差比没有这类机构的成员国要小，且小于的幅度达到GDP的2.7 % 。

column1: It would be better still if governments were legally bound to use these independent forecasts in their budget plans (borrowing an innovation from Chile).
column2: 如果各国政府能立法要求在其预算计划中必须使用这些独立预测的话则更好（这是从智利借鉴来的创新 ） 。

column1: But, regardless of how well designed the rules are, clever and determined politicians can find ways around them.
column2: 但是，不管规则设计得多么巧妙，聪明而有决心的政治家都有办法绕过这些规则。

column1: One trick is privatization of government enterprises, which reduces the budget deficit in a given year on a one-time basis, but might increase the deficit in the long run if the enterprise had been profitable.
column2: 其中一个窍门就是把政府企业私有化，这就减少了某年的预算赤字 — — 当然只能使用一次，但如果这个企业是盈利的话这也许会增加政府的长期赤字。

column1: Another trick is to legislate tax cuts that are “temporary,” in order to make future revenues look larger, despite the intention to make the cuts permanent before they expire.
column2: 另一个窍门就是立法实施“暂时”的减税，这会使未来的收入看起来更多 — — 尽管其意图是维持减税直到该法律失效为止。

column1: Other things being equal, the right institutions can curbpro-cyclical fiscal policies – tax cuts and spending hikes during booms and austerity during downturns – in the short run, while helping to deliver debt sustainability in the long run.
column2: 在其他条件不变的情况下，好的机构可以在短期内遏制那些以周期性为幌子的财政政策 — — 经济繁荣时期减税并增加支出，经济低迷时期实施财政紧缩 — — 并在长期内有助于实现债务可持续性。

column1: These institutions include independent fiscal-forecasting agencies, combined with the cyclically adjusted budget targets that the eurozone’s fiscal compact mandates.
column2: 这些机构包括独立的财政预测机构，并与由欧元区财政契约授权的周期调整预算目标相结合。

column1: Much can go wrong even if such mechanisms are in place; but, as the history of the SGP illustrates, the risk is higher if they are not.
column2: 虽然即使具备这样的机制也很可能出错；但正如《稳定与增长公约》的历史表明的那样，如果没有这样的机制，出错的风险将会更高。

column1: Will Ex-Mexicans Choose America’s Next President?
column2: 墨西哥移民是否选择美国的下任总统？

column1: Among the many surprises during the Republican Party presidential candidates’ debates a couple of weeks ago was the rekindled importance of immigration.
column2: 几个星期前共和党总统侯选人辩论中出现的众多惊奇之一就是重新触及了移民的重要性。

column1: After the failure of President George W. Bush’s and Senator Edward Kennedy’s comprehensive immigration reform effort last spring, most observers thought the matter would remain dormant until 2009, since even touching it was potentially fatal for Democrats and Republicans alike.
column2: 去年秋天布什总统和肯尼迪参议员的全面移民改革失败以来，大多数观察家认为这一事情将会在2009年以前搁置起来，因为即使是触及此事也会对民主和共和两党是潜在致命的。

column1: But as Democrats discovered in other recent debates, and as Republicans realized with a little help from the CNN organizers, who skewed the questions toward issues they feel strongly about, immigration is an issue that just won’t go away.
column2: 但是正如民主党人在最近的辩论中所发现的以及共和党人在有线电视新闻网组织者帮助下认识到的那样，移民问题是一个挥之不去的问题。 这些电视台组织者拼命对那些他们有强烈感觉的问题提出问题。

column1: This is one reason why I wrote a short but – I hope – useful book on Mexican immigration to the United States, entitled Ex-Mex: From Migrants to Immigrants .
column2: 这就是为什么我写一本短小但是希望是有用的有关墨西哥人移民美国的书。 这本书的名字叫<<原墨西哥人：从移居者到移民>>。

column1: Based on internal documents from the Mexican and US governments, countless interviews, and a survey of much of the existing literature on the subject, Ex-Mex seeks to fulfill three purposes.
column2: 这本书力图根据墨西哥和美国两国政府的内部文件、数不清的采访以及对这一问题现有的文献调查来达到三个目的。

column1: First, I wanted to provide a Mexican voice in the immigration debate.
column2: 第一，我想要在移民问题辩论中提出墨西哥的声音。

column1: Mexicans make up more than half of the flow and stock – legal or not – of all immigrants in the US, but a point of view attempting to reflect their interests and aspirations has been largely absent from the American discussion.
column2: 墨西哥人在美国的所有合法或非法移民移动和总量上占据一半以上，但是在美国人的辩论中却基本上一直没有试图反映墨西哥人利益以及渴求的观点。

column1: Of course, my book cannot be the Mexican stance.
column2: 当然，我的书并不能成为墨西哥的立场。

column1: But an assessment from the vantage point of past, current, and future Mexican immigrants to the US is a necessary component of the American debate – all the more so when one recalls that immigration has, in fact, not generally been exclusively a domestic US policy question.
column2: 但是分析过去、现在以及将来墨西哥到美国的移民的观点却是美国人辩论的一个必要的组成部分。 实际上，如果人们记得移民一直并不是单纯的美国国内政策问题，这一点就更为如此了。

column1: The first American immigration agreement with another country was signed in 1907 – the so-called Gentleman’s Agreement with Japan, while the US and Mexico negotiated and administered the Bracero Program for more than twenty years, from 1942 thru 1964.
column2: 美国与外国签订的第一个移民协议是在1907年，也就是与日本签订的所谓君子协定。 从1942年到1964年，美国和墨西哥在二十多年的时间里谈判并执行了短工项目。

column1: And, of course, the US has had a standing immigration agreement since 1965 with a country most Americans would not imagine: Fidel Castro’s Cuba.
column2: 当然，美国自1965年以来与一个大多数美国人难以想像的国家即卡斯特罗统治下的古巴一直保持一项移民协议。

column1: Second, it is important to place the current, raging debate in historical context.
column2: 第二，把当前情绪化的辩论放置在历史的角度非常重要。

column1: The most important feature of that context is that the actual flow of Mexicans entering the US today is not much greater than the overall average figure for the Bracero Program period: around 400,000 per year.
column2: 最为重要的特点就是今天实际进入美国的墨西哥人数量远远大于短工项目期间的总体平均数量，也就是每年40万人左右。

column1: It is similarly important to understand the evolution of US legislation on immigration since the 1920’s, and the shifts and hypocrisy involved in the application of those laws.
column2: 同样重要的是理解自二十世纪二十年代以来美国移民立法上的变迁以及在执行这些法律上的变化和伪善。

column1: For example, the 1996 immigration reforms implemented by the Clinton administration, along with other, underlying structural trends, halted the traditional circular pattern whereby Mexicans came and went to the US every year.
column2: 例如，由克林顿政府在1996年实行的移民改革与其他基本的结构性趋势一样停止了墨西哥人传统上每年往返美国的循环模式。

column1: Instead, they began to settle in communities farther from the border, greatly increasing the stock of Mexicans in the US.
column2: 相反，他们开始远离边界社区，从而大幅度增加了美国的墨西哥人数量。

column1: Finally, the efforts of the Mexican and US governments since 2001 to reach an accommodation on the issue have not been well understood.
column2: 最后，人们还没有很好地理解墨西哥和美国两国政府自2001年以来试图达成移民问题的努力。

column1: Confidential papers from the Bush and Fox administrations show that talks went further than previously known.
column2: 布什政府和福克斯政府的机密文件显示，会谈进行的要比原来知道的要深入。

column1: The US, and particularly then-Secretary of State Colin Powell, was willing, as stated in a unclassified memo addressed to Bush in late August 2001, to go to great lengths to reach an understanding with Mexico on the issue.
column2: 根据2001年8月底向布什提交的一份解密的备忘录所称，美国政府特别是国务卿鲍威尔愿意尽力与墨西哥在这一问题上达成谅解。

column1: Indeed, the substance of the negotiations was not much different from the content of the Bush-Kennedy “grand bargain” that was fashioned in 2007.
column2: 实际上，谈判的实质内容与布什肯尼迪在2007年提出的“大赦”并没有多大区别。

column1: The electoral numbers perhaps best explain the immigration equation’s importance in today’s presidential campaigns.
column2: 选民数量可能最好解释当今总统竞选中移民问题的重要性。

column1: In 2008, it is likely that Latinos will make up 9% to 10% of the electorate, the highest share ever.
column2: 在2008年，拉美族裔人口有可能占据选举人口的9%到10 % ， 这是有史以来最高的。

column1: They will wield decisive importance in swing states like Colorado, New Mexico, Florida, and Nevada.
column2: 他们将会在科罗拉多、新墨西哥、佛罗里达以及内华达等摇摆不定的州发��决定性的作用。

column1: Having made significant inroads among Hispanic voters in 2000 and 2004, thanks to Bush’s support for immigration reform, Republicans now can barely count on 20% of that total – mainly among Cuban-Americans – thanks to their strident anti-immigration stance.
column2: 由于布什支持移民改革，共和党在2000年和2004年在拉美选民中取得重大进步。 由于共和党人强硬的反移民立场，他们现在只能指望这一总数的20 % ， 主要是在古巴美国人中。

column1: Thus, if the Democrats demonstrate a minimum of compassion, sensitivity, and realism, they can count on a 7% advantage in the popular vote.
column2: 这样，如果民主党表现出最低程度的同情、敏感以及现实主义，那么他们就可以在全民投票中得到7%的优势。

column1: But doing so could cost Democrats dearly in old industrial states like Pennsylvania, Ohio, and Michigan, where the arrival of Mexican migrants, transformed into immigrants, has stoked passions.
column2: 但是这样做有可能在宾夕法尼亚、俄亥俄以及密西根等老的工业州让民主党付出代价。 在那些地方，墨西哥的移居者转变成为移民燃起了热情。

column1: Since the Democrats’ victory will most likely depend on these states, the Democratic candidate who can square this circle, or the Republican who can break it, may well win the presidency.
column2: 由于民主党的胜利最需要依靠这些州，那些能够在移民问题上获得成功的民主党人或者打破这一问题包围的共和党人就有可能赢得总统大选胜利。

column1: Will Global Imbalances Return?
column2: 全球失衡会重现吗？

column1: BEIJING – Future history books, depending on where they are written, will take one of two approaches to assigning blame for the world’s current financial and economic crisis.
column2: 北京－未来的历史书籍，由于写作地点的不同，会采用下述两种方式中的一种，来归咎当前世界金融和经济危机的责任。

column1: One approach will blame lax regulation, accommodating monetary policy, and inadequate savings in the United States. The other, already being pushed by former and current US officials like Alan Greenspan and Ben Bernanke, will blame the immense pool of liquidity generated by high-savings countries in East Asia and the Middle East.
column2: 历史书籍两种归责方式中的一种，会将当前的金融和经济危机归咎于美国松懈的监管、没有原则的货币政策以及储蓄不足；另一种 — — 像格林·斯潘和本·伯南克这样的前任美联储官员和现任美联储官员已经强调了这种方式，会将当前的金融和经济危机归咎于东亚和中东的高储蓄国家制造的巨大流动性。

column1: All that liquidity, they will argue, had to go somewhere. Its logical destination was the country with the deepest financial markets, the US, where it raised asset prices to unsustainable heights.
column2: 他们认为，所有这些流动性都去了某个地方，其合理的目的地就是拥有最复杂的金融市场的美国，并且在进入美国之后将美国的资产价格抬升到了无法持续的高度。

column1: Note the one thing on which members of both camps agree: the global savings imbalance – low savings in the US and high savings in China and other emerging markets – played a key role in the crisis by allowing Americans to live beyond their means.
column2: 请注意，上述两个阵营的人对这个观点达成了共识：即全球储蓄失衡 — — 美国的低储蓄和中国及其他新兴市场的高储蓄 — — 使美国人过上一种本身无法承受的生活，这对经济危机的发生起到了关键作用。

column1: It encouraged financiers desperate to earn a return on abundant funds to put them to more speculative use.
column2: 这种全球储蓄失衡，促使金融家为了获得收益，不顾一切地将大量资金投入到越来越具有投机性的用途中去。

column1: If there is a consensus on one issue, it is the impossibility of understanding the bubble and the crash without considering the role of global imbalances.
column2: 如果说人们已经在某个问题上达成了共识的话，这个问题就是，如果不考虑全球失衡的作用，要想理解资产泡沫和经济危机是不可能的。

column1: Preventing future crises similar to this one therefore requires resolving the problem of global imbalances.
column2: 因此，要预防将来发生类似的经济危机，我们就要解决全球失衡的问题。

column1: Here, the early signs are reassuring.
column2: 在这里，事情发展的初步迹象是令人欣慰的。

column1: American households are saving again.
column2: 美国家庭再次开始储蓄了。

column1: The US trade deficit has declined from $60 billion a month to just $26 billion, according to the most recent data.
column2: 根据最新的数据，美国的贸易逆差已经从每月600亿美元下降到每月只有260亿美元了。

column1: As a matter of simple arithmetic, we know that the rest of the world is running correspondingly smaller surpluses.
column2: 只要我们进行一个简单的算术运算，就知道世界其他地区的贸易顺差相应地减少了。

column1: But once American households rebuild their retirement accounts, they may return to their profligate ways.
column2: 但是，一旦美国家庭重新充实了他们的退休账户，他们就有可能回到挥霍的老路上去。

column1: Indeed, the Obama administration and the Federal Reserve are doing all they can to pump up US spending.
column2: 事实上，奥巴马政府和美联储都在竭尽所能地提振美国消费。

column1: The only reason the US trade deficit is falling is that the country remains in a severe recession, causing US imports and exports to collapse in parallel.
column2: 美国贸易逆差减少的唯一原因是美国仍然处在严重的衰退之中，而衰退又导致美国的出口和进口同时减少。

column1: With recovery, both may recover to previous levels, and the 6%-of-GDP US external deficit will be back.
column2: 随着经济的复苏，美国的出口和进口都有可能恢复到以前的水平，占美国GDP6％的国际收支赤字会再次出现。

column1: In fact, there has been no change in relative prices or depreciation of the US dollar of a magnitude that would augur a permanent shift in trade and spending patterns.
column2: 事实上，美元相对价格的变化，或者是美元的贬值，都没有达到足以预示国际贸易和消费模式会发生永久性转变的程度。

column1: Whether there is a permanent reduction in global imbalances will depend mainly on decisions taken outside the US, specifically in countries like China.
column2: 全球失衡是否会有永久性的减少主要取决于美国之外的国家的决策，具体来说，就是像中国这样的国家的决策。

column1: One’s forecast of those decisions hinges, in turn, on why these other countries came to run such large surpluses in the first place.
column2: 反过来，人们要预测这些国家会作出什么决策，其关键在于首先要知道，这些国家为什么要保持这么巨额的贸易顺差。

column1: One view is that their surpluses were a corollary of the policies favoring export-led growth that worked so well for so long. China’s leaders are understandably reluctant to abandon a tried-and-true model.
column2: 一种观点认为，这些��家的顺差是长期以来运行良好的鼓励以出口为导向的经济增长模式的政策的必然结果。 中国的领导人不愿意放弃一个经过检验的模式，是可以理解的。

column1: They can’t restructure their economy instantaneously.
column2: 他们不能瞬间改变中国的经济结构。

column1: They can’t move workers from painting children’s toys in Guangdong to building schools in Western China overnight.
column2: 他们也无法在一夜之间，将在广东给儿童玩具上色的工人转移到中国西部建造学校。

column1: They need time to build a social safety net capable of encouraging Chinese households to reduce their precautionary saving.
column2: 他们需要时间来建立一个能够鼓励中国家庭减少预防性储蓄的社会保障网络。

column1: If this view is correct, we can expect to see global imbalances re-emerge once the recession is over and to unwind only slowly thereafter.
column2: 如果这种观点是正确的，我们就可以预期，一旦经济衰退结束，我们又会看到全球失衡再次出现，而且此后只能慢慢调整这种失衡。

column1: The other view is that China contributed to global imbalances not through its merchandise exports, but through its capital exports.
column2: 另一种观点认为，中国不是通过其商品出口造成了全球失衡，而是通过其资本输出造成了全球失衡。

column1: What China lacked was not demand for consumption goods, but a supply of high-quality financial assets.
column2: 中国缺乏的不是对消费品的需求，而是对高质量的金融资产的供应。

column1: It found these in the US, mainly in the form Treasury and other government-backed securities, in turn pushing other investors into more speculative investments.
column2: 中国在美国找到了自己缺乏的高质量的金融资产 — — 这些金融资产主要表现为美国国债和其他政府证券，而这又促使其他投资者进行更为投机的投资活动。

column1: Recent events have not enhanced the stature of the US as a supplier of high-quality assets.
column2: 最近的经济危机并没有提升美国作为高质量的金融资产提供者的形象。

column1: And China, for its part, will continue to develop its financial markets and its capacity to generate high-quality financial assets internally.
column2: 而在中国方面，中国会继续发展其金融市场以及提供高质量的国内金融资产的能力。

column1: But doing so will take time. Meanwhile, the US still has the most liquid financial markets in the world.
column2: 但是，中国要实现这一点需要时间，同时，美国仍然拥有世界上流动性最好的金融市场。

column1: This interpretation again implies the re-emergence of global imbalances once the recession ends, and their very gradual unwinding thereafter.
column2: 这样的阐释再次暗含着，一旦经济衰退结束，全球失衡就会重现，在此之后对其的调整也很漫长。

column1: One development that could change this forecast is if China comes to view investing in US financial assets as a money-losing proposition.
column2: 有一种变化能够改变这种预期，即中国认为投资美国金融资产是一个赔钱的买卖。

column1: US budget deficits as far as the eye can see might excite fear of losses on US Treasury bonds.
column2: 就目前而言，美国的预算赤字可能会引起中国对投资美国国债亏损的担忧。

column1: A de facto policy of inflating away the debt might stoke such fears further.
column2: 美国事实上的通过通货膨胀抵消债务的政策，会进一步强化中国的这种恐惧。

column1: At that point, China would pull the plug, the dollar would crash, and the Fed would be forced to raise interest rates, plunging the US back into recession.
column2: 届时，中国就会撤出投资，美元就会崩溃，美联储就可能被迫提高利率，进而使美国经济再次陷入衰退。

column1: There are two hopes for avoiding this disastrous outcome.
column2: 对避免这种灾难性的后果，存在两个希望。

column1: One is relying on Chinese goodwill to stabilize the US and world economies. The other is for the Obama administration and the Fed to provide details about how they will eliminate the budget deficit and avoid inflation once the recession ends.
column2: 一个希望是希望中国具有稳定美国和世界经济的善意，另一个是希望奥巴马政府和美联储提供有关一旦经济衰退结束，他们会怎样消除预算赤字并避免通货膨胀的详情。

column1: The second option is clearly preferable.
column2: 显然，第二种选择更可取。

column1: After all, it is always better to control one’s own fate.
column2: 毕竟，掌握自己的命运总是比依靠别人要好。

column1: Will Governmental Folly Now Allow for a Cyber Crisis?
column2: 政府的愚蠢能否立即导致一场网络危机？

column1: CAMBRIDGE – When the financial crisis of 2008 hit, many shocked critics asked why markets, regulators, and financial experts failed to see it coming.
column2: 剑桥 — — 2008年金融危机来袭时，很多大吃一惊的批评家们质问为什么市场、监管机构和金融专家未能预见到这场危机。

column1: Today, one might ask the same question about the global economy’s vulnerability to cyber-attack.
column2: 今天，人们或许会对全球经济面对网络攻击时的脆弱性提出同样的问题。

column1: Indeed, the parallels between financial crises and the threat of cyber meltdowns are striking.
column2: 其实，金融危机和网络崩溃这两种威胁之间惊人的相似。

column1: Although the greatest cyber threat comes from rogue states with the capacity to develop extremely sophisticated computer viruses, risks can also come from anarchistic hackers and terrorists, or even from computer glitches compounded by natural catastrophe.
column2: 虽然最大的网络威胁来源于有能力研发复杂计算机病毒的流氓国家，但风险也同样来自于信奉无政府主义的黑客和恐怖分子，甚至可能来自于因自然灾害而加剧的电脑故障。

column1: A few security experts have voiced great alarm, including, most recently, Jonathan Evans, the head of the British Security Service (MI5).
column2: 不止一位安全专家都发出了严正警告，包括不久前英国安全局（军情五处）的负责人乔纳森·埃文斯。

column1: By and large, however, few leaders are willing to compromise growth in the tech sector or the Internet in any significant way in the name of a threat that is so amorphous.
column2: 但总的来讲，很少有领导人愿意因为这样一种难以名状的威胁而明显放缓科技领域或互联网的发展速度。

column1: Instead, they prefer to establish relatively innocuous working groups and task forces.
column2: 反之，他们更愿意组建相对无伤大雅的特遣队和工作组。

column1: It is difficult to overstate the dependence of modern economies on large-scale computer systems.
column2: 人类几乎不可能夸大现代经济对大型计算机系统的依赖程度。

column1: But imagine if one day a host of key communications satellites were incapacitated, or the databases of major financial systems were erased.
column2: 但想象一下如果哪天某台管理关键通信卫星的主机瘫痪无法工作，或者主要金融系统中的数据库遭到删除。

column1: Experts have long identified the electricity grid as the most acute vulnerability, since any modern economy would collapse without power.
column2: 电网早就被专家认定为最严重的漏洞，因为一旦供电被切断，任何现代经济都会陷入崩溃。

column1: True, many skeptics argue that with reasonable low-cost prophylactic measures, large scale cyber-meltdowns are highly implausible, and that doom-mongers overstate the worst-case scenarios.
column2: 当然，很多怀疑论者提出只要采取低成本的合理预防措施，大规模网络崩溃的可能性非常之低，末日论者夸大了可能出现最坏情况。

column1: They say that the ability of cyber-terrorists and blackmailers to take the global economy to the brink, as in the 2007 Bruce Willis movie Die Hard 4, is utterly fictional.
column2: 他们表示网络恐怖分子和恐吓勒索者再现2007年布鲁斯·威利斯电影《虎胆龙威4》中的恐怖一幕，将全球经济推向崩溃边缘的能力完全是虚构的。

column1: It is difficult to judge who is right, and there are important experts on both sides of the debate.
column2: 辩论的正反两方都有重量级的专家，很难判断哪一方的观点更加贴近事实。

column1: But there do seem to be an uncomfortable number of similarities between the political economy of cyberspace regulation and of financial regulation.
column2: 但是，网络空间监管和金融监管的政治经济之间的确存在着令人不安的相似之处。

column1: First, both cyber-security and financial stability are extremely complex topics with which government regulators can hardly keep up.
column2: 首先，网络安全和金融稳定都是极为复杂的课题，政府监管部门想要完全跟上它们的发展有些力不从心。

column1: Industry remuneration for experts is far in excess of any public-sector salary, and the best minds are continually bid away.
column2: 从业专家的报酬远远超过任何公共部门的工资，而顶尖的人才不断地被吸引过去。

column1: As a result, some argue that the only solution is reliance on self-regulation by the software industry.
column2: 因此有人认为，唯一的办法是依赖软件业的自我调节机制。

column1: One hears this argument for many modern industries, from big food to big pharma to big finance.
column2: 人们在许多现代工业中都��听到这种说法，从大型食品到大型制药再到大型金融公司。

column1: Second, like the financial sector, the tech industry is enormously influential politically through contributions and lobbying.
column2: 其次，像金融业一样，高科技行业通过捐款和游说拥有了巨大的政治影响力。

column1: In the United States, all presidential candidates must make pilgrimages to Silicon Valley and other tech centers to raise money.
column2: 美国的所有总统候选人必须到硅谷和其他高科技中心去朝圣筹资。

column1: Excessive financial-sector influence was, of course, a root cause of the 2008 meltdown and remains deeply implicated in today’s continuing eurozone mess.
column2: 金融部门影响过大无疑是2008年危机的根本原因，而且在今天的欧元区乱象中仍然脱不了干系。

column1: Third, with slowing growth in advanced economies, information technology seems to hold the moral high ground, just as finance did until five years ago.
column2: 第三，随着先进经济体增长放缓，就像五年前的金融业那样，道德的制高点似乎被信息业所占据。

column1: And crude attempts by governments to enforce regulation are likely to prove ineffective in protecting against catastrophe, while all too effective in strangling growth.
column2: 事实证明政府执行监管的粗暴尝试可能无法防止灾难的发生，但在扼杀经济增长方面却收效显著。

column1: In both cases – financial stability and cyber security – the risk of contagion creates a situation in which a wedge can form between private incentives and social risks.
column2: 在金融稳定和网络安全两大课题下，蔓延的危险造成了私人激励和社会风险机制的分离。

column1: Admittedly, progress in the technology sector overall often produces huge social-welfare gains, which arguably outstrip those produced by all other sectors in recent decades.
column2: 诚然，技术领域的总体进展往往能产生巨大的社会福利效益，这种效益甚至可能超过近几十年来所有其他行业的总和。

column1: But, just as with nuclear power plants, progress can go awry in the absence of good regulation.
column2: 但正如核电厂一样，缺乏良好的监管可能导致在进展的过程中出现差错。

column1: Finally, the greatest risks come from arrogance and ignorance, two human characteristics at the heart of most financial crises.
column2: 最后，最大的风险来自于傲慢和无知，这两种人性的弱点一直处在多数金融危机的核心位置。

column1: Recent revelations about the super-viruses “Stuxnet” and “Flame” are particularly disconcerting.
column2: 最近关于超级病毒Stuxnet和火焰（Flame）的披露尤其令人不安。

column1: These viruses, apparently developed by the US and Israel to disrupt Iran’s nuclear program, embody a level of sophistication far beyond anything previously seen.
column2: 这些病毒似乎由美国和以色列研发用于破坏伊朗的核计划，体现出远超之前记录的先进水平。

column1: Both are deeply encrypted and difficult to detect once inside a computer.
column2: 这两种病毒均经过深度加密，一旦输入计算机就很难被发现。

column1: The Flame virus has the capacity to take over a computer’s peripherals, record Skype conversations, take pictures through a computer’s camera, and transmit information via Bluetooth to any nearby device.
column2: 火焰病毒能够接管计算机的外围设备、Skype通话记录、借助电脑摄像头拍照，并通过蓝牙设备向任何邻近设备传输信息。

column1: If the world’s most sophisticated governments are developing computer viruses, what guarantee is there that something won’t go awry?
column2: 如果世界上最先进的政府都在研制计算机病毒，那么还有什么能够保证不会出现差错？

column1: How can we be sure that they won’t “escape” and infect a much broader class of systems, or be adopted for other uses, or that future rogue states or terrorists won’t find a way to turn them on their creators?
column2: 我们怎能肯定它们不会“泄露”并感染更大范围的系统，或者被转作其他用途，再或者未来的无赖国家或恐怖分子不会利用它们反过来攻击它们的创造者？

column1: No economy is more vulnerable than the US, and it is arrogance to believe that US cyber superiority (to all except perhaps China) provides it with impenetrable security from attack.
column2: 没有哪国经济比美国更加脆弱，认为美国（对除中国之外所有国家）的网络优势在攻击面前坚不可摧仅仅是傲慢而已。

column1: Unfortunately the solution is not so simple as just building better anti-virus programs.
column2: 不幸的是，解决办法不是编写更好的防病毒程序那么简单。

column1: Virus protection and virus development constitute an uneven arms race.
column2: 病毒防护和病毒开发构成了一场不平衡的军备竞赛。

column1: A virus can be just a couple hundred lines of computer code, compared to hundreds of thousands of lines for anti-virus programs, which must be designed to detect wide classes of enemies.
column2: 病毒可能仅仅是几百行计算机代码，但防毒程序的长度却至少成千上万，因为防毒程序的设计必须能够发现各式各样的敌人。

column1: We are told not to worry about large-scale cyber meltdowns, because none has occurred, and governments are being vigilant.
column2: 我们被告知不用担心大规模的网络崩溃，因为政府会时刻保持警惕，而且这样的网络崩溃还从未发生过。

column1: Unfortunately, another lesson of the financial crisis is that most politicians are congenitally incapable of making difficult choices until risks actually materialize.
column2: 不幸的是金融危机的另一个教训是，多数政客命中注定无法在风险实际兑现前作出艰难的抉择。

column1: Let us hope that we are lucky for a while longer.
column2: 我们只能希望能够幸运更长一段时间。

column1: Will Hamas Win the Peace?
column2: 哈马斯会赢得和平吗？

column1: WASHINGTON, DC –For generations to come, the Palestinians will remember the horrific war in Gaza with pain and bitterness.
column2: 华盛顿特区－接下来的几代巴勒斯坦人都会充满痛苦地记住可怕的加沙战争。

column1: But what cannot yet be seen is how Palestinians will view Hamas.
column2: 但是，巴勒斯坦人会怎样看待哈马斯，仍然有待观察。

column1: Whether Hamas can claim a victory – and whether Palestinians will believe them will be determined by the type of ceasefire that is eventually agreed, if a formal one is eventually agreed.
column2: 哈马斯是否能获胜，以及巴勒斯坦人是否信任他们要取决于最终达成的停火的种类 — — 如果最终达成了正式停火协议的话。

column1: The end game – for both Israel and Hamas – is thus crucially important.
column2: 因此，对以色列和哈马斯来说，战争的结局都是至关重要的。

column1: For the moment, Hamas is perceived by the majority of Palestinians as the victim of a war intended to gain its surrender.
column2: 当前，大多数巴勒斯坦人将哈马斯看作是一场为了使哈马斯投降的战争的受害者。

column1: After all, Hamas was democratically elected, but was forbidden from ruling and besieged in Gaza.
column2: 毕竟，哈马斯是民主当选的，但是，却被禁止在加沙进行统治，而且还被包围。

column1: At the same time, Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas is accused of siding with Israel in order to restore his lost authority in Gaza.
column2: 同时，许多巴勒斯坦人指责巴勒斯坦民族权力机构主席穆罕默德·阿巴斯为了恢复其在加沙失去的威信，而支持以色列。

column1: The war exposed flaws in Hamas’ judgment.
column2: 这次战争暴露了哈马斯判断的失误。

column1: Hamas apparently did not envision a full-scale confrontation with Israel when it refused to renew a six-month truce.
column2: 当哈马斯拒绝续订六个月的休战协定时，它显然没有预想到会和以色列进行全面的对抗。

column1: With Gaza suffering under a lengthy siege, Hamas leader Khalid Mashal said that there was no point in a new truce, since the old one had “failed to lift the siege on Gaza.”
column2: 在加沙遭到长时间的封锁时，哈马斯领导人卡里德·马舍尔（Khalid Mashal）声称，因为老停火协议“没能解除对加沙的封锁 ” ， 所以没有订立新停火协议的必要。

column1: Other leaders were quoted as saying that Hamas would “lift the siege by force.”
column2: 根据有人援引的哈马斯其他领导人的说法，哈马斯会“使用武力解除封锁 ” 。

column1: If Hamas is to survive the war, it must demonstrate that its resistance resulted in a permanent opening of Gaza’s border crossings, especially in Rafah.
column2: 如果哈马斯要在此次战争中幸存下来，它必须证明其抵抗在加沙边境地带，特别是在拉法（Rafah ） ， 形成了一个永久性的通路。

column1: For Palestinians, these are signs of victory.
column2: 对巴勒斯坦人来说，这些都是成功的标志。

column1: With open borders, Hamas would secure its regime in Gaza and build its popularity in the West Bank, putting enormous pressure on Abbas, the leader of the rival Fatah movement, to accept a national unity government on terms set by Hamas.
column2: 随着边境的开放，哈马斯会巩固其在加沙的政权并建立其在约旦河西岸的声望，这会对竞争对手法塔赫运动的领导人阿巴斯形成巨大的压力，迫使其接受按照哈马斯确定的条件组成的全国统一政府。

column1: Members of Fatah’s Central Committee are already accusing Abbas of supporting Israel in the fighting, of wanting to “return to Gaza on an Israeli tank.”
column2: 法塔赫中央委员会的成员已经开始指责阿巴斯在本次战争中支持以色列，想“坐在以色列的坦克上返回加沙 ” 。

column1: Radical groups within Fatah are leaning toward an open alliance with Hamas.
column2: 法塔赫内部的激进团体，也想要和哈马斯公开结盟。

column1: If Hamas comes out ahead, Abbas’s allies in other Palestinian factions will press him to accept Hamas and Islamic Jihad within the PLO.
column2: 如果哈马斯提前发表观点，阿巴斯在其他巴勒斯坦派别中的盟友就会向其施加压力，迫使其在巴勒斯坦解放组织内部接受哈马斯和伊斯兰圣战组织。

column1: Egypt will have to backtrack on its rejection of Hamas in order to recover its image among the Arabs and to reduce tensions within Egyptian society.
column2: 埃及也将不得不为了恢复其在阿拉伯人中的形象和缓解埃及社会内部的紧张状态而放弃对哈马斯的抵制。

column1: Pressure to integrate Hamas into Palestinian politics is also likely in some European capitals, particularly Paris and London, where some expressed opposition to isolating Hamas even before the war.
column2: 有些欧洲国家的政府，特别是巴黎和伦敦，也可能存在将哈马斯纳入巴勒斯坦政治的压力 — — 在巴黎和伦敦，有人甚至在战争爆发前就表示反对孤立哈马斯。

column1: But if Israel forces Hamas to accept its conditions for border controls and a formal ceasefire, Hamas’s image as the guardian of Palestinian resistance will be severely damaged.
column2: 但是，如果以色列迫使哈马斯接受其边境控制和正式停火的条件，哈马斯作为巴勒斯坦抵抗运动守护人的形象就会遭到严重的破坏。

column1: Palestinians will ask if it was really necessary to fight this war and pay such a high price.
column2: 巴勒斯坦人就会怀疑，是否真的有必要进行这场战争并付出如此高昂的代价。

column1: Abbas will be able to argue that he advised Hamas to renew the truce and to end its missile fire on Israeli towns, but that Hamas insisted on exposing Palestinian civilians to devastation.
column2: 阿巴斯就可以声称，他已经建议哈马斯续订停火协议并结束对以色列城镇的导弹袭击，但是，哈马斯却坚持使巴勒斯坦平民遭受战争的荼毒。

column1: One indicator to watch for: the length of that ceasefire.
column2: 对此次战争要关注的一个指标是：停火时间的长短。

column1: Palestinians will recognize Hamas’s acceptance of a multi-year truce with Israel as a sign of defeat, which would also underscore Palestinian feelings of humiliation and abandonment.
column2: 巴勒斯坦人会将哈马斯接受与以色列达成为期几年的停火协议视为哈马斯战败的标志，而这也会增强巴勒斯坦人遭到羞辱和被抛弃了的感觉。

column1: Hezbollah, despite its rhetoric, has taken no steps to support Hamas, and the Arab states seemed more than willing to support its defeat.
column2: 尽管发表了种种言论，但是真主党却没有采取措施支持哈马斯，而且，阿拉伯国家似乎非常乐意看到哈马斯失败。

column1: It is in rebuilding Gaza that the stakes of the competition will increase.
column2: 哈马斯和阿巴斯竞争的厉害关系，在加沙战后重建中会增加。

column1: Abbas, supported by the United States and the European Union, may have control over significant funding.
column2: 得到美国和欧盟支持的阿巴斯，可能对大量的资金有控制权。

column1: The test for him will be to deliver quickly.
column2: 对阿巴斯的考验是快速分配资金进行重建。

column1: Hamas will also have resources for reconstruction.
column2: 哈马斯也有进行重建的资源。

column1: Qatar, a Hamas supporter, has already announced an investment fund for Gaza and contributed $250 million.
column2: 支持哈马斯的卡塔尔，已经宣布建立一个加沙投资基金，并且捐助了2.5亿美元。

column1: Hamas will have to make a convincing case that Gaza’s near destruction is a price that had to be paid.
column2: 哈马斯必须提供有说服力的实例，来证明加沙的近乎毁灭是一个必须付出的代价。

column1: Many Palestinians believe that Israel inflicted this damage on Gaza to drive a wedge between the people and the “resistance.”
column2: 许多巴勒斯坦人认为，以色列对加沙造成这样的破坏是为了分化巴勒斯坦人民和“抵抗运动 ” 。

column1: There is a precedent for this argument: Hezbollah described the destruction of Beirut’s southern suburbs in exactly these terms at the end of the Lebanon War in July 2006.
column2: 这样的观点有一个先例可考：在2006年6月份黎巴嫩战争结束的时候，真主党将贝鲁特南部郊区遭到破坏，正是用这样的语言加以解释的。

column1: More importantly, Hamas can demonstrate that its leaders have been on the front lines during this war, sharing Palestinian suffering; many have been killed, along with their families.
column2: 更重要的是，哈马斯可以证明在此次战争中，其领导人到战争前线参加战斗，分担巴勒斯坦人的痛苦；许多哈马斯成员和他们的家人一起牺牲了。

column1: The biggest question is whether the war will alter Hamas’ political goals.
column2: 最大的问题是，此次战争是否会改变哈马斯的政治目标。

column1: Two weeks ago, Musa Abu Marzouk, a senior Hamas official, praised Jimmy Carter in The Los Angeles Times as the only American president who had brought true peace in the Middle East.
column2: 两个星期前，哈马斯高级官员穆萨·阿卜·马祖卡（Musa Abu Marzouk）在《洛杉矶时报》上称赞吉米·卡特是给中东带来真正和平的唯一一位美国总统。

column1: This is a radical departure from Hamas rhetoric, which has always portrayed the Camp David agreement between Israel and Egypt as a betrayal of the Islamic world.
column2: 这和哈马斯总是将以色列和埃及签订的戴维营协议描绘成为对伊斯兰世界的背叛的观点，有巨大的差异。

column1: It remains to be seen whether Abu Marzouk’s view is merely a tactic intended to encourage the Obama administration to reach out to Hamas, or whether the war convinced Hamas that the two-state solution is the only viable option to settle the conflict with Israel.
column2: 阿卜·马祖卡（Musa Abu Marzouk）的观点是否只是一个为了刺激奥巴马政府接近哈马斯的策略，或者战争是否使哈马斯认识到两国共存方案是解决与以色列冲突的唯一可行选择，还有待观察。

column1: The Framing of MH-17
column2: MH-17事件的框架

column1: PHILADELPHIA – US President Barack Obama called the downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 an “outrage of unspeakable proportions,” whereas Russian President Vladimir Putin termed it an “accident” and a “terrible tragedy.”
column2: 费城 — — 美国总统奥巴马称马航17航班被击落所引发的“愤怒难以言表 ” ， 而俄罗斯总统普京则用“意外”和“可怕的悲剧”来形容。

column1: Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko branded it an “act of terrorism,” and Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak called it an “inhumane, uncivilized, violent, and irresponsible act.”
column2: 乌克兰总统波罗申科称之为一次“恐怖事件 ” ， 而马来西亚总理纳吉布·拉扎克则称上述行为“反人道、反文明、暴力且不负责任 。 ”

column1: All of these descriptions may be accurate, but each carries different rhetorical weight and legal implications.
column2: 上述所有说法可能都有道理，但其修辞重点和法律内涵则各有不同。

column1: The time has come for governments and international organizations to call the attack on MH17 a probable war crime.
column2: 政府和国际组织是时候将MH17遇袭事件定性为潜在的战争罪行。

column1: This rhetorical shift is needed, first and foremost, because framing the moral reprehensibility of this despicable act within a common language will help to align public perceptions of it.
column2: 这种说法上的转变很有必要，因为用所有人都听得懂的语言指出这种卑劣行径的道德错误对统一公众看法很有帮助。

column1: As it stands, the public narrative in Russia and the West diverges sharply.
column2: 目前俄罗斯和西方的公众说法截然不同。

column1: Russian media and officials portray the episode as, at best, a terrible mistake, and, at worst, an American plot to undermine support for the rebels.
column2: 俄罗斯媒体和官员充其量把此次事件说成是可怕的错误，甚至说成是美国人削弱对叛军支持的阴谋。

column1: Americans and Europeans, for their part, increasingly blame Russia for possibly equipping or assisting the rebels.
column2: 而美欧则越来越多地指责俄罗斯可能为叛军提供装备或者协助。

column1: As a result, the possibility of achieving a common understanding of the act is being lost – and, with it, whatever potential there may be for meaningful cooperation.
column2: 结果是就上述行为达成共识的可能性越来越小 — — 开展有意义合作的机会也正在消失。

column1: But, by recognizing the downing of MH17 as a war crime, governments may be able to create an opening to reconcile these narratives.
column2: 但如果认定击落MH17属于战争罪行，各国政府或许可以打破坚冰，统一态度。

column1: Whatever the perpetrators’ underlying motives, there is no denying the moral and legal wrongdoing that occurred.
column2: 无论肇事者出于何种潜在动机，此次事件是道德和法律犯罪都是无可否认的。

column1: Calling the offense by its legal name acknowledges this, thereby preempting a rhetorical battle to frame the attack as terror, tragedy, or conspiracy.
column2: 用合法名称来形容此次事件承认了这一基本事实，并对恐怖、悲剧和阴谋论进行了有力的反驳。

column1: Even the Russians may be willing to accept this framing, because it avoids finger-pointing against particular actors and affirms that a court of law – not a series of media statements – will determine what occurred and who is responsible.
column2: 就连俄国人都有可能愿意接受这一框架，因为这样做避免了指责特定人员，并确保将由法院而不是媒体来决定事实真相和责任者。

column1: In fact, another important reason to characterize the downing of MH17 publicly as a war crime is that it may prove beneficial in apprehending the perpetrators.
column2: 事实上，将击落MH17公开定性为战争罪的另一重要原因是这样做或许有利于逮捕肇事者。

column1: There is a real danger that those responsible for pressing the launch button – and, perhaps, for ordering the launch – will disappear into the chaos of eastern Ukraine, the vast expanses of Russia, or elsewhere.
column2: 按下发射按钮 — — 或者也许是下达发射命令的人的确有可能消失在混乱的乌克兰东部和俄罗斯广袤的国土当中。

column1: There is also a danger that the perpetrators, if found, might avoid trial if the local authorities label the crime political, and thus exempt from normal extradition requirements.
column2: 此外，还有可能即便找到了凶手，地方当局也会以政治犯罪为由让凶手逃避审判，避开正常的引渡请求。

column1: All of the relevant states in the region have accepted the legal obligation to assist in the investigation and prosecution of war crimes.
column2: 该地区所有相关国家都认可协助战争罪调查和起诉的法律义务。

column1: The obligation to prosecute suspected war criminals, or extradite them to face prosecution elsewhere, becomes more compelling in accordance with the seriousness of the alleged crime.
column2: 所谓战争罪越严重，起诉犯罪嫌疑人、或将其引渡到其他地方接受审判的义务就愈加引人注目。

column1: While the full details of the attack on MH17 remain unknown, shooting a surface-to-air missile at a civilian airliner flying over a war zone is most likely a violation of the law of war – by which the Ukrainian government, the Russian government, and the rebels are all bound.
column2: 虽然MH17遇袭的全部细节尚不清楚，但用地空导弹袭击飞越战区上空的民航客机无疑违反了战争法 — — 乌克兰政府、俄罗斯政府和叛军均应受到该法的约束。

column1: Indeed, the conflict in eastern Ukraine constitutes a non-international armed conflict (a war between a government and rebel movement) governed by international humanitarian law, which categorically bans the intentional targeting of civilians.
column2: 事实上，乌克兰东部冲突属非国际性武装冲突（政府和反叛运动作战）性质，需要遵守国际人道主义法，其中明确禁止蓄意袭击平民目标。

column1: In other words, if whoever launched the missile did so with the intent of killing the civilian passengers aboard MH17, the act was unmistakably a war crime.
column2: 换句话说，如果导弹发射者想要杀害搭乘MH17的平民乘客，那么该行为明白无误属于战争罪的范畴。

column1: Even if the objective was to strike a Ukrainian transport aircraft, the act likely constitutes a war crime.
column2: 即使原定目标是击落乌克兰运输机，上述行为仍有可能属于战争罪的范畴。

column1: Fundamental to the law of war, including the law applicable in non-international armed conflicts, is the principle of distinction – the requirement that fighting parties distinguish between civilian and military targets.
column2: 战争法，包括非国际性武装冲突法的基本原则是要区别对待，要求交战方分清平民和军事目标。

column1: In the words of the International Committee of the Red Cross, that duty of care includes doing “everything feasible to verify that targets are military objectives.”
column2: 用红十字国际委员会的话说，这项义务包括“尽一切可能确认目标是否是军事目标 。 ”

column1: In this case, many steps could easily have been taken to differentiate MH17 from a military-transport plane, including visual identification (perhaps with binoculars), radar-signature analysis, and a check of the civilian aircraft transponder-code broadcast.
column2: 在这种情况下，有很多手段可以轻松区分MH17和军事运输机，其中包括视觉识别（或许采用双筒望远镜 ） 、 雷达信号分析和民用飞机应答码广播核查。

column1: If, as seems likely, these basic steps were not taken, even an accidental strike on MH17 would constitute a war crime.
column2: 如果看似并未采取这些基本措施，那么即使误中MH17也有可能划入战争罪的范畴。

column1: A Dutch or Malaysian court, or even a special tribunal under the auspices of the United Nations (like the one that prosecuted the 1988 Pan Am Lockerbie bombing), will ultimately determine who bears legal responsibility for the downing of MH17.
column2: 一家荷兰或马来西亚法院，甚或是联合国授权的一家特别法院（比如1988年起诉泛美洛克比空难的法院）将决定在法律层面谁来为击落MH17航班负责。

column1: Framing the attack as a likely war crime now – as UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Navi Pillay has done – may help to reconcile the conflicting narratives that are emerging.
column2: 像联合国高级人权专员皮莱那样将此次袭击作为潜在的战争罪行对待可能有助于统一不断出现的矛盾叙述。

column1: And, perhaps more important, doing so can play a key role in securing the political, diplomatic, and legal support needed to bring the perpetrators to justice.
column2: 而且，更重要的是，这样做能在争取将肇事者绳之以法所需的政治、外交和法律支持中起到关键的作用。

column1: China’s New Reforms in Theory and Practice
column2: 中国新改革：理论与实践

column1: HONG KONG – On November 12, the Third Plenary of the 18th Central Committee of the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) announced a major turn to market-oriented policies: interest-rate and currency liberalization, reform of banks and state enterprises, clearer land ownership for rural inhabitants, and a better deal for urban migrants.
column2: 香港—11月12日，中国十八大三中全会宣布了一组重大的市场化转向政策：利率和货币自由化、银行和国有企业改革、更清晰的农村居民土地所有权、以及更好的城市农民工待遇。

column1: Behind this landmark decision was a potential crisis.
column2: 隐藏在这一划时代决定背后的是一场潜在危机。

column1: China’s success has been driven by cheap exports based on cheap labor, infrastructure built by state enterprises with low-cost bank funding, and government budgets funded by land sales.
column2: 中国的成功一直是由基于廉价劳动力的廉价出口、廉价银行资金支持的国有企业建设的基础设施以及土地销售提供资金的政府预算推动的。

column1: But labor is no longer cheap, road construction to connect major cities has given way to building large shopping malls in small towns, and land sales based on rezoning are reaching both economic limits and the limits of villagers’ tolerance.
column2: 但劳动力不再廉价、连接主要城市的道路建设已经变成了在小城镇建设大型购物城，基于重新规划的土地销售已经达到了经济和村民容忍力的双重极限。

column1: Cheap money with limited investment outlets now risks fueling property bubbles and industrial overcapacity.
column2: 如今，廉价的资金加上投资渠道受限有可能助长房地产泡沫和工业产能过剩。

column1: Without fundamental change, China faces slower economic growth, inadequate job creation and innovation, and popping bubbles.
column2: 如果没有根本性变化，中国面临着经济增速减慢、就业创造和创新不足和泡沫破裂的风险。

column1: The solution is a rapid shift from China’s export-based growth model to one based on domestic demand; from infrastructure to consumption; from the dominance of large state-owned enterprises (SOEs) to that of small and medium-size private enterprises; from industry to services; and, more broadly, from bureaucratic control to market control.
column2: 解决办法在于迅速地从基于出口的增长模式转变为基于内需；从基础设施转变为消费；从大型国有企业主导转变为中小型民营企业；从工业转变为服务业；以及更广泛地，从官僚控制转变为市场控制。

column1: All successful Asian countries have made this shift; South Korea and Taiwan are models.
column2: 所有亚洲成功经济体都做过这一转变；韩国和中国台湾堪称榜样。

column1: But rapid change entails immense pain.
column2: 但快速变化意味着阵痛。

column1: SOEs will lose their low-interest loans, subsidized land, monopoly protection, and privileged housing.
column2: 国有企业将失去低息贷款、受补贴土地、垄断保护和福利住房。

column1: Party and state bureaucracies will lose power (and income).
column2: 党和国家官僚将失去权力（以及收入 ） 。

column1: Local governments are particularly desperate.
column2: 地方政府尤其着急。

column1: They have huge debts, which they amortize by rezoning and selling land.
column2: 它们背负着巨额债务，对于这些债务，它们通过再规划和销售土地摊销。

column1: Already squeezed by exorbitant property prices and popular resistance to land takings, they now face higher interest rates, property taxes, villagers empowered by stronger rights, and expensive new requirements to provide social services to migrants.
column2: 除了房价过高、群众对征地的抵制之外，地方政府现在还面临利率提高、房产税、村民力量和权利增加以及为农民工提供社会保证的需要大笔开支的新要求。

column1: The desperation of local potentates and SOE executives has created powerful resistance to reform.
column2: 地方执政者和国有企业掌门人的焦急构成了对改革的重大阻碍。

column1: At a plenary reportedly marked by acrimony, China’s political leaders sided with reform.
column2: 据说三中全会中充满了斗争，最终中国政治领导人站在了改革一边。

column1: As one economic planner said, when asked about resistance before the decisive meeting, “In the end, all of our leaders understand numbers.
column2: 一位经济计划官员在这次决定性会议前被问及遭遇的抵制时回答说 ： “ 说到底，我们的领导人都明白数字。

column1: The implications of the numbers are clear.”
column2: 数字的影响力是毫不含糊的 。 ”

column1: The Third Plenum’s announcement of its decisions took the form of a statement of broad principles, leaving many observers concerned by the lack of detail.
column2: 三中全会的决定以提纲挈领的形式公布，让许多观察者担心缺少细节。

column1: But the CCP’s role is to set the direction of policy; executing the Party’s decisions is the government’s job.
column2: 但中共的角色是决定政策方向；执行党的决定是政府的责任。

column1: And the Plenum did establish a top-level group to coordinate and enforce implementation of its decisions.
column2: 三中全会确实成立了顶层领导小组协调和强制其决定的实施。

column1: While implementation will be a long struggle, with occasionally fierce resistance, key reforms are already underway.
column2: 实施将是一场长期斗争，会遇到一些激烈抵制，但关键改革已经上路。

column1: The current 12th Five-Year Plan calls for annual wage increases to average at least 13.4%; this year, wages are rising at an average rate of 18%, which will squeeze out industries characterized by obsolescence or overcapacity.
column2: 当前的十二五规划要求工资增长平均至少为13.4 % ； 今年，工资增长平均率为18 % ， 这将挤压过时和产能过剩的行业。

column1: Moreover, the government’s anti-corruption campaign is targeting some of the most powerful industry groups, such as the petroleum faction, thereby weakening their resistance to reform.
column2: 此外，政府的反腐运动将目标定向一些权力最大的工业集团，比如石化行业，从而削弱了对改革的抵制。

column1: Most important, economic outcomes are becoming increasingly aligned with the authorities’ goals.
column2: 最重要的是，经济结果日益与当局的目标相一致。

column1: Services already account for more output and employment than industry – the Internet company Alibaba, for example, is empowering both consumers and smaller companies on a previously unimaginable scale – and recent growth has been driven by domestic demand rather than net exports.
column2: 服务业对产出和就业的贡献已超过工业 — — 比如，互联网公司阿里巴巴以此前难以想象的规模壮大了消费者和小公司 — — 且近期的增长受内需而不是出口推动。

column1: Reform is not just a plan; it is already happening.
column2: 改革不仅仅是计划，而是正在进行时。

column1: Economic openings to Central Asia and to ASEAN (specifically to Vietnam) are well underway, and reform will include further international opening.
column2: 向中亚和东盟（特别是越南）开放经济也在积极展开，而改革将包括进一步的国际开放。

column1: The Third Plenum’s decisions follow the launch in September of the Shanghai Free-Trade Zone, which will open new sectors to foreign investment and permit largely market-based financial transactions and capital flows.
column2: 在三中全会的决定之前，9月份在上海成立了自由贸易区，自贸区将向外国投资开放新部门，允许基本由市场决定的金融交易和资本流。

column1: The liberalization of capital flows is intended to be a gradual national policy, channeled through trusted institutions in Shanghai.
column2: 资本流动自由化将成为常规国家政策，由上海的可信机构作为渠道。

column1: For trade in goods, the new free-trade zone is intended to compete directly with Singapore and Hong Kong.
column2: 对于商品贸易，新自贸区将直接与新加坡与香港竞争。

column1: China fears dependence on those entrepôts in the event of conflict.
column2: 中国担心在面临冲突事件时过度依赖香港和新加坡等中转站。

column1: For foreign investors, the policy will be to expand greatly the range of opportunities while curtailing foreign control; foreign companies, for example, may hold minority stakes in the telecoms sector, while dominant foreign companies like Monsanto will face constraints.
column2: 对外国投资者来说，这一政策将极大地扩大机会，同时限制外国控制；比如，外国公司可以成为电信部门的少数股东，但孟山都等国际大公司将面临约束。

column1: President Xi Jinping faces the politically risky task of pushing the CCP’s reform agenda against fierce opposition while the economy slows.
column2: 在经济放缓的背景下战胜反对者、推动中共的改革日程是习近平主席面临的高风险政治任务。

column1: By emphasizing Party control – through a crackdown on SOEs, government opponents, and critics in the media and academia – Xi seeks to maximize his ability to impose economic reforms while minimizing the risk of a challenge from conservative forces.
column2: 习近平强调党的控制 — — 通过打压国有企业、政府反对派和媒体和学界的批评 — — 以此寻求推动改革能力最大化和保守派挑战风险最小化。

column1: Above all, he is determined to avoid the fate of previous Chinese leaders like Hu Yaobang and Zhao Ziyang, who lost their jobs after a critical mass of their opponents came to believe that economic and political reform jeopardized Party control.
column2: 总之，习近平要避免前任中国领导人胡耀邦和赵紫阳的命运。 胡耀邦和赵紫阳因为反对者认为经济和政治改革威胁到了党的控制而被迫下台。

column1: So, at least for now, China will focus on another great wave of economic reform, whereas political reform will mostly be limited to reorganization of government agencies to boost efficiency and strengthen efforts to reduce corruption.
column2: 因此，至少从现在看，中国将专注于新一轮伟大的经济改革，而政治改革最有可能将局限于重组政府机构以增进效率以及打击腐败。

column1: (There have been some steps toward reform, including a decision to remove judges from local political control.)
column2: （改革之路已经跨出了一些步骤，包括取消地方政治控制法官。 ）

column1: And yet China will find it increasingly difficult to postpone stronger measures that would appease popular demands for fairness, including the establishment of an independent judiciary, which could prove to be no less an imperative than structural economic reforms.
column2: 但中国将会发现，中止迎合公众对公正的要求的更强有力的措施将变得越来越困难，建立司法独立就是其中之一，这将是不亚于结构性经济改革的当务之急。

column1: Likewise, the leaders must either accept much of the information revolution’s swamping of controls or engage in far more costly repression.
column2: 类似地，领导人要么接受信息革命对控制力的颠覆，要么实施代价高昂的打压。

column1: Hopes for political reform rest on the possibility that Xi’s second term will see the accession to top leadership of reformers like Politburo member Wang Yang and Vice President Li Yuanchao.
column2: 政治改革的希望在于，在习近平的第二个任期，政治局委员汪洋和国家副主席李源潮等改革派能进入最高层。

column1: For now, however, China will focus on another great wave of economic reform.
column2: 但是，眼下中国将专注于新一轮伟大的经济改革。

column1: China’s Xi Factor
column2: 中国的习因素

column1: HONG KONG – Before China’s leadership transition earlier this year, experts said that the Chinese Communist Party was intent on preventing a larger-than-life personality from assuming power.
column2: 香港—在今年早些时候中国领导层交接之前，专家们纷纷表示中共决意要避免英雄人物掌权。

column1: The CCP, it was argued, wanted someone more like the bureaucratic outgoing leader, Hu Jintao, rather than a charismatic successor like, say, the former Chongqing provincial governor Bo Xilai.
column2: 他们指出，中共希望新领导人更像即将卸任的胡锦涛是一个官僚，而不要像前重庆市委书记薄熙来那样是一个强人。

column1: Yet the new president and CCP leader, Xi Jinping, is hardly dull.
column2: 但新国家主席和中共总书记习近平绝非平庸之辈。

column1: He began his term by paying homage to Deng Xiaoping at his statue in Shenzhen, where, more than three decades ago, the former Communist Party leader had launched the campaign to convert a reluctant Party to free-market reforms.
column2: 一上任他就前往深圳朝邓小平雕像致意，三十年前，作为前中共领导人的邓小平在深圳拉开了改革的序幕，让顽固的中共接受了自由市场。

column1: In a top-level November meeting, Xi set out the details of a fundamental change in economic direction, overshadowing his colleagues.
column2: 在11月的顶层会议中，习近平制定了经济方向根本性变革的细节，光芒盖过了它的同事。

column1: Xi now leads a new economic group that will coordinate and impose his reforms on fractious colleagues.
column2: 如今，习近平领导的新经济小组将协调他心存不满的同事，实施他的改革。

column1: And, unlike Hu, he immediately became head of the military and now runs a parallel national security council.
column2: 与胡锦涛不同，习近平马上就成为军队首脑，现在还领导着国家安全委员会。

column1: At first glance, a new “paramount leader” appears to be emerging.
column2: 咋一看，一位“最高领袖 ” （ paramount leader）正在冉冉升起。

column1: Recent history explains this re-concentration of power.
column2: 近期历史解释了这一权力的再集中。

column1: In 1993, central-government leaders enjoyed relatively limited powers: they did not control the money supply and had difficulty firing provincial governors or relocating top generals.
column2: 1993年，中央政府领导人的权力相对有限：他们控制不了货币供给，也很难更换省级领导人或高层军官。

column1: Central government revenue was low; indeed, proportionately smaller than that of central governments in any other major economy.
column2: 中央政府收入很低；事实上，按比例计算，中国中央政府是主要经济体中规模最小的。

column1: This changed when then-Party leader Jiang Zemin and his prime minister, Zhu Rongji, centralized authority in order to stave off economic crisis at a time of growing risk to China’s banks.
column2: 这一状况在时任总书记江泽民和国务院总理朱镕基任上发生了改变，江泽民和朱镕基通过权力集中避免了中国银行风险上升带来的经济危机。

column1: In the process, the labor force of China’s state enterprises declined by 50 million, China lost 25 million manufacturing jobs, and central-government employment was slashed.
column2: 在此过程中，中国国有企业职工人数减少了5 000万，全国减少了2 500万个制造业岗位，中央政府工作人员数量也大幅下降。

column1: These measures saved China’s economy, but at the price of widespread social stress, which made Zhu widely disliked when he left office.
column2: 这些措施挽救了中国经济，但代价是社会压力的全面增加，也导致朱镕基在离任后非常不受欢迎。

column1: Popular reaction against the cosmopolitan, coastal, and market-oriented reforms of Zhu and Jiang brought to power leaders whose formative experiences were in the inland provinces of Gansu and Tibet.
column2: 针对朱镕基和江泽民的城市、沿海和市场导向改革的群众反对情绪带来的是从政经历来自内陆省份甘肃和西藏的领导人。

column1: Riding a wave of resentment against inequality and social tensions, Hu and his prime minister, Wen Jiabao, promised a “harmonious society,” without the stresses of Zhu’s agenda.
column2: 面临对不平等性的怨恨和社会紧张局面的胡锦涛和他的总理温家宝提出了“和谐社会 ” 。 不再强调朱镕基的日程。

column1: They slowed economic reform and ceased political reforms.
column2: 他们减缓了经济改革，暂停了政治改革。

column1: The bureaucracy expanded from 40 million to 70 million, and power devolved to provinces, bureaucracies, and state-owned enterprises (SOEs).
column2: 官僚人数从4 000万膨胀到7 000万，权力则下放到各省、官僚机构和国有企业。

column1: The somnolent Hu/Wen era, fortunately, did not dampen the economic growth triggered by the earlier reforms undertaken by Jiang and Zhu.
column2: 幸运的是，令人昏昏欲睡的胡温时代并没有让江朱时代实施的改革所开启的经济增长减慢速度。

column1: But the economic-growth model that those reforms created was running out of steam.
column2: 但江朱改革所形成的经济增长模式正在失去动力。

column1: Low-cost exports were struggling as labor costs rose.
column2: 随着劳动力成本���上升，低成本出口难以为继。

column1: Investment in infrastructure was shifting from growth-enhancing projects, such as inter-city highways, to less productive shopping malls in second- and third-tier cities.
column2: 基础设施投资对象不再是城际高速公路等强化增长的项目，变成了生产率更低的二三线城市购物城。

column1: Productivity plummeted in SOEs, whose privileged access to financing crowded out private-sector investment.
column2: 国有企业生产率大幅下降，同时它们优先获得融资的特权又挤出了私人部门投资。

column1: Local-government funding, through the seizure and resale of property, was reaching its limits.
column2: 地方政府通过征地和卖地进行融资的做法也已经趋于极限。

column1: Thus, it became essential to launch a new wave of far-reaching reforms, including liberalization of interest rates, securities markets, and foreign-exchange controls, in order to fund the more productive private sector and reduce excess capacity in SOEs.
column2: 于是，实施新一轮深层次改革就变得至关重要，包括利率、证券市场和外汇管制的自由化，这样才能为生产率更高的私人部门提供资金并削减国有企业的过剩产能。

column1: In particular, the reforms were needed to deflate an emerging property bubble resulting from huge savings and foreign capital inflows that had no other profitable investment outlet.
column2: 特别地，中国需要改革抑制房地产泡沫。 房地产泡沫的罪魁是找不到其他可盈利投资渠道的巨额储蓄和外国资本流入。

column1: The government planned to liberalize interest rates and the capital account to encourage investment in modern, high-value industries, rather than continue to subsidize low-value exports.
column2: 政府计划实施利率和资本账户自由化以鼓励对现代高价值行业的投资，不再继续补贴低价值出口部门。

column1: It started to shift the economy’s base from export-oriented industries to domestic growth, and from manufacturing to services.
column2: 政府开始将经济的基础从出口导向型行业专项国内增长，从制造业专项服务业。

column1: And it announced its intention to slow local governments’ seizures of farmland and excessive borrowing through captive enterprises.
column2: 政府还宣布将抑制地方政府征用农地和通过政府控制企业过度借贷。

column1: Unsurprisingly, opposition to reform was implacable.
column2: 毫不奇怪，改革的反对之声不绝于耳。

column1: SOEs were determined to defend their privileges.
column2: 国有企业决意捍卫它们的特权。

column1: Highly leveraged local governments could not tolerate higher interest rates or an appreciating currency, and they were adamant about continuing land sales and opposing property taxes.
column2: 高杠杆的地方政府无法忍受提高利率或货币升值，坚持继续卖地和反对房产税。

column1: They feared the financial burden of new requirements to provide social services to urban migrants.
column2: 它们担心向农民工提供社会服务的新要求所带来的财政负担。

column1: As a result, a new, lean leadership team had to be mobilized.
column2: 因此一个精干的领导团队必须动员起来。

column1: The number of top leaders was cut from nine to seven.
column2: 最高领导层人数从九人减少为七人。

column1: The new lineup eliminated the most powerful voice on the left (Bo) and relegated the “extreme reformers” on the right (Li Yuanchao and Wang Yang) to the second tier.
column2: 新阵容排除了最强硬的左派（薄熙来 ） ， 而右派“极端改革者 ” （ 李源潮和汪洋）只能位居次等。

column1: To reduce elders’ interference, Hu stepped down as head of the military and Jiang Zemin promised to step back.
column2: 为了减少老干部的干扰，胡锦涛卸任军队首脑，江泽民也承诺力挺习近平。

column1: Moreover, a leading economic group was established to enforce bureaucratic compliance, as was a national security council (similar to that in the United States) to coordinate foreign policy.
column2: 此外，习近平成立了一个经济领导小组迫使官僚屈服，还成立了国家安全委员会（与美国国家安全委员会类似）协调外交政策。

column1: Previously, the military often kept the foreign ministry in the dark; and the party’s foreign-affairs office, which handled North Korea, often failed to coordinate its activities with the foreign ministry, which handled South Korea.
column2: 此前，军方常常让外交部无所适从；而中共外事办公室（负责朝鲜事务）往往不能协调其与外交部（负责韩国事务）的行动。

column1: An anti-corruption campaign weakened opposition, and Zhu re-emerged as a hero.
column2: 反腐行动减弱了改革的反对力量，朱镕基以英雄形象再次出现在公众视野。

column1: This set the stage for Xi’s arrival.
column2: 这些都是在为习近平的上台铺路。

column1: In short, the new-style leadership, a form of managed charisma, was collectively designed to serve national needs.
column2: 简言之，中共集体设计了一种新的领导风格 — — 有管理的领袖形式（managed charisma）来满足国家需要。

column1: And it implies that Xi is unlikely to emerge as paramount leader.
column2: 这意味着习近平不可能成为最高领袖。

column1: The Chinese presidency’s authority has certainly increased; but Xi is powerful only when he has the votes.
column2: 中国国家主席的权威显然增加了，但习近平只有在掌握选票的情况下才能得到权力。

column1: On contentious issues, he has but one of seven.
column2: 在存在争议的问题上，他只是七人中的一人。

column1: Desperate Women’s Dangerous Moves
column2: 绝望女性的危险运动

column1: GENEVA – One of the most significant recent trends in migration has been the rise in the number of women using dangerous routes previously used mainly by men.
column2: 日内瓦—当前移民活动的一个重大趋势是越来越多的女性采用了此前主要由男性采用的危险办法。

column1: More and more women – fleeing discrimination, violence, or poverty – are now taking the same risks as men in search of a better life for themselves and their children.
column2: 越来越多的女性为了摆脱歧视、暴力或贫困而甘愿像男性一样冒险为自己和孩子争取更好的生活。

column1: This is desperation migration.
column2: 这就是绝望的移民。

column1: Indeed, while many women travel with their families, the International Organization for Migration (IOM) is seeing an increasing number of women migrating on their own to an unknown, unpredictable, and often dangerous future.
column2: 事实上，尽管许多女性跟随家庭迁徙，但国际移民组织（IOM）发现独立地为了未知的、不可预测的并且往往是很危险的未来而移民的女性数字正在增加。

column1: Women and children migrants are dying with increasing frequency at sea, crossing deserts, and on other hazardous routes.
column2: 女性和儿童移民越来越多地丧生于渡海、穿越沙漠和其他危险途径中。

column1: What has changed?
column2: 是什么发生了改变？

column1: Among the many factors pushing women to migrate are pervasive gender bias and social prejudices against single mothers or widows in their country of origin.
column2: 促使女性移民的因素包括原住地无处不在的针对单身母亲或寡妇性别歧视和社会偏见。

column1: But poverty is almost always the strongest force driving women to leave.
column2: 但贫困几乎永远是促使女性迁徙的最重要动力。

column1: In most poor countries, women are poorer than men, owing to the systematic discrimination that they face in education, health care, employment, and control of assets.
column2: 在大部分穷国，女性比男性更穷，这是因为她们在教育、医疗、就业和资产控制中处于系统性的被歧视地位。

column1: Of course, most migrant women do not encounter mistreatment or die on their journeys; in fact, many derive real benefits from migration.
column2: 当然，大部分女性移民在迁徙过程中没有遇到虐待或死亡；事实上，许多人因为移民而境况大为改善。

column1: But, among the world’s estimated 111 million migrant women (half the total), violence and abuse can occur at any time, starting from the very outset of the migration process.
column2: 但是，据估计，全世界有1.11亿女性移民（大约占总数的一半 ） ， 而在移民过程中，随时可能发生暴力和虐待，几乎从移民过程的一开始就是如此。

column1: Throughout the migration cycle, women are more at risk from physical violence by fellow migrants, smugglers, and state officers, and can be forced to exchange sex for transportation, food, or accommodation.
column2: 在整个移民过程中，女性更容易受到来自同伴、走私贩和国家官员的人身伤害，并有可能被迫用性换取放行、食物和住宿。

column1: Unsurprisingly, migrant women are often victims of human trafficking, finding themselves enslaved as laborers, prostitutes, or participants in organized begging operations.
column2: 毫不奇怪，女性移民往往是人口贩子的受害者，最后沦为奴役劳工、娼妓、或乞讨集团成员。

column1: This is true regardless of why women migrate.
column2: 这就是事实，不管女性移民原因为何。

column1: When women run for their lives because of natural or man-made disasters, gender-based violence is one of the great risks they face.
column2: 当女性因为自然或认为灾难而为生命而迁徙时，基于性别的暴力就成为她们所面临的的一个大威胁。

column1: Displaced women, often destitute, are easy prey for criminals.
column2: 流离失所的女性往往身无分文，很容易成为犯罪对象。

column1: This was one of my immediate concerns when Typhoon Haiyan struck the Philippines, and at my request a special program was instituted to alert and help women in peril.
column2: 当海燕台风袭击菲律宾时，我最担心的事情之一也在于此，在我的要求下成立了一个特别计划帮助受灾女性。

column1: Even when women migrants find a job in a host country, it is rarely easy for them.
column2: 即使有女性移民在东道国找到了工作，也决不轻松。

column1: They are predominantly employed in domestic work, care-giving, agriculture, and entertainment – all low-paid, largely unregulated sectors that are rarely covered by national labor laws.
column2: 她们大多从事家政、看护、农业和娱乐工作 — — 都是低薪工作，并且往往属于得不到国家劳动法覆盖的不受管制的部门。

column1: They are often subject to punishingly long working hours, non-payment of wages, forced confinement, starvation, beating, sexual abuse, and threats and intimidation.
column2: 她们往往必须承受极长的工作时间、工资克扣、强制监禁、挨饿、挨打、被性虐待，还饱受威胁和恐吓。

column1: Many women migrants are unskilled or undocumented domestic workers.
column2: 许多女性移民是无技能、无合同的家政工人。

column1: This makes them more vulnerable to violence, because they typically depend on a single employer and in many countries face deportation if they attempt to change jobs.
column2: 这让她们更容易遭到暴力，因为她们往往得依靠单一雇主，并且在许多国家如果试图换工作就要面临遣返。

column1: Moreover, social integration in a new country can be more difficult for women than for men.
column2: 此外，在新国家融入社会对于女性也比男性更难。

column1: This is partly because women are often subject to harmful traditional practices, such as early and forced marriage, female genital mutilation, and so-called “honor” crimes, enforced by families who want to maintain a link with their country of origin.
column2: 这部分是因为女性通常需要被迫接受伤害性风俗，比如强制性童婚、割礼以及由试图坚守国家传统的家庭强制实施的所谓的“荣誉犯罪 ” 。

column1: And it is especially difficult for women migrants to navigate between the tantalizing freedom of choice and expression in their host society and the traditional roles expected of them at home.
column2: 女性移民想要在东道国诱人的选择和言论自由和母国期待她们的传统角色之间游刃有余更是难上加难。

column1: The rising number of migrant deaths – both women and men – at sea and in deserts is a wake-up call for the international community to act.
column2: 死于海中和沙漠中的移民数量 — — 不管是男性还是女性 — — 的上升是警世钟，国际社会应该行动起来。

column1: IOM has called on all relevant actors – including countries of origin, transit countries, and destination countries – to address the plight of migrants attempting life-threatening journeys and find solutions.
column2: IOM呼吁相关行动方 — — 包括来源国、中转国和目的国 — — 改变移民尝试有生命危险的旅程的现象并找出解决方案。

column1: Protecting women migrants – often the most desperate of the desperate – should top their priorities.
column2: 保护女性移民 — — 她们通常是绝望者中的绝望者 — — 应该被列为重中之重。

column1: In 2014, the international community will review the United Nations Millennium Development Goals, which expire next year, and decide on a post-2015 development agenda.
column2: 2014年，国际社会将评估明年到期的联合国千年发展目标并决定2015年后的发展日程。

column1: IOM believes that migrants, and in particular women migrants, who in the past have been largely invisible in the language of development, must be a part of this.
column2: IOM认为，移民，特别是女性移民，应该位列其中，她们过去的发展问题上往往受到忽视。

column1: We must no longer ignore half the world’s migrants.
column2: 我们再也不能忽视世界移民人口中的这一半了。

column1: Like all migrants, women on the move are entitled to personal security and basic dignity.
column2: 和所有移民一样，运动中的女性有权获得个人安全和基本尊严。

column1: Will NATO’s Prodigal Son Return?
column2: 法国会重回北约怀抱吗？

column1: PARIS -- Few state visits have lasting results.
column2: 巴黎—很少有国事访问能产生持久的成效。 而萨科齐对华盛顿刚刚进行的访问可能是个例外。

column1: Nicolas Sarkozy’s just completed trip to Washington may be an exception, because the French President may be preparing to bring NATO a highly valued present for its 60th anniversary in the spring of 2009: France’s return to NATO’s integrated military structure, from which Charles de Gaulle withdrew in 1966.
column2: 因为这位法国总统可能正准备为北约在2009年春的60周年诞辰献上一份厚礼：法国将重返北约统一军事架构。 在1966年戴高乐执政时期法国退出了北约。

column1: In retrospect, de Gaulle’s decision proved to be much more detrimental for France than for the Alliance.
column2: 回头看来，戴高乐的决定对法国造成的伤害比对北约造成的更大。

column1: By withdrawing from NATO’s integrated military command, France excluded itself from political decision-making within the Alliance and thus became the equivalent of the “Harkis”– the local soldiers who served with the French army during the Algerian war: fine soldiers, but with virtually no reward for their service.
column2: 由于退出了北约的统一军事指挥体系，法国将自己排除在该联盟内部的政治决策之外，成为与“Harkis”军人类似的身份—这是些在阿尔及利亚战争中与法国军队并肩战斗的当地军人：勇猛的战士，但却几乎没有因为服役而获得任何犒赏。

column1: How realistic is the possibility of scenario French return to NATO’s military fold?
column2: 法国重返北约军事体系的可能性究竟有多大？

column1: Historically, aborted moves and faux pas abound on both sides in the French/NATO relationship, the latest being Jacques Chirac’s failed attempt to patch up France’s relations with NATO upon his arrival in power in 1995.
column2: 从法国—北约关系的历史上看，许多类似的举措要么不了了之、要么马失前蹄。 最近的一次失败是希拉克在1995年上台以后企图修补法国与北约关系的努力。

column1: Success is not guaranteed this time, either, but the chances are much higher now, because France, the United States, and the world have changed.
column2: 虽然这次也不能保证成功，但机会却很大，因为法国、美国和世界都发生了变化。

column1: For starters, the US now has a real friend and ally in the Élysée Palace.
column2: 首先，美国现在在爱丽舍宫有了一个真正的朋友。

column1: To speak of Sarkozy as a substitute for Tony Blair in Europe would be premature – and unhelpful, given Blair’s inability to exert significant influence on US policy.
column2: 虽然鉴于布莱尔在对美国政策施加重大影响方面的无能，就说萨科齐会在欧洲取代他还言之过早—也于事无补。

column1: But Sarkozy is both eager to transform France’s relations with the Alliance and has a strategy to do so.
column2: 但萨科齐不但有转变法国与北约关系的热情，还有相应的战略。

column1: Moreover, the French army supports such a move, while only a small segment of the Foreign Ministry is opposed.
column2: 此外，法国军方也支持这一举动，只有外交部的一小部分人反对。

column1: Sarkozy’s strategy is to link progress in building a common European defense and security structure with a redefinition of NATO.
column2: 萨科齐的战略是将建立欧洲共同安全与防务架构的进展与对北约的重新定义联系起来。

column1: More Europe in security terms means more Alliance.
column2: 更安全的欧洲也意味着结盟程度更高的欧洲。

column1: So, because Sarkozy wants to be seen as a convinced European, he must normalize France’s relations with a new Alliance based on two pillars – European and American.
column2: 所以，由于萨科齐希望被看作是一个满怀信心的欧洲人，他就必须使法国与新联盟的关系正常化。 新联盟的两大支柱是欧洲人与美国人。

column1: Moreover, financial and human resources for military affairs are scarce and cannot be duplicated, while France and Britain want to restart the Saint-Malo process of bilateral defense efforts launched nearly ten years ago.
column2: 另外，尽管法国和英国想要重新启动近十年前开始实施的双边防务的Saint-Malo进程，但军事的财政和人力资源是稀缺并不可复制的。

column1: As a result, for the sake of Europe, France must move closer to the Alliance.
column2: 所以，为了欧洲，法国必须与北约走得更近。

column1: Sarkozy has also fully integrated into France’s approach to Europe a reckoning with the new balance of power within the European Union following the accession of Eastern European states.
column2: 萨科齐也完全融入了法国对欧洲的策略，在东欧诸国加入欧盟以后承认新的权力平衡。

column1: Unlike Chirac, he understands that it is counterproductive and unrealistic to ask countries like Bulgaria or Romania to choose between their European or Atlantic loyalties.
column2: 与希拉克不同，他明白让保加利亚或罗马尼亚这样的国家在对欧盟或北约的忠诚之间做出抉择是不现实的，其后果会适得其反。

column1: Here, again, strengthening Europe requires strengthening the Alliance.
column2: 这一点再次说明强化欧洲需要巩固北约。

column1: Sarkozy’s approach may work, because America, too, has changed.
column2: 萨科齐的策略可能会行得通，因为美国也改变了。

column1: In American eyes, the Kosovo war in 1999 demonstrated NATO’s glaring and myriad shortcomings, while the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001, moved America still further away from the Alliance, particularly after President George W. Bush disparagingly rejected NATO’s offer of help.
column2: 在美国人的眼中，1999年的科索沃战争反映了北约的种种软肋，而2001年9月11日的恐怖袭击更使得美国与北约渐行渐远，特别是在布什总统轻蔑地拒绝了北约的援助之后。

column1: Former Secretary of Defense Donald Rumsfeld even tried to use divide-and-rule tactics by pitting “New” Europe against the “Old” Europe led by France and Germany, which opposed the Iraq war.
column2: 前防长拉姆斯菲尔德甚至试图采用“分而治之”的办法，在“新”欧洲和法、德领导的，反对伊拉克战争的“老”欧洲之间制造对抗。

column1: Those divisions are now history, and American reservations about a European security pillar cannot trump America’s pressing needs for allied support.
column2: 这种分化现已成为历史，美国对欧洲安全支柱的迟疑远不如其对盟友支持的需求来得急迫。

column1: Confronted with disaster in Iraq, the risk of Afghanistan following Iraq into chaos, and the escalating crisis with Iran, the US can no longer treat the NATO allies with disdain.
column2: 面对伊拉克的灾难，阿富汗步其后尘陷入混乱的风险和伊朗危机的升级，美国不能再轻视北约盟国了。

column1: Although Europe remains militarily weak, America’s power is now in doubt.
column2: 虽然欧洲的军力依然虚弱，但美国的实力也令人怀疑。

column1: If a European pillar within NATO is needed to strengthen the Alliance, why not accept it?
column2: 如果北约内部需要一个欧洲支柱来强化联盟，为什么不接受呢？

column1: Beyond the changes in France and the US, the decisive factor behind the possible reinvention of NATO is the transformation of the international system itself.
column2: 在法国和美国的变化之外，重塑北约的可能性背后还有一个决定性因素，那就是国际体系本身的变化。

column1: Aside from the explosive situation in the Middle East and the threat of Islamist terrorism, the West is now confronted with the rise of Asia, the return of a more assertive Russia, and new energy and environmental challenges.
column2: 除了中东一触即发的局势和伊斯兰恐怖主义的威胁，西方现在还面临着亚洲的崛起、一个更为自负的俄罗斯和新的能源及环境挑战。

column1: Both France and America have a key role to play in addressing these issues effectively.
column2: 法国和美国在有效应对这些问题方面都要扮演关键性的角色。

column1: Sarkozy’s trip to Washington, and his address to a receptive US Congress, was one more step toward ensuring that they do so together.
column2: 萨科齐的华盛顿之行和他受到美国国会欢迎的演讲是确保两国走向合作的第一步。

column1: Bankers with Borders
column2: 有边界的银行家

column1: LONDON – When Mark Carney replaces Mervyn King as Governor of the Bank of England in July 2013, the world will be deprived of King’s witty public utterances.
column2: 发自伦敦 — — 等到马克·卡尼（Mark Carney）在2013年7月接替默文·金（Mervyn King）成为英格兰银行行长之后，我们就再也听不到后者诙谐幽默的公开发言了。

column1: My personal favorite came when, commenting on strong retail-sales figures during one Christmas period, he cast doubt on their significance for assessing the state of the economy.
column2: 我很喜欢他对圣诞期间零售业强劲数据的评论，这些数据对评估经济状况的重要性在他看来都值得怀疑。

column1: “The true meaning of the story of Christmas” he solemnly intoned, “will not be revealed until Easter, or possibly much later.”
column2: “圣诞节的真正意义 ， ” 他严肃地吟诵道 ， “ 要到复活节或更晚之后才能揭示 。 ”

column1: A new career on the stage, or in the pulpit, surely beckons.
column2: （一语双关，暗指耶稣显圣和经济真相的最终昭示都需要时间）可见一份在舞台或圣坛上的新事业会非常适合他。

column1: King’s most quoted phrase is that “global banking institutions are global in life, but national in death.”
column2: 金被引用得最多的观点是“跨国银行机构因全球而生，却以国家而亡 。 ”

column1: They trade globally, across porous borders, attaching little significance to the geographical location of capital and liquidity.
column2: 这些机构渗透各国边界进行全球交易，并不在乎资本和流动性的地理位置。

column1: But, when the music stops, it is the home regulator, and the home central bank, that picks up the tab, even if the losses were incurred elsewhere.
column2: 可一旦环境恶化，即使这些损失产生于别处，却是其所在国监管机构和央行为之买单。

column1: By the same token, a failing bank may leave behind a mess in third countries, which its home authorities may not clean up.
column2: 同样地，一个破产银行可能会在第三国留下一个烂摊子，但其所在国内当局可能并不会出面收拾残局。

column1: Icelandic banks, for example, took deposits in the United Kingdom and the Netherlands, and swept them back to Reykjavik, leaving the host countries out of pocket.
column2: 以冰岛各银行为例，它们把英国和荷兰的存款卷回雷克雅未克，却让两国去承担损失。

column1: Likewise, the collapse of Lehman Brothers left European creditors more exposed than those in the US, whose funds had been wired home to New York on the Friday before the end.
column2: 同样，雷曼兄弟的倒闭将欧洲债权人置于比美国债权人更危险的境地，因为美国人的钱在一切结束前的那个星期五已经被汇回纽约了。

column1: Regulators have been wrestling with this problem for years, without conspicuous success.
column2: 监管机构过去几年一直与这一问题搏斗，却未能取得明显成效。

column1: In mid-December, the Bank of England (BoE) and the United States Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) announced what seemed like a breakthrough, at least concerning the major banks headquartered in the US or the UK – that is, 12 of the 28 institutions regarded by the Financial Stability Board as globally systemic.
column2: 11月中旬，英格兰银行和美国联邦存款保险公司公布了一个似乎是突破的举措 — — 至少对总部设在美国和英国的大银行而言，也就是被金融稳定委员会视作28个全球系统性机构中的其中12个。

column1: In their case, a resolution authority, in London or Washington, would take control of the parent company, remove senior management, and apportion losses to shareholders and unsecured creditors.
column2: 对它们来说，一个在华盛顿或伦敦的解决方案机构将会接管母公司，炒掉高级管理层，把损失摊派给股东和未受保护的债权人。

column1: It sounded plausible.
column2: 这听起来似乎可行。

column1: BoE officials declared firmly that they were prepared to trust their American counterparts, and would not step in to grab subsidiaries or assets based in the UK.
column2: 英国央行官员坚称他们已经做好准备相信美国同行，不会插手夺取位于英国的子公司或资产。

column1: “This is a journey that involves trust,” said BoE Deputy Governor Paul Tucker.
column2: 英格兰银行副行长保罗·塔克（Paul Tucker）说 ： “ 这是一个包含着信任的过程 。 ”

column1: But the Anglo-American love-in quickly soured when the FDIC chairman was asked to give the same assurances of confidence in the British authorities.
column2: 但是当美国联邦存款保险公司总裁被要求对英国当局作出同样的信心保证时，这场英美之恋立刻变了味。

column1: According to the Financial Times, he “laughingly declined.”
column2: 根据《金融时报》的说法，他“笑着拒绝了 。 ”

column1: Indeed, while the FDIC and the BoE were working on their plan, the US Federal Reserve was developing proposals that will expose overseas banks in the US to a far tighter set of controls, and closer supervision, than they have hitherto experienced.
column2: 事实上，当联���存款保险公司和英格兰银行研究其计划之时，美联储正在研究一种在美外资银行处于比当前更牢固掌控和严密监管之下的提案。

column1: The Fed is seeking to oblige foreign banks to create a holding company to own their separately capitalized subsidiaries, effectively giving the Fed direct oversight of their business.
column2: 美联储正试图迫使外国银行建立一个控股公司，下属各单独资本化了的子公司，这能有效地让美联储直接监督他们的业务。

column1: They will also be required to maintain stronger capital and liquidity positions in the US.
column2: 这些公司也将会被要求在美国保持更强大的资本和流动性头寸。

column1: The justification offered for these new impositions is that overseas banks have moved beyond their traditional lending business to engage in substantial and often complex capital-market activities.
column2: 这些新规定产生的理由是外资银行已经越过了它们传统的贷款业务，参与到了实质性且通常比较复杂的资本市场活动之中。

column1: “The crisis revealed the resulting risks to US financial stability,” said Fed Governor Daniel Tarullo.
column2: “这场危机揭露了由此产生的美国金融稳定风险 ， ” 美联储理事丹尼尔·塔鲁洛（Daniel Tarullo）说到。

column1: The UK’s Financial Services Authority has been invoking the same rationale for requiring foreign banks to establish local subsidiaries, rather than taking deposits or lending through a branch of the parent bank.
column2: 英国金融服务管理局已经使用相同的理由来要求外资银行建立当地子公司，而不是通过母公司下属的分公司来进行存款或贷款。

column1: On the face of it, these moves appear to be well justified, given the mayhem created by poorly regulated banks in the major financial centers.
column2: 表面看来，考虑到监管不力的银行在全球各主要金融中心引起的混乱，这些举措似乎很合乎情理。

column1: But we should be clear that these changes are not just tinkering at the edges.
