column2: 如今，IMF已经承认大量欧洲银行存在巨大的资本漏洞，那么，它应该开始大力推行全面可信的欧元区债务危机解决方案了。 这一方案包括部分分解欧元区以及基础宪政改革。

column1: Europe’s future, not to mention the future of the IMF, depends on it.
column2: 欧洲的未来（更不用说IMF了）便系于此。

column1: Will the Polluters Pay for Climate Change?
column2: 污染者会为气候变化付出代价吗？

column1: I am writing this in New York in early August, when the mayor declared a “heat emergency” to prevent widespread electricity outages from the expected high use of air conditioners.
column2: 我八月上旬在纽约写这篇文章，当时，纽约市长宣布实行“高温紧急状态”来防止由于预期的大量使用空调而造成的大范围停电。

column1: City employees could face criminal charges if they set their thermostats below 78 degrees Fahrenheit (25.5 Celsius).
column2: 市政雇员如果把他们的空调温度调到华氏78度 (摄氏25.5度) 以下就会面临刑事指控。

column1: Nevertheless, electricity usage has reached near-record levels.
column2: 但是，用电量还是接近历史最高记录。

column1: Meanwhile California has emerged from its own record-breaking heat wave.
column2: 与此同时，加利福尼亚刚刚走出该州自己的破记录的热浪。

column1: For the United States as a whole, the first six months of 2006 were the hottest in more than a century.
column2: 美国全国而言，2006年的头六个月是一个多世纪内最热的。

column1: Europe is experiencing an unusually hot summer, too.
column2: 欧洲也在经历一个不同寻常的酷暑。

column1: July set new records in England and the Netherlands, where weather data go back more than 300 years.
column2: 英国和荷兰的七月份气温都创下新高，这两个国家的天气数据记录超过300年。

column1: The hot northern summer fits well with the release of An Inconvenient Truth, a documentary film featuring former US Vice-President Al Gore.
column2: 北半球的酷暑与美国前副总统戈尔主持的电影纪录片“烦恼的真相”不谋而合。

column1: Using some remarkable graphs, images, and other information, the film makes a compelling case that our carbon dioxide emissions are causing global warming, or, at the very least, contributing to it, and that we must urgently address the issue.
column2: 这部电影使用一些生动的图表、画面以及其他信息，有力地阐明了人类的二氧化碳排放造成全球气候变暖，或者至少是促进气候变暖，并且大力呼吁处理这一问题是当务之急。

column1: Americans tend to talk a lot about morality and justice.
column2: 美国人趋向于对道德和正义高谈阔论。

column1: But most Americans still fail to realize that their country’s refusal to sign the Kyoto protocol, and their subsequent business–as-usual approach to greenhouse gas emissions, is a moral failing of the most serious kind.
column2: 但是大多数美国人依然没有认识到他们的国家拒绝签署京都议定书、对温室气体排放采取一切照旧的做法是最为严重的道德败坏事情。

column1: It is already having harmful consequences for others, and the greatest inequity is that it is the rich who are using most of the energy that leads to the emissions that cause climate change, while it is the poor who will bear most of the costs.
column2: 这已经给其他人造成了有害的影响，而最大的不公平就是，富人使用绝大部分导致排放的能源造成气候变化，而穷人将会承担大部分代价。

column1: (To see what you can do to reduce your own contribution, go to www.climatecrisis.net.)
column2: (如果想要了解自己如何做来减少气体排放，请访问网站www.climatecrisis.net ) 。

column1: To see the inequity, I merely have to glance up at the air conditioner that is keeping my office bearable.
column2: 我只要看一下让我的办公室呆得住人的空调就可以知道这一不公了。

column1: While I’ve done more than the mayor requested, setting it at 82F (27C), I’m still part of a feedback loop.
column2: 尽管我做的比市长要求的还要好，把温度设定在82华氏度(摄氏27度 ) ， 我仍然是反馈回路的一部分。

column1: I deal with the heat by using more energy, which leads to burning more fossil fuel, putting more greenhouse gases into the atmosphere and heating up the planet more.
column2: 我通过使用更多的能源来对付酷热，导致燃烧更多的矿物燃料、把更多的温室气体排入大气层并且让地球更加炎热。

column1: It even happened when I watched An Inconvenient Truth: on a warm evening, the cinema was so chilly that I wished I had brought a jacket.
column2: 即使是我在观看“烦恼的真相”的时候也是如此。 那是一个炎热的晚上，电影院冷气逼人，以至于我希望我带来一件夹克。

column1: Heat kills.
column2: 酷热可以致命。

column1: A heat wave in France in 2003 caused an estimated 35,000 deaths, and a hot spell similar to the one Britain had last month caused more than 2,000 deaths, according to official estimates.
column2: 根据官方估计，2003年法国的一场热浪造成大约35000人死亡，上个月英国一场类似的热浪造成2000多人死亡。

column1: Although no particular heat wave can be directly attributed to global warming, it will make such events more frequent.
column2: 尽管没有一场特别的热浪可以直接归咎于全球变暖，但是它将会让这样的事件更为频繁。

column1: Moreover, if global warming continues unchecked, the number of deaths that occur when rainfall becomes more erratic, causing both prolonged droughts and severe floods, will dwarf the death toll from hot weather in Europe.
column2: 而且，如果对全球变暖继续不加以节制，那么，当降雨变得更为不规则，造成持续的干旱和严重的洪灾时所发生的死亡人数将会让欧洲炎热天气而致命的数目小巫见大巫。

column1: More frequent intense hurricanes will kill many more.
column2: 更为频繁的强烈飓风将会让让更多的人死亡。

column1: Melting polar ice will cause rising seas to inundate low-lying fertile delta regions on which hundreds of millions of people grow their food.
column2: 融化的极地冰川将会造成海平面上升，淹没数以亿计的人口种植粮食的低洼地带三角洲良田。

column1: Tropical diseases will spread, killing still more people.
column2: 热带疾病将会扩散，让更多的人死亡。

column1: Overwhelmingly, the dead will be those who lack the resources to adapt, to find alternative sources of food, and who do not have access to health care.
column2: 死亡者中的绝大多数人将是那些缺乏资源适应、寻找替换食物资源以及那些没有医疗保障的人。

column1: Even in rich countries, it usually isn’t the rich who die in natural disasters.
column2: 即使在富国，通常也不是那些富人死于自然灾害。

column1: When Hurricane Katrina hit New Orleans, those who died were the poor in low-lying areas who lacked cars to escape.
column2: 当卡特琳娜飓风袭击奥尔良的时候，那些遇害的人都是在低洼地带缺少汽车逃命的穷人。

column1: If this is true in a country like the US, with a reasonably efficient infrastructure and the resources to help its citizens in times of crisis, it is even more evident when disasters strike developing countries, because their governments lack the resources needed, and because, when it comes to foreign assistance, rich nations still do not count all human lives equally.
column2: 如果这发生在像美国这样具有大体有效的基础设施以及在危难时候帮助其国民的资源的国家，那么，当灾难袭击发展中国家之时，由于它们的政府缺少必需的资源，而且由于富国在对外援助时并不平等看待人命，情况就会更为明显了。

column1: According to United Nations figures, in 2002 per capita emissions of greenhouse gases in the US were 16 times higher than in India, 60 times higher than in Bangladesh, and more than 200 times higher than in Ethiopia, Mali, or Chad.
column2: 根据联合国的数据，2002年美国的人均温室气体排放高出印度16倍，孟加拉国60倍，比埃塞俄比亚、马里或者乍得高出200倍以上。

column1: Other developed nations with emissions close to those of the US include Australia, Canada, and Luxembourg.
column2: 排放水平接近美国的其��发达国家包括澳大利亚、加拿大以及卢森堡。

column1: Russia, Germany, Britain, Italy, France, and Spain all have levels between a half and a quarter that of the US.
column2: 俄国、德国、英国、意大利、法国以及西班牙的排放水平都只是美国的四分之一到一半之间。

column1: This is still significantly above the world average, and more than 50 times that of the poorest nations in which people will die from global warming.
column2: 这还是比世界平均高出很多，比最贫困国家高出50倍以上。 这些国家的人死于全球气候变暖。

column1: If a polluter harms others, those who are harmed normally have a legal remedy.
column2: 如果一个污染者损害了他人，受害者往往有法律救济。

column1: For example, if a factory leaks toxic chemicals into a river that I use to irrigate my farm, killing my crops, I can sue the factory owner.
column2: 例如，如果一家工厂向我用来灌溉农田的河流渗漏了有毒化学品，杀死了我的作物，那么我可以起诉工厂的主人。

column1: If the rich nations pollute the atmosphere with carbon dioxide, causing my crops to fail because of changing rainfall patterns, or my fields are inundated by a rise in the sea level, shouldn’t I also be able to sue?
column2: 如果富国用二氧化碳污染大气，让我的作物由于降雨模式改变而歉收，或者我的农田由于海平面上升而被淹没，那么，我难道就不能起诉吗？

column1: Camilla Toulmin, who directs the International Institute for Environment and Development, a London-based NGO, was present at a lecture on climate change that Al Gore gave in June.
column2: 国际环境和发展研究所是一家总部设在伦敦的非政府组织。 今年6月份，戈尔作气候变化演讲的时候，该所主任图明也在场。

column1: She asked him what he thought about compensation for those who are hit hardest by climate change, but who have done the least to cause it.
column2: 她问戈尔如何看待给那些受到气候变化打击最大、但却对气候变化作用最小的人予以补偿的问题。

column1: The question, she reports on www.opendemocracy.net, seemed to take him by surprise, and he did not support the idea.
column2: 她在www.opendemocracy.net网站上汇报说，这一问题让戈尔措手不及，而且他也不支持这一观点。

column1: Like Toulmin, I wonder if this is a truth that is just too inconvenient, even for him.
column2: 向图明一样，我不知道这一真相即使对戈尔来说也是太过烦恼。

column1: Will the Rumsfeld Revolution Continue?
column2: 拉姆斯菲尔德的革命会继续吗？

column1: America’s defense policy is at a crossroads.
column2: 美国的国防政策正处于转折点上。

column1: Since 1997, the United States Congress has required the Department of Defense to undertake a major defense review every four years.
column2: 自1997年以来，美国国会就要求国防部每隔四年进行一次全面的国防评估。

column1: The department is currently developing the third such review and will release it later this year.
column2: 国防部目前正在进行第三次这样的评估，评估结果将在年底揭晓。

column1: The review promises to be nothing short of a watershed.
column2: 这项评估据称将会具有分水岭式的意义。

column1: The last Quadrennial Defense Review was published a few weeks after the September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks.
column2: 上一次四年一度的评估在2001年9月11日恐怖袭击以后的数周发布。

column1: As a result, it gave only hints of the counterterrorism strategy to come.
column2: 所以它只对未来的反恐战略做了些许提示。

column1: The 2005 review, by contrast, will represent several years of thinking by the Bush administration, and thus will serve as a key indicator of the future course of American defense policy.
column2: 相较之下，2005年的评估将会代表布什政府几年以来的思考成果，因而会成为美国未来国防政策的一项重要指标。

column1: The grand strategy that serves as the foundation for American defense policy has not undergone major change since 2002.
column2: 作为美国国防政策基础的大方向战略自2002年以来没有发生重大变化。

column1: Focusing on terrorism, the strategy calls for strengthening the network of international partners seeking to eradicate transnational terrorism, and for direct action against terrorist organizations and their sponsors.
column2: 以恐怖主义为重心，该战略呼吁加强寻求根除跨国恐怖主义的国际伙伴网络，同时还呼吁对恐怖组织及其赞助者采取直接行动。

column1: Ultimately, it seeks to address what President Bush considers the root causes of terrorism, particularly the absence of open political systems and economic opportunity.
column2: 最终，这一战略的目的是要根治布什总统认为的恐怖主义发生的根源，特别是开放的政治体系和经济机遇的缺失。

column1: What is changing is the way that US military power is used to implement this grand strategy.
column2: 正发生着变化的，是美国用于实施这一宏大战略的军事力量。

column1: There is little doubt that the 2005 Defense Review will formalize the change in focus underway since September 11, 2001.
column2: 几乎可以肯定，在《2005国防评估》中会正式确认自2001年“9.11”以来的这种变化。

column1: Before that, the American military concentrated on swift victory in a major theater war against another state’s military forces.
column2: 在此之前，美国军方的注意力主要放在针对他国军力的速战速决的做秀式的战争。

column1: Today, however, the US military is more likely to be used to stabilize and rebuild failed states, assist partners in countering insurgency and terrorism, control nuclear weapons when regimes collapse, or directly eradicate terrorist organizations and their supporters.
column2: 但现在，美国的军力更可能会被用来稳定和重建战败国，帮助伙伴国对抗叛乱和恐怖主义，在政权崩溃时控制核武器，或直接铲除恐怖组织及其支持者。

column1: This requires a different type of force, and one capable of running a marathon rather than a sprint, sustaining major deployments for extended periods.
column2: 这就需要另一种军事力量，一种可以跑马拉松而不是100米的军事力量，以适应长期性的重要部署。

column1: The global configuration of America’s military is also changing.
column2: 美军的全球部署也发生着变化。

column1: The goal is to keep most of the force stationed at home in the US, with a network of lightly-manned bases abroad that can serve as forward operating locations during a crisis or war.
column2: 其目标是将大部分的军力驻扎在美国本土，同时在国外保持驻军不多的基地网络以便在危机或战争时期作为前沿运作地点。

column1: Rather than being miniature Americas, many of these bases will be operated in conjunction with or by the host nation.
column2: 许多基地都会由美国和所在国一起运营，而不仅仅是作为美国的延伸。

column1: This will capitalize on the US military’s ability to project force around the world quickly, while providing a more flexible and politically palatable way of doing so.
column2: 这样就能够充分发挥美军向世界各地快速派遣军队的能力，同时也使这种做法更为灵活、更符合当今的政治潮流。

column1: But, beyond the ongoing changes, major strategic questions persist.
column2: 然而，在这些进行中的变化之外，重大的战略问题依然存在。

column1: First, how much conventional war-fighting capability should the US military retain?
column2: 首先，美军需要保持多强的常规战斗力呢？

column1: The goal is to maintain enough to deter aggressors, but not so much that it detracts from other, more likely missions.
column2: 目标是保持足以阻止进攻者的常规战斗力，但又不至于强到拖累其它类似使命执行的程度。

column1: Second, what will America’s relationship with its traditional allies be?
column2: 其次，美国和其传统的盟友要保持怎样的关系？

column1: Will formal alliances such as NATO remain the centerpiece of American strategy, or will they be superseded by mission-specific coalitions?
column2: 像“北约”这样的正式联盟会依然是美国战略的核心，还是会有以具体使命为目的组成的联盟来替代它们？

column1: Third, how much should the US continue to invest in advanced, high-tech weapons more appropriate for conventional enemies than for fighting terrorists or insurgents?
column2: 再者，相对于反恐怖和反叛乱的投入，美国还需要在应对常规敌人的先进高科技武器上多投入多少呢？

column1: Systems such as the F/A-22 Raptor aircraft and the Army’s Future Combat System are extraordinarily expensive.
column2: 像F/A-22“猛禽”战斗机和“未来战斗系统”等装备都极为昂贵。

column1: At a time when deployments to Iraq and Afghanistan are straining the defense budget and much of the military’s existing equipment needs repair or replacement, questions arise as to whether such programs are a good investment.
column2: 在向伊拉克和阿富汗派军使美国国防预算吃紧，且许多现役设备都需要维修和更新的时候，在这些项目上投资是否明智就是值得考量了。

column1: Fourth, what is the appropriate size of the US military?
column2: 还有，美军的规模究竟需要多大？

column1: Many defense intellectuals, former military leaders, and politicians believe that America’s military, particularly the ground forces, are too small to implement Bush’s grand strategy.
column2: 许多国防专家、前美军领导人和政治家都认为要实施布什的宏大计划，美军，特别是陆军的规模太小了。

column1: Secretary of Defense Donald Rumsfeld, on the other hand, believes the size of the military is adequate if it is re-organized for maximum efficiency.
column2: 但另一方面，国防部长拉姆斯菲尔德认为如果通过重组使效能最大化，那么美军现有的规模足够了。

column1: He is also concerned that an increase in the size of the military will diminish funds available for advanced technology and systems.
column2: 他还担心扩军会使在先进技术和系统方面的投入减少。

column1: Because Rumsfeld is the primary architect of the upcoming defense review, it is very unlikely to recommend an increase in the size of the force.
column2: 由于拉氏是即将出台的国防评估的首要负责人，所以这份评估不大可能会建议扩大军队规模。

column1: The changes underway in American defense policy reflect planning assumptions.
column2: 美国国防政策正在发生的变化反映了一些规划性的假设。

column1: The strategy that emerges will be only as strong as these assumptions are accurate.
column2: 这些假设的准确度将会决定该战略的有效性。

column1: The upcoming defense review will mandate changes based on events of the past five years, focusing especially on Iraq, Afghanistan, and other aspects of the war on terror.
column2: 即将出台的国防评估将会以过去五年所发生的事件，特别是以伊拉克、阿富汗和反恐战争的其它方面为基础，要求进行改革。

column1: The question is whether future American military missions will replicate those of the past five years.
column2: 问题是未来的美国军事使命是否会照搬过去五年以来的先例。

column1: If not, the US might be preparing for the last war rather than the next one.
column2: 如果答案是否定的，那么美国可能就会为其最后一场而��是下一场战争做准备了。

column1: One hopes that the 2005 Defense Review will address this issue, although it is certain to answer some strategic questions and leave others open to continued debate.
column2: 我们希望《2005国防评估》会着手解决这一问题，虽然它肯定会回答一些战略问题而将其他的留在日后商榷。

column1: In any case, the new review will serve as a roadmap for future US defense policy, thus affecting America’s partners and adversaries alike.
column2: 无论如何，新的评估报告会成为美国未来国防政策的路线图，从而对美国的伙伴和敌人都产生影响。

column1: Will the Sun Still Rise?
column2: 日本能否再次崛起？

column1: TOKYO – The scale of the earthquake and tsunami that struck Japan in March was far greater than even the authorities’ worst scenarios foresaw.
column2: 发自东京 — — 3月那场地震海啸灾难的破坏程度比日本当局的最悲观预计还要严重。

column1: Nearly six months later, the total damage remains difficult to estimate.
column2: 虽然灾难发生至今已近6个月，但总损失却依然无从统计。

column1: Social unrest and confusion, as well as radiation leaks from the Fukushima nuclear power plant, continue.
column2: 同时社会的动荡则与福岛核电站放射性泄露一样无法遏制，愈演愈烈。

column1: And now the country has absorbed another huge blow: another downgrade of its bond ratings. Both Moody’s and Standard & Poor’s now rate Japanese bonds at only their fourth-highest level.
column2: 如今这个国家再遭重创，穆迪和标准普尔两大国际评级机构都将日本国债评级调整到第四高的级别。

column1: So what policies should be implemented in response to these economic blows?
column2: 那么面对接踵而来的经济冲击，日本又该采取何种政策应对呢？

column1: Last year, Japan’s economy grew at a relatively healthy 3% annual rate, higher than in the United States or the European Union, owing mainly to the fiscal expansion undertaken after the collapse of Lehman Brothers in 2008.
column2: 得益于2008年雷曼兄弟破产后采取的扩张性财政政策，去年日本经济实现了相对健康的3%年增长率，高于美国和欧盟。

column1: But growth in 2011 had been predicted to slow even before the earthquake.
column2: 但2011年的增长预计会比地震前更差。

column1: Indeed, the economy shrank by 3.5% year on year in the first quarter.
column2: 事实上第一季度经济较去年同期下滑了3.5 % 。

column1: Now, with so much fixed capital and infrastructure destroyed by the earthquake and tsunami, the economy’s productive capacity has fallen by an estimated 2% of GDP.
column2: 如今又有如此海量的固定资产和基础设施遭到地震和海啸蹂躏，使日本企业的产能萎缩，其损失相当于2%的GDP。

column1: But that may not be a bad thing: Prior to the earthquake, Japan had a demand-supply gap of approximately 5% of GDP.
column2: 但这或许并不是件坏事：地震之前日本经济已经供大于求，而供需缺口约等于GDP的5 % 。

column1: While reducing this gap to 3% of GDP has led to higher prices, this is exactly what Japan needs after years of persistent deflation.
column2: 对于长期持续遭遇通货紧缩的日本来说，缺口下降到3%并引发物价上升的状况真是求之不得。

column1: Meanwhile, higher public spending on capital investment and other special procurements will boost domestic demand.
column2: 与此同时，在资本投资和其他特殊采购项目方面的高额公共支出将刺激日本内需。

column1: The Hanshin earthquake in 1995 destroyed capital stock worth 2% of GDP.
column2: 1995年的阪神大地震毁坏了相当于当年GDP2%的相关资产。

column1: This time, the loss is estimated at 3.4% of GDP, implying a larger increase in domestic demand if the right public policies are pursued.
column2: 而这次的损失则想当于GDP的3.4 % ， 意味着只要推行合理的公共政策，就能更大地提升国内需求。

column1: On the downside, confidence among consumers and investors alike has taken a hit, mainly owing to fears about radiation leakages and power shortages.
column2: 而负面因素则是出于对核泄漏的恐惧以及供电不足，消费者和投资者的信心也遭受重挫。

column1: According to the Japan Center for Economic Research, power-supply disruptions could negatively affect the Japanese economy for the next three years.
column2: 日本经济研究中心的报告认为电力短缺将影响未来三年的经济发展。

column1: If the Tokyo metropolitan area’s power supply were to decrease by 10% this year, for example, Japan’s GDP would fall by 2%.
column2: 如果东京大都市圈内的电力供应在今年内下降10%的话，日本的GDP就将下滑2 % 。

column1: Soon after the disaster, the government announced that reconstruction demand and higher prices would bring about relatively rapid economic recovery.
column2: 灾后日本内阁府宣称重建需求和物价上涨将带来相对较快的经济复苏。

column1: I think this view is too optimistic, because I suspect that the government wants to finance its new expenditure with a tax hike.
column2: 但笔者认为这个观点可能过于乐观，因为政府可能会加税来填补新的支出项目。

column1: Moreover, the extremely sharp contraction in first-quarter GDP may indicate that the disaster’s negative impact on the economy was more significant than expected.
column2: 此外今年第一季度GDP增长的极度萎缩可能意味着灾难对经济的影响要远超预期！

column1: Indeed, the economy is expected to have shrunk by another 2.6% year on year in the second quarter, with growth set to resume only in July-September.
column2: 日本经济预计将在今年第二季度继续遭遇2.6%的同比下滑，直到7~9月才能恢复增长。

column1: And, contrary to the government’s outlook, the start of economic recovery could be delayed until the end of this year, with medium-term annual growth reaching 1.5- 2%.
column2: 但相对于政府的预测，经济复苏的启动时间将推迟到年末，中期年增长率则会维持在1.5%到2%之间。

column1: A key question has been the disaster’s impact on global supply chains.
column2: 而另一个问题则关于这场灾难对全球供应链的影响。

column1: According to Japan’s Ministry of Economy, Trade, and Industry, which surveyed firms roughly a month after the earthquake, more than 60% of production sites in affected areas had already recovered as of April 15.
column2: 据日本经济产业省在灾难爆发一个月后所进行的调查，受灾地区超过60%的生产场所已经在4月15日前恢复运作。

column1: Almost 30% expected to recover by the summer, and the remaining 10% foresaw normal operations after the autumn.
column2: 还有30%预计将在今年夏天复工，而剩下的10%则有望在秋后恢复生产。

column1: But the impact of even a small number of disruptions to supply chains can be highly significant, particularly for the Asia-Pacific region.
column2: 但即便是供应链的其中一个小环节受损，所造成的影响都可能极为严重 — — 分布在亚太地区的产业链尤甚。

column1: Consider Renesas Electronics, a medium-size company, with ¥150 billion ($1.9 billion) in annual sales, which accounts for more than half of worldwide production of essential micro-computing components for automobiles.
column2: 以日本瑞萨电子为例，这个年销售额1500亿日元（约合19亿美元）的中型企业负责为汽车提供某个必不可少的微电脑部件，供应量占全球一半以上。

column1: Partly as a result of the damage at Renesas, Toyota’s capacity-utilization rate dropped to 50% at the beginning of May.
column2: 由于该企业受灾，丰田汽车5月初的产能利用率下降了超过50 % 。

column1: Likewise, the chemical manufacturer Kureha (¥130 billion in annual sales) has a 70% share of the global market for adhesive materials for lithium-ion batteries – a small but essential component of cell phones.
column2: 同样，Kureha这个年销售额1300亿日元的化工企业负责供应全球70%的锂电池黏性材料 — — 锂电池虽小，却是手机不可或缺的部件。

column1: Nokia in Finland, for example, imports 12% of its cell-phone components from Japan, and thus could be indirectly affected by the disaster.
column2: 芬兰的诺基亚公司有12%的锂电池需要从日本进口，并因此受到了地震海啸灾害的间接影响。

column1: As a result, more companies are likely to create and implement business continuity plans.
column2: 因此更多日本企业都在着手制定和实施“持续经营计划 ” 。

column1: Indeed, “BCP” is set to become a key term in the region’s economic discourse.
column2: 事实上，这类计划将成为受灾区域经济的关键议题。

column1: Using BCPs to determine alternative producers means that regional economies will be integrated in a new form, with companies establishing cooperative relationships even with their competitors.
column2: 利用持续经营计划来确定其他的可替代供应商意味着该区域经济将以一种新的形势重新整合，而企业甚至会和自己的竞争对手建立合作关系。

column1: Unfortunately, Japan’s public officials appear incapable of similar flexibility.
column2: 但不幸的是，日本的官僚们却似乎缺乏类似的弹性。

column1: The disaster confirmed the traditional view of Japan as a country that combines a dynamic private sector with an anemic public sector and central administration.
column2: 这次大灾其实证实了一个观点：日本就是一个极富活力的私人部门与死气沉沉的公共部门与中央政府的结合体。

column1: The government’s mistakes in so-called “risk communication” regarding the Fukushima nuclear plant, and its slowness in getting necessary aid to people displaced by the disaster, have once again put the stereotype on full display.
column2: 政府在福岛核电站事故中的所谓“危机沟通”中所犯的错误以及在救助灾民时的迟钝表现都一再印证了这个老观点。

column1: In terms of international relations, however, the disaster could improve Japan’s bilateral ties with influential countries.
column2: 但在国际关系方面，这场灾难将改善日本与周边主要国家的双边关系。

column1: For example, Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao and South Korean President Lee Myung-bak met with outgoing Japanese Prime Minister Naoto Kan in Fukushima, near the damaged plant – helping to ease neighboring countries’ concerns about radiation leakage.
column2: 例如中国国家总理温家宝和韩国总统李明博最近都在福岛附近地区与时任日本首相菅直人进行了会晤 — — 也有助于缓解邻近各国对核泄漏的担忧。

column1: Moreover, Japan’s relations with the US, which had suffered since the Democratic Party of Japan came to power two years ago, appear to have emerged from the disaster stronger than ever.
column2: 此外，自从两年前日本民主党上台后就步入低谷的日美关系似乎在灾后有所巩固。

column1: Japan’s Self-Defense Forces played an important role in rescue and restoration activities, with about half of its 200,000 personnel dispatched to the damaged area.
column2: 日本自卫队在灾后拯救和修复方面扮演了重要角色，派遣了全部20万兵力中的一半进入灾区。

column1: While this severely weakened Japan’s defenses, the US ensured East Asia’s security by deploying an aircraft carrier and cruisers, and American forces also searched for missing victims together with the JSDF.
column2: 而此举虽然严重削弱了日本的防御能力，但美国专门派遣了一艘航空母舰和巡洋舰来维护东亚安全局势，同时美军也与自卫队一道搜索灾难失踪者。

column1: But Japan’s neighbors expect rapid reconstruction and normalization, and for that, stronger political leadership is needed.
column2: 周边邻国都希望日本能尽快实现重建和经济正常化，而这意味着我们需要一个强大的政治领导。

column1: The earthquake and tsunami have confronted Japan with a profound crisis – but also with a rare opportunity to undertake the comprehensive reforms that the country has postponed for far too long.
column2: 地震和海啸无疑使日本遭遇了深刻危机 — — 但也提供了一个绝佳的契机，使其能够推行拖延已久的全面改革。

column1: Will the US-Japan Alliance Survive?
column2: 美日同盟会继续吗？

column1: CAMBRIDGE – Next year marks the 50th anniversary of the United States-Japan Security Treaty, a central feature of stability in East Asia for half a century.
column2: 坎布里奇 — — 明年是《美日安全条约》五十周年纪念日，半个世纪以来它一直是东亚稳定的核心特色。

column1: But now, with the Japanese experiencing a period of domestic political uncertainty, and North Korea’s nuclear tests and missile launches increasing their anxiety, will Japan reverse its long-standing decision not to seek a national nuclear-deterrent capability?
column2: 但现在当日本国内政治前途未卜，北朝鲜的核试验和导弹发射又使他们更加焦虑的时候，日本会不会改变不寻求国家核威慑力的决策？

column1: Is the US-Japan alliance coming to an end?
column2: 美日同盟是否正面临解体之厄？

column1: In the early 1990’s, many Americans regarded Japan as an economic threat.
column2: 20世纪90年代初，许多美国人视日本为经济威胁。

column1: Some people – in both countries – viewed the security alliance as a Cold War relic to be discarded.
column2: 美日两国都有人认为应当作为冷战遗物摒弃安全同盟。

column1: These trends were reversed by the Clinton administration’s 1995 “East Asia Strategy Report.”
column2: 克林顿政府1995年的《东亚策略报告》扭转了这种趋势。

column1: In 1996, the Clinton-Hashimoto Declaration stated that the US-Japan security alliance was the foundation for stability that would allow growing prosperity in post-Cold War East Asia.
column2: 1996年，克林顿－桥本声明提出美日安全同盟为保障后冷战时期东亚日渐繁荣起到了稳定基石的作用。

column1: That approach has continued on a bipartisan basis in the US, and polls show that it retains broad acceptance in Japan.
column2: 这种姿态继续在美国被两大政党所接受，且民意测验显示这种观点也被日本人广泛接受。

column1: Most close observers of the relationship agree that the US-Japan alliance is in much better shape today than 15 years ago.
column2: 美日关系的多数密切观察者认定，今天的美日同盟比15年健康得多。

column1: Nonetheless, the alliance faces three major challenges in a new external environment.
column2: 尽管如此，同盟还是在新的外部环境中面临三大挑战。

column1: One is North Korea, whose recent behavior has been clever and deceptive.
column2: 其一是北朝鲜，它最近的举动既聪明又有欺骗性。

column1: The North Koreans have violated their agreements, knowing that China, the country with the greatest potential leverage, is most concerned about regime collapse in North Korea, and thus the threat of chaos on its borders.
column2: 北朝鲜违反协定，因为他们知道潜在影响力最大的中国最担心北韩政权崩溃，进而在中朝边境上造成混乱。

column1: Japan officially endorses the objective of a non-nuclear world, but it relies on America’s extended nuclear deterrent, and wants to avoid being subject to nuclear blackmail from North Korea (or China).
column2: 日本官方赞同实现无核世界的目标，但却依赖于美国的延伸核威慑，希望避开来自北朝鲜（或中国）的核敲诈。

column1: The Japanese fear that the credibility of American extended deterrence will be weakened if the US decreases its nuclear forces to parity with China.
column2: 日本人害怕如果美国将核力量降低到与中国对等，美国延伸威慑的可信度将会减弱。

column1: It is a mistake, however, to believe that extended deterrence depends on parity in numbers of nuclear weapons.
column2: 但认为延伸威慑有赖于核武器数量对等是一种误解。

column1: Rather, it depends on a combination of capability and credibility.
column2: 相反，它取决于核能力与核信用的结合。

column1: During the Cold War, the US was able to defend Berlin because our promise to do so was made credible by the NATO alliance and the presence of American troops, whose lives would be on the line in the event of a Soviet attack.
column2: 在冷战期间，美国能够保护柏林是因为北约联盟和美军进驻使我们的承诺真实可信，如果苏联进攻，美国士兵的生命将处在危险之中。

column1: Indeed, the best guarantee of American extended deterrence over Japan remains the presence of nearly 50,000 American troops (which Japan helps to maintain with generous host-nation support).
column2: 实际上，美国对日延伸威慑的最佳保障依然是近50，000名美军的进驻（这支部队的存在也有赖于日本慷慨的东道支持 ） 。

column1: Credibility is also enhanced by joint projects such as the development of regional ballistic missile defense.
column2: 发展地区弹道导弹防御等联合项目也提高了同盟的可信度。

column1: Equally important are American actions that show the high priority that the US gives to the alliance, and its guarantees not to engage in what Japan fears will be “Japan-passing” in its relations with Asia.
column2: 表明美国重视美日同盟的行动以及不像日本人担心的那样在对亚洲关系中“忽略日本”的保证也同等重要。

column1: That is why it was so important that US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton’s first trip was to Asia, and her first stop in Japan.
column2: 它解释了希拉里·克林顿国务卿上任后首访亚洲、而首访亚洲时又将首站定为日本为什么如此重要。

column1: It is also why it is mistaken to speak of a formal G-2 with China, rather than multilateral cooperation.
column2: 它还解释了探讨中美两国正式峰会，而不是多边合作为什么是错的。

column1: A second challenge for Japan is the dramatic rise of China’s economy.
column2: 中国经济的戏剧性崛起是日本面临的第二大挑战。

column1: Although an important trade partner, China’s growing power makes Japan nervous.
column2: 虽然是日本重要的贸易伙伴，但中国日渐强大的力量令日本感到不安。

column1: When re-negotiating the US-Japan security alliance in the 1990’s, Japanese leaders sometimes privately asked me if the US would desert Japan in favor of China.
column2: 20世纪90年代重新谈判美日安全同盟时，日本领导人有时私下问我美国是否会抛弃日本转而与中国交好。

column1: I responded then (and today) that there is little prospect of such a reversal, for two reasons.
column2: 我当时回答说发生这种逆转的可能性极小（现在我的回答还是一样 ） ， 原因有两个。

column1: First, China poses a potential threat, whereas Japan does not.
column2: 第一，中国会带来潜在威胁，而日本不会。

column1: Second, the US shares democratic values with Japan, and China is not a democracy.
column2: 第二，美日之间拥有共同的民主价值观，而中国不是民主国家。

column1: Moreover, China’s internal evolution remains uncertain.
column2: 此外，我们也无法确定中国的内部变化。

column1: While Chinese are more free today than at any time in their history, China’s political evolution has lagged behind its economic progress.
column2: 尽管今天的中国比历史上任何时候都更加自由，但中国的政治改革已经落后于经济发展。

column1: Unlike India, China has not solved the problem of political participation.
column2: 和印度不同的是，参政问题在中国并没有得到解决。

column1: There is always a residual danger that China will embrace nationalism to ward off domestic problems.
column2: 因此中国借民族主义逃避国内问题的危险永远存在着。

column1: At the same time, it is in the interest of the US, Japan, and China that China’s rise be peaceful and harmonious (in the words of Chinese leaders).
column2: 与此同时，中国和平和谐（用中国领导人的话说）的崛起符合美、日、中三方的利益。

column1: Treat China as an enemy, and you guarantee enmity.
column2: 把中国当成敌人注定会收获仇恨。

column1: That is why the strategy of integration, plus a hedge against uncertainty, makes sense for both the US and Japan.
column2: 这也解释了融合策略，再加上对不确定性防范，为什么适用于美日两国。

column1: Indeed, there are strong grounds for the US, Japan, and China to engage in areas of trilateral and other regional cooperation.
column2: 实际上，美国、日本和中国有充分的理由在三边及其他地区合作中互相配合。

column1: Third, the US-Japan alliance will have to face a new set of transnational challenges to our vital interests, such as pandemics, terrorism, and human outflows from failed states.
column2: 第三，美日同盟将不得不面对传染病、恐怖主义和失败国家人口流出等对我们根本利益的新一轮跨国挑战。

column1: Chief among these challenges is the threat posed by global warming, with China having surpassed the US as the leading producer of carbon-dioxide emissions (though not in per capita terms).
column2: 在这些挑战中居于首要地位的是全球变暖，中国已经超越美国成为二氧化碳第一大排放国（虽然从人均角度衡量并非如此 ） 。

column1: Fortunately, this is an area that plays to Japan’s strengths.
column2: 幸运的是，这个领域是日本的强项。

column1: Although some Japanese complain about the unequal nature of the alliance’s security components, owing to the limits that Japan has accepted on the use of force, in these new areas, Japan is a stronger partner.
column2: 尽管某些日本人由于日本接受了运用武力的限制条款而抱怨同盟安全条款不平等，但在这些新领域中，日本是更强有力的伙伴。

column1: Japan’s overseas development assistance in places ranging from Africa to Afghanistan, its participation in global health projects, its support of the United Nations, its naval participation in anti-piracy operations, and its research and development on energy efficiency place it at the forefront in dealing with the new transnational challenges.
column2: 日本的海外发展援助遍及从非洲到阿富汗的各个角落，它对全球健康计划的支持、对联合国的支持、派海军参与打击海盗行动、以及它在能效方面的研发工作使其处在应对新跨国挑战的前沿。

column1: Given today’s agenda, there is enormous potential for an equal partnership, working with others, in the provision of global public goods that will benefit the US, Japan, and the rest of the world.
column2: 在今天的大背景下，建立平等的伙伴关系、为全球公共利益相互合作从而使美、日和世界其他国家从中受益的潜力巨大。

column1: That is why I remain optimistic about the future of the US-Japan alliance.
column2: 这也解释了我为什么对美日同盟的未来持乐观态度。

column1: Can Trump’s Sanctions Break Iran?
column2: 特朗普的制裁能击垮伊朗吗？

column1: LONDON – “The Iran sanctions have officially been cast,” tweeted US President Donald Trump three months after he signed an executive order in May announcing his administration’s withdrawal from the 2015 Iran nuclear deal.
column2: 伦敦 — “ 伊朗制裁已经正式开始 ， ” 美国总统特朗普在5月份签署宣布其政府退出2015年伊核协议之后三个月发推特说。

column1: He went on to boast the return of “the most biting sanctions ever imposed,” as if sounding the death knell of the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA), as the deal is officially known.
column2: 他接着夸耀恢复了“史上最严厉制裁 ” ， 好像已经敲响了联合全面行动计划（JCPOA，伊核协议的正式名称）的警钟。

column1: The announcement took few observers by surprise.
column2: 特朗普如此宣布并没有让观察者们意外。

column1: But the irony was not lost on Wendy Sherman, the JCPOA’s senior US negotiator, who quipped recently that she had always expected “the greatest challenge to the deal’s success would be violations by Iran, not the political machinations of the president of the United States.”
column2: 但JCPOA的美国资深谈判员温迪·谢尔曼（Wendy Sherman）突显出其讽刺之处，她最近从这个她一直认为“取得成功最大的挑战将来自伊朗违规，而非美国总统的政治诡计”的协议中辞职。

column1: Indeed, Iran and the US seem to have reversed roles: Iran’s isolation before the deal now contrasts with America’s determination to swim against the global tide.
column2: 事实上，伊朗和美国似乎发生了角色颠倒：协议签订前是伊朗被孤立，这与美国逆全球潮流而动形成鲜明对比。

column1: Disappointment, if not disbelief, prevailed among the JCPOA’s other parties – the European Union countries, Russia, and China – whose leaders were quick to reaffirm their strong commitment to the agreement.
column2: JCPOA的其他各方 — — 欧盟国家、俄罗斯和中国 — — 无不感到失望甚至信念破碎，这些国家的领导人很快就重申将强烈支持伊核协议。

column1: By contrast, US officials have reiterated the Trump administration’s determination permanently to rein in Iran’s “nuclear ambitions,” limit its ballistic missiles program, and scale down its regional influence.
column2: 相反，美国官员重申特朗普决心要永久封杀伊朗的“核野心 ” ， 限制其弹道导弹计划，并削弱其地区影响力。

column1: By the sanctions’ final stage, which kicks in on November 4 (coinciding, as it happens, with the 39th anniversary of the abduction of diplomats and staff at the US Embassy in Tehran in 1979), the US goal is to reduce Iran’s oil exports “down to zero.”
column2: 至于始于11月4日（恰巧正逢1979年美国驻德黑兰大使馆外交官和工作人员被绑架39周年）的制裁第一阶段，目标是将伊朗石油出口削减“到零 ” 。

column1: Given the long and fraught history of economic sanctions against Iran, the question looming now is whether this time they are more likely to be effective in changing the regime or its behavior.
column2: 从漫长又令人心忧的伊朗经济制裁史看，现在的问题是这一次的制裁在改变伊朗体制或行为方面是否可能奏效。

column1: The last time Iran’s oil exports were reduced to negligible levels through an extensive economic boycott was in the mid-twentieth century, when Iran’s popularly elected prime minister, Mohammad Mossadegh, nationalized the oil industry.
column2: 上一次通过全面经济抵制让伊朗石油出口下降到可忽略水平是在二十世纪中叶，当时，伊朗深孚众望的当选总理摩萨德实施了石油工业国有化。

column1: A British-led blockade of Iran’s oil brought the industry to a virtual standstill, destabilized the economy, and paved the way for the infamous US and UK-instigated coup which restored the Shah to power in 1953.
column2: 英国发动的抵制伊朗是有运动让伊朗石油业几乎停滞，经济陷入动荡，也为美国和英国煽动臭名昭著的1953年沙复辟政变铺平了道路。

column1: Such has been the hangover from those tumultuous years that it took a half-century for US Secretary of State Madeleine Albright to acknowledge in 2000 that the coup that ousted Mossadegh was a clear “setback for Iran’s political development” and a key reason “why many Iranians continue to resent this intervention by America.”
column2: 这些骚动年代的余波让半个世纪后的美国国务卿奥尔布赖特在2000年时承认推翻摩萨德的政变显然是“伊朗政治发展的倒退 ” ， 也是“大量伊朗人憎恨美国干预”的关键原因。

column1: Such remorse, if it can be considered that, did not, however, close the door on more sanctions against Iran.
column2: 但如此懊悔也没能阻止对伊朗采取更多制裁。

column1: Sanctions imposed by the US and the EU from 2010 to 2015 had mixed results.
column2: 2010—2015年间美国和欧盟所施加的制裁效果喜忧参半。

column1: These comprehensive measures – described by then-US Vice President Joe Biden as “the most crippling sanctions in the history of sanctions,” shrank oil exports by two-thirds, to below one million barrels a day.
column2: 这些全面措施 — — 时任美国副总统拜登称之为 “制裁史上最令人窒息的制裁 ” — —让伊朗石油出口量减少了三分之二，至每天一百万桶以下。

column1: The resulting stagflation heaped misery on ordinary Iranians, with GDP contracting almost 6% in 2012 and inflation averaging 35% the following year.
column2: 由此导致的滞涨让普通伊朗老百姓不堪重负，2012年，GDP收缩了6 % ， 第二年，平均通胀达到了 35 % 。

column1: Widespread private-sector failures and growing unemployment followed.
column2: 私人部门的大量破产和不断升高的失业接踵而至。

column1: Contrary to the sanctions’ principal objectives, however, the economic and political hold of the public sector and parastatal organizations strengthened.
column2: 但与制裁的主要目标背道而驰的是，公共部门和准政府组织的经济和政治控制力不降反升。

column1: Meanwhile, Iran insisted on its sovereign right to pursue a peaceful nuclear program.
column2: 与此同时，伊朗坚持发展和平核计划的主权权利。

column1: The scope for compromise seemed absent until the reformist administration of President Hassan Rouhani took over in 2013.
column2: 直到2013年伊朗改革派总统鲁哈尼上台，才有了妥协空间。

column1: So what is different this time?
column2: 那么，这一次有什么不同？

column1: Though promising to be even more biting, the US sanctions regime is not backed by UN Security Council resolutions and hence lacks international legitimacy.
column2: 尽管美国的制裁号称更加严厉，但并没有联合国安理会决议的支持，因此不具有国际合法性。

column1: This means Iran’s isolation will be far less complete, with key trading partners such as China and Turkey already announcing that they will abide by “legal” sanctions only.
column2: 这意味着伊朗并非完全孤立，中国和土耳其等重要贸易伙伴都已宣布只配合“合法的”制裁。

column1: But the sanctions’ de facto, not de jure, status will determine their effectiveness.
column2: 但制裁的实际而非法律地位才是决定其效果的因素。

column1: This is especially true of European firms, which will ultimately decide the outcome of the battle for secondary sanctions in cognizance of their shareholders’ interests, rather than the political machinations of their governments.
column2: 对于欧洲企业来说尤其如此，其股东的利益，而非政府的政治诡计，才是决定二级制裁（secondary sanctions）的结果的因素。

column1: This explains the significant stream of exits from Iran’s markets already announced by large firms.
column2: 这解释了为何大量大企业宣布退出伊朗市场。

column1: In an interconnected world where US economic influence extends far and wide, it is hard even for European firms – auto manufacturers, airlines, energy companies, banks, and the like – to risk the ire of the US Treasury.
column2: 在这个美国经济影响力大得多、广得多的联动世界，即便是欧洲企业 — — 汽车制造商、航空公司、能源公司、银行等 — — 也不敢冒险触怒美国财政部。

column1: This means that the ultimate success of sanctions is likely to depend on what others make of them as much as on what Iran does.
column2: 这意味着制裁的最终成功不但取决于伊朗做什么，也依赖于其他国家怎么做。

column1: But domestic conditions in Iran also play a key role, and it is here that the US seems to be basing its confidence that sanctions will “succeed.”
column2: 但伊朗的国内情况也起着重要作用，而美国认为制裁将“成功”的信心基础也在这里。

column1: For months, Iranian cities have been rocked by widespread protests, ostensibly against worsening economic conditions.
column2: 几个月来，伊朗各大城市爆发了广泛的示威，表面上看，是因为经济情况的恶化。

column1: These outbursts have weakened Iran’s reformers by undermining their monopoly on hope.
column2: 这些示威的爆发破坏了伊朗改革派对希望垄断，削弱了他们的地位。

column1: Hardliners, it seems, have been offered a new lease on life and can now claim their dismissal of the JCPOA was justified from the start.
column2: 强硬派赢得喘息之机，现在，他们可以宣称他们对JCPOA的抵制从一开始就是正确的。

column1: The economic impact has already been felt, with the Iranian currency going into freefall after speculation about a US withdrawal from the deal began.
column2: 经济影响已经能够深切感受到，自人们开始猜测美国将推出伊核协议以来，伊朗货币价值暴跌。

column1: The specter of inflation is back.
column2: 通胀的幽灵卷土重来。

column1: Ultimately, for sanctions to succeed from the US perspective, they must bring about either regime change or behavioral change.
column2: 最终，从美国角度要让制裁成功，必须实现政权更迭或行为改变。

column1: Historically, sanctions have a less-than-convincing track record (think Cuba, Myanmar, and Zimbabwe) on achieving the former, and whether they can pave the way for the latter, in the form of a negotiated settlement, remains to be seen.
column2: 历史上，制裁对前者的效果十分有限（想想古巴、缅甸和津巴布韦 ） ， 至于能否为后者（以商定和解为标志）奠定基础仍有待观察。

column1: But one thing is clear: applied to Iran, the “Trump doctrine” of pushing one’s foes to the brink, in the hope that they will blink first, has entered uncharted terrain.
column2: 但有一件事是清楚的：在伊朗身上，将敌人逼到墙角希望其就范的“特朗普主义”已经进入了未知领域。

column1: Renminbi Rising?
column2: 人民币崛起？

column1: SHANGHAI – China is increasingly debating whether or not the renminbi should be internationalized, possibly joining the US dollar and the euro as an international vehicle currency (IVC) – that is, a currency that other countries use to denominate the prices of their traded goods and international loans.
column2: 上海—在中国，一场日益激烈的争论是人民币是否应该国际化，加入美元和欧元的行列成为国际媒介货币（international vehicle currency，IVC ） ， 即其他国家用来为贸易商品和国际贷款计价的货币。

column1: Related to this is a debate about whether Shanghai can become a first-tier international financial center (1-IFC) like London and New York.
column2: 与此有关的一场争论是上海是否能够成为顶级国际金融中心（first-tier international financial center ，1-IFC ） ， 与伦敦和纽约相抗衡。

column1: Financial history can help to answer these questions.
column2: 金融史可以帮助回答这些问题。

column1: First, a city can become a 1-IFC only if its national currency is an IVC.
column2: 首先，一个城市只有在所在国货币成为IVC时才可能成为1-IFC。

column1: But, as London’s status shows, a longtime 1-IFC can retain its position in the international financial system even if its currency is no longer an IVC.
column2: 但是，正如伦敦的地位所表明的，即使所在国货币已不再是IVC，老牌1-IFC仍可以保有其在国际金融体系中的地位。

column1: Second, the transaction cost of using a foreign currency as a medium of exchange is inversely proportional to the extent to which that currency is used globally.
column2: 其次，使用外国货币作为交易媒介的交易成本与这种货币的全球使用程度成反比。

column1: Similar economies of scale characterize foreign investors’ use of a particular international financial center.
column2: 外国投资者使用某一特定国际金融中心具有类似的规模经济特征。

column1: As a result, there cannot be more than three or four IVCs and 1-IFCs.
column2: 因此，IVC和1-IFC的数量不会超过三四个。

column1: Third, a country’s financial sector must be both open, with no capital-flow restrictions, and sophisticated, with a wide range of instruments and institutions.
column2: 第三，一国的金融部门必须是开放的，没有资本管制，并且十分成熟，具备各种工具和机构。

column1: It must also be safe, with a central bank maintaining economic stability, prudential regulators keeping fraud and speculation in check, macro-prudential authorities displaying adequate financial fire-fighting capabilities, and a legal system that is predictable, transparent, and fair.
column2: 它还必须是安全的，有一家维持经济稳定的中央银行，有监督欺诈和投机的审慎监管者，有足够的金融救火能力的宏观审慎当局，有可预测、透明、公正的司法体系。

column1: Last – and most important – successful convergence to IVC and 1-IFC status requires the national economy to be strong relative to other economies for a substantial period of time.
column2: IVC和1-IFC的第四个（也是最重要的一个）成功秘诀是，在相当长的一段时间里，其国民经济相对其他经济体保持优势。

column1: The United Kingdom occupied a position of global economic leadership for more than a century.
column2: 英国占据全球经济领导地位超过一百年。

column1: In 1914, the US/UK GDP ratio was 2.1, but the US dollar was not an IVC, suggesting that America’s relative economic strength was inadequate.
column2: 1914年，美国/英国GDP之比为2.1，但美元仍不是IVC，这表明美国的相对经济实力仍不够强大。

column1: A decade later, in 1924, the ratio was 3.2 and rising – and the US dollar had eclipsed the British pound as the most important IVC.
column2: 十年后的1924年，美国/英国GDP之比变为3.2，并呈现继续上升之势，美元也超过英镑成为最重要的IVC。

column1: Relative economic strength explains why the Japanese yen failed to develop into an IVC, and why Tokyo – whose financial markets satisfied the relevant requirements – failed to become a 1-IFC.
column2: 相对经济强势解释了为何日元没有发展成为IVC，以及东京 — — 其金融市场已满足相关条件 — — 没有能够成为1-IFC。

column1: With its GDP reaching only about 60% of America’s at its peak in 1991, Japan never attained the critical mass required to induce foreigners to use the yen to lower transaction costs.
column2: 在1991年的最高峰，日本GDP只有美国的60 % ， 因此日本从未达到过促使外国人使用日元来降低交易成本的临界值。

column1: Determining the future international status of the renminbi and Shanghai must begin with a calculation of China’s expected relative economic strength vis-à-vis the US under two plausible scenarios.
column2: 确定人民币和上海的未来国际地位必须从计算两种大概率情形下中国对美国的相对经济强度开始。

column1: In the first scenario, China becomes caught in a middle-income trap, with per capita GDP stuck at 30% of America’s – an outcome that has characterized Latin America’s five largest economies since at least 1960, and Malaysia since 1994.
column2: 在第一种情形中，中国将陷入中等收入陷阱，人均GDP停留在美国的30 % — —拉美最大的五个经济体自1960年以来便处于这一状态，马来西亚则从1994年开始处于这一状态。

column1: This would put China’s economic strength relative to the US at 1.1 – well below the necessary ratio.
column2: 这意味着中国对美国的相对经济强度为1.1，远远低于必要条件比率。

column1: In the second, more favorable scenario, China’s per capita GDP would reach 80% of America’s – higher than the 70% average rate for the five largest Western European countries since 1960 – and its economic strength relative to the US would amount to roughly 2.8.
column2: 在第二种较有利的情形中，中国人均GDP将达到美国的80 % — —高于西欧最大的五个经济体自1960年以来的平均水平70 % — —其对美国的相对经济强度将达到2.8左右。

column1: This would make the renminbi eligible for IVC status and enable Shanghai to choose whether to become a 1-IFC.
column2: 这意味着人民币有资格获得IVC地位，上海也有资格选择是否成为1-IFC。

column1: But China’s economy still would not be strong enough relative to the US for natural market forces to ensure the renminbi’s international success.
column2: 但中国经济相对美国的强度不足以保证通过自然市场力量让人民币获得国际成功。

column1: Given this, the Chinese government would have to implement decisive measures to encourage international traders and creditors to price their transactions in renminbi.
column2: 基于此，中国政府必须采取果断措施鼓励国际交易者和债权人用人民币为交易定价。

column1: Specifically, China would have to use its market power to promote pricing in renminbi for relevant manufactured exports and raw-material imports, and encourage renminbi denomination of foreign financial assets that China purchases (which the country’s status as a net creditor should facilitate).
column2: 具体而言，中国必须利用其市场实力促使用人民币为相关出口制造品和原材料进口品定价，并鼓励用人民币为中国购买的外国金融资产计价（在这方面，中国的净债权人地位应能有所助益 ） 。

column1: But there are serious pitfalls to avoid in this process.
column2: 但在此过程中需要规避诸多陷阱。

column1: As the Asian financial crisis of 1997-1998 demonstrated, capital-account liberalization could lead to financial meltdowns – a danger that opponents of internationalizing the renminbi often cite.
column2: 正如1997—1998年亚洲金融危机所标明的，资本账户自由化可能导致金融崩溃 — — 这也是人民币国际化的反对者经常提到的危险。

column1: But these risks do not outweigh the potential benefits of financial openness, and they can be minimized with effective monitoring and regulation, including requirements for large capital buffers and low leverage ratios, together with strong crisis-response mechanisms, like a resolution trust corporation.
column2: 但这些风险尚不足以胜过金融开放的潜在好处，也可以通过有效监控和监管实现最小化，包括提高资本缓冲、降低杠杆率以及成立清算信托公司等强大的危机反应机制。

column1: In fact, effective financial-monitoring and prudential-regulation systems do not have to precede opening the capital account.
column2: 事实上，有效的金融监控和审慎管理体系并不一定要先于资本账户开放。

column1: On the contrary, developing and enacting financial regulation must be a gradual process, shaped by both existing knowledge and firsthand experience.
column2: 相反，发展和实施金融监管必须是渐进过程，根据现有知识和第一手经验改进。

column1: After all, no financial market is either completely open or completely closed forever; the degree of openness at a given moment depends on policy choices.
column2: 毕竟，不存在永远完全开放或封闭的金融市场，给定时刻的开放程度根据政策选择而定。

column1: The recent establishment of the Shanghai Free Trade Zone will allow for the emergence of an offshore international financial center that offers real-world training to China’s regulators.
column2: 最近成立的上海自由贸易区将允许离岸国际金融中心的出现，中国监管者将受到真实世界的训练。

column1: This will give them the tools they need to recognize the signs of a developing crisis, defuse the threat, and efficiently handle the recapitalization and reorganization of failed financial institutions.
column2: 这将让他们获得识别危机发展信号、扼杀风险、有效处理倒闭金融机构资本重组所需要的工具。

column1: China’s pursuit of an IVC and a 1-IFC city would serve not only its own interests.
column2: 中国对IVC和1-IFC的追求不仅符合其自身利益。

column1: Allowing the renminbi to help meet global demand for international reserves and risk diversification would also strengthen global financial stability.
column2: 让人民币帮助满足世界对国际储备和风险多元化的需求能加强全球金融稳定。

column1: There is little time to waste in internationalizing the renminbi.
column2: 人民币国际化刻不容缓。

column1: Given the limited number of currencies that can serve as IVCs, the failure of the renminbi to achieve IVC status before, say, the Indian rupee, the Russian ruble, or the Brazilian real could mean that the renminbi is denied IVC status – and that Shanghai fails to achieve 1-IFC status – for generations, if not forever.
column2: 能成为IVC的货币数量极为有限，如果人民币不能抢在印度卢比、俄罗斯卢布或巴西雷亚尔之前成为IVC将意味着在几代人的时间里（如果不是永远的话）人民币都将失去IVC地位，上海也将无法获得1-IFC地位。

column1: Winners and Losers in the Post-9/11 Era
column2: 后9/11时代的赢家和输家

column1: September 11, 2001, is one of those dates that mark a transformation in world politics.
column2: 2001年9月11日是标志世界政治转折的日子之一。

column1: Just as the fall of the Berlin Wall on November 9, 1989, signified the Cold War’s end, al-Qaeda’s attack on the United States opened a new epoch.
column2: 正如1989年11月9日柏林墙倒塌标志着冷战的结束，基地组织对美国的袭击开创了一个新的时代。

column1: A non-governmental group killed more Americans that day than the government of Japan did with its surprise attack on another transformative date, December 7, 1941.
column2: 一个非政府组织在那天杀死的美国人比日本政府在另一个具有转折意义的日子，1941年12月7日，发动突然袭击杀害的人数还要多。

column1: While the jihadi terrorist movement had been growing for a decade, 9/11 was the turning point.
column2: 尽管杰哈德恐怖运动10年来一直快速发展，9/11仍然是一个重要转折。

column1: Five years into this new era, how should we characterize it?
column2: 在如今离新时代开启已满5年之际，我们又该如何定义这个时代呢？

column1: Some believe that 9/11 ushered in a “clash of civilizations” between Islam vs. the West.
column2: 有人认为9/11导致了伊斯兰和西方之间“文明的碰撞 ” 。

column1: Indeed, that is probably what Osama bin Laden had in mind.
column2: 没错，那也许正是奥萨马·本·拉登袭击美国的初衷。

column1: Terrorism is a form of theater.
column2: 恐怖主义是一种戏剧化的模式。

column1: Extremists kill innocent people in order to dramatize their message in a way that shocks and horrifies their intended audience.
column2: 恐怖分子杀害无辜群众，以此来增强其信息的戏剧化效果，惊吓和恐吓他们的目标受众。

column1: They also rely on what Clark McCauley and others have called “jujitsu politics,” in which a smaller fighter uses the strength of the larger opponent to defeat him.
column2: 他们还必须依赖克拉克·麦考利和其他人所说的“柔道政治 ” ， 其核心是小个子斗士利用大个子对手的力量来击败他。

column1: In that sense, bin Laden hoped that the US would be lured into a bloody war in Afghanistan, similar to the Soviet intervention two decades earlier, which had created such a fertile recruiting ground for jihadists.
column2: 在这种意义上，本·拉登期望美国会禁不住引诱，像20年前苏联一样，在阿富汗发动一场血腥的战争。 苏联那次入侵为圣战分子创造了甚为肥沃的人员招募土壤。

column1: But the Americans used a modest amount of force to remove the Taliban government, avoided disproportionate civilian casualties, and were able to create an indigenous political framework.
column2: 但美国只派小股部队推翻了塔利班政府，避免了大规模的平民伤亡，还建立起了本土的政治框架。

column1: While far from perfect, the first round in the fight went to the US.
column2: 尽管远远称不上完美，但美国赢得了战争的第一个回合。

column1: Al-Qaeda lost the sanctuaries from which it planned its attacks; many of its leaders were killed or captured; and its central communications were severely disrupted.
column2: 基地组织失去了策划袭击活动的庇护所，很多高层领导人物命丧黄泉或锒铛入狱，其核心领导层的消息传递也严重受阻。

column1: Then the Bush administration succumbed to hubris and made the colossal mistake of invading Iraq without broad international support.
column2: 接着布什政府被傲慢自大冲昏了头脑，没有赢得国际社会的普遍支持就贸然入侵伊拉克。

column1: Iraq provided the symbols, civilian casualties, and recruiting ground that the jihadi extremists had sought in Afghanistan.
column2: 杰哈德极端分子在阿富汗未能得到的象征标志、平民伤亡和人员招募土壤，都在伊拉克战争中如愿以偿。

column1: Iraq was George Bush’s gift to Osama bin Laden.
column2: 伊拉克是布什送给奥萨马·本·拉登的一份厚礼。

column1: Al-Qaeda lost its central organizational capacity, but it became a symbol and focal point around which like-minded imitators could rally.
column2: 基地组织失去了核心组织能力，却成了号召思想极端的模仿者们的旗帜和焦点。

column1: With the help of the Internet, its symbols and training materials became easily available around the world.
column2: 通过互联网络，基地组织的标志和训练材料可以在全球范围内轻易得到。

column1: Whether al-Qaeda had a direct role in the Madrid and London bombings, or the recent plot to blow up airliners over the Atlantic, is less important than the way it has been transformed into a powerful “brand.”
column2: 无论基地组织是否直接参与了马德里和伦敦爆炸案，或者前不久在大西洋上空炸毁航班的阴谋，与它已经转型为恐怖主义最大“品牌”的事实相比都显得无关紧要。

column1: The second round went to the extremists.
column2: 极端分子赢得了第二回合。

column1: The outcome of future rounds in the struggle against jihadi terrorism will depend on our ability to avoid the trap of “jujitsu politics.”
column2: 反抗杰哈德恐怖主义今后斗争的结果将取决于我们能否避开“柔道政治”的重重陷阱。

column1: That will require more use of the soft power of attraction rather than relying so heavily on hard military power, as the Bush administration has done.
column2: 这需要更多利用吸引力等软性力量，而不能像布什政府那样过多地依赖强硬的军事实力。

column1: For the struggle is not a clash of Islam vs. the West, but a civil war within Islam between a minority of terrorists and a larger mainstream of non-violent believers.
column2: 因为这场斗争的双方不是伊斯兰和西方世界，而是伊斯兰内部矛盾，对立双方是少数恐怖分子，以及作为主流的伊斯兰非暴力信徒。

column1: Jihadi extremism cannot be defeated unless the mainstream wins.
column2: 只有主流获胜，才能击败杰哈德极端主义。

column1: Military force, intelligence, and international police cooperation needs to be used against hardcore terrorists affiliated with or inspired by al-Qaeda, but soft power is essential to attracting the mainstream and drying up support for the extremists.
column2: 这需要军队、情报和国际警察部门通力合作，打击基地组织下属、或在其感召下成立的强硬恐怖分子。 然而，在吸引伊斯兰主流民众、铲除对极端分子的支持方面，软性力量起着至关重要的作用。

column1: US Secretary of Defense Donald Rumsfeld once said that the measure of success in this war is whether the number of terrorists we are killing and deterring is larger than the number that the terrorists are recruiting.
column2: 美国国防部长拉姆斯菲尔德曾经说过：这场战争胜负的衡量标准是看我们杀死和遏制的恐怖分子是否超过了他们所吸收的新鲜血液。

column1: By this standard, we are doing badly.
column2: 按照这样的标准，我们的成绩不容乐观。

column1: In November 2003, the official number of terrorist insurgents in Iraq was given as 5,000.
column2: 2001年，伊拉克叛乱分子的官方统计数字是5，000。

column1: This year, it was reported to be 20,000.
column2: 今年，据称这个数字已经增加到20，000。

column1: As Brig. General Robert Caslen, the Pentagon’s deputy director for the war on terrorism, put it, “We are not killing them faster than they are being created.”
column2: 正如五角大楼副主任罗伯特·凯斯伦准将所说的那样 ， “ 我们消灭他们的速度远远比不上他们自我复制的速度 。 ”

column1: We are also failing in the application of soft power.
column2: 在软性力量的应用方面，我们也做得非常不够。

column1: According to Caslen, “We in the Pentagon are behind our adversaries in the use of communication – either to recruit or train.”
column2: 凯斯伦说 ， “ 五角大楼在宣传沟通的运用上不及我们的对手¾在人员招募和训练方面都是如此 。 ”

column1: The manner in which we use military power also affects Rumsfeld’s ratio.
column2: 我们使用军事力量的方式也影响到“拉姆斯菲尔德比 ” 。

column1: In the aftermath of 9/11, there was a good deal of sympathy and understanding around the world for America’s military response against the Taliban.
column2: 9/11事件后，全世界都对美国对塔利班的军事打击表示理解和同情，而美国入侵与9/11袭击毫无瓜葛的伊拉克将世界人民的同情挥霍殆尽。

column1: The US invasion of Iraq, a country that was not connected to the 9/11 attacks, squandered that good will, and the attractiveness of the US in Muslim countries like Indonesia plummeted from 75% approval in 2000 to half that level today.
column2: 美国在印度尼西亚等穆斯林国家的吸引力指数已经从2000年的74%大幅下降至上述比例的一半。

column1: Indeed, occupying a divided nation is messy, and it is bound to produce episodes like Abu Ghraib and Haditha, which undercut America’s attractiveness not just in Iraq, but around the world.
column2: 实际上，占领一个四分五裂的国家本身就非常棘手，像阿布格莱布和哈迪塞这样的事件几乎肯定会发生，它们使美国在伊拉克、乃至全球的吸引力都大受影响。

column1: The ability to combine hard and soft power is smart power.
column2: 硬性和软性力量的结合需要智慧。

column1: When the Soviet Union invaded Hungary and Czechoslovakia during the Cold War, it undercut the soft power that it had enjoyed in Europe in the aftermath of World War II.
column2: 苏联在冷战期间对匈牙利和捷克斯洛伐克的侵略破坏了二战结束时它在欧洲国家中曾经有过的软性力量。

column1: When Israel launched a lengthy bombing campaign in Lebanon last month, it created so many civilian casualties that the early criticisms of Hezbollah by Egypt, Jordan, and Saudi Arabia became untenable in Arab politics.
column2: 以色列上月在黎巴嫩的长时间轰炸造成了太多的平民伤亡，使得埃及、约旦和沙特阿拉伯从前对真主党的批判在阿拉伯政治中丧失了根基。

column1: When terrorist excesses killed innocent Muslim civilians such as Egyptian Islamic Jihad did in 1993 or Abu Musab al-Zarqawi did in Amman in 2005, they undercut their own soft power and lost support.
column2: 如果毫无节制的恐怖分子再像伊斯兰杰哈德1993年在埃及或者扎卡维2005年在安曼那样去杀害无辜的穆斯林民众，损害的将是他们自己的软性力量，失去的是民众对他们的支持。

column1: The most important lesson five years after 9/11 is that failure to combine hard and soft power effectively in the struggle against jihadi terrorism will lead us into the trap set by those who want a clash of civilizations.
column2: 9/11事件发生五年后最重大的教训是：如果不能在应对杰哈德恐怖主义的斗争中将硬性和软性力量有效地结合在一起，我们就会落入文化冲突论者早已设置好的陷阱。

column1: Muslims, including Islamists, have a diversity of views, so we need to be wary of strategies that help our enemies by uniting disparate forces behind one banner.
column2: 穆斯林，包括伊斯兰教徒在内，有着多种不同的观点，因此我们必须对能够帮助我们的敌人联合各种力量的策略保持警惕。

column1: We have a just cause and many potential allies, but our failure to combine hard and soft power into a smart strategy could be fatal.
column2: 我们拥有正义的事业和很多潜在的盟友，但如果不能将硬性和软性力量结合成明智的策略，将可能给我们带来致命的打击。

column1: The Middle East’s Lost Decade
column2: 中东失去的十年

column1: BERLIN – The United States has waged three wars since Al Qaeda’s terrorist attacks on September 11, 2001: against Al Qaeda, in Afghanistan, and in Iraq.
column2: 柏林 — — 2001年9月11日的“基地”组织恐怖袭击后美国已发动对“基地”组织、阿富汗和伊拉克的三次战争。

column1: The first two were forced upon the US, but the third was the result of a willful, deliberate decision by former President George W. Bush, taken on ideological grounds and, most likely, for personal reasons as well.
column2: 前两次美国是因为迫不得已，但第三次则是前总统乔治·W·布什出于意识形态、极可能还有个人理由做出的故意决定。

column1: Had Bush, former Vice President Dick Cheney, former Secretary of Defense Donald Rumsfeld, and their neocon allies been forthright about their intentions – to bring down Saddam Hussein by means of war, thereby creating a new, pro-Western Middle East – they never would have received the support of Congress and the American public.
column2: 假使布什、前副总统迪克·切尼、国防部长唐纳德·拉姆斯菲尔德及其新保守派盟友将借助战争手段推翻萨达姆·侯赛因并建设亲西方新中东的真正意图公之于众，他们永远也得不到美国国会和公众的支持。

column1: Their vision was both naive and reckless.
column2: 他们的理想鲁莽而且非常幼稚。

column1: So a threat – Iraqi weapons of mass destruction – had to be created.
column2: 因此必须捏造出来自伊拉克的大规模杀伤性武器威胁。

column1: As we now know, the threat was based on lies (aluminum tubes for a nuclear-weapons program, for example, meetings between the 9/11 plot leader, Mohamed Atta, and Iraqi officials in Prague, and even glaring forgeries like supposed Iraqi orders for yellowcake uranium from Niger).
column2: 我们现在知道这种威胁纯属谎言（核武器计划的铝管、9/11阴谋领导者穆罕默德·阿塔跟伊拉克官员在布拉格会面、甚至令人发指地伪造出所谓伊拉克从尼日尔订购铀“黄饼”的订单 ） 。

column1: Such were the justifications for a war that was to claim the lives of almost 5,000 US soldiers and more than 100,000 Iraqis.
column2: 这就是发动夺去近5,000名美军士兵和100,000多伊拉克人生命的战争的理由。

column1: Add to that the millions more who were injured and displaced from their homes, as well as the destruction of one of the world’s oldest Christian communities.
column2: 这场战争还造成数百万人受伤和流离失所，并对世界最古老的基督教群体造成了毁灭性的破坏。

column1: For this, the US alone spent up to $3 trillion.
column2: 仅美国在伊战中的花费就高达3万亿美元。

column1: Bush’s war against Saddam did radically change the Middle East, though not as he envisaged.
column2: 布什对萨达姆的战争的确从根本上改变了中东局势，尽管这种改变完全出乎他自己的预料。

column1: For starters, if the US had set out to destabilize Iraq, its efforts could hardly have been more successful: ten years later, the country’s viability as a single state has never been in greater doubt.
column2: 首先，如果美国的初衷是破坏伊拉克稳定，那恐怕这一目标已经完美实现：10年后，伊拉克能否作为统一国家存在都充满了变数。

column1: With Saddam gone, Iraq’s Shia majority assumed power after a horrendous civil war, leaving Iraq’s defeated Sunnis longing for revenge and waiting for an opportunity to regain their ascendancy.
column2: 萨达姆被推翻后，伊拉克的什叶多数派在恐怖内战后上台，而被打败的逊尼派则渴望报复、等待夺回优势的机会。

column1: The Kurds in the north cleverly and adeptly used the window of opportunity that opened before them to seize de facto independence, though the key question of control over the northern city of Kirkuk remains a ticking time bomb.
column2: 北方的库尔德人巧妙地利用这次机会实现了事实上的独立，尽管北部城市基尔库克关键的控制问题依然是一枚定时炸弹。

column1: And all are fighting for as large a share of Iraq’s enormous oil and gas reserves as they can get.
column2: 所有人都竭尽全力争夺伊拉克庞大的石油和天然气资源。

column1: Taking stock of “Operation Iraqi Freedom” a decade later, the Financial Times concluded that the US won the war, Iran won the peace, and Turkey won the contracts.
column2: 英国《金融时报》十年后盘点“伊拉克自由行动 ” ， 认为美国赢得了战争、伊朗赢得了和平而土耳其赢得了合同。

column1: I can only agree.
column2: 我只能表示同意。

column1: In political terms, Iran is the big winner of Bush’s war.
column2: 伊朗是布什战争在政治意义上最大的赢家。

column1: Its number-one enemy, Saddam, was dispatched by its number-two enemy, the United States, which presented Iran with a golden opportunity to extend its influence beyond its western border for the first time since 1746.
column2: 其头号敌人萨达姆被二号敌人美国推翻，伊朗也由此看到了1746年以来首次将影响力扩大到西部边境以外的黄金机会。

column1: Bush’s war, with its poor strategic vision and worse planning, increased Iran’s regional standing in a way that the country was unlikely ever to have achieved on its own.
column2: 布什的战争因其蹩脚的战略眼光和糟糕的计划从某种意义上提升了伊朗的区域地位，这种提升伊朗靠自己的力量永远不可能做到。

column1: The war enabled Iran to assert itself as the dominant power in the Gulf and the wider region, and its nuclear program serves precisely these ambitions.
column2: 战争使伊朗成为海湾及更大范围内的主导力量，而核计划恰恰满足了伊朗在这方面的野心。

column1: The losers in the region are also clear: Saudi Arabia and the other Gulf states, which feel existentially threatened, and have come to regard their own Shia minorities as an Iranian fifth column.
column2: 中东地区的输家也非常明确：感觉生存受到威胁、开始将国内什叶派���数族裔视为伊朗第五纵队的沙特阿拉伯和其他海湾国家。

column1: They have a point: with the Shia in power in Iraq, Iran will seek suitable opportunities to use local Shia populations as proxies to assert its hegemonic claims.
column2: 他们其实有一定道理：由于什叶派在伊拉克掌权，伊朗会寻找适当时机利用当地什叶派人口代理维护其霸权要求。

column1: This is what is fueling Bahrain’s domestic turmoil, beyond the Shia majority’s local grievances.
column2: 这是除什叶多数派对当地的不满之外激起巴林国内动乱的理由。

column1: Leaving aside the lies, fictions, and questions of morality and personal responsibility, the critical mistake of America’s war against Iraq was the absence of either a viable plan or the necessary strength to enforce a Pax Americana in the Middle East.
column2: 除去谎言、虚构、道德问题和个人责任等因素，美国对伊战争最致命的失误是缺乏可行计划及必要势力在中东贯彻美国治下的和平。

column1: America was powerful enough to destabilize the existing regional order, but not powerful enough to establish a new one.
column2: 美国的强大足以摧毁原有的地区秩序，但却不足以建立新的秩序。

column1: The US neocons, with their wishful thinking, grossly underestimated the scale of the task at hand – unlike the revolutionaries in Iran, who quickly moved in to reap what the US had sowed.
column2: 一厢情愿的美国新保守主义者严重低估了这项任务的难度 — — 而伊朗革命党人却恰恰相反，他们迅速行动夺走了美国种下的果实。

column1: The Iraq war also marked the beginning of America’s subsequent relative decline.
column2: 伊拉克战争也成为美国相对衰落开始的标志。

column1: Bush squandered a large part of America’s military strength in Mesopotamia for an ideological fiction – strength that is sorely missed in the region ten years later.
column2: 布什在美索不达米亚的意识形态谎言中浪费了美国很大一部分军力 — — 十年后这些军力在该地区还根本无法补充。

column1: And there is no alternative to be seen without America.
column2: 美国的力量仍然无法代替。

column1: While there is no causal link between the Iraq war and the Arab revolutions that began in December 2010, their implications have combined in a malign manner.
column2: 尽管伊拉克战争和2010年12月开始的阿拉伯革命间不存在因果关系，但两者的影响已经以恶性的方式互相结合。

column1: Since the war, the bitter enmities between Al Qaeda and other Salafist and Sunni Arab nationalist groups have given way to cooperation or even mergers.
column2: 战后“基地”组织和其他萨拉菲斯特和逊尼派阿拉伯民族主义团体间苦涩的仇恨已经被合作、甚至兼并所取代。

column1: This, too, is a result brought about by the American neocon masterminds.
column2: 这同样是美国新保守主义操纵者所带来的苦果。

column1: And the regional destabilization triggered by the Arab revolutions is increasingly converging on Iraq, mainly via Syria and Iran.
column2: 由阿拉伯革命引发的地区动荡通过叙利亚和伊朗越来越集中到伊拉克。

column1: Indeed, the gravest current danger to the region is a process of national disintegration emanating from the Syrian civil war, which is threatening to spread not only to Iraq, but also to Lebanon and Jordan.
column2: 事实上，地区目前最严重的威胁是叙利亚内战导致的国家解体，它不仅有可能威胁到伊拉克，也有可能威胁到黎巴嫩和约旦。

column1: What makes Syria’s civil war so dangerous is that the players on the ground are no longer its driving forces.
column2: 令叙利亚内战如此危险的是其实际参与者已不再是战争的驱动力量。

column1: Rather, the war has become a struggle for regional dominance between Iran on one side and Saudi Arabia, Qatar, and Turkey on the other.
column2: 相反，这场战争已经演变为伊朗和沙特阿拉伯、卡塔尔和土耳其之间对地区霸权的争夺。

column1: As a result, the Middle East is at risk of becoming the Balkans of the twenty-first century – a decline into regional chaos that began with, and was largely the result of, the US-led invasion ten years ago.
column2: 中东也因此有可能沦为二十一世纪的巴尔干 — — 陷入到十年前以美国为首侵略所造成的区域动荡之中。

column1: Winning the Confidence Game
column2: 信心是胜利的根本

column1: NEW HAVEN – On April 2, the G-20 will hold a summit in London to discuss what we may hope will be an internationally coordinated plan to address the world economic crisis.
column2: 纽海文 — — 4月2日，20国集团将在伦敦举行峰会，会议的主题是，为了应对目前面临的经济危机，如何建立一个国际间相互合作协调的方案。 这正是我们目前所关心的问题。

column1: But can such a plan really work?
column2: 难道这方案真的会管用么？

column1: The basic problem, of course, is confidence.
column2: 当然，问题的关键还是信心问题。

column1: People everywhere, consumers and investors alike, are canceling spending plans, because the world economy seems very risky right now. The same thing happened during the Great Depression of the 1930’s.
column2: 面临着波及全球范围的经济危机，世界各地的人们，不管是消费着还是投资者，都在削减开支，就象1930年代的大萧条那样。

column1: A contemporary observer, Winthrop Case, explained it all in 1938: economic revival depended “on the willingness of individual and corporate buyers to make purchases that necessarily tie up their resources for a considerable length of time.
column2: 当时的亲历者温思罗普·凯斯在1938年这样写到：经济的复苏靠的是“企业和个人愿意投资和消费，而且需要持续相当长的一段时间。

column1: For the individual, this implies confidence in the job, and in the end comes equally back to the confidence of industry leaders.”
column2: 对个人来说，就是要对自己的工作有信心，对企业来说，就是老板对所从事的行业有信心 。 ”

column1: Unfortunately, confidence did not return until World War II ended the depression.
column2: 不幸的是，直到第二次世界大战结束，信心才开始恢复，萧条真正得以结束。

column1: If the leaders meeting in London are to succeed where governments failed in the 1930’s, they must commit themselves to a fiscal target that is sufficient to restore full employment under normal credit conditions.
column2: 伦敦参会的领袖们必须有一个清晰的财政目标，那就是保证充分的就业和信贷市场的正常化；同时，保证借贷市场的正常化也很重要。

column1: They must also commit themselves to a credit target that will restore lending to normal.
column2: 人们只有在有了工作，有了借贷信用的时候，才会正常的消费。

column1: People will not spend normally unless they have both a job and normal access to credit.
column2: 这样才不会重导大萧条时代的覆辙。

column1: During the Great Depression, such targets were not used on a large enough scale, merely fueling public despair that stimulus policies would ever work.
column2: 仅仅依靠财政刺激方案是不可能获得成功的。

column1: The G-20 Summit should also be an occasion for affirming some basic principles.
column2: 20国峰会同样要重申一些基本的准则。 信心不是靠消费和借贷才能恢复的。

column1: Confidence isn’t built up on the basis of spending or lending alone.
column2: 人们要了解金钱不仅仅是由政府经济刺激方案来提供，而是要有一个稳定的来源。

column1: People need to believe that the money represents something more lasting than stimulus measures, which may eventually end in failure.
column2: 如果只依靠政府的经济救助方案，最终不能达到恢复经济的目的。

column1: After all, the Great Depression did not end simply because of the massive stimulus of war-related expenditures.
column2: 毕竟，大萧条时代的结束并不是仅仅因为战争导致的大量支出。

column1: Why should World War II have produced any confidence in the future?
column2: 然后，为什么二战后大家会有信心呢？

column1: To be sure, World War II reduced the unemployment rate in the United States dramatically, from 15% in 1940 to 1% in 1944, and had a similar effect in other countries.
column2: 应该看到，二战显著地减少了失业率。 例如，美国失业率从1940年的15%下降到1944年的1 % 。

column1: But this was not because of a revival in business confidence.
column2: 其他国家也有类似的现象。

column1: It was because of a nasty war, plain and simple, with people drafted into fighting, or into industries supplying the war effort.
column2: 失业率减少的原因很简单，当然不是由于商业信心恢复，而是那场该死的战争本身：大量的人员或是被直接卷入战争，或是为战争相关产业服务。

column1: The real recovery of confidence did not occur until after World War II, when the world did not sink back into depression.
column2: 市场信心的真正恢复是发生在二战之后。 当时的世界并没有重新回到经济萧条之中。

column1: The US Council of Economic Advisors warned of this possibility in 1949, and it was not alone.
column2: 而在1949年，美国国家经济委员曾认为世界经济会重新回到萧条之中。 这当然不是偶然的。

column1: There appears to be more than one reason why, on the contrary, confidence came roaring back.
column2: 信心恢复的原因比较复杂。

column1: First, there was a general perception of “pent-up demand.”
column2: 首先是因为“被压抑的需求”的爆发。

column1: After years of privation (and in many countries the physical destruction of war), people just wanted to live normally – to rebuild, own a home, a car, and other consumer goods.
column2: 由于战争而导致的多年物质极度匮乏，因此，人们想要过一种正常的生活，战后的废墟需也要重新建立 — — 重建自己的家园，拥有自己的车和其他生活用品。

column1: The widespread impression that there was such pent-up demand also led people to believe that there could not be another depression.
column2: 基于由于以上的共同认识，人们普遍认为不会再会有另一次经济萧条。

column1: The perception of pent-up demand was like a powerful economic stimulus package, and it had the advantage that people believed it would be long-lasting.
column2: 如此强大的需求就如同经济刺激方案，特别是大家都认为这会是一种长久的需求。

column1: Indeed, the same long-term confidence triggered the post-war “baby boom.”
column2: 同样的信心也导致了战后“婴儿潮”的出现。

column1: According to some contemporary observers, however, “pent-up demand” was only part of the story.
column2: 对当时的一些观察者来看 ， “ 被压抑的需求”只是经济复苏的原因之一。

column1: During the brief but deep recession of 1949, the financial commentator Silvia Porter reflected on the attitudes that led to the 1929 crash: “We saw nothing wrong – in fact, we saw everything right – with the wild speculative boom and credit inflation that…culminated in the now almost unbelievable gambling orgy of 1929.”
column2: 1949年出现了短暂的经济萧条，在回顾1929年大萧条��期人们的表现时，当时的金融评论家塞尔威·波特说道 ： “ 那时候投机盛行，信贷膨胀，我们当时觉得一切都很正常，大家都沉浸在一时的狂欢盛宴之中，没有人意识到危险的到来 。 ”

column1: But now, Porter wrote, after the depression and war, “We began to listen to the idea that a hundred million citizens, acting through a central government, could achieve much more than a hundred million acting as separate selfish units.
column2: 但现在，波特写到 ： “ 现在，我们一亿公民的心声通过一个中央政府来集中体现，这比我们各自为政而产生的效果要好的多。

column1: We developed, in short, a new attitude toward the responsibilities of government.”
column2: 因此，我们需要对政府职责重新认识了 。 ”

column1: She concluded that the positive effect of “pent-up demand” and government measures can “make sense only when viewed against the background of our changed economic and political philosophy.”
column2: 只有在我们的 社会政治观念发生改变之后，她对“压抑的需求”和“政府职责”的积极方面才能体现出来。

column1: The Marshall Plan, which operated from 1947 to 1951, became a symbol of this new attitude.
column2: 1947—1945年的马歇尔计划正是这样改变的标志。

column1: The US gave billions of dollars of aid to rebuild war-ravaged countries in Europe.
column2: 美国拿出数十亿美元重建战后的欧洲。

column1: The plan was widely viewed as reflecting a new kind of enlightenment, a recognition of the importance of supporting people who needed help.
column2: 此举显示出一种全新的理念，那就是关注那些需要救助的人们。

column1: Europe would not be allowed to languish, and the stimulus came from abroad.
column2: 为了防止欧洲的衰败，救助的力量必须来自欧洲大陆之外。

column1: After the war, Keynesian economic theory, which was generally not accepted or understood during the Great Depression, became the basis of a new social compact. It was a theory that was perfectly suited to a generation that had just endured exceptional sacrifices, for it reaffirmed a belief in our responsibility for each other.
column2: 大萧条时代不能接受凯恩斯主义的经济理论，而在二战后以后，凯恩斯主义开始流行起来，经过二战之后，大家都已经付出了超出寻常的牺牲，为了战后的重建，大家仍然需要同舟共济，共同面对问题。

column1: The effect of economic stimulus is redoubled by this kind of inspirational belief.
column2: 有了这种共识，再加上政府的经济刺激方案，所达到的效果就事半功倍了。

column1: That is why all of the commitments made and intentions expressed at the upcoming G-20 summit matter.
column2: 以上所阐述的就是20国领导峰会所要达到的目标。

column1: The countries represented must show a generous spirit and make the world economy work for all people.
column2: 参加的国家代表必须有着宽阔的胸襟，目的是为了整个人类的经济而努力。

column1: Seemingly peripheral issues, like aid to the developing world and the poor, who suffer the most from a crisis like this one, will be part of the primary story of the renewal of confidence, just as the Marshall Plan was part of that story after World War II.
column2: 就如同救助那些发展中国家和贫穷人口的那些方案那样，对于那些深陷经济危机的国家来说，重新建立信心是一个最重要的基础，这也就是“马歇尔计划”在二战后所发挥的作用。

column1: Winning the European Confidence Game
column2: 夺取欧洲信心战的胜利

column1: CHICAGO – If any solution to the European crisis proposed over the next few days is to restore confidence to the sovereign-bond markets, it will have to be both economically viable and politically palatable to rescuers and rescued alike.
column2: 芝加哥 — — 如果未来几天内出台的欧洲危机解决方案想要重塑人们对主权债券的信心的话，那么该计划就必须在经济上可行，而且在政治上可以让救援者和被救援者双方接受。

column1: This means paying attention not just to the plan’s technical details, but also to appearances.
column2: 这意味着我们不仅要关注解决方案的技术细节，也要注意它的包装。

column1: There is growing consensus about any solution’s key elements.
column2: 对于解决方案的关键点，人们越来越有了共识。

column1: First, Italy and Spain will have to come up with credible medium-term plans that will not just restore their fiscal health, but also improve their ability to grow their way out of trouble.
column2: 首先，意大利和西班牙必须给出可信的中期计划，不仅要重塑财政健康，还必须改善它们走出困境的能力。

column1: While any plan will involve pain for citizens, the markets must deem the pain politically tolerable, at least relative to the alternatives.
column2: 不管是什么计划，公民肯定会经受一些痛苦，与此同时，市场必须认为这些痛苦在政治上是可接受的，至少要比替代方案好。

column1: It is important that these plans be seen as domestically devised (though voters will have no illusions about the external and market pressures that have forced their governments to act).
column2: 有一点很重要：这些计划应该被视为是由本国设计的（尽管选民们会对迫使本国政府采取行动的外部和市场压力心知肚明 ） 。

column1: At the same time, an external agency such as the International Monetary Fund could render the plan more credible by evaluating it for consistency with the country’s goals and monitoring its implementation.
column2: 与此同时，外部机构，比如IMF，可以通过评估计划与该国目标的一致性以及监督计划的实施来加强计划的可信度。

column1: Second, some vehicle – the IMF or the European Financial Stability Facility, with either entity funded directly by countries or the European Central Bank – has to stand ready to fund borrowing by Italy, Spain, and any other potentially distressed countries over the next year or two.
column2: 其次，在未来一两年中，某些机构 — — IMF或欧洲金融稳定基金（由欧洲各国直接提供资金或由欧洲央行提供资金的实体 ） — —必须时刻准备着为意大利、西班牙和其他具有潜在风险的国家提供贷款融资。

column1: But there is an important caveat, which has largely been ignored in public discussions: if this funding is senior to private debt (as IMF funding typically is), it will be harder for these countries to regain access to markets.
column2: 但这里有一个在公众讨论中往往被忽视的重要警告：如果该融资比私人债务级别高（IMF融资通常如此 ） ， 那么这些国家重回资本市场将难上加难。

column1: After all, the more a country borrows in the short term from official sources, the further back in line it pushes private creditors.
column2: 毕竟，一国从官方渠道借入的短期融资越多，私人债权的比重就越低。

column1: That makes private lenders susceptible to larger haircuts if the country eventually defaults – and thus more hesitant to lend in the first place.
column2: 这使得私人贷款人会怀疑如果该国最终违约，则其损失会更大，从而在一开始就对贷款犹豫不决。

column1: In other words, private markets need to be convinced both that there is a low probability of default (hence the importance of credible plans), and that there is some additional loss-bearing capacity in the new funding, so that, if there is a default, outstanding or rolled-over private debt does not have to bear the full brunt.
column2: 换句话说，你必须让私人市场相信，你的违约概率很低（因此可信计划非常重要 ） ， 且新融资会有增加的损失吸收能力，万一违约发生，未偿还或展期的私人债务不会受到完全的损失。

column1: This may seem unfair.
column2: 这可能有些不公平。

column1: Why should the taxpayer accept a loss when they are bailing out the private sector by providing new funding?
column2: 为什么纳税人要在他们通过提供新融资拯救私人部门的同时接受损失？

column1: In an ideal world, distressed countries would default as soon as private markets stopped funding them, and they would impose the losses on private bondholders.
column2: 理想的情况是，受困国将在私人市场停止提供融资时立刻违约，损失将由私人债权人承担。

column1: In the real world, however, if Italy and Spain are viewed as being solvent, or too big to fail, official funding should be structured so that it gives these countries their best chance to regain market confidence.
column2: 但是，在现实世界中如果意大利和西班牙被认定破了产（或太大而不能倒 ） ， 就必须组织官方融资，以便这些国家能尽可能地赢回市场信心。

column1: This does not mean that official funding should be junior to private debt in any restructuring, for that would require substantially more loss-bearing capacity from the official sector – capacity that is probably not available.
column2: 这并不意味着官方融资应该在重组中获得比私人债务更低的地位，因为将要求官方部门拥有极大的损失吸收能力，而这有可能是不现实的。

column1: Indeed, if official funding were junior, it would be providing a larger cushion to private creditors – and thus bailing them out to an even greater extent.
column2: 事实上，如果官方融资地位较低，那么它相当于在为私人债权人提供更大的损失缓冲垫，从而更多地拯救私人债权人。

column1: The simplest solution is to treat official funding no differently from private debt – best achieved if official lenders buy sovereign bonds as they are issued (possibly at a predetermined yield) and agree to be treated on par with private creditors in a restructuring.
column2: 最简单的解决办法是对官方融资和私人债务一视同仁，最佳实现方式便是在发行主权债券时由官方贷款人购买（可以固定收益率 ） ， 官方贷款人同意在重组中与私人债权人具有同等地位。

column1: As the country regains market confidence, the official funding can be reduced, and eventually the bonds can be sold back to the markets.
column2: 当该国重新赢得市场信心时，官方融资可以削减，其买入的债券最终可以卖回给市场。

column1: The bottom line is that official funding must be accompanied by loss-bearing capacity.
column2: 要点是官方融资必须具有损失吸收能力。

column1: If the funding is channeled through the IMF, and is to be treated on par with private debt, the Fund will need a guarantee from the EFSF or strong eurozone countries that it will be indemnified in any restructuring.
column2: 如果官方融资走IMF渠道并与私人债务一视同仁，那么IMF需要EFSF或欧元区坚挺国家的担保，它可以在重组中获得保护。

column1: Of course, the IMF’s member states might be willing to accept some burden sharing if a sufficient buffer provided by the eurozone were eroded, but that cannot be taken for granted.
column2: 当然，如果欧元区所提供的充分缓冲遭到破坏的话，IMF成员国可能也会愿意接受一定责任共担，但不能把这一点视为理所当然。

column1: Once the first two elements of the plan are in place, there should be little need for the third – bond purchases by the ECB in the secondary market in order to narrow interest-rate spreads and provide further confidence.
column2: 当解决方案的前两大要素具备后，第三大要素 — — 欧洲央行在二级市场购买债券以缩小利差并提供更多的信心 — — 是否具备已经无关紧要了。

column1: Indeed, if the ECB intends to claim preferred-creditor status for any bonds that it buys, it is probably best that it buy very few.
column2: 事实上，如果欧洲央行欲使其所买入的债券拥有优先债权地位，那么它最好不要大量买入。

column1: Of course, the ECB will have to continue to provide support to banks until confidence about their holdings returns.
column2: 当然，欧洲央行将不得不继续向银行提供支持，直到市场对它们所持有的债券恢复信心。

column1: But there is one more element that is needed to assure markets that the solution is politically viable.
column2: 但要让市场相信解决办法在政治上可行，还需要另一大要素。
