column1: Citizens across Europe, whether in rescued countries or rescuing countries, will be paying for years to clean up a mess for which they were not responsible.
column2: 欧洲各国公民，不管是救援国还是被救援国，将在多年内为清理并非由他们引起的乱象买单。

column1: Not all banks voluntarily loaded up on distressed government bonds – some were pressured by supervisors, others by governments – but many have made unwise bets.
column2: 并非所有的银行都是自愿买入受困国政府债券的 — — 一些是迫于监管者压力，一些是迫于政府要求 — — 但确实有很多银行做出了不明智的投资决策。

column1: If they are seen as profiting unduly from the rescue, even as they return to their bad old ways of paying for non-performance, they will undermine political support for the rescue – and perhaps even for capitalism.
column2: 如果它们被认为从救援行动中不正当地得利了，那么就算它们回到为不良贷款买单的错误老路上去，也会破坏对救援行动 — — 乃至资本主义 — — 政治支持。

column1: So a final element of the package ought to be a monitored pledge by eurozone banks that they will not unload bonds as the official sector steps in; that they will raise capital over time instead of continuing to deleverage (if this hurts bank equity holders, they should think of this as burden sharing); and that they will be circumspect about banker bonuses until economies start growing strongly again.
column2: 因此，解决方案的最后一大要素应该是欧元区银行作出受监控的承诺，它们不会在官方部门介入是卸去手上持有的债券；它们将不断筹集资���，而不是不断去杠杆化（如果银行股东因此受害，那么他们应该把这想象为责任共担机制 ） ； 它们必须谨慎发放奖金，直到经济再次开始强劲增长。

column1: Cries that this is not capitalism should be met with a firm retort: “Nor are bailouts!”
column2: 对于那些“这不是资本主义”的嚷嚷，我们可以大声地回应 ： “ 救援也不是 ！ ”

column1: Winning the Peace
column2: 实现和平

column1: Afghanistan’s future hangs in the balance as its weak national government struggles to maintain support and legitimacy in the face of a widening insurgency, warlords, the heroin trade, and a disappointed populace.
column2: 在叛乱规模越来越大、军阀越来越多、海洛因贸易猖獗、人民大失所望的情况下，阿富汗虚弱的国民政府拼命想要维持自身的合法性和民众的支持，阿富汗国内局势摇摇欲坠。

column1: Across an arc extending from Afghanistan to East Africa, violence now also surges in Iraq, Lebanon, Somalia, and beyond, to Sudan’s Darfur region.
column2: 从阿富汗到东非一线，战火在伊拉克、黎巴嫩、索马里甚至苏丹的达尔富尔地区肆虐燃烧。

column1: Everywhere, politicians, generals, and even diplomats talk of military strategies and maneuvers, but everywhere something utterly different is needed.
column2: 政治家、将军甚至外交家有关军事策略和调动的谈论声不绝于耳，但真正符合这些地区需要的政策却截然不同。

column1: Stability will come only when economic opportunities exist, when a bulging generation of young men can find jobs and support families, rather than seeking their fortune in violence.
column2: 只有经济机会才能催生稳定，当越来越多的年轻人能找到工作、养家糊口，而不是靠暴力斗争来改变命运时，才能实现真正的稳定。

column1: We are seeing again and again that a foreign army, whether NATO’s in Afghanistan, America’s in Iraq, Israel’s in occupied Palestine, or Ethiopia’s in Somalia, may win a battle, or even a war, but never the peace.
column2: 我们一再看到无论是阿富汗的北约部队、伊拉克的美国驻军、巴勒斯坦的以色列占领者还是索马里的埃塞俄比亚人，所有这些外国军队能够打胜一场战役，甚至赢得整个战争，但却永远无法实现和平。

column1: Peace is about dignity and hope for the future.
column2: 和平是尊严，是未来的希望。

column1: Military occupation saps dignity, and grinding poverty and economic disarray sap hope.
column2: 军事占领一点一点地消磨人的尊严、折磨人的贫穷和经济混乱慢慢使希望丧失殆尽。

column1: Peace can be achieved only with a withdrawal of foreign troops, and the arrival of jobs, productive farms and factories, tourism, health care, and schools.
column2: 只有撤出外国军队、创造工作机会、建设高效率的农场、企业、发展旅游、医疗和教育，才能最终实现和平。

column1: Without these, military victory and occupation quickly turn to ashes.
column2: 如果没有这些，军事胜利和占领的喜悦很快就会灰飞烟灭。

column1: The United States government has proven itself blind to these facts, but the international community also remains ill equipped to assist in the restoration of peace following conflicts in impoverished countries.
column2: 事实证明美国政府对这一切视而不见，而国际社会也依然对战后贫困国家重建和平束手无策。

column1: Repeatedly, a fragile peace has broken down because of the lack of economic follow-up.
column2: 因为没有后续的经济发展，脆弱的和平一而再、再而三地遭到破坏。

column1: Despite grand promises of foreign aid, economic reconstruction, and development in Afghanistan, Iraq, Lebanon, and elsewhere, the actual record of international assistance to post-war reconstruction is gravely deficient.
column2: 尽管阿富汗、伊拉克、黎巴嫩等地无一例外地得到了国外援助、经济重建和发展的慷慨承诺，但真正用于战后重建的国际援助却少得可怜。

column1: The scenario has become painfully familiar. A war ends.
column2: 情况令人心痛地相似。

column1: An international donors’ conference is called. Pledges of billions of dollars are announced.
column2: 战争结束后召集国际捐助大会，会上承诺捐赠成百上千亿美元。

column1: A smiling new head of state graciously thanks the international community, including the occupying power.
column2: 面带笑容的新国家元首礼貌地向包括占领国在内的国际社会致谢。

column1: Months pass. World Bank teams from Washington start to arrive.
column2: 数月以后，来自华盛顿的世界银行特派小组陆续抵达。

column1: But actual reconstruction and recovery is delayed, perhaps for years.
column2: 但真正的重建或恢复工作却一拖再拖，也许长达数年之久。

column1: Crony businesses from the US and Europe, which are utterly unfamiliar with local conditions, squander time, aid funds, and opportunities.
column2: 来自美国和欧洲的企业任人唯亲，完全不了解当地的情况，将时间、援助款项和机会浪费殆尽。

column1: Two or three years pass.
column2: 两三年过去了。

column1: The grand pronouncements become a pile of out-of-date World Bank studies.
column2: 义正词严的声明变成了一堆过时的世界银行调研报告。

column1: Recriminations fly, the occupying army remains, and a new insurgency spreads.
column2: 到处能够听到相互指责，占领军还在耀武扬威，新一轮的叛乱又蔓延开去。

column1: Many factors contribute to this disarray, beginning with the shocking inability of the US, Europe, and the international organizations to understand things from the perspective of poor and displaced people.
column2: 造成这种混乱的原因非常复杂，但归根结底，美国、欧洲和国际机构根本不愿为流离失所的穷人考虑是一切混乱的源泉。

column1: Their lack of empathy is deplorable, but there are conceptual problems as well.
column2: 他们不会换位思考令人可悲可叹，但与理念有关的问题也急待解决。

column1: The international agencies involved in post-conflict reconstruction have so far failed to understand how to start or restart economic development in a low-income setting.
column2: 参与战后重建的国际机构到目前为止还没有学会如何在低收入环境中启动经济的发展。

column1: It’s important to distinguish four distinct phases of outside help to end a conflict.
column2: 找出外来援助结束冲突的四个步骤至关重要。

column1: In the first phase, during the war itself, aid is for humanitarian relief, focusing on food, water, emergency medicine, and refugee camps.
column2: 在第一阶段，也就是战争阶段，援助是为了人道主义目的，重点放在食物、水、急救药品和收容帐篷。

column1: In the second phase, at the war’s end, aid remains mainly humanitarian relief, but now directed towards displaced people returning home, and to decommissioned soldiers.
column2: 到了第二阶段，也就是战争结束阶段，援助仍然以人道主义目的为主，但现在要侧重于流离失所的百姓和退伍军人重返家园。

column1: In the third phase, lasting three to five years, aid supports the first phase of post-war economic development, including restoration of schools, clinics, farms, factories, and ports.
column2: 第三阶段一般会持续3到5年，援助的任务是启动首阶段的战后经济发展，包括重建学校、诊所、农场、企业和港口。

column1: In the fourth phase, which can last a generation or more, assistance is directed to long-term investments and the strengthening of institutions such as courts.
column2: 而第四阶段则需要整整一代人或更长时间的努力，重点更多地放在长期投资，以及加强以法院为首的机构建设。

column1: The international community, and the US in particular, is dreadful at the third stage.
column2: 国际社会，特别是美国，在第三阶段的表现简直糟糕透顶。

column1: Once a conflict is over, aid agencies seem paralyzed.
column2: 一旦战争结束，援助机构似乎就变得束手无策。

column1: Instead of sending help, they send study groups.
column2: 他们送去的不是援助，而是派去调研小组。

column1: There is often a lag of years before moving from humanitarian relief to real economic development.
column2: 通常从人道主义援助到真正的经济建设需要花去几年的时间。

column1: By the time such help actually arrives, it is often too late: war has been re-ignited.
column2: 等援助真正到位的时候常常已经太迟了：战火已经被再次点燃。

column1: In fact, it is possible to restart economic development through targeted “quick-impact” initiatives.
column2: 实际上，通过目标明确的“快速起效”方案来迅速启动经济是完全可能的。

column1: Since the economies of most impoverished post-conflict countries are based on agriculture, restarting farm output is vital.
column2: 因为多数贫困战后国家的经济主要依赖农业，恢复农业生产是至关重要的。

column1: Impoverished farmers should receive a free package of seeds, fertilizers, and low-cost equipment (such as pumps for irrigation).
column2: 应该向贫困农民免费发放种子、化肥和低成本的器械（比如灌溉用的水泵 ） 。

column1: When such aid is made available quickly, former soldiers will return to their farms, and can establish a livelihood by the beginning of the first growing season following the end of hostilities.
column2: 一旦这些援助迅��到位，从前的士兵就会返回到自己的故里，并在敌对状态结束后通过种植第一季庄稼开始新的生活。

column1: This type of aid does not require long studies, but quick action.
column2: 这种援助根本不需要长时间的调研，它所需要的是迅速采取行动。

column1: Similar quick-impact measures should be undertaken to control disease.
column2: 应该采取同样的迅速起效方案来控制疾病的蔓延。

column1: Small rural clinics can be built or rebuilt very quickly, within the first year of peace.
column2: 小型的乡村诊所能够在停火后一年内迅速建设或者重建。

column1: Solar panels and wind turbines can provide off-grid power in isolated rural areas.
column2: 无须建设电网，太阳能电池板和风车也能为偏远的乡村地区提供能源。

column1: Wells and cisterns can be put in place to ensure safe drinking water.
column2: 可以修建水井和水塔，确保饮用水的安全。

column1: These and similar efforts can mean the difference between famine and food security, epidemic disease and health, income and utter poverty, and, most importantly, hope and despair.
column2: 上述措施和类似的努力能够避免饥荒，提供安全食品、消除流行病、确保人民健康、给普通人带来收入，消灭极端贫困，最重要的是，为人们驱除绝望，带来希望的曙光。

column1: Yet the window of opportunity closes quickly.
column2: 但如果没有好好利用，机遇的大门很快就会关上。

column1: Quick-impact economic development is exactly what is needed now to help end the horrific violence and suffering in Darfur.
column2: 迅速见效的经济发展是结束达尔富尔恐怖暴力和灾难的必由之路。

column1: Sanctions, threats, and peacekeepers are only short-term measures, whereas real progress there against extreme poverty is not only achievable, but also is something that the government and rebels can agree on.
column2: 制裁、威胁和维和部队都只是短期的办法，而消除极端贫困的真正进展不仅可以实现，而且能够得到政府和叛乱势力的一致赞同。

column1: The same applies in Somalia.
column2: 索马里的情况也是一样。

column1: But the window of opportunity closes quickly in these and other post-conflict regions.
column2: 但在上面提到的战后地区和其他遭受战火蹂躏的土地，机会的大门很快就会关上。

column1: Only by taking quick, meaningful action to fight hunger, poverty, and disease can there be a chance of creating conditions for long-term peace.
column2: 只有采取迅速、有效的措施来战争饥饿、贫困和疾病，才有机会为长久的和平创造条件。

column1: Winning the Transition
column2: 实现转型成功

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – Is the Arab Spring turning into a gloomy autumn?
column2: 华盛顿 — — 阿拉伯春天之后阴沉的秋天是否正在来临？

column1: With brutal crackdowns in Syria, a bloody civil war in Libya, and Yemen teetering on the brink of chaos, the number of skeptics is growing.
column2: 随着叙利亚的残酷镇压、利比亚的血腥内战和也门在混乱边缘摇摇欲坠，持怀疑态度的人数正迅速攀升。

column1: Although Egypt and Tunisia’s pro-democracy movements achieved rapid regime change, uncertainties remain in those countries, too.
column2: 虽然埃及和突尼斯的民主运动快速实现了政权更替，但这两个国家同样存在不确定性。

column1: After a brief period of hope, many observers now wonder whether the region is capable of producing viable, and economically vibrant, democracies.
column2: 在短暂的希望过后，不少观察家现在怀疑该地区能否诞生能独立发展、充满经济活力的民主国家。

column1: Revolutions and their aftermaths, of course, are always fluid and fickle times, and the outcome is often perched on a knife’s edge.
column2: 当然，革命和革命的结果往往都非常善变，而最终的结果往往系于千钧一发之间。

column1: Bridging the vast gap between high expectations and the reality of limited budgets and capabilities is a test in itself.
column2: 弥合殷切希望和有限预算和能力之间的鸿沟本身就是一种考验。

column1: Redressing past injustice and building an economy that offers opportunity to all are major challenges as well, fraught with volatility, uncertainty, and the dangers of political opportunism.
column2: 纠正既往不公和建设机会均等的经济也是一项充满波动、变数和政治机会主义风险的严峻挑战。

column1: But transitions are also times of great opportunity.
column2: 但转型往往也伴随着巨大的机遇。

column1: In the 1990’s, I was among those Indonesians who demanded and celebrated the departure of our own autocrat, Suharto, and I joined the new government when he left.
column2: 20世纪90年代，我曾经是要求并且庆祝独裁统治者苏哈托下台的印尼民众的一员，苏哈托离开后我加盟了新的政府。

column1: Many observers predicted that Indonesia, the world’s most populous Muslim country, would be unable to sustain democracy and would ultimately decline into chaos.
column2: 当时很多观察家预测全世界人口最多的穆斯林国家印尼将无法保持民主制度，并最终陷入到混乱当中。

column1: The task ahead of us was daunting.
column2: 令人生畏的任务摆在我们面前。

column1: But we proved the skeptics wrong, and learned some fundamental lessons.
column2: 但我们证明了怀疑论者的错误，从中汲取了某些基本的经验。

column1: Perhaps most importantly, we learned that there is no one-size-fits-all solution for democratization.
column2: 或许最重要的是，我们体会到没有放之四海皆准的通用民主化方案。

column1: Each of the countries of the Middle East and North Africa will face unique challenges, which will have to be addressed on their own terms.
column2: 中东和北非的每个国家都面临各自的问题，这些问题的解决必须根据其自身的条件。

column1: Even so, they all must make a real and symbolic break with the past.
column2: 即使如此，他们都必须从真正意义上与过去决裂。

column1: The new authorities must send strong signals that the old ways are finished.
column2: 新政府必须明确旧的方式已经不复存在。

column1: Change must be formally manifested, with new laws that are widely publicized.
column2: 改革和新的法律必须得到广泛宣传。

column1: Legislation that empowers citizens with freedom of expression, free and independent elections, and freedom of association is crucial, and it must be made clear to the public that no one is above the law. Anything less will undermine the transition.
column2: 赋予公民言论自由、独立自由选举权和集会自由的法案至关重要，必须让公众明白没有人能凌驾于法律之上，否则转型就有可能遭到破坏。

column1: Moreover, corruption is the bane of development everywhere, so new governments should move fast to establish institutions and procedures to fight it.
column2: 此外，腐败无论在哪里都是发展的祸根，因此新政府必须建立起与之斗争的机构和程序。

column1: Transparency and accountability are powerful ideas with near-universal support, which means that new leaders should not give up when the fight becomes difficult.
column2: 透明制和问责制是近乎受到普遍支持的强大思想，也就是说新领袖不应放弃艰苦的斗争。

column1: Civil-society organizations, local communities, representatives of the poor and vulnerable, and women play a vital role in this regard, and they should be included at every level of decision-making.
column2: 民间社会组织、地方社团、穷人和弱势群体代表及妇女在这方面所起的作用至关重要，他们必须参与到所有层次的决策当中。

column1: In Indonesia, we signed a hundred laws in less than 18 months, covering everything from media freedom to elections, corruption, decentralization, and anti-trust rules.
column2: 印尼在不到18个月时间里签署了一百部法律，这些法律涉及媒体选举自由、腐败、权力下放和反垄断规则的方方面面。

column1: We ratified new public-finance legislation and ensured the independence of the country’s central bank.
column2: 我们批准了新的公共财政立法，保障印尼央行的独立管理权。

column1: New leaders must also expect and manage setbacks.
column2: 新领导人还必须预想并管理各种困难。

column1: In post-revolutionary times, expectations are high, and the obstacles to meeting them are enormous.
column2: 在后革命时代人们的期望值空前高涨，而实现这些期望却面临着巨大的障碍。

column1: I know from personal experience that we did not always have the luxury of getting the best outcomes.
column2: 我从亲身经历中得知我们并不总能得到最好的结果。

column1: We had to compromise and settle for the best possible results.
column2: 我们必须学会妥协，接受最有可能的结果。

column1: Security threats are among the most serious setbacks in transitions.
column2: 安全威胁是转型过程中最严重的障碍。

column1: Nationalistic sentiment is strong, and politicians and interest groups can exploit it.
column2: 民族主义情绪空前高涨，政客和利益团体可能利用民族情绪达到自己的目的。

column1: Often, the security forces are holdovers from the old regime, and there is no independent judicial system.
column2: 通常安全部队都来自旧政府的残余势力，独立的司法制度也没有建立。

column1: Reforms will take time, and the old bureaucracies may not be able to implement them.
column2: 改革需要时间，而指望旧的官僚机构推进改革可能并不现实。

column1: In Indonesia, we used various innovations to work around such dilemmas.
column2: 在印尼，我们采取各式各样的创新措施来解决这种两难局面。

column1: For example, we appointed an independent judge to take over the bankruptcy and corruption courts, because career judges were too tainted.
column2: 比方说，我们指定一名独立法官接手破产和腐败法庭，因为职业法官已经染上了污点。

column1: Likewise, when we started cash-for-work programs as part of our pro-poor agenda, we asked communities to run these initiatives.
column2: 同样，当我们启动穷人支持计划付现工作方案的时候，我们请求社会团体来推行这项计划。

column1: More broadly, new leaders are well advised to ensure that the economy performs well.
column2: 更广泛的说，新领导人将得到充分的建议，以确保经济能够进入良性循环。

column1: It is important to restore economic activity and create a favorable environment for entrepreneurs, particularly small and medium-size businesses, which constitute the main engine of job creation.
column2: 恢复经济活动并为企业家（特别是中小企业家）创造有利的环境非常重要，因为中小企业是创造就业机会的主要来源。

column1: The recent revolutions, it should be recalled, started with the self-immolation of a Tunisian fruit vendor, who was harassed and insulted by the authorities.
column2: 我们应该记得一位突尼斯水果商人的自焚引发了最近这场革命���这名商人自焚是因为不堪忍受政府的侮辱和骚扰。

column1: But economic success without accountability and social inclusion is not sustainable, and new governments often must face tough choices in order to protect the poor and vulnerable.
column2: 但是不具备责任和包容的经济成功不是持久的成功，新政府往往会为保护穷人和弱势群体而面临艰难的抉择。

column1: They might have to abolish mis-targeted subsidies to free up resources for more targeted and efficient anti-poverty and job-creation programs.
column2: 他们可能需要取消错误的补贴，以节省更多资源用于更有针对性、更加高效的扶贫和就业创造计划。

column1: In Indonesia, we had to draw a line between the very poor and the near-poor.
column2: 在印尼，我们不得不区分贫困和近贫人口。

column1: We could not afford to raise salaries or provide subsidies for everybody.
column2: 我们没有能力提高工资，或为所有人发放补贴。

column1: Our help had to be targeted.
column2: 我们的帮助必须有针对性。

column1: So, while we helped the neediest, we excluded others who were not poor enough to benefit.
column2: 因此，我们在为最贫困群体提供帮助的同时，也把不够资格享受补贴的人群排除在外。

column1: This was a tough and unpopular choice.
column2: 这项工作既不受欢迎又非常艰难。

column1: Finally, countries in transition need support – not only money, but also technical know-how to implement highly complex reforms.
column2: 最后，转型国家需要支持 — — 其中不仅包括资金，也包括推进高度复杂改革的技术知识。

column1: When I became Indonesia’s finance minister, I had 64,000 employees.
column2: 我担任印尼财政部长期间，手下拥有64，000位员工。

column1: But when we had to modernize our tax system, we could not find the required expertise anywhere in our country.
column2: 但当我们需要改革税收系统的时候，却找遍全国都没有找到所需的专业人才。

column1: Yes, we needed external assistance, but we never surrendered “ownership” of the reform process; we made it work for us.
column2: 是的，我们需要外部支持，但我们从未放弃对改革的“所有权 ” 。 我们的改革取得了成功。

column1: If we Indonesians had not been in charge of our own transition, it could easily have failed.
column2: 如果印尼人没有领导我们自身的改革，那么改革很有可能会陷入失败。

column1: That lesson, too, is one that all countries in transition should bear in mind.
column2: 所有处于转型时期的国家都应该汲取相关的经验。

column1: Winning with Opium in Afghanistan
column2: 以鸦片制胜阿富汗

column1: Despite considerable effort by the international community in Afghanistan since 2001 to eliminate the Taliban and al Qaeda, the insurgency in the south of the country has gathered momentum at breakneck speed in recent months.
column2: 尽管国际社会自2001年以来在铲除塔利班和“基地组织”方面付出了巨大的努力，但近几个月来，该国南部叛乱的形势还是以非常危险的速度发展着。

column1: Our field research shows that we are not winning the campaign for the hearts and minds of the Afghan people – the Taliban are.
column2: 实地调查表明，我们正在赢得阿富汗民心的较量中落败—而塔利班却正在胜出。

column1: Indeed, the international community’s methods of fighting the insurgency and eradicating poppy crops have actually helped the insurgents gain power.
column2: 的确，国际社会对抗叛乱和铲除罂粟作物的方式其实助长了叛乱分子的力量。

column1: The international community has so far pursued policies of destruction, rather than the promised reconstruction.
column2: 国际社会到目前为止推行的是摧毁政策，而不是所承诺的重建。

column1: The aggressive United States-led counter-narcotics policy of crop eradication has failed to win the support of Afghans, because it has triggered a chain reaction of poverty and violence in which poor farmers, with their only livelihood destroyed, are unable to feed their families.
column2: 美国领导下的激进的铲除种植的反毒品政策没有赢得阿富汗人民的支持，因为它引发了一系列贫困和暴力的连锁反应。 当贫穷农民唯一的生计被破坏以后，他们就连养家糊口也成了问题。

column1: This has been exacerbated by the failure to provide even the most basic aid and development in the country’s poorest areas.
column2: 由于未能在该国最贫穷的地区提供哪怕最基本的发展援助，更加剧了这一局面的恶化。

column1: At the same time, communities have been torn apart as a result of bombing campaigns, which have destroyed the very homes we came to protect.
column2: 同时，由于轰炸攻势使得居民社区支离破碎。 我们摧毁了本应受到保护的目标。

column1: This, in addition to four years of drought, has forced entire families to leave their villages for makeshift internal refugee camps.
column2: 这一因素，加上长达四年的干旱，迫使许多家庭背井离乡，安顿到国内难民营的临时棚户中。

column1: You do not win people over by bombing them, but by helping them.
column2: 轰炸得不了人心，而援助才是正道。

column1: The Taliban have exploited the failures of the international community in extremely effective anti-Western propaganda that has fueled significant doubt in the minds of the public concerning the reasons justifying the international presence in Afghanistan.
column2: 塔利班在他们极为有效的反西方宣传战中利用了国际社会的失败。 这些宣传加深了公众对在阿富汗的国际干预合法性的质疑。

column1: Sadly, our troops are often the first to pay the price – sometimes with their lives.
column2: 悲哀的是，我们的部队常常是首先付出代价的人—有时是生命的代价。

column1: It is not too late to win back the hearts and minds of the Afghan people.
column2: 现在要赢得阿富汗的民心还为时不晚。

column1: International troops are excelling in an exceptionally hostile environment, but this is not a war that will be won by military means alone.
column2: 国际部队在极端敌对的环境中保持着优势，但这场战争单靠武力是不能获胜的。

column1: With public perception a crucial factor in winning the war, and the Taliban poised to launch a large military initiative next spring, failure to adopt a successful local strategy could signify the last chance the international community will have to build a secure and stable Afghanistan.
column2: 在民意成为制胜的关键因素，而塔利班又做足准备在明年春季发动一场大规模军事行动的情况下，如果不能采取成功的本地战略，那么就意味着国际社会将失去在阿富汗建立安全和稳定的最后机会。

column1: But a successful strategy – one that responds to Afghanistan’s extreme poverty crisis –requires that the international community reverse course on crop eradication.
column2: 但是一个成功的战略—一个应对阿富汗的极端贫困危机的战略—需要国际社会在铲除鸦片的问题上反其道而行之。

column1: In fact, the eradication of poppy crops not only damage local communities and undermines the international community’s goals, but it is also failing: opium production last year was at an all-time high.
column2: 实际上，铲除罂粟作物不但破坏了当地民生、阻碍了国际社会实现其目标，而且也是失败的：去年的鸦片生产创历史新高。

column1: In September, the United Nations Office on Drugs Crime announced that poppy cultivation soared by a record-high 60%.
column2: 在九月，联合国毒品犯罪办公室宣布罂粟种植创纪录地增长了60 % 。

column1: Eradication will never be successful in Afghanistan, because it destroys the single crop that will grow in the south’s harsh climate – and thus serves as the main source of income to millions of people.
column2: 铲除罂粟种植在阿富汗永远不会成功，因为它摧毁的是唯一一种能在南方的恶劣气候中生长的作物—而它又是上百万人的主要收入来源。

column1: So a new, long-term, economically sustainable solution is urgently needed – one that directly engages with the communities that are suffering most – in order to achieve the support of the deeply impoverished rural population.
column2: 所以，现在急需一个新的、长期的、并且在经济层面上可持续的解决方案—一个与最困苦的当地社区直接相关的方案—从而赢得最贫困的农村人口的支持。

column1: As a way to address this dilemma, the Senlis Council is proposing to run scientific pilot projects to research an opium licensing system for Afghanistan, which would be a core component of the economic reconstruction process.
column2: 作为摆脱困境的途径之一 ， “ 森利斯委员会 ” （ Senlis Council）正提议为研究针对阿富汗的鸦片许可体系而进行科学试点项目。 这可能会成为经济重建进程中的一个核心组成部分。

column1: A system in which poppy is cultivated under license for the production of pain-killing medicines such as morphine and codeine would allow farmers to pursue their traditional livelihood and way of life, and, more importantly, to feed themselves and their families.
column2: 它是一种为生产吗啡和可待因等止痛药而特许种植罂粟的制度。 这种制度能让农民继续他们传统的谋生方式，更重要的是可以让他们养家糊口。

column1: There is a global shortage of morphine and codeine, particularly in underdeveloped countries, where these vital medicines are often in short supply, if not completely unavailable.
column2: 全球的吗啡和可待因供应短缺。 特别在欠发达国家，这些重要药品即便不是没有也是紧缺的。

column1: Not only would poppy licensing address the poverty and hunger crises that have engulfed the south of Afghanistan; it also would stabilize existing local structures, giving communities a reason to support President Hamid Karzai’s government and the international community.
column2: 罂粟种植许可制度不仅可以缓解笼罩在阿富汗南部的贫穷和饥饿危机；它还能稳定现有的本地架构，给与当地社会足够的理由支持卡尔扎伊总统的政府和国际社会。

column1: Farmers would gain a sense of ownership in counter-narcotics efforts, in sharp contrast to the current idealistic – and evidently un-achievable – policy of crop eradication.
column2: 与现行的、理想主义的—且明显难以为继的—铲除行动形成鲜明对比的，是农民们在反毒品的计划中还能获得一种主人翁的感觉。

column1: We must have the backing of the Afghan people if we are to defeat the Taliban.
column2: 如果要击败塔利班，我们必须要有阿富汗人民的支持。

column1: By endorsing such an initiative, the international community would demonstrate that it is in Afghanistan for the good of the local population, which would help farmers sever ties with the insurgency.
column2: 通过采取如是的举措，国际社会可以证明它在阿富汗的目的是为了当地民众的利益，从而帮助农民切断与叛乱的联系。

column1: But for such a system to be successful, the extreme poverty in the south of the country must first be our top priority.
column2: 但这样一个体系要取得成功，该国南方的赤贫问题就是我们的当务之急。

column1: According to the World Food Program, 70% of the population lack food security.
column2: 据“世界粮食计划”统计，当地70%的人口缺少食品安��。

column1: An immediate injection of emergency food and medical aid is urgently needed to break the vicious circle of suffering and violence.
column2: 马上输入紧急食物和医疗援助是打破困苦和暴力的恶性循环所急需的。

column1: Only then could a new, long-term development strategy in Afghanistan – one that admits that the international community is not winning the war, and that the status quo is unacceptable – be implemented.
column2: 只有到那时，一个在阿富汗的新的长期发展战略—一个承认国际社会正在战争中落败，且当前形势不可接受的战略—才能付诸实施。

column1: Licensing the opium crop would be a realistic and pragmatic cornerstone of that strategy’s success.
column2: 鸦片种植许可制度会是这一战略成功的一个现实而切实的里程碑。

column1: The Western Alliance in the Digital Age
column2: 数字时代的西方联盟

column1: MUNICH – This weekend, Helmut Schmidt and Henry Kissinger will participate in a discussion at the Munich Security Conference (MSC) – just as they did a half-century ago, when they took part in the first “Internationale Wehrkunde-Begegnung” (the forerunner of today’s conference).
column2: 慕尼黑—这个周末，赫尔穆特·施密特（Helmut Schmidt）和亨利·基辛格将在慕尼黑安全会议（MSC）上参与讨论 — — 半个世纪前，��MSC的前身第一次举办时，他们就曾经参与过讨论。

column1: In the meantime, many developments around the world have given us reason to rejoice – but also to reflect.
column2: 与此同时，世界各地的许多发展趋势让我们兴奋，也让我们深思。

column1: It is not only the crises extending from Ukraine to Syria that will prevent the MSC, the fiftieth, from becoming an exercise in self-celebration.
column2: 让第十五届MSC无法成为欢庆舞台的不仅仅是乌克兰和叙利亚危机的发酵。

column1: The transatlantic partnership, traditionally the backbone of the conference, has seen better days than these.
column2: 大西洋两岸的伙伴关系，MSC的传统基石也不如以前那样牢固了。

column1: The United States has now at least recognized that a great deal of trust has been lost in recent months, owing to the scale of surveillance undertaken by its National Security Agency.
column2: 如今，美国至少已经意识到，因为其国家安全局的监控行为，它在最近几个月损失了很多的信任。

column1: President Barack Obama’s speech about reforms of US intelligence-gathering activities, as well as his subsequent interview on German television, represented a first attempt to regain the confidence of America’s allies.
column2: 总统奥巴马关于美国情报搜集行动改革的演讲以及随后参与的德国电视访问算得上重新争取美国盟友信任的第一批动作。

column1: But it signals, at most, the beginning of an intensive transatlantic dialogue on the issue.
column2: 但这充其量只是开始加强关于这一问题的跨大西洋对话的信号。

column1: The topic is too broad to be discussed solely among governments and secret services.
column2: 这个主题所涉太广，无法只在政府和秘密机构间讨论。

column1: What we need is a more comprehensive international debate that engages, say, the American and German publics, as well as the US Congress and the German Bundestag – in short, an intra-Western debate about our relationship in the digital age.
column2: 我们需要的是一场更全面的国际讨论，包括（比如）美国和德国公众以及美国国会和德国联邦议会 — — 简言之，这应该是一场关于我们在数字时代的关系的泛西方的讨论。

column1: In 1963, when Ewald von Kleist invited participants to Munich for the first conference, which Americans fondly call the “Wehrkunde” to this day, the motivating idea was to invite our most important allies to a discussion about the major strategic issues directly affecting Germany and NATO.
column2: 1963年，克莱斯特（Ewald von Kleist）来到慕尼黑参加美国人今天天真地称为“Wehrkunde”的第一届会议，其初衷是邀请我们最重要的盟友讨论直接影响德国和北约的重大战略问题。

column1: The main topic, at that time, was the Atlantic Alliance’s nuclear strategy.
column2: 当时的主要议题是北约的核战略。

column1: After all, Germany would have been the first victim of a nuclear confrontation between NATO and the Warsaw Pact countries.
column2: 毕竟如果北约和华约爆发核冲突，德国将是首当其冲者。

column1: Kleist wanted to contribute to the creation of a German “strategic community,” which could make its own contributions to the NATO debate, rather than just absorbing whatever their technologically superior US ally proposed.
column2: 克莱斯特希望推动成立德国的“战略社区 ” ， 进而在北约的讨论中起到作用，而不仅仅是唯其名义上的上级美国的马首是瞻。

column1: In a way, we are in a similar situation today.
column2: 从某种程度上说，如今我们面临相同的局面。

column1: Though the security implications of the digital age are less tangible and not as destructive as a nuclear attack, the technological possibilities fundamentally alter the playing field of international relations.
column2: 与核打击相比，数字时代的安全影响并不那么有形，也不那么具有破坏性，尽管如此，技术可行性仍从根本上改变了国际关系竞技场。

column1: The revelations concerning the NSA’s surveillance activities are just the start.
column2: 美国国安局监控行为只是揭开了冰山一角。

column1: A future of “thinking drones” and defensive and offensive cyber weapons raises new ethical, legal, and political questions.
column2: 未来的“思想无人机”和防御性和进攻性网络武器将带来新的伦理、法律和政治问题。

column1: We Europeans need to be self-critical and admit that we are not only lagging behind in terms of technical capabilities; we are also in danger of not fully grasping in time the possibilities and dangers of the digital world.
column2: 我们欧洲人需要自我批判并承认我们不但拖了技术能力的后腿；我们还有可能无法在第一时间把握数字世界的可能性和危险性。

column1: And of course, we will hardly be able to engage in meaningful negotiations with the Americans on cyber issues unless we succeed in establishing a united stance within the European Union.
column2: 当然，除非我们在欧盟内部成功形成了统一战线，否则不可能与美国人展开有意义的谈话。

column1: Doing so would put us in far better position to negotiate on equal terms with the US, just as we can on trade issues.
column2: 实现这一目标能让我们更加有利地与美国展开平等谈判，正如我们在贸易问题上做得那样。

column1: In the past, the Western allies’ participation in NATO and its Nuclear Planning Group accommodated their concerns and prevented them from becoming mere objects of US strategy.
column2: 在过去，西方盟国加入北约及其核计划集团（Nuclear Planning Group）安抚了它们的担忧，也防止了它们沦为美国战略的目标。

column1: Today, we need similar initiatives with regard to the digital world.
column2: 如今，我们需要在数字世界做同样的安排。

column1: Those hoping to achieve true cooperation must be willing to make their own contributions.
column2: 要想形成真正的合作就必须做出自己的贡献。

column1: This year’s MSC will include not only security officials from many countries.
column2: 今年的MSC不仅将包括来自多个国家的安全官员。

column1: Three dozen German MPs and a significant US Congressional delegation will also participate.
column2: 三十六位德国联邦议会议员和庞大的美国国会代表团也将出席。

column1: That is why the conference is an excellent opportunity to step up the transatlantic debate.
column2: 正因如此，本届会议将是建立跨大西洋讨论的绝佳机会。

column1: After all, let’s be honest: there will be real changes in US intelligence agencies’ behavior only if Congress regulates their activities more strictly.
column2: 毕竟，我们应该坦承，只有国会更严格地规范其行为，美国情报机构的行动才会发生实质改变。

column1: The revelations and resulting debates in recent months have shown that many US politicians are also uneasy about the liberties taken by the secret services.
column2: 最近几个月以来的事件发酵和由此带来的争论表明，许多美国政客也对秘密机构干涉自由深感忧虑。

column1: However, without domestic pressure, little will change.
column2: 但是，没有国内压力就不可能出现多少变化。

column1: It is all the more important that societal stakeholders – companies, NGOs, or international commissions of experts – both here and in the US become more heavily involved than before.
column2: 欧洲和美国的社会各界 — — 公司、非政府组织或国际专家委员会 — — 比从前更积极地加入其中是至关重要的。

column1: This issue affects us all.
column2: 这一问题影响着我们所有人。

column1: The debate is not – and should not be – between Europe and the US.
column2: 这一讨论不是 — — 也不应该是 — — 欧洲和美国的讨论。

column1: Some Americans are grateful for Edward J. Snowden’s revelations about the NSA, which they believe have stimulated urgently needed public deliberation.
column2: 一些美国人也感谢斯诺登（Edward J. Snowden）揭发国安局，他们认为这刺激了急需的公共思考。

column1: The institutionally assured possibility of self-criticism is, arguably, the West’s best characteristic – its outstanding trait.
column2: 有制度保证的自我批判是西方最优秀的品质，也是它的突出特征。

column1: Our democracies are better organized than other systems to scrutinize their own policies and respond to criticism.
column2: 我们的民主制度在监督我们自己的政策和相应批评方面比其他制度更加井井有条。

column1: In the 1960’s, the West had to agree on a common strategy for the nuclear age, and learn to deal with the atomic threat.
column2: 20世纪60年代，西方需要在核时代的共同战略上达成一致，并研究如何应对原子威胁。

column1: Subsequently, we were able to take the first steps toward arms control and disarmament.
column2: 随后，我们就迈出了通向核武器控制和去核化的第一步。

column1: Today, we need a similar debate in the West regarding our strategy for the digital age if we want to overcome new challenges without denying our identity as liberal democracies.
column2: 如今，西方需要类似的讨论思考信息时代战略，如果我们想克服新挑战又不否定我们的自由民主国家身份的话。

column1: This weekend in Munich, the Schmidts and Kissingers of today and tomorrow will have an opportunity to engage in what is probably the most important strategic debate of our time: how to prevent the West from falling apart inthe digital age.
column2: 在本周末的慕尼黑，当代和未来施密特们和基辛格们将有机会参与可能是现时代最重要的战略讨论：如何防止西方在数字时代落于人后。

column1: Germany’s Same Old Foreign Policy
column2: 德国外交政策老方一帖

column1: MUNICH – More than ten weeks after its general election, Germany continues to be without a new government.
column2: 慕尼黑—大选已经过去十周，德国仍没有产生新政府。

column1: But, though the post-election coalition negotiations have been unusually prolonged, there is little disagreement between the parties over foreign and security policy.
column2: 但是，尽管选举后的执政联盟谈判时间反常地长，在外交和安全政策上各党派之间并无多少分歧。

column1: Indeed, when Chancellor Angela Merkel’s Christian Democratic Union and the Social Democratic Party (SPD) finally presented their coalition agreement on November 27, the working group on foreign and security policy had been finished with its job for two weeks.
column2: 事实上，当总理默克尔的基督教民主联盟（Christian Democratic Union）和社会民主党（Social Democratic Party ，SDP）在11月27日最终宣布执政联盟协议时，外交和安全政策工作小组已经完工了两个星期。

column1: Except for a few tweaks that generally resonate more at home than with Germany’s European and international partners (such as requiring the government to be more transparent concerning arms exports to autocratic regimes), continuity and caution will remain the watchwords of German foreign and security policy.
column2: 除了一些总体上在国内比与德国的欧洲和国际伙伴引起更多共鸣的微调之外（比如要求政府在对专制政权武器出口的问题上更透明 ） ， 连续性和谨慎仍将是德国外交和安全政策的关键词。

column1: Observers may disagree about whether German leaders’ stance provides a welcome sign of reliability or reflects a lamentable lack of diplomatic ambition.
column2: 观察者可能对德国领导人的立场代表着可靠的积极信号还是反映了可悲的缺少外交雄心有不同见解。

column1: Those who hope for more active German leadership may well be disappointed by the new government.
column2: 希望看到德国领导人更加积极的人可能会对新政府感到失望。

column1: Big ideas, or even big questions, are notably absent from the coalition agreement.
column2: 执政联盟协议的一个显著特征是看不见大思想，甚至连大问题都没有。

column1: This is very much a reflection of many Germans’ views about themselves and their future: they are comfortable with the status quo, see no need for further reform proposals, are not interested in grand strategy, and would largely prefer to be left alone.
column2: 这在很大程度上反映了许多德国人对自己和未来的看法：对现状踌躇满志，认为没有必要进行进一步改革，也对宏大战略不感兴趣，宁可独自冷眼旁观。

column1: Consider NATO policy.
column2: 就拿北约政策来说。

column1: Successive German governments have maintained that the alliance should be, or even is, the place to discuss and decide on key security challenges.
column2: 连续几届德国政府都坚持该联盟应该成为 — — 甚至已经是 — — 讨论和决定重要安全挑战事宜的场所。

column1: But Germany has at times been rather reluctant to take crisis issues to NATO headquarters.
column2: 但德国时不时会不愿意将危机问题拿到北约总部讨论。

column1: And when it comes to provision of military and civilian security beyond what the coalition agreement calls “our geographic neighborhood,” the incoming government will favor enabling other regional organizations to do the job.
column2: 而在超越执政联盟协议所谓的“我们的地理邻居”范围之外的军事和民事安全问题，新一届政府更愿意让地区性组织来承担责任。

column1: Or consider the question of Turkey’s accession to the European Union.
column2: 或者拿土耳其加入欧盟的问题来说。

column1: Continuing disagreement between the coalition partners will not permit a proactive German role.
column2: 执政联盟伙伴一直存在分歧将让德国无法占据主动。

column1: Instead, the compromise solution will be no solution: neither yes nor no.
column2: 相反，妥协方案也不是方案：既非是，也非否。

column1: At the same time, some interesting new perspectives appear in the coalition agreement.
column2: 与此同时，���些有趣的新方面出现在执政联盟协议中。

column1: For starters, the United States’ strategic “pivot” to the Asia-Pacific region is described as an opportunity for Europe to assert a coordinated foreign policy that finally plays a role in the development of cooperative policies in the region.
column2: 首先，美国的亚太地区战略“支点”被描述成欧洲主张最终能在该地区合作政策发展中起到作用的协作外交政策的机会。

column1: Moreover, to encourage this outcome, the coalition agreement promises that the government will “adopt new initiatives to strengthen and deepen the Common Foreign and Security Policy” after the EU summit in December 2013.
column2: 此外，为了促进这一结果，执政联盟协议承诺政府将在2013年12月的欧盟峰会后“采取新措施强化和深化共同外交和安全政策（Common Foreign and Security Policy ） ” 。

column1: It includes a call for an annual European Council session on security and defense, as well as for a strategic debate about the purpose of EU foreign relations.
column2: 其中包括呼吁增加一个关于安全和防务的欧盟理事会年度议程，以及一个关于欧盟外交关系的战略性讨论。

column1: In addition, the German government will support European defense integration and maintain the establishment of a European army as a long-term goal.
column2: 此外，德国政府将支持欧洲的防务一体化，并把建立欧洲军队作为长期目标。

column1: This may not amount to much in practice, but the language in this section is much less tepid than elsewhere.
column2: 或许这不会大规模落实，但这一部分的用词比其他部分都要温和。

column1: Finally, the coalition agreement responds to concerns about Germany’s ability to be a reliable partner in NATO and EU military missions in a potentially more integrated EU defense organization.
column2: 最后，执政联盟协议回应了关于德国成为北约的可靠伙伴的能力以及未来一体化的欧盟防务组织中的欧盟军事任务的疑虑。

column1: According to a 1994 ruling by Germany’s Constitutional Court, the German parliament has the final say when it comes to deploying soldiers.
column2: 根据1994年德国宪法法院判决，德国议会对于调遣军队问题拥有最终决定权。

column1: However, Germany’s partners will hardly agree to integrate forces further if the German parliament were to retain a veto over their deployment.
column2: 但是，如果德国议会握有兵力部署否决权，那么伙伴国是不会同意武装力量的进一步一体化的。

column1: The coalition partners disagree about how urgent it is to sort out this issue.
column2: 关于如何厘清这一问题，执政联盟没有达成一致。

column1: Nonetheless, they have agreed that, within a year, a commission will provide different options and models to protect the German parliament’s rights while providing assurances to Germany’s European partners that the country will be a reliable contributor to troop deployments.
column2: 尽管如此，它们同意在一年内通过一个委员会提出不同观点和模式以保护德国议会的权利，同时向德国的欧洲伙伴国保证德国将是军事部署的可靠积极因素。

column1: Should the SPD, which will vote on the coalition agreement in early December, block the formation of the new government (an unlikely development but not entirely out of the question), disputes over security and defense affairs would not be the culprit.
column2: 12月初，SPD将就执政联盟协议投票。 如果SPD不通过新政府的形成（可能性微乎其微，但不能完全排除 ） ， 罪魁并不在安全和防务事务的争议。

column1: Aside from a few minor particulars, consensus prevails.
column2: 除了极少数次要方面，其余都以形成了一致。

column1: For some, that is a cause for ambivalence.
column2: 对一些人来说，这造成了矛盾心理。

column1: “I do not like the idea that Germany plays itself up to impose its will on others,” German President Joachim Gauck said recently. “Yet neither do I like the idea that Germany plays itself down to eschew risks or solidarity.”
column2: “我不喜欢德国妄尊自大、将自己的意愿强加于他人的说法 ， ” 德国总统高克最近如是说 ， “ 但我也不喜欢德国妄自菲薄、逃避风险和团结的说法 。 ”

column1: Whether German foreign policy can and should do more is a reasonable question.
column2: 德国外交政策是否可以以及应该做得更多是一个合理的问题。

column1: To some degree, the new coalition will feel the pressure and consider the necessity to assume more responsibility for international leadership.
column2: 从某种程度上说，新执政联盟会感到压力，并认为有必要承担更多的国际领导责任。

column1: But it will respond ever so slowly and ever so carefully.
column2: 但它会以极慢极谨慎的方式作出反应。

column1: The bottom line is this: Expect no surprises from Germany.
column2: 总而言之，不要期望从德国身上收获惊喜。

column1: Considering how difficult it has been for some, if not most, other EU countries to deal with the challenges of the last five years, that is actually rather good news.
column2: 考虑到一些（如果不是大部分的话）欧盟国家在过去五年中应对挑战的艰难，这实际上是一个大大的好消息。

column1: Wolfowitz and the World Bank at Bay
column2: 陷入困境的沃尔福威茨和世界银行

column1: Will World Bank President Paul Wolfowitz’s troubles finally catalyze real change at the World Bank?
column2: 世界银行总裁沃尔福威茨的困局是否会最终引发该行真正的变革呢？

column1: Will there finally be an end to the archaic practice by which the President of the United States unilaterally appoints the head of the world’s most important development agency?
column2: 是否会最终废止古老的做法，也就是由美国总统单方面指定全世界最为重要的发展机构的领导人呢？

column1: Facing an extraordinary rebuke from the Bank’s ministerial oversight committee and open revolt from his professional staff, Wolfowitz has faint hope of limping through the last three years of his term.
column2: 沃尔福威茨现在面临着世界银行部长监督委员会的指责以及该行员工的公开反叛，能够苟延渡过最后三年任期的机会渺茫。

column1: The immediate uproar is over the exceedingly generous pay and promotion package that Wolfowitz awarded in 2005 to his girlfriend as compensation for leaving the Bank to pave the way for his arrival.
column2: 造成众怒的直接原因是沃尔福威茨在2005年提拔其女友以及极为大度的加薪以便其离开世界银行来为沃尔福威茨就任铺平道路。

column1: At a time when the Bank has been emphasizing high governance standards as the key to development, the recent revelation of that arrangement’s details have dealt a serious blow to the Bank’s credibility.
column2: 在世界银行强调较高的管理标准作为发展的关键的时候，这一项安排的细节曝光对该行的信誉度是一个沉重的打击。

column1: But even if Wolfowitz is eventually forced to resign, nothing will be gained if US President George W. Bush is allowed summarily to choose his replacement, as US Presidents have been doing ever since the Bank was founded after World War II.
column2: 但是，即使沃尔福威茨最终被迫辞职，如果美国总统布什像二战后世界银行成立以来的历届总统那样可以随意选择其接班人，那么，这还是于事无补。

column1: Instead, the Bank’s head should be chosen in an open and transparent process that aims to select the best-qualified candidate, whether from the US, Europe, or the developing world.
column2: 相反，世界银行的领导人应当在一个公开和透明的程序中做出选择，这一程序的目的在于挑选最为称职的候选人，而无论其来自美国、欧洲抑或是发展中世界。

column1: Indeed, a big part of Wolfowitz’s weakness today is the way he came to his job, as an in-your-face appointment from a US administration weak at international cooperation.
column2: 确实，沃尔福威茨现在的弱点的很大一部分是其任职的方式，也就是在由一个在国际合作上无所作为的美国政府专横地加以任命。

column1: The World Bank is a development finance institution.
column2: 世界银行是一个发展金融组织。

column1: But Wolfowitz’s background at the US State and Defense Departments gave him no real expertise or experience in either area.
column2: 但是沃尔福威茨在美国国务院和国防部的背景并不给他在任何一个领域提供实际的专长和经验。

column1: Instead, his claim to fame was his role as architect of America’s failed war in Iraq.
column2: 相反，其名声在外之处却是作为美国失败的伊拉克战争的设计师角色。

column1: By all accounts, Wolfowitz is brilliant, but it seems inconceivable that an open, transparent, and multilateral selection process would have chosen him to head the World Bank.
column2: 总体而言，沃尔福威茨是出众的，但是，一个公开、透明以及多边遴选程序挑选他领导世界银行是难以想象的。

column1: I reach this conclusion even though I am sympathetic to the Bush administration’s desire to catalyze change at the Bank.
column2: 尽管我同情布什政府促进世界银行变革的愿望，但是我还是得出这一结论。

column1: I have long advocated shifting the Bank’s center of gravity from lending to outright grants, a policy that the Bush administration strongly endorses.
column2: 我长久以来主张将该行的重心从贷款转移到直接赠款之上，布什政府强烈支持这一政策。

column1: But choosing someone with no obvious background or experience in economic development was not the way to make progress on this front.
column2: 但是挑选某一没有明显经济发展背景或经验的人并不是在这一领域取得进展的途径。

column1: A more open selection process, indeed, would have zoomed in on the fact that Wolfowitz’s girlfriend worked at the Bank.
column2: 确实，更为公开的遴选程序将会突出沃尔福威茨的女友在该行供职这一事实。

column1: This may seem a trivial issue, but it is not, given the Bank’s strong policies to protect against nepotism.
column2: 这看似小事，但是鉴于世界银行严格的防止裙带关系政策，实则不然。

column1: If Wolfowitz were otherwise overwhelmingly the most qualified candidate, the selection committee may have found a way to finesse the issue, openly and transparently.
column2: 如果沃尔福威茨是一个毫无争议、最为合格的候选人，那么，挑选委员会就可以公开和透明地找到妥善处理此事的办法。

column1: But, given his questionable fit for the job in the first place, the girlfriend issue might have been disqualifying.
column2: 但是，由于他首先是否适宜担任此职就令人质疑，女友问题就可能令其不适宜这一职务了。

column1: Why does the world meekly go along with the status quo and let the US dictate the Bank’s top position?
column2: 为何世界顺从当前的局面并且让美国独裁世界银行的最高职务呢？

column1: It is a sorry tale of poor global governance.
column2: 这是一个不幸的全球管理不善事件。

column1: Europe does not get in America’s way because it wants to maintain Europe’s equally out-dated privilege of appointing the head of the International Monetary Fund, the Bank’s sister institution.
column2: 欧洲并不想干涉美国，因为它想要维持欧洲所有的、同样也是过时的任命世界银行姊妹组织国际货币基金组织总裁的特权。

column1: Asia has little choice but to defer to the US and Europe’s shenanigans because it is grossly under-represented in both organizations.
column2: 亚洲除了听从美国和欧洲的把戏之外选择不多，因为在这两个组织内它的代表权不够。

column1: As for Africa, its leaders are loath to do or say anything that might interrupt the flow of World Bank largesse.
column2: 至于非洲，其领导人们不愿做或者说任何可能打断世界银行施舍的事情。

column1: Many people, including myself, have long complained about the leadership selection process at the World Bank and the IMF.
column2: 包括我本人在内的许多人一直抱怨世界银行和国际货币基金组织的领导人遴选过程。

column1: How can the Bank and the Fund continue to go around lecturing developing economies on good governance and transparency but fail to allow change in their own houses?
column2: 世界银行和国际货币基金组织如何能够继续向发展中经济体讲授良好管理和透明而又不在其自身机构中允许改革呢？

column1: Now and again, both organizations pay lip service to the issue.
column2: 现在，两个组织都是再一次对这一问题文过饰非。

column1: But so far, they have exhibited no real desire for change.
column2: 但是目前为止，它们还没有表现出变革的欲望。

column1: To be fair, the IMF’s leadership is making a determined effort to give dynamic emerging economies, particularly in Asia, a bigger say in Fund governance.
column2: 公平而言，国际货币基金组织的领导层正在做出坚定的努力来给充满活力的新兴经济体，特别是亚洲在该组织管理中更大的发言权。

column1: If carried far enough, this process would ultimately catalyze the necessary changes.
column2: 如果进行的足够多的话，这一进程将最终促进引发必要的变革。

column1: Unfortunately, the IMF’s rebalancing efforts are proceeding at a glacial pace.
column2: 不幸的是，国际货币基金组织的重心平衡的努力进展过于缓慢。

column1: At the World Bank, nothing seems to be happening at all.
column2: 在世界银行，好像根本就无动于衷。

column1: Perhaps when Gordon Brown becomes the UK’s next prime minister, he will be able to convince the G7 group of rich countries to lead the charge for change.
column2: 可能当布朗成为英国下任首相之际，他将会能够说服七国集团率先变革。

column1: As head of the Fund’s ministerial oversight committee, Brown understands the issues as well as anyone.
column2: 作为国际货币基金组织部长监督委员会主席，布朗与其他人一样理解这些问题。

column1: Or perhaps the Wolfowitz debacle will prove to be the catalyst.
column2: 或许，沃尔福威茨的惨败会成为变革因素。

column1: Maybe at last, the next World Bank or IMF president will come from outside their usual domains.
column2: 可能最终下一任国际货币基金组织或者世界银行的总裁会来自通常的领地以外。

column1: There are plenty of great potential non-American candidates.
column2: 有许多不错的非美国籍的候选人。

column1: South African Finance Minister Trevor Manuel has ably served as head of the World Bank’s oversight committee and would make a brilliant World Bank president.
column2: 南非财政部长曼努埃尔出色地担任了世界银行监督委员会的主席，可以成为该行杰出的总裁。

column1: And it still could be a qualified American.
column2: 当然也会有合格的美国人选。

column1: What about Bill Clinton?
column2: 克林顿如何？

column1: One way or the other, the Bank and the IMF leadership selection process urgently needs to be revamped.
column2: 不管怎样，世界银行和国际货币基金组织的领导层遴选进程急需改革。

column1: What the Wolfowitz debacle tells us most clearly is that the time for patience with the status quo is over.
column2: 沃尔福威茨惨败告诉我们最为清楚的是，对现状的耐心已经结束了。

column1: Women and Development
column2: 女性和发展

column1: COPENHAGEN – A girl born in South Asia or sub-Saharan Africa faces a cruel double burden.
column2: 哥本哈根—一个出生在南亚和撒哈拉沙漠以南非洲地区的女童面临着残酷的双重负担。

column1: She will grow up in a region beset by poverty, disease, war or famine.
column2: 她将会在一个充满贫穷、疾病、战争或饥荒的地区成长。

column1: She will also confront these challenges with the added disadvantage of being female.
column2: 她还要带着身为女性的弱势来面对这些挑战。

column1: Although more attention is being given to gender issues, inequality persists in every culture, country, and continent.
column2: 虽然性别问题已经被给予了更多的关注，但不平等现象仍然在各个文化、国家和大陆存在着。

column1: A new study for the Copenhagen Consensus project shows that eliminating this disparity is an investment with high payoffs.
column2: 一项关于哥本哈根共识项目的新近研究表明消除这些不平等是一项高回报的投资。

column1: Despite global interest in education for all, many girls in poor countries continue to be denied basic education; right from the start, they are disadvantaged.
column2: 尽管有全球在普及教育方面的努力，但许多贫穷国家的女童仍然被剥夺了基本教育的权利；从一开始，她们就是弱势群体。

column1: Three in five illiterate children in the world are girls.
column2: 世界上文盲儿童中的五分之三是女童。

column1: Particularly in South Asia and sub-Saharan Africa, cultural norms and economic hardships stop parents from sending their daughters to school or from keeping them in school for as long as they enroll their sons.
column2: 特别是在南亚和撒哈拉以南非洲地区，文化传统和经济艰辛阻止了父母让他们的女儿上学，或让她们在学校里接受与儿子们同等时间的教育。

column1: This unequal investment is neither equitable nor efficient.
column2: 这种不平等的投资既不公平又很低效。

column1: An obvious solution is to build more schools in places where girls and boys must be educated separately.
column2: 一种显而易见的解决方案就是在男女不能同校的地方建立更多的学校。

column1: In poor Muslim countries like Pakistan, Yemen, and Morocco, single-sex schooling is the norm, but many rural areas can afford only one public school, which is usually set aside for boys.
column2: 在许多贫穷的穆斯林国家，如巴基斯坦、也门和摩洛哥，单一性别学校是一种传统，但许多农村地区只能负担一所公立学校，而这所学校往往是针对男童的。

column1: In theory, about half of the education gap in these areas could be closed by building girls’ schools.
column2: 从理论上讲，通过建立女子学校，这些地区的男女入学差距可以被缩小近一半。

column1: Elsewhere, supply constraints are not the problem.
column2: 在其他地方，物力制约不是问题。

column1: Instead, policymakers must find ways to strengthen the incentives for parents to send their daughters to school.
column2: 政策制定者们必须想办法强化让父母们将女儿送去读书的激励机制。

column1: In countries where the family’s cost of schooling girls is lowered either by a no-fee policy or by a stipend for girls who enroll in school, girls’ enrollment rate increases.
column2: 在那些降低了家庭让女童接受教育的成本的国家（不论是通过免学费还是为女童入学提供补贴 ） ， 女童的入学率都增加了。

column1: The experiences of these few countries lead us to propose a system whereby mothers are paid if their school-age daughters attend school regularly from the 3rd to the 9th grade. This would increase girls’ enrollment and also put money into women’s hands – important because studies show that money given to women is more likely to provide positive nutritional and health benefits for their children than money given to men.
column2: 这几个国家的经验让我们提议建立这样的一个体系：如果学龄的女儿们从三年级到九年级正常上学，那么她们的母亲将得到报酬，既增加女童的入学率又增加女性的收入—这是非常重要的，因为研究显示相较于男性，女性更会将得到的资助用于向她们的子女提供积极的营养和健康福利。

column1: It also provides the women with greater bargaining power in their own households.
column2: 这也使女性在自己的家庭中更有发言权。

column1: The annual cost per pupil would be $32.
column2: 每一个小学生一年的教育成本是32美元。

column1: Covering every eligible girl in sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia for a year would cost $6 billion.
column2: 让撒哈拉以南非洲和南亚的所有适龄女童接受教育的年成本是60亿美元。

column1: Benefits from increased future wages and the reduction in health-care use would be between three and 26 times higher.
column2: 而从未来薪资增加和医疗费用降低中获得的收益要（比这成本）高3到26倍。

column1: Pregnancy is one of the most vulnerable times for poor women; 99% of the 529,000 women who die annually from pregnancy-related complications live in developing countries.
column2: 妊娠期是贫穷妇女最为脆弱的时期之一；每年死于与妊娠有关的并发症的529000名妇女中，有99%都在发展中国家。

column1: Severe malnutrition and the absence of prenatal care during pregnancy put both mother and child at serious risk.
column2: 严重的营养不良和妊娠期的产前护理缺失让母亲和小孩面临严重的风险。

column1: Spending $3.9 billion on family planning and maternal health initiatives, such as provision of emergency contraception in sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia, could avert 1.4 million infant deaths and 142,000 pregnancy-related deaths in women.
column2: 在计划生育和妇科医疗方面（如在撒哈拉以南非洲和南亚地区提供紧急避孕服务）支出39亿美元，可以避免140万婴儿死亡和142000桩与妊娠相关的妇女死亡。

column1: Making reproductive services available to women who cannot afford to pay their way can help prevent these deaths.
column2: 向经济上无力负担的女性提供生殖服务有助于避免这些死亡。

column1: But such services must not shy away from promoting and providing modern contraceptive methods to avoid unwanted pregnancies.
column2: 但这些服务决不能羞于推广和提供现代避孕方法，从而避免意外怀孕。

column1: Nearly 20% of women in developing countries report that they would like to stop having more children but are not using any form of contraception or family planning, possibly because reproductive services are not available.
column2: 发展中国家近20%的妇女表示不愿再生育更多的小孩，但却没有采用任何的避孕或计划生育措施。 这可能是因为生殖服务缺位。

column1: For adolescent girls, early marriage or an unwanted pregnancy typically curtails schooling.
column2: 对青春期女童而言，早婚和意外怀孕通常会打断她们的教育。

column1: Delaying marriage and childbearing allows them to gain more education and perhaps more earning opportunities, as well as improved health, education, and labor market success for their future children – benefits worth ten times more than the cost of providing reproductive services.
column2: 推迟结婚和生育能让她们获得更多的教育、更多的收入机会以及为他们未来的子女获得更好的医疗、教育和就业市场的成功—这样的收益是生殖服务成本的十倍。

column1: Other tools, aside from schooling, can help women improve their income-earning ability.
column2: 除了学校教育之外的其它工具能够帮助女性提高她们创收的能力。

column1: Microfinance institutions, such as Bangladesh’s Grameen Bank, play a vital role in allowing self-employed women to build profitable businesses.
column2: 微型金融机构，如孟加拉国的Grameen银行，在让从事自由职业的妇女创业赢利方面发挥了关键作用。

column1: Small loans empower women by giving them more control over household assets and resources, more autonomy and decision-making power, and greater access to participation in public life.
column2: 小额贷款通过给予女性对家庭资产和资源更多控制权、更多自主和决策权以及更多参与公共生活的机会，提升了她们的权利。

column1: Women are more likely than men to meet regular repayments and to spend their earnings on children’s health and education.
column2: 女性比男性更可能按时还款并将她们的收入用于子女的健康和教育。

column1: Policymakers should continue to facilitate the rollout of microfinance programs.
column2: 政策制定者们应该继续为微型金融项目的实施提供方便。

column1: Studies show that each dollar loaned by a microfinance institution increases household expenditure by almost 10% in the first year, and that the benefits will continue for another 30 years.
column2: 研究表明微型金融机构贷出的每一美元在第一年会使家庭支出增加10 % ， 而且这种收益会持续30年。

column1: Benefits are estimated to end up about six times higher than the costs.
column2: 据估计总收益将比成本高6倍。

column1: Though women have the right to vote in almost every country, gender inequalities in political representation remain large.
column2: 虽然在几乎所有的国家女性都获得了选举权，但在政治代表上的性别不平等仍然严重。

column1: Governments should consider gender quotas at the local level of politics.
column2: 政府应该考虑地方政治中的性别配额。

column1: Greater female representation may not necessarily lead to more emphasis on “female” policy priorities, but in India, village councils with gender quotas for village chiefs have higher levels of safe drinking water, better immunization coverage and roads, and less bribery.
column2: 更高的女性代表率不一定产生对“女性”政策优先的重视，但在印度，对村民委员会的委员有性别配额要求的地方，饮用水安全程度更高、疫苗接种率更高、路况更好，贿赂的情况也更少。

column1: There may be some losses from electing women because they tend to have less political experience than men, but the record in India suggests that if it took 20 years to establish a 30% share of women in local positions in other countries, the benefits would be at least double the costs of achieving this.
column2: 女性当选可能会有一些缺憾，因为她们相较于男性政治经验往往不足。 但从印度的经验来看，如果花20年的时间使其他国家的地方官员中女性的比例达到30 % ， 那么其产生的收益至少是实现这一目标所耗成本的两倍。

column1: Being a woman need not and should not be among the greatest challenges of life.
column2: 身为女性不需要也不应该成为生活中最大的挑战之一。

column1: The Next Stage of Women’s Emancipation?
column2: 妇女解放的新阶段？
伦敦—2018年2月6日是《人民代表法案 》 （ Representation of the People Act）诞生一百周年。

column1: LONDON – February 6, 2018, marked the centenary of the Representation of the People Act, which enfranchised (some) women in Britain for the first time – a reward for women’s work during World War I. In honor of this historic event, statues of two leaders in the struggle for women’s suffrage, Millicent Fawcett and Emmeline Pankhurst, are to be erected in British cities.
column2: 该法案首次授予（部分）英国妇女选举权 — — 以表彰妇女在第一次世界大战期间做出的贡献。 为了铭记这一历史性事件，英国许多城市都为两位妇女参政权斗争的领导者 — — 米莉森特·福西特（Millicent Fawcett）和艾米琳·潘克斯特（Emmeline Pankhurst）树立了雕像。

column1: The economic emancipation of women had to wait till after World War II, when permanent male labor shortages – the result, incidentally, of Keynesian full-employment policies – pulled ever more women out of domesticity and into factories and shops.
column2: 妇女的经济解放则要等到第二次世界大战之后，男性劳动力的长期短缺 — — 凯恩斯主义充分就业政策的偶然结果 — — 促使更多妇女走出家门，走入工厂和商店。

column1: This second wave of emancipation concentrated on economic inequalities, especially discrimination in job selection and disparities in pay and property rights.
column2: 这一第二次解放潮集中在经济不平等上，特别是就业选择歧视和薪酬和财产权利不公。

column1: These battles have also mainly been won.
column2: 这些斗争也大体赢得了胜利。

column1: Discrimination in inheritance is long gone, and equal pay for equal work is accepted in theory, though a gender bias persists (as it does for selection to senior posts).
column2: 继承歧视早已不复存在，同工同酬也在理论上被接受，尽管性别偏见依然顽固（比如在高层岗位的遴选上 ） 。

column1: For example, Carrie Gracie recently resigned as the BBC’s China editor in protest against unequal pay between male and female editors, shaming six top male employees to agree to substantial wage cuts.
column2: 比如，凯利·格雷西（Carrie Gracie）最近因为抗议男女编辑薪酬不平等而辞去BBC中国编辑一职，让六位高层男员工感到无地自容，被迫同意大幅减薪。

column1: It is only a matter of time – of overcoming habit, prejudice, and inertia – before what is accepted in principle becomes practice.
column2: 从原则上被接受到转化为实践只是时间问题 — — 需要克服习惯、偏见和惯性。

column1: The most interesting remaining argument for unequal treatment relates to activities for which there is a premium on physical qualities, as in sport.
column2: 对于待遇不平等问题，现有的最有趣的论点指出在一些活动存在身体条件溢价，比方说体育。

column1: In traditional societies, men did the fighting, because they were stronger, faster, and taller.
column2: 在传统社会中，男性负责战斗，因为他们更强壮、速度更快、个子更高。

column1: Not surprisingly, one of the last remaining bastions of unequal pay today is in competitive sport, which is a ritualized form of warfare.
column2: 毫不奇怪，当今薪酬不平等的最后几个堡垒之一便是竞技体育，即仪式化的战斗。

column1: In most major sports, there are separate men’s and women’s teams and events, with lower standards of performance expected of women.
column2: 大部分体育项目分男女团队和赛事，对女子比赛的标准和预期表现都较低。

column1: For example, men’s tennis matches often comprise up to five sets, compared to three for women.
column2: 比如，男子网球比赛通常为五盘三胜，而女子为三盘两胜。

column1: The best men can beat the best women because they are stronger, hit the ball harder, and have more stamina.
column2: 最佳男选手能够击败最佳女选手，因为前者更强壮，击球力量更大，耐力更好。

column1: In swimming, the longest race for men is 1,500 meters, while for women it is 800 meters.
column2: 在游泳比赛中，男子距离最长项目是1,500米，女子是800米。

column1: One sport in which women compete equally with men is equestrianism – not just racing, but also dressage, show jumping, and three-day eventing.
column2: 女子与男子平等竞技的项目是马术 — — 不仅仅包括赛马，也包括盛装舞步、场地障碍赛和三日赛。

column1: The question is whether pay ought to be equal in an area in which performance is unequal “by nature.”
column2: 问题在于，在表现“天然”不平等的领域，是否应该薪酬平等。

column1: In tennis, the principle of equal pay for unequal performance is accepted for grand slam events, but not for many others.
column2: 在网球界，大满贯赛事接受了表现不同但薪酬相同的原则，但许多其他赛事并非如此。

column1: Elsewhere, the gender pay gap remains striking, notably in football (soccer).
column2: 在其他项目上，性别薪酬差距巨大，特别是足球。

column1: The captain of England’s professional women’s team, Steph Houghton, is paid just £65,000 ($90,000) a year, whereas Neymar, the world’s most expensive male player, receives roughly 500 times as much.
column2: 英格兰职业女子足球队长史蒂夫·霍顿（Steph Houghton）年薪只有65,000英镑，而最昂贵的男子选手内马尔（Neymar）年薪是这一数字的500倍。

column1: And while players in England’s women’s super league earn an annual wage of up to £35,000, Chelsea’s male players are paid, on average, a staggering £4.5 million.
column2: 英格兰女足超级联赛球员年薪不超过35,000英镑，而切尔西男足选手平均粘性高达450万英镑。

column1: One argument frequently made for equalizing pay is that sportswomen put in as much effort as sportsmen to produce their results.
column2: 要求薪酬平等化的一个常用论点是女运动员为了提升水平，付出了和男运动员一样多的努力。

column1: This harks back to the old labor theory of value, which contended that all value was created by work.
column2: 这让人想起旧劳动价值论，即所有价值都由工作产生。

column1: But the link between hours of work and market prices is almost non-existent in practice, which is why economists needed a different explanation for market prices.
column2: 但工作时间和市场价格之间的联系在现实中几乎不存在，正因如此，经济学家需要对市场价格做出不同的解释。

column1: Economists today say that prices (including wages and salaries) are determined by consumer demand.
column2: 今天，经济学家说价格（包括工资和薪酬）由消费需求决定。

column1: What a thing costs depends not on the amount of time and effort spent producing it, but on what it is worth to the buyer.
column2: 一样东西需要多少钱不取决于生产它用了多少时间、耗费了多少努力，而取决于它对买家有什么价值。

column1: Male footballers are paid more than female players because their services are more in demand.
column2: 男足球运动员薪酬比女足球运动员高，是因为他们的服务需求更高。

column1: If women’s football teams started paying their players the same as men’s teams, they would go bankrupt.
column2: 如果女足球队给队员和男足一样的薪酬，就会破产。

column1: Unemployment is the price of insisting on being paid above the “market-clearing” level.
column2: 失业便是坚持支付高于“市场出清”水平的价格。

column1: Market prices, economists insist, do not measure moral worth but market worth.
column2: 经济学家一直说，市场价格不衡量道德价值，只衡量市场价值。

column1: If we want market-determined rewards to equate with “just” rewards, we either have to abolish markets – the socialist solution – or restructure individual preferences.
column2: 如果我们想要市场决定的奖励等于“公平”奖励，就必须放弃市场 — — 这是社会主义的方案 — — 或者改变个人偏好。

column1: One argument is that women in sport would command the same market price as men, if only structural gender biases, such as greater media coverage and sponsorship for men’s sports, were removed.
column2: 一个观点是女运动员只有在结构性性别歧视 — — 比如男子项目能够获得更多的媒体覆盖和赞助 — — 被消除的情况下，才能要求和男运动员一样的市场价格。

column1: Although market value may be determined by consumer demand, as economic theory has it, these preferences are themselves the result of socially structured gender biases.
column2: 尽管如经济学理论认为的那样，市场价值由消费需求决定，但这些偏好本身也是社会中的性别偏见的结果。

column1: In the absence of these biases, demand for women’s sports – as measured by attendance at matches, television ratings, and so on – would equal demand for men’s sports.
column2: 如果不存在这些偏见，对女子项目的需求 — — 用看台上座率、电视转播率等指标衡量 — — 就能和男子项目等量齐观。

column1: This argument is based on the assumption – which extends far beyond sports – that real gender equality will not be achieved until the formation of tastes and habits is no longer subject to gender stereotypes.
column2: 这一观点基于一个假设 — — 这个假设可以在体育的基础上推而广之 — — 即真正的性别平等要等到品味和习惯的形成不再受到性别成见的影响时才能实现。

column1: Boys would not automatically be given toy guns, while girls are given dolls.
column2: 男孩不再自动被给予玩具枪，女孩不再被自动给予洋娃娃。

column1: This sounds reasonable enough, until one recognizes the lengths to which radical feminists are willing to go to re-engineer tastes and preferences.
column2: 这看上起非常合理，但让我们看看极端女权主义者在重塑品味和偏好方面走得多远。

column1: Language is being systematically purged of “gender bias.”
column2: 语言正在被系统性地清洗“性别偏见 ” 。

column1: University courses in humanities and social sciences are being subjected to implicit or explicit forms of gender censorship.
column2: 人文和社会科学大学课程需要受到直接或间接的性别审查。

column1: Gender itself is increasingly seen as “socially constructed”; and children, therefore, should be encouraged to choose their own gender.
column2: 性别本身被日益视为“社会产物 ” ； 因此，儿童应该被鼓励选择自己的性别。

column1: To me, the latest offensive against men is a good cause gone mad.
column2: 对我来说，这一最新的仇男论是因为良好的初衷过犹不及。

column1: But then, as a 78-year-old white male, I would think that, wouldn’t I?
column2: 但身为一名78岁的白人男性，我会想，我会吗？

column1: Women for Integration
column2: 妇女的融合作用

column1: COPENHAGEN – The past decade has proven again and again that empowering women worldwide holds the key to solving many seemingly intractable issues that have otherwise stymied policymakers. Poverty in the developing world seemed ineradicable until micro-lenders saw millions of low-income, destitute women as potential entrepreneurs.
column2: 发自哥本哈根 — — 在过去十几年中，事实已经不断地证明全世界那些被赋予权力的女性可以令那些困扰政策制定者的棘手难题迎刃而解：发展中国家的贫困问题看似无法根治，直到小额贷款者将数百万低收入的贫苦女性视为潜在的创业者就有了转机。

column1: Involving African women in decision-making about crop production turns out to enable environmentally sustainable farming practices.
column2: 而将非洲女性纳入到农业政策制定过程中的举措则令到农业的环境可持续发展成为现实。

column1: Runaway population growth becomes controllable when women have access to literacy and business opportunities as well as to contraception.
column2: 原本失控的人口增长率在妇女得到受教育权和经商权，以及学会避孕之后也变得有章法了。

column1: Could the tensions and conflicts surrounding the issue of immigration in Europe be yet another issue for which the empowerment of women holds a solution?
column2: 那么围绕着欧洲移民问题所造成一系列紧张和冲突局面是否也能通过这些被赋予权力的女性来解决呢？

column1: In a recent visit to Copenhagen to commemorate International Women’s Day, I took part in many conversations that duplicate others throughout Europe: citizens from across the political spectrum were struggling with the issue of non-European immigration and the cultural tensions that have ensued.
column2: 最近在赴哥本哈根庆祝国际妇女节的时候，我参加了许多场跟欧洲其他地方一模一样的对话：所有欧洲人，不管持有不同政治立场的，都纠缠于非欧洲移民以及随之而来的文化冲突问题。

column1: What does it mean to be Danish, German, or French in the presence of these millions of newcomers, most of whom come from non-democratic societies?
column2: 许多丹麦人，德国人和法国人根本不明白这数百万新移民究竟意味着什么，更何况其中绝大多数移民甚至来自于非民主国家！

column1: Some of this anxiety is pure racism; but some is not.
column2: 其中有些担忧纯粹是民族主义的；有些则不是。

column1: What would “integration” mean, and how is it achieved without the loss of cherished civil-society values?
column2: “融合”这个词究竟该如何解读，又该如何在不伤及市民社会价值理念的情况下达致融合？

column1: These are not necessarily xenophobic questions: a post-enlightenment civil society, with a free press and due process, is a precious thing, and those values should not be sacrificed to politically correct moral relativism.
column2: 这可不仅仅是排不排外的问题：一个拥有新闻自由和法定程序的，后文明时代的市民社会是非常宝贵的财富，而这些价值观不应该被那些官员们只顾政治正确的道德相对主义而遭到抹杀。

column1: This issue has been given new urgency by the arrests in Ireland of alleged jihadists from several countries who are accused of plotting to murder a Swedish cartoonist who drew an image of the prophet Mohammed as a dog.
column2: 在爱尔兰逮捕了多位试图谋杀一名将先知默罕默德描绘成一条狗的瑞典卡通画家的所谓圣战者之后，这个问题变得更加紧迫了。

column1: Across Europe, the discussions are growing more intense as anti-immigration platforms gain supporters in otherwise liberal countries, from Germany to France to traditionally inclusive and tolerant Denmark itself.
column2: 有关这个问题的讨论在全欧洲都日趋激烈，反移民政党在其他自由主义国家都获得了更多的支持，从德国，法国，一直到传统上比较平等包容的丹麦。

column1: Then I witnessed the prototype of a true solution.
column2: 但随后我看见了一个真正解决方案的雏形。

column1: I met Elisabeth Møller Jensen, the director of KVINFO, “the Danish center for information on gender, equality and ethnicity” – an extraordinary organization funded by Denmark’s Ministry of Culture.
column2: 我碰到了丹麦性别，平等和种族信息中心的主管伊丽莎白·穆勒·詹森，她所在的是个受丹麦文化部资助而且非同寻常的机构。

column1: One of its many innovative programs is already showing results in terms of genuinely integrating immigrant families into Danish society.
column2: 而该中心的其中一个创新性项目则已经在移民家庭真正融入丹麦社会方面取得了成果。

column1: By addressing immigrant women – and by viewing them as potential leaders, rather than as quiescent potential maids or service workers – KVINFO is enabling their families to witness the benefits of an open civil society in their own lives.
column2: 通过把女性移民视为潜在的领导者 — — 而不是沉默的候补保姆和服务员 — — 中心使得她们的家庭可以亲身见证一个开放社会所带来的好处。

column1: KVINFO began a “mentor network” aimed at immigrant and refugee women in 2002.
column2: 在2002年，中心启动了一个专门针对女性移民和难民的“顾问网络 ” 。

column1: By 2010, it had 5,000 participants, had won awards and international acclaim for best integrative practices, and is being replicated throughout Denmark – and observers are exploring programs or partnerships modeled upon it in Canada, Spain, Portugal, and Norway.
column2: 时至今日，这个网络已经有5000名参与者，并在融合实践中赢得了奖项和国际声誉，并在丹麦全国推广 — — 而参观过这个项目的人又将其模式复制到加拿大，西班牙，葡萄牙和挪威。

column1: The program pairs refugee and immigrant women in a one-to-one mentoring relationship with women who are established leaders at all levels of Danish society.
column2: 而这个项目的做法就是让女性移民和难民和丹麦社会中的各级女性领袖结成“一对一”的顾问关系。

column1: The pairing is not cursory.
column2: 这个配对可不是随便安排的。

column1: A careful matchmaking process unites the interests and goals of the women on both sides, and already has paid amazing dividends.
column2: 一个精心设计的配对程序将双方的兴趣和目标结合起来，并结出了丰硕的成果。

column1: Women who were journalists, engineers, or scientists in their countries of origin – and who could not get jobs as checkout cashiers in Denmark – have been paired with Danish counterparts and are now back in school, or working in research.
column2: 那些在原住国身为记者，工程师和科学家，却在丹麦连个超市收银员都当不上的妇女和丹麦当地的女性同行结成一对，得以回到学校或者投身研究工作之中。

column1: But even women who arrive with no higher education or professional skills create an “action plan.”
column2: 而那些没有高学历或者专业技术的女性也制定了一个“行动方案 ” 。

column1: They learn from their mentors what options there are, how to proceed, and what to do to reach their objectives.
column2: 她们从自己的结对顾问那里学到了如何选择，如何运作以及如何行动去实现自身目标。

column1: As they enter the workforce, their language skills improve, their household income soars, and their children see firsthand a woman in a respected, economically valued role.
column2: 随着她们投入到工作当中，她们的语言能力得到提高，家庭收入增加，而她们的孩子则亲眼看到了一个有尊严，有经济能力的女性。

column1: Their loved ones thus learn how to thrive in a European context – occasionally coming to KVINFO events and benefiting from their mothers’ expanding network of contacts.
column2: 孩子们也因此学到如何在欧洲的文化背景下取得成功 — — 偶尔还能来参加中心的活动并从母亲不断扩大的社会联系网中获益。

column1: So, rather than feeling exploited and condemned indefinitely to the fringes of a Northern European society – and thus vulnerable to the stirrings of demagogues and extremists – these women’s children grow up fully familiar with Danish civil society, well informed about higher education and professional opportunities, and hopeful rather than cynical.
column2: 因此，这些妇女的后代就不会在一个北欧国家的社会边缘中感到无尽的剥夺和不幸，并因此易于受到煽动者和极端分子的蛊惑，而是在对丹麦市民社会的充分理解中成长，被赋予更高的教育水平和职业机会，对生活充满希望而不是愤世嫉俗。

column1: By empowering women, the whole family is lifted up and, in a supportive rather than a colonizing way, “Europeanized” in the best sense.
column2: 通过这些被赋予权力的妇女，整个家庭都通过一个支持性而不是殖民式的方式得到提升，用最好的方式实现了“欧洲化 ” 。

column1: I am often struck by the way many Europeans use arms-length euphemisms when talking about immigrants: they want immigrants to feel “welcome” or “comfortable.” I always wonder, “But do you want them to feel French, or German, or Norwegian?”
column2: 我常常惊讶于许多欧洲人在谈论移民时喜欢用一些特别冗长委婉的词汇：他们希望移民能感觉到“受欢迎”和“舒适 ” ， 我一直在想：你为什么不让他们感觉特法国，特德国，或者特挪威呢？

column1: To be fully integrated, Muslim and other newcomers to European countries must be welcomed not as perpetual visitors – even if, ideally, as nicely treated visitors – but rather as family members, as the American model does (or aspires to do).
column2: 为了实现完全融合，穆斯林和其他欧洲各国的新移民不应被被视为“永久性访客 ” （ 甚至理想化地视为受到良好照顾的访客 ） ， 而应该像美国模式（或努力追求的）那样被视为家庭的真正成员。

column1: As Møller Jensen put it, “I want these children to feel Danish .”
column2: 正如穆勒·詹森所说 ： “ 我希望这些孩子都觉得特丹麦 ” 。

column1: These young people and Denmark itself will benefit, as this “KVINFO generation” grows up with a genuine stake in Danish civil society, and seeing the world as Danes, not as guests.
column2: 随着“中心一代”在一个纯正丹麦市民社会的基础上成长，并以丹麦人而不是外来人的视角来看待这个世界，获益的将不不止是他们自己，还有这个国家。

column1: Arab Women’s Unfinished Revolution
column2: 阿拉伯妇女未竟的革命

column1: FEZ – Though women across the Middle East participated actively in the Arab Spring protests that began in late 2010, they remain second-class citizens, even where popular uprisings managed to topple autocratic regimes.
column2: 费斯—尽管中东地区的妇女积极地参与了2010年末开始的阿拉伯之春起义，但她们仍是二等公民，即便在群众起义推翻了独裁统治的地方也是如此。

column1: Indeed, the Islamist governments now in power in several countries seem more determined than the despots that they replaced to keep women out of politics.
column2: 事实上，如今，不少国家掌权的伊斯兰政府比被他们取代的暴君更热衷于将妇女排挤在政坛之外。

column1: In conducting interviews with women in the region, I am struck by their overall pessimism.
column2: 在采访该地区妇女的过程中，我被她们的悲观情绪深深地震惊了。

column1: They fear the loss of their rights.
column2: 她们担心丧失权利。

column1: They see economic disintegration all around them, raising the possibility of a further increase in violence.
column2: 她们认为经济崩溃随处可见，这让暴力进一步升级的可能性大大增加。

column1: As social bonds fray, they feel increasingly vulnerable.
column2: 随着社会契约的腐蚀，她们感到越来越无助。

column1: More than once, I heard them express the view that things were better before the revolutions.
column2: 我不止一次听她们表示目前的状况还不如革命之前。

column1: Female representation in parliaments and government cabinets after the Arab Spring has been either absent or meager, and women activists worry that Islamist parties will implement reactionary policies that discriminate on the basis of gender.
column2: 阿拉伯之春后，国会和政府内阁中的女性代表要么不存在，要么无足轻重，妇女活动家担心伊斯兰政党会采取性别歧视的反动政策。

column1: In Egypt, for example, the Freedom and Justice Party, which dominates the parliament, claims that a woman cannot become President.
column2: 比如，在埃及，占据议会多数的自由公正党（Freedom and Justice Party）宣布不能由女性出任总统。

column1: Egyptian women were heavily represented in the protests that brought down former President Hosni Mubarak’s regime in 2011, but they have been largely excluded from any official decision-making role ever since.
column2: 在2011年推翻前总统穆巴拉克的起义中，妇女居功至伟，但在此后的所有决策过程中都鲜有女性身影出现。

column1: In Morocco, while there were eightwomen in the previous cabinet, today there is only one in the Islamist-led government.
column2: 在摩洛哥，上任内阁中有八名妇女，而在今天的伊斯兰政府中只剩下一名。

column1: In January, the Islamist-dominated parliament adopted a decree lowering the age of marriage for girls from 18 to 16, a major setback.
column2: 1月，伊斯兰教徒占多数的议会采纳了一项法令，将女孩适婚年龄从18岁降至16岁，这是一次大倒退。

column1: Moroccan feminists have protested vigorously, but to no avail.
column2: 摩洛哥女性强烈抗议，但完全无用。

column1: Parliamentary representation for women has also taken a hit.
column2: 议会中的妇女代表也遭受了打击。

column1: Women hold less than 1% of seats in the current Egyptian parliament; previously, they held 12%.
column2: 目前埃及议会的妇女代表数量不到1 % ； 此前曾达到过12 % 。

column1: In Libya, a first draft of the electoral law reserved 10% of seats in the constituent assembly for women, but the quota was later abandoned.
column2: 在利比亚，选举法第一草案为妇女保留了10%的制宪大会议席，但这一配额后来被取消了。

column1: In Tunisia, the election in 2011 brought 49 women into the 217-seat Constituent Assembly.
column2: 在突尼斯，2011年的选举将49名妇女选入了217人的制宪大会。

column1: But 42 of these women are members of Ennahda, which regards Sharia (Islamic law) as the source of legislation.
column2: 但其中42人是复兴运动党（Ennahda）成员，该党认为伊斯兰教法才是合法性的源泉。

column1: Long-time Tunisian activists fear that Ennahda, which dominates the assembly, will use the presence of women MPs to restrict women’s rights.
column2: 突尼斯的长期活动家担心在制宪大会占多数的社会运动党将利用妇女议员阻挠妇女权利。

column1: The recent assassination of the secular Tunisian opposition leader Chokri Belaid has raised the stakes for women there.
column2: 最近发生的行刺突尼斯世俗反对派领袖贝莱德（Chokri Belaid）事件让人担心该国妇女的命运。

column1: Belaid was a voice on behalf of women’s rights, and the threat of increased political violence will focus on those who advocate secular equality for all Tunisians, including women.
column2: 贝莱德是妇女权利的拥护者，政治暴力抬头的威胁将集中在支持所有突尼斯人（包括妇女在内）世俗平等的人头上。

column1: Unfortunately, conservative forces in the Arab world repeatedly turn against women when political unrest spreads.
column2: 不幸的是，在政治动荡蔓延时，阿拉伯世界的保守势力一再反对妇女。

column1: In Bahrain, several women protesters have been arrested and tortured.
column2: 在巴林，不少妇女示威者被逮捕并遭受严刑拷打。

column1: In Yemen, the authorities call on male relatives to “tame” their women.
column2: 在也门，当局要求男性亲属“管教好”家中的女人。

column1: In Tunisia, the most Westernized of the Arab countries, women have been attacked at universities and schools, and are being forced to wear the hijab.
column2: 在最西方化的阿拉伯国家突尼斯，大学和学校中的女性频频遭袭，并被迫戴上面纱。

column1: A woman who was allegedly raped by two policemen in September 2012 was charged with public indecency when she filed a complaint.
column2: 一名据称于2012年9月被两名警察强奸的妇女在提起申诉时被指公开猥亵。

column1: Likewise, in Egypt, women protesters face greater scrutiny than men.
column2: 类似地，在埃及，女性示威者面临着比男性更严格的审查。

column1: Those arrested by the military during the anti-Mubarak protests were subjected to virginity tests as a form of intimidation.
column2: 在反穆巴拉克起义期间被捕的女性需要接受贞洁测试，以此作为恐吓手段。

column1: Across the Middle East, Islamist militias have harassed, arrested, raped, and tortured women pro-democracy activists.
column2: 在整个中东，伊斯兰军队骚扰、逮捕、强奸和虐待女性民主活动者。

column1: The model of Iran’s Islamic Revolution in 1979, which imposed second-class citizenship on women, is frequently cited as a threat in Arab countries now ruled by Islamist parties.
column2: 1979年伊朗伊斯兰革命的模式 — — 将妇女视为二等公民 — — 被频繁视为如今由伊斯兰党派执政的阿拉伯国家的一大威胁。

column1: These countries are at a crossroads.
column2: 这些国家都面临抉择。

column1: Women make up half of the Middle East’s population, and any hope of political and economic development must account for that fact.
column2: 妇女占据中东人口的一半，任何政治和经济发展希望都必须考虑到这一事实。

column1: Organizations like the United Nations Development Program have repeatedly issued reports demonstrating the connection between economic decline and oppression of women.
column2: 联合国发展计划署等组织一再发布报告，说明经济衰落和压抑女性之间存在��联。

column1: Simply put, the Arab countries will not succeed unless women are fully integrated into political and economic life.
column2: 一言以蔽之，除非妇女充分融入政治和经济生活，否则阿拉伯国家不可能获得成功。

column1: In her Nobel Peace Prize acceptance speech in 2011, Yemeni political activist Tawakkol Karman, made the point clearly: “The solution to women’s issues can only be achieved in a free and democratic society in which human energy is liberated, the energy of both women and men together.”
column2: 在2011年诺贝尔和平奖获奖演说中，也门整治活动价卡尔曼（Tawakkol Karman）明确指出 ： “ 妇女问题的解决方案只有在民主社会中才能达成。 在民主社会中，人类能量得到了解放，女人和男人的能量都得到了解放 。 ”

column1: Middle Eastern countries should protect and consolidate women’s rights as a way to reinforce democratic ideas and habits.
column2: 中东国家应该保护和巩固妇女权利，以此作为强化民主思想和习惯的方式。

column1: They must institute the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and other international laws and agreements in order to eradicate gender-based discrimination and violence.
column2: 它们必须将《世界人权宣言》和其他国际法和协定制度化，以此消灭性别歧视和暴力。

column1: The hope for women’s progress is really a hope for a decent society in which development for all is possible.
column2: 妇女进步的希望就是美好社会的希望，就是一切发展皆有可能的希望。

column1: A Woman’s Place Is in the Digital Revolution
column2: 妇女的地位在于数字革命

column1: MONTREAL – Digital technologies are a double-edged sword for the world’s women.
column2: 蒙特利尔—数字技术对全世界妇女而言是一柄双刃剑。

column1: Men’s greater access to these technologies puts women at risk of being left even further behind economically and socially.
column2: 男性更容易获得这些技术，这使得妇女有可能在经济和社会角度进一步落后。

column1: But if women can tap the full power of digital technologies, vital new opportunities will open up for them.
column2: 但如果妇女能够充分利用数字技术的力量，就能获得至关重要的新机会。
