column1: According to estimates by the GSM Association, women’s access to the Internet and mobile phones is about 85% of the level for men, on average, and a total of 1.7 billion women in low- and middle-income countries are unconnected.
column2: 据GSM协会的估计，妇女能够上网和拥有手机的比例平均而言只有男性的85%左右，中低收入国家的17亿妇女无网可上。

column1: This severely limits the prospects of women and girls.
column2: 这严重限制了妇女和女童的前景。

column1: Digital technologies enhance women’s access to finance, with mobile banking enabling them to avoid long journeys to a branch or ATM.
column2: 数字技术能增加妇女的金融普及，移动银行让她们不再需要长途跋涉才能用上网点或ATM机。

column1: Likewise, technology-enabled health care delivered via phone or tablet improves health outcomes, as it reaches women even in the remotest areas, sparing them a long and often risky trek to see a doctor.
column2: 类似地，基于技术的医疗通过手机或平板电脑实现，能够改善健康结果，即使是最偏远地区的妇女也能获得这些服务，而不再需要冒风险长途跋涉去看医生。

column1: The timesaving potential of digital technologies is so great that they may make the difference in enabling women to seek paid employment.
column2: 数字技术在节约时间上的潜力非常巨大，有可能打开妇女寻找带薪工作的新局面。

column1: Today, women undertake three-quarters of all unpaid care work, producing output of around $10 trillion, or 13% of global GDP – none of which is translated into income, let alone economic power.
column2: 如今，妇女承担了四分之三的无薪工作，贡献了大约10万亿美元的产出，或全球GDP的13 % — —其中没有一分钱转化为她们的收入，更不用说经济实力了。

column1: By their nature, e-commerce and technology-based businesses offer women more flexibility and autonomy, helping them to manage home responsibilities alongside paid work.
column2: 电子商务和基于技术的企业天然能够为妇女提供灵活性和自治力，帮助她们做家务和挣工资两不误。

column1: In Indonesia, women-owned businesses generate 35% of e-commerce revenue, compared with only 15% of the revenue of offline businesses.
column2: 在印度尼西亚，妇女所有企业创造了35%的电子商务营收，而线下企业的这一比例只有15 % 。

column1: Likewise, in China, 55% of new Internet businesses are founded by women, and Alibaba’s Taobao e-commerce platform has an equal number of male and female store owners.
column2: 类似地，在中国，有55%的新互联网企业由妇女创办，阿里巴巴的淘宝电商平台上男女店主数量一样多。

column1: In fact, China is home to 114 of the world’s 147 self-made female billionaires, compared to just 14 in the second-place country, the United States.
column2: 事实上，全世界147位白手起家的女亿万富豪有114位在中国，而第二名的美国只有14位。

column1: Women’s economic empowerment is good not just for the women who benefit.
column2: 妇女经济赋权的好处不只限于妇女受益者。

column1: The McKinsey Global Institute (MGI) has estimated that advancing gender equality could add $12 trillion per year to the world economy by 2025.
column2: 麦肯锡全球研究所（MGI）测算，到2025年，性别平等的改善每年能够为世界经济增加12万亿美元产出。

column1: In the Asia-Pacific region alone, getting more women into full-time employment in higher-paid, higher-productivity sectors could add $4.5 trillion per year to GDP, 12% above the current trajectory.
column2: 光是在亚太地区，让更多妇女在薪酬和生产率更高的行业获得全职工作每年能增加4.5万亿美元GDP，较当前水平提高12 % 。

column1: At the company level, a growing body of evidence shows that more gender equality is good for bottom lines.
column2: 在公司层面，越来越多的证据表明促进性别平等对利润有利。

column1: Greater diversity of leadership styles improves the quality of decision-making. If given the opportunity, women could be leading innovators in the age of automation and artificial intelligence, and could help to ensure that algorithms are free of gender bias.
column2: 领导风格的多样化能改善决策质量，在得到机会的情况下，妇女能够在自动化和人工智能时代成为创新领导者，帮助确保算法免受性别歧视干扰。

column1: But major barriers prevent women from seizing these opportunities.
column2: 但妇女要抓住这些机会，面临着巨大的障碍。

column1: For example, in India, where only 29% of all Internet users are female, girls in rural areas often face gender-based restrictions on their use of information and communications technologies.
column2: 比如，在印度只有29互联网用户是女性，农村女童常常会因为性别而被限制使用信息和通讯技术。

column1: One village in Uttar Pradesh implemented a fine for any girl using a mobile phone outside the home.
column2: 在北方邦的一个村庄，女童在家外使用手机会被罚款。

column1: Beyond the social attitudes that undermine women’s access to digital technologies, women and girls often disproportionately lack the requisite skills to seize the opportunities of the digital age.
column2: 除了社会态度干扰妇女获得数字技术之外，妇女和女童还常常缺少抓住数字时代的机会所需要的技能。

column1: In Singapore, for example, women lag behind men in education in science, math, engineering, and technology.
column2: 比如，在新加坡，妇女的科学、数学、工程和技术教育水平落后于男性。

column1: At Nanyang Technological University, females comprised only 27% of the undergraduate computer-science program in 2015-2016, despite accounting for half of all undergraduates at the university.
column2: 在南洋理工大学，2015—2016学年计算机科学专业本科生女生数量只占27 % ， 尽管全部本科生中有一半是女生。

column1: What is at stake is not just women’s ability to seize the opportunities offered by the digital revolution, but also their capacity to withstand the coming wave of automation.
column2: 重要的不只是妇女抓住数字革命所提供的机会的能力，也包括她们面对即将到来的自动化浪潮的能力。

column1: According to MGI research, in Singapore alone, 800,000 full-time-equivalent jobs could be displaced by 2030 due to automation.
column2: 据MGI的研究，光是在新加坡，到2030年有800,000个全职等价工作可以被自动化所取代。

column1: The jobs that are most vulnerable to automation are the low-paid, lower-skill jobs that women are more likely to hold.
column2: 最容易受自动化冲击的工作是低薪低技能工作，也是妇女更有可能从事的工作。

column1: At the same time, though automation risks disrupting many jobs (or tasks within jobs) for both men and women, it also takes some of the drudgery out of current work, tailoring it to human abilities.
column2: 与此同时，尽管自动化风险对男性和女性的许多工作（或工作任务）都构成了破坏，但它也承担了当前工作的一些苦力活，让工作更能彰显人的能力。

column1: The result could be higher wages that contribute to the creation of more new jobs – 300-365 million worldwide – as spending increases, with emerging economies gaining the most.
column2: 结果可能是工资提高，形成更多新岗位 — — 全世界范围内高达3—3.65亿个 — — 原因在于支出增加，其中新兴经济体获益最多。

column1: Furthermore, among the new jobs that will be created will be many in fields like education and health care, where women have traditionally thrived.
column2: 此外，新形成的工作岗位许多在于教育和医疗等传统女性优势领域。

column1: According to MGI research, more than 100 million jobs could be created over the next 10-15 years as health care and education needs grow.
column2: 据MGI的研究，随着医疗和教育需求的增加，未来10—15年能够创造出1亿多个工作岗位。

column1: It is not yet clear exactly how automation will affect women’s employment.
column2: 自动化具体如何影响妇女就业尚不清楚。

column1: But there is no doubt that protecting – and even enhancing – women’s job and income prospects will require upgrading their skills, so that they can take advantage of the new and changing opportunities created by the ongoing digital revolution.
column2: 但毫无疑问，保护 — — 甚至加强 — — 妇女就业和收入前景需要升级她们的技能，以便她们能够抓住数字革命所创造的日新月异的机会。

column1: The success of women in e-commerce attests to the power of digital technologies to level the economic playing field, to the benefit of individual women, their communities and societies, and the world economy.
column2: 妇女在电子商务方面所取得的成功证明了数字技术在建立公平竞争以及为妇女个体、社区和社会，以及世界经济带来收益等方面的力量。

column1: More women in work – particularly in the technology industries that are shaping our collective future – would be good news for all.
column2: 更多女性进入职场 — — 特别是改变着我们的集体未来的科技行业 — — 对所有人都是好消息。

column1: The Media’s #MeToo Problem
column2: 媒体的“米兔”问题

column1: LONDON – Journalism classrooms may be dominated by women, but global media are still ruled by men, who occupy the majority of management positions, report more news stories and are more frequently presented as expert voices.
column2: 伦敦—新闻学教室中也许大部分是女性，但全球媒体仍然由男性主宰，他们占据了大部分管理岗位，报道更多新闻，也更常代表专业声音发声。

column1: This imbalance is reflected in the content newsrooms produce, with fewer written words and broadcast seconds dedicated to telling women’s stories.
column2: 这一失衡反映在新闻编辑室所“生产”的内容中，用于讲述女性故事的纸媒文字和广播声音都更少。

column1: It is also reflected in the industry’s culture, which leaves women more vulnerable to sexual harassment and abuse.
column2: 它也反映在行业文化中，女性更容易受到性骚扰和侵犯的影响。

column1: Given the importance of relationship-building in media, not to mention the desire for connection among journalists who cover extreme or harrowing events in difficult environments, intimate ties can easily form among colleagues and associates.
column2: 在媒体行业，构建关系十分重要，尤其是排除万难报道极端或恐怖事件的记者们更加渴望联系，因此，同事和搭档之间很容易形成紧密联系。

column1: The problem arises when these relationships turn sour or, worse, when they are non-consensual or based on coercion, such as when a more senior colleague pursues a sexual relationship with a subordinate.
column2: 当这些关系变坏，或者更糟糕地，当它们变成非自愿或基于强迫时，问题就会产生，比如上司要求和下属发生性关系时。

column1: Of course, across countries, there can be significant differences in what is considered predatory or inappropriate behavior.
column2: 当然，不同国家对于侵犯或不恰当行为的定义大相径庭。

column1: But, globally, almost half of women journalists report having experienced work-related sexual harassment, according to a 2014 study by the International News Safety Institute (INSI) and the International Women’s Media Foundation (IWMF).
column2: 但据国际新闻安全研究所（INSI）和国际妇女媒体基金会（IWMF）的一项2014年的研究，全球而言，近一半的女记者报告经历过与工作相关的性骚扰。

column1: Two-thirds reported that they had faced “intimidation, threats, or abuse,” mostly by bosses, supervisors, or co-workers.
column2: 三分之二的女记者报告她们曾面临过“恐吓，威胁或暴力 ” ， 这些行为大多来自上司、督查和同事。

column1: For perpetrators, impunity remains the norm.
column2: 施害者通常不会受到任何惩罚。

column1: Almost three-fifths of respondents in the INSI/IWMF study who had experienced harassment said that they had reported incidents to their employers.
column2: 在INSI/IWMF的研究中报告曾经历过性骚扰的受访者中，有近五分之三说她们向雇主报告过情况。

column1: In most cases, however, it was the women who experienced the abuse who suffered adverse consequences: damaged reputations and career prospects, not to mention the impact on their psychological and emotional wellbeing.
column2: 但最常见的结果是遭受暴力的女性承受负面后果：名声败坏，职业生涯受阻，更不用说身心伤害了。

column1: So while men with histories of predatory behavior continue to occupy senior positions in the global news industry, women journalists are pushed to the point that they consider leaving it.
column2: 因此，有过侵犯行为史的男性继续占据全球媒体行业高位，而女记者被推向被迫离开媒体业的边缘。

column1: In a recent survey by the IWMF and TrollBusters, one-third of respondents said that they had considered abandoning journalism; those at earlier stages in their careers were twice as likely to say that they were considering work in other fields because of the threats and attacks they received, in person or online.
column2: 在一项IWMF和TrollBusters进行的最新调查中，三分之一的受访者说她们考虑过离开新闻业；处于职业生涯初期的人因为受到威胁和攻击（包括人身攻击和在线攻击）而考虑换行的可能性要高出一倍。

column1: Despite the obstacles they face, more women appear to be rising in the ranks of the global media industry, even though progress is relatively slow.
column2: 尽管面临着这些障碍，但更多的女性正在攀升到全球媒体行业的更高职位，虽然进步相对较慢。

column1: In digital newsrooms, which often have fewer of the inherent inequities of legacy media, the number of women in leadership positions appears to be growing faster.
column2: 数字新闻行业的固有不平等性较之传统媒体更低，获得领导岗位的女性数量增长得更快。

column1: However, the “bro” culture in certain newer newsrooms carries its own sexual harassment risks for women.
column2: 但是，一些较新的新闻媒体的“兄弟”文化给女性带来了新的性骚扰风险。

column1: Meanwhile, in the United States, several high-profile male journalists have lost their jobs in the last year over allegations of inappropriate behavior toward their female colleagues – part of the broader #MeToo movement.
column2: 与此同时，在美国，去年有一些身居高位的男记者因为被控对女同事有不当行为而丢掉了饭碗。 这些指控是广泛的“米兔 ” （ #MeToo）运动的一部分。

column1: But, overall, newsrooms continue to fail to take seriously the threats female journalists face on the job, both in their own workplaces and in the field.
column2: 但总体而言，新闻媒体仍然没有正视女记者所面临的职场威胁 — — 不管是在办公室中还是在外勤。

column1: While newsrooms conduct risk assessment and deployment discussions regarding journalists in the field – where women can be particularly vulnerable to unwelcome advances from male colleagues, contacts, or strangers – they rarely account for the specific threats women face, at least not in a sufficiently nuanced way.
column2: 新闻媒体会就外勤记者的风险评估和部署进行讨论 — — 跑外勤的女性尤其容易受到来自男同事、线人或陌生人指使不喜欢的工作 — — 他们几乎不会考虑女性所面临的特殊威胁，至少不会充分细致地考虑。

column1: This may be partly because, for major news organizations, these assessments are often handled in consultation with safety advisers – usually former military men, who may not fully appreciate the particular risks women face.
column2: 部分原因也许在于，对主要新闻组织而言，这些评估通常是根据安全顾问的意见进行的 — — 这些安全顾问往往是男性退伍军人，未必能充分理解女性所面临的特殊风险。

column1: Sometimes, the safety advisers turn out to be perpetrators of sexual harassment.
column2: 有时，安全顾问也会成为性骚扰的施害者。

column1: Anecdotally, I know of several journalists who have been sexually harassed by safety advisers.
column2: 我就知道一些传言，有记者被安全顾问性骚扰。

column1: Depending on where this takes place, such behavior can have significant security implications.
column2: 取决于这些骚扰所发生的地点，它们可能造成重大安全隐患。

column1: As if that were not enough pressure, female foreign correspondents who are assaulted in the field often find themselves at the center of debates about whether women should be deployed on certain stories at all.
column2: 雪上加霜的是，在出外勤时遭到攻击的外国记者，常常会发现自己成为应不应该让女性负责报道某些新闻的争论的核心。

column1: Male correspondents are never the subjects of such debates.
column2: 男记者永远不会成为这些争论的对象。

column1: This macho myopia reinforces the damaging imbalance in perspectives shaping the media. It also carries significant economic costs.
column2: 这一大男子主义近视强化了影响媒体的失衡，也造成了巨大的经济成本。

column1: As the Harvard Business Review put it, “we all pay the price” when sexual harassment continues or is covered up.
column2: 《哈佛商业评论》指出，当性骚扰不断或被掩盖时 ， “ 我们都要付出代价 。 ”

column1: By impeding women from advancing within the industry or compelling them to change jobs, harassment diminishes their earning potential and deprives society of the best use of its talents.
column2: 性骚扰阻挠女性在业内获得晋升或迫使她们换工作，拖累了她们的薪酬潜力，也让社会无从最好地利用人才。

column1: The fact is that journalists of various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds experience different environments differently, in terms of both the risks they face and the rewards they can reap.
column2: 事实上，不同性别、种族和背景的记者，能以不同的方式体验不同的环境，包括他们所面临的风险和能够获得的奖励。

column1: Any assessment of a story needs to account for that nuance, with managers choosing the best journalist for the job – and providing the support needed to keep all journalists safe.
column2: 对报道的评估都必须考虑到这一细节，管理者要为任务遴选最佳记者 — — 并提供需要的支持保证所有记者安全。

column1: To change the organizational culture that has enabled harassment and other forms of abuse against women – a moral obligation, as well as a legal and economic imperative – newsroom managers must lead from the top.
column2: 要改变让女性饱受骚扰和其他形式的暴力的组织文化 — — 这既是道德义务，也是法律和经济当务之急 — — 新闻组织管理者必须起到领导作用。

column1: Change will not happen overnight, nor will it be driven by a single actor.
column2: 变化不会一夜之间发生，也不会由某个人以一己之力推动。

column1: Leaders should listen to the women in their ranks, and invite diverse perspectives to help effect change.
column2: 领导者必须倾听女下属的声音，吸收多样化的视角来推动有效的变化。

column1: The goal is not to pit young against old or women against men.
column2: 目标不是爱惜年轻人或怜香惜玉。

column1: It is to rectify the media industry’s failure to protect its most vulnerable workers.
column2: 而是纠正媒体行业无法保护最脆弱员工的状况。

column1: We all pay when that failure prevents women journalists from achieving their full potential.
column2: 当这方面的失败阻挠女记者充分实现潜力时，我们所有人都会付出代价。

column1: It’s Time to Let Women Thrive
column2: 是时候让女性繁荣

column1: DAVOS – In public debates around the world, women’s empowerment is increasingly being recognized as a top priority.
column2: 达沃斯 — — 在世界各地的公开辩论中，女性授权越来越被认为是重中之重。

column1: The question of how to provide more economic opportunities for women is firmly on the agenda at the World Economic Forum’s annual meeting in Davos this year.
column2: 今年在达沃斯召开的世界经济论坛年会上，如何为女性提供更多经济机会已经牢牢地登上了议事日程。

column1: And longtime advocates for women are feeling energized, as countless others – men and women alike – have come to recognize the urgency of the task.
column2: 女性权利的长期倡导者正在感受到这种活力，因为无数其他人 — — 无论男女 — — 都已经开始认识到这项任务的紧迫性。

column1: Affording women and girls the opportunity to succeed is not just the right thing to do; it can also transform societies and economies for the good of all.
column2: 为妇女和女童提供成功的机遇不仅是对的；它还可以改造经济和社会，让所有人都过上更好的生活。

column1: For example, bringing women’s labor force participation up to the same level as that of men would boost GDP by as much as 9% in Japan and 27% in India.
column2: 例如，将女性参与劳动的比率提高到与男性同等水平能使日本国内生产总值增长高达9 % ， 印度则可以增长27%之多。

column1: The International Monetary Fund has documented many other macroeconomic benefits associated with women’s empowerment.
column2: 国际货币基金组织已经记录了与女性授权相关的其他许多宏观经济好处。

column1: Reducing gender gaps in employment and education has been shown to help economies diversify their exports.
column2: 事实证明缩小就业和教育方面的性别差距有助于经济体实现出口多样化。

column1: Appointing more women to banking-supervision boards can prevent cozy groupthink, thereby ensuring greater stability and resilience in the financial sector.
column2: 任命更多女性加入银行监管委员会可以防止惬意的团体思维，进而确保金融部门的弹性和稳定。

column1: And reducing gender inequalities also reduces income inequality, allowing for more sustainable growth.
column2: 降低性别不平等还可以降低收入不平等，从而使经济增长更可持续。

column1: Closing the gender gap may seem like a tall order, but it is essential for long-term economic development and prosperity.
column2: 缩小性别差距可能看似一项很难完成的任务，但却对长期经济发展和繁荣至关重要。

column1: The challenge for every country, then, is to make the most of all of its people’s talents.
column2: 因此，充分发挥民众的能力是各国所面临的难题。

column1: Realizing women’s potential is a universal mission.
column2: 充分发挥妇女潜力是一项普遍的使命。

column1: But some of the barriers holding women back are also universal.
column2: 但阻止妇女进步的某些障碍同样具有普遍性。

column1: Astonishingly, almost 90% of countries have one or more gender-based legal restrictions on the books.
column2: 令人惊讶的是， 近90%的国家都有至少一项以性别为基础的法律限制。

column1: In some countries, women still have limited property rights compared to men; in others, husbands have the right to forbid their wives from working.
column2: 在某些国家，与男性相比女性的财产权依然有限；而在另外一些国家，丈夫则有权禁止妻子外出工作。

column1: Beyond legal barriers, women also face social and cultural obstacles that limit their access to education, work, and finance.
column2: 除法律障碍外，女性还面临社会及文化障碍，限制她们接受教育、获得融资和外出工作。

column1: This is especially true in countries with fragile political systems.
column2: 政治制度脆弱的国家尤其是这样。

column1: Now that public awareness of is growing, it is time to press ahead with concrete measures to help women remain in the workforce while raising a family.
column2: 现在公众意识不断增强，是时候全力推行具体政策，协助女性在养家糊口的同时继续留在劳动力市场。

column1: For a glimpse of what that might look like, consider Norway, where affordable childcare and parental-leave schemes have proven successful in enabling both mothers and fathers to work.
column2: 只需以挪威为例就可以了解可能的状况，那里廉价的儿童保育和育儿假计划已经证明使父母双方同时加入劳动力队伍可以做到。

column1: Yes, these programs are costly.
column2: 没错，这样的计划非常昂贵。

column1: But they are well worth the investment, given employed women’s enormous contribution to economic growth.
column2: 但鉴于就业妇女对经济增长作出的巨大贡献，这样的投资非常值得。

column1: Moreover, programs that help women keep working also change the role of fathers.
column2: 此外，协助女性继续工作的计划同样也改变了父亲的角色。

column1: In Norway and other countries with similar policies, fathers now share equally in parental leave and child-rearing.
column2: 在挪威和其他实行类似政策的国家，父亲现在平等地享受育儿假并承担抚养子女的义务。

column1: As a result, more women can pursue leadership roles in work and public life.
column2: 因此，更多女性可以在工作和公共生活中发挥领导作用。

column1: Of course, countries that are not yet at Norway’s level of economic development typically face other gender-related challenges, including limited access to water and education.
column2: 当然，经济发展水平尚不能与挪威相媲美的国家往往面临着与性别有关的其他挑战，包括获得的饮用水和教育机会不足。

column1: Unfortunately, while many countries have made progress in reducing gender gaps in primary-school enrollment, there is still much more work to be done at the secondary and tertiary levels. As long as these gaps persist, women will not be able to aspire to political and economic power on an equal footing with men.
column2: 令人遗憾的是，虽然许多国家在缩小小学入学率差距方面已经取得了进展，但在中学和大学层面还有许多工作要做。

column1: Accordingly, Norway has made girls’ education a top priority in its international-development programs.
column2: 只要这些差距依然存在，妇女就无法追求与男性同等的政治和经济权力。

column1: Beyond education, ensuring that women in developing countries have access to finance is critical, because it enables them to participate fully in the economy, including as entrepreneurs.
column2: 除教育外，确保发展中国家女性融资权至关重要，因为这能使她们充分参与经济，包括成为企业家。

column1: When women are empowered to start their own businesses, they can drive innovation and help their countries prosper.
column2: 当妇女有权开办企业时，她们就可以推动创新并协助国家实现繁荣。

column1: Because women’s labor-force participation is so important for growth, organizations such as the IMF are committed to working with governments around the world to empower women economically.
column2: 因为女性劳动力对经济增长尤为重要，像国际货币基金组织这样的机构正致力于与世界各国政府合作，实现在经济领域为女性授权的目标。

column1: IMF-supported programs in Egypt and Jordan, for example, include measures to boost investment in public nurseries and safe public transportation.
column2: 例如，国际货币基金组织在埃及和约旦支持的项目包括加大对公共托儿所和安全公共交通的投资力度。

column1: In addition to specific policies, today’s conversation has increasingly focused on the need for wider social change.
column2: 除具体政策外，今天的对话越来越关注对大范围社会变革的需求。

column1: And now that movements such as #Equalpay and #MeToo have gained so much momentum, it looks like that change could be coming.
column2: 而现在像#薪酬平等和#我也是这样的运动已经引发了如此大的反响，看起来这样的变化可能即将到来了。

column1: It has been inspiring to see so many women, girls, and – yes – men speaking out against retrograde attitudes toward women, which have been holding all of us back.
column2: 看到这么多妇女、女童 — — 还有男性 — — 公然抨击对女性的落后态度确实令人鼓舞，因为这样的态度一直在阻止我们发展进步。

column1: With the global economy recovering, governments must now lay the foundation for long-term growth, by creating the conditions for women everywhere to realize their full potential.
column2: 随着全球经济复苏，各国政府现在必须通过为各国妇女充分发挥潜能创造条件，从而为长期经济增长奠定基础。

column1: Discrimination and abuse against women can no longer stand.
column2: 对妇女的歧视和虐待决不能继续存在。

column1: It is time for women to thrive.
column2: 现在是时候让妇女实现繁荣。

column1: Women on Top?
column2: 女子掌权?

column1: What will G-8 summit meetings be like when American President Hillary Clinton and French President Ségolène Royal join German Chancellor Angela Merkel in a formidable triangle of women’s power?
column2: 如果美国总统希拉里·克林顿，法国总统塞格琳·罗雅尔以及德国总理默克尔这样一个令人生畏的女性领导铁三角聚首在八国峰会上会是怎样一种景象？

column1: The scenario is not altogether unlikely.
column2: 这种情况的出现并不是完全不可能的。

column1: Indeed, in the United States and France, there are even alternative female candidates for the presidency (Condoleezza Rice in America, Michelle Alliot-Marie in France).
column2: 事实上，在美国和法国，甚至还有另外一些女性的总统候选人，美国有赖斯，法国有阿里奥马里 。

column1: Will this mean a new style of both domestic politics and international relations?
column2: 这会不会意味着国内政治和国际关系的一种新模式呢？

column1: The answer is not obvious.
column2: 答案是并不明显。

column1: After all, some women have long had the strength and the will to make it to the top. Think of Indira Gandhi, Golda Meir, or Margaret Thatcher.
column2: 不管怎样，一些女人早就拥有了实力以及问鼎的意志力，比如英迪拉·甘地，梅厄或者撒切尔夫人。

column1: All three were powerful prime ministers of their countries, though perhaps not the epitome of what might be regarded as feminine values.
column2: 这三个人都成了她们国家强有力的总理，尽管这也许不能被看作是女权主义价值的一个缩影。

column1: They all outdid men at their own game and had little time for what came to be called feminism.
column2: 她们在她们各自的竞赛中都战胜了男人，但是却很少有时间去关注所谓的争取女权运动。

column1: Indeed, another trend may be more significant as far as political leadership is concerned.
column2: 毫无疑问，世界上许多地方政治领导的模式正在发生转变。

column1: When it comes to the formation of governments, women have managed to break out of the prison of their traditional domains, such as education and social affairs.
column2: 当政府组建时，妇女已经能够打破其传统领域，例如教育和社会事务的束缚。

column1: Foreign policy in particular has become a female aspiration.
column2: 特别是，外交已经成为女性的向往。

column1: Both the US and the European Union have women leading their foreign offices; so do half a dozen EU countries, including Britain.
column2: 美国和欧盟都是由妇女来掌管外交；其他众多欧盟国家也是如此，包括英国。

column1: Has this changed the style, indeed, the substance of foreign policy?
column2: 这是否改变了外交的风格，还是外交的实质？

column1: Undoubtedly, a shift in policy styles is occurring in many parts of the world.
column2: 毫无疑问，在世界许多地方正在发生政策风格的转变。

column1: In a word, it appears that the Reagan-Thatcher period is over.
column2: 简单地说，看上去里根-撒切尔的时代已经过去了。

column1: While opponents of globalization still fight “neo-liberal” policies, political discourse has taken a new turn.
column2: 当全球化的反对者还在与“新自由主义”的政策抗争之时，政治演讲的口气已经转向了一个新的方向。

column1: Words like “justice” are back in fashion; there is concern about globalization’s losers and the “underclass.”
column2: 像“公正”这样的词汇有重新成为了时尚；而对于全球化的失败者以及“下层社会”的人也有了更多的关切。

column1: Likewise, the leader of Britain’s Conservatives, David Cameron, startled more old-fashioned supporters of his party by saying that people released from prison “need, above all, love.”
column2: 同样地，英国保守党领袖卡梅隆所谓从监狱里释放出来的人“最需要的是爱”的说法震动了他的党内更为古派的支持者。

column1: When Prime Minister Tony Blair described the next election as a fistfight in which the “flyweight” Cameron would be carried out and the “heavyweight” Brown victorious after a short bout, he got much applause from his supporters in the House of Commons, but the remark went down badly with voters.
column2: 当布莱尔首相把下一次大选描述为一场拳击比赛 ， “ 轻量级”的卡梅隆会在一个很短的回合后就被“重量级”的布朗轻松击败，他博得了他在下院的支持者巨大的欢呼，然而这种说法并没有被选民所接受。

column1: Somehow, people prefer “softer” values than were prevalent in the last two decades.
column2: 就某种程度上讲，人们现在比过去二十年来更倾向于“软”价值。

column1: Yet it is not the leading women who above all represent these values.
column2: 然而并不是那些处于领导地位的女性最主要地代表了这些价值。

column1: Merkel may have been softened by having to preside over a grand coalition, but her original stance was more of the Reagan-Thatcher variety.
column2: 默克尔也许在建立一个大联合政府时会有所软化，但是她最初的立场更多地是里根-撒切尔类型的。

column1: Yuliya Tymoshenko was clearly the most stouthearted among the leaders of Ukraine’s Orange Revolution, and no one has ever described Hillary Clinton as particularly “soft.”
column2: 季莫申科显然是乌克兰橙色革命的领导人中最勇敢的一位，同样从来没有人把希拉里·克林顿描述为一个特别“软”的人。

column1: On the contrary, her possible Republican opponent in 2009, Senator John McCain, while a war hero, is also a man who represents to many Americans the new soft values.
column2: 恰恰相反，可能在2009年成为她的共和党对手的参议员麦凯恩作为一个战争英雄，在许多美国人眼里却代表了新的软价值。

column1: Merkel had a difficult time in the run-up to her recent party conference, because Jürgen Rüttgers, the minister-president of the largest German state, North-Rhine Westphalia, reminded the Christian Democrats of their historical support for strong social-welfare policies.
column2: 默克尔在她前一次的党代会上走上前台也是颇费了一番周折，因为德国最大的州北莱茵-威斯特法伦州的州长约尔根·吕特格尔斯提醒基督教民主党注意他们在历史上一贯支持强有力的社会福利政策。

column1: Only Royal may be said to represent softer lines against the hard-liner of the governing party, Nicolas Sarkozy.
column2: 只有罗耶尔相对于执政党的代表萨尔科齐的强硬路线而言可能代表了软的价值。

column1: So, have women at or near the top made no real difference to politics?
column2: 那么，女性当权真的在政治上没有带来任何变化吗？

column1: Whatever change they have brought has not been obvious.
column2: 至少这种变化并不明显。

column1: In a sense, women’s advance is simply the normal consequence of the gradual move to effective equality of opportunity that began in the 1960’s.
column2: 某种程度上讲，女性所取得的进展只不过是二十世纪六十年代慢慢开始形成的给予男性和女性平等机会的运动的一个正常结果。

column1: It took decades to become real, and there are still countries that have a long way to go.
column2: 这个目标花了几十年时间才变成现实，但是依然还有一些国家距离实现这一目标还有很长的道路要走。

column1: Despite Tymoshenko’s leading role in Ukraine, it would be surprising to see Russian President Vladimir Putin replaced by a woman, and, while there is a female vice-president in China, there is no sign of a woman becoming Japanese prime minister soon.
column2: 尽管季莫申科在乌克兰处于领导角色，但是如果俄罗斯总统普京被一名女性所取代的话那会令人非常惊讶，而尽管中国有一个女性的副总理，但是没有迹象表明日本会很快出现一名女首相。

column1: Even so, in many parts of the world, women have made considerable headway on the path to the top.
column2: 尽管如此，在世界上许多地方，女性在走向权力顶峰的路上已经取得了巨大的进步。

column1: Not infrequently this has been helped by explicit policies.
column2: 明确的政策在这其中常常帮了很大的忙。

column1: David Cameron prides himself on a successful campaign to make 40% of all Conservative parliamentary candidates in Britain are women.
column2: 卡梅隆在一次成功的竞选活动上自豪地称英国40%的保守党议员候选人是女性。

column1: But this is precisely the point.
column2: 但是这正是问题所在。

column1: It is not the women at the top who have changed the scene.
column2: 并不是处于权力顶峰的女性改变了这一现象。

column1: Rather, it is a more general trend, helped along by open-minded leaders of both sexes, that has changed the political climate in countries.
column2: 这更多地是一种整体的趋势，在两种性别的开明的领导人的推动下，改变了许多国家的政治气候。

column1: No one, man or woman, can today aspire to setting the tone of public discourse without recognizing that politics is no longer only a man’s game.
column2: 没有一个人，不管是女性还是男性，今天在寻求公开演讲的基调时会不认识到政治已经不再是单单男人的游戏。

column1: In other words, normalization by equal opportunity is itself the change.
column2: 换句话说，平等机会的正常化本身就是一种改变。

column1: Whatever the particular values of leading candidates, this is undoubtedly progress.
column2: 不管处于领先地位的候选人代表的是哪一种价值观，这毫无疑问就是一种进步。

column1: What Boosts Gender Equality in Developing Countries?
column2: 什么促进了发展中国家的性别平等？

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – On March 8, the world will celebrate International Women’s Day, an annual opportunity to recommit to gender equality.
column2: 华盛顿—3月8日，世界将迎来国际妇女节，这个节日是一年一度的重振性别平等的机会。

column1: This year’s observance comes at an important time for women’s rights, as global movements like #MeToo and #TimesUp are refocusing attention on the discriminatory practices that women confront in their social and professional lives.
column2: 今年的三八妇女节正逢妇女权利的重要时刻 ， “ 我也是 ” （ #MeToo）和“抓紧时间 ” （ #TimesUp）等全球运动正在让人们的注意力重新集中于妇女在社会和职场生活中所遇到的歧视型对待上。

column1: But while women in the developed world are waging big battles over gender bias, women and girls in developing countries remain focused on smaller victories.
column2: 但是，尽管发达世界妇女向性别偏见发动了更大规模的进攻，但发展中国家的妇女和女童仍然着眼于小胜利。

column1: On this International Women’s Day, we must not forget that in the world’s poorest communities, poverty, hunger, domestic violence, and discrimination remain endemic obstacles to gender parity.
column2: 在这个国际妇女节，我们切不可忘记在全球最贫穷的社会里，贫困、饥饿、家庭暴力和歧视仍是阻碍性别平等的巨大障碍。

column1: I have studied gender and development in the Global South for 15 years.
column2: 我在全球南方研究性别和发展问题有15年之久。

column1: My research, which has included thousands of interviews with women from India to Burkina Faso, has centered on one question: How can the international community improve the welfare of the world’s poorest women?
column2: 在研究过程中，我访问过来自从印度到布基纳法索的数千名妇女，主要话题集中在一个问题上：国际社会如何改善世界最贫穷妇女的福利？

column1: The answer, it turns out, is to help them do what they are already doing on their own.
column2: 答案是帮助她们从事她们自己已经在做的事。

column1: One of the most effective ways to empower women anywhere, but especially in the developing world, is by promoting financial independence.
column2: 不论在什么地区（尤其是发展中世界 ） ， 妇女赋权最有效的方法之一是促进财务独立。

column1: In many areas, that means supporting “informal savings groups,” networks of like-minded women who pay dues to build a shared pool of resources.
column2: 在很多地区，这意味着支持“非正式储蓄组织 ” ， 即由意气相投的妇女组成一个网络，共同出资形成一个共享资源池。

column1: This money can then be drawn on to fund any number of items, such as small business expenses, school fees, or health-care costs.
column2: 这笔资金可以用来支持一切项目，比如小笔商务支出、学费、医药费等。

column1: Community-based savings groups – there are millions in Asia and Africa alone – are changing lives every day.
column2: 基于社区的储蓄组织 — — 光是在亚洲和非洲，这种组织就有数百万之多 — — 正在改变日常生活。

column1: I once met a woman in Burkina Faso whose son owes his life to the financial resources of a savings network.
column2: 我曾经在布基纳法索遇见一位妇女，靠储蓄网络的金融资源救了自己儿子的性命。

column1: One evening, when the boy was violently ill with diarrhea, his mother called a taxi to take him to the nearest clinic.
column2: 一天晚上，她的儿子剧烈腹泻，她叫了一辆出租车把他送到最近的诊所。

column1: But taxis, like ambulances, must be paid for in advance, and the woman had no money.
column2: 但出租车和救护车一样，必须先付钱才提供服务，但她没有钱。

column1: Fortunately, a neighbor who belonged to a health savings group was able to contribute and pay the fare.
column2: 幸运的是，一位参加了一个医疗储蓄组织的邻居能够慷慨解囊。

column1: That immediate access to cash very likely saved the boy’s life.
column2: 立即能够获得现金很有可能是她的儿子能够活下来的主要原因。

column1: Most savings group loans are similarly small.
column2: 大部分储蓄组织贷款都是类似的小额贷款。

column1: In Benin, for example, the average loan size in one group is just $9.
column2: 比如，在贝宁，一个组织的平均贷款规模只有9美元。

column1: But, in a country where the average annual income is less than $800, small amounts can make a huge difference.
column2: 但贝宁平均年收入不到800美元，一小笔钱就可以造成巨大的不同。

column1: Unfortunately, many savings groups, as important as they are, do not scale; most operate in isolation from official services, which weakens their effectiveness.
column2: 不幸的是，许多储蓄组织尽管十分重要，却没有实现规模；大部分此类组织脱离官方服务运转，这削弱了它们的效果。

column1: Women in poor communities must rely on one another, but they also need access to government and international agencies if they are ever to escape from hunger and poverty.
column2: 贫穷社会的妇女必须“抱团取暖 ” ， 但要摆脱饥饿和贫困，她们还需要政府和国际机构的帮助。

column1: That is why my organization, the Grameen Foundation, is using digital technology and mobile phones to connect savings groups with other service providers.
column2: 因此，我的组织格雷米恩基金会（Grameen Foundation）运用数字技术和移动电话将储蓄组织和其他服务提供者联系在一起。

column1: One of our largest projects is in Burkina Faso, a desperately poor country in West Africa where an estimated 55% of the population is food insecure for at least a portion of the year.
column2: 我们最大的项目之一在布基纳法索。 这是一个位于西非的极端贫穷国家，大约55%的人口一年总有一段时间口粮得不到保证。

column1: Since 1993, we have worked with more than 73,000 women in nearly 3,300 savings groups, bringing services directly to the women who need them.
column2: 自1993年以来，我们与近3,300个储蓄组织的73,000多位妇女进行了合作，为需要它们的妇女直接提供服务。

column1: Our average participant is 40 years old, illiterate, and earns just $7 a week selling crops like sesame and peanut.
column2: 总体而言，我们的参与者平均年龄为40岁，文化程度为文盲，依靠出售芝麻和花生等农作物为生，每周只能挣7美元。

column1: When we began the program, only about half of the women we worked with said they felt empowered in their homes; many feared their husbands.
column2: 项目启动时，只有大约一半的参与妇女说感到在家里有得到赋权的感觉；许多人都害怕自己的丈夫。

column1: Today, those sentiments are slowly changing.
column2: 如今，这些情绪正在慢慢改变。

column1: By serving as a bridge between informal savings groups and banks, health centers, schools, and agricultural extension services, we are helping women make better decisions about food use, nutritional practices, and spending.
column2: 我们充当了一座连接非正式储蓄组织与银行、医疗中心、学校和农技服务之间的桥梁，帮助妇女做出有关粮食使用、营养和支出的更好的决策。

column1: Our goal is to reduce poverty rates by strengthening asset-management skills, which would give women a greater voice in their communities.
column2: 我们的目标是通过加强资产管理技能让妇女在社区中发出更响亮的声音，从而降低贫困率。

column1: “Gender dialogue sessions” that we host are also strengthening family bonds.
column2: 我们主办的“性别对话大会”还加强了家庭关系。

column1: During each of my field visits, I have been amazed at how these efforts are affecting women’s lives.
column2: 在每一次实地访问中，我都会对这些措施如何影响妇女生活感到高兴。

column1: On one recent trip, I met Rasmata, a young mother who told me that thanks to the safety net of her savings group, she was managing to support her family despite her husband’s emigration abroad, her father’s recent death, and a lingering drought.
column2: 在一次最近的访问中，我遇到了一位名叫拉斯马塔（Rasmata）的年轻母亲，他告诉我，在她的储蓄组织所提供的安全网的支持下，她得以在丈夫移居海外、父亲去世、干旱持续不退的情况下养活全家。

column1: She was diversifying her income, managing her finances, and even adopting climate-smart farming techniques.
column2: 她正在设法实现收入多样化，进行财务管理，甚至用上了气候智能农作技术。

column1: The best part was that she described herself as a “hard-working, respectful, rigorous, and ambitious woman.”
column2: 最令人欣喜的是，她自我定位为一个“努力工作、有礼貌、严格、有进取心的妇女 ” 。

column1: Those are adjectives that women everywhere, regardless of their financial situation or education, deserve to ascribe to themselves.
column2: 不管身居何处、财务状况和教育程度如何，所有妇女都应该这样自我定位。

column1: So this week, as the world celebrates the incredible progress that women have made on the long march to parity, I will be thinking about women like Rasmata, who have accomplished so much despite having so little.
column2: 因此，在本周全世界庆祝妇女在通往平等的漫漫征途上所取得的巨大进步时，我会想到像拉斯马塔这样的妇女，她们几乎一无所有，但取得了如此不凡的成就。

column1: The Myth of the Women’s Vote
column2: 女性选票传说

column1: WASHINGTON, DC – Among the clichés that deserve to be thrown out after the recent presidential election in the United States is the idea of a “women’s vote.”
column2: 华盛顿—在应该从最近的美国总统大选中消灭的糟粕中，有一个是“女性选票”的概念。

column1: It may seem surprising that only 54% of the female electorate voted for Hillary Clinton, the first woman nominated for president by a major party.
column2: 看起来好像很奇怪，只有54%的女选民把票投给了历史上第一位主要政党总统提名人希拉里·克林顿。

column1: But while gender is a strong marker for how Americans think about certain issues, it is not the best predictor of how they will vote.
column2: 然而，尽管性别是美国人看待某些问题的重要标记，但它并非如何投票的最佳指标。

column1: It turns out that female candidates do not face a single gender gap, but rather multiple gender gaps.
column2: 看起来，女候选人面临的不是单一性别差距，而是多重性别差距。

column1: To be sure, a superficial look at past election results reveals an enormous and persistent difference between men and women voters overall.
column2: 诚然，肤浅地研究过去的选举结果表明，男性和女性选民之间总体而言存在巨大且持久的差异。

column1: According to Pew Research, the last presidential election in which men and women voted the same was the 1976 contest between Jimmy Carter and Gerald Ford.
column2: 据皮尤研究公司（Pew Research ） ， 最近一次男性和女性选民投票结果相同的总统选举时1976年吉米·卡特与杰拉德·福特之间的竞争。

column1: In this year’s election, women favored Clinton by 12 percentage points, and men favored Trump by the same margin.
column2: 在今年的选举中，女性以12个百分点的优势更支持克林顿，而男性以同样的优势更支持特朗普。

column1: Men favored George W. Bush by 11 points in 2000, and women favored Obama by 13 points and 11 points in 2008 and 2012, respectively; but until now we have never seen double-digit gaps in both directions simultaneously.
column2: 2000年，男性支持小布什的优势为11个百分点，2008年和2012年，女性支持奥巴马的优势分别为13和11个百分点；但到目前为止，我们从未发现两个方向同时出现两位数差距。

column1: But this still does not mean that the gender gap tells us much as a first-order factor, especially if we consider other gaps among demographic groups.
column2: 但这仍然不意味着性别差距可以作为第一等因素，特别是如果我们考虑人群之间的其他差距的话。

column1: If we sort by race or ethnicity, we find that white Americans favored Trump by 21 points, while Hispanics and African-Americans favored Clinton by 36 points and 80 points, respectively.
column2: 如果我们用种族或民族分类，就会发现美国白人支持特朗普的优势为21个百分点，而西班牙裔和非洲裔美国人支持克林顿的优势分别为36和80个百分点。

column1: Meanwhile, voters with different education levels were further apart than in any election since 1980.
column2: 与此同时，不同教育水平的选民之间的分歧为1980年以来之最。

column1: College-educated voters backed Clinton by a nine-point margin, while people without a college degree backed Trump by an eight-point margin.
column2: 具有大学文化的选民以九个百分点的优势支持克林顿，而没有大学文凭的选民支持特朗普的优势为八个百分点。

column1: A New York Times analysis of exit polls found that voters with annual incomes below $50,000 backed Clinton by about a ten-point margin, while voters with incomes above that level split evenly between the two candidates.
column2: 《纽约时报》的口民调分析发现，年收入50,000美元以下的选民以十个百分点的优势支持克林顿，而年收入50,000美元以上的选民对两位候选人的支持不分伯仲。

column1: This indicates that, at least in this year’s election, ethnicity and education were much more predictive than income.
column2: 这表明，至少在今年的选举中，种族和教育比收入更有预测意义。

column1: As it happens, they were also more predictive than gender.
column2: 是的，它们也比性别更具有预测意义。

column1: Ninety-three percent of African-American women and 80% of African-American men voted for Clinton.
column2: 百分之九十三的非洲裔女性和80%的非洲裔男性把票投给了克林顿。

column1: But 53% of white women and 63% of white men voted for Trump, while only 43% of white women and 31% of white men voted for Clinton.
column2: 但53%的白人女性和63的白人男性支持特朗普，而只有43%的白人女性和31的白人男性把票投给了克林顿。

column1: Similarly, Clinton won the support of white, college-educated women by six points; but she lost white non-college-educated women by 28 points and white non-college-educated men by 49 points.
column2: 类似地，克林顿以六个百分点的优势赢得受过大学教育的白人女性的支持，但她在未上过大学的白人女性上输掉了28个百分点，在未上过大学的白人男性上输掉了49个百分点。

column1: And if we look just at Republican voters, the gender gap vanishes almost entirely: 91% of Republican women and 92% of Republican men voted for Trump.
column2: 而如果我们只看共和党选民，性别差距几乎完全消失：91%的共和党女性和92%的共和党男性把票投给了特朗普。

column1: This all points not to a single gender dynamic, but to one refracted through multiple social and economic lenses.
column2: 所有这些都不支持单一的性别动态，而指向多重社会和经济滤镜的深度折射。

column1: For example, as CBS News noted, Clinton’s failure to match President Barack Obama’s performance with African-American voters was “entirely due to black men” not voting for her – though why this was the case remains unexplained.
column2: 比如，CBS新闻台指出，克林顿没有取得奥巴马总统在非洲裔选民中的表现“完全可以归因于黑人男性”没有投票给她 — — 尽管为什么会这样没有得到解释。

column1: And, despite her candidacy’s historic significance, Clinton’s performance with white women voters was no better than Obama’s performance in 2012.
column2: 此外，尽管她在提名竞争中取得空前大胜，但克林顿在白人女选民中的表现并未优于2012年的奥巴马。

column1: We know that Republican women voted according to their party affiliation and not their gender.
column2: 我们知道，共和党女性投票是根据政党属性，而不是性别。

column1: But Trump also seems to have reached white women not affiliated with a political party, perhaps owing to his campaign’s strategy of hyping women’s anxiety.
column2: 但特朗普似乎也赢得了不属于某个正当的白人女性，也许这是因为他的竞选战略直击女性的焦虑点。

column1: This strategy’s success indicates one way that gender can play a role in voter decision-making.
column2: 这一战略的成功表明，性别在某种程度上可以影响投票决策。

column1: Voter data going back 50 years suggests that women, more than men, are moved by the anxiety of changing circumstances and external threats.
column2: 回溯50年的选民数据表明，女性比男性更受环境变化和外部威胁所带来的焦虑的驱动。

column1: For example, in the 1964 presidential election, Lyndon B. Johnson’s campaign aired the now-famous “Daisy” advertisement that suggested that his opponent, Barry Goldwater, would pull the US into a nuclear war; a week later, polls found that 45% of men, but 53% of women, shared that concern.
column2: 比如，在1964年的总统选举中，林登·约翰逊竞选班子制作了如今大名鼎鼎的“黛西”广告，暗示他的对手巴里·戈德华特（Barry Goldwater）将把美国拖入核战争；一周后，民调显示45%的男性表示感同身受，但女性的这一比例达到了53 % 。

column1: Similarly, George W. Bush performed 30% better with women voters in his 2004 re-election campaign than he did in his 2000 campaign, which many political analysts attribute to anxieties among white middle-class “security moms” in the aftermath of the September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks.
column2: 类似地，小布什在2004年的连任选战中的女性选民表现比2000年更好，许多政治分析家将此归因于白人中产阶级“安全妈妈”因为2001年9月11日的恐怖袭击而引起焦虑。

column1: Still more recently, in the 2014 US midterm elections, Republicans emphasized the US’s vulnerabilities, and aired advertisements hinting that the Islamic State was directing Ebola-infected agents to kill Americans.
column2: 更近一些的2014年美国中期选举中，共和党强调美国的弱点，并制作广告暗示伊斯兰国派出感染埃博拉病毒的特工杀死美国人。

column1: Experts ridiculed these claims, but polling suggests that the advertisements were nevertheless effective, and a number of Democratic incumbents, and women in particular, lost elections that year.
column2: 专家对这样的宣传嗤之以鼻，但民调显示这些广告是有效的，而在那一年的选举中，许多民主党在任者 — — 特别是女性 — — 败走麦城。

column1: The Democrats’ focus on reproductive rights had done little to sway women who were already worrying about the Islamic State and Ebola.
column2: 民主党对生育权的强调几乎无法动摇已经开始担忧伊斯兰国和埃博拉的女性。

column1: As I warned at the time, the 2014 election was a trial run for a 2016 strategy to defeat a woman candidate.
column2: 当时我警告说，2014年选举是2016年击败女性候选人策略的试验场。

column1: Many political observers assumed that this strategy could not possibly work for a Republican candidate who had suggested that a debate moderator was menstruating, joked about dating his daughter, was caught on tape boasting about groping women, and was publicly accused by several women of sexual harassment and assault.
column2: 许多政治观察家认为这一策略对于一位表示电视辩论主持人来“大姨妈 ” 、 打趣约会他女儿、吹嘘“咸猪手”被人拍下、被多位女性公开谴责性骚扰的共和党候选人来说根本没有作用。

column1: But, just as in the 2014 election, Republican-leaning voters in 2016 were far more concerned about terrorism, crime, illegal immigration, and economic security than they were about issues such as sexism, racism, and inequality.
column2: 但是，一如2014年选举，2016年倾向于共和党的选民更加担心的是恐怖主义、犯罪、非法移民和经济安全，而不是性别歧视、种族主义和不平等性等问题。

column1: Where does this leave American women?
column2: 这对美国女性意味着什么？

column1: A female US presidential candidate has now won a majority of women’s votes, and more total votes than her male opponent, and yet her strategy failed to deliver enough votes to secure a victory.
column2: 一位女美国总统候选人赢得了多数女性选票，总票数也多于她的男性对手，但她的策略没有吸引足够选票以保证胜利。

column1: In America’s polarized political culture, appeals to one group simply alienate other groups.
column2: 在极化的美国政治文化中，吸引一个群体等于疏远其他群体。

column1: As long as female candidates are forced to meet multiple, contradictory gender expectations, the US will never close the most prominent gap of all: that between America and the many countries that have already chosen a woman to lead them.
column2: 美国永远无法填补最显眼的差距：美国和许多已经选择女性来领导他们的许多国家之间差距。

column1: Making “Women’s Work” Count
column2: 让“女性的工作”创造价值

column1: ISTANBUL – Over the next few months, the 12,000 employees based at Apple’s headquarters in Cupertino, California will complete their move to an extravagant new campus.
column2: 伊斯坦布尔 — — 接下来的几个月，加利福尼亚州库比蒂诺市苹果总部的12,000名员工将要完成向豪华新址的搬迁工作。

column1: The “spaceship,” covering 2.8 million square feet, includes a two-story yoga studio, running paths, and even revolutionary pizza boxes that keep slices crisp.
column2: 占地280万平方英尺的新址“宇宙飞船”包括一座两层的瑜伽工作室、跑道甚至是能保持比萨饼酥脆的革命性的比萨盒。

column1: One thing it does not have, however, is daycare.
column2: 但新址却没有日间托儿所。

column1: When it comes to ignoring the importance of childcare for working parents, Apple is far from unique.
column2: 在无视托儿工作对职业父母的重要性方面，苹果绝不是独一无二的。

column1: And that omission places a powerful drag on parents’ ability to achieve their economic potential, with women suffering the most.
column2: 这样的忽视对父母发挥其经济潜力造成了巨大的拖累，其中尤以女性受损最多。

column1: Worldwide, women carry out twice as much unpaid domestic and care work – including raising children, caring for sick or elderly family members, and managing the household – as men do.
column2: 世界范围内，女性所从事的不计薪酬的家务和护理工作是男性的两倍 — — 其中包括抚养子女、照顾患病或年老的家庭成员，以及承担家庭管理工作。

column1: In Mexico, India, and Turkey, women do three times more care work than men.
column2: 在墨西哥、印度和土耳其，女性承担了超过男性三倍的护理工作。

column1: This “gender chore gap” limits women’s choices, as it impedes their ability to obtain formal education, secure good jobs, and achieve equal pay.
column2: 这样的“性别家务差距”限制了女性的选择，因为它导致女性无法接受正规教育、寻找良好工作并获取同等报酬。

column1: Indeed, though women around the world actually work more than men in total (including both paid and unpaid work), they earn one quarter less, on average, hold only one quarter of executive positions in the private sector, and occupy less than one quarter of all seats in national parliaments.
column2: 事实上，尽管全世界的女性实际付出的劳动多于男性（包括付费及无偿劳动 ） ， 但她们的平均收入却比男性低1/4，仅仅占据1/4的私营部门管理岗位，并且在全部国家议会席位中仅占不到1/4的份额。

column1: Only half of working-age women worldwide are in the paid labor force, compared to more than three quarters of men.
column2: 全世界仅半数工作年龄女性参与有偿劳动，而男性这一比例则超过3/4。

column1: This situation is slowly beginning to change.
column2: 这种情况正在慢慢发生变化。

column1: Unpaid household and care work is gradually shedding its reputation as “women’s work,” and men today are assuming more household responsibilities than their fathers and grandfathers did.
column2: 无偿的家务和护理工作正逐渐褪去“女性工作”的名声，而今天的男性与他们的父辈和祖辈相比正在承担更多的家务职责。

column1: Some countries, particularly in Europe, are revising traditional leave policies so that parents can choose how to allocate time off after the birth of a child.
column2: 某些国家，尤其是欧洲国家，正在修改传统的休假政策，以便有孩子的家长可以选择在孩子降生后如何分配休假时间。

column1: More broadly, the value of unpaid household and care work – not just for children and family members, but also for the long-term health of societies and economies – is increasingly being recognized.
column2: 更广义地讲，无偿家务和护理工作的价值 — — 不仅针对子女和家庭成员，而且针对长期社会和经济健康 — — 正在越来越多地被人们所认识到。

column1: Efforts to measure the contribution of care work to national economies have produced estimates ranging from 20% to 60% of GDP.
column2: 据衡量护理工作对国家经济贡献的项目估计，护理工作创造了20~60%的GDP。

column1: In 2015, United Nations member states adopted the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), which call for recognizing, reducing, and redistributing unpaid care work – a measure long proposed by feminist economists and gender-equality advocates.
column2: 2015年，联合国成员国通过了可持续发展目标（SDGs ） ， 要求承认、减少和重新分配无偿护理工作 — — 这是一项女权主义经济学家和性别平等倡导者长期以来积极建议的举措。

column1: The question now is what can actually be done to meet this objective.
column2: 现在的问题是人们可以为实现这一目标做些什么。

column1: The responsibility will lie, first and foremost, with governments.
column2: 责任首先在于政府。

column1: After all, while businesses or neighborhood associations may offer childcare options to working parents, costs and quality vary widely.
column2: 归根结底，虽然企业或社区协会可以向职业父母提供育儿选择，但成本和质量差别很大。

column1: Government action is needed to ensure that care services cover all who need them – from preschool children to the sick, the disabled, and the elderly – and that they are universally accessible and affordable.
column2: 只有政府采取行动才能确保所有需求者都能得到护理服务 — — 从学龄前儿童到病人、残疾人和老年人 — — 而且这些服务必须经济实惠、随处可得。

column1: Beyond services, however, achieving the SDGs’ targets will require policy change.
column2: 不过除服务外，实现可持续发展目标将需要改变政策。

column1: Most important, governments must establish requirements for parental and family leave programs.
column2: 最重要的是，政府必须制定家长和家庭假的硬性规则。

column1: Together with private companies, they can also provide monetary incentives for men and women to share household and care work more equally.
column2: 政府可以与私营企业合作为平均分担家务和护理工作的男性和女性提供货币奖励。

column1: Such policies have proved effective not only in Northern Europe – the most commonly cited model – but also in Eastern European countries like Lithuania, Estonia, and even Hungary, demonstrating that they can be applied anywhere.
column2: 事实证明这样的政策不仅在最常被用作范例的北欧地区有效 — — 而且在立陶宛、爱沙尼亚甚至匈牙利等东欧国家也取得了很好的效果，事实表明这样的政策在地域上是普适的。

column1: At a time when many governments, particularly in the developing world, are faced with severe fiscal constraints, such interventions may seem farfetched.
column2: 在许多国家政府，尤其是发展中国家政府，普遍面临严重财政困难的时刻，这样的干预措施或许看起来是不切实际的。

column1: But spending on the care sector should be viewed as an investment, not a cost.
column2: 但护理行业的开支应当被视为一种投资，而不是一种代价。

column1: A recent study in Turkey showed that one dollar of public money invested in the care sector could create 2.5 times as many jobs as a dollar invested in the construction industry.
column2: 近期土耳其的一项研究表明对护理行业投入一美元的公共资金可以创造建筑业单位投资2.5倍的工作。

column1: More than half of those jobs – decent jobs that could raise incomes and living standards, particularly for poor households – would go to women.
column2: 这些工作中有超过半数 — — 这些体面的工作可以提高贫困家庭的收入和生活水平 — — 主要分配给女性求职者。

column1: International institutions can play an important role in helping governments to seize the opportunities presented by investment in the care sector.
column2: 国际机构可以在协助政府抓住护理行业投资机遇方面发挥重要的作用。

column1: In the former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, the United Nations Development Programme undertook an initiative that helped women who had mostly worked at home their entire lives to find jobs in the care sector, enabling them to make use of their skills, by caring for children and for young adults with disabilities, while earning an income.
column2: 在前南斯拉夫马其顿共和国，联合国开发计划署采取了一项举措，协助多数时间在家工作的妇女在护理行业寻找工作，促使她们能够运用自己的技能，照顾儿童和残疾青年，并同时赚取收入。

column1: As populations grow and age, the care sector will only increase in importance.
column2: 随着人口数量和年龄的增长，护理行业的重要性只会不断增加。

column1: Adapting to these new circumstances now will give countries a considerable advantage, as it bolsters women’s rights and freedoms, generates jobs, and make societies more equal.
column2: 现在适应这样的新情况将赋予国家相当大的竞争优势，因为它增强了女性的自由和权利、创造了就业机会并且提高了社会的平等度。

column1: So what are we waiting for?
column2: 既然如此，我们还在等什么？

column1: Worker Protests In China: Plentiful But Preempted
column2: 中国的工人抗议：众而不力？

column1: The last annualized figure for labor protests that Beijing was willing to announce publicly was 100,000 for the year 1999.
column2: 中国官方愿意公布的上一个关于年度劳工抗议活动的数字是1999年的100000起。 而据公安部2001年的一份内部报告披露，该数字自1997年以来“如疾风般增长 ” 。
这一年正值以“效率”为名施压让工厂解雇工人的中共十五大召开。

column1: But a 2001 internal report from the Ministry of Public Security disclosed that the numbers "began a rise like a violent wind" from 1997, the year of the Communist Party's Fifteenth Congress, which pressed for factory firings in the name of "efficiency."
column2: 虽然中国政府决意对媒体封锁一切可能引发骚动的消息—或至少轻描淡写地报道其规模和破坏性—但我们仍然能够从发生在1994至2004年间的200多次不同事件中收集到信息。 这些事件只是在这期间实际发生而却未被报道的数千起事件的冰山一角。
这些报道有的来自于香港的媒体，一小部分来自于中国的出版物，还有的来自于西方媒体。

column1: While the government is determined to keep news of all disturbances out of the media--or at least downplay their size and disruptiveness--it has been possible to collect information on nearly 200 separate events occurring between 1994 and 2004, some from news sources in Hong Kong, some from the Western media, and a few from Chinese publications.
column2: 这些报道反映了同一种普遍增强之中的模式：各级政府，不论是北京还是地方，一般而言都容忍由手持请愿书和标语的农民和工人参与的，声势和规模较小且非破坏性的游行和静坐。 如果示威者们只是自发、无组织、地方性和无领袖的，政府对其态度则更为宽容。

column1: They all exhibit the same, unchanging pattern: the government, whether in Beijing or the localities, tolerates the low-decibel, smaller-scale, relatively non-disruptive marches and sit-ins by demonstrators bearing petitions and posters, especially if they appear to be spontaneous, un-organized, localized and leaderless.
column2: 政治精英层对于那些可能由持不同政见者发动的，带有明显暴力性质的，体现出某种组织性的，以扩大化相威胁的或造成交通主动脉堵塞的动乱则不那么包容了。 的确，在中国大陆之外得以报道的少数事件往往都包含抗议者卧轨或阻塞城市主干道，攻击权力机关或与之发生冲突，拘留和逮捕等因素。

column1: The incidents loom substantially more dangerous to the political elite if they seem to have been mobilized by dissidents, are marked by some measure of violence, threaten to spread, or entail the obstruction of major transport trunklines.
column2: 在这么一个通常被描绘为发展日新月异和高度强调“稳定”的国家，是什么在诱发这些不安定因素呢？ 原因是：拖欠工资和养老金；突然和大量地终止劳动合同；造成一些工业企业破产的腐败官员；以及绝大多数从1950年代共产党政权早期就一直得以保证的社会主义权益的终结。

column1: Indeed, the episodes that make it into the media beyond the Mainland are usually such protests.
column2: 的确，在许多中国人日渐富裕的同时，失业让许多大城市近八分之一的正式登记居民直接陷入贫困。

column1: What is sparking so much unrest in a country usually depicted as daily growing more affluent?
column2: 为了废止被后毛泽东时代的领导人们认为是过度和浪费的社会主义计划经济，自1990年代早期以来就有6000万国有企业职工因工厂效益差而被解雇。

column1: Generally the causes are these: unpaid wages and pensions; sudden and massive job terminations; and management corruption held responsible for the bankruptcy of industrial enterprises--where discharged workers were secure, enjoying privileges and benefits, since the 1950s.
column2: 这些国有企业难以为继的原因是缺乏先进的技术和设备，管理不善或资产侵占，沉重的社会福利负担，或是来自国内外更为现代化和更有成本效率的非国有企业的竞争。

column1: Job losses in the range of 60 million have suddenly rendered nearly an eighth of the urban populace indigent. Often without a dependable channel for airing their grievances, hordes of laid-off workers and retired folk have filled the avenues over the past decade or so.
column2: 由于没有真正可靠的渠道申诉不平，在过去的十年里，许许多多被解雇的工人和被迫下岗（只拿部分养老金）的工人正向政府发起挑战。

column1: Doesn't the government mind if so much of its urban populace is sinking into poverty and becoming disaffected? Why is this stability-obsessed regime allowing so much instability?
column2: 难道这个自我标榜为“人民的”政府不在乎如此之多的城市平民陷入贫困，不满情绪与日俱增吗？

column1: In fact, the leaders are terribly uneasy about the situation and discuss it frequently. Some of the response has been coldly coercive.
column2: 为什么这个重视稳定多于一切的政权允许这么多的不稳定因素存在呢？

column1: But there is also a compensatory effort that has absorbed much of the energy of the bureaucracies for labor and social security, and for civil affairs.
column2: 事实是，虽然党的领导人们对这样的情况甚为不安并频繁商议对策，但在中国两种制度的过渡时期他们能有所作为的空间是有限的。

column1: For 2004, the central government allocated some 78 billion yuan for laid-off workers and the poor, with localities also upping their outlays. But the sad truth is that probably only about a quarter of those pushed out of their plants ever received assistance.
column2: 共产党对“社会不稳定”的危险紧箍咒般的强调，和不遗余力地掌握政权，使得其官员们被迫以有限的手段来应对这些爆发性的不安定的现实及其背后的原因。

column1: For those who have, however, this policy has nipped discontent in the bud.
column2: 同时这些动乱也使共产党蒙羞，它本应代表无产阶级的最高利益。
该党的一些反应是冷酷而具有强制性的。

column1: Additionally, there have been attempts to create new posts, develop labor-intensive industries and small and medium sized firms, promote the private sector, and encourage service jobs, plus offering occupational training: the government allocated an additional 4.7 billion yuan expressly for job creation in 2004.
column2: 但它也采取了一些补偿性的措施，让劳动、社会保障和民政部门的官僚们忙得不亦乐乎。 他们都必须为平息社会动荡而划拨数目可观的应急资金。
其中之一就是“再就业计划 ” （ 自1998年起在全国展开 ） 。
该计划的一个远大目标就是安置国有企业的下岗职工。

column1: These policies mitigate the pain of job loss for their recipients.
column2: 该计划在为下岗职工提供基本的生活费、医疗保险和养老金方面起到了临时管理者的作用。 同时，它也试图为下岗工人寻找新的就业机会或为他们自己创业提供优惠的条件。

column1: Promotion of the law also aims at alleviating anger. As workers' consciousness of their rights increases, they are gradually more and more apt to appeal grievances to the courts: from 1995 to 2001, adjudicated labor disputes rose from 28,000 to 101,000.
column2: 实际上，中央政府在2004年共划拨779亿元巨款用于下岗工人和贫困人口，各级地方政府也同时加大了拨款力度。

column1: Offering workers legal redress has turned their attention temporarily from the streets to mediation and may well have reduced the number of street demonstrations.
column2: 但悲哀的是可能只有约四分之一的下岗工人曾得到过任何有实际意义的帮助。 而对于那些成千上万未能受惠的工人，这项政策已将他们的不满掐灭在萌芽状态。

column1: Other initiatives are a program of allowances, training and placement for the laid-off; unemployment insurance (which, unfortunately, depends on the economic health of the firm to which a worker was once attached); and pension reform--having similar problems.
column2: 随着广大工人的维权意识日渐加强，他们更倾向于向法庭申诉冤情。 的确，在1995至2001年间，法院裁决的劳资纠纷从28000件增加到了101000件。

column1: There is also a scheme to supply a "minimum livelihood guarantee" to the desperately poor.
column2: 诚然，工人们时常发现由于受贿和被告的经理人们更大的影响力，仲裁并没有起到多大作用。

column1: Recipients numbered over 20 million as of early 2004, when 15 billion yuan was budgeted for the program (with the central government contributing a full 60%). These programs are noticed at the grassroots, with the indigent feeling grateful for them.
column2: 但法律途径至少将一部分心怀不满的工人的注意力暂时从走上街头转移到法律调解，而这就有助于减少对抗性的街头示威。

column1: Protest in China has spun upward dramatically in recent years, in numbers, scale, and organization.
column2: 虽然如此，在过去几年里，中国城市抗议活动的数量还是大幅增加，而且据警方的报告称，它们的规模更大也更有组织了。

column1: But by the means listed above the regime has become adept at suppressing opposition.
column2: 到目前为止，政府通过控制媒体（从而防止一个抗议运动了解另一个并与之串联 ） ， 通过发放临时津贴安抚失业工人，和镇压及关押不听劝阻的人等方式成功地保持了总体的稳定。

column1: Its power to intimidate and punish may trump all its other moves to stay ahead of the discontent.
column2: 然而，与由苛捐杂税、官员腐败和肆意征地引发的农民抗议活动联系起来考量，以上所为也不过是权宜之计。 共产党的领导人们发现自己正面临着一种令他们极为不安的情况。

column1: But overall, increasing responsiveness--if clearly not in a democratic mode--has managed to maintain the instability that does exist at a level and within a scope that marks a game of unwritten rules -- one of complainants confining their choler within understood bounds and of the government watchful over an ever-simmering stew.
column2: 因为现在中国共产党所面临的政治威胁不再像1989年时那样由学生和知识分子构成，而是由工人和农民构成。 荒谬的是，毛泽东正是以这两个被剥削阶级为基础建立了他的革命，而中国共产党以正是以他们的名义进行着一直以来的一党专政。

column1: Workers’ Paradise?
column2: 是工人们的天堂吗？

column1: CAMBRIDGE -- Will the political resurgence of labor unions throw a wrench into the wheels of globalization?
column2: 剑桥 - - 众多工会组织在政治上东山再起是否会阻碍全球化的进展呢？

column1: Or will their growing strength serve to make globalization more sustainable by fostering great equality and fairness?
column2: 或者其日益增长的实力通过促进平等和公平而让全球化更为可以持续呢？

column1: One way or the other, unions stand as a major wild card for the evolution of our economic system in 2008 and beyond.
column2: 不管怎样，工会在2008年及其今后将会成为我们的经济制度演进中的一个难以琢磨的因素。

column1: Unions’ rising influence is evident in many recent events: German Chancellor Angela Merkel’s controversial deal to raise minimum wages for postal employees; several American presidential candidates’ open misgivings about trade and immigration; and the Chinese leadership’s nascent concerns about labor standards.
column2: 工会日盛的影响力在最近许多事件中都昭然若揭。 德国总理默克尔为邮政职工提高最低工资引发了争议；几个美国总统侯选人对贸易和移民公开表示担忧；而中国领导人最近则对劳工标准表示关切。

column1: Along with their political clout, unions’ intellectual respectability is also experiencing a renaissance.
column2: 工会在智识上的受尊敬程度与其政治影响力一样在复苏。 几十年来，经济学家们诽谤说工会增加了失业并限制增长。

column1: After decades of vilification by economists for raising unemployment and strangling growth, the union movement is now receiving backing from thought leaders such as Paul Krugman, who argues that stronger unions are needed to counter globalization’s worst excesses.
column2: 现在，工会运动则得到了思想界人士例如格鲁格曼的支持。 他们说人们需要更为强大的工会来对抗全球化最为糟糕的方面。

column1: The sudden emergence of unions as a political force is particularly surprising in the United States, where private-sector union membership has fallen from 25% in 1975 to 8% today.
column2: 在美国，工会突然间作为一支政治力量显现尤其令人惊讶。 美国私营部门工会成员人数从1975年的25%下降到今天的8 % 。

column1: From high-tech Google to mass retailer Wal-Mart, US companies have found ways to keep their shops union-free.
column2: 从高技数的谷歌到大型零售店沃尔玛，美国的公司有办法把工会组织拒之门外。

column1: Only the public sector, where the membership rate is 35%, has remained a union bastion.
column2: 公共部门的成员比例达到35 % ， 也只有它才继续保持成为工会的堡垒。

column1: One of my best friends from childhood married a union organizer who found it so difficult to land a job in the US that he eventually moved his family to strike-happy Canada.
column2: 我儿时最好的一个朋友嫁给了一个工会组织者。 他发现在美国根本难以找到工作，于是最终举家搬到了罢工快乐的加拿大。

column1: Today, US political leaders such as Congressman Barney Frank want to bring back unions.
column2: 今天，美国的政治领导人例如国会议员富兰克想要恢复工会的风光。

column1: But there is good reason to be skeptical.
column2: 但是人们有充足的理由对此表示怀疑。

column1: For a relatively poor country like China, real unions could help balance employers’ power, bringing quality-of-life benefits that outweigh the growth costs.
column2: 对于一个类似中国那样相对较穷的国家，真正的工会可以制约雇主的权力并且带来超过经济增长代价的生活质量的利益。

column1: Factory conditions in parts of China are all too reminiscent of the early twentieth-century, pre-union US.
column2: 在中国的一些地方，工厂的条件让人想起二十世纪早期工会发展之前的美国。

column1: Thousands of Chinese workers die each year in coal mines that sometimes lack basic safety precautions.
column2: 中国每年有几千名煤矿工人死亡，这些煤矿有时缺乏基本的安全保护措施。

column1: But, for the US and rich countries in Europe, the argument that stronger unions would bring more benefits than costs is far more dubious.
column2: 但是，对于美国和欧洲的富国们来说，更为强大的工会带来的利益大于代价，这一论点是难以令人信服的。

column1: Nowadays, most workers already have legal and statutory rights that cover the basic protections that unions originally fought for a century ago.
column2: 当今，大多数工人已经有了法律和法定权利，这些权利包含了工会在一个世纪前所争取的基本保护措施。

column1: Instead, union influence today all too often serves to promulgate inflexible work practices and flat salary structures that do not adequately reward work effort and skill.
column2: 相反，如今工会的影响力过多地用来公布不能足以奖励工作干劲和技能的僵化的工作实务以及划一的工资结构。

column1: It is no surprise that the public sector, where productivity is low and fiscal constraints soft, typically has the greatest union concentration.
column2: 公共部门效率低下，没有太多的财政限制，通常工会组织最为集中，这也就不足为奇了。

column1: Teachers’ unions, especially, are a catastrophe, blocking any rationalization or improvement of many countries’ education systems.
column2: 教师工会特别是一个灾难，它们阻碍许多国家教育体系中任何合理化和改进。

column1: Before the modern globalization era, unions could thrive by organizing on a national scale, giving them enormous bargaining power vis-à-vis both employers and consumers.
column2: 现代全球化时代之前，工会可以通过在全国范围内组织而发展壮大，从而在对雇主和消费者上给了它们巨大的讨价还价的实力。

column1: Now, after the explosive post-war expansion of global trade, most unions have seen their monopoly power eroded, if not shattered.
column2: 现在，全球贸易在战后爆炸式发展，大多数工会发现其垄断实力要么瓦解，要么受到侵蚀。

column1: That is why unions throughout much of the developed world have been fighting so hard to block free-trade negotiations that might erode their position further.
column2: 这就是为何发达国家中的工会不遗余力地阻碍可能进一步侵蚀其实力的自由贸易谈判。

column1: Some of the issues that unions are promoting, such as human rights and environmental quality, are unassailable.
column2: 工会所促进得某些问题，例如人权和环境质量是无可非议的。

column1: When they try to connect these issues with trade, however, their motives become questionable.
column2: 但是，当它们企图把这些问题与贸易挂钩的时候，它们的动机就变得可疑了。

column1: A case in point is union lobbying against the US-Colombia free-trade agreement, ratification of which would greatly advance US-Latin American relations.
column2: 其中一个事例就是工会游说反对美国和哥伦比亚的自由贸易协议。 批准这一协议将会大大增进美国和拉美国家的关系。

column1: Legitimate questions about how the Colombian government conducted its epic civil war with drug-financed rebels do not trump broader issues.
column2: 哥伦比亚支付与贩毒组织支持的反叛力量进行了艰苦卓绝的内战，对于其如何进行这一内战的合理的问题并不让更为广泛的问题消失殆尽。

column1: So anti-pact activists have complained that Colombia is anti-union because it does not protect union members from rebel violence.
column2: 因此，反对这一协议的活动份子们抱怨说哥伦比亚反对工会，因为它并不保护工会成员免于反叛者的暴力。

column1: Yet the Colombian government notes that all Colombians suffer from rebel violence – union members actually experience less of it than the rest of the population.
column2: 但是哥伦比亚政府注意到，所有的哥伦比亚人都受到反叛者暴力之苦，而工会成员实际上要比国内其他人经���的要少。

column1: Unfortunately, this play is being re-enacted across a host of trade issues, including many involving China.
column2: 不幸的是，在许多贸易问题上这一闹剧都在重演，包括中国在内。

column1: For rich countries, income redistribution is much better handled through taxes and benefits system, rather than by government edicts to strengthen unions.
column2: 对于富国而言，通过税收和福利制度可以更好地处理收入重新分配，而非通过政府法令来加强工会组织。

column1: The rich today pay so little in taxes in many countries, that it would be a big improvement simply to move to a flat tax, with a very high exemption level so that lower-income families pay nothing.
column2: 如今，许多国家的富人纳税很少，倒不如干脆转向免税额度很高的单一税，这样低收入家庭就不必纳税。

column1: For middle-income countries, it is a tougher call.
column2: 对于中等收入国家而言，这是难以做出的决定。

column1: But here, too, increasing workers’ legal and statutory rights, while allowing most unions to fade away, seems like the right approach.
column2: 但是在这一问题上还是这样，也就是增加工人们的法律和法定权利，同时让大多数工会自生自灭似乎是一个正确的办法。

column1: Unfortunately, we are far more likely to see unions’ growing political influence become a major destabilizing force in trade and growth, with highly uncertain consequences.
column2: 不幸的是，我们更有可能发现工会不断增长的政治影响力成为贸易和经济增长的一个主要不稳定力量，其后果令人难以预料。

column1: When we see political leaders in many rich countries pander to unions by bashing each other on free trade and immigration, there is every reason to worry about trouble ahead.
column2: 当我们看到富有国家中的许多政治领导人通过在自由贸易和移民问题上相互抨击对方而取悦于工会之时，人们就有理由担心今后的麻烦。

column1: That is why unions will be one of the main economic wild cards in 2008.
column2: 这就是为何工会将会成为2008年主要的一个不可知的经济因素之一。

column1: The Evolution of Work
column2: 工作的演化

column1: CAMBRIDGE – In mid-December, the United Nations will launch the latest of its annual landmark Human Development Reports.
column2: 坎布里奇—12月中旬，联合国将发布最新一期标志性的年度人权发展报告。

column1: This year’s report focuses on the nature of work: how the way we earn a living is being transformed by economic globalization, new technologies, and innovations in social organization.
column2: 今年的报告关注焦点是工作的性质：我们讨生活的方式如何被经济全球化、新科技和社会组织方面的创新所改变。

column1: The outlook for developing countries, in particular, is decidedly mixed.
column2: 特别是，发展中国家的前景十分模糊。

column1: For most people most of the time, work is mostly unpleasant.
column2: 对大部分时间里的大部分人来说，工作大多是不令人愉快的。

column1: Historically, doing lots of backbreaking work is how countries have become rich.
column2: 历史上，辛苦勤劳地工作是国家致富的源泉。

column1: And being rich is how some people get the chance to do more pleasant work.
column2: 而变富是一些人有机会做比较令人愉快的工作的原因。

column1: Thanks to the Industrial Revolution, new technologies in cotton textiles, iron and steel, and transportation delivered steadily rising levels of labor productivity for the first time in history.
column2: 拜工业革命所赐，棉花纺织、钢铁和交通方面的新科技给我们带来了历史上第一次劳动生产率水平的稳步提高。

column1: First in Britain in the mid-eighteenth century, and then in Western Europe and North America, men and women flocked from the countryside to towns to satisfy factories’ growing demand for labor.
column2: 先是十九世纪中叶的英国，然后是西欧和北美，男男女女从乡村涌向城镇以满足工厂对劳动力的不断增长的需求。

column1: But, for decades, workers gained few of the benefits of rising productivity.
column2: 但是，在几十年的时间里，工人几乎没有得到任何生产率提高所带来的好处。

column1: They worked long hours in stifling conditions, lived in overcrowded and unsanitary housing, and experienced little growth in earnings.
column2: 他们在令人窒息的环境中长时间工作，住在没有卫生设施的拥挤的宿舍中，收入也几乎没有增长。

column1: Some indicators, such as workers’ average height, suggest that standards of living may have even declined for a while.
column2: 一些指标，如工人平均体重，表明生活质量可能下降了一段时间。

column1: Eventually, capitalism transformed itself and its gains began to be shared more widely.
column2: 最终，资本主义改变了它自己，其收益得到了更加广泛的分享。

column1: This was partly because wages naturally began to rise as the surplus of rural workers dried up.
column2: 这部分是因为，随着农村剩余工人数量的枯竭，工资自然开始上涨。

column1: But, equally important, workers organized themselves to defend their interests.
column2: 但是，同样重要的是，工人们开始自发组织起来捍卫自己的利益。

column1: Fearing revolution, the industrialists compromised.
column2: 产业家害怕革命，只能妥协。

column1: Civil and political rights were extended to the working class.
column2: 公民和政治权利扩大到工人阶级。

column1: Democracy, in turn, tamed capitalism further.
column2: 民主反过来进一步制约了资本主义。

column1: Employment conditions improved as state-mandated or negotiated arrangements led to reduced working hours, greater safety, and family, health, and other benefits.
column2: 国家规定或劳资双方商定的安排降低了工作时长，增加了安全度，提高了家庭、医疗和其他福利，就业环境有了改善。

column1: Public investment in education and training made workers both more productive and freer to exercise choice.
column2: 教育和培训方面的公共投资提高了工人的生产率，也让他们能够更自由地进行选择。

column1: As a result, labor’s share of the enterprise surplus rose.
column2: 于是，劳动力占企业盈余的份额开始上升。

column1: While factory jobs never became pleasant, blue-collar occupations now enabled a middle-class standard of living, with all its consumption possibilities and lifestyle opportunities.
column2: 工厂工作仍然不令人愉快，但蓝领岗位已能够让人过上中产阶级的生活，拥有中产阶级的消费能力和生活方式机会。

column1: Eventually, technological progress undermined industrial capitalism.
column2: 最终，科技进步打破了产业资本主义。

column1: Labor productivity in manufacturing industries rose much faster than in the rest of the economy: The same or higher quantity of steel, cars, and electronics could be produced with far fewer workers.
column2: 制造业的劳动生产率增长远远快于经济的其他部分：质量相同或更高的钢材、汽车和电子产品，只需要少得多的工人就可以生产出来。

column1: So the “excess” workers moved to service industries – education, health, finance, entertainment, and public administration, for example.
column2: 因此“过剩”的工人们进入服务业 — — 教育、医疗、金融、娱乐和公共管理等。

column1: Thus was born the post-industrial economy.
column2: 后工业经济诞生了。

column1: Work became more pleasant for some, but not for all.
column2: 对一些人来说，工作变得更加令人愉快了，但并非所有人都是如此。

column1: For those with the skills, capital, and savvy to prosper in the post-industrial age, services offered inordinate opportunities.
column2: 对拥有技能、资本和见识，能够在后工业时代实现发达的人来说，服务业带来了超乎想象的机会。

column1: Bankers, consultants, and engineers earned much higher wages than their industrial-age forebears.
column2: 银行家、咨询师和工程师的收入远远高于他们工业时代的前辈。

column1: Equally important, office work allowed a degree of freedom and personal autonomy that factory work never provided.
column2: 同样重要的是，办公室工作提供了工厂工作所不具备的一定程度的自由和自主性。

column1: Notwithstanding long hours (perhaps longer than in factory jobs), service professionals enjoyed much greater control over their daily lives and workplace decisions.
column2: 尽管工作时间很长（可能比工厂岗位更长 ） ， 但服务业专业人士能更好地控制日常生活和决定工作场合。

column1: Teachers, nurses, and waiters were not paid nearly as well, but they, too, were released from the humdrum mechanical drudgery of the shop floor.
column2: 教师、护士和侍应生的薪酬并不是很高，但他们可以摆脱商场中单调乏味的机械式工作。

column1: For less skilled workers, however, service-sector jobs meant giving up the negotiated benefits of industrial capitalism.
column2: 但是，对于技能较弱的工人来说，服务业岗位意味着放弃与产业资本主义商定的福利。

column1: The transition to a service economy often went hand in hand with the decline of unions, employment protections, and norms of pay equity, greatly weakening workers’ bargaining power and job security.
column2: 转向服务经济常常与工会、就业保护、薪酬平等性规范的式微一起发生，大大削弱了工人的议价能力和岗位安全度。

column1: So the post-industrial economy opened up a new chasm in the labor market, between those with stable, high-paid, and fulfilling services jobs and those with fleeting, low-paid, and unsatisfying jobs.
column2: 因此，后工业经济开启了劳动力市场的新差异，一端是稳定、高薪、有满足感的服务业岗位，一端是动荡、低薪、的满意度的岗��。

column1: Two factors determined the share of each type of job – and thus the extent of inequality produced by the post-industrial transition: the education and skill level of the workforce, and the degree of institutionalization of labor markets in services (in addition to manufacturing).
column2: 两大因素决定了每一种类型岗位的比重 — — 也决定了后工业转型所带来的不平等程度：劳动力的教育和技能水平，以及（制造业以外的）服务业劳动力市场的制度化水平。

column1: Inequality, exclusion, and duality became more marked in countries where skills were poorly distributed and many services approximated the textbook “ideal” of spot markets.
column2: 在技能分布情况糟糕、许多服务类似于教科书上的“理想”现货市场的国家，不平等、排斥和二元性日益显著。

column1: The United States, where many workers are forced to hold multiple jobs in order to make an adequate living, remains the canonical example of this model.
column2: 在美国，许多工人被迫打多份工才能维持体面的生活，堪称这一模式的经典案例。

column1: The vast majority of workers still live in low- and middle-income countries and have yet to go through these transformations.
column2: 仍然生活在中低收入国家的绝大部分工人尚未完成这些转型。

column1: There are two reasons to believe that their future path will (or need) not unfold in quite the same way.
column2: 基于两个原因，可以认为他们的未来路径不会（或不必）一样。

column1: First, there is no reason that safe working conditions, freedom of association, and collective bargaining cannot be introduced at earlier stages of development than has occurred historically.
column2: 首先，没有理由认为安全的工作环境、结社自由和集体议价必须遵循历史模式，而不能在发展的较早阶段就引入。

column1: Just as political democracy need not wait for incomes to rise, strong labor standards need not lag behind economic development.
column2: 正如政治民主必须要等待收入上升才能开始，提高劳动标准也不一定要落后于经济发展。

column1: Workers in low-income countries should not be deprived of fundamental rights for the sake of industrial development and export performance.
column2: 低收入国家的工人不应该为了工业发展和出口表现而被剥夺基本权利。

column1: Second, the forces of globalization and technological progress have combined to alter the nature of manufacturing work in a way that makes it very difficult, if not impossible, for newcomers to emulate the industrialization experience of the Four Asian Tigers, or the European and North American economies before them.
column2: 其次，全球化和科技进步的力量已经形成合力，改变了制造业工作的性质，后进者很难甚至不可能模仿亚洲四小龙或更早的欧洲和北美经济体的工业化经验。

column1: Many (if not most) developing countries are becoming service economies without having developed a large manufacturing sector – a process I have called “premature de-industrialization.”
column2: 许多（甚至大部分）发展中国家在没有发展出巨大的制造业的情况下就开始转向服务经济 — — 我称之为“早产去工业化”过程。

column1: Could premature de-industrialization be a blessing in disguise, enabling workers in the developing world to bypass the drudgery of manufacturing?
column2: 早产去工业化可能是一种伪装的福音，让发展中世界的工人直接跳过枯燥乏味的制造业吗？

column1: If so, how such a future could be constructed is not at all clear.
column2: 如果答案是肯定的，那么未来可能怎样尚不清楚。

column1: A society in which most workers are self-proprietors – shopkeepers, independent professionals, or artists – and set their own terms of employment while making an adequate living is feasible only when economy-wide productivity is already very high.
column2: 一个社会中的大部分工人都自我就业 — — 成为店主、独立专业人士或艺术家 — — 有各自的就业条件，同时能够过上体面的生活，这种社会只有在全经济生产率相当高的情况下才可行。

column1: High-productivity services – such as IT or finance – require well-trained workers, not the unskilled kind that poor countries have in abundance.
column2: 高生产率服务业 — — 如IT和金融 — — 需要受过良好训练的工人，而不是穷国遍地都是的低技能工人。

column1: So there is both good and bad news for the future of work in developing countries.
column2: 因此，对于发展中国家的工作的未来来说，既有好消息，也有坏消息。

column1: Thanks to social policy and labor rights, workers can become full stakeholders in the economy much earlier in the process of development.
column2: 拜社会政策和劳动权利所赐，工人能够在发展过程的较早阶段就成为经济的完全相关利益方。

column1: At the same time, the traditional engine of economic development – industrialization – is likely to operate at much lower capacity.
column2: 与此同时，传统社会发展引擎 — — 工业化 — — 可能动力较低。

column1: The resulting combination of high public expectations and low income-producing capacity will be a major challenge for developing economies everywhere.
column2: 由此产生的高公共预期和低收入产生能力的组合可能成为所有发展中经济体的主要挑战。

column1: The Unfinished Business of Gender Parity
column2: 性别平等的未竟事业

column1: DAVOS – When it comes to the importance of gender equality in the workplace, the message has clearly gotten through to those at the top.
column2: 达沃斯 — — 高层人士已经明确开始关注在工作场所实现性别平等的重要性等问题。

column1: Surveys – including those conducted by my own organization – consistently show that business leaders understand the need for equal treatment of men and women in the workforce.
column2: 包括我本人所在机构进行的各项调查结果一致表明，企业领导人对于必须平等对待男女劳动者已经有了明确的认识。

column1: Indeed, my own conversations with senior businesspeople around the world confirm that progress clearly is being made.
column2: 事实上，我与世界各地资深商务人士的对话证实在这方面正在取得显著的进步。

column1: The vast majority recognize the issue as imperative to their companies’ success and have implemented measures to promote gender parity in their organizations.
column2: 绝大部分人认识到这对企业的成功必不可少，并已着手采取措施提高所在机构的性别平等程度。

column1: And yet, for all the fine words, much more remains to be done before gender parity is actually achieved.
column2: 但尽管态度非常积极，真正实现性别平等还要进行很多工作。

column1: The facts speak for themselves.
column2: 事实是不言自明的。

column1: There is still a pay gap in every country in the world, with men earning more than women for similar jobs.
column2: 工资差距仍在世界每一个国家从事类似工作的男女员工间现实存在着。

column1: Likewise, the percentage of seats on corporate boards occupied by women appears to have stalled at just over 17%.
column2: 同样，女性担任公司董事的比例似乎一直徘徊在17%左右。

column1: This bias has not gone unnoticed – especially among female employees.
column2: 这样的偏见并未受到人们 — — 特别是女性员工的忽视。

column1: In a 2015 PwC global survey of female millennials born between 1980 and 1995, half of those working in financial services said they believed that men received more favorable treatment when it came to promotions.
column2: 2015年普华永道对生于1980和1995年间的千禧女性全球调查结果显示，从事金融服务工作的女性近半数表示她们认为男性在升职方面得到的待遇更加优越。

column1: More than 70% said that as much as their organizations talk about diversity, in reality, opportunities remain unequal.
column2: 超过70%的女性表示尽管其所在机构提倡多样性，但在现实中她们仍然得不到平等的机会。

column1: Interestingly, other studies conclude that when women are provided with the opportunity to perform on an equal footing with men, they more often than not come out on top.
column2: 有趣的是，其他研究得出结论，当为女性和男性提供同等机会时，往往女性能够拔得头筹。

column1: A recent ten-year analysis of 300 start-up investments backed by venture capitalists in the United States showed that companies with a female founder performed 63% better than those with all-male founding teams.
column2: 近期一份由美国风投人士出资进行的针对300家初创企业的投资分析表明，有女性创业者的企业业绩较之全是男性团队的企业高63%左右。

column1: And another of PwC’s research programs, examining the changing faces of billionaires worldwide, discovered what we called the “Athena Factor.”
column2: 普华永道另一项研究结果显示，世界各地亿万富翁的变化体现出我们所谓的“雅典娜因素 ” 。

column1: The increase in the number of female billionaires significantly outpaces that among men, with Asia registering the fastest growth in the ranks of self-made female billionaires.
column2: 女性富豪人数增加明显快于男性，其中增长速度最快的首推亚洲自主创业的女性富豪。

column1: Where women have the opportunity to capitalize on their talents, they are doing so successfully and with gusto.
column2: 在女性有机会发挥才华时，她们对此满怀激情并取得了成功。

column1: Meanwhile, there is growing recognition of the positive contribution that greater workforce diversity makes to business performance.
column2: 与此同时，劳动力多元化对企业绩效的积极贡献越来越被人们所认识到。

column1: And yet, as reflected in the stubborn persistence of the pay gap, barriers to women’s progress remain.
