column2: 不过，长期存在的工资差距显示依然存在阻碍女性进步的因素。

column1: What is now needed is a genuine and permanent shift in attitudes and behavior.
column2: 现在需要的是态度和行为真正的永久性变化。

column1: Many of the biases holding women back are unconscious; and, by their very nature, these blind spots cannot be tackled by statements of intent alone.
column2: 阻碍女性进步的很多是无意识因素；而且，其本身性质决定了仅靠明确目的来解决这些盲区还远远不够。

column1: Tackling gender inequality will require us to identify where, how, and why these biases materialize, and to develop systematic strategies and interventions to root them out.
column2: 改变性别不平等需要我们明确上述偏见在哪里、为什么和怎样付诸实施，并制定系统的战略和干预措施来加以铲除。

column1: In order to accomplish this, businesses must actively challenge men to help advance women in the workforce.
column2: 为实现上述目标，企业必须积极要求男性协助女性争取职业进步。

column1: That is why I am proud to be a founding Corporate Impact Champion of the UN Women’s HeForShe movement.
column2: 因此我为成为联合国女性他为她运动最初的企业影响创始者而感到自豪。

column1: Creating real and lasting change will require helping men and women work together.
column2: 男女必须竭诚合作才能实现真正的永久性变化。

column1: The business case for doing so is incontrovertible.
column2: 这样做有着不容置疑的商业理由。

column1: Not only do women make up half the global population; the same skills needed to work through differences in gender – open-mindedness, humility, empathy – can be used to work across other types of differences, be they cultural, physical, or personal.
column2: 不仅女性占到全球人口的一半；而且克服性别歧视所需的同样素质 — — 即开放、谦逊、同情 — — 同样可以克服文化、生理或人性等其他类型的不同。

column1: It is important, of course, to reassure male skeptics who view gender parity as a threat.
column2: 当然，让怀疑性别平等是某种威胁的男性放心非常重要。

column1: In June 2015, I hosted a HeForShe chat on Twitter , and while the conversation was overwhelmingly positive, an obvious concern surfaced: Why should men help promote women to positions for which they themselves are aiming?
column2: 2015年6月，我在推特上主持了他��她计划的聊天活动。 虽然谈话从总体来看非常积极，但仍然出现了某种显著的担忧：男性为什么要帮助女性得到他们自己都希望得到的职务？

column1: Addressing such concerns will require us to show that we are not promoting some people at the expense of others; gender parity must be win-win, not zero-sum.
column2: 安抚这些担忧需要明确我们不是要以牺牲某些人为代价来抬高另一些人；性别平等必须达到双赢、而非零和的效果。

column1: At PwC, this is being addressed by hosting conversations in which men and women discuss gender issues collaboratively and respectfully, and by working with both genders to challenge double standards and acknowledge potential blind spots.
column2: 普华永道正组织男女员工在合作和相互尊敬的基础上探讨性别问题，并与两性合作挑战双重标准、寻找潜在盲点。

column1: Recent research suggests that, at the current rate of progress, it will take another 80 years to reach gender parity.
column2: 近期的研究表明按照目前的发展速度，还要再过80年才能实现两性平等的目标。

column1: That is not good enough.
column2: 这样的速度远远不够。

column1: Let us all commit to achieving it in our lifetimes – for the benefit of everyone.
column2: 让我们所有人致力于在有生之年实现 — — 这对我们每个人都有好处。

column1: Four Ways to Beat HIV/AIDS
column2: 消灭艾滋病的四个办法

column1: PITTSBURGH – In the fight against HIV/AIDS, some stories illuminate the long road to global eradication more than others.
column2: 匹兹堡—在与艾滋病的战争中，一些故事更能说明通往全球消灭艾滋病的漫漫长路。

column1: In 2009, I heard one such story in Tanzania.
column2: 2009年，我在坦桑尼亚就听说了这样一个故事。

column1: I was visiting a remote village when I spoke to a woman who knew that she was HIV-positive.
column2: 我访问了一个偏远村庄，和一位获知自己艾滋病毒阳性的妇女对话。

column1: She told me that the established health guidelines at the time indicated that she could not receive treatment until her count of CD4 T-helper cells, a type of white blood cell used by the immune system, had dropped below a certain threshold.
column2: 她告诉我，当时的卫生指南说，在她的CD4 辅助性T细胞（一种免疫系统中的白血球）下降到一定阈值以下之间，她不会得到治疗。

column1: After walking several miles to get her count checked, she arrived at the clinic only to find its testing machine broken.
column2: 她跋涉数英里去检查CD4 辅助性T细胞，到了才发现测试机器坏掉了。

column1: The machine was still inoperative the second time she made the long journey.
column2: 过了一段时间，她又跋涉数英里去做检查，但机器仍然坏着。

column1: Only months later, after her third trip to the clinic on foot, did she receive her cell count: her levels were far below the necessary threshold.
column2: 过了几个月，她第三次步行前往这家医院才成功地做了检查，她的细胞数量已经远远低于阈值。

column1: Her treatment should have begun months before.
column2: 她应该在几个月前就开始获得治疗。

column1: Since HIV/AIDS was first identified in 1984, it has killed more than 35 million people.
column2: 自1984年艾滋病第一次被识别以来，它已经杀死了3,500万多人。

column1: Although the number of AIDS-related deaths has fallen by almost half since peaking in 2005, there are still far too many people dying from this preventable condition.
column2: 艾滋病相关死亡人数在2005年达到峰值，随后下降了近一半，但仍有太多的人因为这个可预防的疾病而失去生命。

column1: In 2016 alone, one million people around the world died from HIV-related causes, while 1.8 million more became infected.
column2: 光是在2016年，全球就有一百万人死于与艾滋病毒有关的状况，另有180万人被感染。

column1: Contrary to popular myth, we have not turned the corner on AIDS – not by a long shot.
column2: 与流行的故事相反，我们并没有能够扭转艾滋病形势 — — 至少从长期看没有。

column1: World AIDS Day, on December 1, is an occasion to honor the millions of victims, and to recommit to ending this devastating disease.
column2: 12月1日是世界艾滋病日，设立这个日子是为了纪念数百万受害者和鼓励人们消灭这个可怕的疾病。

column1: According to UNAIDS, just 54% of HIV-positive adults, and only 43% of HIV-positive children, are currently receiving the antiretroviral therapies that save lives and prevent new infections.
column2: 据联合国艾滋病规划署的数据，目前只有54%的艾滋病毒阳性成年人，以及43%的艾滋病毒阳性儿童，正在接受能够拯救生命和阻止传染的抗逆转录疗法。

column1: With so many untreated patients, the virus will continue to spread.
column2: 得不到治疗的患者如此之多，艾滋病毒必然还在继续传播。

column1: As CEO of a global pharmaceutical company, I’m proud of the work we have done to fight HIV/AIDS around the world.
column2: 作为一家全球制药公司的首席执行官，我对于我们在消灭艾滋病的全球战争中所做出的贡献深感自豪。

column1: Today, more than eight million people – nearly half of all patients receiving treatment for HIV in developing countries – depend on the antiretroviral treatments that we produce.
column2: 如今，超过八百万人 — — 相当于发展中国家接受艾滋病治疗的所有患者的近一半 — — 需要依靠我们所生产的抗逆转录治疗手段。

column1: But for those of us on the front lines of this struggle, our work is far from over.
column2: 但对于我们这些站在这场战争最前线的人来说，我们的工作还远没有结束。

column1: The pharmaceutical industry has a responsibility to expand access to testing and treatment, and to help stop the spread of HIV once and for all.
column2: 制药业有责任扩大测试和治疗的普及度，帮助一劳永逸地阻止艾滋病毒传播。

column1: Fulfilling four key commitments will make this goal achievable.
column2: 兑现四项关键承诺能够助我们实现这一目标。

column1: For starters, pharmaceutical companies should do more to increase the availability of low-cost, generic medicines.
column2: 首先，制药公司应该做更多的事增加低成本通用药物的普及度。

column1: My company, Mylan, introduced the first generic once-daily pill for developing countries in 2009, and we have continually reduced its price to make it more accessible to more people.
column2: 我的公司 — — 迈兰制药公司在2009年推出了第一种面向发展中国家的一日一次普通药，此后我们一直在调降药价，让它走近更多的人。

column1: With this treatment alone, Mylan and other generic manufacturers save the US government, international donors, and national health programs more than $4.5 billion a year.
column2: 光是通过这种药，迈兰和其他通用药制造商每年都能为美国政府、国际捐助人和国家卫生计划节省45亿多美元。

column1: Still, treatment options could be expanded further.
column2: 尽管如此，治疗选择可以进一步扩大。

column1: In September, Mylan announced a collaboration with UNAIDS, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, the Clinton Health Access Initiative, and other partners to provide the next-generation single-pill HIV regimen to patients in more than 90 low- and middle-income countries for less than $75 per year.
column2: 9月，迈兰宣布与联合国艾滋病规划署、比尔和梅琳达·盖茨基金会、克林顿健康倡议计划（Clinton Health Access Initiative）和其他合作者携手为90多个中低收入国家以每年不到75美元的价格提供新一代单一药物艾滋病疗法。

column1: These drugs are widely used in high-income countries because they produce fewer side effects.
column2: 这些药品因其副作用更小而在高收入国家广泛使用。

column1: Affordability initiatives like this one should be replicated.
column2: 此类平价计划应该被广泛复制。

column1: Next, drug makers must continue investing in capacity and supply-chain reliability.
column2: 其次，制药商必须继续投资于产能和供给链可靠性建设。

column1: Since 2005, the number of people on antiretroviral therapies worldwide has grown by a factor of ten, to 21 million.
column2: 自2005年以来，全世界接受抗逆转录治疗的人数增加了十倍，达到了2,100万人。

column1: But roughly twice as many people are currently infected with HIV.
column2: 但目前被艾滋病毒感染的人数两倍于此。

column1: Over the last decade, Mylan has invested more than $250 million in expanding production capacity, and we now produce four billion tablets and capsules each year.
column2: 在过去十年中，迈兰公司投入了2.5亿多美元用于扩大产能，目前我们每年都要生产四十亿片药片和胶囊。

column1: But further investments are needed if we are to provide access to the other 21 million people still not on treatment.
column2: 但如果要为另外2,100万仍然得不到治疗的人提供药物，还需要更多投资。

column1: A third urgently needed commitment is to increase support for research that accelerates the development of new innovations in effective and efficient treatment delivery.
column2: 第三项继续做出的承诺是增加研究支持和加快高效治疗实现的新创新的开发。

column1: For example, Mylan provides study medications to research trials, like the MaxART trial in Swaziland, which demonstrated that providing treatment to all HIV-positive people is the best way to slow the disease’s spread.
column2: 比如，迈兰公司为研究实验提供研究药品，比如斯威士兰的MaxART试验，该试验发现，向所有艾滋病毒阳性人员提供治疗是遏制艾滋病蔓延的最佳办法。

column1: We also supported the Kirby Institute’s ENCORE1 trial, to develop a reduced-dose version of the most commonly used HIV treatment regimen.
column2: 我们还支持科尔比研究所（Kirby Institute）的ENCORE1测试，该测试要开发最常用艾滋病疗法的减剂量版。

column1: And we are currently working with the US Agency for International Development as part of a partnership called OPTIMIZE, which aims to accelerate access to new therapies.
column2: 目前，我们还与美国国际开发署进行合作，这是一个叫作“优化 ” （ OPTIMIZE）的合作项目的一部分，其目的是加快新疗法的普及。

column1: We do not support trials like these because we hope to gain any marketable intellectual property – we won’t.
column2: 我们支持此类试验不是因为我们向获得可以待价而沽的知识产权。

column1: Rather, we support them because it is the right way to advance science and improve treatment.
column2: 相反，我们支持这些试验是因为这是推动科学、改进疗法的正确方法。

column1: Finally, real gains in the fight against HIV/AIDS will require drug makers to account for the limitations of health-care systems and distribution networks in the developing countries they serve.
column2: 最后，艾滋病战争的真正收益需要制药公司顾及它们所服务的发展中国的医疗体系和分销网络的极限。

column1: Antiretroviral therapies for children are a good example of these challenges.
column2: 儿童抗逆转录治疗是这类挑战的一个显例。

column1: Drugs for young people produced in the West are often liquids that require refrigeration.
column2: 西方所生产的年轻人用药通常为液态，需要冷藏。

column1: But developing countries often have limited cold-storage capacities or an inability to transport liquid in bulk.
column2: 但发展中国家常常冷藏能力不足，也不具备大量运输液体的能力。

column1: That’s why Mylan has developed heat-stable, taste-masked, dispersible tablets that can easily be incorporated into food.
column2: 因此，迈兰公司开发了一种热稳定的矫味分散片，可以方便地掺在食品中。

column1: Our scientists are now working on the next-generation formula, which comes in the equivalent of a sugar packet that even newborns can take.
column2: 我们的科学家正在开发新一代配方，将采用糖包，即使是新生儿也可以服用。

column1: More innovations like these will be needed to solve the country-specific issues that patients face.
column2: 我们需要更多类似的创新来解决具体国家患者所面临的问题。

column1: The global health community has made remarkable progress in turning the tide on HIV/AIDS, introducing new products and advocating for earlier treatment.
column2: 全球医疗界在扭转艾滋病趋势方面做出了重大进步，引入了新产品，推动了提早治疗。

column1: But when I think back to the woman I met in Tanzania, I am reminded of how much work remains to be done.
column2: 但每当我回想起在坦桑尼亚遇到的那位妇女，我就会想起还有很多工作等着我们完成。

column1: Makers of generic medicines have an important role to play in this fight, and we will not stop working until treatment is available to every patient in the world who needs it.
column2: 通用药制造商在这场战争中扮演着重要角色，我们会一直致力于此，直到全世界所有需要的患者都能得到治疗。

column1: The World Bank Needs to Return to Its Mission
column2: 世界银行需要回归其使命

column1: NEW YORK – The World Bank declares that its mission is to end extreme poverty within a generation and to boost shared prosperity.
column2: 纽约 — — 世界银行宣称在一代人的时间里消除赤贫、促进共同繁荣是其使命。

column1: These goals are universally agreed as part of the Sustainable Development Goals.
column2: 上述目标被普遍认为是可持续发展目标的组成部分。

column1: But the World Bank lacks an SDG strategy, and now it is turning to Wall Street to please its political masters in Washington.
column2: 但世界银行缺乏可持续发展战略，而现在它正在转向华尔街，以取悦华盛顿的政治领袖。

column1: The Bank’s president, Jim Yong Kim, should find a better way forward, and he can do so by revisiting one of his own great successes.
column2: 世行行长金墉应当通过回顾自己曾经取得的重大成功找到一条更好的前进之路。

column1: Kim and I worked closely together from 2000 to 2005, to scale up the world’s response to the AIDS epidemic.
column2: 2000到2005年金墉和我曾密切合作，以推广世界各国对艾滋病疫情的应对之策。

column1: Partners in Health, the NGO led by Kim and his colleague, Harvard University’s Paul Farmer, had used antiretroviral medicines (ARVs) to treat around 1,000 impoverished HIV-infected rural residents in Haiti, and had restored them to health and hope.
column2: 由金及其同事，哈佛大学的保罗·法莫共同领导的非政府组织“健康伙伴 ” （ Health in Health）一直在使用抗逆转录病毒的药物（AVR）来治疗约1，000名被艾滋病毒感染的贫困的海地乡村居民，并使他们的健康和希望得以恢复。

column1: I pointed out to Kim and Farmer 18 years ago that their success in Haiti could be expanded to reach millions of people at low cost and with very high social benefits.
column2: 18年前我就曾对金和法默指出可以对他们在海地的成功进行推广，以较低的代价和非常高的社会效益惠及成百上千万民众。

column1: I recommended a new multilateral funding mechanism, a global fund, to fight AIDS, and a new funding effort by the United States.
column2: 我推荐了一种新的多边投资机制，一支抗击艾滋病的全球基金，以及促使美国开展新的投资项目。

column1: In early 2001, UN Secretary-General Kofi Annan launched the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis, and Malaria, and in 2003 US President George W. Bush launched the PEPFAR program.
column2: 2001年初，联合国秘书长安南发起了抗击艾滋病、结核病和疟疾的全球基金，2003年，美国总统乔治·W·布什牵头发起了总统防治艾滋病紧急援助（PEPFAR）计划。

column1: The World Health Organization, led by the Director-General Gro Harlem Brundtland, recruited Kim to lead the WHO’s scale-up effort.
column2: 由总干事布伦特兰夫人领导的世界卫生组织招募金墉来领导世卫组织的扩大工作。

column1: Kim did a fantastic job, and his efforts provided the groundwork for bringing ARVs to millions, saving lives, livelihoods, and families.
column2: 金出色的完成了这项任务，他通过努力将抗逆转录病毒药物带给成百上千万人，为挽救生命、生计和无数家庭奠定了基础。

column1: There are four lessons of that great success.
column2: 这一伟大的成功有四条经验可以汲取。

column1: First, the private sector was an important partner, by offering patent-protected drugs at production cost.
column2: 首先，私营部门是重要的合作伙伴，以生产成本提供具有专利保护的药物。

column1: Drug companies eschewed profits in the poorest countries out of decency and for the sake of their reputations.
column2: 药品企业为了顾全声誉和体面放弃了最贫困国家的利润。

column1: They recognized that patent rights, if exercised to excess, would be a death warrant for millions of poor people.
column2: 他们认识到如果过度行使专利保护，就会成为成百上千万贫困民众的催命符。

column1: Second, the effort was supported by private philanthropy, led by Bill Gates, who inspired others to contribute as well.
column2: 其次，由比尔·盖茨领导的私人慈善机构支持开展这项工作，并激励其他人也这么做。

column1: The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation backed the new Global Fund, the WHO, and the Commission on Macroeconomics and Health, which I led for the WHO in 2000-2001 (and which successfully campaigned for increased donor funding to fight AIDS and other killer diseases).
column2: 比尔和梅林达·盖茨基金会支持新全球基金、世卫组织以及2000到2001年我所领导的宏观经济与医疗委员会（该委员会成功地争取了抗击艾滋病和其他致命疾病捐助资金的增加 ） 。

column1: Third, the funding to fight AIDS took the form of outright grants, not Wall Street loans.
column2: 第三，抗击艾滋病的基金采用的形式是直接赠款而非华尔街贷款。

column1: Fighting AIDS in poor countries was not viewed as a revenue-generating investment needing fancy financial engineering.
column2: 在贫穷国家抗击艾滋病并没有被视为需要复杂金融操作的创收型投资。

column1: It was regarded as a vital public good that required philanthropists and high-income countries to fund life-saving treatment for poor and dying people.
column2: 这项事业被认为是需要慈善家和高收入国家为贫困和垂死民众提供救命治疗的至关重要的公共服务。

column1: Fourth, trained public health specialists led the entire effort, with Kim and Farmer serving as models of professionalism and rectitude.
column2: 第四，由受过专业培训的公共卫生专家来领导这项工作，职业和诚实的典型代表就是金和法莫。

column1: The Global Fund does not stuff the pockets of corrupt ministers, or trade funding for oil concessions or arms deals.
column2: 全球基金并没有流向腐败部长们的口袋，也没有用卫生资金来交换石油特许权或武器协定。

column1: The Global Fund applies rigorous, technical standards of public health, and holds recipient countries accountable – including through transparency and co-financing requirements – for delivering services.
column2: 全球基金采用严格的纯技术公共卫生标准，并通过账目透明和联合出资等规定对资金接受国的服务提供情况进行问责。

column1: The World Bank needs to return to its mission.
column2: 世行需要回归自己的使命。

column1: The SDGs call for, among other things, ending extreme poverty and hunger, instituting universal health coverage, and universal primary and upper secondary education by 2030.
column2: 可持续发展目标要求在2030年之前结束极端贫困和饥饿、实现全民健康覆盖和普及小学和高中教育的目标。

column1: But, despite making only slow progress toward these goals, the Bank shows no alarm or strategy to help get the SDGs on track for 2030.
column2: 但尽管在实现上述目标方面进展非常缓慢，但世行却并未引起警惕、也没有制定相应的策略以求实现2030年可持续发展目标。

column1: On the contrary, rather than embrace the SDGs, the Bank is practically mute, and its officials have even been heard to mutter negatively about them in the corridors of power.
column2: 事实上，世行不但没有拥抱可持续发展目标，反而装聋作哑，而有人甚至听到世行官员在权力走廊上消极抱怨可持续发展目标。

column1: Perhaps US President Donald Trump doesn’t want to hear about his government’s responsibilities vis-à-vis the SDGs.
column2: 也许美国总统唐纳德·特朗普并不想听到有关美国政府在可持续发展目标方面的责任。

column1: But it is Kim’s job to remind him and the US Congress of those obligations – and that it was a Republican president, George W. Bush who creatively and successfully pursued the battle against AIDS.
column2: 但金有义务提醒他和美国国会 — — 恰恰是共和党总统乔治·W·布什创造性地成功支持了抗击艾滋病的战斗。

column1: Wall Street may help to structure the financing of large-scale renewable energy projects, public transport, highways, and other infrastructure that can pay its way with tolls and user fees.
column2: 华尔街或许有助于安排能靠收取通行费和使用费偿还贷款的大规模可再生能源项目、公共交通、高速公路和其他基础设施项目的融资工作。

column1: A World Bank-Wall Street partnership could help to ensure that such projects are environmentally sound and fair to the affected communities.
column2: 世行与华尔街合作有助于确保这些项目不损害环境，并确保这些项目对不同群体的影响是公平的。

column1: That would be all for the good.
column2: 这些都是好的结果。

column1: Yet such projects, designed for profit or at least direct cost recovery, are not even remotely sufficient to end extreme poverty.
column2: 但这些旨在牟取利润或至少收回直接成本的项目就连消除极端贫困都远远不够。

column1: Poor countries need grants, not loans, for basic needs like health and education.
column2: 贫困国家需要拨款而非贷款，以满足医疗和教育方面的基本需求。

column1: Kim should draw on his experience as the global health champion who successfully battled against AIDS, rather than embracing an approach that would only bury poor countries in debt.
column2: 金应该借鉴他成功主导抗艾滋病斗争的全球健康经验，而不是只会把贫困国家淹没在债务当中。

column1: We need the World Bank’s voice and strenuous efforts to mobilize grant financing for the SDGs.
column2: 我们需要世行积极宣传并致力引导为实现可持续发展目标筹集援助资金的工作。

column1: Health care for the poor requires systematic training and deployment of community health workers, diagnostics, medicines, and information systems.
column2: 为穷人提供医疗服务需要全面培训和部署社区卫生工作者，并建立诊断、药物和信息系统。

column1: Education for the poor requires trained teachers, safe and modern classrooms, and connectivity to other schools and to online curricula.
column2: 为穷人提供教育需要训练有素的教师、安全现代的教室，并连接其他学校以及在线课程。

column1: These SDGs can be achieved, but only if there is a clear strategy, grant financing, and clear delivery mechanisms.
column2: 上述可持续发展目标可以实现，但前提是必须要有明确的战略、拨款资助和明确的分配机制。

column1: The World Bank should develop the expertise to help donors and recipient governments make these programs work.
column2: 世界银行应当发展专业能力，协助捐助者和受援国政府取得这些项目的成功。

column1: Kim knows just how to do this, from his own experience.
column2: 金在这方面有着丰富的经验，他知道怎样做才能实现目标。

column1: Trump and other world leaders are personally accountable for the SDGs.
column2: 特朗普和其他世界领袖均对可持续发展目标负有个人义务。

column1: They need to do vastly more.
column2: 他们需要付出比现在多得多的努力。

column1: So, too, do the world’s super-rich, whose degree of wealth is historically unprecedented.
column2: 全世界超富阶层也是一样，他们所掌握的财富比例从历史上来看可谓前所未有。

column1: The super-rich have received round after round of tax cuts and special tax breaks, easy credits from central banks, and exceptional gains from technologies that are boosting profits while lowering unskilled workers’ wages.
column2: 超级富豪已经获得了一轮又一轮的减税和特别税收优惠，他们能够轻松得到央行贷款，并在推高利润的同时获得非技术工人薪酬降低带来的巨大好处。

column1: Even with stock markets’ recent softness, the world’s 2000+ billionaires have around $10 trillion in wealth – enough to fund fully the incremental effort needed to end extreme poverty, if the governments also do their part.
column2: 即使近来股票市场疲软，全球2000多位亿万富豪也拥有约10万亿美元左右的财富 — — 如果政府也能够尽其所能，这些财富足以为消除极端贫困所需的渐进式努力提供资金援助。

column1: When going to Wall Street, or Davos, or other centers of wealth, the World Bank should inspire the billionaires to put their surging wealth into personal philanthropy to support the SDGs.
column2: 在访问华尔街、达沃斯或其他财富中心时，世界银行应当鼓励亿万富翁将他们激增的财富投入个人慈善，用于支持实现可持续发展目标。

column1: Bill Gates is doing this, with historic results, for public health.
column2: 比尔·盖茨正在从事这项事业，并在公共卫生领域取得了历史性的成果。

column1: Which billionaires will champion the SDGs for education, renewable energy, fresh water and sanitation, and sustainable agriculture?
column2: 哪些亿万富翁将主导教育、可再生能源、淡水及卫生设备以及可持续农业等领域的可持续发展目标？

column1: With a clear SDG plan, the World Bank would find partners to help it fulfill its core, historic, and vital mission.
column2: 凭借明确的可持续发展目标计划，世行将找到合作伙伴，协助其完成历史性且至关重要的核心任务。

column1: The ABCs of Doing Business
column2: 关于《营商环境》的基本点

column1: NEW YORK – The World Bank’s annual Doing Business (DB) report is probably its most-cited publication.
column2: 纽约—世界银行年度《营商环境 》 （ Doing Business）报告也许是被援引最多的出版物。

column1: It is also the Bank’s most contentious, and with the release of Doing Business 2018 last October, the controversy surrounding the report has reached new heights, with some critics accusing it of obfuscation, data rigging, and political manipulation.
column2: 它也是世界银行最有争议的报告，去年10月《2018年营商环境报告 》 （ Doing Business 2018）发布后，围绕该报告的争议达到了新高度，一些批评指责报告含义模糊，玩弄数据，还受到政治操纵。

column1: I was closely involved with the DB report from 2012 to 2016, so I had to restrain myself from jumping into the debate on the topic.
column2: 我深度参与了2012—2016年间的营商报告，因此一直没有加入争论。

column1: But now, a review of the DB index and annual report seems worthwhile.
column2: 但如今，对营商报告指数和年报做一番评论似乎是有意义的。

column1: I first became familiar with the DB report when I was an adviser to the Indian government and would look to it for ideas about how to cut India’s notoriously cumbersome bureaucratic red tape.
column2: 我熟悉营商报告是在印度政府顾问任上，我从中寻找关于如何削减印度臭名昭著的繁文缛节和官样文章的思维。

column1: So, when I moved to the World Bank and learned that I would be overseeing the DB team, it was like a regular restaurant patron suddenly being asked to supervise the kitchen.
column2: 因此，当我来到世界银行任职，并获知将领导营商报告团队时，我就像是一位突然被任命负责厨房的饭店常客。

column1: The upshot was that I learned all that went on behind the scenes.
column2: 结果是我了解到关于营商报告背后的一切。

column1: And although I had some conceptual disagreements, I was impressed by the integrity of the process.
column2: 而尽管我有一些概念上的不同见解，仍对整个过程的完整性印象深刻。

column1: The DB index aims to measure, across countries, the ease of starting a business, obtaining the relevant permits, accessing essential infrastructure, and so forth.
column2: 营商指数的目标是衡量各国创办企业、获得相关许可、获得必要基础设施等方面的容易程度。

column1: It comprises ten indicators, each of which is based on various sub-indicators, and all of which are aggregated, according to a fixed rule, into a final score that determines a country’s ranking among 190 economies.
column2: 它包括十个指标，每一个都基于众多次级指标。 所有次级指标根据固定规则加总后得出一个分数，决定了一国在190个国家中的排位。

column1: According to the 2018 report, New Zealand and Singapore are the world’s best and second-best places to do business, and Eritrea and Somalia are the worst, at 189 and 190, respectively.
column2: 根据2018年报告，新西兰和新加坡是全球排名第一和第二的营商目的地，厄立特里亚和索马里情况最遭，分列第189和190位。

column1: Although there were aspects of the DB rankings that I did not like, I do not find the recent charges of data rigging to be credible.
column2: 尽管我不太喜欢营商环境排名中的某些指标，但我也不认为最近关于玩弄数据的指控可信。

column1: Having personally supervised much of the process, which involves a very large team compiling economic data from around the world, I can vouch for the multiple layers of checks and balances that are in place.
column2: 从我个人经验出发，我负责过整个过程的大部分，其中包括一支庞大的团队负责搜集全球经济数据，我可以证明，我们有多层次的制衡机制。

column1: Nevertheless, there certainly are ways to influence the rankings without cooking up data.
column2: 尽管如此，肯定有办法再不操纵数据的情况下影响排名。

column1: With any big operation – whether it is the DB or an effort to measure GDP – one occasionally discovers conceptual flaws.
column2: 任何大操作 — — 不管是营商报告还是衡量GDP数字 — — 都会出现偶尔的概念性漏洞。

column1: For example, when I first took over the process, I disagreed with the prevailing assumption that a higher tax rate is necessarily worse for an economy.
column2: 比如，我第一次主管营商报告时就有过分歧：我不同意高税率一定不利于经济的假设。

column1: After all, the same logic dictates that the lower the tax rate, the better, which implies that a tax rate of zero is optimal.
column2: 毕竟，同样的逻辑意味着税率越低越好，进而零税率最好。

column1: But that is obviously absurd.
column2: 但这显然是荒谬的。

column1: Even if one ignores the moral dimensions, a very low tax rate leaves a country more exposed to the threat of severe fiscal crises, which are a nightmare for business.
column2: 即使忽略道德因素，极低的利率也让一国更加容易面临严重财政危机，而财政危机对企业来说是一场噩梦。

column1: Steps were taken to make some minimal corrections that would not be too disruptive.
column2: 我们采取了一些措施，做了一些影响不会太大的小修正。

column1: Still, recognizing such problems poses a dilemma.
column2: 尽管如此，认识到这些问题仍然带来了一个困境。

column1: It is never ideal to have to change a yardstick that has been used to track changes over time; but nor is it right to rely on an assumption that one knows to be flawed.
column2: 不得不改变用于追踪随时间发生的变化的基准绝非理想情况；但依靠已知有缺陷的假设也不正确。

column1: At the end of the day, it’s a judgment call.
column2: 最终需要进行一些调整。

column1: For my part, I mitigated against possible biases by not even looking at the final result until I had first decided, using abstract reasoning, which changes were essential.
column2: 对我来说，我减少可能的偏见的办法是着眼于最终结果，直至我通过抽象推理做出关于必须做出哪些改变的初步决定。

column1: In this year’s DB, the two big controversies concern India’s rise and Chile’s fall.
column2: 在今年的营商报告中，两项较大争议是印度排名上升和智利排名下降。

column1: Between 2016 and 2017, India moved from 130th to 100th place.
column2: 2016—2017年间，印度从第130名上升至第100名。

column1: I no longer have inside information on the data, but I can see two reasons why this could occur.
column2: 我现在不清楚关于数据的内幕，但我认为有两个原因。

column1: First, if a country is determined to move up the ranking, it can do so by focusing on the ten indicators that determine the final score, though this is not a national economic strategy that I would recommend.
column2: 首先，如果一国决心要提高排名，可以专注于决定最终分数的十个指标，尽管我并不推荐将此作为国家经济战略。

column1: Second, any change in ranking can be driven either by what a country does relative to other countries, or by measurement changes that the DB may have instituted in a given year – changes like those mentioned above.
column2: 其次，排名的变化可以由一国相对另一国做了什么决定，也可以由营商报告在某个年度所进行的衡量指标变化决定 — — 比如上文所提及的变化。

column1: For example, when India moved from 142nd to 130th place between 2014 and 2015, the DB team and I computed that only four of the 12 positions that India had climbed reflected changes India had made, with the remainder attributable to changes in the DB methodology.
column2: 比如，2014—2015年间印度从第142名上升到第130名，期间营商报告团队和我测算，在这12个位次的攀升中，只有四个是因为印度所做出的改变，其他都可以归因为营商数据指标方法的改变。

column1: As for Chile, which slipped from 48th to 57th place between 2015 and 2016, and is now ranked 55th, it is worth noting that there is a lot of cheek-by-jowl competition at the higher end of the ranking.
column2: 智利则在2015—2016年间从第48名下滑到第57名，目前排在第55名。 其中值得关注的是，较高排名区间竞争非常激烈。

column1: Small changes by countries that neighbor one another in the index can result in a sharp reordering.
column2: 在排名中彼此接近的国家指标的微小变化就有可能产生剧烈的升降。

column1: But it is also true that Chilean President Michelle Bachelet’s government has placed greater emphasis on social indicators than on economic indicators.
column2: 但智利总统巴切莱特政府更加强调社会指标而非经济指标也是事实。

column1: To my mind, that is a cause for praise, not criticism.
column2: 在我看来，这值得赞扬而不是批评。

column1: Having worked with Bachelet on the World Bank’s 2018 World Development Report on education, I know that she is that rare politician who is genuinely committed to improving social welfare.
column2: 我和巴切莱特一起参与了世界银行2018年《世界发展报告 》 （ World Development Report）教育篇，深知她是那种罕见的真正致力于改善社会福利的政治家。

column1: Many countries and political leaders make the mistake of equating the DB ranking with overall welfare.
column2: 许多国家和政治领导人都犯了一个错误：将营商环境排名等同于总体福利。

column1: But the DB merely measures what it says it measures: the ease of doing business.
column2: 但营商环境只衡量它明言试图衡量的东西：营商的容易程度。

column1: That is certainly important for an economy, but it isn’t everything.
column2: 这对于经济来说当然很重要，但并非全部。

column1: In fact, one of the first lessons of economics is that all good things in life involve tradeoffs.
column2: 事实上，经济学的第一课就教育我们，生活中的一切好东西都包含了权衡。

column1: It would be a pity to see more countries focusing only on “doing business” to the exclusion of other indicators of wellbeing.
column2: 更多国家只关注“营商 ” ， 而不顾其他福利指标，这是令人遗憾的现象。

column1: The Risk of a New Economic Non-Order
column2: 新经济无序的风险

column1: LONDON – Next month, when finance ministers and central bank governors from more than 180 countries gather in Washington, DC, for the annual meetings of the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank, they will confront a global economic order under increasing strain.
column2: 伦敦—下个月，180多个国家的财政部长和央行官员将齐聚华盛顿，参加国际货币基金组织（IMF）和世界银行峰会。 他们面临着一个日益吃紧的全球经济秩序。

column1: Having failed to deliver the inclusive economic prosperity of which it is capable, that order is subject to growing doubts – and mounting challenges.
column2: 这一秩序没能带来它有能力实现的包容经济繁荣，正在受到越来越多的质疑和挑战。

column1: Barring a course correction, the risks that today’s order will yield to a world economic non-order will only intensify.
column2: 如果不予以纠正的话，现有秩序导致世界经济失序的风险还会继续增加。

column1: The current international economic order, spearheaded by the United States and its allies in the wake of World War II, is underpinned by multilateral institutions, including the IMF and the World Bank.
column2: 当前的国际经济秩序由美国及其盟友在二战后引领，其基础是包括IMF和世界银行在内的多边机构。

column1: These institutions were designed to crystallize member countries’ obligations, and they embodied a set of best economic-policy practices that evolved into what became known as the “Washington Consensus.”
column2: 这些机构设立的初衷是为了明确成员国的义务，它们也包含了一系列最佳经济政策实践，即日后著名的“华盛顿共识 ” 。

column1: That consensus was rooted in an economic paradigm that aimed to promote win-win interactions among countries, emphasizing trade liberalization, relatively unrestricted cross-border capital flows, free-market pricing, and domestic deregulation.
column2: 这一共识植根于一个旨在促进各国间双赢互动的经济范式，它强调贸易自由化、相对不受限制的跨境资本流、自由市场定价以及国内去监管化。

column1: All of this stood in stark contrast to what developed behind the Iron Curtain and in China over the first half of the postwar period.
column2: 所有这些都与铁幕之后的国家和中国在战后时期上半段的做法截然不同。

column1: For several decades, the Western-led international order functioned well, helping to deliver prosperity and relative financial stability.
column2: 几十年来，西方领导的国际秩序运转良好，帮助实现了繁荣和相对金融稳定。

column1: Then it was shaken by a series of financial shocks that culminated in the 2008 global financial crisis, which triggered cascading economic failures that pushed the world to the edge of a devastating multi-year depression.
column2: 接着，它遭遇了一系列金融冲击，2008年全球金融危机为其高潮，它触发了一连串经济失灵，让世界几乎跌入灾难性的多年萧条。

column1: It was the most severe economic breakdown since the Great Depression of the 1930s.
column2: 这是自20世纪30年代大萧条以来最严重的经济倒退。

column1: But the crisis did not appear out of nowhere to challenge a healthy economic order.
column2: 但这场危机并不是无中生有冒出来挑战健康的经济秩序的。

column1: On the contrary, the evolution of the global order had long been outpaced by structural economic changes on the ground, with multilateral governance institutions taking too long to recognize fully the significance of financial-sector developments and their impact on the real economy, or to make adequate room for emerging economies.
column2: 相反，全球秩序的演化一直落后于结构性经济变化，多边治理机构充分认识金融业的发展及其对实体经济的影响消耗了太长时间，为新兴经济体创造足够空间的动作也过于缓慢。

column1: For example, governance structures, including voting power, correspond better to the economic realities of yesterday than to those of today and tomorrow.
column2: 比如，包括投票权在内的治理结构更适合过去的经济现实，但已与今天和未来的经济现实不甚相容。

column1: And nationality, rather than merit, still is the dominant guide for the appointment of these institutions’ leaders, with top positions still reserved for European and US citizens.
column2: 国籍，而不是资质，仍然是任命这些机构领导者的主要原则，最高职位被欧洲和美国公民垄断。

column1: The destabilizing consequences of this obstinate failure to reform sufficiently multilateral governance have been compounded by China’s own struggle to reconcile its domestic priorities with its global economic responsibilities as the world’s second-largest economy.
column2: 顽固地不肯充改革多边治理所造成的动摇性后果，因为中国难以调和其国内重点和身为世界第二大经济体的全球经济责任而加剧。

column1: Several other countries, particularly among the advanced economies, have also failed to transform their domestic policies to account for changes to economic relationships resulting from globalization, liberalization, and deregulation.
column2: 其他一些国家，特别是经济发达国家，也没能转变国内政策以顾及全球化、自由化和去监管化所导致的经济关系变化。

column1: As a result of all of this, the balance of winners and losers has become increasingly extreme and more difficult to manage, not just economically, but also politically and socially.
column2: 拜所有这些因素所赐，赢家和输家的平衡变得更加极端和难以管理，不仅经济上是如此，政治和社会上也是如此。

column1: With too many people feeling marginalized, forgotten, and dispossessed – and angry at the leaders and institutions that have allowed this to happen – domestic policy pressure has intensified, causing countries to turn inward.
column2: 太多的人感到被边缘化，被遗忘，被剥夺 — — 对放任这些情况发生的领导人和机构充满了愤怒 — — 国内政策压力也随之日益加剧，导致各国不得不向内转。

column1: This tendency is reflected in recent challenges to several features of the economic order, such as the North American Free-Trade Agreement, as well as America’s withdrawal from the Trans-Pacific Partnership and the United Kingdom’s renunciation of European Union membership.
column2: 这一趋势体现为最近经济秩序的某些标志（如北美自由贸易协定）受到挑战，以及美国从跨太平洋合作伙伴关系中退出、英国放弃欧盟成员国资格等。

column1: All are casting a shadow on the future of the global economic system.
column2: 所有这些都给全球经济体系的未来蒙上了一层阴影。

column1: America’s inward turn, already underway for several years, has been particularly consequential, because it leaves the world order without a main conductor.
column2: 美国的向内转已经进行了多年，其影响尤其重大，因为这导致世界秩序失去了舵手。

column1: With no other country or group of countries anywhere close to being in a position to carry the baton, the emergence of what the political scientist Ian Bremmer has called a “G-Zero era” becomes a lot more probable.
column2: 其他国家或国家集团都无法接过美国的接力棒，政治学家伊恩·布雷默（Ian Bremmer）所谓的“G-0时代”的出现已是板上钉钉。

column1: China is responding to the global system’s weakening core by accelerating its efforts to build small networks, including around the traditional Western-dominated power structures.
column2: 面对全球体系核心的衰落，中国的应对之道是加快构建小网络的步伐，包括在传统的西方主导的权力结构之外另起炉灶。

column1: This has included the establishment of the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank, the proliferation of bilateral payments agreements, and the pursuit of the “Belt and Road Initiative” to build infrastructure linking China with western Asia, Europe, and Africa.
column2: 其中包括建立亚洲基础设施投资银行、各种双边支付协定的涌现，以及推出“一带一路计划”建设连接中国和西亚、欧洲和非洲的基础设施。

column1: These dynamics are stoking trade tensions and raising the risk of economic fragmentation.
column2: 这些动态助长着贸易紧张，也提高了经济分裂的风险。

column1: If this trend continues, the global economic and financial configuration will become increasingly unstable, amplifying geopolitical and security threats at a time when better cross-border coordination is vital to address threats from non-state actors and disruptive regimes, such as North Korea.
column2: 如果这一趋势继续下去，全球经济和金融格局将越来越不稳定，加剧地缘和安全威胁，而与此同时，加强跨境合作才是解决来自非国家行动方和破坏性政权（如朝鲜）的威胁的关键。

column1: Over time, the risks associated with this shift toward a global economic non-order could have severe adverse effects on geopolitics and national security.
column2: 假以时日，伴随向全球经济无序的转变所产生的风险可能给地缘政治和国家安全造成严重的消极影响。

column1: None of this is new.
column2: 所有这些都不是新鲜事。

column1: Yet, year after year, top government officials at the IMF/World Bank annual meetings fail to address it.
column2: 但是，年复一年，参加IMF/世界银行年会的政府高官们都无法解决它们。

column1: This year is likely to be no different.
column2: 今年预计也不会有什么不同。

column1: Instead of discussing concrete steps to slow and reverse the march toward a global economic non-order, officials will probably welcome the cyclical uptick in global growth and urge member countries to do more to remove structural impediments to faster, more durable, and more inclusive growth.
column2: 官员们不会讨论延缓和扭转通往全球经济无序的进程，更有可能因为全球增长的周期性好转而欢欣鼓舞，敦促成员国加大力度克服结构性障碍，构建更快、更持久、更包容的增长。

column1: While understandable, that isn’t good enough.
column2: 这一点可以理解，但不够好。

column1: The upcoming meetings offer a critical opportunity to start a serious discussion of how to arrest the lose-lose dynamics that have been gaining traction in the global economy.
column2: 即将到来的会议是一次关键的机会，开启关于如何扭转在全球经济中势头渐猛的双输动态的严肃讨论。

column1: The longer it takes for the seeds of reform to be sown, the less likely they will be to take root – and the higher the probability that a lose-lose world economic non-order will emerge.
column2: 改革种子撒播的越晚，它们深根发芽的可能性就越小，而出现双输的世界经济经济无序局面的概率就越大。

column1: Poverty Beyond the Numbers
column2: 数字之外的贫困

column1: ASUNCIÓN – What is poverty?
column2: 亚松森—什么是贫困？

column1: For decades, we have defined it with a number, which the World Bank currently puts at a personal income of less than $1.90 per day.
column2: 几十年来，我们用数字来给它定义，世界银行目前的标准是个人收入低于每天1.90美元。

column1: But a single number fails to capture the complexity of poverty.
column2: 但一个数字是无法捕捉到贫困的复杂性的。

column1: Measuring more than just income is essential to understanding the needs of poor people and delivering optimal assistance.
column2: 用收入以外的指标进行衡量对于理解穷人的需要和给予最优援助至关重要。

column1: As the World Bank convenes its Spring Meetings in Washington, DC next week, we have an opportunity to set benchmarks that include social and environmental dimensions of poverty.
column2: 下周，世界银行将在华盛顿召开春季会议，我们有机会设定包含贫困的社会和环境因素在内的基准。

column1: The Bank has acknowledged that more than income should be considered, and recently established a Commission on Global Poverty to recommend additional metrics.
column2: 世界银行承认应该考虑收入之外的指标，并在最近成立了全球贫困委员会推荐增加的指标。

column1: Although many public and private groups already collect data on a range of issues affecting poor communities such as nutrition, maternal health, or access to education, such information remains largely untapped and is rarely shared across institutions.
column2: 尽管众多公共和私人团体已经开始收集影响贫困社区的一系列问题的数据，如营养、母婴健康、教育普及度等，但这些信息仍然没有得到充分利用，并很少在机构间共享。

column1: But there are some beacons of light, including the Social Progress Index, which provides a framework for tracking multiple symptoms of poverty across countries and complements traditional income-based measures.
column2: 但也有一些希望之光，如社会进步指数提供了一个追踪不同国家多种贫困指标的框架，可以补充传统的基于收入的指标。

column1: When we rely on a single number to measure poverty, we misdiagnose the needs of poor people.
column2: 当我们依靠一个数字来衡量贫困时，我们误判了穷人的需要。

column1: In my home country, Paraguay, I work with one of the country’s largest social enterprises, Fundación Paraguaya, to provide microfinance, education, and training to thousands of our poorest citizens.
column2: 在我的祖国巴拉圭，我与我国最大的社会机构之一巴拉圭基金会（Fundación Paraguaya）合作为成千上万最贫穷巴拉圭公民提供微金融、教育和培训。

column1: We look at 50 metrics across six dimensions of poverty, including income, housing, education, and infrastructure.
column2: 我们着眼于六个贫困维度的50个指标，包括收入、住房、教育和基础设施。

column1: One of our clients, Doña Mercedes, is now a successful micro-entrepreneur from a rural community not far from the capital city of Asunción.
column2: 我们的客户之一唐娜·梅赛德斯（Doña Mercedes）现在是一位成功的微企业家，她出身于距离首都亚松桑不远的农村社区。

column1: When she first started with Fundación Paraguaya, she was sharing a single-bedroom home with 16 other family members and cooking meals on a small fire pit on the dirt floor.
column2: 当她从巴拉圭基金会起步时，她与16位其他家庭成员共享一个单间，在泥土地板上支起一个小火炉做饭。

column1: Now she has a cement floor, a brick house, a separate kitchen, and around $500 in personal savings.
column2: 现在她有了水泥地板、砖瓦房和独立厨房，还有500美元个人储蓄。

column1: By using Fundación Paraguaya’s self-evaluation on poverty, she was able to understand her own needs better and address them one at time.
column2: 通过使用巴拉圭基金会的贫困自我评估，她得以逐一认识和解决自身需要。

column1: While traditional approaches focus largely on estimating the sources of household expenses and income, the Fundación Paraguaya self-evaluation helped Doña Mercedes break down her needs into 50 discrete areas that she could work on, piece by piece, and monitor over time.
column2: 传统方法主要专注于估计家庭支出和收入源，而巴拉圭基金会的自我评估帮助唐娜·梅赛德斯将她的需要分解为50个具体的部分，让她可以逐步逐个努力解决���并随时监控效果。

column1: For example, she self-evaluated the state of her bathroom and kitchen, the quality of the food eaten at home, the family’s dental health, the number of separate bedrooms in the house, and even her self-esteem and decision-making capacity.
column2: 比如，她自我评估了卫生间和厨房状态、在家吃的食物的质量、家庭的牙齿健康、房子中独立卧室的数量，甚至她的自尊心和决策能力。

column1: A simple poverty map helps her track her progress by using the colors of the stoplight, red, yellow, and green, and highlight her priority areas.
column2: 一张简单的贫困地图通过信号灯的颜色 — — 红、黄、绿以及将重点区域高亮显示帮助她追踪自己的进步。

column1: Next she plans to add two more bedrooms to her house and to work on enlarging her business.
column2: 接着，她计划为房子增加两个卧室并致力于拓展生意。

column1: Fundación Paraguaya has been able to replicate this type of success in other parts of the world.
column2: 巴拉圭基金会能够在世界其他地区复制这一类型的成功。

column1: In Tanzania, where I worked for three years in rural communities, we helped villages in the Southern Highlands adapt our poverty indicators to the local context in order to tackle water, sanitation, and electrification needs.
column2: 我在坦桑尼亚农村社区工作了三年，帮助南方高地（Southern Highlands）的村庄根据本地环境采取我们的贫困指标解决水、卫生和电气化需求。

column1: Similar efforts are being deployed in South Africa, Nigeria, Uganda, China, and beyond.
column2: 南非、尼日利亚、乌干达、中国和其他国家也进行了类似的努力。

column1: We could make even more progress with public-sector support.
column2: 如果有公共部门的支持，我们可以取得更大的进步。

column1: Fundación Paraguaya collects rich data across multiple dimensions, tracking more than 8,700 families each year in Paraguay alone.
column2: 巴拉圭基金会收集了各个维度的丰富数据，光是在巴拉圭每年就要追踪8,700多户家庭。

column1: If this information were to reach the government of Paraguay – which has its own methods for collecting data – we could identify pockets of poverty sooner and customize programs to help each family.
column2: 如果这一信息可以为巴拉圭政府所用 — — 它有其自身的收集数据方法 — — 我们可以更快确定贫困区域，为每户家庭制定个性化的帮助计划。

column1: Because the information is self-reported, this sort of collaboration could deliver targeted aid and highlight specific public services that are needed.
column2: 由于信息为自我报告，这类合作能够实现定向援助，突显出所需要的具体的公共服务。

column1: Moreover, if the World Bank’s Commission on Global Poverty adopts multidimensional poverty measures, it will spur other organizations to produce and share more detailed poverty data.
column2: 此外，如果世界银行全球贫困委员会采取多维度贫困衡量指标，将刺激其他组织收集和共享更加详细的贫困数据。

column1: That will give aid workers a more comprehensive poverty map of the world, helping to boost the effectiveness of anti-poverty efforts everywhere.
column2: 这将让援助工作者获得更加全面的世界贫困地图，有助于提高世界各地扶贫措施的效果。

column1: It won’t be easy to choose which measures to include, or even how to set universal yardsticks; but even adopting a few basic ones would spur progress.
column2: 要决定选择纳入那些指标绝非易事，甚至决定如何制定通用标准也不容易；但即使是采用一些最基本的指标也能刺激进步。

column1: For too long, one-dimensional measures such as the $1.90 per day guideline have misdiagnosed poor people’s problems – and more importantly, their causes.
column2: 长期以来，每天1.90美元这样的一维指标误导我们对穷人的问题 — — 以及更重要的，问题的根源的认识。

column1: We know that the $1.90 per day benchmark does not fully capture the struggles of poor people in places such as Paraguay.
column2: 我们知道，每天1.90美元的基准不能充分抓住巴拉圭等地区穷人的潦倒状况。

column1: Fortunately, the World Bank now appears to recognize the limits of its income-based indicator.
column2: 幸运的是，如今世界银行似乎认识到其基于收入的指标的局限性。

column1: Ensuring that the right type of aid reaches those most in need in a timely and effective manner requires development policymakers to embrace the type of multidimensional poverty data that aid organizations like Fundación Paraguaya have learned to gather.
column2: 确保正确的援助类型及时高效地到达最需要的人需要发展政策制定者采用巴拉圭基金会等组织已经学会收集的多维贫困数据类型。

column1: The High Cost of “De-Risking” Infrastructure Finance
column2: 基础设施融资“去风险化”的高昂成本

column1: OTTAWA – The World Bank and other multilateral institutions are increasingly promoting measures to “de-risk” infrastructure investments in developing countries, in order to make such projects more attractive for international finance.
column2: 渥太华—世界银行和其他多边机构日益推动发展中国家采取措施实现基础设施投资的“去风险化 ” ， 这是为了增加这些项目对国际融资的吸引力。

column1: But “de-risking” is a misnomer: any project can be set back by external events, poor design, or mismanagement.
column2: 但“去风险化”的用词不当：任何项目都可能因为外部事件、设计不佳或管理不善而受挫。

column1: At least some level of risk – whether stemming from human error and institutional weakness, or from earthquakes, hurricanes, and countless other sources – is inherent in all infrastructure investments.
column2: 至少一定水平的风险 — — 不管是来自人为失误或制度弱点，还是来自地震、飓风和其他各种原因 — — 是所有基础设施投资所固有的。

column1: So the question is not how to eliminate risk, but rather how to allocate it between participating parties. When the World Bank and others talk about de-risking infrastructure finance, they really mean reducing the risk for investors – and increasing the risk for governments.
column2: 因此，问题不在于如何消除风险，而在于如何在参与方中间分配风险。

column1: The proposed risk-allocation provisions for public-private partnerships contained in the World Bank’s Guidance on PPP Contractual Provisions, 2017 Edition take this approach to a new extreme.
column2: 世界银行的《PPP合同条款指南2017版 》 （ Guidance on PPP Contractual Provisions, 2017 Edition）包含了公私合作（PPP）的风险分配条款建议，其建议将这一方针用到了新的极致。

column1: In almost any contingency – from “force majeure” to performance failures on the part of the private party – the public party is directed to assume all or a significant part of the risk.
column2: 在几乎所有或有情况中 — — 从“不可抗力”到私营方业绩失败 — — 公营方都被引导假定要承担全部或大部分风险。

column1: Moreover, the Bank’s metric for determining the effectiveness of this unyielding approach is “successfully procured PPP transactions.”
column2: 此外，世行确定这一一刀切方针的效果的指标是“成功采购的PPP交易 。 ”

column1: Missing is any measure of whether a project is actually providing the intended goods or services to citizens, and any mechanism for recourse if it is not.
column2: 完全没有任何指标去衡量一个项目是否向公民实际提供了意向商品或服务，如果答案是否定的，也没有任何机制追偿。

column1: This extreme approach to risk allocation could have far-reaching consequences.
column2: 这一风险分配的极端方针可能产生重大后果。

column1: A major reason why governments use PPPs in infrastructure is so that they can list such projects as “off-book.”
column2: 政府在基础设施中使用PPP的一个主要原因是这样一来它们可以将这些项目列为“表外 ” 。

column1: That means the financing of the project is neither counted as a direct government capital expense nor applied against government debt ceilings.
column2: 这意味着项目融资不会算入直接政府资本支出，也无需受到政府债务上限约束。

column1: And because a project’s costs are supposed to be paid out over time through direct user fees or operational funds furnished by the government, the capital expenditure is regarded as “free money” that governments need not account for.
column2: 而由于一个项目的成本应该通过直接用户费用或政府提供的运营资金逐渐支付，其资本支出被认为是“自有资金 ” ， 政府不必担责。

column1: But financial institutions such as the International Monetary Fund are now pushing back against this notion of “free money,” by pointing out that the higher the risk for a government, the less a project can be defined as “off-book.”
column2: 但国际货币基金组织（IMF）等金融机构现在正在反驳这一“自有资金”的概念，指出政府的风险越高，项目就越不能被定义为的“表外 ” 。

column1: Accordingly, the World Bank’s lopsided risk-allocation provisions should actually make it more likely that PPP projects will have to be categorized as on-book financing and debt.
column2: 据此，世界银行的有失偏颇的风险分配条款实际上应该让PPP项目更多地必须归类为表内融资和债务。

column1: That would be a good thing in itself.
column2: 这件事本身是一件好事。

column1: By listing all infrastructure projects as on-book, governments will be in a better position to test whether they are delivering real value for money.
column2: 将所有基础设施项目列为表内将是政府能够更好地考察它们是否实现了资金的真正价值。

column1: The problem is that these discussions are all happening behind the scenes.
column2: 问题在于这些套路都是在幕后进行的。

column1: In the meantime, the World Bank has continued to promote PPPs as the only acceptable form of infrastructure financing for developing countries in cases where a private party can do the job.
column2: 与此同时，世界银行继续推销PPP为发展中国家唯一可接受的私营方可以做出贡献的基础设施投资形式。

column1: And governments have continued to accumulate ever more risk, on the assumption that it is off-book and thus not counted as a sovereign-debt obligation.
column2: 而政府则不断地积累更多风险，它们的假设是这是表外项目，因此不计入主权债务。

column1: As a result, many developing countries are now heading for a doomsday scenario.
column2: 结果，许多发展中国家现在走向了末日情景。

column1: The risks that governments have taken on will last 20-30 years in many cases.
column2: 在很多例子中，政府所承担的风险会持续二三十年。

column1: During that time, governments will face severe challenges in managing public expenditures, and they will incur unforeseen costs related to off-book commitments and excessive debt, raising the possibility of a default on all credit commitments.
column2: 在此期间，政府将面临严重的挑战，包括管理公共支出等，还会导致与表外承诺和过度负债有关的预料之外的成本，提高所有信用承诺的违约概率。

column1: Making matters worse, the World Bank’s current approach creates moral hazard: the less risk the private party in a PPP assumes, the less it has to lose from poor performance.
column2: 更糟糕的是，世界银行的当前方针造成了道德风险：私营方在PPP中承担的风险越低，其因表现不佳而遭致的损失就越小。

column1: The Bank’s guidance provisions stipulate that even a private-sector partner that has failed to deliver must be compensated in order for a government to terminate the contract.
column2: 世界银行的指南条款规定，即使是没有达到效果的公私合作项目，私营方也必须得到补偿，这样政府才能终止合同。

column1: As a result, some private-sector contractors may not assume that they have to perform well; instead, they may constantly weigh the costs and benefits of doing mediocre or poor-quality work.
column2: 结果，一些私营承包商将认为自己无需拿出优异的表现；相反，它们可能会一直评估表现平庸甚至低劣的成本与收益。

column1: The current approach is also an open invitation for private parties to squeeze governments even further, by renegotiating active contracts.
column2: 当前的方针也是在公开邀请私营方通过重新谈判合同而进一步挤出政府。

column1: Faced with absorbing the full costs of a failed project or paying more to ensure that it succeeds, a government has little choice but to accede to a private-sector partner’s demands.
column2: 因为必须吸收项目失败的全部成本，或支付更多以保证项目成功，政府将别无选择，只能向私营方的要求妥协。

column1: This is not a far-fetched risk.
column2: 这绝非牵强附会的风险。

column1: The World Bank and others have understood for years that private companies frequently initiate contract renegotiations in PPP infrastructure projects.
column2: 世界银行和其他机构多年来早已明白，PPP基础设施中的私营公司频繁发起合同重新谈判。

column1: And this is even more likely to happen when contracts are awarded in a context of imperfect competition, which creates opportunities for private companies to set unrealistic contract terms.
column2: 而如果合同在不完全竞争的环境下授予 — — 从而私营公司有机会设定不现实的合同条款 — — 这样的可能性还会更大。

column1: No doubt, the World Bank has good intentions.
column2: 毫无疑问，世界银行的初衷是好的。

column1: But pushing all of the risk onto governments is not the way to attract investment in developing countries.
column2: 但将所有的风险都分配给政府绝非为发展中国家吸引投资指导。

column1: The Bank urgently needs to reverse course.
column2: 世界银行急需改变策略。

column1: That means promoting balanced risk allocations and ensuring that all infrastructure projects are assessed as if they were on-book.
column2: 这意味着推动平衡的风险分配，确保所有基础设施项目都作为表内项目进行评估。

column1: Guidance that is blind to its own consequences is not helpful.
column2: 无视其自身后果的指南无济于事。

column1: And when it is offered to developing countries that already have unsustainable sovereign debts, it is downright dangerous.
column2: 而把这些指南提供给主权债务已然不可持续的发展中国家显然是极其危险的。

column1: Can the World Bank Redeem Itself?
column2: 世界银行能实现自我救赎吗？

column1: CAMBRIDGE – In recent years, as the World Bank’s financing role has been eclipsed by the rise of private capital and a surge in money from China, its leaders have been desperately seeking a new mission.
column2: 发自剑桥 — — 随着这几年私人资本崛起以及来自中国的资金激增，世界银行的融资角色已经黯然失色，其领导人一直在想方设法寻求新的使命。

column1: And interminable reorganizations, politicized appointments, and the changing priorities of successive presidents have contributed to the perception that the institution is less than functional.
column2: 然而无休止的重组，政治化的人事任命以及历任总裁不断更改的优先事项都使人们认为该机构已经不具备实用性。

column1: But can that change?
column2: 那么这一切能有所改变吗？

column1: The World Bank has tried to reinvent itself as a supplier of global public goods and a “knowledge bank” that provides data, analysis, and research to its developing-country clients.
column2: 世界银行一直试图将自身重塑为一个全球公共产品供应商以及为其发展中国家客户提供数据，分析和研究的“知识库 ” 。

column1: And few would deny the Bank’s achievements when it comes to gathering indicators of economic activity, measuring poverty, identifying deficiencies in the provision of health and education, and, in earlier years, designing and evaluating development projects.
column2: 同时该机构在收集经济活动指标，衡量贫困程度，揭示健康和教育供应短缺状况，以及在早些年设计和评估发展项目方面所取得的成就也是举世公认的。

column1: But many, such as the Nobel laureate economist Angus Deaton, have criticized the World Bank’s overall performance.
column2: 但也有许多人，比如诺贝尔经济学奖获得者安格斯·迪顿（Angus Deaton ） ， 对世界银行的整体表现提出了批评。

column1: One problem is that development outcomes also depend on poor countries’ external economic environment, which is shaped by the policies of the major economies.
column2: 一个问题在于发展成果还取决于贫穷国家的外部经济环境，而后者又是由主要经济体的政策所决定的。

column1: And when it comes to promoting sound policies, the World Bank has fallen far short in recent decades, exemplified by three major intellectual sins of omission.
column2: 同时在近几十年间世界银行在推动合理健全的政策方面已经远远落后，特别是出现了三起在智识上的重大疏忽事件。

column1: The first relates to the World Bank’s role in the Latin American debt crisis of the early 1980s.
column2: 第一件涉及到世界银行在1980年代初期拉美债务危机中所扮演的角色。

column1: As its official history shows, the Bank restricted research on the implications of excessive borrowing during the crisis.
column2: 正如其官方历史记录所示，世行限制了针对危机期间过度借贷影响的研究。

column1: Moreover, it did little to make the case for debt write-downs, despite the reckless increase in lending by big banks.
column2: 此外尽管各个大型银行都在不顾一切地增加贷款，但它在要求债务减记方面却鲜有作为。

column1: Instead, through its structural-adjustment lending, the World Bank, along with the International Monetary Fund, effectively became a debt collector for creditors.
column2: 相反，通过其结构调整型贷款，世界银行和国际货币基金组织实际上成为了债权人的债务催收员。

column1: The result was a lost decade for Latin America, but not for the bankers.
column2: 结果是拉丁美洲失去了十年，而银行家们却全身而退。

column1: The resulting moral hazard would encourage another bout of exuberant lending, which led to further financial crises in developing countries in the subsequent decade.
column2: 由此产生的道德风险又激励了另一轮大干快上的贷款，进一步推动了发展中国家在随后十年中多次爆发金融危机。

column1: The World Bank was also silent when its developing-country clients’ access to life-saving medications was being restricted.
column2: 当其发展中国家客户在救命药物方面受到限制时，世界银行也保持了沉默。

column1: In the late 1980s, the leading industrialized countries – the United States, Europe, and Japan – began to push for stronger patent regimes that would boost their own pharmaceutical companies’ profits.
column2: 在1980年代末各主要工业化国家 — — 美国，欧洲和日本 — — 开始推动更强势的专利制度以提高本国制药公司的利润。

column1: In 1995, developing countries were forced to sign the onerous Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights agreement at the World Trade Organization.
column2: 1995年，发展中国家被迫在世界贸易组织框架内签署了繁重苛刻的《与贸易有关的知识产权协定 》 。

column1: Moreover, under Section 301 of the US Trade Act of 1974, sanctions were imposed on several developing countries, from Chile to India, accused of failing to strengthen patent protections sufficiently.
column2: 此外还根据1974年《美国贸易法案》第301条对从智利到印度的多个被指控未能充分加强专利保护的发展中国家实施制裁。

column1: Even when the AIDS crisis was ravaging Sub-Saharan Africa in the early 2000s, global patent rules were not just maintained, but actually tightened further, until pressure from civil society finally forced the expansion of access to affordable treatment.
column2: 即便是艾滋病危机在21世纪初肆虐撒哈拉以南非洲地区之时，全球专利规则也不仅得到了维持，甚至实际上进一步收紧，直到民间社会的压力最终迫使获取可负担治疗的渠道得以扩大才告一段落。

column1: The World Bank, however, said little.
column2: 然而世界银行对此却惜字如金。

column1: This brings us to the World Bank’s third failure, the consequences of which are unfolding today.
column2: 这就把我们引向了世界银行的第三项失误 — — 而其后果眼下正在徐徐展现。

column1: During much of the 1980s and 1990s, the Bank oversaw structural adjustment programs in developing countries that focused on deregulation, privatization, and economic liberalization, especially trade opening, all of which helped to enable globalization.
column2: 在1980年代和1990年代的大部分时间里，世界银行监督发展中国家实施的结构调整方案重点都在于放松管制，私有化和经济自由化，尤其是贸易开放，所有这一切都有助于全球化的实现。

column1: While there were undoubtedly problems with many aspects of such a one-size-fit-all package of policies – the Washington Consensus, as it was known – the trade liberalization component helped accelerate lower-middle-income and middle-income countries’ economic convergence with developed countries.
column2: 虽然这种一刀切式的一揽子政策 — — 就是众所周知的华盛顿共识 — — 无疑在许多方面都存在着问题，但其与贸易自由化相关的要件有助于加速缩小中低收入国家和中等收入国家与发达国家之间的经济差距。

column1: But, today, the United States is rejecting trade openness, imposing unilateral tariffs and other barriers, and renegotiating trade deals on worse terms.
column2: 但如今美国开始抵制贸易开放并强行施加单边关税及其他障碍，并祭出更糟糕的条件来重新谈判贸易协议。

column1: And the World Bank’s silence is deafening.
column2: 而世界银行对此简直陷入了死一般的沉默。

column1: Its senior leadership has said nothing about the serious threat posed by the actions of the US or of other major players.
column2: 其高级领导层对美国或其他主要参与者的行径所构成的严重威胁三缄其口。

column1: While the Bank’s annual report, released in September, talks of a commitment to “researching today’s most pressing topics,” trade is not among them.
column2: 虽然该行于9月发布的年度报告谈到了“研究当前最紧迫话题”的承诺，但贸易竟不在其中。

column1: This is not just some oversight; during all of these episodes, the Bank knew that its responsibility was to act as an advocate for its poor clients. Instead, it decided – every time – to kowtow to its most powerful shareholders and their vested interests (such as Big Pharma and the financial industry), arguably in exchange for additional resources for its soft-loan window (the International Development Association) and, less frequently, capital increases for the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) and International Finance Corporation.
column2: 这可不仅仅是疏忽；在所有这些事件中，世行知道自己责任是要为那些贫穷国家客户争取权益，但它却决定 — — 而且是无一例外地 — — 向那些最有权势的股东及其既得利益者（如大型制药公司和金融业）俯首称臣，据说是为其软贷款窗口（国际发展协会）换取额外资源以及（不那么频繁地）为国际复兴开发银行和国际金融公司增加资本。

column1: For example, this April – after the US had launched its trade war with tariffs on steel and aluminum – the Development Committee of the World Bank Board of Governors endorsed a package that included a $7.5 billion paid-in capital increase for the IBRD.
column2: 例如，今年4月 — — 在美国利用钢铁和铝关税发起贸易战后 — — 世界银行理事会发展委员会批准了一揽子计划，其中包括为国际复兴开发银行增加75亿美元的实收资本。

column1: This required the support of President Donald Trump’s administration, leading to silence from the Bank until June, when it finally warned of the negative impact of trade protectionism on global growth.
column2: 为了换取特朗普总统政府的支持世界银行一直对贸易战保持沉默，直到6月才终于对贸易保护主义对全球增长的负面影响发出警告。

column1: One might wonder whether such a Faustian bargain could be worthwhile if it means that the World Bank has more resources to promote development in poor countries.
column2: 人们可能会思考如果这意味着世界银行能有更多资源来促进贫穷国家的发展，那么这种类似浮士德与魔鬼交易的做法是否也值得一试。

column1: But while money certainly matters, the evidence suggests that development outcomes are determined more by factors like state capacity and national policies, and crucially, a supportive global environment.
column2: 资金固然重要，但有证据表明，发展的成果其实更多地取决于国家能力和国家政策等因素，更重要的是要有一个起到支持作用的全球环境。

column1: Rising trade protectionism, tighter immigration policies, and a lack of action on climate change by the world’s biggest economic players – particularly the US – thus pose serious threats to development, which a little extra money for the World Bank cannot offset.
column2: 全球最大的经济参与者 — — 特别是美国 — — 不断上升的贸易保护主义，更严格的移民政策以及对气候变化的无动于衷已经对发展构成了严重威胁，这是世界银行所获得的额外资金所无法抵消的。

column1: The ends do not justify the means: money may not matter that much, while ideas matter immensely in the broader fight against poverty (as this year’s Nobel Economics laureate, Paul Romer, has shown).
column2: 其实结果无法证明手段的正当性：资金可能并不是那么重要，而理念则会在更广泛的反贫困斗争中起到极为关键的作用 — — 正如今年的诺贝尔经济学奖获得者保罗·罗默（Paul Romer）所表明的那样。

column1: The World Bank cannot erase its troubling history of silence.
column2: 世界银行无法抹去其令人不安的沉默历史。

column1: But it may be able to redeem itself.
column2: 但它或许能够实现自我救赎。

column1: Its new chief economist is an expert on trade. The Bank’s leadership should empower her to lead the charge in making the intellectual case for open markets for goods, services, and people.
column2: 其新任首席经济学家是贸易专家，而世界银行的领导层应该授权她去为商品，服务和人员的开放市场做出明智的指引。

column1: The World Bank is well aware that its mission – “to reduce poverty, and improve living standards by promoting sustainable growth and investment in people” – cannot be achieved without an open global system.
column2: 世界银行清楚地意识到，如果没有开放的全球体系，它的使命 — — “通过促进可持续增长以及对人的投资来减少贫困，提高生活水平 ” — —是不可能实现的。

column1: If it chooses not to uphold a core tenet of its mission, and instead continues to try ingratiating itself with its largest shareholders, it will not only fail its clients throughout the developing world; it will also lose whatever is left of its raison d’être.
column2: 如果它选择不去坚持其使命的核心原则，而是继续尝试讨好其最大的股东，那么它不仅会辜负那些发展中国家客户；也将失去其存在的理由。

column1: The Sky Is Not Falling
column2: 天并没有塌下来

column1: VIENNA – Humans are partial to bad news.
column2: 维也纳 — — 人类更愿意相信坏消息。

column1: Media outlets reflect and shape this preference, feeding us woe and panic.
column2: 媒体渠道反映并迎合这种偏好，为我们带来悲伤和恐惧。

column1: Long, slow, positive trends don’t make it to the front page or to water-cooler conversations.
column2: 缓慢而积极的长期趋势不会出现在头版头条，也不会成为人们茶余饭后的谈资。

column1: So we develop peculiar misperceptions, especially the idea that a preponderance of things are going wrong.
column2: 因此我们发展出特殊的误解，尤其认为绝大多数领域都在出现问题。

column1: When I published The Skeptical Environmentalist in 2001, I pointed out that the world was getting better in many respects.
column2: 2001年我出版充满怀疑的环保主义者时，就曾指出世界在许多方面都取得了进步。

column1: Back then, this was viewed as heresy, as it punctured several common and cherished misperceptions, such as the idea that natural resources were running out, that an ever-growing population was leaving less to eat, and that air and water were becoming ever-more polluted.
column2: 我的观点在当时就被视为异端邪说，因为它戳穿了几项被人们普遍接受的错误认知，如认为自然资源正在枯竭、不断增长的人口正在导致粮食短缺，而空气和水污染所造成严重问题正变得越来越严重。

column1: In each case, careful examination of the data established that the gloomy scenarios prevailing at the time were exaggerated.
column2: 在所有情况下，认真审视数据都会发现夸大了当时流行一时的悲观情绪。

column1: While fish stocks, for example, are depleted because of a lack of regulation, we can actually eat more fish than ever, thanks to the advent of aquaculture.
column2: 例如，尽管缺乏监管正导致鱼类资源陷入枯竭，但多亏水产养殖业的发展，实际我们却可以吃到比以往更多的鱼。

column1: Worries that we are losing forests overlook the reality that as countries become richer, they increase their forest cover.
column2: 担心森林正在消失的忧虑忽视了这样一个现实，那就是越来越富裕的国家增加了森林覆盖率。

column1: Since I wrote the book, the world has only become better, according to many important indicators.
column2: 写完这本书后，据许多重要指标显示，世界已经取得了持续的进步。

column1: We have continued to see meaningful reductions in infant mortality and malnutrition, and there have been massive strides toward eradication of polio, measles, malaria, and illiteracy.
column2: 我们继续目睹婴儿死亡率和营养不良率大幅降低，而且巨大的进展发生在消灭小儿麻痹、麻疹、疟疾和文盲等领域。

column1: By focusing on the most lethal environmental problem – air pollution – we can see some of the reasons for improvement.
column2: 通过重点研究最致命的环境问题 — — 空气污染 — — 我们可以找到一些进步的原因和理由。

column1: As the world developed, deaths from air pollution have declined dramatically, and that trend is likely to continue.
column2: 随着世界的发展，空气污染造成的死亡急剧下降，而这种趋势很有可能会延续下去。

column1: Looking at a polluted city in a country like China might suggest otherwise, but the air inside the homes of most poor people is about ten times more polluted than the worst outdoor air in Beijing.
column2: 单看中国等国家的受污染城市可能得出不同的结论，但多数贫困民众的室内污染比北京最严重的室外空气污染要差十倍。

column1: The most serious environmental problem for humans is indoor air pollution from cooking and heating with dirty fuels like wood and dung – which is the result of poverty.
column2: 对人类而言，最严重的环境问题是利用木材和牛粪等肮脏燃料烹饪和取暖所造成的室内空气污染 — — 而这种污染来源于贫困。

column1: In 1900, more than 90% of all air pollution deaths resulted from indoor air pollution.
column2: 1900年，空气污染死亡率的90%以上来自室内空气污染。

column1: Economic development has meant more outdoor pollution, but also much less indoor pollution.
column2: 经济发展恶化了室外空气污染，但同时也导致室内污染大幅降低。

column1: Reductions in poverty have gone hand in hand with a four-fold reduction in global air pollution mortality.
column2: 经济发展在减贫的同时导致全球空气污染死亡率降低了4倍。

column1: Yet more people today still die from indoor air pollution than from outdoor pollution.
column2: 而今天室内空气污染仍然比室外污染致死的人更多。

column1: Even in China, while outside air has become a lot more polluted, poverty reduction has caused a lower risk of total air pollution death.
column2: 即使中国的室外空气污染进一步加重，但减贫仍然导致空气污染死亡的总体风险降低。

column1: And as countries become richer, they can afford to regulate and cut even outdoor air pollution.
column2: 而随着国家变得越来越富，甚至就连室外空气污染他们都有能力监管和控制。

column1: Two hundred years ago, almost every person on the planet lived in poverty, and a tiny elite in luxury.
column2: 200年前，地球上几乎所有人口都陷于贫困，只有一小撮精英才能享受奢侈。

column1: Today just 9.1% of the population, or almost 700 million people, lives on less than $1.90 per day (or what used to be one dollar in 1985).
column2: 而今天，仅总人口的9.1 % ， 也就是差不多7亿，每天仅靠不足1.9美元生活（1985年这一数字曾仅有一美元左右 ） 。

column1: And just in the last 20 years, the proportion of people living in extreme poverty has almost halved.
column2: 而在过去20年中生活在极端贫困中的人口比例几乎减少近半。

column1: Yet few of us know this.
column2: 但鲜有人知道这样的事实。

column1: The Gapminder foundation surveyed the UK and found that just 10% of people believe poverty has decreased.
column2: Gapminder基金会对英国进行了调查，发现认为贫困减少的人仅占10 % 。

column1: In South Africa and in Sweden, more people believe extreme poverty has doubled than believe – correctly – that it has plummeted.
column2: 在南非和瑞典，更多人相信极端贫困翻了一番，而并不相信极端贫困已经大幅减少的事实。

column1: How do we continue our swift progress?
column2: 我们怎样才能快速发展下去？

column1: There has been no shortage of well-intentioned policy interventions, so we have decades of data showing what works well and what doesn’t.
column2: 人类从不缺少善意的政策干预，因此我们有几十年的资料显示哪些措施行之有效，哪些则不是。

column1: In the latter category, even well-considered ideas from the world’s most eminent thinkers can fall short.
column2: 在后一种类别中，即使世界最杰出思想家深思熟虑的想法也有可能出错。

column1: The ambitious Millennium Villages concept was supposed to create simultaneous progress on multiple fronts, producing “major results in three or fewer years,” according to founder Jeffrey D. Sachs.
column2: 按照创始人杰弗里·萨克斯的说法，雄心勃勃的千禧村概念本应在多方面同时取得进展 ， “ 用三年或者更少的时间创造出重大的成果 ” 。

column1: But a study by the United Kingdom’s Department for International Development shows the villages had “moderately positive impacts,” and “little overall impact on poverty.”
column2: 但英国国际发展部的一项研究表明千禧村仅产生了“微弱的积极效应 ” ， 而对“消除贫困的整体影响不大 ” 。

column1: It’s more constructive to focus on what works.
column2: 更具建设性的方法是关注有效的举措。

column1: Global analysis of development targets for Copenhagen Consensus by a panel of Nobel laureate economists showed where more money can achieve the most.
column2: 由诺贝尔经济学奖获得者组成的专家小组对哥本哈根共识发展目标的全球分析表明在哪些领域投资可以取得最大的成果。

column1: They concluded that improved access to contraception and family-planning services would reduce maternal and child mortality, and also – through a demographic dividend – increase economic growth.
column2: 他们的结论是加强避孕和计划生育服务能降低孕产妇和儿童的死亡率，并同时 — — 通过人口红利 — — 推动经济增长。

column1: Likewise, research assessing the best development policies for Haiti found that focusing on improvements in nutrition through the use of fortified flour would transform the health of young children, creating lifelong benefits.
column2: 同样，评估海地最佳发展政策的研究发现通过使用强化面粉重点改善营养能够彻底改变幼儿的健康状况，并终身为其带来好处。

column1: Other Copenhagen Consensus research suggests that scaling up government e-procurement platforms would be transformative.
column2: 其他哥本哈根共识研究表明扩大政府采购平台将带来革命性效果。

column1: This may sound tangential to poverty reduction, but it’s not.
column2: 这听上去似乎与减贫无关，但实际情况却不是这样。

column1: On average, developing countries use half their budgets on procurement; enabling transparent competition could reduce losses caused by corruption.
column2: 平均而言，发展中国家将预算的一半用于采购，创造透明的竞争环境可以减少腐败造成的损失。

column1: This is not mere speculation.
column2: 这绝不仅仅是无端的猜测。

column1: A case study in Bangladesh, which spends more than $9 billion on public procurement annually, found that piloting e-procurement in just one government department lowered prices by 12%, leaving more resources for other important budget priorities.
column2: 针对孟加拉国每年在公共采购上花费超过90亿美元的一项案例研究显示，仅在一个政府部门试行电子采购就降低了12%的价格，从而可以将节省下来的更多资源用于其他重要的预算事项。

column1: The research shows that expanding digital procurement government-wide would save $670 million annually – enough to increase annual public-health spending by about 50%.
column2: 研究表明在整个政府范围内实现数字采购每年可以节约6.7亿美元 — — 足以增加50%的年度公共卫生支出。

column1: The Bangladeshi government is now fast-tracking this expansion.
column2: 孟加拉国政府现在正在抓紧推广电子采购工作。

column1: And the most powerful weapon in the fight against poverty is the one that got us where we are today: broad-based economic growth.
column2: 与贫困作斗争最有力的武器让我们取得了今天经济普遍增长的伟大成就。

column1: Over the past 30 years, China’s growth spurt alone lifted an unprecedented 680 million people above the poverty line.
column2: 过去30年，仅中国的经济发展井喷就实现了前所未有的6.8亿人脱贫致富。

column1: A global trade agreement – such as a successful conclusion to the stalled Doha Round – would lift another 160 million people out of poverty.
column2: 达成全球贸易协议 — — 如圆满结束停滞不前的多哈回合谈判 — — 将使另外1.6亿人脱贫致富。

column1: Skepticism toward free trade hurts the world’s poorest.
column2: 怀疑自由贸易会损害世界最贫困的民众。

column1: While other US policies and tweets by President Donald Trump get far more coverage, the current administration’s rejection of free trade could be the biggest tragedy.
column2: 尽管唐纳德·特朗普总统其他的美国政策和推文吸引了更多的媒体关注，但现政府拒绝自由贸易可能拉开了最大悲剧的序幕。

column1: Humanity’s success in reducing poverty is an extraordinary achievement, and one that we are far too reticent about acknowledging.
column2: 人类减贫成功是一项了不起的成就，我们对这方面的认识还远远不足。

column1: We need to make sure that we don’t lose sight of what got us this far – and what justifies the hope of an even better future.
column2: 我们必须确保了解上述成就的来源 — — 以及什么才能使我们的未来更加充满希望。

column1: The World Economy in 2018
column2: 2018年的世界经济

column1: STANFORD – All major macroeconomic indicators – growth, unemployment, and inflation – suggest that 2017 will be the American economy’s best year in a decade.
column2: 发自斯坦福 — — 所有主要的宏观经济指标 — — 增长，失业率和通胀率 — — 都表明2017年将是美国经济十年来最好的一年。

column1: And the global economy is enjoying broad, synchronized growth beyond what anyone expected.
column2: 全球经济也正享受着超出所有人预期的，广泛而同步的增长。

column1: The question now is whether this strong performance will continue in 2018.
column2: 而如今的问题这在于：这个强劲表现能否在2018年延续下去。

column1: The answer, of course, will depend on monetary, fiscal, trade, and related policies in the United States and around the world.
column2: 答案无疑将取决于美国和全球各国的货币，财政，贸易等相关政策。

column1: And yet it is hard to predict what policy proposals will emerge in 2018.
column2: 但2018年会出现哪些政策议案是很难预测的。

column1: There are relatively new heads of state in the US, France, and the United Kingdom; German leaders still have not formed a governing coalition since the general election in September; and the US Federal Reserve has a new chair awaiting confirmation.
column2: 美法英三国都有了新的国家元首，德国领导人在9月份大选后尚未组成执政联盟；美联储的新主席人选还有待确认。

column1: Moreover, major changes in important developing economies such as Argentina, Saudi Arabia, and Brazil have made the future outlook even murkier.
column2: 同时阿根廷，沙特，巴西等重要发展中经济体国内局势的重大变化也使得前景更加阴暗难猜。

column1: Still, we should hope for the best.
column2: 不过我们依然会满怀希望。

column1: First and foremost, we should hope that synchronized global growth at a rate of just under 4% will continue in 2018, as the International Monetary Fund projected in October.
column2: 首先，如国际货币基金组织10月预测的那样，我们可以指望略低于4％的全球经济同步增长率能在2018年得以延续。

column1: Growth not only raises incomes, but also makes vexing problems such as bad bank loans and budget deficits more manageable.
column2: 经济增长不仅提高了收入，还能使银行不良贷款，预算赤字等问题更加容易应对。

column1: As former US President John F. Kennedy famously said in an October 1963 speech in which he promoted his proposed corporate and personal tax reductions, “a rising tide lifts all boats.”
column2: 正如美国前总统约翰·F·肯尼迪（John F. Kennedy）在1963年10月一次提议降低企业和个人税率的演讲中所说的那样 ： “ 潮水一涨，万帆皆高 ” 。

column1: For my part, I predict that the global recovery will continue, but at a slightly slower growth rate of around 3.5%.
column2: 在我看来，全球经济复苏将持续，但增速略低，大概在3.5％左右。

column1: The two most obvious risks to keep an eye on will be Europe, where a cyclical upturn could stall, and the oil-rich Middle East, where tensions could flare up once again.
column2: 最需要注意的两个最明显风险一个是周期性好转局面可能出现停滞的欧洲，以及紧张局势可能再次爆发中东产油区。

column1: Second, let us hope that the Fed, guided by the steady hand of its new chair, Jerome “Jay” Powell, will continue or even accelerate its monetary-policy normalization, both by raising its benchmark federal funds rate, and by shrinking its engorged balance sheet.
column2: 其次，让我们希望美联储能在其新主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）的稳定执掌下继续或甚至加快其货币政策正常化进程，一方面提高基准联邦基金利率，另一方面收缩其过度膨胀的资产负债表。

column1: And we should hope that economic conditions allow the other major central banks, especially the European Central Bank, to follow suit.
column2: 我们也希望经济条件能允许其他主要央行（尤其是欧洲央行）效仿这些举动。

column1: On this front, I predict that the major central banks will continue to normalize monetary policies more gradually than is necessary.
column2: 在这方面，我预计各主要央行将会继续逐步实现货币政策正常化。

column1: The biggest risk here is that markets may try to test the Fed under its new leadership, for example, if inflation rises faster than anticipated.
column2: 这里最大的风险在于市场可能试图考验一下新领导人治下的美联储，比如如果通胀上涨速度可能超出预期。

column1: Third, let us hope that the Republican tax package will, if enacted, deliver on its promise of increased investment, output, productivity, and wages over the coming decade.
column2: 第三，我们希望共和党的一揽子税收方案能够在未来十年内兑现其提升投资，产出，生产力和工资的承诺。

column1: Here, I predict that the legislation will pass, and that investment in the US over the next few years will be relatively higher than if no action had been taken.
column2: 在此我预测立法会通过，而未来几年的对美投资会比不做出任何行动要高。

column1: To be sure, whether investment will rise from its currently subdued level will depend on many other factors than the corporate-tax rate.
column2: 可以肯定的是，投资能否摆脱当前的低迷水平还得取决于企业税率以外的其他因素。

column1: But the tax package can still be expected to boost output, productivity, and wages.
column2: 但税收方案仍然可以提高产出，生产率和工资。

column1: The question is not if, but when.
column2: 问题不在于能否，而是何时。

column1: If the full effects of the legislation are not felt before the 2018 or 2020 elections, that lag could prove politically consequential.
column2: 如果立法效应无法在2018年或2020年选举之前全部释放，那么这种滞后可能会产生一定的政治后果。

column1: The biggest danger is that its benefits will be delayed, and that its key provisions will be reversed whenever the Democrats are back in power.
column2: 最大的危险在于它的正面效应将会被延后，而其主要条款将会被重夺政权的民主党人所逆转。

column1: Fourth, let us hope that governments everywhere begin to address the looming crisis in public-pension and health-care costs, which have been rising for decades.
column2: 第四，让我们希望各地的政府都开始着手解决一项迫在眉睫的危机：几十年来一直在上升的公共养老金和医疗保健成本。

column1: As social programs become costlier, they crowd out government expenditures on necessities such as defense, while generating ever more pressure to impose higher growth-suppressing taxes.
column2: 随着社会项目的成本日益上涨，国防等必需品的政府支出遭到了挤占，也令到压抑增长的加税压力不断增大。

column1: Europe, in particular, must not let its cyclical rebound lull it into complacency.
column2: 欧洲尤其避免在周期性反弹下保持清醒。

column1: Many European Union member states still need to reduce their government debt, and the eurozone needs to resolve its “zombie bank” crisis.
column2: 许多欧盟成员国仍需缩减政府债务，欧元区则得着手解决“僵尸银行”危机。

column1: Beyond that, structural labor-market reforms of the kind French President Emmanuel Macron is pursuing would be most welcome.
column2: 除此之外，法国总统马克龙所追求的结构性劳动力市场改革也是最为急需的。

column1: Unfortunately, I’m afraid that progress on structural reforms will be sporadic, at best.
column2: 不幸的是我担心结构改革的进展恐怕会是断断续续的。

column1: The danger is that slow growth will not lead to sufficient wage gains and job creation to defuse the ticking time bomb of high youth unemployment in many countries.
column2: 危险在于缓慢增长无法带来足够的工资收入增长和就业增量以化解许多国家的高青年失业率定时炸弹。

column1: Another risk is that reform attempts could provoke a political backlash that would be harmful to long-term investment.
column2: 另一项风险在于改革尝试可能会引发一场不利于长期性投资的政治反弹。

column1: Fifth, let us hope that the eurozone can avoid a currency crisis.
column2: 第五，希望欧元区能避免货币危机。

column1: This will depend largely on whether German Chancellor Angela Merkel can form a coalition government and restore political stability to Europe’s largest economy.
column2: 这在很大程度上取决于德国总理默克尔能否组建联合政府，让德国这个欧洲最大经济体恢复政治稳定。

column1: Sixth, we should hope that the EU and the UK can agree on a reasonable Brexit deal that will preserve fairly strong trade relations.
column2: 第六，我们应寄望欧盟和英国能达成一个合理的脱欧协议以维护双方之间的密切贸易关系。

column1: The main risk here is that localized declines in trade could spill over and cause broader harm.
column2: 这里的主要风险是贸易的局部下降可能会蔓延开来并造成更广泛的伤害。

column1: And, beyond Europe, let us hope that negotiations between the US, Canada, and Mexico over the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) will result in an arrangement that still facilitates continental trade.
column2: 而在欧洲之外，我们希望美国，加拿大和墨西哥三国之间就《北美自由贸易协定》进行的谈判将产生一个仍然有利于北美大陆贸易的安排。

column1: For trade generally, the biggest risk is that the Trump administration could start a lose-lose trade dispute, owing to its understandable eagerness to help American manufacturing workers.
column2: 对于贸易来说，最大的风险在于特朗普政府会因为急于扶助美国制造业劳动者而发起一场双输的贸易争端。

column1: Seventh, let us hope that new policies targeting information and communication technology (ICT) strike the right balance among all stakeholders’ competing and legitimate concerns.
column2: 第七，让我们希望以信息和通信技术为目标的新政策能够在所有利益相关者的竞争和合理关切之间取得适当的平衡。

column1: On one hand, there is reason to worry about certain Internet companies’ concentration of market power, particularly in online content and distribution, and about the effects of new technologies on personal privacy, law enforcement, and national security.
column2: 一方面，有理由担心某些互联网公司在某些市场 — — 特别是在线内容和分发方面 — — 攫取过大权力，以及新技术对个人隐私，执法和国家安全的影响。

column1: On the other hand, new technological advances could deliver immense economic gains.
column2: 另一方面，新技术进步的巨大经济收益也不容忽视。

column1: It is easy to envision a scenario of too much regulation, or of too little.
column2: 监管过多或过少的状况可能出现。

column1: It is also easy to envision a large-scale public backlash against the major technology companies, particularly if poor self-policing or a refusal to cooperate with law enforcement leads to some horrible event.
column2: 特别是在因自我管理不善或拒绝配合执法而导致一些可怕事件后，公众针对大型科技公司实施大规模反弹也是有可能的。

column1: Here, I predict that achieving an appropriate policy balance will take years.
column2: 在此我预测达致适当的政策平衡将需要几年的时间。

column1: If some future event strikes an emotional chord, the public’s mood could swing dramatically.
column2: 如果未来的事件引发情绪上的共鸣，公众的情绪就会剧烈波动。
