column1: It is hard to argue that all developing countries should enjoy the indefinite privilege of opting out of the WTO’s general obligations for all sectors of their economies.
column2: 很难说所有发展中国家都应享有无限期特权来避免承担世贸组织对其经济中所有部门所下达的一般义务。

column1: And with so many of their WTO partners claiming preferential status, developed-country members often resist trade concessions within the organization, preferring to conduct negotiations in other forums.
column2: 而由于太多世贸组织合作伙伴都声称享有优惠地位，发达国家成员国往往会抵制组织框架内的贸易让步，而更愿意在其他平台上展开谈判。

column1: The dynamic in the WTO stands in stark contrast to that within the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank.
column2: 而世贸组织内部的动态则与国际货币基金组织和世界银行形成了鲜明对比。

column1: At the WTO, developed countries would like to see big emerging markets take on more obligations, while developing countries resist. At the Bretton Woods institutions, developed countries are blocking emerging economies from gaining greater influence.
column2: 在世贸组织中，发达国家希望看到各大新兴市场国家承担更多的义务，而发展中国家则抵制；在布雷顿森林体系机构内，发达国家却在遏制新兴经济体获得更大的影响力。

column1: But the two dynamics have something in common: intransigence, even if coming from different quarters, reflects a denial of reality.
column2: 但这两股动态存在一些共同点：即使来自不同阵营，却都反映了对现实的否定。

column1: In the Bretton Woods institutions, the emerging economies are right that their increased economic weight should correlate with larger capital contributions and more weight in decision-making.
column2: 在布雷顿森林体系机构中，新兴经济体不断增大的经济体量应当与更大的出资比重和决策权重相关联。

column1: In the WTO, S&D clearly needs to be updated to ensure that it benefits only countries that actually need it.
column2: 世贸组织的优待条款显然也需要更新，确保只有那些真正有需要的国家才能受益。

column1: Ministers at the conference in Buenos Aires should thus be prepared to have an honest discussion about S&D.
column2: 因此布宜诺斯艾利斯会议的部长们应该准备针对优待条款展开诚布公的讨论。

column1: A second topic that the WTO needs to address relates to consensus-building.
column2: 世贸组织需要处理的第二个议题涉及到共识的建立。

column1: Under current WTO rules, most decisions can be adopted by a majority vote.
column2: 根据当前的世贸组织规则，大多数决策都可以通过多数赞成票来达成。

column1: But the long-standing practice has been to adopt all decisions by consensus.
column2: 但长期以来的做法是以协商一致的方式来通过所有决策。

column1: This is wise and should not change.
column2: 这是明智且无须改变的。

column1: Though consensus-building can be slow and cumbersome, it is the only way to generate the legitimacy that WTO decisions need.
column2: 虽然建立共识可能冗长而繁琐，但这是世贸组织决策获取所需合法性的唯一途径。

column1: A simple majority vote, after all, would fail to account for differences in market size.
column2: 毕竟简单的多数投票将无法体现市场规模的差异。

column1: And weighted voting would undermine the WTO’s capacity to settle disputes by adjudicating rights and obligations among members of different size and political heft.
column2: 而加权投票则会破坏世贸组织通过对不同规模和政治影响力的成员之间的权利和义务进行裁定来解决争端的能力。

column1: The problem is that consensus is interpreted as an unlimited veto power, such that a member can block any discussion on matters of interest to others.
column2: 但问题在于共识被曲解成了无限制的否决权，这样一个成员就可以阻止别人去讨论一切事关他人利益的问题。

column1: A consensus-based approach can work only if it entails an obligation by all members to work toward shared interests, with members objecting formally only to decisions running counter to some fundamental interest.
column2: 如果某项共识能赋予所有成员国责任去追求共同利益，那么寻求公识的手段才能起作用，因为成员国只会对与某些根本利益相违背的决定提出正式反对。

column1: The Paris climate agreement was made possible by a simple method called “Indaba,” adopted from the Zulu and Xhosa people of South Africa. Negotiators had the right to withhold consent, but only if they put forth alternate proposals aimed at finding common ground.
column2: 巴黎气候协议就是借助南非祖鲁和科萨人称为“因达巴会议（Indaba ） ” 的简单方法达成的 — — 谈判者有权拒绝共识，但只能是在提出旨在寻求共同点的替代建议之后。

column1: If Indaba worked in Paris, it could also work at the WTO.
column2: 如果因达巴可以在巴黎奏效，那么当然也可以用在世贸组织上。

column1: In Buenos Aires, ministers should discuss how to ensure that WTO members responsibly exercise their right to block decisions.
column2: 在布宜诺斯艾利斯，部长们应讨论如何确保世贸组织成员负责地行使其否决权。

column1: The final issue that ministers should be prepared to discuss in Buenos Aires is the need to ensure that the WTO adapts effectively to a changing international environment.
column2: 部长们应该在布宜诺斯艾利斯讨论的最后一个问题是如何确保世贸组织能有效适应不断变化的国际环境。

column1: The problems with both S&D and consensus decision-making at the WTO are not new, but they have long been ignored, allowing them to deepen.
column2: 世贸组织的特殊和差别性待遇以及共识决策问题长期存在，却又一直被忽视以致不断恶化。

column1: This would not have happened if incremental reform was ingrained in the WTO’s regular activities.
column2: 如果渐进式改革能根植于世贸组织的日常活动中，这种情况就不会发生了。

column1: Both the IMF and the World Bank have policy watchdogs that regularly scrutinize and evaluate their functioning.
column2: 国际货币基金组织和世行都有设有政策监督机构来定期审查和评估自身的运作。

column1: Running on very small budgets, these ruthless truth-tellers regularly force their institutions’ leaders to have honest discussions about organizational effectiveness and possible reforms.
column2: 这些真相的无情揭露者不需多少运行经费，却能经常迫使本机构的领导层就组织效率和可能实施的改革开展诚恳的讨论。

column1: Such an independent office for evaluation is precisely what the WTO needs.
column2: 而这样一个独立评估办公室正是世贸组织所需要的。

column1: The WTO cannot sweep its problems under the carpet forever.
column2: 世贸组织不可能永远掩盖自己的问题。

column1: The question is whether it will undertake the reforms it needs now or wait until a costly crisis leaves it no choice.
column2: 问题在于它能否立刻进行所需的改革，还是等待一场巨大的危机将其逼到墙角。

column1: The WTO Reborn?
column2: 世贸组织重生？

column1: NEW DELHI – For too long, the World Trade Organization has languished, to lift a reference from T.S. Eliot, by the “waters of Leman” (Lake Geneva).
column2: 新德里—世界贸易组织已经黯然失色了太长时间，用艾略特的话说，是因为“莱曼之水 ” （ 日内瓦湖 ） 。

column1: Once the world’s preeminent multilateral trade forum, the WTO has been steadily marginalized in recent years, and recent rebukes of globalization, such as the United Kingdom’s Brexit vote and the election of Donald Trump as US president, suggest that this trend will accelerate.
column2: 作为昔日杰出的多边贸易论坛，世贸组织在最近几年逐渐被边缘化，而最近对全球化的反动 — — 如英国的退欧公投和特朗普当选美国总统 — — 表明这一趋势还将加速。

column1: But these outcomes may actually have the opposite effect, owing to three key developments that could enable the revival of the WTO – and of the multilateralism that it embodies.
column2: 但这些结果实际上可能起到相反的效果，因为三个重要发展态势可能让世贸组织 — — 以及它所代表的多边主义 — — 重塑昔日辉煌。

column1: The first development is the decline of alternative trade arrangements.
column2: 第一个发展态势是替代性贸易安排的式微。

column1: The WTO reached its peak in the early 2000s, a few years after the Uruguay Round of global trade negotiations concluded, and a time when more countries – most notably China – were acceding to the organization.
column2: 世贸组织在21世纪初达到顶峰，当是时，全球贸易谈判乌拉圭回合刚刚在几年前结束，更多的国家 — — 最引人注目的是中国 — — 答应加入该组织。

column1: But major trade players like the United States and the European Union subsequently shifted their focus from multilateral trade agreements to bilateral, regional, and mega-regional deals.
column2: 但美国和欧盟等主要贸易方随后将注意力从多边贸易协定转向了双边、地区和大地区协议。

column1: The mega-regionals – namely, the Trans-Pacific Partnership (TPP) and the Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership (TTIP) – posed a particularly grave threat to the WTO.
column2: 大地区协议 — — 即跨太平洋合作伙伴关系（TPP）和跨大西洋贸易和投资伙伴关系（TTIP ） — —给世贸组织造成了特别巨大的威胁。

column1: Yet those are precisely the deals that the Trump administration is rejecting, or at least postponing.
column2: 但特朗普政府正是要和这些协议说“不 ” ， 至少要将它们搁置起来。

column1: European integration had a similar impact on the WTO, as it provided an alternative platform for managing intra-European trade.
column2: 欧洲一体化也对世贸组织造成了类似的影响，因为它提供了一个新的管理欧洲内部贸易的平台。

column1: But the European project has fallen on hard times, the most salient sign being the UK’s impending departure from the EU.
column2: 但欧洲工程已经步履维艰，英国即将脱离欧盟就是明证。

column1: After Brexit, the WTO will probably become an important forum for Britain’s trade relations with the world.
column2: 英国退欧之后，世贸组织也许将成为英国与世界贸易关系的重要论坛。

column1: Any further disintegration of the EU will only bolster that trend.
column2: 欧盟的进一步解体都将强化这一趋势。

column1: Of course, it is possible that regional trade agreements in Asia and elsewhere will continue to flourish.
column2: 当然，有可能亚洲和其他地方的地区贸易协定仍将继续兴盛。

column1: But new leadership would have to emerge.
column2: 但必须出现新的领导者。

column1: And no single systemically important country today meets the rigorous requirements of such leadership: internal political stability, economic dynamism, relatively contained risk, and a steadfast commitment to open markets.
column2: 而如今没有一个具有系统重要性的国家可以单枪匹马满足这一领导力的严格要求：内政稳定、经济有活力，风险相对受控，坚定致力于开放市场。

column1: However counterintuitive that may sound, a second development that bodes well for the WTO’s revival is voters’ increasing rejection of hyper-globalization.
column2: 听起来似乎与直觉相反，第二个可以作为世贸组织复兴之福的发展态势是越来越多的选民开始拒绝超全球化（hyper-globalization ） 。

column1: Hyper-globalization is essentially “deep” integration.
column2: 超全球化从本质上即“深度”一体化。

column1: It goes beyond creating open markets for goods and services to include increased immigration (in the US and Europe), harmonizing regulations (the ambition of the TPP and the TTIP), and intrusive adjudication of domestic policies (the investor-settlement procedures under NAFTA and the TPP).
column2: 它不仅包括为商品和服务创造开放市场以容纳更多的移民（在美国和欧洲 ） 、 调和监管（TPP和TTIP的雄心）和对国内政策侵略式裁判（北美贸易自由协定和TPP规定的投资者和解程序 ） 。

column1: In the EU’s case, it even entails a common currency.
column2: 在欧盟的例子中，它甚至包括了共同货币。

column1: For such integration, regionalism is much more effective than the WTO.
column2: 对于这样的一体化，再地区化远比世贸组织更有效。

column1: Now that “deep” is out, the WTO could once again become an attractive forum for trading countries to do business.
column2: 如今 ， “ 深度”已是明日黄花，世贸组织有望重新成为有吸引力的论坛，为各贸易国提供生意机会。

column1: Make no mistake: there will still be a lot of globalization for the WTO to facilitate and manage, not least because of the inexorable march of technology.
column2: 不要搞错了：因为技术的无情的进步，世贸组织仍要为全球化提供大量便利和管理。

column1: The mesh-like structure of trade and investment connecting countries, embodied in global value-chains – what Aaditya Mattoo of the World Bank and I have called “criss-crossing globalization” – will prevent significant backsliding.
column2: 贸易和投资的网状结构将各国联系在一起，嵌入全球价值链 — — 世界银行的阿迪特亚·马图（Aaditya Mattoo）和我称之为“十字交叉全球化 ” — —这能够防止大溃败。

column1: The third development that could reinvigorate the WTO is a more protectionist stance by the Trump administration.
column2: 第三个有望重振世贸组织的发展态势是特朗普政府所采取了更加保护主义的立场。

column1: If the US raises tariffs or implements a border-adjustment tax favoring exports and penalizing imports, its trade partners are likely to turn to the WTO for adjudication, given the organization’s demonstrated dispute-settlement capability.
column2: 如果美国提高关税，或征收边境调节税以奖励出口、惩罚进口，其贸易伙伴可能转向世贸组织要求作出裁决，因为该组织拥有经过了证明的纠纷解决能力。

column1: The WTO could, therefore, become the place where US trade policies are scrutinized and kept in check.
column2: 因此，世贸组织有望成为美国贸易政策得到检查和制约的场合。

column1: The universality of WTO membership, previously seen as an impediment to countries eager to move ahead with new rules and agreements, could be its main strength, as it implies a high degree of legitimacy, which is essential to minimize trade tensions and the risk of conflict.
column2: 世贸组织成员的普遍性曾经被视为渴望采取新规则和协定的国家的一大障碍，现在可能成为其主要优势，因为这意味着很高的合法性，而这是贸易紧张和冲突风险最小化的关键。

column1: In my book Eclipse, I argued that multilateralism offered the best means for ensuring the peaceful rise of new powers.
column2: 在我的书《日蚀 》 （ Eclipse）中，我指出多边主义提供了确保新力量和平崛起的最佳方式。

column1: But it seems that the same argument could apply equally well to the management of receding powers.
column2: 但似乎同样的观点也适用于管理衰落力量。

column1: But the WTO’s revival will not happen automatically.
column2: 但世贸组织的复兴不会自动发生。

column1: Willing stakeholders must actively pursue it.
column2: 有意愿的相关利益方必须积极追求这一结果。

column1: The most obvious candidates for the job are the mid-size economies that have been the greatest beneficiary of globalization, and that, unlike the US and some European countries, are not currently under pressure from a globalization-averse public.
column2: 最显而易见的候选者是已是全球化最大受益者的中等规模经济体，以及 — — 不同于美国和一些欧洲国家 — — 目前未受到讨厌全球化的公众的压力的经济体。

column1: The champions of multilateralism should include Australia, Brazil, India, Indonesia, Mexico, New Zealand, South Africa, the United Kingdom, and possibly China and Japan.
column2: 多边主义的主力军应该包括澳大利亚、巴西、印度、印尼、墨西哥、新西兰、南非和英国，可能还有中国和日本。

column1: Because none of them is large (with the exception of China), they must work collectively to defend open markets.
column2: 由于它们都不是大经济体（中国除外 ） ， 因此它们必须团结起来捍卫开放市场。

column1: Moreover, they must open their own markets not only in the traditional areas of agriculture and manufacturing, but also in new areas such as services, investments, and standards.
column2: 此外，它们必须开放资深市场，不仅包括农业和制造业等传统领域，也包括服务业、投资和标准等新领域。

column1: In doing so, these countries would also be responding to the increasingly transactional approach to sustaining openness that the larger traders are being compelled to adopt.
column2: 如此，这些国家也可以对应日益交易性的、保持大贸易方被迫采取的开放的方法。

column1: The world needs a robust response to the decline of hyper-globalization.
column2: 世界需要强力面对超全球化的衰落。

column1: Multilateralism, championed by mid-size trading economies with a strong interest in preserving openness, may be it.
column2: 能从保护开放性中获得重大利益的中型贸易经济体所引领的多边主义或许是应对方法之一。

column1: To the shores of Leman they must now head.
column2: 它们必须抵达莱曼之水的彼岸。

column1: Putin on Parade
column2: 游行中的普京

column1: NEW YORK – This May’s parade in Moscow to commemorate the 70th anniversary of the end of World War II promises to be the greatest Victory Day celebration since the Soviet Union’s collapse.
column2: 纽约 — — 今年五月即将在莫斯科举行的二战结束70周年纪念游行有望成为苏联解体以来规模最大的胜利日庆祝活动。

column1: Some 16,000 soldiers, 200 armored vehicles, and 150 planes and helicopters are set to pass through and over Red Square.
column2: 大约16,000名士兵、200辆装甲车和150架飞机和直升机将穿越红场地面和上空。

column1: It will be a scene that would easily have been familiar to Soviet leaders like Leonid Brezhnev and Nikita Khrushchev, taking the salute atop Lenin’s tomb.
column2: 勃列日涅夫和赫鲁晓夫等苏联领导人曾非常熟悉向红场列宁墓致敬的场景。

column1: Yet, though Russia’s WWII allies were from Europe and North America, no Western leaders will attend the commemoration – a reflection of the West’s disapproval of Putin’s invasion of Ukraine and annexation of Crimea.
column2: 但虽然俄罗斯二战盟国均来自欧洲和北美，但西方领导人却不会出席纪念活动 — — 这是西方对普京入侵乌克兰及吞并克里米亚不满的反映。

column1: Instead, Russian President Vladimir Putin’s high-profile guests will include the leaders of China, India, and North Korea, underscoring just how few friends Russia has these days.
column2: 相反，俄总统弗拉基米尔·普京的高规格嘉宾包括中国、印度和朝鲜领导人，这凸显了当今俄国鲜有同盟的孤立环境。

column1: The surreal nature of this gathering reflects the increasingly bizarre nature of Putin’s regime.
column2: 此次超现实主义聚会是普京政权怪诞现实的反映。

column1: Indeed, watching Russia nowadays is like watching the last installment of the X-Men film franchise, “Days of Future Past.”
column2: 事实上，看现在的俄罗斯就像在看最后一集X战警《未来昔日 》 。

column1: Just as the X-Men in that film join forces with their younger selves to save mankind’s future, today’s Kremlin is harking back to Russia’s Soviet past in what it sees as a contemporary fight for the country’s survival.
column2: 正像影片中的X战警与年轻的自己联手拯救人类未来一样，今天的克里姆林宫正试图借助过去苏联的力量来打赢俄罗斯的现代生存战争。

column1: Critical to this strategy is propaganda conflating the West today with the Germans who invaded Russia in 1941, while painting Ukrainian government officials as “fascists” and “neo-Nazis.”
column2: 上述战略的关键是将今天的西方与1941年入侵俄国的德国混为一谈，同时把乌克兰政府官员描绘成“法西斯”和“新纳粹分子 ” 。

column1: The Kremlin has relied on such claims, together with the supposed need to defend Russians abroad, to justify its aggression against Ukraine.
column2: 克里姆林正是依靠这样的说法和保护海外俄国人的所谓必要性来为侵略乌克兰寻找借口。

column1: In Putin’s speech following the annexation of Crimea, he charged that the West’s refusal “to engage in dialogue” left Russia with no choice.
column2: 在吞并克里米亚后的讲话中，普京指责西方国家拒绝“参与对话”令俄罗斯别无选择。

column1: “We are constantly proposing cooperation on all key issues,” he declared.
column2: 普京称“我们不断在所有关键问题上寻求合作 ” 。

column1: “We want to strengthen our level of trust and for our relations to be equal, open, and fair.
column2: “我们希望强化信任，让关系平等、开放、公正。

column1: But we saw no reciprocal steps.”
column2: 但我们没有看到西方采取相应的步骤。

column1: A month later, Putin reinforced this image of Russians as the morally superior victims of a cruel and uncompromising West.
column2: 一个月后，普京再次强调俄罗斯是残酷且拒绝妥协的西方在道德上具有优越感的受害者。

column1: “We are less pragmatic than other people, less calculating,” he asserted, before adding that Russia’s “greatness” and “vast size” means “we have a more generous heart.”
column2: 普京称“我们不像其他人那么务实算计 ” ， 他还补充说俄罗斯的“伟大”和“广阔疆域”让我们“更加大度和宽容 ” 。

column1: It is not difficult to see the parallels between Putin’s approach and that of Joseph Stalin, who declared at the start of WWII that the “enemy” aims to “destroy” Russia’s “national culture,” to “Germanize” its people, and “convert them into slaves.”
column2: 不难看出普京和斯大林的做法有相似之处，后者曾在二战伊始宣布“敌人”想要“消灭”俄罗斯“民族文化 ” 、 将俄国人“德国化”并奴役俄国民众。

column1: The difference, of course, is that the Nazi Wehrmacht actually invaded the Soviet Union, whereas Ukraine simply wanted to decide its own future.
column2: 当然，不同之处是德国国防军的确入侵了苏联，而乌克兰不过想要主宰自己的命运。

column1: Without defending Stalin, one must recognize the immense Soviet contribution – including the lives of 26 million citizens – to the Allied victory in WWII.
column2: 即使一点不为斯大林辩护，人们也必须承认苏联对二战盟军胜利的巨大贡献 — — 包括2，600万民众为此献出生命。

column1: At the time, the military parade in Red Square – featuring almost 35,000 troops, up to 1,900 pieces of military equipment, and a 1,400-man orchestra – was a well-deserved pageant.
column2: 当时的红场阅兵 — — 约有步兵35，000人、军事装备1，900件、乐队1，400人 — — 可谓一场当之无愧的盛宴。

column1: The Soviet leadership spared no cost in staging its military displays, which, in the absence of an external military threat, became an important vehicle for rallying national unity.
column2: 苏联领导层不遗余力地展示军力，那次阅兵在没有外来军事威胁的情况下，成为凝聚民族团结的重要手段。

column1: After the Soviet Union’s collapse, Russia, no longer a superpower, put its military spectacles on ice.
column2: ��联解体后，俄罗斯不再是超级大国，也因此暂停举办阅兵式。

column1: But in 2005, to commemorate the 60th anniversary of the end of WWII, Putin held a major parade – one that Western leaders, believing that Russia might have a European future, did attend.
column2: 但2005年，为纪念二战结束60周年，普京举办了盛大阅兵式 — — 当时西方领导人相信俄罗斯未来可能加入欧洲，并因此出席了那次阅兵式。

column1: The tone of this year’s Victory Day commemorations is far less anticipatory.
column2: 今年胜利日纪念活动的气氛远不及预期。

column1: How can one celebrate the end of a war at a time when the descendants of those who fought it (undoubtedly driven by the hope that future generations would live in peace) are killing one another in a brutal little war in eastern Ukraine?
column2: 怎么能在战争英雄（推动他们打这场战争的是希望子孙后代能够和平生活）后代在东乌克兰残酷的局部战争中互相残杀的情况下庆祝战争的胜利？

column1: What is the point of grandiose fireworks displays amid the firing of real howitzers and rockets?
column2: 在榴弹炮和火箭纷飞之际宏伟的烟花表演能有什么意义？

column1: The historian Robert Paxton believed that one could tell much about a country by its parades.
column2: 历史学家罗伯特·帕克斯顿相信游行能在很大程度上反映国家的面貌。

column1: His 1966 book Parades and Politics at Vichy describes how Philippe Pétain, as Chief of State of Vichy France, used pageantry, reactionary politics, and, of course, a partnership with Adolf Hitler to dupe his defeated country into believing that it still mattered in the world.
column2: 他1996年的著作《维希的游行和政治》讲述了担任法国维希政府首脑的菲利普·贝当用华丽、反动的政治策略，当然还有与希特勒的联盟来欺骗战败的祖国，让其相信自己在世界事务中仍有一席之地。

column1: The Vichy state’s brand of authoritarian traditionalism lionized family and fatherland, with Pétain, a former military commander, serving as a kind of military king, exalted on the tribune.
column2: 作为维希政府标志的专制传统主义让家族和祖国流芳千古，而前军事指挥官贝当则扮演着某种军事王者的角色，并被抬上神圣的讲坛。

column1: The parallels with Putin’s Russia are clear.
column2: 维希政府与普京领导下俄罗斯的相似之处显而易见。

column1: Putin views himself as a new czar.
column2: 普京以新沙皇自居。

column1: His KGB background dictates his leadership style, which includes the abolition of free and fair elections, the persecution of opponents, and the promotion of conservative values that he, like Pétain before him, juxtaposes with the corrupting influence of an “immoral” and “decadent” West.
column2: 他的克格勃背景决定了他的领导风格，包括取消自由公正选举，迫害反对派以及宣传保守的价值观。 就像曾经的贝当一样 ， “ 非道德”和“颓废”的西方腐败深深影响着普京。

column1: Relying on this approach, Putin has built alliances with the likes of Syria’s President Bashar al-Assad and Egypt’s military ruler Abdel Fattah el-Sisi.
column2: 依靠这种方法，普京已与叙利亚总统巴沙尔·阿萨德和埃及军事统治者阿卜杜勒·法塔赫·塞西结成联盟。

column1: China, the world’s second largest economy, is a useful addition to this collection of friendly anti-democratic states, as it has its own strategic grievances with the West.
column2: 全世界第二大经济体中国因为有其自身对西方的战略不满，成为对友好反民主国家联盟的有益补充。

column1: Unlike China, however, Russia is not a rising superpower.
column2: 但不同于中国的是，俄罗斯并不是崛起中的超级大国。

column1: Putin may try to portray his actions in Ukraine as a fight against fascism.
column2: 普京可能想把乌克兰行动描绘成一场反法西斯斗争。

column1: But it is really a fight for relevance – a fight he will never win.
column2: 但它实际是争夺影响力的战斗 — — 在这场战斗中他根本不可能获胜。

column1: No matter how grand the parade, he cannot hide the truth: Russia’s days as a superpower are in the past.
column2: 无论阅兵式多么盛大都无法掩盖真相：俄罗斯作为超级大国的历史已经一去不复返。

column1: Putin’s patriotism, like Pétain’s, is that of the vanquished.
column2: 普京的爱国主义像贝当一样属于被征服者。

column1: Xi’s Strong Hand Against Trump
column2: 习近平对特朗普的强手

column1: LONDON – The world will soon witness a historic test of wills between China and the United States, two superpowers whose leaders see themselves as supreme.
column2: 伦敦—世界将目睹中国和美国之间的历史性考验，这两个超级大国的领导人都自视为超级领袖。

column1: In the immediate sense, it will be a battle over trade.
column2: 眼下，这场考验将是贸易战。

column1: But also at stake is the strategic leadership of East Asia and, eventually, the international order.
column2: 但同样有可能成为斗争对象的还有东亚以及最终的国际秩序的战略领导地位。

column1: As things stand, China holds a stronger position than many people realize.
column2: 目前，中国手牌之强超乎许多人的意料。

column1: The question is whether Chinese President Xi Jinping will feel confident or brazen enough to want to prove it.
column2: 问题在于中国国家主席习近平会充满自信还是会“任性”地想要证明这一点。

column1: The test of wills was hardly China’s choice; but nor does it come as a surprise.
column2: 意志的考验向来不是中国的选择；但这也不是什么令人意外的事。

column1: US President Donald Trump’s recently announced import tariffs on steel, aluminum, and other Chinese-made goods are in keeping with his brand of economic nationalism.
column2: 美国总统特朗普最近宣布对钢、铝和其他中国制造产品征收关税，这与他经济民族主义的名声倒是相符。

column1: And his decision to accept North Korea’s invitation to hold bilateral talks on its nuclear program reflects the same “bring it on” attitude that he applied to the North’s earlier threats of war.
column2: 他还决定接受朝鲜的邀请，就朝鲜核计划进行双边对话，这反映了与他此前应对朝鲜战争威胁时相同的“放马过来”态度。

column1: The upcoming test will be historic because it promises to reveal the true strengths and attitudes of the world’s rising power vis-à-vis the weakened but still leading incumbent power. For better or worse, the result could shape the world for decades to come.
column2: 即将到来的考验之所以是历史性的，是因为它有可能揭示世界崛起强国对已削弱但仍起着领导作用的现任强国的真正优势和态度。

column1: On the trade front, China’s large bilateral surplus with the US could mean that it has more to lose from a trade war, simply because it has more exports that can be penalized.
column2: 在贸易方面，中国对美国保持巨大的双边盈余，这意味着它在贸易战中可以输的东西更多，因为它有更多的出口可以被惩罚。

column1: It is often said that surplus countries will always be the biggest losers in any tit-for-tat escalation of tariffs and other barriers.
column2: 人们常说，盈余国永远是以牙还牙的关税和其他壁垒大爆发的最大输家。

column1: But this assumption misses multiple points.
column2: 但这一说法没有抓住很多要点。

column1: For one thing, China is more economically resilient to the effects of a trade war than it used to be.
column2: 一方面，相较从前，如今中国对贸易战行为的经济承受力更强了。

column1: Trade as a share of its total economic activity has halved in the past decade, from more than 60% of GDP in 2007 to just over 30% today.
column2: 贸易占总经济活动之比在过去十年中下降了一半，从2007年占GDP的60%以上下降到今天的略高于30 % 。

column1: China also has major advantages in terms of domestic politics and international diplomacy.
column2: 中国在国内政治和国际外交方面也拥有重大优势。

column1: As a dictatorship, China can ignore protests by workers and companies suffering from US tariffs.
column2: 作为独裁国家，中国可以无视因为美国的关税而受到影响的工人和公司的示威。

column1: In the US, where mid-term congressional elections will be held this November, the outcry from exporters, importers, and consumers facing higher costs will be heard loud and clear.
column2: 在美国，中期国会选举11月就要拉开帷幕，面临更高成本的出口商、进口商和消费者的呼声表达的非常清楚。

column1: Of course, Trump, too, might ignore protests against his trade war if he is convinced that taking on China will please his core voters and win him re-election in 2020.
column2: 当然，如果特朗普确信与中国较量能取悦他的核心选民，为他赢得2020年连任，那么他也有可能忽视反对他的贸易战政策的示威。

column1: But congressional Republicans will probably feel differently, especially if their states or districts are among those being singled out by Chinese import tariffs.
column2: 但国会共和党感觉将有所不同，特别是如果他们的州或选区成为中国进口关税征收对象的话。

column1: In terms of international diplomacy, Trump’s trade war will help China present itself as the defender of the rules-based international order and multilateral institutions such as the World Trade Organization.
column2: 用国际外交的话说，特朗普的贸易战有助于中国将自己包装为基于规则的国际秩序以及世贸组织等多边机构的捍卫者。

column1: To be sure, not all countries would follow China’s lead.
column2: 当然，并不是所有国家都会跟随中国的领导。

column1: The WTO does not recognize China as a market economy, owing to the Chinese government’s significant involvement in industry and alleged theft of intellectual property.
column2: 世贸组织不承认中国是市场经济，因为中国政府严重干涉产业，并被控窃取知识产权。

column1: But China will have a chance to play the victim, while arguing that the US now poses the single largest threat to the global trading system that it helped create.
column2: 但中国将有机会扮演受害者角色，指责美国成为它所帮助建立的全球贸易体系的最大威胁。

column1: And if a US-initiated trade war drags on, China’s case will become only stronger as more countries suffer the disruptive effects of tariffs.
column2: 而如果美国发动的贸易战延绵日久，中国的指控将随着越来越多的国家因为关税的破坏效应而变得更强。

column1: Of course, China may choose not to fight Trump’s trade war at all.
column2: 当然，中国可能选择根本不与特朗普打贸易战。

column1: With symbolic concessions – such as an agreement to import US-produced liquefied natural gas or promises to offer new guarantees for intellectual-property rights – it could convince Trump to stand down.
column2: 象征性的让步 — — 如同意进口美国产液化天然气或承诺新的知识产权权利保障 — — 就可能让特朗普满意收手。

column1: But if Xi suspects that a show of strength will bolster China’s international standing while undercutting that of the US, he may decide to act accordingly.
column2: 但如果习近平认为示强能增强中国的国际地位，同时削弱美国的国际地位，他有可能做出这样的决定。

column1: The North Korea issue is more complicated.
column2: 朝鲜问题更加复杂。

column1: But here, too, China will have an advantage.
column2: 但在这个问题上，中国也有优势。

column1: Even barring real progress in the talks, China already looks like a good global citizen.
column2: 即使阻挠了谈判的真正进展，中国看上去也像是国际好公民。

column1: Over the past year, it has been pressuring the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un, to negotiate.
column2: 去年它一直在施压朝鲜领导人金正恩参与谈判。

column1: By participating in coordinated economic sanctions against the Kim regime, and by reportedly capping vital exports of oil and other essentials to the North, China has played its part in bringing Kim to the table.
column2: 加入针对金氏政权的合作共同经济制裁，以及（据称）切断对朝鲜至关重要的石油和其他必需品出口意味着中国在吸引金正恩回到谈判桌方面起着作用。

column1: On paper, the fundamental question is whether North Korea will be willing to abandon its nuclear-weapons program, the fruit of more than 30 years of work.
column2: 表面上看，根本性问题是朝鲜是否愿意放弃其30多年来的工作成果 — — 核武器计划。

column1: And as China well knows, North Korea would never give up its nuclear weapons without major changes in the military balance on and around the Korean Peninsula.
column2: 中国十分清楚，朝鲜绝对不会在朝鲜半岛周边军事平衡发生重大改变的情况下放弃核武器。

column1: Kim will likely offer to denuclearize solely on the condition that the US withdraw its forces from South Korea, and perhaps from Japan, too. Barring that, he would not feel secure enough to do without the nuclear deterrence on which he has staked his regime’s survival.
column2: 金正恩可能提出，只要美国从韩国（也许还有日本）撤军就实施去核化。

column1: For his part, Trump could not possibly accede to such a condition. At best, he could agree on a process through which such extraordinary moves might be discussed at a later date.
column2: 否则的话，他就无法在失去与其政权的生存系于一身的核威慑的情况下获得安全感。

column1: Either way, China comes out on top.
column2: 无论如何，中国占尽主动。

column1: In the event of stalemate, it will have gotten Kim to the table and put America in the position of being a refusenik.
column2: 如果出现僵局，它会让金正恩回到谈判桌，而让美国陷入被拒移民（refusenik）的地位。

column1: And if the US does agree to any military concessions, China’s strategic position will be strengthened.
column2: 如果美国真的同意军事让步，中国的战略地位也会增强。

column1: The only real question for Xi, then, is whether he wants to assert China’s top-dog status now, or sometime in the future.
column2: 因此，对习近平来说，唯一的真正的问题是他想现在就树立中国“带头大哥”的地位，还是等到未来某个时刻再树立。

column1: China’s Dream World
column2: 中国的梦想世界

column1: CLAREMONT, CALIFORNIA – Ruling elites almost everywhere – whether in democracies or in authoritarian regimes – believe that clever sloganeering can inspire their people and legitimize their power.
column2: 发自加利福尼亚克莱尔蒙特 — — 几乎所有国家（不管是民主还是专制政体）的统治精英都认为漂亮的口号能鼓舞民众并使其权力合法化。

column1: There are, of course, crucial differences.
column2: 当然，这其中有着关键性的差别。

column1: In functioning democracies, government leaders can be held accountable for their promises: the press can scrutinize their policies, opposition parties are motivated to show that the party in power lies and cheats.
column2: 在实行民主制的国家，政府领导人要为其承诺负责：媒体可以仔细考究其政策，在野党会主动揭发执政党的谎言和骗局。

column1: As a result, incumbents are frequently forced to carry out at least some of their promises.
column2: 因此，在位者常常会被迫兑现至少一部分承诺。

column1: Autocratic rulers, by contrast, face no such pressures.
column2: 相比之下，独裁统治者就无需面对这样的压力。

column1: Press censorship, repression of dissent, and the absence of organized opposition allow rulers the luxury of promising whatever they want, with no political consequences for failing to deliver.
column2: 新闻审查制度、对异见的镇压以及有组织反对派的缺失使得统治者可以任意夸下海口，却无须为诺言的无法兑现承担政治后果。

column1: The result is government of the sloganeers, by the sloganeers, and for the sloganeers.
column2: 这就会导致政府由喊口号者组成，被喊口号者把持，并只为那些喊口号者服务。

column1: China appears to have perfected this form of government over the last decade.
column2: 中国在过去十年间似乎已经完善了这种政府形式。

column1: The ruling Chinese Communist Party (CCP), in response to rising public demand for social justice, has devised numerous slogans, such as “governing for the people,” “building a harmonious society,” “balanced development,” “scientific development,” and so on.
column2: 执政的中国共产党为了回应公众对社会正义日益增长的需求，已经设计了众多口号，比如“执政为民 ” 、 “构建和谐社会 ” 、 “平衡发展”及“科学发展”等等。

column1: Whenever the top leadership in Beijing uttered such slogans, they became the rallying cry of the bureaucracy.
column2: 不管北京的最高层领导何时提出这样的口号，它们都会成为官僚机构的战斗口号。

column1: The party’s massive propaganda machine went into overdrive and blanketed the country with a publicity blitz that would make the most extravagant Madison Avenue advertising campaign look like child’s play.
column2: 中共的庞大宣传机器随之开始急速运转，用宣传闪电战地毯式轰炸整个国家，其情景简直让纽约麦迪逊大道上的广告宣传活动看起来像小孩玩的游戏。

column1: But government by slogan, whether in China or in other autocracies, seldom achieves its declared goals.
column2: 但空喊口号的政府，无论是在中国还是在其它独裁国家，很少能达到其宣称的目标。

column1: In the last decade, GDP growth soared, but most indices of social justice, governance performance, and public welfare deteriorated.
column2: 在过去的十年，中国GDP实现了高速增长，但社会正义、治理绩效和公共福利的大部分指标反而都恶化了。

column1: Macroeconomic imbalances worsened as economic growth became excessively dependent on investment and exports.
column2: 随着经济增长变得过度依赖投资和出口，宏观经济失衡状况不断恶化。

column1: Inequality worsened.
column2: 社会不平等状况也在加剧。

column1: Official corruption escalated.
column2: 官员腐败升级。

column1: Social mobility declined.
column2: 社会流动性下降。

column1: Environmental degradation reached a crisis point.
column2: 环境恶化则到达了一个危机爆发点。

column1: Today, it is the responsibility of China’s new leadership, headed by President Xi Jinping, to avert another decade of missed opportunities.
column2: 如今，避免接下来的十年继续错失时机的责任落在了以习近平主席为首的新一代领导层肩上。

column1: Without missing a beat, Xi, like his predecessors, rolled out a new slogan to inspire popular confidence in his leadership.
column2: 紧随其前任的步调，新主席很快推出了一个新口号来激发公众对其领导能力的信心。

column1: As a catchphrase for his administration’s objective, “the great renaissance of the Chinese nation” is bit long, but it has lately morphed into the simpler “China Dream.”
column2: 作为行政目标的宣传语 ， “ 中华民族的伟大复兴”有点长了，但它最近被改成了较为简单的“中国梦 ” 。

column1: The substance of the China Dream remains difficult to determine.
column2: 但中国梦的实质内容仍然难以确定。

column1: When Xi first unveiled his slogan after being selected as the CCP’s new general secretary, he defined it in simple, accessible, but nonetheless generic terms: The “Chinese people dream of living the same good life as all other people in the world.”
column2: 在习近平被选为新任中共总书记后首次公布其口号时，他用简单，容易理解，但依然笼统的术语来定义中国梦：即“中国人民过上和世界其他国家人民一样美好生活的梦想 。 ”

column1: Xi has said little about the China Dream since – and his silence has caused considerable trouble.
column2: 自那以后习近平很少谈及中国梦 — — 而其沉默已经造成了相当大的麻烦。

column1: China’s ever-zealous propaganda officials, evidently fearful of not demonstrating sufficient loyalty and respect for the new party chief, quickly hijacked the slogan; the China Dream has replaced the “China Model” in official political branding.
column2: 一向狂热的中国宣传部门官员显然害怕自己没有对新的党委总书记展示足够的忠诚和尊重，很快就劫持了这个口号；中国梦已经取代了官方政治宣传中的“中国模式”标牌。

column1: Whatever the new administration does is touted as part of its ambitious effort to make the “China Dream” come true.
column2: 不管新政府干了些什么，都会被吹捧为是立志为让“中国梦”成真而努力。

column1: Unfortunately, China propagandists, who double as censors, have a perverse ability to discredit anything that they try to brand.
column2: 不幸地是，中国的宣传者 — — 还同时兼任审查者 — — 拥有一种抹黑任何他们想要打造的招牌的怪异能力。

column1: The China Dream is no exception.
column2: 如今的中国梦也不例外。

column1: So far, public reaction has ranged from puzzlement to derision.
column2: 迄今为止，公众反应从迷惑转为了嘲笑。

column1: After a decade of government by slogan, the Chinese public wants substance.
column2: 在经历了十年的口号统治之后，中国民众想要一些实质性的进展。

column1: This presents Xi with a real challenge.
column2: 这给习主席提出了真正的挑战。

column1: He has risen to the top by winning friends and allies inside the CCP.
column2: 他通过在共产党内部赢得朋友和盟友攀上了权力顶峰。

column1: Now that he is the leader of a dynamic, diverse, and increasingly demanding society, he must gain popular support and confidence to maintain his credibility and become an effective politician.
column2: 如今他领导着一个动态、多元且要求越来越高的社会，他必须获得公众的支持和信心以维持其信誉并成为一个拿得出政绩的政治家。

column1: The first thing that Xi should do is to articulate a clearer, more specific, and inspiring version of the China Dream, and stop letting the CCP’s propaganda officials define it for him.
column2: 习近平应该做的第一件事情是要明确给出一个更清晰、更具体且鼓舞人心的中国梦版本，并阻止中共宣传官员代他去下定义。

column1: The China Dream may include all of the economic benefits and material comfort that ordinary Chinese desire, but it will not be complete without the human rights and dignity that citizens in civilized societies take for granted.
column2: 中国梦可以包含所有普通中国人想要的经济利益和物质需求，但如果缺乏文明社会公民视为理所当然的人权和尊严，中国梦就会是一个不完整的理念。

column1: The second thing that Xi and his colleagues need to do is to follow up with specific policies and actions that can bolster the credibility of their declared goals.
column2: 习近平及其同僚应该做的第二件事则是跟进实施可以支撑其宣传目标可信度的具体政策和行动。

column1: Political slogans, however high-sounding, become stale when their purveyors fail to make good on their promises.
column2: 政治口号 — — 无论多么高调，当许诺者不能兑现其承诺时都会变味。

column1: Xi may still be enjoying a honeymoon with the Chinese public, but it is likely to be a short one.
column2: 习可能还正与中国的民众享受着他们之间的美好“蜜月 ” ， 但这个“蜜月”期会很短。

column1: His predecessors had ten years to carry out real reforms and accomplished little, leaving the Chinese in no mood to endure another decade of government by shibboleth.
column2: 他的前任有十年的时间来实施真正的改革但只实现了很小一部分，这使得中国人失去了再次忍受十年空喊口号的信心。

column1: Will China Weaponize Social Media?
column2: 中国会将社交媒体武器化吗？

column1: ATLANTA – Ever since the 2016 US presidential election, with its revelations about Russian meddling, European officials have been on the lookout for similar attacks.
column2: 亚特兰大—2016年美国总统选举以来，随着俄罗斯干预大选行为的披露，欧洲官员也暴露在类似的攻击风险中。

column1: But Europeans aren’t the only ones paying attention.
column2: 但欧洲人不是唯一保持关注的群体。

column1: So, too, are China’s leaders, who are considering what they might learn from the Kremlin’s successes.
column2: 中国领导人也在保持关注，他们正在考虑或许可以从克里姆林宫的成功中汲取经验。

column1: For Chinese President Xi Jinping, maintaining domestic stability is a top priority, a point underscored by China’s annual budget for internal security.
column2: 对中国国家主席习近平而言，保持国内稳定是第一要务，者从中国年度维稳预算中可见一斑。

column1: At well over $100 billion, the official number is low.
column2: 官方数字是1,000亿美元以上，一点也不高。

column1: Like defense outlays, the real number is much higher, owing to hidden spending, including on research and development.
column2: 和防务支出一样，拜包括研发在内的隐藏支出所赐，实际数字要高得多。

column1: For example, China is exploring how artificial intelligence (AI) and big data can be used to monitor everything from social media to credit-card spending, and it plans to assign all citizens a social-reliability rating to weed out potential troublemakers.
column2: 比如，中国正在探索如何运用人工智能和的数据来监控从社交媒体到信用卡支付的一切，还计划给所有公民进行社会可靠性评级，以挖掘潜在的麻烦制造者。

column1: The regime’s Orwellian strategy is focused squarely on social media and controlling not just what is said, but also how information flows into and around the country.
column2: 体制的奥威尔主义（Orwellian）战略的核心关注点是社交媒体，不但要控制说什么，还要控制信息如何在全国流动。

column1: Moreover, the authorities are bringing technology companies into line with tough new laws and cyber-security investigations.
column2: 此外，当局要求科技公司遵守严苛的新法律和网络安全调查。

column1: For Xi, the ease with which the Kremlin has manipulated Facebook and Twitter demonstrates the need for a tighter grip on China’s own social-media platforms.
column2: 对习近平来说，克里姆林宫能够轻易操纵脸谱和推特表明中国有必要抓紧控制自己的社交媒体平台。

column1: The Chinese government is now requesting seats on the boards of companies such as WeChat, Weibo, and Tencent, and demanding access to their users’ personal data.
column2: 中国政府现在要求在微信、微博和腾讯等公司董事会安排董事，还要求接触用户个人数据。

column1: Chinese cyber spies are also studying Russia’s success.
column2: 中国网络间谍也在研究俄罗斯的成功。

column1: To be sure, Chinese hackers do not lack technical savvy.
column2: 平心而论，中国黑客并不缺乏技术。

column1: They have launched cyberattacks against US presidential campaigns, expatriate Tibetan movements, and Uighur activists.
column2: 他们发动过针对美国总统选战、流亡西藏独立运动和维吾尔活跃分子的网络攻击。

column1: They have burrowed into Western think tanks and universities that study China.
column2: 他们还潜入研究中国的西方智库和大学。

column1: They have even hacked into Western news outlets that published embarrassing stories about Chinese leaders’ wealth.
column2: 他们甚至入侵了报道中国领导人财富丑闻的西方新闻机构。

column1: Still, the Chinese may have something to learn from Russia’s well-choreographed online army of trolls and bots.
column2: 尽管如此，中国仍然可以从俄罗斯处心积虑构建的滚轮和机器人网络大军中汲取经验。

column1: Similarly, strategists at the People’s Liberation Army (PLA) are likely poring over the Kremlin’s handiwork to inform their own cyber-war tactics.
column2: 类似地，解放军参谋们也可能正在仔细研究克里姆林宫的做法，来充实自己的网络战战术。

column1: Chinese strategic thinking about “political warfare” holds that an adversary’s political, social, and economic institutions – particularly the media – should be targeted before a shooting war ever begins.
column2: 中国“政治战”的战略思维认为，敌方的政治、社会和经济机构 — — 特别是媒体 — — 应该在战争打响前先行打击。

column1: To that end, Russia’s diffusion of bogus news and conspiracy theories through its state-funded media outlets RT and Sputnik could prove instructive.
column2: 在这方面，俄罗斯通过国家拨款的媒体机构RT和Sputnik来散播假新闻和阴谋论，对中国很有教育意义。

column1: In addition to expanding China’s cyber capabilities, Xi has also been developing China’s soft power through economic, social, cultural, and media initiatives.
column2: 除了扩大中国的网络实力，习近平也在通过经济、社会、文化和媒体计划发展中国的软实力。

column1: And although he has not yet coupled these programs with China’s clandestine forces to launch the kind of audacious attack that roiled the 2016 presidential election, he clearly is establishing the means to do so.
column2: 他尚未将这些计划与中国发动类似于颠覆2016年总统选举这样的大胆攻击的秘密力量组合起来，但他显然正在建立这样做的办法。

column1: Recently, it was revealed that China has been conducting wide-ranging influence operations in Australia, using official campus organizations to monitor Chinese college students, business associations to tout Chinese interests, and diplomats to police local Chinese-language media.
column2: 据披露，最近中国一直在澳大利亚进行大范围影响力行动，用官方校园组织监控中国大学生、利用商会来推进中国利益，利用外交官来管理本地中文媒体。

column1: Late last year, an Australian senator was forced to resign over his alleged ties to a Chinese billionaire.
column2: 去年年底，一位澳大利亚参议员因为与一位中国亿万富豪扯上了关系而被迫辞职。

column1: China is also expanding its global media presence.
column2: 中国也在增加其在全球媒体中的露脸机会。

column1: By some estimates, the government is sinking some $7 billion into new media and broadcast outlets abroad every year.
column2: 据一些估算，中国政府每年大约要花70亿美元用于新媒体和传播组织。

column1: Its official news agency, Xinhua, has more than 170 bureaus around the world and publishes in eight languages.
column2: 其官方新闻机构新华社在全球有170多个分社，用八种语言发布消息。

column1: China Central Television (CCTV) has more than 70 foreign bureaus and broadcasts to 171 countries in six languages.
column2: 中国中央电视台拥有70个海外记者站，用六种语言向171个国家播出节目。

column1: China Radio International is the world’s second-largest radio broadcaster after the BBC, broadcasting in 64 languages from 32 foreign bureaus to 90 radio stations worldwide.
column2: 中国国际广播电台是仅次于BBC的世界第二大广播台，在从32家外国分台用64种语言向全世界播送广播。

column1: None of these organizations has yet to distinguish itself as a go-to international news source.
column2: 所有这些组织都不认为自己是时兴的国际新闻源。

column1: But they have become a significant source of information for people in underserved regions such as the Middle East and Africa, where they purvey China’s views and are building sympathetic audiences.
column2: 但它们已经成为中东和非洲等广播服务稀缺地区的人民的重要信息源，在这些地区传播中国的观点，建立有同理心的受众群。

column1: At the same time, China is purchasing “native advertising” in Australian, American, and European newspapers.
column2: 与此同时，中国在澳大利亚、美国和欧洲报纸购买“本地广告 ” 。

column1: This allows China to place officially authored content about controversial issues – such as its militarized island-building in the South China Sea – next to those publications’ editorial offerings.
column2: 如此，中国就能让官方授意的争议问题内容 — — 如在南海军事化的造岛行为 — — 和这些报纸的社论并列出现。

column1: Xi is also playing the long game, by approving investments in movies and other forms of mass entertainment to influence how global popular culture treats all things Chinese.
column2: 习近平还在从长计议，批准投资电影和其他形式的大众娱乐来影响全球流行文化对待中国元素的方式。

column1: Despite the Chinese government’s recent clampdown on outbound capital flows, Chinese companies are still adding to their major stakes in Hollywood properties.
column2: 尽管中国政府最近阻止资本外流，但中资公司仍在大举收购好莱坞企业的多数股份。

column1: The Chinese conglomerate Dalien Wanda alone has some $10 billion in entertainment assets in the United States, Europe, and Australia.
column2: 光是万达集团就在美国、欧洲和澳大利亚拥有价值100亿美元的娱乐资产。

column1: And other Chinese Internet and financial giants such as Alibaba, Tencent, and Hony Capital, as well as state-owned companies such as the China Film Group, have invested tens of billions of dollars in US film ventures.
column2: 其他中国互联网和金融巨头，如阿里巴巴、腾讯和弘毅资本，以及中国电影集团等国有企业，都耗资数百亿美元投资于美国电影产业。

column1: With these financial stakes, the Chinese government has leverage that goes beyond old-fashioned censorship.
column2: 在投入了如此巨资后，中国政府就有了比老掉牙的审查更大的影响力。

column1: Hollywood studio bosses with an eye on China’s massive domestic market will be tempted to kowtow to the government’s “creative” requests when it comes to scripts, casting decisions, and so forth.
column2: 好莱坞制作公司的老板们觊觎巨大的中国国内市场，将会为五斗米折腰，遵从中国政府在剧本、选角等方面的“创造性”要求。

column1: At $8.6 billion in 2017, Chinese box-office receipts are second only to North America’s.
column2: 2017年，中国票房收入高达86亿美元，仅次于北美。

column1: Yet China allows only 38 foreign films into the country each year, inducing filmmakers to bend over backward to please the censors.
column2: 但中国每年只允许引进38部外国影片，这让制片商竞相折腰取悦审查者。

column1: Of course, Hollywood executives aren’t the only Westerners helping Xi’s realize his agenda.
column2: 当然，好莱坞高管们并不是帮助习近平实现自己的日程的唯一的西方人。

column1: Between Apple’s recent decision to relinquish its Chinese user data storage to a Chinese partner and Google’s announcement that it will site a new AI research center in China, US technology giants are not just making deals to benefit their “stakeholders.”
column2: 最近苹果决定将中国用户数据储存转交给中国合作企业来进行，而谷歌也宣布将在中国建立一个新人工智能研究中心，这说明美国科技巨头不仅仅在设法让它们的“相关利益方”获益。

column1: They are also handing Xi and his cyber operatives proprietary technologies and know-how, and even potential access to US targets.
column2: 它们还在向习近平和他的网络计划提供专利技术和知识，甚至直达美国目标的可能渠道。

column1: This raises an obvious question: If Russia could roil a US presidential election without such intimate business relationships, what will China be able to do in the years ahead?
column2: 这引出了一个显而易见的问题：如果说俄罗斯在不具有如此紧密的商业关系就可以颠覆美国总统选举，那么中国在未来几年中能够做到什么？

column1: To think that China’s only interest is making money, one Hollywood executive recently acknowledged, would be “very naive and dangerous” indeed.
column2: 一位好莱坞高管最近承认，认为中国唯一的兴趣是挣钱，这真的“非常幼稚和危险 。 ”

column1: Xi Jinping’s Vision for Global Governance
column2: 习近平的全球治理视野

column1: NEW YORK – The contrast between the disarray in the West, on open display at the NATO summit and at last month’s G7 meeting in Canada, and China’s mounting international self-confidence is growing clearer by the day.
column2: 发自纽约 — — 在北约峰会以及上月加拿大G7会议上公开展现出来的西方混乱状态，与中国日益增强的国际自信之间的对比日益明显。

column1: Last month, the Communist Party of China (CPC) concluded its Central Conference on Work Relating to Foreign Affairs, the second since Xi Jinping became China’s undisputed ruler in 2012.
column2: 上个月中共召开了中央外事工作会议，也是习近平自2012年坐稳最高领袖大位以来第二次召开此会议。

column1: These meetings are not everyday affairs. They are the clearest expression of how the leadership sees China’s place in the world, but they tell the world much about China as well.
column2: 这些会议绝非日常事务，而是关于领导层如何看待中国全球地位的最清晰表达，同时也向世界传达了许多关于中国的信息。

column1: The last such conference, in 2014, marked the funeral of Deng Xiaoping’s dictum of “hide your strength, bide your time, never take the lead,” and heralded a new era of international activism.
column2: 2014年召开的上一次会议标志着邓小平“韬光养晦，争取时间，永不称霸”指导方针的终结，并预示着一个中国开展国际行动的新时代。

column1: In part, this change reflected Xi’s centralization of control, Chinese leaders’ conclusion that American power is in relative decline, and their view that China had become an indispensable global economic player.
column2: 在某种程度上这种变化反映了习近平已经完成集权，中国领导人认定美国实力已经相对衰落以及认为中国已成为不可或缺的全球经济参与者的观点。

column1: Since 2014, China has expanded and consolidated its military position in the South China Sea.
column2: 自2014年以来中国不断扩大巩固其在南中国海的军事存在。

column1: It took the idea of the New Silk Road and turned it into a multi-trillion-dollar trade, investment, infrastructure, and wider geopolitical/geo-economic initiative, engaging 73 different countries across much of Eurasia, Africa and beyond.
column2: 它开创了新丝绸之路的理念，并将其转变为数万亿美元的贸易、投资，基础设施和更广泛的地缘政治/经济倡议，涵盖欧亚大陆，非洲以及其他地区的73个不同国家。

column1: And China signed up most of the developed world to the first large-scale non-Bretton Woods multilateral development bank, the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank.
column2: 同时中国与大多数发达国家签约建立了第一家大范围非布雷顿森林体系多边开发银行 — — 亚洲基础设施投资银行。

column1: China has also launched diplomatic initiatives beyond its immediate sphere of strategic interest in East Asia, as well as actively participating in initiatives such as the 2015 Iran nuclear deal.
column2: 中国还在其邻近东亚的战略利益范围之外实施了一系列外交举措，并积极参与到了2015年伊朗核协定等外交倡议之中。

column1: It has developed naval bases in Sri Lanka, Pakistan, and Djibouti, and participates in naval exercises with Russia as far away as the Mediterranean and the Baltic.
column2: 它在斯里兰卡，巴基斯坦和吉布提开发了海军基地，并远赴地中海和波罗的海一线与俄罗斯共同进行海军演习。

column1: In March, China established its own international development agency.
column2: 中国还在今年3月成立了自己的国际开发机构。

column1: The emergence of a coherent grand strategy (regardless of whether the West chooses to recognize it as such) is not all that has changed since 2014.
column2: 一个连贯性大战略的浮现（无论西方是否选择承认这一点）还不是自2014年以来所发生变化的全部内容。

column1: For starters, the emphasis on the CPC’s role is much stronger than before.
column2: 首先，对中国共产党所扮演角色的强调力度比以往大大加强。

column1: Xi, concerned that the party had become marginal to the country’s major policy debates, has reasserted party control over state institutions and given precedence to political ideology over technocratic policymaking.
column2: 习近平忧虑中共会在该国重大政策辩论中遭到边缘化，因此重新巩固了党对国家机构的控制，并优先考虑政治意识形态而非技术官僚政策制定。

column1: Xi is determined to defy the trend-line of Western history, to see off Francis Fukuyama’s “end of history” culminating in the general triumph of liberal democratic capitalism, and preserve a Leninist state for the long term.
column2: 习近平决心无视西方历史的发展主线，摒弃弗朗西斯·福山（Francis Fukuyama）认定自由民主资本主义获得普遍胜利的“历史的终结”观点，并在长时期内维系一个列宁主义国家。

column1: This approach – known as “Xi Jinping Thought” – now suffuses China’s foreign policy framework.
column2: 这个被称之为“习近平思想”的路径如今已经彻底充斥着整个中国外交政策框架。

column1: In particular, Xi’s view that that there are identifiable immutable “laws” of historical development, both prescriptive and predictive, was particularly prominent at last month’s foreign policy conference.
column2: 特别是习近平关于在历史发展方面存在可以辨认且永恒不变的“法则 ” — —而且既可指定又可预测 — — 的观点在上月的外事会议上显得尤为突出。

column1: If this sounds like old-fashioned dialectical materialism, that’s because it is.
column2: 这听起来像是老一套的辩证唯物主义论调，而且事实也确实如此。

column1: Xi embraces the Marxist-Leninist tradition as his preferred intellectual framework.
column2: 习近平选取马克思列宁主义传统作为自己首选的知识框架。

column1: Given its emphasis on iron laws of political and economic development, a dialectical-materialist worldview means that there is nothing random about world events.
column2: 在这一政治和经济发展铁律之下，辩证唯物主义的世界观意味着世界上的各类事件不存在任何随机性。

column1: So, Xi argues, if Marx’s analytical framework is applied to the current period, it is clear that the global order is at a turning point, with the West’s relative decline coinciding with the fortuitous national and international circumstances enabling China’s rise.
column2: 因此，习近平认为，如果马克思的分析框架适用于当前时期，那么全球秩序显然处于一个转折点，西方的相对衰落再加上有利的国家和国际环境造就了中国的崛起。

column1: In Xi’s words, “China has been in the best period of development since modern times, while the world is undergoing the most profound and unprecedented changes in a century.”
column2: 用习近平的话说 ： “ 当前我国处于近代以来最好的发展时期，世界处于百年未有之大变局 。 ”

column1: Of course, formidable obstacles lie ahead for China. But Xi has concluded that the obstacles facing the US and the West are greater.
column2: 当然中国的前进道路上依然存在着巨大的障碍，但习近平得出的结论是美国和西方面临的障碍要更大。

column1: How such thinking will now drive China’s concrete foreign policy is anyone’s guess.
column2: 这种想法如今将如何推动中国的具体外交政策还是个未知之数。

column1: But how one-party states, particularly Marxist states, choose to “ideate” reality matters a great deal: it is how the system speaks to itself.
column2: 但至关重要的则是一党制国家 — — 尤其是马克思主义国家 — — 在对现实进行“理想化”的过程中如何抉择：这关乎整个系统是如何跟自身对话的。

column1: And Xi’s message to China’s foreign policy elite is one of great confidence.
column2: 而习近平对中国外交政策精英传达的则是极大的信心。

column1: Specifically, the Central Conference called for the country’s international policy institutions and personnel to embrace Xi’s agenda.
column2: 具体而言，本次外事工作会议要求本国的国际政策机构及人员响应习近平的议程。

column1: Here Xi seems to have the foreign ministry in his sights.
column2: 在此习近平似乎有意针对外交部。

column1: There is a strong ideological flavor to Xi’s apparent frustration with the ministry’s glacial approach to policy innovation.
column2: 习近平对该部门在政策创新方面的动作迟缓深感不满，并因此传达出一种强烈的意识形态气息。

column1: China’s diplomats were urged to bear in mind that they are first and foremost “party cadres,” suggesting that Xi is likely to push the foreign policy apparatus toward greater activism, to give full effect to his emerging global vision.
column2: 会议要求中国外交官牢记自己首先是“党的干部 ” ， 暗示习近平可能会推动外交政策机器更大程度地发挥主动性，以充分服务于他本人新构筑的全球视野。

column1: The biggest change to emerge from last month’s conference concerns global governance.
column2: 上个月会议产生的最大变化则是在全球治理方面。

column1: In 2014, Xi referred to an impending struggle for the future structure of the international order.
column2: 在2014年，习近平提到了即将到来的事关未来国际秩序结构的斗争。

column1: While he did not elaborate, much work has since been devoted to three inter-related concepts: guoji zhixu (the international order); guoji xitong (the international system), and quanqiu zhili (global governance).
column2: 虽然他未能继续详细说明，但自那以后，许多工作都致力于三个相互关联的概念：国际秩序；国际体系；全球治理。

column1: Of course, these terms have different and overlapping meanings in English, too.
column2: 当然，这些术语在英语中拥有相互不同又有所重叠的含义。

column1: But, broadly speaking, in Chinese, the term “international order” refers to a combination of the United Nations, the Bretton Woods Institutions, the G20, and other multilateral institutions (which China accepts), as well as the US system of global alliances (which China does not).
column2: 但广义上来说，在中文中“国际秩序”一词意指（中国所接受的）联合国，布雷顿森林体系机构，G20集团和其他多边机构以及（中国所不接受的）美国全球联盟体系的组合。

column1: The term “international system” tends to refer to the first half of this international order: the complex web of multilateral institutions that operate under international treaty law and seek to govern the global commons on the basis of the principle of shared sovereignty.
column2: “国际体系”一词多指这一国际秩序的前半部分：由根据国际条约法规运作并寻求在共享主权原则的基础上管理全球公共领域的各个多边机构所组成的复杂网络。

column1: And “global governance” denotes the actual performance of the “international system” so defined.
column2: “全球治理”表示以此定义的“国际体系”的实际表现。

column1: What is startlingly new about Xi’s remarks at the Central Conference was his call for China now to “lead the reform of the global governance system with the concepts of fairness and justice.”
column2: 习近平在外事工作会议上最令人吃惊的新言论则是要求中国“以公平正义为理念引领全球治理体系改革 。 ”

column1: This is by far the most direct statement of China’s intentions on this important question offered so far.
column2: 这是迄今为止中国在这一重要问题上对自身意图的最直接表述。

column1: The world should buckle up and get ready for a new wave of Chinese international policy activism.
column2: 为此全世界都应该坐稳扶好，迎接中国国际政策主动出击的新浪潮。

column1: Like much of the rest of the international community, China is acutely conscious of the dysfunctionality of much of the current multilateral system.
column2: 与国际社会其他大多数国家一样，中国非常清楚当前大部分多边体系的失能状况。

column1: So Xi’s wish to lead “reform of the global governance system” is no accident.
column2: 所以习近平领导“全球治理体制改革”的愿望绝非偶然。

column1: It reflects growing diplomatic activism in multilateral institutions, in order to reorient them in a direction more compatible with what China regards as its “core national interests.”
column2: 它反映了中国将更多地针对多边机构进行外交主动出击，以便将它们重新定位到与中国自身“国家核心利益”更加一致的方向上。

column1: Xi has reminded China’s international policy elite that the totality of China’s future foreign policy direction, including the reform of global governance, must be driven by these core national interests.
column2: 习近平提醒本国的国际政策精英说，中国未来的外交政策方向，包括全球治理改革，必须由这些国家核心利益所驱动。

column1: In this context, China also wants a more “multipolar” international system.
column2: 在这一背景下中国也想要一个更“多极”的国际体系。

column1: This is code for a world in which the role of the United States and the West is substantially reduced.
column2: 它指向的是一个美国和西方权重大幅减少的世界。

column1: The challenge for the rest of the international community is to define what type of global order we now want.
column2: 而国际社会其他成员所面临的挑战则是确定我们现在想要哪种类型的全球秩序。

column1: What do existing institutions like the European Union, the Association of Southeast Asian Nations, or the African Union want for the international rules-based system for the future?
column2: 欧盟，东南亚国家联盟或非洲联盟等现有机构对未来的国际规则体系有何寄望？

column1: What exactly does the US want, with or without Trump?
column2: 无论特朗普是否上台，美国到底想要什么？

column1: And how will we collectively preserve the global values embodied in the UN Charter, the Bretton Woods institutions, and the Universal Declaration of Human Rights?
column2: 我们将如何集体保护《联合国宪章 》 ， 布雷顿森林体系机构以及《世界人权宣言》所体现的全球价值观？

column1: The future of the global order is in a state of flux.
column2: 全球秩序的未来处于不稳定状态。

column1: China has a clear script for the future.
column2: 而中国构思出了一个清晰的未来蓝图。

column1: It’s time for the rest of the international community to develop one of its own.
column2: 同时也是时候让国际社会的其他成员发展出属于自己的那一套了。

column1: This is an edited version of an address delivered to the Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy at the National University of Singapore.
column2: 本文是根据作者在新加坡国立大学李光耀公共政策学院所发表的演讲整理而成。

column1: Xi of Arabia
column2: 阿拉伯的习主席

column1: BEIJING – Those who have criticized China’s cautious foreign policy need to reconsider their position, following President Xi Jinping’s just-completed visit to Saudi Arabia and Iran – two major Middle Eastern powers that are currently at each other’s throats.
column2: 北京—那些批评中国外交政策谨小慎微的人需要重新考虑立场了。 中国国家主席习近平刚刚结束了对沙特阿拉伯和伊朗的访问。

column1: The visits reflect the more active foreign-policy approach that Xi has spearheaded, particularly in the Middle East.
column2: 这两个国家都是中东主要力量，目前处于严重对峙状态。 此次出访体现了习近平所主导的更加积极的外交政策方针，特别是在中东。

column1: This new approach raises an important question: Can China’s impact on the region be more constructive than that of the United States?
column2: 这一新方针引出了一个重要问题：中国在该地区的影响力是否比美国更具建设性？

column1: Now is certainly a tense time to become involved in the Middle East, a region where, as Richard N. Haass argues, a New Thirty Years’ War, in which “civil wars and proxy wars become impossible to distinguish,” is unfolding.
column2: 如今显然是介入中东的敏感时刻，理查德·哈斯（Richard N. Haass）认为，该地区正在展开一场新三十年战争 ， “ 内战和代理战争已无法区分 ” 。

column1: A key factor in unleashing the current chaos – which represents the convergence of numerous deep-rooted challenges and conflicts – was America’s 2003 invasion of Iraq.
column2: 导致当前乱象 — — 其根源是众多深层次挑战和冲突汇聚在一起 — — 的一大关键因素是2003年美国入侵伊拉克。

column1: By eliminating Saddam Hussein’s Sunni regime, the US paved the way for a Shia-led government, a development that tilted the regional balance of power toward Iran and left Sunni-ruled Saudi Arabia feeling encircled by a Shia coalition.
column2: 美国推翻了萨达姆·侯赛因的逊尼派政权，为什叶派领导的政府扫清了道路，这一变化让地区平衡向伊朗倾斜，也让逊尼派统治的沙特阿拉伯感到被什叶派联盟所包围。

column1: That is why Iran and Saudi Arabia are so deeply involved in Syria’s civil war.
column2: 因此，伊朗和沙特阿拉伯都深深介入了叙利亚内战。

column1: They know that the fate of President Bashar al-Assad’s Alawite regime will have significant implications for the regional order.
column2: 它们知道，叙利亚总统巴沙尔·阿萨德的阿拉维派政权的命运对于地区秩序具有重大影响。

column1: For Saudi Arabia, reining in Iran is all the more important in the wake of the recent agreement on the country’s nuclear program, which has resulted in the lifting of international economic sanctions that have long constrained Iran’s regional leadership ambitions.
column2: 对沙特阿拉伯来说，在最近伊核问题达成协议（长期限制伊朗作为地区领导者雄心的国际经济制裁将因此取消）的情况下，制约伊朗是其第一要务。

column1: Of course, neither Saudi Arabia nor Iran – or Turkey, which has also joined the competition for regional influence – is seeking a direct confrontation.
column2: 当然，沙特阿拉伯和伊朗 — — 还有土耳其，它刚刚加入到争夺地区影响力的竞争中 — — 都不想要直接冲突。

column1: These countries would rather empower other actors, even if it means fueling dangerous religious radicalization and the privatization of violence.
column2: 这些国家宁可扶持其他行动方，即使这意味着会增强危险的宗教激进化和暴力私有化。

column1: The terrorist movements that have emerged as a result of this approach – namely, the Islamic State – cannot be defeated using traditional counter-terrorism operations.
column2: 因地区国家的这一方略而崛起的恐怖主义运动（即伊斯兰国）是无法用传统反恐行动打败的。

column1: To be sure, these Middle East rivals are not the only ones involved in the region’s current quagmire.
column2: 平心而论，这些中东对峙各方并不是该地区当前乱局的唯一当事方。

column1: External powers like France, Russia, and, of course, the US are also deeply involved, each with its own geopolitical objectives.
column2: 外部力量，如法国、俄罗斯，当然还有美国，也深深地介入其中，每一方都有其自身的地缘政治目标。

column1: Now China is entering the fray, bringing a uniquely constructive vision with it.
column2: 现在中国也在加入其中，带来了独一无二的建设性政策。

column1: The two characters that comprise the Chinese word for crisis (危机) mean, individually, “danger” (危) and “opportunity” (机).
column2: 中文词语“危机”包含着“危”和“机”两个汉字。

column1: That is precisely what China sees in today’s Middle East.
column2: 这正是当前中国对中东的看法。

column1: For most of the relevant actors, highly perilous geopolitical competition is overshadowing vast economic opportunities.
column2: 对最相关的行动方而言，高度危险的地缘政治竞争使巨大的经济机会黯然失色。

column1: Not for China.
column2: 对中国来说并非如此。

column1: As Xi put it on his recent visit to Cairo: “Instead of looking for a proxy in the Middle East, we promote peace talks; instead of seeking any sphere of influence, we call on all parties to join the circle of friends for the Belt and Road initiative.”
column2: 习近平最近在访问开罗时指出 ， “ 我们在中东不找代理人，而是劝和促谈；不搞势力范围，而是推动大家一起加入‘一带一路’朋友圈 。 ”

column1: This reflects the broader foreign-policy rebalancing that Xi has been pursuing since taking office in 2013.
column2: 这反映出习近平自2013年执政以来一直在推动的更大层面上的外交政策再平衡。

column1: Unlike the US, which has been engineering a strategic “pivot” from one geographic region to another, China is rebalancing from “politics among nations” to “politics among networks,” focusing on “connectivity” rather than “control.”
column2: 与一直在将战略“支点”从一个地区转向另一个地区的美国不同，中国正在实施从“国家间政治”向“网络间政治”的再平衡，着重于“连通”而非“控制 ” 。

column1: The Middle East is crucial to this connectivity-oriented grand strategy, not least because of its key role in the “One Belt, One Road” project that Xi promoted in Cairo.
column2: 对于这种以连通为导向的大战略来说，中东地区至关重要，它是习近平此行在开罗所宣扬的“一带一路”计划的关键。

column1: China’s determination to reestablish the ancient Silk Roads – including the overland route that runs through the Middle East – has led it to enter into strategic partnerships with eight Arab countries in recent years, and to sign agreements with six Arab countries to pursue the initiative jointly.
column2: 中国决心重建古丝绸之路 — — 包括横穿中东的陆上丝绸之路 — — 因此近几年来中国与八个阿拉伯国家建立了战略伙伴关系，并与六个阿拉伯国家签署协议共同推进“一带一路 ” 。

column1: Iran, Turkey, and seven Arab countries are among the founding members of the Beijing-based Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank, a key institution for financing related infrastructure projects.
column2: 伊朗、土耳其和七个阿拉伯国家是亚洲基础设施投资银行的创始成员国，该银行总部设在北京，它是相关基础设施项目的关键融资机构。

column1: But China is not waiting for the One Belt, One Road initiative to be completed before pursuing increased trade with Middle Eastern countries.
column2: 但中国并没有等到“一带一路”计划完成后再去增加与中东国家的贸易。

column1: During his recent visit to Saudi Arabia, he claimed that free-trade negotiations between the Gulf Cooperation Council and China should be concluded this year.
column2: 在最近访问沙特阿拉伯期间，习近平宣布，海湾合作委员会与中国的自由贸易谈判要在今年完成。

column1: Moreover, Xi announced that China will issue $55 billion in loans to the Middle East, including a $15 billion special loan for industrialization, $10 billion in commercial loans to boost production capacity, and $10 billion in concessional loans.
column2: 此外，习近平还宣布中国将向中东提供550亿美元贷款，包括150亿美元工业化特别贷款、100亿美元用于增进产能的商业贷款和100亿美元优惠贷款。

column1: The remaining $20 billion will go toward a joint investment fund with the United Arab Emirates and Qatar to invest in traditional energy, infrastructure development, and high-end manufacturing industries in the region.
column2: 其他200亿美元将以与阿联酋和卡塔尔组成联合投资基金的形式，投资于该地区的传统能源、基础设施开发和高端制造业。

column1: All of this aligns with the “1+2+3” cooperation pattern that Xi proposed at the June 2014 Ministerial Conference of the China-Arab States Cooperation Forum in Beijing.
column2: 所有这些都与习近平在2014年6月的中阿国家合作论坛部长级会议上所提出的“1+2+3”合作模式相符。

column1: According to this approach, energy cooperation should form the core of collaboration, while infrastructure construction and trade and investment form two wings. Nuclear power, satellites, and new energy sources are three high-tech areas where cooperation can lead to important breakthroughs.
column2: 根据这一方针，能源合作将成为一个核心，而基础设施建设与贸易投资组成两翼，核能、卫星和新能源是合作中可能形成重大突破的三大高科技领域。

column1: Here, the goal is to take advantage of the region’s energy resources, while helping it to industrialize and diversify its economy.
column2: 这一合作模式的目标是利用好中东国家的能源资源，同时帮助它们实现工业化和经济多元化。

column1: Of course, China’s success in the Middle East requires progress on mitigating the region’s tensions, cooling its hotspots, and stabilizing weak countries – all of which will require smart diplomacy by many actors.
column2: 当然，中国在中东的成功需要在减少该地区紧张局势、给热点降温、稳定较弱国家等方面取得进展 — — 所有这些都需要众多行动方的明智外交政策。

column1: But peace and development are inextricably linked.
column2: 但和平与发展是密不可分的。

column1: To turn the tide against extremism, Middle Eastern countries must be able to provide economic opportunities to their people, and these can only be secured through trade, investment, and jobs.
column2: 要想扭转极端主义趋势，中东国家必须能够为民众提供经济机会，而经济机会只能通过贸易、投资和就业来实现。

column1: In this fundamental respect, China has a lot to offer the Middle East – and President Xi has once again shown his determination to offer it.
column2: 在这一关键方面，中国能够给中东提供很多帮助 — — 而习近平主席也再次表达了提供帮助的决心。

column1: China’s Contradictions
column2: 中国的各类矛盾

column1: NEW HAVEN – China’s quinquennial Communist Party congresses are that rare event where ritual and dogma combine with introspection and strategy. The 19th National Congress, which began on October 18, is no exception.
column2: 发自纽黑文 — — 五年一度的中共全国代表大会是一场罕见地将仪式、教条和内省、战略相结合的事件，而10月18日召开的十九大也不例外。

column1: Notwithstanding the suspense over potential changes in Party leadership, which typically occur at the end of the meeting, President Xi Jinping’s political report, delivered on the opening day, was a high-impact event.
column2: 尽管悬念总是被放在会议末段的中共高层领导班子调整上，但习近平总书记在开幕当天的政治报告也是一个具备高度影响力的事件。

column1: Significantly, it says as much about the Party as it does about Xi.
column2: 值得注意的是，报告用了跟谈论习近平一样的篇幅来谈论党。

column1: As Alice Miller, a leading Sinologist at Stanford’s Hoover Institution, emphasizes, the report was carefully crafted over a one-year period to convey the consensus of the Party’s highest organ, the 205-member Central Committee.
column2: 正如斯坦福大学胡佛研究所的知名中国研究家爱丽丝·米勒（Alice Miller）所强调的那样，这份精心攥写了一年的报告就是用来传达由205人组成的中共中央委员会（也是中共最高领导机关）的共识。

column1: Three conclusions from Xi’s address are particularly important.
column2: 习近平的三个结论尤为重要。

column1: For starters, the ideological underpinnings of “Xi Jinping Thought” have been raised to the same lofty level as those of “Mao Zedong Thought,” effectively elevating Xi over his three predecessors – Hu Jintao, Jiang Zemin, and even the revered Deng Xiaoping.
column2: 首先 ， “ 习近平思想”已经被提升到与“毛泽东思想”相同的崇高水平，实际上超越了他的三位前任：胡锦涛，江泽民，甚至是威望极高的邓小平。

column1: Much has been written about Xi’s consolidation of power since he was appointed General Secretary in November 2012. But this elevation makes it official.
column2: 我们已经看过有很多关于习近平自从2012年11月被任命为党总书记以来如何巩固权力的文章报道，但这一提升使其被正式确定下来。

column1: After only five years in office, the Party leadership has anointed Xi as one of modern China’s two greatest historic figures.
column2: 仅仅在位五年时间，党的领导层就已经将习近平拔高成了现代中国的两大历史人物之一。

column1: Second, the political report speaks with great confidence about a China that has now entered a “New Era.” But by underscoring the Chinese adage that the “…last leg of a journey just marks the halfway point,” Xi sketched an even more ambitious future.
column2: 第二，这份政治报告以充满信心的语气谈论了现在进入“新时代”的中国，但通过强调“行百里者半九十”这句格言，习近平描绘了一个更加雄心勃勃的未来。

column1: China’s sights are now set on two goals – completing the task of building the so-called moderately prosperous society by 2035, and then establishing its position as a Great Power by 2050.
column2: 中国的目光现在放在两个目标上 — — 到2035年完成建设所谓小康社会的任务（报告原文为“在全面建成小康社会的基础上，再奋斗十五年，基本实现社会主义现代化 ” ） ，然后在2050年前建成一个强国。

column1: Unlike China’s goal-setting exercises in the past, there are no quantitative targets attached to these “twin centenary goals” (which roughly align with the Party’s founding in 1921 and the establishment of the People’s Republic of China in 1949). They celebrate the long-awaited national rejuvenation that Xi has dubbed the China Dream.
column2: 跟中国过去的目标制定做法不同，这两个“百年奋斗目标 ” （ 与1921年中共建党和1949年中华人民共和国成立时间大致配对）并没有提出任何量化指标，只是颂扬了期待已久的民族复兴（习近平称之为“中国梦 ” ） 。

column1: The third point is perhaps the most intriguing.
column2: 第三点可能是最有趣的。

column1: This is couched in the form of China’s “principal contradiction” – a Marxist concept that serves as an admission of a fundamental problem requiring resolution.
column2: 这体现在关于中国“主要矛盾”形式的措辞上 — — 这是一个用以提出亟待解决之根本问题的马克思主义概念。

column1: The principal contradiction, while typically elliptical and ambiguous, frames a rich discussion of risks and opportunities, strategy and tactics, reforms and governance – all of which will shape China’s prospects for the foreseeable future.
column2: 这一主要矛盾的表述虽然通常是隐晦且模凌两可的，但却会构成对关于风险/机遇、战略/手段和改革/治理的丰富讨论，所有这些都将在可预见的未来塑造中国的前景。

column1: The big news is that, under Xi’s leadership, the Party has revised its principal contradiction for the first time since 1981. Whereas the contradiction had previously been framed as a tradeoff between the needs of the people and China’s “backward social production,” it is now viewed as a tension between “unbalanced and inadequate development” and the “people’s ever-growing needs for a better life.”
column2: 最重要的是，在习近平的领导下中共自1981年以来首次修改了对主要矛盾的描述，该矛盾从前被认为是人民日益增长的物质文化需求和“落后生产力”之间的折衷，如今被修改为“不平衡不充分的发展”和“人民日益增长的美好生活需要”之间的紧张关系。

column1: This restatement of the principal contradiction has not emerged from thin air.
column2: 这个主要矛盾的重述并不是空穴来风。

column1: It clearly signals a far-reaching change in national perspective – from that of a poor developing country to that of an increasingly prosperous society focused on becoming a Great Power.
column2: 其清楚地展现了关于中国国家视野的一个重大变化 — — 从贫穷的发展中国家再到一个旨在成为强国的逐渐富裕社会。

column1: It is also consistent with the critique of former Premier Wen Jiabao, who in March 2007 famously warned of a Chinese economy that was becoming increasingly “unstable, unbalanced, uncoordinated, and [ultimately] unsustainable.”
column2: 这也跟前总理温家宝的评论是一致的，他在2007年3月曾经警告说，中国经济越来越“不稳定，不平衡，不协调，并（最终）不可持续 ” 。

column1: Over the past ten years, two five-year plans – the 12th, enacted in 2011, and the 13th, enacted in 2016 – plus a major set of reforms adopted at the so-called Third Plenum in 2013, have aimed to resolve China’s persistent and worrisome imbalances.
column2: 在过去十年来出台的两个五年计划（2011年颁布的十二五和2016年颁布的十三五 ） ， 加上2013年召开的十八届三中全会所通过的一系列改革，都旨在解决中国持续存在且令人忧虑的失衡问题。

column1: Xi’s political report doesn’t alter the main thrust of those efforts.
column2: 习近平的政治报告并未改变这一系列努力的主旨。

column1: The real significance is that rebalancing is now enshrined within the Party’s ideological underpinnings. It is a foundational pillar of Xi Jinping Thought.
column2: 真正重大的意义在于再平衡现在已经被纳入了党的思想基础之内，也是习近平思想的基础支柱。

column1: The political report’s focus on China’s principal contradiction also raises important questions about what still may be missing from the Party’s long-term strategy.
column2: 政治报告对中国主要矛盾的关注也引发了关与党的长期战略中仍然缺失哪些内容的重大问题。

column1: Three “secondary contradictions” are especially striking on the economic front.
column2: 而对此三个“次要矛盾”在经济方面尤为突出。

column1: First, there is ongoing tension between the role of the state and that of markets in guiding resource allocation.
column2: 首先，国家与市场在指导资源配置方面所扮演的角色依然存在冲突。

column1: This was a glaring contradiction of the 2013 Third Plenum reforms, which focused on the seemingly inconsistent combination of a “decisive role” for markets and steadfast support for state ownership.
column2: 在2013年十八届三中全会改革中曾提到过一个明显矛盾，重点在于市场的“决定性作用”和对国家所有权的坚定支持这两者看似不协调的组合。

column1: The Party has long believed that these two features of economic life are compatible – the so-called blended economy with Chinese characteristics.
column2: 长期以来，党始终认为经济生活的这两大特征是可以兼容的 — — 也就是所谓中国特色的混合所有制经济。

column1: Xi’s political report praises the mixed ownership model and also aspires to an economy led by great firms with unmatched global competitive prowess. But it glosses over the thorny issue of state-owned enterprise reform that may be required to resolve this contradiction and avoid the Japanese “zombie” problem of a chronic debt overhang.
column2: 习近平的政治报告赞扬了这一混合所有制模式，也渴望建立一个以具备压倒性全球竞争实力的伟大企业为主导的经济，但报告掩盖了解决这一矛盾以及避免日本式“僵尸企业”长期欠债问题所需的棘手国企改革。

column1: Second, there is the tension between supply and demand.
column2: 二是供需矛盾紧张。

column1: Consistent with other recent pronouncements of senior Chinese officials, the political report leaves little doubt that supply-side structural reforms are now the highest priority of economic policymakers.
column2: 与最近中国高层官员的其他声明一致，政治报告认为供应方面的结构改革无疑是经济决策者当前的首要任务。

column1: The related emphasis on productivity, innovation, pruning excess capacity, and moving up the value chain in manufacturing and services are underscored as key building blocks of this effort.
column2: 对提高生产率，创新，削减过剩产能以及向制造业和服务价值链上游迈进的相关强调也是这一努力的重要组成部分。

column1: At the same time, the report de-emphasizes consumer spending and services – now buried deep in the list of priorities for a modernized economy.
column2: 与此同时，该报告放弃了对消费者支出和服务的强调 — — 这项事务如今已经在建设现代化经济的优先事项中排名末尾了。

column1: Yet focusing on supply without paying equal attention to the foundations of aggregate demand is a puzzling and potentially worrisome disconnect.
column2: 然而，关注供应却不重视那些构建总需求的基础是一个令人困惑且有可能在将来引发担忧的缺失。

column1: A final secondary tension can be found in the contrast between the path and the destination.
column2: 最后一个次要矛盾可以在路径和目的地之间的对比中找到。

column1: Notwithstanding all the self-congratulatory flourishes in Xi’s political report, there is good reason to believe that the Chinese economy is only in the early stages of its long-heralded structural transformation.
column2: 尽管习近平的政治报告充斥着自我表扬，但有理由相信中国经济依然处于其长期鼓吹的结构转型的早期阶段。

column1: Its services sector is growing rapidly, but is still embryonic, accounting for just 52% of GDP.
column2: 其服务业正在快速增长，但仍处于初创阶段，仅占GDP的52 ％ 。

column1: And household consumption, which is also growing rapidly, is still less than 40% of GDP.
column2: 家庭消费虽然也在快速增长，也还不不足GDP的40 ％ 。

column1: China may well be on a path to a New Normal or a New Era.
column2: 中国或许已经走上了一个迈向新常态或新时代的道路。

column1: But the final destination remains far down the road, with many contradictions to be resolved during the journey.
column2: 但最终目的地依然遥远，旅途中也会有许多矛盾需要解决。

column1: When Xi Meets Obama
column2: 当习近平遇见奥巴马

column1: CLAREMONT, CALIFORNIA – As Chinese President Xi Jinping begins his trip to the United States in Seattle, home to many of the world’s leading technology firms, most observers are looking ahead to his subsequent meeting with President Barack Obama.
column2: 克莱蒙特，加利福尼亚—中国国家主席习近平在西雅图开始了访美之旅。 西雅图是许多世界领先的科技公司的总部所在地。

column1: Can the summit reverse the downward spiral in US-China relations that began with Xi’s accession to power in 2013?
column2: 许多观察者正在期待他随后与美国总统奥巴马的会面。 两人的峰会是否能够扭转2013年习近平上台以来中美关系恶化的趋势？

column1: Few dispute that the world’s most important bilateral relationship is in deep trouble.
column2: 毫无疑问，全世界最重要的双边关系陷入了深深的麻烦。

column1: From the US perspective, China’s reckless behavior in the South China Sea, unrestrained cyber attacks against American targets, protectionist economic policies, and escalating political repression at home have demolished the belief that a globally integrated China would be a responsible and cooperative partner.
column2: 从美国的角度，中国在南海的“任性”行为、无节制的针对美国目标的网络攻击、保护主义经济政策和逐步升级的对内政治压迫使其无法再相信融入全球的中国将是负责任的合作伙伴。

column1: Indeed, recent Chinese actions directly challenge vital American interests and core values.
column2: 事实上，最近中国的行为直接挑战了美国的核心利益和核心价值。

column1: Chinese leaders, for their part, view America’s strategic “pivot to Asia” as a thinly veiled step to tighten its geopolitical containment of China.
column2: 而中国领导人将美国战略性“重返亚洲”视为欲盖弥彰的加紧对华地缘政治遏制的措施。

column1: Moreover, they have become obsessed with US dominance in international finance and technology and, most important, America’s ideological commitment to liberal democracy, which they regard as an existential threat to the Chinese Communist Party (CCP).
column2: 此外，他们着迷于美国在国际金融和科技方面的主宰地位以及，更重要的，美国坚定的自由民主意识形态（他们视为中共的生存威胁 ） 。

column1: The toxic mix of mutual mistrust and tit-for-tat behavior has brought Sino-American ties to their lowest point since the Tiananmen Square massacre of 1989.
column2: 互不信任和针锋相对行为构成了一个危害重重的组合，让中美关系跌至1989年天安门事件以来的最低点。

column1: There is now widespread concern that the US and China may be headed for a new cold war.
column2: 如今，人们广泛担忧美国和中国可能开始新的冷战。

column1: For Xi, the stakes of his US trip could not be higher.
column2: 对习近平来说，此次访美可谓意义重大。

column1: To maintain his domestic image as a strong leader, he must stick to his nationalist rhetoric and policies.
column2: 要想维持其强势领导人的国内形象，他必须坚持其民族主义口风和政策。

column1: But he also needs to stabilize the all-important relationship with the US.
column2: 但他也需要稳定最重要的对美关系。

column1: Judging by recent moves by China and the US, we can expect modest success in a few contentious areas.
column2: 从中国和美国最近的动作判断，我们可以期待双方在一些有争议的领域取得些许成功。

column1: While such improvements, on their own, will not change the relationship’s adversarial dynamic, they may halt the deterioration in bilateral ties, at least for now.
column2: 这些改善本身不会改变中美关系的对抗动态，但也许能够阻止双边关系的恶化，至少在当前是如此。

column1: On the eve of the summit, both the US and China took positive, albeit symbolic, steps to demonstrate their goodwill and improve the diplomatic atmosphere.
column2: 在峰会即将到来之际，美国和中国领导人都采取了积极（尽管是象征性）的举措证明各自的良好意愿、改善外交氛围。

column1: The US extradited a low-level Chinese official to face corruption charges.
column2: 美国遣返了一名面临腐败指控的低级中国官员。

column1: The Obama administration also decided not to announce sanctions against Chinese entities and individuals allegedly involved in cyber attacks on American companies and government agencies.
column2: 奥巴马政府还决定不对被控参与对美国公司和政府机构发动网络袭击的中国单位和个人进行制裁。

column1: For its part, China released a human-rights activist and dispatched a high-level delegation to the US to discuss cyber security.
column2: 中国则释放了一位人权活动家，并派了一个高规格代表团来到美国讨论网络安全问题。

column1: In fact, the two sides are reportedly negotiating a landmark deal that would prohibit cyber attacks against each other’s vital infrastructure.
column2: 事实上，双方据称正在谈判一项里程碑式的协议，禁止互相网络攻击关键基础设施。

column1: An agreement on the issue could be the most important outcome of the summit, although other types of cyber attacks are unlikely to be covered by it.
column2: 在这一问题上形成协议可能是峰会最重要的成果，尽管该协议不可能覆盖其他类型的网络袭击。

column1: For China, the biggest prize is a bilateral investment treaty (BIT).
column2: 对中国来说，最大的好处是双边投资条约。

column1: In practical terms, a US-China BIT would make it easier for Chinese entities to invest and operate in the US and increase American firms’ access to Chinese markets.
column2: 从务实角度，中美双边投资条约将让中国单位更加方便地赴美投资和经营，也能促进美国企业进入中国市场。

column1: Such a deal would be a near-term boon for Xi, because it would represent a vote of confidence by the US in China’s struggling economy.
column2: 对习近平来说，这一协议是一个短期福音，因为这代表美国对陷入困境的中国经济充满信心。

column1: But the prospects for a BIT are uncertain, at best.
column2: 但双边投资条约的前景并不确定。

column1: The US Congress is deeply skeptical, and the American business community needs convincing as well.
column2: 美国国会深刻地怀疑中国，而美国企业界也需要确信。

column1: Both have been bitterly disappointed by China’s mercantilist trading policies after its accession to the World Trade Organization.
column2: 国会和企业界都因为中国加入世贸组织后采取的重商主义贸易政策而大失所望。

column1: Given how many contentious issues remain unresolved, an accord is unlikely during the summit.
column2: 考虑到众多争议问题尚未解决，峰会期间不太可能形成协议。

column1: The South China Sea dispute may prove to be the toughest diplomatic nut to crack.
column2: 南海纠纷也许是最棘手的外交问题。

column1: China has staked its national prestige and its leadership’s nationalist credentials on this issue, which means that Xi is likely to rebuff US demands that China cease all activities seen as militarizing its new artificial islands in disputed waters.
column2: 中国在这一问题上押上了国家尊严和领导人的民族主义情操，这意味着习近平可能会断然拒绝美国要求中国停止所有被视为对其在争议海域的新造人工岛进行军事化改造的行为。

column1: The most that can be realistically expected is an insipid statement of the two sides’ agreement to disagree.
column2: 从现实角度，我们最多能够期待双方发表一些无关痛痒的承认分歧的声明。

column1: But the most politically sensitive topic for China has little to do with cyber security or the South China Sea. It is China’s ongoing crackdown on civil liberties and human rights.
