column2: 但对中国来说，政治上最敏感的话题既非网络安全，亦非南海，而是中国一直在镇压公民自由和人权的问题。

column1: Facing enormous domestic pressure, Obama has announced that human rights will be on the agenda of his summit with Xi.
column2: 面临巨大国内压力的奥巴马已经宣布人权将是其与习近平峰会的议程之一。

column1: But Xi is unlikely to make any concessions, because doing so could damage his political standing within the CCP and undermine a central component of his political vision: the reassertion of political control over a dynamic society.
column2: 但习近平不可能做出任何让步，因为这样做将危害到他在中共党内的政治立场，也有害于其政治愿景的一个关键要素：重新获得对充满活力的社会的政治控制。

column1: Ultimately, the key question looming over the summit is whether Xi will be able to offer enough to repair the damage done to Sino-US relations in recent years.
column2: 最终，峰会的关键问题是习近平是否拿出足够的诚意修复近几年来中美关系所遭到的破坏。

column1: To be sure, trying is better than doing nothing.
column2: 诚然，做点尝试比什么都不做要好。

column1: But what really matters is whether, after the summit, China takes concrete actions that reflect a genuine shift from the policies that have fueled the deterioration in bilateral ties.
column2: 但真正重要的是峰会之后中国是否拿出实际行动证明其真正开始远离那些加剧双边关系恶化的政策。

column1: The Sino-American Employment Challenge
column2: 中美合作应对新经济时代就业挑战

column1: HONG KONG – Donald Trump’s rise to power in the United States involved more than a little China-bashing.
column2: 香港—特朗普为了当选美国总统，采取了不少抨击中国的策略。

column1: Yet, with Chinese President Xi Jinping’s visit to Trump’s Florida estate earlier this month, it seems that the status quo in the bilateral relationship – crucial for global trade, growth, and stability – will be maintained.
column2: 但本月初中国国家主席习近平与特朗普在其佛罗里达庄园的会晤显然具有稳定中美关系现状的作用。

column1: That could be very good news for Chinese and US workers alike.
column2: 中美关系对于全球贸易、增长和稳定有着至关重要的意义，这次会晤对于中国和美国的工人来说都是非常好的消息。

column1: At the summit, Xi reiterated China’s commitment to maintaining a positive relationship with the US.
column2: 在峰会上，习近平重申了中国保持对美良好关系的承诺。

column1: “We have a thousand reasons to get China-US relations right,” he said, “and not one reason to spoil” them.
column2: “我们有一千条理由把中美关系搞好 ， ” 他说 ， “ 没有一条理由把中美关系搞坏 。 ”

column1: Trump, for his part, accepted Xi’s invitation to visit China soon.
column2: 特朗普则接受了习近平的邀请，将于近期访华。

column1: On trade, Trump and Xi agreed to a 100-day plan for discussions on reducing the US trade deficit with China.
column2: 在贸易方面，特朗普和习近平同意启动一个百日计划，讨论如何减少美国对华贸易赤字。

column1: Moreover, the US accepted China’s proposal to revamp the framework for bilateral engagement by creating the US-China Comprehensive Dialogue, consisting of four sub-dialogues: diplomacy and security, economic issues, law enforcement and cybersecurity, and social and cultural affairs.
column2: 此外，美国也接受了中国关于通过建立中美全面对话来改善双边关系的一个框架性的建议，对话包括四个方面：外交与安全、经济问题、执法与网络安全，以及社会和文化事务。

column1: The understanding between Xi and Trump reflected a sober acknowledgement of the domestic and international risks their countries face.
column2: 习近平与特朗普之间的相当积极的互相理解反映出他们对各自国家所面临的国内和国际风险有着清醒的认识。

column1: Both seemed to recognize that a stable US-China relationship is necessary to enable them to focus on their respective challenges.
column2: 两人都认识到，稳定的中美关系是他们能够专注于各自挑战的必要条件。

column1: For Xi, those challenges include supply-side structural reforms to address corruption, pollution, rising debt, overcapacity, and low productivity.
column2: 对习近平来说，这些挑战包括供给侧结构改革以解决腐败、污染、债务增加、产能过剩和生产率低下问题。

column1: As for Trump, the main imperative is to overcome political and institutional obstacles to fulfilling his promises, including to reduce taxes and invest in infrastructure.
column2: 对特朗普来说，当务之急是克服政治和制度障碍，实现包括减税和基础设施投资在内的竞选承诺。

column1: But there is one key challenge that both leaders have in common: jobs.
column2: 但两国都面临一个共同的关键挑战：创造就业。

column1: Technological advances, especially in automation and robotics, are putting a growing number of jobs under pressure.
column2: 科技进步，特别是自动化和机器人，让越来越多的工作岗位处于压力之中。

column1: In the US, that pressure was a driving force behind Trump’s election (though it was often and disproportionately blamed on immigrants and developing-country exporters, including China).
column2: 在美国，这一压力是特朗普当选的推动力之一（尽管人们常常错误地将就业问题归咎于移民和包括中国在内的发展中国家的出口 ） 。

column1: But in China, too, technology-driven job insecurity could pose a threat to political stability.
column2: 而在中国，科技导致的就业问题同样也可能给政治稳定造成威胁。

column1: According to a report released by US President Barack Obama’s administration last year, anywhere from 9% to 47% of jobs will be threatened by automation during the coming decade.
column2: 据去年美国总统奥巴马政府发布的报告，未来十年将有9 % — 47%的就业岗位受到自动化的威胁。

column1: More recently, McKinsey released its own report on the topic, in which it estimates that about 60% of all occupations could undergo automation of 30% or more of their constituent activities.
column2: 最近，麦肯锡也发布了有关这个问题的报告，其中估算，大约60%的岗位中可能发生30%或以上的工作将被自动化机器代替。

column1: Now, world leaders – beginning with Trump and Xi – must figure out how to sustain employment, as existing jobs disappear.
column2: 如今，任何世界领导人 — — 从特朗普和习近平开始 — — 必须找到办法在现有工作岗位不断消失的情况下维持就业。

column1: The Obama administration’s study recommended a three-pronged approach: investment in artificial intelligence (to take advantage of its benefits); education and training of workers for the jobs of the future; and aid for workers in transition.
column2: 奥巴马政府的研究报告建议采取三管齐下的方针：投资人工智能（以利用其收益 ） ； 为工人提供未来就业岗位所需要的教育和培训；以及在转型过程中为工人提供补助。

column1: This is all well and good, but one imperative is missing: ensuring that enough new jobs actually are created.
column2: 这一方针虽好，但忽略了一个当务之急：确保实际上能够创造足够多的新岗位。 没有新岗位，培训得再好的工人还是没有工作。

column1: In both the China and the US, job disruptions are subject to sectoral and geographic imbalances.
column2: 在中国和美国，就业岗位危机都受到产业和地区结构失衡的影响。

column1: Driverless cars, for example, will threaten some 2-3 million jobs in the US.
column2: 比如，无人驾驶汽车将在美国威胁到200—300万个工作岗位。

column1: Those job losses will hit workers in some sectors – beginning with personal and freight transport – particularly hard.
column2: 这些岗位损失对于某些产业 — — 如客运和货运交通 — — 的冲击将特别严重。

column1: Similarly, the effects of automation on factory workers tend to be concentrated in particular regions.
column2: 类似地，自动化对工厂工人的影响主要集中在特定的地区。

column1: America’s Rust Belt, which once boasted a powerful manufacturing sector, is already suffering the consequences of automation.
column2: 美国的锈带，即昔日引以为豪的强大的制造业基地，已经在承受自动化所带来的后果。

column1: In China, it is the northeastern region that is being hit hardest by job losses, owing to overcapacity and the closure of polluting and loss-making heavy industries.
column2: 在中国，由于产能过剩和重污染、高亏损的重工业企业的倒闭，受就业岗位损失冲击最大的是东北地区。

column1: But the most consequential asymmetry affecting the job-creation challenge may be the one between institutions and policies.
column2: 但影响就业创造最严重的障碍也许是用人机构与就业政策之间的不协调。

column1: Sharp increases in government employment are usually fiscally unsustainable and even counterproductive, as they can crowd out the private sector.
column2: 政府就业的急剧增加常常令财政不堪重负，甚至产生适得其反的效果，因为这可能挤出民营部门的扩张。

column1: Yet large enterprises – whether private or state-owned – are in job-reduction mode, driven either by profit or efficiency pressures.
column2: 而大企业 — — 不论是民营还是国有 — — 都处于裁员的压力中，或者是因为利润萎缩，或者是为了减员增效。

column1: This leaves small and medium-size enterprises (SMEs) to pick up the slack.
column2: 这意味着中小企业必须填补未来就业的空白。

column1: China’s SMEs are certainly capable of doing so.
column2: 中国中小企业显然有能力完成这一任务。

column1: Indeed, even if large enterprises were not currently shedding workers, they would be at a disadvantage vis-à-vis more efficient and innovative SMEs in an economy transformed by interactive Internet platforms.
column2: 事实上，即使大企业目前没有裁员，它们面对一个被互动性互联网平台所改变的新经济中的高效创新的中小企业也不存在优势。

column1: Consider e-commerce.
column2: 以电子商务为例。

column1: As a recent report by the Alibaba Research Institute points out, e-commerce is transforming the relationship between customers and businesses.
column2: 阿里巴巴研究所的最新报告指出，电子商务正在改变客户与企业之间的关系。

column1: What was once a business-to-consumer supply-and-distribution model has become far more interactive, with customers constantly delivering feedback to which businesses must constantly adapt.
column2: 曾经的企业-消费者供销模式互动性大大增强，客户可以随时提供反馈，而企业必须随时根据反馈做出调整。

column1: Large Internet platforms like Alibaba can use Big Data and smart analytics to monitor such changes.
column2: 阿里巴巴等大型互联网平台可以利用大数据和智能分析监控这些变化。

column1: But large established firms cannot respond to those changes – say, by adjusting what they are producing or how they are distributing it – with the same speed and flexibility as their SME counterparts.
column2: 但老牌大企业则无法以中小企业同行一样的速度和弹性应对这些变化 — — 它们往往很难调整其固有的产品生产及分销渠道。

column1: Despite the potential of SMEs to produce valuable innovation and create jobs, however, the sector has been woefully neglected by policymakers.
column2: 尽管中小企业在创造有价值的创新和就业岗位方面潜力巨大，可惜它们往往被决策者忽视了。

column1: For example, tax incentives do not account for SMEs’ positive externalities in terms of job creation and innovation.
column2: 比如，税收激励往往没有考虑中小企业在就业创造和创新方面的正外部性。

column1: And, because of the risks of individual failures, SMEs often face higher costs for bank credit, particularly in China.
column2: 此外，由于担心企业风险和破产，中国的中小企业常常面临更高的银行信用成本。

column1: As the world’s two largest consumer markets and leading trade partners, China and the US can do much to help each other overcome the barriers to increased, broad-based, and high-quality job creation.
column2: 作为全世界最大的两个消费市场和主要贸易伙伴，中国和美国在互相帮助，克服障碍，增加广泛的高质量就业岗位方面大有可为。

column1: The US has the technology, talent, and regulatory experience to continue to lead the way on innovation, supporting job creation in new and future-oriented industries and activities.
column2: 美国拥有领先的技术、人才和监管经验，可以继续引领创新、支持在未来导向的行业和项目中创造工作岗位。

column1: And China’s move toward a consumption-led economy, driven by an increasingly modern services sector, is likely to boost demand for high-quality and innovative US goods and services.
column2: 而中国向消费拉动及现代化服务业驱动型经济的转型可以刺激对高质量的创新性美国商品与服务的需求。

column1: The result would be a much more balanced trade relationship and, potentially, a new global partnership for development.
column2: 中美合作的结果将是更加平衡的贸易关系，并有望形成新的全球发展合作伙伴关系。

column1: With that in mind, one can only hope that Trump maintains the cooperative spirit demonstrated at the recent Florida summit.
column2: 但愿特朗普能将他在最近的佛罗里达峰会上所表现出来的合作精神保持下去。

column1: Why Work at Work?
column2: 为什么要上班工作？

column1: PHUKET – Marissa Mayer, the new CEO of Yahoo!, recently created a fuss by issuing an edict that forbids anyone at the company to work from home.
column2: 普吉岛—最近，雅虎新CEO玛丽莎·梅耶（Marissa Mayer）发布公告禁止雅虎员工在家办公，此禁令掀起了一阵波澜。

column1: Mayer’s demarche received a lot of press coverage, probably more than it deserved.
column2: 梅耶的这一新政吸引了大量媒体注意，以致有大惊小怪之嫌。

column1: That may not be so surprising: she is a woman, and she allegedly has a nursery for her baby next door to her office.
column2: 这或许并不那么令人惊奇：她是女人，而且据说她办公室隔壁就有托儿所可以照顾她的孩子。

column1: Above all, people seemed to react to the categorical nature of her decision (why everyone?) and to the irony that Yahoo! is a tech company (don’t they know about Skype?).
column2: 毕竟，激起人们反弹的是她的决定的绝对性（为何所有人都得如此？ ）以及雅虎是个技术公司所带来的讽刺意味（他们不知道Skype是怎么做的吗？

column1: I think that Mayer made the right decision, and I am sure that over time exceptions to her order will be allowed at managers’ discretion.
column2: 我认为梅耶的决定是正确的，我可以肯定，假以时日，经理就有批准其指令的例外情况的自由裁量权。

column1: But, until now, the “right” to work at home was sacrosanct at Yahoo!, something that an employee’s manager could not overrule.
column2: 但是，到目前为止，在家工作的“权利”在雅虎仍是神圣不可侵犯的，是经理不可否决的雇员特权。

column1: And, by all accounts, enough people at Yahoo! were not working, either from home or from more interesting places, that it had become a serious problem.
column2: 但是，据大家所说，雅虎有很多人根本不工作，不管是在家还是在更有意思的地方，这已经成了一个严重的问题。

column1: Beyond that, Mayer’s edict makes more sense as a means of cultural change within a business than it does as a way to improve any particular individual’s productivity.
column2: 除此之外，梅耶的禁令与其说是改善特定员工的生产率的方法，不如说是改变企业文化的手段。

column1: Almost precisely because working remotely is easy, the advantage that a workplace has over a collection of home workers – or a set of outsourced workers assembled through Task Rabbit – is that people can accomplish more in a setting that provides a common culture and the benefit of serendipitous connections.
column2: 远程办公很容易，正是因为如此，有工作场所比起集体在家办公 — — 或通过任务兔子（Task Rabbit）组织一组外包员工 — — 的优势在于在提供共同文化的地方一起办公能完成的工作更多，更能激发意外默契。

column1: Long ago, the advantage of a firm was that it lowered transaction costs (an idea first clearly expressed by the Nobel laureate economist Ronald Coase), such as the costs of finding workers, assigning them to tasks, assessing productivity, and setting salaries.
column2: 很久以前，企业的优势在于它能降低交易成本（第一个清晰阐述这一思想的是诺贝尔经济学奖获得者罗纳德·科斯 ） ， 即招聘员工、指派任务给员工、评估生产率、设定薪水等活动的成本。

column1: Now that transaction costs are so low, the primary benefit of working at work is that the physical interactions foster an organizational culture and boost creativity, rather than efficiency or productivity, within an established routine.
column2: 如今，交易成本已经极低，上班工作的主要好处在于固定模式中的身体互动能激发组织文化和提升创造力，而不在于效率和生产率。

column1: Mayer, I think, did not order her employees back to the office merely because some people were not actually working at home; rather, many of those who were working were not working together.
column2: 我认为，梅耶要其员工回到办公室的原因绝不仅仅是某些员工在家并不工作，而是许多工作的员工没有在一起工作。

column1: To be sure, it seems contradictory to some people that Yahoo!, an online business, requires its employees to be physically present in the company’s offices.
column2: 诚然，对一些人来说，雅虎作为一个在线企业，要求其员工天天出现在办公室中有些奇怪。

column1: But most of the money and talent in this industry already seem to concentrate physically in one small part of the United States, between San Francisco and San Jose.
column2: 但该行业的资金和人才都集中在美国从旧金山到圣何塞的一小块区域中。

column1: Whether it’s the Yahoo! Cafeteria (now more inviting and more frequented with the advent of free food), or the halls of the Plug & Play startup accelerator, proximity matters.
column2: 不管是雅虎的自助餐厅（随着免费食物的出现变得更有吸引力也更繁忙）还是Plug & Play创业孵化大楼，面对面（proximity）至关重要。

column1: Being physically present at work means direct contact with other sharp and creative minds.
column2: 上班出现在工作场所意味着与其他犀利而富于创造力的头脑的直接交流。

column1: And the benefits of human contact and interaction are why salespeople still call on customers instead of using Skype, and why Meetup (which supports organizers of face-to-face meetings; I am on the company’s board) changes lives in ways that Twitter and Facebook rarely do.
column2: 人际交流和互动的好处正是销售员仍在拜访客户，而不是使用Skype的原因，也是Meetup（支持组织者的面对面会议；我是该公司董事）能以Twitter和Facebook所不能的方式改变生活的原因。

column1: Of course, those who prefer to work at home cite not just the cost and time of commuting, but also the proliferation of meetings – too much culture, perhaps – and a steady flood of communication that simply interrupts their work rather than enhancing it.
column2: 当然，喜欢在家工作者的论据不仅包括沟通需要成本和时间，也包括会议滋生 — — 也许是太“多”的文化 — — 和稳定的过度沟通只能干扰其工作，而起不到促进作用。

column1: Interestingly, I heard this point at a WPP Stream “unconference” in Phuket, Thailand, where a couple of hundred people had flown thousands of miles to meet face to face to share ideas and strengthen working relationships.
column2: 有趣的是，我在泰国普吉岛WPP Stream“非会议 ” （ unconference）上听说了这一点，在那里，好几百人从千里之外飞来面对面分享关于强化工作关系的心得。

column1: So, yes, online work can make a lot of sense in many situations, but when you are trying to fix a broken corporate culture, you need the commitment, human engagement, and creative interaction that happen most consistently in a physical workplace.
column2: 因此，在线工作确实在多种情形中作用多多，但当你试图修复破坏的公司文化时，你需要承诺、人力参与和创造性互动，而这只能在实体工作场所中才能坚持进行。

column1: In the end, it is up to good managers to decide who can work where, and to make meetings short and useful.
column2: 最后，优秀的经理会决定谁能在何处工作，并让会议变得简短有效。

column1: Indeed, the whole point of having managers is that they are supposed to exercise judgment.
column2: 事实上，之所以要有经理，全部原因在于他们能够执行裁决。

column1: Otherwise, computers and the Internet would allow us not just to work from home, but to report to a software program rather than to a person.
column2: 否则的话，计算机和互联网不但可以让我们在家办公，还能让我们向软件程序而不是活人报告。

column1: But, in the end, the challenge is to find the right fit between people and environment.
column2: 但是，最终，挑战在于找到人与环境的正确契合点。

column1: Personally, I come at this from the opposite direction.
column2: 就个人而言，我是个反面范例。

column1: As an independent angel investor with no real day job, I don’t have an office to report to every day.
column2: 作为非真正全日制工作者的独立天使投资人，我没有办公室，也不需每日报告。

column1: But I would miss the companionship of people working around me – even if they do not necessarily work with me.
column2: 但我会失去与周围人一起工作带来的交谊机会 — — 即便他们未必是我的同事。

column1: Fortunately, Meetup allows me to sit at a desk amid its roughly 90 people; I travel a lot, but I work from a desk at Meetup whenever I am at “home” in New York City.
column2: 幸运的是，Meetup让我能够与大约90人共济一堂；我做了长途旅行，但我在纽约市的“家”中可以随时随地出现在Meetup会议桌上。

column1: True, I don’t have to go to the company’s meetings, but I like being surrounded by busy people; I know it makes me work harder.
column2: 诚然，我不必非得出席公司会议，但我喜欢周围都是忙人的感觉；我知道，这让我工作更加努力。

column1: Whatever our work, we remain physically social beings.
column2: 不管我们做什么工作，我们始终是社会生物。

column1: Yankee Bases Go Home
column2: 美军基地滚回去

column1: RIO DE JANEIRO – Last month, the leaders of all 12 countries of South America (except one) gathered in Quito, Ecuador’s capital, for the summit of the Union of South American Nations.
column2: 里约热内卢 - - 上个月，南美全部十二个国家的领导人（除了一位）会聚厄瓜多尔首都基多举行“南美国家联盟 ” （ UNASUR）峰会。

column1: UNASUR or UNASUL (depending on whether one speaks Spanish or Portuguese) was established by the twelve presidents in Brasília in May 2008 with the aim of furthering economic and political integration.
column2: UNASUR 或 UNASUL（缩写视西班牙语或葡萄牙语而定）是（南美）十二国总统于2008年五月在巴西利亚建立的，其宗旨是促进经济和政治一体化。

column1: Instead, Venezuelan President Hugo Chávez hijacked the Quito meeting to propagate his Bolivarian Revolution and expound his own ideas for the continent’s future as independent of the United States.
column2: 然而，委内瑞拉总统查韦斯却劫持了基多会议来宣扬其玻利维尔革命，并详细解释了他自己关于该大陆独立于美国的未来的理念。

column1: Thanks to America’s recently announced military agreement with Colombia, Chávez’s ideas got more of a hearing than might have been expected. For, instead of infrastructure plans, commercial or environmental treaties, or even multilateral action against such common problems as violence and poverty, the issue that dominated both press accounts and the speeches at the gathering was the new US-Colombian military agreement, announced less than a month before the summit.
column2: 由于美国最近宣布与哥伦比亚达成军事协定，查韦斯的声音得到了比预想更多的关注：因为媒体报道和峰会演讲中的主导性话题不是基础设施规划，商业或环境条约，甚至也不是应对暴力和贫困等共同问题的多边行动，而是在峰会前不到一个月时宣布的美国 - - 哥伦比亚新军事协定。

column1: To no one’s surprise, Chávez dominated the criticism of the pact.
column2: 查韦斯毫无意外地发出了批评该协定的最强音。

column1: He claimed that the “Winds of war are blowing,” and that the announcement of the military agreement “can transform itself into a tragedy.”
column2: 他宣称“战争的风正在吹起 ” ， 军事协定的宣布“可能转化成一场悲剧 。 ”

column1: Unfortunately, Colombian President Álvaro Uribe was absent from the meeting.
column2: 不幸的是，哥伦比亚总统Álvaro Uribe没有出席会议。

column1: Colombia and Ecuador broke diplomatic relations in March 2008, after Colombia’s army pursued FARC guerillas, who have been fighting Colombia’s government for decades, into Ecuadorean territory.
column2: 在哥伦比亚军队追击FARC 游击队进入厄瓜多尔领土之后，两国于2008年三月断绝了外交关系。 该游击队已经与哥伦比亚政府对抗了数十年。

column1: So Uribe could not defend the new military agreement.
column2: 因此Uribe未能就新军事协议进行辩护。

column1: This left the floor open to Chávez to isolate Colombia and preach against the US.
column2: 这就给了查韦斯机会孤立哥伦比亚并高唱反美论调。

column1: In a continent where anti-Americanism remains both very popular and an effective way to consolidate national cohesion and political power, Chávez’s attacks found a ready audience.
column2: 在这片反美情绪依然广泛，并能被用来有效地强化民族凝聚力和政治权力的大陆，查韦斯的攻击言论大有市场。

column1: In addition, Uribe’s absence allowed Chávez to avoid responding to Colombia’s accusations that Venezuela and its ally Ecuador support the narco-Marxist FARC.
column2: 另外，Uribe的缺席使得查韦斯避免了回应哥伦比亚关于委内瑞拉和其盟国厄瓜多尔支持毒品马克思主义的FARC的指控。

column1: One week after the summit, US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton tried to calm the continent’s fears about the US-Colombia agreement, explaining that it is merely a minor revision of the Bill Clinton-era Plan Colombia, an American program to support the government against the drug cartels.
column2: 在峰会后一周，美国国务卿希拉里·克林顿试图缓和南美诸国对美国 - - 哥伦比亚军事协议的恐惧。 她解释说这只不过是对克林顿时期《哥伦比亚计划》的微调而已。

column1: But her words did little soothing.
column2: 美国的该项计划是为了支持哥政府对抗毒品卡特尔。 但她的解释没有令人放心。

column1: Nor did it seem to help that even most local military analysts say that the agreement does not represent any major change in the US military position on the continent.
column2: 即使大多数当地的军事分析家都认为该协议并不代表美国在该大陆军事立场的重大改变，但也于事无补。

column1: The simple fact is that the timing of the announcement of the pact was terrible, and gave a platform for Bolivarian rants that will not be without consequences.
column2: 事实非常简单，该协议宣布的时机太糟糕了。 它给了玻利瓦尔式“后果很严重” 的咆哮一个机会。

column1: Indeed, the ongoing fallout is likely to remain very negative.
column2: 的确，这场未平的余波所带来的影响仍将是非常负面的。

column1: By raising anti-American suspicions and strengthening Chávez’s position across the continent, the agreement weakens the influence of Brazil.
column2: 由于激起了反美的怀疑情绪并强化了查韦斯在南美大陆的地位，该协议削弱了巴西的影响力。

column1: Recently, Brazil had been differentiating itself from the rest of the continent through its stable economy and vibrant democratic political system, both of which were helping the country’s poor.
column2: 最近，巴西因为稳定的经济和富有活力的政治体系而在南美独树一帜，而这两项都有利于该国的穷人。

column1: So the spread and strengthening of Chávez’s so-called Bolivarian Revolution was not in Brazil’s interests, even though some of President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva’s officials appear to be fans of Chávez and his administration.
column2: 所以，查韦斯所谓“玻利瓦尔革命”的推广和强化不符合巴西的利益。 尽管卢拉总统麾下的某些官员似乎是查韦斯及其政府的崇拜者。

column1: The terrible timing of the US-Colombia military agreement also gave Chávez and his allies a reason to build up their armies against the “evil imperialist ianque .”
column2: 美国 - - 哥伦比亚军事协议的糟糕时机还为查韦斯及其盟友壮大军力对抗“邪恶的帝国主义美国佬” 提供了理由。

column1: After all, one must remember, the Bolivarian Revolution’s supposed “enemy�� is the US, and no one else.
column2: 毕竟，我们必须记住，玻利瓦尔革命的“假想敌”不是别人，正是美国。

column1: So the agreement may legitimize and produce an arms race in South America, which is in no one’s interest.
column2: 因此这项协议可能在南美引发一场合法的军备竞赛，而这对于任何国家都是无益的。

column1: Another unexpected consequence of the US-Colombia military agreement may be a further heightening of tensions between Venezuela and Colombia.
column2: 美国 - - 哥伦比亚军事协议的另一个意想不到的后果可能是进一步加剧委内瑞拉和哥伦比亚之间的紧张关系。

column1: The radical polarization of the Andean region between those two countries will create difficulties in building regional consensus and security problems in the Amazon, as well as weakening the Brazilian project for South American political and economic integration.
column2: 两国之间的安第斯地区的激烈两极分化会给达成区域性共识和阿马逊地区的安全问题造成困难，同时还会削弱巴西在南美政治经济一体化中的努力。

column1: Finally, another major consequence of the US-Colombia deal are the doubts that it has created in Latin America about President Barack Obama’s administration, and about the future of relations between the US and South America, especially Brazil, the main regional power.
column2: 最后，美国-哥伦比亚协定的另一个重大后果就是在拉美制造了对奥巴马政府和对美国和南美，特别是和地区大国巴西之间未来关系的怀疑。

column1: The agreement revived the perception that US diplomacy lacks sensitivity where the region is concerned.
column2: 该协议又印证了一种看法，即美国外交缺乏对该地区的敏感性。

column1: If Obama wants to encourage moderate and democratic politics in South America, and to bolster Brazil’s efforts to foster stability and economic progress against the region’s radical and undemocratic forces, it must take greater care in not appearing to undermine those the US claims to support.
column2: 如果奥巴马想要鼓励在南美实行温和与民主的政治，并支持巴西对抗该地区的激进和非民主力量，以实现稳定和经济进步的努力，他就必须倍加小心不要给人口蜜腹剑的印象。

column1: For Chávez is showing that the old cry of “Yankee go home” still resonates.
column2: 因为查韦斯正让人意识到“美国佬滚回去”的经典呼号仍然回响在耳边。

column1: The Periphery’s Purgatory
column2: 外围国的炼狱

column1: ATHENS – German Chancellor Angela Merkel’s upcoming visit to Athens will be a far less tense affair than her earlier journeys here during Europe’s long financial crisis.
column2: 雅典—德国总理默克尔即将访问雅典，此次访问所引起的紧张远远比不上她在欧洲长期金融危机期间来访时。

column1: Of course, Greeks have little love for Merkel; but, thanks to Europe’s modest economic recovery, some of the poison has been drawn from Germany’s relations with Europe’s most damaged and distressed economies.
column2: 当然，希腊人并不喜欢默克尔；但是，感谢欧洲经济的缓慢复苏，德国与欧洲受伤最深经济体之间的关系也有所缓和。

column1: Indeed, Europe is no longer considered a risk to global financial stability.
column2: 事实上，欧洲已不再被视为全球金融稳定的风险因素。

column1: The eurozone’s core economies are showing signs of revival, and financial conditions in the over-indebted periphery are improving as well.
column2: 欧元区核心经济体正在显示出恢复迹象，过度负债的外围的金融状况也在改善。

column1: But, given capital shortages, depressed demand, and the slow pace of reform in the eurozone periphery, continued progress is far from certain.
column2: 但是，由于存在资本短缺、需求受抑以及欧元区外围改革进展缓慢，进展能否保持还远未可知。

column1: In the eurozone economies that were hit hardest by the global economic crisis, the output and employment losses have been huge and persistent.
column2: 在受全球经济危机冲击最大的欧元区经济体，产出和就业损失巨大而持久。

column1: Real (inflation-adjusted) per capita income in the eurozone as a whole hovers around its 2007 level; in Greece and Italy, however, it has sunk to the levels recorded in 2000 and 1997, respectively.
column2: 欧元区整体实际（经通胀调整的）人均收入在2007年水平徘徊；希腊和意大利分别下降到2000年和1997年水平。

column1: Meanwhile, the eurozone’s overall unemployment rate is 12%, and it is much higher in the periphery.
column2: 与此同时，欧元区整体失业率高达12 % ， 外围更是远远高于这个数字。

column1: In Spain, more than 25% of the labor force is jobless, while Italy’s youth unemployment rate stands at 42%.
column2: 在西班牙，超过25%的劳动力没有工作，意大利的年轻人失业率高达42 % 。

column1: In Greece, where the overall unemployment rate has climbed to 28%, some 60% of the country’s young people are unemployed.
column2: 在希腊，总体失业率升高至28 % ， 更有60%左右的年轻人没有工作。

column1: Recovering from such crippling employment losses will not be easy, and will require a speedy return to high and sustainable growth rates.
column2: 从如此惨重的就业损失中恢复决非易事，并且需要快速恢复可持续的高增长率。

column1: Consider Greece, where the government is planning a return to the capital markets in the coming months to finance the country’s long-term borrowing needs, even though securing such financing would require paying unsustainably high interest rates.
column2: 以希腊为例，希腊政府计划在未来几个月回到资本市场为其长期借款需要融资，尽管确保融资需要付出不可持续的高利率。

column1: The fact that the government seems willing to do so translates clearly its desire to move beyond the influence of the “troika” (the International Monetary Fund, the European Commission, and the European Central Bank).
column2: 希腊政府决心这样做这一事实清楚地表明他渴望摆脱“三驾马车（国际货币基金组织、欧盟委员会和欧洲央行）的影响。

column1: Indeed, since 2008, Greece’s GDP has shrunk by almost 25%.
column2: 事实上，自2008年以来，希腊GDP收缩了近25 % 。

column1: Recovering lost capacity will require large amounts of capital, but there are five reasons why such financing is unlikely, under present conditions, to be forthcoming:
column2: 恢复失去的产能需要大量资本，但出于五个理由，希腊无法在当前条件下迅速获得融资：

column1: · As a result of austerity, public investment as a share of GDP continues to fall and has now reached a record low.
column2: · 拜紧缩所赐，公共投资占GDP之比一直在下降，现已降至创纪录的低位。

column1: Having already committed substantial rescue funds, eurozone authorities do not seem inclined to inject fresh capital.
column2: 已经承诺给出大量援助资金的欧元区当局似乎不再愿意注入新资本。

column1: · Sources of domestic private capital are limited, because the recession and the related near-collapse of asset prices, along with a sharp increase in taxation – particularly on high incomes and on capital – significantly weakened balance sheets.
column2: · 国内私人资本十分有限，因为衰退和近乎崩溃的资产价格加上税收的急剧增加 — — 特别是对高收入和资本的税收 — — 极大地破坏了资产负债表。

column1: · Bank lending has slowed drastically, as a result of Greek banks effectively defaulting in the wake of the troika-imposed losses on sovereign creditors and the nationalization of the country’s banks.
column2: · 银行贷款急剧放慢，因为希腊银行已经事实违约，而违约原因是三驾马车给主权债权人强加的损失以及希腊银行的国有化。

column1: A record-low level of deposits and the recession-related rise of non-performing loans have weakened Greek banks’ capital position further.
column2: 创纪录的低存款和拜衰退所赐的不良贷款增加进一步削弱了希腊银行的资本充足度。

column1: (Today, companies in the eurozone periphery borrow at substantially higher rates than their counterparts in the core.
column2: （如今，欧元区外围国政府的借款利率显著高于核心国。

column1: For bank loans, the ratio is almost two to one; for long-term financing, it may reach as high as ten to one.)
column2: 对银行贷款来说，比例为2比1；对长期融资来说，比例可能高达10比1 ） 。

column1: · Greece’s unsustainable debt position is discouraging foreign private investment.
column2: · 希腊不可持续的债务状况让外国私人投资打起了退堂鼓。

column1: The assumptions about primary surpluses, private-sector involvement, and GDP growth underlying the government’s commitment to reduce its debt level, which currently exceeds 170% of GDP, to 124% of GDP by 2020 cannot be realized, given Germany’s opposition to restructuring the official financing that replaced the defaulted private loans.
column2: 初级盈余、私人部门参与、以及政府降低债务水平承诺所需要的GDP增长水平（目前的债务水平位GDP的170%多，到2020年应降低至124 % ） 等方面的目标不可能实现，因为德国反对重组取代违约私人贷款的官方融资。

column1: Some easing of loan conditionality – via extended maturities and reduced interest rates ‒ will be agreed later this year, but it will not be enough to calm fears of a new default.
column2: 今年晚些时候将达成一致放松一些贷款条件（通过延长期限和降低利率 ） ， 但不足以平息对新一轮违约的担心。

column1: · Trust between foreign and Greek investors is lacking, and it will not be restored until debt sustainability is achieved.
column2: · 希腊和外国投资者之间缺乏信任，并且在实现债务可持续之前，信任无法重塑。

column1: But Germany and the other core eurozone countries consistently block any proposal that contemplates debt mutualization or fiscal union.
column2: 但德国和其他欧元区核心国家一致地阻挠任何考虑债务共同化��财政联盟的方案。

column1: Ideas such as Eurobonds, a single European finance ministry, and increased capitalization of Europe’s common rescue funds (the European Stability Mechanism and the Single Resolution Mechanism) are not even being contemplated.
column2: 欧元债券、单一欧洲财政部和增加欧洲共同援助资金（欧洲稳定性机制（European Stability Mechanism）和单一清算机制（Single Resolution Mechanism ） ） 等方案更是想都不用想。

column1: Along with inadequate capital supply, Greece is suffering from a demand shortfall, as the troika continues to squeeze the country with harsh austerity.
column2: 除了资本供应不足，希腊还饱受需求短缺折磨，因为三驾马车一直在用严厉的紧缩挤压希腊。

column1: If these policies are not relaxed or offset by more expansionary policies in the eurozone core, demand will remain depressed, discouraging further investment.
column2: 如果这些政策不放松，或没有欧元区核心国的宽松政策抵消其影响，则需求将继续受到抑制，从而抑制后续投资。

column1: Finally, on the reform front, time is running out.
column2: 最后，在改革问题上，时间正在耗尽。

column1: For the last few years, rather than confronting the special interests – state-protected businesses, public-sector trade unions, and lobbies – that inhibit reform, Greece has spread its economic misery horizontally through blanket spending cuts.
column2: 过去几年来，希腊并没有直面阻挠改革的特殊利益 — — 国家保护企业、公共部门工会和游说集团，而是用一刀切的减支推广了经济痛苦。

column1: Reforms such as privatizing state-owned enterprises, opening up closed professions, abolishing restrictive business practices, and reducing the size of the public sector have been undertaken very slowly and inefficiently, and they will not significantly alter growth prospects.
column2: 私有化国有企业、开放封闭的行业、废除限制商业的行为、收缩公共部门规模等改革进展极慢、效率极低，也无法极大地改变增长前景。

column1: As it stands, Greece is unlikely to meet the recovery challenge – and other peripheral economies will probably falter, too.
column2: 就目前而言，希腊无法应对复苏挑战 — — 其他外围经济体亦然。

column1: Sufficient reforms and capital are lacking, while the social rifts resulting from austerity increase the risk of potentially devastating political instability.
column2: 它们缺少充分的改革和资本，而紧缩带来的社会分裂增加了爆发灾难性政治动荡的风险。

column1: With the European Parliament election approaching, the prospect of populist anti-austerity parties prevailing in the periphery – and of anti-euro, anti-bailout parties gaining power in the core – heightens the risk of instability even more.
column2: 欧洲议会近在咫尺，民粹主义反紧缩政党在外围国大有夺权之势 — — 而反欧元、反援助政党则极有可能在核心国掌权 — — 发生动荡的可能性进一步增加了。

column1: Should financial turbulence return and herald a new eurozone crisis, the monetary union’s sustainability will again be called into question.
column2: 如果金融动荡回归并且预示着新的欧元区危机，那么这一货币联盟的可持续性将再次产生疑问。

column1: To prevent this outcome, Greece and the eurozone’s other peripheral economies must limit austerity, buttress demand, undertake reform, increase investment support, and pursue fiscal union.
column2: 为了防止这一结果，希腊和欧元区其他外围经济体必须限制紧缩、巩固需求、实施改革、增加投资支持并追求财政联盟。

column1: Unfortunately, these keys to ensuring a cohesive and prosperous eurozone are likely to be left unturned – until, perhaps, the next crisis occurs.
column2: 不幸的是，这些确保团结、繁荣的欧元区的关键都不太可能取得突破 — — 也许要靠另一场危机的发生才行。

column1: China’s Singapore Swing
column2: 中国转向新加坡

column1: BEIJING – The Chinese Communist Party has released the final document of the Third Plenum of the 18th Central Committee.
column2: 北京—中共公布了十八大三中全会的最终文件。

column1: In the CCP’s history, the third plenum has traditionally been the occasion for the party to announce its major policies for the next 5-10 years.
column2: 从历史上看，中共往往在三中全会上公布未来五到十年的重大政策。

column1: This year happened to be one of leadership transition, so the third plenum became more important.
column2: 今年恰逢领导层过渡之年，因此三中全会也变得更加重要。

column1: As expected, its final document unveils a plan for comprehensive reforms that will reshape China’s economy and society in the next decade.
column2: 如人们所期望的，此次三中全会的最终文件揭开了将决定未来十年中国经济和社会面貌的全面的改革计划。

column1: For starters, the household registration (hukou) system will be reformed.
column2: 首先，户口制度将得到改革。

column1: Small cities and towns will allow migrants to apply for the local hukou with no strings attached, and medium-size cities will do the same, with some restrictions.
column2: 小城市和建制镇将放开农民工落户申请，不再附带条件；中等城市也将如此，但会有一些限制。

column1: Although large cities will remain as closed as ever, the new policy will dramatically weaken the institutional foundation of China’s long history of urban-rural and regional divides.
column2: 尽管大城市的大门仍如以往那样关闭着，但这一新政策将极大地削弱中国长期的城乡和地区差距的制度性基础。

column1: Similarly, the one-child policy that has been enforced for the last 34 years will be modified.
column2: 类似地，强制执行了34年的独生子女政策也将修改。

column1: In most provinces, parents who are both single children themselves already can have two children.
column2: 在大部分省份，双方本身都是独生子女的父母已经可以生育二胎。

column1: The new policy recommends that provinces allow couples to have two children if either parent is a single child.
column2: 新政策建议各省允许任一方为独生子女的父母生育二胎。

column1: While this will affect only around 10 million couples – a small number in a country of more than 1.3 billion people – the reform represents a gigantic step toward ending the one-child rule.
column2: 这项政策大概只能影响1000万对夫妻 — — 对于人口超过13亿的中国来说，这个数字只是九牛一毛 — — 但它代表了迈向结束独生子女规则的巨大一步。

column1: Farmers, moreover, will be granted the right to sell their residential land on the open market and will be much more likely to be compensated at market rates when their land is taken by the government.
column2: 此外，农民将获得在公开市场上出售宅基地的权利，并大大提高他们在土地被政府征用时以市场价格获得补偿的机会。

column1: State-owned enterprises (SOEs), meanwhile, are expected to surrender more of their profits to the government – up to 30% by 2020.
column2: 与此同时，国有企业将把更多的利润上缴给政府 — — 到2020年上缴比例最高将达到30 % 。

column1: This extra revenue will be used to finance China’s social-security system.
column2: 这一额外的收入将用于充实社会保障系统。

column1: Indeed, from now on, the central government will take over social-security expenditure, establishing nationally unified pension and health-insurance systems, while the retirement age will be raised gradually.
column2: 事实上，从现在开始，中央政府将接管社会保障支出，成立全国统一的养老金和医疗保险系统，同时退休年龄将逐渐提高。

column1: Currently, women can retire at the age of 50, and men at 55 – ridiculously low by global standards and clearly unsustainable, given China’s rapidly aging population.
column2: 目前，女性退休年龄是50岁，男性是55岁 — — 以全球标准来看显然过低，且考虑到中国人口迅速老龄化的趋势，这显然是不可持续的。

column1: SOEs’ power will be curtailed in other ways.
column2: 国有企业的权力还将受到其他方式的削弱。

column1: Their ability to stifle innovation will be weakened by a drastic reduction in the government’s power to restrict the entry of new competitors into all areas of the economy, as well as a major effort to reduce bureaucratic red tape.
column2: 政府限制新竞争者进入经济各个领域的权力将大大受限，官僚主义繁文缛节也将遭到大力削弱，这将极大地降低国有企业对创新的制约作用。

column1: Financial liberalization, too, will be deepened, which will help startups and private firms most of all.
column2: 金融自由化也将得到深化，受益最大的将是创业企业和民营企业。

column1: In addition to pledging to liberalize exchange and interest rates, the final document also calls for allowing domestic private capital to form small and medium-size banks.
column2: 除了承诺汇率和利率自由化外，三中全会最终文件还要求允许国内民间资本组建中小型银行。

column1: And, in an effort to bring coherence to commercial courts’ rulings, the court system will be directly financed by the central government, rather than by the corresponding local government.
column2: 此外，为了保证商业法庭裁决的一致性，法院系统将直接由中央政府而不是对应的地方政府提供资金。

column1: This promises to strengthen the independence of the court system at the local level.
column2: 这将有利于增强地方层面法院系统的独立性。

column1: All of these reforms have long been expected.
column2: 所有这些改革都是人们所长期期待的。

column1: But the third plenum also provided surprises, including the creation of a leading group within the CCP to steer reform.
column2: 但此次三中全会还带来了惊喜，包括在党内成立全面深化改革领导小组。

column1: China used to have a reform commission within the executive branch; the establishment of the leading group indicates the CCP’s commitment, and that of President Xi Jinping, to comprehensive reform.
column2: 中国的行政部门体系中已经有了发改委；领导小组的成立彰显出中共和习近平主席对全面改革的决心。

column1: A second surprise is the document’s emphasis on the market.
column2: 第二个惊喜是文件对市场的强调。

column1: In the past, government direction was emphasized, despite an acknowledgement of the market’s positive role.
column2: 过去尽管也承认市场的积极作用，但总是强调政府导向。

column1: Now, for the first time, the CCP is officially calling for “allowing the market to take a central role in resource allocation.”
column2: 如今，中共首次正式要求“使市场在资源配置中起决定性作用 ” 。

column1: A final surprise is that the document sets a timeframe to complete all of the reforms; by 2020, China is supposed to become a full-fledged market economy.
column2: 最后一个惊喜是为完成全部改革制定了时间表；中国准备在2020年建成成熟的市场经济。

column1: This is the first time in recent history that the CCP has set a specific deadline for policymaking.
column2: 这是中共在最近一段时期首次为政策制定设置具体的期限。

column1: And yet, while all of these measures are encouraging signs, some key items are missing.
column2: 但是，尽管所有这些措施都是令人鼓舞的信号，也有一些关键点没有触及。

column1: For example, there was no clear mention of further SOE reform.
column2: 比如，文件没有明确提出进一步改革国有企业。

column1: Likewise, though the document calls for strengthening local legislatures, it proposes no concrete plan to curb local governments’ role in economic activities, which is one of the sources of distortions in the Chinese economy.
column2: 类似地，尽管文件要求加强地方立法机构，但并没有拿出具体的计划限制地方政府在经济活动中的角色，而这是中国经济扭曲的来源之一。

column1: This is related to the final document’s most significant lacuna: political reform.
column2: 这与最终文件最重要的空白有关：政治改革。

column1: In fact, a Singapore-style approach – combining a freewheeling market economy and an authoritarian regime – has clearly emerged from the plenum.
column2: 事实上，三中全会显然决定采取新加坡式的方针 — — 自由市场经济和专制政权相结合。

column1: It is an approach that awaits the test of time.
column2: 这一方针有待时间的检验。

column1: Singapore is a city-state of five million people – roughly the population of the Haidian district of Beijing.
column2: 新加坡是一个城市国家，只有500万人口 — — 大概和北京市海淀区相当。

column1: Given China’s much greater size and complexity, the Chinese government’s pursuit of the Singaporean model, with its suppression of any and all social disorder, would ultimately undermine economic dynamism.
column2: 中国的规模和复杂性远甚于新加坡，因此中国政府追求新加坡模式以及对一切社会动荡采取高压手段最终会破坏经济活力。

column1: To build the innovative economy envisioned by the third plenum, the CCP’s leadership needs to find a new governance model that fosters a vibrant society.
column2: 为了建设三中全会提出的创新型经济，中共领导层需要找到能培养有活力的社会的新的治理模式。

column1: Sooner rather than later, the crucially important economic reforms that have just been unveiled will not be enough.
column2: 很快，刚刚展开的具有关键重要性的经济改革便会显得后劲不足。

column1: China’s Real-Estate Wrongs
column2: 中国的房地产问题

column1: BEIJING – China’s real-estate sector has been a source of serious concern for several years, with soaring property prices raising fears of overheating in the housing market.
column2: 北京—几年来，中国的房地产业已成为一个严重忧虑，一飞冲天的房地产价格让人们担心住房市场存在过热。

column1: But, with price growth easing, it seems that the government’s campaign to rein in property risk is finally taking hold.
column2: 但是，随着价格涨势的减缓，政府遏制房地产风险的举措似乎终于见效了。

column1: The danger now is that the housing market will collapse – bringing China’s economic prospects down with it.
column2: 现在的危险是住房市场可能崩溃，并将中国经济前景也拖下水。

column1: In its effort to control rising housing prices, China’s government has pursued nine distinct policies, not all of which have served their purpose.
column2: 为了控制房价上涨，中国政府采取了九项不同政策，但并非每一项政策都达到了效果。

column1: Though policies like limits on mortgages for first-time buyers and minimum residency requirements for purchasing property in a first-tier city like Beijing or Shanghai helped to ease demand, supply-side tactics, such as limiting credit to real-estate developers and imposing new taxes on property sales, have proved to be counter-productive.
column2: 尽管将按揭限定于首次购房者、北京和上海等一线城市要求达到最低定居时限才能买房等政策有助于遏制需求，但供给端的策略，如限制房地产开发商信贷、实施新房销售税等，效果适得其反。

column1: This flawed approach allowed China’s housing prices to continue to rise steadily, fueling major housing bubbles, especially in first-tier cities.
column2: 这一存在缺陷的方针让中国房价继续稳步上升，催生了巨大的住房泡沫，特别是在一线城市。

column1: The average Beijing resident would have to save all of his or her income for 34 years before to be able to purchase an apartment outright.
column2: 普通北京居民需要将收入不吃不喝存34年才能全款购买一套公寓。

column1: In Shanghai and Guangzhou, the equivalent is 29 and 27 years, respectively – much higher than in other major international cities.
column2: 上海和广州则分别为29年和27年 — — 远远高于其他国际大城市。

column1: The expectation that this trend will continue has driven homeowners to retain possession of their properties, even though rental rates amount to less than 2% of a property’s market value.
column2: 预期这一趋势还会持续让业主继续持有自己的房产，即便房租率只相当于房产市值的不到2 % 。

column1: But, with the real-estate sector finally facing a downturn, the time to rethink this investment strategy has arrived.
column2: 但是，随着房地产业最终开始面临下降趋势，反思这一投资战略的时间也已到来。

column1: In the first four months of 2014, housing sales dropped by nearly 7% year on year, with construction of new floor area falling by more than 22%.
column2: 2014年前四个月，住房销售同比下降近7 % ， 新建楼面面积下降22%以上。

column1: As a result, downward pressure on property prices is mounting.
column2: 照此看，房价下跌压力正在积聚。

column1: In normal times, citizens and officials alike would welcome this trend.
column2: 在正常时期，公民和官员都会欢迎这一趋势。

column1: But, at a time of weakening economic performance, China cannot afford an implosion of the real-estate sector, which accounts for at least 30% of overall growth.
column2: 但是，在经济表现不力的时候，中国无法承担至少贡献了增长总量30%的房地产业崩溃。

column1: Indeed, though China’s government has expressed its willingness to sacrifice some growth in its pursuit of structural reform and rebalancing, the impact of a housing-market collapse on the financial sector would cause growth to slow beyond the acceptable limit.
column2: 事实上，尽管中国政府表示愿意为结构改革和再平衡牺牲一些增长，但住房市场崩溃对金融业的冲击会导致增长下降至远低于可接受下限的水平。

column1: That impact partly reflects the highly problematic nature of the Chinese government’s long-awaited move to liberalize interest rates.
column2: 这一冲击部分反映了人们期待已久的中国政府放松利率管制的政策有很大问题。

column1: Instead of taking a direct approach – lifting the interest-rate cap imposed on banks – liberalization has been achieved by allowing shadow banking to flourish.
column2: 利率自由化并没有采取直接方式 — — 提高银行利率上限 — — 而是通过允许影子银行兴盛的方式实现。

column1: As a result, a large number of nonbank financial institutions – such as wealth-management companies and online financial-services providers – are now using promises of high returns to attract small investors.
column2: 结果，如今大量非银行金融机构 — — 如理财公司和在线金融服务商 — — 以高回报承诺吸引小投资者。

column1: Making matters worse, the monetary authorities have tightened the credit supply, in an effort to deleverage the Chinese economy.
column2: 更糟糕的是，货币当局收紧了信用供给以促进中国经济去杠杆化。

column1: While both interest-rate liberalization and deleveraging are critical to the long-term health of China’s economy, the skyrocketing cost of borrowing is forcing many low-risk companies, which are unable to offer sufficiently high rates of return, out of the market.
column2: 尽管利率自由化和去杠杆化对中国经济的长期健康至关重要，但高企的借贷成本迫使许多低风险公司因为无法提供足够高的回报率而被挤出市场。

column1: At the same time, real-estate developers who have borrowed heavily from shadow-banking institutions, based on the assumption that property prices would continue to rise steadily, may struggle to repay their debts, with a sharp decline in prices inevitably leading to defaults.
column2: 与此同时，认为房价将继续稳步上升而大量从影子银行机构举债房地产开发商可能难以偿还债务，价格的急剧下跌将不可避免地导致违约。

column1: Given that the formal banking sector provides a large share of shadow-banking finance, this could initiate a chain reaction affecting the entire financial sector.
column2: 考虑到影子银行金融的很大一部分资金来自正式银行部门，这可能导致影响整个金融业的连锁反应。

column1: Many remain convinced that China’s government – which wields with the world’s largest foreign-exchange reserves and virtually unchecked authority – would be able to prevent a major financial crisis.
column2: 许多人仍认为坐拥世界第一大规模外汇储备、拥有几乎无限权力的中国政府能够避免重大金融危机。

column1: But the financial crisis in the fast-growing city of Wenzhou, triggered by bad loans, suggests otherwise – not least because the economy has yet to recover fully.
column2: 但高增长城市温州因为坏账而发生了金融危机，这表明上述观点未必正确 — — 因为经济尚未完全复苏。

column1: There is no reason to believe that a similar crisis could not occur on a national scale.
column2: 没有理由认为类似的危机不可能在全国���围内发生。

column1: To avoid such an outcome, China’s leaders must urgently adopt counter-cyclical measures.
column2: 为了避免这样的结果，中国领导人必须紧急采取反周期措施。

column1: They should begin by eliminating non-market-based restrictions on the real-estate sector, which have generated serious distortions not only to the economy, but also to people’s lives, with couples divorcing temporarily to gain the right to purchase an additional apartment.
column2: 他们应该从取消房地产业的非市场限制开始，这些限制所造成的严重扭曲不但影响了经济，也影响了人民的生活，许多人不惜假离婚以获得购买第二套公寓的权利。

column1: When it comes to the real-estate sector, China’s government has consistently had the right objective and the wrong strategy.
column2: 在房地产业的问题上，中国政府一直在用错误的战略追求正确的目标。

column1: It is time to align intention with action.
column2: 目的和行动之间应该一致。

column1: Otherwise, China’s financial sector – indeed, its entire economy – will suffer.
column2: 否则，中国的金融业 — — 事实上，是整个经济 — — 都要遭殃。

column1: In Praise of China’s New Normal
column2: 为中国的新常态欢呼

column1: BEIJING – China’s economy is, at long last, undergoing a rebalancing, with growth rates having declined from more than 10% before 2008 to roughly 7.5% today.
column2: 发自北京 — — 在经过了漫长的等待之后，中国经济终于启动了结构再平衡进程，增长率也从2008年以前的超过10%下降到如今的约7.5 % 。

column1: Is this China’s “new normal,” or should the country anticipate even slower growth in the coming decade?
column2: 这是否就是中国的“新常态 ” ， 还是这个国家预期在未来十年内会出现更低的增长？

column1: China’s rebalancing is apparent, first and foremost, in the export sector.
column2: 首先，中国经济在出口部门方面的再平衡是显而易见的。

column1: Export growth has slowed from its 2001-2008 average of 29% annually to below 10%, making foreign demand a far less critical engine of growth.
column2: 出口增长从2001~2008年间的年均29%下降到低于10 % ， 使得国外需求作为增长引擎的作用不再如此重要。

column1: Moreover, manufacturing employment and output, as a share of the total, began to decline last year.
column2: 此外，制造业就业和产出占总体的比重在去年开始下降。

column1: In fact, in the first half of this year, services accounted for more than half of total economic growth.
column2: 在今年上半年，服务业占据了总体经济增长的超过一半。

column1: It is no surprise, then, that China’s current-account surplus has shrunk rapidly, from its 2007 peak of more than 10% of GDP to about 2% of GDP today.
column2: 因此中国的经常账户顺差从2007年占GDP超过10%的顶峰迅速下跌如今大概2%的情况也就不出所料了，

column1: This rebalancing has helped to improve China’s income distribution.
column2: 这一再平衡帮助改善了中国的收入分配状况。

column1: Indeed, in recent years, labor’s share of national income has been on the rise – a direct reflection of the decline in manufacturing and expansion in services.
column2: 事实上近年来劳动工资收入在国民收入中的比重有所上升 — — 这也直接反映出制造业的收缩和服务业的扩大。

column1: That has meant greater regional balance as well: The coastal provinces, which produce more than 85% of the country’s exports, are experiencing the most pronounced slowdown, while inland provinces have maintained relatively high growth rates.
column2: 这同时也意味着更深层次的区域性再平衡状况：占中国出口总量超过85%的沿海省份正经历着最为显著的放缓过程，而内陆省份则维持着较高的增长率。

column1: As a result, China’s Gini coefficient (a 100-point index of inequality, in which zero signifies absolute equality and one absolute inequality) fell to 0.50 in 2012, from 0.52 in 2010.
column2: 在这样的形势下中国的基尼系数（定量测定收入分配差异程度的指数，其值在0和1之间，0表示收入分配极端平等而1表示极端不平等）从2012年的0.52下跌到了2012年的0.5。

column1: Two principal factors are driving this shift.
column2: 推动这一转变的是两大基本因素。

column1: The first is the decline in global demand in the wake of the 2008 financial crisis, which has forced China to adjust its growth model sooner than anticipated.
column2: 其一是2008年金融危机以来全球需求下降，迫使中国提前开始调整自身增长模式。

column1: The second is China’s ongoing demographic transformation.
column2: 其二则是中国人口结构的不断转变。

column1: The share of working-age people (16-65 years old) in the total population has been declining since its 2010 peak of 72%.
column2: 处于16~65岁之间的劳动人口占总人口的比例自2010年达到最高72%后逐年下降。

column1: And the absolute number of working-age people has been falling since 2012.
column2: 而劳动人口的绝对数量也自2012年后不断减少。

column1: At the same time, China is undergoing rapid urbanization, with some 200 million people having left the agricultural sector in 2001-2008 to seek urban manufacturing jobs.
column2: 与此同时，中国正处于高速城市化进程之中，在2001~2008年间有约200万人脱离农业寻找城市制造业工作。

column1: More recently, however, the pace of migration has slowed substantially, with rural areas retaining 35% of China’s total labor force.
column2: 但近年以来这一移民进程持续放缓，而农村地区则吸收了全国劳动者总数的35 % 。

column1: All of this implies lower growth rates for China – though perhaps not as low as the 6-7% rates that economists like Liu Shijing and Cai Fang are predicting for the next decade.
column2: 所有这些都体现出中国更低的增长率 — — 虽然可能不会像经济学家刘世锦，蔡方所预计的那样低到6~7 % 。

column1: In fact, relying on China’s past growth record to predict future performance is inherently problematic, owing not only to important shifts in the labor force, but also to the fact that the speed and scale of China’s pre-2008 growth was unprecedented.
column2: 事实上，依靠中国过去的增长记录去预测未来的经济表现显然是站不住脚的，不仅仅是因为劳动人口方面的重大转换，还必须认识到中国在2008年之前的发展速度和规模都是前所未有的。

column1: For starters, it is likely that the contribution to output growth of the rising ratio of working-age people prior to 2010 was overestimated.
column2: 首先，在2010年以前劳动人口数量增长率对生产增长的贡献很可能被高估了。

column1: That makes the subsequent decline in the ratio an inaccurate measure with which to determine the negative impact on economic performance.
column2: 这使得随后该比率的下跌成为了测定经济负面影响的一个不准确手段。

column1: Moreover, this approach neglects the educational dividends that China will enjoy over the next 20 years, as the younger generation replaces older workers.
column2: 此外，这一手段忽视了中国在未来20年间享受的教育红利，因为新一代劳动者正不断取代老一辈。

column1: As it stands, the rate of return-adjusted educational attainment for Chinese aged 50-60 is half that of those aged 20-25. In other words, young workers will be twice as productive as those entering retirement.
column2: 按照这一情况，50~60岁年龄段中国人的收入/受教育程度比率只有20~25岁年龄段的一半，换句话说，新一代劳动者的生产力将是临近退休者的一倍。

column1: Indeed, the level of educational attainment in China continues to improve.
column2: 事实上，中国国民的教育水平正不断提升。

column1: By 2020, the share of those aged 18-22 who are pursuing a college education will reach 40%, compared to 32% today.
column2: 到2020年，在大学求学的18~22岁青年将占到该年龄段总人口的40 % ， 而目前为32 % 。

column1: This improvement in human capital is bound to offset, to some extent, the net loss of labor.
column2: 这种人力资本的提升将在一定程度上补偿劳动力的净流失。

column1: Furthermore, China’s low retirement age – 50 for women and 60 for men – provides policymakers with considerable room to maneuver.
column2: 与此同时，中国的低退休年龄 — — 女性50岁和/男性60岁 — — 为政策制定者们提供了相当大的回旋余地。

column1: Increasing the retirement age by just a half-year for each of the next ten years would more than compensate for the annual decline in the labor force, which is projected to be 2.5 million workers during this period.
column2: 只需在未来每十年将退休年龄提高半年就足以补偿每年约250万劳动力的流失。

column1: Other trends are boosting China’s prospects further.
column2: 还有另一个趋势在进一步推动中国的繁荣。

column1: Though investment is likely to decline as a share of GDP, it will probably take a decade for it to dip below 40% – still robust by international standards.
column2: 虽然投资占GDP的比重不断降低，但可能需要十年的时间才能降到低于40 % — —按照国际标准来说这一比率依然较高。

column1: Meanwhile, the capital stock can maintain a reasonable growth rate.
column2: 同时资本存量也会维持较高的增长率。

column1: Finally, China’s capacity for innovation is improving steadily, owing to rapidly increasing human capital and rising investment in research and development.
column2: 最后，因为人力资本迅速增加和研究投资的不断增长，中国的创新能力正在稳步提升。

column1: By next year, Chinese R&D expenditure, at 2.2% of GDP, will be closing in on advanced-country levels.
column2: 明年中国的研究支出将相当于GDP的2.2 % ， 接近发达国家的水平。

column1: Based on these trends – and assuming a constant labor-participation rate – China’s potential growth rate over the next decade is likely to hover around 6.9-7.6%, averaging 7.27%.
column2: 基于这些趋势 — — 并假设一个持续的劳动参与率 — — 中国在未来10年的潜在增长率将在6.9~7.6之间波动，平均为7.27 % 。

column1: This may be much lower than the 9.4% average growth rate in 1988-2013, but it is more than adequate by global standards.
column2: 这个数字或许比1988~2013年间的年均9.4%低得多，但相对于全球标准来说这已经足够了。

column1: If this is China’s “new normal,” it would still be the envy of the rest of the world.
column2: 如果这就是中国的“新常态 ” ， 那么依然会是个令全世界羡慕不已的状况。

column1: China’s Shadow Menace
column2: 中国的影子威胁

column1: BEIJING – The US Federal Reserve’s decision to exit from so-called “quantitative easing” – its massive monthly purchases of long-term assets – is stoking fears of a hard economic landing in China.
column2: 北京—美联储退出所谓”量化宽松 ” （ 大规模月度长期资产购买）的决定正在引起关于中国经济硬着陆的恐慌。

column1: But China’s strong economic fundamentals mean that policymakers have the space to avoid such an outcome – as long as they bring the country’s shadow banking system under control.
column2: 但中国强大的经济基本面意味着决策者有空间避免这一结果 — — 只要他们能将中国的影子银行系统控制住。

column1: As it stands, Chinese consumption and investment growth is expected to remain at roughly last year’s levels.
column2: 目前，中国消费和投资增长预计将维持与去年相当的水平。

column1: Meanwhile, economic recovery in the advanced economies, especially the United States and Europe, is reinvigorating external demand, leading analysts to project annual Chinese export growth of more than 10% this year – 3-4 percentage points higher than in 2013.
column2: 与此同时，发达经济体（特别是美国和欧洲）的经济复苏正在重新刺激外需，这让分析师们预测今年中国出口年怎张率将超过10 % ， 比2013年高3—4个百分点。

column1: This would bring annual GDP growth in 2014 to a very healthy 7.5-8%.
column2: 这将让2014年GDP增长率达到相当健康的7.5—8 % 。

column1: The problem is that China’s financial sector has accumulated considerable risk in recent years, with broad money (M2) having ballooned to ¥110.7 trillion ($18 trillion) – almost twice the country’s GDP – at the end of last year.
column2: 问题在于，近几年来中国金融部门累积了大量风险，到去年年底，广义货币（M2）总量膨胀到110.7万亿元，接近GDP的两倍。

column1: In an attempt to rein in M2, which could indicate that the economy is overleveraged, the central bank tightened conditions for commercial bank lending, so that, for any given increase in M2, less credit is extended.
column2: 为了遏制M2 — — 该指标表明中国经济有杠杆过高之嫌 — — 中国人民银行收紧了商业银行贷款标准，因此，对于任何给定的M2增量，信用增量下降了。

column1: But the move failed to contain M2 growth; on the contrary, M2 grew faster last year than in 2012.
column2: 但这一措施并未遏制M2的增长；相反，去年M2增长比2012年更快。

column1: Worse, restricting commercial banks’ role as financial intermediaries and encouraging the growth of unregulated shadow banking has generated even more risks for China’s economy.
column2: 更糟糕的是，限制商业银行作为金融媒介的角色、鼓励不受监管的影子银行的增长已经给中国经济带来了更大的风险。

column1: Clearly, a new approach is needed – one that is based on a deeper understanding of the dangers inherent in China’s banking system.
column2: 显然，中国需要新方针 — — 基于对中国银行体系内部风险更深认识的方针。

column1: While it is true that surging M2 can reflect excessive leverage, it is not a particularly accurate gauge in China, where commercial banks can easily circumvent high reserve requirements and quantitative controls by moving loans off their balance sheets to wealth-management products – practices that fuel artificial credit expansion that looks like M2 growth.
column2: 诚然，M2的飙涨可能反映了过高的杠杆，但这在中国并不是一个特别准确标尺。 中国的商业银行可以轻松地规避高储备金要求和量化控制手段，只要将它们的贷款从资产负债表移到理财产品即可 — — 如此形成的人为信用扩张与M2增长十分接近。

column1: In this sense, it is the Chinese monetary authorities’ reluctance to open up the formal financial sector to domestic private capital, or to liberalize the deposit rate, that is fueling the expansion of shadow banking.
column2: 照此看，助长影子银行扩张的恰恰是中国货币当局不愿向国内私人资本放开正式银行部门和实施存款利率自由化。

column1: With small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) – by far the economy’s most important growth engine – unable to acquire sufficient funding from the formal financial sector, they have been forced to turn to informal channels.
column2: 中小企业 — — 目前它们是中国经济最重要的增长引擎 — — 无法通过正式金融部门获得足够的融资，被迫转向非正式渠道。

column1: As shadow banking has become the primary source of finance for SMEs – which tend to be higher-risk borrowers – the financial risks in China’s economy have grown exponentially.
column2: 随着影子银行变成中小企业的主要融资源 — — 而中小企业总是风险较高的借款人 — — 中国经济的金融风险呈现出指数增长。

column1: Exacerbating matters, the central bank’s repeated efforts to tighten the money supply raises the cost of capital.
column2: 雪上加霜的是，中国人民银行一再收紧货币供给，从而提高了资本成本。

column1: Last June, the annualized interbank lending rate surged to more than 10% – a level that it almost matched in December.
column2: 去年6月，年化银行间拆借利率飙升到10%以上，12月又几乎重演了一次。

column1: SMEs ultimately shoulder these costs, diminishing their ability to contribute to overall economic growth.
column2: 中小企业是这一成本的最终承担者，它们对总体经济增长的贡献能力也因此受到了制约。

column1: Consider the Internet giant Alibaba, which began using Zhi-fu-bao, the Chinese equivalent of PayPal, to raise money last year.
column2: 以互联网巨头阿里巴巴为例。 去年，阿里巴巴开始利用支付宝融资。

column1: In just a few months, it received ¥400 billion from 85 million small investors.
column2: 不出几个月，支付宝就收到了来自8,500万小投资者的4,000亿元资金。

column1: Tencent, China’s largest Internet company, is now using the same strategy to compete with Alibaba, with both companies offering high rates of return – often 6-7% annually – to attract as many investors as possible.
column2: 中国最大的互联万公司腾讯公司现在正在用同样的战略与阿里巴巴竞争。 不管是腾讯还是阿里巴巴，都给出了相当高的回报率 — — 年化水平通常可达6—7 % — —来吸引尽可能多的投资者。

column1: The problem is that most of this investment is in the interbank market, meaning that SMEs ultimately face interest rates of more than 10% – and that does not include the added 3% for SMEs’ loan guarantees.
column2: 问题在于这些投资的主要去向正是银行间市场，这意味着中小企业最终面临超过10%的利率 — — 还不包括3%的额外的中小企业贷款担保。

column1: These unsustainable high rates are transmitting major risks to the real economy.
column2: 这一不可持续的高利率正在把巨大的风险转移给实体经济。

column1: Nowhere is this more apparent than in the real-estate sector.
column2: 最能说明这一问题的莫过于房地产业了。

column1: Liquidity-thirsty developers, unable to acquire financing through the formal banking sector, have been taking out massive loans at extremely high interest rates.
column2: 急需流动性的开发商由于无法从正式银行部门获得融资，不得不以极高的利率借入大量贷款。

column1: But, in many cases, housing demand has not grown as expected, raising the risk of default – the effects of which would be transmitted to the entire financial sector.
column2: 但是，在许多情形中，房地产需求的增长赶不上预期，这提高了违约风险 — — 其效应将传递给整个金融部门。

column1: The fact is that China has never been closer to a major financial crisis than it is today.
column2: 事实上，中国从未像今天那样如此接近重大金融危机。

column1: Yet China’s monetary authorities do not seem to understand the scale of the risk – or its root causes.
column2: 但中国货币当局似乎并不清楚风险的规模，也不清楚它的根源。

column1: The Chinese economy may well need to be deleveraged.
column2: 中国经济或许急需去杠杆。

column1: But, instead of blindly tightening the credit supply, policymakers must pursue deep financial-sector reform to liberalize the deposit rate, eliminate quantitative controls, and, most important, allow for the establishment of domestic private financial institutions.
column2: 但是，决策不能盲目地收紧信用供给，而必须深化金融部门改革，实现存款利率自由化，取消量化工具，最重要的是，必须允许成立国内私人金融机构。

column1: Pursuing this agenda is essential to China’s long-term financial and economic health.
column2: 追求这些日程对于中国的长期金融和经济健康来说是至关重要的。

column1: But doing so presupposes a major shift in Chinese monetary authorities’ mindset.
column2: 但这样做需要中国货币当局转换思维。

column1: Therein lies the real challenge facing China today.
column2: 而中国今天所面临的挑战也正在这里。

column1: Will the Yellow Vests Reject the Brown Shirts?
column2: 黄背心会抵制棕衫队吗？

column1: PARIS – From the moment the French government canceled its planned fuel tax hike in the face of massive protests, it was obvious that the move would be perceived as inadequate, insignificant, and above all incapable of having any calming effect.
column2: 巴黎 — — 从法国政府面对大规模抗议活动取消其原计划大幅上调燃油税的那一刻起，显而易见，人们对此次运动的看法将会是不充分、不足道，而且最重要的是，无法带来任何安抚情绪的效果。

column1: Honor to whom honor is due: the Yellow Vests claim to be an expression of the sovereign people.
column2: 荣誉属于那些值得赞许的人：黄背心自称是主权民众的代表。

column1: But they now bear a heavy responsibility.
column2: 但他们现在所肩负的责任却是沉重的。

column1: For starters, they must announce a moratorium on demonstrations and blockades for a period long enough to accommodate the dialogue proposed by Prime Minister Édouard Philippe, if not longer.
column2: 首先，他们必须宣布一段足够长的示威和封锁暂停期，以允许总理爱德华·菲利普所提出的对话。

column1: In particular, they should renounce the much-touted December 8 “Act IV” of the movement, brewing on Facebook since Saturday evening, which everyone expects to be more violent, destructive, and tragic than the preceding installments.
column2: 特别是，他们应当放弃此次备受追捧的12月8日运动“第四幕”计划，该计划从周六傍晚起就在Facebook上被传得沸沸扬扬，所有人都预计这次行动会比前几次更暴力、更具破坏性，也更具悲剧色彩。

column1: There have been enough deaths, injuries, and damage (including to some of the most famous monuments in Paris).
column2: 最近发生的死亡、伤害和破坏（包括对巴黎某些最著名的遗迹）已经足够多了。

column1: If the Yellow Vests decide the machine they have unleashed has overtaken them, and they can no longer stop Act IV, they must be prepared during the protests to help the police flush out the violent “brown vests” who will be circulating among them.
column2: 如果黄背心们认为他们启动的机器已经超出了自身的控制，而且他们无法再阻止第四幕的发生，那么他们必须随时准备配合警察开展对混在他们当中崇尚暴力的“棕背心”的清洗活动。

column1: Because the wreckers of the far right and far left will surely reappear to vandalize, terrorize, and desecrate; it is up to the Yellow Vests to say once again, this time as if they really mean it: Not in our name.
column2: 因为极右翼和极左翼肇事者肯定会再次出现，破坏、恐吓并亵渎这次运动；黄背心们必须再次明确表态，而且这次表态必须非常郑重：这并不是我们想要的效果。

column1: Whether the Yellow Vests declare a moratorium or continue to protest, nothing would serve their cause better than to dissociate themselves – decisively and unambiguously – from all the political profiteers who would capitalize on their misery.
column2: 无论黄背心宣布暂停抑或继续抗议活动，对他们而言最好的策略都是果断且毫不含糊地与那些利用他们痛苦的政治投机者脱钩。

column1: The cast of opportunists is well known.
column2: 机会主义者的阵容是人尽皆知的。

column1: Here is Jean-Luc Mélenchon, who, having finished fourth in the 2017 presidential election won by Emmanuel Macron, is desperately seeking a new following.
column2: 其中包括梅朗雄，他在2017年总统大选中排名第四，位列胜选的伊曼纽尔·马克龙之后，而他现在正拼命寻求新的支持者。

column1: There is François Ruffin, the leader of the anti-austerity movement Nuit debout, with his irresponsible anti-republican calls of “Resign, Macron!” And over there is Marine Le Pen, oscillating comically between taking pride in and repenting her call to occupy the Champs Élysées last Saturday, thereby becoming accountable for the worst of what was said and done there.
column2: 此外还包括弗朗索瓦·鲁芬，鲁芬是反紧缩运动Nuit debout的领袖，他一直到处散播不负责任的反共和言论，不断高呼“辞职，马克龙 ! ” 此外，阵容中还包括马琳·勒庞，她在为上周六占领香榭丽舍大街感到骄傲和悔恨之间不停地摇摆，因此可以说，她应当为那里所发生的最糟局面负责。

column1: And there the intellectuals who, in the manner of Luc Ferry and Emmanuel Todd, suggest that it was perhaps not “by chance” that the wreckers had such an easy time approaching, storming, and sacking the Arc de Triomphe.
column2: 还有像卢克·费里和伊曼纽尔·托德那样的知识分子，他们认为破坏者如此轻而易举地靠近、攻陷和洗劫凯旋门可能并不是“偶然”的。

column1: Such rhetoric lays the worst of all traps for a popular movement: the trap of conspiratorial thinking.
column2: 上述言论为群众运动所能陷入的最可怕陷阱打下了基础：那就是阴谋论思维。

column1: In other words, the Yellow Vests are at a crossroads.
column2: 换言之，黄背心们正站在十字路口。

column1: Either they will be bold enough to stop and take the time they need to get organized, following a path not unlike that of Macron’s own La République en Marche !, which, in hindsight, might appear to be the Yellow Vests’ first-to-arrive twin.
column2: 他们或者大胆地停下来，留出足够的时间重新组织，然后再沿着与马克龙自身的法国前进运动类似的道路继续往前走。 事后看来，马克龙的法国前进运动似乎与黄背心们有着诸多的相似之处。

column1: Macron’s movement, too, had right and left wings. And it knew that it was a new political body, engaging in a dialogue or even a showdown that would lead to an honest reckoning with poverty and the high cost of living.
column2: 马克龙的运动同样分为右翼和左翼，而且它清楚自身是新的政治机构，因此全心全意进行对话甚至是摊牌，从而促使人们对贫困和生活成本居高不下等问题进行诚实的思考。

column1: If the Yellow Vests build a movement that rises to the height of Macron’s, it may end up writing a page in the history of France.
column2: 如果黄背心最终发展为一个与马克龙达到同等高度的运动，那么它可能最终会被记入到法国的史书。

column1: Or the Yellow Vests may turn out to lack that boldness and settle for the paltry pleasure of being seen on television.
column2: 黄背心也可以被事实证明缺乏必要的胆略，并因为受到电视报道这样微不足道的乐趣而满足。

column1: They will allow themselves to become intoxicated by the sight of luminaries and experts of la France d’en haut (elite France) seeming to eat from their hands and hanging on their every word.
column2: 他们将允许自己为得到la France den haut（精英法国）的名人和专家的注意力所陶醉，看似心甘情愿地被他们所豢养并对他们的所有命令言听计从。

column1: But if the Yellow Vests allow passionate hate to win out over genuine fraternity and choose wrecking over reforming, they will bring only chaos, not improvement, to the lives of humble and vulnerable people.
column2: 但如果黄背心允许激情仇恨压倒真正的兄弟情谊并选择破坏改革，那么他们只能祸乱而非改善卑微和脆弱民众的生活。

column1: They will careen off into the darkest side of the political night, and end up in the dustbin of history, where they can rub elbows with those other yellows, the early-twentieth-century “Yellow Socialists” of the proto-fascist syndicalist Pierre Biétry.
column2: 他们将陷入到政治黑夜最黑暗的一面，并最终被扫进历史的垃圾箱，在那里他们会与其他黄色运动不期而遇，比如20世纪初期皮埃尔·比奇特的亲法西斯工团“黄色社会主义者 ” 。

column1: The Yellow Vests must choose: democratic re-invention, or an updated version of the national socialist leagues; a will to repair, or the urge to destroy.
column2: 黄背心们必须在民主再造或国家社会主义联盟升级版之间作出选择；两者之间的差异在于修复的愿望抑或毁灭的冲动。

column1: The decision will hinge on the historic essence of the movement – whether its reflexes are good or bad, and whether, in the final analysis, it possesses political and moral courage.
column2: 他们的决定将决定该运动的历史本质 — — 决定其反应是好是坏，以及归根结底，它是否是政治和道德勇气的秉持者。

column1: So the ball is in the Yellow Vests’ court.
column2: 因此球就在黄背心的脚下。

column1: They have the initiative as much as Macron does.
column2: 他们手握的主动权并不亚于马克龙。

column1: Will they say, “Yes, we believe in republican democracy?”
column2: 他们会说 ， “ 是的，我们相信共和民主 ？ ”

column1: And will they say it loud and clear, without equivocation?
column2: 他们会不会就此作出毫不含糊的明确表达？

column1: Or will they place themselves in the tradition of paranoid nihilism and pollute their ranks with the political vandals that France still produces in abundance?
column2: 或者他们会屈服于偏执无政府主义的传统，最终任由依然在法国大量存在的政治破坏者们污染他们的队伍？

column1: Did US Drone Strikes Lose Yemen?
column2: 美国无人机打击输掉了也门吗？

column1: NEW YORK – Recent revelations that the US killed an innocent American in a drone strike in Pakistan confirm what a new study, “Death by Drone,” of civilian harm caused by US drone strikes in Yemen shows – that claims about the precision of drone strikes are overstated.
column2: 纽约—最近，也门滑入了危机，这激起了一场争论：美国总统奥巴马政府称其在也门实施的以无人机打击为核心的反恐战略取得了成功是否错误。

column1: The revelations also underscore the stark asymmetry between how the US treats drone strikes that kill its own citizens and those that kill others. While the Obama administration has now publicly acknowledged that it has recently killed three US citizens in drone strikes, it has refused to acknowledge countless other drone strikes around the world which have killed non-US civilians.
column2: 事实上，最新报告《死于无人机 》 （ Death by Drone）指出，即使最近的危机不曾爆发，美国无人机打击给也门平民所造成的伤害也足以应该让美国反思这一战略。

column1: In Yemen, the US has been conducting drone strikes since at least 2002, with estimates of the total number of strikes ranging from 91 to 203.
column2: 美国至少早在2002年就开始在也门实施无人机打击，总打击次数估计在90次到198次。

column1: While the American and Yemeni governments have lauded the drones’ precise targeting, they have refused to meaningfully disclose key details about the strikes, including how many have been conducted, who has been targeted, or, crucially, the number and identities of civilians killed.
column2: 美国和也门政府大肆宣传无人机的精确定位，但拒绝披露打击的关键细节，包括阻止了多少次、以谁为打击目标，以及最关键的，误杀的平民数量和身份。

column1: In a May 2013 speech at the National Defense University, Obama offered assurances that, outside the Afghan war theater, no drone strike would be carried out unless there was “near-certainty that no civilians will be killed or injured.”
column2: 在 2013年5月的国防大学（National Defense University）演讲中，奥巴马信誓旦旦地表示，在阿富汗战场之外，除非“几乎肯定不会有平民伤亡 ， ” 否则就不会实施无人机打击。

column1: Obama also claimed that the US targets only “terrorists who pose a continuing and imminent threat to the American people,” and that it does not launch drone strikes when it has “the ability to capture individual terrorists.”
column2: （总体而言，他的确承认美国无人机打击导致了平民伤亡。 ）奥巴马还宣称美国的目标只是“不断地对美国人造成紧迫威胁的恐怖分子 ， ” 美国不会在具备“捕获个体恐怖分子的能力”的情况下发动无人机打击。

column1: “Death by Drone,” which includes first-hand testimony from eyewitnesses and survivors of drone strikes in Yemen, tells a different story.
column2: 《死于无人机》包括了也门无人机打击的目击者和幸存者的第一手证词，它向我们讲述了一个完全不同的故事。

column1: The nine case studies documented in the report, four of which cover attacks that came after the 2013 speech, provide credible evidence that US drone strikes have killed and injured Yemeni civilians, suggesting that the “near-certainty” standard is not being effectively implemented.
column2: 报告中所记录的九个案例 — — 其中四个包括奥巴马2013年演讲之后所实施的打击 — — 以如山铁证证明美国无人机打击造成了也门平民伤亡，并指出“几乎肯定”标准并没有被有效实施。

column1: The report also casts doubt on Obama’s other claims, with evidence indicating that targets of drone strikes, though perhaps posing a threat to Yemen, may not have posed a direct threat to the US, and that their capture may have been possible.
column2: 报告还质疑了奥巴马的另一个说法。 报告提出证据证明，无人机打击目标 — — 尽管他们也许给也门造成了威胁 — — 未必对美国造成直接威胁，并且捕获他们也不是没有可能。

column1: In other words, Yemeni civilians have suffered and died from drone strikes that may not have been necessary.
column2: 换句话说，也门贫民因为未必需要的无人机打击而遭遇伤亡。

column1: More generally, the report provides a window into the experiences of Yemeni civilians directly affected by US drone strikes.
column2: 对于被杀平民的家庭而言，无法证明无人机打击的必要性 — — 甚至不直接承认实施了无人机打击 — — 让他们更加无法接受家人的死亡。

column1: The testimonies of these individuals, vital for assessing the US drone program, are all too easy to overlook because these individuals are poor and have no political influence, and because the strikes are conducted in secret, far away from the US.
column2: 2014年4月19日在美国无人机打击身亡的四位无辜平民之一的纳赛尔·穆罕默德·纳赛尔（Nasser Mohammed Nasser）的父亲哀痛地说 ： “ 我儿子以及和他一起死去的人和基地组织毫无瓜葛。 他们只是在讨生活的路上。
既然如此，美国飞机为什么还要攻击他们 ？ ”

column1: As Yaslem Saeed bin Ishaq, whose son was killed in a US drone strike in Wadi Sir on August 1, 2013, observed, “They just kill.
column2: 当然，从距离遥远还往往保密的地方打着国家安全的旗号发动无人机打击在政治上相对容易一些。

column1: They do not know what havoc their missiles have caused. They are unaware of the suffering they create for our families.”
column2: 当受打击影响的平民是缺少政治影响力的穷人、因此没有什么能力吸引媒体眼球时，发动打击就更加容易了。

column1: Indeed, if the US never acknowledges the specific strikes, how can ordinary Americans possibly know that Rasilah al-Faqih, a pregnant Yemeni woman, was killed in Walad Rabei’, along with her husband and ten-year-old daughter, as they headed home from a visit to the doctor?
column2: 亚斯勒姆·赛义德·本·依沙克（Yaslem Saeed bin Ishaq）的儿子在2013年瓦迪瑟（Wadi Sir）美国无人机打击中身亡，他观察道 ： “ 他们只是为了杀戮。

column1: Or that Abdoh Mohammed al-Jarraah’s house in Silat al-Jarraah had 19 people, including women and children, inside when it was hit by a US drone strike?
column2: 他们根本不知道他们的导弹造成了怎样的破坏。 他们不知道他们给我们的家庭造成了多大的痛苦 。 ”

column1: The US’ refusal to acknowledge drone strikes that kill foreigners is sending a damaging message in Yemen and beyond.
column2: 事实上，如果美国不承认具体的打击，普通美国人如何能够知道也门孕妇拉西拉·法基赫（Rasilah al-Faqih）在瓦拉德拉贝（Walad Rabei ’ ） 与她的丈夫以及十岁的女儿在就医返回途中被杀？

column1: As Moqbel Abdullah Ali al-Jarraah, a villager from Silat al-Jarraah, put it: “I believe that America is testing its lethal inventions in our poor villages, because [it] cannot afford to do so at any place where human life has value. Here, we are without value.”
column2: 他们如何知道阿卜杜赫·穆罕默德·贾拉哈（Abdoh Mohammed al-Jarraah）在希拉特贾拉哈（Silat al-Jarraah）的房子被无人机打击夷为平地时里面有19人，包括妇女和儿童？

column1: In every incident recorded in this report, the families of Yemeni civilians killed in US strikes want to know why they were targeted.
column2: 但是，尽管美国政府一直对无人机袭击保持沉默在国内或许有帮助，但在也门和其他地区，这释放了一个危险信号。

column1: As the father of Nasser Mohammed Nasser, one of four innocent civilians killed in a US drone strike on April 19, 2014, lamented: “My son and those who were with him had nothing to do with Al Qaeda. They were simply on their way to earn a living.
column2: 希拉特贾拉哈的一位村民莫贝尔·阿卜杜拉·阿里·贾拉哈（Moqbel Abdullah Ali al-Jarraah）说 ： “ 我认为美国拿我们贫穷村庄试验它的致命发明，因为它不能在其他任何人命很值钱的地方进行试验。

column1: Why, then, did the American aircraft strike them?”
column2: 在这里，我们的命毫无价值 。 ”

column1: But the US has given Nasser no answers.
column2: 2013年2月，时任白宫反恐首席官员的约翰·布伦南（John Brennan）在其赴任重要情报局局长的审核听证会上说 ： “ 为了��明度 ， ” 美国必须公开承认误杀。 当月晚些时候，他承认美国政府“应该公开因为美国针对基地组织的打击而丧生的平民总数 。 ”

column1: It has not even acknowledged that it killed his son.
column2: 但这两件事美国一件也没有做。

column1: In February 2013, then-White House counterterrorism chief John Brennan testified at his Senate confirmation hearing to become CIA Director that, “in the interest of transparency,” the US must acknowledge mistaken killings publicly.
column2: 因此，对于像纳赛尔那样在美国袭击中失去了母亲、父亲、儿子和女儿的平民来说，毫不奇怪他们不但对美国怒不可遏，对同意采取无人机打击的也门政府同样怒不可遏。

column1: Later that month, he recognized that the US government “should make public the overall numbers of civilian deaths resulting from US strikes targeting Al Qaeda.” The US has done neither.
column2: 从这个角度讲，无人机打击远远没有让也门和美国变得更安全，反倒可能强化对基地组织的支持。

column1: It should come as no surprise, then, that civilians like Nasser, who have lost mothers, fathers, sons, and daughters in US strikes, are outraged not only at the US, but also at the Yemeni government, which consented to the attacks.
column2: 今年早些时候，美国宣布了新的无人机出口政策，据称这是为了与其他国家合作为无人机的使用“制定国际标准”并约束无人机进口国“根据国际法使用无人机系统 。 ”

column1: They believe that instead of making Yemen and the US safer, drone strikes only strengthen support for Al Qaeda.
column2: 但是 ， 《 死于无人机》指出，美国本身也没有遵守国际法，甚至连它自己的指引也不遵守。

column1: Earlier this year, the US announced a new policy for drone exports, purportedly part of a broader effort to work with other countries to “shape international standards” on the use of drones and compel recipient states “to use these systems in accordance with international law.”
column2: 如今，美国仍然拒绝承认无人机计划对平民百姓造成的影响。

column1: But, as “Death by Drone” shows, the US drone program is fundamentally flawed and should not be perpetuated. The Obama administration’s recent admissions that its drone strikes killed its own citizens only underscore this fact.
column2: 但是，它们至少绝不应该向其他国家出口它在也门所使用的保密的、有可能是非法的无人机武器模型。

column1: Can Yemen Be Saved?
column2: 也门还有救吗？

column1: SANA'A – Yemen is no stranger to crisis.
column2: 萨那—也门对冲突绝不陌生。

column1: Exposed to a regional proxy war between Iran and Saudi Arabia, plagued by an entrenched Al Qaeda affiliate, and divided by tribal disputes and a secession movement, the country has become a poster child for everything that can go wrong in the Arab world.
column2: 也门暴露在伊朗和沙特阿拉伯的地区代理战争中，饱受根深蒂固的基地组织折磨，也因为部落纠纷和独立运动而分裂。 阿拉伯世界中的所有问题，你都可以在也门找到。

column1: Yemen has demonstrated remarkable resiliency in the past.
column2: 在过去，也门表现出引人注目的恢复力。

column1: To ensure that the recent overthrow of its government by the Shia Houthi rebel movement does not deal Yemen the lethal blow that it has avoided so far, the international community must not abandon the country in what may be its hour of greatest need.
column2: 为了确保最近什叶派胡塞（Shia Houthi）反抗运动颠覆政府不会给也门造成其到目前为止成功避免了的致命一击，国际社会绝不能再也门最需要的时候放弃这个国家。

column1: The origins of the Houthi movement date to 1991, when it was created to protect Zaydism, a moderate form of Shi'ism, from the encroachment of Sunni Islamists.
column2: 胡塞运动的起源可以追溯到1991年。 这一年，胡塞运动成立，初衷是保护什叶派伊斯兰教的温和形势斋德主义（Zaydism）不受逊尼派伊斯兰教迫害。

column1: After the attacks on New York and Washington, DC, on September 11, 2001, the group's battle took on a geopolitical dimension, as its fighters objected to Yemen's decision to collaborate with the United States and enhance bilateral intelligence cooperation.
column2: 2001年9月11日纽约和华盛顿恐怖袭击发生后，该组织的战斗又增加了地缘政治维度，其战士拒绝也门与美国采取联合行动和加强双边情报合作的决定。

column1: From 2004 to 2010, the group fought six wars against the Yemeni government and even skirmished with Saudi Arabia.
column2: 从2004到2010年，该集团与也门政府打了六场战争，甚至与沙特阿拉伯也产生过摩擦。

column1: Yet it never managed to expand its reach beyond its stronghold in the north of the country.
column2: 但它从未成功将势力范围推广到其牢牢掌握的也门北部以外。

column1: That changed in 2011, when the popular protests and political chaos stemming from the Arab Spring led to widespread institutional paralysis, allowing the Houthis to march past a military that largely refused to fight it.
column2: 2011年，形势发生了变化，阿拉伯之春所导致的群众游行和政治混乱引起了普遍的制度瘫痪，军队拒绝与胡塞运动分子作战。

column1: The group's power grab has frightened its adversaries, leading them to seek new alliances that could imperil the state's security.
column2: 该集团的得势令其对手大感恐惧，促使它们结成新的联盟，以至于危及国家安全。

column1: In the central region of Marib, home to the oil and gas facilities that Yemen relies on for foreign currency, several tribes have vowed to fight the Houthis.
column2: 在马利布（Marib，作为也门主要外汇来源的油气设施所在地）地区，多个部落都宣誓与胡塞运动斗争到底。

column1: The region was once a stronghold of Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP), an affiliate of the global terrorist organization.
column2: 该地区曾为阿拉伯半岛基地组织（AQAP，基地组织的分支）所牢固掌握。

column1: If the military refuses to assist the tribes – as is likely – they may be tempted to turn to AQAP.
column2: 如果军队拒绝帮助部落 — — 很有可能如此 — — 它们就有可能倒向AQAP。

column1: The situation is no less precarious in the southern provinces, where a secession movement has been active since 2007.
column2: 南部省份的情况尤其恶劣。 也门南部的分裂运动在2007年便已十分活跃。

column1: Southerners are up in arms because the Houthi rebellion halted plans for the adoption of a federal system, which would have given the region greater autonomy.
column2: 南方人之所以武装起来，是因为胡塞叛军中止了采取联邦制的计划，而联邦制将带给南部更大的自治权。

column1: In response, armed groups seized checkpoints and closed the port of Aden.
column2: 结果，武装集团占领了检查站，关闭了亚丁港。

column1: The risk of secession is very real.
column2: 分裂的风险是实实在在的。

column1: Southern Sunnis have been marginalized since a 1994 civil war that left northerners in control of most of the country's political institutions.
column2: 1994年的内战让北方人控制了也门的大部分政治机构，此后，南方的逊尼派就一直被边缘化。

column1: Many in the region worry that the Houthis will discriminate against them further.
column2: 该地区的许多人担心胡塞运动分子会更加歧视他们。

column1: AQAP is firmly rooted in this region as well, implying the possibility that local residents will seek its help in defending against an expected Houthi onslaught.
